column13:
Not a bad place for some South American food in my experience. 

As soon as you get there, you can see a lot of memorabilia all over the place with flags, decorations and typical music of Colombia.

The menu is pretty straight forward and it's compiled with just a few dishes and drinks. I ordered the typical bandeja paisa and it was very good! Very tasty.

The attention was alright. It was just one person for the whole place. It's not really a complain. 
I would recommend people to give this place a try!

They have only one vegetarian item on the menu. It was pretty good okay .. They could add some more vegetables instead of all starch and carb. Add a few more vegetarian items that are lighter in calories. 

Be creative.. Look on pinterest... Thank me later

There are many good views of Los Parceros on Yelp, while I don't think this is a bad restaurant, the food was a little bland for my taste. I was there for an early lunch and ordered a tamale with a side of yuca. The yuca was not seasoned. The Colombian tamale was quite substantial, it had a chicken thigh, a piece of pork, half a boiled egg, a slice of potato and carrot, wrapped in leaves and steamed. One would expect the flavor should be concentrated in the cornmeal of the tamale but it this case, there just was not enough cornmeal to soak up the flavor. The whole tamale was dry and I had to wash it down with water.

It appeared the majority of the customers ordered the bandeja paisa, maybe that is what I should have ordered. 

The two waitresses were friendly. The music was loud like in a bar. When the restaurant began to fill up, the service became quite slow.

I was craving some Bandeja Paisa ( a traditional Colombian plate) and Los Parceros was one of the only places in Denver that had this on the menu. I made the 45 minute drive to visit, and was not disappointing. We got the Picada Pequena as an appetizer, it had so much food on it. The fried yucca is probably my favorite part of the plate. I had the Bandeja Paisa and my wife had the Sancocho de Res (beef stew). I won the food comparison battle this time. I love the chicharron that comes with the Bandeja Paisa and the sausage. 

If I'm around this part of town again, ill be stopping by...

After getting a great review my wife, sister & I tried Los Parceros. It is very close to my house on Colfax between Jersey & Jasmine.

The restaurant isn't huge with three or four booths on the left side and three larger tables on the right side. The decor is very enjoyable with vibrant color reflecting the Colombian flag amongst lots of other items presumably from Colombia. 

Los Parceros serves Colombian food & drinks. We started with the empanadas, which typically use flour but are made with corn here. This is great for my wife who is gluten-free. They come five to an order and were fresh, delicious and hot.

For entrees we tried the churrasco steak, which is big enough for 2 or 3 people. It comes with fries and  cooked to order. It was seasoned well. 

We also tried the Arroz con pollo, which is chicken and rice with various vegetables mixed in. The rice had great flavor and chicken was shredded in small bite size pieces. It comes with a side salad and it was a big enough portion there were leftovers for a full lunch.

The last item we ordered was the vegetarian platter. It is not on the menu. It comes with fried plantains, small potatoes, a side salad, avocado, yucca, black beans and a fried egg.

Everything was good and the server was polite and helpful.

Support this tasty restaurant on Colfax. You won't be disappointed.

I'm Colombian and new to the area from Queens, NY so I was super excited to find this place. Unfortunately I was very disappointed. The food was mediocre, the staff wasn't very friendly, which shocked me because Colombians are known for being so friendly. But at least is nice to have a place where I can get Colombian beer.

Terrible experience.  
We arrived around 7:20 p.m. and waited until around 7:45 p.m. to be seated.  We were told right away that they were closing so we had to order right away. 

We ordered a "bandana Paisa" but they said they had just made the last one, so we had to order something else.  We wondered why they couldn't make another bandana Paisa, our conclusion was that they simply wanted to leave and didn't want to make it, that simple.

We also ordered two "ajiaco" soups which were advertised as having chicken, three different types of potatoes and corn.  We received instead two small bowls of "corn in the cob with broth" and a couple of slivers of shreded chicken.  

Be aware that this ajiaco soup is $12 each.  It had no potatoes, only traces of chicken, it was just broth!
We told the lady that served us why it had no chicken, so she went back to the kitchen to get more chicken, but she came back saying the had no more and if the owner of the restaurant was there, maybe he could have discounted something from our bill.

We ate our broth and left feeling very disappointed and upset.
I do not recommend this place.  The service from the waitress was decent, but the food availability, quantity and price was just unacceptable.
We will NOT be back.

Given my Colombian heritage on my mom's side, this was a no-brainer. My folks just moved to Arvada from CA and haven't wasted any time getting acquainted with Denver. My mom made friends with the owner Joaquin and his two sons, all of whom work at the joint. We had a huge family dinner, 9 total in their tiny intimate restaurant. They handled it gracefully with smiles on their faces. While everything on the table was tasty, I have to highlight the appetizers. Their empanadas are incredible and gluten free. Compared to other spots, like the Chiva food cart, these are most and flavorful, paired with a spicy green sauce. Next, were the patacones, which some may call tostones. This is my single favorite latin dish.

You take a green (immature) plantain, cut them into small cylindrical pieces, deep fry on both sides, take them out and SQUASH them, then put the back in the hot fat one more time to fully crisp them up. mmm. They are what I call Latin Fries, because they are treated like French fries often. At Parceros, they presented these with a salty, acidic and sweet chunky tomato tapenade. Increible! Make sure you try these if you go. 

What's more is the owner took my whole family and I out on the town in their Chiva bus. A very authentic experience and a great party idea!
Bad, I came here from so far on Sunday at 6:18, they told me was closed but the site says they close at 7:00pm.

This place is so good. It makes me happy that it's here. It's not a hidden gem exactly, but a gem it is indeed. I had the Bandeja Paisa which was a Symphony of delicious meats. The empanadas are the best anywhere. The people who gave this place one star are cowards. This place represents everything that is good and sacred about food.

Get the bandeja paisa and then three million orders of empanadas.

Keep in mind that Colombian food should by NO MEANS be confused with our perception of Mexican food (which is not too authentic...).  

Expect carbs (sometimes fries AND rice), carbs (black beans), carbs (maduros), and protein.  PERFECT! The juices are amazing--get them with water, not milk.

It's a little embarrassing to admit that I was born in Colombia and lived there the first three and a half years of my life but haven't had Colombian food as an adult. 

Lucky for myself, the hubs and my parents we got to try and in my parents case, walk down memory lane on Christmas Eve. The restaurant is small and cozy with bright colors. The service was very good as well which made the night all the more enjoyable. 

We started with the cheese arepa and the empanadas with aji sauce. The empanadas were hands down the best part of our meal. Crispy on the outside with creamy potato and beef drizzled with the incredible aji sauce. We all agreed we could eat just a plate full of those for dinner. We all got the passion fruit juice which was incredible and hit the spot. 

Forgive my lack of Spanish with our entrees. We tried:

Arroz con pollo - this was good except for the slices of hot dog that my mom picked out

Beef flank - my dads dish which was very tasty

Fish with rice, fries and salad - the rice was incredible. The fish was a bottom feeder related to tilipia so it did have a little of that dirty flavor associated with catfish 

Traditional Colombian meal with chicharrones, sausage, egg, plantain, beans, rice and avocado. This was a HUGE amount of food. My husband ate half and sadly left his to go box on the table. We realized later that night when we had already left :(

We also got churros that were incredible and totally unique with a caramel style filling. 

I'm ready to eat Colombian again and make up for lost time!

Excellent food, Great service by concerned staff.


This is a great family restaurant, with empanadas and chimichurri sauce to die for.

I went to Los Parceros last weekend and it was a nice change from my usual dining spots. We were lucky to snag the last table inside when we arrived. The restaurant is relatively small with a few tables. I had a margarita with some of their speciality squeezed juice and my boyfriend has solely the juice. They don't give you water unless you ask for it. We had some empanadas to start which were very tasty and large. I had one of the soups made with corn, meat, potato, and more. It was very flavorful and soothing.. Yum! Overall it was a good experience and the ambiance inside is very cute and makes you feel you are actually in South America. The door wouldn't shut all the way unless you pulled it close, which was a bit annoying since we were seated near the door and it was cold outside. The service was OK but we still had to wait for awhile at times to order drinks and such.

Second visit - more empanadas and the Carne asada dish which comes with rice, steak, fries and a salad.   

The portions are meek compared to the Colombian restaurants I've recently visited in New York.  So let's work on that.

Los Parceros is the type of family owned, hole-in-the-wall place that dreams are made of! A friend & I went last week & were thrilled with our experience. The restaurant is small, homey, & brightly decorated. When I arrived, of the three other full tables, I was the only native English speaker (always a good sign). I know they opened about 6 months ago, and I think they are working out a lot of the "kinks" I read about in some of the other yelp reviews. The owner's son talked with us extensively, and answered a lot of questions for us. We started with empanadas & fried plantains (don't remember the dish name).The empanadas were stellar. The plantains were great! We both got fresh juices, and it was as if milk & fruit made sweet, sweet love to one another in a blender! They were wonderful! We split the Arroz Con Pollo, a common chicken & rice dish, and it was good, not great, but good.

They keep the menu simple with about a dozen things to choose from. They have several Colombian sodas & we were told they are in the process of getting their liquor license & will also carry Colombian beer! 

I will say, the entree prices are a little higher than I expected, running about $12-$22, but overall things were great.

I had the most amazing lunch here with The Hubs a week or so ago.  I had a soup called Ajiaca that was so delicious I went online looking for recipes after I got home.  Essentially, it's a very filling chicken and potato soup with such a depth of flavor it's difficult to describe. Let's just suffice it to say that I would most definitely order it again.  The Hubs had the Bandeja Paisa which was a huge plate of food.  I think it consisted of a sausage (chorizo?), red beans, rice, seasoned ground beef with a fried egg on top, chicharron, arepa, fried plaintains and avocado.  He said it was good and would order it again, but only if he was really, really hungry.  He tasted my soup and said he would most likely  order it next time.

The restaurant is small (maybe 8 or so tables and booths inside, and a few small tables outside), but cute.  It's brightly painted and decorated and is very festive, especially with the fun (although very loud) Colombian music (I'm assuming) that was playing.

All-in-all, we had a good experience once someone noticed we were there.  That's why I'm giving them four stars instead of five.  After we walked in, we seated ourselves and waited.  And waited.  It was a good ten minutes before anyone who worked there noticed we were even there (or at least acknowledged we were there).  One of the staff was busy serving other people.  One guy was fiddling around with the stereo.  Another was seated in the dining area eating his own lunch.  It would have been nice if someone had just looked up and said they'd be with us in a few minutes.  Frankly, we almost left.  I'm very glad we didn't though.  I will say that once we were noticed, we did have very good service and excellent food.  We will be back!

Maybe we ordered the wrong thing, but the food was disappointing.  The whole fried fish tasted good, but the chicken and rice dish was bad. There was very little chicken, but lots of cut up hot dog. Not at all what we were expecting. We also tried the flan for dessert, which was acceptable. My suggestion,  stil with the fish.

My wife, who's Colombian, has been searching for a Colombian restaurant in the area since we moved here 3 years ago. She found this place because the Chiva was parked outside. When we tried it for the first time the food was good but nowhere near as good as the Colombian restaurants we had tried on the east coast. My wife ordered an arepa with cheese and they gave her an arepa that was the same size as the one on the bandeja paisa which are very small but good and the empanadas are just ok. The bandeja paisa plate is pretty good as well. The workers are very friendly, and I believe it is family owned and operated. Also, the atmosphere is very nice, but the prices are pretty high for what you get.......but then again they are the only Colombian restaurant in the area so it's almost justified. On a side note and this is pretty cool, you can rent out the Chiva as a party bus.

This place was amazing.  I had the number one it's the Colombian national dish.  A ton of food and extra delicious.   Small mom and pop place that I will be eating at several times in the future.  They were able to keep my 16 month old daughter happy as well.

First. The food was good soup was great. Meat very taste. Second. Staff could better service customers by writing down orders and extras. We ask several times for extra plate, napkins etc.  will return but might suggest things one at a time.

Never been to Columbia but have travelled extensively throughout Peru, Ecuador and Chile so I appreciated the decor, especially the little tables and chairs :o)
I showed up 30 minutes before they closed but was pleasantly greeted and sat. Unfortunately no alcohol but they have an extensive juice list tho I recognized the apple soda which Ive had before so settled for that. I asked my waiter what he recommedned  and I was given quite a few choices but luckily the menu aint that extensive like sat a Mexican one so figured I would start with the Empanadas which were crispy and stuffed with beef & potato $7.50 for six wasn't too bad. I then had the Ajiaco which is basically a potato and chicken soup served in a clay bowl. Three different types of potatoes, lean chicken, not sure on all the spices and other veggies, oh and a little corn on the cob, hearty stuff and for $12 it would of been plenty enough on its own! It also came with some rice and a little salad so I was totally stuffed by the time I left. I will definitely be back to try some of the other dishes.

We had the mojarra frita (whole fried fish, type of sea bream) and carne asada. The flavors were excellent. The meals come with quite a bit of starch (rice and french fries) and I'd be glad to exchange some starch for veggies/salad. But overall the meal was great. The fish was not greasy at all and had great flavor.
We each had one of the marvelous fruit juice drinks. For mine I had them make it with water. My friend had a mix of half milk and half water as suggested by the waiter.
The server was excellent: very patient to discuss the foods and drinks and then pretty much left us alone while eating. 
Can't wait to go back.
This is another one of the excellent Latin restaurants popping up in the area.

SO grateful to have a Colombian restaurant in Denver!  This is as truly authentic Colombian cuisine as you can get in Denver.  I am Colombian and was raised eating Colombian food.  I have been here a couple of times and the menu was reflective of typical dishes you would find in most restaurants in Colombia.  I frequent Colombia and can say that the food at Los Parceros is like ordering from a restaurant in Bogota or Medellin.  My personal favorite is sancocho and Los Parceros did not disappoint.  I had the sancocho de Carne which was excellent and made just like I have had it many times in Bogota.  My favorites off the menu include sancocho, ajiaco, and bandeja paisa.  All were excellent.  In addition, all of the side staples were available to order and excellent as well.  Arepas, patacones/tostones, platanos maduros, yuca fries, etc.  This is a GEM!

The place is clean , bright and the staff was friendly.   I started with a mango and milk juice,  it was like a light milk shake. It was good and I would get another. The empanadas were also pretty good maybe priced a little high for what you get but tasty. I had the lunch special with fish and my companion had the traditional meal.  The food was pretty good.   I sampled everything and thought it lacked flavor except for the sausage. Not much salt and little spice everything else.  I have never had Columbian food before so nothing to benchmark it too but was surprised to learn Colombian food typically is not spicy.  There was not even pepper on the table which I thought was interesting .  I would like to come back and try some more items,  maybe sneak in some hot sauce because to me would be better with some kick.  
The employees seemed generally happy we were there and that makes me want to give it another try too.   

Probably more like 3.5 stars

This place is a gem. Quaint, small dining area with a few patio tables. Very friendly, albeit slow, service. We ordered the Colombian hot chocolate and columbiana soda with some fried plantains. My kids really enjoyed the unique flavor and the house made soups were the highlight of our meal.

This place, there is a very little variety of Hispanic good in Colorado and this is the first Colombian restaurant I've been to and I must day it is absolutely delicious.. They great food and drinks. I residually love Mora juice

Let me start by saying that its my first time trying Colombian food. Out side a very fun looking bus greets you which is called "La Chiva" and also serves as a party bus. As you walk in the walls are filled with Colombian memorabilia, hats, purses, hammocks even some pictures of the famous artist Botero. It's pretty small and has a homely feel to it. 
Kenny our server was very nice and took very good care of us. We had coffee which Kenny made sure our cup was never empty. We staterd with some empanadas which come with a very delicious sauce that looks like chimichurri sauce. I also had the Bandeja Paisa which is a traditional Colombian plate, very good for the carnivorous person. The fried plantain and chimichurri sauce complements every item in the dish. Overall the flavors to the dish were amazing and the service was like non other. If you want to experience a homelike  meal, with flavors that make your taste buds crave more, I say you give it a try. I can't wait to come back and try a different dish. 

Gracias Kenny por su atención todo estuvo riquísimo, nos vemos muy pronto.

My wife and I frequent Colombia and is great to have real Colombian food in Denver! We were lucky to find them since they just opened June 7th.

They also have a great list of juices such as : Guanabana, Lulo, Mora, Mango, Pina, Guayaba, Maracuya, Papaya, Fresa and Tamarindo. 

Great food and great people!! 

We are coming back many times!!

Consider me a fan.  I'm a gringo who grew up with Colombians and ate dinner as a kid over their house frequently.  This took me back to fond memories 20 years ago. Good prices. Authentic taste.  Nice people.  Brought my family here and felt welcome. The brothers that work there were super nice.  Place is small and takes a bit longer than you would think, but hey it's worth it and much closer than flying down to bogota!

Went around 6 on a week night.  My wife and I stood inside for awhile before someone seated with their back to told us to sit ourselves.  We went to a table outside as the music was very loud inside.  Someone brought us menus and said our server would be right out.  After 15 minutes, we left.  There was one other customer who appeared to be waiting for takeout.  Too many good restaurants to put up with service this poor.

I walked in on a lazy saturday evening. I hurried in out of the usually unusual Denver spring weather. It's May, it's hailing, snowing and raining. Typically unusual, but pretty usual stuff for Coloradans amirite?...What isn't typical or routine is a random trip to Colombia. I mean that in an almost literal way. I opened the door to Colombian music and cool light energy. I was greeted by the manager I think. Everyone was dressed nice and it had a family-run-feel to the way it operated from my angle. Anyway he asked if i ever had Colombian food and when i replied "no", he lit up like a tour guide who loved their job ( i really appreciated the enthusiasm) needless to say, I was an eager student. (since lunch was my favorite school subject and I was on the honor roll for it). 
I went for the Colombian sampler plate. Everything about it was delicious. Cultures crossed deeper with every bite. I had real Colombian coffee, I was surrounded by art and at the end you get a piece of candy. Sweet. When I left, I felt like I had an extra stamp in my passport.
Amazing food.. Very friendly staff even the owner sat and talked with us!! Def coming back!!

If you want to feel like you stepped out of Denver and into Bogota for a few minutes, this is the place.  The decor is about as authentic as you can get outside of actually being in Colombia.  Vibrant colors, on point artifacts, and they even have a fully outfitted "Colombian style" bus that sits across the street.  Stopped in today for their lunch special, which fills you up nicely for about $10 (with tax and tip), but more importantly gives you a nice offering of what you would expect in a typical Colombian meal.  Soup, grilled chicken, rice and beans and a salad were what the lunch special consider of today, and it varies daily.  Also, a nice variety (15+) of fresh juices from fruits that are not common to America, such as Passionfruit.  While giving it 4 stars, I know this place has the potential for 5...I just did not get to taste enough of the menu...yet!  Service was excellent- the girl helping me out was super friendly and helpful.  Plus, she continued speaking to me and letting me practice my Spanish LOOOONG after she knew it was not my first language.

I've been to Colombia a lot and this place takes me back!  Great authentic Colombian did and a friendly staff will keep me coming back! 

I ordered the typical mixed meat plate and a Colombiana to drink and both were really good.

I just moved to Denver... Came from California and was desperately looking for a Colombian restaurant. Came across Los Parceros and I have to say that the food here is 100% Colombian! The taste is just amazing! Friendly staff. Love this place!

I'm 100% COLOMBIANO & THIS WAS TO EXPENSIVE ... I ordered the "churrazco" wich is supposed to be a tender lean skirt steak topped w/ marinated with cut herbs in olive oil. Complimented with a "arepa" on the side and a side salad, sometimes. BUT HERE!! fatty chewy oily steak cooked in oil with a side of oily frozen fries. The empanadas had to go back because they were frozen in the middle!.. And the water based juice was horribly over priced!.... I lived 4 yrs in Florida and 8 in Cali, Colombia this meal shouldn't have been more than $23.00(expensive lunch) vs "LOS PARCEROS" $40.00( que hp!)
Wonderful food and wonderful staff! The juices are very tasty and the atmosphere is great, I love the music they play!

This place is officially open for business. I had a lunch special and it consisted of grilled steak, rice, salad, fried plantain and a soup for $8. Any foodie wanting a hell of a deal needs to run down here as fast as possible before they raise their prices. The food is basic Colombian fare but it is well executed. They don't have a menu yet and it helps if you speak Spanish but try this place out anyways as you will not be disappointed. Be careful with the empanadas. They have five empanadas for eight dollars which is fair but I would have rather have had a couple as an appetizer. This kind of small misstep comes with not having a menu. That kept it from getting four stars. 
   If you can't get to Bogota any time soon this place will help ease your longing.

Wow! So glad I found this place. The empanadas were superb- the best I've had. The bright atmosphere was sweet and welcoming and the staff warm and friendly. Oh, and the Mango juice smoothie? Delicioso!

5 of us arrived today at noon.  It was closed, and no hours were posted.  We couldn't even find a telephone number.  

I can't rate this well if the owners make no effort to communicate the restaurant's availability.  Perhaps it's a front for cocaine smuggling or money laundering.
Amazing Colombian food. Service was.. eh. I had a guava juice in milk, it was very good.

first my wife is Colombian and we have been going to  los parceros since November the owner and his wife are always warm and friendly and always greets us at the door.
the food they make is better than my mother inlaw makes  we try to hit it at least once a week.  david  you must be an assclown how many times have you been to Colombia?? soon they will be serving Colombian beer and open fulltime we can't wait

Osaka Sushi has everything in one menu: Bento Boxes, Meat & Veggie Bowls, Hot Dishes, Sushi Chef Specials, and all you can eat, but at lunch only on certain days! So be sure to ask. The Yakki Nikku was cooked perfectly, and it made a great starter. It comes with a side of fresh veggies and limes. Basically, short ribs with sautéed veggies!! I love Shrimp and crunchy bites, so the Crispy Shrimp with mild sauce is a good appetizer that I went with. Their sushi, I think, was very impressive. Some days I'll feel so-so whenever I eat sushi, but Osaka really killed it. 

It's a very romantic spot with candles and roses. A full bar with Ozeke Sake at the tips of your tongue. They had a special if you complete a very, very, very spicy roll, they'll reward you with a bottle of Sake! Cha-Ching! 

The Rolls: 

The Dragon Roll has always been a mere favorite of mine, and I enjoy the way it is topped off with the basic avocado and it goes well with ginger. Get this if you're a fan of crab meat and cucumber. (& Unagi and Masago, which is my total fave) 


Ichiban Roll comes with spicy tuna, Masago, Spicy mayo and sweet eel sauce. 
I think this one we won't consider getting again. It wasn't balanced. 

The best roll is the Avalanche Roll! It's stuffed with hot Tempura and crab meat. It's very saucy and creamy, if you're into a MouthGasm adventure. It has Tobiko and Unagi with White Sauce and baked salmon. 

The dessert is the best here: Seriously, the whole dessert menu is a castle of fun. I fell in love with the Tempura Icecream at Katsu Sushi, but Osaka has eye-popping selections. I mean. Everything. Is. Eye. Popping. 

We got the Berry Paradise, which at first I wasn't rooting for, but thanks to Kay, our very beautiful server, convinced us that it was amazing and it really worked. 
I chose the Tiramisu cake which looked like a sunrise beach painting . It was so cute I couldn't take it. Please come here. It was a stunning experience.

We got to the restaurant and although it wasn't overly busy, it took us over 5 min to be seated. Our dinner was 7:45 on a Tuesday night. After being seated at the Sushi Bar, we sat for another 15 minutes before we decided to leave.

Other than being handed a menu, we weren't offered a drink or even given any water. Both  the parties seated on either side of us were given drinks and appetizers during that time. 

After spending over 20 min inside the restaurant and no service it was time to move on.

Other than the poor service...and having plenty of time to look at the menu, their prices seemed to be high especially for the local market! I was going to order their medium sashimi plate and at the $30+ price tag, I definitely know you can find better options in the area. Probably with better service too...

This was a first and last kind of visit. I would not recommend an attempt by anyone else especially when there are so many other options within a mile or two.

Fantastic place to get sushi and interestingly enough Osaka has two very vibes with lunch and dinner!

Lunch: This is the most recent experience of mine. I walked in at 11:15am since they have lunch specials that run seven days a week from 11a-3pm. I thought it would be empty but there were already a few tables sat and even so, it was pretty tame and quiet. I sat at the sushi bar since the sushi chefs looked lonely and was promptly greeted. From beginning to finish the experience was perfect. I got the sashimi lunch combo which came with soup, salad, two pieces of a sushi rolls, six pieces of sashimi and about five or six pieces of tempura shrimp and veggies. OMG, it was like food-gasm city. Everything was delicious and the salmon sashimi practically melted in my mouth. It was so much food for $12, you really can't beat a deal like that for all that food plus the quality of the food. I was chatting with the sushi chef and he said not to spend the money on the AYCE lunch special, you definitely get more bang for your buck ordering the lunch specials or various rolls. 

Dinner: Well, this was about two and a half years ago but it was a completely different experience atmosphere wise. It was like a party! We didn't have to wait for long but it was a full house on a Friday night.  We stuck with mostly rolls that night and did family style with some friends but the thing I remember the most was there being free sake bomb shots for all throughout the restaurant. There was music blasting and they stopped the music so everyone could unite in the name of alcohol and do a shot. Yep, this is definitely my kind of place!

The amount of fish they give you when you order sashimi is enormous!  And its very fresh too.  I was not happy with the tempura oysters, super greasy and definitely NOT coated with tempura!  The seaweed salad was teeny tiny for 7$.  The service was average to slow.  Our food took forever, but the cold sake choices were plentiful so we were happy.  The place had no ambiance, its like a shack.  Overall I liked the fish but not a great experience.  I will say it was reasonably priced for all that we had.
Plating is wonderful, they have a nice selection, sushi chefs and wait staff are very nice, but sushi is mediocre  at best and not fresh, and the price is a bit much
Never order all you can eat sushi here.. They have too much rice and they're so blunt about it. I won't be coming back though.

Yummy Yummy. 
First off... I'll never understand how a land locked city like Denver has so many sushi places. I just don't get it. 
Surprisingly, some of them are actually pretty good - this being one of them. 
From the outside it looks kind of shady... like... oh this is not going to be good... but then it is. 
Fresh fish. I always get yellowtail sashimi when I go for sushi and this was pretty good... not the best... but relatively fresh tasting. They have a huge selection of rolls... all of which were pretty delicious. 
Quick service. Hot sake. Good sushi. I enjoyed it.

I've been going to Osaka for ~10 years now & have yet to have a poor experience. Their seafood is always fresh & delicious. Servers are always attentive & kind. All of their special rolls make me super happy (especially the play boy & play girl) & their agedashi tofu is still the BEST I have ever tried... and trust me, I've been on the hunt for years! Ever since they introduced all you can eat lunches, I visit this spot now more than ever.

First time in Denver and we were craving some sushi.  Our hotel was right down the street in cherry creek so we decided to take the 5 minute walk.  Eye appeal from the street isn't going to get you to walk through the door, but the food will keep you coming back.

We had a fantastic experience here.  From the start we were greeted warmly and with a smile.  We sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chefs were quick to say hello.  We decided to order a Cupid roll, a Avalanche roll, fresh oysters, red snapper (both) sushi and sashimi, and wahu sushi.  In addition, we ended up having a couple bottles of Nigori Sake which was fantastic.  

The food here was served quickly and it was all delicious.  Our favorites of the night were the red snapper sashimi and the fresh oysters.  Both very fresh and large portions too!  The rolls were creative and the presentation was flawless. 

I enjoyed it here and if I'm ever in Cherry Creek again I'd have no issue stopping in for a second go around.

To be honest, we weren't sure about this place when we first pulled up... But we should've remembered to never judge a book by its cover!!

Started off our meal with gyoza and weren't disappointed! Some of the best dumplings I've ever had and they came out of the kitchen fast, which was an indicator that the service would continue to be top notch (which it was!!).

We then ordered two rolls: Avalanche and Spicy Crunchy. The Avalanche had a lot going on, but was warm, fried, and filling. The Spicy Crunchy was like a spicy tuna roll 2.0 and I'd highly recommend both.

Saw another reviewer telling people to try the Nuclear Roll, but we very quickly ruled that out as the description said "very very very very very spicy" :)

If we ever come back to this part of town, we'll definitely be back to sample some more sushi rolls!
Great food and amazing staff.   Great Colorado roll which is warm and melts in your mouth.   Many other great choices.

Warning: Do not come here for the all you can eat special (it's 99% rice)

With that warning out of the way my friend got their lunch special box and it was perfect! :) For being a sushi bar in Denver I am very impressed. It's a simple restaurant, and it has that feeling like it has been around forever. The service was fantastic, and I would definitely come back to eat their lunch special :)

Omg! Hard to find; it's tucked in the back of a grocery store shopping center that time has forgotten, but mercy the food here was incredible. Sushi and sashimi (chefs choice), spectacular desserts (we loved the creme brulee and the triple dance chocolate mousse. We came back a second night just for dessert because it was SO GOOD. The people were incredibly nice too.

The rolls were awesome. If just judging off the rolls it would be the best sushi in Denver. However I would say the sushi itself wasn't that impressive. We had tuna, fatty tuna, and yellowtail. It was still good and maybe the fact that they brought out the sushi after my husband and I crushed 4 rolls, or maybe it just wasn't the best. Overall though, I would definitely recommend this place. The service was great, our waitress was really sweet and on top of it. I also enjoyed the atmosphere.

Years after our favorite sushi restaurant closed its doors we wandered into Osaka Sushi and bumped into our favorite chef Goro working there. Since this time we've  been coming here for a few years and always have a great experience. The staff is friendly the owner always inviting and the food is divine. Keep up the good work!

Very good sushi!
When I first walked in, I was concerned with a slight smell, but I know I'm sensitive so I sat at the bar. 
The Chefs were friendly, and a mix of Korean and Japanese. 
They started with a bit of kimchi and some miso (I like both, and both were good here).
Anywhere I go, I always get one specialty roll and some mixed nigiri and sashimi, and was not disappointed in either at Osaka. The yellowtail was awesome!
Finally, if you have never had FRESH wasabi, you don't know what you're missing. And theirs was a very good accompaniment to the meal.

I wanted to be impressed, I really did, but I wasn't. I had the Cupid roll, masago and California roll. My boyfriend got some fried beef something or other, he referred to it as the most white thing you can order. He said his was great. Mine just tasted off, all of it. Maybe it was just me, because I heard a lot of other people LOVING it. Maybe my tastebuds are off today. The prices are a little high for what you get. They don't take AMEX, this hurt my heart. They don't give out mints, but instead cappuccino candies, which were a nice twist.  The menu has pictures of everything on it, which is very nice if you're not familiar with specific rolls or food. Based on all the buzz around me and the constant flow of traffic, you should give it a try, it just wasn't for me.

So delicious! Their menu has different options than I've seen on other menus, plus all the ones I love. Great sushi selection, loved the Ichiban roll so much, also tried and really like the Colorado roll, spicy tuna roll and the scallop sushi. Everything seemed fresh and it I will definitely go back!

So I think the food is good. Not super amazing great, but reasonably priced and good. I wish they had more non-mayo, non-tempura, non-crab special roll options. The reason it gets 5 stars is for customer service. We were there last night, and asked if they did anything special for our friend's birthday. The manager responded by literally giving a free sake bomb to everyone in the restaurant (photo attached). I thought this only happened in movies. Also, I have never seen so many non-Asian children happily eat at a Japanese restaurant before. Would return a million times.
I have been going here for a little over a decade! A nice, relaxed sushi place to get your good sushi on. Don't be fooled at its hidden location; it gets pretty packed. But always a place to sit.

This review was based on the "all you can eat" lunch special, which apparently was a mistake to order. 

First of all, I don't get all the reviews that rave about this place.  I mean it's entirely possible that the "all you can eat" menu has completely different food than the regular menu, but if the former is that much worse then they shouldn't even offer it.

So, about the food... We had some nigiri sushi, I ordered tuna and yellowtail, and my friend ordered crab.  Crab was imitation crab, and the tuna was a tiny sliver on a big piece of rice.  You couldn't taste the fish if you ate the whole thing in one bite.  Same with the yellowtail.  We ordered "dynamite" which basically ended up being a bowl of mayonnaise with I don't know what else in there.  Green mussels, which I don't like to begin with, came with more of that "dynamite" mayo. The roll, tuna crunch roll, also had way too much rice, you couldn't taste any of the filling.  The tempura was on the greasy side, and the udon was bland.  We ordered quite a bit of variety, yet there was nothing that I would characterize as "good."

One would think that this was a good deal at $17 per person, but for the quality of food I received, I certainly don't think it was.

Wonderful sushi! We were extremely happy with our food. Great selection of rolls, varieties of sashimi and even desserts. Our waitress suggested the mega lotto roll - it was gooey and delicious. The Hamachi and Toro were both fatty and fresh. The people next to us ordered the "love boat" and it was a quite extravagant mix of sushi served in a huge wooden boat. Our service was slow but friendly, and it was Valentine's day weekend after all. We'll definitely be back.

No fuss sushi. Sit, eat, enjoy, and leave happy! We probably eat here twice a month because it is a good neighborhood sushi restaurant....definitely one of my family's favorites because it's easy, you can just pop in. The owners are warm and friendly and the staff are courteous and timely. The sushi is always reliable and delicious, what more could you ask for. Tom the waiter is amazing!!!!!

I have to start by saying that I don't eat Sushi. I don't eat any fish for that matter. But I married a woman who loves sushi. This is one of her favorite sushi restaurants. She says the sushi is alway great...a little on the pricey side...but great. I judge sushi restaurants by their non sushi food. Most of the time I order chicken...but most sushi places overcook their chicken. I tried their beef here and it was very good. Cooked perfect.

Came for all you can eat lunch. DO seaweed salad green muscles, gyoza, and tempura. DONT anything off the sushi menu for all you can eat. Excessive amount of rice. Worst quality of paper thin fish I have ever had. ie clam, tuna, eel. Yellow tail was descent, but how can you mess up Saba? 
Don't do all you can eat. Unless you just order from the kitchen.
This is the Place WAS great before but we went two weeks ago and is now with New Crew  is completely different , No Taste at all , the Sushi Rolls started Falling in parts we were very disappointed .

Honestly, I think this is one of the best sushi places in town. Top five for sure.  Great atmosphere, the staff is very friendly and welcoming.  They always have fresh specialty fish on the menu.  If jay is in the house, chances are, he'll enjoy a shot with you.  Stop by if you want top quality sushi.

I Googled sushi places near Colorado blvd and Alameda and came across Osaka Sushi. Tucked away off Colorado behind Rubio's Baja Grill, I wouldn't have known about it. The place is kind of tiny and not good for large groups. I ordered a California roll, a Colorado roll, yellowtail sushi and miso soup. Everything was great! The Colorado roll was a Cali roll covered with baked salmon and smothered in a sweet sauce. I actually ate everything, and that typically doesn't happen. The server was attentive and quick at refilling my iced tea. I will be back for sure.  Great sushi place!

Osaka sushi was not only delicious and priced well, but the owner gave me a beer while waiting for my takeout order. This seems silly to be so excited about, but it goes to show how much they care about their customers. Apparently, the fresh fish menu on the wall behind the sushi bar is amazing. I had the vegetable tempura, seaweed salad, spicy tuna roll, and playboy roll. All of which were amazing as I said above. I highly  recommend this place. Plus, it was packed and the atmosphere seemed really fun!

What a hidden gem! I live right here and had no idea how good this place is. It's tiny inside and got very crowded right after 6 on the Thursday I was there. I can see why it got so crowded! The sushi is very good, as is the service. My family and I enjoyed every roll we tried. To top it off they have green tea ice cream (my favorite) and they give you a generous serving. 

If you love spicy rolls they have something called the nuclear roll, if you finish they give you a bottle of sake! I'm too chicken to try that, I can only handle tiny amounts of wasabi. But I'm sure there are plenty of brave souls out there that would enjoy this challenge.

I'm always skeptical about sushi places in Colorado but this place was worth the price and the wait! I'm sure I'll be back.
Great service and amazing lobster tempura rolls!

I travel to the Cherry Creek area for work almost every week and I eat sushi at least once every trip I make. I have tried several of the other sushi spots around here and this is absolutely the best. This place honestly gives my Houston sushi spot a run for its money. 
I had the seared tuna sushi - THE BEST I have ever had, hands down no hesitation.
Philadelphia Roll - some places in Denver seem to put cucumber in philly rolls and exclude the avocado and that is so wrong, Osaka does it right. Salmon, cream cheese and avocado. 
Ichiban - OMG. I had them add cream cheese (which can sometimes be confusing but these guys totally got me) and it reminds me of the first roll I ever fell in love with. Amazing. 
I cannot believe this place is landlocked. 
Osaka has an atmosphere that I love. I feel completely comfortable going in alone and enjoying a nice relaxing dinner but they have plenty of space for large groups. It seems to be family or personally owned, I felt like everyone that worked there cared. 
The service is fantastic (this was my second time visiting - they were extremely busy my first time) and the guys behind the sushi bar were fun to chat with. It really reminds me of my go-to sushi spot at home and that's why I'll be visiting Osaka every time I crave sushi in Denver.

Literally the best place ever. Amazing owners, excellent food!

On Fridays there are free saki bombs for everyone.
Best sushi in town!  We adore this place and have come here for years. Owner and staff always remember us and make us feel so invited!

I wasn't  happy with the sushi,  just didn't have good flavor for the AYCE. The nigiri had way too much rice.  I definitely prefer sushi katsu for flavor and portions. the service was friendly and prompt.

The all you can eat weekend buffet is a complete scam. Not only that. When we first started they said that they won't charge my 2 year for the buffet. So we started to have lunch there. After we finish eating they decided to charge my daughter. All she ate was 1 bean! The waitress kept on apologizing.
 
So now the food. The fish barely covers the rice! If you don't eat the rice than they will charge you for individual pieces. The edamame bean was under cook. That is why my daughter only ate one bean. The regular sushi on the other table looks good, but I didn't order any. After they rip me off by charging my daughter. Never ever going back. Enjoy the 3 dollars you got from charging my 2 year old daughter and lost of all future business from me.

Really like this place. The female owner is top notch. She brings you tea when you wait for you pick up order. The man owner cares more about his waiter than customers. He is like scare of them.  This one waiter gave me a hard time splitting my bill. He rise his voice to me. This male waiter  was so lazy. The boss was looking at us, but the waiter could give ditto.  I explain to the waiter, and he finally split it. The thing is that it should not be so difficult. If I want my bill split up, I should get it split up.  I came here a few times, and I would continue. Since I can't determine when the female owner is there, I make sure I avoid the bad vibe from that waiter by not going here.

My husband and I love this place. The food is great, the service is friendly. The only complaint I have is that they always bring the check before asking for dessert. 

I love their rolls - very creative and indulgent.

We went there and gorged ourselves for under $70. It was great. Drinks, main courses, rolls, and dessert.

It was.. ok.. 

had spicy tuna (not spicy or tuna tasting), sunamono (Very sweet sauce) 
and nigiri Ikura (Great news is it was fresh! though bland), Tai (Tasted good), Maguro (Bland and cut weird.)

I saw all the plates going over the counter : the presentation was very impressive !

This place has some really good sushi. I would defiantly Come back when I'm in the area or not just to get my sushi from here. The prices are not bad, I would say In-between. They don't bother you even few minutes so you can enjoy your time here. We sat at a table but left the sushi bar a tip.

Nice place extremely friendly staff ,fresh fish always!!
I come here at least twice a month it it's always great.
Cozy environment and cool patio for the summer days.I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

I am somewhat new to sushi, Osaka has definitely set the bar high.  I have tried different sushi restaurants in town, and this is my favorite by far.  The staff is always willing to help find the sushi/roll that best fits your desire.  Kay is my favorite server.  She always has a smile on her face and is so warm and friendly.  I highly recommend this place
Best sushi I've had in many years. Came from Colorado Springs and would definitely make that trip again just to eat here.

Update 10/13/15 - They're still awesome, of course. My teenage boy and I always leave the table stuffed. Knowing that we just stuffed ourselves with fresh, high quality food is also very important to me and I know I get that at Osaka.

It is, hands down, the best sushi I've ever had. The staff is very friendly, the presentations are attractive (some even beautiful), and the prices are reasonable. I know my selections will be fresh, prepared properly and that the flavors will be on point. 

As other reviewers have noted, the exterior isn't notable. It's tucked away from the street in a strip mall in a corner unit, it's not spalshy in the least. I don't find this an issue since I use the internet to find restaurants, and that's exactly how I found Osaka Sushi. Seating is a little close, but it's a small establishment. It's very clean, which is a big deal for me, and ups the appeal (and my likelihood to recommend it to others) quite a bit. I place a lot of importance on cleanliness. If the dining room is sparkling, chances are the kitchen(s) are, as well.

Sushi lovers, I believe, will not be disappointed with their visit to Osaka Sushi.

***Update 3/9/16***

We've tried 3 sushi places in Colorado Springs since moving back last month. Osaka remains the favorite. We hope to visit them again very soon. We miss you, Osaka!

Nothing complex about this place which is why I loved it. Inside was nice and there is an outdoor patio too. 

The sushi and tempura were great, especially for the price, and the service was good. I'll definitely be returning

One of the best sushi restaurant in Denver. All there rolls are amazing. You should try the yellowtail grilled. 

The service is excellent.

We came in late after a concert & they were so friendly even though it was close to closing time. We had sushi rolls & pieces & all of it was great. I'd recommend the Sensual Roll & Bronco Roll. The Red Snapper & Hawaiian white tuna were both great too.
This is one of two of my favorite sushi spots. Great prices for quality sushi. I always recommend this place.

This place is great! The people that work here are fun and not aggressive.  
The variations of sushi are good. We had...
Ichiban roll
Osaka tataki
Tokyo taco ( oh boy I could eat the seaweed chips all day long)
Denver roll(refreshing)
Scallop sushi
Cold saki sampler 

Delish!

This place is a hoot!
We go Friday nights - the environment is always so fun and upbeat. We were even given free sake bombs that Friday! 
You can tell the owner really takes pride in his restaurant. He's often there smiling and laughing it up, from table to table. A really great, personable guy.
The sushi is better than average, but not exactly sushi den! 
& Besides the chef's picks, I've never batted an eye at the prices! 
I would definitely recommend, especially on a Friday!
Once again Osaka left me satisfied with a belly full of great sushi. Colorado roll and Sensual roll are definitely worth trying.

Great sushi. Decent prices for lunch as well ! Not the cheapest sushi - but definitely worth what you pay. The have a crazy nuclear roll- if you eat the whole roll you get a free sake - really intense ! Literally spicy tuna and half wasabi with habanero hot sauce on top- whew ! Owner is always here!

Osaka is finding itself in my weekly rotation of go-to restaurants.  Solid sushi located right off Colorado Blvd.  My friend and I come here at least once a week for lunch and typically get a heart attack roll each.  We then will share some random roll so we can try everything. Gotta say though, the heart attack roll has my heart.  It has a nice bite to it with the spicy crab and the flavors are delectable. The fish is always fresh.  I have never had a bad experience.  I highly recommend Osaka Sushi if you are in the area and looking for some delicious sushi.

I love Osaka Sushi! I go here probably once a month, and I'd say it's the best sushi in Denver aside from Izakayden and Sushiden (and there's usually no wait for a table). The staff and owners are incredibly nice, and the sushi is always fresh - I can't say the same for a few other places in the area.

I highly recommend the spicy tuna roll!
Very good service and friendly staff. The atmosphere was wonderful, and the sushi was good as well. Overall it was a great experience, and I plan on coming again when I have time.

Our family really enjoys the staff and the atmosphere at Osaka Sushi. Jay the owner really puts forth an effort to interact with his patrons. I went for lunch for the first time to try their all-you-can-eat special for $15. It's only Thursday Friday and Saturday and when I called to ask about it they told me the Sushi pieces were quite a bit smaller if I'd been there previously for dinner. I was told the rolls and appetizers were roughly the same size as dinner. I was a little concerned looking at some of these earlier reviews that said there was absolutely no fish and it was all rice. After reading this I ordered heavy on the rolls and 4 pieces of the sushi. I also ordered a seaweed salad. Seaweed salad was very good. When the sushi came to be honest I was expecting even less fish. I was fine with the portion. I ordered 5 more pieces. There was a lot of rice but hey this is all you can eat for $15. The rolls were as good as dinner. For the price , and for the friendly staff I would definitely go back for the lunch special. The staff in the wonderful food keeps bringing us back year after year.

Went here because of their playboy roll. They also have Dragon roll, all are very fresh. They made it really good in my opinion.

They also got a good place, love the decorations on the wall. Very comfy.

Will come here again.

It took 10 minutes before anyone acknowledged that we had sat down and another 10 to get our drinks. Our shrimp dumpling appetizer was not bad but the sushi we ordered was mediocre at best and incredibly overpriced for the portion size. The roll we got was also covered in cold, deep-fried scallops, which were so bland we ended up picking most of them off. For what we paid ($45 for an appetizer and two rolls) there are many better options out there. I doubt we'll be back to Osaka.

Came here for an early dinner 5pm on a Saturday evening. Unless you are from the area, it hard to tell that this place exists. It's best seen off Exposition. It behind another business.  The atmosphere of the restaurant is bright, warm and relaxing.  There was a party and a couple people at the sushi bar and a few people in booths. There isn't a lot of space so we got there in time before the weekend dinner rush.  You can tell its a authentic sushi/Japanese restaurant when the sushi makers are all Asian :-) Our waitress was very nice and attentive.  I wasn't feeling sushi that night but they had a great selection of rolls and the menu has pictures so that is a plus.  I ordered the Chicken Katsu (my fall back aside for Udon soup) and it was good, I didn't like the fact they put the katsu sauce on top of my meal. I'm use to the side of sauce.  Putting it on top made the panko crust soggy.  My boyfriend ended up getting the chicken yaki soba noodles.  The miso soup was good. The mochi was ok, a little freezer burn.  Based on our meal that night, it was ok. I will definitely come back to taste some of their rolls.

After working nearby for a few days, my colleague and I were ready for some sushi. We found this place on Yelp, and decided to try it since it was a mile from our hotel and the reviews looked good.

It is behind Rubio's (same building), but we saw it right away. There is ample parking in the strip mall. We were greeted and seated immediately at a table in a cool little glassed-in area. It overlooks the parking lot (oh well), but was cozy. Ambience is pretty basic. Linen tablecloths and napkins, but not super-fancy.

I had a cup of green tea and the Super Bowl (spicy) - basically hwe dup bap (or Korean chirashi, I like to say to make my Kor-Am friends angry). It was a large bowl, and really delicious. Rice, greens, a generous amount of sashimi, lots of colorful tobiko, and the sauce on the side. I would go back for this.

My colleague ordered three rolls and said they were amazing. He couldn't finish three pieces of the spicy tuna roll, and the server asked him, "Was something wrong?" He said, "No! There are only three pieces left, so obviously not."

Nice service, great food. I hope these folks stay in (delicious) business a long time.

Disappointing. $12+ for a tiny rainbow roll that made me nauseous. They get points for having nice staff and being well decorated but for the money I would rather go elsewhere. Denver has lots of good sushi places. I won't return.

I would live here if they'd let me! Amazing sushi. Great service. Great location. The owner and staff are always happy. They make us feel at home. Been coming here for close to a decade now. The Colorado roll is the best!

We were pleasantly surprised. The food was amazing, and the rolls had flavors that were so different than anything we've had before. The service was very friendly and efficient. The prices were a little high, but worth it when you taste the quality. 

The atmosphere is a little dated, and could use a refresh, but the food more than makes up for it. We live an hour away, but will definitely be sure to get back here again.
Couldn't even stay because the place literally smells like a toilet. It's not like a faint odor either. It's like someone dropped a deuce under your table.

Ok, I'm a sushi snob.  I'm also a sake snob... so I figured that I would probably lean towards the 2-star folks who know their sushi and not the 4-star folks who seem Ok with everything being fried and covered with mayo.  But that's not what this was.  They had tons of unusual items, and even my beloved shiso and quail egg for the masago.  And here's the best part: they have my favorite sake at about $5 less per bottle than the next guy.  

Good selection, some unusual roll combinations (that were really tasty!), and above average sushi.  It's not the "best in Denver," but it's pretty damn good.

One of my favorite sushi places in Denver! They have creative rolls, which I love, and the fish is clearly fresh. The atmosphere is what makes it unique though. The servers are very friendly and I have a great sushi night story thanks to Osaka.

My boyfriend and I came in to Osaka a few months back.  He had never been before, but I had visited a few times. We're immediately seated and notice a large party in the middle of the dining room.  As we debate what they're there for, the owner (or who I'm assuming was the owner) comes out and makes the longest line of sake bombs I have ever seen. It was all the way down the sushi bar, twice. The whole time he is singing and laughing, and the whole restaurant is into it. They proceed to pass out the sake bombs to EVERYONE in the restaurant, not just the party in the middle, who were celebrating multiple birthdays. Everyone cheered as we toasted the birthday people and drank our free sake bombs. The owner continued singing and dancing around the restaurant, and it was a blast.  My boyfriend fell in love with Osaka that night, and we try to come in regularly.  Haven't had another experience like this yet, but we're always hopeful!

Rating: 5/5 stars
Good for: groups, date night, foodies

Born and raised in Denver and have been eating sushi since high school. 

Osaka has the best roll I have ever had. It is called the Colorado Roll and it is unlike anything I have had elsewhere. It has Crab Meat, Avocado, and Cucumber topped with baked Salmon and the baked salmon is the kicker. Melt in your mouth buttery taste that is out of this world. 

Don't miss this roll! The service is good and the prices are fair. The only two complaints I have is there is no wine special on happy hour and they don't open until 4:30 on Sundays. 

COLORADO ROLL ALL THE WAY!

I wish I could give this place 5 stars, because as far as my enjoyment of it goes, it deserves it. But I'm a realist and 5 star reviews are only saved for the best of the best. So this place gets a 4, a high-five, a you-should-go-there and a this-place-is-awesome.

I love Osaka. First time there the owner was celebrating something and called us into a sake-bomb train. Needless to say, we didn't need to be asked twice. How fun is that?

Service can be hit or miss, though I go here so often I notice that the poor servers tend to not last long. So overall it's generally pretty good.

The sushi is good. It's not the BEST in the world but it's definitely one of the best sushi spots in Denver. I've reached out to other yelpers who've left negative reviews about Osaka to ask where they prefer to eat, because honestly I've had a hard time finding better sushi than Osaka for the price, and no one's been able to provide anything worthwhile. I honestly think they might've just had a bad single experience and wrote this place off. Big mistake.

Osaka isn't the cheapest option in Denver. As a matter of fact, it might be a bit over-priced. But all sushi is in Colorado, and for the quality they provide and the atmosphere it's in (super laid back, wear whatever you want, ultra friendly owner) I always enjoy myself eating at Osaka.

Hint - sit at the bar. You'll get faster service and a free small pickled snack :)

Osaka is my go-to sushi joint and I recommend to everyone it become theirs.

This place is probably one of the hidden gems in the city in terms of sushi. If you're somebody who loves hole in the walls and sushi, you absolutely have to try this place! We love the rolls but my favorite dish is the Super Bowl! It's a bowl of rice, fresh salmon and tuna, some vegetables and a spicy red sauce. The pieces of salmon and tuna are amazingly thick and fresh! The owner Jay and his wife are so nice and definitely create a family like environment. Their daughter Esther is pretty cool too!

I was introduced to Goro (head sushi chef) by a friend and colleague years ago, he will not disappoint - he is a sushi magician!  The restaurant is clean, and simple casual.  The menu is typical for most Sushi joints, but I've never had an average meal here.  The preparation, quality of fish and overall delivery is excellent.  Caution: Goro has Mondays off :).

Visited my family for the thanksgiving and this is where my sister wanted to bring me to eat right after my flight. Now I see why! I had the most amazing dinner. I hate airport food so coming here after a flight was delightful.
Not the best sushi in town by any means, but it was overall enjoyable.  If anything the place needs a facelift.
This is my favorite sushi restaurant in all of Denver. The sushi and service is always fantastic, plus the owner is very nice. I always recommend Osaka to my fellow sushi lovers!

Very very very delicious and quite creative with the sushi roll options. I have to say one of the best things I've had for a long time is the Cupid Roll which is a basic crab roll topped with a deep fried scallop and Unagi (eel) sauce. The balance of crunchy and melty is phenomenal! 

I was also impressed with the Caterpillar Roll which is eel and avocado. Finally, a decent place that gives you a hearty portion of eel! I also enjoyed the octopus which was just the right combination of chewy and yummy.

As I mentioned, the prices here are bit more expensive than I normally like but for the quality of sushi I would be willing to pay a tad bit more for this mouth watering experience.

There are a ton of seating options for such a small place. You can sit at the bar, a table, a booth or even outside on the patio. I plan to enjoy some outdoor sushi upon my next visit - even if it's in the dead of winter!

Employees here were really quick and nice. I believe it was the owner who asked us about the meal as we were leaving. He was funny and really showed that he cared about his customers and their experience. Quality service for sure!

This is a great place - it's well hidden from the main drag of Colorado Blvd. so only the Yelpers in the know can find it. Go get you some!

Welcoming owner and service was great. I ordered the Super Bowl which was loaded with fresh sashimi, fish eggs, greens/lettuce - all nicely presented. The server was very attendant and thorough. The fish was fresh and portion sizes ample. I think prices were as expected. Noticed some reviewers commenting the price was high but if you want quality fish I would not want to pay "bargain" prices.

Wow! We moved here from South Florida a year ago (I grew up in Alaska, where there is a large Japanese population and grew to love sushi) and have struggled to find a great sushi place. We trusted fellow Yelper's and they did not lead us astray!  Our server was knowledgeable and incredibly friendly. She recommended some FANTASTIC sushi (black snapper, anyone?) and we decided to eat those as an appetizer before ordering another Deluxe Combo.  We will definitely be back and have found our sushi home in Denver!!!
Great sushi! Try the Osaka special! Second best sushi in Denver!!, not to expensive either, the miso soup was great also!

My husband and I went here on the night of our wedding. We had a morning ceremony so dinner wasn't part of our plans. We decided after  long joyous day to go somewhere nearby and light. From their menu you can tell that crab is their favorite ingredient for rolls. Overall we had a good experience, nothing blew us away, but it all tasted good and the service was friendly.

Great spot for sushi!
Found this place on a business trip and it is fantastic.  Lots of good choices and everything I've tried has been good.

I'm an NYC transplant that's lived here for a year and this is the freshest sushi I've had so far. There is absolutely nothing fancy about the decor (in fact it's a little beat up) but I'll deal with it for some fresh fish and great service. 

This is the first place I've been too in Denver that wasn't confused by the question "what's fresh today?". That's probably because they already have that information listed on their specials board. They had a great selection of fish that was brought in the day I was there (red snapper, black snapper, baby yellowtail, spanish mackeral, halibut, and more). 

The service was also great here. My server was friendly and knowledgable. She made great recommendations and really added to the whole experience.

I would recommend this place if you are looking for fresh fish. It's also great for Americanized sushi lovers since they have a menu with pictures and all the regular deep fried saucy rolls. There's definitely something for everyone here. I will definitely be coming back!

How does this place get such great ratings?!?!? The rolls have hardly any sushi associated with them. The ingredients are ok. Pretty sure the Edamame was nuked in the microwave. If the rolls were $7-8 I would somewhat understand, but the rolls over $10-$14. So many other places with way better quality food and atmosphere for the same price.

And atmosphere... the food was 2 star, the atmosphere brought it down to 1.

COME ON YELPERS!!! This is not a 4 star place!!!

In town for business and saw the great reviews on yelp so had to try it. It was across the street from the hotel I was staying at tucked away in a strip mall and does not look like anything special from the outside.  Ordered yellowtail, salmon, eel nigiri and playboy roll. It was very fresh and I especially liked their yellowtail.  The only thing was that half the rice from the nigiri pieces would fall out when I picked it up with chopsticks, but the fish was so fresh it didn't bother me as much.  Prices were good for the quality you get.  This is a traditional Japanese sushi place where you go to enjoy fresh sushi, not to go to a trendy place.  Would definetly come back again.

I am from out of town and this Japanese Restaurant was right across from my hotel. I was REALLY IMPRESSED with how authentic and delicious this place was. Exactly what I was craving. The place was clean, the sushi was very fresh. I came back more than once during my trip.
Good sushi, a little overpriced. I think there is better sushi elsewhere in Denver.
We are here once a month. Everything is great - rolls to service to prices.....playboy roll is awesome. Sit at the sushi bar for a change...so fun!

Wow! This is our new favorite spot for sushi. It's already difficult to come by a good place for sushi in Denver, but this place surpassed our expectations! I had the ichiban roll and it was magnificent. My bf also greatly enjoyed his roll. We love the quaint atmosphere and the service was excellent. We can't wait to go back for another date night!

Overall great eating experience. Fast, cheerful, staff and clean atmosphere. 

Food was great. Large house salad and their combination rolls have a few unique options that will leave any sushi fan happy. 

If you are looking for a solid sushi choice in Denver that is family friendly and not too hard on the wallet - this is it. 

If you are looking for fancy, overly fresh fish and higher end atmosphere try Sushi Den.

In addition to the happy hour BOGO domestic beer and hot sake, this is a really great sushi place, especially if you're near Glendale and don't want to stray too far.

The prices for their regular sushi rolls are pretty nice, in the $4-6 range.  Their prices for their specialty rolls are a bit more expensive than average, $10-14.  That being said, their specialty rolls are great.  Prices on nagiri are pretty standard.  If you eat a combo of basic and specialty rolls, you'll probably spend about the same amount as you would anywhere else.  And their house salads are HUGE - it's a 9" or 10" plate - so plan for that if you're getting soup, salad, and sushi.

I unfortunately haven't had any of their other menu items, but I'm sure they're great.

A word of warning, if they have their sushi challenge while you're there, DON'T DO IT!  I eat a ton of hot things.  Most things that people think are inedible, I think taste a little spicy.  Their challenge is to eat a (forget what the name is) roll.  It's spicy fish of some sort - it really doesn't matter, because you will taste no fish - with a couple types of hot chili sauces.  And it's not a dab, it is several tablespoons-full.  What do you get?  A small, cheap bottle of sake if you finish it.  What did I leave with?  A shirt with pit stains, chest-sweat stains, and we'll just say "a lower GI tract" that wasn't happy with me and burned for 12 hours.

PS - the service is great always.  They even cheered me on a bit when I was all sweaty and gross from the aforementioned roll.

To be fair, I can't speak to the quality of their regular menu. However, I can say that Osaka's all you can eat lunch buffet was terrible! I apologize in advance for not taking pictures of the paper thin sushi with huge oversized balls of rice. I get it rice is cheaper than fish. but if you appreciate and respect the art and balance of quality food , you will not want to dine here. 

Lastly and kind of a funny story.  When I was leaving the owner came up to me with a bowl of half eaten rice that I removed from the bottom of the paper thin sushi and said you must eat this. I swear he really did!  I was like seriously??? Made me laugh! Anyway, terrible buffet and completely clueless owner!

Don't let the southern comfort decoration fool you, these sushi rolls are the bomb! The sensual toll (funny to say) is delicious! The Colorado roll and playboy are my other favorites.... Have not been disappointed yet! Yum yum yum!
Great environment! Very friendly staff! Oh, and the sushi was awesome!!! We had several different things but we always go back to spicy salmon roll as our fav!

This is one of my husband and I's FAVORITE sushi places, ever. We drive from Lakewood to eat here, and it is always worth the drive. 
The service is great, and the sushi rolls are amazing. We haven't had one that we don't like. 
Our favorite is the Playboy and Sensual Roll. YUM!

Great dining experience. Jay makes you feel like you are a part of the family. A quiet atmosphere great if you want to talk to your table. My personal favorite is the Osaka roll and sensual roll, both good for people new to sushi. 

If you come on a Friday or Saturday night be prepared to take a saki bomb with the sushi chefs. Great place with quality sushi and fair prices.

After reading a bunch of  excellent reviews about this restaurant I was convinced to try this place out.

I ended up ordering a lunch combo, which included simo soup, salad, 2 california rolls, tempura veggies and salmon. It was actually a good deal for the price, but the rolls were rather small and the rice was just bad, which gave the sushi a weird texture that I particularly didnt like. I've tried a lot of sushi, and these rolls were the worst I've ever tried, not because of the flavor, but because maybe the way they cook the rice or the type or rice they use isn't the appropiate. My brother in law ordered a 2-piece white tuna rolls and they were tiny too and he was so hungry and he paid around 25 dollars for the rolls and 1 beer. He was actually dissapointed and so was I  I had high expectations and this place is not at all a good or excellent sushi place as I read in the previous reviews. I would only come back for the lunch combo. The rest is just too small and expensive

Osaka is truly the hands down best sushi spot in Denver. The playboy roll is my absolute favorite. One of the best things I can say about Osaka is that the quality of food is consistently amazing! Highly recommend this restaurant to all.

My team headed to Next Door for lunch, because one team member liked it and we needed a spot that could easily seat 10 for lunch about 15 minutes after we made the decision to go there. Check and check. 

Everyone nommed on the smashers - don't skip them for salad, at least not the first time you head over. I opted for the roasted chicken lunch special. It was *excellent.* My colleagues had burgers, calamari, and salmon, and while I didn't get individual reviews, I think the yummy noises spoke for themselves. The happy hour menu also looks awesome, so we'll be back for sure!

Next Door Union Station is part of The Kitchen Family of restaurants. Its a bit of a dressed down version of The Kitchen restaurant a few blocks away. But that doesn't mean much of the vibe has been lost. (Nor the price either) Also they have a great happy hour with cheap beer! 

Next Door is a good lunch spot for those who work in LoDo and want something a little nicer and healthy. I use it often for staff lunches as a nice place to reward people for doing a good job that doesn't break the bank. I do think the lack of french fries is a bummer but the potato smashers are delicious and the food is always clean and tasty. 

I recently took Claire C and my family here for dinner. I like it even more with a beer in my hand an a happy hour menu on the table. I absolutely LOVED the fried pickles. Sliced thin with a distinct flavor they are my new fav. The dates too. Wow so much flavor in such a delish package. Well done to whoever created both of those. And for only a few dollars both are totally a well worth appetizer. Also, the Bahn Mi Burger is great too. Especially with a beer. Did I mention that Next Door is way better with a beer? Yup Beer.

Food was good but nothing unexpected. The service was terrible for a new restaurant in Union Station. Basically, go anywhere else.

The smashers were tasty and properly cooked. The bacon wrapped dates were also good and the spicy sauce that it came with paired well. The sliders were average; cooked correctly but flavors were so-so.

The service was terrible. We came in with our kids and friends kids on Sunday afternoon. We sat outside and waited a prompt 20 minutes for a waiter to come by with water and to take our drink order. Brutal considering there were three other tables outside that he was going over to frequently. The server also seemed quite disinterested in our group maybe assuming that with kids we weren't well off or weren't going to spend money there? 

Either way, skip this dump and chose another of the amazing restaurants in Union Station to eat at.

This is a nice, casual restaurant within Union Station that can be frequented for a variety of occasions. My friend recommended it based on her many good experiences here.

I only ordered a local Denver Beer Co. fruit beer and a salad but enjoyed them both. We had to sit inside unless we wanted to wait for an outdoor table, but it was fine. The inside is really cute and welcoming.

We were served fairly quickly and on our way!

I've been a long time fan of this causal eatery and have gone to multiple locations in the past. Their seasonal menu is dedicated to showcase the best ingredients of local market with a modern twist!  The family of restaurants support local school gardens by donating a portion of their profits!

The location of this establishment is perfect for exploring downtown and grabbing a bite to eat afterwards.  The long bar tops are really cool and the neon light display above the bar gives it a urban feel to the space!  The outdoor patio is simply the best spot for people watching and enjoying the view of the water features in the square!

I've had their hummus plate, beet burger, salmon sandwich and pickled veggies and they were all incredibly well prepared!  We stopped by tonight for a light bite and some beer. We ordered the sweet and spicy shrimp on a bed of coleslaw. It's definitely got some kick to it from the Siracha sauce!  While we enjoyed the flavor combo and the fresh veggies, it would've been better if the app came with some sort of bread or crackers to offset the pungent flavors.  The portions are bit on the smaller side compared to the hummus and veggie plate.  

Overall, I'd come back in a heart beat when I'm in the area for some healthy food and to support their mission of "Community Through Food."

I would have liked to actually drink/eat here, but that didn't happen.

My friends and I decided to grab some drinks and appetizers in the Union Station area. This was one of the first places we went to since my local peeps had never been there before (and we wanted them to try something new). 

Unfortunately, there was a 15-20 minute wait for seating indoors and outdoors. That's not usually a problem....but the place was half filled. Perhaps they didn't have enough staff...but the hostess didn't come across as particularly friendly....so we left.

It looked like a nice place with potential, but there are lots of other choices in the area.
Food was okay. Got the merlins carolina pork and it didn't really have a taste but the "fries" were good. Service was alright. The environment seems like they are trying to hard be hipster

5/16/2016 - Came to The Kitchen Next Door by mistake looking for another place. Best mistake ever made! It is a beautiful location. I love the grey, dark green and orange colors.
