We came in as soon as they opened and were greeted right away. My friend and I were not too hungry so we decided after looking at their extensive menu that we wanted to try a little bit of everything.

Starters: 
* Chorizo stuffed bacon wrapped dates (3 per order $6.95) - Mouth-watering dates with crispy bacon, so flavorful.
* Crispy Garlic Smashers ($7.95) Absolutely scrumptious!
Sides:
* Balsamic Beets with almonds and feta crumbles ($3.95) Sweet & Tangy (wish it had more almonds)
* Quinoa Salad ($3.45) My favorite! with the raisins. So refreshing, I could have this dish every day.
* Italian Polenta ($2.95) Even though it wasn't as flavorful as the other dishes, it definitely did not disappoint. 

Kitchen puts our phenomenal top-notch food. The staff works as a Team, KUDOS to management. Highly recommend The kitchen Next Door!!!

Came here on a whim with some friends from Texas.. It was in a Fantastic spot.. Just across the street from Wynkoop Brewery AND Union Station.. Because who doesn't want to check out Union Station!!!
I thought the menu leaned on the pricey side. It was a bit upscale bar food with low key atmosphere! The waitress was very nice and accommodating. We had 6 adults and a toddler. We were able to sit outside enjoy the scenery of the splash area for the kids and still be shaded by the umbrellas and buildings!! The food was decent. I actually ordered off the kids menu, got the slider burger with garlic smashers.. I thought the burger was the right size for me rather than an adult size.. It was still a lot of food. If you super love garlic, order the garlic smashers. If you are so so on the garlic don't get the smashers, they are pretty heavy on the garlic and high on the indigestion scale.
Overall was good. The others with me thought the burgers were decent.. But two of them were made incorrectly and we didn't want to wait for them to be remade.  So it's decent I thought.. But the scenery was pretty fantastic!!

We came here for a friends birthday. Luckily for us it was happy hour which is every day from 3 to 6. We looked at the regular menu but weren't too hungry so we ordered a few things off of the happy hour menu for bites. We tried the fried pickles, the falafel, the cheeseburger slider and the meatballs with polenta everything was super tasty and decent portions considering the $3 - $5 price tag. We had a few different servers during our visit and we attributed that  to shift change. We were well taken care of by all and out last server informed us that they pool their tips. I like this idea and feel that you get better service. I really appreciate the many organic options. Although the prices were not overly inflated because of this. We will definitely go back to order off the real menu another time.

Came here for afternoon happy hour.  I got a burger with "smashers" (lazy cut fried potatoes) and my wife got a salmon salad sandwich with roasted cauliflower in a curry sauce. The burger was fine, nothing special, but the smashers came out tough and stale. My wife was expecting chunks of grilled salmon with lettuce or something in the sandwich, ended up with essentially a tuna salad sandwich made from canned salmon plopped on a burger bun. The cauliflower wasn't cooked well and the texture was soggy and gross.

Sent back the smashers, the cauliflower, and the salmon sandwich. They redid the smashers, which were better but now crazy greasy. The wife ordered a burger slider but by the time we got it we were both ready to just leave. 

Wouldn't recommend it, wouldn't come back. It comes across as trendy and hip with their gluten-free and vegetarian offerings but the execution was just all wrong. Walk 5 minutes outside of Union Station and you have a plethora of better places to grab a bite to eat.

This is currently my favorite happy hour in Denver. They have the most amazing hummus and assorted other small plates (all at great prices), and drink specials as well (house wine is totally decent). Plus, a killer wrap patio that has the most amazing Union Station People Watching. 

Lunch is also super solid; a concise, well-executed menu. It's a seated restaurant downtown, and priced accordingly. 

I'm here a few times a month and the service has always been prompt and friendly, with the most adorable hipster staff.

Once again gave a Union Station restaurant a visit to make sure some family from out of town were able to get their picky selves taken care of. They were quite happy with their dry salads - mission accomplished!

I'm not sure where I heard it, but rumor held that TKND had Fish and Chips and it was rather good indeed. To arrive and find it not on the menu brought me a great deal of sorrow - my quest continues. I opted for a Salmon Salad Sandwich which had good flavor, but the sandwich needed some flair - some lettuce, tomato, and red onion would've really set it off.

I stole some tastes of the Caesar Salad - tasty - and the Tomato Soup - creamy! Our waitress was delightful, so I'll be back around for some tourist watching.

Unfortunately, not a fan. Came here with a work group, and would not go back on my own. 

Ordered the tomato soup and side of roasted cauliflower.

The tomato soup had very good flavor, actually, but was room temperature at best.

The roasted cauliflower was cold (served that way on purpose, but it didn't actually say that on the menu), and it had some kind of VERY UN-TASTY curry mayonnaise all over it. It was actually one of the worst dishes I've ever had! :-(

We visited Denver this weekend and stumbled across next door while looking for somewhere to eat with our friends and this place was perfect!!!! The atmosphere, the food, the service- everything was great! We got a table for 6 and only 2 of us were there for nearly an hour while we waited for the other 4 to join and the server was patient and understanding. We all ended up ordering a ton of food and drinks and had a great time. It's so nice being able to travel and find a healthy and reasonably priced place to eat with a fun vibe. I ordered the Roasted Veggie Salad (it was huge) and the Kale Chips and it was amazing. Others in our group raved about their food, too. We went back the next day for lunch! Highly recommend!!

This was literally the "last stop" on my most recent trip to Denver. We actually came to Union Station on a prior day for coffee and drinks and knew we had to come back to one of the restaurants for a meal. There were several options but we ended up choosing The Kitchen due to their varied menu. We literally waited until the doors opened at 11am to come in and got to pick a primo spot in the dining area across from the bar. Our server was really great; very friendly and continuously checked on us regularly. 

We ordered a variety of items. The Chorizo Stuffed Bacon Wrapped dates were amazing! The only downside was that there were only three. Crispy Garlic Smashers were basically a deep fried small smashed golden potato rolled in delicious garlic and herbs! These were absolutely delicious! I would order these over french fries any day of the week! The Italian Polenta was very good but was sort of bland. We actually mixed the red sauce that came with the dates in it and it was actually very good that way. The Quiona Salad was delicious. I didn't expect it to be served cold but I guess since it's listed as a "salad" I should have. I also ordered the Merlin's Carolina Pork Sandwich per our servers recommend. The BBQ sauce was a tad too sweet for me; I prefer more of a spicy sauce, but the pork was delicious and was perfectly shredded. The only thing I didn't enjoy was the type of bread/bun it came on. I actually ended up eating the BBQ pork, slaw, onion straw, pickle mixture naked without the bun after a few bites. The slaw that came on the sandwich also stood out to me. I enjoy a good cole slaw and this was great! The sandwich was also served with a side of arugula salad which was good mixed with the pork as well. They have a great wine and local beers list, as if that would be different from any other restaurant in Denver! If you're in the Union Station area and are looking for a great place for a meal, definitely recommend a stop in The Kitchen.

Cool happy hour deals including sliders and the usual pub fare. The menu is American comfort food, with vegan and gluten-free options. Pretty decent selection of beers on tap. 

The beet sliders were delicious and big. The BF liked his pulled port slider so much that he ordered a second one.
The roasted veggie salad we shared was quite nice. It had lots of beets and carrots, with beans to up the protein content. What it lacked was a dressing to add a bit of tanginess. 

Nice place for lunch, dinner or happy hour.

I like the kitchen a lot, but for this outpost I feel like they kept a little too much of the price and not quite enough of the food. Seems like the casual neighborhoody vibe should be matched with a little more of the casual neighborhoody prices. Good food, don't get me wrong, and not a bad space, but a little underwhelming all the same.
Amazing Mushroom Ragout... best kale I've ever had in my life!! Minus 1 star... no soda refillls. Nice place.. Thanks Denver.

We came here for happy hour. Great menu options for both food and drink. The beet burger had a lot of flavor considering what it is and the meatballs were really good. Portions sizes were reasonable too. The atmosphere is fun and it's located in a trendy part of downtown denver. Overall pretty good and i would come back again but nothing outstanding

This place was a hop skip n' jump in Union Station.  We sat outside under bright orange umbrellas, watching children enjoy the water fountain in the square.  The happy hour selections were unique, offering local brews. . .refreshing.

All the food here is really great. The crispy garlic smashers are INSANE!! we ended up ordering 2 of them. Service is great and very friendly, with beautiful outdoor seating for warmer nights and happy hour.

The only area of improvement are the drinks, I've been here numerous times and the cocktails seem to be a little too complicated. The sangria was too sweet with cinnamon, margaritas didn't have that tangy punch and the Moscow mule was over saturated with ginger syrup. Stick to a beer if you are getting drinks.

Kitchen Next Door is excellent within the context of what it is - great, reasonably priced food in a casual atmosphere with locally sourced, fresh ingredients. Union Station is a great location, and a great vibe. Have had burgers, a pulled pork sandwich, fish tacos, salads - all very tasty. My five year old daughter had their kids meal - mac and cheese - and loved it. I love their garlic smashers and roasted cauliflower sides (though I see some reviewers were negative about these - I never have any issue). This is not a white tablecloth, "special meal" kind of place - by those standards I would rate it lower. But for a nice business lunch or casual dinner, it is a great option.

Visited the happy hour here many times, weekdays and weekends. Consistent quality options, w plenty of items for veggies as well. Staff is professional and quick. A nice simple option in Union Station amidst a blizzard of fairly fine dining establishments. Outdoor seating by fountain is nice on a summer day.

Super fast lunch service with a good grassfed burger cooked to a proper medium (not careless oops it's well done medium). The honey siracha sauce on the Pineapple Express is good sweet with heat. The roasted cauliflower was a nice surprise, savory with a sweet compliment from the golden raisins. They were out of the butternut squash soup but I'll look for it on a return trip this fall (that and a chance to do happy hour with the interesting list of craft brew. PS kudos to Kevin for friendly, fast, and sincere service :)

Trains may be a outdated way of traveling these days, but it's still somewhat romantic and nostalgic. Union station is a great platform to host these weary travelers (or tourists) who are looking to kill some time. The Kitchen Next Door is a community pub within the station that is reasonably priced especially during happy hour, 3:00-6:00 pm everyday. 

This would be a great place to meet up with friends or co-workers after a long day. The happy hour menu has your typical pub food as well as a number of draft beers. Gluten-free options are numerous. The bacon wrapped dates ($3) come in threes and was on the sweeter side. I found the cheese burger slider ($4) to be quite lackluster and flavorless. However, a couple of highlights include the salt 'n' pepper calamari and the honey sriracha wings (both $5). The Thai butternut squash soup was a little on the bland side, but I did enjoy the sunflower seeds and it's another gluten-free and vegan option. The Odell 'Loose Leaf' is a nice session ale to wash everything down. 

I would stay for a few beers and some of the items on the happy hour menu, but probably not your best option if you want a good sit-down meal.

Went here for an office lunch. It pretty yummy, but not spectacular.

I ordered the mushroom rag-out and shared a plate of garlic smashers with the rest of the party. The garlic smashers came suspiciously quickly and were lukewarm. My boss suspected that they were a misplaced appetizer. However, even in their subpar state, they were crazily addictive. After all, who can resist fried fingerling potato slices doused in Parmesan and garlic? The mushroom ragout was yummy, even more than yummy. The juicy, thick mushroom slices were smothered by a large helping of creamy polenta and topped with tangy, bitter chard. The meal was flavorful and unique, but somewhat lacking in the subtlety and finesse that would make it 5-star worthy. Still, this was a very homey and tasty meal, and the service was quick and polite. So yes, I'd go again to order another helping of garlic smashers and try their burgers.

We walked in today for lunch. Stood at the hostess stand for 20 min along with a long line behind me. No one ever came. I went to ask the bartender if we could just sit because there were lots of open seats but no one was actually available to seat us. The bartender quite rudely told me to continue to wait in line. We ended up getting lunch elsewhere after seeing others in line do the same and after waiting for 30 minutes to be seated despite them having available tables. 

After walking around Union station, we stopped by on the way back for a beer and dessert. The place was totally empty by then. We had an encounter with the same rude bartender as before. She proceeded to tell us that the dessert we ordered would take "a while" since she had to make it herself. Then she practically threw down empty glasses and the glass bottle of water in front of us that it made a startling noise. Did the same with the menus with the couple next to us. Let's hope she was just having a bad day and isn't the norm, but the place seemed pretty uninterested to win over their customers for a return visit. Disappointing.

Honestly, all I had was some beers and an ice cream sandwich but my service was so outstanding it is an automatic five. I rarely write yelp reviews but the server Geo was so fantastic I would go back just based on his exceptional service. I hope you read this, owners! He was delightful from start to finish and we were the annoying customers who stayed til closing. Lovely patio on summer night!

Food was yummy. I ate upstairs with my uncles at the cooper lounge so I ended up being kind full but we ate outside and had some yummy fish tacos, calamari, potatoes and salmon with kale. The local Denver brewing port that had on the menu was also tasty. It's great that there are so many good options at union station, especially this place with so much indoor and outdoor seating.
Good food but it is always busy! We had a 45 minute wait at 10:45am on a Tuesday. Most times we just buy a coffee and a pastry from the cafe side instead of waiting to get a seat.

Been here a couple of times for lunch and dinner. The food is great and the patio is perfect when the weather is nice. My biggest frustration is the service-on both occasions we waited about 30 minutes or more for our food. Not ideal when you're on a lunch break from work :( Neither our server or the manager acknowledged our food was so slow, which really does go a long way (I waited tables for years, so I understand things happen, but at least just apologize!). 

I'm willing to keep going back as long as I'm not in a hurry somewhere!
Yummy food, healthy, veg/gf options, located next to union station, pretty view, workers work fast it was busy and we got seated right away

Celebrated a birthday here with a group of six. Wasn't a particularly memorable experience. Apps and entrees were fine. There were a lot of gluten free and vegetarian options. We ordered everything from beet to burgers to garlic mashers to vegetarian ragout. Everything was fine but it was nothing we couldn't have made at home. Desserts were dense and boring; we ordered five different ones and only liked the lemon cake (it was called Kim's Cake or something close to that). Cocktail menu and beer list was small but fine. Two of us had the feature margarita and the others had beer and wine. There was a good seasonal pumpkin beer. The margarita was good, nice and strong, but again it wasn't anything that we couldn't have made at home or ordered at another restaurant. Hosts were not friendly (one person in our group made a comment about the host's "snooty attitude"). The worst part for me was the service. The server did the bare minimum, was not attentive, and made mistakes with both our appetizers and drinks. Overall, the server made us feel like we were an inconvenience. We are an easy group and always try to make things as easy as possible for wait staff when we go out, so this was particularly disappointing.

 On the plus side, the atmosphere is great! It has a refined-casual feel and is a great place to socialize with friends, family, and colleagues. Also, the hand soap in the bathroom smells really good.

We expected more from a Kitchen restaurant, especially having gone to The Kitchen on 16th Street as well as The Kitchen Upstairs in Boulder and having a great experience at both locations. We'll have to give this location another try in the future (and hopefully update this review with more stars).

We love coming here for late night happy hour. Sitting outside watching people, kids, and dogs frolic in the water fountain is so fun. And of course you have the neverending stream of Union Station patrons. I have never had bad service here, the waiters are always conversational, knowledgeable, and prompt. I like their beer options, if you want you can get a 6-oz pour of one of their draft selections for something like $3. (Odells 90 Shilling ftw!) The food is good - bacon and chorizo wrapped dates are to die for. And of course the meal would not be complete without their delicious Adult Milk Shakes - get the salted caramel with whiskey. YUM!  I will say my most unpleasant experience of this place is that the male host who usually seats us, seems to be very unhappy. Never smiles, greets you with a halfhearted "Hi. 2?" and then just lays the menus on the table as he slinks away from your table without even making eye contact or bidding you an "enjoy your meal!" I think he needs a major attitude adjustment.  :-/

Went here on a whim one Saturday night and it was pretty good! 
We started with a couple of apps....Honey Sriracha Wings & Bacon Wrapped Dates. Both were good!
My dinner was a special that was one of the most delicious Patty Melts I've ever had! My hubby had the Pulled Pork sandwich...good as well.
Great casual dining in Union Square.

Bean salad over salty and waiting for Caesar replacement.  House white wasn't at the tight temp.  Need to be colder. 
Chicken soft tacos fell apart. 

Annoyed !

Spending time enojoying friends/family at this restaurant is always a good idea.  From the initial service to the food, you feel as if you're at home, without the load of cooking, dishes, and cleaning up.  The atmosphere and menu are well thought out making for a great and reliable experience each time.
Great food and environment. Nice and casual at the same time. Great beer, awesome salads and those garlic smashers are unreal. Way to go The Kitchen Group.

My boyfriend and I tried this place tonight after stopping in here the other day for a quick drink. Our servers name was Geo (I think) and he was phenomenal! He was very attentive but not too much, funny and didn't seem to care at all about our million questions. The food was delicious! We had the crispy garlic smashers and they are a must order. Don't forget to ask for a side of their house made ranch perfection! We also had the calamari and I ordered the mushroom ragout. My boyfriend had a burger and my friend had the po boy. The food showed up and a hush fell over the table. Not a bad choice in the menu as far as we can tell. The price point for this place is awesome especially considering where it is. Oh and almost their whole menu can be or is gluten free! Major score!! The portions are great so is the food and the service! Can't wait to go back!

Always solid. I frequent here for lunch and HH and everything I have ever had has been tasty and well prepared. 

Service is generally good but they do get busy for lunch (totally understandable and should be expected). Varied beer selection and tasty cocktails.

I thought the food was delicious. The burger was handcrafted, and my chicken caesar had the perfect ratio of dressing to crotons to chicken to fresh cut romaine. My daughter on the other hand... The tomatoes soup is absolutely to die for fresh, puréed tomatoes and seasoning. Being a foodie I found it absolutely two thumbs up, she wanted Campbell's. Haha. My advice, leave the kids at home, enjoy a delicious glass of house made sangria off the happy hour menu, and people  watch to your hearts content.

This is a place my wife loves to come to. Me? Not so much.  It's OK and the food is OK. I don't like the choices of beverages and find the menu items lacking. The Quarterback loves the potato garlic smashers, but one item isn't enough to win me over.  Would it kill to put a Lager on the drinks menu?  This is like so many places that thinks everyone is into craft beer.  We there is a lot of us that aren't. I don't care if its extra hoppy or malty or has some type of fruit in it! I just want a plain old fashioned beer. I had the cuban for lunch and while it tasted OK, it was thin and uninspired looking.  Something that the panini press pushed too hard. I'll be going to the Thirsty Lion from now on.

Affordable? Check!
Delicious? Check!
Strong tasty large dirty martini? Check and Check! (Because I think I had 2)

Food is very tasty and surprisingly affordable for the location. I was prepared to drop a lot more for a plate of mussels.
Small menu which is the biggest reason for 4 stars. Also my mussels were really good but a touch overcooked.

I and two others at my table truly had one of the best burgers here. It wasn't the biggest and it didn't come with fries but all three were perfectly cooked and hot when brought out to the table. You know how you order a burger medium rare or rare so they don't burn the damn thing just hoping it'll come out medium?? Well ours were done as ordered. We actually joked about how we have to order what we don't really want so we get what we want....get it?
Also get the smashed garlic potatoes. They use the little fingerling potatoes, smash them, fry them and sprinkle on this garlic butter sauce... so good. Guess that's why they don't have fries. We love the calamari too!
Inside Union Station

We enjoyed walking through Union Station at Christmas time and checking out all the development here. The restaurant itself had a nice selection of craft cocktails and a relatively small menu. The appetizers were great - garlic smashers, calamari, kale chips, etc. some ordered burgers and loved them. Overall decent place to grab a bite but not worth the 45 min wait on a Friday night. The service was very good!

First time visiting Union Station and this establishment. The service and food was phenomenal! I'm not a fan of warm pineapple on just about anything but took a chance on the Pineapple Express burger and it's to die for! Balsamic pineapple = genius! Brought the whole family and all of us give it 5 stars!

Happy to report they have corrected all of the problems from the review I gave shortly after opening. Happy to recommend both the calamari and margarita to you... though I prefer the mule now! So glad I didn't give up on this place and that they brought the quality up to where it needed to be.

Had a company dinner here and they were able to accommodate about 15 of us out on their patio. We had two phenomenal servers who were excellent and quick on their toes. They made awesome suggestions and brought us out beer samples galore. I'm not Really a beer drinker- but who better to get drunk in front of than the people you work with LOL. It was kinda funny because the server started at one end and when he finally made it to our end, we asked if anyone else had ordered alcohol- apparently the whole table had. So gauging on that- we were really here to celebrate and have a good time (nobody got drunk btw... We were just sipping)  their passion fruit beer is outstanding!! I don't even drink! I'm the type of person who's a lot a fun but once you get a couple of sips in me I am laid out on the floor and that's no fun. For me to order a whole beef and not a sample will tell you how much I liked it. It was crisp, zesty and cold- the way a beer is suppose to be. I may start ordering beer at every meal ;) the pumpkin beer was light with some pleasant notes. And I felt just the right amount if alcohol.... 'Twas a good time. We got kale chips, calamari and honey sriracha wings as an app. Kale chips were good but drenched in oil, calamari was just ok- they give you tentacles and all. I usually just like the rings because ever since a I was a child I  was scared those tentacles may come back alive and start sucking on my tongue the minute I put it in my mouth. Honey sriracha wings we're pretty tasty.they were grilled but lacking a little spice.i ordered fish and chips as the waiters had suggested. I couldn't have picked a better meal. I think mine looked the best out of anybody's. Fish was white and flaky with just the right amount of golden batter. Chips were real potatoes smashed down, seasoned nicely and fried. Shrimp taco came out in soft flour tortilla with cabbage and pineapple. Looked good but was very bland. Shrimp to tortilla ratio was mismatched. Some tacos overflowing with shrimp while the other one was skimpy. I really like the environment of this place. Sitting on the patio- people watching and enjoying good food. Just the fact that it's right by union station makes it even better. Union station is breathtaking since the remodel. All In all- this restaurant is pretty good. We always go somewhere with healthier food options when we go with our company. I'm definitely going back for a beer and I'm bringing my husband next time. He loves those citrusy beers. His current favorite is some crazy grapefruit beer but I'm excited for him to try to passion fruit.

This was an interesting addition to Union Station.  Small but great beer selection ,a good wine by the glass and Irish Whiskey selection.

The menu was also limited but interesting selection of appetizers and sandwiches that you don't see on a normal menu.

I had a Cuban sandwich (minus the pickles of course).  It came with smashed garlic potatoes that were outstanding.  I haven't eaten potatoes on years for health reasons but I ate these and remembered why I liked potatoes so much.

According to three of us, the mussels were very good.

It is a busy place and you would need reservations on the weekends or you would have to eat at the bar.

I enjoyed the atmosphere of the place and the service was great.

Came in from San Francisco Bay area tonight and staying at Union Station. I had heard about the Kitchen "Next Door" but have only eaten at the main Kitchen a few blocks away. I sat outside on a cool Denver night and ordered an organic lemonade with a pineapple burger and garlic smash potato slices and a side salad. It was a fantastic meal and great vibe, service was friendly and enjoyed the experience. This will be my new location for a quick high quality meal when next in town! I totally recommend the place.

I have eaten here before and enjoyed the food served.  Today was a different story.  I ordered the shrimp tacos, an entry on the menu ($14.95).  It took too long for our lunch to be served and when it was I was more than disappointed.  They must have looked all over the ocean for the smallest shrimp they could possibly find and then deep fried them until they were hard, dry  and tasteless.  I would have sent them back if I wasn't so hungry.  I hope the next time I go there I make a better menu choice.

The newly remodeled Union Station has some great tenants! The Kitchen Next door location here did not disappoint!

I came here for dinner on a Friday night..table reservation for 10 (they dont do smaller reservations FYI). It was pretty busy but not jam packed. We were seated immediately due to the reservation. I noticed some other smaller groups waiting a bit but nothing more than 10min it seemed.

The space is great..a bit industrial, a bit new, a bit retro (awesome green booths), and that amazing neon sign over the bar...I love it. Our table was one of the large high tops since we had a large group.

We all started off with some beers. I had a local Porter from Hogshead brewing. The tap selection was pretty good. Not massive but some really nice local choices. Service was great the entire time..especially with it being a pretty busy friday night after their grand opening. 

I ordered the beet burger with feta. I am not a vegetarian..but this thing was awesome! The combination of the beet and feta was perfect. I also got a side of garlic smashers..kind of like potato wedges but a million times better. I split an order of bacon wrapped dates with a friend..those were also really good. The bacon was amazingly smokey on it. I had a small taste of my friends mushroom ragu..also another tasty dish. Some others at the table got the burger and fish n chips. Thumbs up all around on the food. I cant wait to go back!!

The calamari needs work.

The garlic smashers are weird but good.

Moscow mule needs a cooper mug/cup.

The spicy shrimp needs a grain and better portions. 

Service is good.

The location is the best part of this place. The outside seating faces the plaza, and with good weather, you'll want to hang out for a while. The root beer float and home made ice cream cookie are amazing! Smashers are good, especially for the garlic lovers out there. The shrimp tacos are a little too spicy for my liking--also, the tortillas are corn. Not my favorite.

This is an updated review based on my last experience. The first experience went really bad, but the owner and his team reached out to me, listened to what I had to say, and won me over on my next visit. Honestly, these guys care about their customers, their restaurant and their team. That's 4 stars in itself.

Food was excellent. The chef and his team made every dish flavorful and perfectly seasoned (seriously Chef, if you read this, it was a great service. High marks). We were even lucky enough to enjoy a couple dishes that the chef creatively created and successfully executed to perfection. Our server was extremely friendly and very attentive. We were even greeted by the manager who was super friendly and I really felt like she listened to everything we talked about instead of providing "lip service". Their garlic smashers were probably my favorite :-)

While I'm sure there was a little extra given due to my bad first visit, they could have easily just told me "thanks for telling us, have a nice day" and instead they took the time to just talk with me like a human being and listen to what I had to say. They didn't wave free stuff in front of me to make me happy, they just went out of their way to listen and make sure everything was how it should have been. Thanks guys! You won me over.

Nice decor. Laid back style. Easy to get a large table together. The on tap drinks were a bit weak, though they tasted good. The peach whisky drink was good. The smashed garlic potatoes were good. I'd say its above average bar food, but not amazing. The burgers were ok. Two within our party were undercooked. It was ok, likely good for happy hours and large groups. The service was quick. We took a while and the waiters didn't try to rush us.

Went here again for a second visit after a nice one a couple months ago. Ordered the Greek salad with lamb and my significant other had a hamburger (medium). It took forever to get our food (the entire visit took 90 min+another hour dealing with the aftermath) and the hamburger was well done and super dry (nothing like the first experience).  So I told the waitress and she asked if we would like another. We asked if it would take forever to get back...her response was probably given they were swamped. Now if you order something, and it isn't correct, shouldn't you be placed ahead of the queue to get what you ordered? That is what a nice burger place did for us last week in under 10 minutes. Not at this place. The manager came over and asked us about the problem and offered another hamburger too. Again, she didn't know how long it would take, but you could tell it was going to the end of the queue. We were tired of waiting and just wanted to move on with our evening, plus I was done eating my super small tasteless salad that was not worth its price in gold.  At the end of dinner, the waitress returned and asked us if we'd like dessert. At this point, you'd think they would at least give us a dessert for free, but that was not offered. At this point I told the waitress about our previous experience and she said "see we aren't that bad." That is not what you say! You ask the customer what you can do to make their experience better at that moment...you don't sluff it off. They gave me two comment cards...I'm guessing that was a hint.  I left a comment discussing the situation, but after we left it just kept nagging at me how much we had paid for the food and their response to the overcooked hamburger.  So I called and spoke with a different manager. I figured they needed to know how we really felt about the situation (not a few lines on a comment card).  Needless to say, that call got us nowhere and he kept trying to get off the phone with me. He did offer a free meal at the end (probably a way to get me off the phone given the impatient tone), which I declined and then requested a refund. He said he'd comp it as long as I "trusted" him  with the credit card over the phone. Why would you say that to a customer! I hung up the phone, we decided to forgo our the plans for the evening, and proceeded back to the restaurant. We discussed everything with the first manager we saw (not the one on the phone), she requested the receipt (strange not the credit card given Mr. Impatient's request on the phone), and refunded us.  It is not clear to me if the managers are just naive, and haven't been properly trained, or the owner (who apparently is "running all over the place and cannot be spoken to directly, but you can leave a comment on a comment card") has requested that they not compensate customers for their mistakes. Generally customers don't complain, they just don't come back; but given our first experience, I wanted to give them a chance to make it right. However, you need to make it right asap.  Ruined our evening out and we are both going to bed hunger :-(. Major bummer!

Out of wings, lemonade, low on ice, bad service and an out of order bathroom. Their side salad was a pile of unseasoned arugula with no dressing, boring sandwich and appetizers were just bad dishes. Really surprised this place can be successful in Denver considering how dialed the restaurants around here are, must be all about the location. I'm only compelled to leave a review when places are really good or really bad..

What a huge disappointment. The kitchen needs work.

Pros: 
- service was quick and friendly
- the spaces is great. Fabulous patio, huge windows, high ceilings, and a plethora of booths and various tables 

Cons:
- calamari was like salty battered and fried paper
- fish and chips were so soggy they tasted like they were wrapped in pancakes
- chicken on the salad tasted like it came out of the fryer

Happy hour is decent with app, beer, and wine specials ... But not worth staying for the main event.

3 stars were just because the bacon date appetizer was fantastic.  Otherwise it would just be two stars.  This is another Denver "hipster" place.  

I came on a Tuesday and the daily special was fish tacos.  I get that it is a "fresh" kitchen.  But if your chalk special board item is that, and your out of that at 5:15pm, erase it!  There were a couple of other printed menu items they were out of which was disappointing and made the limited item menu even more limiting.

I settled for the pork sandwich and don't remember what it was served with.  Neither were anything more than just ok.  

I would skip this place since downtown is horrible for parking, the atmosphere was nothing special.

This place is good. The atmosphere is cool and relaxed the food is not pretentious. Portions are decent size for the dough. I'd come back. It's clean and friendly. Our server was attentive and she gave time to our 5 year old who loves to tell stories. 
Give it a try. Checkout the daily special and the underground menu, but shhhhh it's supposed to be a secret.

Just an incredible place filled with people that care. Super pleased to get a reach out by the GM and called the next time I went in on a sunny summer night during a Rockies game. Patio table and Rachel was our server. Just nothing but love and shockingly quick food out of the kitchen that is all made from scratch. 

The fried kale, the bacon wrapped dates, the happy hour offerings, the kids menu, the patio and the sheer speed of things coming out of the kitchen. 

Water was filled, we were checked on frequently and our friends joined us and added more food that came out delicious and fast!! Salads, hummus, calamari (weak spot) and wings. 

Oh and those garlic smashed potatoes. Damn!!!!

I say give it a go!!

Stopped in for a late-afternoon snack, taking advantage of happy hour.  Although we've been here umpteen times, we decided we should finally give it a quick review.

First off, service and the waitstaff are professional, friendly and speedy.  Compared to many establishments, it's refreshing to find a staff like this one that seems to enjoy their jobs and make you feel at home.

Food:  Even if you don't like things like kale or beets, you really should try the kale chips and beet slider.  Seriously.

Standout items include the calamari (very light on the batter), meatballs and polenta, and the cheeseburger slider (or go all out and get a full size burger).  And as we said, get the kale chips.  

We do suggest steering clear of the garlic mashers and the wings.  The pork sliders are tasty but dry: save your calorie intake on the other items.

Overall, Next Door has been consistent in service and food across all of our visits, and we highly recommend stopping by for a happy hour or casual lunch-dinner.

The kitchen next door did not live up to the hype. I'm so glad it's reasonably priced or else I would have been very upset over the mediocre meal I received there today. 

I ordered the chicken sandwich, thinking it would be a "grilled chicken breast" sandwich. It was not. It was dark and light meat, had no seasoning whatsoever. I asked for a honey mustard sauce or something to give it some flavor. I ultimately sent it back and ordered the chicken and quinoa soup instead. It at least had flavor, but I didn't see a bit of quinoa in the soup. My friends ordered the burger and were not impressed, one of them compared it to a burger you would get at a BBQ and "assemble yourself" so something you could most definitely make at home and do a better job. 

The service was good, I did appreciate our waitress taking my below average sandwich off our tab. But that alone would not bring me back to dine at the kitchen again.

This was a real disappointment. While it exudes a hip, healthy vibe in its menu, the restaurant's food was mediocre at best. 

My tomato soup had a sour taste, and my roasted vegetable salad was mostly greens: tiny bits of vegetables and a sprinkling of quinoa were hard to find amidst the greens, and the dressing was barely discernible and tasteless.

My mom had a pork sandwich that was so greasy she could barely eat it. Our server indicated that some of the liquid was vinegar but it was obviously not, making it unseemly to hold and leaving a large pool of dripping oil on her plate.

My husband ordered the beet burger which was interesting but certainly not amazing. My dad's hamburger was good, but at this point there was relief at the table that at least one thing was good.

Great location by Union Station, nice decor - but the restaurant could improve through better quality in its modern offerings.

The food was good, and so was the beer. The bartenders on the other hand....I'll try and be polite when I say...are these kids stoned, or stupid?

Here's how it went down :
We have about 20 minutes to wait for a table, so I go to the EMPTY spot at the bar and order a beer. As I am about to order, some giant bearded bartender walks between the tiny girl I was about to order from, and GOES MEGA-BRO with his buddy standing next to me. I'm all for fun and seeing a friend, but that was strike one and fantastically RUDE! The girl apologized and I order. Mind you, I order a beer for me and a water for my pregnant wife. 1st.....she leaves me standing there with the beer (no water) having NOT paid, and starts to help other people. I leave the money on the bar with NO water, and walk over to a serving station and get it myself.

I bartended for over 8 years and i find that the new batch of tenders in this town pretty much SUCK! You wanna make your money or have fun and goof off!? Do your fucking job! My wife and I decided, we'll probably go to any number of other places in LoDo next time and hopefully skip the lame attitudes at this over-hyped trendy establishment.

Here's a thought.....be professional! It's not a dive-bar on Colfax.

The food was great. The service was prompt and attentive. I had the Carolina Pork Sandwich which comes with an arugula salad. I also added the Parmesan garlic smashers. With a soda that meal totaled $15 and it was well worth every cent. The bbq pork was moist and tender, the greens were crisp and fresh and the Parmesan garlic smashers (smashed potato wedges) were amazing. We had a party of five on a busy night. The wait was gonna be about 20 minutes but 5 corner seats opened up at the bar and we sat there. It was a great night and I didn't break the bank. Great ambiance and the Train Station location allows for great activities afterward.

So we sat down to order lunch.  I ordered the philly sandwich which was a Tuesday special. My friend at the table orders the same meal.  When my sandwich arrived, there was hardly any meat in the sandwich, especially compared to my friends sandwich.  When i pointed it out to the waiter he took it and then brought it back saying it had three ounces of meat , so that's the way it is.

Great place in the newly remodeled Union Station.  The beer list was short, sweet and to the point.  It was 10 beers long and included only Colorado based micro-brews.  Hogshead brewery was a highlight for me since they are harder to find in bars and restaurants.

The menu is not to big, not to small.  There is an assortment of salads, sandwiches and entrees along with a number of sharing/small plate dishes.  I tried the bacon wrapped dates, which were out of this world.  (It had been so long since I have seen dates on a menu!)  I also tried the garlic smashers.  Basically these are small potatoes, whole with the skin on with sections sliced into them and garlic seasoned.  They are very similar to truffle fries, but the whole potato.

For my main meal, I had the Salmon Salad Sandwich.  The sandwich itself was pretty basic, but amazing.  It was salmon salad, topped with arugula and an aioli.  Let me just say the sandwich did not last very long....

Unfortunately, I did not try any of the desert items.  Included on the menu are cookies, ice cream sandwiches and a few other items including an Adult Shake. (This tempted me the most for obvious reasons!)

I went on a Friday night and the place was fairly packed.  We had a reservation, so got seated right away, but others had to wait 15-20 minutes.  On a side note, I found it funny the restrooms both had red lights above the doors.

I'm just not impressed, especially since I love The Kitchen.

I've been here twice. It's fine at most. Service tends to be slow. Food isn't exceptional and comes our bizarrely fast, while drinks take twice as long.

My fish and chips were not very crispy and generally flavorless. Kale chips were greasy and slightly soggy.

I've never been a fan of the Kitchen in Boulder. It's too crowded, too noisy and tries too hard. However, this Kitchen (and the other Denver location) are none of that. When the weather cooperates, eat outside. Their outside seating allows you to people watch and enjoy the area.
The food is great, and the staff freindly and helpful. Every meal I've ordered has been well prepared and of generous proportion.
The roasted veggie salad makes any visit worthy. The Cuban sandwich is also good. Not impressed with the beer selection during our visit, but that was the only downside.

The hubs and I really really like the Kitchen in Boulder. When we were down at Union Station we saw the Kitchen Next Door and were excited to give it a try. 

I arrived first and went to the west side doors. Locked. With no sign to indicate where to go. I walked around and found the entrance on the north side. Easy if approaching from the north but any other direction and it's confusing. 

I sat at the bar to order and the staff was really friendly. I was brought water and it tasted really weird. No biggie just weird. I waited and waited. Got the ticket but the server realized he had charged me the wrong amount. I didn't see the itemized receipt to know what was charged incorrectly. Brought it back and it seemed to be right. 

Finally got our sandwiches and left. When we ate them my husbands pulled pork was SOAKING in what we think was olive oil. It was practically dripping off his fingers yet the pork was dry. Weird. He couldn't finish it. I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich and it too had a lot of mayo on it. I didn't finish either. The only saving grace of the meal was the side of smashed fingerlings we ordered on the side. That was five stars. If we had eaten in the restaurant we would have sent the sandwiches back.

We have been to the Union Station location quite a few times. 
Like the vibe, and the decor. Usually an eclectic crowd as well. 
Love coming here because the food is fresh, healthy, yet substantial. 

They weren't 100% on top of their game this time. My husband got the fish and chips. Immediately, he knew the dish had been sitting and must have been reheated. Definitely NOT fresh. But the manager was on it. Gave us the hummus appetizer while waiting for them to redo the fish and chips. Appetizer was nice. I had the tomato soup and Learning Garden salad. Both were excellent. 
But it was a bummer that the place that should be serving fresh food, would reheat an entree. Bad decision on someone's part.

Service was great, my friend loved our server!

As many have noted, some of the food is clearly prepped well in advance and kept warm and/or reheated. Our garlic smashers were quite dry and were not very good or very bad, just okay, but the lack of moisture was a give away. You do expect more with the way this restaurant presents itself though. The Greek Salad was very good acording to my friend who had that. The burger I had was ordered "medium" but came out well done. There was no pink at all in the meat. Nice Beer selection.

The most telling review response for me is, I will not be coming back if I am picking the restaurant, but I will not object to going again if my friends want to.

We met friends here for a holiday dinner while on a Denver trip. Great food and atmosphere, though a trifle loud if you're wanting to have private conversations. We sat at the bar and our server was a hoot and half. Excellent service and recommendations.

Kitchen Next Door is one of my favorite spots downtown for happy hour or a casual dinner! Can't beat the $5 drinks and $4 appetizers (4-6 pm) in a nice, welcoming environment. It is located in Union Station and has a nice patio outside that is great for people watching. I love that they use all natural/local ingredients, you can definitely taste the difference. Highly recommend the Chickpeas and Hummus, it is my favorite! The staff is always super friendly and the service is fast.

Had a great mule never this way before but the smashed potatoes were amazing gonna make those at home!! Then we had the classic burger the meat was fantastic and of course the service by far the best.  What a great city you have Denver for the food gromonde!!
So many low marks - TOTALLY undeserved. The service here is over the top. You want something - they deliver NOW. Smashers are fun and good. They'll fix whatever you want - however you want it.

This place is a great value. Big portions and good prices, with prices ranging for how much you want to spend (sandwiches and salads v. entrees). We got calamari, meatballs and fish and chips as well as drinks all for under $45. We were a little disappointed they were out of mussels, but I can't remember the last time I've had calamari that good. The fish in the fish and chips was not too crispy but good, and I think it's hard to find a good fish and chips dish. The potato "smashers" or whatever were AMAZING! 

I will definitely be back... Especially if I can make it for "community hour" someday.

A small dinning area, but great food and a big bar for the footprint of the restaurant. Defiantly a hotspot; as the entire Union Station is packed with energy and people. 
Food was great. Pork Sandwich was delicious & the Tomato soup is outstanding! Service was also amazing. 
Defiantly will make this a new regular rotation as it is not overpriced.

Mediocre food, the appetizers were not delivered until after the main courses arrived, three of the entrees arrived but the fourth was forgotten. I would not recommend this establishment at all, there are many other great restaraunts in the area that serve better food  and have better service.
Even though they establishment completely dropped the ball; they did take off a substantial of the final bill.

After checking in to the Crawford Hotel we came here for dinner.  I ordered the house Margarita which I wouldn't recommend.  But for dinner I had the tomato soup which was delicious and a very fresh Caesar salad.  My husband ordered the butternut squash soup which he liked but was very different.  He also ordered the sockeye salmon salad sandwich which he loved.  Unique place that I'd recommend.

Union Station has got some of the best tenants in town, and The Kitchen Next Door fits in perfectly. Visited for a last minute happy hour with a coworker who was in town for a training and I was pleasantly surprised! 

First off, the decor and atmosphere of The Kitchen Next Door is awesome. It's got that casual Denver vibe with a large patio outside, which is great on those warm winter days and obviously PERFECT come summertime!

I think their community hour menu is one of the best values in town. Drink and food specials from $3-6 with plenty of options to choose from. Even for only $5, their food portions are impressively big and well suited for sharing. I thought everything we ordered was delicious - I'm still drooling over the KALE CHIPS. Seriously, don't miss out on those, even if it's not community hour. Ours were warm, fresh, and perfectly seasoned. They were so good, I forgot to get a picture of them! If they could just make those for me every afternoon, that'd be great.... thanks... We also tried the beet burger, hummus, and bacon wrapped dates, and I don't have a single complaint. Even with drinks, our bill only came to $34 pre-tip. 

While I can't speak for their full menu, community hour hooked me - I'll definitely be back soon.

I always wanted to go to The Kitchen in Boulder, but never made it. When a friend was visiting recently we went to The Kitchen in the newly-remodeled Union Station in downtown Denver.

Our first impression was when we tried to order drinks from the bar - red bull & vodka, Coors Light, and vodka/soda. They didn't have red bull or Coors Light, haha, but that's when we realized we weren't in Kansas anymore.

Now that we'd gotten a hang of the vibe, which was full of hip young, bearded Denveriites and their athletic dates, we settled into our table and ordered a round of bacon-wrapped dates and honey sriracha wings to start. For dinner I ordered the wild sockeye salmon salad, which I'd seen being served to someone else on my way in. The waitress warned the salmon comes out almost like tuna, pulled apart. I happily shook my head as that's what turned me on to the salad in the first place. :) I don't usually even like arugula, but it was so mild and balanced among the other ingredients that I really enjoyed it.

The guys with me enjoyed their meals also, but I can't remember what they got. I would definitely come back! The main reason I'm not giving this a five is that we felt like we were being watched when we walked in, and most of the servers seemed really awkward every time we interacted with them. It was probably just growing pains with a new staff.

After enjoying exploring the newly renovated Union Station, having some authentic Fish and Chips seemed appropriate. After all, the dish is listed up high on the wall in the main terminal. If you are advertising like that, it has to be good. Unfortunately, my hopes and dreams of a great pub fish and chips experience was dashed. Should have headed on over to GB on Broadway. They are the best. 

So what is wrong with the Kitchen's version. The fish itself was ok, beer battered and crispy. 3 small pieces of fish. Hardy a fish and chips size portion. The chips, we all know when you say Fish and Chips in America, you get fish and fries. Nice crispy golden brown fries. Maybe some slaw on the side. Nope, not here. Here you get some kind of potato mush. They are seasoned well with Parmesan and garlic. Again a small portion. But nothing to yelp home about. The dish was accompanied with some kind of Mayo. Not sure what was in it, but there was definitely not a lot of flavor. I think it was suppose to be spicy. Maybe we got the part that did not have much mixed in with it. Who knows. Regardless, the quality was not there. It was like someone was trying to elevate Fish and Chips, but they just did not think it through. At a Pub, really! Some things should be as they are expected. 

Service was nice and friendly. Nice atmosphere. Great location. 

I doubt we will be back. It is a bit of a drive for mediocre food.

Still waiting on our food and it's pretty sad. People show up after Us And get there food before we do. Im sure the food is good but I have no clue. Definitely not a good place if you are wanting your food fast. An hour wait

I wish I lived in Denver so I could eat here all the time! Loved it!! Very cute atmosphere and extremely friendly service (including our waitress, the bus boy, and the manager). We came for lunch on a Friday. The CRISPY GARLIC SMASHERS were heavenly for appetizer! I got the shrimp tacos for my meal - great flavor and had the good, thin tortillas. I tried my friend's meatballs and they were very savory, although the polenta with it wouldn't be my #1 choice. They initially brought out the wrong plate for her and corrected it within minutes and were SO nice about it. The menu is small but everything sounded delicious, and there were lots of vegan/gluten free options as well. They have a nice craft beer selection too. Love this place! I can't wait to come back.

I always seem to find something on the menu here that is delicious. The atmosphere at this location is hard to beat. We often find ourselves here on a sunny Denver day during community hour enjoying both the margaritas and the mules.

Can't go wrong with a night out or day down town at Union station. The food was good but after a long  wait you would expect it to be better. Still not a bad way to end the evening or begin it I suppose.

Absolutely love this place. My fiance and I go here all the time. The food is fantastic and well priced and the people are great. It also just has a nice ambiance/vibe. We love the meatballs, veggie salad with hummus and chicken, kale chips, devils on horseback, beer and pretty much everything else.

My GF and I have been here on three different occasions, and the first two were good enough that we were compelled to spend our final 'date night' here together before she leaves town for a month. Big bummer on us! The hostess w/ the gauged ears was our first interaction. She said very bluntly, "all we have is seats at the bar. is that fine?" and given the occasion, i asked if it would be ok if we waited for a table.  This obviously displeased her and she said it would be 20 mins. (presumably just to see if we would change our minds.) As predicted, our table was ready shortly after.  Our initial waiter was friendly and helpful, but a second waiter chimed in while we were still deciding on food and was obviously eager to get out order in.  He was rude in his approach and we both thought he was weird.  When my cuban came out, it was sloppily thrown together and the cole slaw was measly.  Every employee in the restaurant looked pissed off to be at work.  We were in by 8:15 and out by 9.  Very disappointed! We typically suggest this place to visitors.  I don't think we'll be doing that anymore.  It's a shame, it has so much potential.  Hopefully the owners will step in and get a friendly staff.

Very cute and cozy cafe right there in the CRAWFORD hotel where we were staying. The bartenders were happy and even singing at times. Great food and drinks! The community hour everyday from 3-6 was a nice treat with apps and cocktails from $3-$6!

Some family was in town and decided to head down to Union Station, and this is where we ended up for dinner. Not my choice, but I wasn't going to be picky. We arrived to a pretty busy dining area, and were given two options-wait for a proper booth/table 20+ minutes-or dine at a community high top. The group chose the community high top, again not my choice, after a long day on your feet who wants to sit on a stool without any back support, not me. The service we received from our server was very helpful and professional, happy hour had been over for 15 minutes but he still allowed us to squeeze some food and drink from the menu. This is probably the only reason for 3 stars and not 2.
 I'll explain why, the appetizers were nice. Hummus with carrot chickpea salad was probably my favorite thing...and come on, hummus being the favorite thing at a non-middle eastern place is kind of sad. The wings were nicely flavored and a decent portion for HH pricing. The mussels, oh dear, more sadness. The broth was pretty flavorless and the mussels themselves were tiny, smaller than 'baby clams' from the can. I ordered the bangers and mash and got no bang from it whatsoever. The sausage was bland as were the dense mashed potatoes, and the greens-barely sauteed, again no flavor and I could still taste dirt/grit on them. The gravy tasted of the instant kind, so I just ate more hummus and carrot salad. The food did come out in a timely fashion, but we were probably only there for an hour when a hostess came over to 'politely'  share that our 'community' table's party was arriving and they needed the space cleared and ready for them. She did offer to seat us at another spot when 'one should become available'. Ugh, maybe a heads up upon seating that we were only going to be allotted a certain time frame to dine. There were two in our party that had just received their second round of beers. Plus we were with a toddler, even more of a hassle to move. We just decided to slam the beers and get out of there. This was a disappointing dinner indeed, except for that hummus plate, that carrot and chickpea salad really is good, maybe the only thing to go back for.

This place is great!  Kind of a dive but that's part of the charm. Full menu. Full bar (Yelp needs to update that). 

I went with the shrimp fajitas. I asked my waitress her thought on what shrimp dish I should get. She said it was a big plate which it was. Very yummy. 

5 different salsas. I liked that. One lit me on fire and was addicting. 

Great service. Fair prices. Found my spot for Mexican and only a 6 minute walk from home!

Best Mexican in Denver, hands down.  I've been introducing every friend I have to Los Carboncitos since 2010...and won't stop.  Excellent salsas (chips and 4 salsas come out right away).  I usually go for tacos - the carne asada is excellent as are the carnitas and chorizo.  The sopa azteca is also so freaking good - on a winter night you will want this delicious soup.

As of summer 2016 they now have a liquor license...so don't fear, your DT's can be soothed while eating amazing authentic Mexican food.

This place is a hole in the wall which normally doesn't deter me, especially when it gets good ratings. Keep in mind this restaurant is Mexico Mexican food and I am from Texas, so prefer Tex-mex, but also like Baja-mex, New Mexico-mex and mountain-mex. anyway, the menu was large but many items seemed very similar with just one ingredient difference. I had a hard time figuring out what to order and went with the waitress's suggestion. 

The guac was very good. Not the best I've ever had (I'm picky) but above average for restaurant guac. They also bring you 4 salsas complimentary. The avocado/jalapeño and tomatillo ones were decent but not great. The other two were just spicy with very little flavor. 

My husband had chili rellenos which were poblano chilis (he prefers them to Anaheim which are more common so that was a plus) They admitted they were premade/prestuffed so instead of adding chicken to the inside they added a very flattened chicken breast on top. He says they were above average. 

I ordered the Tlacoyos which were oval shaped thick corn tortilla like things covered in onion tomato cactus and beef. They tasted good but I was full from chips etc so only ate 1 of the 3. I'm looking forward to the leftovers. 

The main reason I am taking stars off from this restaurant is the ambiance and cleanliness. If you prefer authentic Mexican, the food is decent, but I would recommend take out. the dining room experience was subpar. The building was old and outdated and it showed throughout.  You can tell they have done a couple of 'updates' but they were cheap and haphazard. Mostly, I just felt like everything was dirty, like they never bothered to deep clean or in cases like the bathroom, might not clean very often.

Cyn brought me here one day for a late lunch. I was pretty excited to try it out.

Once we arrived, we selected a table and our waitress brought out some salsas and menus. After perusing the menu for awhile, I decided to order sopes. I was not disappointed. Super delicious! I want more of them. I also tried some of Cyn's huarache, which was also tasty.

I'm sure I will come back for tacos at some point. But basically if I never had a taco, I'd be a-ok with those sopes.

Went for a second time and enjoyed it. The chips were fresh and I liked them better than the first time. I ordered the carne asada this time since I was in the mood for meat. Good size steak w rice, beans and tortillas. The steak was tasty and reasonably priced. I ordered the horchata again and liked it. Will be back.

I just want to reiterate how great the meats are at this place. Everything has been so tasty. Great agua fresca too, mango was outstanding! They bring you a salsa caddy to your table, with 4 delicious choices. The salsas are all wonderful, and some very very spicy. We had a torta, a burrito and a couple tacos. The food was really great. I was not one bit disappointed. Anytime I am in this area, I will think about sneaking in for some treats, affordable and excellent. I believe the Torta was the Carboncitas special with chorizo, al pastor, and steak, this is a fantastic sandwich for 8$. We have also tried most of the taco's home run- yum.
http://loscarboncitosdenver.com

I am Re-Reviewing this place. 
A few months ago I became really disgruntled with this restaurant. The service was horrid, the decor was drab , and the food was never consistent.

Well that has all changed for the better. They remodeled the inside and added a lovely bar, the staff is now pleasant and helpful, and the food is so F--king
Good. 

The portions seem bigger, the flavors are all there what a huge improvement! 
Congrats carboncitos , you guys have shown that you really give a damn! And judging by how packed you get for lunch everyday, other patrons have noticed the changes too.
There have also been some menu changes as well, you now get Guacamole with your burrito, and some new and delicious items were added to their menu.

The chilie rellano burrito is the best! There are now 2 stuffed rellanos inside instead of 1. Its huge!!  Love it

I just ate lunch there yesterday, and I already am craving it again. Could I go back again today? Hell yes!

I live for Mexican food. Stick a plate of mole in front of me and consider yourself my new best friend. Which leads me to Los Carboncitos. 

While we could have hung around the Source & had an overpriced plate of $4 per tacos, we chose the authentic route & headed to Los Carbs. This place has been bookmarked on my page for a year...a YEAR, but it was finally time to try it. As a taco fiend (I see you there, Doug), I HAD to go with 1 taco (a tripita) + a coctel de camaron (that's a shrimp cocktail for all you non-bilinguals out there), while hubs got my favorite, Chicken Mole (that's why we're married...he feeds my glutinous tendencies).

The taco was muy delicioso (delicious), and exactly what I was craving. The coctel on the other hand was lacking the spiciness that I crave, but nothing that a little Tapatio couldn't solve. Fair warning - the onions are hovering down at the bottom so mix it up real good. The mole was a little gritty but still great. Hubs didn't like that they shredded the chicken because it creates a soupy texture, but I don't care - I gotta get my fix! 

The service was amazingly friendly & the salsas they bring out were pretty tasty. I only wish I lived closer....

Decent mexican place! It's not the kind of place where you go for the ambiance, but that's not always what I'm looking for. 

As you can see from the pictures, they bring out 4 different salsas which were all flavorful and delicious. I love having different sauces to use with my dishes, so I really enjoyed that. The food was solid--they had some unique dishes on their menu that I hadn't seen at many other mexican places before. 

We went on a weeknight and it was pretty empty, so the service was very prompt and friendly. I'll be back!

Tasty neighborhood tacos and much more! Energetic and friendly atmosphere. I had two pork tacos and one fish taco - nicely sized and seasoned well. Hubby had a torta - it was gigantic! He loved it. Wide variety of food options and patrons. It's bigger than it looks inside. They give you chips and salsa upon arrival - very addicting.

I came here a little over a year ago, remembered loving the food, and then couldn't remember where this place was so it sat forgotten for another visit.  Until now. 

Came here on a Friday night with some friends to celebrate my sisters birthday.  It was pretty cold out so we sat in the back by a heater.... but there was still a breeze by the windows ... so it was like we had hot/cold flashes during our meal....  but I digress.

Huaraches.  I don't really see these commonly anywhere, and this place is the first place I ever tried them.  Tried them the first time ( with steak) and then again this time ... with steak and shrimp ( had to add some variety  LOL) .  They are soo good. They are like long grilled tortillas and have beans and cheese... and then your meat or chicken... or cactus... or chorizo... or... you pretty much name it.   I definitely recommend it.   

Oh, one last thing, I don't think they serve alcohol here, so if that's a deal breaker for you... here is your heads up

In all honesty, this place is 3.5 stars, but for the sake of their staff and food, rounded it up to 4.

Came here after a few beers at a nearby brewery, practically starving after not eating a good lunch and waiting too long to get dinner ideas going.

The place is a bit rundown-looking, but whatever; I'm not here for the ambiance and decor, I'm here for tasty food, and that's what I found.

The salsas are SPICY!  Take your breath away spicy, but I liked them quite a bit.

The entree was filling, unique, and perfectly put together.

The staff was polite, friendly, helpful, and prompt from start to finish.

My only complain was that is was freezing cold inside!  It felt as if the heat wasn't on at all, and we kept our heavy winter coats on the entire time.  It really felt like we were outdoors in late December.

I'll be back at some point though!

My new favorite hole-in-the-wall place to grab delicious food. The first time I came here on a taco tour, hosted and arranged by the taco connisseur Doug Y. Los Carbs (haha. yes. LOTS OF CARBS) was stop #3 and made me very glad I had showed restraint at stops #1 and #2.

A little nicer than some of the other stops, we were seated at tables with menus here. The waitress will bring out a carousel of four HOT AS HELL salsas, plus one mild cup... and a basket of hot, salted, greasy, and crisp tortilla chips. BE CAREFUL and do not dip your entire chip into any of the CAROUSEL OF HELLISHLY HOT salsas. Even if you think you can eat spicy, do a taste test before diving in. All of them are delicious, but they could burn your taste buds right off.

Then, you're faced with the difficult decision of what to eat. During the taco tour, I ate... tacos (duh). The carnitas here are tender crispy and flavorful. I had mine plain (no cheese) with onions only. I dabbed on a bit of salsa and I was in heaven. The second time I came, I had more tacos (this time, carnitas, bistec, and al pastor... with the carnitas still being the favorite), with the griddled cheese. Mmmmm. I was in heaven. The third time, I made myself order something that wasn't a taco. My friend ordered the sopes, which she devoured. I ordered the huerache, which is a giant oblong griddled tortilla, topped with refried beans, queso fresco, onions, and ... carnitas. I was full after eating about 2/3 of it, but enjoyed the last bite just as much as the first (and yes, I finished it. I have no regrets). Plain taco is $1.50. Taco with cheese is $2. The heurache was $7. Seriously folks... please keep your expectations realistic when you're paying so little for so much flavor. No shi-shi decor here, mmm k?
 
I can't wait to try other dishes... but I would expect that every other visit will be for tacos.

So disappointed. I thought this was gonna be a great hole in the wall by all the great Yelp reviews. It could not have been a greater disappointment. 

First off, I'm a first generation Mexican and I know great authentic Mexican food. I can make it and my mom, aunts, grandmothers etc are / were all amazing at cooking and rock authentic Mexican cuisine. This place was Terrible with a capital "T."

I book marked it due to the great review, one of my good friends (who is a Yelp Elite extraordinaire) raves about this place, and because of the sopes on the menu. I recently became a huge fan of sopes after learning to make them in a cooking class. I asked our waitress for her recommendations and the three top dishes that are most popular here. I was excited as she stated the sopes were indeed one of the top 3 dishes. 

If the sopes were one of the top three dishes here, I don't care to try the other top dishes. The sopes were so bland. I tried three different toppings for each - al pastor, steak with nopalitos, and chorizo and all three were flavorless and the pork and steak were on the tough side.

What's even more disappointing is that I took a friend who was visiting from out of town to this awful restaurant. He ordered the chicken flautas and a side of Mexican rice and beans. When they served us, and saw the unappealing presentation, I became really nervous about whether he'd enjoy his meal. I've never seen such a sad plate of flautas. If I can make a better Mexican meal and my presentation is better, (and I consider myself to be an average cook in my family), it leads me to believe that the meal is going to be disappointing and it truly was. 

We were both really hungry, and usually when you're really hungry, it can make what your eating taste even better. This was not the case. I didn't even eat half my meal as I was so put off by the blandness and toughness of the meat on the sopes.

Tacos are the bomb, meat is fresh hot and tasty, homemade tortillas and salsas are on point, I highly recommend this place, I'm Frm Dallas and was lookin for a taco spot and I'm glad I found this place, will be back when I'm in town!! Staff is friendly  and very helpful

The tacos were DELICIOUS. My favorite part was the cheese - instead of just putting shredded cheese on the tacos, they sort of made it into a little pan seared cheese pancake (without batter). It made for an extra crunch texture to the taco while still giving the cheese flavor. I only tried one of the 4 table salsas, as I was told they were extremely hot, and the "mildest" one was too hot for me. Other people at the table were loving them, though. Atmosphere is a little bit cramped, but not bad.

Good news! The review stands. I've been going to Los Carboncitos for several years now and I have to say they still stand tall I my mind. The food is 100% solid. 

I love the tostadas de tinga and the chicken mole is dark, classic, and spicy. It's the slow heat that builds and pours out of your soul. Your tastebuds will never know what happened. 

The portions are huge and you'll definitely have leftovers. The service can be a tad slow at times, but it's completely worth it. 

Try the mango juice out of the tap, it's wonderful!
Enjoy the salsas that come with the chips when you dine in. They're HOT!

Terrible customer service and mediocre food. 4 of us were out to eat, and 1 person got their food 20 minutes before the rest of us. 10 minutes later another plate was served, and 10 minutes later we received the last 2 orders. When we finally did get the food, it was burnt and thrown onto the plate. 

It took 15 minutes to get a refill on a soda, and when we asked about where the soda was, we were met with a defensive attitude saying it would be out soon. Really?!

 It took 35 minutes to pay the bill, and she mistakenly charged us double the amount we were supposed to pay. 

We never received an apology for the slow/terrible service, but were met with a defensive attitude like we should be grateful she was paying any attention to us at all. Our server never asked how the food was, forgot to bring a leftover box multiple times, and the other server was walking around on her cell phone the entire time.

We were very disappointed in the atrocious service and are bummed that we wasted 2 hours and our business at this place.

Here's the deal. I'm trying to be as objective as possible because the harsh reality is that I didn't like this place because it's too authentic. I know that sounds crazy, but as a Denver transplant who was born and raised in Texas when I want Mexican food I really want Tex-Mex. So it's less about me not liking it and more about it not being what I wanted. 

I ordered chicken enchiladas which came with tomatillo sauce. Red sauce is not even an option here, verde or mole is what you get. The quality of ingredients are really good and the fresh queso blanco was delightful. However, because what I really wanted was Tex-Mex, I was super bummed when the rice, beans, and inexplicable pile of iceberg lettuce were missing from my plate. So even though the chicken was crispy and delicious and contrasted the soft corn tortillas perfectly, I was not satisfied. 

My husband ordered (I can't remember the name) what was basically a hash-peppers, meat, cheese- that came with tortillas. Again, well prepared and delicious... But "Where are my beans and lard?!" I shouted silently to the heavens, but sadly no one responded. So he ate it sans beans. 

The service was fine, not great and not bad, and everyone was super friendly. 

So in conclusion, if you are craving authentic Mexican food then you should totally go here all the time. However, if you prefer Mexican food that has been exploited by white people and topped with cheddar cheese... Than you might leave a little disappointed.

Sometimes the urge for "authentic" overrides my personal taste in food and that happened with Los Carboncitos.   The fact that it was packed at lunch gave me the idea that this must be really good food.

I wasn't familiar with a lot of the menu offerings so everything seemed over priced to me.  The long wait after we ordered gave me time to notice that the place feels like it could use a good deep cleaning.  

Then the food came:  my 3 little carboncitos were fantastic!  Real charred steak and cheese plus they honored my special request for some shredded lettuce on top.  Hubby had an enchilada/mole dish that he exclaimed over.  Total cost was about $25 for those and a couple of sodas.

Probably won't go back since I'm not a fan of Mexican food generally, but we came away satisfied.  Another place checked off the list of places to try.

Los carboncitos is a really great local mexican restaurant. All of the food is inexpensive, I'm talking $1.50 tacos, and extremely fresh. 

When you walk in you are greeted with a basket of chips and five different kinds of salsas. There are two green and three red/ orange salsas. The green are relatively mild while the dark red and the Orange are spicy. 

We ordered the chicken verde enchiladas (the chicken was a little dry), 5 tacos, and an order of the churros. The tacos were definitely a steal, and utterly delicious. Out of the tacos we ordered chicken, steak, al pastor, carnitas, and the chorizo the best one was hands down the chorizo. The meat was tangy and flavorful and all around delicious. I highly recommend trying the chorizo, even if you aren't a chorizo fan this will change your mind. Lastly, the churros were amazing. The ice cream that comes with the churros is to die for (and this is coming from someone who doesn't like ice cream). 

If you are ever in the neighborhood I highly recommend coming and trying this restaurant!
