I've eaten here a couple of times now and the food is what I look for in Mexican.  Their presentation is excellent, they season the meat well and everything overall was solid.  I loved their tacos the first time around but the Sopes were a very pleasant experience this time.  Definitely worth heading to if you, like me, are purposefully searching for that next excellent Mexican meal!

This place used to be good before all the stupid hipster white people showed up! 98% of these reviewers on here wouldn't know authentic Mexican if it hit them in the pie hole. 
Last time I went the food was terrible , the chips were stale and store bought . The salsas were old and and also terrible . I doubt I'll ever come back . You know a place has gone to shit if there is more white people than Mexican eating the food .

I work nearby and thoroughly enjoy coming to this restaurant for lunch. The atmosphere isn't too blank and the room is never packed. Friendly staff every time that are quick to service with chips, salsa, and drink while you wait for your food.

While I mainly stick to their tacos, everything on their menu is typically on par with delicious. 

The lemonade tasted not at all home made, but rather dispensed from a fountain. It's fair to say I was mildly disappointed by the lack of an authentic lemon drink. Normally I would take more than one star from the review because of this, but the food and service is far too great.

I ended up ordering the carnitas smothered burrito and it was the best burrito I ever had in my life hands down! The beans, potatoes, and pork had all been slow cooked with such a flavorful sauce that I can still taste it (definitely hints of garlic). For 6.75, you can't beat the price either. The service was also great! If you are in Denver visiting, this is a must.

This place deserves every star for the food and Here is why.  Authentic mexican street food!  Bold sauces- habanero, fresh ingredients, hand made corn tortillas.  Try the tlacoyo with pollo.  Delicious.  This is not your mainstream mexican restaurant.

Fast and delicious. From sitting down to my food arriving at the my table, I waited.... maybe 3 minutes. The food that arrived was delicious. Flavorful and juicy tacos al pastor, and crispy (not crunchy) tacos tripas. Some of the best tacos Ive ever had. Definitely the best tacos tripas Ive had. Finally, the check arrived at a price that made me feel like I was stealing these tacos. Highly recommend.

I love this place for what it is! Like having dinner in Mexico. Very filling satisfying, basic meat based Mexican food. Service good. They have bottles of  Mexican Coke. Great salsas with your chips. Prices are great! I'm glad it's in the neighborhood.

I highly recommend if you want meat and cheese a la Mexicana!

LOVE the food here!! The ONLY reason I didn't give it 5 stars, is because if you aren't sitting down to eat, it's really awkward to go in and order your food to go, because you're either in the way of the waitress, or the people that ARE sitting down to eat! Other than it being a little tight on space, this place is PERFECT!!

They got my order wrong and when I called them about it the girl said they would try better next time. Said she talked to the manager and they couldn't give me a refund. Then hung up on me. I called back and asked for the manager and she said she was the manager. Liar. Then hung up on me again when I asked if they were going to fix my order. B.
I went last  Saturday ( March 19 2016)  Very Good Food but they need more people , because one waitress is not enough!  but the food is really good  !
Get the huarache!!! Big portion and excellent. Their salsas are great. Great casual neighborhood Mexican food. Hope they can get margaritas on the menu this year. No alcohol (yet). Great lunch spot.

As always, this is my go to place when I'm craving authentic (not tex mex) Mexican antojitos. They make the best tortas in town my favorite being al pastor. They serve a decent horchata and offer a wide selection of salsas like any good taco joint should. 

If you're interested in authentic Mexican fare in Denver this is one of the best.

Exceptional food at a reasonable price, this restaurant has become a favorite among friends as we have gotten to explore Denver and it's food. Hands down the most flavorful meat and fantastic tacos that I've ever had. I 10/10 encourage everyone to go and experience the slew of spicy salsas and filling and delicious entrees. Will be a loyal costumer as long as I'm in Denver!

Dropping a star for the following reasons:

1.  Nothing is ever consistent here.  In the short 2 months we have been coming here, we have had problems with orders 4-5 times.  Once, we got a steak burrito when we ordered 2 chile relleno burritos.  Our side of guacamole was with the steak burrito, and they never replenished when they took the wrong food away.  We have been charged for smothered burritos when we never requested smothering.  We have been provided chips and salsa, but not the 4 special salsas, and most recently were given all 5 salsas, and our guacamole, but no chips.  Everyone around us had chips...finally we had to ask after our food had already been brought over.  No refills on water, ever.  

2.  The salsas and chips are recycled should you not eat all of them.  I saw one of the staff take a half-tray of chips from one person's table, fill it with more, and then give to a couple next to me.  The 4 salsas are dumped out into new tins to "fill" them for new patrons.  What all this means is anyone's guess.  Perhaps Chuck has nasty bathroom habits, and pisses all over his mitts prior to shuffling through the chips.  Perhaps Jimmy likes to lick the spoon, and then insert it back into the salsas.  Nonetheless, these things should be considered.

I will add that the burritos are still great, and I appreciate the kitchen staff Wearing Gloves, a lost art.

GOOD:

The chips and homemade salsas are excellent

TERRIBLE:

The quality of the meat is *horrendous*. I got the Chicken Mole Enchiladas and ended up only eating the mole sauce and the tortillas. The meat was either overcooked, incredibly low quality, or both - completely inedible! The chicken was like dry rubber and had to be chewed extensively while suppressing the gag reflex. Every bite was awful, awful, awful! Very disappointing for $13!

The owner's other restaurant Paxia is better, but very overpriced for what you get!

Stopped here for a quick bite after that airport. We were starving and were happy when we were greeted with chips and salsa right after we sat down. I stuck with the mild salsa but loved the green one that had what I thought was cucumber and lime and the orange one which was smokier and more mild. The green one was spicy enough for me so I didn't try the hottest one. 

We ordered the chorizo queso fundido to start. Presentation was plain but they were so delicious! We also ordered the enchiladas verdes and three fish tacos. The enchiladas were a huge portion and tasted good. The tacos were the best dish - the fish was flaky inside and nice and crisp on the outside. The tacos were topped with cilantro and onions and were even better with a generous heap of the mild salsa. 

I recommend this place for a casual and filling lunch. We will definitely be back!

This place is sketch.

Waitress didn't return my card, so i called her out on it. She said she knew she gave it back, so I showed her the server wallet and it was empty. I emptied my wallet and pockets in front of her. Then without bending over she said, "Oh, I found it on the floor" I was like really? without even bending over to pick it up. I think she was trying to steal my card. When I confronted her about not getting my card back, she acted annoyed and was really rude. She almost acted like I was doing her some sort of disservice. Um.. hello lady it's not my fault you tried to keep my debit.

The food was terrible. My gf fajitas were good. I got the Mexican hamburger, which for some reason was a regular hamburger that I could get at a non-mexican restaurant, except If I were to get it somewhere else it may have actually tasted good. 

Terrible, Terrible, Terrible.... SMH

I remember coming here before. Maybe. Well either way I tried it the other night with my best friend and I loved the salsas they give you to dip the chips in!!! I wanted to try the enchiladas verdes and I'm glad I did, I enjoyed them. My best friend on the other hand didn't enjoy her cóctel de camarón. She ate what was left of my food and see too liked it. The size of the agua de horchata is perfect! For me at least. They are open late so I hope to try them out again and try their sopes, or tacos, or their flautas which are called something else on their menu.

There are regions in Mexico that are known to have pretty bland food. I think the cuisine of this place originates from one of these regions. It certainly seemed authentic, but was pretty mediocre in my opinion. 

Also a bit disappointed by the overpriced menu. This is a borderline $$ in my mind: lunch for 2, only water to drink and no apps: $25.
Authentic Mexican food at a great price. They also have good hours so I can pick up food when I get out of work late.
We get take out here often. We really like this very casual corner restaurant. The staff is lovely. The food quality is better than you'd expect.

Best tacos in Denver. None of the fancy toppings and weird hipster sauces all these modern taco places have. Just straight authentic street tacos. They are cheap and tasty. Perfect at 2am after a night out drinking or a quick lunch spot. I wish they had a rewards card for tacos like buy 20 tacos get 1 free. Anyways, get off yelp and just go here already.
I ordered the pastor tacos & they were the best I've had in a while. The hand made tortillas give it that authentic taste. Also not too far from the highway.

The huaraches with steak and cactus are ridiculously delicious. One huarache is enough for two people for lunch (but get two-leftovers are good). The chips and salsa are some of the best around. 

Inexpensive. Quick service. Great salsa. Amazing huaraches. What more do you need? GO!

I used to love this place. The food is really good for Mexican food, but I am sad to report that their service is whack. I usually go in here with my white husband and they seem to give us great service. When I came in there with a group of Asian people recently, we had TERRIBLE SERVICE. The waitress waited on another table that seated after us. Not only that, we had to ASK if we could get waters. We were so upset with the experience that we got up and left. Literally, 20 minutes, no water, no orders and another table who walked in ten minutes after us who gets water and menus and their order taken before us. BTW, the other table was a mexican chick and her boyfriend and she spoke spanish to the waitress. RACIST much? To make matters worse, the day we came in there was my brother's girlfriend's birthday and SHE CRIED.

Went here last night, and I really liked it. I ordered the mole enchiladas with 1 taco al pastor on the side. As soon as I took a bite out of the taco, I wished I'd gotten just a mountain of those instead. At the end of the meal, we went straight for those churros, and oh man, they were warm and fresh and absolutely perfect. 

The women working were friendly and nice and quick with the water refills. 

I will so totally be back.
Good food, nice staff. Not a great location and a bit run down. They need a better salsa recipe, watery and bland. Gordita, enchiladas and alambre all good.

Second visit and I'm really falling in love with their fish taco. Damn I wish their salsas weren't so hot because they're super delicious but I've figured out pick one and mix it with their mild salsa or guac which is extremely fresh and made to order.

The tv was very loud, and my food was just warm,  not hot. I wish they spent as much time on the food as they did with the soccer game. I have been here in the past,  the tables were older but the food was better. I feel ripped off. I had the enchiladas verde. I hate cold food.
Came here one night with a huge craving for Mexican Food, although the flavors were pretty good the portion sizes are really lacking and the presentation is none existence.

This used to be our favorite place to go for tacos. We used to go at least twice a month. I usually get tacos or their ceviche. The last time we went their ceviche was bad! It was tough, chewy and didn't have a great smell.. I told the waitress something was wrong with it and I no longer wanted it.  I told her I would still pay for the cerviche and I wanted to order tacos too. We could tell the server was pissed. She asked me if I wanted to pack up the rancid food... No, thank you?? When the tacos came out our waitress, along with the other waitress took turns coming to our tables every two minutes to ask if it tasted okay. We got the hint, time to go! We paid for all our tacos and the ceviche.
Also, I'm sure I probably ate a good amount of saliva or whatever special ingredient they decided to add to my tacos. 

The food was great, but the service was a disaster. Go enjoy their delicious cheap tacos, but beware if there are any problems do not tell the servers!!

"You have never been to Los Carboncitos?  We have to go right now"   This is what I heard from a friend of ours, so we followed her advice, and off we went.

There was a group of us and we got to have a bunch of different things, which I am still not sure if is was a good thing or a bad thing.  We got apps and that with the chips and salsas I was full by the time my food showed up.

The salsas were great, and they had some for real kick.  Mmmmmmmmm  I like the spice.

The queso with chorizo was excellent and so was the horchata,

Everything that I had was pretty good.   The service was functional.

The location is interesting, our entertainment for our meal was watching two police officers pull over and arrest someone for quite a while.  

Hmmmmmmmmmmmmm

Still, I would go back :)
Smothered burrito as big as my torso for 6.50. I think I heard a 36 second gooooooool in background. I think I'm in love.

Delicious food and addictive salsa! The service is hit or miss - attentive but forgetful.  Atmosphere is best for a late-night bite when you want to wind down and get some great food to soak up a night of indulgence - I think they close around 1:30am!

The food here is legit and super affordable. The portions are large and you get a variety of salsas with your complimentary chips. Cheap good eats for sure. Beware that they do NOT serve alcohol so don't expect a margarita with your dinner.

Hola, mis amigos! Me gustaron los tacos en Los Carboncitos.  I put a thread out on Yelp talk looking for a place in this area where I could grab some take-out for a few guys.  Mark T. recommended Los Carboncitos.  I am glad that he did.  It was only a few blocks from my destination, so that made it very convenient.  I found a nearby parking spot and put in my order.  They did not seem terribly busy, but it took a bit longer to put my food together than I anticipated (but, not too long).  I was a bit disappointed that they do not have a salsa and condiment bar here.  I really enjoy being able to pick out my own salsas, onions, peppers, etc.  I asked for a variety of salsas with our tacos, and they did oblige. 

We sampled several tacos in our order, including: AL PASTOR, BISTEC, CHULETA, and CHORIZO.  The Al Pastor was a tad disappointing. The Pineapple on these particular tacos reminded me of canned (it may have been).  The chunks were rather large, and it made the taco way too sweet for my taste.  The Bistec was a straightforward steak preparation, and it was just fine.  The Chuleta was equally good (how do you not like pork chop?).  I thought the Chorizo was decent, but my one friend loved it and gobbled them up quickly.  I was a bit sad that they did not offer Carnitas on the tacos (my personal favorite).  All in all, these were solid tacos at reasonable prices.  They may not have been as much to my liking as say TacoMex 1 on Colfax or El Taco Veloz on Federal.  But, I would put them on par with Tacos Junior on Federal.

The gorditas could possibly change your life. They are that delicious.

The salsas make me weep for mercy.

I love you still Los Carboncitos.

I really like this place... it's a bit unassuming but I was surprised at how new and nice the interior is. I happened to come once during a (Mexican) soccer game so it was packed! I'll note that for the future to come for a game. Other times, you have a few randoms here or there dining but I come for take-out. 

This place is from Mexico City, so it's a bit different than what I'm used to (GDL). However, I appreciate the differences and I just know what to expect. I have tried a number of tacos here and they've all been really good. I don't think it's possible to go wrong. They're pretty quick about the orders and pretty generous with the ingredients.

I love Colorado-style Mexican food, but sometimes I also crave the real stuff done Mexico City style and Los Carboncitos is exactly where I go to get it. 

As you might expect from a place called Los Caboncitos, grilled/charbroiled food is the specialty here. You can't go wrong with an order of carne asada or just some tacos served up with one of their four super-spicy salsas.

I also really like the huaraches here because they aren't found at most Mexican restaurants in town. Huaraches consist of a masa (sort of tortilla) base with a variety of toppings on top. I got one with grilled beef, charred nopales, and queso fresco. It was quite delicious.

The service can be a bit slow here sometimes and (rarely, thank goodness), a car will slam into the front entrance, but overall a very good place to get Mexican-style Mexican food.

What A Dump!

No wonder it's my new favorite Mexican restaurant in town.

Weird orange paint job right on the corner of 38th & Pecos.

Sticky 50 year old tables and chairs.

Gigunda glasses of water and soft drinks.

Hard working, fast moving waitresses.

Crappy old tv with soccer games almost 24/7.

The food?

The food is from some Mexican Heaven.

Homemade chips with 5 salsas.

The burritos are e-freaking-normous, and equally delicioso!

Cabeza (brain) tacos!

Lengua (tongue) tacos!

Cheap prices.

Hard core fantastic Mexican food.

Ole!
Our family wouldn't know how good this place was as they didn't have enough time to serve us.

Decided to go out for a late dinner tonight. We chose Los Carboncitos on the recommendation of a friend. 
The salsas delivered when we sat down were fantastic. Five different flavors with chips ranged from very hot to very mild. 
We both ordered huaraches with different toppings. I had chicken and mushrooms, and my friend had steak and shrimp. They were served warm and freshly cooked. They flavors blended well, and we found the food different from typical Mexican fare. We did find a piece of gristle in steak. 
The server was good and attentive.
No alcohol served here.
We spent less than $20, on two of us.
We will definitely try this place again.

Good, tasty mexican food, with complimentary tortillas and five salsas as a starter. My partner and I split an Alambres - kind of an awesome, tasty, make your own street tacos deal with peppers, onions, and our choice of meat- we chose steak and al pastor.  Good flavors, good service, fair prices.

The service was good, and food was wonderful. A lot of locals were dining there while we were, which is a good sign.
Just a few things I would change:
1. The menu is not super vegetarian friendly.
2. The salsa they give you is HOT. I mean REALLY HOT. So if you're a wuss like me, skip the salsa.

Huaraches. O.M.G. Huaraches. 

I had never heard of this dish before, but I am officially in love. I got the bistec Huarache and my boyfriend got another variation of this (his came with avocado and.... hot dog?). My boyfriend's dad got a few different types of tacos which he enjoyed. I'm glad I went with the huarache, though. It was huge and there was plenty to take home once I had my fill. 

The salsas they have at the table were all great. Very flavorful and differing amounts of heat. 

They do not serve alcohol but they were happy to let us bring a cooler with some frosty beverages in.

Los tacos, las tortas, el servicio --what's not too love!? I had tacos al pastor and carnitas, and my friend had a torta cubana. I got to take a bite out of that torta, and had to come back the next week to get one just for me! The service is great;  the mesera was hospitable and patient! I love this place!
Authentic awesome food, friendly service,  great atmosphere. The green salsa is to die for hot and fabulous,  so glad I stopped in

So good! they first served us with 5 different salsas some hotter than the other but the main one was fantastic. We ordered some enchiladas with Mole sauce and it was incredible. I have had Mexican all over the country and this Mole sauce was fantastic and completely homemade. They offer food from all over Mexico including Indian (Native American) styles.

Would love to come back and experience more food.

Good food but chips were stale.  I got take out and the tacos were very little street tacos so good thing I got a burrito too.  Salsas are super hot!  Quesadilla was very greasy from the meat but tasted great.  I like La Loma better but worth a try.

Good Mexican at good value.

Two friends and I stopped by around 10 PM on a Friday night, and we were seated immediately; it wasn't particularly busy, and there is ample seating. The chips that they have to start while you wait to order are just meh, but the different salsas they come with adds nice variety to the starter. We ordered a few things a set of head and tongue tacos to split, the Super Carbonara, and the bistec huarache. The head tacos were deliciously fatty and flavored, while the tongue had an odd flavor and texture; I would definitely recommend the former over the latter. The Super Carbonera was just sort of a jumble of meat that was decent but not amazing, but the corn tortillas that they provide are outstanding. Fresh and soft, those were the real stars of the night. The bistec huarache was also decently flavored/cooked meat on the long, hardened corn tortilla which was not as good as the soft tortillas.

The service was pretty poor as we had to essentially serve ourselves/pick glasses that were actually cleaned over others. For a cheap, solid, no-frills Mexican meal, Los Carboncitos will do just fine.
awesome authentic mexican food! definitely my spot in denver metro for all my mexican food needs

I'm still in shock from our experience here last night! Having been a server for many years, it takes a lot for me to not only complain but also to not tip!

When we came in there were only two other groups seated, but the place quickly became busy with other tables seated all around us. We grew suspicious when tables who came in after us, and ordered after us, got their food first. We were about to say something when one person in our party finally got her two simple tacos placed in front of her.

I, and the other person in our party, sat there without our burritos for another ten minutes. Finally my burrito arrived. I had ordered a steak burrito, not smothered, but after several bites I discovered I was given a chicken burrito. The other person in our party, who still had not gotten their food, had ordered a smothered chicken burrito so we let the server know I must have gotten their food.

They took the burrito back and about ten minutes later finally came back with both of our burritos. The person with us turned their plate around, which was a smothered burrito as ordered, but we all discovered several bites out of it! My bites!! They actually took the chicken burrito back that I had started eating, smothered it and brought it to another person at our table! Wow...wow, is all I can say!

We alerted them of this but they clearly did not understand the issue! This is a health issue and completely appalling. 

We didn't receive even the smallest discount for this blatantly horrible experience, nor did we receive an apology; truly, they just didn't get what the issue was. Again, still in shock!

Ehh on the food and horrible service. Took an hour to get unimpressive enchiladas verdes that are far too expensive. No refills of either chips and salsa or drink during the wait. I'll go elsewhere next time.
I come here for the tacos -- chorizo, al pastor, carnitas -- and the fresh salsas. Superb.

Hi, my name is Doug. I'm a tacoholic. It's been less than 24 hours since I had my last taco. When I can't think of anything to eat I resort to my addiction food most of the time. Although I tried to find a new dealer along West 32nd ave to feed my addiction tonight, they friggin all closed at like 9:00pm WTF! You call yourself a Taqueria and you close at 9:00pm on a Friday? Chingao! I knew Los Carbs would be open so that's where I ended up. Suckin up  the salsa once again. The Alembre was good, the torts handmade to order, service and the salsas a little weak tonight hence the 3 stars. But that didn't stop me from eating!. I'm a weak weak man!  (sob)
       dieciocho.

I would give four stars for food, but service is one star. Went here a couple times with my girlfriend and both times I felt like we were invisible to the staff. I had to refill my own drink and find my own silverware.

The less expensive, fresher (read: not sogged down in yellow cheese/sloppy enchilada sauce) Mexican fare that I have dreams about.

I first shyed away from this place as I was afraid that they only had offerings catering towards the carnivorous types.  Not so.

Enter the Alambre Vegetariano.  It's basically a bunch of veggies/fruit (nopales, pineapple, mushrooms, and onions) scrambled with a bunch of cheese and served with your choice of flour or corn tortillas.  They also obliged the boyfriend's request for a meatless burrito despite one not being on the menu (it was HUGE) and only charged $5 for it.  I asked for a side of guac to eat with my meal and it was the variety that all other guacs should strive to be: bright green and chunky with ample amounts of red onion and cilantro.  At $3 for a big side it was a steal.

Warning about the salsas: they are hot.  All four of them.  I went to El Diablo recently and was able to eat their hot salsa like it ain't no thing after singeing my taste buds with this stuff.

The restaurant is large and welcoming, seldom busy, priced just right, and has an expansive menu.  I'm a fan.

Despite the fact that our waitress was new, knew nothing of the items on the menu, and was having a complete emotional melt-down--Carboncitos can whip up some pretty impressive Mexican cuisine. Being Mexican, I am quite a snob when it comes to the food, but Carboncitos threw it down in the kitchen. Our waitress was hysterical, clueless, and even cussed when we asked what she would recommend. So we opted for the Carboncitos, even though we have never tried them before. Little to my knowledge, the tostadas I always make at home with extra toppings are actually called carboncitos when cooked on a charcoal grill in this part of the country. They were delicious. I will be back, and I hope the crazy waitress is there again too.
Great tacos and they don't overcharge like Tacos Jalisco or similar places.  Extremely good food for reasonable prices.  This is my go-to taco place.
Friendly staff. Great meats on the tacos, especially the fish. They bring chips and salsa as well as four amazing salsas/hot sauces to the table. Extensive menu and lively decor.  Great stuff.
The food is great the service is atrocious.  Takes 20 min for them to take your order then another 45  to bring it out.

Great authentic food, no frills, good price. They bring out 5 different salsas to try, some very spicy. Staff was very friendly.  This will definitely be one of my regular spots when craving some Mexican food...

We are sitting around the table at our home in Saudi Arabia and I ask my kids what they want to do and eat when we head home for Christmas next week.  My oldest daughter says, you know those things that are like corn bread with lots of beans and lettuce on top and you get them at the restaurant that is all orange on the outside?   Yes.  I do.  3 years away and My 13 year old daughter is craving huaraches.  Yes.

I really wanted to love this place.  The salsas they bring out were fantastic, so they definitely get points for that.  I had the pollo, pastor and pescado tacos.  The chicken was kind of just meh, not bad but not great.  The fish was pretty darn tasty.  The tacos el pastor, sadly, were cooked to within an inch of their lives.  It was like eating bacon, but not in a good way.  There was plenty of meat on each of the tacos, so points for that, too.  The service was very friendly and the place was packed.

I'd probably go back and give it another try, but I was really disappointed in the tacos el pastor, since that's the main reason I went.  But, some of the dishes I saw being delivered to other tables looked pretty tasty, so maybe I'll try something different next time.

Ladies:  If you use the restroom to wash your hands, as you probably will after eating tacos and salsa, be careful.  The knobs on the sink are reversed and the hot water is scalding hot.  I turned it on and put my hands under there a split second after turning it on and scalded the crapballs out of my hand.  FYI.

Walked in here on a whim the other day (after Yelping it, of course) and had to walk back out. 

I had pretty high hopes based on the reviews, but the chips were cold and stale and somehow damp, the salsa tasted like tomato puree from a can, and everything was just a bit sticky. I hate leaving a place without giving it a real chance, but I simply couldn't force myself to eat a whole meal here. 

But, I'm giving Los Carboncitos two stars instead of just one--partly because I obviously didn't eat much, and I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt (maybe they were just having a really off day?), and partly because the server was very pleasant. Still, that wasn't enough to make me want to come back.

Our final EATS for year 2009 @ Los Carboncitos Pecos St location.

After work, Hubs and I head down to Los Carboncitos for a very late lunch and an early dinner, on Thursday Dec 31st 2009.  If I am not mistaken, the time was : 1530hrs

Luckily, when we arrived @ this location, the store is still open.  Right after we enter the restaurant, we were greeted by the staff, and we choose our seats.  The waitstaff, gave us the menu and ask us, what we want for our beverage.  Hubs order coffee, while I opt for water.

Here are what we order for that day :

*  Carbonicitos ~ Bistec y Queso.  These comes with 3 toastada shells, steaks and white Mexican cheese, some onions and some cilantro.  We share this dish.  Hubs ate 2 and I ate 1 piece of the toastada shells.

*  Enchiladas En Verde ~ This dish comes with corn tortilla, filled with chicken and topped with tomatillo sauce.  Hubs' order.

*  Camarones Emapanizados ~ This dish comes with breaded shrimps, beans, rice and salad.

Hubs give his order of Enchiladas En Verde 4 STARS.  While for the Bistec y Queso, he gives it 3 stars.

As for my main entree of Shrimp, I give it 3.25 stars.  What I like about my Shrimp dish, was that they did not skimp on the shrimp itself.  The flavor of the breaded shrimp is just norm with salt, pepper and some seasoning in which I am still trying to figure out what kind of seasoning they used.

In addition to this, I am still trying to figure out the 4 Salsas that were served to us @ our table in order for us to spice up our food.  

The service is prompt.  Hubs told me, this place reminds him of some place he ever ate in Mexico and some restaurants back in San Diego, Cali.  Mostly, run by the family.

The decor of this restaurant is simple, bright and clean.  We might return to this restaurant or perhaps try the other locations, if we are in the neighborhood.

I've been here a couple of times and generally find the food to be mediocre at best. I really wanted to like it, but just found the food to be bland and run of the mill. With so many excellent restaurants out there, these guys need to step it up to compete.

Many of the other reviews sing the praises of Los Carboncita's huarache.  Let me direct the spotlight for a few moments to their alambre.  Diced beef onions and peppers grilled amd topped with....  bacon. and cheese....  The buttery goodness lingers on lips as I write this review.  So good.

Now imagine replacing the beef with al pastor.  Sweet and tangy pork mixing with bacon.  I might stab someone to get another al pastor alambre.  Really.

This place is so good my significant other loves Mexican food now.   She normally viewed going for Mexican cuisine as a bargaining chip to go something else she wants.  Now she starts begging to go to Los Carboncitos around lunchtime.  No joke.

Are some of the other things here not the greatest?    Absolutely.   Viewing the menu as a whole might only rate this place three stars.  But the things this place specializes in (huarache, alambre, tacos carboncitos) are worth driving across town for, which is my definition of 5 stars.

It was one of those saturdays we just couldn't decide what to eat. 

We knew some yelpers were working their way thru town eating tacos and thought "Well we're not with them, but we can go eat at one of their stops"

and so we showed up to Los Carboncitos. 

Glad we did.

I love hot stuff. Every dish we make at home has kick. THe more the better.
This place kicked my butt. All 4 salsa's they brought out, HOT.

Before my meal even arrived, my mouth was on fire, my eyes were watering, my nose was running.

Then my food arrived. Best mexican dish I've had in a long time. I of course put more salsa on it, and suffered, but loved every minute of it.

Go there, eat good food.

I have been to this place twice now, and it is by far my favorite Mexican food in Denver. Not that I'm a Mexican food junkie like a lot of people....it's usually pretty far down my priority list. However, authentic Mexican food like the stuff this place serves is a whole different story. There is pretty much no gringo-ized food on the menu. We asked the waitress what region the food was from since I had no idea what most of the stuff on the menu was, and apparently it's Mexico City style. 

The first time we tried both the alambre and the huarache, and both were excellent. Full of flavor, and not so unhealthy tasting like a lot of Mexican food that is drenched in cheese and oil. They also bring you 4 different salsas which are all excellent. The second time I had the mole enchiladas which were literally mind-blowing. By far the best mole I've ever had and tasted very fresh. 

I don't think I'll ever be able to enjoy standard "Mexican" food again. This place is one of my new favorites.

On a sketchy corner of 38th, but worth the visit!
I missed the UYE but decided to stop in to get some yummies!

Bottled coke and fanta! Home made chips!

Salsa is HOT! They aren't kidding, they aren't trying to scare the whities...  This is hot and it's awesome!
I went with the tacos - shrimp, carnitas and beef! Yes and yes!
I'll be getting some guacamole next time!

Hubby did the Huarache mar y tierra - and i partook - huge and delicious! shrimp, bacon and beef - duh!

Great little place, huge menu, super friendly staff, a little bit of street parking.

This is a local place in my neighborhood and I'm pretty happy it has established itself with folks as I hope it is here to stay for a long time. The food is as good today as it was when it opened, the quality is still very high, staff very friendly and always checking on you. One of my favorite things here is the shrimp cocktail, which is giant. It comes in a large cocktail glass like most mexican restaurants however this has the most amazing flavor. I love it! The alambre de bistec is also quite good and a regular on our rotation when we dine here. The place isn't fancy or showy but if you are looking for great food, this is a great place to make a yourself a regular.
Huaraches FTW!!!

I have been here 5 times in the past 4 weeks. My wife is in a show at the Bug theater nearby so I found this place for lunch. We live in one of the whitest parts of the metro area and finding delicious authentic Mexican food is a treat. The first time I got a plate of al pastor and it was amazing. The rest of the times I have been here I get tacos. Simple delicious homemade corn tortillas, topped with your choice of about ten meat preparations, cheese, onion, cilantro, their fresh table salsas and I am in heaven. Service is friendly but not quick, but I'm just getting tacos so who cares. Prices are affordable. I'm hoping my wife does more work with this theater company so I have a reason to come back.

Great stop for a happy hour drink ! Great beer selection, I got their blood orange IPA and it was delicious. Nothing too fruity or overly hoppy. 

Other interesting beers they have: graham cracker porter and old chub nitro scotch ale. I tried graham cracker porter which was good but not as dark as some porters. The old chub was flatter than usual. Lol 

Come try the drinks yourself! They have a HH menu for food as well!

My husband and I were in town for the American Dental Association meeting at the convention center across the street, and stopped in for lunch between classes.

It was a gorgeous and unusually warm day in October so we were pleased to score a comfortable booth near the windows. We both really enjoyed the atmosphere. There's a lot going on!

We started our lunch with a dozen raw oysters to share. They were from New York and of a moderate size (no gulf coast fatties). For the entrée my husband had the market chicken salad, and I had one of the daily specials - the cheesesteak sandwich with fries.

The service was spot-on, and everything was tasty. Nothing stood out as being excellent, but nothing stood out as being bad.

While I wouldn't go out of my way to return, it's a solid choice for lunch if you're in the area.

This place is a lot of what's wrong with Denver's burgeoning food scene. It's a pleasant enough atmosphere and our server was polite and attentive, but the food was mediocre at best. 

I had the sushi bowl salad, and it was wayyyy overdressed. Part of the allure of having sushi is being able to taste the fish and feel its texture. It was lost in this salad.

The brussels sprouts were okay, and the sauce was good, but again, there was far too much sauce. 

Worst of all, the small pour of beer I got was twelve dollars. Twelve dollars for a small pour. That's absurd, and it's part of a broader trend happening here in Denver. Yes, it's a microbrew. Yes, it's probably worth more than your standard pint. But $12? Gimme a break.

The deserts were unimpressive. My wife had the Key Lime Pie and the filling was good but the crust was bland. I had the cheesecake, which was also somewhat bland. Both tasted like they had come out of a freezer. 

We ended up spending over $100 for our meal and it was just mediocre. We won't be going back.

I was a little disappointed with Stout Street Social. I felt it was overpriced and the service was pretty slow. The food was okay, but really not worth the prices when there are so many other excellent places to eat downtown. For 3 people, the lunch bill was $70, (two of the three had water to drink and one iced tea, 3 sushi + salads). I think they probably get a lot of business from people leaving the convention center (as we were), but as a local I would not come back here to eat.

Very fun restaurant across from the convention center.

Before I get to the food I want to say that Whitney our server was one of the best I've had in a long time. She was friendly, had a ton of personality and took care of everything we needed throughout the meal. A great server really does make a meal better.

The atmosphere is bar like in one area with high tables and TVs, a big bar with mussels/shellfish, several tables and booths in a more restaurant style. It was very busy on the Thursday we went so any table was good.

The only item I wouldn't order again is the ceviche. It came in a cup surrounded by white and blue tortilla chips. You had to use a fork to get the ceviche out. The ingredients were a ton of onions  (should be chopped up not large pieces ), lime, a type of whitefish and cucumber. Ok taste but nothing special.

What was amazing is the social burger. They cook it to order (I went for medium rare) & the burger has a ton of good spice and flavor and is high quality. The social comes with pork belly, onion straws, jalapeño raspberry jam, lettuce and aoili. With a side of seasoned fries this was out of this world good.

They have a ton of beers and cocktails and what appears to be a great happy hour.

Will definitely be coming to stout street again.

Good location, large selection of food with equally good service. 

Overall this was a good place, we ordered a few rolls which I found very tasty, a couple of prime-rib sliders which I kept to myself and a few glasses of wine. Everything was very good including our service.  My only complaint is when I place says they have sushi they should somehow indicate that what they really mean is rolls and they only had a few of them to boot, we would have probably gone somewhere else because we were really in the mood for sushi, but at this point to hungry to continue on in our search for food.

Stopped by here for a drink and some light grub and was a little unimpressed. The menu is a little unappetizing. I ended up going with a California roll and it was grocery store comparable, which was a shame when you are paying $11 for a California roll! The table also got an order of kimchi fries to share, which were good.

Idk, I think I would pass on this one. It might be a cool place to go and grab a drink, but I wouldn't recommend dinner here. Nice atmosphere and location if you are downtown.

This place is right by the convention center. It has a small outdoor patio and a very large bar.

We stopped in for a late dinner after arriving here for the weekend. Grabbed a seat at the bar. For a Thursday, the place was hopping!

Great selection of beer and wines. In fact one of the best wine selections I have seen for a causal place. I noticed a new Orin Swift wine by the glass I had never tried. the bar tender let me have a sample even! He said it was a label that is usually reserved for wine club. Super cool to see it on the menu! 

They have some interesting menu items: kimchee fires, muscle fries, fresh oysters. The food is upscale for a place I thought would be standard bar food. 

We split the Brussel sprouts, kimchee fires and Mac and cheese.

The Brussels were crispy and wonderful! The waiter said the kimchee fries were his favorite, but he warned me the kimchee was not spicy. I thought there were very good even with mild kimchee. And the kitchen was so awesome, they split our Mac and cheese for us!

The wait staff was so attentive and fabulous. We just loved the place!!!

A hip restaurant in the heart of lower downtown near the convention center and near the 16th Street Mall. They have a good menu with decent drinks and a good selection of beers. This is a fairly casual restaurant for all types. My dining experience was ordinary and much like any other restaurant in the area.

My girlfriend and I went to Stout Street the other day. I really like the space but I'm just not in love with the menu. The food to share is odd. We ended up getting the tuna tower, which was good. Everything is just really heavy apart from the salads.
The staff was very nice as was their wine selection.

3.5 stars (extra half for convenience as this bar was literally attached to our hotel) (embassy suites). 

They have a menu that has the most random things on it "to appeal to everyone" says one of the bartenders. We tried the mussels with fries and garlic aioli on top... because we like fries and mussels so why wouldn't they be good together? And they were good! The mussels were big and tasted fresh, and the sauce was very well seasoned. The fries still retained their crispness and didn't get soggy. 

Tip: ask for extra aioli on the side for your fries. Because, yum. 

As for drinks, they have a fairly wide selection of Colorado beers. I especially like the Floozy and Rob's blonde. 

We also came back one morning for a bloody Mary  (it was just too convenient). My friends really liked it but I'm a bit of a bloody Mary aficionado... it was okay. A bit too tomato juicy for my taste. Juice being the key word there. I need more substance in my bloodies. 

Anyway, good place to stop by if you're in the area, but don't go out of your way to visit. Also gets really crowded as it's right next to the convention center.

After my last review, the manager graciously sent my injured friend a gift card. I thought that was very sweet. My friend was so impressed and decided to take us back here to use the gift card. 

My friend called and booked for happy hour for Saturday afternoon, Saturday morning Stout Street got in touch and let her know that they made a mistake and Happy Hour is only Mon - Fri. So we went anyway and had some drinks and apps. 

My hubby and I arrived first, and it was my fault for not hearing the girl when she asked if we wanted a booth or high table, but I replied with "if we sit outside can we move in after if our friends don't want to sit out there?" I didn't really get an answer, she just took us outside and sat us right in the sun - didn't ask if we wanted to sit at the vacant table under the umbrella or anything. After about 15 minutes of roasting my hubby went in and asked if we could move into the shade, so she came and helped move us over, didn't seem very happy about it.

The guy who was serving us was really friendly. Bought us beer samples when we having trouble deciding. My hubby ordered one of the two beers that he sampled and was given the wrong one. I told him to send it back but he drank most of it then just ordered something different after. I had a few different cocktails, they were all really nice. The Sakitini was the best I think. The apps were kimchi fries and calamari. They were really tasty, you don't get much calamari for $12 and the kimchi could use a little more spice but other than that they were really good. 

With so many places to go & try in Denver, it won't be my first place to go but if someone else invites us along then I won't say no either.

My coworkers and I stopped in here for lunch while we were in town for a work conference. This place was conveniently located right across the street from the Denver Convention Center.

*Kim Chi Fries*
We all agreed that this was good. If you like Kim Chi and you like fries, you would definitely like this item.

*Left Hand Black Jack Porter*
I'm a fan of Left Hand Brewery and porters, so this was right up my alley.

*Grilled Salmon Salad*
The main ingredients where kale, quinoa, salmon, and apple. It was a pretty interesting and different salad, but there was a bit too much kale for my taste.

*Clam Chowder*
It was a surprisingly good bowl of clam chowder! I usually only expect it to be good in New England or up in the Pacific Northwest.

Overall service was good, food was decent, and they've got a decent drink list. I would definitely recommend coming here for a quick bite or a meal if you're in the downtown area.
Good food friendly staff short ribs were very good. Appetizers were average. Working on the desert they were very good

Great appetizers, beer and dessert. 

I never did eat dinner here. We ordered so many small plates with calamari, oysters, and sashimi that there was only room left for dessert. 

The appetizers were all awesome as was the service. 

This tavern has a wide selection of tapped craft beers so everyone should be able to find there favorite type of beer if not the label. I settled for a porter and the followed that with my favorite bourbon, Bulleit. 

I really liked the table arrangements too. There was plenty of space between tables so you don't feel like your joining the party next to you. They also have many tv screens so you can catch a game during breaks in conversation.

Try the banana cream pie with Oreo crust. That was amazing!

My bf and I wanted a couple apps and drinks and we were nearby so we stopped in based on the positive yelp reviews. However, we were totally unimpressed.

We wanted a seat out on the patio, and the hostess was really, weirdly awkward about seating us. She did, and all was well. Until the server came. She was equally quiet and awkward. I really can't explain it, other than that it felt awkward every time she came by. 

We ordered a couple drinks and they took awhile to come. Then we ordered the nachos and buffalo wings. They were both good, which is why I'm giving 2 stars, but it was just a completely lackluster experience overall. I would not visit again unfortunately.

Came here for brunch on a Saturday. No wait, booth seating, plenty of tvs for college football, golf, etc. They let us request what games we wanted on the tvs if no one had made a previous request.

Service was good, our server was attentive, gave us time when we needed but did a good job of coming back to check on us.

Okay now the food and drinks:
Coconut French toast: GET IT. Sweet deep fried crunchy goodness (that didn't taste too much like oil). Cinnamon cream cheese and maple syrup on the side. Definitely a great vacation treat!!!

Ceviche: chef's selection of seafood each day. Small portion (maybe an 10oz cup) that was mostly onions, jalapeno, pineapple and liquid. I had to dig for the fish. Flavor was tart with some tequila, balanced by the sweet of the fruit. Came with 3 large puffy wonton/tortilla chips (yum) then a whole plate of regular tortilla chips. Probably could've done without the regular ones cuz the puffy ones were way better and all I needed for the amount of fish. 

Bloody Mary with oyster: decent bloody. Old bay seasoning and an oyster on top. Used to much more out of the box Bloodies but this wasn't bad.

Ruby Mule: do not order it. I left the full drink on the table. Yuck!

This place is really good. It's totally my style - comfortable and casual, lot of booths, lots of different seating options for your group/party. They have a cool seafood/oyster bar, I haven't ordered anything form it, but it looks good and I don't smell it walking through so that's always a good sign. They have really good specialty drinks and great beer selection. I've been twice and ordered a burger the first time, it wasn't particularly memorable, but I went back so it must have been decent. The second time I went, I got the smoked primerib sandwich and it was amazing. One of the best sammies I've ever had. Came with superb au jus with a hint of rosemary- I could tell somebody put love in it. Homemade horsey cream and fries were hot and fresh. My friend got the salmon salad and she also said hers was amazing- yes the salmon!

Lunch here was SO good, I had the braised short rib at Elyse in the bars recommendation....Elyse was awesome!!  Quick to greet me and very personable!   Definitely would come back again for these two reasons.

Had a great dinner two nights in a row. In town on business at the Hyatt Regency which is right next to the Stout. 

Sat at the bar and the bartenders were very friendly and efficiently worked as a team to be sure we were all taken care of.

The food was really. nice,  very fresh and full of great flavors. I had the mussels and fries the first night and the blackened Mahi tacos the second.  Both meals were excellent. Salads each night with the meal were fresh the white balsamic house dressing is just right. 

Please go and have some good food and good times.

This place actually exceeded our expectations. We were expecting sport's bar food but ended up sharing an appetizer of sweet chili brussell sprouts, short ribs, and artichoke dip. All 3 were awesome and we licked our plates clean. 

I could go for it right now!

First restaurant on our Denver birthday trip! Stopped in for some happy hour snacks and drinks before the Nuggets game. Stellar oyster menu and the Brussel sprouts were out of this world (and a little spicy!). 

Happy hour martins - $4. I had the basil martini and it was divine. Great deals on beer, wine and cocktails as well.

Relaxed, modern vibes with great service. We are staying across the street, so we may even be back before Sunday!

Very eclectic menu and a really an eclectic place, sort of upscale yet with a ton of TVs around the bar in the center of the restaurant. It was packed on a Friday night but we were able to get a table for 8 after less than 30 minutes of waiting, and our tabs were easily transferred from the bar to our table, making things even easier. Everyone seemed pleased with their food and the service was excellent, our waitress was very knowledgable and helpful. She was carrying out the tuna stack to another customer and it looked so good several of us had to order it. It was delicious, such a fun flavor and texture combo, sort of like a giant sushi roll. I would definitely go back for that entree alone.

Service was great here. Ian was awesome.  The sushi was...OK...it is interesting that that offer it here and have a diverse yet simple menu, but its probably best to leave your sushi dining for another place if that's really what you are in the mood for. However the Tuna Tower is pretty dang good. I had the Salmon salad that was also simple yet great.  

This place has a neat atmosphere, but they should probably leave the garage door for the patio closed on hot days, or even just open at night, as this made the rest of the restaurant extremely hot. 

Overall, not a bad option, especially for visitors in town near the convention center.

Looking for a place to watch MNF near our hotel, we found Stout Street Social right across the street. It wasn't too busy, there were plenty of TVs, and we were seated right away. We requested a spot with a great view of the football game, however, she sat us next to the basketball game. So, we had to move ourselves and eventually our server did change the channel to the football game after multiple requests. Other than the game, our service was great. She checked on us often and it didn't take long to get our food and drinks.

For appetizers, we had the kimchi fries and deviled eggs. We really didn't find the fries to be that exciting. The deviled eggs though were so good. If you like deviled eggs, these are a must. The amount of truffle on them is perfect. For my entree, I had the green chile mac & cheese and that was so creamy and the green chile adds a nice flavor to it. I was worried that the green chile would be spicy, but it is not spicy at all. It is served in a pretty big bowl/plate but it was so good I ate it all! For drinks, I got the blueberry collins which is OK. I really couldn't taste the alcohol, so for my next drink, I had the Breckenridge basil which I enjoyed more. 

Others in the party had the brussel sprouts (really good as well), the bison burger (only OK, but the bacon on it was amazing), the fish tacos (a bit spicier than expected), the clam chowder (amazing), and the chocolate cake (rich and delicious). 

If you're looking for a spot to watch some games with tasty food, I'd recommend Stout Street Social. It looks like they have some good happy hour specials as well.

Stout Street Social was a mixed bag for me.  I went with a group of eight ladies on a Saturday night prior to a show at the Bellco.  Luckily,  we had reservations,  and we were seated quickly.  Our waiter,  although nice,  seemed to be either overwhelmed or indifferent to us.  Everyone seemed to enjoy their food,  especially the roasted Brussel Sprouts and sushi.  The problem came with the drinks.  Three of us were immediately served red wine,  the two who ordered white wine were not served for approximately 15 minutes,  and those who ordered beer... Oh my!! Exactly how long does it take to pour a beer?  One of my friends waited through the ENTIRE dinner to be served!!  That included multiple friendly reminders to the wait staff from us,  which led to one bus boy rolling his eyes at us.  Not OK.  As far as food and atmosphere,  I would recommend this restaurant.   However,  the terrible bar service negates said recommendation.  I would like to think this was a isolated incidence,  but when I read other reviews I noticed multiple bad reviews regarding the service.

Came in on a Saturday, late afternoon. We decided to try the special: shaved roast beef tacos ( one of us liked, one of us didn't), green chile Mac and the Cuban. While we waited, we tried the chicken nachos, which were recommended here in the reviews. 

A few notes- our service was SLOW. It took a long time to get drinks, despite being able to see the bar, and it not being that busy. Our food came out really slow too. Not sure what that's about, since a lot of the reviews here say that service is so fast. The nachos were probably the best of our dishes. Tacos were full of filler (fries) and that was really disappointing. Atmosphere here is good, and our waitress was very friendly. Just disappointing that food wasn't better.
Not a bad place to catch a game. Lots of TVs. I got the Bison Stir-Fry and Crispy Brussels. Both were a tad salty, but I still enjoyed them. The Bison in particular, was tasty.

Awesome place to visit.  Great vibe and a few tvs to watch the game.  The servers were very nice and quick when you ordered something.  My friends and I had a variety of drinks and none of them were disappointed.  Had a selection of appetizers from sushi to nacho and they were flavorful and delicious.  Will definitely come back and had dinner next time.

I searched yelp for a good brunch spot because I was craving a veggie omelet. THANK YOU Yelp. 

Stout Street was off the hook. We started with two delicious bloody marys topped with fresh shucked oysters, they were spicy and delightful. I then had one of the best scrambles in my life. What was so special you ask? Fresh ingredients! Spinach, asparagus, cheddar cheese, cherry tomatoes, crispy potatoes, and hollandaise sauce (and I typically abhor hollandaise sauce but this was velvety cream dream). My bf got the green chili biscuits that had chorizo gravy, it was good but no comparison to my scramble. 

Nice atmosphere, great patio and right across from the convention center. 

If I lived in Denver this would be my go to brunch spot. It was awesome

My 3rd time here, last visit was also 3-star -- same this time -- "A-OK" -- but identical issue to last time -- slow service, but I must say they're at least extremely friendly! 

We love sitting directly at the bar because it usually means faster service, but we sat at an awkward place of the bar where we couldn't be served by the bartender as drinks would have to be served over their seafood bar -- weird, just weird + we felt in the way and bumped into -- and it still took forever to get served -- so as soon as available, we took regular seats at the bar -- we of course got served immediately, just about in all ways.

KUDOS to the manager (3/16/16, 6:30pm) as he noticed that we were visibly disturbed and asked how we were doing; we kindly and gladly shared our situation and he apologized. 

I had the Mahi Mahi fish tacos -- just ok, fish was a little dry, and they only offered flour tortillas, whereas 100% of every other place I've been also offers corn tortillas (healther, better!) and I had the seasonal veggies, which were all root veggies -- again, just ok and were actually way too salty.

I truly enjoyed the Hump Day Happy Hour special of the $1 oysters and 2-for-1 beers... just hope this restaurant doesn't decay to a Colorado Convention Center customer-only way of serving customers; this place could really be a gem for Denver.... great decor, setting, seating areas -- all awesome -- just speed up the service + change the weird bar seating at the seafood bar.

A great surprise on a night in downtown Denver. Really enjoyed their version of New England clam chowder (as a Massachusetts native, this dish is important to me) and found it to be much more authentic than many other imitators out of my home state. Gained extra points for having Lagunitas, one of my favorite brews, on tap. Can't recall the exact fish entree that I had, but definitely know that it was tasty and generously portioned. Slightly pricey as may be expected for downtown dining, but worth it for the experience and good food!

Meeting a friend for a light dinner and drinks in d/t Denver Stout was one of the places Adam wanted us to try since he had a great experience here. 

I had their Cuban sandwhich and The Angry Bird Cider. I will have both again if in the area. The Cuban was well prepared with enough meat and they simply made the meat the star. Well the cider is my favorite of the night.

The staff were really great with an occasional forgetful moment. 

Stout is a short walking distance to the 16th St Mall and a few hotels.

While visiting Denver with a couple friends last weekend, we were staying near Stout Street Social and one friend had been here for brunch and highly recommended it. Coming here for lunch was so easy! We were quickly seated and the service was really attentive the whole time.

Deciding what to order was such a challenge! And not just because none of us had slept much and just gotten off a plane. The Ahi Tuna Tower looked very tempting, and I saw it being delivered to someone later on and boy, did it look yummy.

I ordered the Prime Rib Sliders (from the appetizer menu) as my entree. The meat was just melt in your mouth good. I normally hate onion rings but these (called crispy onions) were so delicate they added to the meat in such a great way. The combination of the two sauces, the au jus and the horseradish aioli, was just a flavor orgasm. I just wanted to mix them together and drink it. Both guys I was with ordered the Colorado Bison Burger and customized with cheese, one Swiss and one pepper jack I think. Both were really, really happy.

The fries that came with the burgers were really out of this world, and I'm not much of a fan of fries. They are so well seasoned and crispy without being dry. They went so well with the horseradish aioli and au jus from my sliders as well. The meal from start to finish was the perfect thing to bring us back to life after the flight and get us ready for the day.

Everyone we interacted with at the restaurant had a smile on his or her face and seemed genuinely interested in making our dining experience great. I have no idea when I may be back in Denver but if I am, I'll make a point to come back here, not just for the service but for the tons of things on the menu I still want to try!!!

Joined a friend here for some snack, drinks, dinner and to use her Groupon!
I enjoyed the brusel sprouts - so amazing - and a glass of wine or 2 waiting...
When we started to enjoy our meal we went for a schmorgasborg - loaded wings, a sushi roll and a bowl of mussels...

The mussels - would not do it again...  sushi roll was tasty - but i think other things are better here and the sushi should be enjoyed at other places, and the wings were tasty!

Definitely a varied menu,tons of seating, and if i go again i'll enjoy the bar area instead.

Staff is beyond sweet, helpful and just all around wonderful!

What a great place if you're looking for some options! Japanese, Thai, American, Latin...whatever your stomach craves for, you'll find it here (actually, many other restaurants in Downtown Denver serve fusion food too!). 

My table ordered a few appetizers to share: Fresh Shucked Oysters were very good - I did not have a bite, but my coworker seemed to enjoy them (MK price but they had a shipment from Canada for $2 each, it is typically $3-$4.50 each). Ahi Tuna Tower - $13.95 - had some good flavors. The spicy crab gave the dish a little kick, whereas the tuna was tender and gave a balance from the spicy crab. I personally liked the crispy rice because it gave some textures, but they put a bit too much on the plate. Lastly, the one appetizer I highly recommend is the Crispy Brussels - $7.95. It was such an interesting concept to see rice krispy cereal added, but I didn't taste it all too much. It had a great flavor! 

For my entree, I ordered the Braised Beef Short Rib - $18.95. Boy was it amazing! The short rib was very flavorful and tender. Below the short rib is a mix of mashed sweet potato and cubed sweet potato. I enjoyed the mashed sweet potato, but some of the cubed potatoes were a bit raw still. 

Overall, the staff was friendly, the ambience was on par, and the prices were great. I would recommend this place to a friend.

My younger daughter and I came here on Saturday, March 5th, because of the great Yelp comments. Kudoos to everyone who posted reviews so I could choose a good place to eat that was close to both the Denver Art Museum, where we spent the afternoon, and the Denver Center for the Performing Arts complex, where we went in the evening for a show at the Buell Theater. I wanted the whole day to feel special, as I don't often go to Denver anymore, especially with my daughter. It wasn't a special day for either of us, I mean it wasn't anyone's birthday or something like that, but I don't often go out with her, so when I do, I like to make it interesting for the both of us. Luckily, the weather was lovely, and we managed to get everywhere we wanted by walking. Big cities have a lot to offer, ye'know.

I wasn't 100% sure we would get in to Stout St. Social without a reservation, but we did. We sat at the bar, where we both met lovely people working here, and sharing the bar with us. It's a fun place, but it's big and it was very busy. Despite all that, we got all our drinks and food items quickly. 

I ordered a wonderful, special, dark, rich beer for myself (I so love flavorable beers), but I can't for the life of me recall the name (ugh, I really hate that), and my daughter ordered sake. For my entree, I ordered the Shrimp Tempura Roll and my daughter had the Ahi Tuna Tower. Both were fantastic, and huge! We barely managed to finish them. For the prices, you get a LOT of food. 

I can't wait to go again with a friend who's coming later in the month.

It's a restaurant slash upscale sports bar with local beers to eat your food with! Basketball on multiple tv's all over this restaurant so you have a view anywhere you sit whether your dining at a table or sitting at the bar.
I got the Kimchi Fries and the BBQ Glazed Salmon! The kimchi fries were fun but the salmon was great and was actually upstaged by the vegetables they were cooked excellent and exploded with flavor! 

I work in the fashion industry and travel a lot, if your from out of town I recommend the Blackened Rocky Mountain Trout it's local and looked really good....the local beer was great did I mention that??

Came here on a late night and was a bit confused when I first walked in here. You are asked to seat yourself, but it is not exactly clear where you can sit (dining are vs bar). The bartender had to ask us to move tables so that he could serve us. They have some great happy hour deals. We were here on a Tuesday night and they had a $9.99 deal for a pint of beer with sushi roll. You only have limited choices on the rolls and we got the spicy tuna roll. We also ordered the kimchi fries because seems like other yelpers have liked this. 

Food is not bad, they have some creative dishes like the kimchi fries. The kimchi fries was definitely on the sweeter side, but it was pretty good. I would love to come back here to try some other stuff on the menu!

Interesting and delicious food! Cocktails didn't skip on liquor but were perfectly balanced. We tried the tropical tuna roll, salmon salad and fish tacos.  Each seemed more delicious then the last. Service was timely and thoughtful.

Best spicy California roll ever had. Ceviche was good, just very small for the $. Waitress was ok, did her job but to the minimum. I had questions about the area, being a tourist and all but she did not  act interested in being "social". Ironic I thought.

Solid happy hour & week night specials. I have been here a few times now and it is huge! Typically a good time at a decent price, as long as you go during happy hour.

We sat at the bar last night and had some hh drinks and food while watching the sushi crank out & the drinks fly. There is 2$ off sushi during happy hour and people were ordering enough to keep two guys super busy! 

They have a huge selection of beers on tap. Some are more costly than others, we were told there is currently a $15 sour beer available. When hh drinks are three or four bucks that is what we went with instead. That includes Manhattans and Martinis!

The joint is family friendly and has a large bar/high top table area. We even sat outside on one evening when the weather was nice. There are a lot of large flat screens in the bar area as well.

We had an issue with our server spazing out on us at the end yesterday, but a manager looking fellow hooked us up with some complimentary tequila shots so that was cool. Not sure what happened, but she went from friendly to missing and rude. She likely had some external issue unrelated cuz we are supercool. All other experiences had decent service so hopefully this was an isolated incident.

Overall, this is a solid bar/restaurant and I say check out the happy hour if possible.

This is a tale of two restaurants and the differences around service.  At that last minute I had to switch open table reservations and try this place (a fire at a nearby pizza place).  

In a previous review about a different restaurant I complained about where when an order had to be returned/remade, the other restaurant failed in follow up  (no manager to apologize, no check to see if the second try was right, no offer to buy something -- no nothing).  

At Stout Street Social, I also had to return a sandwich.  My customized cuban sandwich was incorrect.  In fairly quick turn around, the manager delivered my corrected sandwich, said it was on him and later checked to be sure all was OK.   That is the way service should be.  

Thank you Stout Street Social.  The food was fine, they have a good beer list...  Even Chimay on tap (though I didn't have any).  The staff could be a bit better educated on the beers, but that is minor.  My family and I enjoyed our lunch and when we need a lunch near the convention center we will consider it again.

Wow! So glad my large group of co workers stopped here. We were greeted immediately and sat with ease for a party of 11! Waters came out and we had the best server Jacinda who "shot it to me straight" and gave us some killer recommendations. Everything we tried on menu was amazing. Shout out to the chef for the chefs choice sushi it was to die for. In all seriousness this place has everything for all types of food lovers.. Oysters .. Sushi.. Nachos salmon. Burgers you name it they got it and they use all fresh ingredients. Next time I'm in Denver I'm coming here. Thanks again Jacinda! You were a amazing server!

We went here for lunch. It was quite good. Calamari is so tender we didn't think it was squid at first. Sushi roll was good, but, like usual for me, the rice wasn't right. It was the right temperature but it was mushy. Fish tacos were really good. Chicken rice bowl was amazing as well. I can't say anything about this place as a night stop, but lunch was simply fantastic.

First of all, the quality of the food is a 4-5 star for its price point. Everything else was 1-2 star. I went for happy hour and at the beginning, the service was fine. As soon as the joint became moderately busy, everything went to hell. My server was no where to be found and I continually had to find other servers to get my orders in before HH was over. 

They had a Gluten Free menu which was very promising for the sake of my wife. However, you failed miserably. They stated a tempura sushi roll was gluten free. They said we had to just omit the crunchy stuff on top. It came out with the crunchy stuff. Sent back. They then came out with another roll brought by the manager who then said the roll was not gluten free at all. What a pain in the ass. He said the GF menu was "not up to date." What the heck does that mean anyway?

He ended up comping us a roll and the tab was still really high since a lot of the orders that I thought were put in before HH did not happen as such. At that point, we just wanted to get out of there. Its a real shame because the food is delicious, but I would be incredibly hesitant before coming back.

Lastly, the way they have the outdoor patio set up is with a counter with chairs that don't even fit. That was the first strike since you cannot put 3 next to each other; it is too tight by like 1 inch. That is just a dumb mistake.

Limited happy hour not much selection and not great prices. $4 drink specials make up for the good. The service is really slow. If I could choose I probably would not come here. It's a little too expensive for what you get.
Do not get the Brussels sprouts. They come out burnt.
Grabbed dinner here with my family. The craft beer selection is vast and the food we had was good. Most people with us opted for the burger and it was well received.
Not much to choose from on the menu but I will admit I did enjoy what I ordered off the menu. I'm obsessed with the Brussel sprouts from here, super yum! Everything tastes good though, yes.

This place has a great vibe - open kitchen in the back with lime green subway tile and reclaimed wood. The bar is good sized and there are lots of tables as well.

When you walk in, there is a small raw bar so I thought I'd try some oysters. Hump day specials was $1 per so I got 1/2 dozen and I admit I was a bit disappointed. Although the flavor of the oysters were good, they were pretty small and shucked poorly - oysters were torn up and I got several bit of broken shells.

Having said that, the rest of our experience redeemed the oysters. Great beer and craft cocktail selection and the Brussels sprouts were reason enough to come back. The menu seems a bit all over the place but again , it's interesting and keeps you curious.

Just attended a conference in Denver this week and stayed at the Embassy Suites! This corner spot is a must stop for anyone! Attentive and well trained staff of bartenders and servers! My gauge for well run establishments is managerial involvement with the staff and "touching tables" with the guests. Manager from Pittsburgh, forgot his name (sorry) was excellent and personable. Taking time with out if towners to discuss oyster selection and Denver as a whole. Moved my check from the bar to a table, no problem.  My Prime Rib was good, not my best ever, but respectable. My wife and daughters burgers were described as "pretty awesome", so there! Visit, eat Happy Hour Oysters on Wed.
Food came out super fast. Wait staff was frieldnly. I'd recommend the Thai calamari & tropical tuna roll for sure!

Stout Social has it all! I went here to watch Game 5 of the 2016 World Series and I was not disappointed. The Cubs won! The cider on tap was refreshing (not too sweet), the market chicken salad was absolutely amazing (one of the best salads I have ever had), and the atmosphere was electric. I should have went back to Stout to watch Game 6 instead of going to a new bar. Well, live and learn. Stout Social is great!

I've been hearing good things about this place, so when the opportunity presented itself, I suggested to the hubby that we try it out! Here are the takeaways:

1. Killer seafood - and so many different kinds! Oysters, sushi, fresh bar!
2. 75+ beers on draft - ranging from all flavors and sizes!
3. Atmosphere is super cool, laid back and relaxed. Definitely a fun place to enjoy a few drinks, happy hour or a late night snack.
4. Service was pretty good - but lacked enthusiasm - maybe an off night. 

Overall - this place is one i'll return to with a seafood buddy!

Amazing service! I'm in Denver for a conference with a group of co-workers and we had dinner at Stout St. Social last night. 

We were greeted by the happiest host I've ever met. He gave as a tour of the raw bar and told us about the menu. 

A few of us in the group ordered dirty martini's, we asked the waiter if they had blue cheese stuffed olives and unfortunately they didn't. However when the drinks came the waiter appeared with a cup of blue cheese stuffed olives. He had run back to the kitchen and made some for us. seriously so nice!  

For food we started with spinach and artichoke dip and crispy brussel sprouts. The brussel sprouts were really good and my favorite of the two. For dinner four out of five of us got sushi which was really well done. And the other person got the wedge salad with chicken which looked great as well. 

As we were leaving I overheard the host saying how happy he was to see guests leaving happy. 

Stout St. Social is right by the convention center so a great stop if you are staying nearby and in town for a conference.

Uh, what do I say, I really didn't like the food here. I sampled a bunch of different foods and they were either average or under whelming. The wings were average, the skins on them were crispy which was actually really nice, the fried brussels sprouts were average, the artichoke dip was average, their mac & cheese was not very good, and the nachos were average. For my entrée I had sushi which, again, was average. Overall my experience fell short of my expectations and I would not go back to this restaurant again, definitely not a repeat.

AT LAST, CASUAL YET DISCERNING  DINING CLOSE TO THE THEATER! 

First time to Stout after searching for restaurants nearest the Denver Center for the Performing Arts, and so happy to find this spot (open since December)! How many times have I cut short a fancy dinner at Teatro, Kevin Taylor, Oceanair due to tight theater timing? 

Stout Street Social fills that in-between spot in that it is casual, yet refined...you can expedite your meal and still enjoy quality food prior to the theater here. 

We enjoyed the happy hour nachos, tuna roll, salmon with mango roll, prime rib sliders (WOW, btw...WOW!), Olive Oil Cake. 

Our server, Ian, delivered competent, professional service and told us all about the other great dining opportunities at Rialto, Hotel Boulderado...I cannot wait to see what they offer at those spots.  

HOWEVER...after returning after the show for a nightcap...

We love the $1 oysters from 6p to close (which seems to be at about 10p) but CONFIRM that the ones that you order are, indeed, the '$1' oysters. We had a surprise when the second server (yes, we came in twice in one night!!) presented us with a bill for $42/dozen. Ouch. When asked, we thought she sort of glossed over the price as none of us (three adults) caught the bit about us NOT ordering the $1 oysters. 

Our second server...I may not be back after that experience. If not for the experience with Ian earlier in the eve, I'd give this spot 2 stars. However, our experience earlier in the eve seemed more representative of what we think this restaurant strives to offer, so did not penalize them with a 'meh' review. However, lose your late night server. She did not do you any favors.

This is crowd-pleasing food. Nothing exotic, but each item is dialed in: items range from sushi to nachos to Italian-inspired country desserts.
