Great location for the convention center or performing arts. And for that, its a convienent place to eat before an event. Otherwise, somewhat unremarkable. 

Despite the oyster bar, its mostly salads and burgers with a few fish options. The food was fine, but not particularly memorable. 

The bar area has been packed every time I've been with big groups. So plenty of space if your looking to reserve happy hour tables for a lot of people. The downside to that is that you almost struggle to get to tables on the other side of the bar area.

Obsessed with the tuna tower. Try it, you won't regret it. I hear everything else is delicious but I literally cannot convince myself to order anything else. Great location, great beer selection, and did I mention the tuna tower? Do it.

Andrew took good care of us at the bar. Old Fashioned. Let us try beer samples which landed me on Oscar Blues Old Chub. Snacked on the Crispy Brussels and Kimchi Fries. Quite a decadent night. And did I mention the Broncos were playing the Panthers on EVERY t.v.

If I could give this place more stars, I would. A friend and I adopted this place as our own while in Denver for a week-long conference trip. The bartenders were amazing! And really, the bartenders can make or break your time there. They were fantastic. 

As was the food. We had (over the course of several days, mind you) mussels and fries, chicken nachos, a bison burger, kimchi, sushi, and oysters. So. Many. Oysters. The first few days we were there, whoever was shucking was incredible. They were some of the cleanest, perfectly shucked oysters I've had. Delicious and fresh. The last night, the guy wasn't quite as good, but they were still tasty. 

And of course, the drinks. Good selection on tap, and the cocktails were crazy strong and yummy. Our bartenders made great recommendations based on what we liked, and they were pretty spot on. 

If I ever make it back to Denver, this will be my first stop :)

Food was good (nothing memorable but maybe we order the wrong things)  a bit spendy.  The service was nice. 

Local is key - in the lobby of Embassy Suites Denver and across the street from Downtown/Convention Center in Denver

Good for the staff #meeting before the #event @Embassy Suites Denver .
Good for client #dinner after the  #event @Embassy Suites Denver 

I'd try it again!
Just finished dinner with my wife at Stout Street. Food was delicious and the service by our waiter James was spot on. When we return to Denver, we will eat here again.

Came here for a drink before seeing a play at the Buell. We got oysters as well because they have a great deal on Tuesdays! We had already eaten dinner but noticed their reasonable prices and good quality daily happy hour options on both food and drinks. 

Loved the Cisco Brewing Indie IPA. Our waiter Steve gave us great tips around the city; he was helpful, personable, and funny. 
Steve is legit! 

Loved sitting outside as the sun is going down- and the music set a good atmosphere. Loved it and will be coming back! 

Fun tip: if you are going to the performing arts center they buy your first drink!!
The food (ahi stack, oysters and Brussels sprouts) was amazing and the service was exceptional. We loved our service from Jordan. He was knowledgeable and fun. Highly recommend when in Denver!

Very pleasant atmosphere and great food. 

Pretty mellow, would be great for an after work drink

Excellent staff. Stopped on busy evening when big convention in town so every place packed. They worked to get us in quickly. Server was knowledgable about the fresh oysters, kept our drinks and food arriving quickly, and gave us breathing room to chat over drinks. Food was excellent. Tried a variety of oysters and all were fresh and tasty. Bison burger was cooked to perfection and was juicy and flavorful. Kimchi fries were different. It is fries with Kimchi on top like loaded fries. Restaurant is right across from conf center so reservations are recommended for groups or if not wanting to wait.

We ate here 3 times on our stay in Denver.  We had Kerry as our waitress the 1st night and requested her the other 2.  She was that good.  Very attentive, great personality.  The food was great also.  The BBQ salmon was awesome.  Great desserts.  A wonderful time and great atmosphere.

We came here for brunch this past Saturday for my bf's birthday. We ended up having a party of about 35 ish and the staff was very accommodating. Service was a bit slow but I didn't blame them one bit because they weren't expecting such a big group and neither was I. The reservation was for 15. Oops! We were able to all sit in the same room but three long tables. The restaurant was not very busy during the time we were there, which was pretty surprising. The food was great. I tried the biscuits and gravy which also included bacon, egg, and pork green chile. I really enjoyed that. I also tried the cinnamon roll pancake which was too sweet, the chilaquiles which were good according to others but I'm not big on chilaquiles, and the short rib burrito which was good and there were hash browns in there. My toddler who is super picky about food enjoyed the regular pancake-that's a good sign! I definitely want to come back and other things on the menu. Like the coconut cornflake French toast and dinner menu. Everything on the menu looked pretty creative. I would definitely recommend coming here!
Decent beer menu. But out of the top 3 things I wanted to order. Update the damn menu y'all. And serving your craft bees in shaker glasses? For shame!

While patio hopping around downtown, we came across Stout Street Social. They have a large patio and from the outside, it looks very inviting. We were just there for drinks and greatly enjoyed their cocktail menu. Our group tried a social mule with sweet tea vodka, the Lambic Sangria, and a blueberry collins. All were delicious and very well made. The sangria was mine and I was pleased to later find it on the brunch menu and that you could opt for bottomless for $12. Much better than the $8/ea I was going to be spending. Our server was kind enough to switch that over and I would definitely recommend trying it out!

Overall we had a nice visit. The patio furniture is comfortable and the food we saw go by, looked tasty. We'll definitely be back for brunch drinks at the least!

First place I ate at during my recent (1st) visit to Denver, and wow!! The food was SO amazing! We sat at the bar and the bartenders we very attentive, social, nice and really helpful when we asked for recommendations of bars/lounges in the area to check out.

When returning to Denver we will definitely be back here!

My two stars is based on the description of two stars, "Meh. I've experienced better." 

Came here in July 2015. Huge place. I enjoy the decor. 

I had made a reservation for my younger brother's birthday. He likes whiskey, beer and trying new things, so I thought this place was a good choice. 

The hostesses looked confused when I said I had a reservation. We had a party of 5. 3 walk-in parties got sat before us, none of them outside. Then she asked if we wanted to sit outside. It was pretty hot so my brother said, "No thanks." Then we waiting another 10 to get our table right by the server station. It was like we were being punished for having a reservation. There were plenty of other tables open. We were carrying presents so they should understand it was a special celebration. The situation didn't sit right with me. 

Maybe we came in the day before their new deliveries. Everything was out. The first two beers I ordered were out. The first beer my brother ordered was out. The special the server told us was great... they were out. A little disappointing. 

That being said, the oysters we had were the perfect temperature and delicious! I also have the ahi tuna tower appetizer as my entree and it was really good. Everyone else at the table liked their food, but not as much as I did. If I was rating just the AVAILABLE food, I would give this place 4 stars, but the customer service and lack of availability just gave me a bad taste in my mouth. 

I want to try this place again. I want to have that amazing Ahi tuna tower again. I just don't like how we were treated for our special occasion. I might go back and give this place another try, just not for a celebration.

Update:  Came back for lunch, and had DJ as my server this time.   Honestly, this place has the best choice in servers.   He had some great suggestions and was very personable. So polite, he even apologized in case his passing by was disturbing my reading. 

I decided on the wedge salad with pork belly. I love a good wedge salad, and whomever thought to put crispy pork belly on it was just genius. 

You really can't go wrong at this place. If I lived in Denver, I'd be a regular.

Went to meet with old and new friends today for happy hour. My friend grabbed us a seat on the patio. Word to the wise, it can get a bit glaring if you don't have one of those nice big umbrellas like at some of the tables. We were excited to try this place, as they had great specials.

Both of my friends had martinis which they liked, and the beer selection was pretty good. In terms of food, we had the deviled eggs, crispy Brussels sprouts, spicy tuna roll, and kimchi fries. The spicy tuna roll had nice chunks of fresh tuna and was very flavorful. The kimchi fries were probably the table favorite. I could have used maybe a sprinkling of scallions and cilantro instead of the one long piece of cilantro, but the flavors were strong regardless. The deviled eggs were sort of disappointing. It seemed like they squirted truffle oil on top at the end which gave it all of that metallic grossness people dislike. I think it would have tasted better if the truffle oil had been mixed into the yolks. The crispy Brussels sprouts had good crispness, rich umami flavor, and spice. They were however drowning in the sweet chili sauce which was really overpowered the truffle oil and made everything gloopy and soggy. I think a bit less sauce would have really made the dish sing and helped to preserve a crisp texture.

Overall, I had a good time and will definitely be coming back some time soon!

Close to Convention center, modern style. The fried crispy Brussels sprouts was awesome. Spicy tuna sushi was also good.

Waitress was attentive. Good place to go.

Awesome location near the convention center, over 40 beers on tap, and delicious food!!! My sister and I split the blackened trout with dirty rice and seasonal vegetables- it was a huge serving we were glad we split it and everything on the plate was so good! Definitely recommend and split a meal if you can! We also split the spinach artichoke dip which was also very good.

We were so looking forward to an enjoyable Sunday night dinner in Denver.  Rebecca was our server.  Very enthusiastic.  But she needs customer service training.  I'll get to that in a moment.  We ordered Eagle Point oysters.  They were very "creamy."  Wife enjoyed them more than I did.  I ordered medium-rare prime rib and wife ordered the short ribs.  Timing of service was lousy.  We had just gotten our oysters when the entrees arrived.  Not the end of the world. But then... While the rib dish was well done, the prime rib looked like it had been sitting out for a while.  And when I cut into it, it was cold - like it had been out for a while.  Rebecca did not come around for a while so I flagged down another server whose name I did not get and who quickly addressed the issue by taking the cold dish and replacing it.  I ordered the salmon.  The Manager
Andy came to the table to apologize and bought me my entree.  Decent of him to do that without me having to ask. Rebecca acted like nothing had happened.  The salmon, by the way, was good.

Lack of service when restaurant was at 1/4 capacity.  Menu is meek and overpriced.  Sushi rolls were really small.  Waitress totally bombed our side order then charged us for the correct order.  
It may look like a nice, convenient bar and restaurant but just because the location is good doesn't mean the food and service is.  We definitely will not be back.  Way better options for downtown Denver.

The service was friendly and prompt. The food was delicious. They offered to split the check so that each individual could pay separately. I drink a lot of soda, and it was repeatedly refilled without me ever having to ask. I couldn't be more pleased.
Fun place with great decor and knowledgeable staff. Great beer section. Sometimes hard to find the greeter, but interestingly you can check yourself in. Food is quite good B+ to A-

We made reservations and were seated right away.  The food, service and  atmosphere was good.  I had the Blackened Mahi-Mahi Tacos and my husband had the Market Chicken Salad.  They have a good selection of craft beers and their wine selection is decent.
Good food and nice people.  Kind of like a cool sports bar. Lots of tvs. The sushi was great!

Had a work lunch here and despite a stellar draft beer list, I was less than impressed. The menu was across the board with no rhyme or reason. Are they Japanese, a gastropub, a sports bar? I guess I didn't quite understand inclusion of sushi rolls amidst deviled eggs, kimchi fries, and burgers. They strike me as a chain eatery but with a few random sushi rolls thrown in for good measure (or to set themselves apart). 

I had the grilled salmon salad which for $16 was diminutive in size and stature. If you decide to give me what my guess would be a 3 or 4 oz piece of salmon, make the other ingredients more substantial. Flavor was fine, but I left still hungry and for $16 at lunch, that shouldn't be the case.

It also took us the entire meal to get the requested ketchup that my coworker asked to accompany her fries. The ketchup came with the bill after we were done. It was far from busy so there is no excuse.

My coworkers and I left with the same thoughts on Stout Street Social, that being we couldn't see them being open in a year.
The tuna tower was on point. Great beer selection and rotation. I also recommend the green chilli chicken Mac and cheese or the fish tacos.

Great place!  Food was delicious. Eric our server was fantastic, gave us tons of options that all tasted great!   We was looking for a close place to the theater that was good for brunch. 
NAILED IT!! 
My girl loved the saketini!
The Brussels sprouts delicious! 
The ahi tuna tower YUM!

Got a half dozen oysters for an app and the Chile-Espresso Crusted steak with their roasted brussel sprouts instead of the onions, very good! Paired that with a glass of Malbec! Great place and valet parking was very close and convenient for the cold night I was there!
Great food & great service - our server Dustin was totally awesome. Stop in for a beer & hit the oyster bar.

Super cute and trendy restaurant with unique menu items! 

The restaurant is a mix of craft bar food and Asian cuisine! My friend and I ordered a mix of things of the menu including the deviled eggs, spicy ahi tower and chicken sandwich. 

I loved the deviled eggs! They were covered in truffle oil and were so delicious!!!!! They are a must try. The ahi tuna tower was also very good. It came with crispy won ton chips and were made up of a blend of tuna and crab. Coming from Hawaii and California, I've definitely had better towers but this was a unique blend and still tasted good. The fish tasted fresh. 

The chicken sandwich was probably my least favorite item solely because we tried such strong and unique flavors with our appetizers. However, who can go wrong with a chicken sandwich with bacon and avocado?! 

Overall, really loved this restaurant! It was so clean and cute and all the staff was very friendly!
Had appetizers and drinks. They tout an oyster bar but I'm not sure the guy knows how to shuck them all 10 of our oysters had pieces of shell in every bite. That shouldn't be like that.

It was OK for lunch. Service was a little unpolished. Bartender asked my name and shook my hand. Front of the house workers are contaminated enough. I don't think handshaking is a good practice and if it does occur should probably be followed by a trip to the handwashing station.

Brought the wrong side dish with my burger, but I was hungry and so I ate it. Twice tried to bring me other people's food. Burger was decent. Big and not overcooked. 

Beer selection looked good but I wasn't drinking. I'd never eat sushi here because it was mostly overpriced rolls with little resemblance to real sushi.
Best Calamari I have ever had.

Food: Great! 4+ stars!
Service: Ugh. Not knowledgeable about the menu, drinks, specials, etc. Come on, at least try to fake it.  All the food and drinks we had were great; you could've recommended anything and we would've been happy.
Drinks: Excellent; would've had quite a few more if our server didn't take 20 minutes to get each round...and the place was half empty (Wednesday night). 

Lots of potential here.  Still some wrinkles to iron out.

Good food, great service.  Our waitress was super attentive and helpful for our pregnant friend, answering questions and catering to her needs.  We had sushi as an app which was par.  I had fish tacos for my meal which were delicious!  A great spot close to the convention center if you're in the neighborhood.

Fish and Chips are worth a try. I most specially enjoyed a cup of clam chowder for an app. Clam ratio was around 40% and the bacon was not too over powering but present. Great place to visit especially if you're from out of town.

Being from Texas I'm not saying I know what authentic BBQ taste like, but I am. This place is Tremendous! Just alone I'd be willing to pay more than what I did. Great food at low prices, it doesn't get much better than that. 

But what would a place be without customer service? This place has Stellar customer service! Colleen has the most beautiful smile and is soo friendly! 

So if you're in the mood for some delicious BBQ come here !!!!

I have eaten BBQ from all around and I can say this place has it going on. I tried it once for a family reunion we were having in a near by park. It was so good we have been going back for over a year now. They have never disappointed me! Their homemade sauces are to die for! 

They are truly nice people and you can tell they take pride in their business. 

They do take credit now and that is good as before they were cash only.

You have to try their sides!! Everyone of them are a 10!! 

I would rate this a 9 out of 10 BBQ joint!

BBQ served dry with lots of sauce choices. Most of  the sauces were good, there others were OK. The beans and coleslaw were excellent. The meat was a tad dry but not enough to worry about. 

I knocked a star off because I didn't think the prices are in line with the value of the meal, the menu wasn't clear about pricing, and when I ordered the same meal a 2nd time they tried to charge me a higher price. They did adjust it when I mentioned it, and that speaks to the lack of clarity on the menu. 

If I'm in the area and have a BBQ craving, I will stop in, but I won't be making any special trip to the area since there are better options in Denver

My husband picked up takeout last night and every item we received was expertly spiced and delicious. We ordered ribs,pulled pork, baked beans,collard greens and coleslaw. I believe my husband paid under $20 and that included a beverage. We were given plenty of food to feed a family of 3 and actually had leftovers for today. This is hands down the best BBQ I have had in Denver. My husband also mentioned that they were incredibly friendly too. Looking forward to trying more items on their menu.

I am sorry.  I was so disappointed. I am from a city that is serious about bbq. When I saw they had a BBQ sauce named after my city I was elated.  Finally! I can get some damn good BBQ right?  Well... It looked wrong but I decided to give a go.  The taste is wrong.  The consistency is wrong.  It was just... off. The meat had a decent flavor so it wasn't a total bust. It was just OK.

Raging hog's BBQ is excellent. It's the type of place that sells out of meats early. So make sure YOU get there early! 

Last visit we sampled the baby back ribs which were so delicious and full of meat, as well as the hot link and it was equally as delicious as the ribs. I recommend the Mac and cheese and potato salad for sides. The Mac and cheese is traditional in a nice cheese sauce. The potato salad was not your traditional mustard potato salad, it almost tasted like a baked potato with sour cream. I loved it. 

For dessert they have homemade pie and cookies. Mmmmm! Highly recommend!

Excellent BBQ and really enjoyed their sauces.  I though the buffalo short ribs were a little dry. Though never having had them before, this might be normal.  The brisket was great and pork ribs were perfect.  

Coleslaw and Mac n cheese were perfect balance for sides.  Get here early as tables filled up quickly as the time approached noon... Also, they smoke limited amount of meats for service each day, so once it's gone, it's gone.

Driving back from Golden for the Coors Brewery, we were looking for something to eat. We came across Ragin' Hogs and decided to stop in. We both had the 2 meat plate. I picked smoked pork and ribs (came with 3 ribs) and my girlfriend chose smoked pork and smoked chicken. For sides we chose macaroni and cheese, baked beans and green beans. And both of us had the buttermilk pie for dessert. The meat was smoked to perfection and the sides were delicious! Not to mention the buttermilk pie which I had never tried before. I think the best thing about this place was their choices of sauces. Memphis, Carolina, Georgia, Sweet and Hot. My personal favorites were the Memphis and the Georgia.

Besides the food which was delicious, the service was even better! The lady that helped us was very helpful and talked to us about our trip to Colorado.

Food is delicious! I ordered delivery and paid a $5 delivery charge which is pretty reasonable and very convenient for ordering food when I can't leave work and go pick it up.

Price is very reasonable for the portion sizes, o have a full meal of leftovers. 

The potato salad is to die for, it's full of dill which I love. Another great thing is none of the meat dishes are cooked in BBQ sauce that has gluten! It's so annoying to go to a BBQ restaurant and not be able to eat half of the food because it is soaked in a sauce that has gluten. 

I will definitely be ordering from here again!
We loved it!  So friendly and as close to Texas BBQ as we have found in Denver.  We will be going back again soon!  It was worth the drive across town!

The place is a hole in the wall but it is clean and the staff is friendly. I ordered two meat combo, ribs & burnt ends. The order was taken, I received ribs and pork meat. I was there before noon and the burnt ends don't come up till later in the afternoon but this was not communicated to me. I did over hear her tell the guest that walked in after me the burnt ends not ready till later in the day. 
I didn't like the flavor/taste of the ribs or the pork meat on my plate. Very bland, they do have 5 or 6 different kind of sauce on all tables but the meat on its own is bland. The sides were baked beans and slaw. The slaw was average, nothing fantastic and I thought the beans were below average.
I'm not trying to be mean or sound stingy. I spent $17.28 before tip and I didn't like my food. Wish this establishment good luck and the best, it's just not for me and my taste buds.

I've been here a few times, and will basically come out of my way to go to this neighborhood just to stop by for lunch.  Great food, and the owners are nice too. 

There are many other reviews of this place so I don't have much to add, but figured I should at least add a 5 star vote because I really like this place.

I'm no expert in BBQ but I genuinely believe that this place was actually pretty awesome from the start. The service was quick and the people were really nice and didn't seem to mind that I made it obvious I was a first-timer.

I stocked up on all their sauces to give them all a shot and some of them were quite exciting. Again, not an expert so I really don't know the difference between city styles.

Now the reason I love this place so much. The sandwich was pretty good and it went really well with the sauces I liked. The potato salad was AWESOME. Mac n cheese was good. But what is buttermilk pie and why is it so good? That was a very pleasant surprise.

My colleague loved the coleslaw, said it was the best she ever had and she also enjoyed the buttermilk pie immensely. I think the combo was definitely worth it and something I'd definitely recommend.
The best BBQ I have had in Denver! Great selection of sauce, smokey and tasty meat selection, and the potato salad is delicious!

Super hope in the wall type place with AWESOME food! Husband and wife team run the place themselves, really friendly people. Potato salad on point. It's our new favorite bbq place and will definitely be back often!

I'm still patronizing Ragin' Hog and it never fails me.  The owners are so nice and friendly and they always seem to remember me.  Does that mean I'm there too often or not enough?  It means I'm treated well either way and I like that.  Don't change a thing!

We really liked the service and were looking forward to really great BBQ based on the reviews here. Maybe it was just too late in the day or something, but it was nothing that I couldn't wait to eat again. The meat was a bit dry, but the sauces you had to choose from made it much better.  It shouldn't have needed sauces so desperately, though. The baked beans were good, slaw good, mac and cheese good. The place was very clean and homey, though, and as I said, the lady serving was very nice.

Got ribs, sausage, and burnt ends as takeout. Sausage was decent, though Whole Foods makes better. Burnt ends were ok, though pretty dry. Ribs were tender, but dry and there was almost no pork flavor. Maybe they had an off day, but having just gotten back from Austin, TX, it was disappointing that what's supposed to be some of Denver's best bbq was barely decent. Variety of BBQ sauces which were good, but you shouldn't need sauce to make the meat palatable. Tasted like restaurant depot meat, smoked with an indoor electric smoker.

Like I said, maybe it was an off day, or their meat all got delivered without any fat, but I ended up giving away everything to the hungry people downtown, and ordering delivery from somewhere else instead.

column4: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
column13: Fall of the bone baby back ribs, Mac and cheese to die for, and incredible service to boot! It was worth the trip from California!
The food is simply amazing. Who doesn't like good barbeque? Anyone rating this place less than 4-5 stars needs to get their taste buds in checked by a doctor.

A great example of not judging a book by its cover!  For those of you that know, the best BBQ is usually found in these type of places; not the prettiest to look on the outside, but great food on the inside.

We had hot links, pulled pork and brisket with mac n cheese, potato salad(probably the best i've ever tasted), cole slaw and baked beans.  The meat was all very flavorful and the sides were all delicious.  The fact that they have a great selection of different style of sauce is really what sets this place above the rest.  Too many BBQ places insist on only one type of tomato based sauce but the true BBQ joints know that you need at least three.  In this case, Ragin' Hog offers up six!  The only knock was that the brisket was a bit overcooked and that kept me from giving the fifth star.  

All in all, if you're looking for great BBQ in Denver, I'd ask you to give this place a look.

We did carry out so I can't comment on the place itself but I'm really happy with our experience! I really appreciated that they didn't package up our meat until my husband arrived so it wouldn't be cold and tough and they also threw in an extra rib since they knew we were sharing which was so nice of them. We had the 3 meat combo with chicken, pulled pork and ribs with mac & cheese, baked beans, coleslaw and a slice of buttermilk pie. I love how they are ok with substituting the drink for another side because really, who wants to waste room with drinks when you are eating BBQ hehe. I like the assortment of bbq sauces too. I'm excited to eat there in person as I am sure that's going to be even better!
Great food and great owners.  One of my favorite BBQ joints in all of Colorado!  FAVS:  pulled pork, best potato salad I've ever had, and buttermilk pie!  Excellent sauce selection for all tastes.
I have no words. Best BBQ I've had in Denver. Burnt ends, ribs, all of it.

The ownership is phenomenal and kind. The most important business aspects. 

The food will speak for itself, so go check it out!

Ragin' Hoq BBQ is without a doubt a dive. We almost went to the eatery right across the street just because it looked so much nicer from the outside; however, that would have been a huge mistake. 

Upon walking in we were greeted by the most heavenly smokey aroma one could imagine. The smell brings a smile to your face, life to your taste buds, and the satisfaction of knowing you are about to experience some true smoked BBQ. Upon ordering, I went with a two meat plate choosing their chopped pork and their special of the day, burnt ends. The combo also came with the choice of two sides, a dessert and a drink all for $16.00. It was an incredible deal. For my sides I went with mac-n-cheese and corn bread. For my dessert I chose their buttermilk pie. 

The food in just about every way met or exceeded the high expectations that came along with the smell we had experienced walking in. The chopped pork was cooked to perfection, juicily and down right tasty. They offer 5 different home made BBQ sauces and their Carolina sauce complemented  the chopped pork like a horse complements a cowboy. It was a pairing made in heaven. The burnt ends where very, very good; however, I did feel they were over shadowed by the chopped pork. Furthermore, I was able to give their baked beans a try in additional to the two sides I had chosen and they were sweat and cooked to perfection. As was the mac-n-cheese. The cornbread was a little dry for my liking, but that didn't matter ... the rest of the food was so good I barely even noticed the cornbread was even there. For me the baked bean and mac-n-cheese as the two sides I will choose if I ever get the honor of eating at Ragin' Hog BBQ again. 

I ended my meal with their buttermilk pie. I have never heard of buttermilk pie so I wanted to give it a try. Man, what a way to end a meal. It was absolutely delicious! The BBQ at Ragin' Hog was some of the best I have had. The service and southern hospitality was amazing. The price point and value took them to a whole other level. It is probably goes without saying, but they are a five star eaatery hands down!

You want some good solid barbeque with a bunch of sauce choices this place has it. My favorite are the ribs with the Mac and cheese and cornbread. My wife usually gets the brisket or chicken. Only problem is sometimes they run out of stuff quickly so get there early!

This is a top notch BBQ joint!!

The ambiance is nothing fancy, but it's clean and welcoming. The owners are extremely accommodating and pleasant when serving you. It's a small spot with a few large group type tables, but not a ton of seating if there's a lunch rush. 

Everything is made in-house and they have 5 different types of BBQ sauces: Carolina, Georgia, Memphis, sweet and hot and all are sooooo good!

We've had the brisket, smoked chicken and hot links and just about all the sides. The cole slaw is really great. 

Like any great southern spot, they have homemade sweet tea.

Come Hog out at this place!  I've had the pleasure to catch it open several times in the last few weeks as they are keeping more predictable hours now. As a Kansas City native, I have high standards, and this place's ragin' ribs have made me think the south has a place on my pork palette!  Their sides just keep it comin' with twists on potato salad that pleases even the kids...and their tea is soieeeeeeet! If that ain't enough, pig out on their buttermilk pie. And the bonus, you can talk SEC with true Bama haters in the Fall, and Wildcat haters during b-ball season! A tip o the hat and the razorback to this new home away from home for a KC native!

When Doug Y. recommends a bbq restaurant, I'm on my way.  It was excellent.  It's not a fancy place; it's a Mom and Pop in the best sense of the expression.  The "Mom" is listed on their business card as the pitmaster.  When I asked, she told me that she is from Arkansas and is doing Memphis-style barbeque.  They pride themselves on not reheating anything -- everything is fresh out of the smoker, and it shows in the quality.  The ribs were tender and flavorful, not steamtable-ish.  They also pride themselves on sides made from scratch.  I loved the slaw and baked beans.  My husband liked the mac & cheese.

The prices are reasonable.  They only take cash in an effort to keep prices as low as possible.  For instance, a half rack of ribs, 2 small sides, a drink, dessert and tax is $15.

They have a wide variety of homemade sauces.  She (I think her name is Colleen) recommended a combination of the Memphis and the sweet on the ribs.  I thought it was great.

My husband tried the pulled pork and hot links, and he thought those were also excellent.

There should be a line waiting to get into this place!

-------SHORT STORY
Small, family-run dive with a 100% homemade menu.  Solid BBQ and sides.  World Class sauces.  Buttermilk pie is to die for.  Fantastic service.  Fast takeout and a comfortable little dining room.  Bathroom is literally spotless.  I've been 5-6 times and the food and service are extremely consistent.  5 Stars any questions?

ps.  They concentrate on the pig here.  If you want brisket why would you come to a place with "Hog" in the name?

---------LONG STORY
Very good pulled pork, amazing beans, and world class sauces.  I grew up in the deep South (GA and TN) and spent lots of time in Arkansas (where the owners originally hail from), and this place is spot on......not perfect, but top notch for Colorado.  These little joints are a dime a dozen in Arkansas and Tennessee, but I give the Ragin' Hog an HONEST 5 STAR rating since it sits up against the Rocky Mountains.  

As others have said, there is a small degree of blandness to the food but a little S+P and BBQ sauce takes care of that and then some.  The sauces are WORLD CLASS.  They have big, fat bottles on each table.  There are 5-6 to choose from and they're all distinctive from one another.  Their "Georgia" mustard sauce is my favorite.  The Carolina is almost like a sweet N sour and it's incredible.  The Memphis is whatever.......all the sauces kick major butt.  

The only meats I've had were the burnt ends and pulled pork.  The BE's are awesome.  It's hard to screw up crisp pork fat.  Burnt ends can be tough to find, but they gotta em here!!!  

The pulled pork is slightly bland but is kissed with just enough oak + hickory that the sauces make it all good.  I've heard the complaints about the pork not being "smoky" enough.  I get sick of places that over smoke the heck out of their meats.  If anything the pulled pork at the Ragin Hog is just a hair under-smoked, but it's juicy and very tender.  A little fatty too sometimes, but they give the pork a nice chop on request and the fat just melts in with the sauce.........Awwww yeah!!!! 

Beans - 5 Stars, some of the best I've ever had
Potato Salad - 4.5 Stars, Mad-good with lots of S+P
Slaw - 4 Stars, a little runny but very good
Cornbread - 3 Stars, "meh" but good enough
Mac N Cheese - 1.5 Stars, disappointing

And then the Buttermilk Pie.  5++++++++++ Stars.  It's homemade and top notch.  If you like crème brulee, you'll melt when you sample this.  They bring it out warm right as you're finishing your BBQ meal.  Amazing.  

Service is always fantastic.  It seems to be all the family kicking in (Mom, Dad, and a very polite, teenaged son).  Sometimes these little joints only have cans of soda, but they have all the favorites on the fountain machine, so bonus there.  Free refills and someone checks on you every 5-6 mins - very good.  They seem to do a good takeout business and are thusly well prepared for it.  When call ahead folks show up, they never have to wait longer than a minute or two. 

You like good pork BBQ?  Hallelujah, you're home.

YELP's reviews got me to this place.  You positive reviewers were right.

Great food.
More than fair portions for price.
Ma and pa working hard to build a successful business.
Simple menu.
Side dishes also tastie. 

I'd go back.
Placed a big order ahead of time for a party. Everything was delicious. Their meat is the star but the sides are great too, I loved the Cole slaw and Mack and cheese.

Stopped in after a day of looking for housing. All my life has been spent under the influence of Texas BBQ, and the last 16 years I've lived in Austin, which now boasts some of the best BBQ in the world.

Ragin' Hog was right up there. They didn't have brisket (they mentioned having it on Saturdays, so I'll be back to try some) but the pork ribs and pulled pork are some of the very best I've ever had. Anywhere. 

I'm not a sauce user, so I can't tell you how their sauces compare, but the three I tried were very good.

I got cole slaw for a side, and it reminds me of my grandmother's. Could use a tiny bit of black pepper, but that's just me.

You can tell they slow smoke their meat. They do it the hard way, and it shows.

The sausage was good. I'm used to the coarse grind that central Texas sausages have, and the links here are a fine grind, but perfectly spiced. They pack a great punch.

All in all, I'll be back very often. It's really wonderful to have found good BBQ. Not good BBQ. Great BBQ. Really, you should try them today.
Awesome BBQ place with tons of flavor and sides that comfort. The red velvet cookie was delicious! Definitely hit this place up for comfort food.

During a short trip to the Denver aerea, I was disappointed to have spent one of my six meal opportunities on this place.

First off, the atmosphere: it's a craphole. Pretty depressing even by hole-in-the-wall standards.

I got a two-meat meal with brisket and "hot" links, BBQ beans, potato salad, and buttermilk pie. At ~$17 this was quite spendy, so I expected everything to be awesome.

* Brisket: Bland and dry. Even Dickey's is better.
* Hot links: No hint of heat whatsoever. Again, worse than Dickey's.
* BBQ beans: Pretty good.
* Potato salad: Probably the best potato salad I've ever had. Yay!
* Buttermilk pie: AWESOME.

If I hadn't ended the meal on the high note of the buttermilk pie, I would've felt totally ripped off. Nonetheless, it's quite sad that the only two items that stood out were a side and a dessert, rather than the meat.
So good. The owner of this place gets here at 4am everyday to prep fresh for the afternoon rush. Memphis style sauce is the best I've ever had! Nice work

Snowy day in Denver. Someone in the office mentions BBQ and a few seconds later Bite Squad sends me a coupon for free delivery from Ragin Hog. It was fate. While I had leftovers from the day before and even brought an additional lunch, it's probably been at least a year since I've sank my teeth into tender, smokey ribs. I'm sure most would agree it's hard to find good BBQ in Denver especially ribs, but after reading the Yelp reviews and feeling a bit sponteous, I decided a salad wasn't going to suffice. They do deliver, but only in their hood. Thank God for Bite Squad and their free delivery coupon! While delivery time was estimated to be two hours it showed up in 1 hour. Pretty amazing! The ribs were perfect. Smokey, tender and juicy. The only cons were the sides. I believe I'm an expert at mac n cheese so I  might be a tough critic. I liked that they added red pepper, gave it a little punch, but the cheese sauce was watery. It may have also been due to condensation from the warms ribs. The potato salad was very tasty but had very few potatoes. I have a feeling maybe I got the bottom of the bowl. So I would give the ribs 5 starts and sides 3 1/2. All things considered lunch today exceeded my expectations and I got to stay inside, warm and cozy!

Warning: CASH ONLY!! Ragin' Hog is a mom and pop hole in the wall restaurant with good potential. The location is not in the most attractive of locations and the inside is quite simple with four tables accommodating 4 people each. I ordered the hog pile (chicken + 2 sides) and overall it was good.  The food is not presented in any fancy way. The chicken was tender served as small chunks, however, I was expecting more of a smoked smell or flavor.  Fortunately, the selection of BBQ sauces helped add flavor. The Memphis sauce is by far my favorite in combo with the sweet sauce. They have other sauces, which will have to wait another day. The two sides chosen were Mac & cheese and the slaw! I am a huge fan of both sides and normally I always forgo slaw thinking it's a waste of money, but not the slaw at Ragin Hog - I wish I knew the precise ingredients.
The next time I come in I'll have to try the ribs and pork.  I personally would forgo the chicken next time, but if you're on a health binge then chicken is your healthier meat option available.

19JUN2016

+ website

04JUL2015

+ credit cards accepted

11OCT2014

A-OK

+ The ribs are top of the line. Cooked perfectly. Moist and tender. Bursting with flavor. A pig that gave its all. Highly recommended.

You need to go early as they often sell out. And, when they do, they close for the day.

- No Wi-Fi.
- Cash only!
- No beer.
- No website.
- Atmosphere is stark and uninviting.

Customers obviously love the food (see the myriad 5 star reviews), but the owners need to deal with with their success and step up their game.

hard to find but worth the drive! The decor is nothing special just a person's first attempt at a business on a budget. the location is very clean and organized.

The Food, I eat all over and love BBQ! This place is true to what BBQ is supposed to be. The smoke ring, the flavor, homemade sauces all full of flavor. the ribs were cooked perfectly, the chopped chicken was moist and jucy. the links were spicy and just amazing. the sides were all perfect, flaverfull and fresh! 

Desert was spot on buttermilk pie my first try at this delightful sweet desert. 

You the owner is why this place works your passion and knowledge is why you will be a huge success. thank you from Wisconsin...... dave and Tina

Finally made it in and for the North Side this place is awesome. Way better than the more overpriced BBQ on Tennyson. And more authentic home style than Moe's or Brother's.

Had the pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw & mac 'n cheese with buttermilk pie. My dad had the ribs, coleslaw & baked beans. Coleslaw was great very cold and crunchy.

First off, they have about 5 homemade sauces to choose from, HOT, Georgia, Memphis, Sweet and Carolina. I got some of each as my order was to go. They are all really good, my favorite was HOT.

Both the pulled pork and ribs were moist and flavorful, the sides were pretty good my only complaint is that the portion was a small.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE the small business atmosphere and family run vibe. They have Square so they take credit cards and cash.

Give them a try, especially for lunch. Mmmm that buttermilk pie is so yummy and is included with the sandwich meal, how can you go wrong.

I had high hopes for this place, but it was just average. I ordered the chicken, which was the best part of my meal because it was actually moist and tender. Also ordered the collard greens, cornbread, and Mac and cheese. Mac and cheese was okay and the cornbread was decent, but tasted like it had been hanging out in the refrigerator. Everything seemed like it lacked seasoning. The owner was super friendly and accommodating, but the food needs work. There definitely has to be better in the area.
It's good.  I didn't fall off my chair, but it's pretty good BBQ.

So if im not mistaken this place is run by one woman all alone.... which is just unreal. She produces some awesome awesome food.

A group of 5 of us went around closing time so we got loaded up with a her meat and 2 side option. (comes with drink and dessert.. cant beat that)

I got the pulled pork sandwich and it was cooked right and you got to place one of the various sauces on it.. All of them were very tasty and not overbearing.

The group i was with got a mix of everything and had no complaints. The mac and cheese was very good, but the potato salad was just unreal..

finish that all off with a red velvet cookie and a sweet tea and call it a day.

I have never written a review on yelp but I had to share how much I love this place. My husband and I have now officially had everything on the menu and I can say, without a doubt, that this is some of the best food I have ever eaten. To top it off, the owner is a sweet, hardworking woman who seems like the type of person who would give you the shirt off her back. 

Just all around a great little hole in the wall that you NEED to try. You won't be disappointed!
this place was so awesome on GrubHub, used to order it all the time. great sauces!
Not even exaggerating; this could be the best BBQ I've ever had in my life. Owners are extremely friendly and the sauces are incredible. If you're reading this and haven't been- GO!

I am so ridiculously full argh......
OUTSTANDING BBQ.  I got the burnt ends, collard greens and potato salad.
I always went to Big Country on 40th and Tejon, but Ragin' Hog gives much much larger portions of meat.  My new place and it's close.
You will not be disappointed :)
Maybe the best burnt ends and baked beans I've ever had. Don't sleep on this place! Also there is a choice of 5 different sauces that are sure to leave you satisfied.

I feel like I hit the BBQ lottery with Ragin' Hog.  Smoked pork, hot links, baked beans and a variety of sauces is a winning combination.  Everything was delicious and smoked well!

A few quick stand outs.

~ They serve the meats dry.  Meaning you're an adult and can add how much sauce you want.  
~ The baked beans + a little BBQ sauce = a flavor explosion.
~ The Carolina sauce was outstanding.  A hint of spice but all flavor.
~ Cash only.  Hit the ATM on the way over.
~ Limited hours, make sure you check before you head over.

If you even half like BBQ this place is worth checking out.  The smell from the parking lot will guide you to the Hog, and the rest of the smoked goodness.

Holy dry ass brisket!! Almost inedible! Even the pulled pork was kind of dry! The sauces are good and the sides were tasty but that is not what makes good bbq! The ribs were fair. It was dinner time so not sure if going for lunch would make it any better? The people were really nice. Might give it another shot but definitely not a 4 1/2 star place like what is on here.

I tend to read the negative reviews when a place has a lot of good reviews. If there are only a few negative reviews I generally expect the people writing them to be haters or the kind of person that thrive on contradiction but that's not always the case. It depends on their argument. If a person qualifies their negative remarks by stating where they've lived or been as their argument about what makes them an expert, I tend to be judgmental about the person writing the review. That's fine if you know what the hell you're talking about. Do you think that everybody that lives somewhere has an exceptional palate or knows all there is to know about a cuisine? Okay end rant.  For now.
I thought the ribs were pretty good. Decent rub with enough hickory smoke coming through. Not falling off the bone overcooked which a lot people think (in error) is a good thing. Smoke ring? A smoke ring is no longer an acceptable criteria for judging competition BBQ because you can falsify a smoke ring with additives. The pulled pork was moist and tender with enough bark mixed in but was a little underseasoned. They aren't doing brisket because of the cost? I've never heard of this happening but with the sparse decor and the banner sign out front, maybe they are struggling a bit? The sauces might have been the stars with all 6 varieties being pretty good. My favs were the Memphis and the Hot. I thought that the sides we had (baked beans and slaw) were okay. I'd prefer a little more bite to both.
The location is in a tough spot to find but worth it. My only question is, "Where's the Wonder Bread?".  :)
Pleasantly surprised. Excellent barbecue, killer sides and the nicest people. They kept bringing us samples, they are proud of their food and they should be.

I'll start by saying this place's star is its sauces, they offer a variety with everything from Carolina style to sweet, and hot sauces. Their prices are very fair for a BBQ joint, often people complain about hefty prices for BBQ, typically those people do not consider the amount of labor that goes on behind the scenes. This place smokes fresh daily, no leftovers from the previous day. The two complaints is the food wasn't ideal temperature, was a little cold for my liking, and the sides leave something to be desired.
Best BBQ in Denver. Greats meats and sauces. Good sides but would be nice if there were a few more options.

My husband and I discovered this place about 6 months ago. We go every few weeks at least and it's hands down the best BBQ we've had in Colorado (and I love my bbq)!

Colleen, the owner, is helpful and always remembers our names. She'll let you call ahead and have everything ready to take home. I can't recommend this place enough!

Ragin' Hog is true BBQ. It is delicious. No frills, no mustaches, just really good BBQ.  Ragin' Hog serves up authentic simplicity smoked to perfection. 

The ribs, pulled pork, and sausage are the best I have had in Denver. I am eager to try the brisket on a Saturday. The owner makes sure you try the homemade sauces inspired by the great styles of BBQ from across the country. The buttermilk pie makes you laugh at the reality that this comfortable eating situation is not quite over yet. 

The owner has her priorities right. You will only get melt in your mouth BBQ fresh off the smoker. Don't be lazy until you get there because once it's gone it's gone. I hope this place never changes. God Bless America.
Absolutely awesome food!  Highly recommended eating here!  Was searching on Yelp for a Denver area barbecue place and came upon this little gem. We will be back to eat here soon.

Real Southern Hospitality! Beautifully handcrafted BBQ and fantastic sides. My son and I drive 40 minutes across town to indulge in this wonderful family restaurant.  From ribs to brisket to buttermilk pie and red velvet cookies..it is all top shelf. The variety of terrific sauces manage to make a wonderful food experience even better. I still have the mustardy Georgia BBQ sauce stuck in my brain as I write this review.

The owners have always been great. It is a small place ,but, it has always been clean and inviting.

My new go to spot in the berkley park/tennyson area for bbq. Solid flavors and they make a variety of sauces (memphis, georgia, carolina etc....) so you can enjoy the flavors of the different bbq regions. Cash only.

The only thing worth the stop in is the BBQ sauce options. That's literally it. Saturday afternoon my family and I stop in for a meal. The woman working the counter was not friendly and was trying her hardest not to help or provide information. We asked for her recommendation on a large order for 6 people. She told us they have family packs but they are "to go" only. We asked if would could eat at the location (completely empty) and she reluctantly agreed. The food was not great. We ordered the chicken, sausage, and brisket - all dry and lacked flavor. The sausage tasted like grocery store pre-cooked meat. The sides we ordered were green beans that had a weird white film on the outside and had an off putting sweet taste. The beans were edible but tasted like beans straight out of the can. The most disappointing part of this visit was how we were treated as customers - in a very cold and distant way. I would not recommend dining at this establishment and think the owners/staff need to improve the guest experience.

Cute little mom and pop owned shop, cash only! We ordered the chicken with potato salad and coleslaw. The chicken is very very tender and there's 4 bbq options, all were delicious. The cole slaw is very different than I've ever had it before, not too creamy and milky like most places. The potato salad also had a unique flavor, I think they added bacon or something, I don't know, but it was good!
This is real bbq. Being from Texas, this is amazing.  Nothing fancy, but bbq should not be.  Try it and you will be very happy!
Wow competition style BBQ for sure.Nice smokey ribs very tender.All the sides complement the food just right.Must try
The four stars are for the sauces, the meat was decent and we didn't get to try any of the sides this time - I will have to update when we do!

The real deal.  Excellent BBQ is scarce in Denver - for unclear reasons - but if you can make it during their short hours this place beats the pants off Tennyson BBQ nearby.  Perfectly smoked meats, superb sides and buttermilk pie?  Yes, please!

My husband loves bbq and we had our second visit to this great local restaurant. It is simply great food, made by hand in small batches. Portions are generous and reasonably priced. There are 6 sauces to choose and many delicious sides! 
My husband had the chicken and I the 1/2 rack of ribs. 5stars for both! And the homemade red velvet cookies or buttermilk pie for dessert (which is included in the combo price) are a reason to return again and again! 
Truly the best southern bbq in the Denver area! Check them out! But go early cuz is so good they run out of food!

I don't know what makes good BBQ, but I know what tastes good and Ragin' Hog fit the bill.  Smoked pork was moist but a little bland. Perked right up with some sauce. Each sauce was unique and flavorful, the mac and cheese was creamy, and the collard greens were killer. They were the one dish I wouldn't share! 4 stars because I don't give out 5 unless the restaurant is perfect. Ragin' Hog was close!
Best burnt ends in Denver! Great food. Friendly staff. My favorite bbq place in north Denver.

Moving from the South, I looked long and hard for a good BBQ joint in Denver. Ragin' Hog will give you just what you need if you are craving great BBQ, real southern sweet tea, and some real Mac n cheese. Multiple sauce selections playing off of different regions in the south. Glad to have stumbled across this place!

what a frickin rad addition to the highlands neighborhood.  we seemed to be the first customers of the day one Saturday and got to talk with the nice owners about their affinity for Arkansas and the sweet sweet fingerlickin BBQ that I ended up eating for the next 4 days.  Order more than you need, cuz its really great leftovers!

Just found this place and thrilled I did. Not much to look at and kind of an inconspicuous location but the food is outstanding. The meat is smoked daily and very good.The sides sound normal but are anything but. Tried the "brewster  stew?" as a side today. It's not on the normal menu but it had more meat in it than some other BBQ places have in their sandwiches. Loaded potato salad was very light and tasty - and I don't like potato salad. The slaw is wet but perfectly seasoned. The baked beans were excellent. I think the best part of the meal is the BBQ sauces. They have Hot, Sweet, Memphis, Carolina, Georgia. They are all custom developed and made on premise. 5 unique and wonderful flavors. I don't usually get desert but one came with the meal so I tried the Buttermilk Pie. I think I got an instant cavity it was so sweet but I must admit I liked it a lot and will get it again. 
The service is very low key and friendly. Small area for dine in and I believe 1 table outside. This is one of those places that you want to really promote because you like it so much but you are afraid it will become popular and hard to get into or will go corporate. But I'm taking that chance and telling you it's worth trying out.

This place is bad ass. Unassuming, and the entrance faces away from Lowell blvd. It's in the building in the Safeway shopping center that is closest to Lowell and runs parallel to it. 

The lady that runs this place is really cool and makes some amazing BBQ. She told me that she gets up at 4am every day to start smoking meat. I'm really glad that people decide to do this kind of thing so that I can benefit from it. Her food is delicious - across the board. I had the pulled pork, links, slaw, potato salad and all 5 types of her homemade bbq sauce: Memphis, Carolina, Georgia, Sweet and Hot. I felt like I was traveling around the country to different BBQ havens just by changing my sauce every few bites. She encouraged me to try them all with my to-go order and stuffed large containers of each in my bag. 

Customer service is 5 stars too. I didn't have cash on me at the moment and she told me I could just pay her later. It was my first time in. She doesn't know me. That's pretty darn cool. I jogged over to safeway and pulled out cash, but I really appreciated the gesture. They don't take credit cards, which I totally respect for this type of mom and pop business. 

If you like BBQ the way that it's supposed to be made, you gotta stop in. She said she's expanding hours and the menu soon as well which is great news. Just don't buy her out of something before I get there, as she says she closes when she's out of food on most days.

Thanks to Ragin' Hog for coming to the Highlands. I see a long relationship in our future.

Food was edible but not good. DOUBT they smoke their meat. Not real BBQ,  but what do you expect in a state like this? Desert was goodish. People who give this place good reviews have obviously never left Colorado. Just a bunch of hipsters who want to be cool and jump on a band wagon trendy hole in the wall BBQ joint.

This place is pretty amazing...and that I feel is an understatement!  

Always fresh, high quality meats with legitimately homemade sides that really pull it all together!

It's tough spreading the word because I want it all for myself BUT need these guys around so I recommend it frequently for a quick service of some wonderfully slow cooked meat!!

I have to agree with Stacey G on this one.  I too was spoiled by living in Texas for several years and ate barbecue all over the state.  This place is just ok.  

Overall, the meat was bland, but was not dry.  No smoke ring on the ribs, although they were tender. No bark on the pulled pork.  You can achieve tenderness on ribs and pork butt without a smoker- when I eat bbq I want tenderness AND smoke flavor.  I will visit one more time in hopes I was just there on a bad day.

I will also agree with Doug Y's assessment that living or visiting a certain are of the country doesn't mean you are an expert.  However, the simple fact is this: barbecue at an average place in Texas tastes better than it does here.

I'd heard the good reviews of this place so decided to check it out after my weekly stop at Safeway. When I saw the menu, I texted my husband to say "I hope you're hungry!" Got our food to go and wanted to try a little bit of everything. The brisket was the winner in the meat department, but the ribs and pork were also very good. Love the homemade sauces -- just a heads up that the Carolina style is more specifically a Western Carolina style, with tomato and vinegar, not the Eastern Carolina style I prefer (vinegar and pepper only). 

And the sides. We gorged on mac and cheese, cole slaw and potato salad. Would be great if they'd add a few healthier sides (maybe some green vegetables? Succotash? Collard greens?), but it was good southern cooking - tasty and fresh. Note they take CASH only -- no credit cards. 

Really glad I discovered this place and will definitely be back!

I would give it 10 stars if I could! Why did I wait so long?? Im a southerner and bbq lover. Everything I had today was absolutely excellent. Ribs, buttermilk pie, best collards ive had since moving west,  potato salad, baked beans. Ordered a combo and didnt want the drink so they threw in an extra side. Will be haunting this place soon. Don't hesitate to try you will leave happy and full. And the sauces are to die for.
Great friendly service.  Fantastic aroma and even better food.  Came all the way from California and it was worth it!!

I am such a fool. I have driven past this place every day for a year and not bothered to try it out. Today I did and, it was delicious. Everything was great and at a great price. For $12 even, tax included, I had a huge pulled pork sandwich, baked beans and slaw, a slice of buttermilk pie and an iced tea. The pork was moist, super tender and had a good amount of burnt ends mixed in. It was good enough to eat dry but, their sauces are great. The atmosphere is pretty spartan, and it's a cash only joint, but the bbq is top notch.
Unassuming and Fantastic BBQ overall.  Also, try the potato salad as it is out of the world good.

Best BBQ option in Denver.  The owner is such a pleasant lady from Arkansas who knows her craft.  Great selection of homemade sauces & quality food at good prices.  Make sure to try her potato salad.  Best ever.

We recently moved from Texas and have had a tough time finding a good bbq spot.... Tried all the other local ones around our area (Highlands/NW) and finally came upon this little place. It's tucked away in a shopping center so a little off the beaten trail, but it's a fantastic little find.  Best bbq in our area by a country mile.

Ribs: excellent
Pulled pork: excellent
Sides: Awesome
BBQ Sauces: distinct flavors, spicy bbq sauce has some heat! Not dumbed down at all! 
Deserts: Red velvet cookies are really good!

Service: Husband and wife team, they are very welcoming and easy to talk to!
Great sauces, solid pork BBQ - could use a bit more of crisp on edges of meat. Incredible slaw. Beans were also amazing but just a tad too sweet. Will return to try other menu items.

The food at Ragin' Hog BBQ is amazing, this place is my new favorite lunch stop. It reminds me of Brickhouse BBQ (38th/Tennyson) which closed down a couple years ago.  They only take cash, but I will happily go to the ATM before dinning in.

Went here on a weekend afternoon for a late lunch. My husband and I split the 3 meat combo, got the pulled pork, ribs, and chicken with collard greens, slaw, and the buttermilk pie for dessert.  We sat outside on their single picnic table, not much atmosphere in the parking lot but it was a beautiful day and we wanted to sit outside.  The customer service was superb, genuinely nice people.  The pork was my favorite meat, all were delicious, ribs had great flavor but could have been more tender.  The collard greens were better than the slaw but the slaw was still really great.  I've never had buttermilk pie before but it was great!! Good enough to where I'd go swing through there just to grab dessert.  At first we were disappointed at the quantity of food but it was plenty for the both of us.  Also, the selection of sauces is really fun and they are great!  Denver doesn't do BBQ well and this place knows what's going on.  We will definitely be back.

Great place, great food, and the sauces are wonderful!   Oh, and for a real down home finish to your meal get the Buttermilk Pie.  Oh so good and sweet and yummy.   My son, a BBQ fanatic, absolutely loves this place, as do I.   We like the ribs and burnt ends.   A real plus the family atmosphere and owners who work at the place.  Another reason to go - nice local owners who care deeply about the food the put out.

I was doing some random searching trying to find some new restaurants to try out and accidentally stumbled across this place.  My wife and I decided we had to give it a try.  Unlike some other reviewers we didn't think it was that hard to find.  It's due east of the Safeway in another part of the strip mall.  The sign is a little small but we still found it quickly.  The food was great.  Some of the best bbq I've had in Denver by far.  The homemade sauces were great and all worth a try.  The butterscotch pie was very tasty.  The red velvet cookie was great too.  

Well worth the trip and I'm definitely going back!  Very nice owner too.

Was looking for a cheap place to eat while driving through Denver and I saw this one had 5 stars and it deserves it! It's a little tough to find as it's located away from the street but don't be fooled, your GPS didn't send you to the wrong place. I got a pulled pork sandwich, baked beans, Mac n cheese and a slice of southern crème brulé all for 12 bucks! Everything was delicious and I highly recommend the southern crème brulé for your desert unless you absolutely love red velvet cookies because it's amazing. Customer service was great, me and my group of friends had a good conversation with the woman running the place she even helped with directions. Great place to eat for a great price, stop by if you get the chance.
So delicious!! So much careful hard work goes into the food, and you can tell. The owner/operator is super nice and obviously completely on top of things over there - GIRL POWER!!

Everything was wonderful! I don't generally like coleslaw, but that was great too! Their meat, sides and sauces are amazing - and to think we almost gave-up trying to find it. It is located on the side away from the street; not directly on Lowell. 

Try their buttermilk pie! They call it "southern creme-brûlée" and they are right!

What a nice surprise, good BBQ and friendly people!  Be prepared to search for it your first time though, as several other reviewers have noted this place is a little hard to find.

After struggling to find this place, I blustered in all frustrated and hungry.  Upon ordering, I came to realize they only accept cash-- and I only had $4.  The owner very generously decided to take what I had (a mere 1/3 of the actual price of my meal), since I had such trouble finding the place.  Talk about great customer service, this is how you build loyal happy customers.

Now to the real point of the whole ordeal, the food.  Food was excellent, I haven't had a pulled pork sandwich that good in years.  Pork is tender, juicy, with good smoky crust.  Carolina BBQ sauce was exactly what I was hoping for.  Mac n cheese did not disappoint.

To the proprietor: thanks for your generosity today, I will be seeing you soon, specifically the next time I have a hankering for pulled pork!

I ordered the pulled pork sandwich meal.  It came with two side, dessert, and a drink, but the very nice owner offered to me an extra side as I was uninterested in the drinks they had available.

The cold slaw and mac and cheese were average, but the baked beans were really good.  The sandwich, however, was disappointing.  I have high standards for pulled pork after living in the Kansas City area and found the pulled pork here to be pretty flavorless.  I did like the large variety of sauces available and found the cold slaw went really well with some of the mustardy bbq sauce mixed in to cut the sweetness.

We showed up at 6:30pm on a Sunday about a half hour before close.  I pretty much expected them to say the were sold out by then, but I was in luck they had a rack of ribs and some pulled pork.  The lady said she would put together a family meal from what she had.  2 Bags of food later I'm walking out the door!  Once I opened the bags I found a HUGE pile of pulled pork a whole rack of ribs,homemade sides... coleslaw, potato salad, beans, Mac n cheese and some bread pudding. Everything was so great my favorites are the pulled pork and potato salad and vanilla bread pudding.  FYI if your Arkansas fan come show your support

I didn't wanna try this place for breakfast because you know me, I'm a nose-up-high proud Hispanic girl who doesn't really eat at Mexican restaurants. I have a beloved Madre at home to cook me the real shit with love and for FREE, homie. Lol. I whine at my friend for 10 minutes, he's persistent about taking me there to try it. I didn't wanna be a Yelp hypocrite and only eat Shushi, but not something new! 

Fiiiiine, I said. We enter it, it's dead as a cemetery, we saw two very generous workers prepping in the early morning for an eager audience and us. Their menu and specials are translated from Spanish to English, English to Spanish. Mexican music is traveling in each direction, it reminded me of my roots. I was proud to be from Latin America. 

We took forever to finally order something: I'm giving credit to the nice lady at the counter for her level of patience. We took so long, we let a man behind us order first. At first I wanted to try the Colorada:  which had scrambled eggs, chorizo, franks and melted cheese. But at the end of the day, I finally surrendered my curiosity and went with the Hawaiiana Sandwich: with Pineapple, veggies, ham, melted cheese, and chipotle sauce/or jalapeños! 

Two of those, and sweet, sweet orange juice!! It tasted just like mango, but it had fruit in it. The sandwiches were made by a very talented cook who used a grill to perform in front of us. The sandwiches took less than 15 minutes to cook. I spoke Spanish to both of the current workers there. I felt blessed. 

They cut the sandwiches in half for two. They are giant! It took me the whole day to finish the Hawaiiana! I'm sorry I didn't try out this place sooner.

Tasty! 

I didn't notice my usual torta option of al pastor, but I felt pressured to decide quickly due to our movie time. 

The bread  was nicely toasted and the toppings seemed fresh. I had a chicken sandwich with double avocado. If that was a double portion, the single portion must be a sad amount. 

2 sandwiches were made hot and quick as more people started to roll in for their sandwich fills. 

I think we will be returning, but not until after I pore over the menu better!

Love it. I would eat here everyday if it was closer to my home or work.
Praying for a Torta Shop on every corner.

I HIGHLY recommend Las Tortugas--what a lucky find! I stumbled upon it while heading to the Starbucks next door. Let's just say that I never made it to the 'bucks. I had the Güera torta and it was so incredibly delicious. Very friendly staff and I loved all the Latin vibes. Can't wait to get a meal there again.

What's a torta?
No clue. 
But so, so glad Yelp found this place. 
We were looking for some Mexican food and this restaurant showed up. 
I said, "no sandwiches."
But one step inside and I knew we hit the jackpot. 
Get brave. 
Walk inside. 
Order something. 
Anything. 
It will be good. 
Oh, and get an extra water...spicy,
Holy Crap! Best freakin steak torta I've ever had my new favorite place!!!! Bread was soft and delicious. Didn't scrape up the roof of your mouth. Cheese perfectly melted.
WOW. The bread is the truth. If you don't speak Spanish you can play it safe and order the Guera, pronounced wed-dah, which chicken tomato and avocado on the fluffiest warm bread

It's a new location for these guys and was delighted and surprised to find this one sandwiched between Starbucks and Chase.   Didn't plan on eating lunch but now I am.  Ended up getting super Cubana for about $10 loaded with lots of goodies like ham,  melted cheese, fried steak, pork, franks, chorizo and eggs.
They grill it fresh front of you and you get it piping hot.  I had it to go and took it to starbucks next door and I started to dig in.   Few peolpe were admiring my grub.  It was delicious. Instead of jalapeños,  mine was topped with Chipotle.  Yummy flavor! 

I was only able to finish half of it and...  i know what my snack will be.  
It took few seconds to read menu since it's all in Spanish but the ingredient were also in English. 

Great wholesome food with nice price to go with it.

Good luck guys and I will be sure to stop by when I'm passing by.

18 dollars for two sandwiches, a breakfast sandwich and Colorado sandwich. Tiny end piece tomato slices, quartered tiny hot dog pieces, over hard eggs, cheese, onions. And some other stuff on breakfast Sammy, it was not very good and I'm sad that we paid so much money for such tiny portioned meat and veggies sandwiches.
 very disappointed.
Really good Mexican style sandwiches! I especially like the perrona with the chipotle sauce on it. The sandwiches are pretty big, so sometimes it's even ok to split one with a friend.

After finishing up some errands, I decided I needed to try out the new torta place.  I was greeted immediately by the very friendly and helpful cashier.  She walked me through the menu and helped me pick out a pork free torta.

My sandwich was grilled immediately and I took it to go.  Unfortunately, I can't remember the name of the torta I chose but it was dressed with chicken, ham, and cotija cheese.  The bread was thin, which was both good and bad.  Good, because the torta wasn't overwhelmed by the bread, but bad because the freshly grilled meat, onions, and cheese wrapped up in tin foil during the journey home made the sandwich pretty soggy.  I took the offer of chipotle sauce on side, which turned out to be a good decision.  If the sauce had been on the torta during the trip home, I would have had to eat with a knife and fork.  And since the chipotle sauce is so flavorful, I wouldn't have wanted to leave it off.  The chicken was tasty but I was a little disappointed by the one thin slice of grocery store deli meat ham.

The restaurant is a nice, clean open space filled with high-top community tables smartly outfitted with rolls of paper towels.  The cashier said that this location is busier than the other store in Commerce City, so it sounds like word has gotten out.  Look for it across from the Wal-Mart, sandwiched between Starbucks and the bank.

Super tasty sandwiches and the price is very reasonable considering the portions and quality. I keep this place in mind not just for lunch and dinner, but for breakfast as well, as there are several egg-based sandwiches.

This is a sister location of the much-busier Las Tortugas on Alameda in Denver. On the occasions I've been to the Monaco location, there have been no more than a couple of other people there.

You can have anything from a satisfying normal-sized sandwich (e.g. lambada) to an absolute gut-buster (e.g. super cubana) that you could split with someone else. The bread is exactly the right size in my opinion -- as large as a turtle, but not so thick that you'll fill up on bread.

They also have chips, horchata (cinammon rice milk drink), liquados (fruit drinks), fruit smoothies and desserts.

The sandwiches have Spanish names but, as you can see from the menu photo, the ingredient list is printed in English. You can call your order in ahead, or just show up and wait a few minutes for the sandwich to be prepared on the grill.

Ample parking in a large lot. Service was pretty friendly. Clean and fairly nice. The windows face due west and around sunset the sun blazes through the unshaded windows and ricochets off all of the bright stainless steel tabletops and is really bright and unpleasant. It also got pretty loud with some yelling kids and the cook chopping stuff.

The menu is somewhat confusing, alternating between Spanish and English and it's not clear which items are which. Pretty much all the tortas are meat-centric -- like 3 or 4 different kinds -- but not much for veggies.

Took about 5 minutes to get, and it was searing hot. The bread was decent size, however the middle was pretty slim with thin breaded meat, avocado slice, too much chipotle sauce that dominated everything, and that's all that can be remembered. Definitely had much more satisfying and generous tortas elsewhere.

If the police were going through a dry-spell and needed to make a bust then decided to plant some incriminating evidence on my person to which led to my conviction of a capital crime . . . I would choose a half Hawaiian with a half Pork Leg and Cheese Torta with a half of an Espanola from Las Tortugas for my last meal. 

With regret hanging on me like an iron-chained-cloak, I can only imagine the emptiness of staring out the 9x12 window thru my 6 inch reinforced cell door, across the narrow hall looking at the muted glass window watching the glow of what can only be the sun, slowly fading into the deepest, darkest, shadow, of passing time when it would hit me.
(Slap!!) I forgot to add Chipotle sauce and Jalapenos for that extra spice!! This would have been the key component to help me prepare for what life I have left to live with only faded memories instead of the soul-nourishing sandwiches from Tortugas.

It already comes with life-saving tomato, onions, avocado and mayonnaise all delicately placed on two pillows of toasted, crispy, perfect, tortas. 

This incriminating combination left me licking the wax paper the sandwich came wrapped in for anything that may have dripped off. 

Because whatever you do, you will be sorry all the rest of your life if you pass on a sandwich from Las Tortugas. Don't wait until you are incarcerated and left to rot with your tortured soul anguishing in endless sweltering pain inside a 9 x 5 cell asking yourself, 

"Why? Why-oh-Why did I never make it to Las Tortugas?!!!

The menu is almost overwhelming at first glance, but the gentleman at the register helped us out and made suggestions.  I tried the one he said was the most popular and I was not disappointed.  I can't remember the name, but it had ham, pork leg, and steak.  The bread was perfectly toasted and all the ingredients were fresh and flavorful.  I'd definitely eat here again!

A friend recommended me Las Tortugas and i will forever thank him! This place is great! 
This place is the place if you are a met lover, wich i ma! They have the best steaks, and i love the fact that i could see the meat on the grill! The plate is usually full, i can never finish mine, although i try my best to do that! I don't even know what dish is my favourite, because the options are many : the tortas or the super Cubana might be my top choices! Anyway, i plan on trying the whole menu!
Not bad food. Had to wait a bit longer than expected for a sandwich. The seats are hard stools.

I usually stop here on my way home from work. Las Tortugas always has fresh and delicious ingredients.
I usually get the Enmascarada torta. Its so delicious!! It's filled with small grilled chicken pieces, ham, avocado and a delicious melted Mexican cheese. It also comes with onions and tomatoes. 
I prefer my torta with chipotle sauce instead of the jalapenos, but you can get both. The chipotle sauce adds a very good and smoky flavor to the torta.
Also, make sure you try their horchata or one of their fresh fruit milkshakes. They make everything right in front of you, so it's easy to see that everything is fresh.

Looooooooooove this place. Where to start! The tortas are delicious if it's your first time I recommended la borracha it's my favorite get it with jalapeño. The Aqua frescas are top notch best lemonade I've had by far! It's very authentic Sinaloa style tortas yes the menu is in Spanish and for those of you a bit intimidated by Latin culture don't be!
