Embrace it this place is very welcoming and they will help you order and once you try you will keep coming back. Top notch authentic

Wow.  Amazing, legit torts ready to bite your senses.  Make sure to get fries and a coke as this is the trifecta.  Live or up with a fanta.  Atmosphere is clean, inviting and ready for you to chow down.  Viva el cubano!

So disappointed after reading the good reviews...the whole menu on the wall is in Spanish  and bits and pieces of english....lady at counter was not very friendly on helping to translate. Very very disappointed.
Friendly staff, excellent Mexican sandwiches. This is a great place for a cheap & delicious lunch.
Love this place best Tortas ever!! I have been to all their locations and quality is hands down the best.

Im used to a little more meat in my tortas but it only lost a star for that. Other than that I like this place. Great taste overall and the staff is nice... the grill is in view so you can waych them whip of your torta.
Update: Las Tortugas now sells chips! I still think they should add fries to the menu but adding a fryer to the kitchen for one menu item is a pain in the a**. I'm good with the chips! Thanks!

The food here is awesome. This place is down the street from me. I've been here at least a dozen times and have NEVER been disappointed. 

I think as a whole the staff is very friendly. 

I've read these reviews and I do agree that their service,at times, is a bit lack luster. Sometimes you wait for someone to come up front. However, I honestly think they're short staffed and may not receive the best wages.

Closest I've found to SoCal Mexican food in CO. I've read some of the other reviews and I'm not sure about any of the other dishes, but I had the carne asada tacos and I would recommend them to anyone! Location was a little dead but food was hot and delicious.

Great place to pick up a quick burrito 
It's not the best Green chili or burrito but for $5-8 it's a pretty large one with lots of options. 
Friendly service, clean restaurant, & quick wait time. Usually get a burrito here and have not tried other menu items.

I can't really tell you if the food was good or not. My daughter and I were just in here waiting to order some burritos to go. The woman behind the counter was on the phone for the longest time. We patiently waited. And waited. And waited. She stayed on the phone, glaring at us as if we were the biggest inconvenience. Another woman, a co-worker, came along just glaring at us as well. Do we have arms growing out of our foreheads? Wow. We glanced around, and at lunchtime, we were the only customers in the place. Gee, I wonder why. We finally turned on our heels and walked out, burrito less. These people clearly don't want business. Man, are we hungry.

This place isn't going to make it. Cold food, no beer with my burrito and Chris the front guy doesn't understand what it takes to keep people coming back. Ordered my usual bean and beef deluxe with half hot half mild and asked for a small amount of green chili. Chris said ok $1.50! Are you kidding me? Your going to nickel and dime me when it could of just offered a small amount? Wow! Just wow!  Plus the beef was burned bad and the food was cold. 

This kid hasnt a clue and no one that owns it is around. Man to bad I was looking forward to a Chubbys in the neighborhood.... I'd pass if I was you! I know I am.

I honestly try to be objective about any restaurant because at the end of the day,( for good or bad), there is someone counting receipts and paying bills to front a food establishment which is hard work and costly. So despite my consternation with the original Chubbys at 38th and Lipan, I thought what the heck. I will try this spin off and see how much they put into making a decent chile verde. 
So in I went and ordered  a hamburger with green chile . The burger was medium sized and everything was pretty awesome. Meat, buns, lettuce and tomato were all fresh. I then critically evaluated the green chile sauce, which was ordered hot as opposed to mild. It came on the side as a sauce  which was great for dipping and not just straight canned green chile plunked on top ,(although that is ok anyway as very little food can be said to "not" be improved by green chile !).  It passed just fine and was adequately spicy and tasty enough to merit pride methinks to any decent  green chile lover. Tad heavy on the cumin and a little light on actual green chile flavor, but that is only under a microscope and coming from a lifelong chile eater who has tasted the best including ABQ NM cuisine (and believe me those Albuquerquiens don't mess around when it comes to chile). So it passed muster for me and if I am in the area and the budget permits- definitely will try something else there. Gracias.

I was nervous to eat here after reading the reviews as I have been going to the one off 225 for 10 years but was closer to this location. I was pleasantly surprised about how nice the young man was who took my order. He was very polite and helpful. My food was ready rather quickly and was just as good as the other location.

This location single handedly turned us off of Chubby's in general. The service can be quite rude. The food is slow to come out. If I'm near the one on Abilene, I'll go there before I try this one again.
Walked into Chubbys this AM, and the sewage smell was so bad we left! I have mentioned this many times to the employees and the manager, and nothing gets done about it!
Ordered a mild hot Mix chili burrito, Burned my mouth! Went to buy a mild one and they laughed and gave it to me free. Great neighborhood atmosphere

I am appalled with the service and the actions of the gm (lianna) she literally tried to charge me when I requested for 2 salsas for each burrito. Then to say I was rude. She has been rude to me from the time I have frequented the place. However I will NEVER go back. I like their burritos and have referred it to locals due that I am in the industry. Foods good but obviously since I'm not the Hispanic descent management could careless for my loyal!

the food is pretty good! mainly their enchiladas and burritos are the best! but the girl who works up front is a b****! i have never been in a place with such terrible customer service. she is very sarcastically rude when you have questions about the food and always acts like she has better things to do than to do her job.

NEVER GO HERE! Service  was slow beyond belief. As I know it a burrito contains beans,rice and then a protien NOT just chicken in a tortilla.Not to mention the smothering sauce tastes like Chinese food! Will never go here again and I recommend the same for all.

To me Chubby's is a step up from Taco Bell. However it sounds, I don't mean this as a bad thing.  In fact, sometimes I crave their heartburn inducing green chile! 

I generally stick with the basics here, either a Mexican Hamburger or a Beef/Bean Burrito.  It isn't earth shattering, it is basic stick to your ribs Mexi-American fare.  Like  I said, when I am in the mood I love it!  

This one is off Parker and Belleview and is a pain to get into.  You really can only get in by going to the light and entering the parking lot from the back (no turnouts from Parker).  I guess this isn't a biggie, but it seems like it should be easier!  I must say there was plenty of parking in the strip mall and this Chubby's was the cleanest Chubby's I have ever been in - seriously - it was immaculate the day I was there.  It was also completely dead at noon.  However, the staff was friendly and it was fast.  Plus my beef/bean burrito was delish.  

It works!  I will be back :)

I am so disappointed in this location. We go there every Friday for dinner which the food is great. Christmas Eve I understand closing early but 3pm come on. You aren't even giving people the chance to get off work or even get something after last minute shopping. Same thing happened tonight. New Year's Eve on our way home called to order and was told they closed at 3pm. Why?? So we were directed to the Abilene store who has to work. They didn't even know this location closed that early. Apparently they were supposed to be open until 8, but decided on their own to just close when they wanted. Granted it's not like hey are losing a ton of business but the business they are losing they are sending out of the way.
Can't say enough about my experiences at Chubby's! The food is always fresh, the customer service is great, and the restaurant is clean! Will always have my business.

Hey it's a chain! All of the times I have gone the service is quick and friendly.  Colorado is full of fickle green chili connoisseurs. I like theirs, it's not the best I have had, but it does keep me coming back for more. 

I like the basic smothered chicken burrito or smothered bean burrito deluxe; both are extremely difficult to mess up as far as Tex/Mex/American fare go. 

I always get take-away and this place has been good to me. I'll be back soon.
Horrible staff and the food is nasty cold when they finally end up bringing it to you. This isn't a place we will be returning to.

Stopped to grub some breakfast burritos this morning and the teenage gal running the front end could only have more clearly expressed her disdain for life, work, and all things living if she had taken out her head phones and cussed all the customers out. No welcome greeting, no thanks for the business, no eye contact. NO CUSTOMER SERVICE. I watched her interaction with myself and several other customers and it was par for the corse for her. Sad b/c the greasy spoon breakfast burritos I expected were great - her lack of service and her typical bad teenage attitude should be hidden in the back until she grows up a bit.

So I come in to eat lunch took the person 10mins to finally come out and take our order.  Then when ordering the young girl was very rude like she had other things to do.  Bad customer service I do not reccomend this place.  To add on top of it the food was OK.

There are way too many Mexican food places in this town for this place to have the prices it does and small portions.  I ordered a large chili cheese fry and it came in a small container and when I questioned they stated it was the same amount but in a smaller package, knowing it was a load of bull just went on because I was running late.  Point is, if you have a choice go to the next mexican place down the road.

I've always had this preconceived notion of all Chubby's. The only one I had ever been to was the one on Abilene which is dark and dingy with terrible service and just as terrible food. I couldn't understand why my food always took 20 minutes when all they would do was scoop things out of the trays and plop it on a plate.

However, when I moved to this neighborhood, I noticed there was a Chubby's near by and I had a hankering for some green chilli, so we decided to stop in after months of saying we would. I was pleasantly surprised to find it adequately lit, very clean, and the staff was friendly. Now I noticed someone complaining about the entrance, the entrance is super simple and is not at all a pain. If anyone has driven on Parker, you know exactly how the traffic is so the entrance is to be expected.

I was here about a month or so ago and it was nice to see they added some specials, which is much needed since they don't seem to get too much business, probably due to the overall location(nothing to do with entrance). I won't say this is the best Mexican food I've ever had, but I like it. It's quick, easy, and it tastes like it's cooked to order(whether or not it is, I don't really know).
It's ok I not sure I will make an effort to ever stop by again if I am going through town!
One of my favorite breakfast burritos around! Ham and hot green chile inside if you want a traditional breakfast burrito with scrambled eggs from the flattop.
I had lunch here with my family.  We all ordered sopapillas they were probably the worst I've ever had. It wasn't even fluffed up, it was flat and crispy. Definitely not going back to eat here!
Have eaten here a few times as time goes by the food gets worse and worse......dont think ill ever go back again.....take your money somewere else...

Green chili is good but doubtful that we'll return due to the rudeness of their staff.  They seemed annoyed when we walked in and the old bag taking out order even rolled her eyes when I asked get to repeat her jar bled words.

I'd like to say the service was terrible but there was NO service whatsoever! We purchased four burritos and some tacos and spent over $40. If patrons are spending that kind of money, service should be impeccable, chain or not. Such a disappointment and the staff had disgusted looks on their faces. Such a lack of pride and professionalism. The food was subpar. Chile was good. Will never return.

I was excited that a Chubbys had moved into my neighborhood. My excitement has been tempered a bit after eating there. The food was alright, service was fine but man their was a slight smell when I walked in. When I went into the mens restroom the sewage smell was over whelming. Not sure what the H*** is going on their but they really need to get that fixed. 
I have been a Chubbys fan since the first time I ate at the Abilene location. I thought this food was above average for Mexican but I think the food is better at the Abilene location. The green chili is pretty good, maybe just a tad bland. Def packs a lot of spice. 
Although this new location is about a mile from my house, the next time I eat at Chubbys it will be at the Abilene location which is about a 7 mile one way drive for me.  But I think you could do a LOT worse for mexican food in my opinion.

I remember El Chubby's on Abilene being absolutely disgusting when I tried it years ago. I recently noticed this new location not too far from my house, so I decided to give it another go. I figured if they have the money to be opening new locations, they must have fixed their problems and revamped the menu. WRONG. Just as terrible as I remember it, almost in a nostalgia sense. The refried beans smell like a dishrag, the rice was crispy, and my burrito contained mostly fatty undercooked pieces of meat. 

Probably TMI, but I spent that night waking up every couple of hours to have some horrible experiences on the toilet as a result of eating this crap. 

That's not to mention how rude and uncaring the staff was. I stood at the counter for quite a while waiting to have my order taken while meanwhile the guy working the counter was chatting it up with his friends who were in the restaurant. He seemed very annoyed that I came in wanting to give them my money, how dare I!

Bottom line, if their prices were similar to Taco Bell's prices, this place might be acceptable. But take your $10 and get a decent meal elsewhere, your stomach and your wallet will thank you.

I have always been a big fan of Chubby's. This location seems to have a somewhat I don't cars attitude. My burrito was still pretty good. What makes it tastes so good to me is the chicharrones. Hope I spelled that ridht. It's still o.k. but hope they get it to where it should be.

Funny smell.  Pricey for fast-food.  Empty at dinner time should have told me what I needed to know.  Decent green chili, spicy and thick.  For the money, there are many other and better options in the area.

Customer service is one of the most important things to me when I visit a restaurant. I walked into the restaurant at 9:10PM, and the cashier made it clear that I had to place an order to go. When I asked what time they closed, I was not given a straight answer, and only after inquiring several times did he state that they closed at 10, but he wanted to clean the lobby. The burrito was okay, but wasn't as big as usual. 

BOTTOM LINE: I felt rushed and nunwelcomed. Next time I will take my cash elsewhere.

One of the worst Mexican joints in Colorado. 1st of all there was a smell of raw sewage. They used the name of the best "Original Chubby's" off of 38th. There is no comparison. Beans right out of the can, a side of Pace Picante sauce to drop in your nasty taco. The cheese was not even melted on the enchilada. Casa Bonita has better food!

Let me just start that this has got to be one of the worst restaurant experiences I have ever had.  I first arrived at the restaurant about 11 am. and there was nobody in the restaurant and for a while there I didn't see any employees either. I waited about ten minutes and finally seen a lady way in the back. So I waved to her and she contacted another person in the back to let her know i wanted to place an order. This young girl came out of the back and she looked very upset, like i woke her up from a good nap. Right before she took my order the phone rang and she answered it. So I waited a few more minutes until she hung up. Now it was my turn to order. The first words out of her mouth were "what do you want?" I begin to ask about the breakfast burritos and she responded they have three different kinds. I asked her what was in them. She told me to look at the menu. That was a rude response. So I then ordered a breakfast burrito and then she replied "is that it?" I said no. I wanted to add a mexican hamburger. She asked again "is that it?" I said yes. I than paid for my order and waited again. I could see back in the kitchen area and no one was working on my food. Then out of nowhere another guy comes into the restaurant.  I thought he was a customer but then he asked me if I gave been helped. I said yes and then he contined to walk back to the kitchen. I then saw him begin to prepare my food. Once he finished preparing my order him he called me up to the window behind the cash register and said "here's your food". So I had to go behind the register because the cashier was nowhere to be found. I took my order and when I opened that to go container the chili on the mexican hamburger had a sour smell. I cut into the mexican hamburger and the burger tasted old and the beans were cold. The breakfast burrito had a small amount of the sour chile. Both items we awful tasting and thrown away after the first bite. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. I could understand why I never saw any customer at this restaurant. Don't waste your time or money at this place.  The one star I gave this restaurant was way too many stars. I don't think even Gordan Ramsey could save this restaurant on kitchen nightmares. I think Fox 31 should have this restaurant inspected and shown on their restaurant report card. I would be very curious to see what grade they would recieve.

Grabbed some to-go burritos a few days ago and they were not bad. Gf didn't much care for the carne asada steak burrito but it's an acquired taste. I just had a bean and cheese with hot chile and you can't really mess that up. Place was clean, none of the smells as another reviewer stated. Fairly new location so I'm sure it's still a work in progress.

The place was empty, Wednesday at 5:20 pm the cook told me THE GIRL will be here in a minute. Sorry to say THE GIRL acted like I was interrupting her. I asked for a small order of smothered fries, nope just large. By this time I felt like walking out but just ordered the larger brother to the Taco Bell bean burrito. Three something! At least Taco Bell offers onions on it, red OR green sauce, cheese which two of T.B. Equals one plain El chubs. El Chubby has no complimentary sauce. They think that their artery clogging family secret green chili is why the world keeps Turing. Folks the only thing I was looking for was friendly service and my once a year burning of the mouth sensation but count myself better off not feeling the gut consequences. The workers in Thornton act the same way like we are all privileged to enter their doors. Way to costly also.  Chubbys/El Chubbys same thing, stay away.
Food awesome, smell not so much

We came here for a birthday dinner and had a great experience! Service was excellent, very receptive but didn't hover over us. Food recommendations were perfect & the meals were fantastic. Very low key vibe, staff was extremely helpful & friendly. 

Can't wait to go back!!!

Have you ever gotten a restaurant recommendation only to go and be disappointed? This was not the case.

Excellent food. We had wine, the cheese plate and arugula salad for an appetizer. The brie and goat cheese on the cheese plate were excellent. The arugula salad with the fried oyster mushrooms and truffle oil: I could eat this every day.
I had the duck for an entree, and it was fantastic. Dessert with Palisade peaches and a butterscotch sauce was delicious.
Our server was really nice, and the atmosphere was low key.
I am so glad I finally ate at this restaurant and cannot wait to return.

What a BEAUTIFUL night at a BEAUTIFUL restaurant. My party of 4 came to celebrate a friend's birthday. Johanna was our waitress and we couldn't have asked for a more wonderful experience. Three of us ordered the duck entree and the third person ordered the scallop entree. We all enjoyed our meals and raved about how fresh everything tasted. Two of us had the Caesar salads which were also tasty.

The Yelp family also raved about the mussels, so we decided to give them a try. I am a seafood connoisseur so I was excited to give them a try. They. Were. Delicious. I even got two of the people at the table who swear they don't like mussels to try them and they raved about how tasty they were.

They were sweet enough to bring the birthday guy a limoncello shot. It was a little too strong for him but it was a super sweet gesture!

Don't let the strip mall location fool you, this is a top notch restaurant with top notch service.

We will DEFINITELY find our way back out here soon!

I have a good friend who lives in Cherry Hills that I don't see very often and thought I'd take her out for a nice dinner - she gave me a short list of place in the area that she's heard good things about.  The Wooden Table gets generally good reviews and surprisingly for fancy area of town not that many to choose from.  

So, the elephant in the room is the total lack of ambiance.  As you've read it is in a strip mall and the entire front of the restaurant is glass floor to ceiling so you have an unobstructed view of the parking lot and Sally's Beauty - lol.  Concrete floors make it very loud until the crowd thins out which is early because it's definitely an older demographic.  I could be OK with the meh atmosphere if the food blew my hair back but alas it did not - especially at this price point.

Started with a couple of perfect Hendrick's martinis - best thing of the night - icy cold - flawless.  For starters I had the Chicken Liver Mousse Crostini with Currants, Pickled Chilies ($11) - I was hoping for something like the silken deliciousness I had last week at Acorn.  Nope.  Hard, dense little pecan shaped nuggets on way too fragile toasts slivers which disintegrated if you tried to spread out the "mousse".  Not a fan.  She out ordered me with the Fried Ricotta Polenta, Red Sauce, Melted Fresh Mozzarella ($12) - delish but an entree sized portion - even with me helping half got left behind.

For mains she had the Roasted Duck Breast, Acquerello Risotto, Duck Leg Confit, Roasted Fennel Puree, Orange and Fennel Salad ($31).  It wasn't bad but the skin was pretty flabby and the presentation left a lot to be desired.  The risotto, of which there was a huge portion, was an unappetizing gray.  I got to taste the duck and it was pretty flavorful.  I've been craving good lamb (not much to be found in Mexico and much of what there is is from New Zealand and gamy).  So, I had Rack of Lamb, Fava Bean & Herb Vinaigrette, Baba Ganoush ($32).  First, two rib chops does not make a "rack" in any restaurants I've ever been in.  Second, the fava beans were in scarce supply and kind of wrinkled and tired.  Finally, the lamb looked as if it had been done sous vide - no crust, the fat inside was white, and overall it lacked the juiciness I was hoping for.

We washed this down with a bottle of Vino Nobile di Montepulciano ($75) - they decanted it which was a nice touch.  I'm not generally a fan of Italian wines (and their list is 90% Italian) and so I let her choose it.  Didn't finish it so I hope our lovely sever got to sample it.  She was terrific and worth a star on her own.

I passed on dessert but she had the Affogato - Espresso Poured Over Vanilla Bean Gelato ($8).  Pretty hard to screw that up and they didn't - lovely presentation.

So, it was an OK but not great meal and, hold on to your wallet, $275 with tip.  Ouch.  At that price I expect an extraordinary experience and this simply wasn't.  No rush to return.  They're very proud of their pasta so not having it might have been our mistake.  If there's a next time (doubtful) I'd go that direction.

My friend and I stopped in today for lunch to celebrate his birthday! He works nearby and was craving Italian! The Wooden Table is a gorgeous spot with great contemporary decor. Had it been dinner time, we would have loved to get wine. But since we both had to go back to work, we had waters with our pasta. 

I ordered the Ricotta Cavatelli (Duck Confit Carbonara, Pancetta, Egg Yolk) which was so tasty and just the right portion for lunch. He ordered the Pappardelle (Venison Bolognese) which he loved. The waitress offered to give him a free dessert and recommended the Tres Leches Cake. Like all the reviews say, the cake is so delicious! It's a huge portion too and together, we couldn't finish it. Really generous of them especially since most restaurants don't give away anything for birthdays anymore.

Sadly, the restaurant was empty during our entire meal, but hopefully it gets more visitors for dinners and on weekends. Highly recommend! Definitely want to come back and try other menu items like the mussels and scallops.

Wow, who knew there could be such a gem at this location (also psyched there's a Trader Joe's next door!)

I've made several attempts to be here so when we finally made it, my expectation had been built up so high. Good thing The Wooden Table met it!

The dinner menu was simple but I'm happy that they present two different entrée sizes. I gotta say, the prices ain't cheap, that's why it behooves you to join their mailing list and get in on the 15% loyalty discount! 

I was glad to have hung on to the bread because the pastas turned out to be a little on the salty side but I sure enjoyed mopping up the sauces! Definitely loved the Parpadelle with venison Bolognese. At first I saw these super wide noodles and thought they'd used lasagna sheets. It wasn't until a week later when I made lasagna at home using the boxed dry stuff that I realized their Parpadelle was probably fresh pasta!

The Carbonara had an interesting flavor to it, I thought it tasted bitter, some folks might like it though... The Scallop dish was both pretty to look at and wonderful to eat! Don't expect leftovers here, the portion sizes aren't that huge but that's what a classy place should be! We managed to make room for dessert and per next table's recommendation, we got the lemon curd cake. Personally I'd love to lose the curd and have just the cake and eat it too! :-D

Service was spot on, our waitress was very sweet and I promised her she'll see us again!

Truth in advertising . . . They do have wooden tables.
I'm not clear on why one would name a restaurant after that fact, but, nonetheless, it's true.

Hmmmm. Perhaps it is supposed to show that it's an informal neighborhood spot and isn't trying to show off by using any of those really expensive onyx tables. If that's the goal, TWT met it: It's a nice strip mall dining spot with one big open room that has an inviting atmosphere and is peopled by professional and cool servers who tend to a monochromatic Cherry Hills clientele. 

We made the drive down south for 3 reasons: first, we have a Denver Dining coupon book that TWT is in and it gives you 2-fer entrees with a deadline that is fast approaching; second, I was crazy hungry for medium rare roasted duck and on a Monday night TWT was the only place around we could find that has ducky-poo on the menee-you; third, we're moving out tomorrow to do major renovations on our house and there's nothing in the refrigerator/freezer other than a bottle of wohdka (and that didn't sound like it'd be the right thing to do for dinner on a school night:).

Got to TWT and couldn't have been more pleased. We both had their duck and it wasn't that sweet "a l'orange" thing. More savory and very well prepared. Started with an arugula salad that was nicely presented and had a good glass of vino nobile that was the perfect reasonably priced accompaniment to the game. The only thing we weren't wild about was the in-house carrot cake with toasted coconut. The cake was too dense and not particularly carrot-y. The frosting, however, was very good.

All-in-all, we'd probably go back if we were in the neighborhood. If we actually lived around there (and I don't think they'll give us a passport stamp to live that far south of the city) we'd probably hit it up more often.

Sign me,

David "I absolutely Wood go to this place" M

We have gone to this place a few times for one reason:  THEY HAVE A GOOD CHEF.  The food is consistently better than average, including the home-made pastas and meats, that often include very well-sourced lamb, venison, duck breast, and other cool things.    However, I onnly can give three stars overall, and here is why:

Portions/value - portions are tiny.  Especially for the pastas, and at lunch.  One other example, we had sides with the lamb rib chops recently... it came with 6, count em... SIX... fava beans (they were more for looks than anything).  

Wine - thanks to a prior Somm who worked at Wooden Table, who brought up the wines considerably, there are really cool and different wines on the list, including an Etna Rosso (Sicily) and a Pinot Noir from Suditrol (very cool, both!).  However!   ANd this is a BIG however... I have had to send wines back more than once BECAUSE THEY ARE OXIDIZED.  There is really no excuse for sending out wines that have been open too long, as a knowledgeable wine person (like me) can tell a bad wine or a corked wine just by smelling it.

Overall, the food was good, including the cheese plate, and the desserts, also the coffee, and the service... for out in burbs, this is better than most all chains and a nice find.  Just PAY ATTENTION TO THE DETAILS and DON'T BE SKIMPY!
My wife and I have dined here four times and had our wedding rehearsal dinner here. The food is always excellent, the service is even better. Highly recommended.

The linguini with sausage is ok.

I love the bread and smooth olive oil, however the real winner is the tortellini, it is straight out of northern Italy.

A common theme runs through all the negative reviews of this restaurant - a blatant lack customer service. More specifically, customer requests, complaints, and expectations are repetitively ignored or even worse, outright rejected.  Multiple yelpers have echoed this theme and unfortunately I have also experienced it.  Too bad. I want so badly to support small businesses in the community but they first need to learn how to treat customers who may or may not be lifelong depending on how you treat them. Thanks for nothing.

This was such a great experience I can't wait to go back (when I can afford another $30 entree). Our server was funny and offered great suggestions. The gnocchi and salmon dishes were uniquely flavored and delicious. I wish the gnocchi was bigger (I'm curious to know how small the half portion is). With that said I would order both again! The cherry bomb dessert was rich and melt in your mouth amazing. The atmosphere is light and neighborhood-y.

One of my favorite restaurants!! My taste buds were excited and looking forward to another wonderful meal!

Calina and I came in about half an hour before our reservation and were immediately greeted by Robert, such a friendly and personable Host. We were able to enjoy a Walnut Manhattan cocktail before dinner. We used the Yelp check in to get a BOGO for the cocktail.

The Walnut Manhattan was so yummy and my taste buds were happy.

We then ordered a bottle of red wine and proceeded to attack the delicious mussels--Yum, Yum, Yum. The broth is so tasty and could eat it as a soup! Also ordered the delicious Arugula salad (a must get each time we come in to dine).

For the entrees we ordered the duck, the veal osso buco, the cod, the tortellini, and beef platters. We all tried each others entrees and once again, taste buds were jumping and happy!

To end the meal we ordered the Tres Leches Cake and the Chocolate Cake with a round of complimentary Limoncello (made in-house and the best I have ever tasted).

It was another wonderful dining experience and looking forward to the next one!!

Concept: Very Good
Atmosphere: Average
Menu: Very Good
Food: Excellent
Service: Excellent

As many have said don't let the strip mall fool you. Inside you will find an amazing culinary experience. The service is attentive and friendly. The menu is brief but offers a wonderful diversity of dishes. There's something for just about everyone. I had the Duck and it was top notch!

My only constructive feedback I would have is the interior decor could use some quick updating. The inside feels like a strip mall restaurant. Again, the food and service will soon make you completely forget about the mismatched art and styles.

I was a little concerned based on a few of the reviews and I am not really anywhere close to this restaurant, but decided to give it a try and am very happy I did.  You would not expect the quality of food served here to be located in a strip mall.  We went with the recommendations of our server and the sommelier.  We had the mussels to start which were really good enough to want to find every piece of bread in the place and dip it in the broth.  The wine the sommelier suggested was very good and reasonably priced.  We both got pasts dishes since they are made in house.  These were both quite good.  I had the Ricotta Cavatelli which was really good, but note it is rich.  There were too barley cooked eggs on top to stir in on your own which was a nice touch.  My hubby had the linguine, which as good as mine was, I think I liked it even better.  It had a nice kicked to it but not spicy.  

We opted not to have dessert because we were so satisfied with the flavors we had at the point, we didn't want to change it.  We were also crazy full.  

The service was really good, but did slow as they got busier.  I recommend going early.
It's that quiet hole in the wall that harbors exceptional cuisine. Nobody knows it exists. A+.

This is a very nice place. All of the food was cooked beautifully & Nice Wines. The staff were all very nice.
Our friends split a salad for their Appetizer and they were served half each on 2 plates which was a really thoughtful touch. My hubby got the mussels and there was plenty of them. I got the Chicken liver mousse and that was great.
For the mains, us two ladies got the smaller portion of pasta. $14 each and they were pretty small. My Husband spent over $30 on "Lamb T-bone" which were Lamb Chops (we're Australian, we know Lamb) with not much on the side and the other main was scallops, 3 massive scallops. It was all lovely & tasty but usually if I have a main & and app, I'd never get dessert, but I did, a extremely tart Lemon Cake. It wasn't the cake that was the most tangy though, it was the sauce on the bottom.
Hands down some of the best food in Denver and the best pasta we've had. We miss fresh homemade pasta and this is by far the best we've found. The lobster agnolotti was exceptional.

This is a scratch made restaurant. It was absolutely amazing. Appetizer polenta was so fresh and simple. Ceaser salad dressing was homemade even had an anchovies on top. Entrees of scallops were perfectly cooked, angholtti was great too, had peas,cream and lobster, I has two entrees to go with the Groupon. Got the ravioli and steak. Both were so fresh prepared, refrigeratated well for reheats. Desserts...lemon curd cake with raspberry puree...awesome....and tres leches cake was moist and had great hints of spices within. The waitress was attentive and helpful with suggestions. Definitely a go to for company when they visit.

The food is good, but the service was just awful.  I was entertaining my sister and her husband and was so embarrassed.  We waited a long time for the waiter to come to our table, longer for drinks, and so long for our entrees that we had to ask where they were.  When questioned, the waiter was curt and seemed annoyed.  I've been to this restaurant before and did like it.  Never again.

I had dinner a few months back with some friends and we also had a small infant with us.  The staff could not have been nicer and more accommodating to our party to make sure we were in a corner where there wouldn't be a draft and less traffic so that the baby wasn't bumped in her carrier.  

The food was delicious, the wine list decent and the staff friendly!

I signed up for their email list and received an email to get 15% off my next meal -- wooooo!  So, I took my husband back this past weekend.   Can you believe it, again the food was delicious, the wine list decent and the staff friendly!   

The atmosphere is very cozy, romantic but lively.   It's a gem of a spot.

We visited Wooden Table on a Friday evening after purchasing a $60 Groupon for one appetiser, two entrees and one desert.  The Groupon ended up paying for the two entrees with the appetiser and desert being free.  It was a fantastic deal.

We started with the polenta which was a blast of creamy and savory flavors.  For our entrees, I ordered the duck with herbed risotto and my wife had the hanger steak with diced potatoes.  Like the appetiser, our entrees were spectacular.  The flavors worked perfectly on both dishes.  My duck was crispy on the outside and medium rare on the inside.  The risotto had large pieces of duck in it which complimented the flavors of the herbs.  Her steak was perfectly seasoned and prepared and the diced potatoes were like nothing we had previously tasted.

We ordered the tres leches cake for desert and were somewhat disappointed in the dish.  The appetiser and entrees, however, more than made up for the lackluster desert.   

From an ambience standpoint, this is a no thrills restaurant which was slightly disappointing given the menu prices.  It does, however, have an excellent wine cellar.  The only other downfall is that the service was slow.  We spent over two hours on our meal.  Plan accordingly.

Meh...

Chicken liver appetizer was awesome. Signature cocktails were average (lemon drop and hello zacher) but it was fun to find a BOGO Free with a Yelp check-in. 

Arugula salad was good.  Service was good. 

Lamb was $30 but it was like eating 2 pieces of leather. I asked for another steak knife as I hoped the knife was dull, but it only slightly helped stop the table from violently shaking. Halibut was average, at best. Sauces for both entrees were yummy but neither salvaged the dish. The Gnocchi actually had a hard texture. Hard gnocchi?

Despite having a free cocktail, dinner totaled $113 before tip. 

I almost gave 3 stars, but we can find several other restaurants to enjoy at that dinner price.

We went for lunch using a Groupon. We were brought a plate of bread with olive oil.  This was the best part of our meal.

My meatball sandwich was bland.  I like the meatball sandwiches at Firehouse Subs and Subway much better.  The sandwich came with freshly fried rosemary potato chips.  My husband liked them.

My husband ordered a pasta appetizer which was the portion size available with the Groupon for lunch.  There were 7 small tortellini like pastas in a bowl with some broth.  He was still hungry and asked for another plate of complimentary bread.

This place was pricey even with the Groupon and we will not be back.

I'm disappointed and hurt by my treatment at the Wooden Table.

My husband got a promotion at work, so as a last-minute thought, we swung by The Wooden Table for a celebration night. It was a Thursday evening, a little bit before 6:30. They had five open tables. 

The hostess asked if we had a reservation and we replied, "No... but we're hoping we can get a table!"

The manager (I believe-- baldish guy with a big beard) coughed at her "BAR!" and thus we were seated at the bar. I did ask her if any "reservations" for those five open tables cancelled, if we could please be moved. She agreed.

The tables remained open. We were not moved. (By the time we left, around 8:00, there were four open tables, with a horde of people wrapping up to go as we were). During our meal, we heard the manager complaining openly about walk-ins and it sounded like the kitchen was unprepared to handle a half-full dining room. I believe his mother was sitting next to us at the bar, and he was loud and talking about burping in people's faces. A lovely young couple, obviously out on a date, came in with a Groupon, and we heard him complaining LOUDLY about that as well. 

Despite the food being decent, there are much better places to drop $150 for 2 for a night out. And I will say, dessert was NOT good. The molten chocolate cake tastes like a cinnamon bomb. It's hard to taste any cocoa because your mouth is on fire from the unwieldy amount of cinnamon.

I get that reservations are helpful, but to feel sized up, deemed less than, and shunned to the bar when you have open tables is BAD BUSINESS. We were so hungry and my husband was so excited about his night out that we didn't leave, but I wish we had. 

We will never step foot in that restaurant again.

Atmosphere, staff, appetizers, salad, main course, lemoncello, dessert, coffee - fantastic! The house made pasta was delicious, the mussels were bountiful and fixed perfectly; even the bread was 5 star worthy!  I wish I lived closer than 8 hours so we could go there every week!

We have been here twice. Both times using a Groupon deal and both times we had a fantastic dining experience. There were new items on the menu the second time we went and I was told that they change their menu a few times a year. Their wine list had some interesting and fun choices, and their food was amazing. The first time we went we had the lamb chops and scallops, the second time we had the venison chops and braised veal shank. So delicious. And we ended our meal the last time with the bread pudding. Amazing.

Service was always friendly. The space is small, intimate, and it's great for groups as well as a romantic dinner for two. I'm a fan. While they are a little on the pricey side, they have groupons often which makes it an awesome deal. I recommend  having reservations ahead of time for this place.

This place is only a mile from my house so I tried it out for my birthday dinner with a few girlfriends. We were all very pleased! We all got different salads, I had the Caesar, and they were all tasty (for those who are anchovy shy, the Caesar does come with them) I had the tortelloni and it was great, portion is on the small side, but with the salad that worked out just fine. One of my girlfriends had the beef and that will be what I get next time I go. I also had a fabulous dirty martini and to end our meal we went with a 'liquid dessert' and had the homemade lemoncello.

When my husband and I visited Europe a couple of years ago, we loved the long leisurely dinners that took hours to complete.  We loved how the waiters didn't come by and basically push us out the door like so many do in the US in order to get one last tip before closing.  We loved that we could order dessert because we ate so slowly that we had room for the top-off course before going home. 

The Wooden Table gave us that European dinner that we've missed. We ordered the polenta to start- I never thought a little appetizer could make me so happy!  It was fried, smothered in cheese, and then topped with a ladle of marinara.  I need to figure out how to have more of that polenta in my life- without having to buy new pants. 

I ordered the beef with creamed potato and bacon, and haricot verts.  The beef was perfectly tender and so flavorful. The potatoes had the perfect texture- as noted by my texturally picky husband. 

We ordered the volcano cake for dessert, paired with peppermint gelato.  I think it's safe to say that it was the best dessert I've ever had. Ever. Also, The Wooden Table gave us our dessert and night cap on the house when they heard it was my birthday, which added to the deliciousness. 

Every bite of our dinner was perfect, the service was prompt but not pushy, and the atmosphere allowed us to relax and enjoy good conversation. This will be our go-to date night spot from now on!

I will maintain my 5 stars though it's a bit on the cusp. Still fantastic food though not always super inventive.
We had the strawberry basil martini and the Papa Doble. Both were good and definitely strong though I don't know that they're worth $12. The balsamic rim on the SB martini was great.
We shared the polenta appetizer which reminded me of a really fancy mozzarella stick. So good. We almost ordered another!
I had the spinach salad which is studded with butternut squash, bacon, Gorgonzola, and walnuts and the dressed in a lovely apple cider vinaigrette. Definitely worth $9. 
Hubs had the gnocchi with rabbit and the parsnips and truffle oil sauce was to die for. Fantastic dish.
For our mains I had the scallops. It comes with 3 large scallops that sit atop pork belly and then underneath that us a brandade- which is a salted cod emulsion reminiscent of a really fancy hot tuna salad. If your mom ever made bunsteads (which she probably didn't, could be a Midwest thing!) the filling flavor is very similar. Anyhoos- yummy!
Hubs had the lamb. The flavor profile is definitely my cup of tea and is how I often prepare lamb. It was tasty. It came with a spinach, mushroom, and goat cheese turnover and was served over a cheese sauce.
This good food does not come cheap and they're probably a couple dollars overpriced but to have something so delicious in the neighborhood is definitely worth it.

Great food as always, from a short but adequate menu, along with a decent wine selection and intriguing drink list.  The service was quiet, competent, and pleasant.

The greatest drawback is little sense of *place* -- the strip mall setting, the boxy room done up with understated elegance but still feeling like a storefront. That doesn't interfere with the dining so much as recalling the restaurant the next time you're thinking of going out.

I was blown away by the food and service here! I can't wait to go back. This is my new favorite Italian spot. I had the Pappadelle with venison and the Cavatelli with duck confit. Oh and the mussels for an appetizer. Was blown away by everything. I can't wait to go back and try the scallops! I recommend siting at the bar. Jordan will take good care of you. So thankful I found this place.

I've always driven passed and finally decided to give the place a try. Fine dining Italian. Was highly impressed! Great, and friendly staff. We had a late reservation and called to see if they could work us in sooner which they accommodated. We started with a couple of the salads which were tasty. Then had a couple of entrees. The veal was so tender and delicious and the scallops were great as well. Then we finished off with the chocolate covered pear which was not my favorite but my sister absolutely loved it. Definitely would like to return to try some of their pastas! They make them with veal, rabbit, and all kinds of delicious meats. Definitely a nice and unique spot! Make sure to get a reservation a week prior because they are definitely busy!

Upscale restaurant with moderately good food for high prices. 

After having amazing gnocchi elsewhere the previous day, I ordered theirs. It was starchy, dense, and required a lot of chewing. This should melt in your mouth! 

We did enjoy our desserts, the tres leches cake and lemon semifraddo. Definitely save room for this. Or just go for dessert and elsewhere for lunch/dinner.

Everything we had was delicious. The cocktails are well made. The tres leches cake was phenomenal!! The only thing that I would have liked to see more of was vegetarian options. It's a little pricey but well worth it.

Don't let the strip mall setting fool you, The Wooden Table is something special!!

I've been here many times, and it's always such a treat. The menu is inventive, the food is extremely fresh and I always leave so happy that I came. 

Last night we went with another couple and ordered a total of 10 things on the menu (2 apps, 1 salad, 3 app portion pastas, 1 dinner pasta, 1 entree and 2 desserts). Every. Single. Thing was delicious. I agree with our server, Holly...The pastas really are something special because they are all made fresh in house. The pappardelle is mind blowing. 

I wish I could come here more often (once a week would do it!!) but it's definitely on the pricier side. Totally worth it though! 

Thanks for a great night wooden table!

Wonderful atmosphere, hidden Gem! Amazingly fresh homemade pasta made with love! 
We got the sweetbreads as an appetizer which melted in your mouth! The waiter was uber professional and very knowledgable about the menu and backstory of the dishes and wine pairings! Highly recommend!

The Wooden Table is amazing. We went in last evening to celebrate our 7 year wedding anniversary and we felt so taken care of by the staff. From start to finish, the service was immaculate and impeccable. I love that every server you see on the floor is smiling, and working together as a team. As a guest, you can tell everyone working takes great pride in the food and beverages they serve. As well they should, because the food is to die for. Our Mussels came in a mouthwatering Saffron broth with Fennel. They were the best Mussels we've ever had. The Chef puts extra love and flavor into every dish. Even the classic Caesar stood out as special and unique. I'll be dreaming of the Venison Pappardelle for a long time. The beautiful house made pasta, the mouthwatering perfect sauce. We couldn't stop talking about it. Sadly, we ate so much, we had no room for dessert. We will just have to visit again soon. A very special thank you to Robert, who is the kindest, most knowledgeable  Maitre D/Sommelier. Robert deftly paired all of our courses with beautiful wine selections. As a former server in restaurants, I love it when I can learn new things about food and wine. Robert really knows his craft. We left there so happy. Everyone at The Wooden Table should be proud. You are levels above your competition, and completely exceed guests expectations. We cannot wait to visit again. Thank you.
What a great little find!! It has small portions that are fresh and delicious. The atmosphere is nice and casual, a very pleasant experience.  Perfect for a week night treat or a weekend date.

Never expected a restaurant in a strip shopping mall to serve the best pasta in Denver... And then a bigger surprise.. We decided to try their pork chops...delicious!  The bigger surprise was the greens served with the chop!  Absolutely the best I've had anywhere...a marvelous creation fixed with what appeared to be Caramelized onions..a MUST TRY DISH ...the food here is priced reasonably and the ambience once you get inside is lovely.

I visited The Wood Table to celebrate my recent engagement and had an excellent experience. The service was good, the food was great, the atmosphere was comfortable, and the apple dessert was fantastic.

Keep it up! Don't change a thing.

wow! excellent service, menu, food was delicious, wine choices were 
interesting and diverse, very accommodating to give samples to find a
wine we liked.  pasta excellent main course and amazing desserts with a comp
limoncello.  Pleasant and well appointed space even though in a strip mall.
make reservations early!! abondanza! We will go again! t

Delicious! This restaurant had been recommended to us by several people. We finally went last night for my husband's birthday and we very pleased. Started out with a shared Caesar salad and a small portion of the Tortelloni, which was absolutely fantastic, "a burst of deliciousness in your mouth", as my husband said. For our main course, I had the Beef and my husband had the Elk, which was a recommendation from our server. We were both very impressed with our choices. Overall we give this restaurant an A+, from the service, to the ambiance to the food and wine...it was great and I would highly recommend!

I've been here a few times, and every time I leave, I'm always thankful I have a Groupon. I don't mean that in a bad way really -- the food is overall very good (especially their pasta), but I don't think the overall experience is $100 good (see breakdown below). Also, it's a bit strange that a restaurant charging these prices is located in a strip mall. But I digress. 

Sweetbreads ($14) -- crispy, great sauce
1/2 order of Agnalotti ($14)-- nice pumpkin flavor, subtle sweetness
Colorado Lamb ($33) -- juicy and tender
American Red Snapper ($29) --smelled super fishy, tasteless (maybe that's a good thing in this particular case), regardless I was very disappointed
Tres Leches Cake ($8) -- fresh strawberries, some parts of the cake were too dry

Total w/ Groupon: $98 (of note, no drinks were ordered)

I can't really seem to put my finger on it, but I don't think the meal is worth the price. Substituting another entree for the red snapper, I'd gladly pay $60 for all the above (coincidentally what the Groupon costs). Any more than that loses its value though.

The service has always been great. 

I would consider returning but only with a voucher.

This place is an absolute treat!  We have been going here for nearly 3 years now.  The food is great!  No it's spectacular!  Usually go 4 or 5 times a year and the food is always consistent!  Great service and the menu will blow your mind.  Mussels are great!  Wether you want pasta or a great steak this is the place for you!

Really mediocre and disappointing dinner here tonight. There was a 16 person group in the restaurant that seemed to suck all the energy out of the place. We showed up with a Yelp coupon for a free cocktail and had to go through several levels of management  to have it honored. I ordered lamb chops at $33, which came out lukewarm to cold after sitting in the kitchen for 20 minutes.  One came back nicely done after a complaint. A few good things: bread, chicken liver pate, scallops. But after raving about the quality of this place in previous reviews, I must say our experience tonight was sadly disappointing and closer to what one might expect at a chain restaurant in the burbs. Going to be a while before we return, if we do return. It is certainly difficult to make every dish great every night, but I expected more from this place.

2nd time dining for dinner.  Both times food was great. However the service both times suck.  Our luck we have the same server an older gentlemen. Ramon  Guy is terrible.  I gave it a try twice. That's two too much for me. 

I won't be coming back.

Do not let the unassuming location fool you, this is one gem you want part of your food memories...THIS year! It's warm low key vibe was a great back drop to the magic that unfolded. 

We had the distinct pleasure of being served by the brilliant sommelier Robert. My fiancé thought he must be the owner because of the personal joy and pride he showed while guiding us through the menu. We were delighted by the wine he chose for us and the knowledge that came along with the story of the wines history. 

Then the appetizers came...WOW the food. You know that moment when you wish you were alone so you could lift the bowl to your face and lick the plate? That nearly happened! Much to my fiancés relief they provided a spoon with the clams, although meant for serving I embraced the opportunity to have the full experience with the liquid gold that is this broth. The rest of our meal was romantic and Devine. Everything was made and served with thoughtful care.

4 of us visiting from NYC last night, and what a wonderful treat!

The layout of the restaurant is intimate and inviting. Our server, Moana, and the entire staff was very welcoming and excited about the work the restaurant does. You could tell everyone loves the food! 

The wine list was well chosen, with something in everyone's price range. We ended up with 2 bottles of one of cheaper malbecs which was absolutely delicious.  

Started with the Sweetbread with grapefruit - with a genius cheese sauce to blend the two. Well seasoned, juicy, and something I'd order every time I come back. I never would have imagined how well grapefruit and cheese go together, but this was one combo worth writing about! 

The venison rack was cooked to a perfect medium rare, with a plate I could lick clean. 

We finished with some desert wines and an apple tart topped with caramel sauce and cinnamon ice cream, and I couldn't imagine a better dessert! 

We'd been eating in several restaurants in the area over the course of the week, but what a mistake. This is absolutely a repeat restaurant - we're going to just come right here next time we visit! 

Regarding price - this restaurant was about what you'd pay for in New York for a nice up-scale meal. For 2 bottles of wine, one app and entree per person, two desserts and an after-dinner cocktail for everyone, we ended up at about $100pp. Definitely reasonable for a nice night out!

My husband and I came for a date night with a groupon. The food was really good. The service was very good. The ambiance was very nice--it's a perfect date night place. It's definitely pricey without the groupon so it wouldn't be a place we would go to often. But as a treat, it's perfect.

In searching for a new place to try, I found The Wooden Table on Yelp.  I have to give this place a 5 stars for an incredible dining experience.  Derek, our server, made all of the right recommendations and was a fantastic host for our dining experience.  My guests each had the Ravioli and raved about how delicious it was.  I had the Lamb which Derek recommended that be prepared medium rare per the chef.  One of the tastiest meals I have had in a long time.  Compliments to the Chef!  Overall we had a great experience and would recommend The Wooden Table to those looking to support local business and appreciate fine dining.  Thanks Wooden Table!  We will be back.

One of my favorite new restaurants.  

We went on a Monday night where they feature 50% of wines, which is a wonderful deal and allows you to either save some bucks or splurge on a wine you wouldn't normally order.  

For starters, the eggplant dish was phenomenal.  It was very creative, seeming to be a hybrid of the flavors of Eggplant Parmigiana with the shape of Arancini.  It was full of flavor and cooked perfectly so the cheese melted just write when you cut it open.

The Prosciutto salad with grapefruit was also well plated and full of flavor.  It was quite larger than others in my party, and the price explains that ($12 vs $7-9 for other salads).  But it was worth the price.

I had the Duck entree and it was delicious.  I will rate it a 4 only because of the accompaniments.  Although the duck was delicious and cooked perfectly, the accompanying gnocchi was sparse and the butternut squash was diced too small and tasted undercooked.  I would have liked a puree or more of a sauce as well to dip the duck in.  I had a similar dish at Bittersweet Restaurant and it was far superior.  

I will definitely go back and next time I will try the Lobster Linguini.

To finish the meal they bring out complementary limoncello.  This was a very nice touch and it was a delicious palate cleanser. 

Desserts were also beyond exceptional.  We shared the cheesecake, the pot de creme, and the tres leches.  I couldn't pick a favorite because they were all so heavenly.  I would say, however, that the tres leches is a contender for the best I have ever had.

The service was outstanding and Gary is a a wonderful host.

You need to try this place. The food is very good, excellent service, friendly staff, home made pasta-why haven't you made your reservation yet? My friend and I split a pasta as an appetizer-it was absolutely delicious. My friend got the veal and liked it but he didn't love it-I got the steak which was so good. So, so good. The potatoes that came with my steak were interesting-yummy but not like I had them before. I really liked them. Fantastic apple dessert to end the meal. The service was practically perfect-the best service I have seen in awhile. Loved loved loved this place. Yes it is in a strip mall by Trader Joe's-I know-but trust me, try this place. Good wine selection too. 4 stars because it wasn't perfect but I can't wait to go back and try some more of their pasta!

This restaurant is our go-to place for nice dinners out with friends or a romantic evening for two without having to drive downtown.  Has the feel of a neighborhood bistro and you get the impression that many of the customers are regulars.  Definitely not a cookie cutter dining experience, and the menu changes seasonally!

We almost always start every meal with an appetizer of their mussels.  The broth with these is simply to die for ... packed with flavor that has you sopping up every drop with toasted bread, and it's always a hunt to see who can get the last little chorizo meatball at the table.  We've had mussels at a number of places around town, and you'll never find grit in these like we sometimes have had elsewhere.

The husband invariably orders one of the house-made pastas.  His favorites usually center around the bolognese sauce; sometimes made with pork belly, other times he's had it with venison.  Always yummy.  I usually go for one of the main entrees. Lately this winter my favorite has been the lamb, and I'm hoping that this summer the chef will bring back my old favorite - a halibut in an asparagus broth that is to die for.

To top it all off, you're offered a complimentary limoncello apertif that's made in-house.  Can't wait to go back.  

We visit the Wooden Table fairly regularly, but if you keep a sharp eye out you can find great deals via Groupon or restaurant.com which gives you a little extra spending money for the wine list.

I have been a bad Yelp'er and this review update is very tardy! After a great first experience at this high-end, rather pricey restaurant, my husb and I decided to splurge for our First Wedding Anniversary in August 2015. I made a reservation for two on Open Table and wrote that it was our anniv in the comment section. About two hours before our res, I got a wonderful, polite and warm phone call from a gentleman, confirming our reservation. He wished us a happy anniversary and offered either a free dessert or champagne. I asked for champagne. I was so excited for a special night! When we arrived, a women with long, curly red hair and zero-personality vaguely greeted/welcomed us, led us to a table for two and ended up being our boring waitress. She didn't seem to have a clue about our wedding anniv, She certainly didn't know about the complimentary champagne we had been offered. And I got so knotted up about it, I couldn't even begin to ask or explain to her. Which I regret. That champagne would have been really nice and she might have sweetened up her mood a bit. But it's over. I said nothing. My husb and I ordered a ridiculously expensive appetizer, a glass of wine for me and a beer for him. We each ordered pasta entrees (we might have splurged on higher priced fish or meat, but by this point, I think we were both deflated about the state of affairs...). The acoustics in the restaurant were awful and we had trouble talking to each other. The place was packed and with so many people talking. With insufficient insulation in the ceilings, this is what happens. My husb didn't love his vegetarian pasta. He felt it was overpriced since it didn't have meat. My pasta had sausage and was quite savory and tasty. We were asked about dessert, but we declined -- just wanting to get out of there. I followed up two days later by making a phone call to the restaurant. I spoke with a gentleman (I think the Manager on Duty??) named Brad. He was unconcerned about our issues and said that he would pass a message to the owner.  Never heard a single word after that. We won't be going back. Very disappointing experience and obv some huge communications problems between management and the owner. I would bet money that Manager Brad never relayed the message to the owner.

This review is a mixed bag.  The food was great, the drinks were great, the service decent (great for others), but the location was a little odd.

The decor inside is nice but something about staring at a lit Ace Hardware sign through the window while eating in an upscale restaurant threw me off.  There was also the fact that we were the youngest people in the restaurant.  It's not a huge problem but we are in our 30's and everyone else was double our age or more.  It could just be the location and the demographics of our 'hood but it we felt a little out of place.  The owner was making his rounds the entire time we were there talking to each of the 17 tables, which I found endearing...I love those touches.  Until, he never once came to our table.  Was it because we are not gray haired?  We did drop $200 on dinner in his restaurant.  We actually had a bet going that he wouldn't say a single word to us, but as we were walking out the door, he did thank us for coming in.  Also, we saw other diners get to chose from a yummy looking cheese/wine cart that their server brought by after dinner.  I have only seen this done at Tru in Chicago, which is a Michelin star restaurant.  Great touch, only we were not offered the same display.  We were only given the desert menu.  This could just be something that specific server did as his finishing touch.  Our server did not offer the cheese cart to any of her tables.  Big miss in my opinion.

Anyway, negatives out of the way...we tried a little of everything on the menu.  We started with the pork belly appetizer.  I found it a little dry (over cooked?) and the white beans were very al diente,  but the flavors were good.  This was my least favorite dish.  Next we had the Cesar salad.  We both agreed that it was dry and under-dressed, but the fresh Parmesan was tasty.  For the main course (yes we stuffed ourselves) we split the half order pumpkin tortellini, the hangar steak, and the lamb chops.  All three of the main courses were  delicious.  For desert, I had the cheese plate with a sweet port aperitif.  The brie that they pared with the pureed dates was so good that I would go back just for that.

Overall, we wanted to get the full experience.  We live down south and were excited to hear about a non-chain, fine dining option in our area.  We would return and do it on a smaller scale.  I'm just not sure why we weren't treated the same as the other tables in the restaurant.  Other tables were offered an off the menu apple pie desert and a glass of lemoncello.  We asked our server what they were having and she said oh that's not on the menu.  Yet everyone else had it.  She did let us order it though and even said the lemoncello was complimentary.  It seemed weird that every other table was offered this "complimentary" item, yet we had to ask for it.  Maybe the entire restaurant was a group of the owner's personal friends and we just came on a night when he was hosting his colleagues and aiming to impress.  It was just really noticeable that we were not included in this effort.

In case you were wondering, the tables are in fact made of wood.

This is a difficult review because I usually like this restaurant. This experience was with a group of 6. The first course was clouded by one of my guests finding a balled up paper in his salad. The second course, duck, was clouded by the plate presentation & lack of imagination. The food tasted as it looked, all brown. Mono-flavor, mono-pallet, mono-experience. And the dessert course was sadly interrupted by a persistent fly that literally bounced off of my face before claiming the remained of my Tres Leches cake. I normally really enjoy this place. This experience was just poor all around.

Who would of thought a non-chain eatery with serious fine dining cred would wind up in my childhood neighborhood.  The Wooden Table serves up what one would expect at a downtown or Capitol Hill establishment in an unassumming strip mall in the burbs.  Unfortunately for me, this place wasn't around during my youth and is now halfway across town.  Eitherway, it was so worth the trip back to the old stomping grounds.

I ended up here on a Saturday night and began the evening at the bar to partake in their pretty awesome happy hour.  $3 well drinks, wine, and beer as well as $5 house martinis are a great accompaniment to their $6 food options.  We ended up with the mussels and frutti di mare crudo.  Not only substantial for only $6, they were immensely full of flavor, especially the mussel broth which contained chunks of sausage!!  

After partaking in happy hour, we moved to the formal dining room for our dinner.  I ordered the black cod which was highlighted by the accompanying cauliflower puree and shrimp and scallop quenelle.  My mom, being a pasta lover, ended up ordering the caesar salad and the ravioli.  Even with just a half portion, she was fully satisfied.  

To finalize the meal, we were each given complimentary shots of dessert liqueurs.  These shots were awesome ways to cap off the entire dining experience.  Overall,I'll gladly return here as it appears they change up their menu regularly to capitalize on seasonal produce.

Lovely meal for our anniversary. Two had the beef, one, venison and another the pasta carbonara with duck. The service was outstanding!

We will be back.

Was very excited to go here... didn't get the opportunity. They had a deal on living social that I purchased that included a shared appetizer two mains and a dessert, pretty good deal! Unfortunately when I went to make the reservation I was one day late, and the restaurant informed me they would not honor... they didn't say they would give me discount for how much I paid for the voucher, or anything else... they just said I was SOL. I have no problem paying full price for dinner, but I will be spending my money elsewhere.

The Wooden Table is one of those restaurants you don't want to review; it's the place you want to keep secret, to have entirely to yourself.

I'd seen the restaurant reviewed on Yelp but had no idea where it was. Nestled in a strip mall off Orchard & University, The Wooden Table does a good job of staying off the map. It's not difficult to find, but secretive enough not to attract an overwhelming crowd.

The interior is somewhat intimate, but the one-room dining and bar area, with two and four-top tables, doesn't quite set the most romantic atmosphere. Still, the set up is not entirely distracting. Though I could overhear the conversation at other tables, I wasn't completely distracted from my own dining experience.

Many of the dishes are made in-house, including mozzarella, bread, and pasta. Appetizers ranged from said mozzarella, to mussels, to pork belly, with options to enjoy the pasta dishes in appetizer portions as well. Entrees include salmon, scallops, duck, veal, and hangar steak (among others). We settled on the pork belly to start, with duck & scallop entrees.

Our meal was amazing. The pork belly was divine, tender & full of flavor. THIS is what I'd call gourmet "bacon candy." The scallop dish features three large scallops atop a shrimp cake, a decent serving for myself - and fairly standard for a scallop dish - but possibly too light for someone with a larger stomach. The duck entree was larger, with duck served two ways. My boyfriend devoured it, but was kind enough to let me sample. The duck sausage was amazing!

We followed dinner with chocolate frangelico cheesecake & Irish coffee. 

Service was at the level expected for this calibre restaurant, and the manager stopped at every table post-meal to follow up. 

We're looking forward to visiting in the future & highly recommend The Wooden Table.

My wife and I recently went here to celebrate. We did not make a reservation. It was a Thursday and they were able to seat us relatively quickly.

The food was overall very good. There were some absolute standouts such as the pork belly, the duck cavatelli, and the duck with butternut squash gratin and brussel sprouts. 

With their complimentary bread they serve an incredible mix of EVOO, rock salt, and an herb. I can't remember whether it was thyme or rosemary, but the combination was great. It really complimented the delicious bread they receive from Trompeau Bakery.

Surprisingly the lobster entree was somewhat tough and chewy both in regards to the lobster meat and the pasta it was served on top of.

Unfortunately we did not leave room for desert. We both will be back for the Tres Leches and their signature Manhattan cocktail. (but we will most likely sit at the bar.)

Similar to other very good restaurants in the Denver area, the maitre d offered us a substitute bottle of wine at the same price when it turned out that the restaurant did not have in stock the bottle we wanted.  The substitute was very good.

The service was unfortunately pretty lacking.  After we were seated we waited at least 25 minutes before anyone came by to check on us. If we had not placed our food order when we ordered our wine I am honestly not sure what time we would have eaten. 

There was a larger "business" dinner occupying the center of the restaurant with a solid "middle manager" type that wanted everyone to pay attention to him. If anybody is interested this guy had great recommendations for hotels near the red light districts in Dusseldorf and Antwerp. Our guess was that they were all from Visa and half the table was trying to impress their out of town colleagues. To say that their carrying on was distracting is obvious. (Not really something you would expect in a restaurant where the average bill is likely $80.00 per person.)  I believe that the reason we were left isolated for so long was simply that the server decided it best to focus on the "big ticket" table and was unable to split the burden of waiting on them and us.

Additionally, that night there were a lot of regulars as well as the red light district aficionados. Maybe we were just lower on the priority list being new. I guess when the food is this good they can get away it.

The Wooden Table is a smallish nice restaurant in a strip mall in the suburbs. The food is overall good and a refreshing surprise in the midst of such a mediocre environment. The setting reminded me of the original Nobu in Malibu. Among the surrounding area this restaurant is definitely a bright spot. Just be prepared to wait and don't forget to make the most of the limited attention you receive from your waitstaff.

On a final note, depending on the size of your bank account, don't be afraid to show up in jeans, sneakers, and t-shirt. It is Colorado!
The entree was delicious but too small. The appetizer and dessert were sub-par. The ambiance felt more French than Italian. Great serving staff.
What a "hidden gem." I'm glad I took advantage of the Groupon. The apple crostata needs more apple. Excellent service.

Walked into the restaurant on a Saturday night with a kid in a car seat and no reservation. The host and manager made a huge accommodation and sat us right away. The drinks were great and the arugula salad was amazing! Our entrees were also very well done. Great ambiance and very friendly and welcoming wait staff.

absolutely delicious meal in a strip mall type environment.  Staff was attentive and had good recommendations; the sparkling moscato wine was yummy. Portions were generous without being overwhelming.  The Lemon Semifreddo was a light and tart ending for a lovely meal.

Recently tried this restaurant for our anniversary. We will be back! The staff was incredible! All were knowledgeable about the menu and wine pairings. The food that arrived did not disappoint. We shared an appetizer portion of lamb gnocchi, and had the duck and the halibut for entrees. Melt in your mouth perfect! Thank you! Thank you! This place is a gem.

The food here is very good, the only reason it's not 5 stars is it is expensive! I will only come here if I have a groupon or it is a very special occasion. Having a casual dinner here is not in my budget. But like I said the food is great. They used to have a goat cheese ravioli which was amazing, so I hate that they don't have it on the menu anymore, but other dishes are delicious as well.
Jordan is amazing! Not only do you get great one on one service at the bar but he really has great knowledge about wine pairings!!!

Great Italian food in the burbs is a happy place. Fresh homemade pasta, house made sausage, good wine list. We have dined here several times and tried a variety of dishes. Everything has been excellent.

New to the area and excited to try The Wooden Table, my wife and I showed up at 6:15 w/o reservations to an almost empty restaurant and we're told there was no available indoor seating. We chose the patio as it was our only option. The food was great, I had the duck and my wife had linguini. The service however was sub par for the prices they charge. 
We had to ask for bead after being sat for over 15 mins and for refills on our empty drinks. We were never offered fresh pepper or grated cheese for our dishes (as one would expect at a semi-fine dining restaurant). 
We finished with our mains and we're left unattended for 30 mins w/o drink refills or being offered desert, the interior tables didn't start seating until 7:30 leaving us pondering why we weren't offered a table inside over an hour prior. 
Overall it was not worth the $150 we spent. One would expect a certain level of attentiveness from staff in a semi empty restaurant especially with the prices they charge. 
Two stars for the food (as it was excellent) and minus three for the lack of service. They would have gotten five. 
We will not be coming back.

Had a good anniversary dinner there.  They were gracious enough to comp our dessert for the occasion.  The host also helped us pick a wine.  Food was great but the menu seemed limited for my taste.  We ended up switching meals halfway through and the steak was great.

It is nice to have a local place to go for a nice dinner.
Dined here again.  Just was wonderful as the last few times!

What a surprise for a find.  In town for a business meeting and scheduled a dinner for 8.  We started with mussels and sweetened....amazing.  next was an average ceasar salad.   i asked the server to surprise me with an entree and I was served the duck.  Out of this world!  Lastly we ordered desert and got the Molton cake, bread pudding and rhubarb pie, all outstanding and full of flavor.  Would be an instant go to again.  Thanks for the great service.

Great restaurant with food to die for.  We highly recommend the argula salad, pappardelle, and the beef dish.  
Service can be spotty, but overall good. It's also loud.
Overall,  we love this place and keep coming back.
