The food? It's great. Honestly, no complaints. The queso is great; it has guacamole and one of their hot sauces, so it's creamy and great when stirred together. The tacos I've had have all been good (with the exception of the chorizo breakfast taco - pretty bland). I really enjoy the Trailer Park trashy-style: fried chicken and more of the queso.

Unfortunately, the service is often God-awful. I've been waiting in the line and seen four people at the register, yet only one actually helping us. And you can sit at the bar like I did today, but it's often no better. Today we ordered, got our drinks and queso... And then the bartender vanished. After 30 minutes of my drink being empty, I flagged down another bartender. Note that he was near us the whole time and also never checked on us, but when I waved at him and mentioned we'd been abandoned, he said he was just about to check on us. Nice try, but I've been a server and I could see you actively trying to avoid us.

In short, go for the tacos, but only if you don't mind being ignored and taking three times as long as you should. The lines here are only half due to popularity, after all.

I love tacos.  Love them.  I was excited about this fun and funky place.  We walked after a day at the Art Museum and the line was out the door but went fairly fast. 

The tacos were good, not overly amazing but good.  They had a great selection of strange and unusual fillings, fried portabello mushroom, egg, sausage, jerk chicken, etc.  I had the Democrat, one of the few typical or normal tacos.  It was super yummy, lots of flavors- lots of sauces and meaty goodness. def. will come back for that.  I had the fried avocado, but it was not all that.  I was not crazy about the lack of meat, and   I missed the contrast of meat and veggies.      I tried a lot, we are a sharing family, and I can not wait to come when the newness has worn down a bit and try it again.  

It was a bit crowded, and I feel like when I come when it is not super crowded I will have a much better idea of it is really like.  The service was slow, the tacos were not hot and we did not see our waiter for a while to get sauces and let them know we were missing a taco.  But it is a new place and it is super crowded, so I am sure the quality will go up as the crowd goes down.  

I think the key to ordering and eating here is knowing what you like and what sauces are for you, the only way to do that is to try most things.

So we had Torchys breakfast tacos brought in to work.  OMG...delish!  I had the chorizo, egg, & cheese taco - so good!  I'm not a huge fan of eggs, but these are the bomb.  They are light and fluffy and they definately didn't skimp on the chorizo.  And the salsa that comes with it...OMG...so good!  Good smoky flavor, not too spicy, not to mild, just perfect.  Hubby and I are going to have to make a trip to Torchys!

Tried Torchy's for the first time. My experience here was very good overall, but I think I lucked out by beating the crowd. 

My friend and I arrived a little before 5pm. The line wasn't long, just a handful of people ahead of us. We placed our orders and sat down- there were plenty of tables open to choose from. It's sort of like a taco version of chipotle, if I had to compare it to something. Only difference is they have their own bar. 

I had the ahi tuna taco and the shiitake mushroom taco. Both were pretty tasty. I'm perplexed at the tuna in the Mr. Pink. Still kept medium rare but still lightly breaded and crisped on the outside? Whatevs, good job on that. In fact, kudos.

They do give you the option to choose whether you want a flour or corn tortilla for the tacos you're ordering. I almost wish they'd just tell you which one it came with, because in all honesty, some tacos taste better on corn, and others on flour. You may definitely go wrong and order the wrong type of tortilla. Just sayin'. 

So we ate and hung out. The longer we stayed, the longer the line got at prime dinner hours. In fact, it went out the door. And yes, I kept track of how quickly it moved. And no, it did not move quickly by any means. Maybe because there are only 3 registers? I think they need to add a couple more before this explodes and ruins the experience for everyone. I, for one, most certainly would not wait in that line to get these tacos. They were pretty good, but not worth waiting for. And in my experience, it's pretty hard to make a bad taco. 

So here's my advice to you- if you find yourself craving tacos at off meal times, go ahead and give Torchy's a try. Otherwise, I'd make it a taco night at home, with all the fixings and invite friends over. It will be just as (if not more) fun.

Omg.  Went at 1:50pm and it looked like things were slowing down, though still a line of easily 20 people in front of me. I had the Trailer Park, which is the fried chicken taco. I was really delicious and arrived piping hot. Flavorful, crisp, but juicy meat inside.  They put a ranch dressing style sauce on the side that you can add if you like. I really loved it. I also had the chips and salsa.  Salsa was really good, very fresh tasting.  Super pleasant service.

I love the modern, clean design. Looking forward to going back and trying some drinks.

This is the perfect place to get tacos if you're from Austin, if you don't know where else to find awesome tacos in Denver, or if you're simply one of those people who has nothing better to do than wait in lines to check out the latest trendy places. The tacos were OK and pretty big for the price, but nothing special. It was pretty obvious an operation like Torchys leans towards using cheaper mass-produced ingredients, starting with the subpar tortillas and ending with reheated taco fillings. The margaritas were good, but small for the price. The experience made me feel like I was revisiting a school cafeteria, albeit one for wistful hipsters. If that's your thing, good on you, and have an awesome time waiting in line, suckers!

UPDATE: Tried Torchys again, and it was a bad experience. The Trailer Park taco Trashy style (fried chicken with queso) was pretty tasty. But the Crossroads (brisket) was disappointingly tasteless and the Mr. Pink (says seared tuna but was fried well done) was just plain nasty, like chewy tuna jerky. Ordered the Lil Nookies to try a desert item, that's fried cookie dough. Someone at the table suggested it tasted like Play-Doh, which then triggered a childhood memory of spitting that salty nastiness out of my mouth when I was age four or five. So if you seek that kind of nostalgia, this place is for you. Never again for me though.

Awesome tacos, but super slow service both times we've been there.  The most recent time in there 4 of us that came in at 8pm on Tuesday, the place was maybe half full.  It took us almost 1 1/2 hours to get 2 tacos each delivered to our table.  We were on the verge of leaving at 30min, but decided we'd stick it our simply to see just how long it actually took and turn it into a game. (Price Is Right Rules; Closest without going over)  I had 77min and came in 2nd. 

The first time I came to Torchy's it was almost the exact same story, just 15min faster than our 90min marathon this time. 

It gets 3 stars simply because when you eventually do get the tacos they're great.  Just make sure you don't have anything to do for 2hrs when you walk in the door since you'll be waiting most of the time.

Rarely do I give 5 stars, but I just always love going to Torchy's. Such interesting and flavorful tacos.  This location has its own parking which is super nice in this part of town.  I recommend asking for the secret menu - the Mad Cow & Ace of Spades are awesome deals if you are a meat lover.  I also enjoyed the Hipster (fried Tuna) from the secret menu.

Visited this restaurant on 11/19/16 with a group of Yelpers. We had a reservation for 10  people and luckily we were able to reserve the backroom for large groups. 

The waitress Elese was awesome! It was out first time having this cuisine and she made suggestions and when the owner found out that it was our first time he gave us a couple of appetizers (zaatar) on the house.


The food was incredible and the service was excellent. We all had a great time. I enjoyed the checked Schwartz and my wife had the 2 combo special with chicken and kafta kabob. I also tasted one of my friends lamb entree and the lamb tasted amazing.

This is a place that I will be introducing my son and daughter to because it absolutely rocked my world. I certainly recommend  this place and the owner was very nice too.

Thanks for an incredible experience!

Centered around a gorgeous brick oven that they use to bake pita, Phoenician Kabob offers delicious Mediterranean food along with live belly dancing. I was originally just looking for some place to grab dinner on Friday night, little did I know that I was in for an outstanding meal, and the freshest pita that I've had in ages. The falafel were fried fresh to order, the labneh was thick and creamy, and the dressing on the fatoush was tart and a little sweet, making it difficult to stop eating. 

If I lived anywhere near this restaurant, it'd easily become a go-to place for me-- perfect for any and all pita and Mediterranean cravings.

I came in here for lunch a few months ago.  For starters, the restaurant is a lot nicer inside than the exterior would suggest.  I came in for a late-ish lunch, maybe around 1:30 or 2 and the place was pretty empty.  After perusing the menu I decided on the Chicken Shawarma Sandwich and the Fattoush Salad.  I found out soon enough that was WAY too much food for one person.  The sandwich was excellent and would have been plenty of food on its own; it was HUGE.  It came with a garlic sauce that, initially, tasted great.  After a few more bites of it with my sandwich, it became overwhelmingly garlicky.  Now I love garlic, but this was killer.  I also found out as I was eating it that it has egg white in it (I might have passed had I known beforehand.  Eating raw egg doesn't do it for me.)    The salad was also pretty big, but a tad overdressed making it soggy.  It would have been good otherwise.

My server was friendly and stopped by a few times to see if I liked the food and needed anything else.

I was so disappointed by this place, sooo expensive and horrible food!!! I know what Mediterranean food tastes like, and these people don't know anything about it, lentil soup was horrible, and lamb kabob was a disaster, not properly cooked and very hard, impossible to bite. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Wow, this place is awesome. I can believe I hadn't found this place earlier. Casey our waitress gave us the history of this restaurant. Very interesting and authentic. Casey suggestions on on food was outstanding and she is outstanding and her conversation was worth coming out for. So my hats off to you Casey. Thank you

Our waitress Stephanie is just amazing !!!
She doesn't miss a beat.  She gives us atmosphere more atmosphere. 

That only was she sufficient so was the food

They make their own bread and several pastries!

The hummus was outstanding. 
The Mediterranean white wine,  Ksara, was crisp and refreshing. 

I had a lamb sandwich and added eggplant. Delightful !

First time for me and not the last. 

LALALALALALALlLLlshhhhh

With whatever you order...make sure you get the garlic dip! I ordered the chicken kabob lunch entree with saffron rice. It was all so flavorful and so tasty! My only complaint is that this place is a little pricey for lunch time. 
We will definitely be adding this restaurant to our dining rotation.

Ordered take out. Would love to come back to dine in. My neighbors love Thai spot and suggested it to me. 
Great food, but pricey! $30 for one. However they do have generous portions and flavors were great. 
Some suggest to come for lunch specials for a better deal. 

Enjoyed be falafel and gyros entree. I'll be back wth friends! Great date night spot too!

This past week I got carry out for myself and a co-worker with another dish to take home to my husband.  My co-worker and I both got sandwiches - eggplant for me and chicken shawarma for her.  We also shared an order of falafel.  For the hubs I got him the chicken shawarma plate.

My eggplant had incredible flavor, I just wish there had been more eggplant in my sandwich.  I also poured the tzatziki sauce and smeared the garlic paste on each bite.  The garlic paste is strong, strong!  I love garlic though so I didn't mind but be aware.  My co-worker really enjoyed her sandwich as well.  I was told the falafel mix was made in house and they definitely had a unique but delicious flavor to them.  We never did figure out what the secret spice was but it tasted like a hint of clove?

The chicken shawarma plate was enough food to split into two meals so the hubs had it for both dinner and lunch which he happily enjoyed.

Where to begin...I hope you have a snack before settling in to read this review. 
The Phoenician Kabob is the best thing since...pita bread? Sure that works. The staff is super accommodating. They promote a family atmosphere and make you feel like you belong. Ibrahim is awesome. He will come sit with you, visit, take your baby for trips to the kitchen. Bring him back showing him the secret to making Toum. It's great. 
Belly dancing occurs on weekends. Wonderfully fun and entertaining. Belly dancing with swords!! Nothing is better than that. 
I've never had a bad meal here. My standbys are a full mezza of things...in fact that's the best way to enjoy a variety of dishes...take a bunch of people and eat food together like the old country. Family style. We get babaganoush, hummus, pita, kafta, dolmathes, toum, falafel, beef kabobs, lebnee, lamb shawarma...you try it, you won't be disappointed. I promise. 
Please enjoy some for me because I only get to come when I'm in the Denver area. And when I'm in the area--you can bet that I will be here once if not more times!!

I've been on the hunt for the best falafel in Denver since moving here a few years ago, and I think I've finally found it here! Crispy (but not too crunchy) on the outside, moist and flavorful on the inside. There wasn't a dish we tried that fell flat. The hummus was smooth and creamy, the baba ganoush was deliciously smoky, the pita was puffy and fresh out of the oven. The grape leaves were also probably the best I've ever had - very flavorful. My husband was also very happy with his chicken kebab, and the yummy garlic sauce that came with it! We will definitely back!!!

Loved this place. Food was amazing!! Appetizers were good, the lamb shank was fall off the bone & melt in the mouth kind. Kids loved the chicken kebab sandwich. Kanafeh was great. The owner came and talked to us and asked if we liked the food. Overall it was a good dinner with right  ambience and great service and food.

Couldn't figure out where to eat for lunch and decided to try Phoenician. It was a good pick too because there was a cool antique store across the street!

There wasn't anyone else inside when we arrived, but the waitress was very nice and let us sit wherever we wanted. I decided to get a chicken shawarma and a side of eggplant, and my parents got kebab plates. The eggplant came out super fast and it was awesome! They grill it and then top it with a vinegar sauce that tastes great, so we polished that plate off really quickly. 

The shawarma was huge, I was super full after eating it. The chicken was pretty good and there were a good amount of veggies inside, but the tzatziki sauce was kind of mild. They usually serve it with the garlic sauce, but my dad got that one and it was really strong and the consistency was thick, not really what I think sauce looks like. My dad was sad that the kebab plate only had one skewer, but this was probably because it was the lunch special?

Definitely a great place for Mediterranean/Lebanese food. Don't let the location scare you; it's a gem snuggled between a tattoo parlor and psychic. If anything, it gives the entertainment of people watching if you get a table by the window.

You walk inside and you're transported to a world of fresh pitas, garlic, lamb and belly dancers. The grape leaves, garlic sauce, hummus, lamb and grilled eggplant were served hot with fantastic flavors. The garlic sauce is....well,. extremely garlic-y, which I love!! So good. I highly recommend it: it's a huge amount so share and save some for your meal for a kick. The entree are hefty portions with hummus and rice, so you're getting a good deal if you're hungry. My mom had the lentil soup and she said it was perfect; the cup is big enough for a meal on its own.

Early in the evening, a  beautiful and talented belly dancer from Cairo came out showcasing her expertise with a massive sword and symbols; she was so fun and vibrant. Our group was definitely into it though (I'm assuming because it was so early, 6p) the rest of the place was boring and unenthusiastic. 

Only down side to our experience was the service was really slow, the timing of our food was off and we had to ask for the pita that were included in our entrees. They had the bartender second as a waiter which I think was the problem because we felt forgotten about at times.

Overall, excellent fresh food and fun experience. Recommended to anyone in the area or visiting Denver and wants something different.
I was on a cross-country trip and had a one night stay in Denver. I had dinner at this place based on Yelp recommendation and had the best chicken Shawerma ever. I loved this place.

Good ole Phoenician Kabob...  I've been eating here and getting take out for ages.  I love this place for a few reasons, which I'll enumerate here:

1 - SPEED.  They are soo quick.  For both the dine in and take out service.  Food is ready likkity-split and that's a huge win for parents (like Ladyhawk and I).  Dinner at a restaurant is kind of a countdown to some implosion with kids and this place handles it wonderfully :)

2 - TASTE.  I love Gyros.  They do it well.  That is all.

3 - SERVICE.  Not to be confused with speed, this is all about the kindness of the people there and they are all rad.  Everyone I've ever interacted with in person and over the phone is totally awesome.

And that's a wrap.

Wow!! Great homemade authentic Lebanese/egyptian food! BEST in the area!! Excellent homemade bread made in a special oven that was imported from Lebanon! How cool is that!!!

The owners take true pride in the food and service they deliver here. It's their passion. They have secret family recipes for everything. I don't like lamb but I actually ate an entire lamb chop here bc the lamb flavor wasn't strong and the spices were so interesting. It's like real middle eastern lamb, which is a rare find. 

You can even watch the guy making bread from scratch and putting it in the special oven. And it's so wonderful bc it comes out warm. It goes great w the baba ganouj which is absolutely the best I've ever had. They make everything from scratch here and it really is evident. 

You know what else they do really well here? The garlic dip. It's really the best garlic dip I've ever had with the perfect balance of garlic and lemon and salt and everything. I put it on everything and I usually don't eat the stuff anywhere else. It's so good omg. I even get extra to take home and put on fish or chicken as a seasoning!! 

I highly recommend this place. All my middle eastern friends (and there are many) agree that phonecian kabob is the absolute best in Denver.

Phew, major heartburn and tummy trouble after eating here. I enjoy mediterranean food however, I was throughly not impressed with the Phoenician. The atmosphere was nice for date night or for a group of friends.

Location, being located on Colfax street parking is sketchy.  Okay back to the food, heavy on the seasoning so extra salt is a no GO. I ordered the lamb kabob and the meat was cooked medium well. The garlic was a bit heavy which may of lead to the heartburn. The salad was good and oh! For desert, I ordered the the baklava with walnuts which was delicious. No complaints there.

The customer service was awesome and wine divine. I would recommend just make sure you chase your food with cheese or a milk based product to coat your stomach to take the garlic and spices.

What a gem! We went here tonight and everything was outstanding. Started with the zataar and feta and lebnee and it might be my favorite combo ever. Then split  the veggie combo and the meat combo. Everything was so delicious, so fresh...seriously a new favorite restaurant. Plus an amazing belly dancer came through towards the end of the meal - such an incredible experience! And excellent service. We will be back again. And again. And again. Already looking forward to eating the leftovers tomorrow.

I love that this restaurant is in the neighborhood, and it truly has the neighborhood feel too! A good local spot with great flavors, and outstanding food. 

If this review were for food only I would give it 10 stars! The salads are incredible- fresh ingredients, good flavors and overall delicious. The gyro meat is perfectly seasoned. The homemade bread is to die for. I love the garlic sauce, and the hummus is wonderful. We've always had outstanding food here. 

Now for the bad news...the service is absolutely horrible. They don't acknowledge you when you get inside the restaurant so you spend your first 15 minutes trying to track down someone to get you seated. They also either rush you to make a decision with the menu, or forget about you for another 15-20 minutes, with no drinks, apps or anything. It's a busy place, but seems they have staffing issues if they cannot keep up with the tables. Last time we were there they forgot our drink, forgot our main course, there was no silverware, they offered to bring more bread and then forgot. Horrible- when you go out to eat you want to have an overall good experience. I'm not one to complain about the small stuff, but this was bad. Please work on your staffing issues so you can handle all the lovely people who want to taste your delicious food. I'm going to take a break from here for a while, and fingers crossed they will hire more help in the meantime.
I called to place a take-out order at 8:30 and they told me their kitchen was closed. Their posted hours say they are open until 10.

Lovely food. Especially I'd recommend pitas that are cooked on site acc to the staff. The appetizers are medium to low for taste wise. We tried the lebni and falafel and some other appetizers during our trips. 

The lebni is really a yogurt dish and not made of lebni. Falafel is way overcooked when we tried. However the lunch specials and the kebabs are delicious. They are decent sized and very yummy. The rice served is good and the tomatoe salad is decent especially  with lemon on it. 

We tried baklava. I'd not recommend it. I am spoiled by Selda's baklava  in Med Fresh (Phoenix)  .  We  tried the tea and tea is ok if you like earl grey flavour. 

Despite all shortcomings, staff is great, food is good and one of my togo places during the weekend.
I really enjoyed the food and there was plenty of it. Looking forward to going back and trying a different dish.

As you can see from the plethora of reviews currently posted to the listing, Phoenician Kabob has already garnered a great deal of praise on this site. And today, I want to contribute my own two cents to the discussion. So you're gonna listen, and you're gonna like it.

One thing I've always appreciated about PK (as I will be henceforth be calling the restaurant in this review) is their selection of their fresh-baked savory pies and pastries, collectively known as Fatayer. Not too long ago, I was able to sample the spinach/pine-nut pockets called Sabanekh, and was wowed by interplay of flavors and textures within. Another one that comes to mind in this regard is the Palestinian specialty Musakhan (no, it's not related to Moussaka...) which melds moist chicken, soft onions, and tangy sumac into a scintillating symphony of sorts. But if you prefer, say, a heaping helping of grilled mushrooms, or the creamy semisoft cheese called Jibneh, or indeed the classic thyme/sesame sprinkling known as Za'atar, these are possible options for you too so don't despair. I guess what I'm trying to say is that they didn't install that oven just for fun, so why not help them out?

Hmm, what else can I tell you about that's a little out of the ordinary? Oh, I know! Sometimes PK features a red lentil and jalapeño soup which is simply outasight. It's spicy, filling, warming, and undeniably unctuous - and in this case, that's not a bad thing to be by any means. I also should point out that their Vegetarian Combo is absolutely enormous (consisting of falafel, hummus, baba ghanouj, stuffed grape leaves, *and* tabbouleh) - if you order it, you might not want to start with a separate appetizer too, or you may not be leaving your bed for quite a while once you get home (as I discovered on a past excursion)! But it'll hurt so good, I promise. And believe me, you'll definitely want to save some room for dessert, especially if they've got Sha'abiyat [Syrian custard pie] available on your visit. I know I deal in superlatives a lot, but that's honestly one of my favorite sweet dishes in town, so try it out!

I try to seek out Mediterranean restaurants wherever I go. 
This has nice atmosphere and staff. The food is fabulous.
Best hummus and lentil soup in Denver. Clean, well priced and friendly staff/attentive service. A++

Wow and wow! This place has great food and service. We had the lamb shank and the sampler. Both were delicious! Charlie was our server and did a great job in sharing his passion for the menu making it a great experience.
Such a great simple place. I highly recommend. I got the Sultan combo. Great for 2 people.

A group of 6 of us went to Phoenician Kabob last week and it was wonderful. It was Thursday night and relatively empty at the time we got in, so we sat at a table near the window. I live pretty close and really enjoy the various cultural food spots you can go to on East Colfax, so I had to try this spot. 

We started with a bottle of Lebanese red wine (not sure of the name) and it was tasty. I have never had Lebanese wine before. We ordered dolmas, hummus, pitas, and the cauliflower to start. The cauliflower tasted wonderful-- it was cooked in tahini, garlic, and lemon juice, which resulted in a unique flavor I have never experienced with cauliflower before. The pitas were to die for... Super delicate, yet fluffy in a sense. The hummus was also good. The only thing I did not really enjoy appetizer-wise were the dolmas. They were somewhat overcooked and burnt.  

We also received little cucumber, tomato, and onion salads in small bowls. I just put the salad in the pitas with hummus, as well as my entree, so I can't review the "salad" on its own, even though it wasn't quite salad-like and seemed more like a garnish to me. 

For my entree, I went with one of the specials, the Maqlooba. It's an upside-down dish featuring lamb and rice, along with cauliflower, almonds???, sweet potatoes, chickpeas, and some other vegetables, all tossed together with many spices. There were hints of delicious sweetness in the dish and the lamb was cooked to perfection. Yogurt came on the side. I loved the deep and complex flavors within the dish, while I personally would have enjoyed more lamb and less rice (isn't that everyone's dream??). As I am not too familiar with Lebanese and Middle Eastern cuisine, I'm not sure if yogurt is always served on the side of this dish? But if it isn't 100% traditional, I would have liked a more flavorful yogurt-based sauce (more like a cucumber yogurt versus plain). 

All in all, it was a great night at Phoenician Kabob with just a few things within the cuisine that I would have changed! I would like to go back and try the gyros.

Holy crap! I'm angry at myself for living down the street and never eating here! We ate the dolma, baba, and tabbouleh, and they were so TASTY. The tabbouleh came with lettuce leaves which I turned into boats of deliciousness that sailed into my mouth. Walked to the dessert counter and merry the owner, who I could tell had great passion for his food. He recommended his wife's cheesecake and also gave us some other warmed desert that looked like the baby of a blonde brownie and baklava. They were both delicious. Exited to go back and try some other dishes

In typical Colfax style it's hard to tell how great this place is from the outside. But step inside and try a delicious grilled kabob and you will be hooked. My children and I were taking an urban walk and decided to try Phoenician Kabob for lunch. The staff was very friendly and helpful. And the food was amazing from the fatayer oven to the grill to the sauces that come with every dish. In just one week we have already returned with family to share this little hidden gem!

Ate here for lunch, and then for dinner. The food is top notch and delicious. For lunch try the fatayer and the chicken kabobs, although both portions are piteously tiny. I ate both and was still hungry (but I am a hungry guy). 

For dinner we got some okra special and some lamb special and they were *phenomenal*, and huge. We also got the sampler platter, and every last thing on there was excellent.

The garlic sauce is awesome too. Basically aioli. The atmosphere is cozy without being stifling.

I can't give 5 stars because the lunch was small and the service at dinner was not great, but the food is worth it regardless. Perhaps future visits will smooth this out.
This place never fails to impress. Food is very good. Drinks are good too. Service is always on point. Ambience is even a bonus.
Average flavors. Busy! Nice waitress. Limited but decent selection of beer. We will be back for more.
I've ate in and taken to-go the food is always amazing. Full of flavor and the garlic sauce it to die for! It's a nice clean quiet restaurant and the service is great too. We will surely be back!

I had a fantastic time at Phoenician Kabob with some good friends for my most recent birthday. It was a busy Friday night with a lot of people and bellydancing! Since we were a good sized group, the staff gave us the private room. We got a kick out of the painted walls and especially the bellydancer (did I say that already?? Hahahaha). She was pretty awesome and she gave us a bellydancing lesson, which will forever be etched into the banks of my "happy places."

The owner and staff were wonderful people. They treated us like we were a part of their family and it was a very cool and uncommon experience with them. 

Now, onto food. OMFG. Sorry, but my review will not do any justice because the food is in fact THAT good. Seriously. 

I had the kabobs and I have had a couple of lustful mornings waking up thinking about them...so I do need to return and reorder. 

They brought me a plate with 5 different delectable pastries for my birthday which was a complete delicious surprise. Oh, and the Lebanese coffee will give you wings. It is no joke. 

I can't wait to go back, actually. I'll be bringing some new company with me, to introduce to this spot, very soon!

I am so fortunate to live off of Colfax Avenue, a very eclectic and historic road that is surrounded by cool neighborhoods with diverse architecture, parks and most loved, our restaurants.  Phoenician Kabob is so that place.  Nestled on the north side of Colfax by Ivy Street....is this cozy - yet vibrant Mediterranean restaurant servicing authentic Middle Eastern cuisine. My neighbor and I stopped in on Friday night and was happily greeted by the owner,  Ibrahim and his wife, Victoria.  I just love when the owners know your name and welcome you as if you are family!

Barbara and I ordered a bottle of wine via Ibrahim's recommendation...and it was delightful.  Can remember the name but it was only $31.00.

We split one of the specials that night, Molokhia (chicken dish) - which was so delicious.  A green leafy vegetable used in Middle Eastern, East and North Africa and South Asian cuisine - very nutritious -  was cooked with chicken, chicken broth, onions, fresh lemon juice, garlic and house spices.  Check out the photo.  We also split a fresh Fatayer from their oven...with grilled mushrooms, spinach, roasted pine nuts and cheese - like a pizza but so fresh and light.  

The belly dancer came out for a few songs as we sipped on our wine.  A really wonderful experience at the Phoenician Kabob...I highly recommend you go and take your family and friends!

I am giving Phoenician Kebab 4 stars today and not 5 because their food is inconsistent. When its good, its reeeeeeeeally good. But sometimes, the food is left to sit and the meat is dry. I really like the staff. The owner is kind and gracious. I really love going here but every once in a while, it could be better. I have had many great meals here, however. I do think its a real asset to the Colfax neighborhood.

The food was ok, but the service was horrible.  Pita bread was fresh, the meat was ok too. We sat at a table and a skinny lady who we originally saw bar tending came and brought the menus without greeting us and even after we told her "hi", she didnt even bother to reply. The other staff was at best mediocre including the waiter. I wouldnt go back for sure unless I ran out of options mainly because of the unfriendly staff that we experienced.
Very good service, the pita was served still puffed and hot! The Food was presented very nicely and the restaurant had a nice ambience.
Best in town! Garlic dip kills! As does everything on every plate! Love this place! Service is always amazing and welcoming. If ur in the mood for a neighborhood place with amazing food hit it!

What a great surprise! I am rarely in Park Hill but it seemed like a reasonable place to have lunch en route to the airport. 

First, the restaurant was very clean and had nice natural light. The waitress was nice, quick, and charming.

Our food was great. Lamb and kefta kebob were both perfectly grilled. The rice was authentic basmati and cooked just right. The grilled veggies were a nice addition.

Also the pita za'atar feta app was great and authentic according to my Syrian friend.

Finally, the baklava was great. Crunchy, not chewy!

We left very happy and content - thank you.

This place has great food!! We came for an early lunch so it was not too busy and the service was great. The waiter was new to the state like we were so he chatted to us for a bit about living in Denver. The food came out pretty quickly and although our appetizer came out before our entree even though we asked for our appetizer to come out with our main course, it was still hot when our food came out. 

We started with the falafels as an appetizer and they were great!! They were gone so fast I wish there was more in the order. My boyfriend had a gyro and he really liked it and I had the chicken shwarma. The shwarma is really good and flavorful and comes with plenty of rice. Don't be discouraged about the location, the food is totally worth it!!

I recently ordered some food to go after not coming to the restaurant for almost a year. Sadly, the quality of the food has significantly gone down. By the time I got my order home the pita bread was stiff and dry. The pita was also very thin, not thick and fluffy like it use to be. I ordered the kofta plate. The taste of the food was fine, but not what it use to be. Frankly, I can make better food at home. The service was great as usual and everyone was very friendly. What happened? Unfortunately, I am on the hunt for a new Mediterranean restaurant.

I was in Denver for a meeting. I was craving authentic middle eastern fare. This was in an older part of town but I took a chance and I am glad I did. The baba ghanouj and lamb shank I had were delicious.

My boyfriend and I decided to try this place out because I didn't need any comic books and I thnk he had to go try out an enail later that eveing so there wasn't time to be driving all over the place for Middle Eastern Food. A locally renowned brand architect had told my boyfriend that Phoenician Kabob was the bomb so we headed over. 

IMO he was wrong and I'm going to remember that. We started with baba ghanoush and I have to say it was pretty weak. Not much flavor. Our meal also included a chopped tomato, cucumber, and onion salad. This was ten times weaker than the baba ghanoush. The salad was completely without flavor and that is hard to do when you've got raw onions involved. The raw onions tasted mostly like crunchy water with a hint of onion flavor. For our entrees, my boyfriend got a pile of meat. I know he thought one meat was quite good and one was meh. My chicken skewers were good and I liked the rice. It had a nice flavor and was fluffy. The garlic sauce side saved everything. 

Another thing I am going to remember forever from this evening is that my boyfriend told me I look fatter without his glasses. I suppose I can logically understand that it is his astigmatism riddled eyeballs doing this and not me personally getting fatter, but still it was not what a lady likes to hear. Remember that next time before telling a lady she looks fat in any context.

See my other reviews for some way better Middle Easter Options.

I can't remember if I had any ice cream that night.

Incredible! After returning from an Israeli adventure earlier this summer, my boyfriend and I have been desperately seeking a middle eastern restaurant in denver to satisfy our cravings... and low and behold this was it! We had actually been recommended this place over a year ago by the wine guy (sommollier?) at the kitchen upstairs in Boulder. We had been meaning to try it but never got around to it, until I was googling middle eastern food denver and it popped back up! 

They have an awesome lebanese wine list, great service, the garlic aioli and hummus were unreal, pita was hot and fresh, and the owner was there delivering the food & chatting away with all his patrons, three of them came up to say goodbye and hug before they left. Just from the get go you can tell he's a true genuine hardworking person who loves what he does, and it shows in the food! 

We went last night and are so happy we did - definitely can see this being a regular outing. Just wish we lived closer! Highly, highly recommend. Can't wait to dig into our leftovers today for lunch! :)
Very delicious food l, reasonably priced with friendly service as well. They serve kibbi, very similar to how my grandmother made it. This place is now one of my favorites!

If you have a fear of vampires - this is the place for you.  You will never find on hanging out here.  

Oh how I love the garlic dip, let me count the ways.  My co-workers at the afternoon meeting, not so much.  Be prepared to taste the garlic for the rest of the day and perhaps not go to the sauna as it might start coming out of your pores.  Can't say I didn't warn you.  

I love their lunch special.  I've only ever ordered the chicken shawarma.  It is served with salad and rice and the garlic sauce/dip.  It's only $9 and well worth the price.  

On a previous visit I got to try the Zaatar.  I now try to have this every time I go back.

I think they have some of the best pitas in town.  

Service is not always the fastest, it is some of the friendliest.  Parking has never been an issue, plenty of street parking nearby.
Good food and very kid-friendly. They brought out a box of mini blocks and small toys when I came in with my toddler son. A bit of a wait on the food, but the quality and service made it worthwhile.

Great Mediterranean food is hard to find, but NOT at Phoenician Kabob! This place is wonderful! By far the best Hummus & Shawarma I've had in Denver. I also love the chicken Kabob, Greek salad, and fried cauliflower!

On top of the food, the atmosphere is great. Don't you miss restaurants with real table clothes? Phoenician Kabob has them! It's curtains & dark walls give it an intimate, upscale feel, but the staff is always friendly & casual. The owner has come to our table several times & even given us free appetizers before! As a bonus, a couple nights a week they bring in a belly dancer and give you some free entertainment while you eat. Overall a great hidden gem!!

I had the falafel sandwich here and it was spectacularly delicious. There was some sort of spice in it that I couldn't place but that really transformed my falafel-eating experience. The hummus and tahini were also great. As a bonus, it was fairly inexpensive at $7 a sandwich. 

One downside was that the service was fairly slow (there were two guys waiting a nearly full restaurant). Also, we ordered stuffed grape leaves as an appetizer. I wouldn't recommend these. I've had them lots of other places and these were only okay. I also wouldn't recommend their tzatziki. It came with the grape leaves and I found it to be quite flavorless.

LOVE! Superb service and food!  Highly recommend this place- the Baba ganoush is outstanding, as are the pita and the Lebanese coffee! Went there for a friend's bday and had the adorable private room to chow down and get some lessons from the beautiful belly dancer! A total gem!

My aunt and uncle recommended this place for dinner and I would have to say Phoenician Kabob's Mediterranean cuisine is delicious.  

We walked in on a Monday night after deciding against Chinese take-out and got a big table by the window for our party of seven.  They had lots of specials listed on the board by the door and Ibrahim, the owner, is pretty tight with my uncle so they brought out a few complimentary appetizers.

Food:  5/5 Stars

-Stuffed vegetarian grape leaves 5/5 stars -  They were on the thin side, but very good.

-Fried Cauliflower 5/5 stars - I have never had this in my life and I loved it.  Ibrahim said they are going to put it on the menu.  Definitely ask for this if it isn't on the menu.

-  Eggplant slices in balsamic 2/5 Stars - not really my cup of tea.  I like babaganoush or Ikra that is all mashed up as a dip.

-  Chicken breast kabobs with garlic dip 5/5 stars - marinated with the right amount of saffron and the garlic dip rivals Zankou in L.A.  I was in heaven and ate every last morsel of chicken and garlic dip.  

-  Basmati Rice -  Normally I don't eat rice because of the carb factor, but they cook it with a touch of cinnamon and it was delicious.  My hubby, who is Iranian, didn't care for it and I don't think my uncle likes it, but I couldn't stop eating it.  It is kind of like cilantro.  You either love it or hate it.

-  Freshly baked puffy pita bread - 5/5 stars  It was hot out of the oven and so good.

I seriously can't remember what everyone else ordered because I was concentrating on my plate.  They all seemed to be exceptionally happy with their selections.

Service:  5/5 Stars

Our server was amazing.  I can't remember her name, but she was awesome.

Ambiance:  4/5 Stars

It is very nice inside, but I wouldn't say it has a really fancy or hip vibe to it.  That has to do with the location.  If you put this restaurant in a stand alone spot in LoHi or one of the other hip locations in Denver it would be a goldmine.  My wheels are really spinning on this one.  

Parking:   4/5 Stars

Street parking for free.  No lot that I saw.

I will definitely come back to this restaurant when I am in Denver and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a amazing Mediterranean food.

The food here is generally pretty good but avoid the specials. The dinner specials in particular tend to be badly over-priced and not as good as normal fare. The ambiance is marginal. The wait staff is usually competent but a little grungy. Turnover among the staff is high apparently. Overall this place is OK.

I am a fan. We had a work banquet here and the Mediterranean food was superb. I'd say best in Denver.  Im giving it 4 stars because my to-go experience wasn't great. The staff must have been in an off night because thenlady who helped me wasn't very friendly. I ordered a Sultan combo ($20) and it was packed to the brim in the flimsy to-go container. 2 fresh pitas in a pizza box-the pitas were very dried out by the time i got home, but im not sure what to expect since they are made fresh in the restaurant, thus i wasn't upset about this.  I've attached a photo of my Sultan combo by the time i got home.  Everything was mashed on top of everything.  They could have split it up nicer for 20 bucks. It was a mess. Unless they change their to-go process, I'd just rather eat there.

So I have one check in, but the reality is that I come here at least a few times a month.  I have no idea how I haven't reviewed this place until now. This is one of my very favorite restaurants, period. Everything is homemade in house and incredibly delicious. The servers are always kind and accommodating. 

I generally go for lunch, because I like the cheaper lunch specials. I always get the chicken kabob. At lunch that means one chicken kabob with onions, bell peppers, and delicious chicken pieces served with basmati rice (seriously, how do they make rice so good???) cucumber/tomato/onion salad and (drum roll) the garlic aioli (technically called thume.) THE GARLIC AIOLI WILL BLOW YOUR MIND AND CHANGE YOUR LIFE...

All of those things are incredible and I also recommend getting pita bread because it is warm and awesome. 

Now I have to go there tomorrow because I'm craving it like crazy.

This is some good Mediterranean food! My favorite was the garlic dip. It's a simple condiment that has a strong garlic flavor, but it's balanced. I don't want to steer anyone away from it by saying its strong because it's not overwhelming.....just oh so tasty!

We also had the falafel, a gyro, and the chicken shawarma. All of these were darn good too!  They have several other items I want to try so I'll be back.
I crave hummus like there's no tomorrow. Come here, it's delicious. The garlic dip is too. Oh and the homemade pita. Yum. Don't be scared of the location, it truly is a gem.
Absolutely DELICIOUS food. Best hummus in town, hands down. Be sure to get the cauliflower, too. Great spot for lunch as well.

This review will probably read as a love letter, which is appropriate and well-earned.

From the minute I walked in, I enjoy the ambiance of the place, and I was greeted quickly and seated by Katy, who wound up being one of the best servers I've had in a good, long while. She answered all of my questions, of which I had many, and was extremely friendly and helpful. 

I started with hummus, because really, this is a litmus test for me in any restaurant that has it on the menu. The hummus, well... it was probably the best hummus I've ever had, and was accompanied by a big basket of two huge pitas so fresh and hot that I burned myself even trying to eat them right away. I was also impressed by the amount of hummus I got as an appetizer. Too often, I spend $6 and get a plate that looks like someone smeared the thinnest, weakest little spread of hummus on it. This was a generous bowl and I couldn't even finish it.

They have a handful of lunch specials and I went with the chicken shawarma. When it came out, it was chock full of chicken cooked with bell peppers and onions and super fragrant! Even the rice that accompanied the meal was particularly well seasoned and tasty. A small salad of onions, tomatoes, and spices came with the meal, as well as a little container of "garlic dip".  Now, this dip might even have a more fancy or specific name but I'm going to call it garlic dip. And, if I had my druthers, I would be putting the stuff on everything from breakfast to dessert, it is that amazing. Spicy and powerful and outstanding.

I had my leftovers packed up and noticed the desserts. Well, of course, I could not leave without getting some baklava. Then I saw that they had these little homemade cookies , and... Well... I came home with a lot of sweets and a fantastic leftover meal for tonight's dinner.

Everything was reasonably priced, especially for lunch. I believe my chicken shawarma lunch was $9, and they also offer beef shawarma, gyro , and several types of kabobs.

To say that I'd go back would be an understatement, as I will probably try to find a reason to get over there as soon as possible. Ask for Katy, if you get the chance, because she's awesome. And, you know... Get the garlic dip.

On the recommendation of the ever amazing Denver Elite Yelpers, a friend and I came here for dinner on a recent Friday evening.

First - I'm surprised this place was fairly empty at a prime time for Friday dinner - someone should go and fix that!

Second - belly dancing, a manager who came out to check, fast and friendly waitstaff

Third - really amazing food and a ton of it!

As my friend is GF, we were excited to discover she could have nearly the entire menu!  We therefore got the sample platter and an order of the Fava beans.  The sampler was huge - enough for both of us, plus leftovers x2!  The fava beans were warm and like hummus but chunky - think salsa with med flavors and food.  Both were good choices for sure.

While we were too full for dessert, they did have them available for your viewing pleasure in a glass case on the bar.  They also had specials of the night on a whiteboard.

The only slight cons... 1 - the hummus wasn't our favorite.  2 - there is no GF pita bread so that made it a bit harder to eat some of the sauces. 

So if you are in that part of town, or close by, go check out this place for an enjoyable meal!

What a elegant place and best prepared middle eastern food.  Freshly backed pita bread with their hummus and felafel is the best in the city if not the best in the country.  One suggestion if you are heading there ask them to bring the bread ASAP because it is not and melts in your mouth.  I tried lamb shank and I highly recommend it.  We are for sure going back.   My gorgeous fiancé who is from Morocco was very pleased as well.

I'm a Phoenician Kabob fan! I live in Park Hill and it is definitely one of my go to spots in the neighborhood. The servers have always been nice and accomodating. I'm addicted to their pita! Its warm and wonderful. I also really enjoy their kafta, garlic dip, hummus and shwarma options. My BF did try their moussaka- I would not say it is your typical/traditional greek moussaka but still tasted good. Take advantage of their lunch pricing to save some $. Overall, a Phoenician Kabob is a delightful treat every time I go.

Pretty much perfection at the Phoenician Kabob. 

The owner, Ibrahim is an enthusiastic and thoughtful host who wants to make sure everything is "just so" for his guests. I had the combo kabob platter- lamb/chicken/beef and there is no better place outside of Jordan where I've seen better Middle Eastern cuisine. There were 12 people seated at our table and the food was served flawlessly!

There is no comparable restaurant in Denver for the fresh pita or the hummus. This establishment is proof positive that a great "hands on" owner, staff and a concept done well will beat the newest trendiest loft space farm to table restaurants any day of the week and for a much cheaper price  too!

We went for lunch. Less than stellar to say the least. 
The lentil soup was kind of mushy and flavorless. 
Beef schwarma was chewy and the salad that came with it wasn't very fresh. The eggplant sandwich was also not so great. Really thick, chewy pieces with not a lot of other ingredients in the sandwich. 

The server noticed I didn't like it, didn't charge us and gave us some hummus and pita. This was also pretty flavorless and unappealing. 

Besides the service, this place wasn't good. 

Definitely wouldn't recommend.

My food was amazing! There wasn't one thing that I didn't love. I had falafel and gyro first and then a chicken kabob that came with rice and hummus and pita which was homemade and cooked in a really nice pita oven! And then for dessert I had coconut macaroons! Loved it all! The owners are so incredibly nice and know what they are doing because everything was outstanding! I definitely recommend this place and I don't see how anyone could not love the food and the very nice people! Best Mediterranean food in all of Denver and possibly the best I've had anywhere!

I've lunched at Phoenician Kabob twice now and both times took advantage of the lunch special, which comes with your choice of meat with salad and rice on the side.  So far I've tried the chicken shawarma and chicken kabob.  I liked the kabob better than the shawarma, I think.  The kabob chicken was tender and flavorful.  I'd like to try a beef dish next.  Any way you go, it's a lot of food for around $8.00.

I've also had the pleasure of trying some of the appetizers and, honestly, I liked them even better than my entrees.  The smokey, creamy Baba Ghanouj and the deliciously smooth hummus are accompanied by pillowy pockets of warm pita fresh from the brick oven.  The star of the show for me was the zaatar fatayer, a flat bread sprinkled with a mixture of toasted sesame seeds, thyme, olive oil, sumac, sea salt, I think pine nuts, and probably some other spices baked in the brick oven.  Just scrumptious!

Yes, there is an authentic brick oven back in the kitchen, which emits wonderful aromas into the dining room and cooks the food to perfection.  I think sometimes you have to wait a bit but good food takes time.  I bet you'll be more than pleased with the service here and if the owner is around, he'll probably come to your table and say hello.  Great friendly, neighborhood spot!

Yum Yum Yum. 

I don't normally get this far out east on Colfax but I'll drive for this. You know that Colfax has hidden gems, they are just mixed in with a whole lot of mess so its hard to know. I rely on recommendations and in this case it really paid off. 

I'm not exactly sure what's in the Garlic dip because I swear it tastes stronger than straight garlic. Its delicious. I brought some home and while I smelled of garlic for days, 100% worth it. (I may be ranking this whole place on how much I loved it). 

I had a lunch size of the beef shwarma. So glad I got the lunch size; plenty of food and cooked just right. 

It might not be the hippest atmosphere but when you are looking for good hole in the wall food (its nicer than that on the inside really but its not the nice part of Colfax), this is it.

This is the best restaurant on E. Colfax! I would like to respond to Abby G.'s review regarding poor customer service. Sometimes as a patron you need to recognize that a great restaurant may run into extenuating circumstances and realize that maybe an employee called in sick or there are more than the expected customers on an evening than usual. This restaurant is consistently great with consistent wonderful customer service. Brahim and the staff at Phoenician Kabob provide a wonderful neighborhood experience and it always feels like home when we go here. From time to time, yes the restaurant is packed but we always know it is worth the wait! This restaurant is a true gem sitting in the heart of east colfax!

I have discovered my Denver Greek Salad go-to spot! Among the eclectic spots on East Colfax - this is a true gem. The spectacular service is only to rivaled by the spectacular food bursting with deliciously distinguished Mediterranean flavors. 

To begin - I feel I must note just how patient and charming our server was. Not only did she not even flinch when our very adorable 16 month old dining companion flung rice everywhere, but she brushed it off by simply saying 'No big deal, we understand. Things happen'

As she walked us through the menu and delicious sounding specials, we all landed on pretty solid choices of chicken schwarma, dolmas, and my favorite the Greek Salad with chicken schwarma. Never have I laid eyes on a salad so dense in flavor and size with all the best ingredients that constitutes a Greek Salad. Not overwhelmed with lettuce, each olive, feta cheese, lettuce piece, onion were perfectly rationed throughout the ginormous salad. 

But the best part? Oh the best part was this garlic dipping sauce that accompanies the salad. Not particularly sure how the sauce was supposed to consumed as the salad already had a delicious vinaigrette lightly coating each bite, but I am so happy I discovered it. It's the consistency of a butter, yet was informed that is was made of olive oil, egg white, and garlic. And if you are a lover of garlic like yours truly then you'll be dipping your pita in this all night long. I'd almost go as far as to say that this tiny condiment could be a big enough reason to return time and time again. It doesn't hurt that every other dish was just as delicious. Oh - and try the fatayer, too - it's essentially a Mediterranean pizza and is divine!
I haven't found any better kebobs in Denver.  Service is good, prices are fair.  What more would you want?

I know, it is hard to believe that a couple of us were still a tad peckish after hitting Big Smoke and Jax.  But, just like the heart, the stomach wants what the stomach wants.  So, Alissa and I dropped in for a quick drink and a light bite.  I stuck with water to drink as there had been plenty of libations earlier.  My first thought was that the place looked much nicer on the inside than one might expect from the storefront.  The owner (Ibrahim?) and the servers were friendly and efficient.  I ordered the Beef Shawarma sandwich by itself.  It was some of the most flavorful Shawarma I have tried.  I had mine with the garlic dipping sauce (thick and super garlicky) as well as the red chili pepper sauce.  They both complimented this moist and flavorful sandwich. Kelly T. did not exaggerate the magnitude of the garlic in her review, but I enjoyed every reeking bite :)

The pita on the sandwich here is very soft.  This carried over to the fresh pillows of pitas that were brought to us straight from the oven.  They were painfully hot to the touch and oh so good.  They went well with the strongly smokey and quite creamy Baba Ghanouj (smoked eggplant with tahini, garlic & lemon juice) into which we dipped the pita.  Phoenician Kabob has a full bar, and many of the customers were enjoying drinks on this Sunday evening.  Indeed, we even ran into another Yelper friend (first physical meeting) who had checked in for a quick drink.  There are many things on the menu I would like to try in the future, and I will definitely be back to give them a go.

Went exploring along Colfax for dinner options when we stumbled across Phoenician Kabob, and we were happy we did. Started with the baba ghanouj, which was smoky and creamy, served with baskets of their fabulous pita bread. Had the kafta kabob plate, a great choice, the meat was flavorful and well seasoned, served with salad and rice. My date had the chicken shawarma sandwich, also another great option. Service was attentive, the waiters were very friendly and personable. Nice atmosphere, made for a great date night. Look forward to going back soon!

I've been to several near-eastern/Mediterranean places in Aurora and East Denver and Phoenician Kabob is by far my favorite.

Phoenician Kabob's meat dishes are delicious, well-seasoned (but not too salty) and lean with adequate portions.  I've had both chicken and beef and have been happy with both.  They have nightly specials; one night I had an eggplant/potato/ground beef baked special (I don't know what it was called and it was delicious.)  They also offer lamb, seafood and vegetarian options.  The portion sizes are balanced and appropriate, they don't load you up on meat; however, they don't short you on protein and then try to make up for it with too much rice/grain.  

For me, when I eat near-eastern food, its the sides and the sauces that really make or break the meal.  Phoenician Kabob includes several sides including hummus, grape leaves, salads and the like.  I love the various hummus variations and they have a delicious tzatziki; I find it good on everything.  The tabouleh is delicious, lightly minted and refreshes the palate.  It is a nice refreshing complement to the spices and flavors of the other items on the plate.  This last point is important because the baba ganouj is a delicious flavor explosion... I'll leave it at that!

They also offer drinks and desserts including traditional coffee.   

The restaurant interior is understated, and it doesn't need to be flashy, the food says it all.

I've been here several times and I can tell you I'm impressed and think the food is beyond flavorful and delectable.

To give you an idea, my Mom visited not to long ago and I took her here for a lunch/dinner kind of thing and she loved it so much we stopped in before her flight so she could buy some food to bring back to Philadelphia, yep that's right kebabs to go on a plane.

I've had several things here and my ultimate favorite is the kafta (lamb and beef mixture) on a kabob, it's juicy and packed with tons of seasoning.  I usually get the meat platter with two or three kabobs that way I can get a variety.  The hummus is super fresh and served as a side on most meals.  

The last time we were here the owner was there and very chatty, don't pass this up, he's a great guy and enjoys being a restaurant owner.  He showed us around and even told us that he had his brick oven imported from Lebanon and installed it himself.  Truly an amazing feet when you see the monstrous size of this thing.  His brink oven gets to over 1500 degrees and can cook ram pita dough in 30 seconds.  That's how fresh your pita is going to be, all made from scratch and to your table, almost still cooking.  

They also have some wonderful specials on the board daily which includes some food options as well as wine specials.  They have a full bar, so feel free to get your drink on.  

Just reviewing this place gives me a hankering for another kebab trip.  Let's all go and give them something to talk about!!

Everything is amazing, the owners are some of the hardest working, most genuine, and some of the friendliest folks I have met in the restaurant industry. I eat here weekly, at a minimum! Love this place.

Was in Denver on a Saturday afternoon and chose this place on a whim.  We both had the gyro plate and shared the fried cauliflower appetizer.  Both were very good.  The gyro meat was especially delicious.  Chunks vs shaved and quite juicy.  I asked for no rice and I ended up with more meat & salad than my hubby.  (He was jealous). The salad was simply tomato, cucumber & red onion.  I wish it had been dressed somehow...maybe some fresh herbs & oil?  The tomatoes were definitely lackluster but it is winter, after all.  The waitress was super friendly but seemed to be spread a bit thin.
Great happy hour deals, big portions, friendly service, and meals were delicious!! You will not be disappointed!
Love the food, the atmosphere and the service. Overall a good value for quality mid eastern food
My favorite neighborhood restaurant. The best lamb and gyro meat in Denver. The garlic sauce is to die for. Great spot right on Colfax. A must eat for anyone who enjoys good food and a good time.

SO VERY FULL.

Came with four other people. We ordered:

3 glasses of wine, 2 appetizers, 3 entrees, and 4 pieces of baklava.

Appetizers: garlic dip and hummus. Delicious - the garlic dip is REALLY good but so garlicky that it made the hummus taste... a bit blah. The fresh baked loaves of pita are NOT TO BE MISSED.

Entrees: chicken shawarma, kafta kabob, and lamb gyros. All plates eaten clean, but the kafta and gyros were the stars. Each entree is served with a large serving of rice and a bowl of "salad" (cucumbers, onions, and tomatoes).

Dessert: Baklava are HUGE here. The triangle piece is probably 3-4 inches. 

The owner came to ask us how our meal was at the end of the night, which was a nice touch.

I WISH they would serve more family style. If the table wants to share the entrees, why can't they bring out ONE bowl of salad, ONE large bowl of rice, and then the meats on platters? Small thing, but might make it cozier.

Total with tip and tax, per person, was $24.

But the hero here is the pita. Best I've had outside of Metro Detroit.
Awesome food. Slightly stingy on the pita bread (for takeout) but otherwise everything we've ordered has been excellent on all fronts!

We used Phoenician Kabob for catering a 60th birthday party and Brahim and Victoria were great! They were flexible, relaxed (when I wasn't), delivered and set up on time, and recommended the right amount of food. We ordered main course dinner foods like chicken kabob, veggie kabobs, moussaka, and greek salad as well as musakhan, grape leaves, hummus and baba ganoush. And of course the garlic condiment...amazing!! It was all delicious and the guests LOVED the food. It was different, flavorful and the hit of the party. 2 weeks later, friends still mention the great food. They took care of everything and even recommended a wonderful belly dancer. Thanks to Brahim and Victoria for the delicious food and great experience.

The food was incredible! We got the Sultan combo (pretty much a plate of meat, rice and hummus) and my friend got the gyro.  The food was super fresh, the server was helpful with recommendations and the chef was very nice as we were leaving! We will definitely be returning!

We decided to try this place for an early dinner. Note: Lunch specials end at 3pm. 
We tried the hummus, mushroom Fatayer (similar to a white pizza), lamb gyro plate, gyro sandwich, Lebanese coffee and the Sultan Combo. Wow, was this a lot of food.

The hummus was very smooth and creamy with some great olive oil on top. The Fatayer was as tasty as any other great white pizza in my opinion. Very good mushroom flavor and excellent light and slightly chewy crust. The pita bread that came with the hummus was awesome, by far the best bread I've had at any Mediterranean place. It was very light, delicate, aromatic and hot from the oven.

The coffee was interesting, it seemed like it was spiced with some Chai ingredients or something. We asked how it was made and the waitress asked the chef's. In broken english she thinks they told her that they take coffee grounds add it to some water and boil it for a few seconds, take it off the heat, then boil it and repeat a few times. It was espresso like and also like a greek coffee with the grounds at the bottom of the small pot.

The entrees were all good. The Gyro plate was a big helping of Lamb Gyro meat, lightly seasoned white rice and a cucumber and onion salad with spices as well. The Gyro was well portioned with meat and veggies wraped in a fresh pita which had plenty of taziki on the side. I'd get this sandwich next time for a quick lunch. The Sultan Combo was was loaded with all sorts of great things, the highlights for me was the Falafel which was very chrispy and well seasoned and the tabbouleh salad which was very mint forward. 

The service was great, maybe it was just because we were the only ones there. It was between lunch and dinner but lets say it again, it was great service. We all know service can be terrible no matter how busy a place is. 

Check this place out, you won't be disappointed. Even if you hate garlic and hummus, get a Fatyer. I forgot to mention the garlic sauce is ridiculously spicy and raw garlic tasting. Not hot spicy just garlic spicy, WOW and look out for anyone who eats it.
Amazing food, great service and nice atmosphere! Went here on a whim and definitely walked away with a happy, full tummy!

This is hands down the best Middle Eastern restaurant in Denver! I am second generation Lebanese and grew up in a town with a very large Lebanese population and many wonderful options for Lebanese food. Until now I could not recommend a Middle Eastern restaurant in Denver to family and friends. This is not because the places I have tried were bad they just weren't excellent. This place is excellent! 

The quality of ingredients are above and beyond the other options in town. While visiting with a friend who is also Lebanese the owner was walking around speaking to all of his guests. You could tell that he had built a relationship with many of his patrons. Overall the service was fantastic. It was very obvious that the owner takes a lot of pride in his business and the quality of his food.

I am very excited to have found this wonderful restaurant and would highly recommend it to anyone.

A hidden gem!   This place is amazing!  Even make their own pita bread. :)

Great price point & has a nice environment!
Amazing Mediterranean food. Interesting location with super accommodating staff. They also have belly dancing on the weekend!

Recommended by the tire place down the street while I waited.  Very strong flavors made for an awesome wrap.  The fries were those really good thing crispy ones that you seem to only get at Greek and other foreign places.

Garlic Past is STRONG and will leave its mark on you for a while.

Overall great place if you are looking for something different with LOTS of flavor.

We spent one weekend in Denver, CO area. I chose Phoenician Kabob for lunch because it was near our next destination. The restaurant was next to a tattoo parlor, and it seemed to be in a doubtful area. Our group was two families with young children. I was not sure I made the right pick for lunch.

But never have we been welcomed as well as when we went to here. Inside the restaurant, it was neatly lined tables with plates, napkins and silverware arranged with care. There was a greyed hair super friendly gentleman greeting us. He asked us where we're from. When he found out we were out-of-towners, he said he would make us something special. My guess is he is the owner or manager of the restaurant. Our waiter was equally welcoming and friendly. 

A few minutes after we ordered our food, a pizza with home made dough came out with some home made pickled vegetables. The pizza had some lamb gyros cubed and it was very tasty. The pickles were great companions to the pizza.

Most of us in the family ordered various kabobs, some chicken, some beef, some lambs. My niece's lamb kabob seemed to be a little tough but mine and my husbands were tender, juicy and tasty. Even my picky-eater daughter cleaned up her chicken kabob and rice. 

I can attest this was the best meal we had over the weekend. I regretted that we are leaving the area and won't come back here anytime soon. I hope that they stay around for a long long time so when we come back to this area, they will still be here for us to enjoy their food and hospitality.

This place hits the ball out of the park in all areas :) First it is a cute small place on E Colfax. I remember when we hardly had any great places on this stretch of the Fax but times are changing :) The first time I ate here I just ordered it to go and it was yummy but I  decided to eat in this time and it did make a difference. My friends and I came here for a late birthday dinner for me so we wanted to try a few things. Appetizers - Hummus and Sabankh. The hummus was creamy and very flavorful a little less salty the others I have had. The Sabankh was out of this world . The little pastries filled with spinach and pine nuts were so good. I could have eaten just these and be happy. The Greek salad was very good . All ingredient was chopped up really small which is a great way to serve this salad.  We also order the Sultan Combo & Vegetarian Combo both were very good! You can taste the Quality in the gyros and chicken. The tabbouleh and baba ghanouj was oh so good! The Pita however is one of the reasons this place stands out . Wood burning oven cooks the pita and the Sabanekh to perfection :) Don't drive by this place with out stopping for some yummy food!

This place has a bunch of excellent Lebanese cuisine. My favorite thing about this place was the Lebanese coffee. It had so much caffeine in it, I loved it. The kebabs were so excellent, it sounds like it would be a small portion of food, but they are huge. My other favorite part was the hummus, it was some of the best I've ever had, and the pita bread was so delicious and perfect. The food here is great, honestly, I really wasn't impressed with the staff. I didn't really get a lot of courtesy, respect, and politeness that I usually appreciate from any waitstaff ... And I don't have super outrageous expectations for kindness either. But I will say that the most important part of a restaurant is probably the food, and it was some excellent and authentic tasting cuisine. Although it's off Colfax, which isn't the best area, is a very upscale restaurant with good parking available.
When Iron Man mention Shawarma he must have talked about this place. Very good food and the garlic dip is delicious. Also yea Shawarma taste great too!

I had some old gift certificates here and stopped by the other day to grab dinner with them. Not only was the food fantastic, but the woman that helped us was so nice! I believe she was the manager there, and she gave us tons of suggestions for what to get with the gift certificates and her impression of each item. They also had some samples out to try, I recommend the turkey....delish! I was also impressed that the leftover money on the last gift certificate she gave me change for. 

I will definitely be going back when I want a quick, tasty meal. Perfect for parties.
I love how you can get fresh sandwiches here from the fresh deli meat they have. This sandwich was seriously one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. I will definitely be going back!

Is there anything more delicious than a HoneyBaked Ham for Thanksgiving?  It's a family tradition that we've had since I was born.

This HoneyBaked Ham location is a bit drabby, but the service is friendly.  When the holidays roll around, this location gets packed, so be sure to get there when they open to avoid the long lines.

For lunch I've had the ham classic several times and it's always great.  Slices of the spiral cut ham with mayo and smoked hickory mustard served on a croissant.

I'm a huge fan of the Honeybaked Ham Company, and have been getting them for years. Most recently, I bought one for a New Years Eve party I hosted. Yes, the hams are a little pricey, but wow - they are worth it. 

The hams here start at 7 pounds - If you're hoping for ham on a busy holiday, I highly recommend reserving one ahead of time. Even for NYE, they were running out, and people coming in with no reservation were going to be stuck with a 9+ pounder. 

HHC does offer a pretty decent variety of frozen sides, and they have some great sauces, too. I bought a tangy mustard sauce, and a horseradish sauce, both with leftovers in mind... 

As David noted, all you need to do with your ham is take it out of the fridge an hour and a half ahead of time. In the past, I've heated up small portions of it, but it really is just as good at room temp. 

The employees in the Aurora store were friendly and efficient, both on the phone when I made my reservation and when I showed up to pick up the ham. Great product, great service. Five stars. Love it!

Most of the stuff they sell tastes amazing. I love their ham salad sandwich,classic ham (I always add horseradish to both) their potato salad and any of their frozen entrees. Last year I bought my entire thanksgiving meal from here and was not disappointed.

Great service and a damn good burger. Love the buns.  
Staff is spectacular.  Yummy.  
Small joint that's family friendly.  I'll be back again and again.

I hadn't heard of this place prior, and with all the restaurants that pop up in this area of Denver it's hard to keep track. I do know that it's hard to go wrong with a burger joint.

It was a game day, so every HD TV in the place had some kind of football on. I'm not big on sports, but this would be a great spot to catch the game and get a beer, if you're into that. There's a Foosball table and a nice, private outside sitting area. The inside is bright and open, chic in modern decor but still gave off a chill vibe.

Their selection of specialty burgers had a lot of variety, and I ended up with a turkey burger that was very juicy and tender. You can also build your own burger with a plethora of add-ons true to Denver's style, like guacamole and green chile. 

I think the best part were the fries, Parmesan and truffle oil, and you can get a basket for the whole table.

The booze selection was also up the par, lots of local favorites and some I've never heard of. They also have alcoholic milkshakes, which is a win in my book.

Service can be a little slow, but again....game day, understandable. Staff was friendly and made sure we had what we needed. 

So if you're not in the mood for a greasy fast food place but still want a tasty burger and a place to unwind with a casual atmosphere, Park Burger is the place for that.

After leaving an event across the street, we were over come with the smell of burgess and right then know we needed one. As we got closer the smell of bacon join the already mouth water aromas acting like a silent siren. Walked in and the third and most wonderful scent blessed my nose, truffles!

The space is modern and cramped, prefect for the Highlands. We were immediately seated by a friendly wait staff and attended to attentively. 

Our table of three ordered a basked of the Truffle fries, a New Your burger, the Royale burger, and the el Chilango burger. I only tasted the fires and New York, but my dining partners seemed to enjoy as there was silence once the food arrived except for the occasional moan of pleasure and few oh my gods (regarding the food). 

My burger was incredible. The buns were fresh and fluffy, patty was cooked perfectly and the corned beef was delicious. The fries were amazing as well and would have been great even without topping, which was good because half the fries weren't touched by the toppings. The ones that were touched were amazing! 

My one small complaint was the bathrooms seemed a little run down. Clean, but could use a new toilet seat and handle. 

Can't wait to go back and try more wonderful burger combinations!
Not a fan of this location. Messed up my order three different times, and the quality isn't as good as the other locations.

Park burger is as good as it gets. I used to frequent the platte park location when I lived in the area. I was happy to learn that the highlands park burger is just as good as the platte park location.

Only two downsides: 

It is small. Very, very small. 

Parking is terrible which makes it difficult to pick up take out.

Talk about a burger joint! This is a must when you are in the area. It's a small restaurant that seats a few parties. It's an intimate and cozy kind of small not a cramped and suffocating small.

I ordered the tuna burger and their peanut butter and chocolate milk shake. The tuna burger is a really unique take on the sandwich. It's loaded with layers of flavors. The tuna is salty and the bread is buttery. The bread has a similar consistency of that of a croissant. The bread is toasted with a load of buttery goodness. There is a heap of creamy avocado that drenches the burger. The best part is the tart and vinegary taste form the pickled veggies.  

The service is great! They are so laid back and super helpful! 

I say this is a gem. And I am so glad I stumbled upon this restaurant.

We parked around the side and accidentally went in the wrong restaurant lol.  After being and seated we realized it was two doors down.
