After being promptly seated we I ordered the works and a few bloody Mary's, a few burgers, and the chefs burger for me and wow everything was very tasty I love this place!
Will definitely be back here again!

I have been to park burger around ten times, it has become my go to burger joint. Everything that I try there I like. The truffle fries go great with the burgers and the service is always quick and friendly.

Wow, what a great burger this place has. 

We had a really friendly server who went over their menu with us. We ordered a couple burgz and split a basket of fries. Both burgers came out as requested (medium rare) and were actually seasoned (so many places seem afraid of salt and pepper?) and the fries were great. Prices were reasonable, especially considering the portions. I was bummed I couldn't finish my burger.

The only suggestion I have is to get more beer taps. I believe they only have 3, and I wasn't a fan of any of them.

This burger joint brought me back to life. After hiking for a few hours with some friends we hit up this burger joint my local friends had been to..

Our waiter was very cool and informative of specials and beers on tap. Service was fairly quick for such a small kitchen.

Started off with the works fries- yall, I could have eaten the whole thing myself. The cheese sauce they put on it was delicious! Add a side of ranch and you've got the perfect combination.

I ordered the burger with pancetta on it. I was extremely impressed with the patty quality and the flavor. Not to mention the garlic aioli really made this burger above and beyond! Their sweet ish buns.. I'm just saying, it couldn't have been better!

Oh em gee. This place was amazing. It's a small location but the food was wonderful. 
Had the loaded fries and they were to die for. The burgers were just as good. Service was quick and nice.
This burger spot is off the hook.  Small location but don't let that hold you back. This spot has one of the best and richest  burgers that I've had in a long time.  Thanks guys. Will come again.

Great concept! Great food. Great beer. Great energy!
I love a good patio spot, and if you can throw in good food and drink - I'm in. Hands down.
I have been here quite a few times and the servers, albeit seem super busy, all the time, know their stuff. They know the menu very well and are all aware of what beer choices are available and suited for your particular liking. I have always been happy when I have dined here, and see it as a go-to spot for game days and social outings with friends. 
The parking can be a challenge, but they have valet in the evenings which is brilliant.
Well played PB!

In true Park Burger fashion, this space is small and intimate. Not intimate as in a romantic, candlelit dinner restaurant, but it's nice and cozy. There are some seats at the bar, so if you're flying solo and are physically able, sit there to allow groups to be at the tables. 

It may be small, but they are fast!  The wait staff is attentive and quick. Whatever you need, they're on it. Go with one of their burger recommendations or build your own--you can even get yours on a bed of greens. Bunless--thanks for looking out for us gluten-free folk, Park Burger.  The Chilango is a favorite.  Also, do yourself a favor and order some fries. I'm a fan of the sweets myself.  While in ashamed to admit it, I have ordered the Conb salad too. Avocado, bacon, egg--all of the goodness--with fried onions too. Though it's a burger joint, the salads are well executed too!

They do happy hour...and they carry a variety of craft beer and made some killer shakes as well.  The entire experience is well crafted. Delicious burgers, fun environment, in and out.  If I lived near this location, I'd be here far more often.

We met up with some friends while visiting Denver and they brought us to Park Burger for dinner.  I was so hungry after a long day of hiking.  I ordered the El Mariachi burger which is a 
1/3 lb. patty, roasted green chilies, pepper jack, chili-lime sour cream, and pico de gallo.  I also added on a side of fries.  The burger was slightly overcooked, but still had a really nice flavor to it.  The fries were nothing to write home about, but I was hungry and they hit the spot.

This is my favorite burger joint in Denver, hands down.

My favorites are El Chilango (cheddar, jalapeños, guacamole), the Ahi Tuna burger, and have also been pleasantly surprised by the Lamb Burger (tzatziki sauce- mmm!)  Sweet potato fries are also good.

This is a very small restaurant, but service is personal, friendly, and prompt.
Love the burgers, shakes, fries.....all of it! Used to live down the street, now it's a long drive, but maybe they  will open more locations soon! Two thumbs up!

They were busy on a Friday night, but the service was atrocious. 

My bf and I sat at the bar for a quick bite and some beer. Servers were constantly walking by us and looking at us from behind the bar (it's a tiny bar) yet we were never acknowledged. Not until 10 minutes in, I finally reached out and asked for 2 waters. After ordering our beers I figured it'd be a smart idea to order food right away, or else we might not ever get their attention again. 30 minutes later another bartender approached us and said, 'your ticket was lost in the kitchen. Can I have your order again?' No apology, no effort to redeem themselves, no care in the world. We reordered. 10 minutes later I asked if our order of French fries could just come out first as we were starving by this point. We eventually got our food, scarfed it down, & paid the bill. Still no acknowledgement from the staff that our order was lost.

We will not be back. Highland Tap Burger has better burgers and they actually have service.

Food is better at the RiNo location.

Little place with awesome burgers. We ordered park burger, buffalo burger, and shared the works. The service was good and fast. The burgers were so juicy and great, although the size was way to big. The works was so good at first. Then as we progressed, the fries were all soggy and soaked in the sauce too much, even though we didn't spend that much time. So that was disappointing. But I will definitely go back for more burgers. I really want to try other burgers, but they don't seem to come in different sizes. The only small burgers they have is their little burger. I wish their speciality burgers also come in smaller sizes.

Nothing to add beyond what we've said in the past.   Park Burger is the best (and remains the best) burger in town, and their staff is tops.  

Don't forget a side of Parmesan-Truffle fries and a shake or malt.  (PS- they have salads too)

Park burger is our #1 go-to burger spot.  It's simply the best overall burger in Denver metro.  Others challenge this title, others may even grab it (for a while), but Park Burger serves up consistency and longevity.  For years now it's simply the best burger around, with a great, friendly staff, great Parmesan truffle fries and a decent shake.  If you haven't been, go.

This may be a long review but to start off, I am in the service industry and I know exactly the in's and out's of service. I know what it takes to make a tip and I know what it takes to leave a customer pissed the fuck off. This review has a little bit of everything, so for others willing to read this review, here you go:

We used to go here all the time, but stopped coming as much since the service has been going downhill for some time now. We finally came back in yesterday since we were in the neighborhood and were really craving burgers and wanted to give Park Burgers another shot. There were 2 girls working at 2pm yesterday. There was only 1 other table there so it was  slow. No reason to not get service.

Anyways, one of the girls (lets call her server A) comes over, gives us our waters and menus. We sat for a good 5 minutes before the server A came back. I asked her if we were could order then she replies, "Oh, let me grab your server" with a bitchy attitude (#1 red flag right there). Server B comes over (from literally just sitting at the back tables talking to the other employees) takes our order and leaves. The food comes out and we had 1 request for 1 burger and she couldn't even get that right. Anyways we let that slide. No biggie (redflag #2).

We sat there for about 30-45 minutes and the entire time Server B checked up on us once. She was again, sitting at the back table, just talking and talking to the other employees (redflag #3). Towards the end when we were all finished, I placed my wallet on the table with my credit sitting on top (YOU COULDN'T MISS IT). Server B walked back and forth for a good 10 minutes, glanced over at least 3 times, and didn't bother to get the check or ask if we needed too boxes (redflag #4). We had to ask the Server A for our check and boxes which AGAIN her reply was "Oh, let me get your server" with that same bitchy attitude and miraculously Server B comes back (at this point I stopped counting, I was just done and wanted to get out of there).

In the end, our bill was $52 which I left a hefty $10 tip, which was by far MORE than anyone else would have left in this situation. If I was that type of person I would have left $0 tip, but I wanted to be fair and I understand the frustration when a customer leaves nothing, and so still left a decent tip anyways. Funny, I guess they thought that wasn't good enough as the next part pissed me off so much I am NEVER coming back here again.

We left the restaurant, get to the car and start loading (we were parallel parked directly in front of the restaurant window) for a good 5 minutes. I get ready to drive off, only to realize I had forgotten my sunglasses inside. Came back in, went straight to the table, which was completely cleared by now and asked the Server B if she had seen my sunglasses since 1) I know for sure I had left it on the table and 2) no one had made any effort to even walk out the door to give them to me. She pauses for a good time, then goes, "Oh, yeah, they're right here" with the same bitchy attitude as Server A!! She then reaches under the little desk near the register, hands them to me and just smirks and walks away.

Just shows me these girls don't care about service whatsoever. I may have tipped you more than you deserved but your lack of service or gratitude definitely encourages me to never come back again. Thank you.

It's a shame really, I really like the food here but good food + shitty service = shitty place.

After a couples massage the hubs and I headed out for lunch. We made a last minute decision to stop in here for a burger and fries. We got one of the last two available tables right before a swarm of people came in. 

I opted for the park burger with bacon and an over easy egg. The hubs got the croque burger that had an over easy egg, ham and Swiss cheese.

We ordered the truffle Parmesan basket o fries to share and it was a huge portion of fries. Not that we left any of course because they were delicious. 

Service was quick and friendly and the burgers hit the spot.

My boyfriend and I came here a couple months ago, and I've been dying to go back! I ordered The Scarpone burger, which I can confidently say is the best burger I've ever had. I'm not usually one that finishes entire meals at a restaurant, especially burgers, but I wasn't able to put this one down and finished it before my boyfriend finished his (which never happens)! The lemonade was delicious and refreshing as well. My boyfriend had el Chilango and he loved it as well! I'm definitely hoping we will come back very soon!

What a find! If you like burgers and fries you've got to try this place. I had the Royale Burger, parmesan truffle fries and a chocolate malted milkshake. One of the best burger meals of my life! The parmesan truffle fries were so good I took some back for the hosts at my B&B. They liked them so much we went back 2 more times during my six days in Denver to get takeout fries to go with meals back at the B&B.

The food was good, if not a little pricey, the atmosphere was clean and friendly, and the waitstaff was nice and helpful. 

I ordered a caramel Heath shake and was nervous at what seemed like a small size for $5 when it came out, but it was delicious! I worked at an ice cream shop for 4 years so I'm somewhat of an ice cream snob, but that shake was fantastic!

I also had the lamb burger, which was undercooked but still yummy, and the truffle fries, salty but delicious! Everything is ordered ala carte so out bill come out to be over $30 for one beverage, one milkshake, two burgers and two fries. I feel like that's a little pricey but I'd probably come back here because it was so tasty!

Great little burger joint in the Denver area. I've heard people say cherry cricket is the place to go for burgers here. I've tried it and it doesn't hold a flame to park burger. Great service and the burgers were amazing. I would definitely recommend this place and will be back for more when I'm in the Denver area.
amazing burgers, hip part of town, very overpriced. 4 stars for yummyness, lost one for paying 12 bucks for lunch. a burger should be 6 dollars in the most extreme case.

Great food, great service, love all the staff, and is always super clean.  Can't think of anything negative to say.  Shout out to Griffin -- he's taken care of me multiple times and in my opinion one of the best servers in Denver!

This one was a treat.  I came here at the suggestion of a friend, and had a swiss burger with sautéd shrooms, onions and lettuce and tomato.  cooked medium.  I skipped the fries in order to kid myself into thinking Im on a low carb diet.....Yeah,,,, Right!  I must say that they nailed it!  it WAS a great burger and I will return!

Well this is my second time here,  the first time was THE BEST BURGER I've had in my 11 years here, in the Denver area.  Truly, it's one of those things that you just can't stop eating;it just that darn delicious!  From the yummy pickles to cheeses.  As well as great fries. 

The waitstaff is exceptionally friendly as well as customer service oriented.  This is my new favorite burger place!
Kind of loud, but excellent burgers. Their burger sauce goes surprisingly well with the green chile and pico de gallo on the El Mariachi. Tasty thin cut fries. Quick service.
Very good burger joint.  Seating is tight, but they have a small parking lot.  The service is very friendly.

My new FAVORITE hamburger! All four of us were extremely happy with the burgers. It was a good sized patty,  cooked just as we'd ordered, good texture and tasted like real meat! So yummy.  We also ordered side salad, sweet potato fries, regular fries and ice cream cone. 
The salad was crisp and featured 'real' lettuce (not iceberg). We all liked the sweet potato fries. They were the best I've had! I didn't like the regular fries, but everyone else did. I thought they were limp and greasy. The ice cream cone hit the spot, but was nothing exceptional. Next time I am ordering a shake because they looked deliious.

My friends had margaritas and they said they were very good. That's high praise since they frequently order margaritas.

This place is pretty small and it was really busy when we arrived, but  our server was patient, friendly and efficient . She was a young lady with a long dark ponytail. She was great. (I wish I'd gotten her name.) Other employees were very nice as we passed by to use the restroom and navigate out. I loved the vibe here and the food was GREAT! 

I can't wait to come back with my husband.

Another chill local place I got to experience while visiting friends in Denver. This is one of my friend's favorite place so we came here for dinner. A couple of specialty burgers and make your own options. I liked that I could get it on a bed of greens to make it seem healthier. The greens and veggies were fresh. I got a regular patty with grilled mushrooms - the burger was a bit overcooked but juicy enough. Staff was friendly and I can see this as a nice neighborhood spot.

I really liked this place. I don't get over to this part of the Highlands neighborhood very often, but I'm glad I ventured out a bit further. The atmosphere was pretty cool. They had these unique art renditions of their signature burgers that were eye catching and cute. Staff was friendly and observant. Most importantly, the burgers were really tasty, as were the fries. Definitely will remember this place next time I'm feeling a good burger and a beer.
Definitely one of the best burgers I've had locally. I plan to bring my family back to try it out. The staff was very attentive and the burgers are awesome!

Simply put: they get it right. Good meat options that include buffalo and turkey. Good sauces. Fries are excellent. And the buns...maybe the best part. Specialty burgers are good selections as well. Cannot say enough good about. Oh...and good beer and milkshake choices. Must visit.

Great food.  Service was just ok.  As for the food, we all had the Scarpone burger.  It had some chopped peppers on it (gierdeniera?), as well as pancetta, cheese and garlic truffle oil.  Best burger ever.  We also had the loaded French fries.  Very tasty.  Crispy, and just the right amount of bacon, cheese and toppings.  Often this kind of dish is so smothered you don't taste anything buy cheese.  Not here.  Seriously, the food was amazing.

We finished the meal by splitting a couple of shakes.  Cookies and cream--yummy.

Now about the service.  It was early on a Friday night, so it wasn't busy at all.  The server was pleasant enough.  She just didn't seem into it.  I don't know, maybe they were going for trendy indifference?  What ever it was didn't work for me.  When we got there we ordered four beers.  She was helpful taking the order, but then the beers took 15 minutes.  Literally 15 minutes.  We flagged her down to inquire about the issue, and her response was "maybe they had another order before you"..  Really? Wasn't good at following up either.  If we wanted something, we needed to find her.

Overall, I think the food was a 5, and service was a generous 3.  I would still go back, and just assume that the indifferent service was a fluke.

I'm always on the search for a great burger and this place did not disappoint, in fact, it was one of the best in recent memory.  Meat was good size but not overwhelming with just the right amount of grease.  Fries were excellent as well.  Room is cozy but not cramped.  Staff was great - friendly but not hovering.  I highly recommend!

Park Burger:
Excellent restaurant, excellent fries and excellent Burgers!! You have to checo this Restaurant when you are AT Denver

This is one of the best burger restaurants I've ever been to in my life.

The Croque Burger was outstanding and their shakes are terrific.  I tried a Peanut Butter Chocolate Strawberry Shake ... my mouth is still watering.  SO Good.

I also really enjoyed the Waldorf Salad and the French Fries.

The next time you're craving a Burger, make sure to try this place.  You won't regret it.

ENJOY!
Food is great service was excellent.... very close to 5 stars but I need to try more food before I do that haha I has a turkey burger with mushrooms cheese and caramelized onions and it was amazing
These folks do what they do better than anyone else. Wonderful burgers that come quickly. Great to grab a beer with friends and also family friendly. Homerun.

Highlands is by far my favorite Park Burger location. 
The burgers are DELICIOUS, and I get just the basic Park Burger... It doesn't even need anything on it. The plain, truffle, and sweet potato fries are all absolutely worth trying, and the staff there is great. 
Sometimes we pick up orders for carry out, and they're always super prompt and accurate. Plus, the gluten free buns are more than two pieces of toasted cardboard, so that's always a win.
Good burgers but what made it was the truffle fries.  Lots o places these days do a good burger so you have to stand out somewhere and the fires did that.

Really great burgers!!!

Small place and crowded...wish there was more room here cause it would be more comfortible. Otherwise, it a good little joint!

Not too shabby for a tuna burger in Denver. Place is tiny and very stuffy. No air circulation. If it weren't for the patio we would have left. Patio= barstools looking at the street, so not everyone's cup of tea. Pleasant staff, decent beer on tap. Just small and stuffy.

I order take-out here often, and I have never had a problem with anything. The burgers and fries are delicious, and the shakes are a bit pricey but also sooooo good. My favorite things to order are the el chilango burger, truffle fries and the caramel heath shake. There is a large TV inside where you can watch whatever sporting game is on, and there is also a small outdoor seating section with bar stools where you can people watch 32nd Ave.
BLUE CHEESE KETTLE CHIPS ~ a must order, if you're into blue cheese & house made chips these are your bestfriend. The mini burger is perfect size & their jalapeños are actually hot:]

Park Burger is a small spot near the highlands that does big things in a small area.   When I asked my wife why we were gong here, when there were tons of burger spots closer, she just looked at me, said "Their sweet potato fries.", and shook her head in disbelief.  

Oh. 

When we walked in from the cold, the warmth from the open-kitchen floated and surrounded us.  

The host/waiter called to us, saying "Sit anywhere!'.  We grabbed a snug spot on the back wall, close to the window, nestled between 2 other tables.  It reminded me of a NY deli, where you are eating with total strangers (except at Park, you don't share tables).  By the end of the evening, we had made friends with 2 other tables, so I walked away in high spirits with great food and conversation to boot,

I've recently become more indecisive with my food and the pattern is this:  I look at the menu and decide on something I really want.  Then the waiter comes and says "Look at the special" and my choice is now corrupted. 

It happened here when I was presented with a burger with a habanero mayo, when I already had decided a burger covered with crispy pancetta, smothered in a truffle oil.  

2 different styles: heat vs crunchy salt and rich truffle

I went with the special.  Gah~Thick burger and chewy (in a good way) buns, with thick dill pickle chips which really crunched.   

The  wife went with a standard menu item and thenb ordered off the happy hour beer list, an Avery beer (local!)

After we finished our meal and declined desert because we were stuffed, we packed up and left.  Great spot to grab a burrger, and it would be even better in the summer day, as the front street would be full of pedestrian traffic. Park will be a good spot to make future memories at.

What a neighborhood restaurant should be!  Arguably the best burgers in town and an amazing staff who are always courteous and attentive!

Always consistent and great food - the monthly specials are always spot on and unique.  Lucky to have a place like this only a 5 minute walk away!!

I really love Park Burger. They have a dedicated fryilator for French fries which makes them Gluten Free! I am a huge fan of fries but can never eat them so this is a double bonus for me. Try the truffle fries - they are amazing. 

They also offer Udi's buns, which in my opinion aren't that great, but that Udi's problem not theirs! I commend them for carrying buns at all! 

I love sitting outside and people watching. I always get the same guy that waits on me and he is super friendly and can always recommend a good beer. 
I highly recommend!

I think I've been spoiled... 

We tried this location since we've experienced the South Pearl location a few times already, just to see the differences, compare a bit... the verdict is the Highland location is good but it's lacking.  Lacking in outdoor seating (there's a small bar setting that faces the street which is probably good for people watching) and service was fine but nothing special. The food also wasn't special. I got the Popper so I could compare apples to apples, my man got the Croque again for the same reason.  Still delicious, don't get me wrong, but... I don't know. I really can't put my finger on what's missing.  

We also branched out from our norm of blue cheese kettle chips & got the sweet potato fries. Again, good, but they didn't stand out from others I've had.
Just landed in Denver from Portland and found this place! Very awesome environment, as well as amazing food and service!!! Recommend to everyone!!!

Not only was the food amazing, but they went above and beyond with their customer service.  My boyfriend and I ordered Door Dash (the 5th and last time they will screw up delivery for us), and showed up with a half an order, replaced one of our missing burgers with a side of chips, and until I got a hold of support (which is goddamn near impossible since neither patrons nor restaurants can contact them directly), were going to give me "credit" and not a refund.  Park Burger took care of us on their own account and even sent us extra items.  They were courteous, helpful, and best of all our food arrived hot.  We both ordered burgers and the kelt blue chips which were awesome.  We also received some courtesy milkshakes on the house.  I highly, highly recommend both for food quality and for the best customer service [only] I have ever received in this city.  Thanks Park Burger for turning a bad delivery from Door Dash into a amazing dinner.  We truly appreciate it!

This is hands down one of my favorite burger places. I have never had such a flavorful, wonderfully mastered hamburger. The juices were flowing, the flavors were exploding and my taste buds were scandalized. Fabulous. 

I had The Royale burger, containing thick slices of bacon, globs of salty blue cheese and onions caramelized to perfection. My mouth made love to this burger so hard and I never wanted it to end. I also order the Parmesan truffle fries and they were glorious. 

My only regret is that I am only able  to visit a couple times a year, since I don't live in CO.

This place has really gone down hill lately. They have a bunch of untrained servers who can never get my order right. The happy hour menu isnt really happy...example...nachos are reduced from 7 dollars to 6 but they take out the pulled pork. Is that really a deal?  Oh. Guess what...if you want to add pork on the happy hour order its 2 dollars extra which is one dollar more than the nachos with pork on the regular menu. I dont feel i need to give this place any more of my money when they feel they need to cheat me. Maybe they are just plain stupid. Haha.

As much as I am "always hungry for a bowl of pho" I'm about 99% as down to have a burger. We were pretty excited to try Park Burger and stopped by one rainy week night for our first taste. Summary: pretty good, but not great... what's all the fuss?

My wife had the Scarpone and I had The Popper. Hers was pretty darn good with the gardiniera (a relish or tapenade?) adding nice texture and a bit of sourness much like the traditional pickles do. The Popper was a good in theory but I found the soft and slightly slimy chile did not add much to the burger. 

Park Burger loses a star in my review because my burger was waaaaay under-cooked. I always take the recommended doneness and enjoy a juiicy, pink center as much as the next guy but my burger was straight-up bloody. The bottom bun was falling apart because it was soaked in blood! It was kinda gross.

The thing is, the place was not that crowded and it was near closing time. Was this just an anomaly due to cooks nearing the end of their shirt? I'm not sure  but we'll be back to try the other options on the menu - I'm hoping this first was an unlucky experience.

Good!
Got the Park Burger: legit
Got the Buffalo Wings: flavor was traditional but there was something about the texture of the meat.
Wife had the Korean Wings: Stated that they were spicy, but lacked flavor.
I want to give this more stars.. i just dont think comparatively to other burger places.. that this place has the best burgers.  But the Strawberry Basil Lemonade is to die for!
Thanks Yelp for suggesting this wonderful burger place for me. Very good quality food, and very reasonably priced. The "small" fries is enough for two people!

Park Burger, I'd like to introduce myself to you.  My name is Randy Berger.  I'm a bit for a burger snob from LA, and wanted to let you know you helped recently with a much-needed 'fix' during my visit to Denver.  While you're not at my tippy-top, you got the goods a'plenty, and with ease made my "Berger Knows Burgers" with respect.  http://www.yelp.com/list/berger-knows-burgers-los-angeles-2.  For a $7-ish price-point and a handful of drafts, you kick serious arse.

For a first timer --

1.  Park "Royal" Burger (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/park-burger-denver-2#m_9X-KjV3dEJT4vnbgbVPw, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/park-burger-denver-2#ynsuGeDV5PbWIJIJnzPCvA) -- which is just about my favorite combo for a burger -- bacon, bleu cheese. and caramelized onions.  The burger was a decent size (6oz?), hand-formed thin, and well-seasoned.  The bun, oh the bun, was excellent -- very fresh, a bit sweet (nearly Hawaiian), and soft.  The bacon, crisp and plenty.  The bleu, a generous portion.  My dining companion got the same, but over a salad (instead of bun) for an extra 25 cents.  That's cool.

2.  Parmesan & Truffle fries (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/park-burger-denver-2#2d09DRCaXaorkFcmXcMwsQ) -- shoestrings, tasty, good flavor but needed salt.  The large feeds 45 people, or 2-3 hungry ones.  They also could be served hotter, or might have been lukewarm due to staffing issue (see below).

Why not 5 stars? --
The decor is simple and nearly fits being hipster, but not quite. The service while super nice, had only 2 people waiting tables -- which made delays to clean tables, ordering, and needless delays.  The place was hopping, and Park should be able to afford one extra staff working.

Great atmosphere.  We had a beef burger and tuna sandwich with the blue cheese potato chips.  Very tasty....   No a low fat place...  Tuna was very tasty. A nice sandwich with good flavor, slaw, guacamole...  It probably did not need the lettuce tomato, but mind did not last long.

As a proud resident of LoHi I can say this is THE burger joint in this part of town.  Every burger is unbelievable, perfectly juicy, great toppings...awesome fries as well.  My personal favorite is "the croque" with ham and over easy egg.  My wife loves their turkey burger.  The atmosphere is casual and $3 Tecate cans don't hurt either.  You will not be disappointed!

Park Burger is seriously one of my favorite Burger places in Colorado. All of their locations have the nicest staff. They just opened a location in the Rino neighborhood and we at outside on their awesome patio. One of the owners was there and he stopped by to chat and ask us our opinion about the food/atmosphere. 

The staff made awesome recommendations on food and portions and if you get something you don't like, they'll do everything in their power to keep you happy. Everyone seems to work together (have your back mentality which is hard to find). 

If you are with a group of people their large fry order is enough for 4 people to share and you can mix types! Get a basket of the truffle and sweet potato!

Great burgers. My favorite is the El Chilango, I love it. Guacamole, cheddar and jalapenos. It is super good.

The tuna steak is also really good as are the sweet potato fries. I've never had anything I didn't like here. Great spot for a quick dinner.

Great place to get a good burger, I love the fact that the kitchen is open and I can see exactly what is going on.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because my burger, no matter how much I ate, always sat entirely too heavy in my stomach, so I cannot frequent this place as much as I would like, also, the prices are a bit too steep (especially the chef's burger special for the day).  Otherwise good with tasty fries.

I've only been here once, but that's kind of the deal with burger places - if they do one patty right, there's a good chance they know what they're doing with the other ones, too.

We went on one of those rare-but-awesome 50 degrees+ Colorado January days and took advantage of it by hitting up the outdoor seating. It's quaint and mostly designed to seat two at a time, but you can crush in three people in a pinch (like we did). I can't vouch for indoors since I never set foot inside, but I'd imagine they offer a few bigger tables.

My brother and I both ordered the Royale (he had been here before and recommended it) along with some fries and his girlfriend ordered the Turkey-bacon-guac, no bun. I also grabbed a Ska Euphoria that happened to be on tap.

The burgers came out briskly and we all dug in. The chunks of bleu cheese seemed to actually coat some of the bacon, and they didn't skimp on any of the ingredients save perhaps a patty that seemed to disappear before the rest of the burger. The Euphoria was an excellent complement as well - if it's still available, I'd heartily recommend it. It was a savory, rich lunch that left me full without eating too much.

The turkey burger salad looked good as well and everybody cleaned their plates. Making a mental note of this place for next time I'm in the area and in need of a quick burger fix.

Everything I expected and a little more. Food came out super quick too. The mudslide shake was perfect. Service was excellent. There was a little something missing from the taste of my burger but all in all it was good. Truffle fries were tasty and paired well with the meal. Would return again when wanting that type of food.

Great food. Great price. Awesome staff.

Best veggie burger and Ahi tuna burger I've ever had. Really awesome seating in the back alley. These are a must-eat.

Cons: sweet potato fries were classic, nothing special which I expect from this place because everything else was so dapper...and yet we couldn't help but eat every one of 'em...hell, I'm just glad they made the right move to have them on the menu. :)

Stopped in on Sunday and the atmosphere here is amazing. I had the kale salad that was a little dry but next time I will just order with extra dressing, or try the quinoa one. My boyfriend had a burger which was legitimately one of the best I've tasted, and realistically that is what you are supposed to order at this place. Grabbed a glass of wine since it was such a nice day and their prices are so affordable. We will definitely be back.
So good. We are regulars... Get some truffle fries and you won't regret it.
Strait up burger bar. Place kicks ass get a classic made to order burg and truffle fries. Can't go wrong.

I can't believe I'm giving Park Burger and Larkburger both 4 stars, because really they're not in the same class. Maybe I should just go ahead and give this place 5 stars because honestly every time I've eaten here I've fallen in love. Ok, I just changed it. 5 stars it is. Yay! High fives all around. 

This is the kind of place where dreams are made. Or maybe it's the kind of place where your dreams turn into reality. Did I just say the same thing twice? Either way, trust me, you need to go here. Now!!!! 

Look, I don't even know why you're still reading this...why aren't you on your way to Park Burger yet??! Go!!!!!!

My review is specifically for this location. I've been to the others, and they're good, but not as good as this location for some reason. I've eaten probably everything on the menu here, and I just want to tell you, it's all been amazing. 

Do yourself a favor and get a shake with your burger....and get Parmesan fries...and you'll soon be posting your own 5 star review of this place. Trust me. It's that good.

Now go on, get to it. What are you waiting for?

Small, but comfortable space with quick service. Walked by and decided to stop in for a burger and a beer and was impressed. I ordered the Park Burger and truffled fries. The burger was juicy, medium thickness patty. Specialty sauce (comes on the burger) was good, but not overly noticeable. The fries were very good, though I am a sucker for truffle fries so I am slightly biased. The staff was very friendly. The draft beer selection is limited but they have a rotation of beers in addition to their house beer. Stop by if you are close and want a burger!

Fantastic Burgers! This was our first visit, so I went with the popular Royale burger.  I was not disappointed! The buns are soft and buttery, and the meat has great flavor.  My partner in crime ordered the Scarpetto, which was also fabulous.  We tried both the sweet potato and their famous parm truffle fries, and both were highly addicting!   They offer many options for building your own burger, including meatless, turkey and bison, along with GF buns. The shakes looked amazing, but I had to go with a beer! 

Only downfall I can see about this location, is the size of the restaurant.  It's tight, but the service is quick, so table turn around seems like it would be fast.  

We will be back!!
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!  Food is consistently excellent, service is amazing, when my family comes to visit, we go here at least twice!
Came here on vacation. The lamb burger was decent but would get something else next time. Good atmosphere and beer selection.

I'm so glad this burger joint is so close to where I live (it may be a bad thing since I'm addicted to their fries....)! Anyways, I got the Royale and the Works Fries and they do not skimp out on their toppings!! The Royale comes with caramelized onions, bleu cheese and bacon and let me tell you -- every single bite had every single topping. My biggest pet peeve is when burger joints don't put too much toppings so that your left with the last few bites without goodies, but this place does not disappoint! (The 1/3 burger patty was also cooked to perfection - a true medium!) And my god.. the works?! So delicious because of that cheese sauce -- I kept going back for the sauce even when we ran out of fries!
Giving it three as burgers are often greasy. Have had hit or miss here. The burgers also taste saltier than other places I've been to. Not my fav burger place.

It's a burger and it's greasy. There are many different options for topping this burger off. The patty tastes meaty. What more can I say? It's not gonna blow your mind (unless you're easily blown away), but will satisfy that manly urge to consume a burger.

Delicious burgers and sweet potato fries! Friendly staff, excellent service, & great atmosphere! Completely exceeded my expectations, I will definitely be going back. They also have some outdoor seating, it was easy to find a parking spot along the street. My husband and I LOVE this place!
Good food, Good energy, great spot to stop and eat, very popular but definitely worth the wait.

so I revisited this location even though they were very busy I was seated quickly. I ordered the same burger as before and ordered fries as opposed to the blue cheese chips. The service was very good and I never felt wanting for drink or food or condiments. The burger and fries showed up only around 8-10 minutes after I ordered which I consider fast the bun had a nice toast to it.  The pickle, lettuce and tomato were fresh. And it was a perfect medium rare as I had ordered. The burger had a lot of complex flavor and I enjoyed it. However I stopped eating the burger to enjoy the fries and same as last time the burger was so greasy that it soaked through the bun as it sat still while I ate the fries and even went through the paper on the basket and onto the table underneath. That may be a characteristic of this particular burger. But a little too greasy for me. So I subtracted a star from the update. The fries were nicely cooked and salted. I did receive mostly broken fries and end pieces. However customers to my side had received whole fries. They were so good I did not really care they were mostly end pieces. 

Overall a very pleasant trip and I plan to frequent this establishment in the future.



**old review**
Perhaps I may have come in at a bad time. Maybe the cook had been having a bad day.
I ordered the royal burger, first burger on their specials list. Also heard their kettle blue cheese chips were very good. So I ordered both. The burger showed up well done. I had ordered medium rare. Also the bottom bun was so full of grease it fell apart while I tried to eat it. None of the toppings stayed on the burger it was so greasy. I only ate half the burger and moved onto the kettle chips. They also were not crunchy but a soggy mess. The chips had little to no rigidity. And I had to eat what little i did with a fork. Flavor was good but soggy chips ruined the side dish.

I will come back another time. And try a different burger and see if this was a one time thing and update my review accordingly.

Not all that impressed but I didn't try their "actual" burgers. Been eating only fish lately so we went to try their much ballyhooed veggie burger. Why does everyone think it is so good? Tasted like an over-seasoned hashbrown sandwich.

Fries were just OK. Margarita was good but it should have been for $8. Service was pretty good. Bathroom smelled like old football pads.

Definitely will give them another try if/when I'm back eating meat, but not until.
Our meal here was fine; nothing wowed us or deterred us.  I did like the different burger size options... Sometimes you just don't want that third-pounder!!

Great service. Great food. Good price. If you have a craving for a burger, this place should be able to exceed all expectations. I had the croque burger, the truffle fries and a lemonade. I would totally order that meal for dinner seven days a week if I didn't know better. It's that good.

Definitely as good as it gets!

Park Burger focuses on delicious, juicy burgers.  I mean, come on, it's right in their name.  I've been to this location 3 times now, and each time I've had a different burger.  First I tried just their standard Park Burger with Cheese.  It's a juicy, 1/3 lb burger with cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion and pickles.  Burger perfection if I've ever tasted it.  The second burger I had was their BBQ Burger.  Again, a juicy 1/3 lb burger with cheddar, BBQ sauce, and crispy onion straws.  Just sublime.  On my last visit I had the Double Park Burger with Cheese.  I would not have ordered this if it were 2 1/3 lb patties.  Luckily, it's 2 1/4 lb patties, and it was filling and delicious.  

Paired with their crispy-hot, salty fries you really can't go wrong!  

I look forward to trying some of the other specialty burgers at Park Burger!

This is a local place for me so I figured I would check it out. All the reviews seem to be good so why not? Oh, and there were several options on the menu that caught my eye so I knew that there would be something I would want.

I ordered the El Chilago (didn't mean to be redundant) burger since it was what I was in the mood for and several people seemed to like it on Yelp. To me, it was average at best. I felt like the patty was way too skinny although it does say 1/3 pound so I guess that falls on me. I was disappointed that the burger had no kick to it whatsoever and that it was a bit too overpowered by the guacamole. With that said, it was made medium rare as I asked and it was pretty juicy. 

I didn't mean to get a shake but I was messing around with my phone and noticed several reviews for the chocolate/peanut butter shake so I went with it. What I could say? I think the yelpers nailed it... I really enjoyed it.

I think this place was fine and I liked the little local feel to it. I guess my biggest problem was what I was getting for the money. I paid $14 for the burger and the shake (with tax but not tip). In my point of view, for what I got, I think $8-10 would be max. And I understand the burgers as never frozen and come from Harris ranch but it's just my opinion that it's overpriced.

Stopped by this little burger place after a couple hours at a nearby climbing gym. I ordered the buffalo burger and a cherry soda. I had to slow myself down while eating, it was sooo good! The staff was also friendly and the food came out quickly.

Wanted to update my review after my most recent visit to this Park Burger location. I'm glad I gave it another try -- this experience was far better. 

I ordered a regular medium rare cheeseburger with "the works" fries. Service was pretty bad this time, actually -- certainly not as good as before, but the food itself was far better. I was very pleased with  my burger -- cooked perfectly --  and the fries were the tops. My medium rare came out medium rare, which is RARE in this town, to say the least. Everything tasted very good. It was a delightful meal. 

If service tightens up there's no reason this place shouldn't get a strong five star review. Until then, four...and a strong recommendation from me to you to go on and try this place.
The burgers had good flavor and the fries were good. The only complaint would be you had to add on any toppings to your burger for a price.

I honestly didn't expect much coming here for happy hour with a friend. I was really pleasantly surprised! The happy hour is pretty legit, where I got to try Left Hand's Good Juju on draft. The works fries can't be missed. They're really crispy, with the right amount of toppings. I ordered the special of the day burger, which had brie, arugula, balsamic dressing, and green apple. FANTASTIC. The meat was juicy, a little over medium rare but no big deal, and the flavors were awesome. The bun was also perfectly toasted. The best part about this place? FAST service. It's a small joint, but I would definitely come back.

Mmmm Park Burger. This location is just as good as the original. 

Fantastic service and delicious eats. 

Their Milk Shakes totally bring all the boys to the yard and their milk shakes are better than yours. They will also fill you up before your burger hits the table but you gotta get one. 

Burgers, so damn good! I enjoyed the Mini Park Burger on this visit and there was seriously nothing mini about it.

But the Works Fries, be still my heart. They are SO GOOD! So good I'm actually kind of tired that we are getting a few orders to share amongst our group. I don't want to share anymore! I want an order all to myself! 

I seriously love Park Burger and it's totally the best burger in D-Co.

I love this little restaurant. The decor is super cute and I just want to bring a book in and read. The egg and feta sandwich is divine and I've tried to re create it at home to no avail. 

My most recent trip in was for the veggie burger with a cucumber soda. The burger is house made and just tastes delicious especially with the cheese and mayo on ciabatta bread. We had come on a hot day so the cucumber soda was cool and refreshing. I am so glad my new project has me five minutes from here.

Very cute little breakfast place, the decor is adorable with lots of spoons adorned to the walls.

I had a delicious yogurt, granola and fruit bowl. The granola was definitely notable, it was sweet with added dried fruit which made it extra special. There was a healthy serving of assorted fruits and rich yogurt which made for a filling and tasty breakfast.

The service was friendly and speedy.

I came here on Saturday brunch, and I was surprised that the store was almost empty! Like the other reviews mention, the decor and the look of the restaurant are both beautiful. I can see it getting a little cramped, but I think it adds to very homey atmosphere. 

My boyfriend and I ordered the turkey with cranberry chutney sandwich, a slice of blueberry cake, and a hot coffee.  We took the food on our trip to Rocky Mountain National Park, and the food was yummy, but I have to admit the prices were high for such small portions. The main thing that disappointed me about this place was the coffee - it was so sour! I don't know if I came at a bad time or something, but that's the major reason that I gave this place an average review. Sorry - can't tolerate bad coffee ever!

Turkey bacon Swiss sandwich and chicken pesto sandwich were both incredible! $9 seemed a bit high for 1 sandwich but it was so good anyway! I'd say it's more like $$ instead of $ though. Would still recommend to a friend.

I mean, is the name straight out of the Hipster Name Generator? Ya, it lands solidly in that turf. But so do some of my favorite places, so don't let the post-hipster era backlash keep you from popping in.

What you'll find is a pretty simple coffee shop and cafe with a really laid back, come and order at the counter, kind of vibe. We descended upon the place and ordered lots of all the things, and even though it was a larger group, we didn't have to wait too terribly long to get sandwiches and coffee and the like.

I don't exactly recall what I had, so that's a sign that they're not slinging some boundary-pushing meals. But it's also a sign that everything was satisfactory and I have no complaints. As a non-coffee dude, I can't comment on the brew so you're on your own there.

It's a small space, so don't go with a big group (ie do as I say, not as I did) but no matter the size of your group, I would bet they'll still be kind and courteous as they were on my trip. Just a nice neighborhood find with no pretense, and a hipster name.

This place is exceptional. Their grilled cheese is the best I've ever had. Don't forget the sweets and magic bars, service is equally high quality. Better than the nearby coffee shops who throw their pretension at you, this is a quaint and cozy hipster paradise. Nice location, convenient parking as well.

I loved this place. The vibe is adorable. It has a great menu and the person working behind the counter was super friendly and helpful. 

My only complaint is that it's pretty small so getting a spot but can be tough but overall I love this place.
One of the best sandwiches I've ever had (TBS), but the service sucks. I won't go again just because of the cold shoulder the guys had. Smile a little...it won't kill you.

Though the staff was friendly and the space is cute and cozy, I wasn't overly wow-ed by anything I ate or drank at Hutch & Spoon.  I got an artichoke and sundried tomato pesto panini and there was an overwhelming amount of artichoke (that would not stay inside the sandwich!) on it.  My husband got the turkey bacon swiss panini and shared some with me and while I liked it much better than my own sandwich, I didn't love that one either.  I love the idea of housemade soda, but I felt the taste learned more towards soda water than apple-lime.  I should mention, however, that my husband LOVED everything about this place and called it his favorite sandwich EVER.  To each their own!

The breakfast sandwiches, while tasty, are tiny (actually just *half* of a sandwich), the cream for the coffee was spoiled, the fella behind the counter acted like he was doing us a favor, and it's so cramped that four different people in line elbowed me in the back of the head. Left after about five minutes and have no intention of going back.

This is probably Hipster Xanadu for people more interested in photographing their food than eating it, but I'd rather go somewhere where I can count on warm service, reasonable portions, and not getting a mild concussion from the professional wrestling customer base that seems to love this spot.

(Would give 1.5 stars if possible because the tiny sandwich was tiny delicious. Maybe they only brought me the first half of it?)

I went to Hutch and Spoon today for lunch because I was in the area and saw the amazing reviews. I wasn't disappointed! Even though I arrived a little after 3, less than an hour before they closed, I received friendly and thorough service.

I ordered their veggie patty on top of their pear and goat cheese salad. The veggie burger was homemade and satisfyingly delicious. I also got their house made cucumber soda, which I loved. You could see the fresh cucumber pulp in the glass, turning it a bright, refreshing shade of green. When I asked to take the soda to go, a young man working behind the counter graciously helped me!

I hope to go there again soon when I have a little more time to enjoy the adorable shop.

Hutch and Spoon is a hip little cafe in Rino. I like them because for one it's a bit of a food desert out here and also because the food is quite good. It's more on the pricey side I think but it is Denver so I can't really complain plus the serving sizes are worth it. The breakfast sandwich will fill you up for sure and their breakfast burrito is the size of a Chipolte burrito which is fantastic. I wish they had a lunch burrito in which case I'd be there more often. My co-workers choose Hutch and Spoon every time they do lunch. My only gripe with them is the size of the cafe. It's very small and not very cozy if you want to stay and eat unless you come on a downtime.
It's cute and the food's good, but it's better thought of as a coffee shop with some food.  The menu's really limited, and while it's good, it's definitely not "a brunch place."

I think if I eat myself to the point of being uncomfortable, the food is probably pretty dang good. 

We stopped here for lunch after flying into Denver before driving into Aspen, and I was just delighted with the choice. I had a hard time narrowing down my choice, but had a chicken salad sandwich which was to die for. I had an iced espresso drink as well, and my BF had a pannini sandwich with chips. We both left full and happy. My only complaint was the service was a bit slow, and the dining area a bit cramped (we ended up sitting right by the counter so we got bumped by a few people standing in line to order). They were clearly busy though, so I don't think that warrants a star off. 

I look forward to coming here again next time I'm in Denver!

Ya, charming little place in a good location. Unmemorable food choices on my first go round. Nothing about the experience made me want to bring my wife back to experience it, which is usually the sign that i really liked it. we'll see next time. I'd like to try the buffalo reuben and the meatloaf sub.

Ordered their chicken pesto with feta on sourdough sandwich for $8.50. This is their most popular. It's very savory and tasty. 

Note: They only have one power outlet near the window which is nice. They also have an outdoor seating area on the side of the building. They serve breakfast, lunch and include a beer, wine, espresso and house made soda menu.

Stopped in for breakfast after going to spin in a Saturday morning with my partner and our realtor (yes, it's true, if you think your realtor is awesome, they probably think you are, too. Befriend them. #lifegoals) and were pleasantly surprised at so much. 

Small restaurant, so be prepared to squish. Cute ambiance with employees who genuinely seem to want to be there. We opted for mimosas because the spin class was a bust and all ordered breakfast burritos. The service was quick! My negative was the lack of sauces. It was a touch hot and dry and I was hoping for some sort of cream-based something to cool it down and make it juicer, but they only had salsa. But that was the height of my troubles, so this place was awesome otherwise. 

Great prices, too! Split a little sweet from the counter afterward just to eliminate all of the hard work done in spin class. Worth it.

I've been coming here for lunch for years and have always had a wonderful experience and a delicious meal. The food is delicious - simple, fresh takes on classic comfort food. The homemade sodas are wonderful, especially the pineapple ginger. The owner is always very friendly and accommodating. I recommend it to anyone looking for a no fuss lunch in RiNo.
The breakfast bakeries and the meatloaf sand which are insane.  And the staff is anpleasure
Delicious food and the cucumber soda was excellent!

This place is awesome!! Great service, great food and the menu is posted up on the wall with all sorts of things made from scratch. It is definitely a smaller place, so if you have a really big party, you miiiight have a little trouble getting served at the same time....We ate there for breakfast and wished we could have stayed for lunch, as well :-))

I am visiting from out of state and am so happy  that my friend recommended this coffee shop/cafe!  The food, drinks and staff are absolutely wonderful!  I highly recommend the Curried Chicken Salad sandwich. I will definitely be coming back to this lovely restaurant.

I want to like this place more since it is right by where I live, but every time I go I always have a good, never great experience.  The coffee is mediocre.  The espresso drinks can't hold a candle to the 2-3 shops that are in the immediate vicinity.  The food is fine, though the portions are small and rather on the expensive side.  The service is hit or miss.  I sometimes feel like I'm inconveniencing the counter person.  I'll probably go a little out of my way to go elsewhere.
Love this place. Super low-key, super chill staff, good music and a really great breakfast sandwich.
Fantastic staff. Charming. Everything you want in your neighborhood coffee shop. They even have mimosas!
Great cozy little place with tasty sandwiches. Had buffalo pastrami sandwich that was well presented but not as good as I'd hoped. Staff is attentive and friendly.

What a cute place! Reminds me of Europe; loved their collection of spoons! The menu boards are so unique and please note they do change the menu items seasonally. I went in wanting to try the French Onion Soup sandwich that I've read so much about, but no such luck, it's only served in the winter time. Thank God my alternative, the "Roasted Meatloaf & Sharp Cheddar on sourdough" was offered. It turned out to be the best of the three sandwiches of the visit. The breads were buttery and had panini marks. The meatloaf smelled heavenly, if only it was a thicker slice. I mean, the name is "meatloaf", right? 

The "Curried Chicken Salad on Ciabatta" was an impulse order. The ingredients taste fresh and the curry dressing was pretty good but I'd like to introduce something here: SUGAR! I believe it'll elevate the flavor of the chicken salad so much if a little bit of sugar was used.

The "Grilled Cheese with Peach Chutney" sandwich was a sweet ending. It was the perfect amount of sweet + savory and the texture of the chutney paired with the thick slide of cheese made the whole thing creamy, it was unbelievable!

It's a good thing that each sandwich is paired with some green salads.

I thought service could be a little warmer... When I asked for a box to take leftovers to go, they offered to pack it for me, but it kinda of grossed me out a little when the guy just came out from behind the counter and grabbed my sandwiches. I mean, who knows where his hands have been. Am I being too unreasonable? But I forgive him because he was the only one who smiled; plus he explained how to reheat the hot sandwiches! 

3.5 stars.
Loved hanging out for coffee and worked on computer through lunch which was a veggie burger recommended by kit (morning staff.)  Worthy of stellar reviews.

This place has very yummy salads and sandwiches.  It's a small quaint space. Most tables only seat 2-3 people, a few options to push tables together for 4 tops.

The food is very good!  I had the chicken pesto sandwich.  Very well prepared.  Great baked goods made fresh in house too.

Staff is super friendly. Highly recommend this if you are in the neighborhood and are looking for a great lunch.

Not a friendly family environment. Too small. Maybe 8 tables total. Service lacks courtesy. DO NOT RECOMMEND IT for any groups maybe ok for couples. The lack of freshness is the most relevant tip about it. If you can, skip it.

I was recently in the area and I found Hutch and Spoon on Yelp. They have an amazing grilled cheese with chutney. I also enjoyed their homemade sodas. I wish I lived closer because it is a great lunch spot! It gets busy during the lunch rush so be prepared to wait.

Super cute restaurant in the heart of RiNo.  Chilli was delicious and just the right size. My dad had the grilled cheese, which he said was great and although he would have never thought to add it the raisins were a nice addition, but I don't do sweets and savory together, so glad I didn't order that.

I'm totally a fan of this place. Hutch and Spoon is a spot for great for a business casual meeting or to just sit back, relax and sip on a cup of Joe while you work on your laptop. I think one of the things that makes this place feel so comfortable is the natural lighting. Sunlight comes in from two sides of the building and makes the tiny space seem a bit larger than it actually is.

I had my usual fresh brewed coffee (black). Since it was morning, I also had the hankering to order a sausage breakfast sandwich. I'm happy to saw it wasn't too greasy or heavy - just a couple little links cut in half and served between two slices of toasted bread. The sausage had a touch of spice and other seasonings that definitely elevated the taste of this otherwise simple sandwich.

Also: Very friendly, courteous and helpful staff. I can always dig that. I'll have to try the house made soda next time in there.

Awesome little neighborhood coffee shop and cafe. Their food is a little pricy but it's definitely quality and very convenient in RiNo. Try the house made sodas and the egg and feta sandwich. Both are awesome.

The staff here is incredibly nice and extremely helpful. They are conscientious about dietary restrictions and gluten.  I had an outstanding sandwich and latte. The decor is cute, very eclectic.  The silverware is a mismatch of ehat looks like old estate sale cutlery. The spoons hanging on the wall will remind you of going to your grandmother's and some of her serving utensils and cutlery.

Very cute! Food very tasty and service was friendly. You can order to go or call ahead.
Had the tomato garbanzo soup with roasted beet salad ... yum. They serve beer, wine, mimosas. 
Even homemade sodas!

I stopped here while in Denver getting ready to catch a flight and head home from a long weekend ski trip in Summit County.

My handy Yelp app steered me to this place, which in turn steered me to Little Man Ice Cream (based on a recommendation from the owner of Hutch & Spoon). This place was just what I was in the mood for...it's a quaint little shop with salads, soups, sandwiches, homemade sodas, and pastries. I ended up ordering a grilled cheese w/ peach chutney and an almond-pear soda. The sandwich was absolutely delectable! It was pretty big, perfectly toasted, full of ooey gooey cheese, and balanced out perfectly with the sweet & chunky peach chutney. Even though a grilled cheese isn't necessarily pushing the limits of the culinary world...this one was exceptionally good and executed perfectly. The sandwich was served alongside a tiny salad with a light, lemon vinaigrette...which was perfect to cut the richness from the carb/cheese overload of the sandwich.

The soda was also delicious. It was not overly sweet or carbonated. I could taste the nuttiness from the almond and a slight sweetness from the pear to make for a nice & refreshing drink. I also tasted the pineapple-ginger and cherry-vanilla sodas. I wasn't a huge fan of the cherry one and the pineapple one was pretty tasty, but mine was my favorite. The pineapple one would be really nice in the summer since it was lighter than mine, but since it's winter, I preferred the almond-pear.

There isn't much seating here so if you come during peak hours, you may have trouble finding a place to sit. The employees do seem to clean the tables off fairly quickly as people leave, so hopefully you won't have too much of a problem because this place is definitely worth trying out (even if you have to eat your sandwich standing up)!

As I am Idaho-born, I tend to be a tad too friendly for some people, but I feel right at home in Hutch & Spoon! H&S has an awesome staff, who sure are nice, even in the wee hours of the morning AND... I have fallen for their sandwiches. Just those two things would make me give this place 4 stars, but here is my detailed breakdown...

The Grand.
I love the atmosphere - cute, cozy, artsy - perfect for RiNo
Easy-peasy street parking
My tush likes their seating
There is no cheap plastic crud here, this includes real silverware... and H&S once even let me use a hand-knit coffee sleeve (so sweet!) 
Delicious eats: pumpkin bread, pesto/chk sandwich and definitely their egg & feta breakfast sandwich - yum!
Not too busy, you can actually hear yourself think & sip
They source their ingredients locally - locavores rejoice!

The Precautions.
They close at 4pm... which makes me a little sad.
Homemade sodas sounds cool... but they're not for everyone...

All in all, one of my fave places to visit when I'm celebrating Small Business Saturdays or just for a morning pick-me-up.

Tiny, adorable space with delicious sandwiches and unique, housemade Italian sodas.  

You order at the counter, and they bring out your food on cute plates with silverware and cloth napkins.  Love that!  

The menu rotates.  I've liked all of the sandwiches that I've tried, especially the roasted red pepper sandwich with pesto and mozzarella.  Sandwiches come with a simple green salad, perfectly dressed with a vinaigrette.  Love that too!   

I've also liked all of the Italian sodas that I've tried, especially the cucumber soda and pineapple ginger soda. 

I have yet to try the coffee and sweet treats, but I'll get to those sometime.

Maybe the hummus plate is a bad representation, but I'm really not stoked on the food I got. The quality of taste and the freshness are totally fine. However, the inventiveness + portion size for the price is pretty awful - mostly the portion size. $9 for a couple scoops of humus, some cucumber slices in Italian dressing, a sprinkling of feta cheese and 4 olives is not worth it in my book.

Awesome staff!  They are so friendly and talkative.  Really good drip coffee.  Also ordered the egg and feta sandwich to go.  A really fluffly egg patty with feta and a multi-grain toast.  I saw someone get a breakfast burrito which looked fantastic.  

There are a few tables, a great place to grab a bite after doing yoga next door at Yoga Mat.  A great find and so close to my home!

Cute little place! Great lattes. Giving it three stars for their breakfast only -- Their breakfast burritos were tasty but the way they make them is a little different! The eggs were in a long rectangle and looked microwaved. It would have been better if they took all the ingredients and chopped it all up together and then wrapped it in a tortilla. Again they tasted fine - just a little weird in the design. A little too heavy on the potatoes as well.
Super good tea and awesome Pecan salad. Delis food. Will totally go back. Great atmosphere.
Crappy coffee, bland breakfast burrito, super overpriced.
Yummy, Great homemade sodas, chili was spot on, and the meatloaf sammie was OK.

The B.L.T sandwich was super, specially the bacon on it. Breakfast burrito was ok but nothing special. Coffee was good. 
Not too crowded, and the music is on perfect volume. 
The homemade cookies on the counter looks delicious.

I purchased the bacon, turkey, swiss sandwich on sourdough today for lunch. The sandwich was absolutely delicious, with the perfect balance of melty vs. crispy. It was also accompanied by about a five bite salad. I'll definitely head back to this spot again to try other things. However, I only gave 4 stars due to the price of the menu items. $8.50+tax is a bit high I think for a sandwich and small salad. But, like I said, I'll be back. 

Also, the decor is adorable and they have a nice patio area.

Yes please!Yummy house made soda! They also have Petey Bird ice cream sandwiches! The staff is gregarious and eager to please with delicious and wholesome like oatmeal with dried cranberry and raspberry!
The sandwiches here are out of this world and the homemade sodas are fantastic. This place is a "must stop" for lunch in Denver.

Great food and service!  The buffalo ruben and the cherry vanilla soda were delicious!  We will be stopping by again to try other menu items on the next trip to Rino!  Great location and a cozy restaurant in a nicely restored building.  I am anxious to try more of the menu soon!!

Hutch & Spoon is the greatest! These guys make my lunch almost every day and are always a total pleasure to be around. All employees and owner Tracy are always genuinely interested in being there for work and are always having a good time with each other. Food is deli style, small menu but everything is terrific! Nothing to complain about and I mean that completely.
The buffalo Reuben was great! Coffee was good as well. Nice atmosphere and happy we decided to stop in.

We were in the area for the Carnage on Larimer car show and stopped in here for a quick lunch.  I loved the atmosphere, the food choices were *amazing* and the staff uber-friendly!!

My husband had a super moist meatloaf sandwich and I had the roasted red pepper and mozzarella that was mouth-watering.  Both came with a small salad on the side with an amazing vinegarette dressing.  

I love when we stumble upon a small, local place as charming as the Hutch & Spoon.   I wish I had a place like this near our home, it would be a very frequent stop for us.

I will begin on a positive note by saying the food/tea is delicious. But so unsanitary! I have been here multiple times and no one preparing food was wearing gloves. I tried to fool myself by thinking about how well they must have washed their hands. But then the person who handled my money then cleared dirty dishes, wiped down a table and then made my salad with her hands. The person making my boyfriends sandwich covered his mouth with his hands when he coughed but then resumed making the sandwich with his hands. Ew.

I really like this quiet little cafe. Today I enjoyed some outdoor time as they have a few tables outside. I had an iced latte which was good and my favorite sandwich roasted red pepper, pesto, and mozzarella. It's toasted to perfection and comes with a little salad (dressed greens). Service is good and they use reusable everything cups napkins plates etc. Unless you take it to go. It is my second time here and I will surely be back!

Love local businesses, and friendly staff

This place is adorable, the menu is pretty substantial without being overwhelming and having multiple items i'm interested in eating and trying.

I've had a breakfast burrito - and was surprised at the price - nearly $7 for something they put in the microwave...  made me sad. 

But their lunch - mmmm! I went with the Reuben, buffalo Reuben - now where are you going to find that on a menu?  It was tasty, very lean, not chewy!

Not a ton of seating, but enough that we found a table at 12:30 on a winter friday!

I intend to work my way thru the rest of the menu, including the meatball and the italian!

I did try and italian soda which was very tasty, but i think it contained fake sugar, which as i age, sends my stomach into nasty heartburn land...  So i wont be trying any of the other flavors!

Cheers, and i'll meet you there for lunch soon!

I love this place.  Great ambiance and good food.  They serve light breakfast (sandwiches/burritos) and coffee.  Food is quickly made to order.  Very nice breakfast alternative if you want something of better quality than pre-made coffee shop food, but you don't have the time or appetite for a big breakfast out.

Tiny little place over on Larimer (emphasis on tiny).

Stopped in for a quick breakfast on Tuesday, and it was a nice quaint spot.  Since I was doing takeout, I didn't get around to going further back than the counter, but there appears to be some sort of downstairs which hopefully has more seats.

But let's talk about the food and drinks.  They've got a nice breakfast and lunch menu with a wide variety of options.  Beer and wine are available as well, plus coffee, tea, and hand-mixed sodas.  Will definitely return!

Delicious treats!  Our family was on the way to Denver International from Vail. We found this gem on Yelp. Great atmosphere, good prices and amazing sandwiches. Our baby loved it too. This will be our go-to lunch spot when passing through.
Small, cozy, quaint and delicious. We had the meatloaf and turkey with cranberry sandwiches. They were divine. Crunchy, buttery bread and super fresh ingredients.

When the temperatures heat up and you are looking for something to cool you down, look no further than denver's hutch and spoon.  Their cucumber soda is reason enough to make a trip to this quaint spot, located on the boarder of the ballpark and rino neighborhoods.

The cucumber soda that h+s stirs up, includes a house-made simple syrup from muddled and pureed fresh cucumbers, soda water and a spoonful of ice.  The drink is effervescent from the bubbly soda and has a great crisp cucumber taste that goes down smooth.  There are other rotating soda varieties available including peach spice, black currant, pineapple-ginger and mandarin-lavender (and I have tried them all) but none are as balanced in flavor as the cucumber.

On a hot summer afternoon, this is the perfect drink to quench your thirst.  I would suggest ordering the cucumber soda along with any of the tasty sandwiches or salads h+s have to offer.

I stopped in here for a quick late lunch.  I had the hummus plate and a mimosa.  The bill was less than $12.  It was just the perfect bite.  

They don't have wait service and they are very small.  You order at the counter and they bring you the food.  The mimosa was good.....but the 4 stars really go to the hummus. 

The hummus plate was served with large crostini, sliced cucumbers drizzled with tapenade, olives and feta.  I made little cucumber, hummus, tapenade and feta sandwiches while I sipped my mimosa.  So delicious.  The hummus was so flavorful and garlicky, yet light.  I loved it.  

It's a small place - everything is homemade.  It's cute and the people are friendly.

Great food! Had the buffalo Reuben sandwich was fantastic! Seating is limited to smaller groups and there isn't a ton of seating. We went at 2:30 during the week and had no problem getting a spot. Homemade soda is fantastic!! Would recommend!
So worth stopping by to try out. I'm a fan of beet salads and there's was fantastic. Super friendly service!

We've been here twice and enjoyed both visits.    The beet salad and soup were tasty but I forget what the other meal was.  The ambience is my favorite part of the experience.; the fact that the food tastes good is just a plus.

The breakfast burrito is unbelievable.  The Chipotle potatoes with the cheddar and bacon make a flavor explosion I haven't experienced anywhere else. Spicy but not overwhelming,  I will definitely be coming back for more.

Talks a while for anyone to acknowledge you. Checking out takes a while. No explanation that a large and small Americano both have only 2 shots of espresso yet the large is $0.30 more. Had the buffalo Reuben, was disappointed with the meat-to-kraut ratio, and over priced for what you get. Coffee is good, and decor is farmhouse chic. Only ever had carry out, maybe dining in is different?

Love this place! Casual, friendly, good food. I come here one to two times a month, staff is friendly. They remember who I am. (Probably because I modify almost everything I order as I eat low carb) they are great about modifying the menu without looking at me like I am crazy. I had the unsweetened oatmeal  and house made soda with champagne this morning. Made me happy :-)

I'm a local (on Larimer) and go in all the time. It's like an old school local cafe. Very casual in approaching, welcoming and almost everything is made from scratch.

Grab a coffee and/or a bite, sit and enjoy. It is that simple. Engage with the staff, they are interesting and thoughtful. If not the staff, a lot of the regulars are always in and full of interesting stories and laughs.

Cute little place for lunch with the co-worker peeps!  Really enjoyed their hot sandwiches and their soup is pretty good too.  Check it out!

Wasn't all that impressed with the coffee - maybe it was an off day?

Denver, Colorado- I was having trouble finding something I could eat with my dietary restrictions and the gentleman behind the counter likely sensed it. He kindly asked, "Can I answer any questions for you? If you see ingredients on the board that we can mix into something else just let us know!" I shared with him I do not eat meat, dairy, or eggs and he recommended a red pepper and greens panini with red pepper oil drizzled over it. It was absolutely delicious! All of the staff were smiling, pleasant, and a joy to interact with. The patio and interior are quaint.

Don't come here for the coffee but DO come here for millions of other reasons including the following....

- A HUGE list of house made sodas. Pineapple Ginger?! Vanilla Passionfruit?! HEAVEN.
- Burritos the size of my head. I'm not exaggerating.
- Lavender Lemonade. 
- Salad toppings I can feel good about -- goat cheese, roasted beets, candied pecans
- Cute (but tiny) set up. Think cozy like your Grandma's living room but cool enough to bring even your pickiest of friends.

Side Note: They have house made coffee syrups - lavender combo, ginger combo, etc. (I think they may rotate). I got the ginger syrup in my Chai --- sounds heavenly yes? It wasn't :( Maybe I just got a bad batch but the taste was out of my league, and that's coming from a Ginger pheen.

Thrilled to find this place. The coffee and breakfast burrito we split for lunch were both delicious. The owner and his assistant/helper/sidekick were delightful, and the Star of David on my coffee saucer inside of which bore the initials "BJ," left me with a sophomoric smile all day!!

Behold:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sZwfLwtu9Elw9CSjuOPSiw?select=zjuwiNu-Tyx00xaJLtO1EQ

What an awesome little find! Sir Nicholas and I stopped by here over the weekend for a quick breakfast and it was wonderful. First of all the place is fairly small - I would not recommend going with a group larger than 3 otherwise seating could be tricky at best. It's a pretty narrow space that's set up more like a cafe and less like a restaurant - you order from the counter and then find a table and wait for your food.

The menu is pretty small and simple, but that doesn't make it any less delicious. There are just a handful of options for breakfast and lunch, things like breakfast burritos or egg sandwiches, hummus plates or deli sandwiches. They are all reasonably priced and the servings are too big. For example an egg and feta breakfast sandwich only cost $4, but it's not quite as big as a sandwich made with two slices of bread.

The coffee is also the delicious and as many folks have already mentioned the homemade soda options are lovely. Throw free Wi-Fi and very friendly workers into the mix and I think I've found another favorite spot in the city!

So.  So.  Tiny.   Seriously, I could put this place in my pocket and carry it around with me - which wouldn't be a half bad idea, because it is very tasty.  The menu is limited so picky eaters may not fall in love with it but it is well worth checking out if you are up in the Curtis Park/RiNo 'hood and have a hankering for a bite.
