I had a panini with chicken pesto and feta - gah!  So very, very delicious.  They also have house-made sodas with crazy interesting flavors like mango-jasmine, black currant, and pineapple-ginger.  For some silly reason, I didn't try and of them.  I'll report back after I do.  

I don't understand how they'll be able to turn enough tables to make any money, but I hope they stick around - really tasty and worth a return visit, as the menu changes.

Cute and cozy describe this place well. Not sure if we would've stayed had we not found a table.
The menu is written on the wall and there's lots to select from. I went with the chicken pesto sandwich and it was very good. I enjoyed the small salad it came with too. Most items were $8-10.
I wouldn't go here if you're in a rush. Our meal of 2 sandwiches took at least 15 minutes to come out.
We had great paninis with the most wonderfully pressed bread. Very rich - not for the faint of heart - but 100% satisfying. Good coffee, too. Service was very friendly.

All I got was a simple egg and sausage breakfast sandwich and I was blown away. The multigrain bread was one of my favorites I've had in a while and there was nothing bland about the standard breakfast sandwich. Lots of lunch options on the menu that I'll definitely be back for.

French Onion Soup Sandwich: OMG YUM. And vegetarian, to boot. 

This place is tiny and simple in every respect. Multiple chalkboards hanging up comprise the menu, which includes plenty of vegetarian options as well as sodas made in house. (I have only tried the cucumber, and it was too sweet for me to finish the whole thing, but it was tasty.) Definitely not a good option for a large group, but perfect for lunch à deux. Service is fast and friendly.

My only gripe is the hours. I've probably tried to pop in three times when they've been closed (hello, Sunday after a yoga class at the studio next door).

Tasty food, good vegetarian options, cozy nice atmosphere. The staff were incredible, as well. My wife was under the weather (to say the least), and they were so kind, considerate and helpful for our stay. Wonderful people.

Tried this place on a whim, after Yelp's Nearby feature suggested it. I had an excellent beet salad (ok, ok, the bread it came with was the highlight), a refreshing cup of coffee (black, not too bitter, good and flavorful) and a refreshing home-made cucumber italian soda (I'm a sucker for anything with cucumber in it). 

So, so yum. Would recommend to anyone in the Denver area. The vibe was nice and chill. Couple people eating outside on the patio, one person hunched over a laptop, and more than a few people in and out for lunch orders. 

Solid little joint.

Holy yes!! I was craving a Reuben sandwich and went here today for the first time. I would give my food 10 stars if I could! Delicious and fresh! The staff was very friendly and the place is clean and cozy. I will definitely be back here :)

This little restaurant is so cute, it ought to be illegal.

We stopped in here for some breakfast, post sewer scoping at the new house and en route to the Garden and Home show.  Bear in mind that we haven't moved up north yet, still live in the land of plentiful bars and restaurants, and therefore don't yet have a biased view towards the much smaller quantity of places in our new neighborhood.

That said, I'm really looking forward to being near this place!

We ordered breakfast sandwiches and although small, they're only $4 and don't leave you overly full.

The standout for me is their extensive homemade soda offerings.  Out of curiousity, I went for peach spice.  Super bubbly, with a very light and fresh peachy flavor.  Just a hint of sweetness.  I can't wait to puruse all of their offerings (mango jasmine has my name on it, in particular).  You can even get them made into bellinis and the like if you're in the mood for an adult drink.  They also have a nice list of wine and local beers which would make this place a good weekend afternoon hang.

Hutch and Spoon.  I'll take it.

Was looking for a sandwich restaurant near my office and found this place on yelp. I was definitely not disappointed! The staff was friendly and the menu offered a wide selection. I tried the meatloaf sandwich with cheddar on sour dough bread. It was absolutely delicious! I'll definitely be back for lunch very soon.

This cute little place is definitely one of my new favorites. The staff is very nice and friendly and make you feel welcomed. All of their sandwiches are really great, my favorite is the chicken pesto, I could eat it every day! Their homemade sodas are also out of this world. It is definitely worth checking out.

What a great little place! All hidden away in Five Points with all of it's warmth and charm. and of course, all of it's deliciousness.  Darn, I wish I was closer!  What a neighborhood gem!

They are servin up sammies and salads and soups full of love here.  I had the french onion sandwich and my husband had the meatloaf sandwich.  We shared soup and homemade soda.  Honestly, you really can taste the love.  I haven't had food like that for some time.  The home made sodas were tha bomb, awesome flavors such as cucumber and pineapple ginger.  All sorts of yummy desserts filled the counter tops like cookies, breads, and cakes.  I wish I would have had room, I never have room!

I want to go back on a cold snowy day, which I have a feeling will be very soon!

Excellent coffee (probably my favorite ever!), reasonable prices, friendly and attentive staff. If I lived here I could see myself going here often! I also had the veggie burrito which was the size of my head and so delicious.

This is a great place in the RiNo area for lunch. I had the TBS (turkey, bacon, and swiss) hot, and it was amazing. With the sandwich they included a small leafy salad. The raspberry bars are fantastic too. It was hot out, but it wasn't a frigid shock going inside. 

My 2 qualms were: it is a bit pricy, but justified, and  there's not much seating if they'd get slammed.
Had the turkey, bacon and Swiss hot, and it was to die for! Nice employees, quaint place. Found it on Yelp, and glad I did! I'll be back!

Fun little place in the middle of well....not really anything. 

Had lunch with my friend and he recommended it from all of the good yelp reviews. 1 start for having the menu online (I was ready to order once we got there) and 1 for being out of the way (lots of easy parking)

So we ordered and it's small, but cozy. I enjoyed the meatloaf sandwich. REALLY cheesy...right up my alley!

I'll totally be back here. Really reasonable and not a far drive from downtown at all.

Hutch and Spoon has a big menu for a small place. The sandwich I had was VERY fresh. It seems like the ingredients there are homemade/freshmade or at least recently-made somewhere in town. I also tried a double chocolate cookie: tasty. Free refills on my fresh made iced tea were nice. There are only 8-10 indoor seats at H&S, so plan accordingly - I'm sure the takeout is just as good though. They take credit cards and the service is friendly. Give this local business a try!
Great atmosphere and the staff are super chill. The Chicken Pesto & Feta and a Cucumber Soda make for quite an awesome lunch.

The lovely Claire S. invited me to join her here for lunch, and I'm so glad I accepted.  Not just because Claire rocks, but because Hutch & Spoon is charming and delicious.

It was a cold, snowy day, so I ordered a cup of Novo coffee (my favorite).  for lunch, I had the tuna & eggplant caponata sandwich.  It was an interesting and flavorful mix of a Nicoise and caponata, with olives and capers.

This is a cozy place with character; I could hang out here all day.  I can't wait to return to try more menu items, like the house-made sodas and the french onion sandwich.

So stoked to have this spot in our neighborhood, it's one of the few places for a bite to eat in Curtis Park/Rino. The space is small, but really lovely and interestingly decorated. The smallish menu of salads, sandwiches, and some breakfast items, including coffee, feature simple delicious flavor combinations. And the Italian sodas, baked goods, wine and beer make it a great spot for a relaxing afternoon meal. I've never had a bad experience here. 

The couple of guys that work here are very sweet, always asking how you're doing, wishing you a good afternoon and when it's quiet will strike up a conversation if you desire.The service isn't lightening speed, but the food is quality and made with care which outweighs the few minutes you'll wait for your sandwich or coffee. Hutch and Spoon is a fantastic addition to the neighborhood and worth a special stop if you don't live nearby. Try the meatloaf sandwich if it's around, or at breakfast the Feta Egg Sandwich is rich and hearty despite at first appearing small.

Really nice bistro in the neighborhood. All the sandwiches are delicious (try the buffalo Reuben!) and the staff is really friendly. The reason why I have only 4 stars is the limited space. If there are more then 12 people in there you might feel like in a subway at rush hour.

Build your own oat or acai bowl, what a fun concept. Chose your base (steel-cut oats, oats and quinoa, yogurt or acai fruit blend), then add a sweetener and up to three toppings, or go with one of the pre-selected topping combos. Certain toppings such as peanut butter or protein cost extra. 

My oat and quinoa bowl with brown sugar, pumpkin puree, pecans and dried blueberries was delicious and filling. The acai bowls I sampled were also delectable. They add a good amount of bananas to the acai puree, which makes it nice and creamy, also naturally sweet. 

The fresh fruit add ins were a bit scarce, due to the cold season. Only mango, pineapple or kiwi. Berries would have been nice. 

Kudos to the friendly staff, dealing patiently with our gazillion questions and indecisiveness!

This place is the best Acai spot in town! I want to try the other items on the menu but I HAVE to get their Acai. 

Only issue is they need a better line in the back while helping people while it's busy. It was a bit of a cluster when I went but that could be fixed easily.

Great price point - exactly how I like my acai!

What caught my eye as I was walking past...a sign that said acai bowls. Being that I just came back from Hawaii and i ate endless acai bowls, I walked right in. 

To my surprise, it was like a chipotle style setup but for breakfast! They have a sign at the front of their assembly line showing you how to order. You pick the type of bowl you want, the type of honey to drizzle all over your bowl, and three ingredients. I, of course, got the acai base with the Colorado grown fruit honey, which I chose their triple berry honey, and a traditional style acai bowl with strawberry, banana and granola. It was very refreshing and quite yummy! 

They not only have bowls that you can make your own or choose from a premade list, they also sell juices, smoothies, and coffee. It is a very well kept and clean feeling type of hole in the wall little bar type restaurant. I'd definitely recommend stopping by!

Like Chipotle but for Oatmeal. (or Acai or Yogurt)  Awesome! I wish we had somewhere like this in LA. Inexpensive, healthy and delicious!  Choose your base, choose your sweetener, and choose your garnishments (fruits, nuts, seeds, etc.)

I had steel cut oats with agave and fresh fruit.  Pretty basic and not the most exciting combination, but exactly what I wanted.  The 12 oz was plenty for me, and I actually couldn't even finish all of it. They have some really interesting combinations for those who are indecisive or want recommendations.

My new favorite build your own bowl breakfast place ! It's like the cold stone of healthy breakfast bowls . Cute hipster causal cafe where you can create your own dish ! The ladies were so friendly and made it a great experience, I would go back just for the service ! The bases are oatmeal, acai, quinoa, or yogurt, then you can sweeten with brown sugar, honey, or agave, then 3 toppings are free of whatever you like but your not limited to three. All sorts of choices, fruit, nuts, granola, etc ! They also have pre-made choices if your not sure what to pick, things like PB & B or Southner all different ones ! They also have smoothies and coffee, and other drink refreshers to top it off. 

I did oatmeal, brown sugar, peaches, bananas, peanut butter, chocolate chips, and granola ! Very delicious ! Should have got the 16oz instead of 12 oz. The coconut milk latte was tasty too !

We had the opportunity of stopping by Properoats on our last day in Denver. I am so happy we did. The location is small and cozy but down expect to dine long because its a come and go type place.

The concept of build your own has become increasingly popular. You get to choose your oat base or acai. Next you have the option of toppings and fruit and then sweetener. I had Oatmeal with strawberries and banana and honey. The warm steamed milk they pour over is what really makes these bowls. The bowls are large and very fillings. They are the perfect go to if you are on the go and need something to keep you full for a long time. My husband enjoyed his bowl as well and was sad that we could not visit again. So sad that when i got back home a began recreating the bowls at home because St. Louis does not have something like this...at least not yet.

Finally! A juice bar/smoothie/breakfast bowl place that Denver really needed!

We came here for a quick breakfast on the go and it did not disappoint. Properoats is nested in the Highlands. The cafe is cozy & bright, and the staff was so welcoming and friendly. Prosperoats serves freshly squeezed juice, coffee/tea, smoothies, and build-your-own bowls! If you build a bowl, you have 4 options to choose as your base: steel cut oats, quinoa-infused steel cut oats, yogurt, or acai! Then, you choose a sweetener, and up to 3 toppings which range from fresh fruits, nuts, granola, etc. You can also add protein, chia seeds, hemp seeds, or ground flax seeds for extra. They also have some of their own custom combinations if you are unsure how to make your own bowl.

I got one of their smoothies (can't remember the name, sorry!) and some coffee to go and was very pleased! The smoothie was AMAZING and kept me full throughout the morning. Coffee is always a plus. And the entire staff there is all around great. This is definitely my new breakfast spot from now on!

Absolutely fantastic! 

Great healthy place for breakfast, lunch or dinner. The ingredients are fresh, and the staff is helpful. If you don't know what something is ask- and definitely use the acai as your base!

Haha I love what Mona had to say about Prosperoats. It is trendy and hipster lol, and ditto the people who come in. It is quite yummy, for what it is--oatmeal/acai/quinoa-oats/yogurt worth assorted toppings. Think froyo type deal. It's definitely a pretty healthy alternative to what most places offer for breakfast, so I suppose that's good. 

And the folks working there are friendly and helpful. Fruit is all cut fresh, which I like. And they have some good combination suggestions for what to put in your bowl. 

So overall, it's pretty good?

I came in around 9 AM on Tuesday to grab coffee & breakfast. 

The good: 
I had the peach cobbler oatmeal bowl and it was probably the best oatmeal I've ever had in my life. 

The awful:
I also tried to Salt something latte. It was awful. Like 3/4 of it got poured down the drain awful. 

I highly recomend coming here, just skip the coffee.

Yummy yummy!  I love prosper oats.  I have been wanting to try this place out for awhile and I finally made the trip out to do so.  First off, I love the location.  The place itself was clean and there is a good outside patio.  I ordered an acai bowl with strawberries, peanut butter, fresh Colorado peaches and granola.  Everything tasted fresh and the fruit was perfectly ripe.  My fiancé really enjoyed a bowl of the quinoa oats with the fresh Colorado peaches too.  Lots of other topping options to choose from as well.   Prosper oats is a super spot for a healthy breakfast - lots of other people evidently think this as well as the line was pretty long the whole time we were there.  Will definitely come back to try a smoothie or a lunch salad!

Anyone who knows me (or reads enough of my reviews) knows that I'm a big fan of creating your own dishes and Prosperoats definitely speaks to me on that level. It's a pretty casual spot where you can build your own bowl. The bases are oats, quinoa, yogurt, or acai and you add a sweetener and up to three ingredients on top (things like fruits, nuts, or granola) and voila! You have a breakfast bowl to eat. They also have some standard suggestions if you can't or don't want to decide. 

Pair your breakfast bowl with juice, coffee, or tea and you should be set for the day. Fast and easy, and pretty delicious - it's easy to see why this is a breakfast favorite in Denver!

Stopped in before a hike, and it was perfect! They were very kind and walked us through the process for making a bowl. The servings are a great size for the price and the toppings were so fresh and a great selection of them!
*One suggestion, no need for honey/agave on acai bowls, they were sweet enough (but not overbearing) on their own*

This is my new favorite place for light fare- smoothies, bowls and all kinda of tea and coffee goodness. The folks who work here are nice and it's just a hop over the bridge from downtown. It's tucked away on 15th street- but is well worth going the extra step to go here. 

Ingredients are always fresh and the service is always quick and lovely. Please check them out and stay healthy!!
What a treat. Acai bowls are so tasty and the quinoa bowl is filling. Really friendly associates. Great place to work from home -- fast wifi and outlets available.

HOLY MOLY. I'm in love. The combination options are ENDLESS!! 

You could make a quinoa/oat breakfast bowl OR a quinoa/oat lunch bowl w/ soy sauce, Avo & veggies.. Luv it.

The health is next level and the concept is on point! 
Food is bomb too, not that basic healthy meal w no #flavaflav There is something for everyone here. 

Also want to add that the guy who works there, I didn't catch his name but he makes sure each dish is made proper. I watched him remove the foam from my juice so he can add more liquid. Appreciate you man. ( brown hair, beard, SnapBack ) 

Def coming back.

The highlands neighborhood is one of my favorites in Denver. Home to Linger, Little Man, Avanti, Root Down, and more! 

However, when you're looking for a refreshing juice, smoothie, or bowl, Prosperoats is the place to be. The interior itself says all you need to know about its vibe: trendy, hipster, laid back, and deliciously healthy. 

I had the Sandia sparkler, which is full of watermelon goodness, and my boyfriend had the pearls for eyes. Both were delicious and we loved seeing them made right before our eyes! They came out and tasted so fresh. 

Will be back next time for a bowl!!

Oh Prosperoats, you make my plant-based eating so easy!  I am in love with your peach cobbler, but long try so many more.  Your staff is helpful and cheery and doesn't seem to get perturbed when I take my time choosing just the right ingredients for my delicious bowl of oats!  

This place is the bomb!

Woke up craving a fruity morning breakfast, and didn't really know of anywhere around. Prosperoats showed up on Yelp as a suggestion near by and I went for it.
Wow, so glad I did! Excellent acai bowls with plenty of topping options! 
The workers were very welcoming on a lovely morning making the experience all around wonderful.
Curious to come back and try many different combinations

I just tried this place for the first time this morning, and felt prompted to write up a review because it was very good and fresh. They have a TON of different toppings you can choose to put on your oatmeal or yogurt. I tried banana, pineapple, and granola on top of oatmeal, and it was soooo good. Everything was fresh and flavorful. The oatmeal texture was just right...not lumpy, not runny...Goldilocks would have loved it. ;)  

Overall, it's definitely worth a visit for a solid, healthy breakfast. It's almost lunchtime, and I still feel full and can probably get through the afternoon with just a small lunch (or maybe no lunch, haha).

A great breakfast/lunch spot with an endless variety of original, healthy, and delicious meal options. Definitely sign up for their rewards program, they send texts every so often with great discounts on coffee and food!

Nice concept! Being a picky eater I like the idea of customizing my own pizza/burger/froyo and now we can add oatmeal to the list. The staff was very nice in guiding me through it. You basically select a base (oat/acai/etc), a sweetener, and three toppings. They also added steamed milk to mine in addition to the three toppings. For $5 I got the small bowl which is more than enough for a filling meal. Coming here is definitely a good idea for lazy summer weekends when I'd rather be out and about rather than turning on the stove and heating my already warm apartment!

Great healthy breakfast. Thank goodness. The line where you order is a little disorganized and the employees don't help much clarifying or creating order. But they're friendly and it's still a nice place with great oats!

First time in Denver and this place was recommended to me.  I ordered the coffee oats. It was ok. But customer service was sort of lacking.. to the point where I saw 3 employees , including which I believe was some sort of supervisor who was busy talking to her friend, completely ignore a customer that came in that he just walked out.  So next time I'm in Denver, I don't believe I will be back to this place

1.  Interesting new concept - oatmeal/juice/coffee/etc bar
2.  Great location and nice interior
3.  Endless fresh choices, no bowl ever has to be the same
4.  Love that they serve Coda coffee and it is prepared well
5.  Nice, helpful employees

5 star for the food. Three star for the coffee and dining-ware.
Quinoa - savory Mediterranean style - is the perfect protein packed start to a fab Saturday!  Casual quick and healthy.  Really like this unique healthy conscious  option in our neighborhood.  
And why not go the extra mile in consciousness and scratch the disposable products.  I think this lovely delightful yummy meal is worth eating from a colorful ceramic or pottery bowl.  While the paper bowl looks like it is made from recycled material, shame it gets tossed after a very short functional life.  I get not having space time or effort resources to do dishes, but food tastes better from a real dish.  
Coffee and juice not their strength.  But I will be back (with my own bowl and spoon - ha!) for the food, sweet service and nice casual atmosphere.

Delicious make your own oatmeal and açai bowls. I've been here a few times and always have a great experience. They have tons of fresh toppings to choose from, plus a wide variety of recommended pre-built options for oatmeal. My only complaint is that I wish they had recommended toppings for açai bowls too. I've had both the açai and oatmeal, and both are delicious! The staff is always very friendly and I've never had to wait.

Usually, when I visit a town for the first time, I don't go to the same place twice, but this was an exception. My gf and I went here twice to try different bowls. The sailor man is pretty good if you want to get something savory and warm. The peach cobbler acai bowl is not as good as a custom acai bowl with granola, strawberries, and banana.

As a California native, I know a good acai bowl when I have one and ProsperOats acai bowls were exactly that! After much traveling and mediocre hotel breakfasts, the healthier options at ProsperOats really hit the spot. All ingredients were fresh, the base was delicious, and it was the perfect portion. A highlight of the shop was the large variety of toppings available, though adding too many can get a bit pricey. On top of the delicious food, the interior of the store was very hip and modern and the staff was very friendly. A must stop if you're in Denver and have a hankering for a good acai bowl!
Great place for acai bowls! I love that you can choose your own toppings. The employees were also super friendly and helpful. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town

I love this place.
Healthy options and great service!

We traveled from chico, ca and wanted a acai bowl. We didn't some yelp searches and found this gem and it did not disappoint! We were so happy we found this place so good and lots of options to customize!!

Went in on September 22nd at around 11 am. I have heard such great things about this place and was excited to finally try it. The first impression I got upon entering was very unwelcoming. No greeting from the employees, no smiles(except from the male working that day). When I got to the desk no one explained the process they just stared at me. I asked for an oatmeal bowl to be told I would be getting quinoa oats since they were out of regular oats. They were also out of banana. And when I asked for a substitution on the pb&b since they were out of banana they told me it would be an upcharge. Upon checkout they charged me for the substitution and the oats even though I didn't have a choice there were no other options and I tried to order off menu. The cashier (middle aged blonde) was snippy and rude. My sister had said (granted she was a bit crabby and post-op but luckily after having no appetite wanted to go here) that she thought it was a "bit dumb" that we got charged for things we didn't really want. The checkout clerk wouldn't budge on the fact that they charged incorrect prices(not that the 3 dollars mattered it was more of a customer care as someone who works in restaurant management) and told us that "we could just leave the bowls there then if we felt they weren't good enough."
I've never felt so unwelcome at any new place. Quite frankly it was the worst first impression of a place ever. If anyone asks me I will do whatever possible to steer them away toward rush bowls instead.
Update**
The manager or someone like that with the power to respond has responded, and missed my main point. She did apologize and express that she would talk to employees, but she still didn't forgot to diss the other oat company and as a rep of a business that is a bit distasteful.

I am utterly in love with this place. Although it is not "froyo" it closely follows the concept. You can pick your base then everything you want to put inside to make a delicious and nutritious meal. I love their varied ingredients for mixing and its pretty cool that they have a wide coffee selection as I love coffee. Definitely worth a try!
Great breakfast for the tired traveler! The staff is so friendly it hurts. Get here now.
Randomly found this place and highly suggest giving it a try as well. Super friendly service and the coffee is superb as well!

This was the last food shop my boyfriend and I visited when vacationing in Denver. Entering, the restaurant is rather small with tables lined up along the wall and bright menu boards along the opposite wall. The servers were very helpful and helped me to decide on the Banana Toffee Malt in an oat bowl and a small White Pearl. Everything was delicious. The Banana Toffee Malt was a sweet and filling dish. The White Pearl was very sweet (because of the white chocolate sauce) and yummy. Although the White Pearl was good, it seemed overpriced and I would have been fine with just a mocha latte. 

Overall, great food, the only downfall would be minimal seating. If there is a line, it is hard to sit down without someone waiting in line behind you.
Great place for a healthy breakfast! Different bowls (oatmeal, yogurt, etc) with plenty of topping options! The staff is friendly and polite.

My favorite breakfast spot to grab and go or sit with my pup! 

Try the acai bowl with yogurt, honey, and fresh fruit!

OMG!  What a find!  Came here for breakfast and what a place.  You can order all kinds of wild things.  Ingredients were fresh and flavorful.  This is not your ordinary place to eat, so if you want different, fresh, and flavorful, this is the place to go.  Healthy eating too.

Had a Steele Oats bowl with almonds, raisins, banana, and granola. Also a cup of coffee. 

Very good, clean, simple, easy. Very nice attitude.

Only had juice, but even that wasn't all fresh. They used a pre-made mix, and then added some fruit to it. Go pay for a true cold-pressed juice. 

Staring at TV screens to order also didn't seem to fit the feel they were going for. 

They had some cute elements, and their build your own oatmeal bar seemed cool, but if you are eating oatmeal and drinking juice, I have to think fresh, healthy, and maybe even organic matter to you. Didn't seem to find that here. 

Probably a great place for moms and kids to dine together and find common ground.
My fav place to get acai bowls! Fresh ingredients! They have lattes, smoothies, and juices!!! So good.
Great service and great food! We are a family of 6 and everyone got something diiferent. All the different variations were delicicios. My family loved it!  Thank you!
I love the coffee. I use to walk there every morning, but due to the horrific service I am taking my business elsewhere.

Love this place. The staff are friendly and easy going. It doesn't seem overly hipster to me as other reviewers have stated, but I also go there at 6:30am. I love that they have suggested toppings for your oatmeal/quinoa bowl. I would never have thought to make my oatmeal savory, but that is now my favorite way to eat it.

Unfortunately (or fortunately), I found this place just as I was moving out of my apartment right down the street. I'm a huge fan of acai bowls and during a random yelp search rampage I found there was finally an option just down the street! I decided to go outside the box (or bowl) and try the oats on my first visit, I went with the quinoa oats with mango, grapefruit an infused honey (i don't remember which one now, but it was delicious), almonds and milk. I'm hooked.

As far as beverages go, I love their fresh pressed juices and they're pretty flexible with adjusting the ingredients. I've eyeballed the coffee/tea menu and there are some pretty good looking options but so far I've just stuck with a juice.

I've been back quite a few times since my first visit and definitely will be continue. They also have a frequent visitor membership through FiveStars so you can accumulate points for free things!

Fantastic place for breakfast.  Staff was awesome, options are interesting and endless, and because I was a "newbie", the person who helped me was super excited to make suggestions.  It was the best breakfast I've had in a while, and I will be making this a regular stop in the mornings.
Like chipotle for breakfast using acai or oatmeal as the base. Super fast fresh healthy and friendly. Big fan!

Love this place!!! Steel-cut oatmeal, mixed with quinoa, if you'd like (you will - adds a little more texture, flavor, and protein). Top it off with fruit-infused honey and three fruit, but, or seed choices (included), it makes for a phenomenal breakfast, pre-workout, or post-workout meal! The staff is very friendly and helpful, too.
After eating pizza and burguers I need something healthy this is the perfect place if you're looking for something fresh and tasty

Absolutely love this place!  Great helpful friend service to help you start the day, not to mention delicious and nutritious steel cut oats and lots of tempting topping options to make a bowl suited to you.  It's October, and pumpkin was fantastic.

Wish there was a little place like this around my corner back in San Francisco!  Would love to start every day like this!

Much love
I love this place. I'm here every weekend. The establishment is so nice, the staff is very friendly and the food is delicious. The only downside is parking,but I can look past that.

I came into the shop looking for coffee. I found much more inside. 
The acai bowl is what I ordered with granola, banana, and kiwi. Everything tastes fresh and delightful!! I'm thoroughly impressed. 
The two girls that were closing on this particular night were rather cheerful. Not knowing anything about the restaurant, they took the time to explain the process and all the ingredients they served. 
They would receive 5 stars but for an acai bowl and coffee it was $15. A bit pricy for what it is. But overall wonderful.

Absolutely loved this new place in LoHi!!!! We had coffee (very good), and a couple of bowls. The oats infused with quinoa are delicious, very delicate and do not make you feel stuffed. The yogurt base is just the right balance of tartness. The fruit is fresh and so are the plentiful other toppings! 
The strawberry/rhubarb infused honey is a must!!!
My son (1 1/2 year old) ate his entire bowl! 
Healthy, affordable and delicious.
I will be coming for more.

Loved this place! We went to fuel up before a long hike, and the bowls were delicious and filling! The staff was very friendly and helpful explaining what they offer. We liked it so much we returned again before leaving for the airport to try the acai bowl as a last treat before flying home. Like the oats and oat/quinoa bowls- it did not disappoint!

Simple healthy delicious bowls, every order is customized and you really can't go wrong. The only thing that bothered me was how much they charge for additional toppings, it seems a bit excessive but over all this was a great place!
Friendly staff, awesome service ! Bowls are consistently good, I love the gingerbread latte too! Yum :)

Honestly so good, fresh fruit, delicious oats. Definitely my new favorite place in Lohi! The employees are SO nice and personable and make me want to eat here every meal! Also, they have a great reward program, highly recommend.
Cool juice bar, tea and coffee too! Very healthy optiions with custom options where you can create your own. Plenty of seating and a cool place to hang out or just read a book

This place is a breakfast dream come true. Immediately upon arrival, the staff was really friendly and showed a clear enthusiasm for their product. Ordered the quinoa oat bowl, but would have been happy with all of the bowl bases. Excellent selection of healthy and more indulgent choices. Really fun to create your own ultimate breakfast bowl. Somewhat pricey but worth it. Wish there was one in Washington, DC!

What a great spot for a healthy breakfast. Friendly, fast and a fun breakfast concept.
Create your own breakfast bowl!
Kuddos

This place is a hidden little gem in LoHi. The staff is super friendly and you can get great oats and a healthy breakfast overall.

My only complaint is that it's a bit expensive for what you're actually getting.  You could make oats and fruit at home for a third of the price.

But hey, you pay for the conscience and it's delicious every time.

This unconventionally delicious juice bar blew me away. I had the "bananacado lime" juice and I have to say that it was a truly unique combination of healthy ingredients that was nonetheless incredible tasty.  I love that it's a healthier option without the banality of standard health food variety.  Would definitely recommend in the future.
Really affordable breakfast place. Super-healthy, serve Coda coffee. 12oz bowl is super-filling with all the toppings.
Friendly staff, fresh ingredients and a variety of foods I had never experienced but truly enjoyed.  If your a healthy organic breakfast fan this is the place to go.
This place is great. They have lots of options for food and drinks and friendly workers.
Absolutely love this place! Their oatmeal is great with a vast variety of toppings and the staff is super friendly! Plus they have Coda coffee!
Great concept and alternative for breakfast. Enjoyed steel cut oatmeal with quinoa and tons of tasty toppings to choose
Just tried this new place in LoHi and loved it. Unique fresh juices and coffee/tea w oat bowls all day long. Just what the neighborhood needed.
An awesome place all around. A well designed clean interior, incredibly friendly staff who give great recommendations, and the bowls are excellent. This place makes oatmeal a real treat.

It's an interesting concept. I'm the type of person who goes to a fo-yo place & piles on all the toppings I like with out rhyme or reason as to what tastes good together.... you really need to put more thought into combinations here at Prosperaots... and there are a lot of possibilities. I tried one of the suggested combinations as to keep from making a terrible flavor choice. I would like it better if you could just get a small amount of several toppings instead of a full amount of 3 toppings.. besides that, it's reasonably priced & nice employees.

My husband and I have been here twice now and both times have been great. Love being able to grab a quick, healthy breakfast. We have had all base choices, acai, yogurt, oats, and oats/quinoa and they have all been tasty. Their fruit is very fresh and all toppings are beautifully presented. We can't wait to keep trying new combos. 

Very impressed. This place is a must try!!!
So many options to make a healthy and delicious breakfast! The staff is so helpful and welcoming! Great place, will certainly come back!

Super Healthy and Ubber Yummy spot - This is a must try in Denver!  Not to mention they have the BEST Acai (amazing Brazilian specialty). 

Great coffee, yogurt and staff!!!

This is a five-star review from someone who is watching his cholesterol.  I had the Colorado oatmeal, which included different types of fresh Colorado fruit. Makes me feel like I can go out and get a cheesesteak for dinner. (Or not; it's still okay to dream I guess.)

Just a nice, clean place to have a healthy brunch.
One of the only places in Denver that offers such a great variety of healthy oats and acai bowl options. Plus, you get to customize what you get, which is a major plus.

I juice veggies and fruit all the time. This joint is super cute and the people that work here are great. But when I want a Green drink- im looking for a serious boost. They make theirs with mainly 2 green apples- pure sugar- just too much. The other veggies came from the frig which had been juiced earlier in the morning. The thing with fresh juice is to know what is going into the drink and getting it within a few minutes from the time it is juiced.  Next time I'll have the OJ instead- they have a great machine for juicing the oranges.  I still recommend coming in and supporting locally.

Ventured to this part of town after buying a Groupon and I'm so glad I did!  You have four base options (yogurt,  oatmeal,  etc) and a variety of all natural toppings and sweeteners (I recommend the flavored honey!)  With so many ways to personalize, it's great for a group in search of a healthy breakfast that tastes good. I will definitely be back!
Great spot! So glad I finally found a place like this in LoHi. Tons of fresh and healthy options. I loved the Acai bowl!!
Healthy. Delicious. Easy. Options. Went all five days while I was in Denver! Keep it up prosperoats!

Prosperoats is an amazing place to stop in and get breakfast or a snack. PLENTY of street parking in the morning, clean and modern interior, and friendly employees.

I had some oats and coffee to stay, and enjoyed the free wifi while I read a book. The oats and fresh fruit were delicious, and there are a ton of options for toppings.

I will definitely be back and bring my family with me!

Nothing special about the acai bowl with fruit that was small and expensive. The reason I am proactively writing a review is because while I was paying at the counter the waitress spilled my bowl so that about a third of the fruit fell out. I was totally shocked to see her put on a pair of gloves and put the fruit that had fallen on the counter back in my bowl! All while saying the counter was really clean! My sister was arriving at the same time so I didn't react as I should have, but they sure lost my future business!
Such a great idea and addition to Denver! We were a little overwhelmed with all the different options but the staff was so helpful. Great selection and really cool vibe!

Mmmmm... Acai bowl, cool, refreshing and super yummy. Love all the healthy options and they're GOOD healthy options! The coffee selections (aka: warmers) look amazing! I can't wait to try that next. I've got my eye on that Sunburn warmer! Will def be back soon!
Great healthy breakfast option, super friendly staff that want you to have a good experience.

Holy YUM! I can't believe I haven't stopped in until today! The staff are delightful and the options [vegan friendly] are healthy, fresh, and delicious. I got a steel cut bowl with peaches, strawberry rhubarb honey, peanut butter and granola and my whole day is made! Can't wait to go back and try a juice or one of the dreamy coffee creations. Thumbs up!

Just stopped in for a lovely breakfast. My fiance got a yogurt bowl with pumpkin and cardamom and quinoa flakes. She was incredibly please. I had the clean green juice with carrot instead of apple and it was fantastic. The ginger was very very fresh, my mouth is still tingling.

My daughter and I were in Denver for the week for spring break. We had breakfast at Prosperoats. The staff was very friendly. The choices for the oat bowl were diverse. Left wishing we weren't leaving town so we could try other combinations. Will go there again if we make it back to town.

So excited to welcome Prosperoats to the Lohi neighborhood! Fresh juices, smoothies, coffee, ice pops, oat bowls, and more! I'm gonna spend way too much money here, but you can't put a price tag on healthy, delicious options right around the corner!

Bought a groupon for this place since i live close by and so happy I decided to try it out.  Similar concept to the frozen yogurt craze that has been going around, but healthier.  They have an extensive variety of toppings to choose from.  It's a great place to stop in to grab a quick and healthy breakfast.  Haven't tried any of their drinks yet, but I'll definitely need to stop in for one soon!
The Acai bowl is great! The coffee is also really good, but it is somewhat pricey for a simple breakfast. I would definitely recommend coming by for an Acai bowl!
One of my favorite places! Go there at least once a week! The quinoa and yogurt bowls are VERY good but the oats is my favorite! Make sure to get some coffee too!

Prosperoats is incredible. Bright atmosphere with kind and generous employees. The food is unique and fresh. I dream about their quinoa oat bowls all week and come every Wednesday for my favorite breakfast of the week. Also, would be great post workout!
DELICIOUS! Best quinoa oatmeal EVER! It's so nice to be able to go out and get a nutritious delicious meal.  I love to eat at locally owned cafes and this one is a standout!  Cant wait to come back.

Had lunch today at the bar.  It was quite busy and so I decided to sit at the bar where there was lots of space.

Bartender was busy and wasn't too friendly, but he was efficient.  I had an iced tea and their soup and salad lunch special.  The Chicken Tortilla Soup (few pieces of chicken, avocado, and a few chips) was just okay, not very tasty.  Same with the Ranch Salad which was lettuce, tomato, corn, cheese, radish, and mixed in a ranch dressing, only mediocre.

The restaurant is large and noisy.  There are tv's everywhere so you can catch a game.  They have a happy hour which includes a few of their beers, well drinks, and various appetizers.

One of my favorite bars in the Park Meadows area! If you are looking for a good atmosphere, plenty of seating, the largest selection of draft beers in Colorado, and friendly staff - this is the place for you.

I definitely recommend coming on for Monday Night Football as their happy hour menu extends all night long. They have a great selection of nachos, wings, pizzas, and other staple bar food items. I would get the poke nachos and the fried calamari. The calamari was not chewy, and perfectly fried in their batter. You can't beat the prices - most items range from $5 to $7.

Ambiance - Very nice decor and ambiance
Service - Excellent
Food - Tried most of the appetisers, they were really amazing
Drinks - Large selection of craft beers, you can taste before ordering

If you're into sports, beer, great selection of food, yard house is the place to be. Over 100 beer on tap, plenty of TVs, and a vast menu for just about anyone, you can't go wrong coming here for any occasion. I usually order the rib eye and shrimp and it is prepared delicious everytime. The beers are great but there are also plenty of other drinks (cocktails, martinis, wine and sake) for your liking and I definitely recommend trying any of them. Service have been good for the most part and with a huge selection of items, you can be sure to find something to come back for more. 
Tip: recommend to come in groups and for special occasions. The grilled korean bbq beef and lettuce wraps are a must try.

With every visit I like this place a little more.

Went here for happy hour, 4 cocktails, 2 beers, pizza, wings, and 2 plates of truffle fries $60. Everything tastes great.

I love wings and I was surprised at the sweetness and deep taste of the buffalo wings. I will get these wings next time , I promise you Yelp!

Mike, our server, and his crew were attentive and fast. Bravo, Yard House is a new "safe bet" and favorite of mine

YH has a little bit of everything on the menu, but none of it is particularly healthy or memorable. It feels almost identical to a Cheesecake factory, as the food, prices and crowd are concerned. The food is overpriced for the quality you get. 

My fish tacos were decent but nothing I would necessarily come back for. For dessert, the fruit cobbler was good, although probably upwards of 600 calories. Our waitress was very patient with me and my dietary restrictions (no wheat, no dairy). Although she came back from the kitchen stating there was no wheat flour in the streusel topping, just nuts, I am fairly certain it did have flour in it. I took a charcoal pill at home just in case, but if I had celiac or serious food allergies, you might be looking at a 1-star  review right now.

Great beer selection.  In a big group service is very slow.
Fish dishes are delicious. Nashville chicken his hot and crispy.

Good service, altho our waitress didn't seem 100% educated on all the beers. Our group asked several questions about which beers were on tap for different things, but she didn't know the answers. She did come back with them, tho, which was nice.

The food was above par and was absolutely perfect.

Pleasantly surprised! I wasn't too excited when the group picked Yard House over PF Changs  for a bite after shopping but I was impressed!  Our waitress was awesome and the menu was huge! Large drink selection and food menu was almost too big :)  The food selection covers many food genres.  They had poke bowls and lamb burgers, street tacos and ahi salads.  So no matter what you are in the mood for, they probably have something to satisfy it.  

I got the spicy tuna roll and we ordered the duck wings, crispy brussel sprouts and spinach cheese dip for the table.  The crispy brussel sprouts are amazing! Duck wings are also delicious.  I loved my spicy tuna roll.. it's not like traditional sushi rolls.  It was more like a mount of yum.  More of an island shape pile of avocado layered with tuna and edamame.  

We finished with the smore's brownie (omg)  *Needs more graham cracker but it was melty chocolate & marshmallow love.

Why is there not a yard house closer to where I live. My first time at this upscale sports bar was in Vegas and my family was hooked. Warning, not everything on the menu is delicious but you really can't go wrong with a lot of things. 

Large beer selection. Especially local taps. My favorite, and I mean FAVORITE, thing here is the chicken chilli soup. I crave this literally. I also frequent the ahi tuna sandwich or the salmon. My dad loves the pepper jack burger although they changed the bun and it's not as good. 

Last night I tried the pizza. Just smehh definitely not the best, but it was tasty. Expect a wait on a Friday Saturday night or opt to eat at the bar! Parking is difficult at this location, but what do you expect for park meadows mall. 

The yard house is always a versatile and reliable choice

It's a Yardhouse. Lots of beer, interesting menu. Have been quite a few times- never WOWED but never awful....but today our bartender was not friendly. At. All. 

I get it, I have bad days too. But we weren't asked if we wanted to put in a food order; when you drop our (1st round) beers off along with the tab, don't be surprised and storm away (snatching the tab away too) to the computer to enter said order. A simple "sure, no problem" would've been more appropriate. 

Otherwise, like I said at the beginning....It's  a Yardhouse ;)

Solid 3 stars. I came here for a little ladies night out, and was mildly surprised with the food and service. 

I've been to a Yard House or two before, but they always seem to be all over the map. Expensive/reasonable, crummy service/great service, bad food/good food so you never really know what you're going to get. I'd say this location delivered good food, good service, and fairly reasonable prices. It's still on the expensive side, but served its purpose and food hit the spot. 

It's not on my rush back and visit again list, but I also wouldn't vehemently oppose it either.

Yard House is one of my favorite restaurants in Denver. They have a very relaxed environment with a touch of class and refinement. For some reason, it's always dark in the restaurant. I guess it's to create a more intimate environment between tables. 

I had the BBQ Chicken Salad, which is my favorite dish at Yard House. Typically the BBQ marinated chicken comes cold, so I ask for it to be warmed up. I think it tastes better with warm chicken. There's so much different things in the salad like fried onions, avocado, corn, tomatoes and a few more things. The BBQ sauce that's used is just the right amount of spicy. This has been one of my go-to dishes for years. 

I did notice that the salad was smaller this time around. I'd say about 50% smaller than normal. The salad used to be a big task that could fill up the biggest of guys, but this time it was just ok. Hopefully, this was just this one occasion. I'm going to be disappointed if I get the salad again and the size has been reduced.

Last evening in Colorado, we went to dinner with our daughter and son-in-law at Yard House. We had been there on one of our previous trips.  We had the lobster, crab, artichoke dip that came with 4 cheese baked pita chips.  This was a great way to start the meal. Daughter and I had mixed drinks:  SKINNY MARGARITA el jimador silver tequila, fresh lime and  POMEGRANATE PRESS skyy infusions citrus vodka, citrus agave, dekuyper pomegranate & razzmatazz .   Most of the group tried the seasonal beers and samplers.  Always a great choice!  We had 4 tasty dinners:  NASHVILLE HOT CHICKEN fried sage, sweet potato pancakes, pickles, ranch dressing, honey hot sauce , MEDITERRANEAN SALMON* za'atar crusted with spicy tahini sauce and red quinoa with cauliflower, kale, golden raisins, pistachios, LOBSTER GARLIC NOODLES shrimp, crab, lobster, shiitake mushrooms, spinach, parmesan and AHI KALE CAESAR* seared rare, romaine, brussels sprouts, pistachios, raisins, sweet baby tomatoes, parmesan.  Service was good.   Unfortunately, they were not busy this particular evening but it seemed that our waiter left us and getting drink and beer refills was lacking.  So I cannot rank GREAT.
This place was pretty good. The beer selection was fantastic! The menu had lots and lots of options! Food was 4 star
If you haven't already you need to try to California roll it's excellent my only issue with them is they discontinued using the yard glasses

We came here Sunday night. This was my first time and my husbands second. I loved it! We had the mooshu eggrolls and I should have just gotten 2 orders of those for my dinner.. So. Good. I had the spicy tuna sushi and it was pretty good, but they put too much avocado on it for my taste. The tuna wasn't seared, it was totally done, but that's ok. It was a great meal and I cant wait to come again! Our waitress was training another girl so things took a while but they were working hard. It was a great meal.

I've always been a Yard House fan for such a long time and would always go to Yard House back at home in California. 

After moving to Denver, CO due to my husband being in the military, I was excited because I found out there was a Yard House not too far from us. My first time there was HORRIBLE. I was so upset and could not understand why the server was so rude and just flat out did not care about customer service or us. I should have gotten her name, but all I remember was that she was short, thin, dark hair, tan skin and possibly of Hispanic or maybe even African American descent. We didn't even feel comfortable enough to ask her for more water or for dessert because it just seemed like she would get annoyed. She just had a rude look and would roll her eyes when asked if we could order drinks along with dinner. I wanted to speak to a manager that day, but did not want to make a scene and was already really upset and embarrassed. Even though she was rude, disrespectful, and such a horrible server I still tipped her well (which I regretted). My husband knows that's my favorite spot and wanted to take me again, but after that experience, I rather just go somewhere else or drive to a different location.

Great tonight as always! Had a Miami Ice cocktail....smooth and refreshing! We had several appetizers which were very good however we tried a new one (for us), the California Roll. Hmmmm...I was not really a fan. I feel like it could have been quite good but the jalapeños threw me off a bit and i think the dish could have stayed more an asian or sushi theme and would have been great! 

One tidbit of info....please remind your servers to check on water. We did not have a refill, not once and couldn't  get anyone's  attention to ask for more. 

But overall a great evening with great friends and we will be back soon!

We've eaten at many Yard House locations and just tend to love them! Very few restaurants are so vegetarian-friendly, with an entire Gardein section on the regular menu in addition to the various other well marked vegetarian options throughout. We adore the Gardein buffalo wings and order them every time we are at a Yard House. We also tried the fried cheese curds (YUM!) and the mushroom lettuce cups. Seriously. So good! Lots of beer on tap, which is a big plus for a beer lover like me. Also, it's a great place to watch a game. Can't say enough nice things about this place.

Great selection of beers & I enjoyed the lunch menu. Lots to choose from. Wish there was one in Tampa Florida where I live would probably do really well there. It's a chain restaurant but I would definitly go back. Not hating.
Its alright.  We were not impressed with the below par service, staff seemed a bit snobbish and annoyed they had customers.

Came here a few weeks ago and the place was packed due to prom season.  Our wait ended up being an hour or so, but it was not too bad.  I was able to get some shopping done at the mall.  Nonetheless, I enjoy coming to Yard House.

Yard house is a nice place to causally hang out with a group of friends.  They have a huge food selection and an even bigger drink menu.  There is definitely a little something for everyone.  I love ciders and compared to other breweries they have a nice selection.  Food here is not phenomenal, but good enough to satisfy any empty stomach.  Servers are also really friendly here and their happy hour specials are nice as well.

We came here for a quick meal before we had somewhere to be.  We arrived 15 minutes before happy hour ended and our server was great at letting us get our order in just before it ended.  They were out of the first beer my mom tried to order so our server came back to tell her she needed to pick a different one.  I ordered a cocktail, which was surprisingly decent.  Everyone liked their food.  I ordered the mac and cheese. It has truffle oil in it so it was a little heavier tasting than a typical mac and cheese, but I liked it.  They have a large menu, so there is bound to be something for everyone.

The Yard House was pretty tasty and accommodating on a Saturday night even though they were busy with a few larger groups. No reservations but call ahead seating is available. 
I was looking forward to trying the Wisconsin Fried Cheese Curds but unfortunately they were out! I had Moo Sho Egg Rolls and a Spicy Tuna Roll to start out. The Spicy Tuna Roll is not your typical "roll" and very flavorful. The Moo Sho Egg Rolls were crispy and served with a sweet chili dipping sauce, which I did finish to the last drop. 
For the main course it was Spicy Jambalaya and Mac and Cheese. The Spicy Jambalaya was a melody of flavor and had the option of rice or linguine. I had the Jasmine rice, they also have Brown rice. The Mac and Cheese is a great combination of chicken, bacon and mushrooms with a crispy topping mixed with the cheesy noodles. I would go back again and try the Vampire Tacos, they looked delicious as well!

My boyfriend and I came here to celebrate Valentine's Day after being quoted a 1-2 hour wait at Cheesecake Factory. We were seated quickly, but that's about the only positive thing that came from this experience. We waited over 5 minutes to be greeted and to place our drink order. A server finally came over and explained that there was a shift change, which led to the delay in greeting. That's completely understandable. We ordered our drinks and placed an order for chicken tenders for an appetizer. I received a lemonade instead of a Dr. Pepper but that was fine because my boyfriend used it to make an Arnold Palmer with his iced tea. 

Our chicken tenders arrived and I'm not sure what happened with those. The chicken in the one I had was disgusting. I couldn't finish it and my boyfriend attempted to try mine to see what was wrong but couldn't even take a bite. We told our server who said she would take it to the manager and take it off the bill. I almost wanted to leave because the chicken destroyed my appetite, but I didn't want to ruin the night for my boyfriend. 

After ordering halibut and the filet, our server came out to inform us that they were out of mashed potatoes and offered another sides instead. We both opted for salads. After ordering the salads, another server came by to say that they had mashed potatoes again (not sure how they suddenly appeared), but that we would still receive the salads and mashed potatoes with our entrees. My filet was overcooked, but at that point I didn't want to make a big deal out of another problem with the food, so I just ate it without saying anything. 

Our server's presence was basically non-existent, I'm not sure where she was the majority of our meal. We finished and she brought a refill (the first and only) for my drink and cleared our plates. We then waited over 5 minutes for her to return, declined dessert, and asked for our bill. We looked around for her, at which point, a busboy came over and asked if we needed something. We told him we were waiting for the bill, so he went to look for our server. She returned at the same time as he did and when we looked at it, the chicken tenders had not been taken off. 

At this point, I was frustrated and ready to go. The busboy saw us looking at the bill and looking around and went to grab a manager for us. The manager came by and we explained about the chicken tenders and how we were under the impression we wouldn't have to pay for them. He said he would take a look in the kitchen at the other chicken tenders and take them off our bill. We waited for our change for another few minutes. It felt like our server was intentionally taking her time and avoiding us because she would disappear for minutes after each interaction. We felt bad not tipping at all, so we did leave a small tip, although it was completely undeserved. We gave the busboy the same amount as a thank you for his help. As we were leaving, our server was standing at the host stand chatting with the girls there and gave us a very insincere goodbye. 

Needless to say, we were very disappointed in our experience tonight. I appreciate that the salads were free and they took off the chicken from our bill. I understand that when a restaurant is busy, service can be slow. But tonight, 8:30-10 p.m. to be exact, it was not very busy. The service was atrocious and not up to par with Yard House standards (or so I'd hope). I'm disappointed we chose to celebrate our Valentine's Day here and wish we had gone elsewhere in the area. Javier the bus boy is amazing, and deserves recognition. However, our server, Klarissa, was a disappointment and I wish I knew what exactly we had done to receive the bad service from her. We will return to Yard House, but never to this specific location.

No way!  The service was solid, the atmosphere is great, but the food was terrible.  

My wife ordered Tuna and I had Tacos.  Without exaggeration, we had quite possibly the worst meal we have ever had at a restaurant.  

My wife labored to cut her tuna.  We didn't even think that was possible because we have had tuna at many restaurants and have never experienced this.  The side of rice was lifeless.  It was bland and dry, which was surprising since it was supposed to be the spicy rice.  She barely made it through half the tuna and two bites of rice.  

I had three different tacos.  The swordfish taco had a foul piece of fish.  Swordfish should not have a strong fishy taste unless it is old.  The carnitas taco had promise, but the mix of flavors was not right (sorry, but pineapple on a carnitas is the wrong flavor profile).  The last taco was a haha taco.  One bite and I was done.  Again, it was a strong fishy taste.  That is bad fish.  

We were eager to put the dinner behind us by finishing off the meal with a simple dessert.  Creme Brûlée and the peach, apple cobbler.  Believe it or not, the cobbler had maybe a slice of peach and maybe two slices of apple.  It was at least 2/3 crumb topping!  There was virtually no fruit.  

The Creme Brûlée didn't even resemble the common French dessert.  The texture was somewhat chalky.  We couldn't even figure out what was in it.  It is a shame that it is even called a Creme Brûlée because there was nothing about it that resembled the dish except for the color. 

I should have listened to the promptings of the waitress to order something else for my main dish.  

In all, the food cost us $54.  Even if the meal was $20, it would not recommend it to anyone.  They have a serious quality control issue.  The fish was so foul that I would expect that they are putting people at risk.

Poor service, inattentive staff makes for a bad combination. We were completely ignored once we got our food.......then when we asked for our check we were given the wrong check, had to wait 10 minutes to even get someone to bring us the correct one. We will never be back.

I was wavering between a 3 and 4 star, but since I come back I gave them a 4 star.

The beers are fantastic. Great selection and their beer cocktails are yummy.

Food overall is good. A couple of dishes that didn't hit the palate but overall things are yummy.

Service...hit or miss. The bar usually has slow and sometimes unfriendly service. After a bartender snapped at my husband when he asked about the World Cup game, we left. However I did stop to speak to a manager and saw him immediately pull said bartender aside and talk to him. Table service overall has been good, just a couple of servers that struggle.

Like I said we keep coming back, so their shortcomings aren't killing the experience.
In retrospect, in case it's not clear enough already, my first review in 2014 was really mostly about me trying to get the attention of fair winsome Caroline. Alas, 'twas not to be.

With 100+ taps and sports on TV everywhere this is the ultimate man cave hang out.  The vampire taco may be the best taco I've ever eaten.  A fusion taco of Korean short rib and siracha, Italian Parmesan crusted tortilla, roasted garlic Mexican guacamole and cilantro the umami is off the chart.  You won't kiss anyone for a week but oh my this taco is awesome.

Sat at the bar. Spring was our server. Great service!! Great beers!! Returned my ahi because it was frozen. The manager brought me something new over. When we got the bill neither of my dishes were on it. We will be back. Thanks for taking care of us without having to say anything!!!

I visited the Lone Tree Yardhouse location today with my mom and we were blown away at the amazing service. We didn't have to ask for a single thing. Our server was on top of it. He brought more ice for my mom after refilling her iced tea, sent more lettuce over for her wraps, kept my water full. 

I had the lamb burger which was amazing. 

I highly recommend and look forward to coming back.

We came here for dinner. The food was good and they had a large selection of craft beers, kids meals were better then the usually chicken strips,etc. The staff was also attentive and friendly, we enjoyed it and would return.

Busy day after Christmas. Service was slow. Many tables seated after is served ten minutes or more before.  Food arrived nearly cold. Steak much closer to medium well than the ordered medium rare. Server was adequate but not too concerned. 

Didn't screw up the beer.

Great place, friendly smiling people, restaurant manager is involved and equally friendly, fabulous beer selection. You can actually get a half yard of beer here. Only negative is they come out and let you know they only give two tasters. That was weird to hear. Especially since niether one of us asked to try anything. Never the less this is one of my new frequents.

Decent bar food that consistent with other chain restaurants.  If you're looking for quick happy hour deals, this is the place.  We enjoyed the wings, onion rings, and calamari.  Service was average.  Nothing to wow you except for the consistency.

Won't be back.      [but see follow-up below]
Was a Tues eve, moderately busy but not SRO.  It was 1.5 hours from the time we sat down to dinner server.  We did have appetizers but really, 1.5 hours?  They said the kitchen was backed up, but even the drinks took +10 minutes per order.  So my food was mostly cold (veggies & potatoe) and steak had dried out.  They did adjust the bill but the manager never stopped by to apologize.  
And they're the only restaurant in the cluster of restaurants that won't validate the valet parking charge.

Recently, I wrote the above review titled WON'T BE BACK after a bad experience. Yard House corporate must have been watching and they posted a we're-sorry-for-your-bad-experience message and eventually we got in touch with them.  Not only did they apologize with no excuses but brought us back for a make-up dinner on them.  They thanked us for a learning experience and our follow-up dinner was great.  They are now back on our list of regular restaurants. They also assured me they're working to participate in the local valet parking validation.

Usually, I abhor all chain restaurants (for obvious reasons), but I was taken to Yard House by my cousins, so I wanted to keep an open mind. 

Yes, you're going to wait (sometimes an hour plus) if you come in for dinner on the weekend.  That said, you can often find a seat in the bar to enjoy a half yard while you wait.

After imbibing said half yard, our group got seated.  Despite the large menu, the jambalaya looked intriguing.  I asked the waitress about the level of spice and she said it was up there in terms of heat; I ordered it right away.  When it arrived I was pleased to see a pair of jumbo (like U-12) prawns sitting on top of the noodles.  I'll give credit where credit is due, the waitress hit it right on head, it was spicy.  Not overpowering heat, just a nice counterbalance to the dish.

Minus the wait, which really isn't their fault, Yard House was a very good dinner stop.

So you know when you see the name of a place and you develop an idea in your head about what it will be like? I'm sure you've also heard the old saying about what happens when you assume. 
I've avoided this place for a while because I am not a beer drinker and most beer pub concepts  have a huge selection of beers and a menu consisting of the tried and true (read: tired) favorites. *yawn*
Sure, the Yard House has a long list of beers, ciders (for the love of peat, can you all add some Magners or Strongbow so we have an alternate to the syrupy "seasonal" flavors?), and cocktails... but they also have a rather intriguing menu that actually had me indecisive about what to order. 
Duck fat kettle chips? Pork poutine? Pastrami Benedict burger? Street tacos? Decent vegetarian options? SO MANY CHOICES. Some interesting combinations and flavors elevated the usual brewpub fair. Bravo. I would say I'd not be upset with a pared down menu - just how big is the kitchen to prep it all? Our server, Kristin (who's the bomb diggety, btw) said it was a 90% scratch kitchen. Pretty awesome.
Service was great, food was tasty - Kristen made the experience even better. She's a treasure, Yard House, you want to keep that one happy. 
If you're in the Park Meadows area, I'd say check this place out. 
It's definitely toward the top of my list for options when head that way.

Had some Belgian Duvel beers with a lamb burger.  Sat at the bar.  The barman was excellent and looked after us.  The burger and fries were perfect with the beer we chose.  Yard House is consistent  - with very (beer) knowledgeable servers that are happy to discuss each of the millions of beers on tap.

One of the entrees that we ordered came somewhat overdone. Our server Jennifer W quickly ordered another and the manager delivered it to our table with an apology within minutes. No drama. Amazing recovery!!

Thank you
Good food, good beer selection. Terrible customer service. The bartenders were not attentive nor personable.

Easter Sunday, the place wasn't packed which was great for us as we wanted something a bit more quiet.  We were seated immediately and Jeremy our waiter was super nice.   I wanted a simple lunch after spending time checking out the extensive menu I finally figured out I would just have a burger.  

I went with the simple BBQ Bacon Burger.   It is Easter so I needed a little pork in my life.   

This was a darn good burger.  The bacon was nice and thick and plentiful.  It was cooked a perfect medium and was terrifically juicy.   It was served with a pile of truffle fries for an additional charge of course.  But is there really any other way to have fries if they are offered in this manner.  

It's nice to know that they serve a lunch menu daily (even weekends)  Unfortunately  my lunch hour is too early to take advantage of most places except once a week.  

It doesn't seem to be a place I would go out of my way to make sure I visit once a week but I will get back eventually.  I'm not a beer drinker and this seems to be a great place for those who are.

I'm granting another star after dinner with a friend the other night.  I had time to kill, so I bellied up to the bar.  After dealing with rush hour traffic, I needed a shot of Patron.  My kind bartender obliged, and she even chilled it for me.  Perfection!  I then had a grapefruit and tequila cocktail, well blended on ice.  Okay, I had more than one!  The service was fantastic!

We decided to eat at the bar, as the restaurant was packed.  The service again was fantastic.  I had the wasabi-crusted salmon with mashed potatoes, and a ginger sauce.  The dish had a great flavor profile.  The salmon was a little overcooked, but not much, and the flavor was still great.  I wished for more sauce, as it was delightful, but it left me wanting more.  The salmon was topped with delicately thin fried sweet potatoes (I think), and it was not only beautiful, it was tasty.  My friend had the jambalaya, which she enjoyed.  I had a bite and found it quite delicious, great Cajun flavors represented.  We shared the butterscotch pudding with salted caramel sauce - and it was delicious, as well.  I love the juxtaposition of sweet with salty.  

The menu here is extensive, from salads and apps to burgers to classic favorites, pizzas, steaks, and seafood.  I was favorably impressed upon my second visit here.

Our experience started great, we were seated immediately and given menus to look over. It was around 8:30pm on a Saturday night. We waited 25 minutes and no one ever approached our table... Many servers walked by our table, but no one even made eye contact. We were clearly trying to figure out where our server was... Even a manager walked by and failed to acknowledge us. The restaurant did not seem to be understaffed. The last straw was when one of the other tables in our row had a woman standing in the booth waving her arms clearly trying to get someone's attention, without any success. When we returned our menus to the hostess stand, the hostesses acted like a deer in headlights. Total blank stare for seconds before they offered to find out server... What's the point? I don't have time to wait for someone who can't check on their tables for half an hour or longer. Will not be back, I recommend hitting one of the other spots in the Vistas. We ended up going to La Sandia and had outstanding service and a great, timely meal!

For what it is (a big chain with a huge menu), they do a pretty great job. It isn't perfect; they aren't reinventing the wheel here, but the food is consistent, and the service is generally good. 
One thing I love about this place? The size and breadth of their kids' menu. My kids aren't super picky, but they get tired of the same "burger, chicken fingers, grilled cheese" options everywhere we go. They have thoughtfully imagined choices, and there is something to interest my kids even on their least-motivated days. 

Value: The meals I've had have always been delicious, though possibly a little overpriced. I'd rather pay $1-3 extra per person for a consistent product, though, so I'll take it any day. 

Food Favorites: the four-cheese grilled cheese with tomato soup (ah-mazing!), the steak-and-blue-cheese salad, and the burgers. Yum. 

Service: while it isn't my favorite part of the experience every single time, I have had decent service. I had one server who was excellent, and the rest were "just fine." Never had any problems. 

Atmosphere: it's big, and there's a ton of beer on draft. They play classic rock. I wish they had a patio. Overall, B+.
I absolutely fall in love with their lamb burger, best in town period!

Fun place to eat at huge menu and lots of gardein vegetarian options ! Gluten free available but I do Wish there were some more variety of vegan options. However the different gardein meals are great . The Orange gardein chicken and jasmine rice is excellent !! They have nice desserts to the Myer lemon raspberry soufflé is delicious and if it's a birthday and you tell them they will dust the plate with cocoa powder saying happy birthday ! Staff is friendly, yet very slow service. Very dark ambiance at night, it's like an upscale sports bar look. A bar with large tvs and a fancy dining room. No outdoor seating. Food is good and large portioned .

Yummy! Wish I had more room to try more dishes. Everything I had was delicious. My brother and I sat at the bar. The bar tender was super attentive. Guy next to me ate five courses and every dish of his looked great too.  With so many beers on tap, good luck picking which one you want. Ask for a sample if you aren't sure. Get there during happy hour to try more for less.  I drank the Breckenridge Avalanche Amber on tap, made right in Denver 5.4%. I also had the pot pie - OMG - huge. Bartender told me it was big, but he failed to say bigger than my head! Next time I am in Aurora area I will definitely go here to eat and drink again!
Amazing selections of beers and cocktails. The thai pizza is delicious. It is so different than any other pizza and hits the spot.

Gorgeous spot for Yard House!! It's attached to the mall and spacious inside! We placed an order over the phone to pick up and the girl said it would 10 minutes and it's already 30 minutes!! What kind of service is this?!? The food is not as GOOD as the location in Houston! Not sure if it's because we took our food to go, but that shouldn't make a huge difference. I always order my favorite entree Skirt Steak Salad. I was extremely disappointed! My hard boiled egg in the salad was too hard. The dressing was mixed in with the gonz. Cheese. I would prefer if they packaged this up separately. The strips of bell peppers was clumped to the side...I give my salad a 4. My friend ordered the kids Mac and cheese and didn't eat much of it at all. This was her first time trying Yard House and I'm sooo bummed she didn't have a good experience with the food here. We will definitely have to try the one in Houston! I never have complained about the poor food there. However, she loved the edamame seasoned with garlic..for me it was heavily on the seasonings. Watch out for their edamame!!! My friend had bad gas from it. Lol!!

No complaints about the food. Bar was a bit iffy. I know it's a yard house serving a huge variety of beers; however, it could use a better reds selection and the bartender should be more efficient in mixing. Kids enjoyed their food and dessert that came with it. Great spot to catch a game.
I love the beer list. I've been here several times and the staff is always first rate.

We usually come here for a beer or two when the "usual" isn't sounding so great. The beer menu is outstanding, and I am always trying something new. I've found a few new favorites because of this place! The food is always outstanding, though I do feel some of the dishes are a bit overpriced.

Will definitely be back again and again. Those Moo Shu egg rolls are heaven!

I had the ginger-crusted salmon over wasabi-mashed potatoes. Atop the fish was a pile of fried carrot "fries". My mind was blown. What a unique concoction! And an added bonus: it was delicious, truly exemplary.

Unfortunately, everything else about my dinner was unexceptional, bordering sub-par. The fried calamari for starter lacked the crunchiness I anticipated. The brownie dessert was under-cooked. The wait before we ordered, the wait to order our dessert, the wait to receive our dessert, the wait for the bill - I was hungry again by the time I left. Obviously an exaggeration, but the point is made.
Service was marginal. We waited 25 minutes for our appetizers to arrive. DON'T GET THE CALAMARI it was gross. The edamame however was very good. We also had the Margarita pizza which was tasty.

Anyone who has been to the Yard House knows they have an extensive beer menu. I have learned that it isn't just a great place to get a beer, they also have excellent food. In this instance, we had just watched a free concert by One Republic in the Park Meadows parking lot. Ryan Tedder mentioned how he loved The Yard House before leaving the stage. We thought the same thing and headed that way for a late dinner. After going over the menu multiple times, I landed on the salmon.
