It was a ginger crusted Norwegian salmon with wasabi mashed potatoes, snow peas, and carrots covered in a spicy peanut vinaigrette. I felt like the snow peas and carrots were overwhelming for the dish, but the salmon and potatoes were perfect. They were cooked extremely well.  Brian got the blackened swordfish tacos. All of the flavors of the fish, mango and papaya came together to make an excellent taco. Great food, great beer and fantastic service!

I've had lunch here a couple of times now with coworkers. I love the gardein options available! This last visit, I ordered the turkey burger and it was so, so good. Had just the right crust on the burger and right seasoning. The bun was buttered and the burger had just the right amount of grease. It was the perfect lunch! Service was a little slow, but there was a lunch rush, so I get it.. I'd like to try some more things on the menu!

My friend and I sat the bar for late night drinks. The bartender gave me great drink recommendations. I didn't ask about their food since we only got hummus. I should've asked. The hummus was bland and completely flavorless. The pita bread and tortilla chips were very fresh...bread was soft and chia were crunchy.
Awesome beer selection with a pretty steady rotation. I can always find something I want to drink here. Being an IPA fan I say go for the Six-Pack IPA sampler!

I was here for a business dinner and I had a steak that was cook perfect to my requirements.  The service was stellar and this place has many different beers to try from the bar.  Furthermore, they will bring you a sample if you have never heard of the beer, which I thought was cool, so we will be back.

I am posting this poor review based mostly on my husbands experience rather than mine.  For the first time in 35 years, we walked away without tipping.  I have NEVER done that and frankly am a bit shocked that my husband did.  Given our personalities - I would be voted the most likely to not tip.  And this over a piece of bread. Yes - bread.  Hubby was in the mood for a bowl of soup.  But hubby can't have his soup w/out bread.  So he asked our server if he could get bread w/ his soup and the server said of course!   Well the bread never showed - 30 + minutes hubby tried to get some bread - asking our server 3 times and the person who delivered the food once.  Nothing.  Soup went cold and not only did we not get the bread - we didn't even get an offer for something else or at least a warm bowl of soup.  We had to ask for the soup to be removed from the bill.  If bread was such a difficult request to fill - if our server had simply said...no, sorry we aren't able to serve bread w/ your soup...hubby would have ordered something different.  Instead - the poor man looked like Oliver in the soup line asking for more....

Can I give a 0 star? Absolutely disgusting food. Go to McDonalds. Ordered angel hair pasta which was a pile of unflavored slop with huge unappetizing chucks of eggplant. You all should grill thin slices with olive oil and lemon to present a better looking meal. Yuk.

This is a great spot for happy hour, dinner, lunch etc. I love going for happy hour. We live about 20 minutes away and as some of you may know around happy hour time I25 can be a pain and the wait at this Yard House can get a little hefty. We always use call ahead and when ever we show up at most have to wait about 10 minutes. They do a great job with their call ahead. I have gone to other places with call ahead and you get there and still have to wait 45 minutes...NEVER with Yard House! Love the food, but so many choices its so hard to decide sometimes :)

Late night happy hour starting @9PM! I got a pineapple cider & 2 dishes off the happy hour menu. I got garlic noodles ($5) & traditional chicken wings (firecracker flavor for $6). The value is ridiculous! I thought happy hour menu items would be tiny considering the price but they were huge! The $6 wings came on a bed of purple cabbage and amounted to 8-10 wings! They have 3 sauce options: firecracker (sweet Asian zing), buffalo & Jamaican jerk rub. The garlic noodles were very buttery & were more like a pasta as opposed to the garlic noodles you get @ Asian restaurants. It came with chicken, pieces of asparagus & a ton of mushroom! The space is moody & modern & the beer/cider/alcohol list is huge! It's adjacent to the mall so it makes for a great post mall night cap place. Other happy hour menu items include vampire tacos, boneless wings, sliders & tuna stackers. There were about 15 options from this menu.

This is by far the best restaurant in the south metro area. The food is great with many unique entrées, and the beer selection, not to mention cider, wine, and spirits, is enormous. If you haven't been to Yard House yet, you're plain doing it wrong.
The food was delicious and the service was wonderful. Ask for Jeff's section, he's the best. :-)

The food was awesome and we had about the best service ever from Spencer. 

Our food took about 15 minutes which was understandable for how busy it was.
We came for a birthday dinner and had a great time. 


Huge beer selection, great place for a date night!

I think I have been to the Yard House at each and every time of day, at the Mills, Park Meadows, Downtown, and in California and Scottsdale, Arizona!  In reviewing my Yelp activity, I can't believe I haven't checked in, or reviewed it even once - so here it goes!  The beer list is awesome, and their happy hour is grood.  (Not a typo, I really want to say "great" - but can't get the word out, so lean on ending at "good.")  Why, you ask?  When the bill comes, it is always just a little more than I expect for what seems like a good deal at the time I am ordering and drinking.  Secondly (and this is not just for beer-thirty) regardless of time, location, lunar or solar positioning, etc., there is a "shift change" mid-dining or drinking experience.  It's just awkward.  But, back to the first comment - beer selection is unparalleled, and rarely, rarely, rarely, does one labor over the extended beer list, only to order and be told, "sorry, we're out."  (One of my pet peeves, that has not happened here!)  My "hint" for the unwieldy menu...all of the food is delicious, and the presentation is impressive.  Before you even GLANCE at the menu, I mean even PEEK - know what you do not want, and do NOT look at that section of the menu.  If you don't want pizza - that's ok!  Not feelin' a salad?  Leave it for the rabbits - don't look!  Looking at what you don't want will only tempt and confuse you because the combinations and descriptions are all appetizing.  Think about what you are in the mood for at the time (mexican, asian, sandwich, hefty entree, mix of apps, pasta, etc.,) and stay focused!!!!  If you try to choose from the vast menu, you'll end up with order envy (or order regret) - I promise.  Plan to come back again when you are craving something else!  The quality of the food is outstanding and always fresh (hot if it's supposed to be hot; not if it's not); portions are large (thankfully, because it isn't cheap).  Sometimes it gets loud, particularly when it is busy, so if you are down for an intimate conversation, pick somewhere else (or snuggle up on the same side of a comfy booth); and it is a bit dark - two things to keep in mind if you are planning a business lunch.  Interestingly, and as a couple other Yelpers have commented, sitting at the bar is sweeeeet - even if you are not alone.  Bartenders are always friendly and attentive, and keep a "running tab" in front of you so when you are ready to pay, you can.  If you eat at the bar, they use a big napkin as a "tablecloth" and the bar isn't framed in a way that makes it difficult to eat.  When it gets crowded, it's close - super close.  Although there are TV's, particularly around the bar, it does not have a cheesy sports-bar vibe.  To me, it is more about the drinks, food, and music - the music selection is awesome, always.  There will be a wait, if you show during busy hours - it is worth it (if you have the time), and every time I have been there with a wait - the pager goes off in no more time than promised!  Bathrooms are always clean, cloth napkins, properly uniformed staff, manager makes his or her rounds, consistently good service, quickly bussed tables, no charge for soda water today!!!  Worth a try - regardless of where!
Great food in hose and cold cold beer just don't order take out... They always get it wrong

1st time visitor to here but was very happy with the beer selection and my burger was very good.  Our server, Carly, was fantastic!  She was attentive, kept us apprised of the extra time that the kitchen seemed to be taking, even apologizing for the wait at one point.  I never did notice an excessive wait but was appreciative of her thinking about it.  She truly seemed to enjoy her job which came through in her level of service.  I'll come back again!
Good for a decent place for dinner and drinks. Has fallen off a bit since it opened. No reason the booths should have worn and torn vinyl.

I have come here for a couple occasions now. I really like the parking situation (and valet is available when it gets crowded). We usually don't have to wait long, as they take call ahead seating. Impressive beer selection and food. Last time we came here we had really slow service and a waitress who seemed to be having a bad Some menu items are spectacular, some are just meh. My go to is the turkey club. All the appetizers and burgers here are good. Not a fan of the fancier entrees. The size of the menu makes it overwhelming to make up  your mind.

Order 3 appetisers did not know it was HUGE... Crab cake was pretty good. Fried calamary was good too. The only thing was the lettuce chicken, someone forgot towash the lettuce... It still have Mud on it... very organic I guess. Violet have the chicken strip it was HUGE too for her. Over all good food, good atmosphire and good service. 

Will be back!

This is a great happy hour or dinner spot. Food isn't mind blowing but it's consistent and the beer selection is fantastic. 

Absolutely love sitting at the bar! Bartenders are really friendly and knowledgeable about both the food and drink menu. 

Definitely a long wait during peak times which is to be expected in The Vistas but don't be surprised if you're people watching from the lobby for a while.

I was contacted by management so they could help figure out the service issue I explained in my previous review. I appreciate places that make an effort to create an enjoyable experience for the customer and to help make up for it if the experience wasn't up to par. I will definitely be back thanks to Ashleigh following up with me. Like I mentioned in my previous review, this place has some really good food and beer selection. I'm excited to go back and try some new items/drinks on the menu.
Food is alright, nothing outstanding. Service mediocre, but no service job is easy, definitely worth the alcohol oh and happy hour

I love Yardhouse.  Probably one of my favorite chains if I am being honest.  This one is excellent, great staff, quick service and consistent food.  I will say, my rice was a bit undercooked last night, but no matter.  Everything else was excellent.  My better half had the Lobster-Crab Omelette and said it was fantastic.  I, being a vegan, had the Orange Peel Gardein Chicken.  One of my favorites, and always tasty.  Our waitress' name was Kacie and I must tell you, this petite woman is one of the best I have ever seen.  Very personable, friendly and I never wanted for anything!  Boy was she quick.  Definitely keep her Yardhouse.  If you are in this area check it out.  Vegan options, Gluten-Free menu, great selection of beer and wine.  Definitely worth a stop at this Yardhouse!
Love this place. Awesome happy hour, food is delicious and service has been great for us every time we go.
First time at this restaurant.  Had the California Roll and Ahi Poke appetizers.  FANTASTIC.  Server was friendly and informative.  Will definitely come here again.

I would say my review is in line with the majority of the other reviews on Yelp. This particular experience I had was consistent, the service was good, and the team that was serving our group (about 20 people) were definitely on top of things. 

We did a spread of appetizers, everything from Mahi to hot wings, to onion rings, you name it. Everything was good, it was cooked fresh and definitely had a taste to it that would put any "chain" restaurant to shame. 

Spend a couple extra dollars at Yard House, give it a shot, I am sure you will be impressed and would make it a point to come back in the future. I would give them 3.5 stars, but because of the level of service we received, I will definitely give them four stars.

The staff was really helpful, proactive, and welcoming with our party of 20. I had the lunch portion Ahi Crunchy salad that had approx 3 oz of seared Ahi tuna. The vinaigrette was tasty and complemented the tuna, but it seemed to be heavily dressed, so I think next time, I will ask for dressing on the side.

I have always loved the Yard House because of their selection of Gardein products. Their Gardein buffalo wings and orange chicken are so delicious, meat eaters even like them. Awesome drink menu, I guess the only con to this place is that sometimes it can be too loud.

I've reviewed the other yard house but this sitting exceeded my expectations. They always are so perfect and peanut matter which one you go to. 

Service =perfect 

The food was great my buddies and I arrived about 30 minutes before happy hour but luckily they have the snacks menu for some cheap eats anyway. After happy hour started the liquor started to flow on our thirsty Thursday. 

The burgers were great as well. 

I have nothing negative to say and have never had a bad experience at any yard house. The beer is obviously great. 

DONT FORGET THE TRAVELING CHALK BOARD

amazing food, amazing service the only concern is a little of cleanliness at places like under the table.. with a child you are forced to see at all the wanted unwanted places...lol!! The server was reallly friendly and tried to accomodate all our requests.

Food is ok, didn't find it to be anything special. I don't recommend going with a large party- service wasn't great - mixed up a lot of our orders and forgot drinks - very slow service for not even being that busy.

I have become somewhat addicted to another chain restaurant, and while I should be terribly ashamed, I have decided that 100+ types of beers will soothe my tears. 

You can count on the Yard House to satisfy even your most picky eaters as well, because the menu is massive. There are no reasons to think the food items are gourmet, but you can count on a solid meal as a reasonable price. And if the food sucks, then you can drown your liver in so many beers that it becomes very hard to chose.

Pay close attention to the rotating menu of on-tap beers, because there are some delicious options you may not find anywhere else in the city. So, if you are stuck at the mall looking at clothes with your significant other, hire another dude to stand there for you and go have a frosty beverage and some sweet potato fries!

Wide selection of beers and happy hour prices are reasonable. My friend found the tip of a plastic knife in his queso dip which was disheartening, however the manager took care of the issue and comped some of the other apps. Main appeal here is the beer selection.

I'm not sure how long Yard House has been at Park Meadows, but you'd think it just opened.  It was insanely busy this past Friday.  Thankfully we had called ahead and only waited about 15 minutes after arriving.  Our server (Kai) was friendly and on top of things.  It never felt that we had to wait long for anything.  Even without seeing the kitchen I'm impressed at how efficient they are.

I'm half tempted to give a one star deduction for the outrageous prices.  The food is good, but not really any more special than other chains like Elephant Bar.  A pint of beer will set you back $6, and some salads and other entrées are easily $17.

If you can sit on the west side of the restaurant it is much quieter than sitting near the bar area.

I became a fan of Yardhouse when I lived in Hawaii -- unfortunately the mainland branches don't compare. The ahi isn't anywhere near what you get in Waikiki but I can't blame the restaurant itself - just not a beachy, paradise location. The beer selection is decent --- if only they had more Cali craft brews!
Great food and good service. Burgers are big and tasty and the Ahi sandwich on rye is terrific. We will be back.

Lousy. We asked the hotel clerk where the locals eat, and he sent us here. Either he was sadly mistaken, or the locals have very bad taste. Decent service, awful food. Was a TGI Fridays in disguise. A lot of variety, nothing done well. My wife had a flavorless rice bowl, and I had a watery bland penne pasta dish. Avoid.

This place used to be pretty good. The last time I was there though, they were out of pickles and that made me kind of sad. A burger without pickles is like bread without butter. They were also out of ice cream. Also, 3 out of four of us got burgers and they forgot the dipping sauces that were supposed to come with all three of them. It was too busy for our waiter to get back to us in a timely manner, so we had to go without. And I don't blame the waiter for this, I blame management for understaffing. They also changed the presentation of their food and it just isn't as nice as it used to be. I think this place may be under new management, and they totally suck. It seems like service is going downhill. I used to love this place but not so much anymore.... They also don't give you salt and pepper on the table.... ????? Why all the changes? You shouldn't change a good thing...,,

I was very impressed with the place. We had very good service, very good food and fantastic beer. They had a large food selection, including vegetarian options. I'm a meat eater, so I had seafood and it was very tasty.

We mainly went there for the beer. They have a very large selection and you can get beers in three different sizes, so if you want to try many, you don't have to commit to large glasses. They also have quite a few lambics to choose from and that's the first time I've seen a restaurant in Colorado that had that.

They told me they don't take reservations but we were able to do call-ahead seating and avoid a long wait.

The soufflés are very tasty but small. That would be my only criticism.

Pig wings! Yesssss! Stopped by last night before a movie and sat at the bar. Enjoyed great service and amazing food. It's clear that the people working there are incredibly invested in the success of the business--the pride and pleasant attitudes were great to see.

And the pig wings. A must purchase! I'll be the first to admit that the location wouldn't be my first choice...but I can see myself going back pre-movie just for some amazing pork.

This was our first order and we got delivery. The order was exactly what we ordered and it got here fast! A great start for a new place!

The wings...were amazing!  The finish on the grill makes a huge taste treat.

We got teriyaki, Cajun dry rub and one I think was called smoking hot. That had major heat for 2 very experienced guys who eat ridiculously hot food regularly! 

We will be back and we will eat in the restaurant next time since it replaced where we used to go a lot when it was a sushi restaurant.

Not much to say other than the wings were fantastic. Love the way they are prepared. Finishing them on the grill really enhances the texture and flavor. Sauces were great - we chose BBQ wild and Sweet Ginger Thai. 

Service was excellent, too. We'll be back.

After reading the reviews I had to try the pig wings...if not for the sauce I would have needed a little more seasoning. However, i was pleased with the food and the service, very nice waiter. Not to mention it's only five minutes away. I also ordered the jumbo shrimp and traditional wings. A must try!

I am from Jacksonville, FL and found this restaurant on yelp. OMG! This food was amazing. I had the shrimp, grilled wings and fried corn that I can only imagine was blessed by God! I need them to move to Jacksonville with me.

Those pig wings... Oh. Em. Gee. 
They serve booze, good fries, good rings, and the chicken wings are actually pretty good. But those pig wings - wow. Oh, and the sauce sampler is a great touch. Good service. Nothing bad at all to say about this place.

Hope this place is busy more often they have the best wings in Denver. I came in around 2 on a Tuesday. The arrangement is a little different than the other one and when I walked in I didn't know if I was to order at the bar or what. Adrienne just told me to sit and she would come to me. I ordered just wings this time but I usually get their pigs wings too (a must try!). I ordered honey hot, teriyaki, and lemon pepper seasoning. The wings came out perfect. The sauces were on point except the lemon pepper wings needed more seasoning. Carrots and celery were cold and fresh and the ranch was cold. They have multiple tvs inside to watch the game and a nice patio when it's nice outside I'll definitely be back!

This is a true find for a comfortable casual family friendly restaurant offering great food and outstanding friendly service. We have become regulars and have never been disappointed. We have recommended this restaurant to all of our friends and we have only gotten totally positive feedback. If you like chicken wings...this is your place. The menu is reasonably complete. Salads are fresh and a simple but more than adequate. Tonight I had a Caesar Salad with Chicken Tenders and it was superb. They are currently offering an avocado app to die for. Don't miss the desserts...they are killer. I have no doubt you will enjoy and will frequent this easily accessible restaurant. Don't miss the small but neighborhood friendly full service bar. They also have a large heated patio for larger groups and families.
If you are looking for a casual cool atmosphere that will not break the bank try this place. Service was top notch and the FOOD IS AMAZING!

How great is this place? Bartender Jaysin greeted me immediately and I couldn't ask for better enthusiasm from  an employee. So far a good start. Ordered a full dozen chix wings and a five piece jumbo shrimp. Unbelievable. Perfectly crispy. Will be coming back.
The wings are awesome, cant go wrong....BUT, if youre deciding between lone tree or the University location, youll save time driving there - this spot is RIDICULOUSLY slow

My brother was in town from Idaho over the weekend and only being in Highlands Ranch for less than a year I had not looked very hard for a good wing place until now. Found a couple of good possibilities here on Yelp but decided to go with the ratings and they were right.

Usually my brother and I go for the melt your face off kind of wings, as long as they taste good. GWT has a good variety of sauces, not the Triple Atomic or Chernobyl level but a good variety. And as you have seen from the posted pictures, they bring you a sampling tray which I think is a really smart idea.

We ended up ordering a couple dozen wings so we could get 4 sauces, one dozen pig wings, 2 sauces and I think it was an order of 10 of the jumbo shrimp.

I'll start with the staple, the wings. I love grilled chicken but I have never grilled wings. And in the variety of sauces they were all really good. The pig wings were delicious as well. The jumbo shrimp, AWESOME! They were huge, truly JUMBO. and of course you get a sauce with them. They were delicious!

I already started thinking on Sunday what I will order the next time I go there. :)

I found a new hidden gem in my neck of suburbia. This place offers chicken wings, but they have a secret that most do not offer and it's called Pig Wings. These are delicious and that is why I'm back. Amazing sauces and selections. They even offer different varieties of fries, from truffle parma cheese to pork green chili. Service is excellent and the food is amazing. I would recommend this place to anyone who likes to try uniquely tasty foods.

This is a great little lunch, casual dinner place...in the heart of Park Meadows shopping district in Lone Tree, Colorado. We were here for lunch on a Wednesday with our 3 small kids amongst business people and other young professionals enjoying a nice casual lunch enjoying a local craft beer. Wonderful wings, onion rings, special fries, prawns, jalapeños & more! They also have full bar selection of your favorite liquor including gluten free Tito's vodka. Lots of TV's around too for your viewing sports or news pleasure! A really cool concept I would love to take back to St Louis. By the way...this is Where Pigs Fly!!!

Among the best wings I've had in Colorado, and I've had an awful lot of them. I tried both the chicken and the pig wings, and do prefer the chicken wings. Fried, then grilled. (Having that char gives a lovely illusion that they're prepared in a lower-fat manner, despite the underpinnings!) I had an extremely enthusiastic and responsive server. I do agree with one prior comment that the 'try our sauces' table buffet might not pass muster with the Health Department, so they might reconsider that. Maybe make free individualized 'three-sauce samplers' available on request.

Went for my first time tonight and will not return. I see that I am in the minority here so let me explain why I won't be back. First off, I found the sample sauce platter to be really gross as the SAME platter and the sauces are shared with multiple tables. The waiter explained this and there's even a sign on the platter saying not to double dip. I find this really gross! Who knows who else sampled the same exact same sauces and what they did while the platter was at their table. Also, the celery and carrots that were provided with the sauces where limp and pale in color. 

The wings themselves were OK - nothing spectacular, in my opinion. We also tried the onion rings and I didn't find them to be anything beyond average. 

It is important to note that my husband was with me, and while he was also grossed out by the sauce platter, he liked the wings more than I did. So, it is possible that I have different tastes than the majority, but I stand by the fact that the sauce sample platter is just plain gross and unhygienic.
Found this place by accident!!  This is the best place for wings I have in the Denver area by far.

Probably the best chicken tenders I have ever had. They were my daughter's. I had to steal some fron her. Next time I am ordering my own! Wings are smokey and good. Jalapenos are on point. I am not a big fan of the pork wings. They were pretty good but there are other things better there. Must try!

I think they should leave the sauces at the counter though. Can't imagine health department being ok with that. I would rather go up to try sauces that I know is cleaned and being monitored.

I love their wings!!!!!! My husband is obsessed with chicken wings so I went to many restaurants to try wings and this is my favorite. Their pig wings and chicken wings are char grilled.  It is delicious and I don't feel bad after eating it because there isn't much fat left on the wings. Their sauce is not over powering. Their shrimp is amazing too. You must try it. If you love beer this is a to go place. They serve draft beer just right.

5 stars because it is EXACTLY what they claim to be.  Grilled wings that are supper yummy, served with a ton of choices for sauce and always great service.  There are usually regulars at the bar and sports on tv.  It is just what you want in a wing place.... Great wings.  They have pig wings, which are also tasty and I personally think the fries are good too.  If you are looking for wings in the area... this is the place to go.  It is a nice change from Bdubs and offers a different and more local atmosphere. The staff at this location is top notch and we always have a good time!

I had a great experience!  I loved that they had a sauce tray so you could sample all of their sauces before finalizing your selection.I tried the Sweet Ginger Thai on the pork wings and the honey got on the chicken wings.  Every thing was so good!  And really friendly and helpful service!
This place is amazing!! Best wings in town the grilled wings are prepared perfectly!! The waiters are also very good !! Overall great vibe !!

This place is so awesome I'm actually writing this review while sitting waiting for my husband to finish his beer. 
Seriously this place is sooooooo good. We had the pigs wings in honey hot, chicken wings in medium and bbq wild. The bbq wild and honey hot were our favorites.
Our waiter was Nathan, he was awesome too! Super nice, courteous and keep the drinks filled! Our food came out fast and was pipping hot!!
Come and give this new establishment a visit, you won't be disappointed
Great wings-not too wet. The pig wings were delicious- I would order them again.  The service was great, he was very attentive. We enjoyed patio dining; I will return!

3 1/2 stars because The wings and fries are very good. I agree with a previous reviewer about the sauce sample platter and potential for double dipping. Not very appetizing considering they took ours and brought it directly to another table. What if I stuck my fingers in the bowls? I didn't but ... 

A full bar is nice. I think the menu needs to be bigger tho my wife was happy.

The staff was so friendly and helpful. We usually like fried wings and wanted to give somthing else a try and now I won't go back. I loved the flavor they grill it with and give you the sauce on the side. My favorite is the garlic spicy...

Great addition to Lone Tree! The menu is simple (a good thing) with some great selections. My seven year old and I tried the chicken wings and the pig wings. Both were fantastic! The wings are also a great size. If you're used to the little mini wings at Buffalo Wild Wings then you're in for a treat.

They have other items on the menu that we will definitely try next time (the shrimp and the fries).

The staff was great and you pick up on the locally owned vibe.

There's no reason for us to cross over County Line Rd. for Buffalo Wild Wings ever again!

Try the pig wings!
We were in town from Vegas and had just spent the afternoon at the zoo. Came across this little place (not a lot of space inside). We were there on a late Sunday afternoon and there were only a couple other people in there. We decided to try a little bit of everything. Wings were good but nothing really made them stand out to me. I think next time I would try them with dry seasonings. We also had the grilled shrimp which were very good and a nice addition to a wing meal. The pig wings were great. Very meaty and tasty with the sauce we chose, hot honey. I also think these would be good with dry rub seasonings. As a side dish we got the jalapeño caps. They are deep fried pieces of jalapeño. Not super hot, just right. 
Overall enjoyed the experience and thought the food was good value and good atmosphere.
Hesitant to try this place based on its curbside appeal. Glad we stopped in!! Very good wings with wonderful sauces. Sides weren't bad. Staff was friendly. Food was great!

This place was a fun find on a Saturday afternoon. One of the reasons Yelp is a great way to find new places.

The service was great, the sampling of the various sauces before ordering was a really great way to try something new. The wings are good size and larger than the national chain who's name I won't mention.

They had several TV's for any sports fan, and for warmer weather it looks like they have a decent patio for outdoor seating.

I will bookmark this place, and would come back.

The best chicken wings I've ever had! I had the Cajun dry rub and the wings were juicy and delicious! I can't wait to go back again. Finally, a place that has superb wings. There is a bar, but this is more of an eating establishment than a sports bar. No problem with me. If you like chicken wings, you gotta try this place.

There's so much to say about this place! The customer service was excellent. There was a misunderstanding on my order but the waiter had no problem fixing it and letting me keep the other order. The wings were crispy (which I absolutely love) and they give you extra sauce on the side to pour to your liking. And, before even ordering, they bring you a cool tray of all the sauces so you can try them before you order!! Such a great idea! I'd recommend the Sweet Ginger Thai and Teriyaki, and the Chili Cheese fries were so good. This is my new favorite wing place! The only downfall is that it's a bit pricey, but it's definitely worth it.

The wings are fantastic and so are the fries.  Our server was great too.  The only problem is the atmosphere...it needs music to compete with the Rio.  You almost feel like you weren't invited to the party going on next door which is sad because the food is excellent.  Also, it would be nice to have TVs outside.

We have been trying to find a great wing place closer to town, and I believe we found it! The wings came out hot and crispy and delicious. I am very picky about wing sauces, especially buffalo, and theirs was terrific!
Our server Andrew was very professional and friendly. He was very informative of the menu, and he was true to the description of the food.
Very satisfied, and will be back for sure
Highly recommended going if you want some mouth watering wings

What a great find this was! I was at a doctors appointment with the hubs in the local area and decided to.stop by today for lunch. Had some chicken tenders and some pig wings. Oh my, what could those be?  Well, according to our waiter extraordinaire, Jason, it's a shank and we couldn't leave without ordering some. They were certainly a wonderful surprise. Jason greeted us from the bar area and immediately assisted us with drink orders and brought out a tray of 15 to 20 different sauces to try with small strips of carrot and celery. It was hard to make the choice.  We liked so many, but narrowed it down to one sweet and one spicy. The iced tea and Coke refills kept coming without having to ask. The food was served quickly and piping hot. We ordered the lunch specials, the quality of the chicken breast for the tenders was off the chain. Those pork wings were fat and gristle free and fall off the bone delicious. (Pictures included).    We're definitely coming back.  Jason says not to miss the shrimp, and we won't. The chicken portions were offered either battered or grilled which was nice to hear. I ordered battered this time and could taste the underlying lime flavor, Jason was extremely knowledgeable on all of the preparations and the sauces and explained that the batter is chipotle lime based, yet it was mild and flavorful and not bland. The french fries were well seasoned. We can't wait to go back and sit out on their fully covered patio as we did today. Parking is ample and it is a couple doors down from Sweet tomatoes, & easy to find from that reference point. Food was terrific, but the star of the day was definitely Jason, the on the ball, one-man show during today's lunch hour. He was so friendly and answered all of our questions and made great suggestion for us.  There were people at several other tables, yet none of us were ignored and we all appeared to have excellent service.  Great job Jason!!!!!
Came here for wings but fell in love with their pork wings. Good food and the price isn't bad. Definitely will be back

Amazing wings, great sauces. 
Try the crispy shrimp sliders with again bite, they are awesome.
The pork wings are phenomenal and their corn on the cobb is great! Overall great food and great people!
Gotta say, it's gets the 3G's from me....good food, good service, and good people! Next time I will have to go for the pork wings because the chicken stole the show. YUM!

The wings are really delicious.  Deep fried then finished on the grill to caramelize the sauces.  We got 1.5 dozen and were able to try three sauces:  hot, honey garlic and the jerk (dry rub).  Very tasty!  The service was pleasant.  I also got a side salad which was pretty meh but--then again--most people probably aren't coming for the salad.  There's another bigger chain wing resto in the area but you should give this place a try!  Plenty of screens to enjoy the sports too.
Stopped by for lunch and got the 5 tenders with 2 sauces. They make sauces in-house, the rest are not made from scratch. Huge potion of chicken for the price!!'

Really good place, need to go after work so I can have a beer with my wings. Huge variety of sauces. Awesome they let you sample first. Great lunch specials. Chickens strips are bomb. Jalapeño caps are a must. Great place to try!

One of my new places to eat!!! Ok so here's the deal. They start you off with a tray so you can sample all of their sauces, which was really cool and definitely changed my mind on a couple of sauces that I was going to get. Once you order wings, they are fried tossed in the sauce of your choosing THEN grilled! So the wings are not covered in sauce when you get them. They tend to have more of a background flavor but they do provide extra sauce on the side if you like! (Which I do). The wings are delicious and very crispy, and if you buy 2 beers you get your wings at half off!! What a good reason to drink!, service was amazing, and just for funzies I got a desert (deep fried brownies) since they sponsors the Broncos, and they were great!! I will definitely be going back! Side note! The dry rumba are VERY dry! Stick to sauces!

This place is amazing! Get the "pig wings." The staff is amazing and the atmosphere is just what you're looking for. First off, when you sit down, they put a tray in front of you with all of their sauces so you can sample before ordering. Go here!!

Yum!  The chicken wings were amazing! Really good flavor from the grill really add something.  The pig wings were delish too!  So tender that they just fell off the bone!  I love that you can sample all of their sauces to before you decide what you want with your meal.  The staff was friendly and the atmosphere was nice.

yeah. realllllly good stuff. the pig wings for sure are the surprise hero. fried corn on the cob pretty ridiculous too. and the fudge-filled brownies in pancake batter and fried.... umm... what could be wrong?

I reviewed the University & Exposition location a long time ago. Was pleasantly surprised to drive by and discover this location! Just as good as the original, good service and great food. I swear the Sweet Thai Chili pig wings are like crack. I could eat them until I burst. A "must-try".
Have been here twice in the last two weeks. Both times the food was fantastic. Finally tried the pig wings and they did not disappoint. Try it out, you won't be sorry!

I have been here a few times.  Food is good.  Standard wings and such.  

The reason for one star, the service.  Consistently bad...

I have yet to have a good experience.  The wait staff seems overwhelmed and not excited to see you.  

We came today with a large party, around 20 people.  We were greeted by a guy with a beard that was t excited to see us.  He had us sit outside on a cool day with out the heat on initially.  

He was irritated to help and was quite short with every response.  

I would not recommend.  Go to the original in Bonnie Brae. 

We will take our business somewhere else.

Best Wings I've tried since I left BUFFALO NY (the home of chicken wings), & it's been 4 years I tried the bbq and Cajun dry rub and mango habanero and the pork wings were really good tried the sweet and spicy on those. I'm more of a traditional chicken wing kinda girl but the pork wings were fantastic. I fellow NYer works there too friendly and great service! You better get in your car now and go get some, thanks for the 20% off that was awesome! I will be returning...maybe even tonight lol

Enjoyed trying this new wing place. They definitely have better fries than Buffalo Wild Wings, and the portions are more generous. Also, being able to try the sauces is great. I also loved their beer list. The "pig wings" were especially tasty, and I like them better than traditional chicken wings. I do wish that they had boneless options that weren't fingers, but to be fair, we didn't try the fingers/strips, so they may be good. The service was good, and the only negative thing was that the atmosphere was very quiet and subdued, despite having 6-7 tables full. We'll definitely give it another try.

Best wings EVER and I know my wings!!!!! Great sauces and cooked to perfection.  Onion rings and fries are great too!  Even had deep fried brownie bites! Yuummmm
Thanks for the best wings in town!!!

So excited this amazing "Wing Heaven" is now near the Ranch -- we used to go to the one near DU -- loved the medium extra crispy, hot & mango habanero extra crispy & grilled over -- even the blue cheese dip was special & the guys running the place are super nice and inviting -- go here for sure & if you can stay awake after gorging go next door to United Artist & catch a movie!

Welcome to the neighborhood. Great place for wings. Their pig wings (counterintuitive, I know) are awesome, along with their traditional chicken wings. Lots of sauce choices. Andrew is a great bartender/therapist. Great music choices. Awesome Sunday evening happy hour. Go before or after a movie next door. You'll love it.

Fantastic wings at a reasonable price.  The wings are huge, I split a dozen wings and some fries with a friend and we were full.  Love the fact that they are grilled and the fact they give you a side of the sauce with the wings.  Favorite wing place yet.
Just OK.  The service was good, and the food didn't suck.  There wasn't anything that is going to make me want to come back.  Pig wings were pretty good, the chicken was a little dry.  Overall, 6/10.

This place shouldn't be open yet. Food is amazing but the service is horrendous. Lunch took over two hours. The server took 30 minutes to greet us and take our order, then waited for our food for another 30 minutes, and asked for our check immediately when he brought our food. It took him 45 minutes to bring us the checks, get them right, then ring them up. I would have loved to go back for the food but the experience was extremely painful.

Great wings are reasonable prices. I thought the service was solid and the food was great. I would avoid the Garlic Parmesan fries though. They were topped with a ton of raw garlic, which gave the fries a bitter taste. Wings are a 5/5.
I had the best wings I have had at grillin wings and things. Not only did I have the best wings but I had a very peppy and funny server, Isaac. I highly recommend this place if you really want wings.

We stumbled across this place about a week ago.  I don't like wings generally, but these are exceptionally good!  I had a wing or two, but my order of grilled Jumbo Shrimp was great.  Loved trying the sauces first.  They've only been open for about 4 months.  Great service.  This is our go to place for wings now.

Found this place the other weekend and decided to swing in for the last part of a a football game and was not disappointed. For starters the my have plenty of tubs and great happy hour specials to catch a game. The wings are top notch, best I've ever had! Service is impeccable. I will definitely be back!!

Went in for lunch the other day knowing the food is fantastic as I have eaten at the Denver location.  Once again the food did not disappoint but the service at this location was horrendous.  Nobody at the host stand so we just took a seat, not a big deal.  At least 10 minutes before a server came along. Finally we got our order in, 15 minutes after our order the soft drinks showed up, (why this took so long is beyond my logic) and over 30 minutes for our food.  Not exactly a quick place to go for lunch.  Also agree with the other commenters about the sample sauce platter, what a horrible idea, totally disgusting.  The great food will keep me coming back, I hope the service shapes up a bit, honestly the worst service I have had in years.
Great food, outstanding service. Nathan at the bar was really friendly. Our new favorite wing place!
Hands down best wings in town. They fry then grill em, very unique. They bring a sauce tray when you step on so you can try all the sauces. A new place with a good vibe.
This is much needed in the Lone Tree area! Stopped in for a quick but and the service and food is fantastic. You definitely have to get the pig wings! Great drink specials as well
I was very disappointed in this place the service was horrible took 10 minutes for my beer really. The trash was over flowing and 2 employees just looked at it and walked a way really dirty place.

Like the grilled wings! Crispy from the pre-fry and then chargrilled-very good. There's a sauce tasting platter as soon as you sit down. Great service, very friendly. WiFi wasn't working and doesn't sound like it's going to anytime soon. We will be back!
Great service.  Great food. The wings are awesome. Pre-movie or post-movie or just cuz. I'll be back. Nice addition to Lone Tree.  Get the corn on the cob!!!
Pigs really do fly at this awesome local spot. Great service and atmosphere right next door to the theatre.  Will definitely be back

Just stopped by for the first time. Wow! Awesome food! Server was super friendly and informative. Not the fastest, but oh well. Tried the buffalo hot, spicy garlic chili and the BBQ wild (kinda like Daytona style). All were good. Look forward to trying other flavors. FYI the pig wings are pretty big. Don't order as many as you normally would chicken wings.

I ordered wings for our company lunch based on Yelp reviews.  Thank you Yelpers!  I lived in western NY for awhile, home of the chicken wing, and have never found a wing in Denver that comes close, until today.  Grillin' was also a great customer service experience.  Michael was great to work with and the food was just as my fellow Yelpers described.  And don't forget the Pig Wings!

Really good meaty wings, shrimp was delicious, love how you can sample the sauces before. During the week (Mon-Thur I  think) after 7 they have 1/2 price for a dozen wings if you order two bar drinks per person which is a good deal. Staff was super nice and attentive. Looks like they have a pretty good patio too.

This place was great, the whole idea is really original with a kind of "why didn't I think of that" moment after the introduction of the sauces and the pig "wings". The chicken wings were great, pork was delicious and the sauces were unique and flavorful. We've told friends about this place and we'll definitely back. Happy hour special looked good, too.

Fantastic wings. The grilling keeps them from being soggy and flabby - Especially important if you are getting take out. There's sauce on the side you can dip into if you like super saucy wings, but it isn't necessary. The pig wings were our favorite. Kind of like eating a really meaty rib. Excellent service too. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. I will definitely be back.

Excellent wing spot. Service was awesome. Servers were very friendly and attentive. Love the sauce sampler to sample the different sauces. We went with the tenders with the hot sauce and thai ginger. Both were good choices. Jalapeño caps and onion rings were very tasty as well. I don't think you could go wrong with anything here.

Awesome place to grab some quick wings. Pig wings with bbq wild and garlic fries were great. Fast friendly service. My only complaint is that it was very quiet. Would have been nice to have some music or the games audio on (I was sitting at the bar)

I would highly recommend this place!  To start off, I loved the interior of the restaurant.  It is contemporary and very comfortable.  I also thought that the wait staff was excellent.  Our server was very attentive and friendly.  She checked on us the right number of times and was knowledgable about the menu.  

We enjoyed both the taste and the presentation all of the dishes we ordered.  The portion size was big enough - we ordered a fair amount of food and definitely had a couple of meals of leftovers to take home.  The menu had some unique options and some tasty sounding seasonal dishes that we will need to come back to try.  We decided to try an appetizer since we visited during happy hour - $2 dollars off select appetizers.  We ordered the fried wontons with chicken.  They had good flavor and were a nice bite to start off our meal.  I also ordered a bowl of Tom Yum soup to start as well.  I thought the broth was very rich and had good spice.  For our entrees, we ordered green curry and thai fried rice.  Both entrees came out hot, had fresh crisp vegetables and were super yummy.  We will definitely be back!

Hmmm...  we really wanted to love this place.  Though it's tucked in a small, non-descript shopping center, the interior is contemporary & cozy.  The wait staff were pleasant and attentive, and at first blush it seemed at first like it could become our new fave Thai joint.  

However, I'm afraid it doesn't quite fit the bill.  And by that, I mean that their prices & a la cart style menu do not match the clientele they will surely attract considering their location.  All in all, we felt the bill was way too high for four people, and we didn't appreciate that they charged extra for rice.  When you order curry, rice is expected.  

It's the little things that bugged me about this place.  Therefore, I can't bring myself to give it more than 2 stars, and I likely won't be back.

Citizen Thai Bistro is offering something very special in what can be generously described as a culinary wasteland. Having experienced a wide variety of Thai cuisine in so many settings (our family is American/Thai bi-cultural) we know when to take note. 

Lakewood! You need to wake up and keep this place busy!  If you don't they will go away and you will be stuck with nothing but corporate machine food. 

First thing: the menu was nothing like I had ever seen. Most Thai restaurants ply the same fare; not Citizen Thai Bistro. They chart their own course.  A long time Thai food aficionado, I didn't recognize most of their menu. 

I ordered the Peppercork pork. Wow! What a masterful dish. The pork was thinly cut, and the sauce was out of this world crazy unique and delicious. It comes with egg plant (which I normally hate). But somehow they found a way to make it the best part. Really! Egg plant you say? Yes! Absolutely, for yet first time in my life I relished egg plant! 

Going further the decor was pleasant, modern, chic, and very Thai. 

The service was timely, and perfect. 

What else can I say? 

We drove from across the city 15 miles away and it was totally worth it.

I am so happy I found this restaurant while staying at the Courtyard Marriott for work. The food is so fresh and delicious. The owners make it a point to check on the diners and the staff is so sweet and helpful. I ate here with my coworker twice in one week. I recommend this restaurant to anyone who likes Thai food and a cool atmosphere.

Citizen Thai

We live in Roxboughrow and wanted some great  Thai food. Something different my wife said. So she jumped on Yelp!

Citizen is a 30 minute drive for us, but it was soooo worth it! 

Best Pad Thai and Thai fried rice EVER! We were so in love with this new place we kept ordering. We tried the Curry Soup and it is an awesome experience. We also had the beef rolls... Fantastic flavors!

It's a must TRY!

We ordered our food through the yelp web page. It was ready very quickly, looked beautiful and consisted of fresh, tasty, ingredients. We had more food than we knew what to do with for the two of us and it cost us less than thirty bucks and included an appetizer. We loved the Green Curry Chicken!

Great food, nice variety specialty drinks, and wonderful people!  Very authentic Thai food on par with a nice restaurant in Bangkok.  Staff is friendly and helpful if you are not sure what to order or if you want to try something different.  The bar is small but cozy with an impressive assortment of specialty drinks - all with an oriental flare.  My new favorite cocktail is their "Thai Smile".
I can see already say I will be a regular here!

A little hard to find in the small shopping center, but well worth the quest. Comfortable and contemporary with excellent friendly service. The food was beautiful to look at and just as tasty. I had the sweet basil rice plate. It was just the right balance of spicy and garlic and the tofu was tender. My friend had the yellow curry and enjoyed it. Desserts were elegantly presented. The triple mousse (3 chocolates) was fantastic.
I drove across town to try this place and I will now be a regular.

One word:   WOW!!!  From the mango salad prawns to angel hair pad thai, with soft shell crab, everything was amazing!  Unique combinations that turn your mouth into Disneyland. Just wait for the fall special.  I got a deluxe treat with the pumpkin coconut curry.  Off the charts.  I came from out of state just to eat here.  Well worth the effort-- will be back
Go here all the time, have really good items on their menu. Also have a very good level of spice for their food. Every time I've gone in the staff has been very friendly.

This is hands down my new favorite local Thai restaurant. I love the authenticity and high quality food as well as the super friendly staff. Pad see you and/or pad thai is a go to for me here. 
-J

I'm originally from Thailand and now luckily live in Golden, CO. This place reminds me of home. Their Tom Yum Noodle and Boat noodle are fantastic. The fried banana with ice cream is also a must try. The service is also lovely, you can tell them to make your meal as spicy as you like. Definitely my favorite Thai restaurant in this area.

Great small local business that has only been open for a couple of months!  If you're into Thai food than this is the place to go.  I am not a fan of spicy food but I would say that getting spicy adds the right amount of flavor to the food.  Came here as a group and had a great time from appetizers to desserts.  Will come here again for the food and the people working there.

Been excited to try Citizen Thai so tonight my boyfriend and  I stopped and got a takeout order. First let me explain that the decor is presentable, a little too bright for dinner. We were greeted by a stressed out staff, there were 2 tables. Then a waiter eating dinner got up and took our order, very tacky on management. We ordered red curry Thai hot, which the waiter said was hotter than most. My boyfriend ordered Spicy Sweet Basil Thai hot also. 25$ later we got home anticipating our dinner and we're terribly saddened. The curry had 3 bell peppers 5 pieces of chicken and extra water to make the curry. A couple chili flakes was the call for Thai hot. The Sweet Basil for 12$ was ok but for 4$ a McDonald's happy meal would feel you up more. Good luck.

Great yellow curry, they where very friendly and the curry is fantastic. Only problem is the curry to rice ratio is off. (I know this is really just a matter of opinion and personal preference.) I used about half the curry and all the rice, so I had to get more. Other than that no complaints!

I'm not a huge fan of Asian food in general but this place knocked my socks off!

I'm going back for sure!
Awesome Thai food! Great service. Quite. Moderately priced. What else are you looking for? Thank you for a delicious dinner! I'll definitely be back!

My new favorite Thai restaurant (and that is saying something as my wife is Thai). Unique combination of authentic taste (hard to find in the Rocky Mountain area) and creativeness (new variations on Thai traditionals such as noodles added to Tom Yum soup and artistic mango with sticky rice). Cocktails are also unique and include Thai elements like lychee martini. Had the Green Curry which was excellent and the right spice level for medium. Atmosphere was good as the renovations make it very Thai like.

Not your run of the mill Thai restaurant. A little in the pricey side, but the food and service are excellent. Food is fresh, creative, and delicious with an eye to seasonal specials. Updated casual urban chic decor. 

While we particularly enjoyed the Mango Prawn Salad App, Heaven Beef Roll App, Summer Salmon Curry, Spicy Thai Pan Fried Noodles, and Emerald (Pandan Leaf) Sticky Rice with Mango, I suspect you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. My only reservation was the Tom Yum Soup which was good but did not the best I've ever had. My discerning teen son also really enjoyed the Roast Duck Noodle Soup. 

My younger son literally picked up his plate & started licking it. While I generally discourage that kind of behavior, I seriously considered  joining him. 

Lots of gluten-free and dairy-free options (which is why I eat a LOT of Thai food) , with GF being conveniently labeled on the menu.

I love Thai food and it is refreshing to have an authentic yet artistic choice to come to in the Denver area. I would highly recommend coming out! The bar has super unique drinks I haven't seen anywhere outside of NYC, LA or San Fran. The staff is friendly and knowledgable. Don't forget dessert! I'll be back often!!
Great food and service. I love Thai food and have eaten at many places. This place is hands down one of the best I have ever had. We had roti, fried wonton, veg crispy roll, and Thai basil tofu.

We came in on a Sunday night. The food was delicious, we had the Pad Thai and Pad See Yew, which are two of our staple Thai orders. Service was friendly, and the atmosphere was nice and clean. No appetizers on the menu appealed to us or desserts either unfortunately. We asked for mild food and it was just right, and considering some recent experiences with too spicy food elsewhere, that was great. Soda options are limited, but they seem to have a good bar. Was not cheap - $32 for two people with 2 sodas, but they do have a nice seasonal menu and seem t have lunch prices on the days they are open for lunch - which they are not on Sunday.

I'm Thai and I know now where I can have the best noodle bowl. I love the combination boat noodle  and the Pitsanolok noodle. It reminds me of home(Thailand). The food is so tasty. 
And I just tried Pat Thai with the transparent noodle with soft shell crab...OMG!!! This menu must try!!!!

They did a decent job if you are craving Thai food and are not willing to drive to Federal Blvd. for the real deal. The decor was nice and the service was excellent. Perhaps another server or food runner would help the only server on staff not feel as stressed out. The dishes are basic and expensive to begin with. Then, if you want rice with your curry, you have to pay extra. Curry only comes with rice at lunch, not at dinner. I
The food here is SO delicious. Try the the Pad Thai and Roti Curry Chicken Puff Rolls. The fried ice cream is fantastic! Tao and Steph are super fantastic bar tenders and the ambiance is beautiful!

Ready your passport! 

This restaurant is a created Thai oasis; Comfortable, modern and accented with notes of Thai culture. You would expect some kind of fusion place, some trendy dishes with a little heat, or someones impression of Thai.

Tasting the food will dispel all illusions. This is authentic Thai cuisine. After my first bite of Pad See You, everything changed. The meal we ate was a labor of love, carefully constructed to be Thailand. Not a copy, or a version. This is Thai food; Create by a chef who's attention to flavor will have you pricing airfare to the Far East.  

You can probably nitpick, but I have never been disappointed by a meal there. And it's always a little better than I expect. 

The Egg Noodle with Wonton Soup is not to be missed. And the classic Pad Thai is just that: Classic, yet just a little bit better than everywhere else.

Stop reading and go. You won't be disappointed.

Food is delicious! 
Friendly staff and nice atmosphere. 
I'm grateful this place is right around the corner.

This was my first time here, but not my last.  Me and the Mrs.  both ordered soups and loved the complex flavors, balance of noodle to broth, and perfect spice.   I think I've found a new favorite noodle bowl joint.   Can't wait to try the Pad Thai!
This Thai restaurant is my favorite in town! The foods are really tasty and the dishes were well prepared. The noodle soups had a very authentic Thai taste!!!! Also they have fancy cocktail drinks!

We've eaten at Citizen Thai several times and always enjoy the food, drinks, and atmosphere. The staff and owner are incredibly friendly and aim to please. Because of this we just had them cater our party last night. It was great food, everyone loved it, and Ounjit was very easy to work with. Definitely recommend!

This place was amazing!! We got the eggplant with tofu and the lamb special. My husband has not liked any Thai food in the past but I made him come because we live right next to it. He was so happy with his lamb dish and wouldn't even give me a bite! Our server was Somarrey and she was adorable, friendly and helped us with every question. We loved it here!!!
Just ate here while traveling. The food tasted pretty close to what I had in Chiang Mai, and the Thai chili is legit.
Great mix of standards and creative specials. We had the salmon curry special was out of this world. The takeout was fast and accurate.

Best Thai food I have had in Colorado. If you do not live close, such as myself, it is well worth the drive. Fantastic curry, amazing sake, spectacular service. I think I found my new fave. Oh and the soup was to die for.

This place has some potential but there are definitely some things that need to be adjusted. 

The good: the food! They're serving above average tasting Thai food that has a pretty presentation and very solid flavors. 

The bad: the prices. Everything on the menu is at least $3-5 more than it should be. The prices are already too high for all the entrees and then you have to add $3 more for any protein? That would barely fly downtown and it certainly won't in the suburbs. Also - the seating arrangement is strange and lacking privacy. Plus there is no kids menu - which is going to eliminate this as a choice for a lot of clientele in this area. There were a few minor "new restaurant" things too - like my meal coming out 5 minutes before my date's - and no silverware being provided until we had to flag down our waiter. 

If they lower the prices (pretty substantially to be honest) and work out a few kinks - this could be a great addition to the neighborhood.

Try the Dilimma" signature drink, and the the Crispy Roll appetizer.  We were very happy with the Pad Thai & Drunken Noodles, and the rest of the menu looks really good.
As the atmosphere is a great surprise in a small shopping center, this is also Perfect for take out on your way home from the mountains! Congratulations, Golden.  You have a great new Thai Restaurant!

Ate lunch here and was impressed with the interior (had come here before when it was a different restaurant). My husband and I both got noodle entrees and the mango and sticky rice, all of which were very good. The service was good and friendly. Had to knock a star off for a couple issues. I wish they had more vegetarian options, there are some, but the majority of the menu is non-vegetarian. Also felt the prices were a little high. Would come here every once in awhile, but it is too expensive to come on a regular basis.

Wow!! I am love!! This place is so good. I was super impressed. Might be my favorite Thai place now. Ordered some red wine- Good. Reasonably priced. :) Had 2 apps- the won tons and spring rolls. My vote is the won tons! Both had the pad Thai. I got shrimp. The flavor was amazing!! Plus they brought a cute little sampling of spices to add to my bowl. Got the Thai mild so added some spice. Even better!! Highly recommended. The service is great too. The staff is awesome. Can't wait to come back!!

My husband and I were visiting Golden from Chicago and, after reading all the rave reviews on yelp, I knew Citizen Thai Bistro was the place to take our daughter-in-law out for her birthday lunch. We were absolutely delighted with the entire experience! We were greeted very warmly as soon as we walked in. Our grandson  got a 'high 5' and it was apparent that children were very welcomed. The restaurant itself was not only meticulously clean, but upscale and just 'nice'. Our server was wonderful, the service and food both exceptional. The owner, Ounjit, even stopped by our table and thanked us for choosing Citizen Thai. She and her employees were very gracious and we felt so good about our entire experience. Our kids will become regulars and we look forward to coming back next time we're in town. Thank you for treating us like family and for the delicious food and drinks. You put the 'special' in our birthday occasion!

Outstanding maybe the best Thai restaurant in town can not say enough about the cocktails we had the Martini and the thailander amazing. The soft shell cr ab angle hair Pad Thai was fantastic. This is a must try for everyone

I enjoyed the eggplant dish, the flavor was amazing.  The curry was decent. The drunken noodles & pad Thai we delicious. Only strange thing was the dishes don't some with rice during dinner hours that's an add on. I would eat here again, far better than the Thai place in downtown Golden.
Hidden Jim, the food is delicious and the atmosphere it is nice. The only problem you will have is deciding what to order off the menu. It all looks so amazing.

Excellent food!!! I've been to Thailand twice and this food took me right back there again. My husband and I went, I had the Angel Pad Thai with soft shell crab and my husband had the fried rice with fried chicken , we also had a side of coconut rice, that was to DIE for. YAY!!! So happy they are right down the steer from us

Great addition to the neighborhood.  Perhaps the most sophisticated Thai restaurant in the area.  Nuanced flavors, spicy without being overpoweringly hot.  Very interesting menu choices - I really enjoyed the Ancient Thai Noodle Bowl.  Fantastic spring rolls - crispy, with a nice shatter, not greasy in the least.  Very inventive cocktail menu and good beer choices.  I had a Cocktail off the menu with passion fruit and jalapeño - out freakin rageous!  I read an earlier review that mentioned high prices - they may have adjusted some pricing.  While a dollar or two more than elsewhere, it is way worth it.  Give it a try!
Not what you would expect - very nice service, wine, beer, cocktails ... But the food was amazing
Seriously incredible! So much depth of flavor in the pineapple fried rice! Chicken pad Thai was great too! And try the puff rolls! YUM!

I had the Delimma mixed drink with tequila and jalapeño-- it was a very smooth and delicious taste well worth the price. I had pad Thai and my husband had red curry. I also tried my friends green curry. The red curry was my favorite-- it's the best Thai curry dish ice ever had. Green curry was my 2nd fav. The pad Thai was very good too, but no match for the curry!  I can't wait to come back!

Extremely disappointed in the food at this place. I had the chicken Tom Kah ($14) and it was extremely sweet. I mean so sweet you could make a dessert or even ice cream out of it. It literally was the grossest soup I have ever eaten! Oh and they stick about a whole tomato in your soup which makes it seem like you are getting a much bigger portion then usual. This is my favorite soup and I have eaten it at restaurants all over the U.S. and nothing comes close to being as sweet as this place's soup. I could only eat 4 bites before having to throw it away. Unfortunately, it was a complete waste of money and it was pricey too. Now, I also tried the shrimp Pad Thai ($15) which was okay. It was definitely a smaller portion compared to most restaurants and it wasn't anything to write home about, but decent. Then, there are the fried wontons ($6) which barely had any protein in them, huge disappointment. They might have tasted good if there was any filling in them to taste. Overall, very disappointed in the food. If you want good Thai food try somewhere else but here. If you want to spend a lot of money on subpar food then go here. It's a shame this place is so disappointing because it's in a great location.

We had Dinner at this place which was recommended by one of my Husbands Colleague. I really loved the food and ambience. We ordered the Drink Dilemma and I loved it I will surely miss it once we go back to San Francisco. For main course we had order Drunken Noodle and it was one of the second best I have eaten so far. and last but not least their awesome dessert Fried Banana with almond nutella and Vanilla Ice Cream to die for. Surely recommend this place to everyone who visits Denver :).

Amazing food, unique cocktails and service with a smile! The desserts are to die for - the fried ice cream was delicious and they also have a fried Nutella banana dessert that looked good. Tough choices!

Stopped in here before a Nuggets game and boy was I glad I dined here instead of the $10 chicken fingers. 

Started with a couple of beers, not the best selection of beers but if you like sours, you find the right spot.

For appetizers we had the duck poutine fries and bone marrow. The fries were great, the duck and cheese curds matched the gravy perfectly and I would have been content just eating that. The bone marrow was pretty standard but be sure to dunk your fingers, I mean bread, into the juices underneath the bone, they are outstanding.

For our main dish, we had the chicken schnitzel and the bone in pork chop (a special). The chicken schnitzel was good and had a nice apple slaw on it, nothing overpowering but added a nice layer of flavoring. I wish that the sandwich came with some sort of side (not that we needed it), it just kind of looked lonely on the plate. The pork chop was flat out stunning. It was cooked to perfect, came sitting in a tomato bisque which was awesome and included a goat cheese curd. I could eat everything on that dish all day long. 

Overall a great spot, I would certainly revisit and only a short 5 minute walk from the Pepsi center.

Euclid Hall was on our radar due to a suggestion by our hotel concierge. After the overly commercialized disappointment that was the 16th Street Mall, we were desperate for something authentically Denver. We decided to make the walk down to Euclid Hall, with fingers crossed, and not too high of hopes. Turns out, this place was a gem. Just turn the corner and you leave the national chains behind, and find the gray bricked building tucked away in a corner of downtown, with just a glimpse of Mile High Stadium in the background. We immediately were happy with our choice. There is a small set of stairs that leads you up into the dining area. A genuine smile greeted us and we were shown to our corner booth. The industrial feel combined modern and throw-back into a perfectly relaxing setting, and we were ready to settle in with a beer. 
Our server made great suggestions, and we opted for a few choices we hadn't seen in our own area. This was off to a great start, and finally we felt as though we were on vacation. The star of the menu is clearly the selection of fresh poutine. We saw several large parties who ordered nothing but these dishes....we opted to try house made sausages which came with a variety of mustards at varying grains and heat levels. Grilled to perfection, with a touch of char and a bite to the casing.....oh so good!!! We also had an order of cheese curds that were stellar. Out of this world, oh my gosh, where have you been all of my life stellar. I can practically taste them now, nearly a month later, as I think back. 
Euclid Hall is the real deal and we already have plans to return.....as soon as we get back to Denver.

Wow! What a unique place! The decor and atmosphere of this restaurant and bar was so unique and trendy. But the menu, the menu is where it's at. Talk about putting a spin on the typical comfort food. 

Let me start by this, our appetizer was pig ear pad thai. I think overall the group wasn't too thrilled. It was something the about the texture. But the flavor was on point. 

I'm not going to lie, the thought of bone marrow didn't exactly make my mouth water, but my co-worker was quite nice in preparing a sample bite for me. The flavor was good. it was like flavorful fat on top of bread with some drizzle on top. HAHAH Ok I know that was cheesy but I don't know how else to describe this. 

We pretty much had a sample tasting of everything. The poutine was delicious. We had a lamb one and the green chili one. The green chili one was my favorite. It was very flavorful and not too salty. I also LOVED the fried green tomatoes and mozzarella and grape tomato dish. 

I had the "Spunky", I think that was the name, for my drink. It featured a bit of IPA, which is my favorite type of beer and Bullet bourbon. I loved it. The flavor was delicious, not too sweet and very refreshing. I think the crowd was a little too upity and trendy for my liking but all in all, I had a great time and I look forward to going back.

HEAVEN ON EARTH!!! Looooooove this place, always and forever!!! YUUUUM!! Lord, this food is always bomb.com! 
This is our third time eating here and it's always amazing! 
If you have never had Bone Marrow then I'd suggest you try it here, it's like butter! The pig ears are yummy as well, if you don't mind eating pig ears! We also ordered the Chefs special which was 1 pound Ribeye cooked to perfection and tender like nothing I have tasted before.
Service is always on point! This place is definitely Hipsterish. Beer and Wine selection don't disappoint. 
They do offer Valet.

Great gastropub in Denver (LoDo). The selection is pretty small and sausage definitely takes up a pick part of the menu. However, I was pleased with the choices I went with which were the Rocket Salad and White Cheddar Spaetzl. The spaetzl was very rich and could definitely be shared or be your main entree even though it was offered as a side dish. Its almost like a take on mac and cheese. The Rocket Salad comes with a piece of brie and made a good combo with the tangy/sweet dressing. 

The menu changes all the time, so the items I listed may not even be there when you read this review. This place can accommodate large groups and has a full bar!

Poutine!
Bone marrow!
Sausage!
Chicken and waffles!

This place has it all and even some veggies-pickled and fresh!

I really dig that they have small plates and actual entrees. I've been here a few times and even went here for my bachelorette party dinner and it was spectacular. Service is great, drinks and unique and you get your money's worth when it comes to them. A must try place when in Denver!

A 5 star review goes to Euclid Hall bar and kitchen because they absolutely deserve to get a 5 star! 

We got to Larime Square around 11:00 pm and started looking for the available options. We called a few places and luckily Euclid Hall bar and kitchen was the only one that their kitchen was open at that time; and we decided to go there.

My first impression was very warm and welcoming. One of the servers leads us to our table and familiarizes us with the menu and she also made a few recommendations for alcoholic drinks.
From the food menu, we ordered chicken schnitzel sandwich, fries, and Brat Burger; both were amazing and tasty. 
They have an amazing selection of wines, beers, and cocktails. We ordered Epic Escape to CO IPA and Coyote Lovely; both were fantastically refreshing. 

The next thing that I liked the most was the unique design, decoration, and dim lighting of the bar.

Loved this place, a friend of mine suggested to go there. When we arrived to Denver International Airport  it was after 10pm and not so many places were open. We decided to go somewhere close to q6th street and we arrived to Euclid hall around 11:15 and the food was on the table in about 20 minutes. 
I ordered the brat burger it was really delicious. The burger was cooked enough to be juicy but not overcooked. 
The place itself is cozy, I liked the industrial look specially the lamps where to most interesting features to me.
There is also another level upstairs which is  brighter and not as cozy as downstairs. 
The overall experience was good enough to make me go back again if I decide to visit Dever one day

No denying the food here is good. I got one of their sausage dishes as well as a side order of poutine and I was very happy with both choices. The only thing I don't like about New American restaurants are the portion sizes compared to what you are paying. Although the food was enough to fill me up for the time being, I found myself hungry again within the hour. I would recommend coming here while in town just to give it a try, but it wouldn't be a place that I would often frequent. They do seem to have a cool happy hour though that would be worth checking out. When we were there, there were tons of people there that were holding after work business meetings. 

I think for a larger, louder crowd, the second floor is where you want to be. The first floor seemed a little small and sleepy to me, but luckily when we arrived our waitress brought us upstairs where it was much livelier. You get a better view of the city, and you can also look down onto the first floor from the second floor balcony.

Came here with a coworker while in town for a conference. Found this on yelp. The bone marrow looked amazing. And it also tasted amazing. The lamb poutines was really tasty. The lamb was cooked just right. The best part was we ordered 4 dishes and one dessert, the bill was only 63 dollar. Definitely coming back and recommending people come here.

Came here on behalf of my friends recommendation.
We order the pig ear pad thai, fries, elote style corn, and a burger (forgot the name)
I really enjoyed the pad thai but be aware it does not have any noodles. I thought it would have noddles and just few pig ear grinds but they replaced the noodles with the pig ear.
I thought it was weird at first but I really enjoyed it.
Prices are really fair, and quality and quantity of the food was really awesome!
Would go again

Really cute place with great service. The food was really good too. We had some local beers, one of my colleagues got one of the poutines, another got the schnitzel sandwich, and I got the fried green tomato caprese. Honestly, this would have been a 5-star experience, but the lack of vegetarian options made me withhold a star out of spite.

But I ordered the fried green tomato caprese with ranch instead of caesar and it was phenomenal. The biscuit/roll/pretzel with a weird name was underwhelming - I've had better bread. My colleague loved the carnitas poutine.

Came here with a party of 3. Both the ambiance and service are top-notch,  but the restaurant itself could be better lit (needed to use my phone as light to view the menu). 

We tried the duck poutine, beef short rib kielbasa, chicken & waffles, and the butcher's cut (rabbit confit with risotto). The sausages could have used more flavor, but everything else was delicious, especially the duck poutine, which was a perfect combination of crunchy fries, savory gravy, melted cheese, and tender pieces of duck.
