On a side note, the portions are definitely on the smaller side, and we left just slightly unsatisfied, but I guess sometimes you trade quality for quantity. All in all, would definitely come back.

Must visit in Denver. They serve a kind of German fusion food. While different from traditional German food I liked the food and presentation. Very friendly and attentive staff. Definitely recommend, especially nice to sit outside on a sunny day.

Came tonight for dinner with my new bosses. The new salesperson recommended this place. I didn't find anything appealing on the menu. I have never tried chicken And waffles anywhere, so I figured I'd try it here. The chicken was competent bland and dried a bit to much! The waffles were very bland. I ate it because we had been in training all day and I worked out, so I was starving!!' Our waiter was nice and attentive. Dud t get his name but he was from Philly originally. My other people had the fries and plenty of beer Nd liked them all. Myself I wouldn't come bs k for bland fattening food, but because of the waiter, I give three stars.

So glad I gave this place a second chance! Not sure if they've read the reviews or I just lucked out one night, but the music and overall tone of the atmosphere was much more dinner-like last weekend. Well done!

We shared an order of the special, lamb-potato sausage with sour cream and chive mashed potatoes. Holy yum. Our waiter was excellent, was able to suggest cocktails that best complimented our appetizers. Will definitely keep Euclid in my top list of restaurant destinations.

Excellent bar!  One of the offerings from Denver restaurant juggernaut and James Beard award winning chef Jennifer Jasinki and her business partner Beth Gruitch.  Their other endeavors include: Rioja (my personal fav),  Bistro Vendome (the most romantic), and Stoic & Genuine - which I did not have a chance to go to on this short visit.  All of these restaurants are tops, great places in their own right for brilliant food and sharp design so imagine all this know-how offered in a supposedly simple gastropub!

Well what you get is some of best food ever served in a bar anywhere which includes a large assortment of homemade sausages, succulent bone marrow, poutine and other more typical offering plus a well curated beer offering (tap and bottle) that first introduced me to the black beast know as: Firestone Walker Stickee Monkee - watch yourself around that double digit Belgian Quad.

Basically in Larimer Square which is a must visit if your looking for food or fun.

Well..I Have to say it . With so many positive reviews Euclid bar & kitchen hall definitely hit a home run on this visit. Wasn't expecting too much for this dinner apart from trying something new and see what Denver had to offer, and was not disappointed at all
After a long day at work and new city (from Houston) I decided to go out and try something different and came across place to go to eat in Denver and this restaurant came up. If you did the same thing and this come up don't hesitate and just come : 
Waiter was extremely polite and attentive . I told him that's this my first time here and ask his recommendations. This is what he came up. 

1. Half an order of the chips and dip
2. Half an order of the pad Thai pig ears

He pair them with s local beer (sadly I didn't get to write down but extremely amazing pairing thought )

The chips and dip with the dug and goat cheese AND the beer (which brought the goat cheese to another level btw) - was superb

The pig ears....ohh my god ....they paired with these local beer (IPA - dark) heaven 

---
3. Beef marrow bones - you simply have to try it for yourself. Please note that this is not for everyone, more on the fatty side but seasoning and pairing just brings the whole night together. Keep an open mind on these one 

----


There was a review about waiter just not being there, at the start they where extremely attentive but once you start i did notice that it take longer to get a hold of them BUT I personally liked it because they leave you alone to enjoy and savor the food and enjoy the moment...I was here over 2 hours and it was totally amazing ...

---
For dessert white chocolate chip blondie, a perfect ending to a perfect dinner 

Highly recommend them and will be back on my next trip to Denver.

Euclid was the perfect place to grab a late night dinner. 

They do not take reservations but they do let you call ahead and put your name down. Then just show up around the time they quote. I really wish more places would do this. 

Service was excellent and friendly. Menu was fancied German style pub food.

Duck Poutine - $14.50 - I could not find the duck or cheddar churds when eating this. Fries and gravy were good but it got boring after a few bites. 

Sausage Tasting - $17.50 - Lamb was the best and short rib was also good. They were both pretty salty. I did enjoy the Boudin (blood sausage) but my group did not. Mustard that came with it was really good. I liked spicy the most. 

Beef Marrow Bone - $10 - Really rich. Big bone with a good amount of marrow. The demi and gastrique helped cut the fatty richness of the marrow. Good bite to share. 

White Cheddar Spaetzle - $5.50 - Spaetzle had that perfect chew to it. House made whiz was creamy and cheesy. Very similar to mac and cheese. 

Jameson & Ginger - $7 - Not a bad price.

I have been wanting to try this place for a while, and finally got to last night...so good! We sat at the bar and ordered the corn on the cob, bone marrow and poutine. Everything was so delicious! The bartender couldn't have been nicer, I just wish she had warned us about the shot that comes with the bone marrow. That is the one thing I could have done without. I would not recommend that shot to anyone! I enjoyed the dark ambiance and before leaving checked out the upstairs, I was surprised how big the place was! If you are looking for good meat dishes, I would highly recommended trying Euclid Hall.

Hip spot, great drinks and friendly service! 

Strolled in at a random hour after lunch for a quick snack and drink. Wasn't busy at all and was seated downstairs. The place is decorated great, just a chill, industrial vibe.

Bone marrow and toast was just on point! Coupled it with a barrel aged stout right after a refreshing cocktail that had a splash of ipa beer.

Super cool vibes here!

So part of me feels like I should wait to write this review but part of me wants to do it NOW!

Euclid hall. We came here because we wanted a few beers and we heard they had a decent happy hour. True. They have a pretty decent decent selection of craft beers for $3.50, and they have a real nice selection of rotating taps! Crooked stave was on their rotators, as well as Stone enjoy by. But you really can't beat a milk stout on nitro for 3.50...

The ambiance of this place is really cool, open kitchen which is awesome, a little hipsterish, I felt like we were in Seattle. It was fancy hipster (Seattle) not grunge hipster (Portland) I personally really liked it!!

Ugh my only problem was that we weren't hungry... :( all of the food looked so amazing. We sat at the bar which was right next to the open kitchen and where the food came out so we got a real good look at a lot of things on their menu. We did spilt a sausage, because I'm German, and who can turn down a few bites of sausage, if you know what I mean! I seriously can't wait to come back to actually try a bunch of their food. The white cheddar spätzle are definitely on my radar! The green chili poutine looks amazing. The chicken schnitzel sandwich...and on top of this they so specials...and our bartender told us they do all their butchering IN HOUSE! How wonderful is that...and this icing on the cake, everything is very reasonably priced! I can't wait to come back!!!!!

I love the ambiance of this restaurant.  Casual, industrial, and yet still inviting.  The beer selection can't be beat.  I'm on a sour kick and Euclid has a few to choose from.  Having enjoyed the Brat Burger before, I elected to try the Chicken Schnitzel Sandwich coupled with the Cast Iron Veggies.  The sandwich was disappointing.  I was sold on the grilled jalapeno cheddar bread, but I couldn't decipher a hint of either when I bit into the sandwich.  The patty was nothing special and the slaw only slightly redemptive.  The fries our table shared were delightful especially with that naughty bacon aioli.  The Cast Iron veggies were also phenomenal.  

I enjoyed a Duchesse de Bourgogne Flemish Sour as well as a blood orange sour (the name escapes me).  

Service was great, especially considering we dined during the March Madness...er...madness.
I forgot to add some photos

Of all the places I visited in Denver, this was by far the most memorable.

So much duck! The frozen shaved duck on top of the nachos (It was a while ago...) was a really neat addition to the dish. Everything else we had was out of this world too, and the beer selection ended up with me getting a bit tipsier than I anticipated as I was eager to try as many beers as possible.

The two-story, open air atmosphere of the place invites a large and warm atmosphere and the staff were both helpful and knowledgeable. 

It's the #1 place on my list to visit when I return to Denver.
Chicken and Waffles all day!  They have a great beer selection as well and I enjoy the atmosphere.

Really loud,  really loud music,  very crowded, delayed food.  Friendly but overworked staff.  Food was light on quantity but trying to be creative.  You won't find a full dinner on the menu,  but little bites for what seems like a reasonable price. 

For the most part I just thought it was loud, unremarkable and I couldn't wait to get out of there,  but alas my party ordered dessert so I was stuck there for another 45 minutes.  

Good location right by Larimer, so pretty at night.  Don't try to walk back to the hotel after dinner though,  get an Uber and get home safely.

A bar but not your typical bar food. Very unique and eclectic food choices. From the duck confit poutine with foie gras to the white cheddar spaetzle, it was all awesome. We also ordered a marrow bone and the crispy pig ear pad Thai. The atmosphere is lively and overall a great place for inexpensive food to share. Great selection of beers too if you like beers.

Can't recommend Euclid Hall enough!  The staff are SUPER friendly and the food is AMAZING!  The ambiance is good, as well!  Location is also in a great spot, with a parking lot just across the street.   

Having not been there before, we had questions regarding the menu, specifically the Chips and Dip.  The server explained it, but we decided to go with something else.  Despite that, 10 mins later, another server (might have been a manager type) showed up with a Chips and Dip and said that she heard we were interested in the chips and dip and that it was complimentary.  That, is great service!  

Our entrees were expertly prepared and were delicious!  And, of course, the S'mores Pot was delicious as well.  Not too rich, and the graham cracker that came with it, was great!

We will definitely be going back!

Late hours, great food and trendy atmosphere. What more can you ask for?? My BF is from Tx and I'm from CA and we both loved it here. We ordered chips and dip, bone marrow, kielbasa, fowl play and chocolate chip blondie. Everything we ate was amazing. Def coming back.

A "Rocky Mountain Hofbrau" might best describe the rustic goodness that is the Euclid Hall Bar and Kitchen.  The plates are all a memorable combination of flavor and brawn.  My favorite might have been the hand cranked mortadella sausage.  But the the butchers cuts should not be missed.  The NY strip was packed with a beefy flavor that you rarely find in most steakhouses.
Enjoyed the atmosphere. Open late during weekday. Good food, good service, clean restroom.

We were told the fried cheese curds were close to Milwaukee curds, but it was mostly bread. Somewhat disappointing. My local friends assured me that these are the real deal. 

The beer selection, meanwhile, is very impressive. We visited this place twice during Halloween weekend as a result. It's a younger crowd. The rap music being played on our second visit was loud and obtrusive.

This place is located in a good spot. We were near the comedy club and other cool places. I'm sure I will return. Looking forward to a better experience.

The atmosphere at the bar, inside and out was fantastic. Every member of the staff was nice and quick to offer suggestions! Had the chips with duck and can I just say...holy shit! They were DELICIOUS! The French fries were the perfect combination of salt and crunch. Do yourself a favor and stop here!

Went back the next day because j couldn't stop thinking about the food. This time I had the brat burger and my mind was sufficiently blown! Amazing...simply amazing!

This place has the best loaded fries (Poutine)

Our only "complaint"... it was just a tad bit noisy to hold a conversation. I'm not sure if it is that loud all the time or not, but everything else was great!

Great service and staff, great food, great drinks!

Love coming to this place for a late night dinner. You absolutely must try the bone marrow! We get this every single time we are here. It's so tasty we made it a tradition (pro tip: ask for French bread to go with it) 

The Poutine is also delicious with duck and black pepper gravy with sharp cheddar. Also getting the sausage sampler is a smart choice with 4 different samples of house made mustard. Ask the server for recommendations on the sausage

They have good food, but it's a little pricey.

Pros:
* Butchers cut was good
* Duck poutine was great
* Good service

Cons
* Don't sit outside by the alley--it stinks
* The pig's ear appetizer wasn't good

All in all it was good, and from what I hear should give it another try. Seems like a hit or miss place.

Came during Christmas week around 4pm and didn't have to wait to be seated. They even had happy hour pricing, so we got $2 off our beers. 

We ordered the duck poutine and waffle & chicken to split and I loved both dishes. Waffle & chicken had a decent amount of chicken although I wish there was more waffle. The best dish by far was the duck poutine. The duck was very tender and the duck gravy was exploding with flavor. I ordered the left hand nitro stout and it was refreshingly smooth and flavorful.

Service here was excellent, very prompt and courteous.

Items Selected:

Ground, seasoned and cased in house Sausage Tasting: Beef Short Rib Kielbasa / Mortadella, pistachio, black pepper / Boudin Noir avec curry e aubergine / Vindaloo lamb belly, ginger, turmeric
Risotto Ris de Veau, pumpkin risotto, veal sweetbreads, pear, sunflower seeds
Bruléed Center Cut Beef Marrow Bones, Porter demi, sherry gastrique, toast
Foie Mousse, potato bun, thyme, shallots, jam
Pork Rillette, bretzel chips, pear mostarda
Carbonara, pork skin 'noodles,' garlic cream, house cured bacon, English peas, pea shoots, mustard vinagrette, cured egg yolk
Chicken and Waffles, chicken schnitzel, sourdough waffle, pure maple syrup, salty walnuts
Banana Split, funnel-cake fried banana, peanut butter caramel, malt ice cream, hot fudge
Warm Chocolate Chip Blondie, Stout caramel, Bailey's ice cream, candied walnuts
S'mores Pot de Crème, house made graham crackers and marshmallows

Owned by the team behind Rioja with an expansive two-story space just a short walk away from Coors' Field, it was on the recommendation of a local friend that dinner after the 2016 Stadium Series Alumni Game was sought at Euclid Hall, a reported 45 minute wait circumvented by upstairs bar seating where service was not unexpectedly fair-to-middling, while the inspired bar food was an across-the-board success.

No doubt a popular space amongst the 20-to-35 crowd, a sizable craft beer list and housemade sausages harkening concepts commonly seen at trendy spots from The Big Apple to LA, Euclid Hall ups the ante on traditional 'gastropubs' by additionally offering a wide-ranging menu of inspired European and American classics running the gamut from salads and sandwiches to full-size plates and pastas, each taking a twist on tradition with no lack of innovation in plating or approach.

Opting to place our order in rounds, a wise choice as not to overwhelm the countertop though an issue as relates to expediting with both kitchen and bar running at full-tilt, dinner began with three plates of house-prepared meats, the sausage sampling highlighted by traditional Mortadella as well as smooth Blood Sausage redolent with Curry while the Rillette and Duck Liver were equally well crafted with the former particularly impressive when spread atop crisp pretzels crowned by a dollop of pureed pear and mustard seeds.

Told that transected cow bones are something of a signature, the blowtorch brûlée rendering tops glassy while fat beneath remains spreadable and rich, another great bit of offal is offered in the form of seared Veal Sweetbreads atop tender risotto, the flavors of winter brought to the forefront through the use of pureed pumpkin and pear slices with textural contrast built by toasted sunflower seeds.  

Unable to resist the concept of an atypical 'pasta' crafted from pigskin ribbons tossed with belly bacon, peas, and an egg to form a makeshift Carbonara that is every bit as decadent as it sounds, our final savory was actually offered on the house as the result of a long delay due to kitchen error, the "Chicken and Waffles" better than most as a thinly pounded breast was served schnitzel-style on either side of puffy sourdough triangles with a sidecar of pure maple syrup.

Unwilling to forego dessert, the options riffing Americana without entering the rare air of refinement seen in Eric Dale's Rioja plates, those opting for a sweet finish at Euclid Hall are nonetheless presented with tough decisions, the "Funnel Cake-fried" Banana Split unfortunately not quite as interesting as it sounds while a Molten Chocolate Chip Blondie presents like Bread Pudding below melting Bailey's Ice Cream, the S'mores Pot de Crème eating like the world's smoothest pudding beneath lightly toasted marshmallows and graham crackers prime for dunking.
So the Chicken and sour waffle was excellent.   Always has a fantastic selection of Beer too!  Highly recommend.

Great ambience. Great food. Great beer.

This restaurant has an incredible variety. I'm not the biggest fan of anything adventurous (I mean, I don't even like chicken) but I was impressed with their menu. Bone marrow, duck poutine, frogs legs, escargot. They have so much!

Being on the tame side, I had the white cheddar spaetzle. It was a noodle type food with homemade cheese sauce and kale. It was similar to mac and cheese but instead the noodles tasted and felt like gnocchi. Very filling for the portion which only sets you back about $5.

The sausages are also fantastic and they have a good selection. I had the smoked chorizo for about $4, and all come with a selection of mustards. I'm not a fan of mustard and the boyfriend didn't quite like them either. 

Definitely worth a try!

We stopped by for dinner and some local craft beers. The food was mostly German inspired. We had the Ricky Ricardo sandwich, duck poutine, and some sausage. Food was very good and waitress was nice. Atmosphere was fun and trendy. The building looks really old and reminds me of New Orleans.
We also tried the chips and dips and loved it.

Euclid was a great place to grab dinner and a few drinks!

Located in Larimer square, Euclid has a very diverse menu and an expansive drink menu. We ordered the white cheddar spaetzle, chicken schnitzel sandwich, and the best burger. I definitely recommend the chicken schnitzel sandwich and the spaetzle, but I personally wasn't a fan of the Brat burger.  Many others around us ordered the duck poutine and "chips and dip" and those looked incredible as well. 

Although this wasn't one of my Denver favorites, If you are in the area you should check this place out!
Strong beer list. Fabulous deserts. Really okay entrees. Don't get the cocktails. Really. Stick with beer.

Came here upon the recommendation of two locals and so glad I did! 

Our group of 5 were quickly seated upstairs in the dining area. The drink menu was extensive and had everyone cracking up at the names that they make you say to order - "smother me in gravy you big dirty man." I had the Sequence 3 - a refreshingly sweet and light cocktail.

The menu items are not for the faint of heart - definitely some adventurous choices. The green goddess salad was light, with a great dressing. The chips and dip were served as a haystack of chips and duck on top of a creamy tangy goat cheese. The carnitas papas fritas were flavorful. The carbonara pasta was made with noodles that were not pasta but were something else entirely. I couldn't tell you all the things we ate - just that they were exciting to try and rewarding in their flavors and uniqueness. 

The dessert was a big payoff with a delicious banana split and smore's cup. The smore's were a cup of warm chocolate pudding topped with a generous frosting-like layer of just heated marshmallow and a homemade graham cracker. The banana split was served with piping hot chocolate and caramelized bananas. 

The whole experience was fun and different. Will definitely return.

Bottom line: if you are around Larmier Square and want to eat elevated bar food without breaking the bank, this is your spot, in my opinion. The one time I went I had Duck Poutine because I haven't been to Canada, I love fries, and I don't see it on menus around town.  I will be honest, it isn't the most visually appealing dish (it's a pile of gravy on top of fries), but is definitely delicious. 

The Chicken Schnitzel sandwich looked really good, and it is probably the next thing I try next time I go.

Quick Disclaimer - I feel like I need to give this place another chance as my first experience was not the best. We came here on a Saturday night with a group of 10 people and I don't think its the best restaurant for accomodating large groups.

First gripe - we made a reservation and ended up waiting about 30 additional minutes for our table. I understand that its tough with large groups but at the end of the day, that's the point of a reservation. In addition, the hostess was a little snarky.

Second - the food for the price wasn't completely satisfying. I felt that things were a little pricey for what we received and it didn't taste knock your socks off amazing. This could be that we just didn't order the right things or that since there was so many of us and we ate family style that I didn't really get what I wanted.

Finally, the server was just rude. I mean I get it. Saturday night, its crowded you don't want to be there and you can put gratuity on our check. You can at least be polite.

As I said in the beginning though, I would definitely give this place another shot. The place looks awesome and should be super chill. Definitely worth a second chance.

First time in Denver and this place was amazing !!!! Great food , great service and amazing beer 
I had the sirloin steak with oyster mushrooms and arugula . If you're ever in Denver check this place out

My friends and I came here while I was in town for a visit. I loved the industrial, raw and modern aesthetic of the place. At the suggestion of a friend, I indulged and ordered the chicken and waffles. This dish did not disappoint! The plated presentation was nice. The chicken was crisped to perfection, tender and oh so juicy. The waffle was crisp yet moist and the syrup was grade A. I've tried chicken and waffles at a few other places but this dish here stands out the most. 

I also tried a bowl of the spätzle and it was incredible - Tasty and full of flavor! 

This place also has an extensive drink menu!

I thought the atmosphere is really great and the menu looked fantastic. I am gluten free and called ahead to make sure that they had options for me, the lady on the phone assured me there were. Turns on, there was flour hidden in a lot of the menu items. The only thing I could order was a salad with chicken, which was very good, but left me hungry. 

My boyfriend had the chicken schnitzel sandwich. He said it was very good, but a bit dry. 

Overall, I would definitely come back for drinks or happy hour, but would not come back for dinner.

I had a great time here and enjoyed the food and beer but the sour beer smelling dishrag that they used to clean the bar over and over again while we were sitting there nearly ruined our night... There was also bleach being used to clean while we were sitting there - appreciate the cleanliness but man.  I ordered the sausage sampler, a good variety of tastes - what really stood out was the mustards, in particular, the taste and texture of the house mustard stole the show.  I followed that up with a brat burger - filled with flavor but I immediately regretted ordering it when this giant hot dog showed up at the table next to it.  Beer selection was a plus - I was drinking a local dark IPA.. Went down a little to easily.  I'd give it another try but I'm not in a hurry to do so.... I almost forgot - if you do go, order the fries with the bacon aioli.

Great space, solid food, yummy drinks.

What a cool place to go for fun. The vibe is awesome and everyone is friendly.

I had the chicken and waffles. The chicken was nice and juicy with just the right amount of fried flavor. The waffles weren't the best I've had but they worked. I really liked the syrup.

I think I'd prefer this place for drinks with friends and a chill date night.

It's just around the corner of Larimer and 14th. You've got plenty of options for bar hopping after.

Fun casual environment.  We were seated immediately on a Thursday evening. Husband and I tried the sausage (lamb and potato) which was good but not memorable.  We then got the the chips and dip plate which had an assortment of duck meat  (confit and smoked) on it.  Quite an interesting and delicious combination for the foodie in us.  Our last choice was the white cheddar spaetzle which was my husband's favorite dish as it was so hearty with its potato noodles and cheese.  Would definitely come back to try other items on the menu!

Euclid Hall:  Our Larimer square house of meats and gastropub delights! 

EVIL! EVIL! EVIL! Warning-  Things like Buffalo fried and battered chicken skin- EVIL!  Bone Marrow- Evil!  Steak and a cake donut? EVIL! This place is the devil to the healthy eater, tempting you to come and sin again and again.

The last time I was in this building it was a sad, used up tired dilapidated victorian building that housed a very lame night club.  This was a while ago back....

A spiffy remodel, this two floor gastropub does not disappoint. First you will be seated by gorgeous hip hostesses, then fabulous cocktails await served by the thunder-down-under at the bar.  Incredibly beautiful people staffing this place, AND! these eye-candies are incredibly service-oriented.  Amazing feat: Beautiful and nice!  You just feel cool being here!

And the drinks!  "They're real and they're fantastic" artistic mixological experiments to lots-n-lots of beer. The food is tough- reading the menu and listening to the specials is like going to a freak show- tons of things you would never expect to ever have: Frog legs aka "Kermit Kakes", Gator wontons, fried chicken skin, Pig Ears, hand cranked blood sausages- We are feasting in some creepy sexy HBO series!

I should mention that while the food is unique and exotic, some dishes seemed over salted.  The Particular Brit really did not like the demi-glaze on the steak and bone marrow as was not complimentary. Still, these are minor complaints.

The large group did not bother them, they handled us like pros and our server Kurt was efficient, friendly, and a perfect 10.  What is not to like?

Only one thing really disappointed and took the coveted 5th star:  The noise level was ridiculous; Today I am hoarse from screaming and my ears pounded for several hours after leaving. The music level was back at the night club days.  It was difficult to talk, difficult to hear, and conversations were stressful.  I am an old old woman.  Euclid is still a win in my book; Next time I will just wear ear plugs!

I came with a few of my friends after a rousing cycle of hoping an app will resolve our indecision. I can't speak for what they ordered, but my dishes were super tasty. For an overall description, it seems very much a restaurant that focuses on elevated pub fare-like food.

We started off by sharing the duck poutine. The gravy was super tasty, and there were lovely, succulent pieces of duck. The fries were perfectly cooked, but I was hoping for more squeaky cheese curds! The cheese seemed to consist of crumbled cheddar but was still tasty. For my main, I had the chicken schnitzel sandwich. The chicken was well-cooked and crisp. The slaw was nicely balanced. It was super filling and had a slight kick to it. Our server, Leah, was super friendly and responsive. We all felt she took good care of us. I definitely plan to come back and eat more tasty things in the future.

Sausage platter, chips and dip, and the fried green tomato appetizer; all amazing. I highly recommend this place. The chips and dip have warm and cold duck, so if you don't know that going into it, you may think it's not prepared correctly. The combination is killer though. Delicious!

Not the best choice for a vegetarian. I was looking forward to trying a poutine sans meat, but they would not make a version without meat. 

I did have the Fried Green tomato dish and substituted the dressing. It did taste good but not impressive. 

Sat at the bar. Bartenders were inattentive and average. However, one female bartender who came on shift before I left did offer good recommendations for nearby bars.

This place is another Denver fave for me. Never had a bad meal here.

They change up their menu seasonally so you have the freshest ingredients, and the kitchen is an open concept to you can see the chefs going to work. 

I have had multiple lunches and dinners here, and am never disappointed. The pork chop with cactus fries is drool-worthy and I hope they bring it back next fall/winter (hint hint!)

I could describe all the amazing things I've eaten there, but it would be easier for you to just trust me, and pop in!

Came here for restaurant week. It was easy to make reservations, they had a lot of time slots to choose from. My party was late almost 20 minutes that day but they held our table and even gave me a call to make sure I was coming which I really appreciated. 

My party of 4 was seated at a very comfortable booth by a window. The DRW menu was easy to navigate. You choose one beverage (could have had more choices there), one appetizer, one entree, and a dessert to share between two people. I went with the white wine which was pretty good. I got their infamous thai pig ears for starters. They give you a very decent amount. The ears are crispy, coated with this delicious sweet thai sauce and there were also roasted peanuts and cilantro and lime. I loved this dish. For entree, there were a variety of options from duck poutine to mussels to chicken etc. I went with a good old fried chicken sandwich. This was probably one of the best chicken sandwiches I have ever had. The way they breaded the chicken was very unique and then meat was especially tender on the inside. I liked the coleslaw it came with as well. I wished the bread wasn't just a regular slice of bread because it wasn't as sturdy. For dessert, my boyfriend and I ordered the banana split for an extra $2. It came beautifully presented on a long slender plate. There was banana pieces fried in dough coated with chocolate and there were a few scoops of ice cream. It was so good! 

The only downside to the night was that they ran out of the duck confit for my friend's entrees and they didn't offer to substitute with anything else. I thought that was a bit weird. But I think they did charge them a bit less because of it. Euclid hall for DRW was a great experience.

Trendy bar with a cool math theme. 

Love the industrial lighting and rebar paired with dark grays. 

Above average pub food. 

We got the duck chips and dip -- duck confit was excellent!

The house made pickles were okay. We liked the butter pickles but not the other two kinds. 

The house made mustard was delicious. 

The kielbasa was also very good but I wish it had come with more of the pickled cabbage which was a nice offset. 

The leek mushroom cheesy spaetzel was amazing but the portion was too large. For something so decadently rich, between the two of us our stomachs couldn't handle it. 

My boyfriend got the chile verde pork poutine and loved it. 

We wish we had had room for dessert because they had a smores pot de Creme that sounded good.

Our 16-year-old daughter had researched places to visit while in downtown Denver & Euclid Hall caught her eye as she is a math enthusiast! So, while walking the Larimer Square area, we stopped in and enjoyed some refreshing Verdejo wine with some delicious appetizer of lemon goat cheese, duck confit, and house made potato chips along with a pretzel roll nibble with a variety of tasty mustards.

Our server Heather was so gracious and helpful in making selections for a light appetizer for the 4 of us. The place is adorable inside & the staff seems very cohesive - front of the house and kitchen!

Absolutely love this place!  The place is super nice with industrial decor.  The staff is super nice and on their A-game.  Our cups were never empty.  Our server, Justin, was very helpful in helping us decide how to order.

We ordered the carbonara, (2) short rib kielbasas, bretzel roll, waffle and chicken, spaetzle, and ended with the almond joy.  Everything was sooooooooo good.  The carbonara was amazing.  Everything was so good.  All of that was $50.  Not bad at all.

This is definitely one of my favorite spots in Denver.  I can't wait to come back.

Taste: 5
Drinks: 5
Atmosphere:5

A small casual restaurant that will keep you begging to come back again and again.

If you enjoy drinking a quality beer with some mouth watering food look no further. Euclid hall has an extensive drink menu, offer beers that are incredibly hard to find. From limited edition brews to small brewery beers they have it all. The faith Hilling cocktail is simply amazing.

In addition the food is exquisite for the price. For $10-$15 you simply can not beat this place. The Carnitas Papas Fritas, Duck Poutine, and Kermit cakes are incredible. These dishes offer a unique twist with some explosive flavor.

Overall this place is very impressive. However keep in mind this place is a beer hall first and restaurant second, that being said if you're only looking for food there are better alternatives. I would recommend Euclid Hall for friends, business and dates.

It was so nice, I ate there twice!!!  I stopped in on Tuesday night to meet an old friend, we had some drinks and a few bites.  The Pad Thai Pig's ear and Bone Marrow are not to be missed.  The next night, I brought 12 chefs with me.  They sat us at two tables, and brought out the most amazing food.  Pastrami steaks with homemade cheez whiz, no really, it was soooo good. Poutine with Foie Gras, Foie Gras terrines, bone marrow and Pad Thai Pig's ear again, house made sausages that rival some of the best I've ever had, and the desserts, OMG.  The Almond Joy, tasted like an amazing candy bar, yet refined.  The warm blondie, the deep fried banana split, these are reason enough to start jogging.  Get your comfy eating shoes on, and get down there TONIGHT!!!

Probably one of my favorite spots in town! Great atmosphere. Always good beer on tap and awesome food! I like that they have a lot of shareable plates. House cranked sausages and made in house mustards. I got the sausage sampler and everyone was great. Bone marrow also another favorite. Jessica is a bartender there and always takes great care of me. They serve pretty late so after a game or outing it's a great place to close the night. Can't wait to go back again.

Euclid is my boi! Anytime i need to get my shit together and figure out the hard stuff life throws my way, I make a trip to this spot and they always keep it lit. I can feel 100 again just by having the poutine but why stop there? The desserts and entrees and apps are so good you might as well just order a bunch of stuff and share with the whole fam

This is cozy spot with a outside seating which is perfect for people watching.
They have a great selection of beer and appetizer. 
My favorite here is the bone marrow.
Staff is very friendly and its a very chill atmosphere

If there's such a thing as "Denver upscale casual", Euclid hall fits that description.  Cool place inside and we scored a table upstairs by a window facing west.  The place is loud.

OK the food.  One in my party ordered the chicken and waffles only to be told "the waffle maker is broken so they changed it to be chicken and french toast."  Um...OK.  SERIOUSLY YOU HAVE ONE WAFFLE MAKER IN THE WHOLE DAMN RESTAURANT!?  Wow.  Honestly if you've experienced chicken and waffles in the South you'll be disappointed at Euclid's interpretation of said dish (even when the magical mystery waffle maker is functional).

Others ordered the duck poutine.  That was good.  I had the braut sandwich.  No complaints on that.  Good beer list.  Service was prompt and mostly attentive although our server nearly missed out on offering us dessert.  Whoops.

The place is good, but is it great?  Not in my opinion.  Solid 3 stars though.

What else is there to say about this place? Great location, hours are awesome, beer list is incredible, service is what it needs to be, and the environment is fantastic. Oh yeah, the food is quite good as well! Recent stop with a friend, let to the Chicken and Waffles (yeah, delicious), Short Rib Sausage (one of many others), pickled eggs, poutine, and a few other shareables. Just as good as the first visit. Left very full, but still thinking about the food experience days later. Check it out, pretty good stuff!

I come here often and love it every time. The food is not only fantastic, it's interesting. The staff are knowledgeable and helpful. Favorite thing there is the pork carbonara. The noodles themselves are made of the pig.

Everything is done in house, their own butchering and pickling included. Would always recommend.

If your in the Larimer Square area looking for good food, drinks and great atmosphere go to Euclid Hall they have great bartenders. And good food. I ordered a cocktail called the Car Ram-Rod, it was probably the best whiskey drink I've had in months and I live in Brooklyn where things are good! It has Leopold Bros American Small Batch whiskey, Domaine de Canton (a ginger-flavored liqueur made in France), St Germaine, ginger beer & lemon bitters. Euclid Hall has good selections of local beers on the menu and great food I had the Chicken Schnitzel Sandwich & Duck Poutine the schitzel was excellent served on delicious grilled jalapeno cheddar bread with aioli and apple cabbage cole slaw get it it's good!! 

You want to come here for the good drinks & good vibes check out Larimer around the corner they got new Super Bowl jerseys to put up this week!

Everything about this place is perfect! The space, the open kitchen, the beers the FOOD!!! It will transport you! The lamb poutine is absolute perfection, the steak with cactus fries was perfect! All regionally sourced. The service is perfect, the ambiance and background music is perfect! The chefs are the best! This a an absolute must go to when in Denver- if only they were In NY...

Euclid had fair prices and was super delicious. It's close to the 16th street mall and right next to Larimer square. My girlfriend and I both got the chicken schnitzel sandwich and it was probably one of the best sandwiches either of us had ever had. The chicken was perfectly crispy and the apple caraway slaw cut right through the fattiness of the fried chicken. The jalapeño bread was crispy and flavorful but not too spicy so don't let that scare you away. I had the grilled corn as a side and it was sweet and perfectly cooked. Euclid is located in an old brick building but the atmosphere is modern/hip and was quite a nice dining experience. They also have quite an extensive beer and wine list.

Fantastic Gastro-Pub.

Many of the dishes are new takes on an oldie favorite.  Instead of mac and cheese, they have White Cheddar Spatzle.  Instead of brats, they have lamb belly vindaloo sausages..  Instead of Loaded fries with cheese, they have Duck Puotine.. which is basically the same.  You could say the food experience is 'elevated'.  Instead of your regular stuff, they put a twist to it and walla.... food made better.

I think their Pig Ears dish is very good. If you like Thai flavors , you should definitely get it.
We've also had their Bone Marrow and it was OK. I think they should retire bone marrow from their menu, its such an old and tired item on the menu.  

Service is FAST, FAST and FAST.  The limited menu is both a blessing and curse. On one hand,  you can expect consistent food, and on the other hand, everything is prepared in advance.  We ordered 7 items and they ALL came out at once. Nothing bad about it, except that we had no table space to handle all that food. 

Overall, a good place to visit to try out the 'new' dish..
A lot of fatty meat's, no chicken...

Euclid Hall is a really cool spot to grab some dinner or just chill.  We stopped by to have dinner before our flight back to California and I was impressed by the decor, service, food and beer selection.  It's a two story building with a bar area on the first floor and a main dining area and bar on the second floor.  They had a really good beer menu with a large selection of craft beers.  

Overall, I definitely enjoyed the meal, the service and the beer selection.  I wasn't expecting much from Euclid because I don't think anyone in the world would consider Denver a melting pot of culinary achievements.  However, I would definitely recommend Euclid hall.

Yummy food and AWESOME sours options!

Every single thing I've ever tried here has been the bomb.com.  Four stars only because I wish their menu was a little more diverse.  If you're too hungry for just an app, and want something other than a sandwich or poutine, it can feel a little restrictive.  Also, it can get pretty loud at times.

On a positive though, whatever you DO get will be amazing.  The bone marrow is by far my favorite- super rich and flavorful.  Be sure to take a shot out of the bone marrow bone once you finish it.  Fun, and good!
Chicken schnitzel Sandwich was good!  Service was good too!

Great food. I love the pickles, the bone marrow might be the best in Denver.  They have great muscles, the poutine is outstanding. Honestly I haven't had anything that I didn't like on their menu. 

I would give it 5 stars, but unfortunately the last time I was here the service from one of the bartenders was terrible. He was slow, inattentive, and it seemed as if he was more annoyed that he had to wait on us than anything else. Fortunately another guy came on shift towards the. end of our meal and salvaged it. 

Overall this is a great gastro pub and the prices are very reasonable.

While in Denver for a short weekend trip that revolved mostly around food and beer, my two friends and I absolutely had to visit Euclid Hall - the one who'd been to Denver before said it was a must and boy, was it.

We arrived shortly after 2 last Sunday (when they open) and it was already pretty busy (just on the first floor though). They were kind enough to seat us even though we were still waiting on a 4th to arrive. The server was fantastic with giving beer recommendations to my friends (I don't drink) and they were really happy with what they ordered (I can't remember to save my life, sorry).

The menu was just heavenly in terms of amazing options, but it made it so hard to order. We ended up getting two orders of the amusingly named (I think), Chips and Dip, to share, as well as each getting our own things to eat as well.

Oh.

My.

God.

I have seen the light and it is the Chips and Dip from Euclid Hall Bar & Kitchen. The lemon goat cheese was so perfectly tangy and creamy I just wanted to bathe in it. The two takes on duck, warm and cold, just made my insides feel so very happy. The chips (while some were a little salty) were a perfect vehicle for the cheese and duck. I could have just died happy right there.

My two friends traveling with me ordered sausages, the short rib kielbasa and the vindaloo, with the assortment of mustards, and were both delighted. The friend in town had an ounce of foie gras and loved it.

I got the French Onion Frites (poutine) and it was pretty darn great. At first, I kind of wasn't sure about it, but once I moved the fries around a bit and got to the sherry and French onion soaked ones at the bottom and all of the beef shank chunks, I was in love.

They were great about splitting the bill for us and overall, it was a great afternoon. They didn't rush us out after we were done eating and just hanging out, and they made us feel really comfortable the whole time. A great Sunday afternoon place to hang out over some really, truly delicious food and great beers.

I came in a group of 4 on a Tuesday night at 7:15pm. We were seated instantly. It was pretty busy at the time.

My hubby and I both got the Brat Burger ($10) and shared a side of fries ($3.50). I thought the concept of a Brat Burger with a brioche bun was very interesting! The portions were pretty small but they tasted pretty good! I'd go back again to try more dishes for sure.

I really really want this place to rock. For me it does not.

I've been trying to make it amazing since the yelp event years ago. The open floor plan - well - giant hole in the middle just seems to make it noise. IT's a cool view, but the sound just reverberates everywhere.

There is usually a line and they don't take reservations for under 7. Ugh. I hate waiting in line for food. It's a personal pet peeve and i know it's my issues, but it's another thing to make me shy away from here.

The bar area is ok, as long as you can grab a table! There are 2 bars, and both are usually packed.

Beer selection is pretty big, and the food choices are interesting.
Some of the options are just too weird and the cost too much in case it isn't all that... 

One time hubby got a pork/beef patty and sadly it was undercooked...  i wasn't paying attention to what he was eating until he at over half and was like, should it be pink...  that night ended badly. 

The sausage sampler platter can be interesting, but again, expensive and some of what you get - meh or ick (to my taste buds). 

It's cute, it's fun, it's adventurous, but just too many negatives for me.

Incredible! I'm only sad that it was too dark to take decent photos of our plates.

We ordered the Carnitas Papas Fritas as an appetizer (I think you can order it as an app or side) and it was gone within the minute. It was basically fancy green chili cheese fries with tender spiced pork on top. 

We also ordered the winter salad, Chicken Schnitzel Sandwich, and Brat Burger. Honestly, these sandwiches were better than anything we've had at any authentic German restaurants that we've eaten at across the country! The chicken schnitzel was cooked perfectly and came on delicious jalapeno cheddar corn bread with yummy apple slaw. The sandwich is quite large. I would have been perfectly fine without ordering a side. The Brat Burger came with a flight of mustard; 4 in total. Again, tasty dish. The brat was juicy and pretzel bun was soft and chewy. Wonderful combinations of flavors and textures in your mouth. Our winter salad was a great addition on the side.

Always a good meal here. Downside is always a good wait to get in. If you haven't tried any of the poutine, you must. My favorite is the duck poutine. Chicken and waffles are also a favorite. Great bar selection, both for local beer and mixed drinks. Fun for a date night or a night out with the girls. Prices are fair and service is good.

The beer selection was quite impressive. While most of the beers were available in cans or bottles, there were many rare gems on the list. I wish more of the beers were available on draft, although some of the selections are difficult to make available on tap. 

This German style beer garden was mathematically themed for Euclid (father of geometry). The theme permeated the beer menu. Beer categories worked up from "arithmetic" to "quantum mechanics". 

We tried several dishes and all were good. We started with an order of the fried cheese curds. 

We also split the white cheddar spaetzle (it was outstanding, food highlight of the meal), pasta carbonara, and a sausage sampler, including: beef short rib kielbasa, mortadella pistachio black pepper, boudin noir aver curry e aubergine, and hardwood smoked chrorizo. The sausages came with four different mustards. We also ordered a side of the apple cabbage caraway slaw. 

The food was good (spaetzle was worth going back for), but the beer selection was inspiring. I spotted Mephistopheles (Avery) on the menu and while this was not available, I was more than happy with the Uncle Jacob's Stout (Avery) I found instead. This rare treat was an amazing find.  I hope to be able to return to this spot so that I can further investigate more of the rare beers. 

We also ordered and my wife and sister-in-law loved the rhubarb dessert.

A great downtown restaurant, but make sure you have a reservation.  I went to Euclid Hall on a Friday night and it was extremely busy.  Thankfully, someone in our group had thought to make reservations as there were many parties waiting.  Despite the crowds our server was amiable and accommodating.  The atmosphere is clean and orderly, albeit a bit claustrophobic when crowded. 

Euclid Hall has a vast menu and I wanted to try many things, but ultimately I opted for the Pad Thai Pig Ears because it sounded a bit unique.  I was expecting a traditional pad thai with rice noodles and pig ears for the protein, needless to say I was surprised to discover the pig ears were the "noodles" in the dish.  While this was a lot of meat, I enjoyed every flavorful bit of it.  My friends ordered schnitzels and poutines and all enjoyed what they ordered. I have no qualms returning to Euclid Hall in the near future to try something new.

Well I have to say I have mixed feelings even almost a week later. We were seated immediately and the building is very nice and is 2 stories. The table was fine and the atmosphere was pretty good. The music was a bit loud and they really liked playing stuff like offspring, not exactly eating music.

I ordered the chicken schnitzel sandwich and I was thoroughly disappointed. Your bread was way too burnt, the chicken was cooked to oblivion with no flavor, there was next to no sauce on my sandwich, the only good part was the dressing. I asked for more sauce and was brought a white container of god-knows-what that tasted like sweet whipped mayonnaise. One of the worst sandwiches I've had in my entire life. The drink I got was named after super troopers and was decent but pretty bad for being $12.

The server was great (nice, fast, prompt, polite, didn't try to bug us too much) and we had to go to a show so I didn't have time to ask for something else to eat. I'd love to review this place again one day as I feel like it has potential, but that sandwich does not. I'd like to watch a manager eat that sandwich and tell me with a straight face that it doesn't taste like burnt sawdust with overcooked chicken and no sauce.

We came here for our first Denver meal and absolutely loved it.    We were lucky and got to sit upstairs which is a bit quieter.   

Bone marrow-  very good.  
Beef sausage- homemade and also very good.
Duck Poutine- amazing.  Perfectly done with large chunks of duck.
Desert- we had a special with a blonde brownie and homemade caramel sauce.  Very good.

Beer- tried a homemade Belgian IPA which was also very good.

Overall the food was very good and service did not disappoint.  Our server was great about offering extra bread and water.  Make sure to call ahead to get your name on the wait list on busy nights.

Nice venue with an inventive menu which is overall pretty meat heavy; vegetarians, you've been warned. The beer menu is expansive with some unique cocktails which are worth sampling as well. I have been here numerous times for work events and therefore tried the majority of the menu and have never been disappointed with my meal. My favorite, the steak and donuts- who doesn't love that. The deserts are spectacular as well so be sure to save room. 

The only draw back is the restaurants noisy, to the point I have had to shout during most of my dinners there. Perhaps that is par with being a beer hall but for me that is the only drawback.

Overall, solid restaurant with a great beer selection and a delicious menu.

This place is really clean and has a nice friendly vibe to it.
This was my first stop to eat at since I never been to Denver.
We were promptly greeted and seated by this nice hostess with colorful purple hair.
Our waiter was this bald guy that came from the bar to serve us.  He had a grumpy face and got frustrated when we were taking our time to order.  Was killing our vibe, almost left but I really wanted to try this place out.
Once we ordered our drinks it came really fast! That was awesome and it tasted great too.
We ordered the duck poutine, bone marrow, and the pig ear pad thai. Loved all of it.  The food also came fast! Great service.
When it was time to pay the grumpy faced waiter saw we aren't cheap at tipping and finally had a smile on his face.  
I would've given this place a 4 but..
Note to waiter all Asians aren't cheap that's the vibe you were giving us and if you were having a bad day go pound a drink bro
Great atmosphere! Super rustic and Catholic Church like feel. Food was delicious and very reasonably priced. Pad Thai app was amazing.

"High-concept eclectic bar bites & a carefully sourced beer list in an industrial-modern pub setting."

I found the quote above on an anonymous Google review and have chosen to incorporate it here because i think it is a perfectly suitable description! 

I ate her today for dinner with a group of 6. The dark color palette of the design and indie playlist gives Euclid Hall an aesthetic that is sophisticated, urban and moody. 

I ordered the chicken liver mousse, beat pickled eggs and hops-infused pickled cucumbers. The mousse was essentially an extra fluffy and smooth pâté; it came with toasted bread and a sweet jam. I was pleasantly surprised to find the two spreads went well together. The eggs were overlooked for my taste, but still were an enjoyable compliment. The hops pickles were truly like nothing I've ever had: fresh, light and subtly spicy. I also had the blondie for dessert. Candied nuts make this an excellent way to end the meal. Friends ordered the poutines and seemed to really enjoy them! Service also met the standard. Highly recommend!

Came here for lunch and got the highly reviewed Chips & Dip, which was a plate of lemon goat cheese, smoked but rare duck breast*, duck confit, and Kennebec potato chips.  It was definitely different.  The duck was partially frozen (it's supposed to be), which threw me off.  I have to say that while it was good, I don't know if I'd get it again, at least not as my entree.  It's better as a side to be shared.  My friend's Chicken and Waflles were really delicious, though!  The chicken was lightly battered and fried to a nice crisp, soaked in a little maple syrup.  The waffles were super light and fluffly.  One of the best Chicken & Waffles!  Small dish, though, for $13.50.  Third friend got the Chicken Schnitzel Sandwich, which she said was good.  Food is definitely on the pricier side here, but definitely good quality.  We came during lunch on a weekday and the place was pretty empty, though I heard it gets really busy on the weekends.  They also sell a variety of beer, but we didn't try any.

Came for a rehearsal dinner. 
The sausage and duck appetizers were wonderful. Really great blood sausage. 
No elevator-well that sucks :-(
The service was wonderful.
The salad not so much. Had fennel in it, but no mention of fennel on the menu :-(
The red cabbage under the sausages was wonderful, wish I could have ordered that for the salad
The beef short ribs were 2/3 fat. We were readily offered a new piece--thank you Tina--but the kitchen should have never sent the two plates out--very unappetizing. 
The s'mores dessert was interesting. Was expecting a warm marshmallow-alas no :-(
Might be fun to brûlée at table side and a great show too :-)
The "graham cracker" was like a cross between shortbread and a graham cracker, never quite hitting the mark :-(
Be careful of the red wine, served at room temp with today (07/14/16) was like 78--yuck. 
Again the service was AWESOME!!! :-)

I will start by saying that the service was good! Our server was attentive and offered some menu/drink selections that she thought would pair well together. The interior and decor is also very cool.

However--it is so ridiculously loud in there that you cannot even think. I was, unfortunately, on a first date, and we spent the entire time shouting at each other. I'm sure I only understood about 1/4 of the conversation. In fact, I'll go ahead and blame Euclid Hall for the relationship not working out. Ok, I'm kidding about that. But I was definitely hard of hearing after dining there. The food was mediocre and overpriced. Drink selection was also not impressive. There are much better options in Denver.

Very good N.Y. style slices. The prices went up recently, so it not as affordable anymore, but it is a good treat for something special. Thank you for selling slices right next to where I live. I can walk to my pizza now.

30 minutes  I will never get back. After watching everyone else get their food, I  asked them where's my food ...............Whatever . I fkn went home on the goddamn bus no fkn pizza . They didn't  reimburse  me for my drink.. ANTHONYS YOU OWE ME 30 FKN MINUTES OF MY LIFE!!!! I HOPE YOUR  THANKS GIVING  IS A SHITTY AS MINE.

I ordered a pizza to go from here last night. I love pizza and consider myself somewhat a connoisseur having lived in Chicago and visited many places known for pizza. This pizza has surprised me. I really love everything about it.

It has tons of pepperoni the sauce is spicy. The crust is delicious and thick at the ends.  I can't say enough good things about it and it upsets me because I don't live in Colorado anymore so I can't have this whenever I want.

I was teetering on 3-4 stars for this this place.  The pizza is very good by the slice, but lacks a bit of oomph if you buy a whole pie.  I don't know what they do different, but whether you buy pizza by the slice, or by the pie matters.  They taste completely different, so if you are looking for a well-oiled NY style slice, this is a great spot.  You want the whole pie?  It's alright.

The service in house is very good.  The manager is great and the staff is personable.  Delivery can take a while (a long while).  I suggest you go pick up your order.  It's worth it.
We love this place. Good pizza. And the marinara is great. Cute little spot. Owner is really nice too :-)

Pretty good ny style pizza in an open relaxed casual atmosphere. Cheap and delicious and they have the spices and cheese at your table if you want those. Also offer beer and maybe liquor as well as fountain drinks and pasta.

I hate to be this person.....BUT it's been a reoccurring problem at this location & after my attempt to first solve the problem with management failed I figured I'd leave this review. 

First off-the pizza is awesome! I moved to CO from the Midwest & have had a hell of a time finding some decent pizza & Anthony's solved that for me! 

The problem: pick up orders take over 40 minutes. No matter the day no matter the time and the managers response to a complaint is "there's nothing I can do for ya". This is a general manager at that. When I explained I didn't have this issue at their other locations his only response was that he was a general manager and couldn't help me. I worked at pizza places for 4+ years throughout high school & my undergrad years in college & never once told a customer I couldn't help them. 

Overall A+ pizza & D- customer service.

Maybe it was an off night but my son and I ate here tonight since we were in the area and it was not good. My slice of pizza was sopping with grease and toppings looked like they just got dumped on top and heated up. My son had pesto pasta and it came as a bowl of spaghetti with bland oily pesto sauce and hard garlic bread. No one asked how we liked it and the vibe in there was awful- the place had no music and the workers seemed grumpy. Won't be returning. 

.....month later .....

I am changing my review from 1 to 3 stars. After the last experience here Peter contacted me and gave us two free pizza coupons to give them another chance. We went to the location off 8th and CO this time. It was nice inside- very up to date and clean. We ordered the same pizza as last time with a salad to go. I only had to pay for the toppings and salad, so thank you Peter for that coupon. It was definitely better than the last time. We got meatball, black olive and green pepper again. Unfortunately I don't think they used meatballs though- it was more like crumbled sausage. But it was cooked better and we appreciate the offer to try again.

It has to be 5 stars. I dont really care about the service etc, but that was fine. Great Neopolitan slice, or what we call a slice in NY. Thin almost cracker-like crust, full sized pizzas, oily (a sign of good cheese), balanced pizza sauce (not too much oregano or anything , not raw) perfectly made pizza (proportions and cook).

And all the NY Pizzeria basics for your pizza... For me just a couple chili flakes. 

Good prices IMO.

Why would a pizza place that has a huge sign screaming out PIzza by the slice- not have any slices of pizza on a Saturday night?   Not to late in the evening for a summer night on a Saturday.   Did not even offer a hey it will take fifteen minutes to bake a pizza-  Just a sorry we are out of slices-Well sorry spent my money and gave the tip money someplace else.

Asked as soon as I came in which pizza just came out bc I wanted fresh slices 
Then the guy says they all just came out while I'm looking at a rack of 12 pizzas
Then I wait 15 mins for it to come out 
And it's deff not fresh like he said 
Only reason for 2 stars is bc other whole pizzas looked awesome
And cashiers as was nice to look at lol

I love ordering pizza from this location. 

My visit tonight was wonderfully uneventful, which is exactly how I like it. 

Ordering a pizza on Friday night, I expected it to take a bit longer than usual. When I called in my meal the girl who answered told me it would be about an hour before my meal was ready. I showed up 45 minutes later expecting to wait for fifteen minutes, I waited 15 minutes and my meal was ready. 

The pizza was hot, the cheese was perfectly melted, the wings were spicy, and my family loved it. Thank you all for a wonderful meal.

For now, it's a 3.  I'll have to give it another shot before changing my rating.  I got a slice of the huge slice, but that was a mistake.  The flavor and texture was great, just not entirely enjoyable since I had to throw out half of the bread.  I plan to try the thin slice next time.
The pizza here is amazing, but it does take quite a while for them to bring the food out. It is worth it though. I definitely recommend this pizza place.

Delicious food and great staff! Shortly after ordering online, I received a call from them to review my order. Turns out I had accidentally ordered enough pizza to feed a football team! I don't know exactly what prompted them to call me, but boy am I thankful. Lol...  so with that being said, I give this place two thumbs up! Thanks Anthony's!

No complaints! I like to go for the two slices and a drink lunch deal. I have never had a problem with service and they have always been professional and efficient in my experiences. Pizza has always been delicious. I have almost become slightly addicted to it.

Thankful someone delivers to Murphy Creek! Good pizza! Not as greasy as I remembered, which is a plus. Good size. I would recommend the Neapolitan as the crust wasn't too thin but not thick either. Delivery driver was very friendly. We will order here again.

What can I say I love this place especially after they remodeled. I've never had New York pizza but I bet this come really close. You can't go wrong with pizza unless it's a copy frozen one. So check this place out its good!
Always good and fast! Best calzone and pizza in Aurora so far! Toppings under the cheese is not my favorite.. gets a little soggy and wet but still pretty good.

I love the lunch special!!! Such an awesome lunch spot. Great value, friendly staff, generous portions. Their garlic bread is delicious. Pasta dishes are pretty good as well. If you are looking for a great new York slice, look no further.

Very good New York style pizza. The price is a little high but worth it. Great place for kids and they also serve beer, which is a plus. 
The guys that work the counter and the kitchen are great. They are always friendly and seem like they are having a great time.

I order delivery from Anthony's once every week or two. Tonight, though, the pizza and the customer service was extra good. The person who took my order was friendly, sweet, and wished me a happy Mother's day. Also, they told us it would take 1.5 hours and we got it in one hour. The delivery driver was also friendly. The pizza had plenty of dough, sauce, and cheese and was pretty amazing. I usually don't usually leave Yelp reviews (actually this is my first one ever) but you went above and beyond tonight so I felt like you should know!
The pizza is great. The cannollis are delicious. I definitely recommend the farmers salad with ranch. Staff was very polite.
Just like a Good east coast  should taste. Nice fast service.  I have been going here for years. Puts everyone else to Shane.

Pretty good. Delivery was very speedy- I made the delivery driver wait on accident, thought my husband was already home and I was in the shower-oops. Pizzas were still hot and yummy, but I wish they packed us some crushed peppers and parmesan. My only dissapointment was that I assumed the basil would be fresh, as it was pictured on the homepage of the Anthony's website. Instead my half of the pizza was covered in old, bland definitely not as tasty, dried basil. :(

Amazing NY style pizza (coming from a true New Yorkah) Delivery is always pretty quick and service has been great.  Especially like the primo bread and marinara sauce.  I'll miss you guys when I move back to NY in a month.

As a native New Yorker (born & raised in the Bronx baby) coming to Colorado is cool since I prefer the cold to the dead heat. Since pizza is my favorite food, I am always in search of a place that will satisfy my New Yorker pizza cravings. I am GLAD I came here wow the pizza was SO GOOD I can still taste it, yum!!! Hit the spot right on and the New York pictures on the wall made me nostalgic of my home sweet home. This will be my spot for the next 3+ years that Colorado will be home. Take it from a New Yawka- this pizza is amazing!

I find it hard to believe I have not reviewed this location yet.  I do frequent this spot as it's close to home and does deliver.  

It's situated in a shopping center surrounded by a grocery store, hardware store and liquor store.  You can quite literally grab those few things you need from the hardware store, do your grocery shopping and go grab a pizza and a 6 pack in one stop.  Yes.. I have done just that on occasion. 

I have never had any issues with this location.  I will admit I have not tried anything other then their pizza.  I don't need to!!!  I like their pizza as has my out of town friends and family who have visited.  It's the way pizza I grew up with has always been.  Flour on the bottom, grease on top.  

There's a lot of room in this location compared to their others.  I know they are trying to have a specific Décor, but it leaves the place a little on the cold side.  Delivery can be a little long sometimes, but I figure if you're in that much of a hurry you can get in the car and go get it yourself.  

I like knowing what to expect and this location has always been consistent.
Fantastic food, reasonably priced. We were shocked how fast they had it ready, definitely will be eating here again.
Anthony's is a very good pizza parlor they have great pizza great sandwiches great calzones good salads.

How in the world is it a good business practice to turn your phones off when your busy!!  Terrible customer service given when you are putting your guests in a bad position already by not communicating.  Good pizza but I'll have other stuff for awhile to give you a chance to better your business.
They do one thing, and they do it well: Fantastic pizza.  A little expensive for a pizza delivery place, but not too bad.  Besides, you'll never want domino's again after you try this place.

Great pizza, delivery or eat in. Guys that have delivered to our house are great. We have always tipped very generously (my husband delivered pizza as a teenager) ,  these guys deserve it
Thank you , keep up the great work

Our first trip to Colorado and we decided to try the pizza from Anthony's. Wow! That was one of the largest larges I've ever seen! The crust was perfectly chewy and the sauce just right. Plentiful topping for sure. Enough leftovers for 2 days! We will stop here again.

Love their pizza! One time I didn't want to wait an hour for delivery so I ordered dominos which turned out to be an epic mistake. Will never order from anyone else ever again! Staff is always friendly, pizza is always cooked well and they put plenty of toppings!

Very good pizza!! And nice staff...
I bought a large slice, salad (with a lot of toppings) and a drink for $6.85+tax. I will be back!!!

Service is good, no matter what Anthony's I go to. Their food selection is consistent and most of all it tastes consistent. They have fast service and they are definitely reasonably priced. I am not a connoisseur of pizza, but I know good pizza when I taste it, good job. 

Overall the pizza is good - not outstanding and most of all, my kids love it. So I will continue to go back!
By far the best New York Pizza in Colorado! Just the best pizza in Colorado, they are pricey and I hate spending too much money on things but this pizza is worth it!

Very greesy. Dirty tables. A little overprices and there is no type of ambiance. Would not recommend. I'm not from around here to say what places are better in this area but I suggest you drive a little further and find something a little more tasty, oh yeah, it lacked a distinct flavor, I guess its good for people who've been drinking and want to stuff their faces after a night out, but I'm not the type to settle for an unsatisfying slice of pie.

Franchise does not have to equal ordinary &/or low quality.
You can taste the freshness in the food at Anthony's Pizza. I LOVE their pizza. I find the proportion of cheese & sauce to be perfect & the crust has a great flavor & thickness. Their pizzas are also quite large so lots of leftovers! I usually have them deliver & they have always been good about delivering within the promised time range (usually within an hour). 
I'm trying their pasta & calzone for the first time tonight & looking forward to it!

I love their pizza and so I feel bad giving only 2 stars but it always takes so long to get any pizza from THIS LOCATION. The past 4 times I've called for a take out pizza there has been a 45 minute wait.....for a pizza. 45 minutes. The one time I actually wait for my pizza I'm here for over an hour. Come on guys. Great pie, crap customer service and it's way too slow for what you are getting. You guys have some work to do to get my business back.

I must have caught them on a bad night, twice.  First time I ordered a veggie pizza, garlic bread and cannoli.  Pizza was soggy and undercooked and they forgot the cannoli.  Not too big a deal, Im used to soggy undercooked pizza since moving here and everyone can forget from time to time. 

  The second time:  I waited 2 hours for the delivery, I called and was told it was on its way.  Given it was snowing thought that was reasonable.  Hour 3 comes and goes, still nothing.  I call to see if possibly I missed the doorbell or what, the person that answers the phone says hold on.  Then a guy gets on the phone stating, "what's the problem?" (seriously?) I told him and he said my card was declined and they were trying to reach me.  I then asked then why an hour ago did someone tell me it is on the way?  Furthermore, my bank show that the transaction went through.  I then asked who I was speaking with and he refused to tell me, just the manager is not here he is on deliveries.  I was left with no option but to go up there and try and get my money back.  While there I finally spoke with one guy that had somewhat of a clue about customer service and got my my money back.  I am a very patient person as I had worked in the restaurant business and know it is a tough job, but seriously?  Since it was snowing I was planning on tipping very well for this service, I ended up time a drive through guy instead.  I hope these two occasion were just some fluke but I will not be going back.
Food was good but service was horrible! Many people waiting while the employees stood around

Mmm nice and greasy fold in half ny style pizza. Can't go wrong here. Try the 18 in pizza for dinner and for tomorrow's breakfast.

For lunch I usually get the 2 piece, 1 drink special.  I'm out of there fore $8.00.  Sitting down and ordering the pies is the best option.  I usually wait 10-15 mins for the pizza to come out.  Nothing glamorous, just good greasy pizza.  I usually soak up the grease though.  Leftover pizza tastes good cold and reheats well.

There is a reason these guys are always busy. They feature consistently good food and service. I also notice that they have very little staff turnover, which generally means they provide a decent workplace. I love the flat, foldy pizza and this place gets it right every time!

I love anthonys. You won't be disappointed. Same pizza every time never a bad pie!
The crust is the iceing on this pizza masterpieces cake! Word of caution if you plan on eating at 6pm order @ 4pm for delivery. My wife love the cheese ravioli. The ravioli is the size of a child's hand lol. My 5 year old lives on the leftover pizza the next day. Just order it.

Sadly disappointed in this particular location with a couple of things. First thing is on the web site for Anthony's Pizza it claims to have glutton free Pizza and failed to have it when taking time off for lunch to try it out. The employee who took my order stated " oh we don't have it at this location." The second thing I was disappointed in was Anthony's Pizza wifi. It's 2014 and Anthony's Pizza doesn't have wifi? It shows up on smart phones and has a lock, when asked what the password was by the same employee who took our order, he claimed they didn't have wifi. I then showed him the wifi  with it saying Anthony's and he said again "oh not at this location...sorry I only work here"  terrible. So I ordered a salad lol at a Pizza place due to them falsely advertising having "glutton free pizza" this location doesn't have it together and gets a huge  #FAIL!

I really enjoy the fresh crust and the fact that they are so close I can order and pick it up way quicker than delivery can and I am OK with that!  I would give it 5 stars but they need to improve the time the pizza's are in the oven, underdone pizza is not good and I really don't want to go home and have to cook it more, defeats the purpose of ordering pizza - we don't want to cook!!!!  Now if you ask for it to be extra done they can kind of take it to far, hope the owner reads this, when we say extra done it is only because it comes under-cooked more often than not.  We love the pizza it is very tasty.  Keep it that way!
Pizza tastes great, good prices, you can buy a whole pizza or just a few slices. Cozy interior and friendly staff. Would highly recommend.

This was, by far, the best pizza we've had since moving to the Denver area in 2012. The pizza situation has been frustrating for us east coast natives, but Anthony's did not disappoint! Great crust - the perfect fold in half kind, the sauce wasn't too sweet and it didn't overtake the whole pizza, and they weren't stingy with the toppings. It was a little greasy, and was cold by the time delivery made it here; other than that, excellent!
I love pizza, plain and simple, and Anthony's is as good as it gets in Denver. Closest to real NY pizza that I have found in Denver.
Pre ordered my calzone as sometimes they are very busy. Was ready when they said it would be (40 min). Pep n mushroom was great!

Of all the pizza-delivery options in SE Aurora, Anthony's is head-and-shoulders the best!!!!  Crust is great and the cheese and toppings are top-notch!!!!  

Yum yum!!!!

Love this place !! High dollar pie, but a dam good one! Crust is killer, toppings are always fresh and good, But the sauce really takes this pie to a happy place, been ordering pizza for the last 10 years here. Delivery times are usually about an hour... So order early so your good and hungry, the slices on the large pie are massive !

I really like their food. But this is the second time in a month that my order was incorrect. Tonight I ordered Sicilian with pepperoni, meatball, and jalapeño. As if waiting 20 minutes wasn't bad enough.... They served me a slice of pepperoni an mushrooms. I showed them the receipt that clearly stated the ingredients. Whoops. Another 20 minutes. Almost an hour for one slice of pizza!!!!! Not even an apology. Very dissatisfied.

Good pizza, but it's nice to have other options to order such as chicken parm, lasagna, and spaghetti available for delivery. We do plan for the hour delivery window. Plus we live close to the boundaries of their delivery area, so we try and be patient and tip well!

Great New York style pizza.  We were planning to get pizza at another place, but it was further out of downtown.  This place has great pizza, very reasonable prices.  It's a small place, but you can eat in or take a slice to go.  The have cannoli, but the shells are dipped in chocolate, which was good, but not traditional.  Still highly recommended!
Great pizza but the delivery time always 1-1.5 hours. They need more drivers. But worth the wait.

Best pizza in Aurora. That's not saying much since Aurora is a cesspool. They have Great New York style crust, not as good as in New York, but is it ever? If your looking for pizza out in this third world, this is the place.

Great, cheap place for a greasy lunch.  The pizza is made pretty quickly and brought directly to your table, so you can sit down and hang out with friends while you wait.

I've only had the thin crust, which is terrible for you and delicious.  The large drinks are LARGE (in the Texas meaning of the word).  I probably eat here 2-3 times per month.
