Delivery: excellent. Had pepperoni pizza, stuffed shells, farmer salad, and wings. Food was hot and delivered within the hour as stated at time of order. I would recommend to someone for a first time try that is tired of the other boring locals. (I.E. Dominos, Pizza Hut, Blackjack, etc.)
Great pizza,  however the last time I walked in to order one to go.....the female OWNER greeted me with a nasty scowl.  Nice way to build business lady.

Pizza is good, Chicken Wings were about as bad as they get.  You would be better off getting frozen wings from the grocery store.  Customer service was poor and if you call for delivery when they are busy then you should expect to have to call back once or twice after being left on hold or hung up on.   I'd avoid it if possible, unless you are really craving their pizza.

Hostess station was very disorganized.  Food was good and tasted great.  The check was not accurate.  The waitress said it was fixed but still didn't match the menu.  My biggest thing is to check your bill before paying.  

Overall, not an outstanding experience but not overly terrible.

I'm generally an optimist but today I just can't! 
I was seated for my Free bday dinner at a table that I doubt OSHA would approve - damn near in the middle aisle! I was seated and greeted by a seemingly nice bit maybe overwhelmed waitress. I have benefit of the doubt because it seemed busy. I was ALONE and ordered an appetizer. When it arrived, the portion was huge! I commented that I didn't know it would be so much - no wonder surrounding tables stared. Lol. Ahhhh... I was hungry and ready to eat but had no silver/plastic eating utensils  A myriad of people passed my table, bumped into me (because that's how tight it was) and all of the elements probably flew in my food. Ugh!
Got my burger that was free but it was pink (gross to a person who barely/rarely eats meat). My waitress was gracious and offered to have the kitchen make another one for me since she explained that I asked for "NO pink." I went back to eating my appetizer that was way too much to begin with. Worked in my favor I guess... an appetizer and two (2) glasses of wine later, a new burger arrives! Who can eat now?? I hate to complain but really... the manager stops by and says "I heard your food wasn't right. Is everything ok now?" I reply a "Yes, it's totally fine," and he walks off. Lol. 
Well... My free burger is in a box, along with the troth of onion rings and I'm over $30 poorer! Happy birthday to me!

I was questioning  a 3 or 4 star.  The burgers were pretty good but the service was not great  .
 We waited I bet 20 to 30 minutes for our meal during lunch and it was not even busy. 
I like the fries in their own containers. You do know if you want more fries they will give them to you
I understand the bathrooms were not very clean. I did notice some of the menus were not so clean either. This is not the way I remember Red Robin. Ok it's been awhile but did they really miss me that mych

Usually love this location as I am a big fan of Red Robin, and the service is usually very accommodating and prompt at this location. This location was also remodeled not too long ago, so everything is nice and new, although a bit disjointed in design. My husband and I's most recent visit was a bit disappointing as the service has seemed to decline, and was not as prompt nor accommodating, but the food was still great. Hopefully, this was a one time fluke. Based on all my experiences at the location overall, I would recommend if you are in the neighborhood.

First time eating at a Red Robin out of the Seattle area. 
It was a-ok.
Love the bottomless root beer floats not a fan of the "name that chicken burger". I'll stick to beef burgers

Placed order to go! They charged me for a side of onion rings but they weren't in my food :( 
Had to wait, while the bartender ignored the fact the the food was out already. She wouldn't give it to me and it got cold! Disappointment :( too far to go back To return the food

After buying Costco dog food next door, it made me hungry so I came in for some burger and brew. 

Strawberry mojito, bottomless fries, red ramen burger, monster shake, that's what I call dinner.

I'm a native of Colorado and I've always liked the variety of burgers at Red Robin.  I ordered the burning love burger, husband ordered the Royal Robin burger, and my daughter had a kids meal with a gluten free bun.  My burger was ok, it wasn't as spicy as I was hoping it would be. Hubby seemed to like his as well as my daughter. Our waitress was fantastic though upbeat, attentive, and knowledgeable. I would have given a four star rating but the hostess was very rude and unprofessional. When we asked to be seated at a booth, which we saw was free, pointing in that general direction,she managed to explain how she had it already set up for some other reason. She didn't seem very accommodating at all. If it wasn't for the waitress, I would have probably left. Don't know if I'll be back.

I tried the A1 peppercorn burger "with some pink" as they say (they say the same thing @ Applebee's). The burger comes with hardwood smoked bacon, fried onion strings, an onion bun, tomatoes, peppercorn spread & a side of thick cut fries for $11.50. I thought the side of fries was smaller than most burger joints but I was ok with that because I usually never finish mine. I also tried the whiskey river BBQ chicken burger which comes with cheddar, onion straws, lettuce, tomato & mayo. It also came with a side of fries & was under $11. I liked the two about the same amount. For dessert I tried the chocolate fruffles. It was frozen brownie bars dipped in dark chocolate with a side of whipped cream & berry "ketchup" for dipping. I thought the berry sauce was too sweet & the whipped cream looked like the pre-made canned kind. The bars had a candy bar texture but harder/chewier. I also tried the freckled lemonade cake which is basically a lemon tiramisu. It has lady fingers & shaved white chocolate on top. On the bottom of the cake are some strawberries and a strawberry sauce. It was by far my favorite thing on the menu!!! I plan on trying to make it @ home. This place is neat because they have little iPad-like tablets on each table from which you can pay, order, call the waitress, or play games. You barely have to interact with anyone @ all (if you're into that kind of thing)! I think Chili's has something similar. The games aren't free. It costs $1.99 to play them.

We came back to give Red Robin another shot. The service fell short again. This was no where near as bad as last time but still disappointing. 

The group of ladies at the host stand performed admirably. They told us we were going to have a fifteen minute wait for a table and we waited 8 minutes. They led us to almost the exact same table. 

The hostess told us the server would be right with us, we saw her about 5 or 6 minutes after sitting down, which is a bit longer than it should be - in my opinion - to greet a table. When she brought out our drinks we ordered our food and asked if she could bring out an order of fries for us to get started with. She said she would and we saw her about fifteen minutes later after our burgers came out. 

I couldn't see where she got off to, but we were hoping for something to snack on while we waited for our food. Also of the four of us there, we got one refill on our drinks. Not one round, literally one. My son sat there with an empty drink nearly the whole time after he got his food. $5 for a "bottomless" freckled lemonade huh?

The food was okay again. My daughter had the corn dogs, my wife a plain cheese burger, I had the clucks and fries, and our son had a chicken sandwich. I had a few fries that were cold which was likely due to the lettuce the fries were sitting on.  She did ask if we wanted more fries after we were done, however I felt if I would have said yes I may not have seen them anyways after already being forgotten once. 

This place needs a good training on proper service. If you tell someone you're going to do something, do it. The value that we pay for just doesn't seem worth it, when I can get a burger and fries from five guys down the street without all the mistakes.

I have always enjoy Red Robin because of the option of having a turkey patty instead of beef. Our service name was Talon (I love the name!), he was EXCELLENT, very professional, friendly and informative. He stayed on top of refilling our beverages and checking on is. I really appreciated his service, smile and warm personality!  Thanks Talon!

While the food and service was ok, I am always suprised how expensive the check is for the experience. French fries were slow to arrive but lots of kiddos there for birthdays making the atmosphere upbeat.

Back for a third time and service was still lacking. We were not the only table complaining about terrible service, forgetful waitresses, and wrong food. Idk what is wrong with the staff here... Idk why they have a call server button on the tablets if nothing happens when you push it. I love Red Robin. I just can't come back to this location. Comping my drinks and giving free dessert does not make up for your complete lack of competency. Why Red Robin? Your food is great! Hire people who enjoy their job so your customer can enjoy your product!!!!!!!

Amazing burgers and you can't go wrong with endless fries. Our bartender Tiffany was a real gem. She made us laugh and was extremely friendly. One of the best bartenders I've ever met. She's smelled nice also!. I definitely recommend Red Robin as a munchie buster. They also have a blue moon shake!!!

I've always loved going to Red Robin ever since I was a kid and their fries have always been my favorite. Yet, the last 4 or 5 times I've been there my burger has just be terrible. The fries and shakes are still good. Can never get enough fries!  The burgers are just not the same. I don't understand what happened. Every time I go and order a burger I can't finish because it takes dry and I feel like it doesn't have the flavor it once had. I know the economy is tough right now and things are more expensive and they may need to go cheap on stuff. But I would of paid for an old Red Robin burger if they had raised the prices instead of going cheap on materials. It's really disappointing considering how long I've loved this restaurant please step your product up!

No. No no. Just no. When my wife and I entered, the hostess asked us if we were both over 21. After my wife responded with a yes, she immediately proceeded to take us over to the crowded bar area. Neither my wife or I drink so just because we're both over 21, don't assume we're alcoholics. While she was leading us over there, my wife said "we don't want to sit in the bar area". Now mind you, the bar area was completely full. The rest of the restaurant had less than 10 tables occupied. Either the hostess was day dreaming or she didn't hear us, but she kept on walking towards the bar area. We had to repeatedly tell her we don't want to sit in the bar area before it finally clicked with her. 

Now onto the food. I ordered the Red's tavern double. If you're wondering what it tastes like, grab a Whopper from BK and it's pretty much the same thing. My wife got the Clucks and Shrimp for almost $13. It had two pieces of the driest chicken tenders you can imagine, six tiny pieces of shrimp, and ten steak fries. $13? Seriously? No thanks.
If you like waiting helplessly at your table for an absurd amount of time because of waitresses who do not give a **** then this is your place. Never again.

Horrible.  Horrible. Horrible.  Our server was non attentive.  It took at LEAST 20 minutes just to get our drinks. Fries?  LOL!!  Nope. Those never came. Our food came out looking disheveled.   Our 6 year old order the chicken strips and one strip was still FROZEN!!  We tried to flag down our server. 5 minutes. 10 minutes. Nope.  Sorry kid, you get a chicken popsicle for lunch.  THEN when our check was delivered we were charged $1.99 for "entertainment fee"and $2.99 for one CAN of soda!!!  Attempted to ask the server about the charges....but you guessed. Never came back. Are you kidding me?!! Worst service, worst food, worst experience. Will not be back.

THANK YOU FOR USING YELP help is lacking at the red robin asked for  appetizer first came out 1 min before burgers wife hates this.i complained waiter said no it did not (argumentative waiter)   food was overcooked bad. blue burger good second time  ,mine burnt though  took short time to remake .shake very thin like milk and small  not full glass no flavor took long time to make was 4 bucks  used to love this place was there when they first opened .loud very loud bus table next to us threw plates and glasses in tub  i hope staff reads this,,,,the.fat chick waitress? manager? was yelling about something near the kitchen maybe it was cold overdone food  they comped one burger which is embarrassing BURGERS ARE THE EASIEST FOOD TO MAKE  if you don't  like working there then quit,,, gave 2 stars because i did not get sick

Since I was little my family and I would always come to this location. The food was always great as well as the service but this time not so much. It was very evident that there was not enough staff for the tables seated. It took us at least 20 mins to get drinks an another 20 mins to get a basket of fries. There were times that we looked around to find our server but couldn't even find one staff member in sight. I understand it being tight staff but it was very evident that they could have used one more server there. The only other complaint that I have is that a dirty dish rag that, I'm assuming had been used to clean tables, was left on the ledge next to my face.

I hadn't been to Red Robin in awhile, but decided to check it out again recently since there is a location close by us.  Love their turkey burgers!!  A lot of times turkey burgers are pretty bland, but the Red Robin ones are pretty tasty.  I really like getting it on the ciabatta bun.  Like others have mentioned, the service some times lacks.  For us it is hit or miss.  Sometimes service is great, other times slow and food comes out kinda cold.  Overall good expereince so we will be back!

Burgers are a love of mine and when I need a burger, I'll drive just about anywhere to satisfy the craving. Red Robin serves burgers and it just so happens I haven't been to a Red Robin in years.

Do to our schedule we ordered takeout so I will review the food alone and not the service.  The drive back home took at least 15 minutes and when I opened my burger it was still hot and was not falling apart.  

I ordered the Bleu Ribbon Burger to go mainly for the blue cheese and crispy onion straws.  The burger was juicy and I could taste all the ingredients.  I wanted the blue cheese to be more equally spread over the whole burger, the blue cheese taste was primarily in the center of the burger.  

The onion rings are where it's at.  The onion rings are larger than large and have a crunchy and crispy exterior with a sweet onion on the inside. Make no mistake, it may seem like they don't give you enough onion rings, but these rings are super filling and with a burger as well I could only eat five rings with my meal.

A satisfying burger experience and Red Robin kept my burger craving satisfied for one more day.

For food out of a box, I don't hate it.  The sweet potato fries are good, and the burgers are tasty.  Sierra Nevada Pale Ale in draft?  Sure.   It's legit, and better than the other boxed food places(Applebee's, Chili's, etc...).  Still, their payment touch pad is always covered in grossness. -2.

I like Red Robbin. The food and service are usually good. I came here because I was in town for my mom's birthday and I had a birthday coupon for a free burger. The service was slow in the bar area!! My mom and I waited almost 5 minutes before someone came to us. We didn't have to wait too long for our food, which was good. We did have to wait for refills a couple times. Don't know if using the kiosk would have been faster.

This location in particular has been very troublesome for me and my friends. After coming here three times, three times we've had bad food and sent something back to the kitchen.

The last time I came here I got the fish and chips. The fries were fine but those are hard to mess up. The fish was very disappointing. The pieces of fish themselves were not completely coated in batter so the inside of the fish was highly saturated in oil. The batter itself stayed oily even after blotting it with a napkin. In my experience, this is due to not frying at a high enough temperature. I gave them the benefit of the doubt and asked them to remake it. It came out the same way though. I asked the server if it always comes out oily and not coated completely and the server told me it does.

I appreciated their attempt to remake the dish but after it sounds like mediocre was the norm for fish and chips, I've decided to stay away from this location. The Park Meadows location is much much better.
When I am in Aurora with my little guy we will stop at Red Robin since he likes the food and I like the Bleu Burger and the wait staff are fast.

This place just isn't anything to talk about. It's dirty. When I'm sitting in a restaurant I don't like my shoes to stick to the floor. Maybe it's to stop you from fleeing the building? 
The food is mediocre at best and quite frankly Red Robin is an over priced Mc Donald's with a liquor license. 
 If your speciality is burgers...... You should be able to cook them and present them well.
 Thanks Red Robin for a truly forgettable experience.

This isn't my favorite burger joint but they offer gluten free buns that my girlfriend can eat. I do like their fries which are bottomless.

On my recent time there the wait was 15-20 minutes on a Wednesday evening. After being seated it appeared that there were many open tables but not enough servers.

I shared a salted caramel shake which was actually pretty tasty and big enough for 2 full cups. For my entree I tried the colossus Burger. As you can only order it  pink or no pink I chose the less well done option. The burger was fine but looked nothing like the picture (as is normal with big chain restaurants). It had brisket, provolone, grilled onions and two types of sauce.  

The burgers came out before the shakes, which was a little unusual.

Our waitress was friendly but so busy that she wasn't able to refill our water at any point in the meal. 

A fine experience but not a homerun.
I'm really sad that they don't serve their Chicken Alfredo anymore. I guess for several years now. I don't come here often, once every 4 years? Lol

I had the Double taver and was delicious.  I am a little disappointed with our server Jacob he was not tentative to us as he was with the table next to us. We asked him lemon for our water and he never brought it we ended up asking the person who brought our food. The runner was kind of rude at first he said he will send our server over and he never came. Keith I believe was his name. I think he realized that we were not getting the proper attention and said if we needed anything to let him know.

The original Red Robin is from Seattle, an ugly building under a bridge.  Not that that has any bearing on this review other than it being an interesting factoid.  That original is now closed and torn down, and Red Robin is a huge chain.  And as chains go, Red Robin is not too bad.  I choose this chain over most others.  This Aurora location is the same level of a-ok that most Red Robin's are.  It seems pretty new, so it's clean and open.  The service is okay in that overly solicitous way that most chains do it.  Am I the only person who thinks it bizarre to be called sweetie by a seventeen year old?  The food is truly okay.  It's a better burger than most other chains.  The fries are bottomless, though your bottom will not be less after the third go-round.  They will replace most beef sandwiches with chicken, and if I remember correctly the chicken is hormone free.   The beer selection is terrible.  They have a full bar with those fancy schmancy drinks.
If you're looking for something decent to eat and want the comfort of knowing what you are getting, then this Red Robin is an okay choice.

Good in a pinch if you don't want a fast (McDonald's/Burger King/Wendy's) burger but can't spring for something a little more on the upper scale (Tag Burger/Park Burger).....we tend to go for their Tavern Tuesday special should our Denver Broncos record two or more sacks the Sunday before....who doesn't like a free burger?!

This place would get no stars if I could!   

We walked in to the bar area and the joint smelled like a ships scullery.  The stench was so rancid. YUCK!   We were very hungry so we decided to check out the dinning room area. The tile floor leading up to the carpeted area was so sticky our shoes even stuck to the carpeted area.   More YUCK!  we decided to leave and go somewhere else that is cleaner and that deserves our hard earned money.   As we were driving to another restaurant I decided to call and tell the manager about our experience....however after being put on hold for about 8 minutes I hung up.  Obviously they do NOT CARE!   

Red Robin = YUCK!   Not yum!

We live less than a mile from this location and our son loves it, which is why we went 3 times over the past few months. Every time we hoped the service would be better, but it only got worse. The service was seriously laughably bad. We felt like we were on an episode of candid camera.

Oh man. I love Red Robin but this location... No good.  We don't live near the area but we stopped by since we were visiting someone. It wasn't very busy and we walked in, got seated.... Got our drinks.... So far so good. We place our order at 7pm... At 7:20 our waitress comes to tell us half their grill wasn't working so it would be "just a couple more minutes".... (Would've been nice to know that from the beginning)... 10 minutes later still no food but the waitress does come back to say "just one more minute"... 5 minutes later nothing.... I tell my husband that if the food doesn't come in the next 5 minutes we'd leave. Coincidentally the food arrived maybe 2 mins later - but that was a wait of almost 40 minutes!!!! For 2 burgers!!!!! Even worse is that there were at least 2 other parties that arrived after us but still got their food first so was it really the grill that was the problem? 

I've been to different RR's and usually there is some type of compensation whether it be a discount or a free dessert or drink when something isn't up to par. Not here... The manager didn't even bother asking how our service was as they usually do... But he was there just walking the premises.... In reading the past reviews it seems like they have a lot of work to do at this location. Food tastes great but I'd like to eat my food when I'm still "excited" for it, not once my appetite has been spoiled by a long wait.

Luckily this is not my local restaurant and the one closest to me has much better service because I'd never come back to this one.

Horrible service. 
For the start the server paid no attention to me or the table next to mine. Then I was served the wrong burger. The second came back raw. So I told them I didn't want another.
The manager then came out. He stood next to my table awkwardly for a moment then looked around looked back and asked "did you have a burger or something."  As the raw one is sitting on the edge my table. I replied with yes and I don't want another or this one. He made no recognition to the mistake grabbed the plate and walked away saying ok.
They took the burger off but after the awful service, especially from a manager,  I would expect to not pay any and just leave. Not having pay for my fries and drink.
Horrible service and very unprofessional people. Mc Donald's is more professional. Wrong order 3 times and cold food. Wouldn't recommend this to anyone.

The last time we visited our Red Robin on Havana was about 2 months ago. We will never go back. Everyone from the hostess to the servers were rude at best. It took about 15 min to have someone take our drink order and then another 15-20 min to take our food order. The food came our warm, not hot. I ordered a chicken sandwich and I wouldn't have fed it to a dog. It came out cold and rubbery, which means that they had to of microwaved it. We tried to get the attention of a server but no one came over until everyone else had finished. We explained about the chicken and the server could care less. We weren't even offered anything else and to top it off the manager didn't even come over to apologize. Bad for you because I have told quite a few people and they agree that Red Robin has gone way down hill, even to the point some said that you suck. Your loss is someone else's gain.
Jackie

Burgers are good - that's where the positives end with this place. The name of this place is red robin - burgers and brews. My question is how do you advertise yourself as a place with "brews" when you have the same selection as one might see at an Applebee's or the like. I mean, there's nothing compelling about their selection - straightforward domestic lagers as you'd expect. I feel misled. Also, everyone working there we came in contact with was dumb as rocks.

Just had lunch at this location and I will not return. There was an unpleasant smell throughout the facility, sticky and otherwise dirty floors, dirty dishes left out on tables, and almost every single page of the drink menu had food stuck to it. I watched an employee walk two full bags of trash through the bar area (where they were seating most of the customers, including me). Cleanliness is critical and it makes me wonder if the kitchen was in as bad of a state.

The waitress was pleasant and provided excellent service. She was the only person that seemed to be keeping busy, and I didn't see anyone that looked like they were in a management position.

Well, when you make reservations do not expect to walk in and get your table. In fact, expect 4 other large tables to get sat while you wait. I love their food and my customer service on the servers side was excellent I just really felt like if you're going to make reservations yearly need to honor those and not have them stand around and wait while clearly other large tops are being seated. It definitely made us all feel very uncomfortable and make us not want to reserve any other parties at red Robin.when it comes to the food the food is accurately priced I enjoy the food and I am welcome the experience and the amount of money I'm going to pay I especially love now that they can have options for burgers it's great to switch things up. I also love the endless baskets of fries my son does too!

Horrible on a monday night.  Horrible wait staff waited waited and waited!   Horrible service asked for malt got a shake asked to please get a malt and was punished and didnt get it til I was done eating!  Had to chase people down for condiments and fries!

Red Robin never fails. Went last night for a special someone birthday dinner. He had a free birthday burger coupon through their rewards program. They were busy. The hostess apologized for the wait (waited for 5 minutes to be seated) which you hardly get. Not even a minute went buy after being seated the waitress acknowledged us and said will be right with us. Service was efficient and the bugers were  superb. They have tasty gluten free buns and the fries were fresh and hot. Thanks again Red Robin. YUM!

I absolutely love Red Robin and this location is no different. The staff was friendly, and our food came out quickly and accurately. The fried mushrooms are big, delicious, and came out steaming hot. They aren't those little baby, tasteless, button mushrooms. The burgers are all amazing, my favorite being the Ghost Pepper Tavern Double! Bottomless fries are always a plus too. They have some good appetizers and drinks, but I am unaware of any "Happy Hour" type specials. Overall I love Red Robin and I will continue to come back.

Dang. I'm not sure why this place cannot get their stuff together. I ordered a togo order today. I get home and find my order was wrong. No big deal. I called back and I am told that the manager "Luis" is in the kitchen helping out because they're "so busy" and he cannot help me out right now and "Can I get your name and number to call you back?". What?! I could not believe that, instead of getting a manager on the phone to correct my dinner, they asked for my name and number to call me back?! I'm flabbergasted! Am I just supposed to just skip dinner? I can't come back because my kids are eating and I will not neglect them to come fix an issue that could have already been resolved. I told the guy on the phone that I will not hold, that it absurd, and will hold for a manager. He said "Okay" and hung up on me. I called again and am now waiting on "Luis" to call me back. I will be calling headquarters if he does not call soon. Ridiculous!

Usually I hate this Red Robin... The servers are rubbish and the fries are always cold.
Yet I come back time after time because other people like it.
Tonight though, our server Andrea was the best I have EVER had here. It was incredibly shocking. 
The garlic fries were still cold and rather gross, but for once the server was attentive. 
If I could ever get edible fries, this place might receive more stars.

Service has gone downhill. Food tastes good but when you have to ask 4 times for one thing it's just frustrating. Also, somehow they sit me in the same booth every time and it has a broken bench. You remodel the whole place but can't fix a bench?  It's been broken for months and is seriously uncomfortable. Fix it already

Red Robin used to be the go to place for burgers, it is close to home and used to be a family treat, I was excited to go especially since they recently went through a renovation. I must say the relocation of the handicap parking to a closer more ADA compliant area was appreciated, I do feel for this location because they are right next to Costco, and those patrons are always parking in this area and leaving their carts all over the place.  Now let's get to the food, it has declined severely, poorly cooked, no plating sight appeal, definitely not worth the money.  For this to be a recently renovated restaurant, it's dirty, food splashed on pictures and walls, the beer chandelier in the bar area is severely dusty, the dust takes away from the whimsy of the piece.

We found ourselves waiting to be seated for sometime as we looked around at open tables. The hostess seemed as if she was overworked. Once seated, thank goodness our waitress was better but alas, or favorite burger that we always get  seemed pre-made, cold, and dry. We love Red Robin and it kills us to say but this was the worst burger we have ever had there and I would not recommend this location to anyone unless they get there act together...but we won't be back to find out if the do! Red Robin..... yuuuck!!

These guys make a very decent burger and I also like the big, broad steak fries. No complaints about the food! The reason for the 2 stars is this: they make chocolate milk only at the bar, and it comes in a very small glass. They offer free refills which is nice, but if you have kids, then you know how quickly they power through a little glass of their favorite beverage. Because it's made at the bar, it takes a long time to be delivered to your table. I've noticed that the same is true for shakes. So you'd basically have to order a chocolate milk and then order another one the very minute the first one was delivered.  

Don't get me wrong- I don't allow my child to drink a gallon of Choco milk in a sitting, but the glass size is very small by industry standards. And it's the only restaurant I've been to where it comes only from the bar.

We love love love Red Robin. We probably come here once every week or every other week. Our son is 3 and this is his favorite place to go. The service is always great from the waitstaff. Some of the greeters/hosts could be a little more acknowledging. The food is always done well, never had a complaint there. We're part of the royalty rewards, which is free to sign up for. So we get emails for discounted items and such. I usually get the same few things every other time I come here. The chicken fingers and bottomless fries (the honey mustard poppyseed sauce is so yummy) or the Reds Tavern Double burger. They also have real good milkshakes which the kiddo is always excited to share as he eats his usual mac n cheese. Yes, the prices are a little higher than I'd like, but its a treat for the family to go out with the little guy to his favorite place. We'll be back.

Reading through previous reviews, I see a few, who had a problem with the service. 
I was lucky and cannot confirm that. Red Robin's staff was fast, friendly and helpful. Our order came right and quick on a busy evening. 

There clearly are places with better burgers. Maybe even chains. But for a chain, I think this is solid quality. Very much good enough to get back there. 

The interior decoration might not me my exact idea for a burger place, but it is no problem to tolerate.

Use to love Red Robin. But the service is mediocre at best and the burger is no better than  a Wendy's burger or Burger King. What happened to the fries they used to be so good. The new decor is nice so it gets 2 stars. Rather drive the distance to Crave. We may try the corporation restaurant at Cornerstar though before we completely disown Red Robin.

We just tried to eat here with four of our six children and we were horrified by the service! They seemed to think we should balance our 8 month old twins in their car seats on chairs or just stick them on the floor under the table, and when we requested a booth we were refused.  We love red robin but we will not be returning to this location!!  Too bad for them, with a family of 8 that's easily $100+ every time we eat out even before the tip.

Usually have a great experience here. Not tonight. Slow service. Waiter didn't care when I expressed that I was unhappy that my salad had 5 pieces of avocado and was mostly lettuce. It was the lamest salad I have ever had. He offered to bring more avocado, but didn't offer to bring me something else. My hubby's burger had the egg on it and it was overcooked, not runny at all. The runny yolk is what makes it yummy! So disappointed. Won't be back.

Our waiter was awesome. Very nice (the kids kept saying so). This particular Red Robin seems like it is one of the older ones in town but it was still clean. Food was good, as usual.  The staff was very friendly.

Wow. Worst experience ever at red robin. EVER. 

Greeted by the hostess, and I say greeted loosely. More like we were grunted at after waiting for a minute or two. She leads us to our table, tells us our server, Caitlin, will be right with us and then literally throws the menus down on the table and walks away. If I hadn't been starving I probably would have walked out at this point. 

Our server makes her way over and she can barely look at my sister and I. I attempt to ask about a special that  I had read aboit in my email this morning and get a rude response about "yeah I know how to put the order in" ummm, ok...awesome. We order our burgers, app and drinks and barely see or hear from her again. She did bring refills for our drinks when our food arrived, probably the only nice thing that happened. 

It was inconvenient when we asked for extra napkins and sauce. Or she was just not having it but this is no way to treat customers. My sister and I have both worked in the industry and were appalled.

We ordered the same burger, one lettuce wrapped one not. Same salads. One burger came wrapped (not the lettuce one) and one came on a plate and while the other came in a basket. Sloppy. Not impressed at all. 

Get it together Red Robin. This is pathetic. This location will not be getting my business again.

How can you not love red robin? The fries are always so delicious and go perfect with ranch with a little bit of hot sauce. I'm not a big fry person at all, but here I will always eat them. The burgers are always good too and if I ever want a burger I prefer this place. My favorite I've tried is the Whiskey BBQ. They have a variety of alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks that always look so good and end up tasting as good. Also I have never had any problems with the service here and everyone is so friendly.

We always came here for a burger and we always had a fantastic meal and experience.  Today we stopped by before going to get emissions done on the car.  Ordered our usual Banzi Burgers with extra teriyaki sauce on the side for fry dipping.  When the food came out it was obvious the burgers were smaller, they didn't have all the fixing as they used to dressed in the burger wrapper.  The waiter decided two people only needed a small cup of sauce filled 1/3 of the way.  The bread was dry, barely any lettuce, pineapple, tomatoes, mayo, smashed dry burger patty, hardly any cheddar, and a dab of sauce.  Super gross and they won't be getting our business any longer.
Great burgers try the green chili burgers. Nicole is a excellent server except she tries to make you eat the broccoli instead of french fries. Just kidding great waitress.

Service was great!
There was no wait to be seated and we never waited more that 10 minutes for our appetizer, burgers, and dessert. 
I also never had to ask for a refill of freckled lemonade :)

The onion tower was hot and crispy. 
Our burgers were cooked to perfection. 
Our cake was amazing. 

Definitely a satisfying dinner!
On top of all this, it was a Friday night!
Good food but our server, Matt, really made the difference. He was attentive and very helpful.
The service was ok, but the food was not fresh. The salad I ordered was actually disgusting!  BEWARE! You will leave this place still hungry!
Nikki was my waitress and Cassie the bartender. They were excellent! The food is consistent when you are looking for a good burger or beer. Great location too. Come here for reliable food and drinks!

Unfortunately we had a horrible experience. I wish I would have known before going that they removed the kiddie arcade area. Such a bummer especially having kids with you. Are waiter was completely slow almost trying to avoid us we had to ask for re-fills for extra cups to be taken away and food orders were messed up. The manager was super awesome and gave us our whole meal for free 4 adults 2 kids and added on 2 desserts. But unfortunately for the wait, and the quality of food I would not come back.

I live very close to this location so have been there several times.  Starting with a positive note, they recently did a remodel and the place now looks great.  Both the inside and outside were remodeled and it looks very up to date and nice.
  
With that being said, the service here is not very good.  I was just there 4 days ago and our server asked us as he was taking our drink order if we wanted any appetizers.  We said yes and ordered mozzarella sticks.  When he brought the drinks back he took our food order.  We sat there waiting and waiting but no mozzarella sticks ever arrived.  As our meals were being brought out we asked the server what happened to our appetizer.  He went back to the kitchen to check.  When he came back out empty handed he told us there was a mix-up in the kitchen.  We told him to just cancel it.  He then came back 5 minutes later with the mozzarella sticks and said he will not charge us for them.  I understand mix-ups can happen but this is not the first time dealing with frustrating service at this location.  When the server gave us the bill he made sure to tell us out loud what the total should have been and then how much we saved since he took the mozzarella sticks off and also didn't charge us for our drinks.  Was he telling us what the total should have been so we tip based on that amount?  Just seemed weird...

Another time I was there recently (maybe 3 weeks ago) I ordered a Blue Moon Shake as dessert.  I waited a solid 15 minutes for the shake to be made.  My server actually gave me my check, came back and got my card, ran my card and brought me back the receipt all before it arrived. 

I do like the food so I keep going back but the service is starting to make me question if I should keep going there or now.  Time after time I have been disappointed.

A Red Robin is a Red Robin is a Red Robin. There isn't much to say special about this particular store compared to the chain in general. Good food, nice people. This store is one of the older stores as noted by the name Red Robin Burger & Spirits Emporium. The design is very open providing lots of seating and room for large groups. The game room area seems much larger than the typical Red Robin and I'm currious to why they didn't just use the space for more seating. The lobby/waiting area is small compared to the amount of seating available.

Horrible service.  The restaurant is pretty much empty and our server had us spending more time waiting than anything. 

Not acceptable for a place with mediocre food at best.
Still not sure how they built the entire restaurant around cheeseburgers, but high five!

Red Robin has tons of fun stuff all over the walls. I love that kind of thing. The menu is simple and not overly elaborate; there is nothing wrong with that. When I go to a place like Red Robin that is exactly what I want. 
Their drinks are large in variety and I LOVE a place that will serve an adult beverage with my meal. 
The downside for me is the wait service at this location is lackluster. Though I never have to ask for a refill on my beverage that is the only attentiveness that there is. It may just be me but I have never been asked how is my meal until I walk out the door and I feel like I am being rushed out said door every time. 
Bottom line; I will go again since its close to home, but I don't expect much.
Fast, courteous service.  The tavern burger and chicken sandwiches were hot, fresh, and delicious.  The bottomless fries were hot and yummy.  Perfect date night burger!

The good of this visit to red robin is that they have not lost there the ability to make good onion rings freckled lemonade and onion ring sauce. The bad was the service. I can't believe I had to sit and wait for 15 min for a drink refill when there was 10 tables active in the whole restaurant. Not only that I saw my waitress twice the whole visit. Once for my order and once when my food came. The only time my drink was refilled was when another gal brought out my appetizer. Now the ugly. I had not been here for some time and with past experience the food is usually tasty. I can say that I have had better burgers at McDonald's. The food tasted cheap and was soggy. For thirty bucks I expected more.

Food was good. Atmosphere is terrible. Overheard waitresses and waiters talking about sex and literally laying down on the job, (laying on table bench taking a break.) not good family environment with current staff.

I am not from this area but I was in town visiting relatives and we decided on Red Robin. Our server was not responsive, and almost seemed to be not okay-- maybe under the influence of something. She seemed to be in her own world. It took over 30 minutes for our food to arrive, which was brought to us by a food runner-- not our server. She never checked on us after that and I'm not sure if she disappeared. It was then a hassle to try to get the check so we could leave the place. The whole experience left me feeling like I was in the twilight zone-- Maybe zombies do exist????

I am a creature of habit and order the teriyaki chicken sandwich and sweet potato fries almost every time! It tastes great, just a bit messy! My husband had the prime burger with the Guiness milkshake, yes milkshake! Chocolate ice cream, Guiness and Jamison! Interesting but nasty! Try it for yourself...

Not sure why the bad reviews, my food is never cold, or gross, and I am a regular here. I like this red robin location a lot because we usually get seated right away and the wait for our food is not bad at all. We have a red robin loyalty card that we've taken advantage of and received free burgers from. I am a vegetarian and it delights me that they can substitute the patty for you for a veggie patty. Our food is always fresh and not cold at all. The taste is great. The fries are always warm and delicious. Their appetizers aren't bad at all. I love the onion rings and kettle chips. My only problem is that there's been a few times when I ordered my meal that I asked for a side of ranch and the waitress forget it. I reminded her and she forgot again so I gave up, but that's only happened twice. I also don't care for the bar side because I don't like being seated so close to other people but usually it isn't packed so it's not a problem. The waiters and waitresses we have had, have been prompt and friendly. Once they brought me a burger with a meat patty and the waitresses right away corrected it and brought me my veggie burger without a problem. The other plus to this place is that it's open late so it's a great place to get dinner at after working a long day.
Food had always been great,  that's why I've come back quite a few times. But I came in tonight with only one server, and the bartender,  who was not polite in the slightest. Won't be going back.

Fool me once,SHAME on you.  Fool me twice, SHAME on me.I know they're terrible at this one but I live a falf mile away and II got an email for a free burger since it was my birthday.so I get my bansai burger. I know it sounds wimpynbut I reccoment you get your burger in half so can see ifbthey cook it right and also prevents ingredients sliding out which always happens here! I honestly don't know why they ask how you want your burger. I like mine pink like they say but, it's always not pink or cremated!  I tried to post a pic from my iPad because I asked how long it takes for a burger and they say usually 8 min. I get mine in 14 min. For as dead as it was, it makes no sense.
No one has a better burger!  This isn't bar food, they serve an amazing selection of gourmet burgers.

I would have rated 0 stars if it would have let me. My group of 5 just left (literally) after 30 minutes, after 20 minutes of waiting to get seated and watching 2 parties who arrived after us, get seated before us, and once we were finally seated, we not only had servers argue about who was going to take our table in front of us, but were ignored for another 10 minutes before someone stopped by to ask if we wanted drinks. Then our server finally revealed herself, making an excuse about having been switched from the bar area and not knowing she had a table, then walked away from us. We promptly got up and left. Very bad service all around, from the rude hostess who needed to be reminded there was a party of 5 waiting for a table, to the servers who side-eyed us in their attempt to be cut early, to our "server" who couldn't even be bothered with actually apologizing to us. As a hotel manager, if my staff EVER acted like that with a guest, they might be sent home after a long discussion and a documentation.  DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY. 6/21/15
Just terrible! Dirty, waitress seemed like she didnt care. Food took forever, didnt get my beer till the middle of my meal. Just sad to see such a great place go down hill.

I know it had been a long time since I'd visited a Red Robin, but it wasn't because the food wasn't good.  I had gone to this location with Moms after a little shopping.  The service was good, but the food was only okay.  We had the luau wings or something as a starter, and they were pretty good.  I had the chili burger and mom had a burger melt.  Her bread was so hard, she had to do the old "side bite" just to try to get through it.  She gave up and discarded the bread.  My burger was so greasy, it was ridiculous.  The peach shakes we had were awesome, though.  Won't be back to this place (at least this location), no matter how convenient.
Red Robin used to be really, really good. Now it just seems like another burger joint.  Nothing really exciting about the food anymore.

Not the burger it used to be. Tasted like something I could have gotten from McDonald's for a 10th of the price. Plus getting a plain cheeseburger with 20lbs of mayo littered with lettuce and onions straws was awesome- oh wait, I didn't order that.

Not Gluten Free (can't say if it was the burger or the fries that caused the reaction). I talked to the manager before dining and explained that many people do a gluten free diet as a fad but that I have Celiac disease and get sick from even trace amounts of gluten.  He was very nice and said they offer a gluten free bun and their fries are cooked in a designated fryer.  The burger and fries came out and they tasted as good as it gets but an hour so later and one urgent trip to the bathroom and the good times were over.  I truly believe the manager believed they were offering a gluten free option but my guess is probably that one of the cooks dropped something breaded in the fryer when they got busy.  I've heard of this happening before.  This is a major bummer because the burger was great, maybe I might try the burger only and no fries if I get enough courage to go back.

Great place for lunch or an early dinner.

Pros:
- very flexible menu with veggie options
- decent kids menu
- choice of two veggie patty substituions for their extensive burger list (boca or Gardenburger)
- bottomless fries
- botomless non alcoholic drinks
- decent mixed drink + beer selection
- great place to eat if you are hitting up Costco
- kids can play some games + get balloons
- waitstaff is great 95% of the time
- while often busy there is rarely a wait to be seated

Cons:
- the prizes in the kids games either smell like petroleum byproducts or break within minutes of leaving
- chain
Service was great. Burger was a little dry and lacked flavor.
Came here today for Jim Day.  We get a free Jim Beam burger if we are Jims.  That alone deserves 5 stars from me.  Thanks Red Robin!

My wife and I love Red Robin and frequent this location. Tonight was particularly good. We started with the guacamole, salsa and chips. The salsa was very fresh and flavorful. Nice big fresh tomatoes, red onions and flavorful avacado. Big, juicy burgers, we both had the Whisky River Burger, dripping into the basket of fries. Good stuff!

My boyfriend and I stopped in for lunch and had a great experience!  I'm a fan of the Chain anyway, so it would be hard for me to bash this place.

We split an order of buzzard wings and a cobb salad.  Both were fantastic!  The only down side was my salad came with olives on it after I specifically asked for no olives.  Overall, our service was great!  It also was, however, the middle of the afternoon and the place was empty (which was also really nice).

One of my favorites on the menu is the California chicken burger.  I've loved that one for many years!  I'm also fond of the garlic fries but haven't had them in a while.

All around a good place to stop in for a bite.  After sampling a lot of the lunch spots in the area, this is one of the best!

Been a while since I visited RR it will be much longer before I return. While the service was good, that was the high point. I was sad to see the chili chili cheese burger is no longer offered. The french dip I picked instead was sub standard. Too much gristle on the meat made the sandwich difficult to bite through. The sauce was subtle, but unpleasant. As a finale I was ill o my return home.
I occasionally like to order the chicken ensenada platter from this place.  That's all I order and it tastes great!

Yah I know it's a chain. But you get BOTTEMLESS steak fries.  I'm very happy to discover that Red Robin seems pretty consistent with their service and food.

Their burgers (even veggie patty substitute) are always humongous and again, the yummy, crunchy, bottomless fries makes it all worth it. 

I think their better than TGIFs, BJ's, etc..

Red Robin is a great place to go because I know what I like and I know it will be the same every time, I guess that's the beauty of chain restaurants right? I order the whiskey river chicken wrap and split a rookie magic milkshake. And of course the bottomless steak fries are always great. You can get the fries crispy, I personally don't like them crispy because they tend to be TOO crispy sometimes.

Just came to the bar to order for take out. Pure chaos, and only one bartender. His name is Brandon, and this dude has been running in circles since we got here, but has maintained nothing but professionalism, prompt service, and a warm feel. Five stars just for Brandon alone!

I just had to leave before finishing my meal on Veterans Day due to the balloons being inflated and popping loudly the entire time I was at this location.  I spoke with the manager who dismissed my concerns and complaints with a flippant "we shouldn't have purchased them from China" and proceeded to do absolutely nothing.  Never returning.

This place is nice, the waiters and staff are really friendly. Three stars because my meal was not worth what I paid for. My fries were cold (that's a sin). The menu described this very saucy type of burger with really great detail. Sadly, there was more detail in the description than the actual burger (I ordered the Nacho Crunch Tavern Burger, which I do not recommend if you love sauce like I do). All in all, clean environment, friendly people, thumbs down on the food.

Lately, this has become my Red Robin of choice.  I always sit in the bar area, and I always get consistently good service.  They are doing a good job of following their own rules and keeping the kiddies out of this area.  That gives this  room more a nice "adult burgers and beer" vibe, and less of a "happy-happy-birthday, lord of the flies, free-for-all" one.

The quality of the burgers and chicken sandwiches have been solid.  They do have the same problem here that all the Red Robins now seem to have when it comes to the french fries.  Ever since they went to serving smaller amounts of fries with your meal in those asymmetric metal ring molds, I can never seem to get hot and fresh fries on the first pass.  I have a theory that they are batch cooking them, instead of doing them to order.  This is rather annoying as I would really like to have hot fries while I eat my burger, and not later, after I have finished it, when they finally bring out a new batch.  This location does do a better job than most of getting the second batch out as quickly as possible.

They also have a decent beer selection here, and they serve them nice and cold.  The servers are friendly, and the prices, although creeping upward, are on par with similar establishments.

I have never tried Red Robin up until a few days ago, but being a huge burger fan, I had to check it out (my wife has been pestering us to go for the bottomless fries). Overall, everything was great. The server was friendly and helpful, the food was tasty and came quickly and the drinks were strong and delicious!

Have gone to this Red Robin a few times and I have to say the service is the only underwhelming part that makes me choose a different location. The food is good and hot but the service is below average . 

Went here yesterday and order drinks, fries, and food immediately upon sitting down. Our drinks came quickly and the restaurant was not busy on a Sunday afternoon. Around 10 minutes later still no fries so maybe she forgot ? We asked and she said they should have been out and apologized , saying they would be right out. 15 minutes later nothing. 20 minutes later our food was out. She asked if there was anything else and we said the fries. She assured us the fries would be out and apologized. Then almost the whole way through our meal she came back to our table and said, " they still didn't bring you those fries ! I'm about to go back there cause we have a problem " okay so then she should go check to see why the kitchen is not on top of it . I'm pretty much almost done with our meals 2 baskets of fries are put on our table. Communication is a problem there. 

That's not the only bad service. One time I was at this location and the girl didn't want to write any of the orders down and I said I have a lot of allergies so she was aware , she came back 3 times asking about things that weren't right for my order and it came out wrong.
Red robin has gluten free buns for there hamburgers and they are AMAZING! The buns are so soft and not the same old buns they have at every other restaurant when you're gluten free.

The food is usually pretty good. Service from visit to visit is not consistent. Waiters are much better than the waitresses at picking up on the small details like, no silverware at my table, I need extra napkins due to children at my table, keeping drinks refilled, clearing tables quickly. Not sure why this is...
 I like that the waiters always wait for my family to finish praying before interrupting us to take our order.
I just love that whiskey River barbecue wrap and wedge salad.

The location and service was great, the burgers are good but mine was lukewarm. Seeing as this is a chain restaurant, I'd approve of this place for its service and location. Plus, the happy hours deals are okay. 

But the burgers need to be warm!

This is the second visit to this location and we were yet again disappointed at the slow inattentive service for dinner.  The food was as ordered but the service was slow even though the restaurant was mostly empty.  We asked for a second sandwich midway through the meal and the ticket wasn't added to the kitchen until we were ready to pay the check.  The bottomless fries are useless if refill requests are not fulfilled.  We will avoid this location in the future and would suggest the same for other customers.

Well back at RR I had the Black & blue cheese burger it was OK but at almost 15.00 it just seemed small probably 4-5 ounces?  The fries were soft soggy and seemed undercooked, so not sure how they get them very soft undercooked but not hard but they did it.  My wife had what they called French Onion Soup and as you would probably expect it was not only not very good it was bad.  The soup had very few onions in it even though that is the name.  The cheese was a giant glob of some kind of artificial cheese, it had a glob by plastic taste to it that I just can't place other than it is not cheese.  The "soup" tasted like a package of instant beef broth instead of the long simmered taste it should have.  Overall it was not a great visit.  The waitress was pleasant but one other nit is RR serves a lot of fries every day, our ketchup was empty and so was the bottle on the table next to ours.  Salted Caramel shake allowed us to leave happy at least it was very good.

I like Red Robin, I just don't like THIS Red Robin location. The food is always blah. It doesn't have a lot of flavor and it seems mushy and sloppy and they always take forever, even when the restaurant is empty during off hours. I've tried it a couple of times because I live nearby but I won't be planning on returning.

Well service was great Brandon the server was great. The food was ok fries were cold I ordered a blue ribbon burger and received a burger with fish and no blue cheese they took it back and said they took it off the bill and did not. I think they need to retrain the kitchen staff and if you say your going to make it right then do it. Not planning on going back to red robin.

Terrible service. Terrible food. Terrible all around. 
Never consistent with their service, quality of food or cleanliness of restaurant. A big disappointment... especially being in the neighborhood. If you want a real burger with a side of outstanding service, go a bit further down the road to Maggie's Irish Pub... you'll be glad you did. 
Oh, and the bar & bartenders are much more attentive and interested at Maggie's too.

Came here for lunch today during the Broncos game.  Our waitress was preoccupied with the game every time she came to our table. She brings out the food and my niece and nephews macaroni and cheese was in a plastic bag! Seriously?! Then she proceeds to open the bags at the table and squeeze the food into a bowl.  Never got a refill on any of our drinks either.
Standard Red Robin, but please keep the fries fresh because they are bottomless.  Not yesterdays crunchy ones from the bottom of the fry bin.

Brandon was our waiter today and was amazing. Talked to everyone at the table and made sure we were take care of. He is the true meaning of a great waiter. Talked to my daughter like she was an adult and told her she had awesome an mom for letting her have what she waited to drink(root beer float). He made sure she had extra root beer when it ran low in her float. Food came out fast and was HOT, just the way it should be. Amazing service and will for sure make sure we sit in Brandon's section again!

The service was good but I didn't like the food. All the food is burgers (so you better like burgers) except for 6 alternate choices. I got a prime rib meal and was disappointed when it came because it was just a sandwich, not actual prime rib steak. The fries are not good at all and the portions were small. The coleslaw was on a piece of lettuce to make it appear bigger. Also, after the sandwich which was $13 and tax and a few bucks for a tip it was over $17! What a rip off! I could have gone to Five Guys or Smashburger 3 times for that
Service is very slow. Silverware had chunks dry food on them. Tables were sticky. with that being said, the food is delicious.

Pretty disappointed in the salad I ordered. Got the southwest grilled chicken salad and It's was just plain iceberg lettuce that was 90% stems. If your gonna charge almost $10 for a salad give me so real greens like spinach, arugula, romain or any other green leaf than iceberg! 

The dressing was ok but nothing special. Chicken wasn't over cooked but wasn't that flavorful. Only good part were the corn, beans and fried jalapeño chips. 

My wife for a mushroom burger and it decent. But she said she'd rather get a burger at 5 Guys and Fat Burger. We definitely won't be going back anytime soon, if ever.

I hit this location up occasionally for lunch because it is near my office, and have consistently had good LUNCH service with food cooked to order and fast friendly service. The couple visits i have made for dinner were mediocre with over cooked meat and slow service.

My lunch visits have consistently gotten me in and out and back to my office within my hour break, and have never required me to complain to get my order right or drinks filled. I prefer my burgers cooked medium and I have had consistently pink meat here, unless i go at dinner. The waiters seam to be much more on point than the waitresses for some reason. 

Overall, solid for lunch, but skip it for dinner.

We go to red robin often, we have only been to this one twice both of witch were not good. They get the orders wrong and the food is thrown together. We will be going to the other locations and won't return to this one. It only got two stars because the wait staff is friendly.

I'm generally a fan of RR, mostly going to other locations but this past weekend night the food at this location was iffy...I realize they were slammed at that time but....

I asked for a med-rare burger and was told they only do well done or just a little pink...thought that was odd as I never heard that at the other locations before. After the meal came, I could tell the burger was pre-cooked and just warmed probably to get food out quick. My wife's chicken sandwich was similar (reheated). 

My thought is, if a restaurant wants to be known as a burger place and charge $10+ a burger, then it better be one good burger and this was a major letdown.

Again, I'm not sure if this is a common practice at this location or was due to the crowds at that time since I haven't had that issue at other RR's locally.

Generally speaking red robin is usually good but this location in particular always falls short of expectations. It's worth the drive to the one at Parker and 470 for more consistent food and much better service.  I don't know if this location uses different suppliers but the hamburger buns at this location always fall apart making nothing but a mess of ingredients. Never have had this issue at other locations. Even when this location isn't busy the service is subpar. Went Saturday about 8 in the evening. They weren't busy but our service was horrible. Servers and managers seemed more concerned with chatting amongst themselves than actually taking care of the customers.  Or the cleanliness of the place.

Shady Staff!

My friend and I visited there last night. Our server was great, but once we were done and left the table we went to the bathroom. While in the bathroom I realized I left the Christmas gift she gave me on the table. We were not even gone for 5 minutes, we had not left the premises yet, and when we asked the hostess and female bartender about it they looked shocked. Pieces of the gift were stashed behind the bar and at the hostess stand and the bag was thrown in the trash! I was expecting to find the bag, and all of its contents in one place, but these immature and greedy girls obviously went through the bag, picked out what they wanted, and threw the rest away. 

Again, we never left the premises!  I will NEVER visit this location again based on the fact that two greedy girls tried to steal someone else's Christmas gift. Shame on them!

Fantastic food, great service. A lot of shouting in the kitchen and had the manager yelling at an employee in the middle of the restaurant. I will still be coming back, hopefully this is a one off problem

Newer location so maybe service could get better. 

Great happy hour in the bar area. $3.50 Margaritas 

Good burgers and endless fries.

I love RR! I took my team out for lunch and we arrived just after noon and we were promptly greeted and seated. I know if we would have went to the Park Meadows location or Arapahoe and Yosemite location, we would have probably had to wait. 

We had 11 people and the service was very accommodating and they took care of us with our drinks and food in less than an hour. They even kept the fries flowing! 

I would go out of my way to go to this RR anytime. Keep up the hard work!

Have always been a fan of Red Robin, but I will never go to this location again even though it is closer to my home. First, it was very busy. Over half the seating is for the bar, which had more than enough empty tables and yet there was still a line out the door and a 20 minute wait.  Our server was very nice and really was doing the best that she could. The most disturbing part of the evening came, when my son uncovered a rotten baby carrot that came with his kids meal. I gave his plate to our server and told her she may want to let the kitchen know. Fifteen minutes later we were given our check. I did not make a scene about the rotten food, but still hoped that someone would address it and at least offer an apology. Ten minutes late our bill was paid and we were out the door, still no explanation or apology. 

I can get a tasty cheese burger across the street at Freddy's, I go to places like Red Robin and pay $10 for their version of something that Freddy's does way better because I like the fun atmosphere and service. Tonight Red Robin failed. That they would think that the service of rotten food is something they can just skim over and pretend like it did not happen is as rude as it is reckless.
I love sitting at booths, but the booths here are so tight. I'm not a big fan of RR in general, but the food is always hot and fresh.

Visited for dinner this evening, and sat in the bar area, since it's child free. We ordered two milkshakes, and I watched them sit in the service well for over ten minutes. Other than that hiccup, food was good, and our server Jacqueline seemed nice. Will probably be back again, but not anytime soon.

My son and I went on a lunch date & it was great. Food was good, I had a teriyaki chicken sandwich wrapped in lettuce... Delish! My son had a corn dog & oranges. Service was ok; server looked to have too many tables.

Good place for kids!

It's the worst restaurant! We've been to it today. Very bad service & management to. It took them 15 to come and get our drinks and then another 20 minutes to get the orders and on top of all that the food tasted so bad. It wasn't good at all. I will never go there again $ this is not the first time it happened to us.

This location is close to the office.  Going here for lunch is convenient.  I would recommend this location to anyone looking for fast, friendly service.  Today I had a great experience with Jacqueline.  She was so friendly and accommodating.

Dinner time on a Thursday eve...the place was busy but no wait for a table. Still, that shouldn't be reason for apps or salads to come out WITH the entrees (and the server apparently thought this was fine). The staff all looked busy, running this way & that, but didn't seem to really be "doing" much. Overall, the food was quite good. Service was not the worst we've ever had, but it was sure lacking.

GREAT FOOD, TERRIBLE ETHICS

Red Robin never fails to impress with thick, fresh, tasty fries and big, beautiful juicy burgers.  The value is great and they have a great menu selection from burgers to fish and chips to milkshakes to salads...love it all!  I'd rate them 4 STARS FOR FOOD!

This location, however, has a terrible team of employees.  Our service was not very attentive (didn't check back very often and had to ask twice for ranch and lemons)... the real kicker and why I give them 1 STAR FOR EVERYTHING ELSE is that when I was in last night I exchanged gifts with my friend and she left the gift bag on the table... in the approximately 7 minutes it took us to go to the bathroom and get to the parking lot and realize she had left the bag, four of the staff members had gone through the bag and divided up the gifts amongst themselves... the bartender pulled out one item from under the bar, another was hanging in plain view off the bar, a host pulled one item out from under the host stand, and the bag with the last two items was pulled from the TRASH CAN -- only 7 freaking minutes after we left it!  Finally, we never recovered the final gift bag item...some server must be enjoying her colorado-made shimmer lip balm right now.  The sad thing is, it wasn't one rogue employee who snatched the bag, the whole team was in on it -- happy holidays... I'll stick with another location from now on!

Met dad for the Broncos 2 sack deal.  All day Tuesday after the Broncos get 2 sacks in a game you get a free tavern burger with the purchase of another meal and 2 drinks.  Another we figured out is you can get your bottomless fries and order a salad with your hamburger.   Quite a good deal and I sure do like the Fiery Ghost Burger and the Crispy Chicken Tender Salad.

Red Robin has some tasty burgers.   I had the 'shroom burger, fries, and a Fat tire.  The burgers are big and this one had Plenty of mushrooms piled high on the burger.  They tasted like they were just saute'd, they still had a little body to them and not mushy.

The wait staff was attentive with out hovering, and when we asked to split the check differently the waitress smiled and said no problem... and she even looked sincere!   I will continue to eat at these places because they have good solid food for the price... even though they are a chain.

I usually enjoy RR but this location could improve their service. The receptionist (young girl, long hair, somewhat curly) was rude. She did not greet us and we stood right in front of her. I finally told her that we needed a table and she acted very "inconvenienced." It was not crowded and there were many tables. We didn't even get a hello or a smile from the receptionist. The waitresses were very nice and helpful (the one who seated us and the other who served us). The kitchen took forever getting our food out and there was confusion with our appetizer (super late) and when we received our food, it was luke warm. I believe it was the confusion in the kitchen because it appeared several people (and several waiters/waitresses stations) within the restaurant were getting their food very late.  I want to reiterate that the restaurant wasn't overly crowded. This location needs to improve or we will just go down the road.

We like to go to this Red Robin but only if Anna is working at the bar!!  I like that they have a policy of no underage kids in the bar/booth area.  Red Robin can be filled with little kids and soccer teams.  Sometimes adults just want a quiet meal out.  

The food is always good.  The service could be a lot better.  The management could be a lot better.  We only eat there when Anna is working at the bar.  She is an excellent server and she listens.  I have sent more food back to their kitchen than anywhere.  The other servers don't listen and often our glasses sit empty.   

Managers should come by and talk to patrons.  They have become very cheap with their bottomless fries...............

My family and I like Red Robin.  We like the place and the food.  My favorites are the burgers.   I usually have the Banzai Burger or chicken tortilla soup and salad.    Only complaint that I have is getting a well done burger is regularly an issue.

Children
Staff and patrons
I don't understand the presence of either
Seventy bucks, burgers with 4 kids?
No beer on tab, had to go to the bar, to get ONE
But whoever heard of burgers and beer
Rosie/Ruby, I forget, didn't know what local meant
When asked about local beers, Rosie/Ruby, replied "bud"
If you profess "local support" on the menu, do so
I almost left then, wish I had
Yum my ass
bu-bye

Very slow service. Waitress was nice but the food took forever to come out. The  appetizers came out cold and to make even worse, the two tables around us all complained on the temperature of the food. 40 minutes and counting and we still don't have our food! Will not be returning here!

I am sorry, but Red Robin serves burgers that are just barely a step up from drive-through.  Their fries are good if you ask for crispy, but they are often underdone if you don't.  If you want to be thought of as a burger choice, you need to serve your burgers to the temperature of your customer's choosing.  Red Robin refuses to serve rare burgers, and most of the time their burgers are med-well to well.  Wrong for me.  Worst of all, when you send a message to their corporate offices via email to suggest that they should consider buying beef that they are comfortable serving rare, they simply ignore and do not respond to your message.  I am a customer, and I will bring my patronage to businesses that can appreciate that dynamic.
3rd time in a row horrible service. They definatly need a bit of restructuring in this location. Poor poor service we will not come to this location again.
The chain is usually good.  This location is a poor representation.  Go elsewhere.

Love their burgers. Bottomless steak fries are always hot and fresh. Over the years i have ate at this location a dozen times or so and have always had above average experiences. Service is always above and beyond. I would eat here any day of the week before other chains like TGIs, Chilis, etc.
Every time we go to this red robin every person on staff is terrific! Even the bus boy stopped and asked if we needed anything. Sometime food takes a little long but the service is the best!

My husband and our 1.5 yr old ate dinner here Friday.  We arrived just after 5pm, so it wasn't too busy and we had no trouble at all getting a table immediately.  

When we were shone to our table, our son was repeatedly begging for milk already, so I asked the hostess if she would mind seeing if our server could get him milk first thing.  Only a minute or so later, he came by with a cup of milk for our son.  As a parent, every thing they do to help make it easier with hungry, anxious children means so much.  It helps us keep our sanity!

Even when our little guy spilled milk and was dropping things on the floor (which we cleaned up voluntarily as much as possible - don't feel right leaving that), the server and other staff were always quick to offer help with extra napkins etc.  

The food was good, as always/predictable.  The staff was very friendly and available.

Great family place!!!
Went 2 days ago. We had to wait almost 30 minutes for a table. When we finally sat down we saw many open tables. Service was extremely slow. Food was mediocre. Won't be back.

I very much enjoy their burgers as they are excellent.  The atmosphere is a bit noisy but it seems to cater to children as well as adults.  The service is very customer orientated and the visit the table quite often.  I will return as their spicy burgers are the best!
Another test kitchen location. The service at this place is alright. As per usual with RR this is a pretty noisy place; amusing considering there weren't a whole lot of people when I stopped in.
Love the whiskey river BBQ chicken wrap!!!!!

I don't get Red Robin. People seem to love it. I don't think I've ever had a burger there; maybe that's what they specialize in - whatever it is, I do NOT get the hype. I've gone three times over the past few months, and I've come to discover that Red Robin kind of sucks. Such minuscule portions of such mediocre food at such ridonk prices. Thirteen ninety-five for a "prime rib" French dip sandwich. Smaller than a 6-inch sub from Subway and bland as an old shoe. The au jus was like dirty bathwater, too. Meh! Same price for a plate of "riblets" and chicken fingers. (Hubby ordered *grilled* chicken, not fried, but whatev.) The portion was WEE. Half of the plate was cole slaw, and that was pretty meh, too. And the kids' meals - it galls me to see a place offer mandarin oranges as a side, instead of fresh fruit - especially when they serve them up in a tiny sample cup like the ones at Costco. I wish so badly I could find a kid-friendly restaurant that offers decent food at a good price.

We stopped in for lunch and I'm happy we did. This may become my favorite sit down Mexican restaurant.
  I ordered the carne asada plate and we also had the smothered stuffed sopapilla with shredded beef. My carne asada was good and the beans and rice were excellent. In my opinion, if a Mexican restaurant can get the rice and beans correct then the rest of the menu will probably be great. Well, let me tell you the rice and beans reminded me of my mom's and was just amazing, loved them both! The stuffed sopapilla was the winner out of our entrees and excellent all the way around. Stuffed with amazing shredded beef and smothered with green chili sauce and cheese. This thing was great and will be ordered again the next time I'm here; which will be soon.
  Lupitas is on Colfax and the area seems a bit sketchy but we were there for lunch so no worries. There was plenty of parking on the sides and rear of the building. The working owners were very nice and genuine. Service was a little slow but I attribute that to walking in right behind a big party (just my luck). 
  I'll go back a couple of more times before I raise my rating just to make sure it was that good. I hope my next visits are as enjoyable.
