Great find where we didn't expect it! Way off the beaten path, but happened to be on our way to the airport. Had a nice breakfast at good prices with very courteous service & it's super clean- especially the restrooms.  They even made borracho beans for my husband (not on their menu) instead of refried. If you happen to be in the neighborhood, this is a great little place for authentic, home style Mexican.

Lupitas' Restaurant had me at lobster, when I saw they indeed sell lobster!! My goodness, the ambience is amazing and romantic. Good for a strong crowd, and lovely tables. Live music and more! Who doesn't want any live music provided for them? This restaurant also hosts birthday parties, business meetings, family gatherings with a full house. That's why their restaurant has the biggest restaurant tables ever.

Two stars because the service was good. Otherwise the place looks like somebody's junk room and there weren't a lot of customers there during what should've been a busy dinner hour. There were two servers, presumably one of them the owner, they were milling about without any worry about all the mess and junk all over the tables. We weren't sure the place was even open when we walked in.

The food was bland and greasy, and I'm always amazed at how some restaurants can completely cook the flavor out of food.

If I were desperate and nothing else was open, I might consider going back here purely out of need. Otherwise there are many good restaurants all over town and no need to go to a place in such disarray.

Lupita's is right up the street from me so I'm surprised I don't eat here more often! Had family in town for Easter and we enjoyed a great meal on a Saturday night with live music and great service. Had the cheese enchiladas smothered in green chili and loved them. My brother had the carnitas and said they were great! I'll have to make it a point to visit Lupita's more often!

This place has gone downhill over the years. It seems there is no effort to clean up anything inside and outside the building. The food is tasteless and a bit overpriced for the quality you get. I remember when this was a Mr. Steak years ago and I think they still use the same furniture. I want to like this place and with all the new construction up Colfax near University Hospital they could really capitalize on new clientele. I wish them the best in the future.

Wow, I was super disappointed with everything.  I gave a one star, but if zero stars was an option that is what I would give this place.  Somehow, this place got a 4.1 which fooled me into going.  First disappointment was the service was extremely slow!!  Lupita's customer service sucked!!  She was very argumentative when we asked for a soft taco after receiving a hard shell taco and not only that she got some of our order wrong!!  The food was not authentic tasting, it taste like processed food.  Those of you that know how authentic food taste know the difference.
While waiting for our food, we noticed the dirty salt shaker that looked like bugs were drowning in there and the cleanliness of the restaurant looked questionable.  I would NOT recommend this place at all.  I don't normally rate places, but I thought I'd be doing someone a favor by not recommending this place.  

Do us a favor Lupita and retire that aweful mexican food!!

I checked out Lupita's after hearing about it from colleagues at the Anschutz Medical Campus. This is a classic Colfax Ave. dive!

When you walk in be prepared to go back into the 1970s. It's like you seriously stepped into a wormhole. 

The food is what I'm learning is 'Denver Mexican' where everything is smothered in cheese. It's cheap and the proportions are plentiful. The beef was incredibly moist and the flavor profiles are pretty straight-forward. Heavy--cheesy and greasy. 

Refills are not free and you do not get free chips and salsa refills either. 

If you want a hefty portion for a good price Lupita's is worth a look, but it's far from being a top Mexican restaurant in any regard.

Yes, this place is charming and hole-in-the-wally but falls short in the good Mexican food department. Bland red salsa. Bland green chili. Bland food. Good sized portions and great live music. They'll charge you for the second order of chips and tasteless red paste. Why?

There are much better places in the area, real Mexican joints. I assume this type of "Mexican" food would fly in the Midwestern U.S.

I tried this place because of the reviews. People mention great food and attentive waitstaff. There must be two Lupita's in Aurora.

I'd have to say, this place is not bad! I wasn't expecting much from it, but the restaurant offers a lot of different menu options as well as combination options for when you can't make up your mind. I opted for a combo plate (of course) that came with a chicken enchilada, tamale, chili relleno, beef taco and rice with a side of green chili. The green chili was pretty good, as was the enchilada and the tamale. The chili relleno was the star of my place. Hilariously enough, the best part about it was that it wasn't battered traditionally, but it was wrapped in an egg roll wrapper instead. It was super crispy on the outside and the cheesy filling on the inside was perfectly melted and delicious. The only sad part of my entree was the beef taco. It was very reminiscent of the type of tacos you can buy at Taco Bell. I also got a chance to try some of the guacamole from my brother's plate and it was GOOD. I would come back here for just the rellenos and guac. 

Service wasn't great, but it wasn't bad either. I'd say pretty average. The staff was nice, but not as attentive as I would have expected considering how empty the restaurant was. Definitely a recommendable place if you're looking for a sit down Mexican restaurant.

This place is definitely a gem in the neighborhood.... I met an old friend here, and the wait staff was very attentive. They had a large selection of house cocktails which made this girl happy. Not my normal style of Mexican food, but very good :). Lastly, the prices were very affordable... Would definitely go back :)
Ate the menudo with oxtail. Excellent. Also had the white sangria,  refreshing and perfectly prepared. Would definitely return.
The best margaritas in town!! Great service. The owner always comes to the table to say hello.

The food was good but the service wasn't so hot. I got the feeling if you weren't a regular you got sub par service. We waited nearly 30 min for the 1 complimentary basket of chips and salsa (which I had to ask for). I watch 4 other tables around me receive theirs immediately after being seated. We felt largely ignored by staff; that being said -- the food was delicious.
As always Lupita's satisfies. Friday nights with great food and live music are a terrific east to end the week and start the weekend. The only downside is I never have room for dessert.

I don't often have money to go out to eat with family or friends, but when I do, Lupitas is at the top of my list for places to go and it is always a treat! Betty the owner always comes around to every table and thanks everyone for choosing her restaurant which I feel is a very warm and welcoming touch and most owners of businesses just sit back and relish their earnings. Not Betty, she works along side her employees to make sure her patrons are well taken care of. The place needs a little work but it's because she doesn't want to raise the prices of her food to cover the cost of fixing seats, she'd rather make do with what she has and try and ensure a wholesome environment for her customers. I love eating at Lupitas as do new people I introduce to her establishment and their food is always on point ^_^. Thanks Lupitas for adding some wonderful color to otherwise dim colfax.

Worst service food and experience all together!!! We sat down at 930. Got our drinks and menus 30minutes later .. Waited another 30mins for water refill... The food was dry and gross seriously way better Mexican restaurants on Colfax... When we mentioned it the owners response was no its not why you give me problems. Seriously it was just feedback I'll pay for my meal just saying. . . after paying with my credit card we get chased down cuz she doesn't like my signature and now wants an I'd. I understand wanting to see my ID but you should've originally asked for it. Plus my signature is my signature 90% of peoples isn't legible. Ridiculously rude horrible food and terrible experience.save yourself the headache  and go somewhere else

They charge for refills on chips and salsa but the salsa tastes more like watered down spaghetti sauce so no worries on wanting more. My tamales were dry yet the filling was greasy rice and beans were bland and tasted like they had been sitting on the stove for a week. Taco Bell has better beans and I won't feed them to my dog!! There are far better Mexican places all around dont know how this place stays open.

Lupita's is my go-to sit down Mexican food restaurant in this part of town.  Excellent Mexican street food joints and Taquerias are a dime a dozen around here, but if you want a delicious smothered burrito or cheesy enchilada's with a basket of chips and salsa and a salty Margarita then Lupita's is the place to go.  The owner Betty is always around and always checks on you in a friendly and never annoying way.  Service is ALWAYS good.  The food is consistently good Colorado style mexican food.  
I've eaten here about once a month over the last 5 years that I've been living in this neighborhood and I have never had a bad experience.
The salsa was more like spaghetti sauce and green chili he no flavor and watery.  The worst tamale I've had

"Happy"! The little tune rolls in my head as I enjoy Lupita's Skillet for breakfast. Our server noted that all menu items were available upon our 0700 arrival--tasty accommodation for hospital and construction workers. Great vibe, the family supports many charities and arts. Parking would accommodate trucks. Me? Now I'm having homemade flan w breakfast. More "Happy"!

Not sure what to think of this place. The service was excellent, but everthing else was a little iffy. The decor was out of the 70's, and the tables and booths need an update.
The chips were good, but the salsa was awful. I ordered the chimichanga and my friend had the mexican hamburger. We followed that up with sopapillas. The entrees were okay, not the best, but not the worst. Dessert was served warm, but a little greasy.
Prices were reasonable, and portions were good sized. 
Was up with a sour stomach most of the night so I won't vouch for the overall food quality. Would I go back. Maybe but for breakfast.

I've only been to this place 2X. The first time I had no issue.. This time however I do have to critique the service I recieved. When ordering I specified that I did not want ONIONS with my food.. Well that's exactly I what I got.. I did mention this to the waitress and all I got was "I hope theres not too many." The owner I'm assuming came and told me that most of her food has "garlicky onions." Well that's what she should've said in the first place. I got the green chili burrito.. It wasn't too bad but the onions were a little too much. Knowing what she told me I could've reconsidered my order. Anyways... I asked for my check so I could leave and it took a while for them to bring it to me. Once I got it I waited a little too long for them to come around to pick up the payment. So I took matters in my own hands and walked to the register and made payment. Other people are right service is slow when you are not a "regular." I will def reconsider my food choices when I return to Colorado!

I loved my visit here. It was so funny!!! They had a cute live band of some people who were "past their prime" and they were very entertaining and fun. The food is pretty straightforward. Nothing crazy or unique, just good Mexican food. The only reason why I only give 4 stars is because one time it took 30 minutes to get the check and another 30 to run my card. They had received a big order to go, so they were busy, but dang! Next time I'll bring cash.

One Friday night, my girlfriend and I were hoping to try a new restaurant nearby. We were in the mood for Tex/Mex and eventually found Lupita's. Boy, were we excited to discover that Lupita's has Friday night live country music every week!

The festive atmosphere on Friday nights is really fun, with a mix of (mostly) older and (some) younger folks. On Live Country Music Friday, everyone has a smile on their face. The night we went, there was a good country band playing, and we got up to country line dance a few times. The open mic sessions were a hoot.

The food itself was a bit bland--I would say average Tex/Mex. The service was fantastic. Our waitress was very attentive, friendly, and offered advice when ordering. The margaritas were pretty cheap and OK.

All in all, I would highly recommend going to Lupita's for Country Music Friday. Soak in a unique and awesome dinner atmosphere and enjoy some decent Tex/Mex.

I've been eying up Lupita's for months now.  So with my new found sense of culinary adventure, I decided to hit up Lupita's for a quiet solo sit down lunch.

I first opened the door to the kitchen, since there wasn't any sign saying otherwise, but quickly orientated myself to the front, main entrance.  I was immediately greeted and not heckled for my mistake, but quickly sat down and served some chips and salsa.  I was also sat right near the entrance, perhaps to display that a little white girl was eating here on her own?  I don't know, but I would've preferred a table not so in your face.  However, it was quiet enough that it really didn't bother me or take away from my pleasant experience.

I decided upon the Beef Plate:  beef taco, beef burrito, and beef enchilada.  Figuring I'd have about 10 minutes to wait, I cracked open a book to kill some time.  Oh no, the Lupita's staff was back with my dish before I could finish three paragraphs.  Good?  Bad?  I'm not sure, but each item on the Beef Plate was tasty.  I could've used a little more kick of spiciness, but I'll take it.

Aside from the eventual glare down from another patron (I think she was irritated that I didn't have a male companion with me!), Lupita's is a great mom and pop restaurant to check out if you're over by the AMC, Anschutz Medical Campus.  Fast and friendly wait staff.  Tasty food at a good price.  I'll certainly be back for another go.

Cordial family environment, family owned and operated, authentic Mexican and South American food, great prices, good service.  What's not to love?  Live music Friday nights.  Needs a little more spice in the green chili -- but for mainstream folks, it's probably about right.  Flan is great!
I really like this place. Food and drinks were delicious and the service was fantastic. I met Betty the owner and I have to say she is why the service is fantastic. I will return.

Was lured here on a recent Friday night by a co-worker who goes just about every Friday to here the live music by Rudy Grant and the Buffalo Riders. The odd mix between the food, decor and music kind of makes it endearing!

I ordered a margarita (run-of-the-mill) as well as the stuffed sopapilla which was really good! Had taco meat and cheese in it and lettuce, tomato and rice on the side. The sweetness of the sopapilla combined with the saltiness of the meat made it really good! I would recommend it. The other members of my group ordered combo platters which they cleared their plates of so I'm guessing they liked theirs as well!

At one point Rudy from the band called us up on stage so be forewarned! If it's your first time there and you're sitting close to the front he might do that (or was it just us!?)

Either way, good mexican joint in an "interesting" part of Colfax :)

So after living in the neighborhood for a year and eating at every taqueria In North Aurora  I decided to give Lupita's a shot. Especially after reading these solid reviews. 

Lets just say this isn't authentic anything. From the decor to the food its a mismatched heap. Peruvian/Xmas decor and horrible Mexican food. Now being Mexican and from So Cal I am accustomed to great Mexican food and Lupitas falls short...way short. I ordered a bowl of Menudo to start and Tamales for my entree. I've had better Tamales from street vendors and what kills me or what literally could of killed me was my spoiled bowl of menudo with the strong after taste of iron and way to much fat in the broth. Yea stomach problems all night! No Bueno!  Oh and dont get me started on the tamales which were dry and puny covered in tasteless red chili! 

Come on now people. I am no food snob and love a good hole in the wall when its actually good, but i cannot say that for Lupitas. At least my beer was cold! Lupita's Lets offer something better to the public, I know you can do it.

I travel on Colfax between Colorado Blvd and Tower on a very regular basis as my horses live out east. After spending hours, brushing, caring, and riding horses, I am usually famished. And quite often on the way home I stop at Lupita's. I like sitting down and having a basket of hot chips and a negro modelo put in front of me without really asking and I like the owner to come over and say hi, how are the horses. Betty Ortiz, the owner of Lupita's, has become a community favorite. She treats everyone like family and gives back to the community. 

She serves good food, and if you don't believe me, drive by during any meal time and see the number of cars around the building including Cadillacs, police, F150 trucks, and small beat up sedans. I love the souffle style chili rellanos if I am going to have a meal otherwise I order a fish taco. On the weekend you can get a good Caldo de Mars (Soup of the Sea) along with oysters on the half shell. I have not been and will review later but on the first and third Friday of the month she has a dinner show usually featuring what I call western/Tejano music. The only reason I give Betty 4 stars is I am not in love with the salsa, I like it but it has been tamed down a bit to accommodate all tastes. However, I should give it back as she lets me in smelling of horses and barns, I truly appreciate that.

I visited Lupita's for the first time today.  My husband, a friend and I stopped for lunch.   I was struck by the kitschy decor and we commented on the Christmas lights, bows and greenery that were obviously left up year round.  As other reviewers mentioned, the place is in need of some serious updating and TLC.  Although worn, it's kept clean.

We each ordered an entree off the menu.  I got the tamales, hubby got the pollo  poblano, and our pal got the sante fe burrito.  No complaints from any of us, and our plates were clean by the end of lunch.  

Our only disappointment was that the menu advertised a Tres Leches cake for dessert, but our server said that it wasn't available.  Moreover, it hadn't been available for a while.  Why get our hopes up and keep it on the menu?  Oh well.  We had to settle for a sopapilla each for dessert.  The crispy, warm, cinnamony goodness ALMOST made us forget our yearning for Tres Leches.

If you're in the area, stop in.  Prices are good and so's the food.

Lupita's is always consistent and fresh. It is a shame that they do not have a line out the door. Not to mention the owner Betty is always helpful in suggesting something new on the menu! Thank you Lupita's.

Actually 3.5 stars.  This mexican restaurant serves good fresh food - all the standards including generous looking 'combo' plates. 

The service is very friendly and the place is clean. Good sized booths or tables - your choice. And most importantly, a full-service bar! Oh, and they have breakfast all day? is this true? Might have to try the Huevos Rancheros and a Bloody....

If  you aren't at Helga's raging it up with a few liters of Warsteiner, Fridays here look like fun with live entertainment - either a mariachi band or teen wonder singer! 

I had a great chicken burrito and two ice cold beers. Each time my beer was served with a fresh icy-cold frosty glass. Can't beat it!

I was impressed with this place. Ordered delivery on a very snowy day to a hotel. The owner herself went out of her way to bring us our food. Food was very good and I was surprised at the presentation in a to go container. Overall the food was very tasty I was pleased.

Lupita's is a family owned place.  We go back a looong way.  All the way back to the days when it was a dinky, dingy little place on Montview Blvd in a tiny strip they shared with the Montview Bar and Grill (which is still there).  It had, at most, a dozen tables covered with red and white checkered oil cloth, and mismatched chairs.  The main cook was the father.  I never knew his name; he was affectionately called "the old man".  The rest of the staff was family.  For seven or eight years we were bimonthly regulars.  The menu was limited, but everything was fresh and delicious.

When the old man retired in the early 90s they moved to larger digs on Colfax just west of Peoria where they are now.  The food and service was just as good, but the atmosphere was different.  We kept going for a few years, but less and less frequently, and eventually just drifted away.  It's been at least 10 or 12 years since I've been in the place.

When I checked Yelp for a spot for my weekly breakfast out, Lupita's came up in the search.  Well heck, why not?  The amazing thing is that after all this time, the place was exactly the same.  It's like I was just there last week.  And, as Jodi A. noted, it really needs to be updated.

I had the chorizio, egg and potato burrito smothered with green chili and cheese.  Wow!  Lupita's, why oh why did I ever leave you?  I'm back.
Very friendly staff, decent food, great portion size average prices. The decor is not that great but I'm more interested in food than decorations.

After several years, I was pleased to get back to Lupita's for lunch and I'm happy to say it hasn't changed a bit! I brought the place to the attention of my colleagues and the 5 of us headed over. Our crew includes everything from the foodies who will eat anything as long as it's authentic, others who just like good tasting food and me with my special love for all Mexican food whether gourmet or diner style. 

Lupita's met all of our wishes! I enjoyed a Pollo Poblano burrito that was the perfect mix of creamy, spicy chicken with grilled peppers and onions. It was smothered with green chili and honestly, I was enjoying my dish so much, I forgot to stop and taste the chili on its own to judge it. The other dishes all received high marks, and covered everything from tamales to a pork dish to a cold tomato based soup filled with seafood. 
My fresh made limeade was a highlight and I was pleased to note on the menu that they sweeten it with low-calorie sweetener. I was only halfway through my drink when it was refilled -- free refill on a "specialty drink"? Now you've got me! 
The prices cover just about every budget. I would think you could get out of here with a $6 lunch if absolutely necessary. Mine came to $10 before tip. (Oh and honorable mention for the fact that they offered separate checks with no guilt -- I love that) 
This place has the nice feel of authentic without being intimidating. Now, maybe I can convince a few friends to give it a try after work -- I can only imagine the margarita that limeade would make!

Oh my oh my! It's been awhile since we've been to a soup & salad place!

After passing Sweet Tomatoes many times  on the freeway, we were glad to look this place up and discover that this place is Soup Plantation! Yes!!! Last time we had Soup Plantation was when we lived in San Diego! 

The staff here is soo friendly and accommodating... always making sure that we were doing okay and someone was there to pick up our plates & utensils if needed. 

The Salads ingredients were fresh... soups delicious... and the pastas yummy. You can't go wrong with your own salad, clam chowder (you could actually taste big pieces of clam & potato!) and the oh so creamy Mac n Cheese! 

Finishing the meal up with a blueberry muffin & honey whipped butter ...  then some tapioca... and you can't forget the ice cream with toppings if choice... or a kid favorite... in a mini cone :)  

What a great experience with the family ... to enjoy fresh delicious food, clean and inviting tables, and really friendly staff. We are so glad to find another family friendly place for lunch or dinner!

My memories of the location in las Colinas, Tx were unfortunately not repeated here.

Granted, that store seemed a lot bigger and in one of the richest zip codes in the Dallas area, but the options seemed very similar on the pasta side, and I found the focaccia flatbreads to be undercooked and most of the other baked goods overdone. 

The soups here are always nice and the salad bar has a lot of variety, I just couldn't help thinking it wasn't as good as I remember and I unfortunately passed a lot of other options I wish I stopped at along the way.

I used to love coming here for their fresh salads but in the last few times I have been here I was disappointed in the quality of their food. I guess it makes sense since I read somewhere that their big company was filing bankruptcies.

So there is good and bad this time,  now first I have to say I love this place but because my wisdone teeth just came out I had to adjust.  I didn't get the salad bat I went for breads and soups the muffins along with the cheese breads not marinara and not were dry as could be. However the red velvet lava cake was amazing  lol and the chicken pot pie soup.was too.  I do love the honey whip butter as well on the soft buttermilk.biscuits.  so yeah this wasn't the best of my four visits but I'm.loyal and I believe next time will be better.

It's been a five year hiatus from all Sweet Tomatoes, due to it being my ex-wife's favorite places to eat. My current and amazing wife asked that we go because she wanted a good salad. So, I honestly know of no better build your own salad place than sweet tomatoes. This location was well kept, some of the patrons were a bit sketchy but the food and service negated these issues. We were pleased with our meal and are very confident that we will return soon.

A BIG HUGE THANK YOU for the 50% military discount!! Love that they are SO generous!!!! I would eat at salad bar restaurants everyday!! That's how much I love a good salad bar! I love Sweet Tomatoes in Orlando and hoped for a consistent experience since it's a chain. The food is good!! I was extremely disappointed in the care of the facility. It looks like the walls around our booth had not been cleaned in ages. The flip chart ad on the table was plastered with food remains. The salad bar was super clean and the selection was fantastic!!! Staff was on the downside of friendly. I would come back for my love of Sweet Tomato but I sure wish the table areas were more clean.
vegetarians paradise at its finest. Fresh salads and soups and the bread oh my. yummy food for a reasonable price
Budget soups, salads, etc.  Quality, quantity, and nice staff.  Wouldn't be ready to improve upon

Sweet Tomatoes is probably my favorite buffet place (minus Indian buffets -- those places are amazing). They have a variety of soups, salads, and desserts available throughout the day. The options seemed very limited at my most recent visit when I went there for a late lunch, as there were only two pasta choices, two pizza-like things, their usual soups (a lot), but plenty of baked goods (muffins, cornbread) and soups. Perhaps, this location just doesn't serve as many options? Whatever the case, I thoroughly enjoyed filling my tummy with fresh vegetables from the salad bar, and blueberry/chocolate muffins with ice cream at my most recent visit. Yum.
Support our troops and first responders,  they do a 50% discount. That's awesome! ! Food is always fresh and yummy. Love it here

Kind of a sad salad place, although the only one I could find in the area. It's lunch time, but only about 5 people sitting there. The salad bar was pretty sparse; it was basic salad fixings and nothing else. The pasta salad at the end looked grey and like out has been sitting there awhile. This chain could make a ton of money being in such a fast food saturated market! But the locations I've been to have been lackluster at best.

I'm glad I have an option in town for a healthy salad, but Sweet Tomatoes just fails to impress.  The price is steep for a salad bar and the salad bar itself just isn't very impressive.  The soups and pastas are nice but probably not a good idea if you're trying to eat healthy, which I suspect most of their customers are trying to do.  The place is decorated like a hotel room and feels as sterile and personality-free as one as well.  Service is quick, but not very friendly.  It's just a big "meh" overall.
Why don't they have ham, chicken, turkey or bacon on their salad bar? So annoying. Ruby Tuesday's salad bar is WAY better.
Why do I keep trying? Awful selection unless you want a vegetable only salad. No protein on salad bar besides beans. Must be vegan. Not even eggs.
Always a good place to come and eat when you want to eat somewhat healthy the soup salad pizza pasta and dessert

This location is kind of trashed.  It's like both the customers and employees like trashing this place.  Some people there care a lot while others don't.  It makes for a mediocre experience.  The food was pretty good and the kind waitresses picking up our plates gave it a touch of home.  I might be back but as of right now, I want to check out the other locations to see how they size up.  From what I've been told, this is not the best location.

Pretty happy with my experience. We went to the littleton location and the baked items were old and undercooked. Your location is fantastic. Everything we ate we enjoyed. Just wish the tables would get wiped off.
Food was edible but not quite up to the good level. Everything was filthy from the dishes to the floor. Hygiene standards will keep me away from here indefinitely.

It was JUST okay. Nothing to write home about.
Other locations seem to have more fresh tasty food

I love a good salad bar and while this place isn't fancy (what buffet style really is) it is really solid for toppings and freshness!  

After the salad there is a great selections of soups (had a great cheesy cauliflower tonight) and a potato bar (my 2nd favorite stop), and a great selection of breads (I go for the focaccia!).  Also I tend to not head to the pasta bar and dessert ice cream section but other people love it.

Staffing was a little short (not stellar that night at the register), however the manager Jason was excellent and made our stay pleasant. Friendly attentive girl clearing (didn't get her name).  I will always go here for my salad bar fix!

It has been about 6 months since we have eaten here.  We noticed a few changes that we were not happy with. The biggest one was the ice cream. It use to be a really rich, fluffy frozen yogurt. Now it's heavy water based goo. Not cool. If it's not broke don't fix it. Second thing is that the slices of bread use to stay nice and warm in a towel under the heat lamp. Now it just sits out by the muffins and hardens. Third thing is that there are no longer eggs at the salad bar. The only reason I gave it 2 stars is because the soup was really fresh and yummy.

Definetly not what it used to be. When first arriving i asked the lady making a salad if it had meat in it (I dont eat meat). She politely said no and filled the salad in the serving bowl with no tongs for me to serve myself with and proceeded to talk to a coworker about a break. I then asked someone else if another salad had chicken in it. She said no. When i sat to eat it, it clearly had chicken in it. I got some soup and some pasta but it all tasted cheap and from a box. The only good thing about he whole experience was the ranch dressing but I should've saved my money and eaten lunch at home. I will not be returning.

I was looking for Souper Salad for my Post Gym Workout meal. 
I stumbled upon Sweet tomatoes. 
It was about 8 dollars for lunch. 
And Well worth it, from the salads to the array of soups and the mac and cheese. 
The warm muffins and biscuits. 
The ice cream and jello. 
Multiple drink options besides soda for the health conscious. 
I know where Ill be going when i need an energy fix after the gym from now on. 
And friendly employees from the Cashier to the servers coming by to clear the table.

A great manager makes for a great experience.  Food was excellent, service equally excellent, but it starts at the top.  We were a group of 5 seniors, 3 of the group in their 80's and two with walkers.  Eric, the manager, was most helpful bringing out fresh lettuce while we were going through the salad bar, and then getting us to our table, helping with our coffee, desserts and trays. It's difficult getting out, but it was well worth the effort going to a restaurant with such excellent food and service.
Stopped for lunch and the salad bar was very good and fresh.  The chili was also excellent. My wife enjoyed the tomato chipotle bisque soup too.

So I will not be returning to this restaurant ever again. The salad bar is okay not the best but the ingredients were fresh and it was clean. The food on the hot side seem like it just came out of a plastic bag not very good at all. The thing that got me was that the lady that was busting the tables kept putting the dirty dishes that were already in her hand down on our table 1st before she grabbed our dirty dishes. It really grossed me out and therefore I will not return.

We met friends here for dinner and now we want one in Anchorage, Alaska.  The veggies were fresh, there was a large selection of fresh veggies and a variety of salads to choose from. They also had baked potatoes with several toppings. My only complaint was that the cheese was full of bacon bits from other people spilling things between serving bowls, but when I brought this up they brought fresh cheese.  There were hot pasta dishes to choose from, at least six soups, plus a variety of breads including corn bread.

I received an email about a fantastic Mother's Day Menu from Sweet Tomatoes, and  thought it sounded great so I invited all of the family there for an early breakfast since I had to work at 11am. This was a horrible mistake.It opened at 8am and had special discounts till 9am, so we met there early at 8:30am, plus i figured it would be very crowded due to the holiday. I thought the empty parking lot was a good thing, evidently everyone else knows NOT to go for breakfast here. The salad bar looked good as normal, but not at 830am, the waffles and french toast was what we came for. Everything was very dry and old looking and ended up being cold before we started eating. The menu they boasted was all horrible. Fresh fruit, consisted of rotten strawberries and orange slices, potatoes dry, waffles/french toast dry and cold, syrup was even cold. The best item they had was an egg sausage scramble, but you had to be brave to try because it looked like regurgitated leftovers. Their advertisement had bacon and sausage links in the pic, but they had none, WTH.  Also, shame on YOU Sweet Tomatoes for charging me an extra $2 for coffee. Luckily many folks I invited decided not  to come, I was embarrassed that I chose such a lame spot to enjoy Mothers day.

this is a nice place. i come here occasionally with my coworkers, they actually introduced me to it. never realized it was there before! the idea of buffets sometimes give me the heebie jeebies. even with the shields, ya never know right? but i see this place changing out the food regularly so thats always a good sign right? they have plenty of choices here for just about everyone. i know its a salad bar but i could definitely use some more meat ;) maybe they could add up some grilled chicken or something for the salads. but i do appreciate the concept.

It's one of those places that I never think of going but when I get there I'm glad I remembered.  I think the prices a tad high but it's all you can eat salad.

I'm able to build my salad the way that I like it.

I love their chicken noodle soup -big chunks of chicken and think noodles.  Their vegetable soup is gross.  There pasta and breads are solid choices.

This vegetarian buffet has tolerable options and it's versatile because you can make your very own combinations besides what they usually serve, you just would need creativity to make and enjoy it! Monthly, they change their menu at the middle of month.

Decent food. The last two times my family and I have been there though, there is more staff sitting around talking than working! We actually had to clear our own table of plates. I have two teen boys ... and they eat a lot. 

The other thing, make sure you have a coupon in order to make it worth the cost.

Got a coupon this morning offering buy one get one for a dollar breakfast (breakfast??). I was skeptical at first but decided to go for it. Wow, I should have listened to my skepticism. Where do I begin:

1. The eggs are made using liquid eggs, a big no no for any restaurant. (I think this is really only acceptable in penal institutions!)
2. The potatoes are about the only thing worthy, and they come from frozen stock. (Really? I've always heard FRESH is cheaper than FROZEN??)
3.  The french toast, although it really does look like french toast, actually tasted like something else, and my usual fixers of syrup and butter could not even save it.
4. The only thing that they didn't mess up was the salad bar and soup bar, which is not what I went there for in the first place.

Note to Souplantation/Sweet Tomatoes Corporate: Please give up on the breakfast. It's NOT your cup of tea!

I usually go to the Sweet Tomatoes in DTC, however, I happened to be in the area of this one. Similar to the other one, it was fresh, well maintained, and the staff was friendly. I had three bowls of soup and they were lacking flavor, so I had to add my choice ingredients to fix them up. 

One thing that was extremely cool is the waitress was walking around the restaurant handing out coupons for future use. Needless to say I held on to it and will be using it soon. I thought this was a great way to show they appreciate their customers and they want you to come back. Just as a side note, I rarely eat at Sweet Tomatoes unless I have a coupon. This action itself took my experience from 3.5 Stars to 4.0.

Having recently moved to Colorado, I needed to find a great salad restaurant. My prior experience was with another chain, and it's declined over the years. Sweet Tomatoes restored my faith in buffet salad and soup!

+ From the create your own salad fixings to the prepared salad creations, everything was fresh and flavorful. 
- There is a large selection of soups, although I found them to be good but bordering bland. 
+ The three basic pasta options were delicious.
+ Selection and flavor of breads (including muffins) was wonderful.

The staff were very friendly and attentive. The restaurant was very clean and well maintained.
Love this place kids never complain about going here always great food at a great price and not as crowded as country buffet or golden corral

This restaurant has a very friendly ! Especially a hostess named Brianna! She is spectacular!! Brianna was very helpful and friendly! You could tell she genuinely wanted to assist you! Food was also great! Restaurant was Clean! Overall great! Seating is the only real downside. This particular restaurant has a strange set up unlike the others I've visited. Makes the buffet area a bit clogged.

It does the job as a salad bar (fresh) but was disappointing otherwise. The baked potato & soups were OK. I'm not a picky eater but from the pasta, pizza, mac&cheese, brownies, and to the ice cream.. they were pretty TASTELESS. A lot of bland fillers.

You do notice all the cute elderly couples that fill the seats. Perhaps its the 1950's music+discount that settles it with the seniors.. but NOT me! When I'm older & can't taste anything, I'll be firing my taste buds to oblivion.

Friendly and clean service. I'll be here if I ONLY wanted salad.. or am with my grandparents.

I really am happy that Sweet Tomatoes is near my office. I try so hard to eat healthy and light and this is the perfect place for that.  I enjoy going here with co-workers, or going to just grab a salad and soup to go.  I think the salad bar is great. I know it's not the freshest veggies but I'd rather have a salad here than a burger from a fast food joint!  One of my favorite items on the salad bar is the broccoli salad.  It is so yummy! I always save a spot on my plate for a spoonful of that.

The soup selection is huge. I'm not sure how many pots they have, but it's a lot! I also like the potato bar and pasta bar. I'm not a fan of the pizza or the brownies.

I don't think it's that over priced. I feel that I always walk out full,  stuffed as a matter of fact!

Sign up for weekly email coupons and save a buck or 2!

Stopped by as we passed thru the area. Good selection of fresh salad items and a delicious mixed salad of coconut pineapple slaw that was perfect instead of added salad dressing. The server brought by a plate of fresh chocolate chip cookies that we're great to end the meal. Fairly loud with a lot of kids. Bathrooms needed some attention. But would stop again for the food.

This is the "Golden Corral" of salad bar buffets. Which, as I remember, Golden Corral was awesome when they first opened. Now I would not put a foot inside of one. ( Maybe it was the fruit flies in the steamed cauliflower?) I felt like we were at the DMV...not a place to relax and enjoy a meal. The employees had that "I hate this flipping job" glazed look in their eyes...just like the DMV ! The food was passable, but I will not return unless court-ordered.

Personally, I believe that I could make a better pizza, chicken noodle soup, and salad than Sweet Tomatoes can...but then it wouldn't be convenient. And some nights, like tonight, I am all about convenience.

I always get a bigger salad than I want. Maybe it's because they have so many toppings, and I can't help piling carrots and corn and rotini and cucumbers and squash and jicama onto my romaine and then dousing it with their decadent house ranch dressing. Of course, then I get down to the Joan's Broccoli Madness and remember that was actually the only kind of green thing I wanted on my plate - broccoli soaked in mayo with raisins and cashews. Oh yum.

They always have a decent selection of soups (some good, some not so good), a make-your-own baked potato bar, plenty of bread and muffins (carbs!) and pasta (more carbs!). Every month they always have a theme, and I have really enjoyed some of their past special options.

This place will always have a spot in my heart because tonight it is where I, the only daughter and first child, told my mother I am (probably) moving to a small town 6 hours away. Eek. She might never go to Sweet Tomatoes ever again..

Great salad bar and excellent other stuff too, I used to go to a Sweet Tomatoes when I lived in South Florida and I haven't seen one on my travels. My visit today was just as I remembered it - good quality and loads of options.

Entering the place, you start with a tray and a plate, loading up first with greens and then moving down to add all sorts of toppings. You can really push out the boat here if you're not careful and you load up with the oily / cheesy options. I stuck with the lettuce and other veggies but none of the stuff that was already covered in dressing. There's a delicious low cal cucumber dressing option down at the end.

After the salad bar, you have the option to purchase a refillable drink - soda fountain or coffee - and pay for your meal. From there, there's a soup bar (around 8 different choices, tonight's included a meat chili, chicken noodle and vegetarian bean), a bread bar (with pizza, muffins and cornbread), and finally a pasta bar (tonight's choices were mac and cheese, penne arrabiata and a jalapeno salsa pasta). Finally, the fruit/dessert bar includes a soft-serve machine, toppings and cones.

If your kids are picky eaters, or if you're a vegetarian, Sweet Tomatoes is for you. The place really encourages healthy eating, but there isn't much as far as protein. Nothing you can really sink your teeth into, which is part of the style and how they keep the prices low ($13 for an adult dinner with drink).

Would I come here again? Absolutely! I'm still stuffed and I got home two hours ago!

The worst location I have been too. I'd much rather travel to the location near Park Meadows. The food is all the same but it's the staff that warrants low ratings. This is specific to Mon 7/14/14 during the late evening. The elderly men working the bread and soup stations need a lesson or two in customer service. They will follow you and stare you down as you are making your selections. I quite honestly do not enjoy being stared down as I scoop my soup or select my bread--making the entire experience unnecessarily uncomfortable and rude. They were glaring the entire time and whispering amongst each other making the entire experience sour and unappetizing to say the least.

As much as we go here, I am finding that their food is staying the same while prices are going up up up. They are very coupony, which i guess is making them off set the prices or what not. They have made very little changes over the years, to their items. However the did add a new premium section which is an additional 2.50 (i think could be 2.29) which has fancy things like mandarin sections, grilled chicken and artichoke hearts. Like a hipster section of the salad bar. 

They do have a constantly changing menu that varies from month to month but not year to year. Every year they have a "lemon" theme month, or a "Greece Isle" month or "Tropical Paradise" Month, etc.  So if you find something you like eat there every day until that month is over. 

Things I could eat the entire basket of-
-strawberry muffins
-cinnamon breakfast muffins
-blueberry muffins
Did I mention I like their muffins?

My man really loves the tomato soup(seasonal) and the cheese stick dippers. Its like childhood memories for him. We also like to breakfast there once in a while but its only on Sundays. 

The place is still in my opinion geared more towards the senior set and the family crowd, so be ready to be heavy handed with the salt and pepper at the table. I also love the garlic dressing. mmmm
My favorite. Nice, cold crisp salads.  Very clean and fresh.

Good atmosphere & great tasting salads and soups. This place is different from the Las Vegas, NV site we frequently visited. Here, you're seated by a waiter instead of finding your own seat. We like it & we'll be coming here often.

Well, since I often write reviews of places that I detest I thought I should mention that this place or chain usually offers me a perfect lunch or dinner on those days that I only want a salad and soup. I don't think you can beat this for simple basic food. It is always clean, fresh and tasty. Don't pay full price it's only for suckers, coupons are available in the newspaper and through Club Veg their online club.
The pasta is a joke, forget it, The soups are very decent, some are excellent others are, well you decide...Salad fixings  are always fresh and tasty, I agree with some reviewers about the up selling of odd additional items like almond slices and chicken pieces for $2.50 but if you want it then buy it otherwise stick with the basics. Drinks are expensive, but water is free, we always wonder who buys the large drink that costs more than the small drink when all drinks are self service you can refill your small as often as you want...

You either love it or you hate it.

I love it, my husband hates it.  Typically, Sweet Tomatoes restaurants always have a huge variety of fresh salads, vegetables, delicious soups, breads, and pastas.  This one is no exception. As expected, the salads are incredibly delicious and who wants to miss the Tuna Tarragon or Joan's Broccoli Madness? Not me!  The prices are kind of high for a huge family, but if you sign up for the email program, you will get 9 coupons each month to use to your salad-eating heart's content.  The set-up of the buffet is really weird and I'm going to tell you how its set up so you don't walk around like an idiot like I did.  When you first walk in, you go to the right down the salad buffet line. As with any Sweet Tomatoes, there is a second buffet section with the soups, breads, pastas, desserts, and drinks.  But that section is hidden behind a wall and you need to do a u-turn at the end of the salad buffet to find it. The tables line the walls in the restaurant.  So, there are no tables out in the "open". One section of booths is between the salad buffet wall and the soup, breads, pastas buffet wall.  Then there is a room on the west end for parties of 5 or more.

If I'm ever rich and famous, I'm having one of these put in my mansion.

In San Diego, I LIVED on the SoCal-equiv of Sweet Tomatoes, Souplantation.  

I take TWO plates down the salad bar.  I eat like I'm goin' for the chair here.  Thankfully, I'm relatively good and just stick to salad, but I HAVE to have a blueberry muffin every time I go.

You can do a lot of damage here if you load up on the fatty pastas and some of the soups and breads.

But if you love FRESH veggies and fruits and lots of 'em, COME HERE.

MmmmMMmm.

Pretty classy.

All of the salad ingredients appear to be super freshy. I love anywhere you can make your own salad and then use 3 plates because its overflowing everywhere. Yeah!

Little known fact: There is blue cheese almost at the end of the line, don't be a fool like me and get that chintzy cheddar thats closer to the front. Hold out for the azul!

Spinach, romaine, banana squash, chickens, sunflower seeds, variety of dressings and cups to put em in so you can have many. Also, a fancy pepper grinder which is at least 1237892137% better than shake pepper.

Anyway the rest of the stuff is pretty sub-par, but I always eat it anyway. Baked potato bar is pretty solid. Mac & cheese is really unimpressive though it looks like it'd be scrump. 

I like the dessert bar. That part makes me happy. Brownie muffin, twist choc/vanilla ice cream, caramel, oreos, toffee, sprinkles...yeah, I'm a fat kid.

This place is a favorite of mine when I'm starving and I don't want to wait to get served. 

They have several vegatarian choices but not vegan. Every month the change up the flavor but keep the basics. I love the foccacia bread! I always think I'm doing myself a favor eating here but end up eating 4 plates of bread. The salads seem fresh. I like the soups, usually 5 choices. Nothing in here is spicy it is all sort of plain. I think the food is pretty good for a buffet style place. 

The cooks always say hello and seem very friendly. The place seems pretty clean, I have never seen any bugs in there but who knows.

This a great place for healthy eating. Of course you can eat a ton of focaccia and drown your salad in dressings and then it's not so healthy.
             But I can take my 8 yr old daughter here, and send her off to the buffet and at least she won't be coming back with a plate laden in red meat, high fructose corn syrup and tons of sugar. Always friendly staff, clean tables and beautiful views of the traffic on 225.
My family likes this place and it's requested alot

I have passed this place MANY times and never went in. We did have a Sweet Tomatoes in Tucson, AZ where I previously lived--but the only time I went was to get my brother some chicken soup (said he loved it.)

Anywho...my hubby bought a Groupon Now deal. I was able to check the website and text my husband everything I wanted from their monthly feature. Apparently, they change their selection monthly-and some stuff is even changed biweekly.

Everything was tasty. In fact, it was so good, that we ended up going back 5 days later. This time we both went and I was so happy. I was able to see the WHOLE menu. The vegetables appeared to be chopped fresh. And you can see the employees quickly stocking items as they ran out.  The place appeared to be clean. Note: we took our order to go, so I don't know the cleanliness of their dining area and bathrooms.

I guess the only thing that keeps me from giving Sweet Tomatoes five stars is their set up. I feel it needs to flow better for a buffet. You would need to visit the place to know exactly what  I'm talking about. Also, they are a little pricey. So bring your coupons or online deal.

I'll definitely be back.

Oh Sweet Tomatoes, how I love you.

I cannot fathom how Denver, city of healthy people, is so lacking in salad buffets. 

Their veggies are incredibly fresh and they usually have at least one or two soups that are right up my alley. The staff is really good about getting people seated quickly and keeping the place clean and running smoothly, too.

I can't throw down the super sparkly five star review because the layout for the Sweet Tomatoes in Aurora isn't the smartest. If the place is crowded, you can almost count on a bottleneck back near the soup/pasta/drink station.

Big fan of Sweet Tomatoes. They have an extensive salad bar as you walk in and pay, then after you are seated you can get to the good stuff. Soups galore, pizza, pasta, and soft serve ice cream. I always fill up on everything, I wish I could take a to-go box!
decent food, nothing to write home about. lots to choose from. I would eat here again, but I would use a coupon... otherwise its a bit pricey
Decent salad buffet with plenty of extra food types to fill you up (soup, pasta, potato bar, ice cream, etc.). If you're in the mood for all-you-can-eat salads with extras, this is a good choice.

Definitely better than Souper Salad. A lot better selection. Prices seem to have risen significantly over the past two years but it's convenient and the salad fixin's are fresh. Hubby likes the soup and potatoes so it's all good!

This location loses all of my rave reviews thanks to the single cockroach that was chilling on my table's light sconce.  Disgusting and makes me wonder what is happening indoors to allow roaches to fester when it's 20 degrees outside.

Good salad buffet, good price, good soup.  One star taken away because the potatoes at the potato bar were a little puny.  But this is definitely one of my favorite places to eat since it's light and cheap.

My, my, my that bison pastrami deserved to be on a plate with the bun and stuff surrounding it in case you don't want to sully your experience with the extras. Give that bison the respect it deserves! 

The short ribs were perfection. The Brussels were almost perfect, but I had to sprinkle on a little salt, despite the pancetta.

We came here for a quick bite and a drink before seeing a live show at Quixote's and we were not disappointed! 

The patio outside is lovely in nice weather, although I would say that if you really dislike cigarette smoke, you should opt to sit inside. 

We came during Happy Hour, when several pints are half price and the appetizers are $5. I actually opted for mixed drinks that were not discounted, but none cost more than $10 and all are expertly mixed. 

The food was excellent - we had the brussels, the polenta, the mac and cheese and the sliders. The mac and cheese was the standout; so delicious!

The service was great and the restrooms were clean!

Super cool spot to hang out, listen to some classic hip hop and play shuffleboard. 

Relax on the patio outside where they have an imaginary line segregating smokers from non smokers (they tried) or chill inside and enjoy what sounded like the best golden era hip hop playlist they could find. 

Servers are cool, food is good and the happy hour deals were enough to make us hit them up twice.

Been here many times, always a good time! The service is always great and on my last trip, we grabbed a couple apps and the food was really good - the queso surprisingly so! They have a great patio and some really great cocktails. I have not yet had a full meal here but every time a plate goes by me I swear I am going to come back to eat lol. This is just a great bar for hanging out with friends or would be great for a date night too. Heading back soon for dinner - definitely recommend!!

We decided to eat dinner here before it was on the food network. The server mentioned they were famous for the braised short rib sliders. They were awesome. I'm not a big rib fan, but these were so good. I highly recommend them. 

I was here with 2 friends and we all ended up getting the pot pie. We were a little hesitant at first because the menu says they take 20+ minutes, but it was worth it. Not even sure if it took that long. This was seriously the best pot pie I've ever had. 

The drinks are great here too. I had some sort of strawberry cocktail and Moscow mule. 

Bottom line, if you're in the area you have to check this place out!

Say yes to the 20-minute chicken pot pie, but only if: 1. you're not in a hurry 2. you are not on a budget 3. you are not that hungry

The chicken pot pie I got was... de-freaking-licious. BUT at $16, I thought it was going to be sizable, but the size reminded me of the frozen pot pies you can buy at the grocery store. The wait for the pie is over 20 minutes. Yes, the name is 20 minute chicken pot pie, but my god, they are not kidding. The service was good, not super attentive, but I did get everything I needed, so no complaints there.

Prohibition is a perfect little spot.  It's got great food, the bar is large and the space is roomy, and for a Colfax joint they boast one of the best patios you can find, with space and shade.

The food here is really good, the tap list rocks, and it's just got an overall good neighborhood feel to it.  I've never had bad service or a bad time here.  It's a spot I tend to remember fondly except when I'm in the area, something I mean to rectify!

Cheers!

It was my first time here.  Saw the reviews and decided to check it out.  First impression was good.  Good bar area.  Nice vibe.  Very friendly and attentive bar tenders. 

Beer selection was decent.  Specialty cocktails and the such.  Nice whiskey collection. 

Opted for the bison pastrami sandwich.  It was very good. Not $13 good, but hey, it's made with Bison. Side of fries for $3 on the steep side for me personally, but they didn't wow me. 

Overall, a nice place.  Next time I'm going for the short rib burger.  I'd recommend it if you're looking for a bar with good food.

If it didn't taste so good, the Strawberry Fields would be too pretty to drink.
Neighborhood is a little rough but this bar is perfect.

Came here because we saw it on triple D.  It's basically a bar, I believe most people come here for the drinks. My wife got a Moscow mule and she said it was good.  But I came for the food, I ordered the Prohibition special, short rib burger, and man, that is fantastic!  Sitting outside on a summer afternoon is quite pleasant and it's great for people watching and hearing the bell tolls from the church across the street.  Come and try the burger, grab a drink, and relax.  Oh, and parking was a little hard to find, so there's your downside for all you haters. :)

I looked on yelp and saw some pictures and went out of my way to come here. The menu isn't huge but the things we ordered were amazing. We both got their version of an Old Fashion (Breaking Bad) and it was strong and not too sweet. I had to try the short ribs minis (I love anything short rib) and they did not disappoint. The star of the show and the reason we came was the 20 minute chicken pot pie and it was worth the jaunt. The chicken was tender, the sauce packed with flavor and the flakey buttery crust melted in your mouth. 

We sat outside on the patio and had a mighty good time. Highly recommend!

I am only rating for the bar, so I feel like I have to hold back on the five stars until I sample the food.

BUT... love this spot.  I am a big fan of the Colfax bar crawl, and Prohibition is always on the list.  The remodel a couple years ago really made the entire place so much nicer, and I love the fact that there is SPACE to move around and talk with our friends, sit at a table and watch the games on the TVs... all at the same time.  Drinks are great - loved my John Daly cocktail, and although my friend's drink was almost too strong, better strong then weak, right?
Cool bar. I just had drinks with friends. Not too big but not too small. The food that came out for the people next to us smelled delicious! Bar tender was nice, polite, and quick.

I've come here for happy hour and dinner. Both are fantastic. They have great drink and food specials. My friend and I were just a bit more hungry for real food. I got the shrimp po'boy, and it was quite tasty. Lots of great chunks of crispy shrimp and sausage which married well with their spicy remoulade. I look forward to coming back again some time to try more stuff.

Came here cause I saw the wonderful pictures of the 20 minute chicken pot pie. 
I sat at the bar to have lunch. The restaurant has plenty of seating and has a nice size bar. I started with the braised short rib minis. They were tasty! The short ribs were tender and juicy and had a slaw and special sauce on top on fresh baked bread. Then I had the chicken pot pie. The puff pastry top was good. It was buttery and flaky. A little to much salt on top for my taste. The filling was nice and thick wasn't watery at all. It had vegetables, white, and dark meat shredded chicken. The service for lunch was fast and the bartenders were friendly. The restaurant was clean and well kept. They also had a nice selection of local draft beers. They also have a late night menu with small bites.

I don't understand the hype about Prohibition. The food is pretty good, the drinks are pretty good...been in a few times and still have the same outlook. It'll be a while before I'm back because there are so many other options to try/go back to.

Absolutely love this place and the donuts they make.  Everyone that I have tried and I've tried a lot, are truly amazing. Not sugary like the big name donut chains and you can tell they put quality ingredients in everything they make!!  Quality from top to bottom!!

Came in for Geeks Who Drink (Monday night at 8pm) to a decent amount of people ready to play.  The overall atmosphere is relaxing and a good spot to meet-up with some friends. The bar was definitely loud so a bit hard to hear the questions but as is every other place that hosts GWD nights. The drinks were decent and the bar tenders very nice guys. We all ordered some food that was good/ not great but this isn't a five star dining restaurant. 

I wont lie the best part for me was more so the view! There is definitely some prime people watching off Colfax that provides more than enough entertainment for the night!

We stopped in to Prohibition for a late night dinner last Friday night. The vibe of this place is pretty cool, I like the dark, rustic atmosphere. The only thing that was offsetting was the music, holy cow was it loud, we could hardly hear each other speak. When we left my ears were actually ringing. The service was very friendly and quick. 
We started with a couple cocktails, I got the Strawberry Fields which I loved and the boyfriend got a bourbon cocktail which he said was very strong (in a good way!) The meal was great, I loved the 20 minute Chicken Pot Pie and he devoured his braised short rib. Yummy comfort food! We will definitely return, but maybe at an earlier time when the music is down.

So many great things to say about this place!

Pastrami. The pastrami sandwich is the best pastrami sandwich I've ever had! It's thinly sliced and warm and the bread is on point! 

All of the food I tried was amazing, you really can't go wrong here.

Their cocktails are just delightful but nothing beats a beer on the patio at this place with some friends. I think I came here on three different occasions during my short trip to Denver and I'd keep going back if I could.

The servers and bartenders are also really awesome!

Had my birthday lunch here before catching a flight. 

They have the best food. I got three different plates. The ribs are to die for. I only wanted to come here because it was featured on triple d. I will definitely come again. 

Make sure you get the dulce de leche ice cream. Heaven in your mouth.

Our service on this visit was excellent.  It took me a while to get acknowledged in the bar area, but once we moved to the patio it was first class all the way.  Our server made useful recommendations as to drinks and happy hour food.  The quality of both was very good.  I would definitely come here again.

We came in on a Friday night and this is a happening place!  We had the Dining Out Denver books which got us buy one get one for entrees. Our choices were pretty simply since they only have 3 entrees. I got the Fish and Chips which was very good and my guy got the short ribs which he also really enjoyed. 

It was pretty loud in there so having conversations was a little tough. I loved how they gave the check in a book though- it was such a nice touch.

Came in for an early dinner and got the bison pastrami sandwich and sweet potato fries. The atmosphere is nice, like a dimly lit alehouse from some decades ago. Service was fine and friendly.

As for the bison pastrami sandwich, it was maybe the best pastrami I've ever had. The meat was tender and flavorful, but didn't feel as fatty as traditional beef pastrami. The bun was a soft pretzel roll that paired well with the meat and the mustard dipping sauce, and the garlic aioli added some nice extra flavor. Although I wish the sandwich was a tad bit cheaper than $13, given that it doesn't come with a side, I would definitely order it again.

The sweet potato fries were also great, especially when dipped into their garlic aioli. The side of these fries costs $3, so you are out $16 for a pastrami and sweet potato fries, but it's worth it and I recommend trying it next time you are here.

Slightly disappointed in the service. Our server only brought us one round and never came back for refills. He didn't even ask if we wanted another round. He claimed he was in the "weeds" which is understandable but we got no compensation. 

However the food was delicious. Ordered the brisket burger and it was really good. The Mac and cheese was pretty tasty as well!

This review is just about their brunch offerings. 

And, admittedly, I went here not looking for brunch (I was hoping for lunch) and so I was sort of disappointed that their brunch menu only had 4 real 'lunch' items compared to around 8 'breakfast' items. So this all may have colored my review and lowered the rating some.

However, I went here with my partner to grab lunch in Denver before flying out of town that night. Admittedly, the main reason we went here is because we saw it on Diners, Drive-ins & Dives and though it might be humorous (or at least a gloriously indulgent way to finish off a vacation). Unfortunately we found ourselves there on a Sunday afternoon, during brunch, and got a pretty Meh experience.

The bar/restaurant itself looks pretty nice. It's dark but comforting, and all the decorations flow back into the name 'Prohibition.' The bar itself is gorgeous with a beautiful back-display for all their boozy offerings.

Like I said, we were pretty disappointed with the food offerings, but that was because it was 2 PM and the best offers were still breakfast items. We ordered from the smaller number of lunch offerings, and got the Bison Pastrami sandwich and the Focaccia Chicken sandwich. Both were served in a basket with fries (which I'd assume were pre-frozen). Both were pretty good, but not great. The chicken was pretty bland, and the best part of the pastrami sandwich was the pretzel roll. It was good, but not worthy of a TV show. I will admit, the biscuits and gravy I saw at another table looked pretty good.

Our server was good but seemed in a pretty big hurry for how empty the place was. I'm not sure if he ever actually stopped at our table, or just accomplished everything as he was walking by. Dropping off drinks and food, even taking our menu it seemed like he never actually stopped for us, which was just a little off-putting.

Luckily, the prices were really reasonable, so even if it ended up being a pretty 'meh' end to a great vacation, it was probably the cheapest meal we were able to find in the entire state. So that's a plus.

We went here after church on Christmas Eve and it was pretty slow. The decor is just bar-y, despite their name there is nothing particularly "prohibition era" about it not that that is consequential to the quality of the food. 

The service was awesome and Kayla was so nice and helpful. Everything we ate was AMAZING. The queso had sausage or something in it and was the perfect amount of heat and the grilled polenta was fabulous as well. Everyone at the table with the exception of me ordered the bison pastrami and had nothing by rave reviews. I had a bite and it was really, really exceptional. I ordered the short rib mini sandwich things and, no surprise, they were delicious!

They have really good deals for the happy hour which runs from 3-7 or something like that. 

I can't wait to go back!!!
Came here with my two brothers. Both of them really like good food. They loved this place

I don't really see myself returning here. The entire experience was meh. The happy hour is ok, not great. We chose this place because their happy hour ran until 7. $5 appetizers would be better if the appetizers weren't normally $5-$7. Well drinks aren't that discounted either. The service wasn't great. We got there at 6pm, our server probably took our order around 6:15 but after bringing the food didn't come back until after 7 meaning we only got to place 1 happy hour order. Most servers check in just before happy hour ends, I would have gotten another drink and another app. The other two people I was with were just drinking water and sprite, I had a vodka cranberry but I still drank all of my water and never had it refilled. Our server swung by and refilled one of the 3 glasses of water leaving the other two empty and didn't gives us a chance to ask for anything else. 

For food we ordered the crispy polenta, which was delicious and the mozzarella bites and sweet potato fries which were fine.  The place was clean and not too loud until after 7:30. They bring your check in an old book which is cute. Overall the passive aggressive service and lack of charm will probably have me headed for the Irish Snug down the street in the future.

I luckily found myself in this bar this morning. I was in the mood for bloody marys and sassafras was just too busy. Prohibition had no wait, and it was cool, not pretentious, not super divey. My bloody mary was flavorful, spicy and inexpensive. It was only $6! I didn't have any food but I wouldn't mind coming back for more drinks.

The drinks are amazing!! I had a few but I will say that the Whiskey Thyme is fantastic. I managed to get the last one before they ran out if tea but it will be my preferred beverage all summer '16.

The only real issue I had was that they were out of certain drinks and foods late at night. So, if you want the mac and cheese or a Whiskey Thyme, you'll want to come in early.

Rude! Rude! Rude! And then the waitress literally tried to start a fight. 

The one star is for the good food. 

Never in my entire life have I been at a table that was treated with such blatant disrespect over the course of the meal. It started early with snippy comments like "well, do you know what drinks you want yet or do I need to come back?" Well sorry to inconvenience you, Alison, but you're probably going to have to come back. Finally, we get our drinks and our waitress decides that it's clearly too much effort to hand the drinks out individually so w/ a pinch of attitude she announces what the drinks are, sets them down at the end of the table and walks away. At this time, the bar is pretty loud, so we could not hear what the drinks are. Now, this table of 6 is trying to decipher who had what.

Next, we ordered food. The waitress comes over CHOMPING on gum to drop our meals off. Now, this may just be me, but if I'm paying $20/plate, I expect my service to have a little class. I really don't want you snapping your gum over my meal. It's just tacky. It's not a huge deal and I certainly wouldn't have thought much about it if it weren't for her overall attitude all night. 

During our meal, our table decided we wanted to participate in trivia. At one point it was extremely hard to hear the announcers questions. A member of the party politely asked our waitress if she could ask him to turn it up. Her response, "No, YOU can." Just flippant remark after flippant remark. Of course we can ask him to turn it up. Thanks for the hot take. But it didn't seem so out of your way to make a comment to him that the table in the back can't hear while you're grabbing 6 more drinks for our table. 

At one point in time, we ordered another round of drinks and a member of the party unfortunately got the wrong beer. She politely went up to the bar to exchange her drink for the one she ordered. The bartender, of course, had no issue swapping the drink out. Out of nowhere, here comes the waitress to declare that she did indeed deliver the right drink (at the end of the table -- while we're playing trivia) and we just weren't paying attention and somebody else had obviously grabbed it. "I put it into the computer right." That may be, but nobody at our table ordered an Avery White Rascal, so the mistake was not on us. 

Finally, it was time for our bill. Mind you, we have a six-top table that has been at the restaurant now for close to four hours drinking and eating dinner. Obviously, this is a huge inconvenience to split the bill up, and we are certainly happy to help. However, our waitress once again RUDELY declares that she just couldn't even be bothered to keep track of who had what so we're just going to have to figure it out and let her know. This is no easy task. At this time, we've grown frustrated with her attitude and start to get a little agitated that we're tasked with separating this almost $300 bill. We simply were not in a situation where splitting the bill evenly six ways would be fair to everyone involved. She can hear our frustration in trying to split the bill and comes over.  "What's the problem here?" she asks rudely. We explained that we're just trying to figure out who had what and it's difficult. At this time, she starts getting a bit unhinged, arguing with us about how we didn't tell her to split the bill at the beginning and how she has multiple six-top tables (we were the only 6-topper) and she's very busy. Certainly, we'd be much more willing to have sympathy, if it weren't for her attitude the entire night. The whole night, she just simply could NOT be bothered. Everything came with a dose of flip remarks and attitude. 

Finally, she snatches the bill out of one of our hands and storms over to the bartender to help her split it up. Now we've certainly had enough of this lady and we are completely flabbergasted that we're being treated this way. Of course, the conversation quickly turns to "what is this girl's major malfunction?" From across the bar you hear our waitress scream "Do you have a problem? I can hear you talking." Now she's storming over to our table getting into our faces screaming at us in front of the whole bar. As she is arguing with us, off-duty staffers are pleading with her to stop. Now she's telling them that we're rude and talking about her. Finally, the bar manager comes over and tells her to walk away and asks us what the problem was. We explain that we were simply trying to divide the check and our waitress comments "Oh of course now that he's here you're being nice." We weren't any different to him than her. Luckily, the bar manager was more than happy to help us split the bill. 

After this spectacle, we were simply offered apologies from other staffers. Nothing was done to remedy the situation and the waitress continued to serve tables while griping about us. If it were me, she would have been sent home IMMEDIATELY, with more ramifications to come later.

I went here with my girlfriend after seeing the joint on Triple D! We ordered three meals, not apps, meals! The bison pastrami and short rib burger are EVERYTHING! Holy deliciousness, we came for our cheat meal and it was 1000% worth it! We also got the pot pie, even the seasoned veggies and the sweet potatoes were so bomb, the aioli is also super super delicious. great place, will definitely be taking friends here for dinner and a few drinks! 

PS- the mules there are so delicious!

Great mixed drinks! Had a blast there Saturday on the patio! Allison was a great waitress, there was an awful table next to us giving her a hard time and she handled it so well. Great time, definitely coming back!

This is a fun bar right on Colfax. On a weekend, there is a bit of a wait (40+ minutes) so my party and I opted for the bar.
The service is OK, friendly but not timely. Also, even after ordering very basic and simple things, there was a 30+ minute wait for breakfast/lunch options. When you did get served, it was with a smile. The food is also OK and there wasn't an item or drink that screams "only buy it here."
For a Colorado bar, I would want to see more local craft brews. How is there not more a wide selection of Colorado beers? 
It was an A OK experience. Nothing notable or memorable (good or bad).
Great place to hang out after work.  I tried the bison pastrami on a pretzel bun.  It was delicious.  The mustard dipping sauce was a great companion to the sandwich.  Friendly staff and customers.
Got drinks here while waiting for a table at Sassafras. Cool decor, strong drinks. Didn't try the food but it looked like typical American bar food.

I can really only review on the drinks, service, and app menu.  We stopped in one night before going out and I liked this place.

The drink menu is great.  I had a hard time choosing one.  Decided on the Breaking Bad.  It was a version of a Manhattan.  

For food, we stuck with appetizers.  They were ok, but the dinner and brunch menu look awesome.  I will definitely be back.

As far as service goes, it could have been better but it was a busy Saturday night.

Initially, I really thought I would like this place a lot.  We were greeted at the bar on a low-key night and the bartender was friendly and talkative.  We got some food from the kitchen (that closes at midnight) and it was good and came out promptly.  The drinks are good too, but the issue was that waters had to be asked for three times.

It was not even that busy.. I get that you can get sidetracked sometimes and forget, especially since "water" doesn't get added to the tab, but I asked for water.  Several minutes later, no water so my friend asked for water (that'll remind him!).. no water.  So on the third time, I think when our food was out, I asked for ketchup or something and two waters.  Finally.  Water!  

Seems like a locals sort of place.  We overheard some pretty weird conversations going on.  There are huge TV screens behind the bar that are sure to distract the bro on dates with the lady since sportscenter or a current game seem to be typically televised.
