Anyway, it's a cool spot.  I like the feel of it, but water man.. water!

This is one of those gotta try places in Denver. The bartender was friendly and the staff knew what they were doing. The place is sleek and a bit nostalgic but still up to date. It's not that large inside but that adds to the charm. 
I tried the Short Rib Burger and it did not disappoint. A perfectly executed short rib on a brioche bun. That's a real beauty there kid! I had them add some sauté onions. It's nice with the lettuce and tomato but if I had another one I would loose the veggies. 
A really cool place and another DDD joint on my list. FoodDude!
This short rib burger was everything. So much so I sled for additional juice/sauce they cook the short rib in. Omgheeee. It was really good.
Had one of the best cheeseburgers in my entire life so far. Easily top 5 for me, and I've had burgers from coast to coast.
Went here on a whim and really enjoyed the cocktail list and food! The short rib minis were really good and i got the Whiskey Thyme cocktail which was sweet but strong! Definitely going here again!

Came in for happy hour on a workday.  Left pretty happy.

Drinks were cheap and cold, nice on a hot day.

Food was a bit lacking: small portions even for happy hour, and just not that great.

Staff was attentive, professional, and good.

I liked it.  I'll be back at some point for drinks.

Nice lil spot in Denver.  I like the whole scene.  The food was amazing.  The bartenders are attentive and able to handle the stress of the place because it gets crowed and busy fast.  Do not let the Big black scary door fool you.  It's worth going in!

On my recent trip to Denver I visited Prohibition. Their go to dish: short rib burgers. We're talking two huge tender pieces of short rib with decent fries. I would suggest taking the meat from the buns and ask for a small cup of au jus. Pick off pieces of the meat and dip it into the au jus, very tasteful. Don't forget the bun. Eat it along with the dipped short rib. Only $12, you can't beat that price for two huge pieces of tender meat.

 I also had my first Moscow Mule in the classic copper cup.
Not worth the hype I got. Beer served in room temp glasses, fries sat too long before bringing them out, even with just a few customers in the joint. Two lunches: $42. I'd go elsewhere next time.

I'm just posting about the food. 

They recommended the braised short rib as their best dish, so we got the braised short rib burger and the entree. Both were pretty underwhelming. And dry. We asked for more of the braised rib sauce, but even that wasn't enough to combat the dryness. 

Loved the Brussel sprout hash on the entree and the sweet potato fries though. Those were the real winners.

Wondering Colfax before a show at the Fillmore, we happened upon Prohibition one Friday night and popped in.  I must admit that I remembered the short rib burger from Triple D and thought, he let's go here!  

It was still happy hour when we wandered in and surprisingly, not too busy.  We got a booth and were quickly attended to.  I loved the dark woods and easy going vibe that the place has.  Our waiter was working a lot of tables, but was never too far away to check in.  I actually got the spiced rubbed grilled flank steak and queso sandwich with grilled peppers & onions, which was amazingly good.  I would dub it the gourmet Philly cheesesteak.  The hubby had a burger. We loved the food, the vibe and would recommend highly.  I think it might be our go to place when we hit up a concert at the Fillmore!
Awesome spot for great cocktails. Love it! Can't wait to get back here. :)

I came here for dinner on a Thursday night with some friends, and it was a very enjoyable experience. We didn't have much as far as drinks, but what we had was very good. The food was wonderful. I had the chicken pot pie and also got to try some of the fish & chips.

The service was good, it had a pleasant atmosphere, and it's fairly reasonably priced.

I have just a couple complaints. The menu is pretty limited, particularly when it comes to vegetarian options -- it's more of a bar than a restaurant. The other problem was that they had the door to the outdoor patio open the whole time. It had been a nice day, but it wasn't comfortable having a 50 degree wind blowing in the door at us the whole meal.

I love this place. Really I do. The food is wonderful and they have a decent selection of draft beer all the time, great whisky choices, and typically great service at the bar.

However, my last visit took an unfortunate turn. My wife and I have been going to Prohibition fairly regularly since I moved to Denver in August of 2013 (we live 1 block away). 

After working on the 16th Street Mall during the Zombie Crawl myself, two coworkers, and the girlfriend of one of them decided to grab a couple drinks after closing up our shop. 

We came in around 12:30am. One of our party had already arrived and gotten a beer. The coworker I arrived with ordered a beer and got it without starting a tab and headed out to our table. I ordered a beer and told the bartender to put his on my tab (I thought it was slightly strange that she didn't have him open a tab or pay, but I was hoping to buy the first round anyway so it worked out). We sat on the patio for a bit talking about how crazy zombie crawl is and the coworker who arrived before us went in to get another drink and asked if anyone needed anything. My other coworker said, I'll have another beer and she went in and got it on her tab (thus, both of his drinks were already paid for). Pretty normal night thus far.

At 1am they closed the patio and we went in and got a table and continued to chat about the evening. At last call we went up to settle our tabs. Bartender 1 was taking a (large) "shot" of Jamison with a patron. After she took the shot she came over and we asked for our tabs. My coworker was unaware that both of his drinks were already paid for and said he had two tall boys. She immediately went brought him a tab with just that. My tab was accurate and so was our other coworker's. 

This is where our experience took a nose dive. Upon trying to rectify the billing mishap it was very clear the bartender was intoxicated and couldn't really comprehend what we were telling her. I told her that I have worked in the industry and I think it is really unprofessional that she is drinking behind the bar. She asked where I work and when I told her where I currently work she condescendingly said "that's cute." She also told me that the manager lets them drink behind the bar and ignorantly stated that there shouldn't be an issue because she had comped everyone in our party at least two drinks each ... but each of us only had two drinks. So ... at this point I'm realizing how intoxicated this bartender really is. The other bartender finally came over and tried to help and it was clear that she had been drinking as well.

I called them both out on drinking behind the bar and they asked me to leave and never come back. 

I was probably a little short and rude when I called them out for drinking behind the bar. I'll own that. I was not intoxicated in the least and was frustrated by the lack of professionalism demonstrated by these bartenders at a place I've been a patron at longer than either of them have been employed there.

As someone whom works in food and customer service I usually show pity on people when it's busy or they forget something, with that said they were not busy and still managed to make this the worst experience I've ever had literally anywhere.  I ordered a whiskey Sprite and ended up with a whisky ginger. Brushed that off common mistake. Then we order food which took over 45 minute to get ( all we ordered were fries) and my friend orders a sandwich where took over an hour to come out. We were going to a show that we ended up being late for, our waitress was completely unapologetic and rude. We ordered one last round of drinks which took so long it was no longer in happy hour, thanks for that. Then when we expressed that fact that we had somewhere to be they somehow took even longer. I will honestly never walk into the joke of an establishment ever again. And as someone whom deals with a lot of out of town clients and tells them good places to eat and drink I will never recommend this place. Good job

Heard about the braised short rib burgers & had to go try it. It was not at all disappointing. Really, really good. So were the cocktails. The shrimp benedict for brunch for pretty bland & all of the sides were cold. It was a slow time in the bar, so I get it & the servers/bartender conversation was pretty interesting listening. I'd go back but not in my top ten.
Great food, great service! However we sat on the patio and kept getting interrupted by random people on the street...luckily the staff were quick to shoo them away. Tough location but great place!

We came here on a recommendation from Guy Fieri's show. I'm finding out, more and more often, that's a bad idea...

He just RAVED about the "Short Rib Burger". So we got TWO of them in our group. They were dry to the point of nearly choking on them! NO sauce at all, bone-dry! The 2 salads the other people got were good, nothing special in any way shape or form.

The drinks were poor. Dessert was OK. This place desperately n
needs a new Executive chef...

With a name like Prohibition I was expecting mood lighting and some kind of Jazz, or at least interesting moody electronica. I had planned on coming here for several months.  We went in Sat night around 12:30 am after leaving the contemporary art museums closing night of the Marks Mothersbaugh exhibit. In Prohibition the lights were bright, and music was douche central. We exited quickly. Your marketing is schizophrenic. I have been to quite a few nostalgic style cocktail lounges, and this is not one-do not let the name mislead you. I don't care how good your cocktails are, if I am expecting a sultry experience, and come into that, I am leaving. 

Sincerely 
The Bar Fly

Fun place, great atmosphere. Erver was knowledgeable of the menu and was abke to make suggestions for a party of three. Wonderful bison ! When in Denver, go here, it's a must . Don't forget to chill with a vodka Moscow mule, or two.

Been here a couple of times and it's pretty good. Cocktails are always good, service is always friendly. Food is pretty good too. So far, I'vev only had the mac n cheese (which is delicious), fried mozzarella bites, and a really good beef short rib with polenta and brussel sprout entrée. I would recommend more people try this place. Can get pretty loud and busy during happy hour though.

I would think with a name like Prohibition you would get an AMAZING cocktail.
But it wasn't the case.
I work in the service industry and I get it, nights can be busy.
But I was with two guys, who ordered beers and a shot. Which, our server forgot. Oh well, not a big deal. But it happened both rounds. 
And my negroni was just sad. So so sad. Oh well, maybe we caught them on a bad night.

Revise: the manager here was rad enough to send me a message. So clearly they care. 
Just be clear about how you like your drink :-)

This is a pretty chill bar, and I have had good experiences here. They have pretty decent cocktails for sure. And their food looks very tasty. 

Tonight I went out with a few work buddies, and they got our tabs a little messed up. Which I totally 100% understand - I work in the service industry myself, and I get that stuff gets mixed up sometimes. But the bartenders were way way more mixed up than anyone sober would have been. At one point both the bartenders told me and my coworkers that they had "comped each of us at least two drinks". Which didn't make any sense, at all. Since this was the first/only issue we were bringing up to them... Why would they have comped all three of us two drinks each? And we were only asking after a single drink that had been double charged? 

I don't know that I will be back. I don't think that the bartenders were trying to take advantage of anyone, I think they just super overreacted and had been drinking.
This place is fantastic. This is a don't miss in Denver. Good drinks and great food. Atmosphere is perfect.

Have only been once but really liked it and have been wanting to go back. Had a few Midnight Blues, which were really really good. For food, ordered the Focaccia Chicken Sandwich which had a great taste. Service was average, but would go back.
So delicious! We shared the hush puppies, short rib sliders and chicken pot pie. I was kinda mad I didn't just have it all to myself!

Food is delicious. I had the bison pastrami and it was great!!! 
The chicken pot pie is also delicious it is twenty min wait from when you order to get that but it is so worth the wait!!!

Good food. Good drinks. Terrible service. We waited over 30 minutes to be greeted by our server, ordered our first round and it took another 10+ min to see the drinks. This is the third time a similar experience has happened at this place.

This was the first place my friends and I stopped at once coming to visit Colorado, and all of us loved it!!!!  The food was fantastic.  My friend and I split the pastrami sandwich and the chicken/goat cheese sandwich .  Both were soooo good.  We literally cleaned our plates.  Our other friend had a burger that she said was great.  The atmosphere was nice, beers were delish and the service was great.  Absolutely recommend!

I had terrible service and even worse food last night. The recommended vodka for my drink dos not taste good, my table's food came out in shifts, and when I finally did get my chicken sandwich it was cold. I won't be returning. I've attempted this place a few times and it's never a great memory.

Seven of us met up for lunch on a Wednesday. Nice space and atmosphere. Good bartender, who like in most small, indie establishments, is also the server on a Wednesday afternoon. Good service, good food, good music. I liked my signature Whiskey Thyme. If you're happy and you know it clap your hands. Eat and drink in good company and your life  -- and your Yelp reviews -- are sure to show it!

Had a small wait but once seated food was super quick! Had cream of mushroom soup, pastrami sandwich and pulled pork sandwich... EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING!!! Great drinks, great food! Great atmosphere! Minus the location (don't love food right off colfax) it is an awesome joint!

Stopped in on a Monday for a beer and burger on a business trip out to Denver and was not disappointed. I sat at the bar and was pleasantly surprised by the number of mainstream and local craft beer options on tap. The place was pretty busy for a Monday night with groups around the bar as well as diners. There is a space in the restaurant for table service, but it's in the same open space as the bar, so don't expect an intimate setting. The bartenders were very attentive, beer was great and the Short Rib Burger is not to be missed.

We came here at about 7:30 on Friday night for dinner. The sign said Please Wait to be Seated so we waited, but no one came to seat us. We saw a table being cleared off so we asked if we could have it and she said yes. From there it took quite awhile to get drinks. Overall, not great service.
Food was great! 
My biggest complaint was the music blasting so loud we were all yelling at each other and still couldn't hear. It sounded like a night club...at 8:00 pm when almost everyone in the place was eating dinner. Seemed really unnecessary.
Decent place for late night drinks, but won't be going back for dinner.

I was really excited to eat here so I placed an order with postmates. Ordered some mozzarella bites and a chicken sandwich. I don't like goat cheese so I asked to have the goat cheese substituted for mozzarella and I was on the phone while the postmates driver was ordering and the bartender strait up told the driver that they weren't going to put mozzarella on the sand which because it was too much work to cut it off the giant slab of mozzarella they had. What?!?! You have the cheese and refuse to put it on my sandwich? It's a $10 sandwich and they can't make it the way I want? Great customer service. The sandwich was good and so were the bites but I just feel when you charge those kind of prices, customer service should be included. Even though the food was good I won't be a patron for this place anymore. I like to spend my money at places that care about their customers.

We were looking for the perfect date spot prior to seeing a concert at The Fillmore.  Great patio, the service was tremendous and the food was insanely delicious.  Incredible Whiskey selection as well. We will definitely be back.
This place has a great food and cocktail selection! I LOVE the chicken pot pie and queso. The staff is always quick and friendly. I have always had positive experiences here!

Came here while visiting Denver and thought this was one of the coolest place to eat and drink. It was open late which was perfect since we flew in at 9pm.  I had the bison pastrami burger with a Moscow mule. Food and drinks were delicious. On top of the food, it's recommended by triple D. The best part of this place is the quote from Hunter Thompson.

Prohibition has a great happy hour! Well drinks for $3, such a great deal for this area!  If you are trying to get a table expect a wait, the lines during happy hour get long unless you come early. Plenty of room to stand and wait for a table though. 

$10 pitchers of bloody Mary's and mimosas for brunch make for an outstanding brunch service.

The food and atmosphere was really good, but the service was horrible, and it kept getting worse. We almost walked out. 
There are so many good reviews that I might try it again. It may have been a fluke.
My new favorite almost a dive bar with great food and service, but was such an awesome Backbar. It's obviously more than a sports bar

Honeslty, loved it here.

We've seen them on Diners, Driveins and Dives and when we came to the Fillmore recently it seemed like the perfect place to go.

They have a great selection of beer and on happy hour the prices aren't too bad.

I had a burger with bacon and a side of fries, while I didn't like that every single thing was extra - including the fries - I thought my burger was excellent. Cooked to perfection and the bacon was at its crispy best.

Service was excellent, too.

It was all pricey, but good!

Weird atmosphere for brunch. Also, called ahead to confirm I could watch a particular nfl game, which they said wouldn't be a problem. When I arrived I was then told the TVs were all spoken for, sorry. Waste of time.

In a town that has far too many bars that's thinks cooking is turning on a microwave this is a good solid bar with tasty and good food -- never had a bad experience here -- during the Legislative session they host parties which can be a touch disruptive if your just there for a drink and bite to eat

This is the kind of bar where you come in, sit your ass down, watch a good game, and chill and drink. The rest of it will come. By that I mean if you want a good hamburger and or eggs Benedict, it's gonna come. Enjoy your drink, you'll have time. It's one of those bars where the people to waitress ratio is not in proportion, but our waitress Cupcake was so nice, and thorough also. This bar has a local vibe to it, so if you wander in/in "tourist mode," you're probably not going to get hand and foot service. There's no waiting on you hand and foot. I get the feeling sitting here this bar is big on locals meeting up, having some good food, good drinks that aren't watered down, and watching a good football game.

ehhhhhh....
I went here for Brunch on a Sunday.  Service was fast and good, but the food was middle of the road.  I had a veggie Benedict that had good flavor, however unfortunately it didn't really stand out in comparison to Snooze's Benedictus, or any of the brunch places I frequented in Portland.  In my opinion I found the food and decor to be, well...forgettable.

This is only my opinion though.  The service was good, the food and ambiance however, I found lacking.
Two stars cause the drinks are good, but the staff is rude and patronizing. Won't be coming here again.

OMFG!!!!!!! My grandmother used to make chicken pot pies and I loved them and I loved her with all my heart. If she were still alive today, I would punch her as hard as I can in the mouth after eating the pot pie here at Prohibition. This is how it is to be done. No need to have anything else on the menu really. Seriously, I won't try anything else and I should probably not come back because for something this GOOD, there's no way in HELL this could be healthy. But who wants to live forever?

Despite the name, Prohibition is more swanky pub than speakeasy. So the name is a bit misleading but it's cool. Sometimes I don't need bells nor whistles (for the record, that's more the exception than the rule). The interior is as dark dark dark as my heart and I can see losing an entire evening here (or, at least until last call at 2am). When I recently visited, it was impossible not to enjoy the cool evening and I was totally down with the patio on the side (note: sit with your back facing the icky McDonald's across the street that totally ruins the vibe!)

Prohibition is a purveyor of a variety of cocktails, both house specialties and classic, the kind you'd find in my home city. And man, are the prices *right*!!! I'll be real: I wasn't in love with my Midnight Blue cocktail (far too charmed by the name to not realize it would be too sweet for my tastes). I blame the moonshine. Or the fact that the lemonade tasted like it was out of a box rather than fresh squeezed lemons + water. I'm a little bit sour on that fact, not gonna lie. I wasn't compelled to order another and that's a rarity. It might have had more to do with the fact that they close the patio earlier than closing time, which is understandable given the neighborhood being somewhat residential on one side. So, it was a one drink kind of evening at Prohibition.

No food for me here (would it kill them to have a veg option that's not French fries? I guess I just want it all, don't I?)

I don't mean to complain! The service is fine and it's definitely a bar I'd return to when in the area, but probably not a destination for me.

Denver is not a town that's lacking great bars.  With such an embarrassment of riches, it'd be easy to overlook a bar like this, its in an urban portion of the Capitol district more than a few blocks away from the tourists and the LODO.  That'd be a mistake.

You can feel the old-school dive that the place is built on coming up through the floor.  The relaxed attitude and the drinks forward approach, they list the classics right on the menu, are a quick antidote to commercial bar standards.  

Big tables, inviting to sharing or traveling in packs, further the friendly crowd.  And there's a large sidewalk patio just outside to enjoy a smoke and a drink, should that be more your speed. 

Great Drinks, Great Crowd, Great Bar.

The service is very attentive and friendly but, the food is lacking and trying to be something it's not. This is a bar...a very barish bar, not a food destination.  Our food sucked...and the smell of dirty mop while we ate didn't help.  This place needs a detailing and a new kitchen staff...or at least one that doesn't send out poorly prepared food. 
A server (not ours) that was on while we were there was HAMMERED drunk.  That was fun to watch but glad they weren't ours.  Our server was super friendly and accommodating as was the bartender.
Go for a beer, leave for the food.

Cool place! The bartenders were super nice. The food is a-ma-zing. Would recommend the po' boy and the cheeseburger. Soo good! There was a mix up with our appetizers and they comped us our appetizers with out us saying anything to them. We'll be back for sure!

Came in here about three months back...honestly it was a pretty hefty letdown. Not only was the food relatively forgettable, but I came here just after having been to williams and graham, so I was hoping for a comparable speakeasy environment and got bunk.

Ultimately, comparing W&G to Prohibition is like apples to oranges, but I just felt there should have been a more pronounced historical presence...call me old-fashioned, but if you describe yourself as something specific, you should follow through on the premise.

To be fair, the food and drink wasn't terrible. But the price point is what drove it down to two stars -- we got one app, two entrees, one dessert and two cocktails and spent 100 dollars. I could've eaten at a much better restaurant for that kind of money.

We went on Saturday around 11 am and they were serving brunch only. We were really looking forward to getting the balsamic short rib burger but they were not serving it at this time. However we did have burgers and a few drinks and the food was awesome! The patio is well shaded and sits on a corner that is a little loud but not too loud. We would def go back during dinner to view the full menu when we come back to Colorado.

The only thing Prohibition-era about this bar is the name.  It's pretty much a sports bar.  And despite the reference to their "exposed brick" interior, there was really only a 2' x 8' section of exposed brick above the bar.  PBR tin signs decorated the walls and I could see four TVs from where I was sitting.  Their food was okay, but just don't get your hopes up if you're really looking for a 1920's inspired tavern.

Stopped in late one night.   It's with in walking distance of a couple other bars and by the time we got there it was pretty packed.    
Had a Whiskey Thyme which was DELICIOUS.  Ordered a salad (It's called Greens on the late night menu) and asked for it without cheese.  Told them I was allergic to dairy.   Salad arrived with cheese, had to send it back and a replacement came out when we were ready to leave.  I didn't get charged for my salad so that's good.    
Nice decor inside.  Very Hipster crowd.   
Not sure if I'll end up here again.

So i have never been to a chik-fil-a before. I'm like why havent i tried it earlier?! Its soo good especially the frosted lemonade and waffle fries are to die for. I will be coming back for more soon! 
Oh and the service was great as well.

Another food to go place added to my list, this chick-fil-a fast food joint out-stand other fast food joint in the place, they are however fast food joints yet they serve more than what you can expect in a food chain establishment. very consistent in excellent costumer service, costumers are genuinely served with passions by their crews.
Compare to other Chick-fil-a stores this one is the best.
I love Chick-fil-A the service is always really good they're always pretty quick here
This location is consistent with other locations.  It is clean and the service is quick and polite.

Generally speaking you can trust a Chick-fil-a not to screw up your order, but that doesn't seem to apply to this location.  I've been here three times and each time something was wrong or missing.  Plus this is the busiest location I've ever seen, especially around lunch time.  Do yourself a favor and go to the location at Mississippi and Havana if you'd like to receive the food you've ordered.
The food is always good & as a bonus you can always get lunch items at breakfast time if you're willing to wait 5 extra minutes

Amazing food! They were very fast with the order and the food came out fresh. My brother and I were enjoying ourself to some of that good good when he noticed that his soda was a little flat. He went back to tell them and the manager asked exactly which soda and station that soda came from in order to address the problem immediately. Also have the best selection of sauces for your meal and the best ketchup packets!

The food is always amazing. Service is wonderful too. Orders are always accurate and the drive thru never really has a wait. Even with multiple cars in front of us, my boyfriend and I are always headed home with our food before we know it. We dined in once and the store was so clean! Absolutely love this location. ONE time they forgot my fries so I ran inside to ask for them and they apologized and gave me TWO orders of fries. Highly recommend them.
Like every other chic-fil-a, beware the lunch rush. Good food as always and everyone is always so nice and polite. Clean place, friendly staff, just always so busy.

Anything bad I can say? Nope! Great service and , as always, GREAT food. Steaming hot and fresh and crisp like it was just made. Sometimes they have given me pickles despite asking for sandwiches without pickles but I won't raise a fuss over it. The food is too damn good to complain.
Guy at the drive thru is sooooo RUDE!!!!! He wouldn't help a little old lady throw the empty Coke she had away. He just said no. No explanation, nothing. Guess it wasn't "our pleasure" that day....

This is NOT a good chick Fil a locale. I have never gotten an order right, I only come back because it's close to my work location. The service is friendly, but they often get the order wrong in the drive through, and the food is really not that good.
Nothing but smiles when you come here. The staff is fun and friendly and no complaints coming from there. They always supply me with random coupons whenever I come through the drive thru !!!

I have eaten here twice and both times it was  bad. The first time the chicken was under cooked and today 'Cody' was having a bad day. Cody works at the front counter and he has a crappy attitude. I would suggest Cody get a new gig.  Also the floors in this place are slick with grease. Don't eat here-

chick-fil-a is my first go to place for fast food if I have to get it.  This particular location has been pretty consistent for the times visited.

Customer service is always a plus here.  They are always clear in getting your order and deliver it with a smile.  Better than McD's where it seems the folks just don't want to be there (they probably don't).

As I drive more for work and find myself on the road during lunch time with a growling stomach, drive thru's have become commonplace for me.  

Chick-fil-A is always a step above the rest.  Still fast food, but the service and the quality of the food is better.  They're not afraid of spice either, I enjoy the spicy chicken sandwich which is actually spicy, go figure.  

Fast food is never ideal, but when the time comes I hope Chick-fil-A is in the area.

Can't ever go wrong with Chick-fil-A. The recipes are the same nationwide and the training must be the same because every state or city that I've eaten CFA, has all been good and the employees are always helpful and nice.
I do really hate to love this place. From a socio-political standpoint, they oughta burn to the ground. From a delicious food standpoint, I hope they have chik-fil-a in heaven.

great food great service great employees  the most clean fast casual restaurant  I've ever been in  they even have people busing tables sweeping floors etc.
I read awhile back they were rated the #1 franchise in the United States  I can see why.  Try going to any other fast place the food sucks bathroom stick and there crap all over the tables  every McDonald's I've every been to suck  but this place rocks good healthy food
Staff is very fast and efficient food tastes fresh I just wished they wouldn't give me half fries

Best location in have been too. Of course the staff is very friendly and helpful. But what sets this location apart is the speed and accuracy of your order.  It is much faster than most other locations I have been to all over the US.
Always HOT and delicious.  The restaurant is kept very clean and the staff are always helpful and polite.  I love their advertising; the cows are part of the fun!

Stopped for dinner on my way to the airport. I've never been to this location before. Everything was very clean. All of the staff was very nice and helpful. I had to post a review because I was very impressed. 
Thank you to the staff for a pleasant visit.

If they screw up your order don't expect any customer service because I paid for three meals, only got two fries instead of three (for the second time in a row here), and when I called to speak to a manager she acted extremely annoyed at me. After I explained what happened tonight and last time this happened she offered me a free French fry. Why the hell would I want to drive another 20 minutes back to chick fil a after my food is already cold just to get something "free" that I paid for twice? If I could give zero stars I would have. Horrible management and customer service.
The dine-in service was awesome. People came by to offer us refills, and took our trays when we were finished. I'm really impressed with the whole staff!

I love me some chick-fil-a lemonade!! Definitely my favorite item at this restaurant. The lunch lines here are reaaaalllly long both inside and drive thru, so be prepared to wait a while if you come between 12-1pm during the week. That alone is the only drawback for me. The staff is great and always really friendly and helpful and "my pleasure" is repeated after just about everything you say.

This location rocks. Fast service, very friendly, good, hot food and they are consistent with orders. I've never had an issue here. We go here a lot at lunch, I attend the Community College of Aurora so I like to pop in between classes. It's delicious food, not too bad for you as far as fast food goes, and the service is fast. I have to point out the nice fresh flowers they keep on each table inside, it's not very significant but to me just one of those details that make a difference. Very clean too. The staff is super friendly and it's great that they walk around checking up to see if you need refills or anything, but maybe just a little too friendly. The "my pleasure" is a little formal in my opinion for fast food, but it's appreciated. Keep it up, Chick-fil-a! I'll be back!

Chic fil a is always great. This one is no exception! The food was good, inside was clean, and it also has a nice little play area! The price is a lot compared to other fast food, which is to be expected. But the quality difference is worth it IMO. My only complaint is with two employees. They were very loud & playing around. It was not professional to say the least! I would still come back.

This is my favorite restaurant for so many reasons. The play area for kids is wonderful and is super clean and kid friendly, the staff is always polite, friendly and helpful. The food here is served quickly and correctly and I never have a problem with anything. My kids and I enjoy coming to this place when we get the chance to.

Chick-Fil-A is pretty much always clean, the staff is always super helpful, and the food is delicious and this location is no different. Not much to say about "fast food" but out of all the big chains Chick-fil-A is definitely a cut above. Enjoyed my lunch experience here just as I always do!

This has become our most frequented brunch spot, sort of by accident. I'm not even sure how we first found the place, but we keep coming back for a number of reasons. During the warmer months, the patio is the best with a stunning view of Sloan's Lake and plenty of seating. 

We almost never have to wait. I don't know if we just have spectacular timing or what, but the only time we ever struck out was on New Year's Day, which I'm pretty sure is the busiest brunch day of the year, so I can forgive that. 

Their food is so fresh. I usually get some sort of omelet or hash or scramble with a side of pancakes, and it's always top notch. Fresh veggies, generous portions, and everything is ALWAYS delicious. I think if I had to name one complaint, it would be that the upcharge for chocolate chips in the pancakes is a bit excessive (I think it's like $1.50 or $1.75), but I still get them every time. Maybe I'll just sneak in some chocolate chips next time. Call me the chocolate chip smuggler. 

I want pancakes.

I was not at all familiar with this area before I came over to Rupert's. The view from the front patio is gorgeous- and you can see the city across the lake. 
Inside reminds me of an old-school breakfast place, with lots of cafe tables and booths along the sides. I though that the menu would be the standard fare for such a place, with typical breakfast options- quite honestly I was expecting nothing that deviates too heavily from any other breakfast diner in middle America. 
Boy, was I wrong. The menu does have plenty of the usual fare, but there's also some completely unique options that I don't think you can get anywhere else. Seriously, I was completely torn between like six of the meals on the menu. I ended up getting the sweet potato hash with scrambled eggs, and it was a ton of really high quality food. Being the native Coloradan that I am, I of course got green chili on the side, which was a great choice. Their green chili is actually quite spicy and I would totally recommend it to anyone who wants to try it. The menu also has lots of options that are vegan and gluten free, so if you have specific diet restrictions this place is definitely willing to accommodate. 
The wait staff was attentive and willing to answer all my questions- really quite friendly!

A very good breakfast. Food and service. Definitely recommended.

++ Service. A warm welcome from the hostess and spot on service from our waitress. Efficient, attentive, helpful and friendly.
+ Corned beef hash. Sunnyside up eggs as ordered. Delicious biscuits.
+ OJ. Quite good with a fresh taste.

+ Wi-Fi
+ Amex.

0 Average atmosphere. "A breakfast joint".

- Qualité Poise flatware by Walco. Low end.
- Paper napkins are thin.

Ruperts was a great pick! Thanks to all the yelpers out there who informed me via Yelp about awesome this place is. We started off with their bottomless mimosas  which really hit the spot on a Sunday morning! I got the special for the day which was chicken fried steak smoothed in sausage gravy and topped with two made from scratch biscuits and two eggs cooked to your liking. The service was on point for a crazy busy as it was in there. Prices were fair for the amount of food you got. Everything was above satisfactory at Ruperts don't miss out on this place!
This place is bananas! The food and bottomless MiMos are a killer deal, and Natasha provided awesome service and great suggestions! This is totally our new breakfast spot!

Loved loved this place!!! Even though it was snowing it is a great location! The service was impeccable and the food has never been this delicious in a chain restaurant! I am a lover of breakfast and such always on the look out for local breakfast places!! This one is top in my book! I typically eat there 2-3 times before I review simply because I have been disappointed with consistency. I don't even care!! This place everything was perfectly delicious! My friend and I had seconds! The pumpkin French toast was delightful! I'm hungry now!

Amazing breakfast and brunch with such an extensive menu! My friend and I walked here from their place (around Sloan Lake - a pretty good walk!) and came for breakfast early on a Thursday morning.

We sat outside since it was so pleasant and were given water upon sitting down. Our server was attentive and checked in on a lot, which was great.

I ordered their Frittata which was made with egg whites and you were able to choose three different toppings. I went with red pepper, mushroom and avocado. So, so good. It came with a potato cake and spinach salad and both were delicious. I was really pleased with our breakfast. It wasn't too heavy, was home made and had so much flavor. I can see why my friends love this place!

The service was fantastic and the location is nice. The food was ok, but way over priced for what it was. I love breakfast and I wanted to love this place. Maybe I should have gone with biscuits and gravy but French toast is a breakfast staple and I figured that with the rating and comments I couldn't go wrong with anything. Mimosas are cheap so it is a good place if you're looking for brunch and mimosas, but not if you're looking for French toast and bacon to fill you up....which, it should.

A favorite neighborhood hot spot for breakfast. Have you seen the crowds on the weekends? I sure have, and I've been in it too. It's never been so overwhelming that you can't get seated and have to wait 2+ hours though like OTHER popular unnamed breakfast joints in the area. It's bright, cheery, and still got that comfy diner charm going for it. 

The food is consistently good and albeit mostly diner-food, but it's better than what you'd find in a middle-America diner. A step above, if you will. I also say this because dang, their house coffee is pretty darn delicious. I thought it was going to be watered down, tasteless coffee (because that's what you get in the aforementioned diners), but it was smooth, rich and flavorful. 

And I can't forget to mention that their service is awesome and genuinely friendly!

Seriously the best kind of breakfast&brunch restaurant in the Denver area!! Great quality food/drinks + service is by far Eggcellent! (pun intended)

I was very impressed with the food options and had the Solan's Traditional Breakfast for my traditional needs anytime I try out a new breakfast restaurant. I couldn't have asked for a better fulfilling breakfast!  Prices are also very reasonable!  

Natasha was my server and took the best care of me start to finish; super polite and friendly. She didn't treat me like an individual, she treated me like I was her best friend.  Natasha really a phenomenal person's person and I was easily amazed of how great of a multitasker she was! Because of her, I will be a returning customer!
Good service and generally good food. The egg dishes have gotten a little gross...too much butter or cooking spray. Everything else is good!

Tried the GF Apple cinnamon pancakes, amazing. Drinks were great and service even better. Thanks, Dona for making the trip worth it!
Sit outside for a relaxing lake view in the warmer months. Inside...outside doesn't matter. This place knows what they are doing.

My family & I love the food, drinks & great view of Sloans lake. The only downfall is the CUSTOMER SERVICE. We have yet to encounter a friendly host or server, not even a smile or how are you. It's disappointing, PLEASE be more welcoming to families & not just college kids!

Today we walked in to put our names down and the host asked us for a name. I told him mine and then started spelling it and he goes "um can you give me a quick one?" Uh... A quick name? 1. My name is 5 letters long... And how exactly do I give you a quicker name? It's my name!!! Anyways, the food was good but I'm giving this a 2 because the initial service impression. I might be back again sometime but I'm not really in any rush.

Great spot during summer/fall time overseeing a lake. You can sit outside and enjoy bottomless mimosas!!!
Good coffee and decent food. There's a usual wait time of 20-35 minutes if you come on weekends after 9:30am. Friendly staff overall a good spot. Comfy seats:) might sound weird but if you love to enjoy company and hang out for a while- seats matter!!
Ordered the Other Reuben as it's called and it's was delicious! The coffee was disappointing though, they should have dark roast coffee, that would go excellent with the food.

I was in town for a conference and saw the numerous positive reviews and was not disappointed! I had the steak Benedict, which was amazing! The potato cakes are delicious as well. I will definitely eat here again the next time I'm in town!

Rupert's as always is delicious! The food is always amazing and they have have GF options which is an added bonus. The staff here are absolutely wonderful. We came this time on a Monday morning and there was no wait. Please note if you come on a weekend there will be a wait and they don't take reservations. It is well worth the wait!!!

This place should be called Hipsters at the Edge but it's fun and has a great location next to Sloan's Lake. Bottomless mimosas on Saturday, Sunday and Monday (their motto is brunch without a mimosa is just late, lame breakfast) so what's not to like? I had the corned beef hash and it was very satisfying.

First off, parking is a bit challenging but is so worth it.

Let me start by saying that the lake view patio is gorgeous and is pet friendly, so bring yo furry friends (pets, not furries you wierdos).

They do call ahead and will text you when a table is ready, which is as good as morning sex in the sense you weren't expecting it, but damn it was good to have. 

Now the food. I ordered the bottomless mimosas, well because, why not. Daydrinking is ok on weekends, right?

Now, I didn't just order mimosas (no judging needed) and went with the special, the Filet Mignon Eggs Benedict (picture attached). It was seasoned beautifully (Gordon Ramsey voice), complete knockout. The wife had the sloans breakfast and was great, nothing wrong with it one bit.

I would highly recommend Ruperts. Great crowd, great food, and owner is very approachable and talkative. All in all, great local spot.

*if anything doesn't make sense, I'm 8 mimosas in. Give me a break

This place is great I stopped in for the sunrise but the view is just the beginning.  My top 3 faves are green Chile bowl, quiche, and corned beef hash.  If you sit at the bar you can eat as slow as you want because Amberin literally warms your food with her smile. 

Ask about the special Jimmy's coffee.  It's to die for.  
The only down side is the "feature" item gets redundant.
Great service, tasty food decent pricing. Recommend getting here early so the wait is shirt

Anybody say "mimosa"!! Bottomless too! Love this place! Shout out to our girl,Natasha!! She hooked us up!! She was the first to greet us,seat us,and make us very happy with the smoked gouda grits with eggs and side of half jalapeño bacon and traditional and my husband had their homemade corned beef hash. Delish!! If you're in Denver don't forget to stop in and ask for Natasha.

Dining with a view is my first thought. Especially if you sit next to the window. Or better yet during summer enjoy Ruperts by sitting outside and enjoying the view of Sloan Lake. 

Ruperts is on the edge of Sloan Lake hence the edge reference.

We came here for brunch. I enjoyed their Chocolate Cheesecake French toast. It is basically thick toasts stuffed with those two ingredients. I am required to say this: it's dangerously delicious!

The service is super warm and genuine. I love it! 

Oh Ruperts believe that A brunch without a mimosa is just a sad breakfast.   How awesome is that? Salud!

You don't believe me? It's written in big letters on their wall:)
Duck Egg Benedict was delicious!! Chicken fried steak was also very tender. Definitely try this spot out! Wait was about 15 mins!

I'm always on the lookout for my next five star experience, and it was delivered to me in bluebird fashion on a random stop in at Rupert's! 

For those who don't know my rating qualification schema, a five star review means that if someone were to suggest the place for whatever that place does, I'd say yes without hesitation.  Rupert's falls easily into this category after only one visit.  

I tried this warm turkey sandwich thing that was SO good I would recommend it to a turkey.  A cannibal zombie turkey that eats it's kin!  My gal had a veggie omelet that totally hit the mark.  All of that was a solid 4.5 on the scale.  The icing on the cake is very affordable bottomless mimosas, and a very tasty, well made bloody!  Nice!

Add all that to a lakefront location (well, for all intents and purposes - there is Sheridan in between) and a terrific staff, definitely worth a try!

THIS. PLACE. IS. FANTASTIC. We had just gotten back from a vacation in Jersey, and I happen to love Pork Roll. However, it is hard to come by in Colorado. So I got online and searched for restaurants that served it here. I found 2, Rupert's being one of them. (It is called Taylor Ham on their menu.) So we gave it a shot, and SO glad we did. The service is fantastic, and the food equally as good. The potato cakes have the most amazing flavor. I finally got my pork roll in Colorado, and found a great restaurant that we will be repeat customers at as well. Thanks, Rupert's!

Found them on Yelp in the search.  Drove past it a lot but never saw it.  Went there on a Saturday morning.  It was slow at that time but picked up the next hour.  We went around 8ish.  We each had the Benedict.  They were awesome.  The potato cakes were really good.  The corn cakes on the Mexican Benedict tasted great. I recommend this place.  Only complaint is that small juice is really really small.

Had breakfast here and it was delicious. The Veggie Benedict was so good and the little potato cakes were fantastic. Nice outside patio and nice view of the lake. The staff was really nice and friendly. Thumbs up and I'll be heading back for some more good grub.

A fantastic breakfast/brunch place within steps from my house overlooking Sloans Lake, you can't go wrong!! We were actually in a bit of a rush when we arrived at this place, but I can't wait for our next visit when we have more time to chill and enjoy the bottomless mimosas. The menu was large and varied, lots of breakfast egg dishes and an impressive amount of French toast options. The friendly server came and brought coffee immediately and we ordered right at this time. The chefs special that day was strawberry cream French toast and my partner ordered the traditional breakfast. No joke, our food came out in 5 minutes piping hot and delicious! I tried my hardest to eat all 4 slices of French toast, it was so good and the strawberry cream was light, creamy and super strawberry!! My only negative comment was the food came so fast I barely had time to drink my coffee, but that's not really a bad thing. Since we were in a hurry, we literally were in and out of the restaurant in about 20 minutes and made it to our event it's time to spare! We did however take some time to look at the drink menu that contained all sorts of fancy breakfast drinking perfect for a lazy morning brunch! I can't wait to go back to this cute little breakfast joint!

it's  not often you can find a place that combines  great views  and  food. This is one  of them. A little traffic noise especially  during rush hours but worth the visit. Sloan lake and the Denver downtown make a great backdrop for breakfast or lunch.

no complaints here, great brunch spot with great strong coffee and a stunning chicken fried steak and eggs. but, on the short list for the awesome brunch spots. 

little crowded, and the host wants your cell number for table ready, there is no disclosure however of their data retention policies and what they do with your contact information.
Great food! Simple classics sometimes with a little twist. Gouda grits are amazing along with the jalepeno bacon. Service is always great as well.

One of my only 5 star reviews for a brunch spot! Why? The 8.50 bottomless mimosas might have a hand in the play. But let's be honest, you can't leave a 5 start review unless the food lives up to the hype. And it so does! I 

I ordered the BLT and my bc got the burrito. This was not your average chipotle burrito. Twice the size and twice the flavor. He is a deposal truck and couldn't clear his plate. 

Tip: try the grits!!
Only eaten here once but it was so pleasant and delicious can't wait to go again. Super fast and very reasonable price

GREAT SERVICE 
GREAT FOOD 
VERY FAST SERVICE 
WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK!!!! 

This was my first time here and I was greeted very promptly, I sat at the bar. Amberin welcomed me and asked if I would like some coffee (of course). I ordered the sloans breakfast and before I knew it I was being seved my meal! Very fast service. Amberin was very attentive in making sure I had enough coffee and my meal was good. I will definitely be back!

This is the best brunch place in Denver. I wanted to try everything on the menu. I ended up getting the Grits deluxe which is a specialty of theirs. It has Gouda cheese and bacon bits with eggs on top. I also got a side of pancakes which were so fluffy and perfectly cooked. There is usually a long wait for this place so get there early. They are about to stop accepting call a heads too. I recommend sitting outside if you can, they have a great view of Sloans lake.

The food was mediocre at best, but the service was excellent. I got the southwest Benedict which was super bland, my friend ordered the steak breakfast burrito which was also bland. The French toast on the other hand was fantastic as we're the bottomless mimosas. I would go back, but I would out other brunch places higher on my list.
Natashia was an amazing server! Definitely will be coming back again. Food was great, the service was perfect.
The staff are very helpful and friendly and accommodating, nice atmosphere, and tasty food!

My stand by place. Call ahead to put your name on the list. Crowded between 11-1. Patio is great with views of sloans lake and park. Cheapest bottomless mimosas in Denver  $8.50 Saturday through Monday.  Your glass is never empty. Great food and specials daily. Burgers available. Breakfast Burrito is a fav.

I don't write many reviews but we had an absolute incredible experience here. We drive by and always see this place loaded for brunch so we went last Saturday and waited out the wait with some delicious mimosas and beautiful views of sloans lake and downtown denver. Now here is why I'm really writing the review, our server was Jill. She was probably the best server we have had in all of Denver. she was very personable, HILLARIOUS, and very prompt with our mimosas and food and etc. will def be back! this place rocks in my opinion!!
My Monday breakfast spot! The eggs Benedict is amazing!  Jill is always extremely nice and enthusiastic!

Cashed in on a friends suggestion to pay Ruperts a visit for breakfast.  There were 6 of us who sat out on the patio for breakfast, we were quickly seated with no wait (8am).
I had the chicken fried steak, came with 2 biscuits on top and smothered in gravy, 2 eggs & potato pancakes.  The biscuits were very dense, needed extra gravy for those two bad boys, very good.  My wife had gluten free pancakes that also came with eggs,  she absolutely loved it.
Others at the table had corned beef hash and a breakfast sandwich with Texas toast, I forget the name but snapped a pic.  There would be no leftovers this morning.
Great food, ambience, service & view!!
By 8:45a it started to get crowded & by time we left, 9:30ish, it was packed.

Just got back from a late breakfast/lunch at Rupert's and have to say I really liked the place. We had quite a wait to get seated, but that is understandable at such a popular place. And I can see why it is so popular. Great food, I had the chili bowl and it was just what I was hungry for. Not overwhelming hot, but flavorful. The sunny side up egg was perfect. My husband had the truffle scramble. He enjoyed it and from the taste I had I think that is on my list to have there some day.

Even though it took a bit to get seated, the servers were right there ready to help, got us coffee, cream, water and such quickly. Took our order and seemed be at our table so quickly I wondered if they had over heard us talking about what we wanted before we got sat down!

I was not impressed by the coffee, it was not horrible, just not as good as I was hoping for after waiting for such a long time. Next time I know to bring my own and enjoy while I am waiting and get another drink. I did really enjoy the orange juice. I am not much a juice drinker but it sounded good and it was. I am sure the mimosas are great too, just did not feel like starting drinking yet today.
Thanks Jill! We always have an awesome time when we come in on Mondays! This place is great. Bottomless Mimosa Mondays!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Sam was the best server I've ever had! So sweet and took really good care of us! Great personality and cute as a button! I will definitely be coming back, you should give this girl a raise!!!

My family visited Rupert's on Christmas Eve for a mid-morning breakfast.  The place was packed!  The service, however, did not suffer.  Our waitress was kind, attentive, cheery, and helpful! The food was, for the most part, great.  For the most part.  

I had the veggie benedict, though I subbed in the green chili hollandaise.  Since I love heat, this proved to be an excellent choice!  My husband had the sweet potato, corn, and black bean hash.  He also thoroughly enjoyed his dish.  Unfortunately, that's where the good news ends.  My daughter ordered the truffle scramble, and though she was really looking for it, she was extremely disappointed.  There was SO much truffle oil on her eggs that she could hardly eat.  In fact, it not only ruined her meal, but the smell was so overwhelming, that it impacted all of us.  I had to move away from her plate.  It was too bad.  Correctly executed, I'm sure the dish would have been amazing.  Too much of a good thing, even truffle, can be really bad.  Bummer!  

Other than the truffle oil incident, Rupert's proved to be a good little spot.  I'm sure we'll give it a second try, and hopefully we can give it four stars next time!

This has become our weekend go-to spot if we're up early enough to sneak in without a wait or if I've had the sort of week that demands a Saturday morning mimosa celebration. The food is definitely better than typical diner food, service is always friendly and they do $9 bottomless mimosas. When it's nice out, it's lovely to enjoy the lovely view of the lake. When it's gross out, it's lovely to sit and stare at the snow while you stuff your face with comfort food and cocktails and delight in how warm and comfy you are compared to the freezing hell that's happening outside.

We're slowly working our way through trying the whole menu and everything so far has ranged from good to awesome. If you're a little hungover and super starving the breakfast BLT has magic hangover dissolving powers, I swear. The dude has only good things to say about the gouda grits which are a weekend special and if you're a savory grits person, go for it before they run out. If you want the super-cool kid dining experience go ahead over to Snooze and wait 2 hours for weekend brunch, but if you want good food and all the mimosas your little booze loving heart could desire then just go to Rupert's and find something cool to do with the time you just saved yourself.

The best french toast with Nutella ever.  Jalapeño bacon was delicious.  The owner came out and spoke with us very very nice!
they also have a pet friendly patio.
we will be back.

Best hash browns, and biscuits and gravy!  Best patio in the west side of Denver,  looking at Sloan Lake and the Denver skyline.  Get there early, and eat, then take a walk around the lake,  comfy, quality, value,  I love that in a place!

I'm not much of a breakfast gal, but I enjoyed this place. I've been there twice now, I have to say I liked what I order the first time.. I thought the chicken fried steak was purdy bomb! It came with biscuits on top so it was like a two for one dish(biscuits and gravy...yum). There bloody Mary's were also great, they were 2 for 1. I also thought the French toast was super good! The second time I got a stuffed poblano pepper, wasn't too impressed. Overall it was ok. I'll probably be by again to try there mimosa and have another Bloody Mary.. Oh yea I almost forgot, I loved the potato cakes super good!!

So...story of my life, I am in love with mashed potatos, best food in the universe in my opinion. I've always wanted them for bfast, but hesitated due to societal norms on so called 'bfast foods'...ruperts solved this life long problem for me! In steps the gouda grits with bacon!!! Smooth, creamy, rich, cheesy, and TOTALLY ACCEPTABLE as bfast food! Yumyumyum!

We frequently stop by Rupert's for brunch and it used to be great.  Something has happened over the past few months where it has become very average.  Every time we visit, they screw up an order or we have to wait 10+ minutes for drinks.  

They have a creative menu and a fantastic location overlooking Sloan's Lake.  Lots of potential, but it just does not come together.
Service is excellent, friendly, and fast. Location is perfect, views of the lake.  THE BEST Benedict I've ever had!!!

We drove the 25 minutes to Rupert's this morning to give it a try based on the reviews. It's a cute diner, clean looking. Our waitress, Shannon, was welcoming and stayed on top of things. The $8.50 bottomless mimosas are awesome and they don't do the "give you one then come back in 15 minutes to refill you" thing. If you keep drinking them, they WILL keep filling them!
I had the Lobster Benedict, which was pretty good. My husband had the Breakfast Burrito. It had pulled pork and green chili they said was house-made. He said it was really good.
Definitely give this place a try, it's a great brunch spot.

We've been to Rupert's many times. This time around we sat at the bar and had such a wonderful experience with Amberin! She took such great care of us. Best experience dining at Rupert's since we started coming here. LOVE this place and we loved the phenomenal service as well! Keep it up!

The burrito with the added chorizo is to die for!! It is HUGE too so be prepared to have leftovers. Or not, because it's so good you eat it all anyway. There has been a wait every time we've gone but the lake is right across the street so you can go enjoy that since they will text you when your table is ready. We have had great service and the ambiance inside is nice. Love it here!!
Perfect location for outside seating!  Loved the grits bowl and the spicy Bloody Mary was excellent.  If I am back in the area I will definitely be returning!  Excellent service!

Not only was the food and bottomless mimosas great, but the service was seriously impeccable! Natasha was our waiter and she was so attentive to us and made sure we were taken care of! I had heard this place was great so to go and actually experience how great this place was says a lot! If you want a laid back, casual bottomless brunch, I highly recommend Rupert's!
Rupert's is a great breakfast and brunch spot right off of Sloan's Lake. The food is good and the service is always phenomenal. Our server Jamie was perfect and we will definitely come back.

I love that this amazing spot is so close to home. I have tried their Carrot Cake Pancakes, Classic Benedict, Southwest Benedict, and also their Biscuits & Gravy. I have to say their Southwest Benedict is my absolute favorite. It is a very original and tasty dish, and it also pairs nicely with a spicy Bloody Mary. Give it a try!

Unique and incredibly tasty breakfast grub. 

I ordered home made hash (veggie) and poached eggs with carrot pancakes. She (my wife) ordered, the "Sloan's breakfast" with 2 eggs, sausage, and chocolate hazelnut stuffed french toast(!!!).

She was skeptical about my carrot pancakes (secretly I knew she'd love them, that is why I ordered them) but as soon as they were on the table and before I could unwrap my silverware, she had both tasted and commandeered them. 

That was it, she was in love and is already talking about coming back. 

Everything we had was awesome. Fast and friendly service with solid views of the lake. 

Good espresso too.

Rupert's is the best breakfast place in Denver! Perfect price, food and location. Sunday football at the bar with Amberin is my favorite way to spend a Sunday morning! Huge thank you to the staff and owners of Rupert's for doing everything right!

Natasha was our server and she was amazing; recommended the best food for my boyfriend ( picky eater) !!! Great costumer service, food was delicious and prices were on point! Will be coming back again !

Friendly service with a smile! Great place for a laid back brunch if you're around Sloan's Lake Park. I ordered the Southwest Benedict for $9.95 and it was tasty. It comes with a side of potato cakes hash which was yummy. I asked the waitress if they could pour my coffee in a to-go cup and add a little to top it off.  Instead, she gave me a fresh cup. Super nice!

I love this place! I ordered the quiche, which is apparently a new creation every day. Today it included bacon, tomato, and cheese. So dang good! My boyfriend had the breakfast burrito with jalapeño bacon. He loved it also! Cross your fingers that Natasha is your server, she was great!
Awesome food and service. In and out in 30 minutes. Breakfast burrito, the quiche, and Natasha were all great!!

Great place for breakfast. Great food, service and view of lake a plus. Had the biscuits and gravy and it was wonderful. They had this potato pancake that was fantastic. Good brought out fast and hot. Great breakfast choice.

My fiancée and I came in to Colorado for a wedding, and needed to grab some breakfast/brunch. We found Rupert's and thought we'd give it a try. 

They have a front patio seating area that looks out onto a nearby lake, the lake being literally across the street. The patio also allows customers to enjoy the crisp Colorado air while eating their breakfast. We step inside and are greeted by a friendly face that seats us immediately. Our server comes by soon after we are seated to take our drink order, then our food order a little after that. Our burgers come out in about ten or 15 after ordering, which was pretty quick in my opinion considering they had a full house. Our burgers were absolutely divine. Both of us ordered the hangover burger, angus beef, bacon, and an egg with a choice of Parmesan fries, or yam fries for an extra dollar. The bacon was crisp, the burger was juicy, and the egg was a little runny, the way we love it!

We will definitely be coming back to Rupert's any time we are in the Denver area!

FINALLY a restaurant that can cook a soft scrambled egg properly on the FIRST attempt. My hat is off to the Chef, in addition to that the sausage gravy is in my wife's and my opinion is THE BEST IN THIS TOWN. Whether you enjoy it with their HOMEMADE biscuits or their EXCEPTIONALLY seasoned chicken fried steak either is great.  

We'll definitely be back again

Food here is pretty solid. Lots of gluten friendly options (gluten free, but may have been cooked on or near gluten). The $7 bottomless mimosas are killer and the waitresses running around filling and refilling your glass makes for some ruthless headaches, but se la vi! To hell with the day, let's drink.

We have yelp to thank for this one! My husband and I, with our two children, needed a good place to eat for Brunch while in the area and this place was a huge success! Only waited 5 minutes on a Sunday, food was FANTASTIC, view was amazing, service was flawless and we could not find one thing to not like! Our waitress, Shannon, was so happy and attentive! Our $8.50 bottomless Mimosas never had the chance to  empty...heck, it was ALWAYS full. Everyone worked as if they were all a part of a great team and did it happily. The food was hot, fast and was so good! HIGHLY recommended! WE WILL BE BACK!

Rupert's is probably one of the best breakfast spots I've been to in a long time. They have everything you could want and the view just can't be beat. There was no wait when we came here on a Sunday morning, which is a rarity for any breakfast place. The menu is pretty extensive - sweet stuff, healthy stuff, gravy or chile covered stuff, alcoholic stuff. It also seemed like they had a decent selection of mimosas and other day drinking selections. 

I had the peach stuffed french toast, which was a special for the day. Very tasty stuff, but I'm guessing it's gone now. The gouda grits were also awesome. I'm told that grits are not supposed to have cheese in them, but I'm not from the south and they were good and I will order them again and again because I will be back!

Really this is the most delicious place. And little to no waiting because they have an efficient kitchen!  The wait staff is very friendly. 

Try the truffle scramble!

Nice view.  Nothing wrong with my veggie Benedict. Good service. If I lived really close this may have become a go-to spot for me. But i put my proximity-loyalty for this place is low. At least in comparison to Jelly Cafe, which is 6-7 miles from my house in Stapleton. Happy to drive that distance for what they provide. Not a mimosa guy, so take that into consideration with this review.

Carrot cake pancakes! Yes please! 
Bottomless mimosas were a little more than other places, but the menu is full of items to help your cheat day from your diet.
Probably great for a hangover brunch as well.

I want so badly to like this place. The first experience was a letdown. We went here because of the reviews, views, and dog friendly patio. After being seated we moved tables when asked so they could sit a large party together. Ordered the bottomless mimosas and after the first glass went the entire meal without a refill despite being told it was on its way when our food was served. The food was good, and served quickly. It would have been nice to know that when it says "choice of meats" that some of the options they tell you cost extra. They tried to make things right by comping my mimosa and offering a refill as we were paying the check, that is why I gave this rating rather than lower. I may give it a second chance.

This place is amazing. Ive visited 4 times and the most recent time was the best. We came in about 30 minutes before close and got treated like it was the first table of the morning, Shannon was our server and she was so bubbly and helpful and kind and the food was amazing as always. The value and the service here has NEVER let down, and I bring everyone I know here. Such a fan! Keep up the amazingness Ruperts!

I'm sad to say this but this is my first "bad" review in Denver which is a shocker! I got a breakfast burrito (roasted pork) and I enjoyed absolutely nothing on it. I was starving but could only bear half of it. My friend did not enjoy his burrito either. Not sure what happened there. Pretty disappointed.

I wanted to post a follow-up to say that the service at this restaurant has improved considerably. I've been here 2 times since my past review and have had nothing but good experiences. I hope this place continues to do well, the owner has put together a better team (or maybe better training) and has earned my business!

This place is A-OK. I may have given it 4 stars if I would have had the bottomless mimosa (great deal). However, after a rough Friday night, I opted for coffee. For a place that is open primarily for the breakfast and lunch crowds, coffee should be a top priority. However, I couldn't even finish a cup. My other half ordered an Americano and it was also void of great coffee flavor. Overall this place has a great location and looks like it has a nice patio with beautiful Sloan's Lake and downtown views.

Food: The food was also OK. I had the Veggie Benedict. There was nothing great about it. It wasn't horrible, either. It was just OK. I had to use pepper, salt and hot sauce to get it up to par.

Coffee: If this were strictly a coffee shop, this place would have received a scathing review and 1 star. Denver has many great local roasters. I would highly recommend that the owners shop around and change this up for both coffee and espresso drinks.

Staff: The staff was 5 Star worthy. Super nice, friendly and very attentive. If only the food and coffee drinks matched the front of house staff, this place would be a no-brainer for a 5 Star rating.

I only have good things to say about this place. 

1. Excellent service: our server, Ashley, was incredible. She was friendly and answered all of our questions.
2. Amazing food: I had the deluxe chili bowl with a side of jalapeño bacon. It was amazing, especially the potato cakes.
3. Really good coffee. I'm impressed. 
4. We arrived at 9 am on a Thursday (New Year's Eve) and there was no wait.

I would love be to come in the summer and sit outside.  I will definitely be coming back!

Well... Not to much to say about today's visit.  We have been here before after church on Sunday and it was pretty good food wise. Today I came in by myself for breakfast- after being seated I waited approx. 10 minutes before my server showed up for my order (it was not super busy in the restaurant) I ordered a classic eggs Benedict and coffee - although my food did show up quickly there was nothing exciting to it.  Potatoes were two little rounds of tasteless mush.  And the eggs Benedict was lifeless without much taste- a little seasoning would have been good.  Just ok

Awesome spot across the street from the lake and we were able to get a table on the patio fairly quickly. The server was great and the breakfast menu hit the spot. Their 'weekday mimosa' was delicious and filled to the brim for only $4.50.
The only complaint was that our waitress, Shannon, took our order and tacked on extra charges for the 3 blueberries in the pancakes that came on the side. She mentioned the extra $1 charge for choosing a side of fruit, but when saying we could pick toast or pancakes - blueberry, strawberry, or plain - she failed to mention that those weren't standard options and the blueberry version was $1.25 charge. Not a big deal if she had mentioned it rather than acting like the options were all the same. They forgot our avocado on our omelet and it didn't come out until we were nearly finished with the meal, so that was a bit of a bummer.

All in all it's a great breakfast spot and luckily there are some extra parking spots in the back.

I loved this place! Bottomless Mimosa's! (even while you wait for a table) Only took about 20-25 min to get seated or two Mimosa's... 
I was eyeballing the Gouda grits on the special board and was saddened when they erased it before we got our table, but I was not sad for long! 
I had the truffle scramble, and it's all I can think about- it was so good, perfectly fluffy eggs, with just the right amount of crunch from the fresh asparagus! Yum! The crispy on the outside,creamy in the middle potato pancake was a great companion to the eggs, throw in a side of toast and it's what I call a great breakfast!  Everyone was super nice and friendly here; even with the busy atmosphere! Definitely coming back here again!

Rupert's is a good neighborhood breakfast restaurant. The food is nothing to write home about but it is consistently good, just wish they would step it up a notch to make it great as it has the potential. The staff are always friendly and courteous which is nice. The view of Sloan Lake is amazing from Rupert's.

We have lived in the neighborhood for a couple of years now and this is our go to place when we want to walk to breakfast as it is close to home. We wish they would change the menu every once in awhile as it has not changed once since we've been visiting there, even with the change of ownership they did not change the menu which seems a little strange to me. Overall, good but could be better.

Food was excellent but even better was the view of the lake as we sat outside to have breakfast. 
Our server, Hannah was great & provided the friendly service you'd expect at a place like this. 
I'll certainly be back sooner than later.

Oh.  My.  Gosh!  So good!!  I had the Truffle Scramble and it was slightly sweet and definitely savory.  The asparagus was perfectly cooked with no fibrous pieces.  The cheese was perfectly melty.  The truffles added a light tasty flavor.  This amount of food normally would have been to much for me, but between the lightness of the dish and the wonderful flavor it went down easy and I could easily eat more.  Wish I had more.  Next time...  Mental note: must come early!
Great food and very friendly service. Definitely recommend. Nice place to enjoy food while sipping a mimosa with a perfect view of the lake.

Yummy food and friendly staff. We got the scramble (which also comes with potato cakes-delish!-and pancakes!) and the corned beef hash. So far, our favorite hash around town! Shredded corned beef instead of chunks :D

The food was excellent as well as our server today Shannon. We've come here many times and today was outstanding. We really appreciate her attentiveness(especially when it comes to bottomless mimosas) her knowledge of the menu, and for thinking of our pup by bringing water. Thanks again Shannon!

I really like this place!! The food is delicious. You can enjoy Sloan's Lake & the view of downtown Denver from the patio!! Great music (they played Widespread Panic!) and very friendly staff! Excellent experience Everytime:)

Quaint little breakfast spot by the lake. Sit on the patio if you can! Service is anywhere from good to excellent every time I'm here. Never less. I brought a very picky vegan friend the last time I was here- the waitress was a good sport when it came to all of her difficult questions and my friend enjoyed her food thoroughly. The bottomless mimosas could use a tinge more champagne  but I understand how that goes, as I too serve brunch in Denver.

Awesome!!!  This was our 2nd visit to Rupert's.  We had the chicken fried steak and their stuffed poblano last time.  Both were delicious.  This time we had the stuffed French toast, which was stuffed with a berry almond filling and the corned beef hash.  This place is to die for!  Their potato pancakes are heavenly.  A great combination of crispy and creamy seasoned to perfection.  Their corned beef is made in house and is so delicious that I ate my French toast and came close to eating half of my hubby's dish.  It came with hollandaise sauce, which we thought was weird at first, but man did it taste awesome.  Rupert's is casual, comfortable and has a good view of Sloan's lake.  We are definitely coming back, it may even be our new Saturday breakfast spot.
Just stopped by for lunch and made the right choice,a really nice place with great service and delicious food,thank you for that

Based off of the reviews i hesitatingly would be willing to try this place again but only if walking in. I got delivery and my $35 order arrived smelling like it hung out at a cigarette filled bar for an hour. It STUNK something fierce. I totally lost half of my appetite just off of that. Try the wonton soup and it was awful. Wontons were an off/odd color, broth had nothing to it other than bad broth- no cabbage -no nothing. Threw that in the trash after two bites. Then got garlic beef, asked for spicy and it was SOOoO overly sweet. Im really hoping  I just hit them on a horrible day, because this was just all across the board a waste of my money. There are way more delivery options around I like and trust more.

My favorite Chinese food place, have been going here for years and they have always had the same great tasting food. I actually never dine in always take Togo. The staff is very friendly and always generous when my need of soy sauce, fortune cookies, or chopsticks. For the most part my order has always been right with minimal problems. The few times I did have a problem it was just something left out in my order that they gladly fixed the next time . So overall I'll be returning

It's ok, decent delivery Chinese food. We got pork lo mein  (pretty bland, and not many veggies included), also sweet and sour chicken (basic), as well as the sesame prawns (which were delicious). I would try again and try some other dishes. Price comparable to other Chinese restaurants, but thought it was too bland for the price.
