We good awesome Chinese near home, Hurray!  Been here on several occasions always to go, so can't review on table service. Food is worth a big nod. 

They also deliver, even in the Alexander and Arapahoe area. We used their service once, and it was fast, friend, and food came warm. Maybe one of these times we will try a sit down meal. In the meantime we will keep coming back.
Always our favorite!!!! Great food, great prices, and always ready or delivered by when they say or earlier.
One of our all time favorite Chinese restraints. Great fresh tasting food with super service.

This is our favorite Chinese restaurant. My daughter likes the sesame chicken, and I like the sesame beef. The service is always good and the food is outstanding. It's nice having a great Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood. If you haven't tried it you should.

I decided to try this place, due to some co-workers enjoying some of your items. First off: I asked for extra soy sauce and got nothing. Second: when you ask for fried rice, I don't think brown steamed rice is going to cut it. Third: the egg foo young, was gross and the shrimp was on the outside of it as a garnish drenched in a brown sauce. Last: the sesame seed chicken only had the seeds as a garnish also. I spent way to much money here, to only get home and wonder what's for dinner. VERY disappointed and will not spend any money here again

I love this place when I need my Chinese food fix!  The Happy Family is probably the best that I have eaten.  Fresh crisp vegetables every time, with a large portion of chicken, shrimp, beef and pork!  Can't get enough of those Snow Peas!  The restaurant itself is extremely clean and the staff is phenomenal!  This is one of my regular hotspots and will continue to be
Best Asian Chinese food! Quick delivery, fresh food, and tastes amazing. We had lunch sesame chicken, Mongolian beef, and Hunan delight. Delish!! Great value too.
Consistently the best General Tso's chicken and sesame chicken in the area. Their lunch specials are unbeatable and their delivery times are always shorter than they tell you.

Thought id try paradise, awful experience. BE AWARE when you get TAKE OUT and they mess up your order, THEY AREN'T HAPPY to fix it, and HANG UP ON YOU!! Very unprofessional. On the other hand, just down smokey hill by Kings, in the strtch of stores by the subway their is a fantastic Chinese restaurant that offers delivery as well. Better off sticking to one where customer service matters.

I was there on sunday at 8pm with my family. We were not sure what time they close. We checked it say 9 pm, went inside, waitress was already vacuum the place and was not at all happy seeing us there.
There was a another girl on the counter she was smiling all the time.
Food was really good though, but this waitress never smiled not even once, which made our dinner worst, if these kind of waitress can not provide customer service, they should go back to the owner and should say I QUIT.
Please look into the matter

We stopped in the other evening after our painting (and drinking) class.  It was 30 minutes to close, and they were not that busy.  They cheerfully accommodated our late arrival.  So, they truly lived up to what they state on their website, "Open late for your convenience".  In return, we vowed to order and eat quickly.  The menu was fairly large and the prices reasonable.  

We tried a couple appetizers.  The pan fried pork dumplings were well-cooked and tasty.    The won-ton soup was just fine.  I had no complaints about my Mongolian Beef.  Others at the table seemed to really enjoy the Curried Shrimp.  Similarly, the Lo Mein was well received by our table.  Service was good. The food was hot.  And they did not skimp on the rice.  At the end of the meal, there was a pleasant surprise.  Instead of the standard fortune cookie, we each enjoyed a small piece of coconut cake.  It was a nice sweet couple bites with which to finish our meal.

I would definitely come again.  The lunch prices appear especially affordable.

Great lunch specials and perfect service!  Today was 2nd visit since the new owner too over.  New wait staff and new kick to the menu.  If you are near Smoky Hill and E-470 area during lunch time and hungry, this is the place to stop by.  For $5.50, you get soup, crunch noodles, main dish (shrimp is bit higher) that comes with steamed rice or fried rice, cheese wonton, egg roll, fried rice and your main dish.  All this served in nice setting, quite and best of all, great service.  One of the girl actually remembered the drink my hot date ordered last time.  Wow.  

I usually get garlic chicken and as I remembered last time, it was perfect to my taste.  

Good job guys, I m coming back again.  
I was gonna give 4 stars but dont know why I kept one out so Im giving full 5.  
Great value, clean restaurant, perfect service.. what more can I ask for?

Alan is back!

Paradise was our go-to Chinese restaurant a few years ago, but after Alan left, the quality of food declined and the service was subpar.

Now that he's back, the food is great once again, and Crystal, our server, was fantastic.  So glad to have our favorite place back in the groove!

This is still the best Chinese restaurant in town! I usually order take out and stick with a few dishes like sesame chicken; chicken lo mien; and Mongolian beef all are excellent dishes. Highly recommend it!! We did not like chicken fried rice--- too dry and bland but it's okay we are quite happy with the other dishes that are consistent in taste. Hope this restaurant stays open for many years to come!!

I really enjoy the walnut prawns/ shrimp. Huge portions and it comes with nice steamed broccoli. I've ate in and done take out both great experiences service good and take out fast. Mu shu pork was excellent and great as leftovers the next day.

I've been eating at this place for nearly a decade. Their food and service are both very good. I mostly get my order to go but have dined in upon occasion. They never leave you waiting too long either way. 

I typically stick to the chicken dishes- all which have proved to be very good. It is always cooked correctly and not greasy like many other Chinese restaurants. My only wish is that they would include an extra something in their fried rice aside from egg. Throw in some onions or something for a little bit of added flavor please :)
I love this place. The general Taos chicken is amazing highly recommend it.

Ordered their 2 for 20 special hoping that it would be a deal. But they gave me two lunch portions with side of crab cheese wantons. Which is what they cost based on the menu, so it is not really a deal. When I called them, Alan (manager) told me that there is nothing he can do, it is what it is. So, I went across the street to East Dynasty - they do not play games and do not offer a deal which is not really a deal.

This is our favorite option for Chinese in this area. The food is great and they are very accommodating for changes to meals. The portions are a little small for the price but the food is great. We usually go with the chicken with vegetables and sweet and sour combination and we have never been disappointed. My kids also love the crab wontons.

Well...coming from Chicago 6 years ago, I've been on the search for a good Chinese restaurant.  It seems many are on the west side of Denver.  Living in southeast Aurora...they are hard to come by.  Paradise is a refreshing new find for me.  The food is good, not outstanding but really pretty good.  We had the lunch for $6.50 - $7.00.  A very good deal!  Includes soup (Hot Sour is not as good as East Cafe's on Missisippi & Chambers), eggroll (mediocre) , crab wonton and main dish.  Portions are good sized but not too much you can't finish.  Nice touch...they warm your dipping sauces!!  Definately will return.

This is our go to place for chinese. The Sesame Beef is really, really good. We have been eating here since it opened and have never had any issues with food or service. My husband has a food allergy and they are always accommodating.

I actually came here once a while ago and meant to review this.  For the price they charged for the shrimp with lobster sauce, a dish I get a lot, they sure did give me a small portion.  And yes it was well past their lunch hours and  I didn't  expect that portion to be a lunch sized portion.  Needless to say, not only was I pissed off for spending that amount of money I was also hungry and the amount of food I got was not enough to satisfy my hunger.  Also, I have nothing against this place personally but what I ordered wasn't that great from the start.  So in conclusion I ventured here once and haven't been back since.

I had a coupon for a free soda or Thai tea with my purchase, and they didn't bring it when they delivered my food :( I was with clients when my food arrived so I didn't get the chance to check Until 30 minutes later. I don't like their rice, but their noodles are really good.

Recently, around Sept or Oct of this year, Paradise Asian was sold to another person.  My wife and I thought we would see how the new owners fared. We ordered dinner at the restaurant on a Dec Wednesday evening. We had Hot and sour soup, spring rolls, mu shu pork and orange beef, not spicy, white rice came with the meal, and tea. The bill came to $26.00 and change. 

Overall the food was good, nice little spice kick for the hot and sour soup. Hot mustard was definitely spicy. The orange beef, crispy and tender, though not paper thin as another reviewer described it.  The mushu pork they rolled for you, and all you needed to do was unroll and apply your own hoisin sauce and re-roll it.

Comparing Paradise to Ambrosia which is just down the street on Liverpool, we felt that Paradise is better than Ambrosia with Similar pricing.

Overall, an average Chinese restaurant, good food and service, not spectacular, not bad for the suburbs.  There are other Chinese restaurants in the area, but they are about 9 miles or more away from Paradise Asian Cafe.

We came in for dinner at 8:15. I asked for gluten free items, and selected the lemon chicken our server suggested. My husband ordered egg foo young. After roughly 10 minutes or more, the server came back out to say they were all out of egg foo young for the day. It takes too long to make, and therefore we could not order. What?? It's an omelette! My husband placed a different order of chow mein. His food came out so fast, it makes me wonder if it was pre-made and just heated in a microwave. My lemon chicken comes a couple minutes later, Although it did look good, it was two huge chicken cutlets dredged in flour and fried. I said that was not was I was expecting since I requested gluten free items only. The server said yes, it's just flour on the chicken. I informed her that flour has gluten. She promptly whisked it away. I told her I did not want anything else. This whole situation has just gotten too bizarre. She then offered me brown rice. Gee, thanks. If you are going to be running a restaurant, it's probably a good idea to know a little bit about food and ingredients. We used to be frequent diners of Paradise when they first opened. Over the years, the service and quality just keeps declining. This restaurant has changed ownership and staff, and they are driving it into the ground. We were the ONLY people in the restaurant. In previous years the place would be packed. This was our last visit to Paradise Asian Cafe.

My husband and I have eaten here several times over the years but I always avoid the chicken fried rice as they are large flat pieces of chicken that are always under-cooked.  Well, I forgot the last time we were there and ate several bites before realizing it.  I got incredibly sick and have been for three days now.  Unfortunately, because of this experience I will never go back.

I honestly wouldn't recommend going here unless you're purposely seeking out a terrible experience. We've ordered from Paradise Cafe 9 times. Of those 9 times, 8 of those experiences included messed up orders. Today my family ordered 3 take out meals, and when we got home, we saw that one of the meals was wrong (it was supposed to be combination fried rice with no peas or carrots, and was instead chicken friend rice with peas and carrots). When I went in to pick up the order, I specifically asked if it was combination fried rice with no peas or carrots, and was told yes. Since I was in a rush, I took them for their word, paid, and left. When I got home, I saw that not only was it not what we'd ordered, but they'd neglected to give us the receipt inside of the bag despite me asking. After calculating it, we found that they had charged us for the price of combination fried rice (which is more expensive) but had given us only chicken fried rice. When we tried to call back and get what we had actually ordered, they refused. At this point, we're done. I'd strongly suggest going to honey bee asian bistro, moon thai, or any of the other more competent take out restaurants. This place is over priced, the quality of food leaves a lot left to be desired, and they're apparently incapable of getting orders right 90% of the time.

Terrible experience. We ordered food for delivery. Delivery time was 15 minutes later than promised.  The food was cold once delivered and portion sizes less than expected. The sweet and sour chicken was without sauce and when we called about it they did sent out more sauce but it took 25 more minutes to get it.  The food was not very good and when we asked for a discount the manager was very rude and would not accommodate unless we would bring the chicken back into the restaurant (which defeats the purpose of delivery and paying a delivery charge). Will not order or go to this  restuarant ever again.

Whenever I visit my parents in Denver, we always make a point of eating here. 

The orange beef is amazing. Sliced very thin, super crispy, with a sauce that is perfectly balanced- sweet and spicy. I've still not found a place in Chicago that compares.

The prices are super reasonable, too.

I left a tip in cash and just found out they charged my card extra and added their own tip. They stole my money so make sure you check your bank account and always keep your receipt. Waitress was very serious and cold, made me feel very uncomfortable. The food was not that great and super over priced. I will not go here again. If you want a good experience, go to a Vietnamese restaurant instead. Hope this helps!
Good Chinese food plain and simple.

This is one of our go-to chinese take out/delivery places in our neighborhood.  I generally get the sesame chicken.  I like it because it is a true balance of sweetness + spice.  I have eaten at the restaurant only once, but it was a nice experience with attentive wait staff and a pleasant decor. Plenty of parking since it is a shopping center.  The delivery is always quick too - generally get the food within 30 minutes of placing the order!  Can't complain!  It doesn't have too many exotic choices, but the old stand-bys are done well.
We order takeout from Paradise at least once a month and the food is always satisfying and delicious.

I'm pretty bland when it comes to Chinese, usually only like Chicken Fried Rice or Sweet and Sour chicken. Paradise is one of the few we hit pretty regularly and they always deliver within 30 minutes. The food is always top-notch, for being standard delivery Chinese food :)

This is where we usually order Chinese take out. I wouldn't say it's worth driving out of your way for but if you live in the area it is a quick and easy place to get decent take out. We have eaten in the restaurant and I wouldn't bother going back to eat in but take out is fine

I was disappointed that they would not deliver to my home because my order was 1.00 short of the delivery order total, I asked if I could use that 1.00 in addition to my tip to give to the driver. They said no and made me order more (really). Then upon delivery the driver had no change sini had to give him additional tip.
Customer service is above and beyond. We ordered and when my son did not pick up the food they brought it to our free of charge. It was great food too!

This place has gone downhill in the past couple years. We ordered a few dishes, one being beef and broccoli and I am really not sure if it was actual beef. The color and consistency were very odd, even my daughter made a comment about it. We threw the menu out tonight as there are numerous chinese restaurants to order from around here that are a lot better for the same price.
The poo poo platter was ok.  My wife wished for brown rice but their steamed and fried rice is good.  Her sesame tofu was yummy as was my curry chicken.  No complaints.

My husband and myself have met here for our weekly lunch date for about 3 years. We were a little worried when it changed hands and things were trying to settle down, but pleased that it is still our go to place. Hot and sour soup is a little lacking to what it used to, but getting my rice in a heart shape makes up for it.
Paradise is the best in the area. We have tried many Chinese restaurants as it is my favorite food. The staff is wonderful and remember us when we go in. Delivery is great also. Give it a try!!
Love this place!  The food is always good, the people are constantly kind, and delivery is normally under 30 minutes.   Best in the neighborhood!

Paradise Asian Cafe is one of the hidden gems in Southeast Aurora, situated just minutes from the Southlands Mall.  The food quality and service levels simply can't be beat.  The decor is modern and attractive.  We've eaten their about 20 times within the past year, and find the consistency to be far superior to any of the dozen similar restaurants in the area.  

Amazed at the consistency of their quality, I discovered that each day, the owner oversees and tastes the preparation of the sauces, so that you will always find them fresh and according to the highest standards of the attentive owner.  He also makes sure that there are a colorful variety of fresh vegetables, so that you enjoy the same fine quality on any day of the week.  I've tried about 12 different entries and have almost always found superb.

Been there twice - once for lunch, once for dinner...  Coming from the SF bay area, we are spoiled for choices in Chinese restaurants...  And being of Chinese heritage, it ups the ante even further...  The food here is what I'd call "generic" Chinese food...  Basic, sometimes bland, sometimes OK, not inedible, but not a memorable food experience either.  It's passably Chinese food, but sort of the American version of what Chinese food would be like...

I was looking for a good, relatively inexpensive steak, and I found it!

My wife and I started with the green chili mussels, (Yes, green chili mussels!) and they were fantastic. I ordered the T-Bone, which was big, delicious and grilled to perfection. Wifey had the green chili burger, which was spicy and yummy. With dinner I was served a fresh, chilled salad, baked potato and Texas toast. 

We had the mussels, the steak and burger and wifey had two margaritas for $45!!! Our waitress was friendly and prompt with drink refills and everything was served quickly. We will definitely be back. Don't miss an opportunity to check this place out!

Still my go to place for steaks. Been here about 12 times now and it's usually solid (food quality and service). Take out can be hit or miss. I've had a few times where something wasn't cooked right or they gave me a loaded baked potato wrapped up with the loaded sides packaged. Sometimes they fully dress it and package it (preferred). Plastic wear is almost never given... I have to grab it myself. 

All in all I'm still impressed with how good the food is and will keep coming back. It's just short of that 5 star rating for me... but if you're close and have an hour or so... drop by and try it out.

It's a bar with steaks. Friendly service, good beer, but very loud.  We went on a Friday night and the jukebox was blaring.  We both had T-bone steaks, which were prepared the way we requested, but weren't anything I couldn't do at home.  The steaks weren't aged, didn't have any special seasonings, etc.  Just basic down home food.
Pros:  Good prices, decent food
Cons:  Super loud, the steaks aren't bad but nothing special

Checked yelp on the way to Red rock, found this place with such high reviews, so we decided to give it a shot. First impression: friendly and welcoming atmosphere. Food is ok, the salad was great, the steak taste good, a little towards the salty side, but the mushrooms are so salty that I can't eat it at all! Husband ordered the burger, it came out like a Mexican dish, a burger bun on the very bottom, then the hamburger patty, then it covered with green chili sauce. The sauce taste good, however the fries were disappointing. Nice server, but not very helpful. I try to just letting her know the mushrooms were way too salty when she check on us:
Her: how's everything?
Me: the mushrooms are so salty!
Her: great! (Walked away)
I don't think she heard what I said, it's just like a mandatory quick check on you then walk away.

Friends invited us with great  recommendations. I was amazed at the boutique quality of each dish. Green chili fries are fabulous. Wedge salad best I've had. Our steaks were perfect. We always head to the Keg for great food. We'll be back to 5281 instead.
Great food, great prices. Friendly Staff, fun atmosphere what more could you want? Just don't come expecting Ruth's Chris. Expect a good steak though.

Located right off the highway in a shopping center near Home Depot this bar turned resturant has TVs, GREAT food and impeccable service! I decided to make my own salad with ALL the fixing...OMG huge mushrooms, apple wedges, choice of steak, chicken, salmon and more on top of spring lettuce (my personal fav). Everything was FRESH, nice size portions, well stocked bar, reasonable prices and clean bathrooms! The owner is also very personable, which enhanced the laid back atmosphere and down home feel!

We just left this adorable restaurant. Atmosphere was very homey and welcoming. And the food was great, a perfect steak and salad. The wait staff was friendly and on top of there game. 5 stars pleasant experience

I have been here 3 times. Steaks are really good but that's about it. Side options aren't great and I definitely would not call this a seafood place. Once I ordered a salad and it was so drenched in dressing that nothing was edible but the salmon.
Amazeballs! Great service- great food! Nice little joint in a strip... Casual atmosphere, friendly peeps!

Great food, drink and Colorado atmosphere. Right along the  foothills off of c-470 and Quincy is this family owned gem. Particularly the green chile here is irresistible and I can't pass up seconds sometimes. Steaks are cooked well and aren't ridiculously priced. Bar is well stocked and drinks are well prepared. All in all a great find for an any day visit.

Great local place! Had a porterhouse which was delicious and the wife had the salmon with she loved. We shared the crab legs and fire shrimp and it was wow! Kids loved theory food as well. Definitely will be back!!

What I look for in a restaurant:
1.  Friendly greeting
2.  Frequent refills
3.  Knowledgeable staff, clear delivery of specials, attentive order taking
4.  Portions that match the pricing
5.  Quality of food

What I got at 5281:
1 - 5 were met and exceeded expectation.  I ordered the 5281 salad which is a delicious and fresh salad topped with peel and eat shrimp and a strip steak cooked to perfection!!!  My husband ordered the cheesy burger which came with FRESH, hand cut fries, and side of ranch (which is delicious).  It probably sounds silly, but I am always a bit delighted when you don't have to remind the server about the side of sauce that you requesting during the order process.  You will also see the owner moving about the front of the house and making sure the guests are all enjoying their choices.  
We have also eaten here for weekend brunch and the food is fantastic and way less expensive than the chain competitors.  

Stop reading my review and get your tail over 5281 SS&B
Good food, friendly staff and owner checking on his customers to make sure their experience is a positive one

Nothing special about this place or the food. The waitress was good, filled drinks quickly etc. the biggest disappointment was my daughters food. We ordered her Mac and cheese with fruit. We got box Mac and cheese with a cup of dole mandarin oranges. If they put that much effort into her food, what were the adult meals constructed from!?

Found this little gem coming back from Evergreen. While it is in a strip mall and the outside is very non-descript, the food was surprisingly good. Our steaks were very well seasoned, salted fresh cut fries (skinny ones at that), baked potato and salad were tasty as well. Prices were very reasonable for a steak with sides. Menu is fairly small but enough to choose from. Servers were very nice and friendly as well. Do not rule this one out by the looks from outside. Great little hole in the wall to add to your list!

Clean place, great service, the food is great and very inexpensive. My wife and I stopped in before a red rocks concert and were pleasantly surprised.  It doesn't look like much on the outside, but very nice on the inside. Kind of a casual place with great food. I had a NY strip, my wife had a filet and we split some peel n eat shrimp. The steaks were prepared perfectly and everything tasted great!  It's only 10 minutes from red rocks, so it will be a staple for us every time we go to a concert.

Mark the owner and Kristy the server are smoking right on it! And then there is the T-Bone....best I've had in a very long time. HUGE portions. Everything was served promptly. The owner helps the server (obviously a leader from the front).

I would highly recommend this place. Tommy's Subs next door is the best as well. This stripmall is the one stop shop for GREAT food and service.

Delicious flavor in the food ordered. Enough coverage to make sure no one was left behind when coming in the door. The menu is small and t shows the cook team had time to perfect it. The New York had great flavor in the crust and the medium cook was done perfectly. Servers knew the menu and specials without  hesitation including a rotational local selection.

We wanted a steak and didn't want to wait in line for Texas Roadhouse nor pay the price as you would at the Keg or Simms Steakhouse! We saw this place pop up and thought we would try it out. We were not disappointed at all!! We had the porterhouse which was so tender and very tasty!! The price of $18.95 was very reasonable for salad Texas toast and baked potato!

Great homemade food!! Serve breakfast, lunch and dinner and really reasonable prices. Owner actually came out and asked us if everything was good! Definitely be headed back to try dinner having only tried the brunch!

Love this place to eat. Fresh food and friendly staff. perfect spot to stop before a Red Rocks concert. Paige the waitress had only been working there for a couple weeks, but she was amazing and gave us great recommendations and was very nice. 10/10 would recommend.

Pleasantly surprised by this excellent place, tucked into a strip mall.  The fried shrimp are out of this world.  I had an outstanding, very fresh chicken Caesar salad with homemade croutons.  My son's bacon burger came on Texas toast and was cooked to perfection (and came with a mountain of delicious fries).  Service was also fantastic.  We live 80 miles away but we'll be back for sure!
I really like this place, good food and good people. They now have Sunday Brunch from 9am to 11am. We also enjoyed their brunch!
The best smothered green chili burger that I ever had. Very generous portion of green chili.   Everything made from scratch and a nice selection of craft beer.
Love this place, great steaks and amazing green chili, especially when it's smothering the mussels. Service is always spot on. Be sure to save room for the Death By Chocolate!

My wife and I took a long hike today in nearby Rocksborough Park, and we were ready for a great meal afterwards. We found 5281 on Yelp, and we noticed that it had 15 reviews and averaged a full five stars. Needless to say, we were intrigued. We are not from the southwest side of Denver, but rather Broomfield, so we were in unfamiliar territory. We initially thought this restaurant was in Morrison, but it turned out to be in a nondescript strip mall off of C-470 somewhere. Not exactly eye-appealing. To its left is a run of-the-mill liquor store. To its right is a shop that sells standup paddleboards, run by a wacky lady with whom we had a one-way conversation prior to our meal; I now understand that inflatable boards are not a good purchase, and all of her dresses are meant to be worn in the water but have pockets with no closures. We will drop by to see her again never. As for 5281, let me begin with the ending: this place is fantastic. Quite a surprise, and here are a few details. This place is about eight months old, and the personnel are extremely engaging and friendly. Granted, it was not very crowded at the time we were there, so we were able to spend more time with our server because she pretty much insisted on doing so. Her name was Christi, not to be confused with her colleague named Kristie. Really nice and a bit quirky, we learned a lot about her personal life, including her dual ambitions of becoming either a dentist or a wedding planner. That makes sense, I thought to myself. She moved here from California to be near to her grandmother, and I appreciated this sweet sentiment, although I admit my first inclination was to consider her a runaway serial killer, hiding in the shadow of the Front Range. The menu was amazingly straightforward, with staples such as steak, more steak, baked potatoes, and burgers. But, their specialty is a pork-based green chili. I know, I know, everyone has this. However, it was amazing! It was the last thing I needed before running in an event tomorrow, but I could not hold back. The sample that she brought us was enough for me to uncharacteristically order a green chili burger with fries. Upon completion, I notified my family that it was the best meal I've had in the 21st century. My son is in New York City and my daughter is in Russia, each traveling, but I felt it necessary to text them this information immediately. I began to understand why the ratings were so high at this place. The owner is named Bruno, and he looks exactly like someone named Bruno. He is quite physically imposing, and I would bet my last dollar that he has beat the hell out of several fellas in the old days, probably for the betterment of everyone. My wife agreed with this assessment. Bruno told us that they have been making this green chili for 15 years. In addition to the great food, the clientele is quite mixed, and this is a good sign. On one side of us were some tattooed motorcyclists, and we were flanked by a foursome whose aggregate age was about 500, enjoying a combination of New York strip steak, hits on their oxygen canisters, and some cold beer. I'll take that any day! The decor was fake wood with a copious number of television screens showing various sporting events. And in one corner were a cluster of misplaced paintings that I think were for sale. The long bar served plenty of drinks, and everything is reasonably priced and of high quality. These are folks that you want to succeed in their business. As we departed, practically every employee waved and said goodbye, and did not even seem fake. I may make the long drive back to have the same meal very soon, possibly tomorrow. Maybe even in the morning. I highly recommend that you try this place out and enjoy it as much as we did. It's fun to find a little gem out there, and this is such an example. 5281 is damn fine, by golly.

Went to 5281 tonight for our anniversary because we were looking for good steak and a relaxing atmosphere. This place was great. Food was great and the price was right. The service was excellent. My steak came out a little overdone and they took it back immediately and the owner brought out another in short time that was one of the best steaks I've had in a very long time. They even gave us a free dessert that they make themselves and it was great too. I had to bring it home to finish it! The side salads were not your typical iceberg lettuce with carrot either and were very good. The best part was their green chili!! Excellent! We had the green chili fries and my husband was very impressed! We really liked the food, sporty relaxed atmosphere and good drinks. Great alternative to the other crowded steakhouses in this area. We will be back!
Wonderful! The food was great, prices are fantastic and impeccable service. This is our new neighborhood place to eat!

Thought it was worth a follow up simply to say we have it delivered sometimes and other times we go in and grab it. It is always good and fast. We almost always get #9 spicy. But I will venture off and get tuna on occasion. They have a solid good tuna sandwich. I get it spicy too. I always get a pickle. They aren't what ya go there for, but it adds to the experience if you like pickles. Never had a bad experience with a delivery driver!

I absolutely LOVE! This place! Im from La and there is NOTHING ABSOLUTELY NO place as fast at this one! Their T SHIRTS! Even said " service so fast youll freak" and I certainly FREAKED! Haha the employees greet you as soon as you walk in the door and by rhe tome you fonish paing your sandwich has already been made like two minutes ago! Its like majic! I so love his spot its cheap and the sandwiches are delicious! Not to mention they DELIVER?! What?! I saw an employeed going to deliver a sandwich and she was literally running out the door to her car to deliver it!  aside from great service they have a good sence of urgency! Good job jimmy johns in aurora!

I have been to a few different Jimmy Johns and each one does things a little differently.

This location is pretty awesome. Their bread is always soft while most others are a bit crispy. The employees here are super nice every time I have visited and have yet to mess up an order.

I've noticed that this location is pretty skimpy with the tomatoes. I order a #13 - Gourmet Veggie Club. I consistently get 3 small tomatoes per sub which is pretty wild. Same with the cucumbers, the lettuce however is always abundant. I don't mind a lot of lettuce but would prefer a bit of everything in each bite. Anyways, I now request extra of certain things which seems to give me a normal amount in the end. 

Unfortunately they do not deliver to my area. I will never understand their delivery radiuses.  But, whenever I order online for pickup I arrive 7 minutes later and my stuff is ready!!

Very fast. Very clean. Very friendly. 

I came because a friend text me about their $1 Sandwich day, and I had to try it. There was a long line, but these guys are professionals. The line out the door was made short by their "freaky fast" service. 

Sandwich was very good for being a chain sub shop. Pleasantly surprised.
Use this location all the time from work, very fast drivers! I just wish they'd offer iced tea.  Only the usual coke fountain drinks.

Normally JJs is great and lives up to expectations
Today I ordered mine "unwich".  VERY sloppily made. I had to use knife and fork.
Maybe just a bad day... But remember I chose this place and this sandwich,  meaning I drove by a bunch of other places just to be disappointed
I live a mile and a half away and jimmy johns won't deliver to me. Is it really that big of a deal to deliver less than five minutes down the road? I won't be coming here anymore.

I always love Jimmy johns when I'm hungry for something fast that isn't greasy or unhealthy. I'm gluten free so I get the unwich and I'm so happy it's an option. The only sucky part is they don't deliver to piney creek. Please start delivering to all of piney creek or open one near us!

The taste of the food was great. But it was what it did to me at 12:00pm. Well what it did to me and my father. I had gotten the club lulu and my dad got the #14 with cheese and bacon. im not sure what made us both sick. ill be going to another location for my future subs.

The staff is always so nice and energetic, and not to mention fast. Whether I order it online or order in the store it's always ready right away. I wish they delivered to my house but I never mind driving to this location because their team always makes my day!
So great! Good atmosphere and awesome customer service. We seriously had our food 30 seconds after ordering and it was delicious!
Stupid Fast! I'm talking a 7 minutes average order to doorbell ring. Food is good too.
Food was crap, literally on the toilet pooping from the roast beef.. Think before you cop the "hunters club" it'll hunt your butthole down.

Good friendly staff. Super fast delivery to Hampden & Chambers. They always get our subs to us fast and the order is always right! Never stepped foot into their location but if it's as good as their delivery, not sure you can go wrong.
Had the beach club with bacon. It was super delish! The staff is prompt and uber friendly! Great lunch spot.
I love these guys..they are super fast..fresh, friendly and they never mess up on my order. They are a little pricy though
Food always delish. Delivery fast. Orders always accurate. Sad that prices went up a few months ago. Kind of pricey for a sub.

This is usually my favorite place to order delivery. But let me tell you about today's order. I ordered my son a sandwich and wanted to add cucumbers to it. No big deal right!! Cucumbers are a free add on but no not today some stupid policy in why they couldn't put them on the side or on the sandwich.  Oh but I can pretty much order it the way I wanted it for a dollar more. Come on apparently frees not free at Jimmy Johns!!

I used to love this place, but it has gone down hill in the last year.  Expect almost no sandwich filling and zero chance at wheat bread (unless you just want a regular sandwich).  Delivery still fast, but certainly not a customer service-based restaurant.  Watch for discrepancies in the website as well.  Overall, you might do well to avoid this location if you are able.

As is the case with most, if not all other Jimmy John's locations, this one has it down. Newly opened, sandwiches are served fast as usual.

You can expect the same friendly atmosphere and good sandwiches here, as you already expect from your favorite JJ's location.

Sandwiches are always made just right. Even with a line you're out of there in 5 minutes! Everything is simple, there's not a lot to "add-on" which makes the process painless and smooth. Staff is always pleasant and Super efficient! Parking can be a pain as it's a small strip mall with several entrances and exits and side lots and such.
Its okay - I really didn't care for it.

This locations is Awesome the staff friendly on point and the service here really is FREAK FAST. I eat at the jimmy johns by my work and there OK fast these guys get you in and out with a great sandwich. I have eaten just about everything on the menu. Love there bread I personally recommend the Italian night club and the bootleggers club. Keep up the freaky fast job guys.
Thanks, I ordered online and you guys delivered within 20 min

Rocky Top is a terrific neighborhood bar with lots of Colorado brews on tap and good pub food. It's very affordable and they have many daily specials. The service is very fast and friendly. 

The bar atmosphere is nice, it features open air windows and an outdoor patio. It's a really fun place to watch sports. You would think that its proximity to Regis would make it a full fledged college bar, but it's got a really nice balance of folks who frequent the place.

I'll be back again!

We showed up on a Saturday during the day- 
I've passed by numerous times and heard they got good specials-
Seemed mostly a college hang out-
I also love to play pool and they have 2 tables- 
When we got there I really did not like the atmosphere and felt uncomfortable - 
Although I only went outside to take a phone call-  
People were being loud on the patio and it seemed like it was getting a little out of control- 
I did order food because I was hungry and my cheeseburger with bacon was pretty awesome with fries - (Made the trip in worth it) 
The two guys that were bartending had good customer service with our table and I recognized it- : )
 But as for future visits to the Regis Tavern? Most likely NOT-
9-20-2016
On a Tuesday 
Great night to show -
Came for the pool tables, 
And glad I did because turned out to be a good evening, seen some old friends and like the crowd-

Came here while visiting friends and I absolutely loved it. It's a cool little bar with the original beers and liquor and the Denver Brews. The bartender was polite and knowledgeable and recommended a few Denver brews that I loved so much I went and bought to bring back home.

It's in a cool neighborhood location and you get the neighborhood crowds.  The garage doors they have will open to let that cool breeze or sun shine in that leads to the outdoor seating area.

In the inside they have pool tables, darts and a jukebox for your music pleasure.

I wanted so badly to leave a 5-star review for $5 all you can eat wings on a Wednesday night, but I just can't do it! The service was GREAT, but the wings wings were dry and crunchy. And unfortunately, I mean all of the flavors. Between my husband and my 4 friends, we tried all of the wings (even getting some naked with sauce on the side) and the results were the same. Maybe we'll go back on another happy hour night and try some of their other food specials.

I really bump heavy with this dive bar. Surprised that it's considered a college bar because although relatively close to an institution of higher learning, it was more middle-aged locals there from the neighborhood. It's a great atmosphere! Very intimate yet there's an open feel to it. I was with a group cool with the bartenders, from going to school together, so they were more than helpful. Even when I did an apparent party foul asking for a Yuengling and Kyle (the bartender) mentioned "You're not gone find anything like that East of the Mississippi"...Midwesterner problems. Other than that, I had a blast. Pool tables, dart boards, a few sketchy looking folks...the greatness of dive bars. Yet, it as very classy compared to the Midwest dive bar scene I'm used to. You'll have a grand time if you go here.
I have only been there for wings Wednesday which is a great deal for wings and the staff is nice.  I don't especially love the atmosphere and it is always crowded (which is good for them).
Rocky Top is fantastic.  Great food, drinks and especially the service and staff.  Will continue to go back.

Losing stars the longer its open. Yes, I appreciated the renovation but they are sinking into old behaviors. Here's what I don't get: the burgers and wings are good- really good. I agree with everyone who talks about the high quality of the food. They could attract a crowd for food but they are clearly still catering to the Regis crowd exclusively.  

It took 20 mins to get a servers attention and when we did she still failed to clear the table of glasses from the previous occupants. Service didn't improve as time went on and we waited long periods of time between visits to the table and for an extended period of time to pay. It was busy so let's not hold speed against them but cleaning the table is pretty key.  

The floors were gross. Here's why: beer pong. Ok, that's your choice to host pitchers and beer pong at your bar despite the improved bottle display encouraging liquor. But on a busy wing night, maybe postpone taking up 1/3 of your space with what equates to 2 cheap pitchers of beer over 20 mins. 

I'll admit, I'm not above admitting I smoked a cig or two in the previous establishment but I was reminded very quickly of how little had changed when we found ourselves surrounded by pot smoke. 

All in all, I have fond memories of the Hill Top but I wouldn't go unless already deep into a bottle of liquor. It's changed less than you would think post renovation.

Love this place! It's a great neighborhood bar.

They have just enough taps for everyone to get the beer style they like. Their menu is full of foodie, bar food fusion, like Totchos (tater tots topped with nacho toppings). I am definitely coming back for the peanut butter bacon burger!

People are just really friendly and happy, here. We posted up in a corner of the pool room and had a great time chatting and making jokes with the fellas playing pool (including the owner, I believe). We would have stayed longer, had the Snowpocalypse not cut our day short. 

There is plenty of street parking in this neighborhood and I love the proximity to the new Gold Spot Brewing. I see beer tasting and burgers in our future ;)

Love the new and improved, updated, HILLTOP. It will always be the hilltop to me. As an alumni of Regis it was just perfect for the neighborhood. Now even more perfect with open space and garage doors for balcony and pong games. Pool tables, etc!!! Great local crowd!
Love this place.  Dollar tacos are so good.  The shrimp is my favorite.  But all are good.  Try the tatchos.  So good.  Its tater not nachos.  Um. Yum.

I loved the food and service.I am terribly difficult to please in both regards and both deserve my up most sincere wow .The music was so loud and horrible it killed my wow and the neighborhood was trashy.Still wow but wont go back.Ya might wanna do something about the asbestos house next door.Best way to sum it up would be truffle in a s--- wagon.I admire the stones on whoever pulled the rabbit out of this hat.You will do great because you know how to treat people and make good food.I hate noise and garbage but my god you got me.
Great food great service!! Get the totachos and wings! Plus a free 5k on Tuesdays @6 with free pasta and 2-1 bud light. Kitchen stays open til 11 which is great for those late nights.

For a small place the service takes hours, it seems busy because its small, I felt like we were all sardines trying to get wings and drinks. Rude bartenders, ask for a beer get a what and foam overflowing your pint, its a sausage fest with usual guys night perks. man I pay,I chug,and go out the door somewhere else with room. The bar is so small you wont even miss it.
Awesome neighborhood bar. Great food and drinks with great prices. Come on weds for $5 all you can eat wings.

::a hem::  "Rocky Top, you'll always be home sweet home to meeeeeeeee!!  Good old Rocky Top!  Rocky Top, Tennesseeeeeeeeee!!!!"  Ok now that that is out of the way and firmly planted in your head for the rest of the day, on to ze review!

Hit up Rocky Top for what I'll say pretty much the most awesome special in existence.  $5 all you can eat wings on Wednesday nights.  Oh don't you worry, the secret is out.  Place is packed but the servers did a good job of keeping pace.    

All you can eat wings not enough for you?  Well how about all you can drink domestic drafts and well cocktails for $10 from 10 - 12:00 on (get this) Saturday night!  Holy cheap boozels Batman!  And on Saturday!  Man this is a joint after my own heart.  

Happen to be cross country driving I-70 and passing through Denver on a Thursday evening?  Well then sir/madam you are in luck!  $3 burgers and karaoke on Thursdays, right off the freeway!  Who wouldn't want to make a detour to sing some karaoke along the way.  Just don't do Rocky Top, unless of course you are awesome at it.  

Sweet place and hopefully the cornerstone of what will be a cool little strip along Lowell.  Chicka-check it out.
A hangout for the Regis crowd, this a simple tavern with good food and drink. Tvs, game tables and open garage doors make this place fun on any night in the summer. Wing night is tough to beat.
Great lil spot! Great tacos on Friday! Next is wing Wednesday! Busy place but service was good. Definitely a must try!

Cheap wings on wednesdays and despite the complete lack of seating every single time I've been in on a wednesday, the wings keep coming out hot and fresh. Definitely not a bad place for some pub grub.

Service was top notch even though they were SLAMMED on 5$ wing night.  You have a mix of people in this place.  The people that have lived in the neighborhood forever, college kids and then the people like us that are newer to the area.  Wings were great and they kept bringing them out.  The beer was cold and affordable!  Stop in on wing night!  WEDNESDAY

Same owners as pub on penn, good all you can eat wings for $5, if you have any complaints you are an ass!!! Fun atmosphere, the waiters n waitress work hard!!! You should tip well!!! :-) deff recommend to a friend.

Do not be discourage by the appearance of the neighborhood, or the surrounding area.  It's not that bad around there, but it just doesn't look like the area where you would find such a cool bar.  Inside, the place is top notch, fresh, inviting and comfortable.  

Someone has spent some time putting in a first class, neighborhood pub.  It's attractive, it's not noisy, it's clean, and the staff are polite, courteous and accommodating.  Stepping through the doors is almost like stepping into an oasis.  

And, just like a local bar should, they have great drink specials, (the bartender makes a mean Bloody Mary), every day of the week.  This place is definitely affordable.  They have good prices on good "bar food," too.  I was interested to try the nachos made with tater tots, but I did not.  Maybe next time.  

My wife had a big, soft pretzel, and I had french fries.  The pretzel filled a plate, and it was only $6.00 every day.  My fries were adequate, and only $3.00.  The only complaint I had with the food was that it was a bit greasy, but I kind of expect that from bar food.  I certainly liked the french fries here better than those I had at the Buffalo Rose.  I'm thinking they were frozen, but not kept frozen, and, thus, they retained too much oil.  Either that, or the cook did not let them drain long enough before pouring them in the basket.  

My wife said the pretzels at Piflers' on Colfax was better, but this one was adequate.  

The food, as in most pubs, is probably going to be hit or miss.  I am not rating this place on its food.  I am rating this place on its atmosphere, good drink prices, and excellent neighborhood feel.  There are two pool tables in there, (one even converts to table tennis), a video shooting game, four TV's, a patio, (albeit completely unattractive), and a real "What is this place doing here" type of feel.  

This should be a top notch destination for students of local Regis College, and a hangout for neighbors as well.  Why drive into Denver and risk driving impaired when you can walk to such a great, local pub.  If I lived closer, I'd be walking there all the time.

Holy crap, I've found my 2nd home. Not sure how they stay open with their low prices. Every day has a deal with Saturday's 8-10 $10 all you can drink. Friday 5-10 $1 street tacos that are really good. All food prices are SUPER cheap. Pool table, Lots of tvs, golden tee, big buck safari, cute outdoor seating out front. Rock on owners of Rocky Top Tavern!

I have been here a few times, usually for the $5 all you can eat wings Wednesdays (5-11 PM). You also have to buy a drink to get the wings at this special price. There are usually lots of people especially at night. The wings aren't bad because they are really crispy and hot but the only sauce I like is the spicy garlic sauce. I guess I can't really complain but I might be better off at buffalo wild wings on Tuesday nights. So ehh this place is okay.
Should open earlier because we are hungry. Discontinuation of Mac and cheese bites ALMOST led us to give 4 stars, but breakfast burritos suffice.

Great service and great food...simple, typical yet yummy bar food...some great food deals if you go on certain nights though the food really does seem reasonably priced in general...and I appreciate what they have on tap!
I really like this place. Good food, good drinks, good service, good prices.  They've got lots of TVs and good happy hour deals. Very happy to have found such a good spot close to home.
Small little hole in the wall type place, but nicer. Great spot, cool people and surprisingly good food. Cozy on rainy nights.

Wow what an awesome new space! For those that don't know, this was the old Hill Top. I was happy to see though it's gotten a face lift, the clientele is still diverse and fun. Saw a few regulars still in the corner laughing and cuttin' up. The new owners added a kitchen, added more booze and a better beer selection. TV's galore so you can catch your favorite game. We had a few drinks and food on this visit. Burger was cheap and very good. They have typical bar fare, wings, burgers and such. Some dish called totchos ? Check out their very generous specials. All I know is I think I saw "all you can drink for $10 10-12!" That's pretty awesome. $5 freaking all you can eat wings on Wednesday.  WTF?!

My one and only complaint was no bike poles for locking up. That would be a very awesome addition come summer time. Please please?!

Yeah I'll be stopping by for my after work hammer time on the regular. Yay!!

Love this new addition to the neighborhood - a huge improvement over the old bar. 

They have lots of TVs, a decent food menu, great beer on tap, and huge windows that open up in the summer. 

I hope a fenced off patio area is added for the summer. Would love to hang around outside when it's warm!
I love this place! I'm close by and every time I stop by the service is awesome! The hamburgers are ridiculous and the owners are so friendly! Thanks neighborhood bar!!

Came in on a Sunday, had a breakfast burger and knew I had to come back.  We are are now in on a Saturday and I was anything but let down.  The $2 pork and chicken sliders were on a buttered roll and were A-Golly Gee-Mazing! Oh.... Did I mention the $10 all you can drink with service that isn't there to give you two drinks and forget about you?!? This place is worth the drive, regardless of where you live!

A newly re-vamped hiding spot for the locals with amazing food, cold beer, and a fun scene. Great ambiance for a tiny bar, and great daily specials- the wings are amazing- especially the Asian style. The chicken and waffles are beyond good. Fun twists to some favorites, like tatchos (tater tot nachos)

Go! Now! It's awesome!

We went for the $5 all you can eat wings Wednesday happy hour.  It was well worth it.  Although it was packed and we had to sit at the bar, the service was quick and the bartenders were friendly.  We took home some burgers and they were really good.
Not a lot going on but sports on the TV and a pool table to play with - but It's not bad. It's cozy and friendly. You could do worse when in this neighborhood.

Rocky Top is my go to whether it's for a drink, a meal, or a friendly atmosphere. There are lots of TV monitors so it's always easy to catch a game. Awesome daily specials. Friday is taco day and they make great shrimp tacos. Sunday breakfast burritos have tots, it's also mimosa and bloody mary day. Wednesday is bottomless $5 wings, pair those with a pitcher to split between your friends to save cash. There are always Regis students having fun. Great music selection although the machine is a bit expensive.
Good specials, the food was pretty average for bar food. Good place to grab a beer and quick bite. I like it much better when Regis is out of session because it isn't packed with college kids.

Slow service. The servers would rather be taking shots at the bar instead of paying attention to their customers. Food isn't worth the wait. Cigarettes on the patio make for an extremely unpleasant atmosphere. Appetite lost immediately. Good people watching though!

A great neighborhood bar. Good drinks, awesome specials and good service. The patio outside is perfect if you bring your dog or just want to enjoy the beautiful CO weather. The only thing that was a little bit annoying was the fact it was a bit loud inside but what would you expect, it's a bar... Definitely will come back again.
Awesome place. Really good food and incredible service. Their daily specials are really good and the quality of food is excellent.

Love this place. I come in a few times a week. Can't beat the great food deals  Wednesday $5 all you can eat wings, Thursday $3 burger and Friday $1 street tacos! And you have to get the NVP Vanilla Porter! And the owner and staff are great!

Visited here for an early Saturday Morning brunch.The menu isnt super expansive and don't expect traditional pancakes and eggs. This is a good thing! 

I actually had the beet,orange salad- to die for! Light and flavorful, got some bacon on the side for good measure. The prices are very reasonable and we got right in. I'd be curious to taste some of the cocktails. My fiance ordered the pork belly Benedict, I never got the chance to try! 
The service was good, very polite and prompt.

I'd love to come back for dinner and see what its like in a packed house

Atticus is the ambitious girl who wants to break through a certain social class but sabotages herself at every turn. 

Atticus dresses nicely. The ambiance was good - everything clean, lighting nice, decor was high(ish) end. She is pretty well mannered, but the service is where she starts showing some cracks in the facade. It wasn't any better than what you would find at the neighborhood Chili's. 

Sadly, Atticus doesn't have great taste in food. The salmon tartare was fine, but too salty and oily. The risotto was good, but the seafood in the Paella was bland and wasn't allowed to shine through the overbearing citrus. We finished with a dessert that was indescribably bad - cold, soft apples atop a cold, soft crust topped by cold cream and a side of ice cream. Atticus should know better than to serve that to paying customers. The problem is, they do know better, and that's why they never asked if we liked it. We ate just a couple of bites and didn't finish the rest.

Dinner for two cost $80 - far too much for the quality of food provided. It is pretty telling when a restaurant has just two other tables filled on a Saturday night. It's empty for a reason. Atticus is a low class girl trying to charge high class prices. She has some work to do if she wants to break through.

Grandma offered to watch the babe so husband and I tried out Atticus for dinner. We arrived at about 7:45 on Sunday and there were only 4 tables occupied. Service was friendly and very fast. The menu was on the small side with about 5 apps, 2 salads and 7 entrees but it was easy to find some yummy sounding choices.  It looks like they change the menu frequently. 

We ordered mussels in a white wine garlic sauce with fries, French onion soup, crispy salmon with asparagus, wilted greens, and pesto fingerling potatoes and the Atticus burger.  

The mussels were good. I liked the flavor of the sauce and that it was served with fries but I wish the sauce was a bit thicker. 

The French onion soup was very tasty, not too salty, and looked beautiful coming out. There were 3 huge chunks of French bread in the soup with cheese melted on top. 

My favorite part of the meal was the crispy salmon.  I would even call it blackened salmon. It was cooked perfectly, very flakey and tender on the inside with a really nice salty crunchy crispy skin!   The asparagus, greens, potatoes, and sweet potato sides were delicious.  Asparagus still nice and firm and greens and sweet potatoes were a great compliment to the salmon.  My only complaint is that I could barely taste the pesto on the pesto fingerling potatoes. 

I'll be back to try this spot again.

Really cute restaurant. Food is reasonably priced. Mimosa seemed pretty weak. We tried the restaurant because we found it in the Denver Passport list of restaurants. The waiters were a little in-attentive, although they were also very kind. The burger was really good, the beef biscuits were lacking in flavor, I couldn't even taste the green chili.
Mussels are great! The decor is so cute. Love the fireplace. Service was proficient and nice!

Went in during happy hour. Loved the homey feel of the place. Drinks were great. Salad was original and came out very decoratively :) Usually seafood gives me a feel for the place. I was very happy with the way it tasted! I'll be coming back for more and dessert! Staff was super helpful.

What we liked: the scallops/pork belly surf & turf meal, the charcuterie board, the immediate seating (called to see if we needed a reservation- was a little slower weekday evening- no reservation needed)
What we didn't like: the kale Caesar salad- it was overdressed and unimpressive, especially compared to the amazing scallop dish.

Staff was friendly, music was nice, and the cocktails looked amazing.

I discovered this spot through my Denver Dining Out Passbook and I'm so glad I did. It's a quaint spot with wonderful decorations. 

I came for brunch and got the cauliflower hash and it was delicious! It had great flavor and I also got to try a bite of the duck confit hash and that was also great and the duck was really tender. 

I definitely need to try this spot for dinner or lunch.

After my initial infatuation with Atticus over Happy Hour, it was love at first sight.  My raving first review (below) attests to that!  However, a year later, the love affair is alive!  As Atticus is a walkable neighborhood restaurant, I have now been in for dinner and breakfast many many times and I just have to update my review.  

*** 5 stars! *** 5 stars! *** 5 Stars! ***

I just love Atticus. Whether you are there for brunch, noshing on a simple two egg breakfast, or there at dinner enjoying a creative cocktail and some amazing Entree, Atticus has exceptional food and service quality.  

The space is small and intimate with character oozing out of its exposed bricks- remember Fagan's that used to be on that corner?  They left the painted slogan up over the bar for a serious Denver cool factor. The fireplace is a gem.  Make a reservations with your special someone and ask for it. The food is sophisticated but not over-the-top and always delicious.  Service is friendly and helpful.  It is a place you can go again and again and always have a fresh experience!

I am really surprised it only has 3.5 stars, but in a way, that's ok- let's keep it our little secret neighborhood restaurant!

Atticus was a bad experience for me.  We met a couple of friends here for breakfast, we had reservations, and we arrived first.  We were sat on the other side of the wall from the bar.  Our friends arrived almost right after us, but the host couldn't put it together that they were the other half of our party, even though we had all stated there would be four of us.  They sat at the bar for over 10 minutes until they finally heard my voice and looked around the wall.  

Meanwhile, Jess and I ordered mimosas from our server who dropped them off and decided to never interact with us again.  She walked by several times and I watched her see the new arrivals, but never tried to help.  I finally got up and asked another waiter to get her, and he ended up just taking over the table for us.  

The menu wasn't doing much for me, but I went with the breakfast burrito.  When it came out, it was cold, as if the ingredients were poured into the tortilla from cold storage.  The server was apologetic, and had a new one made.  My companions did enjoy their meals.  A manager touched our table and apologized for the experience.  I really appreciate those two actions, but honestly I think the taste in my mouth is a little to bitter for me to return any time soon.

Had heard good things about this place so when my friend said it was on her nutritionist's list of 'clean eating' restaurants in Denver we have it a shot. 

Service-very friendly and attentive waitstaff. Daniel the new GM talked to every table while we were there. 

Ambiance- very cozy, pretty small but not cramped. Nice decor. 

Parking-lot in the back but it's usually full. If you are there during the week after 6:15 pm you can park across the street in the Bank lot. 

Menu-minimal choices for apps, greens and entrees but they make almost everything from scratch so understandable. Surprised they had an oyster offering and a buck-a-shuck day. 
The appetizers and entrees seemed a little expensive at $7-15 and $17-26 but then again everything in Denver is expensive these days. 

Food-waitress recommended the duck tacos, kale Caesar add salmon and the  steak frites. 

We ordered to share 
1) duck tacos-3 to a serving. Wasn't all that impressed but I'm not doing dairy so may not have gotten the full flavor profile without the cheese.  

2) Atticus burger-We substituted seasoned veggies for the fries that normally come with the burger and although the waitress didn't tell us there would be an up charge, it was only $1 and They were worth it. Asked for medium burger and it came out more med-rare, but boy was it delicious! Seasoned perfectly and really juicy. 

3) Brussels sprouts 
Interesting combination with dried cherries. Probably better with the shaved Asiago that it comes with.

We love Atticus for dinner and brunch. We are big sushi fans but pretty picky with cooked fish. Whenever we have fish at Atticus we are blown away by how perfectly they prepare and cook it. I would always recommend the fish special. The duck confit was fabulous too!
Brunch was a cut above as well. The pork belly Benedict was delectable and the shrimp and grits was absolutely done the right way.  
Drinks for dinner and brunch were perfection. 
Service was the right balance of attentive and geared to allow us to enjoy the whole experience. 
We can't wait to go back!

Great service, great ambiance. It was so close to a 5 star place, but our entrees were SO salty it ruined them completely. We started with the brussel sprouts which were AMAZING, a little on the crispy side, but that's how I like them. We followed that with the charcuterie board which was decent. We got the scallops surf and turf and the crispy duck confit for dinner and they both were like salt licks. I could tell if someone hadn't been so heavy handed, they would have been delicious! I would give this place another try, but would probably mention light on the salt.
Ate here last night ....and we loved it.  The Brussels sprouts pair nicely with the risotto. Also, a friend had the surf and turf.  Both plates hit the spot!

We had a great experience at Atticus from attentive, good natured service, to good food and beverage to an opportunity to sit by the fire on a snowy night. 

One of the things I appreciated about Atticus was the menu variety. Given that 3/4 of us at our table we some variety of vegan/limited diet, it was impressive that there were still a variety of choices that suited all diets, tastes and appetite levels.

We ordered the Brussels' sprouts and ceviche as appetizers, and while I did not try the ceviche, the Brussels' sprouts may have been my favorite item of the evening. They were crispy and had a nice balance of savory with a little sweet.

I had the steak frites as an entree and asked of medium well. The steak came out more on the medium side, and while it was not my favorite to eat pinkish meat (I know it tastes better that way to true connoisseurs, but after a bout with food poisoning I go medium well), it was flavorful and juicy. The fries that came with it were also good.

We had a berry cobbler and a chocolate pot de creme for dessert and both were solid. The chocolate was served cold, which I should have expected given that it was a pot de creme and that is how it is served, but it may have been tastier warmed up a bit.

The appetizer was a 4, the service was a 5 and the main course/dessert were a 3. If I could, I'd go for a 3.5 overall.

That said, there is enough on the menu that I'd come back again with a veggie/vegan crowd.

4 Star for how it upgrades the neighborhood. If I lived near here it would be my go-to place.
Surprisingly cute upscale little bistro in university area.  You can tell the chef is determined to make it fine dining - and healthy.

A bit inconsistent in service and food quality but overall great effort.

I've come into Atticus numerous times - work going away party, happy hour and brunch (Dinner is still on my list to try)! Each time was fantastic! The location itself is fairly small so don't expect to get a big group in there. They have a great happy hour special from 3pm - 6pm with $5 charcuterie boards, $2 off wine and other specials. Their brunch special is something like $10 bottomless mimosas - haven't tried it out yet but planning on it!

The ambiance is very intimate but rustic. Decor is super cute - lots of hard wood with a wood burning fireplace.  Definitely making it a point to go back.

Not my favorite of the Table to Tavern restaurants. Maybe I just ordered wrong.

I came here with a friend because the drink menu looked fabulous, I had enjoyed the sister restaurant Blackbird for brunch, and I had the pass book for Denver Dining. We ordered the charcuterie board and brussels, scallops, and sea bass. 

The charcuterie board featured three cheeses, a little pot of honey, proscuitto and candied bacon, with some olives and toasted baguette slices. The candied bacon was... cold and limp. The pieces of toast were rock hard. The cheeses and the honey were the best parts. Of course the brussels were pretty good.

My sea bass was not what I typically expect when I order sea bass. It was served more like trout; the piece was much "thinner" than I expected. Usually, I get a thick piece (think like filet mignon) and this was more like a NY strip. Not bad... but not awesome either.

I'd like to give this place another try and order different food. Maybe this restaurant group does better with their brunches.

My friend and I were looking for a cute restaurant in the DU area that wasn't a chain or pub food so we tried Atticus.  It's a really cute restaurant with a small outdoor seating area on a busy intersection (Downing & Evans).  They open at 11 and we were there at 11:15.  They have a small menu but good choices.  However, the server recommended the salmon salad and then came back and apologized because their seafood truck hadn't arrived yet.  She said she could give me the crab salad with a crab cake instead of crab.  I was disappointed but it was very good.  My friend had the vegetarian sandwich and she liked it as well. I think it might be best for lunch, but I'd be willing to give it a try for dinner if I'm in the area. The server was nice but not overly attentive. Prices were reasonable for lunch.  There were people at a couple of other tables but I liked the quiet atmosphere of the restaurant because we chatted for an hour and a half over lunch and were not made to feel like they needed to turn the table over.

Decent service, but I could've cooked a better meal with my eyes closed. 

We got:
Salmon
Cauliflower
Whiskey smash
Old fashioned

Essentially both of our meals consisted of raw vegetables and pesto. 

Some recommendations for the same price range, but way better food:
- Zengo
- squeaky bean
- colt & grey
- the kitchen
- literally anything else in Denver
Server is rude, took too long for my brunch food... Over an hour. The food was cold and the manager didn't take care of my bill. Everyone in the restaurant seemed to be experiencing the same thing

Met a friend here after work on a Friday. The place was fairly empty, granted... we got there at 3:30. Ha! I hadn't been here since it was all only Boones (the next-door-neighbor bar), and it was really cool to see the transition it has gone through!

The bartender was very friendly. It was pretty obvious that I was waiting on someone to join me, and he stayed and chatted with me for a little while.

We ended up taking advantage of the happy hour deals. Half off glasses of wine (there's some fine print on this... I couldn't keep it straight. If the glass is over $10 it's half price glass, under $10 was $5 glass... I THINK! Don't take my word for it) and then some special appetizers. We got the chef's board which came with 2 meats and 2 cheeses (and other things to top your bread off with). It was tasty... as always I wished there was more bread. And more cheese. 

They have a deal on Monday's and Tuesday's (I believe) for half priced bottles of wine. Not a bad date night idea!

I'll be back here again in the future!

This place was amazing. I saw it while driving by and thought it would be a really good place to to stop and get drinks or a bite to eat. 

We stopped by on a week day to get lunch which was perfect because it wasn't too crowded and felt like a really intimate atmosphere! Nile was out bar tender and he made really great drink selections and amazing drinks! 

The food was amazing and very fresh and not too over the top feeling. We started with the chef board with meats and cheeses and other assorted snacks which was one of my favorite boards ever! We also split the B.L.T. With pork belly and candied bacon which made for a really tasty sandwich.   

As for drinks may I suggest the clover whisky or anything whisky as Nile was a great drink inventor, or the Bloody Mary which included the candied bacon...yum! Thanks Nile!
I haven't tried their food yet, but Atticus is a great bar. Good booze, great atmosphere and a wonderful staff. Recommended.

Lunch for 12 after law school graduation. Was very disappointed. My wife and I  both had duck confit and Brie omelets. Eggs were over cooked, confit was dry and not much Brie. Friend had blt but they didn't put on much in the way of tomatoes. No one really wanted to complain as it was a special event. 
Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Spend your money elsewhere.

What a little gem! The bf and I popped in here on a whim one night as he had been given a gift card by a friend who raved about this place. It was not busy at all the night we stopped by, but it was a little past the dinner hour (and by a little past, I mean 9pm). The service was so friendly and accommodating and they didn't even seem to mind we stayed until closing time. 
For starters we shared an enormous bowl of blistered brussel sprouts which were divine. I tried their Sangria which was so good I'm going to crave it on hot summer nights! For dinner, I had the steak frites which was tender and cooked to perfection. All in all, I was pleasantly surprised. The food here is as good as any "foodie" haunt and the decor is absolutely darling - from the fireplace in the corner to the old time bicycle on the wall. If you're looking for a great meal and a lovely ambiance for date night, give Atticus a try. I don't think you'll be disappointed!

Oh where to start on this one. Let me start with the good. Our waitress was super sweet and gave us a lovely customer service experience. 

The hubs burrito was very good with lots of chorizo, fried potatoes and delicious green chili, however the cheese wasn't completely melted on top. My shrimp on my shrimp and grits was perfectly poached and the initial flavors were tasty. 

Now on to the rest of the experience. The place was half full and it took almost 20 minutes to get our drinks and a full 40 minutes to get our meals. We were told a 6 top table's order went in right before ours causing the extreme delay. It is a little alarming that a restaurant advertising weekend brunch isn't able to stay on their game and gets into the weeds with a six top. 

This isn't the restaurants fault but our experience was punctuated by a table of four braying donkeys, whoops, loud girls that were unaware of the space. Other tables around us were also commentating. 

As I mentioned my shrimp and grits was good initially. About halfway through it became a greasy mess. There was so much butter/oil floating on top I couldn't finish it. The grits were super smooth which only heightened the greasy quality. Our waitress did offer to buy our second drinks on the house but we passed. 

A quick trip to the restroom had watered down hand soap in the ladies. 

We had to ask for our check and an hour after we walked in we were finally released! I think there is a lot of potential but it felt like opening day of a brand new restaurant.

I came to Atticus this weekend with my wife and 2 friends.  We had an 11:30 reservations and were seated promptly. Our waiter was very nice and he took our drink orders in a reasonable amount of time.  We ordered 2 of the Holy Bloody's and a carafe of Mimosa.  After a good 10 minute wait we received our drinks and placed our food order.  The Bloody was missing the pickle that the menu had promised.  I wouldn't normally care about a pickle but I happen to like pickles and with the up charge of $3.00 you would expect you get all the things the menu says your going to get.

After a good 25 min wait the server came over to aplogize that the food hadnt come out yet.  The food was not very good and it felt like they let a new chef cook it all but never told him how to do it.  The vegetable hash was just a bunch of 1/2 sauteed veges on a plate.  You cant put 1/2 raw vege on a plate and call it a hash.  Pretty bad.

I've been twice.  The first time we were the only table in the restaurant and my entree still came out wrong.  Since the food was fairly tasty, I decided to try it again.  Worst service ever. So incredibly slow, and there's no reason why a brunch plate takes 30+ minutes when again the restaurant only had a handful of tables.  Not to mention the eggs were served raw and had to be sent back.  Extremely disappointed, will not go back.

On a positive note, the food was delicious. The service was terrible though. It started off strong, with only a few people in the restaurant, but after my food was delivered it was all downhill. They were going through a menu transition so the items I'd seen online that sounded good weren't options which was disappointing but I ended up with the crab cake benedict. It was good but spicy and if I'd known that in advance I'd have ordered something else. After getting my order I didn't see a waitress for a ridiculous amount of time. I finally ordered a decaf espresso drink which ended up being delicious but it took almost 20 minutes for it to show up so I ended up spending much more time there than originally expected.

I visited Atticus again and had a totally different experience. It was a very quiet time for them (Saturday around lunchtime if you like a little more space, like me!) 

Our server was terrific, and we enjoyed a very tasty meal. I had the short rib sandwich on a bed of greens instead of bread. The fries were perfect, and the meal was delicious, but as I thought about it afterward...

When I started eating my food, I asked the server about the cheese, because it had a weird look and strange texture. He told me it was a mixture of Gouda and American cheese. That hit me a little weird, but I filed it away and enjoyed my meal. Today, the question came back to me and I did a little research. Folks, American cheese means processed, like Kraft singles or Velveeta. 

I really wasn't expecting Atticus to serve me processed cheese. I have a lot of food sensitivities. I choose pricier restaurants like Atticus because I expect that I'm not going to be served horrible food.
