Oh dear LORD, the sweet potatoes. The SWEET POTATOES, people!

Ordered a plate with grilled chicken, braised collared greens and sweet potatoes and just about died. From happiness, that is. 

Service is friendly and eager to help. Space is open and not too crowded (though I imagine this will change as more folks realize it exists). Prices are totally reasonable for a healthy urban eatery. 

And, oh yeah, they have booze.

This place is a block away from my building and I am officially their new regular.

I absolutely love the concept! The atmosphere was really cool and comfortable, the service great, and the food was tasty. However, this place is very pricey. $17 for a piece of grilled chicken with a side of sweet potato mash, Brussel Sprouts, and a tea. I'll definitely be back for drinks at the bar!
Wonderful place at downtown Denver. Simple, excellent and healthy food, Google vibes, beautiful decoration, good prices. Highly recommended. Love it
Great environment. Great service. Fast fresh food. Rainy day and the short ribs plate with seasonal vegetables and mashed sweet potatoes was great.

Hands down the best fried chicken in the city. It's made to order so if you're in a rush it may not be for you but if you have ~10 minutes for them to make it it's fantastic. Their price range is great too for being downtown.

Their sides are fresh tasting and they rotate some of the sides seasonally.

Excellent place. Will keep going back.

If Honor Society was a cafeteria at the airport selling pre-packaged meals to go, it might be acceptable. 

As it stands it is serving over priced food and that prepared too far ahead of time. I added the fried chicken to the seasonal salad and what I received is something I would expect from a KFC bowl.

Honor society never disappoints. Literally every time that I go in I am blown away by the quality of food and the amazing service. Ordering while there or online you're sure to be pleasantly surprised. Well done guys, well done.

The food is tasty, when they get your order right. They need to seriously rethink their customer service and employee selection. Turning down a customer because the cook is working on a big catering order, at 8am, when there is no one else in the restaurant, is pretty bad. I really wanted to support Honor Society because the menu is awesome. But they never get my order right and they're not friendly. I will take my business elsewhere. You may want to do the same, unless you like poor service and inconsistency.

Super healthy and super good!! It's really original in its concept and the atmosphere is really clean and great. Wonderful service!! Especially Danny, one of the cashiers I had. She was super sweet and seemed actually interested in her job. Definitely would go again.

Will never be back! To start off our meal the server forgot to put in my main course and them proceeded to tell me that I only ordered a side ceaser salad and no pizza. The first rule in being a server is don't tell the customer what they didn't order!! When my pizza finally arrived after everyone in my party had already finished and my pizza was doughy from the fact they didn't cook it long enough. Another person in my party ordered a ceaser salad with cashews and it had no cashews.

Went with a friend for week day lunch. Their menu reminded me a lot of gender greens back in Southern California. I went for the chicken plate and my friend had the sandwich option. My chicken was well seasoned, so juicy and the sides were delicious! If you are looking for casual place to grab a bite and want some healthier options that taste amazing this is a good spot. I would definitely go back.
This place is alright. It's expensive for what you get and the chicken was dry as hell.  Should have went down a few more blocks to Mod Market.
$14 for a salad with chicken? Walked away not full and not impressed. Save your money by getting a filling salad down the street at Mod Market

This is a great addition to LoDo. Extremely affordable, and as the name of the restaurant suggests, handcrafted food. 

First off the cocktails are over the top. I'd suggest sticking to their cocktail menu rather than sticking to your usual. You'll be impressed. Even the cocktails on draft are amazing. I can't recall the name, but there is a whiskey sour cocktail with ginger that just has an incredible spice to it. And their own spin on a margarita, served with black Hawaiian lava salt (I am now on a quest for this stuff - delicious) is over the top. The cocktails aren't huge, but are boozy. You are tasting mixology, not a mixer to cover up an inferior spirit.

The food menu is an interesting concept. 5 proteins. You pick whether you want them on a salad, as an entree with 2 sides, or as a sandwich with one side. The prices are really reasonable with the most expensive being $13ish, as I recall, for a flat-iron steak. But I picked the fried chicken sandwich with a Caesar salad side ($11.95). I'm not talking about a breaded and fried patty. Instead, this is legit fried chicken breast that would hold its own against some of the best in the South, just in a sandwich instead of on the bone. I am guessing the entree serving comes bone-in (obviously that would be a problem in a sandwich, though!). The sandwich comes with pickles, arugula, and a delicious spicy sriracha aioli.

Though I'm not really a smoothie person, the bartender gave me a sample of one of the smoothies they have on the menu and it was delicious. If they had these to go, it would make a great quick healthy breakfast/lunch option.

The interior is beautiful, modern but rustic. An open, visible kitchen so everyone can see what is happening. It's non-pretentious and the vibe is relaxed. But you can really tell that a lot of time went into designing this place. 

I ate at the bar, as I usually do when on business travel by myself. The service was great, no complaints! It's amazing that a place can have it together this much considering I went on their second official night open. I look forward to revisiting on my next trip to Denver. Not sure if I can be adventurous and stray away from that fried chicken sandwich, though...it was really that good. Maybe I'll branch out and try one of the other sides at least!

Very disappointing. Not very allergy friendly since the food is all prepared ahead of time. Our food came out room temperature and you could tell it had been cooked awhile ago. The portions were too small for the price and size of my salmon that was dry. We waited forever for this place to open and love the concept, but will not be back.

Came here last week, food was delicious (tried their pizza) but service was pretty rough. It was the first week they were open so I'm sure they'll get the swing of things.

What I'm confused about is why you have breakfast on your menu available until 10:30am, but you don't open until 10:30am? We just walked over to try the breakfast burrito to find you were closed (yelp says you're open, by the way). It will be very said if you open your doors and tell us you aren't serving breakfast because is past 10:30!!! Might want to look at that. :P
Come here during happy hour! We do almost on a weekly basis. The pizzas are half off and drinks are excellent and reasonably priced. We stop in frequently just for the homemade lemonades too!

Super nice staff and had a great conversation with the GM. I loved the quality of the food and the veg plate was awesome. I'm on a pretty strict cleanse right now and they were super helpful in helping me put together a great meal. It was a revised menu on the weekends and the komboucha was unavailable at the time but anxious to go back for that next time.

Great & awesome concept.
Horrible execution.
Chicken had been sitting so long that it had glazed over look and was tasteless.  Butternut squash had a great taste except the squash was as hard as a rock.  Only redeeming dish was the short rib and that was too fatty.
Service staff is friendly & helpful.  However, the managers spend all their time walking around with clipboards and not paying much attention to food and customers.

My mom and aunt were visiting last weekend and I brought them to Honor Society for Friday happy hour. We ended up ordering two half-priced pizzas, but one got lost in the post Rockies game rush. To say they made it right is an understatement -- they went way above and beyond and we were all very happy. The food and drinks are delicious and happy hour prices are unbeatable. Now Honor Society is the only place my mom wants to eat dinner during her visit.
Enjoyed the food and staff. We will be back as we wanted to try it all. James is awesome and a great person to welcome guests.

I had a great meal here - prime rib sandwich with Brussel sprouts. The atmosphere is awesome and the food was delicious. The clean drinks were great as well. I was pretty surprised to see it almost empty. Granted it's surrounded by offices and I was there on a rainy evening. Still worth another visit for sure.

OK - I get it. The food is pricey because its really healthy, "clean" food. I don't mind paying a little higher price for that. What I don't get is why I was charged $3.25 for an iced tea. Just a regular black tea, on ice. About 10-12 ounces. And when I went up to ask for a refill, I was told that they don't do refills for iced tea. And the employee and manager could not have been more dismissive to me about this "policy".  And the other employee who asked me how I was enjoying my meal could also not have been more clueless about the situation either. Granted, I have learned over the years not to expect much from Denver servers (and managers) but seriously, if a customer feels like they're being overcharged, don't just shrug and walk away.

You don't often wander into a new place and find that you can get kale salad, quinoa salad, steak, salmon, fried chicken, flatbreads, a classic negroni, and other craft cocktails under one roof. Tonight, I found just that at Honor Society. Is this High Society or Honor Society? I'm happy. New fav.

LOVE this place. The food is fresh, clean and delicious. The staff is beyond helpful, refill your drinks and will take care of what ever your looking for. I dine here almost weekly for lunch and recently tried one of their seasonal cocktails and was in heaven. A little pricy but worth it!

So disappointed. I tried to order 2 of their 5 beers listed on their menu and the staff had no idea if they actually had it. So I told them I didn't want a drink. We got our food and it was all lukewarm. Mac and cheese was bland and cold. Food overall was unimpressive. This would all be okay if it was cheap, but it's not, we spent $40 for two people. Ultimately, there's something fundamentally wrong with paying that much and then walking inside to get paper napkins.

So first I was excited to see something new, I walked in the west doors not knowing how anything worked. The gal behind the bar didn't say anything, I got eye contact and said hi how are you am I in the right place she responded with "sure just a sec." What???? I am on my lunch trying to spend money and that's your attitude?? She finally asked "do you know what you want", I did ask for a recommendation she said the chicken chorizo flat bread(12.00). I ordered that with no cilantro and a glass of prosecco (8.00). She pored about an ounce of wine in a glass from a tap and stuck her face in the glass to smell it, set that glass down grabbed another and did the same from another tap, picked up the first glass pored about 3 more ounces and handed it to me. I reluctantly looked at the glass and she asked "problems?" There was nothing seeming wrong so I had a few sips. The pizza came out in a huge box 
I opened it and of course there was cilantro. Knowing it wasn't a big deal  I left. Got to my office and my co-worker and I shared it, both of us did notice there does not seem to have any chicken but other than that it was great! The corn was fresh so much so that it looked like it was cut off the cob. The crust has great flavor and flax seeds (great touch!). 

The food thus far great however the service lacking completely!!

Sad news. My coworkers and I were really excited for a new spot so close to our office and went to check it out before brining our greater team. The service was so horrible we left. We were one of three tables at 5pm, was not handed menus, luckily I found menus on the counter. The menus were dirty. Then once the waitress finally took our order she had no clue about any of the wines. We then were waiting for drinks, choose the appetizers we wanted and... waited... some... more. So after catching up on everyone's weekend, we left, sans wine, and had not had a chance to place our order. When I returned the menus to the counter, no one even acknowledged that we were there and/or leaving. 

Sadly this is not an option to bring our greater team to for happy hour until the service takes a major turn. Or a different restaurant opens in the space.
Good location, great vibe, and terrific gluten free menu for a reasonable price! Very, very quick. Will be coming back

The food is great.  The atmosphere is comfortable and clean.  The service leaves a lot to be desired.  My building is right next to the restaurant, so I've been a fair number of times, and more often than not there is an extended wait (even early in the morning when picking up a breakfast taco) or something has been incorrect about my order.  I tend to be pretty understanding in these circumstances but a lack of apology or even acknowledgement from the staff leaves me feeling like pursuing other options nearby.

Great atmosphere, cool mixed medium decor. Came for a happy hour, Drinks were delicious. Tried the Cool Hand Luke, very refreshing on a hot day. It was pretty pricey though. There was only 1 cocktail on happy hour and one beer, which was disappointing because cocktails were 9-11 bucks a piece. 

Food looked really tasty, but as far as happy hours go it was pretty weak considering there are places in LoDo that have handcrafted cocktails at good prices. If they create a happy hour list I will definitely come back more often.

This place is awesome! Menu offers a lot to chose from for all kinda of eaters, even those weird gluten free people. I had the fried chicken sammich and it was fantastic. Quick service and enjoyable atmosphere. Will definitely be back.

Food = good! Happy hour specials on pizzas are great and I liked the cocktails. The service however SUCKS!! Like bad - they seemed confused (which I can understand if they're new) but worse no one was that friendly or cared that much about our experience, at least at the bar. Their hours are also wrong here. I'll try it again for sure as the food was good and I hope they figure some stuff out. Just hope the have some more training for their service staff.

I've been here twice... Once I got carry out and the other time I ate in. The weird thing is that when you eat at the restaurant, the portion sizes are drastically larger than if you carry out, so I definitely recommend eating at the restaurant. The restaurant has a cool vibe.The food is really good and you can tell it is high quality, but given the price, I can't justify coming here on a regular basis, even though I work just a block away. Expect to pay $12-$15 for lunch; I really wish they would have a separate lunch menu with more lower pricing during the daytime. I give them 3 stars because while the food is good, the overall value seems low for the price that you pay.

Oh my goodness - this was so incredibly good. My husband got the braised short ribs and I got the fried chicken. This was one of the best all around meals I've had in a long time. The roasted seasonal vegetables were so delicious with fresh beets, parsnips, carrots and Brussels sprouts. You must try this place. I am already craving it again.

Fantastic! Love the concept of fast-fine dining. Had the chia seed fried chicken, watermelon feta salad, and cucumber tomato salad. All were wonderful. The fresh squeezed lemonade tastes just like you would expect - fresh, a smidge sweet and perfectly tart. Finished the meal with a drink from the bar, the cool hand luke - quite light and very well crafted. Definitely will be back!!

A little bit pricey, but worth it so far. I've had the grilled chicken sandwich and steak sandwich with mac n' cheese and it's been spot on. I won't touch their drinks, especially alcoholic drinks as I've heard it's so overpriced. I'll continue to come here once a week though!

The food concept for Honor Society reminds me a lot of modmarket. Food was decent but more expensive  then modmarket for options that seemed like almost exact copies at times...so I think I'll stick with modmarket.

Man! Best mashed sweet potatoes EVER. Also tried a gluten free pizza and it was perfectly made...no doughy residue at all, fully cooked all the way. Ask for the fresh lemonades not on the menu too - I grabbed a cucumber mint flavor and wow, what a taste! Throwing in vodka next time!
Amazing! Great, healthy food. The staff was super helpful and gives you tasters of the side dishes before you order. Will definitely be back!

I was excited to try this place since I am always looking for a fresh, healthy eatery. The greeter was friendly and the place was clean but the food was mediocre at best. I had the Colorado Quinoa Salad with Salmon and not only were the ingredients thrown in there very sparingly, they gave me the tiniest piece of salmon (half dollar size) for a charge of $5 extra! So I paid almost $16 for a small plate of spinach with a tiny piece of salmon...soooooo not worth it!!!

Nice whole food concept. I had the steak sandwich and Watermelon/arugula/mint/feta side. The only thing noteworthy was the price. The salad was light, fresh and tasty but the sandwich was as bland as can be, small, and the meat was way undercooked (literally seared but raw inside). I had only water and the price was $15.50. If you like overpaying for meh food then give it a shot. Pot Bellys is right next door and offers a way better value and awesome sandwiches (although not much selection of sides). I can get out of there with a small side and sandwich for $7.50.

Figured it was time to add my review. My husband and I started coming in earlier this year, moved into the area st the end of last. As it is a little Irish pub we tried the burgers first. Let me say, they are amazing. My husbands favorite is the Black and Blue, all of my family has rave about this blue cheese burger, we've brought both sets of my parents in for a bite to eat. I always love their BBQ burger. The French dip is great, honorable mentions go to the buffalo chicken wrap and Shepards pie. The only things we've felt weren't great were the Monte Crisco, blackened chicken the seasoning is too salty and the shrimp po-boy had a little too much bread. The fries however are addicting. 

Moving on to the beer selection, please please go check them out for happy hour. They have an amazing selection of micro brews on tap all the time with a nice rotation twice a week. For $6 you get an amazing beer, if you like the watered down crap, those are $3 on tap as well. Sports are playing on the tvs, the juke box is playing a mix of rock and they even sometimes have live music. A true neighborhood jem!

I've been here a couple of times and have had the same waitress both times. One of the best servers I have ever had. Sat at a table with about 20 people and she remembered everybody's name. The food came out at dang near record time and was on point. I've had the steak sandwich with horseradish that was phenomenal and the Fish Po' Boy that was just as good. They also have an awesome beer menu with a bunch of local beers. I never have the same beer twice in one trip. 

Update 1: I just tried the Reuben and Fried Ravioli. Like everything else on the menu they were GREAT!

Update 2: l has the Beer Sausage Sandwich yesterday and it was on point!

Service.... I wouldn't call it that....  Kept sweeping instead of taking order it even greeting us... 2 bartenders looked at me 3 times while standing at bar & kept talking to each other.  Then server asks- do you need something?  This after first forgetting menus, then dropping them at table & warning kitchen closes in 20 minutes....

It was better than I remembered it being as far as food goes.   Nice beer selection.  The waitresses were annoying.   They would ask our table of 4 if we needed anything,  one person said water, and bam!  The waitress was gone.   For ten minutes.   Getting the water.   While the other 3 people had to wait to ask for what they need.   Then the waitress came back with the water,  the next person asks for a beer,  and bam!  She's gone again.   I finally had to tell her we needed to order more than one item at a time.   I'll probably go back,  but will ask if I can order more than one thing at a time.   Highly annoying

This place is definitely 4 star place to enjoy your micro brews and enjoy some appetizers or more at great price. 

On my last visit at 3 pm, bar was already mostly taken by regulars (if u come here often enough,  you get pewter mug reserved) but mostly empty tables.  

It's clean; great food and friendly employees makes this place grest place to stop by and get a quick bite to eat, enjoy your favorite pint or two.  They have plenty of tables for that gathering with your friends.

Bon Appétit and "don't drink and drive"

I feel very bad for anyone who has not gotten good service here. Friday night about 8pm. Sat at the bar by myself after a very long day, football games and Olympics both on TV, there are plenty of TVs for the sports fans. Amazing service, insanely quick food and immediate drinks, bartenders were soooooo on  point with service. Cracking jokes, constantly keeping up with service, handling several people who had one too many drinks. Very polite to everyone as well. And food was INCREDIBLE. Definitely recommend this joint. :)

I will not eat here again.  I will hit the high points first, then I will rip apart the kitchen.

 The place is not all bad.  If you want a beer, I would recommend this place.  They have craft beers and many are locally made.  The bartender (with lovely purple hair) was friendly, attentive, and down right awesome.  

The food on the other hand is dreadful.  The hot wings were cooked, but not hot.  I get the feeling they were parboiled then fried, unfortunately they were not hot.  The out side was warm, the inside was cool...not fantastic.  The buffalo wing sauce lacked flavor and was very thin.  The Ranch Burger was not good.  The toppings were good, but the meat was completely flavorless.  Seriously, salt and/or pepper would have improved the burger greatly, but I don't think this dawned either one of the cooks.  Also the medium burger was medium rare to rare.  It really sucked.

To sum it up, come for the beer.  If you are hungry, there are four other restaurants in the shopping center, including a wing place.

We've been here a couple of times since it opened, food has always been average, service very slow and ok drinks. Last night 8-21-16 we decided to go with my bro in law since it's close to our house and we're looking for a place to watch football. We'll give it another try we thought. And it will be our last time even if they have free food and beer!
Horrible customer service- sign says seat yourself, so we do. 10 minutes later waitress asks if we want menus, yes please and she leaves! No hellos, want drinks, today's specials, just walks away!
Not very busy and she just keeps looking at us from afar, universal signal we're ready to order because our menus are down!
Finally ordered 2 waters and a beer. More waiting....then drinks came then more waiting... ordered Ruben with soup, chef salad and Patti melt. Nothing complicated. Took forever! She brought out hubbys Ruben and bros salad and said my melt would be about 5 more minutes! Ugh I order another beer then. Ruben and soup were cold. Melt Sat for so long bread was mushy. We decided to eat what we can and go. Still hasn't brought my beer so I flag her down. Asked to cancel the beer since we were done eating and she said it was ready. No I don't want it. But it's ready is all she says. AS I WATCH HER GO TELL THE BARTENDER FOR MY BEER WHICH WASN'T EVEN POURED YET AND SHE BRINGS IT OVER SAYING THE BARTENDER WAS BUSY WITH OTHER CUSTOMERS! What a liar! BARTENDER was playing on an ipad! So I said once again that I don't want it but would love the check! She leaves the beer and gets the tab and yes the beer I tried to cancel twice is on there!
This whole dining experience took 1 hour and 10 minutes! I ordered my 2nd beer BEFORE my food came out!
Needless to say the $6 beer came out of her tip! We will never go back. If I want this experience again I'll stay home, make a grilled cheese sandwich and talk to a cardboard box!

After a period of decline the new management over the last few years has stepped it up and turned Hilltop into a great american beer bar.  The rotating selection of beers offers something new every week.  The 3-6pm happy hour offers a great deal and throw in the $3 shot of Tullamore Dew leave you with a craft beer and shot special for $6.50!  The mussels are good for being a 1000 miles from any coast, good burgers and still a mother approved Fish and chips.

I just had lunch here. First, when I wanted my check it was impossible to get the staff's attention. I had a hamburger with a side of mashed potatoes which was allowed as a substitute for fries. However, I was charged 50 cents for mayo and 50 cents for gravy. She told me they charge for sides but didn't tell me in advance--only on the bill. These aren't sides. They are normal condiments. Absolutely ridiculous. No wonder it was empty when I walked in. I won't be back.

This place is Awesome. The food here is amazing. The ranch and Cajun burger is one of the best burgers I've had. Better than Unami (if you're familiar with that restaurant). For me a little pricy on beers. Ranging from 4.5-9 but with two happy hours it's worth it. Good for a first date, not if you're single looking to hookup.

Royal Hilltop is a good neighborhood place. Burgers are ok, and your standard pub fare. This place does have two items that are excellent, The Reuben and the French Onion soup. I am not much of a drinker, so I can not really comment on the libations. Friendly staff and never too crowded.

Great place to grab a drink before a movie. We've ordered multiple things on the menu and everything is good. Salads, French dip, burgers. Great rotating beer tap. Nice atmosphere. They have a small patio which is nice for happy hour in the summer as well.

What did you do for National Burger Day? I went out and enjoyed a fantastic, juicy cheeseburger from Royal Hilltop.  If you haven't been to this great establishment, then you should check it out.  They have an extensive beer list that has options for all. The food menu has a variety as well.  From burgers to grilled chicken to french dips. Knowledgeable staff as well.  The waitress always knows the details of every beer they have on tap. If you want a good bite to eat, and a cold tasty beer, hit up the Royal Hilltop. Totally worth it.

Great variety of beer, cold beer, good food. Nice atmosphere. Friendly staff.  Great breakfast, best Bloody Mary. Watched the bartender whip up a giant batch of their secret recipe, no bottled Mr & Mrs T's here, its the real flavorful deal!

Good bar food and a wide range of microbrews. The beer menu is always changing so you can try somethingnew every time you go. As for the food, it's classic American fare. Good sandwiches, burgers, and fries. Only downside is it gets pretty crowded sometimes, but then, what good place doesn't? Just remember that, and be ready to get creative with your seating arrangements.

Wowza, how had I never been here before today?  We were looking to grab a drink on a Friday afternoon, and this was right nearby.  I am very glad we stopped in.  They have 17 (18 if they get one tap fixed) beers on tap.  Among the beers, many of them were some of my Colorado favorites, some were new to me, and others were somewhat familiar.  They also have up to 12 beers available by can.  All in all, there are a lot of tasty beverages from which to choose.  I did not have any food on this visit, but I sure enjoyed the fermented offerings.

I really, really, enjoyed the Ace Perry Cider.  It was crisp, delicious, cold, and was like getting hit in the mouth (in a good way) with a bag of Granny Smith's.  I will definitely be drinking this again.  I tried a taste of the Golden Monkey from Victory Brewing.  It was a very nice Belgian-style ale with some nice herbal notes.  I rather enjoyed it.  The service here was excellent.  By 5pm on a Friday this place was packed with regulars, and this was not surprising in the least.

Great beer and great food. Have been here many times and am never disappointed. They have high quality ingredients in all their food. The wings are meaty and crispy and cheap for happy hour. Beers are 3.50 during happy hour and they always have a great selection on tap. My favorite place in Aurora.

Good selection of beers, I don't have too much to say. Dropped in for a beer with a friend on a Wednesday night and it was pretty good. Order the garlic pretzel bites (average) and spinach/artichoke dip (DELICIOUS).

I have only gone for a beer so I cannot comment on the food. They have a good selection of local craft beers and you can't beat sitting outside under the tree with a beer while waiting for your movie show time next door at movie tavern.

Got take out a couple nights ago. I got their chicken fingers and a side of their fries with gravy. The gravy, it should be noted - is AMAZING. Like, beyond amazing. I could eat a bathtub full of this stuff. And the fries are great. Chicken fingers were pretty meh, but it's hard to make those stand out. 

I want to try this place for Geeks Who Drink!

They have a decent selection of beer and the food is great but you have to catch the right kitchen staff and the service is just terrible.  Typically rude and could care less about their jobs. Last time my waitress disappeared for 25 minutes AND forgot to put our order in.  I wish they had better service because this would be a for sure go to.

We ended up here last night after a movie next door. The beer was good. I had a flight. Tried 4 different brews. Liked one of them. 
Started with fried mushrooms, seem to be freshly battered. Steaming hit and served with cold ranch dressing.
Had a burger, black and blue. I think the cooks for got it was a black & blue because the peppercorn was on top of the blue cheese, not crusted on the meat patty. 

The fried were crispy but not hot. How is that possible? 

We will be back. The beer was good.

If I could give 10 stars I would, Matt your the bomb! I haven't had a great tasting burger in a very long time, you nailed it 10 times over.  Usually only come here every few months are so, defiantly will be back sooner. Maybe our next date night. The Not your Dads root beer will get me trouble but hey you only live once.
The Hilltop is not what it used to be.  The food has gone way down hill over the years.  It seemed like most of it was microwaved. The service was so so.....not sure if we'll be back.

I went to Royal Hilltop recently for Trivia Night on a Saturday and had a great time.  Trivia is from 8-10, so we got there around 7 to make sure we had a seat and to grab a bite.  

I ordered the black and blue burger but subbed a patty for a chicken breast (this can be done for all burgers on the menu).  I also subbed the fries for a salad.  The chicken breast was very juicy and the sandwich was very good.  The menu was simple and we weren't sure how the "bar food" would turn out, but everyone seemed satisfied.  I will probably go back for trivia when I am in the area again.

A half decent selection of beers, more than you would get from a national chain but still a VERY limited and static menu.

I would tell you how the food was- IF THEY EVER BROUGHT OUR FOOD OUT! The waitress literally forgot to place our order, so after almost an hour of her blatantly ignoring us we she finally walks over with the check and walks away. She said maybe two whole sentences to us the whole time, ignored us waving her down, etc. We grabbed a fast food burger instead. Never again.

Aurora, Colorado- This is an example of second chances.... Actually it took me several visits before it grew on me. After going for Michal's beer and trying some different menu options I have found that the modified Philly cheesesteak with only bell peppers, mushrooms, and onions topped with lettuce and tomato is pretty good. Michal really does rave about the beer so for beer buffs this is your spot. Try the apricot blonde, leaves of lemongrass, or raspberry- these are the reasons Hilltop earns 4 stars.

Been here a few times, but writing first review. It's convenient since it's 2 min from my house. Better than average food, for bar food. Let's just say the foods better than the service. After visit 3, I just accepted the fact, that whoever trains these servers or waitresses is lacking multi tasking skills. I will not come here if I'm starving. But I've been a fan if their fish n chips! They also have delicious fries! Hamburgers are yummy as well.

Ahh the Hiltop.  

A great place to have a drink or a bite to eat.  Situated in a small stripish mall area.   I have been here at many different times of day.  The staff is most always friendly and usually attentive.  Some bad and some good days happen.   

They have a pretty solid menu of things to choose from.  My favorite being the fish and chips.  Their beer offerings change quite a bit as well.  Not being a beer drinker I can't speak much about that.  They have Trivia on Saturday nights and the place gets packed QUICK!

Happy Hour from 3-6 which consists of $3 for draught on tap beers and  1/2 priced Appetizers.  A few other drink specials on wine and well also.  They also have a 5.99 lunch special. 

Great place to meet with friends or watch a game.

A simple review will follow.
We ate next door...
...next time I'll just skip that food and head straight over here.
I don't find myself too often in this part of Aurora, but...
...I will definitely stop back.
This place has a ton of beers.
(17 or 18 if I recall)
Good prices...I love it when the bill comes and I'm shocked, in a good way.
"That is less than I expected."
"Was it Happy Hour?"
"Must have been."
"Sweet!"
Cold glasses, and...
And, the glass size and shape matched the beer being enjoyed.
I understand they have food choices, 
I'll just have to return and try it out.

Im bare assing

Friday night, 7ish

Weird wooden booth
Beer and two sodas, kids
Menus looked at
and looked at
and looked at
Menus balanced off edge of table
attempts at eye contact
Bartender, pay check
not busy, i now know why

smelled funky too

We have been here twice so far for Geeks Who Drink trivia on Saturday nights, and we will be back!  We've each tried the fish and chips and liked it; it's not greasy,  My wife thought the burger was OK the other time; I had the steamed mussels and HIGHLY recommend them (but you'd better LOVE garlic!).  Small dessert menu; just 3 choices.  This place is small so get there early for trivia.  

Overall, I recommend them.
Didn't expect the food to be as good as it is. One of the best burgers & Monty cristo sandwiches around! Good beer too

Great little place to try some local beers. The staff was very knowledgable and able to provide good recommendations. The burger was also really good. This is a great place to have a casual night with friends.

The bartending staff was SUPER cool and they were very personable. The restaurant is close to the movie theater and it gets pretty busy around movie time. The service for my food was kind of slow, but the bartender was extremely apologetic. Would I go back, YES! Even better, I have a 2-for-1 coupon that I will be using next time. 

Tip: The place isn't that big, this can be an advantage or disadvantage, but don't hold it against them :-)
I recieved exceptional service from a woman named Olivia. She was funny and had a great mood and we absolutely adored her! Food was awesome as well, we most definitely will be back :)

I love this place! they're right down the street from my house, so in the summertime we come here all the time. their food has always been really good and fresh and they have one of my favorite beers on tap. I love the relaxed atmosphere. the service can be kind of slow sometimes, but I don't mind because I just love this place. the basket of chips (fries and gravy) is to die for! I get it every time.

Occasion: Birthday Celebration. casual drinks. with friends.

Overall experience: not bad.

I felt quite at ease as i walked into this quaint little tap house. the walls are painted in dark hues, creating an old English pub feel. I like the large chalk board full of beers on tap and in cans. No bottles are served here, which i thought was interesting. The beer, was good. nothing outstanding and stellar, but completely hit the stop. [ i mean what concludes a day of shopping better than beer?] the service was also interesting. i'm not sure if our waitress was tired, hungover/still drunk or just plain stupid but she was slow, rarely checked back with our table and wasn't in the mood for conversation. hmmm.

However, despite the service, this pub is pretty cool. lots of beers. good food & a great place to gather with friends :)

We went with a group of six & had a couple beers, burgers, & fish and chips. The fries were a little salty but everything else tasted great. My husband said his ranch burger was one of the best he'd hag in a while.
Love this place! Amazing fried pickles to die for!  Also a great selection for beer . Staff is super friendly and great atmosphere!

This bar could really have something if the wait staff would step up their game.  I have gone here a couple of times because of its convenient location and I do like the food and selection of beers but the wait time and lack of attention from the servers is disappointing....

Where was Royal Hilltop when I lived in Aurora?  If it had been there, I would have been a regular!  As it stands, we don't get here often, but always enjoy the Hilltop when we do visit.   They have some pretty tasty food, including those amazing Garlic Pretzel Bites!  We can't visit without getting at least one order, sometimes two!  They are too good for words!   The entrees are delish as well.  The burgers are tasty and their Irish fare, like the Shepherd's Pie, is spot on.  The craft beer selection is always great and ever-changing.   The best time to visit the Royal Hilltop is Saturday night, when they have Geeks Who Drink trivia.   It's such fun!   Get there early for a table and for dinner, and enjoy a few beers during the contest.  Even if you don't win, I assure you it's a good time!
Favorite go to bar and grill in Aurora! Best service - neighborhood environment and good bar food!
Nice place... Very loud.... Food was really good...  Service. Not that great... Under staffed... Or to busy sitting in booth with friends playing around...

We came here the other day before heading to the Movie Tavern next door. Like my wife says, I'm thinking they'd be much better for a beer and appetizer rather than an actual meal.

First off, there were only 2 other tables with people on them and a couple people working, so you'd think the service would be right on top of things. Nope. We sat for a few minutes before they bothered to come and take our orders, and there were several times while we were in there that our drinks were empty, which is a HUGE pet peeve of mine. After we were done eating I also had to go interrupt the server (she was in the middle o texting for about 15 minutes) and ask for our check, since we had to get to our movie.

The food itself was decent. We got the fried pickles, which were awesome. I got a burger, which was just okay. It didn't really have any flavor, which was odd since it had BBQ sauce and bacon on it. The wife got the turkey wrap and she said it was flavorless, too. The french fries were good, tho.

Overall, I'd come back for a brew and an app, but that's probably it.

As I broaden my horizons and begin to embrace more of the Aurora eateries and bars, I find that they're not as scheezy as I once thought.  This brewery restaurant is unassuming and casual in it's location and decor, inviting and not very crowded from my experience and other reviews I see.  They have a handful of TVs, several high tops, low tops and booths.

The menu isn't loaded, however what they do offer is better than average eats.  I had the Rueben and despite having pickles on it (huh?) it was hot and good with just the right amount of kraut.  My friend had the fish and chips and they were very good - great batter and hot moist fish inside.

The beer was not very good.  I had their Hefeweizen and the Railyard ale and had to choke them down.  Not good at all - they need some professional consulation on their methods or their recipes.  The service was even worse than the beer.  Despite not ever getting a napkin or utencils with my meal, the waitress didn't even acknowledge me or take my drink or food order when she came by to check on the table (I came a little late).  Okay maybe that was a simple oversight but it didn't stop there.  I never got my water and she was unattentive in general to the whole table.

If it hadn't been for good company it would have been a two star rating.  I can't say I really recommend this place.

I am thinking this is a better for a beer and some apps than a place for lunch.  We did lunch.  

Service was really slow at noon on Saturday - so slow we almost missed our movie start.  The food was decent.  The fried pickle spears were big and crisp.  My wrap was fresh, but flavorless.  The fries were in abundance and had a nice spice.  

They have a decent beer menu and lots of TVs.  Still the food was so-so and the service lacked, so in the end it was only OK, but not something makes me want to come running back.

It's Saturday night and it just so happens to be trivia night - how fun! My husband had the fish and chips which was amazing. The breading on the fish was light and fluffy, the fries were crisp and delish, and their ranch is homemade and amazing! I had the steamed garlic and wine mussels and fries - amazing! We can't wait to come back!
WOW their Pepper jack Bacon Burger is amazing!! Deff getting one again soon!!

Been here many times, great happy hour prices. Good selection of beer overall. Food is decent but not a big selection but it is a small place. Nice atmosphere and wait staff is always friendly and knowledgable about their beers.
this place went down hill after they remodeled and stepped away from being a British pub. Food went with it. only reason they received a second star is because I enjoy micro brews.

Pros:
Staff
The staff reminds me a of mix between Empire Records and Cheers...

The ambience is laid back, the barmaids are super cute and very friendly and the french fries rock!. It's a great place for an afternoon away from a busy bar. The beer selection is good but expensive.

Food
They made some tasty burgers but not alot of variety
I mostly come here though for the mussels and fries! It's an awesome dish- it's served in a butter/lemon/shallot/wine broth with a heavty portion of their stringy crunchy fries, a garlic aoeli dip and a loaf of fresh french bread for dipping in the buttery broth after you're done sucking the mussles out of thier shells.

Happy Hour
it's happy and irish- usually less crowded
Not a place to get the pickup, definately a close knit, neighborhood type bar.

Cons:
They close earlier than all other bars every night- so boo to that
The music is usually too low- sometimes it takes the staff to have a shot or two and it to be dead to get them moving in here.
Went again and enjoyed the great food and service. Our server was Alyssa and it is so refreshing to have someone that seems to really care about the customers

So, I've been to this establishment several times.  After the first time, I said I wouldn't be back.  The beer wasn't fantastic and the bartender was horrible.  But... since this is the closest bar to my house, i've given it a few more chances.  I think I want to like it more than it deserves, because I generally dislike all those pretentious Denver pseudo pubs and wanna be "dive" bars who still charge $6 a pint or $9 a cocktail and those "craft" bartenders who can't seem to figure out the difference between a Gibson and a Martini (tho most won't be bothered to serve a simple drink like a plain ol' Martini or can't cuz only Appletini's are on their drink menu).  Annnyyyywwwayyyy.... I want to like this place as a good ol fashioned blue collar bar.  It definitely has a local vibe and if you're not a regular, a few stink eyes might get thrown your way, especially at happy hour. 

I've sat at the bar and at tables.  One of the best times I had there was on a Saturday night quiz night with my father and girlfriend.  We were greeted with friendly competition and never got booed while we were winning the quiz.  So, the local feel got somewhat friendlier.  

My girlfriend and I recently had an early dinner here.  They seemed busy at the bar with happy hour and the bartender was the only staff working.  She was SO MUCH friendlier than the previous bartender/waitress (the one with the nose ring).  She knew the LOCAL beers, all where from Colorado, so I'm not sure where the idea they don't serve local brews came from.  I had the Philly and GF had a huge side salad and chicken strips.  The Philly was better than the one I got at Pat's in Philly and the chicken strips were battered like fish and delicious.  I got a great Milk Stout to top off the dinner.  The whole meal was reasonably priced.  

I give it three stars instead of more for a couple of reasons.  I've been patronizing the place for the better part of a year and feel a bit cold every single time I walk in.  The other reason is that generally the service is mediocre at best.  This last time was the best by far, but when we walked in 10 till 5pm, the bartender was the only staff.  It wasn't her fault it took a bit to get to us, but why hasn't the owner figured this out?

Anyway, pretty decent place. Not a dive bar or brewery, but a good little local bar selling ok food and good Colorado beers.
Fried Pickles are the best here... they come in spears and like a onion ring batter. And the beer is pretty good. The wait staff is okay.

Yikes !! My husband has always wanted to try this restaurant as it's right down the road from our house and has a nice variety of beers on tap. The variety of beer is probably the only thing they've got going for them. Everything else was pretty bad. 

Our appetizer was overcooked and dry. The waitress was nasty and more interested in socializing with the cook than us and I couldn't even finish my meal. In fact it seemed most of the staff acted as if our party and the other two couples in the restaurant were a nuisance that were interrupting their personal break time.  I can't even remember the last time I've been so unhappy with a meal. 

I left feeling like we would've had a better experience at the Sonic that's in the same parking lot. Sorry Royal Hilltop but I won't be back !!

There aren't many English Pubs here in Aurora and we were excited to try Royal Hilltop located off of Tower Rd and Hampden a couple of months ago.

When we walked in, we weren't sure if we had stepped into a Pub or simply a dive.  There wasn't much décor, just plasma TV's with basketball games on and the standard neon bar signs. We were told that they had just switched from British Ales to Local Brews, so any English charm that we were looking for was no longer there.  The staff seemed relatively friendly but were more concerned with socializing with patrons that are regulars. 

Our waitress, we found really needs to find a new line of work. They weren't in any kind of uniform or T-shirt promoting the place. They had on a plain t-shirt that was a few sizes to small and frumpy pants. She shuffled across the floor, not seeming to care about anything except the friends that were there.  Because she was more concerned with socializing, it took awhile to get our order placed, any refills and our final bill. 

The food was ok but nothing really that is worth gushing about. I ordered the Monk and Cheese. It's Penne pasta served with a three cheese sauce and I asked for chicken. I found the cheese sauce to be bland and the chicken was just grilled with a small amount of spices. I have to admit, a box of Mac and Cheese would be better than what I had and a lot cheaper.  I wish I could say something more on the dish but there isn't really anything else to say.  Simon had ordered the Fish and Chips. It's Alaskan cod that is fried in a beer batter and served with slaw, tartar sauce and fries. The Fries were cooked well but over salted and the fish was ok. 

We feel that the dishes are over priced for the quantity and quality of food. They do have a children's menu and they offer a number of beers. Will we be back? I don't know. Maybe we went on a bad night.  Have you been there and had a different experience?
Good beer, awesome happy hour. My only gripe is sometimes the waitresses are slower than the lines at the dmv.

We are new to the area and just trying out all the nearby spots.  This place is a decent on the fly meal.  Staff was super friendly and food was pretty good.  I had a Caesar Salad with Blackened Chicken (good kick) and it was better than the one I got from Chili's last week that's for sure.  My husband got the fish and he was very happy with it.  Over all a good experience and I'm sure we will stop back in.
My friend farted three times and I didn't smell it... It's a little smelly when I was here. Service was great! Love all the tap beer! Five stars for service.

I consistently drive by and today my husband and I had a early dinner there.  There was a good crowd for 4 pm in the afternoon  and the atmosphere was friendly.  My hubby had Dry Dock Apricot Blonde and I had a Diet Coke. Incredibly dissatisfied when our waitress brought our drinks. The Blonde was flat and poured horribly. My soda was flat as well. Our waitress was not personable and seemed bored with her job. She literally put her elbows on our table while standing; this was after waiting almost 10 minutes for her to take our food order. We ordered wings, french dip sandwich and a Monte Carlo.  Wings were excellent; both sandwiches were good. A tad greasy for my taste.  The waitress was more interested in hugging and talking to the people behind the bar than serving the people seated in her area. She left dirty plates on our table, didn't check to see if we needed anything else and we had to flag her to tab us out. She didn't inform us that happy hour was going on or engage us in any conversation.  It seems like a good neighborhood bar but the waitstaff was horrible. The bartenders seemed happy and friendly. I wish we would've sat at the bar. Not a place I'll visit again which is sad since I live 7 min away.

Decent bar in South Aurora.  They started doing Geeks who Drink here so we are visiting more than we used to.  Decent beer selection and their Fries are fantastic.

I hear they are owned by the same people who own the Cheeky Monk.  Personally, I'd like to see them convert this to a Cheeky Monk.  Perhaps the clientele in Aurora wouldn't support it, which is a shame.

Went last week with a group of 9 and had a great time. We sat on the patio which was quite nice and everyone enjoyed their meals. The burgers were tasty and the beer selection was top notch! The new Owner is really doing it right!

Been there several times but service is hit and miss.  Allow more time before happy hour ends or the waitress will get distracted and not enter your order in the 10min timeout.

Beer selection is fine.  Love the gravy and fries.  If you want mussels then go to Le Central, these are smaller in quantity and lame tasting in comparison, not quite their forte.

Dutch lunch was very adequate and enjoyable.  Tried their wings once but they are somewhat forgettable.  Their soups tend to be on the saltier side.  Happy with their salads.  Fish and Chips is not my first choice but they are OK.

Wife tried their Monte Cristo but it was an uneatable grease sponge and they wouldn't make good on a replacement.  That was a last visit.

Can recommend the Reuben, Fish Po Boy and BLT.

Their remodel from a couple years ago aborted from the pub experience, some of the weaknesses remain in some of their staff and menu items so we rarely go there now.
Dude where's my beer? Love this place the Fish and Chips are the best for this part of town! The staff completely makes this place great!

The staff is very nice and they have a good beer selection.  The happy hour is good $3.00 caft beers and the waitress will usually ask if we want another before the end of happy hour.   The food selection is terrible and the service can be slow, they are always understaffed.
Great beer.  And delicious food.  Nice small cozy place.  Fish and chips is the way to go for food.  I only say that because i havent tried anything else but the beer.

Stopped in here last month because I needed to kill an hour or so and it was either this or the Village Inn.  Had a Guinness and a club sandwhich.  Think I spent about $15 which wasn't bad.  The sandwhich was good and the service was attentive.  I don't recall if the service was slow. I wouldn't have cared if they were.  I almost never care unless I'm in some kind of big hurry which I rarely am.  Anyway, looked like a good place to hang out if I lived nearby.  It was clean, had a decent menu and a good beer selection.

The best hot wings, fried pickles and ohhhhhh the stew.... EVER
Grat Bangers and Mash.  They do love the military...... A few songs here and there.  

The atmospher is the best.

Parking on weekends sucks though.... The food is worth walking 3/4 mile to get to.  

St. Patricks day is a blast oooooooooooooyyyyyyyuuuuummmmmm.... 

I am kinda sad never to have taste the foot though.... LMAO

This is a great stop before or after a visit to the Movie Tavern. It's basically an English Pub. There is a variety of beer, whiskey and typical English dishes like fish and chips. Every time I have been here, I am happy with how clean the pub is.

This little home town pub gets my seal of approval.
I love the Royal Hilltop... its a small, quaint, personal Brit style pub with all that you might expect when you stop for a pint. Great service with a smile!

Once you get service it gets nice. I have been to this restaraunt a few times now and it seems anytime I go there I wait an elongated period of time just for a server to come by and take a drink order. They have some great pub foods that I really do enjoy, and could eat on a regular basis.
Service has improved considerably.  We actually frequent the Royal Hilltop on a frequent basis - love Geeks Who Drink on Saturday nights!

The food here is pretty good, and the service is what you usually expect from friendly bar/pub staff. The few times I've been in late-night or beyond dinner have been somewhat slow, while the dinner-time hours can have a decent crowd. Because it's a neighborhood establishment, I'll certainly go again (as I've done many times before).

I took the locals advice and went back for happy hour...the happy hour is great.  The great service brought me back.  Dogfish Head 90 min. IPA for $3.00?  You can't beat that.  The guy next to me ordered a french dip or a philly sandwich which looked incredible...maybe the night I was there and had the Ruben was an off night?  I will go back and try the food again.

Just as the english are not known for fine dining, neither is this place.  But if you want to grab a "nice" plate of bar food, try the fish and chips, it's salmon not cod!  Also, their beers are pretty darn unique.  Not a cheap place, but a nice place to sit at the bar and have a couple of drinks.

I went on a Tuesday and there were drink specials (good beer specials).  I had the fish n chips, which were good but greasy.  Perhaps I shouldn't mind too terribly much that the fish was greasy, but it seemed to be more greasy than what I had imagined.  I suggest this place and recommend it highly.  They have a decent amount of English brews and a load of single malt scotches.  Its a nice place to sit quietly and enjoy your brew.  The fish and chips, blue burger and ruben are all good!

Had the burger with cheese and bacon...it was delicious. Cooked medium and very juicy, I'd highly recommend it. The fries were also very good. They have a large assortment of whiskey available (but I didn't have any). It's a bit loud for small children, though any over the age of 5 or 6 should be fine.

There is nothing greater than a small bar near your house that serves great food and has a decent happy hour. I think every true beer drinker searches for this ideal place...I am still searching. When we moved back to the Aurora area we were pleased that we might have found a new place to call home. WRONG! The Royal Hilltop smells like a dirty foot and the food tastes about the same. Although the smell of a dirty foot almost always accompanies tiny little bars..usually the food and the service is what draws the crowd in. I've never seen a staff move so slow. Hey...this isn't Montana...we are in the city. You can always count on spending more than $30 bucks for a "quick" beer. Yes, the Hilltop has a great selection of Premium beers...but their happy hour sucks..only $1.00 off. Best best in Aurora...stick to something more consistent, Old C's, which is another review in its self.
Best fried pickles around :) Good beer too!

Stopped by the Royal Hilltop on my way home from work; I had a craving for some fish and chips.  They've expanded their beer selection since the last time I was in, so I had a nice porter while waiting for my meal.  The fish was 3 pieces of excellent cod (not salmon as another reviewer mentioned), and the fries were shoestring and hot and crispy.  Unfortunately, I had ordered tartar sauce, but was informed they no longer serve tartar sauce, only garlic aioli.  What?  No tartar sauce with fried fish, in a bar in the USA?  Somebody in the kitchen thinks they're a gourmet.  Hopefully they'll get over it.  Service was acceptable, and the food was excellent, but -1 for the garlic aioli.  I'll go back, but if I want fish, I'll bring my own tartar sauce.
Update: They were simply out of tartar sauce that night; my waitress made it sound like it was a culinary choice.  Still good fish & chips!  And malt vinegar is still available for those with a more British taste.

This place sucks, missing some of Colorados great craft beers along with other national and international mainstays. Anchor Steam? Guiness? Newcastle? Oskar Blues.. WTF?? New Belgium? Boulder Beer? Tommy Knocker? Is it to much to ask to get a Dales Pale Ale or Gubna. It would be nice to drink great beers and support other Colorado Breweries at the same time. I hate saying this but in this case I would rather support a chain restaurant (Old Chicago) that supports local breweries before  I would spend another dollar at this place. Food sucks too!

I am feeling under the weather and wanted some good, spicy, nutrient rich pho. I checked Yelp! And this place was close for delivery. 

I ordered the large rare steak pho, which came with a very generous portion of meat, noodles and fresh veggies as well as sauce. 
The broth was very flavorful. 

I also ordered some egg rolls, which were fantastic and a taro boba. The boba arrived still frozen and was delicious. 

The delivery man was very friendly and overall the customer service was superb. 

I will definitely return!

So glad I found this place via Yelp!  I've been looking for good pho in the area without having to drive out to Federal.  It's in a strip mall that looks very hole-in-the-wall but really clean and spacious inside.  Friendly service and solid pho.  We tried the seafood pho and the combination.  They even brought out a free side of grilled pork.  The thai spring rolls were pretty good too (with pork and shrimp instead of just shrimp).  

Good size portions too, we got mediums and I couldn't even finish mine.

Very meh, though I'm happy they deliver and will likely order again.

I had the vegetarian pho and the broth was just okay. Nothing special. Husband had the rare steak pho and was fine with it, though he'll eat most anything that's comprised of noodles and broth.

The egg rolls take it down to 3 stars, though. The entire thing tasted and looked pre-frozen. Not at all your standard Vietnamese egg roll. No ridiculously crunchy exterior deep friend to smithereens - just an average egg roll. Boo.

Ordered from here 2x now. First time, it took nearly an hour and a half and they forgot the drink. Driver was extremely rude, basically shoved the food into my hands and ran off to his car before I could ask where the drink was. Not a good look when your tip has been prepaid at 25%. Food was meh, nothing memorable.

Second time, I waited over 2 hours before finally calling and having the order cancelled and refunded. First time I called, the lady assured me it was on the way. Second time she actually asked for my order number, making me think that such long delivery times are the standard for them and they just automatically respond "it's on the way" if you call for an update. For what it's worth, they did refund the money and I got a text this morning offering free food, but to be honest, I don't think this place is worth it. Not even for free.

2 stars for the effort to make it right, at least.
I love this restaurant.  the best pho I have ever tried. when I order Pho here , the waiter give me small place Spice Beef, it's free. really good to eat with Pho. I will be back for sure

Simple new Pho place but boy is it good! I got the seafood Pho and I wasn't disappointed. Clumps of great seafood in the soup and even a lobster claw!  Vietnamese iced coffee was also top notch. Tv and atmosphere was relaxed and the owner was very nice.
I wish him luck on this new business and if you go in now you'll get 20% off!

In short, this place was AWESOME! Came home from work, tired and had a taste for Pho. Checked out the Yelp reviews and decided to go for it! My food came super fast, was nice and hot and delicious! Definitely a keeper! I ordered the shrimp rolls, fried dumplings, the combination fried rice and the Pho with the rare steak. So YUM! 
PS-Free delivery!!!! I'll be ordering again. :)

Pretty solid pho. Not saying I could call it better or worse than pho on 6th (my benchmark).

Spring roll was good.

Appearance of the facility is a little worriesome...

Probably won't make the trip again, but if you're nearby it's decent.

I had the rare brisket.

Veggies were good.

I've only gotten takeout here, but when I picked up my food, the staff was nice. I've ordered Pho twice and it was great! More than I could eat in one sitting, for sure. Always ready super quick. Plenty of toppings. They're Pho 89, I'm not sure if originally they were Pho 999? A little confusing though. It's a bit of a hole in the wall on the outside, but nice on the inside. Great for a pho fix!

Easily the best pho I have ever had. We ordered from this place for the second time today. We were very impressed both times. Everything we have tried so far is amazing. The portions are very generous and more than fairly priced. I am so glad to have found this gem right before fall and winter. I will be eating pho there regularly when it is cold outside. Finally some really awesome food in the neighborhood.

I have to say this place was a real treat on my visit to Denver. The broth was excellent! The waitress even brought me a little side plate of a spicy beef as little surprise... it was delightful. The outside is not fancy but it's what's inside that really counts and that was terrific!
For delivery it was not to bad the egg rolls where a little tough but the soup was good I have tried many pho places I can't say the best but also not the worst

I noticed this place a few weeks ago driving by and stopped in for lunch.  I wasn't really in the mood for pho, so I opted for a rice plate (grilled chicken and eggroll).  It was OK.  The eggroll was greasy.  The grilled chicken was just a tad greasy, but had good flavor.  Overall, it was a generous portion of meat and rice, and with the 20% Grand Opening discount they were giving, it was incredibly inexpensive.

The exterior of the restaurant and the small strip mall it's located in really need a serious facelift and parking is awkward, but the interior of the restaurant is clean and pleasant and the staff were friendly and accommodating.

I just moved from Seattle, one of the Asian food capitols of the US. I know good pho, and this is it! The side basil, lime, and sprouts are generous. The broth is rich but light, herbal, and nuanced. The service is super friendly, and the coffee great. 

The outside is a little run down, but it's an older building. Very nice and completely clean inside. Go here.

This restaurant has exceeded our expectations with every item we've ordered off the menu and is quickly becoming a weekly stop. The pho is so great and you get a ton of it even in the medium. Also the fried rice is delicious and super flavorful. Although it looks unassuming from the outside the inside is clean and nice and the staff is super friendly. 10/1 would recommend
Awesome staff and food, come check this place out and show them some love. There is always a great place that is undiscovered like this one.

Pho 89 is an amazing place. Both times I was having a walk and they treated me great. Great music, scenes, and food, this is a highly underrated place that will be up and coming, and I haven't tried the pho yet. Great vibes and energy my friends!

PHObulous!!!!

I love Pho.... noticed the restaurant on my way to my hotel after a long day and decided to stop by.
Friendly and courteous staff, the food is excellent the pricing is unbeatable with a 20% on top!

I definitely recommend this atabliahment to anyone in the area.... best Pho and shrimp rolls are served here!

Best Banh Mi in Denver area, I am in the game and have been trying different ones around Federal and other places, but none comes close to this one.  Good amount of meat, great crusty bread, put together well.  Also tried the spring rolls and they were excellent.  Have not tried pho yet, but you can tell this family puts heart and effort into the dishes, so just waiting for it to get cold enough to crave pho.  Highly recommended!

I have tried Pho 89 two times. Vegetables are not fresh. Soup broth comes in a styrofoam cup instead of sealed container. The lid is Bakelite and melted. The soup leaked into bag and shards of plastic fell into soup. The delivery driver was confused about my building number and not able to operate the gate call box. Not a terrible experience, but probably will go elsewhere.
Good pho and Vietnamese food. The tastiest pho I have try so far around my neighborhood. Happy to finally have it near home

The new location is in our neighborhood so we tried it and we were not disappointed. the food was delicious and the service great. i looked like the owner was working really hard, doing it all cooking and waiting the tables. its only the second week and they have gotten it together surprisingly well. the food is really good, portions are big, and the prices reasonable. atmosphere is nothing special, although better than most of the Pho places on Havana. we will definately be going back.
Delicious seafood pho and rare steak pho, and eggroll noodle plate. Excellent portions of herbs and lime, everything tasty and fresh -- plus great, friendly delivery!
The food was very good it arrived before the delivery time and the delivery guy was very professional would definitely recommend, I got rare steak pho.

Delicious! I love Pho, and always looking to try out new places. I decided to check yelp again to see if there was anything new near me that I was missing out on. Low and behold, a new Pho restaurant popped up less than a mile from my place. I went and got take out, and was absolutely pleased! It was DELICIOUS! And they have other entrees as well, just in case your looking to feed any non-pho eaters! I have found my new go-to, pho take out restaurant! The restaurant is huge, so dining in is also an option! Don't miss out on this brand new gem!
Good Bahn mi, had the spicy beef. Broth for chicken pho was well spiced. Will go again.
the best food must try the fried shrimp. Great service and very clean restaurant. Everyone in my party enjoyed there food

Really good, especially for the price. Portions were generous and food was fresh and hot. Including delivery charge my order was under $15 for 2 orders of pho that my son and I split into 2 meals. Will definitely order again!

I had Bun Dac Biet, crispy egg rolls, spring rolls and a smoothie. Everything was high quality and delicious, good size portions I got to take plenty as leftovers. They put a little pork into the spring roll as well as the rice noodles, lettuce and shrimp, which is a touch I've always enjoyed.

Absolutely fantastic! 

My dad and I went to Jax to eat dinner. We sat at the bar and watched Monday Night Football. We were also able to take advantage of their happy hour. 

I ordered the ahi tuna, and it was a perfect size. Not to mention the noodles that it was served with. They were fantastic! 

Sitting at the bar, I never expect much of service, but the service that night was really fantastic.

Jax boasts an excellent location in the courtyard of Hilton Hotel on one side and Marriott on the other. It specializes in NOLA style seafood and promises to deliver that in Denver CO. Jax does not disappoint. I am reviewing their early Monday 4PM Happy Hour which apparently does not end until closing. 
We had from Roasted Oysters to Shrimp cooked in Bay Seasoning and from Chesapeake Oysters to Seafood Chowder. Each dish was on target busting out with its own and original Flavors. The experience was that of eating inside a well organized and executed seafood house. Service consisted of an extremely friendly, fast and knowledgeable staff. They also serve a great selection of local beers on tap. 
I must mention that the seafood was fresh, spiced right, presented well & tasted great. It was a perfect experience. Made my Monday evening!

We had a great time at dinner here!  The chargrilled oysters were superb.  We ended up ordering a lot of appetizers and were impressed with all of them.  They have awesome calamari that comes with a really great side/dipping sauce.

The star of the meal was probably the seafood chowder.  The broth was delicious.  So delicious I almost asked for a side of the broth to take home.  Maybe next time...

I love seafood. I thought this place would not know how to do seafood simply because it's in Denver (I can hit a nine iron from my house and it would land in SF Bay). What can I say I'm a coastal snob. 

I went all protein tonight. Starting with the calamari because it came free with hotel voucher. Nice combo sweet savory sauces. Then we ordered six "nawlins" style oysters (cooked on grill with butter and cheese) and six raw.  My dining partner ordered some straight alcohol drink. I ordered homemade ginger beer and Seagrams.

 Our high energy, sweet but not syrupy over the top waitress Abby suggested we get a specific oyster that had a clean finish with a hint of cucumber. 

After we downed those bad boys, not the best but purdy darn good, my dining partner waved me in close to tell me a secret. As I leaned in over the table he asked me if I tasted the cucumber. I said a little very subtle. He said "well Abby knew I liked cucumber because that's the finishing flavor in my drink. It accompanies these oysters perfectly. This girl knows her stuff!"

Wow now that is amazing!!! After that she recommended the special boil as main course. I wasn't one to second guess her after that knowledge so that's what I ordered. 

Bit over boiled to my taste lots of shrimp a few crawdads (crawfish for you northerners) big hunk of snow crab which I hooked up with dropping some old bay into my buttah to hook it up. Snow crab is very clean but mild not like blue crab)
The andouille sausage was ok more like polish sausage but it complimented everything else. 
Washed it all down with an Anchor Steam. Amazing.

Abby indulged us in sampling their own home made brewskies. Not a fan! But I'm sure hard core folks would like em. I'm a lager dude who goes straight from Stella to Guinness. None of those reds ambers, wheats for me.
Then we got the peaches and cream pound cake. To share. 
That Abby... she presented two perfectly proportional pieces, perfect for sharing. Impossible to distinguish which was bigger.  Truly amazing!

Staff backing Abby up were on point with water clearing plates etc. 

So while the food was about a 3.5 the service was a 5 or more. Why would I come back to a place where the food is slightly above average for the price?  Because when the meal is an exploratory event with exemplar staffing, decor is awesome, and in the kitchen you can feel a bit of flare for experimentation leaning to the naughty side (Kind of like New Orleans without the grit and grime) and it's in Denver... come on man... 
This may be as close to a great seafood meal as you land locked knuckleheads will get without getting on a plane. 
Ah yeah -spoken like a guy that can hit a nine iron and be in SF bay.  So if I am coming back... what's your excuse for not?

Yelp challenge 2016 (59/100)

This place was SO convenient to where we stayed in Colorado. It was right downstairs! We came here to try some appetizers and small plates before we went to dinner. 

For apps, we got the Fish Cake Sliders, Garlic Fries, Raw Oysters, Pork Belly Beignets, Calamari, and Fruit de Mer.. I recommend the Calamari and the Garlic Fries. I loved the Pork Belly Beignets because 1. I love pork belly and 2. I love beignets, but the plate itself was pretty small. 

For drinks, I had the Jax Strawberry Lemonade, Cucumber Lemon Press, and Paloma. I'd definitely go with the Strawberry Lemonade.

I would've wrote this review sooner because I thought we were coming back, but we didn't have time :( Overall still a great experience. I'm sure I would've loved having a meal here!

Another great dining experience! I love oysters and today they had oysters for 75 cents each (until they ran out). Came in around 4:15pm with my Mom and were immediately greeted and seated. Marie was our server and she was very pleasant, professional and efficient.

Started off ordering a dozen oysters, calamari and Brussels Sprouts, and a Howdy Beer from the Happy Hour Menu. All were very delicious. My brother-in-law came in later and we ordered two dozen oysters, another Brussels Sprouts and the peel and eat shrimp and the fruit de mer (yum, yum, yummers!!) :-)

He ordered the Cucumber Lemon Press (cucumber infused vodka, housemade lemonade, soda). I definitely had to try it and it was very tasty and went down smooth.

By the time we got ready to go it was pretty full and had a great vibrant feel. They have free valet and also there is free 2 hour parking and free parking in the garage.

I heard mixed things about Jax, before making a reservation for happy hour (my Uber driver literally said, "That place is super overrated"), but we were having company from another land locked state, that enjoy seafood and it was right near my office, so I took the plunge.

Before I even get to the food and drink, as soon as I set foot in the restaurant, I was brushed aside by the hostess which put a sour taste in my mouth.  I came in, and was not addressed, but immediately after me, a big crowd of people came in, and the hostess began seating them.  I got her attention and said, "Excuse me I have a reservation..."  since I had entered a good 2 minutes before them, but she laughed, literally brushed me aside as you would a small child, and said, "Well... let me let these people inside."  (It was also 65 degrees and they were standing in the foyer... not outside in bad weather).  I immediately felt like I was bothering her, and since the place was packed, debated going elsewhere.

I did get seated however, and the place was hopping, and super loud.  It is clearly a very busy place for Happy Hour, but I'm not totally sure why.  The food was ok, but overpriced and not super filling.  Being from Maine, I didn't expect to be blown away, but it was meh.  The spicy tuna things  were good, but super small (and only two for $8????) and the mussels were good.  The drinks were mediocre, and one of the members of our party almost sent hers back (something spicy with ginger beer) but was too embarrassed to make a big deal.  I had the sangria, which was raved about by my co-workers, but I thought tasted like white wine and sprite.  An ok drink, but I guess I was expecting more.  Honestly, I wasn't paying, so it was an ok experience, but truthfully we ended up eating again a couple hours later.

I might go back to give Jax another chance and maybe try the oysters that they are known for, but frankly, I think there are better places in the area especially if you want more bang for your buck!!I

Amazing experience! Happy hour menu was amazing. Excellent flavors in each dish, seafood was extremely fresh and bartenders were super friendly and knowledgeable. Peel and eat shrimp were awesome with a subtle seasoning on top. Brussels sprouts delicious with twist in the sauce. I'm looking forward to the pork fat beignets
Food was amazing clean bathrooms and respectful and kind waiters and waitresses I got wrong food emitit change in food and very wonderful service. Food came fast and was de

Whaaaat? I haven't reviewed Jax?!! This is just the biggest failure on my part ever. I guess I just assumed that I dine here so often my review would write itself!

Well, they (I say they because there are a few locations) are hands down THE best seafood restaurant in Colorado. And not just because Landry's owns all of the others and they are now cheesy chains.

I digress. Jax has stunning decor, classy service, and trendy couture seafood that is fresh, fresh, fresh and num, num, num. Jax has made me like and trust raw oysters again and that was no easy task!

I have probably dined at Jax a dozen times. I tell everyone to go there. I take my friends and family there. I've never been disappointed. I'm so sorry I didn't review them on here. Or did I? Maybe one of the other locations? Yes! Eureka!

Well, now that I've written this one. It stays! Be sure to check out their happy hour and brunch!

Everybody enjoyed what they ordered. I had the wedge salad which was good but not great. I also had the brussels sprouts and they were so salty I could not even begin to eat them. They have some nice early bird specials for food and drink.

I feel discouraged to visit the downtown Jax Fish House after having dined at the Glendale location. It's a brightly lit restaurant not overcrowded by brunchers on a Sunday, so I could not understand why our waitress was surly. Even the bus boy was in a happier mood and was the one who serviced us more.
