Not a whole lot to choose from the Brunch menu (would be nice if other lunch items were offered), we decided on the lobster roll (overcooked lobster meat and you call yourself a fish house?!?) with fantastic house made chips; the burger (had fried oyster in the patty? but instead of being flavorful, it was a bit bitter...) with mediocre fries; and the crispy brussel sprouts seasoned with fish sauce (good flavor).

Wednesday before Thanksgiving? Jax saves the day!

We rolled in around 7 PM and the place was pretty packed, but we still got a table for three smack dab in the middle of the dining room :) No happy hour, but that didn't stop us. We started with a round of hard strawberry lemonades and some calamari and oysters on the half shell. I loved the strawberry lemonade because it was sweet with just the right amount of sour; my mom was expecting more strawberry flavor but I thought it was awesome. Calamari was yummy, not a lot of tentacles though which are fun to eat; two sauces were on the plate so don't miss that if you want to dip! Oysters on the half shell were AWESOME. We ordered six from the West Coast (I'm blanking on the name) and they were delicious with a squeeze of lemon; very fresh, firm, and tasted of the sea.

For the main course I ordered the mussels with pasta, mom had the lobster roll, and dad had a bowl of gumbo and the scallops. The mussels were legit because 1. There were a ton of them, and 2. The broth was delicious! The tomato, oniony deliciousness permeated the mussels and pasta so every bite was perfect. I mean you could even drink the broth! (totally did this using my spoon ;D) My mom liked the lobster roll but was a bit sad the lobster was cold. The side of potato chips were excellent and perfectly salted. Dad's gumbo was great and chock full of andouille sausage, and he enjoyed the scallops which were cooked perfectly.

Service was a bit stop and go; we were seated immediately but then couldn't find our waiter once we had decided what we wanted to eat. He was much more attentive after we put in our order and the food started to come out, but the beginning was a bit rough.

P.S. Restrooms are nice; they have cloth towels for drying your hands.

My girlfriends wanted to have brunch at Jax Fish House in Glendale. Of course, I was in. I have never had brunch there before, so I was excited to try new dishes.  To get the party started, we ordered some mimosas.  They offer several flavors to pick from. I wanted seafood since it is a fish house, but they really don't have much on the brunch menu that has seafood in it.  I settled on a few things to cover all bases. Oysters to start off the brunch were fantastic. Then got the chicken and crawfish gumbo. This dish was phenomenal! I wanted more.  Then to wrap it up, I got biscuits and gravy topped with sunny side up eggs.  What a great overall brunch. The service was great and perfect atmosphere. Great job Jax!

4pm to 6pm is happy hour, go. 

Strong delicious drinks. 

Oysters are fresh and delicious. Many varieties to choose from. Emersum's are the happy hour specials for $1.50 each. They have a special orange champagne sauce for the oysters that is amazing, ask for extra. 

Fruit de Mer is not recommend, small, rubbery, and acidic. 

Calamari is the best I've ever had. The best.  

Peel and eat shrimp is basic. 

Wedge salad is also basic. 

Service was good. 

Can't wait for our next visit.

This place had excellent, excellent service and of course wonderful food. We had the Emersum oysters on the waitresses recommendation and they were awesome! But do not forgo the chowder. Cooked to order and oh so buttery. Yummy yummy!
Kristin was one of the best servers I've encountered. Right on top of everything and very helpful. Made our 10th anniversary super special.

Jumpin' (raw) bar scene downstairs, which is really the heart and soul of this restaurant. Oysters are good, but over-priced at around $3-$3.50 a swallow if it's not HH. Servers and bartenders are all really nice and efficient. 

The food . . . was OK. Hence the 3 stars. Kale salad was good, but seriously over-dressed. Note to self: Self, always ask for the dressing on the side:). Then had the sea bass and the scallops. Both were decent but nothing special. Three medium-sized scallops with some lentils (which were good) and some sauce were not worth $32. The heavily seasoned India-Indian spicing of the vegetables accompanying the sea bass overwhelmed the plain-roasted fish. Key-lime pie was good but nothing special.

Prolly won't go back as a regular, but it was a hoppin' bar scene . . . so maybe I'll make an exception when I'm in the mood for a party and don't care about spending a bit too much for some seafood.

Sign me,
David "The occasional party animal" M

Jax is a decent place to have some seafood. Decent, not great. 

The happy hour menu has a lot of very interesting options, and I'll have to try more of them the next time I am in town. I ordered the happy hour sampler, which consisted of oysters, peel & eat shrimp, and snow crab legs. The oyster were delicious, so I ordered half a dozen more. The crab legs were not so great. I've definitely had fresher crab legs that I bought at Costco. The shrimp were also underwhelming - hard to peel, a bit tough, with - mealy consistency. Not the fresh, snappy consistency that I look for.

I also ordered a wedge salad, which was fairly good. 

For my main course, I had the lobster roll. This isn't a New England lobster roll by any means, but it was still pretty good. The lobster pieces were substantial and tasted pretty fresh. The flesh could have been sweeter, but not bad. My main complaint is the roll. It's fine and all, but it is toasted which makes it a bit too crispy. 

For dessert, I had the key lime pie. The presentation is very frou frou, but the pie itself wasn't spectacular. Not bad, but not memorable either.

Overall, Jax is a fun place to grab some seafood and drinks. Nice atmosphere and all that. And the oysters are great. Just don't expect the rest of the food to knock your socks off.

If Jax & the other businesses in the City Set are an example of what's to come with the Glendale Riverwalk project, Glendale is going to be really well off on good dining and fun.  This Jax location is wonderful with service, food, and location.  They have an upstairs and downstairs patio to offer a nice mix of outdoor fine-dining.  The staff and food have always been really great, and the only time I have seen this place NOT busy is close to closing time, and even then I have seen many people more than you would expect.  This place is great for a date or dining with close friends.

It was very busy when we first arrived, but the manager was very hospitable and instead of a 30 minute wait she found two seats at the bar immediately. Much appreciated! 

We started with the Chesapeake oysters for appetizers and they were delicious, fresh and served with horseradish, tomato sauce, and butter. 

There are two TVs for enjoying your favorite sports teams, nice decor with ocean/fish themes, and a huge bar that takes up most of the real estate. It looks like the tables are mostly set aside for reservations, which they offer through Open Table. 

The menu looked a bit limited in terms of fish selection, maybe due to the fact that we are in Colorado? And it was very pricey! $25 for a small portion swordfish. 

I did love that the women and the men servers had the same uniforms, and the women were not forced to wear short skirts and skimpy tops. :) 

It took about 30 minutes to receive our entrées, but tasted great.

Overall a fun experience, but too pricey for what you received. May be back!

All night Happy Hour on Monday!!! It was tasty! Oysters were fresh and dish. Had a great gin drink along with my 6 oysters, fries, slider, glass of wine, all Fri about 35. Great atmosphere as well. Definitely a place to go back ;)

Great seafood and even desert!!! I had the chowder, Garlic French fries and royal oysters. 

I will come back soon

My husband, daughter and I had dinner here last night.  Overall, it was a solid meal.  My daughter had the 1/2 of snow crab, served hot with butter.  Thumbs up.  My husband and I split the beet-avocado-arugula salad.  Loved it.  For my entree, I enjoyed the Thai catfish--lightly breaded and served with some seriously kick-ass curried squash puree, lovely greens and two slices of (frankly) under-roasted delicata squash.  My husband had the seared wahoo.  He liked it.  It was served medium--so a lightly cooked middle.  I had a taste of the miso-beet puree served with it.  Really, really delicious.  We shared a slice of the key lime pie.  Good pie.  The rum caramel sauce was the star though.  Bit spendy--we ran up our bill with a couple of drinks.

Overpriced even during happy hour. I was not very happy.
Their setup is interesting. Each table has the giant food sheets like you would find at any crawfish place but in the center is a tub of crayons. The guys and I drew portraits of each other.
The fried calamari was great. They were big pieces, juicy and tender. The oysters were on the average review small size I've seen. The spicy tuna sushi was interesting. It was spicy tuna on crispy rice. A bit too oily.

Jax's has really solid seafood and this location in Glendale does not disappoint. 

Came here the weekend before Christmas and it was packed, probably a good sign. My friend and I scored some seats at the bar which was great. We were headed to a parry so we needed just a little bit to eat so we had the crab cakes and the ahi tuna. Solid choices, the tuna was great and had a little kick for me which was awesome. 

Overall, I'd be excited to come back here when the patio opens during the summer time.

I love this place.  The seafood is amazing.  It's fresh and the variety for Denver is great.
I love the king crab, also get beignets, and the bread and butter are fantastic.

I really enjoyed Jax. We ordered the half a pound of crab which I thought might be more but it actually was only one leg. It was delicious though. I also had the lobster roll which I would definitely have again. 

The presentation was great- I wish I would have remembered to take a picture.

The ambiance is great and it's a perfect spot to catch up with friends or have a date night.

Been to this and the downtown location about a dozen times each, Jax has easily become my favorite restaurant in Denver. Everything on the menu is fresh and well prepared. They have the best calamari I've ever had anywhere. The oysters are always fresh and flavorful. The crab, all the fish, the bread, the dessert, it's all awesome. Oh yea the cocktails too. Just go here.

Tasty gumbo. Better than I thought it would be being I am a Cajun girl. The oysters were way over priced so didn't get any. Nice bar area. Looking forward to the roof top area opening this month! Would return.

I've been here a handful of times and the bar tenders are the best in the area. Knowledgeable, friendly, quick, and courteous, and they know how to make a quality drink as well. Try the old fashioned and crab cakes, you'll be satisfied.

Today was our first time at Jax, unfortunately we did not care for the atmosphere or portion size (small).  It is up scale and busy, but the music is very loud.. My lady has food allergies which can be difficult to work around when the menus is based on pre-set apportionment (meaning each meal planned is pre-set quantiles)... the menu had an enticing attraction and we ordered meals.... For instance it wasn't clear that the tuna steak wasn't a steak but rather small sushi chunks that were not hot as we would have expected for a dinner portion... they should have offered this dinner on a sauce plate as an appetizer.. Although they did substitute veggies for the pasta, it seemed like a lot of trouble for them to accommodate the allergies or anything out of the set menu.  

The meal was 4 star price and we knew if we stayed, we would have been miserable for the evening.... for the first time in my 30 years of eating out, I walked out without eating my meal...

I cannot comment on the tastiness of the food, but the music was too loud also and not a romantic environment.

Average food at best, and overpriced. As a native of southern Louisiana, I know good Cajun/creole foods this wasn't it. Their popularity Must be due to the neighborhood, because it wasn't the food! The gumbo was spicy, but not flavorful, the crab cake was bland. The $26 lobster roll wouldn't have been enough to satiate my seven year old, much less an adult. If you're going to overprice your food, either add to the flavor profile (recommended) or increase portion size. But small, overpriced, flavorless dishes? You lose. Well no. I lost. The one saving grace was the exceptional wait staff! Our waitress gave us a discount after she realized I wasn't pleased with the food. Though she was wonderful (even without the bill reduction), We won't be back.

I came here for the happy hour cause I'm a sucker for $1.50 oysters.  To be honest I don't know anything about oysters besides I like them.  I told the waitress that and she fought me two other types of oysters to try without me asking!! She taught me all about west vs east coast, her favorites, etc and I was beyond impressed and grateful for her teaching me FOR FREE!! 

I got two happy hour drinks, $5 each and amazing - I like the strawberry lemonade vodka drink on the happy hour menu the best, just so you know. 

I ordered the scallops entree before I could read the details and see that mushrooms were in the meal - I hate mushrooms.  The meal came out so beautiful, I said "let's try this before I apologize and send it back," but next thing I knew it was GONE because the meal was so so good!! Mushrooms and all!  It definitely says something about a chef and restaurant who can make your least liked food taste AMAZING.

My server was Ashley and she was phenomenal!  She is a true gem in the customer service industry.

Fresh oyters in Denver!!!
Love their happy hour 4pm-6pm daily for $1.50 fresh oysters.

Jax Fish House GLENDALE Location...

I heart you...

I have been to the one in Downtown.. and since Hubs does not fancy to drive to Downtown and park there, to this location we went.  This recent visit was on SUNDAY December 28th 2014.  It was for my VERY BELATED BIRTHDAY Celebration with Hubs since the month of December was so busy for us to get out for Brunch or something.

FINALLY!!!

Time was about 11:35hrs ish.  We are seated promptly in one of the "extended" room.  From the Brunch Menu we opt to order the following items :

*  Fried Calamari ($9.00)
*  Steamed Mussels ($12.00)
*  Maine Lobster Roll ($22.00)
*  Burger with Blue Cheese ($10.00)

I like both the Fried Calamari and the Maine Lobster Roll.  Those Fried Calamari are one of the Best I have had in which I wish I could have more!  The Maine Lobster Roll portion is generous though I cannot deny the pricing could be steep for some.

I am surprised that Hubs like the Steamed Mussels especially the BROTH and the Mussels!  He is NOT into seafood, mind you.  We requested if our order of Steamed Mussels to be cooked without the wine or the Bacon, in which our lovely server obliged to our request!  SCORE!

Hubs like his order of Burger.  Though it was just a BURGER, it was cooked to Hubs specification.  All in all it was a successful VERY BELATED BIRTHDAY Brunch we had at Jax Fish House, Glendale Location.

Maybe we are situated in that "extended" room, that morning, while in the midst of Brunch, a BIG Group had their Party, and that "room" can get "loud" so maybe next time, I would opt to be seated some where else.

While having our Brunch at this location, a LIVE JAZZ BAND, is performing and indeed it was a BALL to listen to those tunes!  Ample of parking outside, but there is also a FREE UNDEGROUND Parking available too.  That morning our lovely server, her name is Julia.  Left this establishment about 12:55hrs ish.

SUNDAY Brunch is from 10am to 2pm.

LUNCH Hours are from 11:30am to 2pm every Mondays to Fridays.

TABLE 61/1

JAX GLENDALE
Eat Fish ... Live Longer!
650 S. Colorado Blvd,
Denver, CO 80246 
Tel : (303) 756-6449

@18/2015

ATTENTION DENVER BEERNUTS - the $3 happy hour beer (The Post Howdy Beer) at Jax is not just any beer.  It happens to be crafted locally AND it is a lager, which is a rare treat for 'micro' local brews - Custom made for the restaurant by none other than supa-master brewer Bryan Selders (one of the founders of Dogfish Head Brewery), who now calls Colorado his home and Post Brewing in Lafayette, his flagship.  Nothing can equate the absolute crispness of this beer, paired with a dozen freshly-flown oysters (for $1.25 each during HH!), on a hot summer day.  

Why Glendale?!?  Because they have an awesome rooftop, baby...and zero parking hazard. Grab your Post Howdy Pilsner and oysters fix during happy hour...stay for the sunset...it's weirdly superb.

Here's an update that includes info for anyone looking for brunch with a young child or baby.  Great service, as before, and they even brought out a sling for us for our baby carrier.  The menu for brunch was good, though I wish they had more food-allergy sensitive options.  My burger was great, and my husband loved his shrimp and grits.  I think my father-in-law was the only one who had a so-so meal.  He ordered the omelet and side of potato casserole.  Both we bland to him.  Prices are high-ish, as expected at Jax.  All in all, great brunch spot for anyone with a baby.

Nope.  Sunday NOLA brunch.  Beignets.  Biscuits and gravy.  With a Colorado twist, I guess.  Give people a chance and tell them this is not Louisiana food but Colorado food.
If you're expecting Cafe du Monde beignets, you'll be rudely disappointed.  Even if this weren't supposed to be a NOLA beignet, it's excessively bacony, excessively salty, greasy, nothing beignet about it but the powdered sugar.  
Biscuits and gravy, no flavor at all.  Nothing.  And dry.  Totally bland.  Like eating paper.

First, I should state that I love Jax. I travel to Denver often and Jax, either downtown or the Cherry Creek location, is always one of stops for Happy Hour or dinner. This review is for the Glendale / Cherry Creek location. 

During my last trip to Denver I stayed near Jax Glendale and went for Happy Hour two nights in a row. Unfortunately, I left disappointed both times. The first night, I had the Happy Hour mussels, like I always do. This time, though, instead of a large bowl heaping with mussels, I was presented with a little cup with a total of 7 mussels in it. 7 mussels for $9! The taste was delicious, but the value proposition has taken a turn for the worst. Mussels apparently are now almost the same price as the Happy Hour oysters.

The second night, I ordered another one of my favorites, the calamari. Most of the time Jax calamari is the best I've ever had, and I've had it many times - crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, and not greasy at all. This time, however, I was presented witha plate of soggy and oily calamari. I thought they changed the recipe or something until I saw diners next to me order the same, but theirs looked normal - dark brown and crispy. This speaks to inconsistently prepared items coming from the kitchen. They were not busy at that time that day - no excuse.

So, two things, they are apparently trying to cut corners by serving an extremely small portion of mussels, and the quality standards of the kitchen appear to be compromised. I hope this trend doesn't continue.

I will be back to Jax, but if the quality and value continue to decline, I will have to start looking for amother favorite place to eat when I'm in Denver.

Hubby and I stopped in here for a late dinner on a Saturday night about a month ago. Food was pretty good, drinks were on point.  I did not particularly enjoy the seabass I ordered- my error in thinking it was a Chilean seabass as opposed to the branzino-ish seabass.  The oysters were fresh and pretty tasty, I would definitely order those again. The restaurant was lively albeit a corporate chain feel.

Dissapointed that my first cocktail ordered was not made correctly.  Then more dissapointed when it took 15 minutes to get a well made cocktail replacement.  Became more pleased when waitress recognized that drink and service was less than good; then she bought one of our drinks.  That helped change my opinion.

We visit Colorado several times a year to snowboard and Mtn Bike. We usually make sure we hit Jax before the flight back to AZ. The food and service has always been outstanding. I did notice recently that it seemed the portions were a little smaller. If you are going to order the Oysters, stick with Happy Hour ones. We got a dozen for $18 but also wanted to try the WellFleet Oysters, so we order 6. I didn't realize that they were $4 each. They were good, but not that good. 
I have to say that the Calamari was awesome. I would highly recommend it. Our server was Abby and she was amazing.

I had received a $20 coupon for brunch, so we thought we would give it a try and were pleasantly surprised. We started with a mimosa and Thai bloody Mary and some oysters. The drinks were only $3 each and since it was after 12 the oysters were on happy hour, which made them only $1.50 each. 
My blood mary was great as were the oysters. They came with the standard cocktail sauce, horseradish, lemon as well as 2 different mignonettes, which were both great. The citrus one was my favorite. We were also given saltines to eat with them, which I had never done before, but really enjoyed. The oysters were fresh, ice cold and delicious. 
I got the hash and my boyfriend got the new Denver omelette. The hash was absolutely amazing. The shrimp was great and the arugula was a nice addition. However, it was the mustard vinaigrette that made the dish. It was a smaller portion than some places give, but not bad for $12 considering it had shrimp and chorizo in it and tasted fantastic.  
The omelette tasted pretty good, but was very flat and looked a bit sad. I can make a better omelette at home. This is the reason Jax isn't getting 5 stars. The potato casserole it came with was awesome though and I will order that as a side when we go back.
Every time I visit this place, the food is amazing and the service is even better.

Their timing is a little confusing. Their direct website says they close at 11.  But yelp says they close at 10. The server said the kitchen closes at 10 and they also close at 10 but people stay until about midnight at the bar...

Anyway their calamari is the best!. The batter is perfect, the sauce is perfect (sweet + spicy) and they give you plenty squid unlike most seafood places that tend to use more batter to cover up small portions. 

I'm a crab cake fan and I try them no matter what seafood place I visit and I'll just say these are not the best. The menu seems short to me it's only half a page but their drinks fill up 2 and a half pages so I assume people go here for the drinks? 

The server was nice, the atmosphere was decent, a bit loud but again I think it's more of a bar feel. It was raining but it seemed like they had a nice outdoor seating area upstairs.

I don't think I can add anything to the other reviews of Jax Its a 15 minute bus ride from Colorado Blvd light rail station. They have some of the best seafood in Denver. We have popped in without reservations several times and were taken care of perfectly. We tend to head in for cocktails/craft beers, oysters and caviar.   We take the parents in for a full dinner service when they are visiting. We will be back into Jax soon.

I'm giving this Jax two stars because I've tried them twice and they really don't measure up to the Jax downtown. 

The calamari was great - in regards to quality and thickness - however the breading was super bland and had no flavor. 

The butter roll - well it was just that.

Scallops were great.

However, my favorite dish at the Jax downtown - the chowder - hasn't measured up either time. The first time it was WAY too salty and the second time it had chills in it and I couldn't even tasted the sherry. It was horrific. I won't be going back.

I took a work crowd here for happy hour and we had a blast.  The happy hour is legitimate: a true deal on quality brews, wines and cocktails.  Jax's has an excellent and delicious variety of oysters Rockefeller and other small plates perfect for sharing.  Seating is plentiful and accommodating, even for a group as large as my work group of eight.  Service was friendly, informed and attentive.  I will definitely be back.

I would just like to add an update on the lobster roll. I have  just heard from Jax management that it is mixed to order and to just let the server know how much dressing you prefer. Perfect! Next to none for east coast authenticity and to my taste.

I will be back.

Sat at the bar with jimmy as our bartender. Great fella! On point with all their suggestions, and Will must be the fastest oyster shucker in the neighborhood  

Thanks again jax fish house 

Dougie

This is my first ever review.  Whenever I travel I use Yelp and it has never failed me. I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn at Red Creek across from Jax Oyster Bar.  This place is off the hook. I started with the Calamari. It was seriously the best I have ever had. Then I had the oysters recommended by Danny the bartender. He said go with the Shigoka and he nailed it. I had the Mirada also but the Shigoka was better. Sweet and clean. I had many different drinks from whiskey to shots to beer and Danny could not have been more accommodating and friendly. He cares and is passionate about customer service. I finished the night with the crab cake and an amber ale. I am from Maryland so I am skeptical about crab cakes from out of state but they nailed it. Ask for a little old bay if you are east of the Mississippi. This place killed it with food, drinks and service. I will be back. Maybe tomorrow. #gooddecisions.

The service at Jax was outstanding. The food was mediocre. I had a creole oyster as an appetizer that was mostly grease. The gumbo had a very very good flavor and had a great compliment of shrimp, mussels, and fillings but was thin, watery and not what gumbo in New Orleans tastes like. The Brussel sprouts had a great charred flavor for the most part but were also very dry. Overall I would eat here again but would try an entree or sandwich.
Great staff and amazing oysters! We were so well taken care of when our flight was canceled and we had to stay another night. We will be back when we come to visit Denver again.

I went here when there were in between their lunch and dinner menu so there weren't too many options. My boyfriend got the lobster roll which he really enjoyed and I had oysters and the spicy Bloody Mary. The oysters were fresh and the Bloody Mary was delicious I will need to go here again when they aren't in between menus.

This particular location of Jax I would recommend. The happy hour menu is quite good and offers a wide variety of dishes and cocktails. The staff are friendly and you have your choice of bar seating or tables. Additionally there is a nice patio which is currently available and rooftop dining that opens in May. 

We arrived at 4:30 on a Weds and .there was plenty of seating to choose from. By 6:30 the place was almost completely full so I recommend arriving early.
I dined here during a conference dinner. The service was excellent and the food was delicious. I had the lobster roll sandwich and a key lime pie bite for dessert. Very tasty and I will be back!

Been here several times already and I have  enjoyed it every time. Good fresh seafood prepared simply to let the natural flavors shine. Service is very good.

The one minor issue I had was that my credit card was billed extra (actual receipt didn't match the charge). My guess is that someone took the cash tip I left with my payment and added the tip amount to my  card charge.

Our first time here. Beautiful location, easy parking. AMAZING calamari, super tender and great flavor. Best I've ever had and I order it everywhere including oceanside towns/cities. We also tried the NOLA grilled oysters, they were so awesome. I had the swordfish it was perfect not fishy like alot of places. Fiancé had the Arctic char and loved it. Both of us cleared our plates! Tried key lime pie for dessert, not my favorite curd (didn't taste like key limes...more lemony) but still good and the meringue and crust were great. 

I heart you Jax, and we will be back

Jax Fish House Glendale:

The seafood at Jax Fish House Glendale is fresh. This is an unexpected pleasant surprise because Colorado is a landlocked state. The fried calamari, brussels sprouts, and seafood platter on the happy hour menu was delicious. Our waitress was professional and effectively sold the menu. Jax's has one of the best Old Fashioned drinks that I ever tasted. I highly recommend if searching for live music, good drinks, and seafood in the Glendale area.

Went here for Happy Hour recently and sat on the patio upstairs.  It is a great atmosphere up there and really nice when the sun is going down. It feels very cozy. 

We had a bit of bad service, but the manager was super nice and wanted to make things right with us.  So we still left happy customers.  They care a great deal about customer satisfaction here. 

Happy hours is definitely the time to come. There is a great selection of fun cocktails including a white sangria, a bourbon raspberry concoction, and of course beer and wine.  Their oysters were 1.50 each and they had peel and eat shrimp for $6.  They also had a sampler that included crab legs, oysters, and the peel and eat shrimp for $18.  

I think this is a STEAL of a deal.  Not to mention, this is one of the freshest places to get seafood around town.  Everything is reasonable and delicious. 

I will definitely be back for more.

Happy Hour is the key phrase for Jax Fish House.  

When discussing the best places for Happy Hour, Jax Fish House is always top of mind with local Denver-ites.  

I haven't had the pleasure of dining here for dinner, I've solely enjoyed their HH during every visit.  I'm addicted to the Bangkok Fizz with Thai chili infused vodka, pineapple syrup, lime and ginger beer.  The drink has enough heat to make my lips tingle and the sweetness from the pineapple syrup that keeps me ordering more.  I also enjoy the Cucumber Lemon Press and the Affirmed for HH beverage choices and at $5 a piece each beverage is a steal.

The HH food is excellent as well and I'll admit that I've had more than my share.  The Calamari with the mango-chili mojo and lime aioli is a fried delight with refreshing dipping sauces to enhance the flavor.  The Fruit de Mer is a cold seafood salad of sorts with squid, shrimp, mussels, octopus and olives.  I was surprised at how much I enjoyed the flavor of this dish but the size of the dish is meant for a child.  I probably wouldn't order this dish again since I enjoy other HH items more and feel like they're the better deal.  

The Peel and Eat Shrimp are at the top of my HH list, I like to get down and dirty with this dish.  The shrimp are served chilled with some sort of spicy rub and then the peeling must start, and you try to peel faster than your neighbor to ensure you enjoy your fair share of these tasty shrimp.  The best part is dipping the shrimp in the Jax mustard sauce and enjoying another level of heat with each bite.  Jax offers warm towels and lemons to clean up your hands afterwards since licking your fingers is nowhere near enough to get them clean.

The oysters during HH are $1.25 each and the perfect accompaniment to the other dishes and all the beverages.  Do yourself a favor and order a dozen before you even sit down, you won't be disappointed.  They're freshly chucked oysters served with cocktail sauce and lemon and disappear quickly with every slurp.  Make sure you order enough so everyone gets the same amount at the table.  There is no way you're going to cut an oyster in half to share.

The other HH food choices are solid as well but the ones I mentioned are the ones worth returning for.  You're at a fish house after all, don't you want to indulge in fresh fish.  I appreciate the atmosphere more at the Glendale location than the one downtown.  The Glendale location feels less cramped and offers an outdoor patio upstairs in the warmer months.  

During the hours of 4-6 every day you may find me at Jax indulging in some adult libations and getting dirty with some shrimp during HH.  Come join me if you dare.

Who is the moron who built a new restaurant with a rooftop deck and no way to convey food from the kitchen? I was with friends who ordered the $200 seafood platter. It came and our waiter checked on us. I asked for bread and butter. "We don't have any." I didn't argue, but I knew house-baked Buttermilk Bread is on the menu. I went downstairs, ordered two servings of bread and butter to go, paid and brought them upstairs. Half the menu and most of the happy hour items are not available on the deck. That is utterly stupid. The waiter came back by and saw the bread. I looked at him and said, "You lied about the bread. You're just lazy."

Bad show Jax! Your stupid policy and lazy staff put me off.

We came in here today for happy hour and sat at the bar. The bartenders were wonderful and attentive. The strawberry lemonade cocktail is addicting, consider this your warning. I may go and grab a bottle of strawberry infused vodka this weekend now! 

The happy hour oysters were also delicious. I just love oysters! They are $1.25 each and luckily I didn't come in with an empty stomach or I would have never stopped. 

We also ordered the happy hour shrimp cocktail and we weren't too impressed. I know there isn't much to a shrimp cocktail but I do love shrimp cocktail but I don't think I'll order this one again.

Next time we will def come in with more of an appetite. The calamari smelled and looked so scrumptious that we will for sure need to taste it. My fiancé was really interested in the gumbo fries but didn't have the appetite to try it. I can't wait to be back for the great service, oysters, and other great items on their menu.

Traveling for business was told that Jax is "killer" so braved it on my own on a Friday night.  Place was packed with a 60 min wait for a table so I sat at the bar.  Service was excellent.  Bar tender made sure I was taken care of.  Lobster roll was one of the best I've ever had.  The grilled oysters I had high hopes for but once you've had them in New Orleans, this isn't even a close second.  They weren't bad but just didn't compare.  I come to town for business a few times a year and I would come back!

Jax has the best Calamari in Denver. Actually.. They have some of the best Calamari I have ever had. 

The drink menu is abundant, service is great and the food is outstanding. What more do you want?

I always take my out of town guests here and they love it.
Love to go here for brunch but such horribly, like forget to give you silverware, sleepy service. Tragic
My boyfriend and I had a really great meal that Jax. Nice special of the night and wine list. I'd recommend this place for sure. Can't wait to check out the rooftop bar this spring!

I have a special place in my heart for this Jax location because it's the place where I had my aha moment with raw oysters (I know, I have a lifetime of catching up to do).  And it has a fantastic rooftop patio.  And I can ride my bike or walk to it.

I haven't yet been for brunch or dinner but have enjoyed lunches and happy hours here.  I have to say that happy hour is definitely where it's at because you can try so many different kinds of seafood and other snacks and keep it affordable.  Some of my favorite happy hour treats are the fresh Chesapeake bay oysters at $1.25 each, and $5 portions of peel and eat shrimp, fruit de mar (squid, shrimp, mussels, octopus, potatoes and olives), chicken and crawfish gumbo fries (you can also get a cup of gumbo but get the fries!), and fried calamari.  Honestly, I've been known to make a meal out of the happy hour offerings.  I like to wash it all down with a Cucumber Lemon Press, Bangkok Fizz, and/or the housemade sangria on tap.

The lunch and dinner menus make seasonal changes, which is always a plus in my book.  Some of the items are a bit spendy but I've always been able to find something that doesn't do too much damage to my wallet.  I've received nothing less than excellent service every time from the friendly and knowledgeable waitstaff.  Jax offers some special event and holiday menus and they had an extended happy hour on Christmas Eve this year.  I hope they do that every year because I think I've found a new holiday tradition!

The staff was very helpful which is why this restaurant is receiving these 2 stars. The sea bass was greasy.... They offered to replace with something else but I said no.  The very sweet waitress also offered a dessert ( very thoughtful). The saffron was a bit over powering on the potato and overall the food was a disappointment. The staff very helpful.

A nice atmosphere whether in the bar (noisier and happenin') or the dining area.  However, $26 for an average 4-6 oz. piece of salmon is a little steep IMHO, especially considering the mediocre accompaniments.  If you like oyster bars, it is very popular for that, and everything looks fresh and well-prepared.

This is a nice, casual place for dinner.  Kind of on the pricey side, but worth every penny as the food is delicious!

For starters, we had the fried calamari and peel & eat shrimp.  The sauces are what really make these appetizers pop.  I could seriously eat multiple plates of these instead of ordering an entree.  We gobbled these up in record time!

For my entree, I had the tender belly pork loin which comes with green beans and smashed fried potatoes that lay on a bed of bacon bits, creme fraiche, and some sort of preserves.  OMGeezy, it was fantastic!  The pork loin was cooked to a perfect medium, so it was moist, tender, and delicious.  Being the glutton I am, I also ordered a side of garlic fries.  It could use more garlic and parmesan, but I enjoyed it nonetheless.  

Dessert was rather interesting.  I settled on ice cream, but was miffed to discover that chocolate was not offered.  The flavor choices were rather eccentric, so I settled on the safest one which was the balsamic strawberry flavor.  This was the shiznit!  Probably the best strawberry ice cream I've ever had.  Next time I'm here, I may even go for the cheddar ice cream.  

Service was great and there's lots of parking.  I've heard the happy hour here is pretty good, so I'll be sure to check that out at some point.

Love, love, love!!!!! Amazing. Upscale atmosphere. Quick, personable service. Professional waitstaff. Somewhat pricey yet worth every penny. Beyond delicious.

I was in the area for work and stayed by at the nearby hotel. The other restaurants surrounding the two hotel are no where close on the caliber of this one, so this restaurant holds a monopoly on class and options as far as dinner cuisine.

I visited two days in a row. Day 1, I had the affirmed cocktail, fruit del mar and the red snapper. The red snapper was so good I forgot where I was and almost had a "Meg Ryan" moment. The next day, I had the cocktail again and tried caviar for the first time. It was not what I expected, it was better. If ever in the area again, I will most definitely partake in the fare again.

The best fresh oysters available in Denver! Sit at the bar for the best service. Beautiful wine list. Great Martinis and fresh amazing seafood, better than anywhere else. Can't wait to check out the LoDo location too!

Damn, I really wanted to like this place. The service was terrific. We were sat in the nook with the drink station, server computers, expo, and kitchen, so I guess it would be hard for anyone to miss us, but the staff was very attentive. Now the problem, maybe they are the best raw bar because that means the kitchen can't ruin the food. Everything from the brussels sprouts to the tuna to the sherbert was over seasoned. The brussels sprouts were soggy with vinegar. My tongue was raw from the sea salt and unexpected blackening seasoning on my rare tuna. I scraped off all the outside layer from the tuna to make it edible. Then my raw tongue got the punch of serrano peppers in the raspberry sherbert. Tuna does not need whole flakes of sea salt and sherbert does not need chilies, stop trying so hard. I wanted a light refreshing meal and it was heavy and overdone. We were both extremely sick, probably from over-consumption of sodium. If you go, stick with the raw bar.

Don't go unless it's happy hour or you have a fetish for burning money. I can appreciate an expensive restaurant if what they offer justifies the price. 

Jax does just that for happy hour. You will not find better oysters for less and the atmosphere gives the impression you could walk out onto the New England coast upon your exit. 

Dinner is another story entirely. My girlfriend, her father, and I missed happy hour by a few minutes and decided to stay. 

We waited for an hour and a half before we were seated. In fairness, we could have got a reservation. However, watching the staff unprofessionally fraternize at the front booth was a bit of a bitter pill to swallow while we waited. 

One we were seated, the service rolled to a crawl. We waited a long time. Long enough for each of us to drink enough to believe we were artists. We used the provided crayons paper table cloth to make a crude recreation of the Mona Lisa. 

The food finally came. It was........ok. Some parts were really good. But it was mostly ok. I can't remark on their signature swordfish plate because they were out. I had sea bass instead.  I just don't think it was worth 30 bucks. I was more impressed with the potato chip appetizer which also available for .... Drumroll.... happy hour.

The waiter, who I must add was a consummate professional, felt our defeat and gave us free dessert. It was a deconstructed s'more and was delicious. 

I felt somewhat vindicated by the free dessert but was then sucker punched by a completely messed up bill. We then had to wait. for. ever. for the staff to figure out what happened between our wait at the bar and at the table. 

To sum it up, go on happy hour and get the oysters or their fantastic burgers. The bartenders and waiters are great and you'll be happy with what you get and spend. Stay for dinner and you'll be less pleased. Their entrees are kinda blah but the appetizers are fantastic.

Happy hour menu is great.  The calamari is a must.  The gumbo was also good.

The person next to me got the pork belly bingets (sp?). I wanted to get them but was stuffed.i cant wait to got back and try the lobster roll.

I will say that your tab will get pretty high when you are not ordering from the happy hour menu but what do you expect for great seafood in the middle of the country!

Excellent food and atmosphere. The bass band was great. I had the New England clam chowder. It is my second favorite behind Pier 39 in San Francisco. The seafood was fresh and cooked to perfection. The lobster roll was pretty good and the homemade chips were a great touch. 

Delicious seafood and great music. I hope to be back.

Wow! So glad Alissa R. and Dale Z. invited me here! I'd been eyeing Jax for a while, so this was a great HH opportunity. Even though I "wasn't hungry" I still managed to have 1 Jax strawberry lemonade, 2 Bangkok Fizzes, an oyster shooter, peel and eat shrimp, and generous tastes of 3 desserts. Get ready for the blue "Read more" 

I missed the memo on the first round and went for the adult strawberry lemonade (umm, can we say "totally refreshing and delicious" all at once?? By putting "adult" I mean it was infused with vodka, but I can hardly believe it). I was back in the game on round 2 and 3 by ordering the Bangkok Fizz. I've mentioned before how I love ginger beer. The Bangkok Fizz is the ultimate drink. Spicy, deceivingly loaded with booze, refreshing, and crazy delicious. 

The oysters were great and I tried them with the mignonette. Mignonette, that's a new one to me, but it was a great compliment to my oyster. It was a good thing Alissa R. and I decided to just get the peel and eat shrimp and even better that Dale Z. made it a double order. The seasoning was finger licking good. Yes, they provided us with wet towels, but I didn't want to waste any seasoning.. 

Desserts. Was I just craving every sort of sweets that night? Or was everything that good? The cobbler served in the cute mini cast iron skillet was excellent. Ice cream with not too tart and not too sweet peaches. There was a flourless (gluten free) chocolate cake with an orange chantilly. Chocolate and oranges is one of my favorite combinations. So this dessert was begging my fork to continuously dive in while the others foolishly talked the evening away instead of indulging. Last but not least, the monkey bread with Stanahan's whiskey brickle ice cream (Jennifer B., I'm going to the source!!). Definitely a more elegant take on the monkey bread that we made in college. Had I known then about this whiskey ice cream, I probably would have gained the freshman 15 times 3 my junior/senior year. 

To ponder: Was it the company that's worth 5 stars? (Answer: Yes.) Or the awesome desserts and HH food that's making me give 5 stars? (Answer: Yes.) Or the 5 star experience? (Answer: Yes.)

If I could lounge on a rooftop patio with a view of the mountains, in patio furniture complete with colorful pillows, while sipping on Bangkok Fizzes all day...I would! Seriously, if you're going to Jax... Invite me. Please!

Oysters on the half shell on a beautiful, breezy patio? What else could you ask for? The happy hour from 4-6pm dominates with Kumamoto oysters hailing from the North West coast to the Chesapeake bay oysters from the East - all waiting to be washed down with one of their many delectable cocktails, like the Bombay Fizz. 

Though, the view from the rooftop isn't the must mountainous, they make up for it in over-the-top great service and deliciously fresh seafood. The ambiance makes for such an awesome array of occasions: a casual happy hour with buds, a business meeting, or a night out with that person in your life - it's all good!

Had a great time at Jax last evening! Came from a late afternoon Friday Neighborhood Association get together and was offered a seat at the bar where everyone took wonderful care of me and made me feel right at home in the midst of a very hectic and busy Friday evening. Had a double IPA along with a delicious bowl of their Seafood Chowder which was more of a bisque, with shrimp and mussels.  The flavor profile was very balanced and complete with depth. Followed this up with the Lobster Roll... very nice combination of lobster and other flavors. Went very well with the Chowder for a very pleasing dinner. Finished it off with some homemade ice cream and sorbet. Nice ending to a fine meal. Kudos to all the staff for their great, attentive and pleasant service! THIS is the Jax experience that I've grown accustomed to over the years!

Despite only being here for drinks, I am compelled to give Jax 5 stars. Hubs and I had an incredible experience sitting on the rooftop with our buns firmly planted at the bar. Matthew was an excellent bartender and he is an expert mixologist. 

We happened to be there during happy hour (offered 4-6 everyday) and there are a variety of tantalizing cocktails on the menu as well great beers on tap and house wines. I started with the cucumber lemonade vodka which was really a mistake. It wasn't bad, I just didn't realize how awesome the other options were. The BANGKOK FIZZ is outrageously good. If you like spicy cocktails, you will love this drink. Jax makes their own ginger beer and it is absolutely amazing. Coming from someone who is typically not a fan, you can trust that it far exceeds any ginger beer out there. Another cocktail winner was the ARNIE. It boasts house-infused black tea vodka, but I think it is the bitters that set it apart- giving the drink an edge that prevents it from being cloying- like so many fruity drinks can be.

I love that Jax does all its own infusions and of course the ginger beer. They also make a sangria that sits on tap. Drinking here is definitely a treat and a fantastic and unexpected addition to the area. City Set has it going on!

We attempted to give Jax another try after our initial visit was so horrible. I took down my initial review because we had been refunded our entire meal after someone from Jax read my review. He sent us a gift card in the full amount and so we decided to give them one last shot. 

This week, we called in a to-go order so as not to have to wait to be seated (and because we live extremely close to this place). Upon arrival, the girl that helped in closing out the tab was EXTREMELY rude and at first did not want to take the gift card. She ran it through the machine a few time, said it wouldn't work and asked us for another form of payment.... uhh no!

Eventually, she got it to work and we left fairly frazzled due to how she treated us. 

Upon getting home, we realized that we did not get one of the things we ordered, my pork was so dry, I ended up giving it to my dog, and my partner's food was deemed inedible after about 3 bites because the meat was raw. 

The only reason this place isn't getting one star is because of the manager trying to correct the inital problem and sending us a gift card to try them again.

We have eaten at other restaurants owned by the same company and I can honestly say I don't know where they're going wrong with Jax. All of their other restaurants are amazing!

My husband and I had 'date night' at Jax last Friday night and had a wonderful experience.  Our waitress was amazing.  Really knowledgable about the menu.  The support staff was 'on it' all night.
When we were being shown to our table, as we went to sit down, the kitchen staff smiled at us.  That was cool!
Food was really good.  Started with the peal and eat shrimp.  The spice on the shrimp is finger licking. I had the king crab and my husband had the special.  Super happy that we choose Jax.  
Our goal is to never eat at the same restaurant, as there are so many in Denver, but this one might make the exception list.

The food tasted great , but portions very small. A "large" salad is small and the "small" one an embarrassment and literally two bites ( of lettuce etc, for $6) Crab cake delicious but only one small one on the plate for $16. Way overpriced for the amount of food provided. We kept ordering more things because we were still hungry. $95 for two with no alcohol. Never again.

Delicious food, great service, and comfortable atmosphere. I had the whole fried fish, Brussel sprouts, and the creamed pearl onions. The fish was perfectly fried, seasoned, and presented. The Brussel sprouts were perfectly roasted, and the creamed pearl onions was a unexpected delight. Will certainly visit again.
Service was alright. Food was great this is one of our go to spot. Please can you peel the shrimp????

A little disappointed going to this Jax after going to the one in Boulder.  This one is large and loud.  Service was fine.  Food selection wasn't as good as Boulder for some reason.  We split the clams and were disappointed.  Just okay.

Went to Jax to celebrate an anniversary and it was okay. I've had moe mind blowing experiences at their downtown location in both food choices and definitely atmosphere. It was incredibly well lit...is there such a thing as over-lit? It was bright in the dining room. I found myself comparing it to like any other super bright place...think village inn...but nicer, of course. 

Drinks: I had a spicy ginger beer drink made with Thai chili vodka that was just...delicious. The waiter warned me it was spicy, and it was, but it was a great kind of spicy!

Overall, the food was good, as it always is. Started with oysters, based on a recommendation from the waiter. Their oysters are always a high point for me--fresh, clean, delicious. For entrees we had ona (husband enjoyed it) and I had halibut. They were ok. Were they worth the price of $30 per? Not really. I felt like there could have been better sauces, better sides. My halibut was gorgeously pan seared though, kudos to the chef.

Summary: I left with the feeling of paying too much, which is never awesome. I've spent more at Jax and not left with the same regret...I just feel like they've gone from amazing to...generic.

Jax could have easily earned 4 stars if not for the sea bass  I ordered that wasn't well cooked. 

The positives: the crab cakes were delish and the gumbo was super yummy! 

Service: we dined here twice during our short stay in town, service was inconsistent, however, the manager earned 5 stars, not just because he waived the bill, but he did do his best to make things right!  This act of goodwill to extend customer service goes a long way!

Went here on a weekend evening with my wife a few weeks ago. We would have liked to sit on the balcony, but as others mentioned, there is no dinner service there. 
Service was very good-efficient, knowledgable, and friendly. 
The menu has some good variety. We tried the king salmon and halibut along with some iced shrimp. The fish was all cooked properly and tasted very good.
My only real issues with this place is the portion sizes and noise levels. The dining room gets very loud during peak hours, and the portion sizes for the price are pathetic. For the typical $30+ plate of fish, you should get more than a 4oz filet and a garnish sized side. We had to order the shrimp just to not leave hungry. For over $100 with no booze, we should have been stuffed. 
Presentation was quite good as well, which is common for restaurants dressing up skimpy portions at high prices.
Fantastic service. Amazing calamari (thanks for the suggestion yelp community!). A nice selection of beers and wines. You won't be disappointed.

This restaurant is amazing. I sat at the bar as all the tables were taken, which is understandable. The bartenders were so nice and knowledgable in the food and of course the wines. But the food itself....beyond delicious. We had the octopus, calamari and oysters.  I was in heaven! Then came desert with their dripped coffee... I love coffee and theirs were superb.

This is a good place for 'fresh' seafood. (Denver is far from the ocean and the fish is either frozen or stressed). That said, this place is good to hit especially when staying at the hotels in the complex. 
The atmosphere is modern 'hip' catering to the 40+ crowd. The background music is really good but at least ten years old. Best place to hit is upstairs, but the menu is limited. Bartender told me this was to more reflect the 'beach' atmosphere.  (But I really want the Gumbo...). 
It does close at 10 during the week (!?!).  If it stayed open longer, it might attract a better crowd and get 5 stars.

I hosted a meeting at the Hilton Garden Inn that shares the parking lot with this Jax and I decided to do our "splurge" dinner at Jax.  Of the 12 guys that attended the dinner, ALL of them thought it was an awesome meal/experience and told me to write this review (because they know I eat most of my meals on the road based on Yelp reviews :)

Being a large party, I made reservations (through Yelp/OT of course) so that we could seated without issue.  It was a Tuesday evening and I made reservations for 6pm.  When I arrived at 5:30, the place was packed and I was glad I made reservations.  In fact, even when we left at 9 (on a Tuesday) it was still packed!

We enjoyed a few libations at the bar before being seated - the bartenders were friendly and helpful: I originally wanted to order the "Thai chili infused vodka" and the bartender warned me about the spice.  I like spice, but when I tried a bit of a coworker's drink later in the evening, I was very glad I didn't have it.  Happy Hour is a great deal - lots of $5 drinks and food.  Our table server was nice enough to put our first round in at 5:55pm :)

We had four dozen oysters which were excellent.  The peanuts were probably not worth the cost, nor was the calamari - there weren't very many to go around.

I had a scallop special, which included roasted brussel sprouts that were to die for!

Finally, of the desserts we had/I tried - I would recommend the monkey bread over the donuts.  

Kristin (our server) and the rest of the staff were wonderful - which is not easy for a big group of guys, especially on a busy night.  My water glass rarely sat empty and the manager was very attentive.  They do not automatically include gratuity, but I was happy enough to tip over 20% for our group.  

If back in the area, I would definitely come back

I went here based on Yelpers reviews. I ordered a lobster roll for takeout. When I went in to pick it up, it looked like a nice clean and cozy, casual place to dine.  It was happy hour (5pm) and for a split second, I thought about staying and having a drink. However I just traveled to Denver a couple of hours ago and I was exhausted, so I took my lobster roll to go. 

Getting back to the hotel, I open the box and it looked Really good! The bread is freshly made, toasted and buttered, and the lobster had bacon pieces on top. It came with a lemon wedge and a tiny side of pickled vegetables.

As a born and raised northerner from a coastal area, I am accustomed to having top notch seafood. I must say that although the lobster roll looked very good and the meat was fresh and the bread was good, I found the lobster meat itself to be bland and lacking flavor.  I wish I had gotten some Old Bay seasoning or something to spice it up. For $24, I expected more - I had a better flavored lobster roll from a gourmet food truck in Northern VA (the Lobster Pound).

I have to give them 3 stars for having friendly servers, a clean restaurant, fresh bread, fresh seafood, and good food presentation. But good food is more than these things, it's about the flavor. I am disappointed that I wasted one of my two days/meals in Denver on an overpriced, unflavored lobster roll.

OMG this place is better than I remembered! Can't wait to come back - apparently they do a Sunday brunch so I'd love to try it! 

We booked a table on Friday night, for Friday night via open table and there was plenty of bookings available when we did it. 

My hubby was feeling pretty hungry so we decided to get an app each, split a salad and then a main. 

My only fault with the place was the speed at which the food came out, which isn't usually a bad thing but our apps and salad came out at the same time. We asked the waitress to puta hold on the main till we were done so we could enjoy our food, which she did and it worked out well. 

Apps: he had bruschetta and the goat cheese mixture was to die for!! I had the gnocchi and holy moly it was so good!! More filling than what I thought it would be. 

Beef & quinoa salad: it was nice but nothing to write home about. 

Mains: my scallops rocked!! The parsnip purée was delicious with the caramely sauce. He had the duck and it was cooked perfectly. Soooo good! 

We also had a bottle of wine and he had a coffee. All up came to a well spent $150 before tip.

I would say it was a 3 and half stars experience. The service was 5 stars, no complaints. They were absolutely wonderful! 
We ordered hummus with pita, butternut squash wood fired pizza and a sandwich salad combo(half roasted beet salad, half aubergine sandwich) 
Roasted beet salad was amazing, the citrus vinaigrette was delicious. The creamy goat cheese on the salad, another hit! Hummus and pita was also very good. The aubergine sandwich failed to impress. I didn't like the butternut squash pizza, but that could be just me as the reason for me not liking it was due to the fact that the butternut squash had notes of almond extract in them. Almond extract tastes nothing like real almonds, it tastes/smells like maraschino cherries(off topic: I detest them, how can they even be called cherries? They have had their very heart and soul sucked out of them!) So, that particular flavor in the squash spoiled it for me. Sad! It didn't taste one bit like butternut squash. 
We ordered grilled cheese sandwich from the kids menu which was very good. It came with fries that were delicious. It also comes with a drink and a kids ice cream. The kids ice cream comes with some chocolate sauce, bits of cookies and some gummy bears. Very pretty plate and something that kids would really enjoy.

What ended up being an unforgettable and transcendent experience at YaYa's started off as petty and negative, believe it or not; we had a little disagreement with a petulant valet, but our subsequent experience is causing that interaction to quickly fade from memory.

Manager Ben Morris and sommelier Jason Duffy hosted our chef's tasting menu with wine pairings, and it was one of the most thoughtful and delicious meals my wife and I have ever had. The arrival of every course was preceded by a visit from Ben and Jason; details regarding the preparation of each dish came from Ben; complimentary flavors and backgrounds of the paired beverages were expounded upon by Jason. Our first course was a seared diver scallop with a delicious sparkling wine; next were roasted Brussels sprouts with not just a fantastic wine, but a lovely saison ale; we later enjoyed lamb cheeks and a red from another part of the globe; the meal's crescendo was a filet mignon so tender that we mocked the presence of the steak knives. Afterwards we chided the server for the lack of a prescribed wine pairing with our "s'more inspired" dessert, but it was nonetheless accompanied by not one but two glasses of port. Though each dish throughout the evening was described and thoughtfully-paired with a beverage on personalized menus: Mr. Duffy did not hesitate to augment his prescribed beverage pairings on-the-fly when he was so inspired; his spontaneous excitement about alternate pairings (the saison, the ports, etc.) further elevated our immersion during the meal.

There are several YaYa's throughout the country, but that doesn't matter; Ben and Jason effortlessly provided such a personal experience that we would not have been surprised if YaYa herself visited our table during the meal. If this restaurant is a chain: it certainly didn't feel like one.

If, after reading this review, you think that YaYa's sounds a little too formal for you: fret not; seated at other locations in the restaurant on a Friday night were families with small children, hipsters in hoodies, business professionals, and people wearing sports jerseys and sneakers. That Ben and Jason were able to pull-off such an immersive and high-end dining experience for the two of us -- all while accommodating the majority of casual customers who just wanted to order off the menu -- is testament to their respective skills. As the place really started to fill-up with patrons towards the evening's end: we unfortunately seemed to have a little less quality time with our hosts, but that was understandable given the size of the place and the quality of service upon which they seem to pride themselves; we certainly did not feel neglected, even as the restaurant began to fill, though we were glad for our early arrival.

If you can get past the valet: YaYa's will treat you right, whether you are there for casual meal, or to enjoy the individualized expression of their chef's creativity. I think it's time to make another reservation...

This review is for Brunch only:
We come here for Sunday brunch all the time and we love it! Great atmosphere, good food and it's always crowded. If your a large group you will need to make reservations. 

The service can be very slow but they are super busy, I let it slide because it's brunch and I like to take my time and relax.

Upon walking into YaYa's, you aren't entirely sure what you're getting yourself into. Everyone is dressed well. The place is immaculate. There is joy in the air. You start to feel like you've discovered a real gem. 

When you glance at the menu, you'll start to wonder what this madness is all about. You pull your phone out to check Yelp on what kind of restaurant this is. "American (traditional), Italian, American (new)."  You grin. Best of both worlds. 

Now, you'll be tempted to order every appetizer on your first visit. Don't do this. Just come back and spread it out.  Don't get too greedy your first ho around.  Start with the beef carpaccio (if you're with a group). If you're solo, jump into that gnocchi. 

Moving on to the entrees. The roasted organic chicken is what sets this place apart. Is it the perfectly roasted potatoes, the garlic and butter sauce that the chicken is bathing in, the tender chicken itself, or the peculiar caper berries? That's right my friends, caper berries. And have no shame, you'll look around to see if anyone minds you tilting your plate back to grab every ounce of that secret sauce that you wish they sold by the pint. They should sell it by the PINT!! 

Oh YaYa's - Old, new, Italian, whatever you are, you are my favorite.

Oh wow! Yaya's got me all happy about Sunday brunch. I don't think anybody's better than Yaya's. Until then this is where the buck stops. 

My friend said that Yaya's has been around since he was a kid. And still rockng the great menu? Wow! 

You can have whatever your heart desires. Seafood? Meat? Eggs? Dessert? Pay extra $10 for a bottomless Mimosa. At $26 pets person if you're a big eater it's so worth it. It's almost as sinful as Las Vegas. Eggs the way you like it. Just tell the man behind the egg station and you're set! Crab legs? Grab legs! 

It's a spread worth your money. Now the view outside is another plus. It's sits infront of or across the street from a small park. The flowers in bloom this season surrounding the fountain and little pond was almost breath taking! 

Drive here and you will thank me. I suggests reserving a spot since its famous and busy!

You cannot be the brunch "buffet"! They have everything you could ever want! The location and venue is beautiful. The service is very prompt and engaging. The food is fresh. And the price is awesome.

We'll definitely be back!

This restaurant is a must go to for the whole family. The staff is very professional and cater to your every need. It is a great place to have. The food is not only amazing but the staff that brings it's out makes sure you know how it was cooked and prepared. I will recommend  this restaurant  to anyone looking for great food and atmosphere.

I took my wife here to celebrate our anniversary and this place didn't dissapoint.  The weather was warm so we opted to sit out on the patio with a view of the little pond and water fountain.  Our server, Cliff, was very helpful and attentive.  

We started off with Crab Cakes along with Humus and Pita.  The crab cakes were moist and had a little spice from what I believe were fresh cut habañero peppers.  Cliff saw how much we enjoyed everything and decided to bring us an order of baba ganoush and focaccia bread which was equally tasty.  To go with our bottle of Sauvignon Blanc we ended up ordering the ravioli and Scottish Salmon.  My wife absolutely loved her ravioli while my salmon was cooked to medium rare perfection with a nice crunchy, almost toasted top layer, on a bed of Spetzle.  

As a special treat Cliff brought us a chocolate cake with ice cream which was out of this world! The cake is actually made of filo dough and melts in your mouth.

When we were done with our food we took what was left of our bottle of wine and headed inside to the bar and enjoy the lively atmosphere.  Definitely a place to go for just about any occasion but I'd recommend dressing in business casual or better.

With a great combination of quality service and food this place is now on the top of our date night restaurant rotation.

We already have reservations for Sunday brunch tomorrow and my wife is excited to check out the spread and see exactly how bottomless a bottomless mimosa really is!

A really unlikely gem sharing the parking lot with Hyatt in DTC.  Some business associates has eaten there before but I wasn't too sure at first. 
Great atmosphere, fantastic wine.  Appetizers were creative and delicious - don't order too much because you will get babaganush while you wait. Excellent! 

I love lasagna. I don't know what they put in it here, but wow. I mean, wow!! The flavor is like nothing you have ever tried, and delicious! Large portion! 

I have also tried several other dishes and all were excellent. Can't wait to go back!

I made a reservation for Thanksgiving dinner at 2pm.  I did not realize it was a buffet only until I received a reminder call 2 days before the reservation.  At that time I was told that my time limit was 1 hour and 15 minutes in order to get everyone through the buffet.  I have never been given a time limit at any restaurant before.  I also looked on Ya Ya's website and no where did it say you could not order off their menu for dinner.  The waiter was very good.  The buffet cost $36.95.  The food was Luke warm.  Prime rib was dry, over cooked and not very flavorful.  The turkey was tasty.  I have eaten at Ya Ya's on several occasions and have been very pleased, however this was not a great experience.

LOVE you YaYa's!  Great for lunch dinner or brunch.  

The bar tenders- awesome, wait staff- wonderful, food- YUM!  

Great patio warm atmosphere and inviting bar area for happy hour.  

Can't go wrong with YaYa's!

My manager brought all of her manager's here for a nice lunch out to end our week.  She ordered the calamari and the gnocchi dish.  The gnocchi was incredible; tender little pillows of potato pasta in a rich cream sauce.  That is comfort food in a dish.

For my main, I got the roasted chicken with crispy potatoes.  It was a very good dish; my only feedback was that I would have loved more capers to add zing to the chicken and fatty potatoes.  Otherwise, a very well balanced dish.  The crispy potatoes were very good!

Not sure what kept me away from this place for 3+ years of living within walking distance, but WOW I'm definitely a fan. Cauliflower is already my favorite food in the world and their cauliflower "steak" was divine; I ate every bite and scooped up every last bit of sauce with the yummy bread they bring (and keep bringing until you ask them to stop!...amazing). I'm sure my date thought that was attractive :) 

If the weather is nice, take a walk around Wallace Park and enjoy the green grass and beautiful fountains.

This place surpassed nearly all of my expectations. Though I can only speak of their lunch menu I can only imagine how good their dinner is. I had the good fortune of trying several dishes. Everything was very well made other than the baked lasagna which seemed to be way over seasoned and somewhat overwhelming. The dessert doe! I am a dessert fanatic and this place had me dreaming about their crème brulee, my mouth is still watering as I write this!

The service was also top notch as well, he was very helpful and gave us some great suggestions while regularly checking in on us. 

Overall this place is amazing and I will definitely be back especially for their dessert!

One of my all time favorite spots in Denver. Yaya's has been  around a while and my grandpa and I use to celebrate our birthdays here every year.  Recently I discovered they also do Sunday brunch.  

They have been ranked as one of the best brunch places in Denver and it definitely lives up to it.  The food is delicious,  the atmosphere is friendly and it will cost you under $40 a person with bottomless mimosas.  The selection is amazing  and includes crab legs,  prime rib,  a to order omelet bar as well as to order eggs be edicts and French toast. 

This place is definitely a favorite and we'll be back for brunch again soon.

I came here with a good friend from college last week and was very impressed. My parents come here often so I wanted to check it out and my gal pal was on board! It is a pretty fancy joint, I am glad we made it during happy hour, the prices were extremely reasonable. 

I opted for the lemon raspberry martini and it was so sweet and delicious. My friend got the mojito and was also happy with it. We munched on bacon wrapped dates and a bruchetta pizzaretta (sp?). Both of which were amazing and cooked to perfection.

Our server was Edward and he was outstanding and very prompt, as was the brunette woman who was also taking care of us. The bar area is perfect for a quick bite and drink after work, the dining area is very intimate, looks like a great place for a date night. Absolutely check this place out if you are in DTC!
Had a great meal last night. Service was outstanding. Drinks were really good .Braised lamb just fell off the bone. Delicious.

I will never be able to find out if their lunch or dinner is as good or better than the Sunday brunch because now every time I think of Ya Ya's, I want to make a reservation for a Sunday brunch!

It's a beautiful spread, granted, not as extensive as the Broadmoor, but well worth the price! I made the mistake of having too much carb (the biscuits & gravy, made-to-order French toasts, and pasta bake all looked and tasted very good) as well as dessert on my first time because how could you not? OK, not a mistake when there's dessert involved (especially such good ones), lol. But now that I've gotten those out of my system, on subsequent visits, I plan to catch up on my share of shrimp cocktail, crab legs, and prime ribs!

I tried to sample everything and there was not a single small thing that didn't taste good. Better yet, all non-alcoholic drinks are included with unlimited refills! Service and ambiance both reminded me of what I experienced on cruise trips, so, top notch!

Dare I say, YaYa's has one of the best brunches in Denver! We came here a few weeks ago for brunch on Sunday morning and reservations are a must. It's only $25/pp and AYCE and they throw down! Fresh lox, crab lunch, prime rib, omelet station along with traditional brunch items like eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. and a lovely selection of salads (my heart longs for the kale and artichoke salad!) If that's not enough incentive for you, you can also order ala cart items from your server like French toast, eggs benedict and pancakes. They had Nutella/blood orange French toast and one piece was enough to satisfy my sweet tooth at brunch. Other than that I ate my weight in lox and crab legs and was in a mercury-induced coma afterwords. Wear your fat pants and sign up for their email club-you get $10 off of your first visit. Say yes yes to YaYa's!

This review is for the amazing pastry chef and staff who made a very special moment for my daughter.  My family visited Ya Ya's to celebrate a double birthday party, party of 9 last night.  After a wonderful dinner, my 2-1/2 daughter was asked by our waiter if she would like to go make her own special dessert with the chef, in the kitchen. She of course said yes and only heard the word "DESSERT."  I went with her, held her hand as she carried her large dessert spoon in the other following our waiter.  We walked into the kitchen, country music playing loudly, clanking pots and pans, lots of action as a kitchen should be. There was a long plate prepared with seven gummy bears, black napkin with sprinkled powdered sugar. She placed the gummy bears on the vanilla ice cream, covered the bears with crushed Oreos and helped the chef drizzle chocolate syrup over top.

Such a special thing to do for my daughter. Thank you for this special moment Ya Ya's! She absolutely loved it. (I posted a short video of the 2 minute video I recorded along with a photo.)

Went here for a date this weekend and it was a pleasant experience. I had the Diver Sea Scallops atop a corn and ricotta ravioli with mushrooms, and it was absolutely delicious! So savory! The only reason I'm not giving this place a five is that the bruschetta was subpar (needed more tomatoes and bread could have been more toasted), and my date's Roasted Organic Chicken lacked flavor and was a little dry.

First the service is incredible. It is easy to make a reservation and they are very accomadating.  The general manager brought our wine and food. He was very friendly and super sweet.  I had the spinach salad,  gnocchi, and the Chocolate souffle. Everything was incredibly good. Everything was full of great flavor.  Even the bread was great.  I highly recommend Yaya's. I have come here for a Christmas party for an office and for a date. The atmosphere is great either way.

Their food is amazing! And they have great service. The Sunday brunch is worth while! They have so much of a selection I felt a little bit like I was in Vegas or Reno for a buffet (except at a smaller scale). I'm not from Denver so if ever I get to come back, I definitely will!

Ya Ya's is a staple for me to take clients - where I know I may be entertaining people with varying dietary restrictions. Personally, my favorite client outings involve burgers or BBQ...but some have more discerning tastes.

Ya Ya's fits the bill. I generally get the Filet Salad, and it is well done. However, I've had several of their pasta dishes - as has my clients and family. I've never heard a complaint.

Ya Ya's is also a sizable restaurant, so it isn't difficult to get a table. Bonus that you can also book a reservation through OpenTable.

They do have outdoor seating, but that is too hot in the Summer. Parking is a real trick unless you are willing to go Valet.

I could see taking clients, extended family, or simply getting away for a date with the spouse.

This seems to be a great place.  I was unaware of its existence, but my food was delicious.  Nothing wrong at all with anything.

Just the tip: don't count on getting a table at lunch without a reservation.

This place blew me away. The combination of décor, flavor and price is absolutely on point!

Parking lot is right outside so you probably won't need to worry about finding a spot.

Walk inside to find beautiful, high ceilings and tasteful, classy decoration of the venue. This can serve as a nice family/friends dinner or as a romantic date or significant life event celebration location. 

First, start off with a unique beer menu that you won't find in too many places around Denver. Then, throw in some fantastic duck confit, pork belly and beef carpaccio to die for! Finish off with the pork tenderloin and/or the trout and consider yourself fat and happy!

Plate presentation is absolutely on point and prices are extremely reasonable for an experience such as this.

The service is what you would expect from a fine dining establishment....what's not to like?!

Come here and sit in the "happy hour section." The food and drink prices are slashed during happy hour. 

Food was okay, nothing amazing. I came here before a show at Comedy Works. I might come back again for happy hour pricing, but I would never pay full price to eat here.

Awesome food and service!! The chicken and appetizers were amazing, service was awesome, and the wine list is so awesome. There's a really wide selection on there, wider than any wine list I've ever seen

I've been meaning to write this review for awhile. I was so impressed with Yayas when our food group dined with them.  The manager was so accommodating making sure that our group of 18 felt comfortable and pampered.  Our server was so sweet and knowledgable and our food was amazing.  Can't wait to go back!!
