We stopped in on a Thursday after asking Siri where we could find good Italian food, and chose Yaya's because it was close and the rating was good. The rating was understated - The food was great and the service--Max was our waiter--was EXCEPTIONAL. The portions were really big, salads were super fresh, drinks were great and reasonably priced, and did I mention the service? Anyway - you can't go wrong with this place. We will definitely go back!
The peaking is a problem but the food makes up for it... I am a slave to the flavor and presentation.

Still great! Good is delicious. I cannot get enough of their made-to-order omelettes and french toast. 

Of course, we cannot forget to mention the endless mimosas!!!!!! I wish I could hang out here at least once a month.

My husband and I have gone here multiple times for happy hour and a few times for dinner. Happy Hour gets crazy and at times can be tough to find seating (Fridays at 4pm). Their martinis are discounted to $8, which is still pretty high but I pay it because their dirty martini is an olive infused vodka vs adding olive juice. Delicious! While not on their HH menu, I love their beef carpaccio served with arugula, lightly drizzled in a creamy dressing and the whole plate is topped with capers. I'd like to think it's a healthier option. ;) Also, they make a lot of stuff in house, and their key lime ice cream, when available, is something I dream about.

Took my sister here for a birthday brunch. The buffet had a good assortment. She got the bottomless mimosas and I got a republic tea which I thought was included but it was $5. With tip, it was close to $85 for 2 ppl brunch.

This review is solely for their brunch. I have also come here for their 5280 menu, but I highly recommend getting in for brunch. I came here a while ago for my birthday and I was so excited after reading their menu options. I made a reservation, which I highly recommend for brunch. They are very busy during that time.

The brunch is $25 which is a very reasonable price. There are other places that charge well above this price for all-you-can-eat. I opted for the bottomless mimosa ($8 extra), but they were in big wine glasses and well worth the $8. The buffet was amazing. They had an omelet station with a prime rib station next to it. They had fresh salmon to make your own lox bagel (super good). They also had a dessert table (my favorite) and the normal bacon, potato, sausage choices. They had ripe fruit to accompany your heavy breakfast and they had made to order items also. I had the lemon-blueberry stuffed french toast and Ya Ya's hot brown Benedict. I was a huge fan of both, I was barely able to finish the Benedict I was so full. I wanted to continue binge eating all this delicious food, but I had to quit.

Bottom line is, come here for brunch and you will not be disappointed. They had everything I love about brunch and our waitress was friendly and attentive.

Excellent from start to finish! Food, ambiance, service were spot on. 

We decided to try YaYa's because I had heard about it for a few years. When an AmEx offer came my way for $25 off $50, we couldn't put it off any longer. First  - it's right in the DTC but we had trouble finding with even the Garmin - aim for the Hyatt and it's right next door.  Happy hour from 3:30-6:30 pm. 

Parking valet - prompt and courteous. Hostess at front door, welcoming and indicated the bar for happy hour. Bobby our waiter? Stellar. He was helped by several other servers and bussers who all delivered superior service. When I changed from a bottle of wine to cocktails after he's already brought the bottle (still unopened), he couldn't have been more accommodating. Cocktails! Superb. I was a little toasty just from the Pink concoction I ordered for $6 with fruit, mint, cassis, etc - complete yum. Husbands martinis were excellent. My second drink was a limoncello - sparking wine cocktail, also excellent -- good thing I wasn't driving, these puppies are strong. 

For happy hour food, we had the chicken skewers (excellent Greek flavor with tzatziki on the side), $5 I think, and $6 lamb meatballs (actually kind of "meh"- meaty and six of them but not my favorite), and an excellent chicken pizza like thing called a spiedini with a sauce with olives you could spread on it -- top notch. $6 on happy hour. Two different servers reminded us when happy hour was almost over so we could lodge any last orders. And then finally - everything was so good we had a dessert. I permitted the husband to order the bread pudding because I hate bread pudding and knew I should eat no more. This bread pudding - Kahlua chocolate bread pudding with ice cream and caramel sauce smelled so good I had to try it. This bread pudding was dynamite! 

Even our trip out the door was pleasant with kind good nights and what totally came off as sincere wishes for our return. I was also slightly tipsy as I mentioned from just two fabulous cocktails. We will definitely be back. 

The dinner menu is kind of pricy $20-30-ish for entrees, but not out of line with the great service, upscale atmosphere, and quality of food and choices.

YaYas... I've eaten here a couple of times in the past few years, and it has been nice....last night, it blew me away.

First note--the service-Lenny was amazing. Gave us great recommendations on wine, what to order, and was just really friendly and very funny. 

Drinks--very extensive wine menu, with great descriptions by flavor profile.

Now to the real deal--the food. A small note: I'm not a restaurant week believer. Most of the time I think of it as a way to go to nice restaurants and get cheap food, rather than the amazing menus they normally offer. We decided to go to YaYa's last night because their restaurant menu seemed to be made of mostly their menu. Four courses--all delicious. Here are a couple of standouts:

Apps- steak tartare. Had a mustard component that was rich, yet subtle. But the real app winner was the fresh ricotta with dates, onions and chorizo. Holy love of cheese, this was fantastic. Smooth, slightly sweet, a little salty...and apparently not to difficult to make at home, according to our waiter. They also gave us some focaccia and baba ganoujh that was really nice. Side note--ricotta and focaccia--amazing!

Salads--pretty standard, nothing to really bust out the postcards and write home about there.

Entrees-I had the best lamb meatball pasta with a mint pesto. It's on their regular menu...and if you like acid, it's a must try. I love acid. I will be back, on the regular, to eat this. Husband had a steak with an amazing beet purée. The steak was cooked perfectly.

Desert-creme caramel cheesecake--great texture, super tasty, and a sticky toffee pudding. Also delicious. Would eat both again and again.

So all in all, amazing amazing food, and restaurant week finally worked for me--I will be going back for more lamb meatballs for sure. (Note, please add ricotta to regular menu)

Came for brunch on the weekend and didnt get good service. Brunch is a fixed price and it cost more than the price that was listed on their website, so that was the 1st surprise.  My waiter brought me drinks i didnt ask for and ignored the requests I gave. I heard other waiters around me tell their tables about extra features that were available and that they could order, my waiter did none of that. My waiter was too busy being over attentive to the table next to me that he neglected me. For a 40.00 brunch, I expect to not be neglected. I was very disapointed at how I was treated for the price I paid.

If you're ever driving down Bellview and are wondering why people are waiting outside Ya Ya's well before it opens then read on.  Service is outstanding.  Food is amazing.  $25 for all you can eat including crab legs, various eggs benedict, fruit and more!  This place is amazing and my mouth is watering as I type!  Definitely make reservations cause if you don't, you might not even make it to the door!

I've been to Ya Ya's many times before with really great experiences. (These visits were before being a yelper) I've even bought gift certificates for clients there. An account executive took me out for lunch today for my birthday today. The service was very good. The atmosphere was excellent as always. But my burger was awful. I ordered it medium, but received it burnt to a crisp. My toasted bun was also toasted black. The bacon was even badly overcooked. It was a celebration, and a gift for me so I didn't want to put a damper on the meal, so I choked down as much as I could, but it was truly terrible. I'm sure I'll give them another shot because of all of the great experiences in the past, but it will be a while. Bummed.

***this is an updated review based on a lousy response I received from a management type fellow in which he blamed me for not sending my food back.  Here is a helpful tip for restaurants: if you receive a critical review, don't blame your reviewer. They already had a bad experience.  Don't make it worse. I'm reducing my formerly 2 star review to a 1 star review. It's no wonder why the quality has gone down. Poor management and attitudes tend to spread like wildfire. If I worked for someone like that, I wouldn't care what kind of food I was putting out either. Soooooo many good restaurants out there.  Save yourself the frustration and never eat here. Ownership: save yourself major losses and find a new manager. This one's heart isn't in it.
The menu is thin, the food is ok but our waiter pretty much ran us out to turn the table for the next group. Turned us off to coming back.

Based on the yelp reviews, I expected more. My reservation was for 10. I called to say I was going to be five minutes late. I was told that would reduce my table time by that amount. What? There is a time limit? Not that I would be there longer than that but there is a timer? So, I show up at 10:03 and it is easily another seven minutes until we are seated anyway. Not that the ten minutes was a big deal but that the person who answered the phone called me out which was an instant turn off (they open at 10). 

You would think the food was just placed in the covered dishes on the buffet, right? The bacon and potatoes were both cold. "Stuffed" French toast? Try two pieces of white bread slightly burned French toast sandwiching a thin layer of diluted Nutella. The prime rib was good, but cut remarkably thin. While I didn't try, I'll bet I could read through it (credit talent of the man who slices it). I didn't get an omelet; my friend said hers was "eh": not bad; nothing great. 

The kale artichoke salad was crisp and refreshing as was the cucumber salad; fruit was fresh and displayed nicely. Made to order Eggs Benedict disappointing (so the half order wise). The dessert table was bountiful with a wide array of options. The cheesecake was light and creamy. I would have liked a piece of carrot cake, but we were running out of time so waiting 15 minutes for it to be replenished would have put us over our time limit. Was it an off day? I don't know, but for $25, I won't risk it again. 

 Atmosphere is beautiful, though. 5* on the ambiance.

Since figuring out that DTC food that is by Arapahoe Rd is terrible and food that is a couple of miles away from Arapahoe can be pretty good, I've been much happier.  Too bad it took me two months.

Ya Ya's is pretty good.  Loads of gluten free options.  I had the pork tenderloin and it was perfectly cooked.  I mean perfectly.  Tender and flavorful.  I might use a better preparation than turnips, but the glaze was very nice.

The bisque (also gluten free) was ok.  I could definitely taste the graininess of the rice flour that was used to thicken it up.

Slightly above average service.

I've only been to Ya Ya's once. Its a great location, a great setting, and a nice menu.

Everything about my experience was good. Nothing was over the top, but everything was good. Definitely plan on going back to try more on the menu.

Decent dining option if you are staying around the Denver Tech area.

Since they open late, and located just across Hyatt Place, I think they get a lot of patrons from the hotel.

The bar area was relatively filled up when I arrived close to 9pm.

Their wine menu is on an iPads which includes extensive description of each.  Not sure if it is necessary but it was kind of neat.  The wine is quite reasonably priced and the options are not too overwhelming.

I am going to say this now, get dessert!  The bread pudding is served warm ala mode.  I licked it clean (even after a full entree below).

I had the steak quinoa salad - HUGE portion.  Probably only a few slices of steak but the quinoa completely filled me up.  The dressing is reminiscence of the bulgur dressing with the abundant parsley.

Service was attentive and friendly.  I was dining solo and didn't feel out of place at all.

I wanted to like it...
Middle of the road at best aside from the service which was really slow.
Granted there we were in a group of eleven and there to celebrate my wife's birthday, and I know large groups can be tough.
It was almost like a big surprise party as the Servers seemed surprised every time another chair at the table was filled with a guest as our friends arrived. For our friends the surprise was in how long it took to get a drink or even be acknowledged...

I had liked the menu online as there seemed to be an offering for everyone, but in reality this was more like going to the cheesecake factory where the menu has a lot of offerings and really nothing special.

The appetizers were good. Nothing unusual, nothing with any impact, but good.

Dinner had the potential of being great, I ordered the trout. Thinking the greatness potential evaporated under the heat lights along with any moisture was left in that poor trout. 
I don't recall all of the other comments our friends made, but no one was enamored with their dinner, and the consensus was more of a "MEH...".

The worst part of the night was the servers adding a 20% gratuity for a less than lack luster job. unfriendly, uncaring and worst of all slow...
I get it with large parties... Some people think that at a table of 8-12 with a $700-$1000 tab a twenty is enough. However on the other side a waitress should not be able to provide crap service and still receive a premium tip. In fairness there did seem to be a "team approach" which in restaurants means no body does anything while the other guy goes to smoke near the dumpster. 

There are just too many other restaurants in the DTC area to waste your time here. Doubt we will go back...

Food is excellent.. Better even is the dessert. The duck confit is a must have. For dessert order the brownie, and thank me later... Best dessert in the Denver area. 
That being said, DON'T SIT AT THE BAR.. PLEASE DON'T SIT AT THE BAR. The worst bartender service ever experienced. You will wait for long and long time to get in attention. The last time here, I left without the dessert, although my favorite thing about this restaurant. Because I was trying to order it for 20 min and finally gave up. 

AVOID THE BARTENDERS...other than that, go. The food is great.

Great lunch service today as I was with clients that I wanted to please. Sitting in the back booth gave us the privacy we needed to discuss business and the lower sound level was much needed.  The lunch menu has bountiful salad choices. I can't wait until the weather cools off to sit on the patio overlooking the gurgling pond next time. This manager knows how to make us feel welcome. I checked out the website to sign up for specials and a  minute later a $10 off email arrived. . Nice
This restaurant has the best hummus in town!  I was also impressed with the scallops and lasagna as well. Love YaYa's

My son suggested this place. Excellent. The waitress was very attentive, the grilled chicken was perfect.. the portions very generous.. atmosphere. Upscale chic but down to earth.. I really enjoyed it. The menu was a little eclectic for my taste.. but in the end I really enjoyed what I got.

Two words: real sommeliers.  This was an excellent whole-family night out.  Perfect and inexpensive wine pairings with an awesome vegetarian dish (cauliflower steak) made me happy. The Mrs. enjoyed the subtle but flavorful fennel sausage pizza.  We enjoyed the duck appetizer.  Most importantly for the whole-family experience was a pro-child atmosphere complete with a kids' ice cream sundae-building experience in the kitchen after dinner.  Real Greek restaurants have waiters who take your kid to meet the whole work team - authentic feel with a broader menu to boot. Superb!

I made a reservation that I confirmed twice for 14 people on the patio. It was a sweet 16 and I was assured I would be outside; twice. I was forced to dined inside and was told that they don't guarantee outside for anyone. I walked in WITH 14 people...who does first come first serve with 14 people? 2 snide managers did the perfunctory cop out of asking me who "I confirmed with by phone". I wasn't aware that if I was going to bring 14 people on a Saturday evening I needed to record 2 separate reservation conversations. If you want a quick walk in on a Saturday (restaurant was dead by 7:15pm) have at your bad self. Make your reservations elsewhere.

I absolutely love this place! The ambiance, the patio, the wait staff and management, oh and the food is delicious! Everything I've tried, I'm always pleased with...well, pleased is an understatement - I'd say delighted is better fitting! The bacon wrapped dates are one of my favorites and I cannot resist ordering them every time I'm there, even if I'm not hungry. They have a phenomenal happy hour but get there on time as it does get a little busy! I will continue to frequent this place whenever I'm in the area!

We were here for my birthday after work. We first sat at the bar for some happy hour drinks and appetizers, then moved into the dining area for dinner. The price of happy hour drinks and food are amazing! The quality of the food were superb. Entrees on the dinner menu look pricy but about same for similar restaurants, the pizzas are reasonably price and the one I ordered was delicious! This is definitely my favorite place for happy hour in DTC!

Wonderful dining on the outside patio and good wine list.  The cheese appetizer plate was delicious.  Service was very poor over two hour wait for food and waitress was abrupt and did not seemed trained.  Did not clear plates without us asking and we had to request silver wear and she acted like it was a chore.  My pork chop was dry and over cooked, Brussel sprouts burnt and the cheese polenta cold.  Everyone else seemed to fare better either with the chicken or fish dishes.   I feel it is over rated-or some people are lucky.
I may bot be a great critic for this one since I ordered the gluten free pizza. It was $4 more for 1/2 the size. Very disappointed.

Good food, decent service.  They have quite a large menu, and seem to cater to the business crowd.  I was there for a client meeting, so their organization, professionalism, and variety was good for me.

Overall, I felt the food was decent.  However, the client I was hosting had to send his dish back because it was so salty that he could not eat it.  The waitress mentioned that others had sent the same dish back for the same reason.  They were attentive and quick to fix the problem, but considering the amount of money we spent and how long we were there, I felt it would have been appropriate to adjust our final bill.  

I will likely give Ya Ya's a try again in the future, as the location is convenient to the Tech Center, and they do seem quite capable of entertaining large groups.

We always enjoy dining here. The food never disappoints. And the wait staff is always great. The calamari is awesome! They use goat cheese in a lot of dishes, which I'm a huge fan of. They could have more dessert options besides the soufflé. But they have a decent wine list. It's great for a nice dinner out when you don't want to venture into downtown or other urban areas.

We recently took two local family members to this restaurant, as a thank you for helping us in a car sale, and because it has great ambience and some good vegetarian choices. Oh, and a superb wine list! This is our third time here, and each time is great. I highly recommend the cauliflower "steak" and the kale salad. My only regret about this restaurant is that we don't live close to it; it's about 45 minutes away. Worth the drive, whenever we're in the area and have the time to relax and enjoy a superb meal.

I am always a sceptic when a place has a huge glamorous building and all the appointments. This place? Yeah talk about nice decor. So usually this equates to average overpriced food (read review for a place up the street... Seasons52). 

So was it average you ask? No... It was awesome. Epic decor, amazing service, and the food? Wait for it... Wait.... Ok it was fantastic!! I had pork belly as an app... Absolutely wonderful. Sea scallops as an entree... Simply creative and delicious. And to top it off?? The sparkling water is free and house 'made'. This is usually where I get ripped off! Not here. So that extra 8 bucks? It goes towards tip.

Date night... Foodie... You name it this place is great. Oh and the prices are exactly what they should be, and the portions are normal... Not tiny like some foodie places and not huge like some American chain. Good find!!

Great food! Horrible customer service!!!!!! If you want to be rushed and forced out of your table as quickly as possible then this is your place. I've never been to a restaurant before that when you are being seated they point to their watch and say now hurry up you only have this table for X amount of time. Nor have I had plates and glasses cleared before they are emptied and checks dropped off before we've even grabbed dessert. Bottomless mimosa you say??? Ya if you can grab your waitress you might get a second one. This place and especially the manager on duty has left a horrible impression on 30 hairstylists with big mouths and lots of clients! Next time we will take our $900 bill somewhere else!!!! Go down the street to Baker's Street, they have 99cent mimosas and super sweet servers!

Their Sunday brunch is absolutely indescribable. Sooo delicious! They have everything from crab legs to stuffed French toast to bottomless mimosas to anything you could ever want in between. This is one of our favorite lunch/dinner places as well. It has the perfect elegant and romantic atmosphere. Definitely a favorite in town!

The food here is amazing! The atmosphere is so cool too! Located at dtc so there's plenty of parking and the restaurant is very well decorated! It's good for both a romantic date and or a night out with friends. We had a very nice waitress and we ordered 2 bottles of wine so we were having a blast! The calamari was delicious and I really enjoyed their crab cakes for appetizers. We the ordered our own entrees which was the sirloin and the meat was cooked to perfection and very tasty!  My friends and I had a really good time here! The past at was also delicious

We had a very well prepared meal and enjoyed the comfort of the layout of the room. I paid the bill in cash and the waitress assumed my tip and offered no change. I guess she felt she deserved 25% of my bill. I felt insulted and it ruined my experience.
Been here many times for lunch. Does not disappoint!

Wholly Sunday brunch buffet! Mussels, crab, shrimp, smoked salmon. I started with the perfectly crispy Yukon potato, rare prime rib (sliced to order), horseradish sauce, marinated tomatoes & mushrooms with mozzarella. I also mixed a Caesar salad with lots of shrimp and crab legs. They also have a short list at the table included in price but cooked to order. 

This brunch was amazing. Bacon, sausage, omelette bar, Pasta salads, veggie salads, lox, hummus and more. The dessert tables were fantastic. I had a taste of caramel tart, cheesecake, and a few cookies. 

For $24.95 the brunch is unlimited. $9 more gets you a bottomless mimosa or $5 per Bloody Mary. 

I can't wait to take my son. The crowd was all ages.

I hate leaving bad reviews... Especially for places I used to love.  Service has constantly gone downhill and today's performance could not be worse.  If I wasn't in the service industry I would have complained and left no tip.  
Customers there at first we thought were just jerks but then we got it, half full patio and empty inside and struggling servers who lacked communication and forget about teamwork... Sorry for the run on but service used to be on point.  
People clearing plates not asking if it's ok, no refills on sodas and debris in my cocktail.  Requested a manager, never got one.  They offered us dessert but comped other checks in a close vicinity.  That's fine I never mind paying but the only people who deserve to be paid today are the cooks.  The food is always amazing.
I will not fine there again but I will still recommend their food.  It's expensive but worth it,  get it to go and leave a 5 buck tip instead of spending $30 a head for lunch.  
Also, a lunch table having alcohol!!! Pay attention dummies!  Good chance to ring in a nice bill and get a better tip!  I hate complaining but wow yayas I was so disappointed I actually dug into my wallet for a coupon that was over a year old... We could have easily walked out and just dropped a tip...  
And to the hostess, you sat us at the only table we wanted to sit in... The people next to us don't deserve any privacy, your in a restaurant on a patio on a nice day, please put your tits away and leave your kids at home next time! Great job!

Went once for happy hour about 3pm last Tuesday, still slow but filled up well by 4. Very nice wait staff, the patio is great, but I doubt I'd go back. $15 for 2 really, really average crab cakes. Average is being generous. I would not have them again at $5. Also had an eggplant based app that was really very good, that I would enjoy again. So one out of two. Fine. 

But those two tiny apps, and two glasses of my fave Kim Crawford sauv blanco came to about $50, plus tip over $60. Kim is $12 a bottle, not per glass. Ouch. 

No way Jose, there's way too many better scenes, MUCH better food and ambiance available around here for the same or usually a lot less dineros. Been to Union Station? Or on the flip side of style and AMAZINGLY good food, Billy's in NW Denver?? Or... Any place else for such better food and value. 

I understand it's DTC etc but still...  I'll pass. I don't need to 'see and be seen' that badly any more.

Excellent food and outstanding service.

I ate here with someone who is sort of a picky eater but she also wanted to try a bunch of stuff.  She ordered for both of us (burger and wrap) then asked the waiter to split everything - half a burger, half a wrap, half the side of fries, half the side salad - between the two of us.  Oh, and cheese on the side and extra sauce and... yeah.

Not only was the food amazing (lamb burger and salmon wrap) but the service was impeccable.  All the requests were followed without the slightest hint that this was a pain in the butt and no mistakes, our waiter was obviously paying attention.  I'm not in Greenwood Village often but when I am, I'll be going back to Ya Ya's.

I'm bumping Ya Ya's to 5 stars because they're just awesome.
As I have reported before, they continue to be my go-to happy hour when the need arises. Yummy food- especially the hummus and the mussels. And of course the wine pours are the best around.

But the other reason I am bumping them to 5 stars is that they just catered our office Christmas lunch and did such a great job- really went above and beyond. We had the garlic chicken with olives, the lasagna, the spinach salad, and the caesar salad. Everyone raved about the food. We had planned to just have plastic ware but Ya Ya's decided that it would be too hard to each the delicious food that way and brought in linens and flatware for us- really making the whole affair so much nicer and festive. Pure yumminess.

They also told me they're catering a mexican party over the weekend- so you're not restricted to just what is on the catering menu. The chefs are definitely talented so I would trust them with any event and anything you had in mind.

I will definitely use them again for future events.

We went to the Sunday brunch this weekend, and it was delicious. The patio overlooks a well-manicured pond with fountains. The brunch buffet was extensive and very good. It is a little expensive, so go with an empty stomach.

Enjoyed an amazing four-course meal for Restaurant Week last Saturday. Outstanding service, and the food was perfectly delicious. The place was packed, but we were seated right away thanks to our reservation. The atmosphere has to be my new favorite; everything from the music to the décor was perfectly primed for the food we were about to eat.

Our server was fantastic and easy to chat with, I loved that he even poured our freshly shaken martinis at the table! Each course was delivered in a timely manner, hot and fresh. I was so impressed, I will definitely be going back!

Went in for Sunday brunch.  Atmosphere was nice and so was staff.  Food though, was average.  The large tray of bacon was mostly under cooked, but some folks like it that way, I like mine crispy.  Also, the boiled shrimp was under cooked.  I'm from the gulf coast, so I'm familiar with seafood. The desserts were nice, but not overwhelmingly great. At the omelet table, I had to wait about 5 minutes for the attendant to return.  Not really a problem, folks need a break, but it would have been nice to have someone there while the cook was away. 
All in all I thought it was average fare for the price.

Food was amazing! Too much to even describe as I went to an all you can eat kinda Sunday brunch.
The place is so awesome, the ambiance was perfect for a cold snowy day and the music was right on. 
Drinks per request and made to perfection. Come here, come here, and come here. That's all folks! ;)

Great service here!  The waiter introduced himself by name and gave some great recommendations for lunch.  I went with the hummus pizza with the Saison and it was delicious.  They have a good brunch option as well.  Great service, great food made from scratch as well.  I will be back here again.

I was out in Denver for work and came here twice. Once for happy hour and once for dinner -- both times were amazing! The food was fresh, tasty and cooked to perfection. There's a cute outside area too but it was raining so didn't get a chance to enjoy it.

I had come here several times and had great service and half the time impressive 5 star food. It is one of my favorites and I would love to keep coming back. But! What has happened here lately? We just finished eating brunch here and the food was mediocre at best, cold and the worst part was the service!! Rude waitress took our plates early, was there to "help" us with our needs during a buffet style brunch and literally said NO to getting us ketchup. She even asked us to share the single tablespoon amount she had already brought and then said go back up to the line get yourself some more. Really?! You don't have condiments on the table and you can't just bring some to the table when we ask kindly? What are we tipping you for then? Not to mention did not get refills on mimosas, forgot drinks, and asked us too many times if she could clear our plates before we were finished. We had to say no a few times. You would think she would get the hint. Although we could not bring ourselves to not tip her, she deserved none and should not be helping customers. Restaurant owners: please get good service. Bad service makes your delicious food not enjoyable and trumps all your other positive efforts. Ruined a Sunday brunch with friends that had great potential to be a great memory of your restaurant. Save yourself the time and annoyance and find brunch elsewhere.
Such an awesome brunch! The food is fresh and delicious. I wish they had a few more choices. The service was terrific. Loved it here. Be back soon!

Ya Ya's is our favorite place to go. The service is wonderful and always consistent, the food is great and the GM Jason is out of this world. He never  leaves us disappointed with his knowledge of wine and recommendations. A++ in my book.

So so

Service only rates as ok not the best 
Some at the table had a good meal my lasagna was dry and over cooked.  No one was overly excited that they would come back.
Great food, service and atmosphere. The wine we ordered was too acidic. Would not get the Justin Chardonnay.

The restaurant appears nice from the outside but looks can be deceiving. The service was terrible. Our waitress appeared to be put out by serving us. The food was overpriced and mediocre at best. Lasagna for $18 and doesn't even come with garlic bread or a crostini. Save yourself the trouble and fine another place. I'm not sure how this is a 4 star on Yelp. I won't be back.

I'm not a regular but I have been here at least a half dozen times. Food is very good. Ambiance is great. Wine is a full pour. Only downside I can think of is that there is always a chance of running into my ex wife. 
( insert shiver here ) :)
This is the best place to come for brunch!! They customized everything for us without even asking!! We will be back for sure!

Unimpressed with portion sizes. I ordered the Rocky Mountain Trout. The fish was very fresh and cooked properly, but it only came with four or five green beans - hardly a 'side.'

Unimpressed with service. When the bartender greeted me, I whimsically said I was "tired, hungry and thirsty." She still managed to take a sip from a coworker's drink while holding the bottle of wine that was destined for my glass. In my world, I service my customers before myself. I guess patrons take a back seat to restaurant employees that sit at the bar. 

Unimpressed with dessert. It was peach concoction in a pastry with ice cream and some sauces. First, don't bring me ice cream and fork. Second, use a smaller plate. The sauces were so far from the pastry that it was like mowing a football field to get to all the flavors. Last, were those peaches really fresh? Tasted canned to me. 

If you're around the tech center, I'm sure there are better places than this.

Mental note - come back here for HH.

I was at Ya Ya's for a business lunch this week and was pleasantly surprised by this place! Despite working in the DTC area, I don't explore too much around here since I'm usually in such a hurry to beat the traffic on 25. 

Between our group we had the butternut squash-pumpkin soup, roasted beet salad with salmon, tenderloin tips sandwich, steak burger, and beef stroganoff. With the exception of the beef stroganoff which just didn't hit the spot - everyone raved about their dishes and everything sounded like it would be ordered again given the chance.

We came a little on the early side, but am thankful we did. This place is hoppin' come 1:00 pm! Nearly every table was full when we were on our way out the door. They do have a valet since the parking lot fills up quickly - so that's nice to know in case you're coming during the rush and the lot is full.

A nice and classy Euro bistro in the south 'burbs of Denver. Even though I was a little tipsy upon arrival, there was no amount of wine that could make me forget the top notch staff -- very knowledgeable about the menu and wine list and happy to make suggestions. I suppose it helps when you're the guest of a couple of regulars who aren't bashful about getting a little extravagant.

Modest me played it safe by ordering the fennel sausage pizza. Thin crust, fresh ricotta, red onion, scallions and house made sausage. I enjoyed it overall, but do prefer my fennel sausage to be a tad spicier.

The atmosphere is interesting. It's contemporary, but feels classic at the same time with large dining rooms complimented by patio seating. If you're in the area and are looking to indulge in a sit down dinner, Ya Ya's is the place.

Off in the burbs of Denver (near DTC) is Ya Ya's.  I was in town for a meeting and looking for a nice reputable place via the Yelp app and stumbled on this place.

With seating outside it just made the dinner that much better as the weather was nearly perfect.  I had the filet and lobster tail and although the timing of the lobster tail was thrown off by being late to the table, they were both great.  Additionally, the beer choices here are pretty good too.

Service was great and the location was easy to get in and out of.

First timers and very happy to report everything was great! Had pizzas, gnocchi and salads which was brought out fast and and large portions. Highly recommend to anyone on the Denver Tech area! Wonderful atmosphere and open.
Love this restaurant! Their signature roasted chicken dish is awesome!
We have been to YaYa's many times. The last two visits have us going elsewhere.

I visit yaya's regularly and always very pleased and satisfied by their food and people.

Angel hair pasta is perfect and the hummus is yummy there.
Their scallop is also amazing, makes me always wonder how come it's so fresh when Colorado is far far away from the sea!! 

Our server Caitlin(or Kaitlin) was the best server ever, she has natural happy attitudes, great smile, also very well knowledgeable about the wine menu and food. 

I honestly can't tell I LOVE their interior (especially the couch of the booth table) but it has beautiful outdoor tables by a pond which I can seat there instead.

Oh man Ya Ya's has some tasty food. Everything we ordered was very good. I was told to get the roasted chicken and it came out great. The skin was crispy and the meat was still juicy. I'm guessing a slow cook finished with a session under an intense broiler. The small mound of potatoes that is served under the chicken were still crispy; good stuff!

Had the calamari as an appetizer and it wasn't overcooked like most places. Light breading and a delicious sauce that came with it.

Service was good and I'd come back again in the near future!

This is our first time visiting Denver and staying at the nearby Hyatt.  This restaurant had loads of positive reviews on Yelp so we walked over for lunch.  We had wine and a light lunch.  The Fresh ricotta small plate was fantastic and so is the decor. Service was excellent which is to be expected because this seems like one of those restaurants that would make service a priority.

Mediterranean fast casual dining. Far exceeded my expectations for shopping mall fare. 

Lots of healthy choices including vegetarian & gluten free options. GF & Low Cal menus & an accommodating staff. Food was fresh & flavorful. Everyone, including kids, was pleased with his/her order. Great Kabobs & Limeade. Proteins were shockingly cooked perfectly, moist & tender. 

Highly recommended.

I love the pasta salad and chicken pita and the fact that the ingredients are fresh.  My daughter devoured her chicken pinwheels and I was happy to see something on a kids menu that wasn't a nugget or mac n cheese. 

Every employee I've seen the has seemed to really care about making it a great experience.  I'll definitely be back.

Zoe's kitchen moved to Littleton Colorado and I was excited to hear of their arrival. They've great reputation nationally. I went with new Live Med salad today... what a humongous portion. I had a chicken added to the salad. Going to go home with me for leftovers. Cool environment friendly staff it's November were eating outside. My son ordered a sandwich it was delicious. Good salads good sandwiches and I've yet to even try the hummus. I'll be back.

You wouldn't think "mall food" has evolved until you've eaten here. The flavors, taste, portion sizes are all perfect. Their grilled chicken an onion, delicious. Their Greek salad, very flavorful. Try their white beans, excellent. Their kabobs are full of meat, properly cooked, and tender. Definitely a must go.

A little Mediterranean flavor in the newly renovated Southwest Plaza mall gets a 5 star in the fast casual department. 

Zoës Kitchen is the newest culinary addition to the Southwest Plaza mall and really delivers as a Mediterranean fast casual spot. It has a very similar feel to a Garbanzo but is laid out a little different. Instead of walking down a line where they assemble a plate in front of you, you place an order at the register, take a number, and they bring you your food in a timely manner. 

 My fiancé and I got the chance to do a pre opening taste test of menu items and we didn't taste one thing we didn't like. My personal favorites were the steak kabobs and the spinach rolls which I will rave over, ugh, I mean review for you all. 

The steak medallions were marinated very well, and cooked to a very nice medium well. Even for being a relatively cheaper cut of steak it was tender and very flavorful. No leather here. It came with a side of broccoli that was very nice and rosemary red potatoes that were seasoned very well and both crispy and fluffy. 

THOSE SPINACH ROLLS THOUGH.....dude. WOW. They were delicious. Spinach cooked down to perfection, just the right amount of cheese, and a crispy dough!!!! I could eat it every single day. If you go check this place out do yourself a huge favor and get an order of those bad boys. You can like my post to thank me lol. 

If you find yourself with a little rumble in your tummy as your doing some shopping, swing by Zoës, grab some spinach rolls, say hi to Mike Noble for me, and enjoy yourself some delicious Mediterranean eats.

Love everything about this place!  The food is fantastic - and the customer service is as well! I've done 2 larger catering type orders and everything was fresh and delicious and well packaged to travel home. 
I received many compliments from party guests and told them about the many options on the menu - something for everyone!

My new fave. 

If you like Greek food, of Mediterranean food, or actually just food in general you have to stop by. It's a quick serve specializing in fresh, healthy food that impressed me so much that I ordered more to carry out for dinner. 

Creamy hummus (the red pepper is amazing.) and the side of grilled veggies was delicious. I had the quinoa salad which was inspired and something I crave. Staff was friendly and the place was packed. 

Go visit so I'm sure this gem stays open a long time.
What a great experience we had our first time at Zoe's. They have a very wide variety of selections I had soup and salad and it was very fresh. This is a great lunch spot.

I'm in love with Zoe's. I moved to Colorado from Florida, where there was a Zoe's pretty close to my school in Jax. I was heartbroken when I moved to Boulder, far away from a Zoe's. When I found this place, I made the drive all the way from Boulder for my beloved chicken salad, pimento cheese, and limeade. Oh, and don't forget about the chocolate sheet cake. Ughhhh my mouth is watering just thinking about it. I can't wait until the Boulder location opens this fall!!!

This couldn't be further from Mediterranean or Greek food, but it is at the mall...so I should not expect otherwise.  The pita chicken sandwich was just ok, about 90% chicken in huge pieces and the other 10% caramelized onions...how is this Greek?  My wife's salad was similar, just horribly Americanized version not even resembling Mediterranean cuisine.  Don't expect anything above mall food, unauthentic experience.

Just had a great lunch at Zoe's Kitchen in the Southwest Plaza. I just read something online saying that a Mediterranean diet can really help prevent heart disease, so I went to Zoe's Kitchen. I had the chicken Kabobs thanks to the recommendation of the person working the counter. Our food was delivered to our table quickly. It was a tasty,healthy lunch. The menu has a lot of variety so you could keep coming back for different things. Try the place, it might help save your life!

Vegan options can be had!  Gluten free can be had!  Everything was very fresh and the service was excellent.  Funky atmosphere, it's fun to eat here.  We were surprised to have stumbled across this little gem.  Hummus platter is excellent, salads are fresh and delicious.  Not sure what else to say, but if you are in Southwest Plaza and craving Mediterranean?  This is your only option and boy is it a good one!

Really tasty "Mediterranean" food. It's "fast casual" and like most of the restaurants in that category that serve fresh food, you'll need to wait five minutes for your food to be cooked. It's definitely worth the wait. The steak kabobs were very tasty and the Mediterranean Baked Feta was outstanding. The chicken was seasoned well. The service was efficient and friendly. My kids both loved dinner and my son has named it his favorite restaurant.
I just had my first lunch there and it was phenomenal. I had the tossed Greek salad and it has to be one of the best salads I've ever had. I can't wait to return!!!
Really enjoyed the hummus plate and the farroh salad was delicious!  A little pricey for the portion sizes and its similar set up to the Panera across the way.

Drove an hour to come as my wife and I missed it so much from when we had lived in DFW. I think this location served it better than most I've had before. Can't wait for the Union Station location to open.

Quick, Healthy, Tasty, Zöe's Kitchen is a wonderful casual eatery that boasts some pretty good food, I had the rosemary ham and Mozzarella Piadina. For anyone that doesn't know what a Piadina is, is that is kind of like a warm Italian sandwich different from a panini. If you are in the area and want something that is filling, healthy and decently priced check out zöes kitchen.

Not that impressed.... I prefer Garbonzo's across the street. But I was here during opening week and it was a bit chaotic - the waiter was scraping the dirty dishes into the trash can, right near our table. Grossed us out. I'll give it another chance... hope they train the staff about ambiance.
This was our first time eating here, and the food was amazing.  Fast and friendly service - the gal at the counter had great recommendations and helped us navigate the menu.  Overall a home run!!
The food is fresh and tasty, and I got the best service from Marika :) she is so patient and adorable!!

Stopped in for dinner last week, but it is too casual for my friends looking for wine with dinner. Tried lunch today.  Tasty tomato bisque soup; fair tuna salad in cold pita. Nice lunch vibe. Will come back for a grilled sandwich or kabob.

Easily my new favorite Indian spot. Stopped in a few weeks ago for the lunch buffet whole in the are and was blown away by the yummy options. Many I have never had before. I have gone out of my way to come back several times since and the offerings change each time. Love that! Plus the best Chai tea I have had. Some of my new favs... Cashew Paneer, Lamb rice with ginger, fish vindaloo and a tangy ginger vegetable dish I can not recall the name of. 

The staff was full of smiles and very welcoming each time we have been in and they remembered us from our previous visits.  I'm trying to stay away for a few weeks so I don't burn it out but I really could eat here again today!

Really convenient location right on off HWY 36, 120th and Wadsworth. Worth the trip.
If you love Indian food bookmark this place and plan to stop by. You will thank me!

I remember when this place first opened because there was another delivery option of Indian food to try. Now they don't deliver though. I've had several of their entress and my daughter and I tried their lunch buffet because after reading the reviews, it seemed they had better reviews than Mini India.

Chicken Korma- it was okay and some flavor to it, but not as good or creamy as mini indias.

Chck Tikka Masala - this was pretty good and is equal to as good as others I've had.

Strawberry Lassi - this was good, not complaints here.

Chicken Curry - not bad, but not memorable.

The total buffet that I did have during lunch time, didn't include any of the above that I previously had in the past, and was an utter disappointment and we went around 1130am. Everything was pretty stale and empty and I will never go back again.  I think I do prefere Taj or Mini over this place.

HOLY sh!t - where do I even start. I will have a boner the size of a skyscraper for days after this meal; I will need to consult my physician. This was literally THE GREATEST Indian meal of my entire life, and I will probably dream of it weekly for the rest of my days. Every single bite induced eye-rolling mouthgasms. We have already planned to return next week, and have even discussed ordering 3x as much to just freeze and horde in our freezer (we live 2.5 hours away). 

We started with the vegetable samosa and onion pakora as appetizers. The tamarind sauce and mint chutney was delicious. The onion pakora was awesome, like an Indian bloomin' onion. The samosas were very flavorful and fresh. 

I had shrimp tikka masala spicy level 3, which was perfect for wanting a little spice and heat without burning your tastebuds off or sweating from the face. The sauce was SO flavorful; really complex and perfectly spiced. I could drink it with a straw. The shrimp was cooked perfectly and the rice was great as well. 

Now for the naan....Jesus take the wheel. I'm pining after the garlic naan. Usually I am a cheese naan girl (we got both), but Zaika's garlic naan is OUT OF THIS WORLD. I have never had such savory, garlicky, buttery naan. If I could use their fluffy naan as a comforter, I would have a slumber party with it and then devour it in the morning. Amazing amazing amazing. 

We finished with those delightful little "cake" balls in syrup (I won't even try to spell the name) and they blew my mind. They're like little soft pancake planets soaked in warm, delicious syrup and sprinkled with coconut. Balls it was good. 

In summary, this was truly the most satisfying and mind blowing Indian meal I have had in my entire existence, and to boot, the staff is prompt and friendly and the restaurant is beautiful and tidy. I will be back again. And again. And again x3918374929.

We thoroughly enjoyed this place!! We usually like Jewel of India for Indian date night but some friends invited us for a double date and we are glad we agreed! The place has a newer, more modern decor and feel than the usual Indian restaurants we have tried, and it is much larger than it looks from the outside. 

From the moment we arrived to the moment we left the service was great. The staff was attentive and wonderfully pleasant! Each and every person we encountered at the restaurant went out of their way to make sure we had a great experience. 

Based on the service alone I would have given this place a 4 star rating but the food won on its own, from the onion pakora we started with to the garlic naan to the carrot pudding. And the entrees knocked it out of the park. The lamb vindaloo was delicious with the perfect amount of spice and the Saag Paneer was awesome!!

We definitely will be back here!

I started going here at first it was good enjoyable and slowly the quality went down. I stopped coming here any more but had cravings for Indian food and thought it might be better after all. Today it was my bad experience. As usual entered Waited for food. Most of the food was empty no chicken is chicjen cream curry, no tandoori, no Mutton. I waited patently and once the food arrived I saw the pakodi was fried with big lumps and the naan was so thick that I could feel the dough inside uncooked. I asked the waiter very smoothly they said they were busy and they have to understand that they are very busy. I was unsure what to say for that answer. I camly finished my food and paid the bill. I decided that was my last visit. I feel customer satisfaction is the most important part of business. Hope you improve on that and also food. Thanks for serving us.
I love this place. Their food is so good. You can't go wrong. I usually get their eggplant dishes to go and they always have it ready when they say!

I would gladly give them 10 stars!!!!!! 
BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE! I ordered an AMAZING GOAT TIKKA MASALA! The sauce was outstanding, and holds up to THE BEST Indian I've ever had. Eddie the owner visited me at my table and struck up a conversation. It is clear he takes absolute pride in his work and in the customers satisfaction. I am from another state, but will be going out of my way to return in the future!

The food is great! My son, who hates vegetables, devoured the veggie dish I ordered for me because he said the sauce was soooooo good he couldn't tell it was veggies.  However, the customer service is exemplary and is what will bring us back! 

The owner walks around, fills guests' water glasses, cleans up tables, and talks to all of his guests. To me, this shows pride and ownership. He really cares about his restaurant, his food, and his guests! I had a really long conversation with him tonight and he's a great guy! His wife and son helps out in the restaurant and you can definitely see the love and support they have for each other. 

We will be back and hopefully next time, we can convince the hubby to come along (he dislikes Indian food).

Last day in Denver and had a very empty belly. Searched for restaurants near me and decided to try this place.  Glad we did because the food was great. The buffet isn't as extensive as my local dallas spot but it did the job. Naan was warm and soft and the chicken dishes were tender and flavorful.

We had dinner here at 8:30pm on Saturday. We made reservations, but they weren't needed! We started out with two delicious unique cocktails. I'll upload a picture of the drink menu some it isn't on their website. They have a full bar with many options. For our meal we had veggie samosas, chicken Tikka masala, and garlic naan. It was plenty for two people, but we did eat it all.  If suggest one entrée per person if you are wanting leftovers.  The Tikka masala was the best I've had in a long time.  Definitely recommend this place!

This is my favorite Indian restaurant between Louisville, Lafayette, Westminster, and Broomfield, CO. The food is absolutely phenomenal! The service is kind and generous. They have a lunch menu that still could serve as two meals and an all you can eat lunch buffet that is divine. Good for groups, business meetings, romantic dinners, or an upscale treat - yourself kind of lunch. Recommended to everyone to try at least once. Full bar, tea, and coffee. Don't forget to always get Naan! My spicy favorite is the eggplant Kale Aur Baingan :D Spicy ranges 1-5 with 4 being a lingering, delayed hot!

Just had a most wonderful dinner! Enjoyed Chicken Tikka Masala, Kerala Seafood Curry, Lamb Mango and various appetizers which were the bomb! Service was superior and attentive, there when you needed them but not overwhelming. Highly recommend the curry dishes and the tasty Nan bread. I will be back again to try the other dishes soon.
Food was very good.  I was able to have a very well balanced meal in a very short time.  Will satisfy any size appetite.

Awesome restaurant, awesome management!!  It's our favorite - my 3 year old daughter asks to get food from Zaika on a regular basis!  Our favorites - Lamb Rogan Josh, Chicken Dhaniya, and Vegetable Korma.  The Tandori menu items are also excellent.  

If you can take the heat/spice, get it spiced up, it makes it that much better.  Unfortunately, my 3 year old has caused us to downgrade our taste buds to a mild for now, but it's still awesome!  

Last, service/management is top notch!  They REALLY care!  There was a hiccup in a recent order and they handled it very professionally!  What they offered was above and beyond my expectations!  I don't know if it's a family run restaurant, but it definitely has a family run feel with a professional touch.

Came in for buffet lunch, $10.95. Had heard that this was a spin off from Azitra, and given Azitra has gone a bit rubbish, thought it was worth a try.  It is probably at the same level as current Azitra, so two stars. 

The buffet was the usual collection of suspects: rice, biryani, 1 fish and 2 chicken curries, tandoori chicken (which was not traditional, but strangely nice...), and some deconstructed blooming onion. Most were luke warm, some were cold. All were thin and watery. 

A search for a local, decent, curry house continues.

Zaika has a pretty decent (and super affordable) lunch buffet. Saag is one of my favorite Indian dishes and unfortunately, their buffet Saag is made with corn instead of chicken or lamb, but it was still good. The samosas (pupusas? I can never remember) dipped in the Tikka Masala sauce were to. die. for. Location was quaint and we were in and out after stuffing our faces. I will definitely be back!

The food was average Indian of the British variety (so not terribly oily and not terribly spicy). It was generally good and the atmosphere was on the higher end. The service was speedy. As a vegetarian, I wanted to try a thali (mixture of lots of items) but since they didn't have a veggie thali, I had to settle for a couple of entrees and a chaat starter. The paneer makhni was good and about what I'd expect from BritInd for a 4-out-of-5 spicy. My advice is to stay away from the kulfi (they called it Indian ice cream): it tasted a bit dishwatery. 

Good news is that the place was basically empty on a Saturday evening so I doubt it ever gets busy. It wasn't a great Indian place but I would like to go back to try their lunch buffet (which is apparently every day except Sunday when they're closed all-day).
The best Indian food I've ever had. Momos, chicken Tika masala, garlic Naan are some of my favorites. Also, had amazing mojitos!
Delicious food that meets all the palette types in our family (young kids, spicy lovers, less adventurous folks). The staff and owners are incredibly kind and helpful.

We were in the Denver area for a training and my wife and I are into finding food trucks.  We found a webpage of one that was supposed to be in the area and we searched and searched but could not find it.  We decided to try this Indian restaurant and in glad we did.  The interior of they place was really nice.  Good utensils, nice glassware, and nice posted.  The decor was nice.  

The lunch buffet was really good with a wide variety of options.  I think I tried each of the dishes and liked each one.
Nice choice! Very good! The naan was hot and delicious. I even tried some of the food I do not typically care for, and even that was tasty. Keep up the good work.

I love this place. My friends and I were regulars at Yak and Yeti.  We tried this place and we like it much better.  It looks pretty casual on the out side but it is beautifully decorated and the staff is friendly.

We love this place!  The first visit we came we had the vegie samosas, chicken tikka masala and nan. Since then I can't get myself to try anything else because I crave the chicken tikka masala for days after having it.  The chicken is so tender and the spice level 3 is just hot enough for excitement but not so much that it burns off your taste buds and you can't taste anything else. The nan is so fluffy it's like eating a buttery cloud. There's really not much else to say.  It's great alone but better drenched in the masala sauce which I could drink it's so delicious.  

If the food wasn't enough to make us come back, the service would be. From the moment we walk in the door we never feel as if we've been forgotten. Are water glasses are always being filled and multiple people check on us during the meal,  not just the 1 server assigned to our table. 

The price listed on the menu may seem a little high but once you experience the quality of the food and the service you'll gladly pay every penny.

Delicious! First time trying Indian cuisine and this place was fabulous. Great service including a welcoming, friendly staff. We started our meal with the Kauli Manchurian (cauliflower with a red sauce) very tasty. Entrees - chicken tikka and kofta keshari, both were awesome! But the kofta keshari (our waiter recommended) was truly delicious! The garlic naan dipped in its curry sauce was creamy, slightly spicy, and incredible. We will most definitely be back here again soon!!!

Literally LOVE this place. The service is amazing, such nice staff. And the food is awesome! Ordered the chicken tiki masala, it couldn't be any better and the garlic nan bread was fantastic! We will definitely come back!!!!!
Great Indian food! Also great customer service. Small family run restaurant that does everything right and the food is great! Highly recommend!

I wish I could give zero star for such a pathetic buffet. Naan cold, curry tasteless, rice not properly cooked, and the list goes on. I can complaint about each item on the buffet menu. Disgusting. I'd never recommend this restaurant to anybody. If you want to make your money worth then kindly avoid this restaurant. I forgot to mention that above all, service was more pathetic than the food. When I told them that "I would never pay 12$ for this food". Reply: Did you try "mini india food" ? Is this how they cover their ass ?
Amazing service, incredible food! My boyfriend and I ordered three dinner entrees because we couldn't choose. All amazing! We'll be back :)

Some of the best Indian food I've ever had. HIGHLY recommend. I had the Chicken Dhaniya, which was outstanding. The staff was super friendly and kind. They seemed to really care about our experience. It's well worth the money and includes dishes from both north and south India. Do it!!

Called in a big order, happy to report that everything was correct. We ordered food for pick up, man it was delicious. Chicken tikka masala, vegetable biryani, vegetable samosas, dal of the day, and several other items. They guy that helped was very polite and helped me carry all the items to the car.

Food : 4/5
Ambience :3.5/5
Presentation : 4.5/5
Price : 4/5

Buffet is good. Service has always been very nice. Not a great bar which is expected for Indian food places. Try the shrimp it is yum..the lamb curry Is very good.

Worth the hype and deserving of all the stars and worth the price. 

Service was a 10, food was prepared with love and my only regret was that I was too full to try other items. 

Can't wait to come back!!

Yummy! Found this little hidden gem on Yelp (of course) and decided to give it a try. The interior design is beautiful and the restaurant is impeccably clean. You're greeted from the moment you walk in the door and although they can be busy at times, seating is readily available. The menu prices are fair and the food is delicious! Undoubtedly, one of the best Indian dishes I've had. The owner, Bobby, even had the courtesy to stop by our table and ask us about our dining experience. If you're in the area, you have to check this place out.
I'm Indian and had the lunch buffet today. The kindest comment I can make about both the food and the service was that they were mediocrity personified.
Fantastic food and great service. Not cheap, but was it good! Land chops, mushrooms, daal soup, mango pickle and Torpedo IPA on draft. How can you go wrong?

Just for background - the management of azitra split into 2 and the other started off zaika - the reason I mention that is cause it seems the chef went with zaika :).
I've been a regular at Azitra and it was hands down the best Indian food in Denver - but zaika beats that . If you like Indian food , you have to try this place . If you don't like Indian food - you should try it as a confirmation that you will never like Indian food or you'll convert.
Great food, great service. We've eaten here several times. It's become our favorite Indian restaurant.

This is by far the best Indian food I have ever had the pleasure of eating. When they first opened I was thrilled that Broomfield finally had an Indian restaurant. After we went I was terrified it would close and I would never be able to eat this delicious food again. Thankfully other people took notice! 

I am a vegetarian and have tried pretty much every dish I can. The tandoori veggie Shaslik is so flavorful. However, the Kauli Manchurian is the BEST food I have ever eaten. It is an appetizer but we've ordered it as an entree before. The spice level is pretty accurate to what you request. I'm a medium+ and I get just the right amount of kick. 

At first I thought the prices were a little high but I think they accurately reflect the quality of the food. We typically order take out but dining in is a nice date night option. Nickel St. has a surprising number of delicious restaurants and Zaika is top notch.
The Chicken Tikka with spinach and potatoes was excellent. Good service. Garlic naan was delicious. Based on that one dish it is worth coming here. I would like to try more and will be back.

Went in yesterday for the buffet as I search for an Indian restaurant that's reasonably close to me.  I was very impressed with the quality of items on the buffet.  This particular day, they had chicken vindaloo, chicken curry, chicken tikki masala, onion pakora, aloo zucchini, a curry using black lentils, and tandoori chicken.  

They were continuing to refresh the buffet, even towards 1:30 PM.  The onion pakora was cooked very well and held up on the buffet line.  The chicken dishes were spiced appropriately, especially the vindaloo, though I was slightly disappointed that potatoes weren't present in the dish.  The raita had generous shavings of vegetables and served as a nice fire hydrant for the spicier dishes.

The only disappointing part of the visit was the iced chai.  It lacked flavor and had no notes of cinnamon or any other aromatics.  Definite worth a visit if you're nearby.

Yummmm. Something for everyone. Had the Rosemary fish which was salmon. Tandoori prepped with a nice crust--medium spicy. Also the eggplant with kale vain gain was just our fave--spicy, sweet--perfect with the Roti. The saag paneer is always a favorite and this had nice big chunks of saag. The naan was as amazing as they say...buttery and delicious! Highly recommend this place. Comfortable atmosphere too with a most gracious and welcoming staff. Very attentive! We will be back!

First Indian dining experience was AMAZING! The owner asked us what kind of meat and level of spiciness we liked and gave us thorough suggestions and explanations from there. He also whipped us up some amazing mojitos, lycheetini and a mango ginger concoction. We ordered shrimp and samosas as an appetizer. Then chicken tikka masala and lamb curry and garlic naan. Holy wow. That was one of the best meals we've ever had!! And such great attending staff as well. We want to go again for lunch today!! Well earned five stars!

The Chicken Masala, OMG perfect.  I ordered it not spicy and it came totally mild, other places insist it's mild but this had zero heat, which I need.  I wanted to chug it from the bowl and lick my plate but I soaked it up with Naan instead.  The wait staff was very attentive.  I haven't tried anything else here but they do my favorite just right, so I'm a big fan.

My wife and I eat here quite regularly. The food and the service are absolutely excellent. I must say, it's probably some of the most creative Indian restaurants I've ever been too.

I also like that their atmosphere is usually really nice and casual and quiet.

I'd highly recommend giving them a try!
Really great Indian food. I got the biryiani with lamb and my wife got the chicken tikka masala which was both of our favorites. The naan was really good to dip into the masala!!
Service is great and the food is even better. Some of the best naan around. Wonderful restaurant. The lunch buffet is a HUGE value.

This was the first time me and my girlfriend tried indian food...and i am so happy we did. The atmosphere was very pleasant and the food was fantastic. The gentleman who waited our table was very friendly and helped us to choose the perfect meal to suit our taste buds. We ordered the chicken tikki marsala hope i spelled that correctly. And it was phenomenal...i highly recommend this place to anybody who wants to try something new

I'm by no means an expert on Indian cuisine, although I have eaten quite a bit of it over the years. I live in SE Denver, so I wasn't initially enthused about driving out to Broomfield for dinner. However, I now here and publicly renounce and repent for all of the doubts that I had. Zaika is as good as it gets for Indian restaurants in Denver. Everything about my dinner experience was top notch. The prices were reasonable, the service was notably excellent, and the food was exquisite. 

I was dining with a group of six, so we ordered a whole bunch of food and shared it around the table family-style. Of all the dishes that we sampled, the Lamb Vindaloo was my personal favourite, but the lamb curry was also amazing. The fish makhni was a big hit around the table, and of the starters that we tried the Kauli Manchurian was the most delicious of a group of delicious dishes. 

I will definitely be making my way back to Zaika in the very near future, and you should too!

Very yummy Indian food!  And very nice staff.  I have only ordered through GrubHub but it has always been efficient, hot and delicious.  I recommended the Lamb Vindaloo and Garlic Naan.  Both have been very tasty.  The vindaloo was spicy but not crazy spicy, just the right amount!  They also have given me a ton of rice with my to go orders.  

Good call on this place, Yelp!
Best Indian food around and a great staff. Catch the lunch buffet and you won't be disappointed.
Loved it! Very welcoming and attentive staff. Great food, loved everything. The naan was very tasty too. We are going to become regulars very quickly! Strongly recommend.

Hands down the best Indian food I've had in Colorado, perhaps the USA. The lamb biryani and crab masala were as good as it gets. Plus the service was extraordinary. One of my favorite restaurants in the entire state!

The food here was to die for!!! Holy moly if I could eat this everyday I would. If you want Indian food this is your stop. The portions were bigger than I expected and the service was amazing. They take pride in what they serve.

Great for a lunch buffet . Food was tasty and ok variety. 3 chicken dishes and a vegetarian. 
Service was basic and nann bread was good.

Food is decent n over priced but service is poor!
Waiters are rude. I have been here a few times before but I guess this will be my last.
If you are going an hour before closing time don't bother going cos they will literally throw you out as soon as possible!

This place was great! Our server explained everything in detail. He was great. 
The service, the food everything. 
Will definitely return

I eat here once a week.  Service is attentive.  The buffet often has unique, authentic Indian food options that are not on every other buffet in town.   

The quality of food sets Zaika apart.

UH, don't go to lunch buffet a 1 PM and expect the best, anywhere.   They cook their food fresh and trail off the volume after 12:45.

Finally. We found good no, great Indian food in the Denver area! We came with friends and enjoyed a really lovely Friday evening. 

Our friends had ordered the veggie dumplings before we arrived. They were steamed and in the style of Mongolia. Definitely a different style than what you find in most Indian restaurants but very good. I also ordered the samosa of the day. Spicy and topped with garbanzo beans it tickled the taste buds. 

For the main I ordered goat curry, the hubs got chicken tikka masala, our friends ordered the chicken coconut curry which I forgot the name of and lamb vindaloo. 

The goat curry had an excellent sauce with the goat tasting like goat and as it turns out isn't something I will probably eat again. The hubs chicken was amazing as was my friends vindaloo. Which was so spicy I literally turned bright red after one bite. 

The garlic naan was the best I have ever had. So good that after we inhaled the first order we promptly ordered another. 

The customer service was top notch and we had fantastic service. I cannot say enough about how great the service was. I would and have recommended this to anyone looking for fantastic Indian food.
The staff and the food are outstanding. The specials are top notch and they cook every dish to your request. Like it spicy? They can make that happen.
Pretty great food.  Great service.  Decent atmosphere.  They didn't have my normal dish of Fish Masala, but the others were tasty.  I'll come back, but only until I find a better Indian joint.

The only word I have for this place is "wow." For one reason or another I've never been a huge fan of Indian cuisine so when my husband had a craving I was a bit hesitant.  We decided to try Zaika due to the amazing reviews on Yelp and man were we not disappointed. This may have been the best meal I've had since I moved to Colorado. I had chicken tikka and my husband had a the chicken curry. As a chicken curry lover, my husband was absolutely blown away by the flavors, portions and quality of the dish. My chicken tikka was nothing short of glorious. Cut each piece easily with my fork and seriously wanted to take a bath in the yoghurt, ginger and garlic sauce.  I chose mushrooms as a side and could have happily had them as a main dish.   The staff was absolutely lovely and seemed genuinely grateful (and gracious) of the immense praise we offered.  In close, this once timid Indian food eater is now whining to go back to Zaika!
Clean and the buffet was good.  If you like spicy food with lots of curry this place is for you.

Surely best Indian restaurant in the area. Food and service both are awesome. Real authentic Indian taste, I tried chicken and mutton dishes and found those awesome in taste.
Must visit restaurant for Indian food.
Went for buffet. Everything I had was fresh and flavorful. I subtracted a star for lack of choices and very small salad bar. Thy the chicken marsala and vilandoo fish.

AWESOME lunch buffet!
Previous managers/owners (I'm not sure) of Azitra., with similar style food.

I Love it when they include a dessert (besides kheer) on their lunch buffet, but this doesn't always seem to happen.
Fresh hot naan is served to your table which is a nice touch.
I wish the food was a bit spicier, but I also have a high tolerance for spice and I understand why this is not so possible.  The food is very flavorful however, so I don't miss the spice too too much.

For lunch I pick this place over Azitra, but for lunch without the buffet or dinner, I'm still heading up to Azitra as the food has a bit of an edge and prices are pretty much identical.

This place is fantastic, and it's very evident that they strive to provide excellent service. 

My gluten intolerant husband was overjoyed to have finally found a delicious Indian food restaurant that's close to home AND has a nice variety of GF options (honestly, Zaika had him at GF Onion Pakora). 

Our household loves Indian food - when we moved here two years ago from NYC, were sad to leave our favorite Indian place behind. Zaika has given us a taste of what we've been missing all this time! We tried a bit of all the basics - an Indian food litmus test, if you will. The veggie samosas were great, the garlic naan was on point, the onion pakora was delectable, and the saag paneer and chicken tikka masala entrees exceeded our expectations.   

This restaurant brings something to Broomfield that we have not found yet: a local restaurant that offers high quality and delicious dishes. Broomfield is pretty lackluster in the restaurant department, and this place sets the bar high. 

We are hooked.

We drove almost 20 miles to eat at this restaurant and it surely met our expectation. The food was delicious and healthy not too creamy or buttery. The service was exceptional though we went almost during the closing time. I would surely visit the restaurant visit again if I have a chance.

Visiting Denver and had a hankering for Indian food! I looked on yelp and saw that Zaika had great reviews so we decided to try it. They served the ubiquitous papadum first, with an extremely delicious green sauce! I don't know what was in it, but it was addictive. The chicken tikka masala was delicious, with just the right combination of spices. I ordered it medium, so it had a kick to it but didn't set my tongue on fire. My husband had a lamb dish made with mangoes, and ordered it extra spicy.  Apparently it was pretty darn good, because he did everything but lick the plate! The garlic naan was light and delicious also. He also had a Guinness, and I had a cocktail made with mangoes and ginger that was very refreshing. In addition, The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Bobby. We will definitely be back here the next time we pass through Denver!
The lunch buffet is a great option! The food is delicious but the service can sometime be slow or unaware of the customers trying to get their attention for something. They are very nice however.

Tried this gem based on the positive Yelp reviews, and was not disappointed!  Kind and attentive service throughout, and our waiter gave excellent recommendations.  Food was so fragrant and flavorful.  Garlic nan is amazing.  My new favorite Indian restaurant in the Denver metro area!

Get to this restaurant even if you have had a bad experience with Indian cuisine or have never had Indian food this place will blow your mind. Family owned by the nicest people you will ever meet. Best naan anywhere and the chicken tikka masala is so rich and creamy it is unbelievable. They often have new things and I do my best to try them all and I have never been disappointed. Support this business we need more places like this.

Not much to say, except delicious and fast Indian food! Super happy to find this gem so close to home. Not in the easiest to find place but worth the effort to get here. I got the spicy chicken tiki masala and my wife got the regular. Portion sizes were ginormous and every spicy bite was delicious! We'll be back.
A happy and attentive team serving really nice cuisine. A welcome find during my travels. Cheers

Best in Denver! Why didn't I show up sooner?!

Classy place with owners wanting to give their best.  Lunch buffet. Gladly substituted roti for naan for no extra cost.

Saag is amazingly flavored, as with everything else.  A great variety with quality vegetables included.  Yellow lentils were the perfect consistency.

Lamb vindaloo was exquisite!
Good service, clean place, owners are attentive and friendly and food is tasty and prepared well.  I've eaten at the restaurant as well as done take out - I recommend both!
Dinner menus are very good. All there shrimp dishes are good. Tried lunch buffet for the first time today and everything was so good!

I come here pretty frequently for lunch as my office is nearby. This place is by far my favorite Indian restaurant that does buffet style food. They actually have a lamb dish, that I forget the name of, which is available in the buffet and is super delicious. The servers here are always super awesome too. Please check it out.

I think its the best Indian restaurant in Colorado. The chicken tikka masala was awesome also the chiken chilli and kauli manchurian. The servers are polite and helpful. I've been here more than  5 times and I everytime I had a wide smile on my face.
All meals were delicious. Staff was very helpful and attentive. Ended the night with mango lasso, also very good. Would go back again. Meals averaged $14 ea.
