We came here for the lunch buffet, which was delicious. They had a great selection of vegetarian options and everything was seasoned amazingly well! The chai tasted a bit off...but overall we had a good experience!

We are regulars here and love both the lunch buffet and dinner menu. The food is always fresh and delicious. The owners and staff are friendly and knowledgable. They have a lot of great vegan options which I appreciate.  Always an exceptional experience.

I have been here twice and it is a great value.  They are very friendly and very attentive to the service.  They only top that with even better food that is fresh and perfectly spiced.  This is my goto Indian restaurant.  Don't let the location fool you this is a hidden gem that you should just give a try.

This place is delicious!  The owners of Azitra split and opened this place. The food is amazing!  Best in town. The service is amazing. Family run and owned. Owner takes the time to come and take orders and make sure everything meets our standards. He is so friendly and helpful. This place is a gem and you must try it!
Great food! Was pleasantly surprised by the quality of everything we ordered. I asked for spicy level 5 - Indian hot and it was great!

All of the food is delicious and extremely reasonably priced. We came in for the lunch buffet. Everything was so tasty - such different flavors in each dish. 

My favorites include the chicken masala, saag paneer (creamed spinach with a homemade cheese), and the naan bread - so fresh and chewy.

The staff is especially friendly and welcoming, and the dining room is comfortable and cozy. Definitely worth a try. You won't be disappointed.
Very good, the service was just as wonderful as the food. My husband and I have never had Indian food before, the staff was so helpful.  We will definitely be back.

Came for lunch during a snow storm.  They had a lunch menu instead of the buffet because they weren't certain how many customers would visit.  I'm SO glad we came for this!  Everything that we ordered was excellent.
Very good! Have been a few times for pick up and everything is top notch. Tried staying for the lunch buffet once and it didn't disappoint - helped me try new things.

Best Indian food ever and great lunch buffet. Go tos are chicken tandoori (very flavorful and the grilled veggies are fabulous) and chicken marsala...both at medium heat...mmm yup. Very friendly service...for takeout, you are greeted coming in and going out and they always offer me a glass of water while I wait. Love this place.

I ate her with my coworker's after a along day of traveling. Everything was so amazing. We ordered a variety of appetizers. My favorites were the Cuto Salad and the cauliflower. For dinner we ordered so many entrees (6 different ones) and I don't remember all the names. I like spicy food and the levels 2-3 were perfect. The waiter was also so helpful in helping us to order just the right amount of food.

This is the best Indian food I've ever had! Just moved to Broomfield and tried this restaurant within the first week. Whole family loved it! The service was good, and the food was excellent. We will definitely go back again.

I am no Indian food aficionado so I don't have a way to compare.  I went during lunch and had the buffet.  It was full of fresh, aromatic, wholesome food.  My favorite was the lamb.  They could have more salad offerings but overall it was delicious.  The nan bread was hot, soft, and yummy,  

The service here is very friendly. And the prices are fair.  I will be back to enjoy again.

This place is so special. I never write reviews but Zaika is a hidden jewel in the burbs!! They are so proud of their  own special dishes and really care if you enjoy your meal. It's unique and not just buffet made. Try their cauliflower dishes! Super yum!

I just had dinner at Zaika and was so pleased i could not wait to return home to write a review.was around 5:30 on a Thursday evening and was very surprised at how dead it was.ZERO dine in customers.Bit of a dark corner location wise.Some more outdoor lighting would be nice(for business as well)..Anywho,. I had a seat as to what would be prob my best Indian Food experience I've ever had.This is REAL Indian food.I had the kofia kashari.A vegetarian dish that was out of this world flavorful.And had the garlic naan which was superb as well.Putting a bit of the rice and sauce on the naan created one of the best bites i've ever had.Service,atmosphere,food,everything 5 stars.Please support this place. Restuarants like this do not come around often.

Let me first say - the service is UNBELIEVABLE here! I am not sure if our server knew it was our first visit, but she gave us a complimentary roll as well as cake dessert. I certainly wasn't expecting that!

The food is definitely 5 star worthy! We got the cream cheese wontons and egg drop soup to start. The cream cheese had a really rich flavor and was perfectly fried with a side of sweet and sour. We ended up ordering the teriyaki shrimp which was delicious as the shrimp was very moist and large accompanied with peppers and onions. The spiderman and dynamite rolls were also AMAZING. Everything tasted real fresh and the flavors were perfect together. 

I can't wait to go back! This could be my new favorite Asian/sushi restaurant in Denver metro now.

Can I give it 10 stars?! This place is THE best sushi restaurant I have ever been to, by a landslide! The sushi is fresh, the flavors are incredible, and the service is out of this world! SO friendly, so attentive, they've given us free appetizers, rolls, desserts - every time we've been there we've been treated like royalty. I love this place!! Diamond in the rough!

THANK YOU, JP NORIS!!!! We will be back!!!!!

Ok first off this place is fantastic.

I have been to this restuarant mutiple times now and it's been better each time. 

This last time, I ordered a moo-shu vegetable, which they don't even have that on the menu. Chef came out told us that it's not on menu here, but knew how it was done, he went back made the best moshu and gave me hoisin sauce. 

Sushi is the best around, bottom line whatever you order will be the best quality.

This really is a great place, tried it for the first time based on reviews and it did not disappoint.  You would not think much of the place driving up to it, but inside its very nice and can hold a fair amount of people.  We tried a lot of food, Miso soup, Drunken Noodles, Lo Mein both with chicken and different types of sushi (Tuna, Salmon and Yellowtail.  The sushi was very fresh and tasted great. The menu portions were more than adequate.  Drunken Noodles had some heat, but  not too much and we did not specify so those that order may want to ask for more spice.  Service was very good, but we did go at a non standard time so it wasn't crowded, but there was a steady stream of people.  5 Star review is based on expectations and overall similarity to other places of this type along with the quality of the food.

For casual sushi, it gets no better.

Date of Visit: 2/17/16

While searching for pre-movie eats in the area, my friend and I came across JP Nori. The solid reviews and pictures were worthy of a test run, and we were pleasantly surprised.

The decor is pretty typical of most casual sushi joints (a bit tossed together), but nevertheless, the place had a relaxed, fun vibe, with cushy booths, and it was *clean* (+1 star). They have a killer Happy Hour with quite a few specialty rolls, apps, and adult beverages for under $5. We went with the Spicy Yellowtail, Spicy Salmon, Combo, and Monkey Brain. Don't worry about what's in the last two - Just order them. 

While this might not be a Michelin star type spot, anytime you add fresh, flavorful sushi with solid presentation and friendly service - You're a 5 star joint in my book.

Finally found the best Asian food in Denver after 3 years of searching! Came here for the first time last week, returned 2 days later for more delicious food. So far we have tried: 
Yaki Udon- which are absolutely delicious
Tuna Roll- very fresh and well made
Pad Thai- best I've had in Denver 
Chicken Gyoza- great appetizer
Crap cheese wontons- crispy and perfect 

The service was great, even on a busy night. Servers were very friendly and attentive. We will absolutely be back.

I came here with my boyfriend last night for a late Valentines Day dinner and we were very impressed! I don't know how we haven't ended up here before, like other Yelpers, I have great things to say. The ambiance is perfect, very authentic with high end decor. And not gonna lie, I also was digging the lightly playing pop music.

We were greeted right away, they were somewhat busy on a Sunday night. Once we sat down we browsed the menu and decided what we wanted and it took a few minutes before someone greeted us. 

Our appetizer seemed to be taking a very long time, someone brought edamame and apologized about the wait, without us saying anything! I was very impressed that the staff took ownership and made things right. The gyoza was outstanding when it arrived. The sushi was also extremely fresh and everything had a wonderful flavor. 

For 3 specialty rolls, gyoza, and 2 orders of nigiri (no drinks) our bill came to about $55 before tip, not bad at all. I would highly recommend this place for a good date night!

Wednesday December 2nd 2015

I went for Lunch with my friend.  We are the only patrons at that time since they just opened their doors.  It was about 11:10hrs ish.

The one thing that catches our eyes are the BUDDHA that is the Largest item we have seen in a Sushi Restaurant on Colorado Soil.  The Décor is modern.  Even our Booth seats are covered with Chinese/Japanese writings what nots...  

From their extensive Menu, I ordered these following items :

*  Regular Baby Octopus ($7.95)
*  Snow Crab ($5.95)
*  Amaebi aka Sweet Raw Shrimp ($5.95)
*  Unagi ($4.45)
*  Wasabi Tobiko ($3.95)
*  Tamago ($3.50)
*  Kaibashira aka Scallop ($4.50)
*  Spicy Scallop ($4.75)
*  Tai aka Red Snapper ($3.95)
*  Black Tobiko aka Black Caviar ($3.95)
*  Squid ($3.95)
*  Octopus ($3.95)
*  Surf Clam ($3.95)

If I am NOT mistaken, my friend ordered these for her Lunch :

*  Drunken Noodle with Beef option ($9.95).

  Since its Lunch, her Lunch Combo also include an Egg Roll, a Soup and Salad.  My friend also ordered some Roll.  If I am NOT mistaken, it was the Spiderman Roll ($12.95).  This Roll comes with Soft Shell Crab, Spicy Tuna, Mango, Avocado, Cucumber wrapped with Soy Paper and drizzled with Eel Sauce.  The Soft Shell Crab is FRIED.  My friend like her Lunch, though she wish, her order of Drunken Noodle could have been more Spicier for her taste bud.  She also liked her order of Spiderman Roll.  As long as my friend is happy, I am happy too.

  When I get the chance to eat one of the Spiderman Rolls, personally it was a tact too sweet maybe due to the Eel Sauce and the Mango that they put in the Roll.  Overall the presentation of the Roll is pretty to look at.

  The Highlights of my Lunch was the order of Regular Baby Octopus.  NOT many establishment on Colorado Soil offer those Baby Octopus.  I wish I could have many more of those Baby Octopus.  My friend like it too, when she eats it.

In terms of the service its stellar with 5 stars.

  Sushi/Nigiri was presentable and there are 2 items that they made slightly wrong for my personal taste bud.  The Amaebi Shrimp Heads were fried with Batter which was slightly too thick in texture for my liking.  Then for the Squid Nigiri, inside it, they put some Bitter Leaf I think it was Shiso Leaf that I don't fancy.

  During our Lunch, and the conversation we shared with our lovely staff, she brought out a Complimentary Dessert of Mochi Ice Cream.  She said since it was my Birthday, the Kitchen staff prepared those for me.  After our Lunch, I spoke to the Sushi Chef and the kitchen staff.  They are willing to make to order what I like, or do not like the next time I come here to JP Nori.  All in all it was a Successful Birthday Lunch and we don't mind returning when needed.

Thank you JP Nori staffs.  See you soon.

Left JP Nori about 13:10hrs ish, stuffed with happy tummy and my Sushi fix.  *Smiling Ear To Ear*

Do contact JP Nori and verify their operation hours in case they might change them in the future.

TABLE # 4
CHECK # 3028

JP Nori is opened during the following hours :

LUNCH 

*  Monday - Friday : 11 am - 2:30pm
*  Saturday - Sunday : 12 pm - 2:30pm

DINNER 

*  Monday - Thursday : 4pm - 9:30pm
*  Friday : 4pm - 10pm
*  Saturday : 2:30pm - 10pm
*  Sunday : 2:30pm - 9pm

HAPPY HOUR

*  Monday - Friday : 4:30pm - 6pm

JP Nori
5302 S. Federal Cir
Littleton, CO 80123
Tel : (720)-283-1818
Fax : (720)-283-9898

http://www.jpnori.com

@80/2015

Went for lunch.  Great sushi, great service and great prices.Only wish that they are in better location..

The Heart attack roll is amazing.

This new little place is sure to become a neighborhood favorite. The talkative sushi chefs will not leave you bored sitting at their bar. They may even try to lure you into buying the last two sea urchins. 

Looking at the menu you'll be pleasantly surprised that there's not a roll over $13 and some of the staple rolls like a philly or rainbow roll are about $1 less than most places.  

Take one of their recommendations. Our guy made a roll that he invented with seared tuna over a blow torch. That's right people - see the photos. It was like watching an artist put together his final piece for a show. Layer upon layer he continued to add decor to the roll until it was go all ready to consume. I wanted to invent a word for the flavor explosion in my mouth. I didn't want it to stop. Flavor explosion, keep going keep going. Another bite - WHAAAABAAAAMM.  It was something like that. A symphony meets dynamite. 

My wife is smacking her lips at this point because her belly is soooo happy and she loves me sooooo much because I take her to sushi for our date night. 

Moving on to some other rolls they recommended and concluding with a treat they delivered spread out like a piece of art on a plate - mochi. I LOVE mochi. Ironically it took 2 sushi chefs and 1 host to explain what it was before we decided to have them bring it out. "It's like sushi rice ice cream." "Yeah, like rice paper and mango ice cream."  I was expecting a piece of nigiri with ice cream being the top but it's mochi boys. "MO-Chee."

Mochi me next time my new friends. I will be coming back.
This place is AMAZING! The food and service was perfect. The playlist they had on was awesome. Please check this place out!

Some of the best sushi I've had in Denver! However it was the staff that made this an excellent experience. Some of the kindest people I've met I felt more like family than a guest in a restaurant.
I will definitely be back.

DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR BUSINESS!!!


I ordered delivery because they mailed me a flyer, but it had been damaged by spilled coffee . Turns out the free delivery was only 3 miles, so there was a $4.00 delivery fee. I ordered 2 sesame chickens with fried rice ($1.95 extra) and 2 egg rolls. Food arrived, gave $5.00 tip to the driver. $27.40 total. 

Turns out, I only got one dinner!  They did include a hot & sour soup. ( I HATE that soup) and a "salad" that had plain lettuce and carrots. 

I called back...the lady said I confirmed one dinner when I made the order. Nothing they can do now. I hung up on her. 

I looked at the bill...found an undisclosed $3.00 tip added. 

Let's see...$4.00 delivery 
                   $2.00 extra for rice
                   $3.00 undisclosed tip
                   $5.00 tip to driver

                   $14.00 extra for 1 bowl of chicken. 

AND they refused to make the order right. 

DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR BUSINESS!!!

A Wednesday night and this place was packed! Excellent choice for sushi dining. We sat at the sushi bar and were treated like King/Queen. The best fresh fish I've seen in a long time. The offered us a sample of monkey brain's for an appetizer and dessert after our meal! Delightfully fresh and wonderful attentive service ! Will definitely return

What a gem this place is. We were searching for a sushi spot for lunch since our go to place isn't opened for lunch. So glad we found this sushi spot!

Everyone was super friendly, inciting and welcoming; from the host to the servers to the sushi chefs. Everyone had a smile on their face and was happy to have us there. 

We had chef Simon prepare our lunch. From the salmon, yellowtail, toro, eel sashimi it was all fresh and really good. 

We also ordered the heart attack - that wasn't our favorite but I can see how others would enjoy it. 

Yummy roll- that was actually pretty tasty.

Not are if I got this name right but it was something like 2 in 1 spicy roll- that was also very good.

The chefs were all friendly and made us feel comfortable. We noticed a lot of locals here- they know each other on a first name basis;so that's saying  something. You always want returning customers. 

I'm glad we have a good runner up from our usual sushi spot. Wish this place was closer! Until next time!
The green roll was really good. Solid 4 yelp star sushi place. Not much else to say about this place.

This truly is a little hidden gem. It's small and intimate great for date night. The staff is attentive and on their game. For starters we had the heart attack appetizer a fav.. Next we had a sashimi starting with the top left salmon, blue fin tuna, seared tuna, fatty tuna and at the top crab. Next the pretty heart shaped roll was spiderman and finally the roll with a jalapeño on top was yummy roll... Overall deliciousness.
Really great, really affordable local sushi. Sorry fancy downtown sushi restaurants - JP Nori has won 100℅ of my family's sushi business.
Absolutely amazing! The food was delicious, the wait staff was extremely friendly and attentive. Next time I'm in the area, I will absolutely return to this establishment.
The sushi and other dishes are absolutely awesome. Very fresh fish. I had a lunch special with 3 sushi rolls, miso and salad for $12, awesome! Will definitely be back.

Well my husband and I have eaten here on two separate occasions. The first time we went in for sushi and really it couldn't have gone better. The service was great the food was fantastic and we felt incredibly welcome. Sushi here is a must!

This second time we ordered delivery. Everything came as promised no mistakes and the wait time wasn't all that bad. My two complaints however are that the wontons were under cooked. They tasted almost stale. The Mongolian beef even though it had great flavor there were literally about 10 small slicked of steak and A LOT of onions. It is not worth the price. The hot and sour soup was neither hot nor sour really a very bland broth. The chicken pad Thai was good but again very little to no chicken. 

In the end we still stick to ordering sushi and most likely eating at the restaurant.

We ate lunch here a few weeks back. Who knew this place was tucked back here? The experience was pleasant. The waitress was polite and the service was great. I loved the food and the decor. While I had the lunch portion of sushi, i was hoping for just a little more (don't we always).

Thanks for the great dining experience. We will be back. I am surprised more people don't know where you are.

Best in town! Best price best service best taste.  We are pleased to frequent this sushi restaurant 3-4 times a month.  It took months to find this gem, if you have not been here you are missing out! Try it out.

Super yummy food. Get the Thai curry rice! It has a lot of chicken, shrimp, and veggies in it!

Service was perfect. Super attentive! Our waters were refilled quickly and napkins brought without asking.

A+++

Consistently good food and great service!!!!  Yummy Roll is YUMMY (no pun intended!). Monkey Brains and Heart Attack is amazing as well.  So worth the long drive~  still coming back for the fried calamari again and again.
Still nothing but good things to say about this restaurant! Had them deliver last night, a small buffet of dishes, all of them fantastic. And the delivery was freaky fast!

This place is tucked back there! Definitely worth the visit! I'm not a huge sushi fan but my wife is. I actually don't care for seaweed but they were able to substitute it for soy paper. Honestly the best sushi I have had. Not fishy at all and very flavorful. The service was awesome. We had Betty and she was so sweet and attentive. Actually all of the servers are attentive! Everything was decently priced as well!

I wish I could give this place more stars! This place is absolutely amazing. They have wonderful service and the people are really friendly and nice. I'm currently pregnant, and they separated the cooked fish from the raw for me. 
And the fish is nice and fresh! So delicious!!
One of the best sushi places in town. Staff is friendly and attentive. The food is great and always fresh. I will keep going back for great food and service.

So I have to say, when I learned that a new sushi place had popped up within two minutes of my house I was beyond thrilled. When I saw that it was doing really well in the review department I thought "Even Better!!!" And when Ty and I finally made it in I was pretty darn happy with what we were served. 

Before I go on however, I must issue a disclaimer: The server reminded us that the lunch special of three rolls (limited selection) for 12.00 with soup and salad was still going on. I'm not sure if the rolls with this special and both my husband and I felt that they seemed a bit small. Still for three rolls plus soup and salad, I didn't feel cheated. 

Alright, moving on. We ordered a bunch of sashimi and the portions were generous and prices where fair. Presentation with an orchid flour: beautiful. 

We order the Spicy 2 in 1 and liked it although I'm A heat freak and wished it could have been a little spicier. Other heat freaks will understand the crazy looks you get when you declare this at a table full of wim- I mean people with a more delicate palate. 

Service: prompt and attentive without beating you over the head. Oh! And I guess it was really cold in there because of an AC issues. I thought it was fine and I was in short sleeves. They gave us tea on the house by was of apology. I thought it was really sweet of them. Our server was funny and teased us good-naturedly about how much we ordered and finished. Is it bad that a 5'4 120lbs girl can put away almost as much as her 6'2 190lbs husband? Please say no.  

Decor: Gorgeous! The little falling lights were a nice touch. The bar is pretty and I think it would be nice to sit there for lunch. 

Sushi: some good, some great here. Again, not sure if that had to do with ordering off the lunch menu. I want to go back and order for dinner and see what's up. 

All in all, I liked it enough to become a regular, they're close to me and they deliver. That deserves four stars from me.
JP Nori's is amazing!!! Great food, great customer service and great prices. Love our neighborhood sushi hub. Don't mind the outside the inside is beautiful.

Definitely a hidden gem like the menu says. Very clean and friendly staff. Affordable and very good food. I had a 15% off coupn and lunch was only 31.00 for 4 sushi rolls and an entree. The jalapeno roll was awesome.
Got my to go menu and will be ordering take out very soon!!

My wife is pregnant but she keeps craving sushi. It's only a matter of time before she gets what she wants. They were very accommodating to us and kept all raw materials away from her food.  The decor is amazing and the food keeps you coming back for more!
Sushi it was very yummy, I had California roll, BlackDragon, with Miso Soup and along Kani salads. I really enjoy the meals. I will go back and order again.
Great Littleton gem.  Cool staff great sushi!!!  Love the atmosphere and the big Budha. It's in a tiny strip mall but don't let that fool you.  Highly recommended.

This place had great customer service, very attentive to our table , and even noticed before we did an error in our order and brought us an extra roll at no charge! Decent prices, fun music and great food , we will be back!

After looking at the reviews, I thought there is no way this place can be as good as people are saying.....but it is.  It's really really good.  I am impressed.  My husband ordered a variety of sushi, and I got Drunken Noodles.  The noodles were wonderful with a good amount of spice.  I was interested in trying some sushi too, so I only had a little of the noodles and took the rest home for leftovers the next day.  Sushi was fresh and delicious.  Large pieces, not too much rice.  Very enjoyable dinner.  We will definitely be coming back very soon.

Sushi and delivery?! What a great addition to the neighborhood. Decent prices and fresh sushi, I was pleased with my order. The delivery time was more than an hour but the food made up for the time! The Thai fried rice with pineapple was unique and fantastic!

This place gets a solid 4 stars. I understand now why it has so many great reviews. My husband and I happened to be in the area and stopped in for a quick lunch. Service was the star here. Waitstaff were ON IT from the time we walked in until the time we left. There were people running food for other tables while those servers were busy with other tables, and I really appreciated that flow. The presentation is the other star. The sushi was presented beautifully - I actually got my specialty roll in a sort of Valentine's Day heart formation, which made me giggle. The tempura was also stacked into a pretty little teepee, and there were fresh flowers on the table, which was an added bonus in my opinion. Everything was very clean and well-presented. Now for the food: the fish and rolls were very fresh, which is ALWAYS appreciated at a sushi establishment. We got some spicy edamame and the tempura shrimp and veggie appetizer, and the batter was nice and light, but the flavor was a little off. The dipping sauce they gave us just tasted like watery miso broth. My Van Roll was the one that came out looking spectacular, and it was tasty, but needed more crunch, like a crisp vegetable texture or panko. My husband got the lunch special, which included soup, salad, and 2 rolls. He got hot and sour soup, which he said was okay, and the Philadelphia Roll and Spicy Tuna rolls were very fresh and tasty. I would probably come back here if I was in the area, especially for the service, but sushi, I'd stick with my favorite spot, which has yet to be beaten in flavor.

There's really not much to add that other yelpers haven't hit on,  but I'll reiterate the wonderfulness that is JP Nori. The quality of the sushi is the best I've had in Denver,  the prices are on par or better than other local establishments,  and the staff is incredible.  Overall this place goes above and beyond and has become a favorite!
The food is amazing. It's always fresh and cooked the way it's supposed to. Friendly staff and quick pickup times. Heart Attack and Crab Wontons are the go to Appetizers. Quality sushi joint overall.

This place is awesome, fast service, super clean and tasty sushi 
We loved it, also good for kids, just what they liked on the kid menu
The sushi was AMAZING!  Best customer service I've ever had at a restaurant!  I will DEFINITELY BE BACK! if you are craving sushi, go here!  You won't be disappointed!

This is hands down now one of my favorite sushi places in Denver! Everyone here is amazingly attentive, kind, and friendly. Very clean and beautiful restaurant. We had a great time sitting at the sushi bar for lunch, as the sushi chefs jammed to some fun music. Sushi was fresh, delicious, firm and thick cut. Definitely worth every penny and then some!

Wow!!! Just moved from Denver to the burbs and was afraid I'd lose some of the food quality. So stoked to have this as a neighborhood sushi spot. It's the 2nd best sushi in Colorado in my opinion. Only behind Sushi Den, but at about 1/2 the price. The octopus appetizer was amazing. The Spider Roll was great. We sampled one of their specials, which was melt in your mouth sushi...everything really was fantastic. Place was clean...good service and the chefs sent out some bonus things to try. 

I'll be back...A LOT!
Great sushi!  Very fresh. Doesn't look like much from the outside but the interior is very nice. Great chefs and good service.

Outstanding- what a gem! Nice ambiance inside. The wait staff and chefs are so friendly. 

 I've also ordered delivery a few times, and am always amazed at the flavors. Our new favorite Asian and sushi restaurant!

Kind of pricey and mediocre rolls - wouldnt go again but other people suggested it and there's the discount for checking in. They gave us free dessert which was nice. The fried monkey brains thing is tiny! Its only like two rolls cut in half to make four little pieces - not worth $6 - such a waste of money. I ended up having to get another roll because usually I fill up on appetizers but that was barely an appetizer - more like your friend letting you pick off a couple pieces from their plate.

A local neighborhood gem! I have had sooooo many bad sushi experiences at "highly rated" suburban joints that I am skeptical about trying anything new. But I was feeling brave one night and gave it a try. Have been back a couple times since, to see if everything would be consistent. It was!

The music is well chosen and not too loud--sometimes EDM, sometimes current pop mixed with 60s pop. The ambiance and build-out are perfect for the suburbs. The service is team-style and friendly. The patrons run the gamut: Japanese couples, single white male hipsters sitting at the sushi bar, middle-aged suburbanites, and 20-something African American girls.

So that leaves the food: super fresh, some things you won't get at every other sushi restaurant, and satisfying. We've tried many rolls and salads. The chef always sends something "extra": a little salad, or dessert. 

The only misses so far are the soups, which are uninspiring and not hot enough, and the mai tai cocktail, which was mostly juice and too sweet. (The house hot sake is perfectly balanced, though.) Give this place a try!
AWESOME!!!! Great service and awesome sushi!!!!!

This is the best Sushi/Asian restaurant I have been in all of the Denver area. Great atmosphere, very clean and extremely friendly service. Food was tasty and authentic while also being very reasonably priced. I was treated to a sample of an appetizer called "Monkey Brain" and WOW it was excellent - Was a deep fried roll with spicy tuna, crab, cream cheese. Great people at JP Nori- I plan on coming here at least once a week for lunch.

Happen to notice the sushi sign on the way home from work one day. I have driven this way for years and never noticed the sign. Decided to try it tonight and started with the miso soup and the hot and sour soup which were both delicious. Then on to sushi rolls: we had the Green Roll
Spicy tuna roll, Spicy 2 in 1 roll and Toro sashimi. We are participating in the whole life challenge and are not able to eat white rice or soy sauce as well as tempura. They were extremely accommodating giving us tamari in place of soy sauce and brown rice instead of white rice for an up charge. They substituted some ingredients for us as well with no up charge. The sale was good and the service was excellent. The Decor is very nice. We will definitely go back.

I'm from Hawaii and know a good sushi restaurant. Their nigiri sushi was very fresh and tasty. We sat at the sushi bar and the food came out pretty fast. Even my friend who eats at a lot of sushi bars said it was good. Only thing I forgot to use the 15% off coupon that is on their Yelp site. Happy eating!!

We absolutely love everything about this place. We love that we are greeted by the hosts as we walk in the door. Everyone that works here is super friendly, warm and welcoming. They honestly make you feel like you are family. We always sit at the sushi bar because we love to talk to the sushi masters and watch them create their beautiful creations. Simon and Andrew are both awesome chefs that offer great recommendations as well as answer any of our questions about the wonderful food they are serving. They also have great senses of humor which makes our meals fun and they are also very creative with the dishes they serve. They are always offering delicious complimentary samples of different items on their menu for our tasting pleasure. Everything we have ordered has been outstanding. Quality is the real deal. Fish is fresh and top notch. Awesome sashimi and nigiri, great selection of rolls too. No matter what we order it is always of good quality, well prepared, beautifully presented and super fresh. The prices are definitely fair and reasonable for such awesome fare. The ambiance is very nice and the service is prompt, respectful and welcoming. Victor is a great host. 

Bottom line, this restaurant is trying to expand people's perception of a plain ole sushi joint and their sashimi and nigri stands out more than anything. If your idea of great sushi is simply spicy tuna and California rolls, do yourself a favor and come here to expand your mind. They have tons of fresh and exotic fish and all dishes are beautifully executed and presented. If you want a versatile menu where you can order a mix of a good roll or two, with tasty sashimi and some great non-sushi entrees, this is the place to go. Thank You Mr. Don Green for bringing me here for the first time. Hands down favorite sushi in the denver area and the friendliest family-owned restaurant I have ever been. WooHoo! as good it gets!!!
Yummy - fresh sushi! Great rolls and sashimi. Service is attentive and ambience is great. A great find for sushi.

Followed the good reviews and wasn't disappointed! Wonderful fresh sushi, friendly, kind staff and great environment! We got special rolls recommended by the chef and couldn't choose a favorite they were all so good! Chefs Simon and Andrew are wonderful people to talk to- sit at the sushi bar to have the pleasure of chatting with them! We even got a special dessert and tempura piece the try. Would highly recommend!!

Passed through the area for a road trip and saw this was the best rated restaurant so we had to try! We went for dinner on New Year's Day so it was not crowded at all. All the servers were very friendly and nice. The decor is neat and the food was delicious! We only ordered one dish with raw fish and it was amazing, so I'd recommend to try that. The shrimp tempura roll and yaki udon were good but didn't live up to the whole hype of the restaurant. I'd say go for all the raw or fancier rolls!
Very nice place to have a good sushi, very fresh, large selection and comfortable athmospere! Will go back in a couple of days!

Don't be fooled by the unattractive strip mall in which this is located! The interior is nicely appointed; the service is excellent; and the sushi is super-fresh and delicious. We thoroughly enjoyed the marinated octopus (not the fried version) appetizer, and the Spiderman roll was incredible and my favorite of the evening. Their sushi is slightly less expensive than most places and as just as yummy as I've had at upscale places in town. Dress is casual. If you like excellent sushi without the crowds, get to this hidden gem before it's really discovered.

Amazing!! I can't believe how awesome this place is. On the outside the building looks like your run of the mill strip center but wait until you get inside! It's beautifully decorated and the staff are dressed sharp. Everyone was very attentive to our needs and even brought us some egg rolls on the house. We ordered sushi, orange chicken and general tso chicken. I can't decide which is my favorite.

Great little sushi spot. 
FOOD - the fish used in the sushi was very Good and the rolls were flavorful and a bit different (green roll = very tasty) than your average strip mall sushi joint. We only had the Gyoza as well - it was deep fried not pan fried so a point off there. They also gave us sample of a tuna salad (excellent) and sweet sour chicken (did not enjoy)
SERVICE - overall the service was great - friendly and attentive. 
AMBIENCE - seeing that this place is in a kinda shady strip mall (see Toad Tavern) my expectations were very low but surprisingly it is very nice inside and comfortable. And Thumbs up the biggest Buddha I have ever seen in a sushi joint !
Return visit YES. Next time we will bring the kid and try some of the non-sushi menu items. But this is definitely a great add to the neighborhood !

This is one of the best sushi/Asian cuisine restaurants I've been to! Service is phenomenal and all the staff were very kind, efficient, and made the experience a great one. The food itself was beyond delicious!!! We received free wontons while waiting for our food to be made, and I thought that was quite sweet of them to do. The Beef Yaki Udon was amazing! As were the various sushi rolls we ordered. I will definitely be coming back many times

They have very good sushi and crab meat cheese wontons. They are a nice replacement since Sakura Buffet closed down. The employees are very friendly and helpful. I will be going back there again. Any place with good shrimp has my attention.
I'm editing this review from way back when, my friends bought me some sushi and sent it to the Rocky Mountain  Cancer Center. Omigawd!!!!

This place has 5 stars for a reason. Great food, service, and they just gave us free sushi! From the outside it seems like a cheap Chinese restaurant, but when you get inside it is nicer than a lot of others in Denver. The service is just as good if not better that many others I've been to in Denver.

This sushi restaurant is in a strip mall, cradled between a bar, a liquor store and a laundromat so immediately I had this pre-conceived idea of the overall restaurant experience. I was mostly wrong. The sushi was good, very well done. The fish quality was good and their specials were way beyond what I expected: the uni was excellent, the toro was outstanding, the halibut fin was delicious. What wasn't so great was our waiter. I arrived later to meet my friends, who has already warned me that the place was packed, so I was ok with waiting for service. Overall the guy was rather busy but as the restaurant started clearing out and there were very few tables left it wasn't as if we suddenly got more attention. The waiter tended to us inattentively, taking plates away with food still on them, not checking our order (we ordered two orders of two types of nigiri sushi and he had to be asked). After we had been talking and finishing up our waiter came to us and informed us that they close at 10, thus he has to drop our check. Of course it was 5 after 10, we had been finishing up eating and were almost ready to go, yet the fact that the waiter wanted to rush us out the door was very rude. Of course, the moment the waiter was able to pick up the check and his tip we never saw he, yet the table still sat with all of our plates on it.
So, all in all, a 4 for food as the quality was close to what you'd get at some better sushi restaurants in town, and a 2 for service, as the waiter could have been so much better, which averages a 3 overall.

This is by far one of the best sushi restaurants I have in Colorado. You can tell a huge difference base on how each roll taste. The fish is so fresh and delicious. My favorite roll is by far the Yummy roll. This place is definitely a destination spot for any sushi lover.
Everything is soooo good! Food, service, drinks, decor, sushi... We love it all! Best sushi in Littleton. Best pad Thai I've found on this side of town!

Great food. Sushi is fresh and also ordered the heart attack and baby octopus. Both were fried perfectly and really delicious. Service is very friendly and there is a nice atmosphere in there as well.

Outstanding. 
The customer service is exceptional. Everyone is pleasant, attentive, genuine, and cheerful. 
The staff frequently engage the customers, especially the sushi chefs. 
The sushi is great! The chefs also made us a free sample. 
The prices are reasonable. 
One negative: the drink I ordered was mostly ice, in a very small (not suitable) glass, and wasn't made well. It was a mango margarita... 


Otherwise, A+!!
This place is soooo good. Everything is fresh, restaurant is clean, staff is friendly. This place is so underrated.

I came here because of the Yelp reviews and it did not disappoint. I came here for the Japanese dinners and got one sushi roll and had to come back for more. Service is awesome they give you little freebies and I've yet to find a sushi place that puts so much care into their food. The sushi rolls use good quality products and the presentation is beautiful. Definitely one of my favorites.

I was pleasantly surprised that a once horrible burrito place attached to the Toad Tavern was remodeled into a decent affordable sushi restaurant.  The lunch special is par for local joints, but the chef's samplers and bonus deserts are a wonderful touch of class and customer care. We'll be back for sure.

We first found this restaurant at random and went in and can I just say love it, I'm not a fan anything that's not cooked, and I was so happy to see that they have a huge selection of cooked rolls,  the staff is super nice always greet us and say good by when we leave. We love it and the food is always yummy a d looks so pretty and not over the top expensive we love it and go about every other week.

Outstanding sushi.  Lovely staff, both friendly and knowledgeable. Prices are what you would expect for sushi in a middle class neighborhood. A true hidden gem. If you want sushi in Littleton then you need to go here.

Don't let the fact that this place is in a small strip mall fool you, it is clean and classy inside and the service and food was fantastic. Very fresh and very reasonable prices too. We will definitely be returning for more!
Food was great! Customer service was great! I have only ordered take out, and the first time, my order was delayed so they brought me out dessert to try!!!
Wonderful service AND food! I went here for a date with my boyfriend, and I was not disappointed. Definitely going to go there again.

We went to this place on a bit of a lazy whim (wanted sushi, didn't feel like driving to our usual place). It is awesome to have a spot close by now! Their roll menu is a little abbreviated, but everything is executed well. Every one is friendly and place is clean and nice.
Best food ever, fresh vegetables. The staff there are amazing,  they take good care of you. Definitely 5 stars!
Great gluten free roll options.  Came here for my bday and very happy with choice.  The staff is friendly and remembers all returning customers.

This place is great! Everything I've had has been amazing and the service is awesome as well. Fish in a landlocked state had me nervous but everything tastes fresh and yummy! They have a really good happy hour also.

This is a neighborhood gem.  Far better than I would have expected based upon the location.  The sushi is delicious, and the service is friendly and attentive.  While the exterior is an unassuming micro strip mall next to a sketchy bar/music venue...once inside you will be pleasantly surprised.  This was my second visit and both times have been outstanding.

The sushi was absolutely amazing. I had the lunch special and chose the salmon skin, tuna, and spicy yellowtail. All of the rolls were delicious, as was the seaweed salad. The soup and salad included were sub par, but how could I really complain about such a great lunch special. Most importantly the server, Mike, did a stellar job. His professional service made lunch that much more enjoyable. Will definitely go exclusively when he is working.
Checked this out after seeing the rave reviews- they lived up to their expectations!

Just moved to the Littleton area from north Denver and I have been looking for a local sushi restaurant that I can frequent. I decided to try JP Nori for lunch today and it was such a great experience. The sushi was amazing, but the service was even better. Thank you all at JP Nori for helping me find my go-to place for sushi!
The sushi here was very fresh,  they had friendly service and the restaurant was very clean.

Went there for the first time last night and I was pleasantly surprised.  We order the traditional 2 person boat/sashimi & sushi/rolls.  The hamachi was great as was the rest of the dish.  Having lived in Hong Kong and the mainland it's nice to know there is a place with quality dishes at a great price here in Littleton.  Now we have to see if the delivery food orders match up.
Very good sushi and the entrees are tasty too. Try the Pad Thai or Thai Basil Chicken.

A friend recommend I try this place so we went for a birthday dinner. I really like the decoration of this place vwry welcoming and clean. Great services, food are delicious. We will definitely come back to visit again.
Went for lunch.  Still the best sushi in Denver.  Great food great service. Great prices.  It's a win win.

First time in and sooooo excited to find this place near my office. I am a spicy tuna roll purist in that I don't want roe or anything taking away from the taste - their spicy tuna roll is pure. The mountain roll was by far the best specialty roll i have had in this,area.  YUM! If you are in downtown Littleton or heading down Santa Fe in Littleton, take a jog to this nicely decorated, clean, friendly place the bubble at South Suburban. You will not be disappointed!
Have been there numerous times. Food is always fresh, may take a little time but completely worth a short wait. Always friendly and clean!! Looking forward to bringing my sister from New York here!

Our favorite Asian food in littleton. We started to get disappointed there were no good Asian in littleton till we found this hidden gem . So good! Chicken lo mein and bento box are our go to orders. They deliver and are so friendly. I have never called to order delivery where someone was so nice!
Excellent service. Gave me a free glass of wine when I had to wait a few minutes for my to go order!
Best salmon skin roll! Shrimp tempura was yummy. Food was quick and beautifully presented. Great service. Coming back to explore the fusion menu.

Let's just say we got our pizza, poppers and apple pie bread about 15 min ago....and it's all gone!! AMAZING! Everything was delicious!  So glad we moved to Parker! Even if just for the greatest pizza.

I actually really love this place. Their pizza, cheesey bread and ranch are all superb. Very reasonable prices too. Like many pizza places they sometimes forget some of the sides or mix up the soda we order, but that's not an issue. My biggest issue is that I live in Parker and despite ordering delivery from here roughly 15x over the past 16mos, I was recently told I am no longer within their delivery radius. First I've heard of this. I guess I'm 4.5mi away and they have a 4mi limit. News to me! Oh well, probably never going to order again given delivery isn't an option anyway. Hope they change their policy, which appears to be new as it's not mentioned anywhere.
This is the best pizza I've had in the Parker/Castle Rock area.  We live in Castle Rock and will drive to Parker to get this pizza every time.

I always loved this place, it was literally the only place we got pizza from. Best pizza and delivery! Tonight I was told I was no longer in their delivery range. With two little kids, pick up at night isn't really an option. Super bummed, won't be going back.
Consistently incredible pizza and outstanding service. You can't go wrong supporting this small business.

Best pizza to open in parker in some time!  Their menu is unique and fresh.  The owner is a young businessman actually in there making these delicious pies, taking calls,  and offering customer service that is second to none. 
I expect this place to be around for a while,  you and your family should try it out.
This place is awesome. Please choose this over the chain restaurants. You won't be disappointed.

The pizza is great and so is the service. Fresh hand stretched based and lots of topings to chose from. The dough is the perfect brooklyn style and sauce is delicious. I got the goat cheese pizza and Aspen. I preferred the Aspen pizza more because it had the perfect balance. 

Would definitely go again.

During a recent visit to see family in Parker we decided to get a pizza for dinner and of course I went to my favorite app - Yelp to help me decide on a place to order a take out.
This place had high reviews so therefore I had high hopes- my husband called up to get the prices since there wasn't any on the menu (my number one pet peeve) why wouldn't the prices be on the menu??? Anyway we found out they only offer 2 size pizzas a large or x-large so we went ahead and ordered an all meat, a sausage and  the chicken with sundried tomato pizza can't remember the name of it. My husband was told that we were 1 mile out of the delivery radius and the pizzas would be ready within 20minutes. No problem he didn't mind picking them up however when he got home with the pizzas I was extremely disappointed by the topping situation they were very stingy with the toppings like literally 3 small pieces of mushroom on the entire pizza and no sundried tomatoes at all.
The all meat pizza was a joke I have never seen so little meat on a pizza very disappointing because the overall taste of the pizzas was good had the toppings been more generous I wouldn't of had any complaints. We sucked it up because it would of meant my husband going back out to return them and pick up new ones and with 3 very hungry children it just wasn't worth the hassle.
This is our go to pizza place! It's delicious and the service is awesome.

Ordered for delivery on a Thursday- one pizza with some hot wings and an order of ranch dressing.  Was quoted 45 mins for delivery.  After an hour, I called to check the status of our order and the guy who answered the phone told me it was "out for delivery."  ANOTHER 45 mins passed with no pizza, so I called and asked to speak with a manager.  He told me that it was "walking out the door as we speak," when I had been told 45 mins earlier that it was out for delivery.  The manager told me that since it had been over twice the amount of time we were quoted that the order would be free.  The food finally arrived after an hour and 40 minutes.  Wings and pizza were stone cold, and the ranch dressing was nowhere to be found.  Woke up the next day to discover they charged my card!!  Had to call and speak with 2 different managers to get a refund, which took several days to process.  Will not be ordering from here again!!!!!!!!!
I'm a pizza snob and this pizza was very good! Hard to find good pizza places but I would recommend this one to anyone, great quality pizza. Friendly staff and local so we'll be back!
Good food , great owner Matt R. Great young kids working hard and providing quality and friendly service with a great pizza and wings
All the yes!  My roommate and I got the supremo and it was amazing. The ingredients were so fresh, perfect blend of cheese, and the dough..yummy. We will be going back for sure.

Only takeout or delivery. No seating available to eat, just a couple seats to wait for your order. Staff was very friendly and attentive. I got the Parker with jalapenos...great taste, but my true pizza test is just plain cheese and it was so good!!! Loved it with some extra Parmesan cheese.

They have some of the best pizza I've ever had.  I must say that when you call and get a  generic voicemail stating to leave a message and the mailbox is full, is unprofessional.  I called your second store in the smoky hill area and inquired about the situation, but I also asked if I was too far for delivery and I was.  The lady at least apologized but could only guess that you were closed as you were not answering your phone.  

One may have a great product, but if the customer service and communication is lacking, it will not end well.  Don't get me wrong, I called over 15 times to see if I could get through as I enjoy your product.  Now with a generic voicemail and your mailbox is full, I will reconsider where I order pizza from.

To summarize, I could have the best product in the world and yet if I don't answer the phone, I wouldn't be able to sell it.

Im not sure what it was about me pizza that I wasn't a fan of. Maybe more toppings would have been good. The sauce tastes like dominos sauce, which im sure they use a similar recipe. Maybe ill give it a shot again. 

Thank you
Great pizza made by good people. I will probably not eat any other pizza while in the area.

We ordered once from here.  The pizza is so-so.   Definitely not as amazing as others have stated on here.  Just an average, run of the mill, New York style pizza.   Nothing really stood out, nothing extraordinary. Maybe our expectations were high.  It did not live up to all the hype.  It was good, but not awesome.

Been ordering from these brothers for over a year now! One of the first places I tried since I'm literally down the street from them and love their pizza! Always willing to accommodate you and great attitude whenever I come in! Highly recommend this place and its pizza! Never been disappointed!

Best pizza in Parker, bar none!  The guys who own the place are brothers and are exceptional to their customers. Great price, amazing product and an unbeatable customer experience.  I'm doing you a favor by sending you their way!

I thought I had written a review for these guys awhile ago. Have been ordering from these guys since day one. Ingredients are fresh and its apparent they are passionate about what they do. Both brothers will always take the time to get the order right and make sure it is perfect. I always mix the garlic and red sauce.. Fantastic!!!
My hard to please kids love this place.  Very high quality ingredients,  incredible sauce.

Coloradough Pizza is a new, small local pizza joint. It's really a takeout only sort of spot, as the interior only has two small tables for a total seating capacity of five. 

What they lack in ambiance they make up for in pizza. Prices are reasonable, and the ingredients are clearly fresh and top notch. My first visit here I went with an 18 inch pizza that was half 5280 (with fresh jalapenos) and half Spinach Feta. They were both delicious but my preference leaned slightly towards the 5280. 

The 18 inch is pretty massive, and dinner for two resulted in us being completely full with 3 1/2 leftover (large) slices. 

The workers were very friendly and clearly enthusiastic about making a great pizza. I will be a repeat customer.

Four stars because of the pizza,  Four stars because its a new business that is trying to do it right,  We went in for lunch based on Yelp reviews.  We dined in.  The price was exceptionally cheap and tbh Id tell the brothers who own this place to raise them, its worth it.  We stood at the counter for a bit as they were in the back working on taxes.  Thats ok, they are a young business and working out the kinks.  We ordered a 14 inch pep sausage pizza that was delicious and cheap.  We ate there at one of the 2 (yes 2) tables.  No Parmesan available at that isn't acceptable in a pizza place.

However, the brothers were very friendly, very helpful and were very inquisitive if we liked their product, which we did.  I thought overall, this place has a great plan and great food, but just needs to step it up a bit.  

Ill go back and review when they have been in business longer but I have high hopes for them.
This the best place for pizza night! Thanks guy for great service and family atmosphere

The pizza from this place is amazing. The pizza crust is thin, the toppings generous, and the actual slices are huge! The owners are friendly and make the pizzas quickly. I would recommend Coloradough pizza to anyone.

So we've heard  a lot about this place from other people so we decided to give it a try...we didn't do much research so we were surprised to find out that it was not a sit down pizza place...no worries we will take it home.  

Overall verdict...4 stars!  Great toppings! Really fresh and very tasty!  Crust was good but by the time we got home it was a little chewy...i'm sure it would have been better if we would have eaten it there.  The sauce was really good and not too sweet or bitter...just right.  Only complaint was that there were very little mushrooms...very little.  Price point was ok...$34 for two pizzas...average i guess for Parker.    

Very good pizza with great service from the workers there.  Very friendly guys that made you feel like a regular when you walked in.  I'm sure they will have lots of success!

I ordered a couple of Coloradough pizzas for friends that had a newborn and their families.  Everyone loved the pizza.  Even better, my friends ordered a couple of Coloradough pizzas a few weeks later and the delivery driver remembered who they were.  He commented that they "were the couple that just had a son." 

This is an incredible place.
Sorry, the kids that run this place are nice, but this pizza is horrible quality, greasy and the sauce was tasted like ragu.

We've ordered a couple of times now and have enjoyed the pizza and jalapeño poppers (fresh made and wrapped in bacon!). I'd always rather support the local hometown businesses and this one didn't disappoint.

Went for the first time today. The two brothers that own the store are basically natives to Colorado (basic meaning moved here when they were under 3, as a native myself it counts). They were wonderful to talk to and my wife and children loved how warming they were. The pizza itself was wonderful. The sauce was obviously genuine in that if it was canned, I would have had heart burn, which did not happen. The flavor, sauce and crust were great! I would recommend them over any pizza place in Parker, the only pizza place in southern Denver that would compare would be Big Bills New York Pizza, which is equally as good. Honestly, great pizza and support local business.

Coloradough's perfect combination of pizza and service compelled me to write my first Yelp review (I know, I've caught up to 2007). We stumbled upon this place almost a year ago due to their early positive Yelp reviews and have been addicted ever since. It's become our Friday night go-to. 

The pizza is incredible!  Even pizzas that aren't really my usual type like "The Parker", a chicken-bacon-ranch masterpiece, are amazing. In fact, I am currently calculating how much farther I would have to run tomorrow if I ate that 4th piece hiding over there in the box.  

But why do we drive by at least 8 other pizza places closer to our house? Why did I buy an insulated pizza bag to keep the pizza warm because they are a little farther than the other guys?  The reason is service like I got tonight.  I realized I forgot my wallet when I was getting out of my car to grab our pizzas. I can honestly say this has never happened to me before so I didn't really know what to expect. They didn't just grudgingly agree to let me go with my pizza. They told me not to worry, go home, enjoy the pizza, then give them a call when I had a chance. When I called, they thanked me for doing so and wouldn't even accept a tip. 

Customer for life. 

The only thing they don't do, you ask?  Get my daughter to like the pizza. Of course as a 14 year old, the only reason she doesn't like the pizza is because her parents do so much. Maybe it is a good thing they can't get her to like it. If she did, I might be worried the pizza was tossed by Satan himself.

We had seen the sign for this place every time we headed home from Costco and decided to pop in and try it out. We thought of eating in, but when we walked in, realized it was a pretty small place with two tables. Last time we were there, they did ask if we wanted to eat there, so some people must do that.

From the moment we walked in the first time, we were greeted very nicely, and shown the menu, which is the one here on Yelp. They explained all the different varieties of pizza and that they use all local ingredients, including the sausage, which is made from a small Denver-based sausage maker. When they run out of fresh vegetables, they run over to Sprouts and get more.

There are only two sizes we noticed, large and extra large. With great pizza like this, no one needs to order smaller pizza anyway. The prices are incredible given the freshness and local ingredients, and the handmade care they use. I think we paid $16 for their biggest pizza: The 5280, which is a meat-lovers paradise. They don't overload the toppings, which leads to a great hand-tossed, crispy bottom, with plenty of yum in each bite!

The guys that run the place are super nice. Our daughter likes to pull up a chair and watch them make each pie. The only issue they may have, is they're getting so popular you need to give them a little extra time at peak hours until they figure out how to manage the high number of orders. But I think any pizza place deals with that at peak hours, and let me tell you, we come from Elizabeth for their pizza, because it's worth it.

Avoid the chains, and get delicious premium pizza from Coloradough! The only downside...you won't have a lot of leftovers because it's too delicious!

My favorite local pizza place - fair prices, great ingredients, and good service. 

Delivery does take a little longer than most places because there's usually only a 2 or 3 guys working at a time but it's worth the wait. They just opened up another location off of Smoky Hill in Aurora that serves the same great pizza I've come to expect from these guys.

Tastes just like Costco pizza bit costs twice as much.... Total disappointment... The dough tasted like it was frozen and the sauce was not great. I think we will try somewhere else next time. I had really high hopes based on the other reviews. The search for good East Coast Pizza in Colorado continues....
We should really come here more often. Amazing pizza and a good value. We always seem to fall into the papa johns trap, shame on us seeing how we have this place in our neighborhood.
Besides having delicious pizza they are the nicest people. Very very friendly. Pizza was great with gracious amount of toppings

YUMMY YUMMY PIZZA!!! I hope they move closer to the center of Parker so they could deliver but it's worth the drive for us.. Seriously the best pizza I've tasted outside of New York City..

The crust.. oh yes THE CRUST!! It's so good.. the perfect amount of chew and crispiness... the ingredients are the perfect amount and the staff is wonderful. 

The price for the giant size of the pizza's is a great value too.. Go now!
The family loves the Garden of the Gods. Delicious! Haven't had a bad pie yet! The 5280 is pretty tasty as well. Give Coloradough Pizza a try!

Great pizza and quick! One of the best pizzas I've ever had. I would definitely recommend the 5280. Loaded with meat, cheese, and just the right amount of sauce. I should mention the sauce is pretty good too and I'm not a very big fan of pizza sauce to be honest. I can't wait to go back and try other pizzas in the menu.

New pizza place that just opened in January and we ordered The Aspen with white sauce which had sun dried tomatoes and thin crust. I'm rooting for this place and wish they offer a garlic sauce like Papa Johns.  

The XL was huge and for $15 it was fair. With so many pizza options it's hard to be loyal to a certain place. Pizza tastes like pizza unless you differentiate your style like Marco's Coal-fired or A-Town Wood fired pizza in Aurora.
Coloradough serves up pizza straight out of the 90's in the best possible way. It was like a slice from my childhood. Some of the best pizza I have had at this price!

Great option for take out or delivery.  A small, local business started by enthusiastic, young, entrepreneurs. We had a 1/2 "5280" (meat lovers) and 1/2 cheese. The kids devoured it!  I hope as business grows they expand to have a sit down option and a broader menu.  As for now, we will be content to pick up and take home.

First time visiting - we ordered the meat lover and the spinach/feta - the meat lover was DELICIOUS!   The Spinach/feta was good too - The service was excellent - we were walk ins so had to wait about 20 mins - very friendly, helpful service!   We will definitely be back to order a meat lover and try something new!

I called from 7:10pm until 7:25pm to put in a delivery or at least an order that I could have gone to pick up before 8pm when they closed. But only got a voicemail message and ringtone for that entire time.

I went to their new location on E Smoky Hill Rd!  The shop is where Johnny's Pizza used to be...thank goodness Coloradough Pizza took over!  Their pizzas were great!  I ordered the XL of the 5280 and a L Spinach and Feta.  Both pizzas were amazing and everyone loved it!
We used a yelp deal to try it out and the guy at the counter was super nice.  I asked if they could deliver it to my house at a later time and he said it was not a problem.  He did inform me that usually with yelp deals they don't deliver, but he will do it for us...so we gave them tip for the delivery and the pizza was delivered nice a hot!  Love the dough and the crust was chewy. Yummm
I love these guys!  Great pizza and great service.  They are funny and personable and seem to really enjoy what they do.  Easily my go to pizza in Parker.

PLAN AHEAD! 
we showed up with time to kill, thankfully, because there was an order of 15 pizzas and an order of 6 after that. Our pizza was made and ready on the exact minute promised. They guys who run the place are super sweet. 
The pizza- ohhhhh so good. We ordered the 5280 (all meat) sans bacon.  The meat was very good and not overly salty. I asked one of the owners why their pizza was so popular and he told me it was bc of the dough he created. The dough is out of this world. I love pizza and to me there is no such thing as bad pizza, but this dough was noticeably very good. It was crunchy and chewy all at once. I found myself going back for more to the point where if I were alone, I prob could've eaten a whole large bc the dough is so good.

This is a good product for Colorado. I will say they need to get a real pizza oven and ditch the conveyor to get to at least 4 stars.
Fresh dough, decent ingredients; use cheddar cheese in the cheese blend which was odd, but did not really taste it.
The pizza needed more spices and flavor overall, but it was good.
The brothers who own/run it are great. This is carry-out or delivery only.

f'n a cotton... FN-A I am stoked. Finally found some fantastic Pizza in Colorado, and who'd a thought I'd be in Parker. Eaten here a dozen times now and every time is the same as the last, FN amazing. A+ Pizza
That said, they are not perfect, they seem to screw up the order or forget to make it 50% of the time, that's not a made up percentage, literately half the time something goes wrong.
This has to be the best pizza I have had in along time. The guys in there were great, nice and friendly. I don't think I will be going anywhere else but here for pizza for a long time.

This pizza is good.  Fresh toppings and reasonably priced.  My kids like this place!  To me though the reason for the 4 star rating is the employees.  They are friendly and fun - really seem like they enjoy what they do.  A smiling face will keep us coming back for sure.

The best pizza in Parker hands down! There isn't another pizzeria that will deliver an XL, 3 topping pizza for $16. The cheap price means nothing though, if the quality of the food is also cheap. At Coloradough that isn't the case though, the pizza is top notch, great crust, a perfect amount of toppings & they use what other places would consider "extra cheese", plus they carry green olives, a huge plus in my book. Don't waste your time and money getting pizza from a chain restaurant, order from Coloradough, your taste buds and wallet will thank you.
Confused by the good reviews.  It's similar to a Papa John's pizza.  An average pizza, nothing more, with average ingredients.

Consistency is king for me, and after having Coloradough several more times now, I'm even more impressed. The Supremo is now my go-to pie, the toppings are so fresh and in the exact perfect ratio.

The second you open the box you know you are in for a treat.  This is how pizza should look!  I feel like John Travolta staring into the warm glow of the briefcase from Pulp Fiction. Mesmerizing!

It's never good when you call a business during normal hours of operation and get "You've reached so-and-so. This mailbox is full. Please try your call again later." Too bad...the reviews are great and the photos on their website mouth-watering.
Tried the new location on Smokey Hill! The Pizza was yummy! My favorite part is the crust! Try it, you will love it!

Those Coloradough Pizza boys make the best pizza I've ever had. I've moved around quite a lot being in the military. But no matter what pizza joint I go to, none compares to that hometown Coloradough Pizza. Good work boys.
This place is so yummy!!!! They deliver to me, which is the best part! I love local places, and this pizza is definitely some of the best I've had. The crust is fantastic, can't wait to order again!

Must try this place!


Seriously best pizza in town. About time colorado got some good pizza!
The guys there really take care of you and they have some awesome customer service skills.
I definitely look forward to eating there again.
Thanks guys!!!!

I have to say, I've only had this place once, but this is good pizza.  The garden of the gods pizza is fresh and awesome! I love the crispness of the veggies and the crust is really good too.  You owe it to yourself as a Coloradan to try this place, locally owned and awesome!

We finally experienced this place the other night, and I can't stop thinking of it's yumminess! The pizza was amazing, the guys that work there are super nice. Can't praise enough...simple setup, fresh ingredients, great pizza. Won't be returning to the chain pizzas with this in town!

These people make good pizza. The 5280 is delicious. 

I left a 1 star review at one point, because they were closed during dinner rush even though they were advertised open. They offered me a free pizza to compensate, so back to 5 stars.

We are always looking for great pizza. Pizza is probably the number one request for family night dinner. We found Coloradough Pizza online and we weren't disappointed. Staff was really friendly and the pizza was a hit with everyone! This will now be our local favorite.
Mmmmm!!! Delicious pizza!!! Excellent customer service too! Thank you!!! Can't wait to try more menu items. We had a half pepperoni, half jalapeño - on point!
The staff was very friendly.  The ingredients on the pizza were very fresh. Overall an awesome pizza and great experience!

To begin, I am not  a huge fan of pizza, however, I eat it relatively often because it is such a staple in social functions. Therefore, my high expectations mixed with abundant pizza tasting experience makes it tough for me to like very many pizza restaurants! Coloradough exceeded my high expectations and I am so happy to have come across this place! Not only is the price incredibly affordable, but the pizza is absolutely phenomenal. Delicious dough, not too much sauce, stringy cheese, and the perfect amount of toppings. And to top it all off (hehehe), they opened a location that is much closer to me than their Parker location, so I will be having much more of their delicious pie :)
By far the best pizza in town! We have ordered the 5280 with jalapeños hard to beat! Would recommend to anyone! Best pizza we have ever had.
Very good pizza, and coming from the east coast, I'm super picky about pizza. And yes, the crust was Delish!

The first time I ordered, I thought it was a fluke they had made the perfect pizza. The 2nd time I ordered I realized they had actually perfected the pizza. I've found the best kept food secret in Denver.
Love their pizza and the folks who work there.  Super friendly every time we've been in!

Wow. Boy am I happy this place opened up! So far the only decent places for pizza in Parker don't deliver. Not only does Coloradough Pizza have EXCELLENT pizza, they deliver, and the service is phenomenal.
My husband and I ordered a large pizza - half sausage and half Garden of the Gods. The pizza was fresh, extremely tasty, and only $12!
The brother (?) I ordered on the phone with was very nice and friendly, and the brother who delivered was very personable with my husband, telling him that if anything was wrong with the pizza we should call them and they would fix it. 

VERY impressed, and can't wait for our next pizza fix! :)
Amazing pizza! I would highly recommend one of their specialty pizza. Great guys running the place too.

This place is awesome!! Ordered 'The Parker' for delivery from the Parker location last night and it was delicious! Looking forward to trying their other pizzas very soon. Thanks for the outstanding pizza Coloradough!

Wow! Blown away by this little pizza joint!very friendly guys and the pizza is to die for! I would recommend calling ahead because it can get a little crowded waiting. Can't beat the price either. I'm happy to support this local business.

Excellent pizza, such nice guys who run the place, and fast service!  The only possible improvement could be a bigger location because it's not really an eat in kind of place - but if you're up for pick up or delivery, this is THE place.  Such great pie and it wasn't greasy at all like so many pizzas - the crust was perfect, the meat was yummy with generous portions, and the veggies tasted garden fresh. Just writing this review makes me crave it!

Just had my first pizza delivered from these guys: wow! Good quality ingredients, great sauce, and an excellent crust. I liked that the toppings extend almost to the edge of the pizza. Sweet chili wings were excellent!

Ordering was easy, and everyone I talked to was super nice. True customer service professionals.  I can safely say we have found our new pizza place. I can't wait to try one of their specialties sometime soon!

Delicious pizza made by the owners themselves!! My 7 year old son and I went there. He was of course asking a million questions and asking to go behind the counter. They were so nice and answered all of his questions and never once seemed annoyed. :) The pizza (dough and all) was made fresh in front of us. They seemed sincerely happy to be there making pizzas and interacting with us! Nice change from the typical aloof teens that work at other restaurants.

We will be back for sure!

Recently transplanted from Chicago, my husband and I were craving good pizza. We've made the rounds, even sinking so low as to start using Costco's deep dish pizza to get our fix. After searching Yelp, yet again, we decided to give this place a try. SO glad we did. 

The brothers are personable and entertaining. They made waiting for the pizza to cook an enjoyable experience (coming from someone who hates making small talk with people--big deal!). They even asked us what March Madness game we were interested in and turned the Huge monitor around for us to watch. The crust was light and chewy. The toppings (sausage and black olive, of course) were perfectly proportioned. They even added extra cheese so the sausage wouldn't dry out. 

Only thing we wish-- served beer and had a better place to sit and eat!

Okay, so it wasn't deep dish pizza, but it was by far the best thin pizza we've had since moving. Actually--unless you're giving me Rosatis, Coloradough is the best thin pizza I've ever had. 100% will be back!

We just tried Coloradough pizza today.  It was excellent.  We had the meat lovers and the spinach feta.  We have had most pizzas in Parker,  but this pizza was so delicious we will order this pizza from now on.  Also, the delivery guy, Noah, was very fast fast and a really polite young man. Thank you!

I have been vacationing in Parker for 12+ years.  In all that time I have yet to find a decent pizza place until now.  Large variety of specialty pizzas named after the local area.  We ordered The Parker, The Spinach, Feta, Chicken, the Supremo as well as traditional cheese and pepperoni.  All were delicious.  We also ordered one box of cheesy garlic bread (Yum!).  The service was excellent on the phone and in person (another first).  I think we drove past 2 pizza places to get there...so very worth it.

Wow,wow,wow! Hands down the best pizza in Parker. Amazing service, quality ingredients, and delicious sauce and crust. We'll be ordering from them 3-6 times a month. So,so, so glad we found Coloradough Pizza!

My family and I have been supporting this local business since they opened. Have had countless pizzas delivered and picked up more than I can remember and always had excellent results with great pizza... called tonight for a delivery with friends and family over and we were informed that they no longer deliver to the pinery. Hard to support a business that has forgot to take care of the people who have supported them since day one.... guess we will reluctantly have to again resort to the chain stores instead of supporting our local businesses.

Only pizza I've found that doesn't make me vomit after eating it. Excellent ingredients and the guys who own/make the pizzas are exceptionally friendly. This app wants me to keep talking but there isn't a lot you have to say about amazing pizza. When it's bad you give big reviews. Lol Great Pizza!

Best pizza in town?  Nooo.  No way.  I did think it was good, especially for how cheap it is.  It reminds me of BlackJack Pizza, and I like Blackjack.  Its good cheap pizza.  Tontis is much much better but its also much more expensive.

Pizza is excellent, and definitely preferred over the chain pizza places in the area.  I would have given 5 stars, but the last two times we have tried to call in and order a pizza, it goes to a voice mailbox that is full.  I'm willing to wait a little longer for delivery, knowing that they are a small brother-owned and operated business, but I haven't been able to get ahold of anyone to place an order.
Best pizza ever, I can believe I live right around the corner and never been there before. Ordered the 5280 with jalapenos, amazing!
These Guys are Rock Stars of Pizza! Best in town, and always on time! Try the 5280 it rocks!!! Just a couple brothers doing what they love! Support the small businesses

Located in an unsuspecting strip mall, this place serves up amazing pizza with no bells and whistles, in the best way possible. It's just about as basic as pizza can get, and oh so delicious. I don't know what's in the sauce, but I found myself wishing I had a dish of it to scoop with with the perfectly chewy crust.  The Mr and I each ordered a smaller size pie so we can enjoy leftovers tomorrow, but I'm not sure they'll survive the night. Oh, and the guys working were exceptionally friendly. We're already planning our next order.  (One warning, there are only 2 tables inside so you might have to eat at home.)

BEST PIZZA IN COLORADO. No joke. Mark and Ryan are so cutesy and seriously i'm obsessed with them and their pineapple pizza. Service is excellent and the pizza is so good i want another one right now brb gonna go order one!!!!!!!!! -Mackenzie

I tried this place because of the excellent reviews saying it was the best in town or anywhere.
