I am not on the same page, I like a sweet pizza sauce and this is spicy, burns my stomach and the toppings didn't have any extra special taste to me. I am a fan of Colannas because the sauce is sweeter and crust is thinner and crisper. This seems much more dense and loaded up.
Ate a chicken, bacon, ranch pizza from here and  jizzed...in....my....pants. That means its good.

Tasty pizza, good value, and the joy of supporting a local small-business. Excellent customer service (they'll work with your special requests -try that at the big names and see what happens!) - super-friendly. They're worth the wait if it's a night with longer delivery times (and in some cases they're worth going to pick up if they're so busy they can't deliver - which is rare, but can happen). I usually just get cheese or pepperoni pizza, and to me, the mark of a really great pizza is how the 'base-model' tastes, and theirs is fantastic!

Great pizza! Super fresh, east coast good! The owners are super nice and friendly. It is pretty much take out only. They were running behind on orders but apologized and took a few bucks off. Affordable too!

AMAZING! Finally some BBQ I really like. Had it at the Federal Center at the Thursday Farmer's Market. I have always been leary about trying new BBQ. But this was P E R F E C T!  

I had the pork sandwich - the meat was moist and flavored just right. The BBQ sauce was sweet and separate so you could add as much or as little as you wanted. The server was so nice and made me feel like family in just those 5 minutes I was getting my food. 

I live in Highlands Ranch, but will definitely be making a trip to Aurora soon to get a bucket to bring home!

One warning though, Bubby's is from Texas where they normally put coleslaw on the meat (I don't like that and they didn't have coleslaw this time) so you might ask if you don't like that style.

UPDATE: I actually called him after that when I wanted to get bbq while I was in Aurora. He said they don't have an actual restaurant, but do catering and deliveries. He offered to deliver it to me, but I met him at the DFC next time he was there and brought a few buckets home.

Just say no. Brussel sprouts overly salty fried beyond any flavor. Shrimp potstickers overcooked chewy shrimp . Edamame has some off seasoning overly steamed.. Sorry but not seeing any quality Troy missed this one. DIA Gee blows doors off of this!

You would never notice this place was a ruby Tuesday's once you step inside,it's beautifully decorated ,Fresh salmon , nice looking  for the take out order ,and they're very fast  on my order,love sushi for my lunch yami!

*** All sushi 50% of ALL DAY MON-THURS***

I'm  always very happy to come here the food is great service is the same, I love the ambiance and the overall feeling. The chefs do a wonderful job  with the sushi, the appearance and taste excel always. They are under new management and seems to be  working well, I would highly recommend  it for almost any occasion and for any crowd.

Food was okay  for the most part, not much rice in proportion to the main dish. Service was lacking & waitress seemed like we were a bother. Considering there were only a few tables occupied on a Friday night, could not believe the poor service! Will likely not be going back!
Second time coming here good little spot they have great deals for happy hours 50% off definitely a must try

Very nice clean place. Great atmosphere and customer service! Always kept my beverage full. Sushi is always fresh! Love the 50 percent off sushi. I would recommend this place to anyone. Great for date night!

You have to ask for chopsticks, and our food all came out at different times, but the service was great.

The sashimi was incredible- Big pieces that tasted divine! The rolls were amazing- Las Vegas roll was on special... never had a deep-fried roll before, but it blew my mind! Shrimp tempura roll was good. The rest of my party had pad Thai- that was really good, sesame chicken- got great reviews from my kids, and teriyaki chicken served on the sizzling skillet on a bed of onions- my daughter loved it but I thought it was a little on the plain side.

Cheese wontons were yummy- very crispy and lots of cheese.

They gave me mango ice cream for my birthday dessert,  and that alone made the trip worth it!!

Monday night special was one dollar beer and one dollar warm sake!! (Good beers like tsing Tao and Heineken!)

The atmosphere was fun and modern, and they had lots of cozy spots for privacy. 

So glad to have a new (to me) sushi place that is open on Monday in the neighborhood!

I may be spoiled after living on the coast the last 10 years but this place was horrible! The tuna tasted like it was from a can, they used crab stick instead of real crab meat and the mango roll tasted like there was alcohol in it :-( out of the 30ish rolls most had tempura or cream cheese or a combo of both, not much of a selection for people who don't eat gluten or dairy. The place was a ghost town on a Saturday but they managed not to mess up the seaweed salad and my water glass was always full :-/

Decent sushi, A bit expensive for what I received.

It was Delivery, I have no comment on the facility itself

A really bad experience tonight. Seated but no menus, so we got our own. Had to hunt someone down to ask for drinks. Twice. Ordered drinks and food all at once since we had sat for over 15 minutes w/o anyone talking to us. 15 minutes later we got our drinks. Then had to wait another 10 minutes for soups. Entrees came out after an hour. 3 of 4 entrees were correct, 1 was way off. One was low quality to the point of not being eaten. 

On top of that there was no heat in the restaurant. The guy at the front desk was wearing his coat. We were freezing our butts off. It wasn't busy, unless it was all takeout orders. One other table on our side, and maybe 3 or 4 booths on the other side.

Between all the issues, they comped nothing. 

I really liked this place 2 years ago, but something has changed for the worst. I think the name has changed slightly recently, so maybe it's under new management. I miss the old management. I won't go back until something drastic changes.

Be forewarned!

Decided I wanted to try some other location rather than my usual place for Asian food. Not too pleased with the overall taste of the food. The wonton soup tasted watered down and the fried rice wasn't very fluffy and flavorful like the other location I go to. Even the shrimp with lobster sauce only had the jumbo shrimp in it and the sauce really didn't have much flavor to it. But their sesame chicken tasted great and the gentle man was really nice when delivering it, but that was it. Never really gonna order from here again, just gonna drive the extra 4 miles to my regular asian cuisine in the next town over.

Great food and good, friendly service.  I had driven by this place a few times when they were moving in equipment waiting for them to open.  Well they finally did.
They have a good selection of various Chinese dishes, i.e sweet and sour chicken, beef and broccoli, etc.  They also have lots of sushi entrees  as well as some hibachi entrees.  The sushi was very good.  I got the Jacky roll and my friends got the volcano roll.  It was a lot of sushi and nicely presented.  The day before I ordered the jumbo shrimp, scallop and squid and that was good also.  The prices are somewhat higher than other Chinese restaurants in the area but I think the food is pretty good here.  So yes, I recommend this place.

Great Place! I can't attest to the sushi (pregnant) but everything else here is spot on. Being Asian it's hard to find DELISH Asian cuisine that's close to home and not too westernized. Also, great decor and atmosphere. I haven't tried their Happy Hours but they seem to have good specials

I took my 2 little boys here last night for our Mommie/son date night. The place was fairly busy for 7pm on a Saturday night but not full by any means.  

We were seated and given menus and the waiter came and got our drink orders fairly quickly. It was all good up until my food was delivered. I then realized I didn't have any utensils or chop sticks. It took me 5 minutes to get someone's attention. Then they disappeared again. Not to be seen until he was about to dump the check off. I told him he were interested in dessert and he pointed to a card on the table that showed 3 desserts. None of them were the ones I had seen pictured on Yelp. So I asked about the fried banana as that's what my kids would eat and he said he would check on it. Up to the point that our food came, and we had one waiter, our drinks were re-filled, and all was good. After that we had another waiter and the service was not good. 

Overall my sushi was great and the kids chicken nuggets and fries were hot and they liked them.

Lovely restaurant, friendly people.  From there it went downhill.  Sat for at least 10 minutes before our order was taken.  First person who came to our table told us they didn't serve liquor.  Since I had walked in past a bar with liquor behind it I asked another person.  They said that they could serve liquor but didn't have a bartender (on a Friday night).  Not a big deal, but the food was not very good.  It was hot, but greasy and odd tasting.  We ordered miso soup, sweet and sour soup, vegetable tempura, kung pao chicken and another chicken/shrimp dish.  Most of the food remained on the plates. Too bad - we could really use a good restaurant in the neighborhood.  We won't be back.
HORRIBLE HORRIBLE food poisoning from here...brought it to their attention only to be ignored.

The hunt for decent Chinese continues as this place is not it! I always look for two things in good Chinese, good egg rolls and good fried rice. If you can't handle these I hold no hope for the rest of the meal. Spring rolls were soggy and fried rice had no taste.  Also ordered soup, entrees, lo men....none of it was good. Had tons of leftovers that ended up in the trash.

Just moved to CO from San Diego Ca and I'm a big fan of sushi and anyone who has been to Southern California knows it everywhere.

This is the best sushi I have had since moving to CO and the staff is great, very friendly and they know how to make a roll. 

Crazy Gril roll is probably one of the best rolls iv ever had. You have a loyal customer here!

Terrible experience!  Extremely long wait to get our food. Sushi pieces are very small portions. My husband and I both had hibachi and the scallops were undercooked, they forgot the soup and salad course all together and just delivered it to the table after the main course after we reminded them it was missed and we both were sick when we got home.   Service was extremely slow and the restaurant wasn't full at all.  I had to ask for chopsticks and my husband had to ask for a knife. To top it off, at the end of the meal they brought out 2 fortune cookies for the 3 of us.  No attention to detail at all.  Waste of money.

I have less check ins here that actual business, because we order delivery from Sunrise a lot. Even though we are on the outer edge of their delivery zone, the food always comes hot and FAST!

All of the Chinese offerings I have tried are excellent. I had a waiter notice I didn't eat the green peppers on my Kung Pao plate one evening, and he told me they could leave them off. Not only did they omit them on my next order, but they made up for it by providing more of the other veggies. I was very impressed with that! Their lemon chicken is great-prefect proportion of chicken and crispy breading (not the soggy, doughy stuff you find all too often). I love thie Egg Drop Soup. 

My husband enjoys their sushi (at much better prices than nearby places) and has tried a variety of their selections. The real impressive thing is the artful presentation of thier sushi dishes - the plates are adorned with hand drawn birds,  tiny bonsai-esque trees, or impressive layouts. The dishes are never boring, and is something I have not seen done at all in the metro area.
We love this place. We have been here for lunch and dinner several times. The food and service are always outstanding.
Visiting my daughter and grandkids and decided to have take away while babysitting. The food was very good with good size portions. Would recommend this restaurant as a go to place for Chinese food.

We have had both in-restaurant meals and deliveries. We are amazed at the number of available options; the quality is consistently top notch. In restaurant service is very good and they have a full bar. It's also family friendly!
Yum! Lunch, dinner, drinks...all are good! A little expensive and the delivery is slow but the food is good! Hard to find good Asian this part of town...it is our go to place.

Came here for a late dinner at the sushi bar.  There were two sushi chefs and they seemed moderately busy at 8 p.m.  When I arrived, there were several groups seated in the dining area, but I was the only person sitting at the sushi bar.

The waitress immediately brought me a menu and took my drink order (water and green tea).  

I decided upon three sushi rolls:  Philly, tempura shrimp and just a plain tuna roll.

The Philly roll was "average to good".  Good portion of salmon and it tasted good.

The tuna roll was excellent for a basic roll.  The portion of tuna was larger than average and good quality.  A really good value.

Finally, the shrimp tempura roll.  The shrimp was cooked nicely.  Interestingly, the roll had lots of shredded lettuce in it.  It made for interesting and decent texture, but was honestly too much lettuce, making the roll very big in diameter.  Seems like many sushi places are making fancy "mega rolls" lately.  Tip for sushi restaurants.  If I can't fit a sushi roll in my mouth, it is too big!  I don't want to be eating sushi rolls with a knife and fork.  Just my personal preference.  I would not order this roll again.

The presentation was very nice and the rolls were served with ample wasabi and ginger.

I will definitely return.

I couldn't wait to review this place. Most people don't know about this wonderful restaurant. The inside is beautiful, it is lit with blue lights and aquariums. I love great ambience like this. Our sushi came out on a beautiful boat, made with wood and brought to our table. We got to meet the owner, and he is one of the nicest, most experienced owners I've ever met. The service was above and beyond excellent, and the food was just to die for. The staff was very friendly and helpful to any questions we had. I absolutely recommend that you go here if it's not too much of a drive!

Really good sushi!

We have visited Sunrise on a number of occasions and have always had good sushi and ok food. The service is inconsistent though.  It can range from having to walk up to the waiter and wait for him to stop flirting with the hostess to get silverware to so attentive that it bordered on stalking.

The main menu is very large and we've tried a number of selections and the best I can say is, yes it's asian food.  There is nothing wrong with it and the portions are generous, but it is also nothing really remarkable.

The Sushi is very good.  They have a traditional menu that is augmented with selections to tempt every palate.  Commonly they experiment with special rolls that bring in exotic flavors.

Let's boil it down to this, I'm forking over a 4 star rating even with spotty service and average non-sushi selections.  If you like to have sushi for a meal, you have to go.  If you're not a sushi fan, this place is probably a pass.

Good, not great sushi place out in the suburbs.  It's not Sushi Den or Sushi Sasa, but it's not priced like either one of those places, either.

Sushi is consistently high quality and a good value for what you pay.  The dishes like Kung Pao Chicken are tasty and portions are large.  This is our new Friday night takeout spot.

I ordered delivery here three times and every time it took well over an hour to get to my house which was 2 miles away. The food is very tasty. I really enjoy the Mongolian beef and vegetable lo mein. It was taking so long for my dinner to our arrival so I called the restaurant. My order was missed placed and they cleaned I did not place it. I had to show them my bank statement online to prove that I made the purchase. I asked for a refund and they said it would take a few days to show on my online bank statement. Two weeks later I still had not received the refund and called. They kept saying that they made the refund and it was the fault of my bank. They never gave me a refund and I will never be back.

Big fan of their tempura and sushi.  Easy to go overboard and order too much as they do provide very fair fare...ie good-sized portions.
Love supporting small family-owned businesses!

My daughter and I came here for dinner.  We had tried it before and ordered something new - we didn't like what we ordered, but thought sushi would be a good idea.  The decor is beautiful and the wait staff is very polite and fast.  We ordered several rolls.  

We received our sushi quickly and it arrived on a cool wooden boat, but it appears they only give you 4 or maybe 5 pieces of their specialty rolls, which is a shame because they are pricy.  I commented to my daughter that the sushi smelled fishy.  She said she didn't smell anything so we ate them.  The rolls were not that good - just ok; we have had much better.  They were not wrapped tightly so when you picked them up, they fell apart.  We ended up using our forks which takes away from the experience of eating sushi.  Our spider roll had a huge piece of lettuce sticking out of it and if you removed it, the whole thing just fell apart.  There was not a lot of rice around the outside - like they were short on rice or something.

We didn't complain and left our normal 20% tip- the food was not the fault of our waiter and he did a good job.  Before we left, we were given a coupon for $5 off our next visit.  Later that night, we were both very sick to our stomach.  I don't know if the fish was bad or not, but we were both effected and ate the same thing.  I didn't call the restaurant, but we won't be back.

Awesome Service, delivery and food.  Thanks Jay, on Sat. 8/3/13, I hosted a Dragon Party Birthday for my good friend. We love sushi and the Asian experience.  I took a chance on this new restaurant in the neighborhood because they delivered.  Yet to my surprise I found a diamond among gems.  The selection of sushi trays, specialty rolls and sesame chicken was wonderful.  My guest were in "Ahh..." It was fresh, delicious and timely for the luncheon.  I have to say thanks to Jay, who was customer friendly, listened to what I wanted and delivered more than I expected.  

So Neighbors if think you need to drive to Denver or the Highlands for a great dining experience - you don't, this place has a beautiful modern flare with a great bar and inviting atmosphere.  I highly recommend!!!

Memories...I think it is a combination of Purple Martini lounge, Sushi Den, Jing and the old Blue Ice.... Would be a great happy hour spot, I may be leaving Hapas if they can match the 2:30-5:30 happy hour special offered.  It's Epic...... in the suburbs..
Great atmosphere, delicious sushi!  So nice to have a good sushi option finally in our area!  Try the mango roll.  My husband was also excited to see duck on the menu.

I am so glad there's a great sushi place nearby...and it's affordable! Sunrise has a great selection of fresh sushi, but also a wide variety of main dishes for those who don't like sushi. Last month, I took my sister in law here for lunch. For less than $10 each, I got a great lunch complete with 2 rolls, salad & soup! My sister got the "lunch box" which was a be credible value- shrimp & veggie tempura, wantons, soup & salad. Overall, a great restaurant at great value.

We just ordered delivery for dinner from here tonight and everything was awful. We had four sushi rolls and not one of them was good at all. Also had hot and sour soup and it was so bland and had no taste. Won tons were so hard that we could barely even break them apart to eat them. We didn't finish one thing we had. Awful food. We will not be back. Oh and this cost us 60 dollars for atrocious food.
Awesome sushi, very fresh!  Best sushi we've had in Colorado.  The sushi chefs are pretty cool too!  Sit at The sushi bar!
Loved it! Sesame chicken was fantastic, sushi was much better than expected, I ate more than I should have! Great atmosphere, but best Asian food this side of town!

We ordered carry-out on a busy Friday evening.  The food was hot, fresh, and ready very fast.  Definitely the best Chinese we have found in quite awhile.  Very large portions and they provided everything we needed as far as condiments.  The staff was very friendly as well.  This is definitely going to be our new go-to spot for Chinese!
Food was good while eating... had to rush home afterwards though from sickness.  I've heard others describe the same experience.

This place has one of the worst service I have ever seen in a resturant in a long time. The food took ages to come, and our server started giving me an attitude when I was ordering. This is truly sad because the place looks good and the food is not bad at all, but the service ruins everything.
Only come here during lunch. Great lunch specials that give a lot of food. Sushi rolls are really good as well!
Maybe it was just a bad night, but food on our visit was mediocre and customer service was terrible. I could fine many more sushi restaurants that I'd be happy to pay twice the price.
This is a great option for Chinese. We usually get the sesame chicken or sweet and sour combo. The food is good and we will definitely continue to come here.
Good food but completely miscalculated the prep time.  Waited 45 minutes for a delivery order.

I ordered the schezwan beef and it was very wet. I don't know what they were trying to cover up with that much sauce. Plus the smell was unappetizing. The waitress and chef came out defensively about the dish. I will not be coming back.

Horrible service!! This is the 2nd time we have had to cancel our order and walk out.  Really tried to give these people the benefit of the doubt but they disappointed again. We waited for take-out tonight for an hour and finally got our money back and left.  Get your act together or get out of business. What a total disappointment.

Only recently began ordering from here and I have yet to be disappointed. The online ordering is fantastic and although the drivers got lost twice coming to my home they were quick to call me. Stupid GPS. I've never been a big fan of orange chicken but it is definitely the best I've ever had. The sushi is decent but I haven't eaten inside yet. The hot and sour soup is also top notch. I very much recommend this joint.

This place is still good, but I've noticed some inconsistencies in the food. The sunomono was different this time and not quite as good. Sushi was good too, but not as fresh and well put together as my previous visit. Worth a try, but not sure it'll be the same next visit.

We were the first family seated for dinner. The hostess sat us in the bar in the full sun and near the TV even though the entire restaurant was empty. Our waitress was the bartender and she knew nothing about the menu. My wife tried the sesame chicken and said it was the worst she ever has eaten. The sauce tasted like ketchup. I tried the duck and it was cooked well but the actual pieces were very bony and seemed like the worst part of the duck. We were excited to have a new Asian restaurant in the neighborhood but will not be returning.  A person who appeared to be the manager walked around during our meal but never asked about the food or service.

Ohhh...this is one of those places that I really want to give a better review but just can't.  After three visits all of which have offered bad service, I just can't recommend this place to anyone. 

On the plus side, this is an Asian restaurant with surprisingly nice ambience for a strip mall.  Great detailing like stone walls, ambient lighting and a granite topped bar in the center of the room.  Also a major pro is the food quality.  Yes, you get a lot for your money and some of the dishes are the best I've had locally.  I am sure you are wondering why I gave this 2 stars then.

The service is just terrible.  I have eaten here 3 times for lunch and all three times service has been painfully slow.  Despite the fact that only a handful of tables are seated, I have had to wait upwards of 15 minutes to be greeted at my table, another 10-15 minutes for a drink and over an hour for food (each time).  Additionally, I have had to flag waiters/waitresses to the table to have my order taken and pay the bill as they are usually watching television on the plasma TV's with their backs turned to the customers.  This has happened each of the three times I was there and with three different members of wait staff, so clearly this is more of the norm than the exception during lunch.

The last time I went, I finally had to flag down the waiter 40 minutes after we ordered the food (I kid you not) because nothing had been delivered to the table and he never once came back to check on us or our two children.  He apparently had forgotten to submit our order even though there was only one other table with people in the restaurant.  At that point, we had run out of time so I asked him to submit the order and pack it up as a to-go meal, which he did do, but there was no apology, no attempt to make it right like maybe a coupon for a future visit or a free kids meal for the inconvenience.  So, 1 hour and 15 minutes with nothing but drinks served and a $61 bill for to-go lunch for 2 adults and 2 kids?  Ugggh.  3 strikes and you're out.
Great food, great customer service, fast delivery, the shumai is the best! They really cater to special requests.
Great lunch experience service and food were high quality! Value for the lunch menu is off the chart. Please give it a try our neighborhoods need great restaurants like this one!

This restaurant is not in my neighborhood but after I received three separate recommendations from friends, my husband and I decided to go here last night. What a great experience!! Fabulous atmosphere, delicious food, good prices and fast friendly service. We cannot wait to return and share this treasure with more friends.

I have been there a half a dozen times. I have always been very happy with the quality of the food the portions of the service and the price. I brought my family and friends there as well I would recommend this to anyone.
Excellent food, phenomenal service!!  It was pouring down rain and they walked us to our cars with huge umbrellas.  We love this place!!

WOW!  A SOLID 4 stars.

I came here on a cold snowy night.  Well, actually, it wasn't snowy, but there was a chill in air - Saturday after Thanksgiving.  Small Business Saturday.  Thanks to AMEX, I gave this place a try - TO GO order.

ORDER:
Beef Chow Fun - **** (pretty good)
Spicy Tuna Roll - ****
Eel Avacado Roll - ****
- sushi was really good for the price.  very fresh IMO.

Price:  ****
Atmosphere:  **** (not what I was expecting!)

Overall, I'd try this place again to give it a more substantial review.  From my first experience, all system are go.  Definitely a surprise for me.  

Wait for my update!

We wandered in Sunrise because it is new, Asian and in the neighborhood.  My measure of a good restaurant IS THE SUSHI - the sushi at Sunrise is fresh, good quality, there is a large variety of interesting rolls on the menu and it didnt look or smell fishy in anyway.  I am also a fan of the miso soup, the beer was good and the bill was reasonable for the amount of food we ate.  I never give anywhere a 5 unless I have been there more than once, but we can start with a 4 and go from there.  But, I heartily recommend this place especially for the neighborhood.
Best sushi on this side of town! Great traditional chicken and cashew.
Came here for the 1st time 2 weeks ago, we've been back 3 times since! New favorite place.

I have gone 4 times now, and twice have woken up in the middle of the night ill.  I would love to recommend it, but now, I would have to warn to be careful what you order.  I had a sushi roll with shrimp, crab and avocado, edamame and the seaweed salad.

We have been in twice, once with our kids and sat in the dining room. The service was outstanding and the food was delicious. They not only paid attention to my husband and I but also to the kids! The second time in, we sat at the sushi bar and received the most amazing service from the entire staff. Again, the food was amazing. We will be returning time and time again! Sunrise is our new favorite place to go for sushi!

I had sushi last week and ordered delivery this evening.  When I had sushi in the restaurant I went for lunch and the place was deserted.  Our server was nice and we had a mango something roll and some kind of hot roll which was deep fried.  Both were very good!!!  My neighbor recommended this place to me so I was looking forward to going.

Tonight I ordered the schezuan beef (not too spicy, but way too many veggies), general tsao chicken and shrimp lo mein (shrimp deveined.....yesssssss!!!!)  for delivery.  The young lady who took my order was very nice and knowledgeable about the menu.  Although it took about 45 minutes from placing the order to receiving it, I will NOT complain because it's twenty something degrees outside, I did not have to get my family out in this weather AND the food was great and delivered hot!  My order was perfect and they even remembered the child chopstick helpers for my daughter. Spent $35, well worth it!  Will definitely be eating here again.  Been here for 2.5 yrs and this is the first place I felt comfortable ordering Chinese from!

I love supporting local business - especially when they're as wonderful as this place!  We went for lunch on Sunday and it exceeded our expectations to say the least!  From being greeting the door to our ice tea never being less than half full - this place knows how to take care of you!  The food is amazing - they offer a great selection of sushi, traditional dishes and combos.  The lunch combo included: soup, salad, crab wonton, egg roll, 4 piece California roll, rice of your choice and the entrée...so much food - all all for only $8!!!  It was all fresh and delicious!  We plan on returning very soon!!!

Give this place a shot - you will not regret it!!!

This place started off excellent, but now they have changed.  For delivery the food is sometimes cold and takes a long time to arrive.  The guy who takes the order on the phone is rude, complete opposite of when they first opened.  The order is not what you ordered sometimes.  Seems like the management has changed, kind of disappointed now.  Probably going back to ordering from East Dynasty.
Sushi rice was hard like it was refrigerated.  Biggest no-no when making sushi.  Threw most of the meal in the trash.  There are better places that are not too far away.

What a disappointment- this was my second trip here, and the second time I've had an issue- first trip was understandable as it was their opening weekend... That time we waited for almost an hour midday and ended up speaking to manager.  This time we r told that they don't serve something (the lunch box) that vision their menu despite it not being labeled as not available..  "All we have for kids is chicken nuggets..."poor service, lack of caring by waitress, inexcusable lack of professionalism... Second chance will be most likely last chance as currently have no desire to go sub par when great places like Bangkok Tokyo are so near and clearly better choices

Pulled in the lot to pick up take out and there was an employee cleaning out a nostril, smoking and spitting into the flower bed.  I hurried in to get my order so he wouldn't wait on me. hope he didn't cook our food. The place was empty. I had to ask again for my 15% off.  The food was mediocre. I got the Hawaii 50 and it was suppose to have beef and no mention of pork. It had pork and no beef.  We will not go back. Should have just drove away with my first impression.

If tacos are your thing this is a must! Everything made from scratch. The sauces are full of flavor. The owner is a great guy, embracing the people and area.

tacos de lengua, tasty!
tacos de camaron, exactly as they should be!

Had to grab one to go just in case 11pm comes around and I need a fix.

Area is a bit sketchy, but great people! Will be back next time I am in town!

I had to try the tacos with the white beans in them.  It seemed interesting, and slightly wrong, so I was in.  When I first walked in, it seemed like a bit of a dive bar turned restaurant, and it sounded like the bar upstairs was lively.  

 I tried the asada and the diablo shrimp (the big ones).  I did have to wait, because the diablo shrimp was made fresh right in front of me.  The beans did not seem to add anything but bulk to the tacos.   Having said that, the tacos were still very good.  I got them to go, so I didn't get to enjoy the restaurant dining room.  Next time I will stick around, as the happy hour prices looked pretty good for the area.  If you go, look for the parking lot in the back, as parking here gets scarce.

I work at the Capitol, so I was super excited to find out that there was a great place to get quick burritos nearby. The first time I came here it was fantastic. I ordered the "surprise" burrito because I was feeling adventurous and did not regret the decision. The burrito was much better than Chipotle, Qdoba, and Illegal Pete's. I highly recommend the raspberry salsa. Delicious! So, since I had such a great time I raved about this place and brought my girlfriend a few weeks later on October 22. First, the girl working there wasn't friendly. I told her we wanted the happy hour menu, and she told us that happy hour was upstairs. We went upstairs, and no one was working at the bar. We waited a long time, and still no one came. We went to tell the girl that no one was upstairs and ask if someone could come up to take out orders. When I told her that the bartender wasn't up there, she just said, "Well, he should be," and left it at that. She wasn't going to do or say anything further on the topic. When I reiterated that he wasn't, she begrudgingly took us upstairs. When the bartender came, he told us that happy hour wasn't going on that night. Still not sure why the girl downstairs couldn't have told us that when we first walked in and why she told us that happy hour was upstairs. She should probably be informed of when happy hour is. 

We both ordered margaritas and burritos. The margaritas were too sweet and not very strong, but they were decent for the price. The burritos were very disappointing, though, after how good they were the first time. Both burritos were totally lukewarm when they came out and not very flavorful. Overall, super disappointed that this place isn't consistently great. The only positive is that the upstairs seating is open-air and has a cool view of Colfax and the bartender is very friendly.

I was in the area and decided to try this joint based on reviews. The menu is simple so I ordered a 3 stack (of veggie tacos), and chips/guac. The food does take awhile because everything is not cooked until you order it, as I did witness this. 

The veggie tacos come with onion, mushroom, green pepper, pico, cheese, and a sauce. They did taste fresh, portion is pretty generous - I basically made 6 tacos since each one comes with 2 tortillas.

The chips are fine, but the guacamole was not cute. It didn't have flavor and was basically just smashed avocado. 

The motto on the sign here is "if you don't like it, you don't pay for it", but when I was asked how everything was, I brought up that I didn't like the guacamole, but was not offered anything and just told that "it was freshly made". Just because it's fresh doesn't mean it's good tbh. I think that sign should be taken down. If I was offered a cup of queso (which I should have ordered instead), all would be good in the hood.

Great for happy hour, has a fun Colfax vibe.

I recommend going upstairs and either sitting at the bar or perching with a window view. The happy hour carnitas tacos are delish & the drinks are reasonably priced. A lot of fun people watching in my experience as well. 

They have a quicker to go line dealio on the ground level with some patio seating too. 

I like the local art they display and the music is fun typically. A decent joint for this spot of town for sure!

Like many places in Denver, the concept, layout and the products are damn near spot on. 

I wanted to just have a couple margaritas and maybe a snack and upon getting up stairs to the bar I walk into something much more. 

The mark down is because I got a non-frozen margarita and it wasn't that great tasting. I will drink a non-frozen margaritas buy I don't care for them. Ordered a basket of chips with guacamole. Chips were okay but the cup of guac was was tiny and not enough for the whole basket. 

Now onto what I did like, the infused tequila shots, the FREE dance lesson, the atmosphere and the delicious tacos. I ordered a strawberry and spicey pickle infused tequila shot and both matched what they were infused with. The strawberry one was sweet and bearable while the spicey pickle was hot and sour going down the hatch. 

So apparently on Wednesday they do free dance lessons that last about an hour. The instructor really gets the participants involved by going through the steps a few times before moving on to the advanced moves and then partnered dancing. This made for for an amazing atmosphere abd a chance to build a friendship in the bar.  

After working up an appetite I went down stairs and had a few of their steak and chicken tacos. To my surprise even with the white beans they were bursting with flavor and hit the spot. 

I don't if your experience will be the same as mine but if you go on a Wednesday night be ready to have a memorable night.

Happy hour is 3-7 M-F. The food is good and priced appropriately for the area, regular taco for 2.69 or big taco for 3.95. The meat is marinated and cooked to order, so no stale or dry tacos. The hot sauces are amazing. Even if you like really spicy, you've got to try the mild tomatillo, just for the flavor.

Really really really good. Tasty flavor combos and tacos that have substantial fillings. I ordered the 3 taco combo and could barely finish the last one (but I did because...yum). I never had white beans in a taco before, but these were simmered with spices and so flavorful - not just the typical Goya beans heated up. I'd highly recommend the shrimp and pescado tacos. Good beer selection and lovely counter people as well.

BFT's per the menu. Big tacos with a twist. A layer of beans on the tortilla. Diablo shrimp, asada, carnitas, and fish are all tasty! Seriously... These tacos are huge and filling. 2 is almost more than a meal, yum!

Good daily specials for food and drinks. And... They have breakfast burritos on the cheap!

Chicken taco is amazing !

So flavorful. 

The rice and beans were fantastic. I can't say I've ever had white beans served  with a taco but I'm sure glad it happened.  

The owners Lisa and her husband Micah make you feel at home. 
Music and atmosphere are a plus. 

WhatchA waiting for ?

Btw , free and large parking right behind restaurant by the Natural Grocers

Hanan G

He Said:

We got shut out of a nearby (closed) Mexican spot and I was craving it bad.  We did a quick search and found Los Tacos.  We were disappointed that we were settling on a place that wasn't a full Mexican restaurant, but it wasn't a surprise so we got over it.  We were pointed upstairs for happy hour and there is no doubt the tacos are worth the special price.  They are a tad watery for me, leaving a bit of a breakdown in the middle part of the tortilla unless drained, but the carnitas meat was very flavorful and the rest of the bits compliment it all very well.  Every street taco is different and Los Tacos makes some good ones.  The hand-made margarita is definitely better than the pre-made, without question.  The beer selection is sparse, but some standard locals are on tap.  The open-style upstairs is great.

She Said:

He is always on the hunt for the perfect Mexican food, and I thought we had found it for him with the place up the street. Sadly, it was closed. Happily, Los Tacos was nearby to appease my man. The bartender (name forgotten--I need to take better notes) was fantastic. Friendly. Hard working. Efficient. And he treated us out-of-towners as if we were likely to become regulars, while he treated the regulars like family. The carnitas were quite good. I could have eaten the meat on its own and been content. The beer selection (as noted) is not fantastic, but you won't have trouble finding something you like. Definitely plan to sit upstairs.

Potty points: No need to visit the potty here!

The shrimp burrito grilled was one of the best things I've eaten in Denver. We are on vacation, stopped in for a quick bite and it was the best burrito I've ever had. Buttery, cheesy, spicy. 

My boyfriend had the steak BFT - really enjoyed himself. We will be coming back for happy hour - looks cheap and delicious. Atmosphere is fun and laid back.

Well before I get started on this, I did have lower expectations overall due to my visit being on Cinco de Mayo, for the record. The experience here was just that horrendous from start to finish. 

First, there was a long ass line. Yes, but wait. There is only one cash register and one person tending to it. You can only order your food and a beer there if that's what you want. A margarita? You must go upstairs. Fine. So I go upstairs and it's damn near IMPOSSIBLE to get much of anything, not even a "hey, I acknowledge your existence." There are not enough people working to serve everybody. The blonde was taking her sweet time chatting with people and not doing much of anything except pretending to check an entire stack of IDs. So yeah, pretty lame to have to wait in 2 different areas to get food and drink. 

And the tacos? Not even nearly worth the word "good." The meat was mushy and gross. They threw on Mexican cheese blend on every one. The only good thing I have to say is that the tortilla was kind of good but nothing outstanding. 

Overall the service was terrible here. And all they could do is make the excuse of "oh yeah, it's just a crazy night" after I complained about standing and waiting at the bar for half a goddamn hour. That's not a great excuse, jerks. Bad service is bad service, end of story. Don't make excuses for it. Or maybe hire some people who are quicker and have more common sense. 

I'm sure the experience is fine here during off hours, but the tacos themselves were pretty lousy. Oh yeah, had a taste of the guac too and it tasted powdery like it wasn't really made out of avocados. 

I don't do this 1 star thing too often but I really felt this experience deserved it.

The restaurant is downstairs and the bar is upstairs. They do have a free parking lot directly behind the restaurant which is great! Technically I think cocktails are only aloud in the bar area, but don't take my word on that. 

That said, the bar area is loud. Really loud. It's like a night club with tacos. They do have some fantastic tequila infusions to try and their bartenders are always great. They make one mean margarita and can even do some interesting twists - just ask. My spicy food loving friend says their food is great and reasonably priced. You'll have to take her word for it as I can't do anything spicy at all. I just like Margaritas.

There is no shortage of taco places popping up in Denver. Unfortunately, many of them aren't that great, and some are incredibly overhyped (sorry Torchy's). I'm happy to say that Los Tacos Famous Taqueria is a different story. They have a relatively simple menu, but there's something for everyone and the prices are very reasonable. You have an option of two taco sizes - the Jr. and regular. I found that two regular-sized tacos and one Jr. taco are more than enough food, even if you're starving. In fact, next time I'll probably go for two Jr. and one regular taco instead.

All of their tacos come in a double corn tortilla (I think they're grilled, which adds to the flavor and also makes them less dry) and are jam-packed with delicious ingredients. On my first visit, I tried the Veggie, Pescado and Diablo Shrimp tacos, and all of them were absolutely fantastic. In particular, I was surprised by the Veggie taco, as I didn't expect it to have as much flavor as it did. It was filled with caramelized onions, green peppers, mushrooms, pico de gallo, white beans and shredded cheese. Yummy! Both the Pescado (fish) and Diablo Shrimp were excellent, as well. Diablo Shrimp had some kick to it, but wasn't overbearingly spicy, which is totally fine with me. The person who took our order (I assume it was the owner) was also very friendly and helpful. I'm definitely looking forward to coming back, especially to check out their happy hour and the patio/bar upstairs.

I wanted to like it more.

My hubs and I went on a weekend for a quick lunch.  We wanted to try something new and both of us had passed this "new" taco spot.  Let's just say that we are suckers for tacos.  And, as such, have pretty high expectations.

We each ordered three.  I went with the pork, chicken, and shrimp.  I don't recall what my hubs ordered.  We were the only people on the ground level (perhaps there were more upstairs?), and we were helped by one employee.  He took our order/payment, cooked up the food himself, and delivered it to us at our seats.  He was friendly, and the food arrived as ordered and fairly quickly, considering it was a one-man job.

Bottom line: these tacos just don't compare to others in the area.  They were decent.  I felt like the meat was a little overcooked.  And the pork and chicken was just too dry.  Even drenching it in salsa/sauces didn't help.  The tortillas fell apart for both of us, which made eating quite messy.  There was also an advertisement for free chips and salsa at our table.  We brought it up, and the employee informed us it was out of date, but he brought some over to us anyway.  Appreciate the gesture--but maybe your advertising should be more clear.

Another man stopped by as we were cleaning up our table.  Perhaps he was a manager or owner?  He was nice and said thanks for stopping in.  We made small talk for a little bit and he mentioned they had been there for a while now.  They do have some breakfast burrito specials on the weekend and on Tuesdays for Taco Tuesday.  While I love the sound of both of those, I'm just not convinced we'll be back.
This restaurant is a travesty.  The food was cold and the service was shoddy, at best.

I'm one who loves food and everything about it and when I heard that los tacos had a big fn taco I  just had to check it out. 


At first sight of the restaurant I fell in love the open arrangement out looking capital hill and vibrancy of the neighborhood is a great feeling  as I entered I was greeted with a smile and a enthusiastic staff member service was awesome but when I ate my bfnb (big f**k n burrito ) I was unsatisfied the burrito was not big at all and very under seasoned and the horchata (Mexican rice drink) tasted like it came out of a instant package mix and the ice scooped out of a ice cooler with no gloves covering the associate's hands. Needless to say I absolutely did not enjoy the food at all it really killed the whole experience for me I would not recommend dining here.

I go on Sundays when some of my friends DJ the rooftop. The music and vibe is super fun and I like that they have music and beer pong. Overall the food is pretty mediocre. I'm not sure how you mess up a chicken quesadilla but it wasn't very good at all. The breakfast burrito was only a little bit better.

Just happened to walk by this place and saw that it was open. Ordered a beef burrito and it was pretty fantastic. They cook everything fresh and grill the burritos so they're nice and crispy. It's not another chipotle rip off. It's a chain from Vegas. It's a small little space but nice atmosphere and the service was super friendly.

This seems like a great place to watch the drunkies on Colfax roam but we haven't had a really poor restaurant experience for a long time until we went here. Margaritas were all mix and very little alch. Too tart. Bloody Mary's were good but we could only have one round because they ran out and didn't want to make more. They ran out of chips. Blonde lady from the kitchen who was food running was extremely rude and didn't know what she was doing. Our server was nice but at a loss. Our orders were messed up and took about ten minutes to come out between all of us (there were seven of us and we ordered Jr. tacos.) There was a piece of a metal can in one of our tacos but the server was apologetic and honestly it wouldn't have mattered except everything else was really bad. The tacos with the can shavings were comped and then we ordered mimosas and the champagne was flat. And the place wasn't even busy. There were half a dozen people at the bar and then our table. We've all worked in the service industry for years and that was just inexcusable.

Had a breakfast burrito, with shredded chicken, egg, potato, cheese and green mild sauce.  It was very flavorful and was ready quickly.  I also got a Strawberry Aqua Fresca which tasted just like summer! It was a delicious and inexpensive grab-and-go breakfast.  There is a parking lot in the back which makes visiting less of a challenge.

Will definitely be back to try the lunch options.

Went here on a Friday night because they have a Groupon and this place is walking distance from my house. 

There's 2 levels. Dining room downstairs and a bar upstairs. We went up to check it out and the first thing we see is some frat bros playing beer pong. In a restaurant. I was kind of shocked. I'd expect this in a college town but not in Denver. Along with the beer pong bros there was awful EDM blasting and I couldn't even hear what my gf was saying. 

We went downstairs to eat. Got 4 tacos and some chips and queso. The chips were the best thing we had. They were in house and the queso was tasty. The tacos however were not very good. They fry the tortillas a bit which is fine but there was so much oil on the tortillas that made it unappetizing and messy. Had to use so many napkins. The tacos are huge. They say they're 1/2 pound tacos which is excessive. There's just nothing impressive about them. Sort of bland. I didn't really like any of them and especially didn't like the chorizo. There was nutmeg or cinnamon in the chorizo that made it taste weird. 

Don't think I'll be back unfortunately.

I came here one evening last week after a terrible experience at another new restaurant with a friend, (see my other latest reviews...) and boy am I glad I did!!!!!!  It totally turned my frown upside down!!!  

First of all, super friendly service. Since they're new, or just because they're nice, the bartender Freddy gave us sips of the infused tequilas.... Perfection!!!!  My husband couldn't stop raving about the Serrano tequila - a week later, he's still talking about it!  I had strawberry, and it was sweet and perfect, just the way I like it! 

I love the open air concept for when the weather is nice. It's right on Colfax, but there is something to be said for the cool breeze wafting in, and the sounds of the city life mixing with the tunes they rock in the bar.

The food... I don't know how else to say it, but they keep it simple, inexpensive, and delicious!!!! You can't go wrong with that combination.  Honestly, one of the best quesadillas I ever had was in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico, two years ago.  It was a simple cheese, steak, and flour tortilla quesadilla, and I still dream about it's simple perfection today.  I found my simply perfect quesadilla here at Los Tacos in Denver!!! #praise

Ummmm... Forgot to mention, heaven in your mouth only costs $3.50.  I accidentally ate part of my food before I took my picture, but it's soooooooo filling!!!!! And seriously... $3.50!!?? You can treat your 10 friends to lunch, look like a baller, and not wipe out your checking account!!!!

Two more things.... The restrooms are immaculate, and there are hooks on the wall for purses/coats in the ladies room.  Also.... WORTH FIVE STARS ALONE: FREE PARKING IN THE BACK!!!!!! They share the parking lot with natural grocers, 45 spots during the day, and the entire lot after the grocery store closes. Seriously, how else can you go out in Capitol Hill!?  Parking is SUCH a pain everywhere else. #winning

So anyway... I had a great experience. I absolutely can't wait to come back!!!!

I went on my first visit to Los Tacos for lunch today and am so glad I did. Thanks, Groupon, for giving me the incentive to try out a new restaurant that's now my favorite food hotspot on Colfax.

Los Tacos offers fast-casual (first floor) and regular restaurant dining arrangements (second floor). Since I was on my own for lunch, I chose the fast-casual option, and even though I was notified that the food might take a little longer since it's all freshly made to order, the wait time was minimal for food on par with the best taco joints in Denver. 

The pollo and pescado tacos were succulent and perfectly flavored (not a given at many Denver taco spots where animal protein options are often on the dry side unless deep-fried) and came with the creamiest Great Northern beans I've had the pleasure to scarf. I went with the Jr. Taco size (akin to the street taco portions at Pinche and Torchy's) but may try one of their mega tacos the next time I'm in.

Just as good as the food were the friendly service and lack of ridiculously long lines. I like Torchy's and Pinche but am not a fan of the long lines and mediocre customer service. Los Tacos is a gem on Colfax. I can only hope that as it grows in popularity (delicious food? inexpensively prices? great service? how could it not?), I'll be able to beat back the hungry hordes to grab tacos to go. Thanks for the excellent food and service, Los Tacos! I can't wait to come back with hungry friends.

Los Tacos and the Denver Broncos Sunday night football game against the Green Bay Packers proved to  be both outstanding! If there was one complaint, it's " I couldn't get enough CHEESE!", as in a few more QB sacks of Aaron Rodgers would of made my night perfect!

The cool, vibrant atmosphere in the upstairs bar area  with open air seating, topped off with multiple hi-def screens and an awesome sound system made for a great night of football! 

My dinner combo of the pork tacos, veggie quesadilla and ceviche were the bomb! Fresh and authentic and paired nicely with my Titan IPA. Freddy, the bar manager, was spot on with his service, just like Peyton Manning's long balls to DT! 

This is my new go to spot on Sunday's to watch our Broncos make a historic run to SUPER BOWL 50! Orale!! Go BRONCOS!!

The service was friendly and fast, certainly couldn't complain. 

We ordered the pork burrito and the pork tacos. The portions were large and seemed to have quality ingredients. The meat really was average though in flavor and texture, nothing to write home about. I wasn't the biggest fan of the pinto beans which were in both. 

The salsa was probably the biggest disappointment. If you visit a taqueria in Mexico, you'll find that the salsa and pickle bar is pretty extensive, full of fresh and spicy salsas and pickled vegetables. Here, we were given two salsas, a mild and a hot/spicy. Neither had any heat and were pretty bland. 

Despite the great service, this place just didn't live up to the 5 star Yelp reviews we had read. There are so many places that offer a more authentic taco that pack more flavor along Colfax.

I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised by just how good the food was here...  I also have to give a mention to how friendly the staff was, they were great!  We got a burrito, a taco, and a quesadilla, all were very good.  The sauces were also very good, esp. the Habanero Salsa which has a great amount of heat and surprisingly good habanero flavor (most habanero flavored things don't taste that much like the fresh chiles).

All in all, I'm happy and we will definitely be back.  Thanks for moving into the neighborhood.
Food was delicious and the staff was friendly!! White beans in a taco were questionable until my first bite. Yum!!!

I walked in and found the sandwich board sign directing me upstairs to order food. While walking upstairs, I thought it odd that I would be ushered away from the food considering that was my key intention of supporting this local business. Instead, I stood, ignored by the seemingly busy bartender (there were only two other people at the bar talking). With his back to me for about 45 seconds, it was clear--business wasn't happening up here either. I went downstairs to ask the person at the register where I can place my order, and he said, "upstairs, my register is closed." Really? Three people in the restaurant and no one to take an order for food? Gladly took my business elsewhere. I would advise others to do the same. 

Bland tacos, poor customer care. As Manny B. says, if you're in Cap Hill you can do better. Dry chicken, unseasoned meat and poor guacamole "spritz." Save your cash for a business that wants to take it!

I had written a 1 star review out of anger when they were closed two times in a row when I tried to go. Finally got to actually eat here so I'm re-reviewing.

Burritos were tasty, the lengua was crisped a little (on a griddle I assume) was was unexpected but good.

I highly recommend the sopapillas. They're a little denser than average but in a really good way.
Never been here before, but was pleasantly surprised! Staff was super helpful and satisfied all our taco fantasies!

Food wasn't terrible, acceptable ingredients, but not authentic. Burrito was dryer than the Mojave. 

If you're in Cap Hill you can do better. The next Mexican place over is legit. Too many doors? Still better food across the street. Don't like crossing streets? There's a pretty good sandwich place on the same block.

Uninspired replica of Mexican food.

The tacos were no street tacos. Hell they weren't even tacos I'm used to. The tortillas were good, but the tacos were disgusting. My dog could make better tacos than that. Eww. The thing they have going for them is that their prices are cheap. But I guess you get what you pay for. This was a real disappointment; I should have went to Cheba Hut next door.

I have been here three times now, and every time I finish eating, I am left awe struck with how good and fresh the food is. The staff is always very attentive and friendly, and I'm loving the new menu. 
Keep it up guys, you have a customer for life! 
Jon 

Recommend the Carne Asada Fries, and the Chicken Tacos. :)

They mean what they say about the ingredients, so its hard not to give this place 5. Friendly fast service and parking to boot makes this place a potential spoiler in the Illegal petes/ chipotle war if they choose to expand.

I just cant, after tasting real milanesa, al pastor, and slow roasted carnitas, put this on the same level as places like Torta Gril and Tacos DF. Hopefully the menu expands in a way that is authentic and interesting, but if not I wont drive past this place if Im hungry.

Finally someone who knows how to cook a quesadilla..! It was crispy and stayed together when you picked it up. Service was friendly and although the sign asked for patience because all their food is made from scratch, we got our food in no time!

Food sucks. Good customer service. They put beans in the tacos (weird). Ordered a burrito instead and it was slimy and soggy. The chips had no salt and the salsa was disgusting. 
I would seriously rather eat Taco Bell.

Great food and great service!! 
Had a chicken taco and a carnitas tacos- both were fabulous!!
Can't wait for the next taco Tuesday!

We love it. All open doors on a beautiful day, the guys that run it are super nice and care a lot. Food is delightful, the tacos are bad ass. My favorite thing about the whole place is the meat. No gristle or heavy fat, they obviously spend a lot of time trimming and cooking meats, and it shows. I'm super picky with meat, and theirs is honestly amazing. Thank You!

I actually really like this place and I hope it does well. Is $6 a lot for a loaded taco? Sure, but you only need one so it seems like a fair price. There are a ton of places cheaper but they're either not close or you need 2-3 tacos to leave you as full, which seems to defeat the point. 

The chips and pico were a nice start, and I loved the simplicity in the pico. I would however recommend a separate dish for the pico, it can make the chips really soggy. I'm sure Los Tacos is trying to cater to all palates, but the pico could use more jalapeño. The homemade cilantro sauce too. Both had great flavor, but were just a little too gringo for my taste. The tacos and quesadillas were great and the jalapeño was a nice touch. We'll definitely go back.

We stopped here on a lazy Sunday. They have really good tacos. At a half pound each it's quite a bit of food. Two of them was enough for me. The drink prices are good too. Hope to see this place around for a while.
Our experience was pretty bad. Burnt chorizo, soggy tortillas, processed cheap cheese. We couldn't finish it. Big taco fans bit those weren't tacos.

I really don't understand why this place has such great reviews... I went the other night with my partner for a quick dinner. They messed up on charging her, $14 for two junior tacos?! whaaaa. They failed to listen to her when she said no cheese, and my tacos had the avocado peel IN the taco. Yuck. Might be a bad first impression, but I left wishing that hotdog place that was here previously hadn't left. Overpriced and Underwhelming. Too bad.

The food is great and I like the set up of the upstairs bar. But the music is turned up to 11 at all times. So loud in there you can't talk. And they blast it at all times of the day... Turn it down a little and this will be an awesome spot.

This place is hands down my FAVORITE taco place in Denver! Not only is there food AMAZING, the service and prices are excellent as well. I have been here a handful of times, and they have a downstairs casual dining, and an upstairs with a full bar and music. We have sat downstairs a couple of times, and upstairs a few times if we are in the socializing mood, and both were great. I definitely recommend this place!

A friend told me it was terrible food. I wanted to prove him wrong so I went to try it. Service was pretty much not there. Managers/employees were sitting on the patio and we had to stand inside for a few minutes before anyone came to help us. We then make our way upstairs to the bar and the bartender wasn't there. Turns out he was one of the ones on the patio. I ordered the tacos and my friend ordered the burrito. We both ordered chorizo. We had to wait a bit for our food. When it arrived, it looked good. Looks are definitely deceiving. The amount of grease was unreal. The chorizo had zero flavor and all I could taste was grease. The bartender was never around to ask how our food was. Finally when I said I didn't like it, he didn't bat an eye. He grabbed it and asked if he wanted me to take it off. He never asked what was wrong   Hell yes I did. It was terrible. I was charged for the one taco I powered through and my friend asked for his to go. 
I do not recommend this place. Denver has good Mexican food and this is not a place to go to for Mexican food.

Amazing and fresh Mexican food at a great price .  Open air seating on the second floor was great for a relaxing Saturday night. This was our first visit. Definitely will be back without the kid for late night drinks and beer pong

If you like tacos, you MUST come check this place out. The tacos are amazing! You can taste the freshness, everything is made from scratch. Casual dining on lower level and a bar upstairs. Delicious!!!

Mediocre food for a taco place. Pinto beans were seasoned with way too much black pepper, same with the queso. Also the avocado was not fresh. Tasted like the frozen kind from Sysco. Salsa is okay, but nothing noteworthy. Breakfast burritos are okay, but you need about 4 salsa cups to make up for the lack of flavor. Good drink specials though, just eat somewhere else.

Took our 2 kids here for lunch, ages 4 and 6. If you are used to ordering the smaller Mexican "street tacos" and usually get 3 or 4 to fill up, your are going to be STUFFED here!  The tacos come with heaps of meat and white beans on 2 corn tortillas.  They are FILLING, and quite delicious too. I ordered 2, along with chips and salsa and was darn full afterwards. Service was super friendly and fast, everything cooked to order.  I would definitely recommend Los Tacos, and would come back for sure!

The tacos are really good.  The shells are both crunchy and soft and chewy.  Provides a nice texture against the super moist chicken.  The bar had a DJ the time I was there, the music is pretty loud so it's  really not a good for a conversation.

Zero complaints from someone new to the area. Along with the Yelp first-time-customer 20% discount, I got a beer and a chorizo taco for just over $8. Pretty laid back atmosphere. There were only two other customers at 1:30 PM on Wednesday. 

The food itself was delicious, although I was starving when I went. Loaded up with guac and beans, I gulped it down in about two minutes. The taco wasn't oversized, but it was definitely packed with flavor.  The restaurant has plenty of room and an oddly-placed big screen TV.  There is a sign requesting patience and explaining that they cook everything from scratch. It was empty and it only took about five minutes, although I can imagine it getting backed up a bit on a busy day. 

Music being played included Hootie and the Bowflish and "I like girls that wear Abercrombie and Fitch", so 5 star A+

Most disappointing burrito of my life.  Perhaps an overstatement, but still an underwhelming and unsatisfying burrito and experience.

I visited at 1130 pm, half an hour to close, on a Saturday night so it's probably my fault for asking someone to give a fuck, understandable.  I got a veggie burrito and while kinda tasty, there were no rice or beans or anything substantial.  Was a very small, thin burrito and for nearly $7 i was left wondering why I even bothered.  I hope it's my bad luck they didn't make the burrito right, because I just cannot fathom how they could charge so much for  an onions and pepper sauce thing in a tortilla.  Avoid, it's not even good drunk.

I came in for lunch for the first time today. The tacos are amazing and the extra cheese melted between the tortillas is fantastic! The sopapillas are fresh and perfectly fried. I definitely plan on coming back to get drinks during their happy hour!

If you like food truck tacos, then you will love this place. I have tried the pork, carne asada, and lengua tacos. All of them are fantastic. I don't really care for white beans that much so I just ask for the tacos without them and they are excellent. They also have a good assortment of salsa and hot sauce for spicing up the flavor! The atmosphere of the pace is really cool and the bar upstairs has a nice setup. It's a fun place to hang with a group of friends. I definitely recommend checking this place out.
Came here for lunch excellent tacos! Perfect shells that were lightly toasted. Fast service too. Great spot.

The tacos where expensive! Hands down the most expensive tacos I've ever bought and on top of that we're terrible . I didn't even think it was possible to mess up tacos but then I tried Los Tacos! They lacked flavor and the salsa was all tomato and onions but mostly tomato. I paid almost $30 dollars for 2 tacos a burrito and a small drink. But if your hungover and just want mediocre tacos.. Go to Taco Bell because this place is garbage. Should be called "The Tacos" because there's no Mexican in them. And I love how the owner keeps messaging bad reviews saying " give us another chance". Really?!  Fool me once shame on you. Fool me twice shame on me. Oh and don't believe me about the salsa ..? Well you can see for yourself by the pictures of the food above.   "Hey Trevor the salsa needs more tomato". Don't be fooled by the 4 star rating they've all been bought or don't know good Mexican food from their butt.
Food and service is great! I hear the drinks are too, but we did not try them this visit!

Went there for a Party Guru event and had a blast. Despite being at capacity, and a five minute wait for my drink because there was really only one bartender there, they did a great job! Very apologetic and had a friendly staff to totally make up for the wait! The drinks specials are insane, best deal around town!!!
Mediocre tacos. Loud top 40 music. Not my kind of place probably won't be coming back. Service was pretty good though. I give this place a thumbs down. Skip it if you want quality food.

LOVE Los Tacos. I dropped by today and tried a Chicken Taco with some (free!) Sopapillas.
Seriously best taco I have ever had! At first I wasn't sure about paying $6 for a loaded taco but after one bite realized it is so worth it. They look small-ish, but trust me, they are totally filling and satisfying :)

On top of being amazing foodwise, the staff was nothing short of wonderful and welcoming. They addressed me by name, brought me a fork, checked in with me to make sure everything was scrumptious. All the folks I interacted with were very attentive and genuine. 

Extra points for being super clean and having nice design elements.

I'll definitely come back and I hope they do well!

So Super AWESOME !!! I had three different kinds of taco and my buddy had a chorizo burrito, everything was delicious and it was tons of food for a great price. I checked out the cocktail menu while I was there, it looked great.  I cant wait to go back and hang out on the roof with a spicy marg in hand !

When the hotdog stand closed and Los Tacos was announced in 2015, we were SO excited. Finally, tacos on Colfax! An option other than diner food!

Before I go into this review, I want to be sure that readers know this review is based solely on service- the food itself, especially the drinks, are fantastic. If you need a taco on Colfax, this is it for sure.

The reason I will no longer be visiting this restaurant is because their promotions, sandwich board, menu prices, e-mail blasts, and facebook posts are never honored at the restaurant. Every time I have visited as a result of an e-mail or facebook special, the menu prices and specials have always been "out of date", "expired", or for some unknown reason, "wrong". I read your e-mails, I follow your facebook, and I do NOT appreciate being lied to. Dishonesty about advertised specials can be easily remedied- just don't advertise them, or honor them when customers ask! If I find a flyer while sitting at your bar that indicates tacos are half off until  8:00 everyday and it is 7:05, I'd appreciate the courtesy of, "well, that's no longer correct, but I will honor the special since it was our error." Instead, when we questioned the owner, we were given rude looks, had to ask multiple times, and practically escorted from the establishment as if we were criminals. 

I understand that there can be human errors on busy nights- I get that. But when advertising dishonesty is the fault of the restaurant, customers appreciate respect. Due to the lack of respect at this restaurant, I can no longer support their business, which makes me very unhappy as I believe their business is a welcome and appropriate addition for this block on Colfax.

OMG 
love the authentic way this food is presented. I love that it is bright and has a great atmosphere. Fresh, fresh and downtown needs a new face! Thank you Los Tacos!
XOXO
Late night, lunch time- see you soon!!!!
This is seriously a great place. From the management down to the food and atmosphere. We will be making this our new bar! Breakfast burritos were amazing.
Casual. Fun.  TV was too loud on the upstairs lounge but great food and drinks.  They have unlimited bloody Mary's!
Amazing tacos and great service, also looks like I just found myself a new sunday funday drinking spot
Absolutely the best, affordable Mexican food I've had in Denver! 3 drinks, dinner for two, bellies stuffed, for under $30! Eat upstairs in the bar. Freddy is awesome!

The staff was friendly enough.  The burritos were "soupy", the tortilla was very greasy and had a strange texture.  The prices were OK for food.  

We had the $3 house margarita which was mediocre at best.  It was very weak and tasted like only ice and mix.

There's no complementary chips and salsa and the water cups are a tad larger than a shot glass.  Just because I drink water, it doesn't mean I drink less.  Upstairs in the bar, they don't refill your water so you have to walk back downstairs and to the back of the restaurant to get refill your 3oz water cup.   

The atmosphere upstairs was neat, but unfortunately it's on Colfax so be careful with your bike out front.  There are much better places.

The best restaurant hands down I have been too in nearly 2 years. Friendly wait staff and even cooler owner with great jokes!! Will come here again and would highly recommend for all patrons looking for good food and a great times.
The gristle in the asada was unbearable. While the staff was excited, and the owner invested, the $8 burrito was tough to swallow . . . Virtually impossible, actually. I had such high high hopes too.
Best carnitas taco ever.  Freddy is the bomb.  Makes  great cocktails.  Makes sure ur glass is never empty....     hmmmm I want this man!!!!!!!

The tacos were delicious, particularly the corn tortillas that are grilled to perfection.   The shrimp and chicken were better than the fish.  The prices are very reasonable and even the smaller size is bigger than a normal taco.  We had guacamole too, and unlike a prior poster, I thought it was very good and had plenty of avocado.  The owner was also super friendly.  Well worth a visit.

Don't go here! Way over priced. One taco is $4.00 and you have to pay for cheese, sour cream, etc on top of that. I didn't even get the cheese on my taco that I paid for. There's so many other authentic taco stands in Denver that are worth it. Super disappointing!

Wow! This place is great! The service was awesome and everything came out very quickly.
The food is delicious.

This place is off the chart's!  The tostada de ceviche is very fresh, best I ever had!  Taco's are big, I could only eat one. Burritos are grilled,  so damn good! Great bar upstairs ,very open with a great vibe. My new fave place!

Good food. I've been here twice since they opened. The food is definitely tasty and the service is always pleasant. 6.50 for a beef burrito pretty decent price because they are bigger portions. Drink specials are pretty good as well.

Loved coming here for a double date and a family nite!!! Food was very fresh and authentic, the service was fast and fantastic. I had the Carne Asada burrito and it was big but delicious, my boyfriend had the carnitas tacos and he loved it. The kids had quesadillas(cheese) and couldn't get enough!!! The pico and chips were a great starter. We also had the Watermelon and Mango Aqua Fresca's drink and they were very refreshing. We can't wait to go back for more!!!

Tacos were amazing! Simple, fresh, and not small. This place is open late, which is a plus. The owner was very kind and gave us free chips, salsa, and sopapillas. Nice to have a great taco shop so close to my house. I hope Trocheys tacos doesn't take away their business.

FOOD AND SERVICE IS FANTASTIC! Freddy and Jeff are awesome bartenders. Food came out almost as soon as Jeff put it in. Even the food runner was very respectful and helpful. Need a good drink, just ask Freddy. Denitely coming back.
The asada tacos are huge and really good. I had 2 regular size tacos, wow. It's hard to find places that serve fresh food and that it's good.

Went here for the first time to grab a quick bite before a show at the Filmore. Wonderful upstairs area with open windows and a full bar. Quesadillas (carne asada and chicken) were both great. The margaritas didn't taste too strong but they were only $3 a piece. Great staff and friendly atmosphere!
The food was great when i went to los tacos the food came out quick i was really hunger and couldnt eat more then two tacos. They tatsed amazing specially the price on happy hour 10 stars
First time here. Tacos were great- carnitas were my favorite. Fun atmosphere and super friendly service. Check it out!
This place is way better than Torchys tacos and better priced! This is my new spot for tacos. Probably one of the best Taco places I've been to since living here.

Good tacos with generous portions.  Full bar upstairs, with a great view and friendly bartender.  Horseshoe shaped bar, and open air vibe, coupled with beer pong and other bar games create a patio like experience above Colfax.  Definitely a place that a group of friends could take over for a couple of hours.
Chorizo tacos is where it's at!!! Was referred by a friend of mine we also had a cocktail that was great.

Great addition to Colfax!  I like the carne asada and chicken best and husband liked the pork.  Red sauce and green sauce were very tasty.  California style and fresh food great beer prices at happy hour as well.

We came in for the $2 craft beers but were quickly impressed with both the quality of food and service. Sal, our bartender quickly catered to our needs, wanting both authentic cuisine and delicious beers, delivered us both. The sauces and flavoring they make for the food are all homemade and there is a wide variety of infused liquors. Overall I recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves authentic Mexican food paired with a delicious drink. The service was impeccable and we can't wait for the rest of the restaurants to open.
Great food...staff is friendly and again food is awesome...great to have a place at this par in capitol hill Denver...

What a genuine experience. I heard Mexican in Denver was good but this really exceeded my expectations. A group of four of us came in for taco Tuesday and we we loved both the deal and the flavor. Between the four of us we sampled the chorizo, carnitas, chicken and best on the menu "secret" taco. Luckily we made a close enough guess on what the secret was to score a free shot of tequila. To top it all off the bottomless margaritas for $15 and free nachos with salsa gave this place in my opinion a five star worthy value.

I went here with a couple friends. I really liked the chicken tacos- very tasty. The upstairs bar is really cool, too. Garage doors that open over Colfax so you can watch all the crazy things going on in the street. They also have really good Happy hour specials.

Finally found a taco place in Denver that I like! Authentic, delicious and all fresh ingredients; I had the chicken taco (only needed one because they load it up). Will definitely be coming back! Also, they were extremely accommodating when it came to food allergies. And should mention...FREE PARKING.
Worst margarita (watery koolaid) and worst service I've had in a long time. Many, many better taco joints here, avoid this place.
