We've eaten here a lot, the food is great. However we order delivery for the first time. I kid you not we received our food hot, fresh, exactly as ordered, exactly 10 minutes after we ordered it! Awesome!!!

I haven't been this happy with food, especially delivery in a long time. I recommend the drunken noodles- hot

I found myself here after being told at the other thai place that there was a wait to be had...decided that it was a good idea to at least TRY the other restaurant in the same area "just in case" I need a back up. 

So here's the verdict: very Americanized. You can tell from the decor alone. It's a bit more price wise compared to US Thai. You can also tell when your food comes and you've ordered a medium spice level, and the spice is barely detectable. I guess this is subjective though...
I also think the food is much sweeter and saucier than it should have been. All in all, if you NEED thai and it's an absolute emergency, this should cover your bases. It's just A-OK. 

What I will say is that this is a bit better than the other thai chains around Denver, just for comparison's sake.

I tried it and really wanted to like it, from the reviews. But honestly, if you're looking for a truly authentic Thai food experience, venture two blocks north to US Thai. 

We dropped in to Thailicious on a whim, and ended up eating two bites of our Pad Thai, paying, and heading up the street for some proper Thai. 

It wasn't that anything was particularly bad. It was just that the presentation and flavors seemed very catered to customers who aren't comfortable with the bold, adventurous flavors in authentic Thai food. The Pad Thai was soupy and overly sweet with little-to-no sour tamarind - and garnished with wontons. (?) 

To sum it up in, Thailicious looked and tasted like Thai food for the 'burbs. If you're less adventurous, it might be right up your alley.

We have been on a hunt for fabulous thai food in Denver - heck i was willing to expand it to Colorado itself...

The fates aligned and one night when friends wanted to go to US Thai it was closed, so we hunted up another and it was only a 2 block walk - woot!

Our waiter was fabulous - offered suggestions and what the best meat in a dish was and the outcome was nummy for my tummy!

I think their tom kha is the best i've had in quite a while. Generally the meat is thrown in as an after thought so the flavor doesn't meld, they make a fabulous one - however they do it - the flavors go very well together!

I've enjoyed the volcano - omg - wow! the skinny chicken larb dish (can't remeber the name ) was awesome! 

I love this place i can't even find the words. The food is great, not greasy. The staff is friendly and helpful not rude and doesn't look down on you!

Can't wait to go back soon!

N

This was our last stop after a busy day of helping some friends move. We came in around 8:30pm, tired and hungry. Having never been here before, I differed to my friends who had and let them pick a variety of dishes for us to share family-style.

If I were rating on the food alone, this place would get 5 stars, no question. We shared some chicken satay skewers, a fried tilapia, massamun curry, papaya salad, and a stir fry. I would order any and all of it again. The flavors and spiciness levels were on point, and the preparations seemed authentic with other experiences I've had (for example, the last time I had a whole, fried fish like this at a Thai restaurant was in Los Angeles). It was a great meal to enjoy with friends.

I have to detract two stars, though, for the service. Our waiter was pretty much comatose, and appeared to be irritated that we were there. We did come in for a late dinner, but it was a Saturday - not too unusual, I think. We had to ask for everything, including basics like rice and water. Lastly, after ordering dessert he came back to our table and informed us that the kitchen was closed and wouldn't serve us anything else. He didn't offer to let us change our order to something that doesn't have to be cooked (ice cream, for example); it was obvious he just wanted us to get out. So we did.

I would definitely come back for the food if I'm ever in the area again; but I would probably get it to go.

Delicious Thai near Sloans lake right off Sheridan.

This was my second time going and I love their food.

We tried the chicken Satay, shrimp sarong and spring rolls for appetizers. They were all delicious. The peanut dipping sauce is so good I would have liked to use my finger to wipe the ramekin clean but manners manners :)  

For drinks they offer a variety including $2 Sigha beers. Water is served in cool glass bottles and your cups are small tin ones, which may be native to Thailand but unsure. 

The entree I tried was the Thai Smile combo, which is papaya salad, grilled beef and larb, which is minced chicken with vegetables and spices.  It comes with a side of sticky rice and a spicy sauce. It is definitely a lot of food and big enough to share. 

The table has three or four dipping sauces including a fish sauce, hot chili oil and a few others.

The only thing that could have been better was the waiter forgot to bring us water even after a few requests. 

Many of their dishes are gluten free, which is nice.

Might have finally found our thai place. We've been on the lookout for a while and while few have sucked none have wow'ed us. Thailicious wow'ed us.

We've been a few times already, even though it's not THAT close, and not on our way anywhere, it's worth the detours.

Came by late on a weekend after having some drinks and shooting some pool down the street, wasn't long till closing but we were greeted and served without issue. 

Kudos to the staff as I've seen many people In similar situations turned away. 

I'm a huge fan of Thai food and love the spice, not Gonna beat any natives in a chile eating competition, but I'd give most Bolillos a run for their money. 

I typically go to US Thai up the street because I know they always deliver legitimate Thai heat, but in my ongoing search I tried somewhere new.

We ordered some drinks to get things started and the fish cakes, drinks came out pretty quick but there was a slight snafu with our Appetizer, not a big deal, it was handled. 

Girlfriend had the yellow curry and I opted for the pepper and garlic stir fry. 

I ordered a 3 out of 5 heat level, after the waiter assured me and made some heat comparisons. 

I was definitely impressed, the dish had a great balance of flavor and spice, not overbearing but enough to get your brow a little moist. 

For anyone who doesn't eat a lot of peppers or spicy fare I would suggest respecting the number scale and staying low, in Thai joints you can always start low and ask for the spice rack, but once you go all in, there's no going back.
Awesome Thai food in a strip mall overlooking sloans lake. Skip the crab wontons, but everything else we had was delicious.

The hubs and I got take out a couple weeks ago. For an app we did the veggie egg rolls. They were crispy and delicious. For our mains, we both went with noodle dishes. Mine was the pad Thai and his was the drunken noodles. The pad Thai was a little too sweet for my taste but the noodles and veggies were perfectly cooked. 

The star of the night was the drunken noodles. The flavors were incredible and I wanted to grab my husbands dish out of his hands and hide in another room to polish it off. 

While we waited for our food we had really lovely customer service and sat at the bar drinking waters.

We have been searching for a Thai place in the highlands area. I'm super happy I stumbled upon it on Yelp. We had the crab cheese and dumplings to start. We knew from those that this was a place we'd be coming back to. Then we had the stop light curries, which is all 3 of their curries: red, yellow and green. Our favorites were the green and red. Then we also ordered the pad Thai. Pad Thai was fricken awesome! The view from the restaurant is gorgeous of sloans lake and the service is excellent! We absolutely will be coming back! 
Also- they have a great beer and wine list too!

Delicious Thai food, with a view of the lake! 

We came here with a very large party and they struggled to get the food out all at once and keep up with the drinks & service, so it is hard to give them more than 3 stars. 

However, the drunken noodles was fresh and hot!  Everyone's dishes looked great and the consensus was positive!  I would go back, but warning, parking is a pain in this plaza and traffic in the evening is absolutely terrible down Sheridan!!

Great place. Tons of personality. Loads of flavor. Awesome view.

What's not to like about Thailicious? It's even fun to say! I find it interesting that the best places are snuggled in to little strip malls that look so lame from the outside, but then behold the glory that is inside.

Very nice selection of food items. Cheap drinks also help matters along. I really like the physical space with it's decor, style, and grace. Totally perfect for this section of town. It's easy and delicious and just what the doctor ordered.

Attentive staff. That's always a good thing. And, I like how they serve water. It's just so cool. I will most definitely be heading back to get me some yummy Thai food. Pad Thai to the max!

I ordered the veggie stir fry and it tasted good but it came out barely warm. It seemed like it has been sitting out for awhile. I'm a vegetarian and I know if the vegetables and tofu were done fresh. The tofu had absorbed the color of the sauce when it was served. It only means that it wasn't freshly cooked. Otherwise the rest of the food were pretty good. The server was friendly, helpful and food came out in a timely manner.

Came here with a few classmate for a quick lunch and actually ended up staying longer than that.  There was only one server so service was extremely slow, however, the food totally makes up for it.  It's in the name Thailicious is delicious.

My friends ordered the Saturday lunch special which was pad thai with your choice of protein and I had the green curry with chicken.  Their dish came with a side of soup and a fried wonton.  We were also given a choice on how spicy we wanted our dish to be from a scale of 1 to 5; 3 being a nice kick and that is what we all got.  Since mine was a simmering soup dish it most likely brought out more of a kick than theirs.  It was good nonetheless.  However, next time I will definitely tone down the spice level to a two. We also ordered the thai sundae to share and it ended our meal perfectly.  It was a trio of thai tea, green tea, and taro ice cream with assorted fruit jellies.

The water here is served on a unique, intricately-designed, aluminum cup no bigger than the size of your palm. With 10+ ice cubes, Thailicious really know how to serve water with a purpose. I've never been served water like this before. Oh, and the food and service here is good as well.

I am so happy to be finding decent Thai food in Denver. My girlfriend and I got up early Saturday to run around Sloan's lake. We ended up running past a little strip mall where Thalicious was located. We ended up stopping in for lunch.

I love that they have lunch specials for every day of the week. We ended up getting the pad thai special. It came with a delicious vegetable coconut soup and wonton. The presentation was just spectacular. Even the water came in cute little metal cups.

I ordered the chicken pad thai with a level 4 of spice. It was the perfect amount of spice. It came in a wonderful little Asian bowl. It doesn't look like it's a lot of noodles but it really is a lot of noodles. I loved it. I had to take over half of it home. Which made for a delicious lunch the next day.

We couldn't leave without getting an order of the Mango sticky rice. The dish came in a martini glass. It was so pretty we didn't want to eat it. But eating out of this glass was easier than when we order it from different places because they chop up the mango and give you little seafood forks for eating it. 

It's all about the little detail.

The service wasn't bad but it wasn't something I'd rave about hence the 4 stars. I would love to go back and try their dinner and see how their green curry is. Thailicious is Delicious!

Well, sad how things change.  Popped in yesterday for some accompaniments to the curry I was planning on making;  papaya salad and an appetizer flight. I ordered the papaya salad medium hot. 

The appetizers were lackluster;  the fried egg rolls had very little filling,  the shrimp sarong were greasy and flavorless.  The papaya salad seemed as though someone had just stood over a pile of grated papaya and whispered "flavor",  as opposed to adding any real ingredients.  Really disappointing,  and expensive;  $20.00 with tip for a weak serving of appetizers and some grated fruit.  I'll not be back any time soon.

Came here recently for a family get-together so we had a large party of about 10 or so. I thought the service was a little lackluster and slow. There were periods of about 10 minutes several times where at least 3 or 4 people had no drinks or needed refills. The restaurant itself wasn't very busy so you wouldn't think we'd be ignored as much as we were.

I got the drunken noodles with a heat factor of 4 (out of 5). I actually really liked them and thought the hotness was spot on. A couple of the people at my table got their meals "as hot as you can make it" and both thought it wasn't hot at all. I didn't sample theirs to compare them to mine, but since mine had some pretty good heat I wasn't sure if they were just whining, or it really wasn't hot.

Regardless, food was good, service wasn't so good. So a solid 3 star place.

This place was some of the worst Thai food I've ever had. We got the Skinny Noodles with Chicken and Sweet & Sour Cashew with Pork. Both were essentially flavorless. We also got Mango Sticky Rice for dessert and it was terrible - not sweet and way too soggy. The only thing that was semi decent was the Tom Yum Soup...and that even lacked flavor. They don't give you any hot sauce or anything so I had to use some at home. Overall - really bad (and a bit overpriced). Don't go here - go somewhere more authentic.

I came in on Saturday night and we were seated right away. I ordered a thai tea (not very good), and a crab wonton app. The crab wontons were burnt at the top and had decent flavor. The cucumbers at the bottom made a fabulous crunch at the end of your bite. I ordered the drunken noodle with beef as my entree. IT WAS SOME OF THE BEST I've had. Meat was juicy and the sauce had awesome flavor. The server had several other tables and we didn't see him much after our food came out. I will be back.

Meh. Food is super salty and I wasn't really a fan. I like Thai basil much better. Broccoli in my curry is a no. Service was okay, but nobody came back and asked how my food was. I don't think I will be back anytime soon.

Once upon a time this restaurant served really great Thai food.  Now.....not so much.  This is the second or third time, I forget how many because I let a considerable amount time go by obviously where I have forgotten how bad their food is and order it again!  My bad.  I will not make that mistake ever again.  The food I got last night I would not feed my dog. Period.

Decent enough food but terrible service.  Arrived at the restaurant on Friday night at 6 with two kiddos and didn't get out until 8:00...kids meals took 45 minutes to receive after ordering!  That's crazy and risky for a restaurant to put kids through that kind of waiting game - they were definitely impatient by the time their food arrived.  Service lacked all around...

We ordered classic Thai staples - pot stickers (for kids) - which were actually shu mai dim sum but good, tom kha gai soup (who puts cabbage in tom kha?!?), drunken noodles, pad Thai, Thai fried rice, and Massaman Curry for six people.  

Overall the food was average - we ordered a couple dishes Thai hot and they weren't spicy at all.  Their menu did have a couple other items that looked interesting.

The restaurant is very well appointed - great environment.  Combination of our service and food experience means we won't go back.  There are too many other great options in Edgewater!

Dare I say the food here is....thailicious!? It is, everything was stellar when we visited for lunch on a Sunday. From Tom Kha Gai soup to chicken pad thai with medium spice, everything was perfectly seasoned, spiced, etc. They have lunch specials on the weekend but it only appeared to be one item and you pay $1 more for a wonton or spring roll and soup. Definitely a great stop when you're in the area--they have patio seating too so you can take a load off and enjoy the views of Sloan's Lake and downtown.

Pretty decent Thai food. I find myself choosing Thailicious over US Thai Cafe pretty often during the week just because they deliver and don't have the long wait for food that US Thai Cafe has. Thailicious is more of a fusion-style sort of place. They have your standard curries and noodle dishes that you find at most Thai places, with the green curry being my favorite, but they also have a lot of unique items. The GI fried rice is actually pretty good! It definitely looks like something you might find in an old Better Homes and Gardens cookbook hidden in your grandma's kitchen somewhere on the menu, but the flavors come together pretty well. 

The view of Sloan's Lake and the Denver skyline is awesome, especially in the summer. The service has also been very friendly every time I've been here, and they make great mixed drinks. My husband and I have been returning here for over a year for take-out and relaxing weeknight dinners out, so I can say I'm definitely a happy customer!

Better off going to US Thai down the street for authentic Thai food. My Pad Thai was super super  sweet which is a bummer. Thought my mango and sticky rice will redeem my disappointment from the pad Thai..I was wrong..Even more of a disappointment! I think they use frozen mangos which is a bit unfortunate as mangos are in season right now.

For the sophisticated output decors, i can say it was perfect. I feel so comfortable here. To really know this place, i ordered food:

Garlic Lamb: Thai spicy level, Chang beer is a good choice to pair with it.
Vegetable spring rolls: its indescribable taste made this dish extraordinary.

As a wine expert some selection should be changed.

Great atmosphere! Good sized portions.
I had a beef curried meal that was delicious! We also had the drunken noodles, they were delicious as well.

If I was craving Thai food especially drunken noodles I wouldn't hesitate to eat here again.

Heavenly! I had been wanting to go here for a while and had built up high expectations and they were surpassed!

We went for a Saturday lunch and although it was warm and sunny out it was too hot for my comfort so we sat inside. The service was fantastic! We got about 5 menus each of all of their fabulous offerings and ordered some beers and a cocktail. We got a chilled bottle of water and some metallic ice water drinking vessels that kept the water super cold. After drinking the cool beverages in the AC I was going from hot to cold. Then, since I ordered the lunch special I got soup I warmed up real quickly. I was slurping the soup so fast, I actually got warm again. Then, I cooled off with more beverages. There was also a delicious wonton included with the soup before the lunch entrée.

The food came out and it was amazing. While the others in my group opted for 'Hot' level spice, I went for mild. Then their temps started rising as they enjoyed their meals. The layers of flavor where delightful and the vibe was magical! The best part was that although I ate until I could eat no more, there was an ample amount of goodness remaining for left overs! And this was the lunch special. 

I am very much looking forward to returning here!

A good Thai restaurant, with reasonable prices. They have  different lunch special each day. Sat and Sun is pad Thai. I really liked their pad thai, it is quite good. We also had the Thom Kha, and Panang curry. Thom Kha was okay, the Panang tasted authentic. This is a nice boutique Thai restaurant tucked into a strip mall. If you are new to curry they have something called the stop light, which is a sampler, of the red, yellow, and green varieties. They say their curry paste is imported from Thailand, which makes me wonder if any Thai restaurants make their paste from scratch. I think Thai Diamond, and Suvipa may, it can be a bit chunkier than other places. If you are looking for Thai in this area, I think you will be happy with Thalicious, or US Thai. 
They also had a sampler dish that I may order next time, it has grilled beef, Larb, and papaya salad for 14.99.
I only did take out but the Traffic Light Curry, and Pad Thai were absolutely delicious! Spicy means spicy too! I was sweating by the end of my curries!!

Thailicious is, well, delicious! The food is well-seasoned and flavorful. I don't know much about Thai food but everything about the choices, taste, and presentation were exceptional. Carl, our server, was very nice.

The guy who accompanied me to this restaurant is long gone, but my like for Thailicious is here to stay.

Me and my husband decided to visit this place since we were visiting Denver. The Yelp reviews and veggie friendly menu brought us here and I'm so glad it did!

This place has amazing customer service! Our waiter was very friendly and accommodating to our vegetarian requests. The food is made to order and we know this because one of the chefs came out to ask us about our order! He wanted to confirm our request for adding egg/no fish sauce. We thought this was really sweet of him to come out to ask us this. Everyone had a smile on their face and were very friendly and nice. They were understanding of our requests and did not show any annoyance. 

Now for the food! We got panang curry with veggie and tofu, thai fried rice with tofu and veggies (add egg) and vegetable spring rolls. All of this was very delicious and flavorful. We really enjoyed the food- the spice level was perfect. 

The decor here was very nice as well!

Next time we are in Denver, we are definitely going to come back!
Great Thai food with favorable spice. Great service our last few visits. Cheap drinks and yummy desserts. Comfortable space and nice views of Sloans Lake and downtown. Our go-to spot.

Food was okay. Prices are a little steep. Ambience is nice. Waiters do not know Thai food or what is in it. Food came out quickly. Rice was really dry. Do yourself a favor...if you want real Thai food go around the corner to US Thai. Much better food, they know what's in it and it's cheaper.

First ate at Thailicious a few years ago when it first opened and wasn't a big fan. The dishes were on the small side and nothing was really a stand-out. So I didn't go back. Until recently and now I feel like I've missed out. We gave them a chance last month because we really wanted some Thai and they have delivery and are just up the street so we figured why not go for it. And it was great. I love that you can put your order in online. The delivery driver was a sweet guy. And the food was REALLY good. We had Pad Thai, Stoplight Curry, Drunken Noodles, Chicken Satay, Egg Rolls and Crab/Cream cheese wontons. I like that we were also able to order a side of plan rice noodles for the kids for just 1.50. 
The Stoplight Curry was delicious. Neither of us could figure out which was our favorite b/c all three had great flavor and good heat. The Pad Thai was flavorful and plentiful and the Drunken Noodles were just right. The kids had the Chicken Satay and seemed happy. REALLY good peanut sauce. The crispy spring rolls are DELICIOUS.  Everything was great.
Fast forward to last night. Again, just ordered off of their drop down menu and piled everything into a cart for easy check-out. Awesome to be able to do at a red light on the way home so the food was ready to go when I got there. Reordered most of the same dishes. Added some pork dumplings which nobody liked and one had a big bone in it which didn't help. Everything else was consistently delicious. And I say consistently b/c we just broke up with one of our favorite Thai places in the neighborhood because they can't seem to get their consistency right (flavors vary and heat really varies to the point of inedible "medium" heat). Anyhow, we are fans. Check them out.

It took us months to find a Thai place we loved. This place used to deliver beyond our expectations but they must have gotten a new cook. The chicken satay a we're deep fired and over cooked  and the pad Thai was super fish saucy. Not sure what changed but I'm sad because this used to be the best Thai place in Denver. The long haired bartender is still amazing and they have Great service

Best Thai I've ever had, and I don't hand that compliment out. 

Food is obviously amazing, service is amazing, and it's pretty cheap, especially for the quality of what you're getting. If you're into Thai, you won't be disappointed by any means.

This place has been amazing the few times we've come. But tonight, our server took 15 minutes to greet us, or take our order. He didn't apologize for his tardiness, didn't ask if we wanted drinks or appetizers, just jumped right to "Are you guys ready to order?" Someone else brought out food, which was missing the appetizer that should have come before the food. When they brought the wontons, they were dark and over cooked. We had to flag another server that we recognized from previous visits, to have them sent back. The wontons that came second, looked just as dark, but were actually ice cold in the center. Hinting that they need to change their fryer oil, and stop freezing their wontons. Our original server never checked on our food, and no one ever even asked how it was. I couldn't even get soy sauce before I had finished my plate. 
My fiancées loved her dish, only reason I'm giving it two s
Unpleasantly disappointed with this experience. I doubt I'll be back.

I just moved here at the beginning of the month and this has already become my favorite spot. great view of the city over Sloan's Lake if you're sitting on the patio. the food is delicious and fresh and served nicely; pleasing to the eye and the mouth. The waitstaff is friendly and attentive. my favorite dish is the pad woon sen. they have options for vegetarians like myself and adventurous meat eaters like my boyfriend who got bison in his stir fry.  I recommend this place to anyone and everyone! so happy to have stumbled upon it.

I have never eaten in the restaurant but go for take away allll the time. The fried veggie egg rolls are the best thing and I love that their food is actually spicy. Like Asian spicy. Not white people spicy. 
Everyone who I have encountered there is really nice and professional. Great place! (I have leftovers in my fridge r now, hence the inspiration for this review)

Thailicious is a hidden gem! They have great prices on food and cocktails and a wonderful view of the Denver skyline behind sloans lake. The food is delicious and perfect when you're craving something spicy. I like to get the traffic light curry, which comes with three kinds of Thai curry. I've also tried the noodles which were very good. Give this place a try today!

This place is dang good! Across from Sloan's Lake with a pretty view of it. I love their curry and fresh rolls! Very friendly helpful staff.  As long as I live near Edgewater this will be my Thai place of choice !!! UPDATE: I've eaten there a few times since posting this...and each time the food was completely different.  The curry bowls seem to be shrinking...

Tried this place for the first time over the summer. Got a table for two on the patio since it was such a nice night.  It's also nice because the view from the patio is Sloan Lake and the city of Denver.  We initially debated if we should leave after sitting there for a few minutes and were not greeted by anyone, yet the staff knew we were there because they were coming outside and serving other tables.  Just as I was using my yelp app to find a place nearby to go to instead of waiting around - our waiter shows up.  
Took him a long time to bring our drinks over, we ordered a beer and one of their bottomless wine slushies.  He was very inattentive and scattered brain.  We ended up ordering the pad Thai with shrimp and green curry with shrimp.  Took about your average wait time.  The food is REALLY good. The best Thai food I have come across since moving to Colorado a year ago.  The waiter continued to disappoint, we ordered another round but he blatantly forget to bring them over to us. Then we finally got our check, but we had to wait what seemed like forever for him to run our card.  Really frustrating when its the weekend and you just want to pay your bill and leave. In conclusion... the service SUCKED.  Food, however, was outstanding.  Since coming here for the first time, we have ordered take out atleast 5 times. 
I will more than likely give dining in another shot sometime.

Their pad Thai is amazing. Just amazing. 

I also asked for my yellow curry wok to be Thai hot and it delivered. Very spicy and a very decent amount of curry for a stir fry. 

The mango and sticky rice was served in a sundae scoop style cup. It was very sweet and I loved the ratio of coconut milk to rice.

We ordered takeout so can't comment on the ambiance, wait staff, location, atmosphere etc, but that just leaves more time to rave about the truly Thailicious food they have here! This place is definitely appropriately named. The flavors are spicy and the food is tasty! For a party of 11, we ordered drunken noodles, a few different curries - red and green,  pad Thai with tofu (which was firm and marinated so tasted great)! The price wasn't too bad, I think the total order came to $60 for 5-6 entrees which fed all of us well. Next time I'd like to go into the place and check it out, but would recommend ordering from here as well.

3 months ago I would have given this place 5 stars and rave reviews but the last time we went the food was mediocre. I always order the Karee curry and it was good but my husbands drunken noodles were dry and bland. He has ordered the same dish for months now and it is always spectacular, when we talked to the waitress about the change, she said there are new chefs in the kitchen. We really hope the new ones can figure out how to make the food as good as it once was because this was our go-to Thai restaurant.

The curry I ordered was pretty good. I ordered the mildest and it was not spicy at all, unlike at other restaurants. The rice was a little overcooked but with the curry on top you could hardly tell. I got one of the special sodas and it was good and unique (not of the shelf entirely) but a little too sweet. 

The atmosphere was really fun with an amazing view of the lake. I look forward to warmer weather to enjoy the outdoor sitting looking out on the lake.

Almost all the curries and soups were GF. My stomach did hurt some afterwards though. I believe it was from cross contamination. I did not emphasis the seriousness of my condition, so I am not sure if gloves and serving ware were exchanged causing the reaction.

Thanks to prior Yelpers!  We are traveling and you all did well with ratings.  All the small touches- good service/food/view, food brought out at good timing, extra spoon brought to share soup, two teacups for blue flower tea, etc.  We spent $23 for two meals at lunch.  
Unique tin water glasses with carafe left on table and nice decor.

Food is great, service is meh.

We get the food to go and enjoy our dishes at home.

Carry Curry.....extra chicken over rice!!
Amazing flavors, beautiful atmosphere, and they have butterfly pea tea that is blue! It's a foodie spot for sure.

The food is good when you dine there, for some reason the takeout is lacking.  We paid the 1.95 floor sea food.  When it came,  we couldn't figure out which one is fine because we couldn't see any sea food. I ate everything else and left the seafood.  The photo is what was left.
Super easy to get vegan dishes and they are delicious! The food also tastes very fresh. Will be back for sure.

Went here on New Year's Day with my boyfriend and a couple of other friends. We really like the atmosphere and the food was pretty good, but the service kept it from getting 4 stars.
The service was a bit off from the beginning. He gave us about 30 seconds to decide on drinks and asked us if we knew what we wanted to order before we had even opened the menus.  He took a very long time to come back each time he left our table. The food took a bit to come out, which wasn't a big deal. The main issue was that once we were done eating we sat there for over 30 minutes waiting for our server to come back. He never even walked close to our table the whole time and it's not a very big place. He had come by earlier to ask if one of us wanted another beer as his was empty and my friend told him he was done. Also, 3 out of the 4 of us had empty dishes and I had pushed mine away from me. Despite sitting there forever with empty plates, cups and beer bottles we still had to ask for our check and had to grab him to give him our credit card. He was just nonexistent and we wanted to head home.
The food was pretty good. We got Tom kha soup, pad Thai, Thai volcano and garlic & pepper pork. The soup was good, but could have been spicier. My boyfriend asked for the pad Thai to be a 4 out of 5 spicy, but they made a mistake and my dish was super spicy and the pad Thai was very mild. The garlic & pepper pork was super spicy (I had asked for a 3 out of 5 on the spice), which wasn't so bad, but was very salty. The leftovers were better the next day. The volcano wasn't spicy and is a very small portion, so beware if you are hungry. 
We likely won't return here as we live on the opposite side of downtown and the service turned a quick dinner out (we had just gotten back from a hike and were starving,but wanted to get home and clean up, so it wasn't so great to be left at our table for so long after we were finished) into a 2 hour meal. There are much better Thai places closer to home and that are faster.

I'll be the first one to admit I was somewhat skeptical about ordering from this place. First, the name of the place is sort of a put off and almost looks like a marketing ploy, and I'm sure it is. Second, no offense, but people in Denver as a whole don't know what good Thai is so I have learned to ignore Yelp ratings for Thai places. Sorry, but I say this through experience.

After living in LA for almost 10 years, which is the home to the largest Thai population outside of Thailand, I've had some amazing dishes! Did I mention I've been to Thailand twice as well? 

This is now only the second legitimate Thai place I've found in Denver. For one, they are not messing around with the spiciness level. If you ask for "3" you're mouth will most likely be on fire. Love it! I hope they keep the Thai scale and don't succumb to a weaker American scale (oops, did I just take another shot?!) ;)

In all seriousness, their food it really good. I had the fried tilapia, which is a dish a Thai friend introduced me to in OC. I thought they did a fantastic job with it and I would absolutely recommend it. The hot and sour soup was more hot than anything but on a cold night it really did the trick. The spring rolls looked a bit unorthodox but I found them rather tasty. Finally, I had the papaya salad, which was good but didn't rank among the best I've had (and not the best in Denver either). It is, however, a Thai dish I absolutely love and crave!

I'm happy to know I have a couple very good options for Thai now and both relatively close to home. In this case, I can order take out if the roads are super snowy! ;)

Interesting Review; VERY MIXED FEELINGS!
So my girlfriend and I stop in for the first time, I live nearby and we had been walking the lake and decided to stop and grab a bite.  Very nice, comfortable environment.  Food was great and exactly what we were hoping for.  So why the mixed feelings?

Our waiter, the Joe Dirt looking guy not the black/grey haired guy, was overtly and obnoxiously flirting with my girlfriend!  Not just the friendly smile and nice compliment kind of flirt, he did those things excessively for sure, but while setting our beers down he lowered himself to eye level with my girlfriend and placed the beers in front of her staring intensely into her eyes with a sly grin!  WTF!  My girlfriend was like, "what is that all about?"  and tried to avoid eye contact with him the rest of our meal!  Totally weird, creepy, uncomfortable and very obnoxious.

IF, I decide to eat there again, it will be delivery so that I can enjoy the food AND the experience!

This place hands down has the best Thai food! Service is profession and the ambiance is cozy! Big portions and quality food! We ate on the patio during sunset and really enjoyed it! Cheap Singha beer also! I loved their chicken pad Thai, my husband loved his Stop Light curries. He likes things spicy so he got a level 2, 3, 4 for the three curries. 
Will definitely be back much more!

My last two experiences with this place have been horrible. I went in one day to get dinner and a glass of wine, the bartender poured a half glass of wine and was going to charge me a full glass. I asked for a glass of water, and the waiter gave me an attitude. I took ONE sip of the wine and decided to leave after the waiter was an asshole. I called to complain, and the manager gave me a credit. So I called tonight to order takeout. The delivery guy was an asshole and got pissed at me for the tip I gave. Not sure what he was expecting? A 20 dollar tip? Then I look in my bag, and I am missing a soda. So I call the place to complain about the attitude and my drink, and the manager gets pissed at me and tells me they could have called the police on me for walking out the last I was there. REALLY?! Then why did you give me a credit? And not only that, but seriously? The cops? I took a sip of the wine and had shitty service. I don't have to pay for anything when I didn't eat or drink the HALF glass of wine. I have a right as a customer to call your crap out and refuse to dine with you. So not only are they assholes, but they don't right their wrongs either. Thanks for the "credit". Oh and instead of bringing me the soda since they forgot it, the manager told me to call the cops if I want the matter settled. How professional!I was a loyal customer up until the night their waiter was an asshole about giving me a glass of water. If they had just handled the situation properly this time, they could have gotten back a loyal customer.They basically took back their decision to give me a credit for my crappy experience the first time and basically said it was OK for the driver to be a dick and not bring my soda.

Update: The delivery driver came back to my apartment with two cops to give me my money back from the tip and the lack of pineapple soda in my bag. He then proceeded to argue with me about the alleged glass of wine I drank without paying for a few weeks ago and me posting bad reviews. Because of this unnecessary drama and the inability of this restaurant to apologize for their staff and management's rude behavior, my 1 star review still stands. Extremely unprofessional and unnecessary. As I stated above, the waiter didn't pour me a full glass of wine to begin with. I took one sip, then the other rude dude who works there gave me shit for wanting A GLASS OF WATER. That is when I left. I have a right to refuse service or refuse to pay for shitty service. On top of that, I am not paying the price of a full glass of wine when it was halfway filled up to begin with, you cheap assholes.I recommend trying the Thai food place down the street. I heard the food is better anyway. And I am sure the service is better because you can't get much worse than this b.s.

Yum. We found this place by accident. It's right across from Sloans Lake in a little strip that is easy to miss but totally worth stopping in. 

The folks who own it are Thai and so most of the food is very rooted. Jade has been to Thailand- so I asked lots of questions about authenticity and much of it checked out- including the friendly demeanor of the servers. 

The pad Thai is great, as well as the other noodle dishes and our server was really great when we told him about dietary restrictions. We got an appetizer of the spring roll variation and it was delightful. 

Totally worth going out of the way for!

I am hesitant to even give two stars based on my most recent delivery experience... I ordered shrimp pad Thai and fried vegetable rolls... The veggie rolls were greasy and the vegetable filling was literally MUSH. The pad Thai had no flavor and was poorly cooked = over cooked shrimp and noodles. The egg in the dish was also overcooked which meant bites which tasted very gritty.  A couple bites of that and the dish goes in the garbage. Just not good! Very sad and disappointed as I had previously given an excellent review.  I suppose the food may be better dining in, but the most recent reviews of the poor service there don't make that a more appealing option... Too bad.

The food here was so good! I will definitely be back. I had this Traffic Light Curry sampler and I loved each curry flavor so much (red/green/yellow) I couldn't decide which was my favorite. Rice was a little dry compared to some of the authentic Thai restaurants I have been too but it was still good.

Food was very delicious. They have different spice levels from 1 to 5 and I picked 3 which was good spicy for me. We changed our glass of water as they have very small fancy kind cup of water. Quick service. Over all loved it.

Reasonable prices, hearty portions, tons of spice. Ordered take out so cannot comment on table service. All interactions over phone and at pickup were pleasant.

I thought the dishes (basil rice, pad see ew, garlic chicken) lacked a little flavor, veggies were a little soft, and meats over cooked. Pad see ew was the best of the three. A very reasonable place overall to grab a bite but not the best place around based on this trip.

Wow I'm floored by this amazing cuisine! Picked this place based on the reviews and must leave one of my own!
Got delivery since I'm at work. They quoted me 30-45 minutes and they arrived in 25. They asked when I placed my delivery over the phone if I was paying with cash or card, so everything was streamlined and fast!
My food arrived steaming hot! The crab fried wontons are alright, a little over fried in my opinion but not too oniony! The 'sweet and sour' to go with the wontons is clear!? They make it homemade! I've never had it clear but it is as advertised & delicious! Actually some of the best sweet and sour I've had!
The Pad Thai- I've never had before anywhere but was wanting to do something different and a classic. And with the name "Thailicious" you should probably try something they're going to make perfect! They've sold me! I got it "Hot" out of mild, med, hot, very hot, and Thai hot. My nose is running it's PERFECTLY HOT!! Big juicy lime to squeeze over the dish, a good amount of chicken mixed in, noodles aren't over cooked. REALLY AMAZED WITH THESE GUYS!!! The flavor is complex and I love the lighy "peanut butter" after taste. YUM!!!! Cannot wait to dine in!!!
You will be 100% satisfied!!! TRY IT!!!!

The Thai food is excellent, the service is very good, and the view from the patio is wonderful. We've been here a few times, but today we got the Massamang curry with chicken and the pad Thai Woon Sen with tofu, both fantastic. We even get the butterfly pea tea, it's a dark blue tea made from some kind of blue flower. 

I recommend sitting outside and enjoying the view of the city from across the lake.
Seriously one of the best Thai places in Denver. Inexpensive and truly amazing food. The view of the Denver skyline is a really nice touch. Get the Pad Woon Sen w/ Beef (medium)

Food is absolutely amazing! Truly authentic Thai cuisine. I had the Pad Sew You noodles and they were delicious. Everything is made to order, so the food is fresh. Just a quick note that medium spicy-ness might be a little too spicy for some, so going on the milder side might be safer for items like the Pad Woon Sen noodles.

This is definitely a neighborhood gem!

Actually never been to this restaurant we've only had delivery and they certainly have delivered every time.  They're super quick to arrive and the food has always been hot (we've probably ordered from here 10+ times).  Highly recommend their Pad Thai and the curries are always amazing.  My favorite thing on the menu is the Garlic and Black Pepper Buffalo, it's fantastic over rice or noodles with some curry.  Definitely highly recommended!

I had never been here before and took a date on a recommendation. The staff was excellent. The gentleman that took our order was very pleasent. My date and I ended up talking till after close. The staff did not bother us to leave at all. 

Aslo the food is excellent and prepared nicely. The resturaunt has a nice warm feeling. I will definitly be going back!

Thailicious is very different from what I would expect from a thai restaurant.  First of all they have a full bar with an interesting cocktail menu. I didn't order one, but they all looked delicious. Second, the decor was modern, hip, and had an open feel...very different from the clichè Asian theme in most Thai restaurants. Third, the service was leaps and bounds better than what I typically expect from a Thai place. 

As for food, I highly recommend the chili basil fried rice (HUGE portion...with leftovers I got three meals worth) and the Thai volcano. Both were fabulous and kept me wanting more!

Big fan. Ate here the first time with my friend and the food was fantastic.  Being gluten intolerant can really be a bummer when it comes to my favorite cuisines, but Thailicious has fantastic gluten free options.  Highly recommend!
I just had a really nice lunch. Food was really good  and the atmosphere was nice for a random Tuesday with a friend. I will eat here again for sure.

Love this place when I'm craving Thai. The traffic light curry is excellent and a great way to sample three different types of curry. 

On a cold winter night the soups always hit the spot. I love the Tom Yum and the Tom Ky. 

To go orders are always fast and the staff here is pleasant. This place is definitely a keeper!!
We have tried this place a few times now that US Thai has been so overrun. They are always super fast and very nice. Although their pad Thai is good.. The sauce isn't as good as us Thai.

Love Thailicious! Finally found some great Drunkin Noodles in Denver! The flavors were there, the portion size was nice and the price was reasonable. The spice was just right at a medium to hot which I like.

Sloans lake is right across the way for a nice view and stroll after dinner. I liked the decor and the hand drawn art on the walls, you can look at it for hours probably and find new little things here and there. The bathroom was clean and had Thai girls in bikinis on the walls for your viewing please, lol. I really look forward to the next time I go back, it was fun and good.

Thailicios serves of very tasty Thai cuisine. The portions can be a little small for the price, but the flavor is BIG. 

Excellent curries, Thom Yum Soup and spicy stir fry are highlights. The interior is well decorated and has a warm contemporary feel. Service has always be solid. The patio is also a nice option with beautiful views of Sloan's Lake.
Delicious! Lovely atmosphere and great service. I will definitely be coming back here.

Love their food and their patio but the staff... Not so much. After many times visiting the establishment, this evening - server was shouting at the top of her lungs that they close at 9, but there's alway people that are here eating at close. .. She was ready to go. Also the staff tends to stray from the Thai menu and tell you how hot you should have it, weather than the way the traditional staff has it in the menu. The Caucasian guy that serves tables is the worst, rude, unhelpful... And customer service is a major thing he lacks. Don't expect any service after you order

Ordered the tropical fried rice specifically because I was craving the pineapple and spices that I love about that dish. I placed the order for pickup and when I got home to eat it there was not one piece of pineapple. Instead there was tomato and broccoli, which were not listed on the dish description. Pretty disappointed with the food but the restaurant and staff seemed awesome.

We've been here twice and both experiences were fantastic!  My wife swears that the Pad Thai is the best she has ever had, and I have found the Panang Curry, Tom Yung, and Basil Chili are the best I've had in Denver.  
While I love US Thai, the heat is a bit too much for my wife.  Thailicious delivers a well rounded flavor with all of the dishes we've tried and have very good ingredients. 
Dogs ok on patio as well!

Alright Thai food, but the worst service I've experienced in Denver. Did not see any service until we had been there for 10 minutes, and didn't see anyone again til they brought out the food. Had to ask a different server to get the check after looking around after eating. Food was good, but I would recommend take out.
Love this place . Turmeric rice chicken , awesome... Delivery is fast . Owner is always friendly... Good stuff
BEST Pad Thai  I have eaten. Great  service and a great atmosphere. The food had the perfect amount of spice. I ordered extra hot and it was perfect.
This is one of my favorite Thai restaurants! Everything I've ever ordered is amazing! Friendly staff. Great authentic Thai food!
I recommend the Green Curry. Served spicy, it's not for the timid

A lot of Thai restaurants in Denver are underwhelming. Lots of small portions abound with bland or just okay dishes.

Thailicious is an exception with decently portioned meals and food that lives up to its name. My group ordered the pad thai, a seafood basil dish and G.I. rice. All three were pretty good with the pad thai having wonton strips that made the dish nicely crunchy along with piquant flavors of peanut, tamarind and chile. The basil dish was very basil-y and pretty spicy too with red peppers. It was also well apportioned with shrimp and calamari. I've never heard of G.I. rice but it was an interesting and tasty fried rice with raisins, peas, fried chicken strips and ham slices...I guess the sort of thing an army private might make with whatever is in his kitchen.

We had the mango sticky rice for dessert...probably the best I've had in town. It was served in a martini glass and had nice chunks of mango drizzled with a thick and excellent coconut milk. 

Thailicious isn't quite the best Thai in Denver (that would still be Dancing Noodle in Parker in my opinion), but it's still quite good and wonderfully quite close to home.

I love, love this place. The restaurant is modern and beautiful. Their staff is so friendly and will take the best care of you whether you're a small table of two or a big party of ten. From delicious appetizers to unique desserts, they really know what they're doing. They also have a bar with an intriguing list of cocktails. Oh, the view of the lake is just another big plus!

Wow, how did I just now discover this place? Perhaps because I've been so fixated with U.S. Thai? We came for lunch and we're VERY pleasantly surprised. Excellent Pad Thai, delicious Coconut Soup, and an atmosphere nicer than just about any Thai restaurant I've ever dined at (and certainly a LOT nicer than the "competition"). Can't wait to come back here for dinner (or lunch again). Delicious!!!
Very nice restaurant near downtown Denver. Well decorated and nice Thai food. Truly spicy if one so desires; escapism sans alcohol.

Great service, delicious food, clean, healthy, my favorite Thai food in Denver and surroundings! A nice dining room and stellar views of Sloan's Lake and downtown skyline if you choose to eat outside. In my opinion way better than other local Thai restaurants, can't say enough good things about this place.

Updating to 5 stars because Thailicious consistently wows me. I haven't had anything yet that didn't exceed my expectations and make me wish my stomach was double it's size. I've tried various curries, noodles, had beef, chicken, tofu... I'm enjoying trying the whole menu. 
And now that it's summer with a patio view of the lake? Even had some World Cup on during dinner today. Love this place. Perfection.
Food and location are fantastic. Great gluten free options.

Wonderful dining experience and excellent food combine with attentive service and a relaxing atmosphere. It's a bit out of the way for us but if you are familiar with the Michelin guide, their recommendation would be "worth a detour." From now on, we'll be glad to make that detour as Thailicious trumps every other Thai restaurant closer to us. We had pad thai with shrimp and it was easily the best pad thai we've ever had. The flavors were so well blended and incorporated into the dish, it was hard to believe it was possible with this very traditional dish. The massaman curry with chicken was equally if not more so impressive. They have steamed options on their menu under the title Thai Country Style which I can't wait to try next. While I opted for a Singha, their drinks menu is extremely varied with interesting wines, including Riesling, and many cocktails (can't wait to have the Thai Bloody Mary).

The decor is very hip, elegant and natural all at once. A spacious interior filled an eclectic collection of comfortable "sofas" and dining chairs, some of which are cushioned, a wall display case of fresh vegetables, a TV and a full bar area complements the outdoor seating area. While Sheridan Blvd is right in front, there is also the undisturbed view of the lake and downtown Denver.

The private parking is shared with the other businesses and could be tight when it's busy so you might have to walk a few extra steps. Yelp offered to make us a reservation about an hour and 15 minutes after we expected to arrive, but the restaurant was not busy at all and there were plenty of available tables at around 7 on a Monday evening. Highly recommended.

This establishment has a patio where one can eat on a beautiful day and enjoy Sloan's Lake. Our visit was marred by the SURLY RUDE WAITER! When we asked if we could eat outside he rolled his eyes at us and was very unpleasant. We told him we would eat else where if it was too much trouble for him.  His obnoxious behavior continued throughout lunch. We should have taken our business next door. If Karl T. brings his bad attitude to your table let him know that bad behavior won't bring customers back for repeat business.

i decided to go grab a bite to eat by myself.i originally wanted chipotle, but if l figure i try this place out (let me add that i don't really care for cheesesteaks).

this place is amazing! the sweetest cashier by the name of pam rung me up, & she talked to me like we knew each other our whole lives, which was nice since i was eating by myself . lol i'll definitely be recommending this place to other people .

I hate to only give two stars. I used to LOVE this place when they were located on Peoria before the Light Rail forced them to move. Last night, my husband and I wanted really good cheesesteaks. I checked out the reviews here on Yelp and took note of how this place was under new management and different. Still, there were enough good reviews for me to check them out for myself. 

We drove 20 minutes to get these cheesesteaks. 40 minutes round trip. We get to the location and I'm immediately disappointed. The door was propped wide open for some reason. Maybe the building got smoky and they were airing it out, I'm not too sure. But it was 50 degrees in Denver last night and the whole restaurant (small space) was freezing cold. We had our kids with us, so it was definitely not somewhere that we could just sit and eat comfortably. The menu looked totally different, The woman ringing us up was nice, but seemed a little out of it. Everyone seemed a little out of it. My husband joked and said they all seemed high, but now that I think about it, that very well could have been true. They told us that they were out of French fries, and that sounded so silly being that they're a cheesesteak place. My first instinct was why don't they run to King Soopers and grab some more, but whatever. They offered to give us onion rings or sweet potato fries instead without the up charge and that was very nice. As we were paying, I watched the guy with the long hair start my sons chicken nuggets in the Fryer and he touched just about everything, including our food without any gloves. If you don't care about that kind of stuff, cool, but I was pretty turned off. 

As we were leaving, the nice young man that brought the bag of food out reviewed our order and confirmed that everything was in the bag. He let us know that they did give my son extra chicken nuggets and that was nice too. However, we get home and it turns out they in fact never gave us our onion rings to go with the adult sandwiches. This was extremely disappointing. They already didn't have fries and then they shorted us by not giving us the onion rings that came with the meal. The sandwiches were yummy, but completely wrong. I'll take some fault though, I need to start being anal again and checking my bag before I leave food places. The experience was just overall not great and I'm definitely careful about how I spend my money and I want my $30 back! I'm pretty sure I'll never drive 20 minutes for a cheesesteak again after this. Hopefully this was just an off night and not an everyday thing, but I doubt it.

Have had the Chicken Philly Cheese Steak and other items.  Every thing I've had is really delicious and has awesome flavor. 
Chef David is a perfectionist and will not serve his customers nothing but the best. A person eats with their eyes first and when your food is brought to you its just gorgeous, cheese is all melted over the meat and veggies. 
They also have great kids menu.

 You've got to go try Chester's Philly Grill.
The owners are really nice! They even gave my daughter free chicken nuggets. Food is made to order and it's always hot. Favorite place
The house special cheesesteak was really good.  It's actually quite comparable to cheesesteaks in Philly.
The regular and large sandwiches are insanely huge. Very delicious food. They seem to have renovated recently so the seating is more comfortable than before. GOOD FOOD

This place tastes amazing, and you can choose which topping you have in your philly just like any other place!
Atmosphere- Small cute place, just like most Philly places I've ever seen. Everything was clean and inviting!
Service- The employees were great and personable. Very friendly, and it was also quick.
Food- Holy smokes my sandwich was amazing; just hearing and smelling it as it was cooked was almost torture because I couldn't wait to eat it! I CHOSE to get the philly with lettuce, tomatoes, peppers, and pickles; and I'm very happy that I did. Food was incredibly hot and I really liked that I could see the chef cooking it.
Price- Perfect price point! 8 dollars for a sandwich that fed me twice and left me stuffed both times.
Overall experience- This place is really great and I will most certainly make a habit of visiting.
Hope you enjoy your visit as much as my husband and I did!

I would've given Chesters a 5 star review but it has switched owners and just is not the same anymore. The cheesesteak I got was still pretty good, haven't tried any of the other new menu items so I can't say it's a bad place now but like I said it's not the same as it was
Good solid cheesesteaks and grinders for east coast transplants. Like most real cheesesteak shops there is not a lot of seating in the strip mall location but it is worth a visit for a to go order.
Food was amazing. There is limited seating but that is the only negative. Customer service was great too! I had the works cheesesteak, and it was phenomenal!

The house special steak sandwich is delicious. I highly recommend it. 

On another day, I ordered their supreme burger. There was nothing supreme about it. It was cooked charcoal black and I had to return it to get another one. It was okay. 

If you visit here, get their steak sandwiches.  No other place compares. For hamburgers? It's okay but nothing to rave about. 

The fries are okay; standard string fries. Lots of people do come here for their steak sandwiches.
The house special is the way to go. I typically don't like all that stuff on a sand which but he way he makes it is amazing. Highly recommend this location.

We LOVE this place!! The Phillys are amazing and the house special is the way to go! As my boyfriend puts it, 'it's the place to go for a MAN'S sandwich!' Customer service is excellent too... The owner is super nice!
Nothing too special but good for a cheesesteak fix. Had the mushroom cheesesteak. Was a little light on the cheese tho.
Amazing chicken philly! Definitely one of the best I've had. A great hole in the wall restaurant. Owner was there and extremely friendly. Highly recommended!

Bad experience. .... bad customer service acted as though I got on his nerves as I ordered. It was 30 $ for two meals and for the taste, I'm very disappointed.  I asked for ranch expected to be charhed he took my dollar gave me ranch them literally a min later someone else asked for ranch and he just gave it to him. Why was my ranch a dollar but someone else's free. Totally wack! Never goin back

This was my first time here and I was craving a philly. Not a difficult task to make an edible philly. And that's exactly what this place has to offer. A mediocre sandwich for a premium price. If I am going to pay $8 for only a sandwich, i expect something more than mediocre.  The reason for two stars is based on my experience and the lack of customer service that came with it.  Appears the owner is washed up and has given up on why he originally started in the first place. Time to change things up or shut the doors.  It satisfied my craving but I won't ever be back.

Guys could be a little more friendly, eff it...a LOT more friendly.  While we ordered, the cook and cashier stood there with blank and apparently irritated looks on their faces as we figured out what we wanted.  It took us maybe 2 minutes tops.  Strike one.

Secondly, there was no suggestions offered during our decision making process.  Some people scoff at this as being, "you're an adult, figure it out" kinda thing, but it DOES build repore and establishes some form of trust for first-timers.  Strike two.

Well the sandwiches were as expected.  They were tasty enough to calm the hunger, but not as good as a few other places I've been to: Taste of Philly, Pat's, and Abo's.  But overall, as I've got to give credit, the sandwiches were tasty enough to compete taste-wise, but not rise above the competition.  

Overall, if the atmosphere was more inviting (including the staff), and the selection was just a bit more robust (since two formerly offered menu items were merely blacked out on the menu instead of being removed, thus not conjuring an, "I wonder what those were/why aren't they offered anymore" response), this place might be more on the map.  Three stars...just for being more accessible in the Aurora area.

Never heard of lettuce on a Philly but that's ok I won't go back anyway... The bread is mushy and it just sucks,  It's not a true Philly cheese sandwich anyway. So if you go and you want a real Philly you will be pissed...

Very regular. Yeah that's how I would explain the cheesteaks here. A little salt would kick the flavor up a bit, otherwise the food is ok I guess. 

I've been here a few times nothing noteworthy about the food, but the people are generally friendly. On a cold day I would suggest getting the food to go though, because I don't think the heater works to well in here.

Wow, best take out pizza in Aurora I found. I've tried all of them in the 5 years I've been in the Denver area. Pizza always tastes good and looks delicious. Staff is super nice. Last time I went they messed up my order, only forgot the extra cheese and she didn't realize it till Min before I walked in, so I had to wait, a few more minutes for a new one, gave me both for free and told me happy 4rth! I'd definitely recommend this place. So sweet.

Delicious pizza at a reasonable price. They have never screwed up any of my orders. Delivery is prompt and you can always pick up in about 15 minutes. I've been going here for take out for over 5 years, lots of options for a pizza joint.

My husband and I decided to try black jack because we saw that they had the deep dish pan pizza. We have been craving deep dish and we ordered it w/ double garlic double cheese.
It is AMAZINGA EACH TIME WE ORDER! It is always crispy and it is always delicious! Never disappointed.

Delivered to our house twice and then arbitrarily decided they didn't want to deliver a third time, likely due to it being a busy Saturday night. When I added my address to the website, this was the first location that came up. They made me order from a second location which did not have the option of square pizzas and had totally different coupons available.

Sooooo happy to have found this place! Not only hadn't we found good pizza around, but also none that would deliver. The pizza and wings arrived quickly and steaming hot and exactly what we wanted. Don't eat pizza often but this place is going on speed-dial

Fantastic, quick delivery. I actually ordered on grubhub.com and the initial order said that it would be here in an hour. They had it to me in about 25 minutes piping hot!  The calzone is absolutely huge, but I like that it doesn't have a ton of dough. The pricing to add additional items is reasonable, and the flavor was impressive.   The BBQ chicken wings were nice and tender, and the flavor even without the extra bbq sauce and ranch was very good.  Highly recommend their food and I will definitely be ordering again.

We used to order from Pizza Hut on Friday nights. After having a few orders that did not taste as well as it used to we decided to try Black Jack pizza. 

Not only are they cheaper, they also deliver when they say they will and they never go short on the cheese! Tonight we ordered and were suppose to pay cash. The driver showed up and we had to large of a bill. It was absolutely our fault, not hers. She didn't show one hint of frustration while she waited during our payment over the phone to her store. 

I can't speak for all of their locations, but this one has awesome service and cooked to perfection pizza.
Love this place! I order from here just about every other week and they are super fast and the delivery drivers are always really nice! The pizza and garlic bread are always so good!

Blackjack Pizza is a tiny, takeout and delivery spot in Aurora that was close to our hotel -- about five minutes away from the Best Western. We got a small, hand tossed cheese pizza and one of their medium specialty pizzas with sausage, green peppers, red onions, and mushrooms. Both were decent. The hand tossed crusts were thick and chewy. They could have benefitted from a slightly crispier crust. Personally, I love a little char and blistering on my pizza crust to give it some added texture. The ingredients were ok, and the price was good -- about $15 for both. The service, both over the phone and in person, was excellent.

We ordered on line for delivery; Thai spring rolls and 2 orders of Pad Thai. Delivery charge was $2.00 plus a tip. The order arrived 40 minutes after ordering. It was exactly as ordered on line to include requests for separate spice levels on the Pad Thai. Since they felt that it took s little too long for them to deliver, the delivery included a free order of egg rolls. A nice surprise. The spring rolls were very good, stuffed with shrimp, rice noodles snd mint. The peanut sauce was tasty but  a little runny. The egg rolls were very good and included a nice sweet sauce. The Pad Thai portions were huge!  Plenty of shrimp and chicken and the flavor was great. There was enough to feed 4 people with the 2 orders. Next time I will try the Panang Curry. Having spent 7 years in Thailand, I am a fairly good judge of Thai food and these guys get 4 out of 5 stars. The only thing that keeps them from 5 stars is their use of Sambal Olek to spice the dish. If they had used traditional Thai dried chili, they would have gotten 5 stars. 

Second time ordering and taste was better than the last. Very good!

Tried a little something different tonight. Wife ordered Sesame Chicken and I got the Curry Chicken With Peanut Sauce. Both portions were very large, but the Sesame Chicken was extremely dry. The coating and sauce were fine but the chicken itself was close to inedible. Wont order that again!  The Curry Chicken was flavorful with lots of vegetables, but seemed just thrown together as the flavors really didn't blend well. In The future, we will stick to the Pad Thai and Panang. Those seem to be safe. 

Saturday lunch with my wife. She had her old standby (Pad Thai) and I had the Vietnamese Soup (Pho'). Another great meal!

I came here with a bunch of my co-workers and there was nice seating options for large groups. 

I ordered the chicken pad Thai. It was ok, but not something I would come back for. The food portions were huge and the price was very inexpensive for the amount of food served which is nice. 

Next time I dine here I plan to order the sizzling rice soup! It's hard to find this soup in most restaurants and I'm excited that they serve it. 

The service was good. Food came out in a timely manner.

it was my first time there. walking in it was very clean and well kept. the ladies at the front were very nice. i made an order for take out; 2 panang currys (1 hotter then the other), spring rolls, and crab cheese wantons. i was told 5-10 minutes for which was awesome. to this point it was fast, very friendly and overall pleasent. but when i got home i realized they had only given me 5 crab cheese wantons. the sweet and sour sauce was in a container so small the first wanton soaked most of it up. the spring roll was wrapped poorly and started falling apart after the first bite. and the panang curry was sub par. its not a bad resturant by any means. but the thai place off of tower road and hampden blows this place out of the water.

I have been here twice and I have had issues both times. The first time I got a lunch order to go which should have included rice and egg roll, but it didn't. Whatever, not a big deal. The second time I ordered two appetizers, only two appetizers, and I had to wait 40 minutes. At 8:00pm. I didn't think that would be a peak time, especially when making a very simple order. The food is good, but I'm not sure I will be going back a third time.

We ordered Chicken Satay and that was very good. Crab n cheese won tons were excellent. Won ton soup had bamboo and no other vegetables so I wasn't a fan. My husband ordered the Vietnamese noodle bowl and the noodles needed to be cooked just a bit more. The meat and sauce were good. It was okay so I will probably try more Thai dishes next time.

We love this place. We have never been disappointed with a meal here. We live a bit out of their delivery range, but they always deliver to us anyways and QUICK. We always order Chinese dishes here, so I don't know anything about their Thai selections. We highly recommend Thai garden! Yum.

Ordered beef pad si yew to go.. Was surprised at how quick it was ready... The portion was huge just like everyone else says.. But something about the flavor was completely off. The noodles were really salty and had a weird flavor. Huge chunks of scrambled egg and to top it all off the "beef" tasted like breakfast sausage I ended up throwing it away. Waste of $11. Feeling disappointed and overall hungry. Guess I'll be sticking with Pearl of Saim and Thai Flavor.

I dig any place that you can order online for quick carry out! I ordered pad thai for lunch and it was ready to pick up in 15 minutes. Their regular pad thai comes with chicken and shrimp and love that I didn't have to pay more for both, only $7.25 for the lunch time pad thai!  I ordered it medium spice and there wasn't really any so I added sriracha at home. It wasn't the best I've had but then again, it was enough for 2-3 meals so I was happy about stretching my dollar! They have a varied menu and close to home with decent prices so I will definitely be back to try more.

I had a great meal here, by accident.  I came in wanting a plate of delicious carbs.  I asked the friendly server which dish she thought was better, the pad Thai, drunken noodles, or the Singapore noodles.  She told me to go with the drunken noodles.  I ordered drunken noodles with chicken...she delivered me drunken noodles with beef.  I tasted the dish and realized, yes that is indeed what I wanted (regardless of what I had ordered).  I recommend the drunken noodles.  There was one disturbing trend, almost all of the customers had to go orders.  I'm guessing the Christan Contemporary music may be a bit much for some.

Thai Garden at Quincy & Buckley is truly one of Aurora's little-known gems. As one might guess from its name, it offers a plethora of pleasing plates not only from Thailand, but also Vietnam and China.

From the appetizer section, the "Healthy Beans" are in fact the steamed in-the-pod soybeans sometimes called Edamame; your colon will give you a hearty "Thanks!" for ordering these fiber-packed wonders. Lettuce wraps with shrimp or chicken are another waistline-friendly possibility, while the seemingly ubiquitous chili wings, spring rolls and crab/cheese wontons are also available if you feel more like splurging. Another very good option to begin is the chicken and coconut soup which sometimes goes by the name Tom Kha Gai. It's light, yet substantial at the same time - no easy feat! (They also have the tangy shrimp soup called Tom Yum Goong if that's more to your liking). But as much as the starters may dazzle you, the main courses will truly leave you breathless.

Seeing "One Night In Bangkok" on a menu may at first give you bad mid-80s flashbacks, but don't worry - this dish of soft-shell crabs liberally drenched in yellow curry will have you singing a different tune by the time you lick the plate clean. Similarly, the presence of "Zinfandel Scallops", "Tequila Lime Beef" and "Tofu Drunken Noodles" may make you wonder if the kitchen is staffed with a bunch of lushes, but you can rest assured that it will all make sense on your first bite. Other ideas to consider are the chicken with a one-two punch of red curry and peanut sauce, the sliced duck with a bounty of shiitake mushrooms, and boneless panko-crusted pork. Don't forget to finish up with a fried banana or bowl of iced "dragon eyes" (longan fruit).

This is a nice gem in a neighborhood grocery center. The food is tasty. The prices are cheap. Lots of take-out, which is probably return customers. The dining area is comfortable and cozy. The staff is friendly and accomodatimg.

Atmosphere was ok but the food here was not to our liking. The Pad Thai was served with a weird red sauce and I found shrimp in it when I didn't ask for it. Luckily I wasn't allergic. My husband indicated that his food tasted like pre-made frozen dishes that were just heated up.
Would not recommend.

Made an order 10 minutes before closing. They called half an hour later, trying to act like i made a carry out order. Once he realized I'm not a dumb ass and knew i made a delivery order, he said my order was cancelled.

I absolutely love this place. I have been ordering out and dining in for years. The service is always kine and very attentive but not over baring I have eaten everything on the menu and have never been disappointed. I highly recommend this place.

Disappointed. Thai Garden was recommended to us as great Thai food. We are big Thai fans (but some would call us fake fans because we always get mild).

We started with Thai egg rolls. They were a bit tough (over cooked maybe?) and bland.

I had pineapple curry (mild). It still had the signature "kick" but the rest of the nuanced flavors (that make pineapple curry my fav) were lost in a bland, milky mess. Even the pineapples had been sapped of flavor.

My wife had the Hong Kong Noodles (I know, not really Thai). The serving size was ridiculously large (but I guess that's not always a bad thing). The "brown sauce" was ... ok. But the beef was very chewy and tough.

I should have known it wouldn't be good when the menu said that it was "Asian Fusion", that usually isn't a good thing. Then, the fact that they didn't even know what Tom Ka Gai is. IMO, the Green Curry was too sweet, and the Pad Thai had a funny flavor.

This is not a real Thai restaurant, this is Chinese owned and Chinese cook. therefore the food is Not Authentic Thai, its Chinese flavor or not real Thai'...its like go to eat Pizza at a Chinese own and cook...
We were not happy with the Thai food quality, and the price is high too...
We are not coming back.
Never to eat at a place that have all 3 Thai, Vietnamese and Chinese...it mostly owned by Chinese...They just cant cook all 3 flavors.NOWAY.

Great.....IF YOU LIKE HAIR IN YOUR FOOD.  Owner took $3.00 off the bill after i showed her that the hair was cooked into the orange chicken, disgusting. Should have comped my meal but only took off $3.00??????....Will NEVER go back.

I ordered the green curry with beef and it came with chicken.  When I called to tell them about it I was told I could come back and they would replace it with the right order and it would be on the house.  They would not deliver it even though they made the mistake.  Instead of being on the house as promised they refunded me $4 and the lady said I ordered the curry with chicken not beef and I know for a fact I ordered the beef.  When I got home there was a hair in the food.  So first they get the order wrong and then replace it with the right order that has a hair in it.  Very disappointing experience.

We love this place. They have some of the best Chinese in Aurora, they have delicious fresh spring rolls, and a great soup selection. I can't eat onions or peppers and they are very accommodating. They make sure to leave them out of any of my dishes, which means that they make everything per order. A rarity with Chinese food. They are so nice and it's the only place I'll order from in Aurora.

I love the food here! Every time I eat it it's delicious! The people who are running this restaurant know what they're doing when it comes to food and service. I thoroughly enjoy every experience I've had. The only reason I gave it four out of five stars is sometimes they can rush a person who is trying to take their time to decide. I have a son who is a vegetarian and kid offers for vegetarian food would be great! That could be something Else that would really make this place just rock.
