I always suggest that people eat their spicy foods as well as anything that they make soup wise.there always packed or someone packed but never dead I've been there at lunch and I've been there at dinner and I've gotten the same service both times overall I have a great experience like I said I just sometimes can feel a little rushed when they're in a busy mode it makes me feel busy.
Huge portions, and everything tasted great!

My boyfriend brought me here for dinner and I was impressed with the dishes. My margarita, though not fitting with my dish, was really great. Even though we were so full from appetizers and dinner we had to order two desserts so we could try everything. The rice pudding was super deliveries and the doughnut plate was a lot of fun!

My friends & I intended on going to the sushi place next door, but they were closed, so we decided to check this place out.  I'm really glad we did too! To drink, my friends all ordered Thai teas, which they really enjoyed.  One friend said it was the best she's ever tasted.  I ordered saki, which I split with a friend.  I ordered a large & we both easily got 3 servings out of it.  For dinner I got the shiitake duck in the brown sauce complete dinner ($12.95 + $2.00 for 2 cheese wontons & a spring roll, which is considered a "complete dinner").  The wontons & spring rolls came out before our food, like an appetizer.  They were absolutely delicious!! I actually got another order of wontons to take home! The food came out in a timely manner & everyone was astonished with how big their portions were!! The meal I got could have easily fed three people in my opinion!! This was my first time having duck & I loved it! Plus all of the veggies were so crisp & fresh! I'm giving this place four stars instead of five because there was an issue with our bill & they forgot my friend's order of crab wontons.  Also, they had boxes stacked out in the restaurant by the bathroom.
Omg, too Americanized. Their food is bland and the desserts not tasty. I wouldn't ever go there again.
it is really good. We got the happy family, the curry chicken taste very special. Very fridently service and reasonable price. Deserves to try.

This place is really over priced for mediocre food.  Their egg drop soup was 75 percent carrot chunks,  not sure what was going on there. 

The restaurant was empty. I'm beginning to understand why.

I was introduced to this place just this Thursday by a girlfriend.  I am now a huge fan!  We ordered delivery.  We ordered crab cheese wontons, sesame chicken, Panang curry, Kung Pao chicken, chicken lo mein, and egg drop soup that was not on the menu.  I was feeding a crowd :)  Everything was so good!  They even threw in egg rolls for free!  The delivery came quickly and was hot and really good.  Plus they deliver for free  I have been ordering from another place around my house that charges $7.00 to deliver and Thai Garden tastes better!  So I am super happy that my friend and neighbor recommended this place.  Will for sure continue to order from them!

Beautiful oriental decor inside but that's about it. Food kinda bland and tasteless, IMHO. They don't even serve Pho which to me was huge disappointment. I tried the Panang Curry and the Pad Thai. Although the Panang was in red font (spicey) on the menu, maybe it was, but it didn't leave a trace of sweat on MY forehead. They do serve alcohol which is a plus so you can get a nice bottle of Yellow Tail wine.  Also the parking lot had very limited parking space so I ended having to park at the Safeway next door.

Love this place. Always quiet, never have to wait long, food always satisfying. Pineapple curry and eggplant dishes are my favorite. Noodles are good too. And they can modify based on your dietary preferences and/or restrictions
Just recently tried the Vietnamese Rice Noodle Bowl (combination with pork, chicken, and beef). It was sooooo good! Enjoyed the Tom Yum soup too.

I love pad thai, and this place was on point! Their spring rolls with dipping sauce are delicious as well. They have pretty big serving sizes, but that is perfect because I save my leftovers and have more to enjoy the next day. It heats up nicely. The staff is friendly and the service is pretty quick for noodle dishes. The quality is consistent and I am a frequently returning customer! I strongly recommend Thai Garden!

Uncle took my cousins and I to this place when we came over to his house for late-summer vacation.

Ordered the chicken basil dish, expecting pad ka paow.. instead, came out something else that didn't even have any basil flavor in it. I asked the server to make sure she got my order right, and she double-checked it and said that was what I ordered.

Well at least it tasted good. Salty, but better with steamed rice.

One of my cousins ordered pad thai, and again.. something else that didn't resemble pad thai came out. We were a bit scared to eat it cuz the sauce was pinkish orange, but we tried a bite anyway and (as expected) couldn't finish it.

Ordered $50 worth of food, didn't even eat half of them & didn't bother to pack them home. They're so not worth it.

Two stars cuz the chicken basil tasted pretty good despite lack of basil, and plenty of parking.

This place made me realize that, living in California with plenty of good thai eateries, I shouldn't take them for granted anymore. As you can guess, I won't be back. Next time I visit this state, I think I'll stick to pho and homemade asian food.
We drove 20 minutes to try this place out since we were given a gift certificate. Was very delicious and enjoyed the chicken coconut soup and drunken noodles. Will make the drive here again!

This place made me fall in love with Thai food. Everything on their menu is great. Fried rice is savory and delicious. Their hot and sour soup is amazing. Spring rolls are crispy and flakey on the outside and juicy with flavor a on the inside. That's just some of their simple items. I order from here at least once a week. I'm addicted! Consistently delicious food
this is best Thai food I tried already, best customer service!! suggest chicken wrapper!!!!!

Just went to Thai Garden, the server was not particularly friendly but she was by herself and busy, so i understood the attitude. When our food came, it was decent. As my son, husband and I were eating,  I noticed a light colored hair mixed into my food.  I showed the server,as my family continued to eat, She took my plate to show her boss. The boss removed the hair And brought it back to our table,  stating that it was not their hair because it was too light.  We were so disturbed by their actions we could not believe it. she went back to the counter with the hair and they laughed about it.  Very disgusted!
I am writing this review from the toilet cause it wrecked me. Used to be a good place not sure what has changed in the last 6 mos. won't go back anymore

This is a decent restaurant.  Nothing too special, but I do like eating here once in awhile.

Most recently, I had the Minty Thai Chicken, which was quite good.  I paired that with the wonton soup, which I really liked.  Mr. Mixer had the Thai spiced soup to start and then the sesame chicken.  The chicken was just ok.  A little bland and a little too sweet.

We come here about once in a few months' time, and I think we'll keep coming here when we are in the neighborhood.
I would describe Thai Garden as fast food. I had coconut curry soup and pad Thai.  Generic and pretty bland. The portions are generous and reasonably priced. The service was good. Very hospitable.

For having Thai in the name, you would think it is a Thai restaurant.  I think there were only a handful of Thai dishes and the rest was Chinese.  I tried the Hong Kong Noodles and the Tom Yum.  Hong Kong Noodles was okay, nothing special.  It comes with shrimp, beef, and chicken (2 pieces of shrimp, the beef is kind of weird, and chicken is chicken).  The Tom Yum was like water that was mixed with a spicy oil with mushrooms, tomato, and red onions floating around.  Kind of a huge disappointment, lots of other better Thai restaurants around the area.
Love the Tofu Pineapple Curry and the Sesame Tofu.  Ordered a dozen times and will continue to order again and again.

The atmosphere is fun and different.  Their food is fine.  I had jalapeño chicken and there was plenty of chicken and veggies on the plate.  My rice was in the shape of a pyramid. My husbands was in the round.  Very nice touch. He had the sirachi beef without onions so they gave him a lot of broccoli.  I just like a lighter sauce.   It's in the neighborhood so we will go back I am sure.  Plus they deliver.

Thai Garden is a really good restaurant, the staff is great! They're always so sweet to my 3 year old daughter and the wontons are amazing. 
My favorite dish is the Thai Basil Chicken, slightly sweet and spicy, but it gets much hotter as you eat!!!
My daughter loves the lemon chicken, and usually eats every bite.

Much better a second time around, though frankly I stayed away from that Thai BBQ Chicken disaster. Came here with Sahib's baby-mama and her offspring. We ordered two types of rolls for starters (traditional cold Vietnamese and crispy spring), both tasty and with delicious dipping sauces - a sweet curried peanut sauce (same you'd get for Satay), and Thai sweet'n'spicy - my personal favorite. Of course, they rock the Sriracha, too, so taste sensations abound!

Our mains were decent and Sahib's baby's mama's babies ate all their food, so that's a darn good sign. Plus, I like Fusion. Any kinda Fusion, really. Asian, European, Cold, Nuclear... it's all about the Fusion. We'll come back again.

Optimus OUT!
One of the best! It is never very crowded but the food is always great and fresh. The seaseme chicken is the best around!

We turned up at TGAF and wondered if the place was closed - there were a couple of cars in the parking lot, but it looked kinda dark inside. Sure enough, it was indeed open. I liked the decor - a wall of colorful silk flowers and grasses greets you by the door, and inside there are life-size fake palm trees, and over-sized Ming-style vases. But it was so... empty. To cut a long story short, one of the servers explained that the restaurant had just experienced a partial powercut. Thus they had limited lighting and cooking facilities, but there was no AC, no TV, no music, and no telephone lines. Sucky... But at least we got our food!

The Tom Yum Goong ($6) was decent, but once again I sadly reminisced about the mind-bogglingly good TYG they served at our fave Thai restaurant back in Columbus. His Pad Se-Lew ($9) was a tad sweet but still really good (gotta love those wide rice noodles). Happily, the star of the show was my Crispy Duck ($12). I was a bit wary when I ordered it cuz you never know if you're gonna end up with a pile of ducky bones and fat, but this was definitely not the case. There was a LOT of meat, and the skin was perfectly crisp. The accompanying coconut/peanut sauce didn't taste especially homemade, but it was still quite good (drizzle sparingly. A little goes a long way). 

Despite the restaurant's setbacks, I wouldn't hesitate in returning. The duck was fantastic. I hope it wasn't a fluke.

They really need to take out "Thai" out of their name and change it to Chinese. This place wasn't anything close to a Thai restaurant but more of an overpriced dollar scoop spot. Don't waste your time if you are looking for a tradition Thai restaurant, everything will taste like sesame chicken.

THe only reason it gets a two is because the food was ok.  I ordered for delivery and based on the customer service I will never order again.  An expectant and ungrateful employee has lost them whatever I would spend annually as well as a bad review via the web and word of mouth.  Congratulations.

Out of 5 *:
Food *****
Atmosphere ? (only did take out)
Service *** (only did take out; -1 * as I hate those "TIP" jars)
Price $$  ****
Overall:  ****1/2 (Rounded to 5* for my YELP rating)

Alright.  Let's get something straight.  YELP can be misleading.  I skipped this place to try PEARL OF SIAM, and I must say...I SHOULD NOT HAVE!  IMHO, this is the best Thai restaurant in the neighborhood.

Jonesin' for some Thai again (when am I not?), so I gave this place a shot a few weeks back.  Hadn't been here since it was Thai Basil, and at that time, I was not impressed.  At that time, Panang only came as MED-HOT.  Why?  Don't know.  But that was then and this is now "Thai Garden", and all is well in Panang land (and Thai land for that matter).

A few weeks back, I ordered panang chicken (mild) and some Thai Spring Rolls (aren't these really Vietnamese?).  Must say that both were really tasty and well balanced.  The rice paper Spring Rolls were CHIPOTLE-esq (when compared to other Thai/Vietnamese restaurants)!

Went back last night and was not disappointed.  Got some Panang Chicken (med), Pad Thai (mild), Thai Spring Rolls, and TYG** (or Thai Spiced Soup).  All were great except the TYG.  It was so-so.  

Panang Chicken:  ****1/2
The Panang Chicken even had some tomatoes in it!  
And for your information, Wild Ginger, tomatoes in Panang Chicken is Da BOMB!   Don't give me the "won't taste right" line, Wild Ginger.  How about "we are cheap" line instead.  (vent over)

Pad Thai:  ****1/2
The Pad Thai was really really good for noodles.  Even with take out, it was not a glutinous mess.  The noodles separated well, the chicken was not dry, and the egg added nice flavor.  Maybe it could have used some more crushed peanuts and bean sprouts, but that was it.

Thai Spring Rolls:  *****
Big.  Soft.  Flavorful peanut sauce.

TYG:  **
(BTW, the BEST TYG is at Moon Thai Express; only thing MTE needs to add are some button mushrooms, and it would be perfection)
Not much in this soup except for 4-5 shrimp, onions, button mushrooms, and peppers.  Flavor was so-so.  I always add rice to mine, and that made it bland.
Compared to MTE:   6-8 shrimp, onions, pea pods, bamboo shoots, water chesnuts, baby corn, peppers, and carrorts, but no button mushrooms. :(  Plenty of flavor even with rice added.


The best kicker is that the amount of food provided for the money is AWESOME! 
Let's review...
32oz Panang, ($9)
32oz soup, ($6)
2 Chipotle-esp Spring Rolls, ($6)
dense Pad Thai* (must have been 5lbs of food), ($9)
2 fortune cookies 
--------------------
$31 (tax included)

Channeling my best Arnold (minus the love child)... "I'll be back."


*(and for some reason I got shrimp in my Pad Thai.  Not complaining, but those allergic to shellfish need to be careful that their dish was prepared correctly.)

**[For those not in the Thai-know, TYG=Tom Yum Goong (hot/sour soup)]

UPDATE:  updated the "atmosphere" and "service" description.  Sorry if anyone took it to mean that they do not deliver.

I've only gotten carryout  there once, but I'd go again, so at least we can say the food didn't hospitalize me.

I went with basics - pad thai and chicken sate.  The pad thai, while not the best I've ever eaten (it was a bit dry), was pretty good, and the portion size was awesome.  I also asked for tofu instead of chicken, and they gave me a lot of it.  Like the pad thai, it was a bit dry, but I was craving it so much I inhaled it anyway. 

On the sate, this was a little disappointing.  The amount was generous, but the chicken was a little overcooked.  However, what really annoyed me was the peanut sauce.  They gave me about a teaspoon of it in a miniscule container.  It was very runny, but also nowhere near enough.  I asked for more, and he gave me a larger container and told me it would be 50 cents.  Not a biggie, but seriously....when it's that runny, just give it to me already!  Also, it came with a couple bites of fresh pineapple.  That's when the "pan asian" kicked in and I realized this wasn't true Thai.

What almost bumped this down to 2 stars (but I'm feeling generous) was the manager or whoever was on duty when I picked up the food.  He was surly to the point of rudeness.  For example, when I ordered tofu instead of chicken with the pad thai, I wanted to make sure he didn't assume I'm vegan and leave off the egg, etc.  (I've had issues with this in the past when tofu isn't listed as a menu option).    So I clarified that and he looked at me like I'd just grown another head.  And then he copped an attitude about the extra sauce.

As long as people don't expect this to be totally Thai, it's decent enough, and the  prices are reasonable for what you get.

Went for lunch.  Nice interior with about a dozen tables.  I had the Lunch special Thai Basil Chicken.  It's served with soup, egg roll and rice.  The soup and rice were okay.  The eggroll was very crispy.  The chicken had a lot of veggies which is good.  The basil flavor wasn't there.  My sister had the sesame shrimp and that was crispy good.  The price was reasonable.  It was about $15 for two lunches.  Very good for the price.
Great food and service, quiet, plenty of parking. Takeout is pretty much always ready in ten minutes. Love their pineapple curry. Definitely recommend this place.
Got the Thai Spring Rolls.  From what I remember, the peanut sauce was thicker last time I was there.  The flavor of the peanut sauce was good, just that it was too runny.

Small family owned restaurant.  Mix of Asian entrees. Clean and friendly. Sometimes the service is a little slow for the number of customers.  The food is good but my taste buds weren't exploding into space or anything.  Maybe thats a good thing.

I live in SE Aurora -- land of chain restaurants and big box stores. 
Ironic, since I hate chains ( except PF Chang's), but I get sick of driving into Denver for meals out.  last year I wandered into Thai Garden and could swear that it was a Thai Basil, but either way, I liked it.  
I gave it a 3 stars...but I have 2 different categories-- Budget and Upscale
This is a budget 3 star restaurant  Versus an Upscale 3 star like SwimClub, Broker, etc where you'll pay $100 for a couple and your expectations are higher.
So, on my 1st visit, I was inbetween appointments and had a good hour to kill.
I ordered a lunch special and was really pleasantly surprised.  Nice portion of meat/veggie, and although I didn't want the sides, you also get an egg roll and rice of your choice.  I did order a hot/sour soup ( the best hot/sour in the greater Aurora ) and wasn't charged.  Not sure if it comes with the lunch, or if they subbed the other stuff.
I've been back at least a dozen times, and each time we had a great Chinese lunch -- I really can't call it Thai, but it doesn't matter, it's tasty.

I think I have eaten IN the restaurant once, the rest of the time it has been takeout.  I enjoy all of their curries and the wife likes the pad thai.  My only complaint I have is the "spicy" rating system is wrong.  We have tried several "spicy" items that weren't and the other way around.

This place is truly a hidden gem. For starters, the service is extremely welcoming and friendly. The handmade non-alcoholic drinks are unique and incredibly refreshing, especially when enjoyed on their covered patio on this warm summer day. My wife had the garlic curry yakisoba, which was excellent; however, I was all the more impressed by my order of Flavorsome Ramen that featured oxtail.

We look forward to trying their other offerings next time.

We came here on a Friday night. They were not busy. Thirty five minutes of waiting and no food. Not even our appetizer. Our waiter was MIA too. The final straw for us was when we saw a table seated 15 minutes after us get their food. We asked for our check to pay for the beers and our waiter a.) had no idea we hadn't gotten our food and b.) didn't comp our drinks as an apology for wasting our time. We will not be back which is a shame as the food was good on prior visits. 

There is something so gratifying about a bowl of noodles even in the dead of summer. Meeting up with a friend we chose to give this a try. For the starter we shared duck buns. The buns were the perfect soft foil for the warm salty duck meat, hoisin sauce and basil. Take a swipe through the chili oil and you're in business. 

I went with the oxtail ramen noodles which were a gorgeous work of art when they arrived to the table. Slices of colorful fish cake, meat, fish roe, butter lettuce and gorgeous shimmering broth made a fabulous initial impression. The taste sensation that followed was among the best ramen noodles I've experienced as of late. 

The hubs got the pork belly sesame ramen which was tasty but I thought the oxtail was the better of the two.

I was really disappointed. It's a ramen place in Highlands, my expectations were fairly high.

To start with, the two most important parts of any ramen dish are the noodles and the broth. I ordered the spicy and the broth had a very strange taste to it. I was tasting it for hours after.

The noodles are not what I'm used to. They had a strang, almost thicker texture than most ramen I've ever had. The meat itself was very fatty and disappointing. Really, there was nothing I liked about the dish.

I think the server was nice and they were quick, but the entire experience was well below expectations

We get in and we order and everything is fine. The food was fairly good. I got the pork belly, which was good but I wished it was a bit more tender. The weird part didn't start until the middle of our meal. My friend asked for a coffee and then didn't get it. He had to ask 2 more times before they remembered. After that we tried to get our check for probably about 20 minutes. We had 2 ppl waiting on us and they kept walking by us over and over again. By the end of it I was waving them down which I absolutely hate doing! I used to be a waitress and I don't like doing that. Then my friend kept asking for a box and they kept doing the same thing... They just kept walking by over and over again. I think we counted 5 times. Finally she had to get up and track down one of the guys and he goes "oh yeah!" And hands her a box. While he's handing her a box our other waiter just waved to her... Just waved... Said hi... It was a super weird experience and by the end of it kind of comical. 

In summary:
Food is good. Service is HORRIBLE!!

Interesting place where you enter through the back patio. To get there you have to walk through a small space between the buildings. I can't imagine that being meeting fire code regs, but maybe the far back space is open (not sure).

I tried the ox tail ramen. Never had it before but the waiter said he grew up on it and loves it. I wasn't thinking I wouldn't order it but decided to give it a try. It was pretty flavorful but like other reviews mentioned, very oily/fatty in the broth and meat pieces. I also got a hard grizzly, round flat object in one of the meat pieces. I doubt I will order it again, but am glad I ventured to try it.

Someone else ordered the curry ramen and she seemed to really like it. Another ordered the duck fried rice which was okay but apparently not that special. All in all, the service was great,   food tasty, and group of us had interesting conversations.

Oh my dear lord stop whatever search you are doing and GO HERE. I don't know what these bitter, sad people are leaving low reviews for. I died in Sera's eating that pork belly ramen and then the hot sake brought me back to life. Service was great, atmosphere is intimate and welcoming. I wish I lived in Denver so I could eat here every night of the week.

First time here was earlier today for lunch. I have to say this is the first ramen joint I've been to in Colorado and it did not disappoint. I ordered the flavorsome bowl which I think deserves a more awesome name than that. The broth was definitely flavorsome and the meat was amaaaazing! Overall everything here tasted great and the service was great as well since we were the only ones there. Small, cute little place with awesome food! Also forgot to mention it's the first ramen place I've been to that also has beer and sake so extra plus for that :)

I wanted to like this place. I just ordered the strawberry limeade and the Wrapped Crisp (shrimp) for lunch since I was in a hurry.  The first bite into the shrimp crisp, I knew these shrimp had not been cleaned/deveined, so I tried another one.  Again - ick.  I even asked the waiter to go ask the kitchen staff if they do clean/devein the shrimp and he came back saying yes.  See the photo.  It's such a simple thing to clean & devein them, I don't know why they would shortcut that.  Totally turned off.  Also, no seasonal vegetables in evidence in the ones I tried.

Stopped in for a hangover breakfast cure. It worked out because I've been wanting to try it and I was right in the area. We were the first ones in for the day and were greeted right away by a nice server. He told us a lot about what was the most popular and what he recommended. Everyone got something different. I tried the spicy miso ramen. It was super yummy I could taste every bit of flavor in it. 

I was starving and slightly hungover and it was the perfect cure and unconventional breakfast. I shall be back for sure.
Outstanding! I lived in Japan for over a year. This is the real deal. The yakisoba is killer! :)
Good food. Friendly service. Small. Have to go between 2 buildings to get to entrance.

I love ramen. Went here today for the first time and got the spicy dashi chicken and it was awesome. The only thing I didn't like was the mixed salad greens that got all witty and weird in the broth. But the broth was freaking delicious so I ate it anyway. 

Cute patio, loved the atmosphere, and the service was good. Can't wait to go back and try every single ramen on the menu.
This place is cute! Ramen was flavorful and reheated up well the next day. Met the owner who was bussing tables.  Pork belly was a little overlooked but not a deal breaker.

Was excited to eat ramen ! Drove in for the Broncos game and wanted some authentic ramen. Ordered a few different things and was very disappointed in how much fat and grease was in the oxtail ramen broth. Ramen was severed cold and had no flavor. 
Boyfriend had bones in his duck sliders and the portion size was small For the price.Never will come here again.

This was a weird, wonderful surprise. We almost didn't go in because you enter through a little opening between the buildings and we felt like we are going into somebody's backyard. I'm glad we took the chance what a great little place with a lot of personality. 

The Roman was very good. The menu was somewhat limited, you can tell this is a newer restaurant. The atmosphere was great but the music didn't really match the environment. But if that's the worst thing about a restaurant they're in pretty good shape.

Give it a try my friends.

Definitely order the Sesame Pork Belly Ramen! 

Some of the best ramen in town! Left completely satisfied! Waiters are nice, as well as the ambiance.

PS: if not the pork belly, the Spicy Dashi (comes with chicken) and Flavorsome (oxtail) are also great!

Here's what you need to know. 35 minutes after ordering and no food was delivered. People seated after us were served before us. They didn't even try to make things right and gave an insincere "sorry". You vote for good restaurants with your dollars, spend them somewhere else.

We stumbled upon this place while walking to the German restaurant  next door. AMAZING!!!! Service was fast and super friendly. Oysters were perfect. The oxtail is one of the most satisfying  Ramen dishes I've ever had (I eat Ramen 3x plus a week) Duck fried rice was so full of duck and crispy it's exactly what youd expect but with way more succulent duck! If I lived in Denver I would go here everyday, I'm not kidding that's how impressed I was.

First time in and it won't be the last.  The Vietnamese egg rolls were fried to perfection.  The flavorsome #3 is beyond words delicious with oxtail that melts in your mouth. Portions are great and the price is very affordable.  Family friendly and a nice spot for couples too.  Nice outdoor seating on patio.

I have tried several Ramen houses in Denver and this is by far the best! Nice ambiance and great service. The flavorsome oxtail ramen was dangerously delicious. Just the the right portion left me full but not stuffed. The broth takes 12 hours to make and you can definitely tell. It had a savory richness that's hard to describe. I recommend adding just a pinch of the chile paste to add a little spice. My wife had the spicy miso chicken which was also amazing. The chicken was surprisingly flavorful and the broth had a wonderful savory sweet spice to it. We will be back for sure to try some of the other flavors and dishes.

This place is truly an enclave! I went into the alley way as the arrows directed, and it opened up to this cozy private patio with trees and flowers, including a mint patch. At first I thought it would be only me, but the place was filled with people. I ended up waiting, but it was definitely enjoyable. My boyfriend wanted to try several of their drinks, esp the Calamansi. We also tried the berry sake, our waiter recommended, It was so different, but so good with the fresh berries. 
Their ramen broth on the menu was interesting. Not the usual soy or nutty pork fat. My boyfriend tried the Saigon curry ramen and I had the oxtail ramen. They were both rich in flavor and the garnishes fun. We sipped the bowl clean...! 

I think this is a creative twist I haven't found with other ramen shops. A must try for Ramen lovers. We are sure to come back. This place has our attention.

I was really excited to see a ramen restaurant on 32nd. I tried the Dashi miso ramen, it was a little bit spicy, had small slices of chicken and some veggies. They serve a good portion of ramen noodles, not too much or too little. Overall this was a tasty dish, but not sure I'll find myself craving it. I would like to try their other dishes as well. I didn't care for the music playing, at all. It sounded like music I'd hear at a nail salon. Overall not super excited about the restaurant's vibe, or lack there of, but food was good. They should add some decor and work on making it a better vibe, but think they know what's going on in the kitchen.

Just what I needed!  Starting to have a sore throat so i wanted a bowl of ramen even though it's almost 80 out today.  I had the oxtail and hubby had the pork belly.  Duck tacos for apps and hubby doesn't like duck.  He loved them!  Ramen broth was rich and beefy.  $14 is still really steep for a bowl of noodles but we are in Denver.  I've had ramen at a few different places (Sushi Hai, Kobe An in Cherry Creek, Osaka Ramen and Bones) they are all on par with each other.

The ramen was good and was much more authentic than the other ramen place called Uncle down the street. My only problem was that the chicken in my ramen seemed a little undercooked, and that tarnished the experience for me. I know beef  typically served undercooked in ramen and the hot broth cooks it more, but undercooked chicken is not good to eat.

Love this place from the atmosphere-sit outside in a quiet, relaxing area, to the service-excellent customer service with the best wait staff, to the food-excellent, delicious, innovative, filling so that you hate to leave a drop. 
Must try! I highly recommend.

We were sad to see our neighborhood restaurant Bang! close, but in its place opened Sera's. We walked up to the restaurant for lunch today, and we loved every single dish.

We started with strawberry limeades (so fresh) and the duck sliders (served on large steamed buns). Our 11 year old son raved about the sliders, and for great reason - the sauce on the side was perfect - spicy but a little sweet, and much more interesting that a typical Sriracha sauce.

My wife had the chilled ramen with beef. I had the Red Seoul Ramen (with poached quail egg). My son had the "kids ramen bowl" with chicken. 

The ramen broths were top notch. They don't use pork, but use chicken, beef, and oxtail broths, so it's not traditional in that sense. However, the broths are very flavorful and perfectly executed. 

I've eaten quite a bit of ramen, including at top rated places in Portland and Vancouver. Sera's does a very good job and has some interesting riffs on classic ramen dishes. 

Highly recommended.
Ranen was delicious! We had the ox tail and the pork belly ramen and they were so flavorful.  Our waitress was awesome! He gave his suggestions and they were great.

This place was an awesome hidden gem! Nice little outdoor patio and extremely friendly staff that sat us immediately and started rattling through their favorite dishes. We ordered the crepes and two different bowls of ramen. Everything came out speedily and our server checked on us regularly but not annoyingly. Food was excellent! Good blend of spice and flavor with nice accents to help cut the heat. We actually saved our ramen so we could have some the next day despite wanting to slurp it all up. Highly recommend!! But not too much we don't want it to get too busy!

I have yet to dine in at Sera's but I have gotten takeout three times and it's been consistently amazing. The dashi miso ramen broth has a delicious authentic taste, the chicken is so flavorful, and the noodles have a fresh bite.  The curry ramen was everything I hoped it would be as well- spicy, fragrant, addicting. The veggie ramen  is good, but probably the least complex of them all and could use more veggies.  I am SO pleased to see this restaurant in the hood and can't wait to dine in with them and try more things. 

One thing I'd love to see in the future- an authentic pho broth to add to their short list of amazingness...I just got back from Vietnam and would love a really good pho option closer to home than federal.

I had take out from sera's for the first time today. Chicken ramen with curry broth was fantastic. Portion was large so will do for 2 lunches. Totally worth the price. Nice to have another option in highlands square.
Best ramen I've had in Denver. The vegetarian broth was incredible and the right level of spice. Feels like you're in a garden in back away from the street. Highly recommend!!

We ordered take out from here and I thought the flavorsl of the food we ordered were delicious especially for take out. We got the Red Seoul ramen, the curry yakisoba, and the crispy crepes. The crepes were no longer crispy from the ride home, but the flavor was still great. I would really like to try them and other dishes fresh at the restaurant.

However, I will probably wait a little while before going back. It seems they are still working out some kinks of being a brand new restaurant. My husband did have to wait a long time for take out (15-20 mins longer than the originally 25 he was quoted) and he said that a lot of the people in the restaurant were impatiently waiting on food as well. Also, the portions were kind of small. But I think that if they can work through these issues, this place could be amazing!

Great food great service, what more can you ask for! Definitely worth going back to.  The macha tea is great and the ramen is homemade and so tasty I didn't even need to add Sriracha or anything else.  My wife got the duck fried rice and cleaned her plate like Oliver Twist!

This place has amazing ramen. The staff are all super friendly and welcoming! I got the spicy dashi miso ramen and it was flavorful and not too salty.  My roommate is vegetarian and got the veggie ramen.  She enjoyed the texture of the noodles and the spicy veggie broth was perfect. The space itself is clean and has a nice outdoor seating area.

I'd go 4.5 if I could. The flavor here are different but compete with the infamous Uncle which you have to wait hours for. This spot is quite, cute, hidden, with indoor and outdoor seating. I absolutely love this little place and I hope the masses don't find out about... for my sake:/ we had the dashi chicken. The grilled chicken was delish. We also had the pork belly which had a super flavorful broth that I found better than the Dashi. As far as beverages go, we had the Thai iced tea and tamarind fizz. The fizz was tart but delicious. Try it. The server and hostess were also really nice which always adds to the quality. Anyways, new love!

This place definitely has potential. 

We had been excited about Sera's after reading about her story in Denver Eater and went to try it on Monday. We were seated quickly which was awesome and the waiter was attentive. The menu felt like it was still in the testing phase, unprotected sheet of paper that might have been printed at my house and still had some formatting quirks. There were no descriptions of any drinks, which were enticing by name, but not helpful otherwise. Here, our waiter gave good descriptions and recommendations. 

We ordered our food after reviewing the few selections, in the mood for ramen of course. My fiancé picked the spicy dashi miso ramen which was apparently the recommended fav, but he was disappointed with it. The noodle to broth ratio was way off--so many noodles and so little broth made it hard to enjoy soup and not a noodle dish. I found the broth to be rather smokey and didn't really care for it. The quail egg that comes with is cute, but the soft boiled egg that is typical with ramen was what we really wanted. 

I picked the flavorsome soup, which is made with oxtail broth and had pulled oxtail and I enjoyed it. The fatty richness of the broth was good and the oxtail meat fell apart nicely. One small issue was that their soup spoons, while pretty, were not so functional. 

I was most impressed with the drinks. I got the calamansi fizz which was basically a sweet carbonated citrus drink was tasty. My fiancé got the ikezo berry glacier and it was pretty cool--gelatin in texture but drank like a liquid. 

So three stars for food that wasn't bad but wasn't quite amazing, for an ambience that has yet to develop a personality and service that was expected. Hopefully as they get their sea legs, things will only get better. We're excited to try again!

Was visiting my friend from San Diego and he recommended this place. Had the Oxtail Ramen and the duck sliders as an app. Oxtail Ramen was incredible! The duck sliders were pretty tasty too. The sauce was delicious and was the best part of the sliders. But the oxtail ramen outshined everything.  Delicious!

I had the Flavorful Oxtail Ramen, it was AMAZING! The broth was delectable and the oxtail and noodles were plentiful.  There was an interesting delicate bunch of greens on top too, yummy!
Its definitely worth a visit!

Way better than Uncle and I used to be obsessed with Uncle. I've had great ramen in other cities and Uncle just doesn't do it for me (not as authentic, too rich, salty and makes your stomach hurt after). The ramen broth here is much more balanced and the one with curry broth is awesome if you're a curry fan! The only negative is we found a bone in one of our duck buns, but can be easily overlooked for how good the food was.

Yay to a ramen spot in Highland Square! We loved Bang! (the restaurant that was there before) so were sad to see it go, but are excited Sera's is so delish! We ordered the strawberry limeade and chilled ramen. Both were very tasty and fresh. We will definitely be back again!
The ramen was delicious and the patio dining area very comfortable. The meal was made better paired with a small but solid wine selection. The service was a bit lacking.

Had the duck sliders and they were perfect! Great flavor and nice portion size. Also had the Oxtail and it was great! Oxtail is a fatty bit of meat so don't order it if you don't like a little grease in your ramen broth. The server was very friendly and gave gods recommendations. I will definitely be back!

Dropped into to have lunch, liked the ramen, but was astounded by the $5 upcharge per bowl of soup for gluten free noodles...a $40 lunch for soup before taxes...the waiter mentioned a upcharge, but not $5 each, and didn't care at all when we asked about why so much and that they didn't say how much. Will not be back.

This place fell short for us. 

1. Like the location and fun hidden entrance to this place. The interior is nicely done. 

2.As a regular ramen eater in Denver the two dishes we order lacked flavor and came off relatively bland tasting when compared to similar dishes at several other Denver establishments. 

After ordering a dish and excitedly waiting for its arrival it was served with no quail egg. One of the reason I had chosen to order this dish, in the first place (eggs in ramen are the best!) 

After close to 10 minutes after my dish was served (they were not busy) the server came out to ask how everything was. I inquired about the quail egg and he told me yes, "it should come with one." After checking with the cooks he came back and said, " I was told we are all out of quail eggs, so yeah." 

Not exactly the type of response you hope to hear. No apologies, no can I get you something else, no Discount on the bill. 
I've had years of restaurant and customer service experience and his was response and lack of action was pretty weak and did not make us want to revisit. 

Unfortunately, we won't be recommending to others in the future.

Really, really good veggie ramen. I was disappointed when it opened without a veggie option on the menu - now addressed to great effect. A spicy (mushroom?) broth anchors a nice mix of greens, enoki mushrooms, and soft tofu. Comfort food of the highest order.
New Denver favorite. Spicy Miso Ramen was excellent. Vietnamese egg rolls fresh and crispy. Crepe crispy wi excellent fresh shrimp. Service nice and friendly.

Excellent food, depth of flavors......... It's such a relief to find good food in Denver! They make their own chili sauce, we want it for home, it's soooo good. Service was smooth, restaurant is super clean. Nice patio dining option as well. We'll be back. This place is a winner.

What a great little place. Nice, hidden patio in the back. Had the duck bun "sliders", which were delicious, and the sesame pork belly ramen.. also delicious. Very good service as well. Great addition to the growing Denver ramen scene. Maybe a couple dollars more expensive than I think it should be (the ramen anyway), as are most of the better local shops, but worth it in the end.

Yum!  This was the best meal I've eaten in awhile.  We shared the crispy crepes, one of the "specials" as a starter.  It was delicious: eggy crepes with curried shrimp inside and lettuce wraps, mint, and cilantro to wrap with it, plus dipping sauce.  It was extremely messy and I'm not sure I ate it correctly, but it was amazing.  I had the spicy dashi miso ramen, which was fantastic.  Hubby had the "flavorsome" ramen with beef. I didn't like it as well as mine, but he enjoyed it immensely.  The jellied, fruity sake drink was different and fun. I wish the beer, wine list was expanded and had a cocktail or two added, but we were good with our Sapporos.  Service was very friendly.  Can't wait to go back.

IF YOU DON'T LIKE WHAT YOU ORDER PLAN ON BUYING IT ANYWAY!!.. I ordered the veggie ramen it's the only thing I could order from the menu because Im Vegan. I asked for MY choices right up front..this is what I was told was my ONLY CHOICE. Me and my friend always go places for ramen She knows her Ramen. She took pictures before we started eating and it looked Good. I stired mine and then realized i DIDN'T have anything 1 slice of some veggie and ONLY a very small amount of garnish. My girlfriend tasted both and  said they were very very Bland I tasted mine and didn't like it it didn't taste very good  just to blend  and I don't put salt in my food . So I asked the waiter and was told that was it. & my only option. My friend decided to keep hers & ordered xtra spice and added salt to hers to try to get some flavor. Although she wasn't very happy with it she kept hers & are very little before asking for a box & her check so we could go someplace else. The check had BOTH our food.Thinking it was a mistake we told the waiter he said it wasn't a mistake. He actually told me I HAD TO PAY for mine. I reminded him that I did not eat it and that I sent it back full. I started to laugh because I thought he was joking BUT HE WASNT. when i refused again. He insisted and became very RUDE and angry like he wsnted to BEAT it out of me. I asked for the manager and he said he was the manager and I still had to PAY for mine. I asked for the owner some girl came out of the back and told me the same. I HAD to tell them to call the police.Any place i have ever been to if you dont like it they will make something else or take it off.  These 2 assholes started talking CRAP about me and my friend like we were not even there. Saying we were cheap and lacked knowing good food.THIS place is the WORST PLACE to eat ramen & on top of RUDE !!? I  WILL NEVER GO BACK TO THIS DISGUSTING PLACE EVER AGAIN. I have never been treated like this for something I didn't eat or like. Wouldn't this be LIKE going into a clothing store & trying on something and then having to buy it because you tried it on??? I've heard of you break it you buy it wouldn't that be like if I ate it I buy it??.. I didn't eat it ??   I didn't EVEN LIKE IT !!.. I didn't want it I didn't box it and I didn't take it with me..why should I have to pay for ANY of it??? This place will go out of business SOON ENOUGH. And by the way ANOTHER THING AS SOON AS WE LEFT my GF got a really bad stomach ache from her food. SHITTY FOOD! !! NO FLAVOR !!! CHEAP !!! RUDE !! .. I didn't even want to give them this one star but I have no choice

Ok, so let us preface this review with the fact that they have been open a mere few weeks, there are bound to be a few hiccups here and there. First off, having just moved to the Highlands it is refreshing to see another form of cuisine other than Mexican and Italian in the neighborhood. Secondly, with just relocating here from Seattle last summer we were prepared to adjust our expectations regarding the whole Asian cuisine of delicious noodles drowned in salty broth (pho, ramen, udon). Seattle's Asian cuisine is legit and we didn't have the highest hopes moving to Denver. Well, this spot certainly changed our minds. Amazing ramen, fried rice and service. I might be singlehandedly floating this business with my pick up orders for the foreseeable future.

Such great service and delicious food. We will be back ASAP! We tried several dishes and the ramen was perfect! Not too busy in there (yet) and had quick service & nice atmosphere. They also have a patio that's cute but we stayed inside. The drinks were Sake based and they had a good beer selection too.

I ordered the oxtail ramen (can't remember the name). It was a little on the small side and the noodles were cool but I'm chalking that up to growing pains. It was okay but it lacked the complexity I'm used to with a good bowl of ramen. I'm eager to go back and try something else since I don't want to base my review solely on one item. Hopefully my next visit will sway my rating because I really want this place to become a staple in my hood.

Such a good new addition to the neighborhood. We had 3 different entrees and each one was  really flavorful and delicious! And on top of that, the prices are really reasonable. The back patio is perfect for summer evenings. We will definitely be back!
Consistent and good.  Non-bleached buns  is a huge plus.  Getting more and more pricey it seems.  Family of 3 with an 8 y/o is still $40+

Okay maybe I'm cheap, but $8+ for a burger. The burger is okay the meat is the real winner. It's stops there the bun is mediocre, the burger itself is small and just to thrown together for that price. 
If you gotta try it try it but it's not what it cracked up to be. 
What's up with all the good review signage on the walls?? Is that to trick your mind into justifying you just got burnt on a overpriced burger you could make at home cheaper and better.

Stopped in for lunch on 5/15/16. Waited 40 mins for overpriced and disgusting food. Moreover, it was made incorrectly. The order ticket was correct, the workers couldn't seem to read it...??
Five guys is off of my families' radar for good.

The initial assesment upon walking in was very good. The restaurant smelled of good grilled food. The cashier that took the order was very friendly. Food was prepared promptly and was cooked to order. The only negative we had was that the tables and floors were not clean. The overall experience was great, and we will return.
I love 5 guys! The burgers are awesome and the fries are awesome! Customer service is great and it doesn't take long to get your food.

Not the best 5 guys I've been to I got the "grilled" onions and mushrooms maybe grilled for 15 seconds my onions were still raw as were the mushrooms if I wanted them raw I would've ordered like that other then that the burger was delicious and the fries are always good if my grilled toppings would've been cooked a couple more minutes id have given 5 stars
Very Exciting they added milk shakes to the menu. I always get a bacon cheeseburger with a side of Cajun fries. I have to give five guys credit for their great customer service.

Gross, greasy and dirty restaurant. Tried it once, tried it twice and will not be back. Quality, service and food leave A LOT to be desired. I understand and I get it..  5 guys. Low overhead. Too bad the product and service isn't what you'd hope it to be. Disappointing.
Good burger, pricier than fast food--so be prepared, and a little more out of the way than advertized when returning from the Airport.

Tasty burgers and fries...good iced tea selection.  General upscale Burger joint atmosphere......No complaints...but no raves either.

I'll be back

Love that they have so many free options for toppings but didn't like that the burgers are all well done.  The meat feels a little greasy but the overall flavor is great. 

The cajun fries were tasty but it was not cooked all the way through.  Had a chef friend with me and she said sometimes people can get sick from real potato fries not cook all the way through like the ones we ordered. 

They are all located pretty far away from me.  I probably won't come back.  It wasn't anything extraordinary with the exception of the free toppings.  I don't usually like chains but I think Red Robin has better burgers....  and so does In-N-Out.
Thanks guys just as good as I remember!

Never had to eat a burger in layers till today. I have been craving a hamburger for weeks.  I broke down today.  Went nuts. Lettuce tomatoes,  mushrooms, mustard ,cheese and bacon.   I can go happily back to salads.  But it was good just messy.

I could do without the mushrooms and the second slice of meat and the cheese but honestly I really enjoyed myself.  I had dinner at my house a few hours later and besides a drink I really was not hungry.  I made a yummy dinner that night and did  enjoy for a few nights afterwards.

This Five Guys has great burgers and fries like the other locations I've been too.  I've only done take-out here, but I did notice that the dining room seemed much smaller compared to other Five Guys I've been too, but that didn't really bother me.  The service I've experienced was fast and friendly.  I do think that the fancy Coke machine at the other Five Guys is really cool (lots of combinations of sodas and flavorings), and they don't have that at this location, but I mostly drink water when I'm there anyways.  Good solid, hot food.

Five Guys is one of those places you hear about from EVERYONE. All I heard was how awesome it was for what seemed like forever.  Everyday on the way home from work it taunted me when I passed it to come on in and try it.  So today, before catching a flick with my hubby, we stopped in for a couple burgers and some fries.  

I like that the menu is short and sweet (or savory in this case).  And the fact that they have big boxes of in the shell peanuts for you to snack on while you are waiting on your order is a nice touch.  It is counter service and the seating area reflects that - tables and chairs with a refill station and condiment station - well ketchup.  

When they call your number you go and pick up a big brown bag with grease soaking through it.  I am not complaining :)  I like a greasy burger!  So I am ready to be impressed. 

We opened the bag to see a bag FULL of fries.  We got 2 orders of reg. fries (which is a little cup), but they fill the bag with fries.  Seriously.  Tons!!  The burgers are wrapped up in foil and when you open them up you are greeted with a two patties of meat, 2 slices of cheese, whatever toppings you chose (jalapenos, onions, tomato in my case) and a white bun.  I couldn't wait for the first bite, and after sinking my teeth - eh, good.  Not great, not the best, but a solid burger.  The fries were next - these are probably the best part.  Fresh cut fries with just a bit of salt. Simple, salty, beauty.  

For the convenience and value, Five Guys is a solid deal.  I suppose it was just built up too big to meet my overblown expectations.  Still I plan to go back and try it again.  I can hear those fries calling my name!

Best burger I've had in Denver so far!

As long as you remember that you are in a BURGER JOINT, theirs are pretty tasty.  I had the bacon cheeseburger, which is actually a double.  They cook it to order, so it might take a little while to get your grub, depending on how long the line is.  The fresh cut fries are pretty good - huge portions!  Tasty!

The have a long list of free toppings, including grilled mushrooms!  Most places would either have some sort of shroom burger or charge extra for that.  Kudos for the toppings!  I got the grilled onions, grilled mushrooms, lettuce and mayo.  The toppings were falling off when I opened the foil wrapped handful of cheesy, bacon-ey goodness.  Tasty!

Not quite In 'n Out, but did I mention - Tasty!

I love any Five Guys Burgers and this location is pretty good, I have had really great customer service and also some not so great service here. 

One of the girls that's taken my order before was AWESOME! I asked her name but I forgot :( However, when I told her I would write a review she said she is also referred to as "the short one" haha.

The burgers are always amazing, a big variety of beverages to choose from and decent customer service. I've had a couple orders get messed up but even when that happens, they correct it quickly and still with a smile. One other thing, the fries at this location are never cooked all the way and often times very soggy and too salty, I order the little fry and can eat maybe 5 before just being over it. I've been to other locations where the fries are freshly made and cooked all the way through making them nice and crispy!

Overall, I will always be a returning customer for their delicious burgers :)
Good burgers and delicious fries. My only suggestion is that they melt the cheese on a cheeseburger. I like metled cheese on a cheese burger

Five guys has decent burgers and fries, they are like in and out, the burgers are pretty consistent with a large variety of toppings.  The Fries are usually hot and you get plenty with a little for one person or even two.  The best part of going to this Five Guys in my opinion is the staff I eat here probably more than  most people and have always found the staff to be friendly and it seems they enjoy their jobs.  Many people just go thru the motions but they do seems to enjoy working at 5 Guys and making my burgers.  I also like that they put the cheese between the patties so I can adjust my burger and it does not get stuck to the bun.

Pretty good burger although it seems the size of the beef patties have decreased while I am certain the prices have increased, dramatically.  $12.50 for  a cheese burger, fries and soft drink that is self serve.   They are kind enough to give you the cup while you wait for your grease stained sack of burgers and fries.  Fries are near the best in the land but back off on the portion size and price.  

I was there today at lunch time, 12:10 pm and the place was 1/4 full. just walked up and ordered.  Bad sign.  Watch your price points.  Get that burger, fries and a coke under $10.00 pre tax and you will be packed like you used to be.  

Pretty good food, poor value.

Food was good as normal but the environment horrible. The Place was freezing cold. I asked if they could turn it down and the just starred at me. Three different customers asked the as well. We ate quickly. Music was also way to loud to enjoy a conversation.

I came here late on a random Thursday night, so I had the place pretty much to myself and I had a great experience.  The service was awesome - the guy at the register was super welcoming and took the time to explain the menu and what the place was about.  For those who don't know, they're the east coast version of In-and-Out.  The place was spic and span clean and they had an rockin' classic rock satellite radio station playing.  Great atmosphere.

My cheeseburger and fries ended up just over $9, so that was a bit on the pricey side for a hybrid fast food / sit-down burger joint.  But the burger didn't disappoint, it was hot, juicy, huge, fresh toppings.  It did take them 10 minutes to make it which I thought was weird considering there were 4 employees and just me and another customer in the place.  

The fries were also very good - thick cut fresh cut Idaho fries with the skin still on, my favorite.  I ordered the "little" size and ended up getting half a bag full.  Sweet.

They have an option for you to call ahead or order ahead online, I would suggest this is you're going to be in a hurry.  Bonus:  They have free peanuts in the shell when you walk in for your table to munch on while you wait.

Greasy burgers are supposed to have tremendous taste, right?? So what happened to the flavor of my burger at Five Guys? I'm not sure how you can have so much "fat" and so little flavor, but they managed.

The fries are fresh, but the oil was not. The fries are soggy and somewhat unappetizing.

Then there is the price. OMG! Who wants to pay almost $8.00 for a burger with no flavor? While they have an impressive list of condiments, which are all free, they don't add much flavor to the overall experience, they just add moisture, which makes the bun completely soggy!

The condiments SHOULD be free, since you are paying WAY too much money for a sub par burger experience.

If you want a greasy, flavorful burger for a little less money, make the trip to Fat Burger. You won't be disappointed. You can get a meal deal at Fat Burger, and you cannot at Five Guys. I really don't understand the draw. I wont be back.

I got so annoyed about hearing about this place so often I finally broke down and went. My co-workers have been raving about it for months. I hope that it was my first and last experience with a 5 guys burger. Any place that has to assault you with plaques and banners that tout the tastiness of their food I am somewhat suspicious of, and here as it turns out I was rightfully so. 

I found two hairs in my fries. Not one, but two. You'd think a place like this would have their employees be a little bit better about hygiene, national chain and all... but no. 

Anyways, the food is actually a decent price compared to others, but was it worth what I paid otherwise? No. I suppose it is really a matter of personal preference, but I did not enjoy anything about my burger. My meat was undercooked and nothing special, the tomatoes were really hard. The pickles aren't dill like you get everywhere else and I couldn't even taste the grilled onions that were on my burger. The bun was pretty much the only thing I really was able to taste, and that was like potato bread or something. It was so huge and so soft; it tasted doughy, like they hadn't finished baking it. 

The fries were okay, again not notable or memorable and WAY too much salt. Like, if you don't use ketchup to balance it out, you may as well stick your tongue on a salt lick. If I got free food, I might be inclined to return and give them a second chance, but otherwise I told my husband he can go back on his lunch breaks.

I usually love five guys but this was an exception.  The person taking orders spoke little english and had to repeat 5 times, it was saturday at 1230 and only 3 tables. Waited a long time for cold greasy fries and a slimy berger that had to be eaten with a fork.  The tomato was so thin you could read the paper thru it and the lettuce was old and rusty, they brag about the peanut oil for the fries but no one told them the need to change it out or the fries are just greasy and nasty.  22$ for 2 burgers one order of fries and 2 drinks is a lot for a fast food mess. Disapointing . Are these the same people who want a better wage?

This is probably the smallest of all 5 Guys stores I have been to. I usually do take-out from this location. 

The staff is very friendly and the wait is usually not more than 15 minutes or so. You do have the option of calling in your order before heading over.

The burgers are a little greasy, but have lots of flavor. I love all the options they have for toppings. Although I like SmashBurger a lot more than 5 guys, I do drop in occasionally whenever I crave a greasy cheeseburger topped with grilled onions and hot sauce :)

Always a guilty pleasure.  Great for hangovers or when I just want to feel fat. My mouth waters as I begin to think of listing out my wanted toppings during the drive there.  After I order and wait listening to the rock and roll and sizzling grill my salivating really starts to increase.  As I see him scooping my fries I am basically drooling at this point.  Burger in hands gotta go

Wow...fries...and also meaty goodness.

I've heard good things about this place so I was down for tryin it out. Much to my surprise it was as good as people said. My friend and I ordered cheese burgers, mine was with green peppers,shrooms, and grilled onions. My veggies were cooked well and my meat was thick and juicy. It didn't fall apart like other similar chains do and wasn't over doing it. The only thing I wish was better about my burger was the cheese..sharp cheddar would have been the best.

And as for fries, this place has got you covered. A large frie here is enough for 5 people to split.

We always love to try new burger joints and this one's been on our list for a while so we finally pulled in today. The menu is pretty basic: burgers, hot dogs, and fries. They've got 2 different sizes of burgers: junior and regular. Apparently the differnce is that the junior is one patty and the regular is a double. 

You can get pretty much anything you want on it: bacon, cheese, and a whole host of condiments. You pay for the bacon and cheese but everything else is free. I like my meat well dead so I'm always concerned when I try walk up burger joints like this. I've had bad experiences before, but they have a sign up that says all burgers are cooked well done, and mine was. There was no pink, at least.

I got mine with bacon, cheese and BBQ sauce. I honestly couldn't tase the BBQ at all and looking at the bun it looks like it just had a little dab on it, but other than that it was really good. The bacon was nice and crisp and the 2 pieces of chz really complemented the flavor.

They have 2 sizes of french fries and I got the regular, which I'm glad I did. They gave you a paper cup full of fresh cut fries and throw an extra couple of handfuls in just for the hell of it. We ended up throwing some of them away because we were so full. You can taste the freshness of the fries with every bite and I have to say that the fries were about 10 times better than the burger, which was excellent in and of itself.

All in all, a good experience!

Love the simplicity, like In and Out, do something and do something well. The toppings options are somewhat overwhelming but after a few visits you start to figure out what you like. I would recommend always ordering the smallest amount of fries possible since they will basically give you twice as much as you order, throwing a scoop into your bag.
Food is okay. WAY TOO COLD in the restaurant to enjoy the food and the manager would not adjust temp. Had to go outside (in 30degree weather) to warm up

I always pass this place on my way home... I figured I'd give it a shot!  
Glad I did.  That's a good cheeseburger. There isn't too much to the menu either. I guess it's better that way. 

The regular burger was way too big for me. Next time I will get the mini-burger.  They have all the basic fixings and a little extra.  Cooked prefect.  

The fries were pretty good too.  They have tons of potato sacks sitting in the front stacked right on top of each other.  SO you can tell that they are freshly made and not frozen.  They were pretty darn good.  

As you walk in you can get a few peanuts in the shell while you wait for your burger.  

I asked questions they answered... I mean the menu it pretty right to the point.  

I'll go back!

This new location at the corner of Arapahoe and Parker is a welcome addition.  Without a decent burger joint in Parker, we've made the 15-minute trip a few times since they have opened.  The kids LOVE it, especially the french fries.

A word of caution...portions are big here.  Also, I'm guessing they start cooking your burger after you order, so it takes 10+ minutes to get it out.  

You order at the counter and they call your number when it's ready.  Make sure to grab lots of napkins because this is a messy burger!

Meh this place is ok. You can tell is trying to be like In-n-Out but just can't quite do it right. The burgers are just burgers nothing special, fried are good. The place is busy during lunch so could be a wait for your food. Don't know if I will be going back often but once in a while will go back.

This is my number one burger and fry shop EVER!!!! I found out about Five Guys when I was living back east and practically cried in enjoyment the first time that I discovered there was one in Denver. (I had been out here for 3 years at that point, away from my beloved restaurant). The person who was driving the car had trouble driving cause I was jumping up and down and screaming in joy that there was a Five Guys, heh!

The fries are INCREDIBLE!!!! Cooked in peanut oil, so no can do for the allergy people. Be careful though, they love to give you TONS!!! Get a small fry and share it with friends, it serves 4 VERY comfortably. 

Than the burgers, yum yum yum!!!! I love their burgers completely!!! They have the best yummy style soft, kinda soggy bread, which for me is like living back east again. So don't overload with toppings unless you want your bread to give away and be way messy. 

My dad and me had a saying about this place though.... Messier the better!

There is not a time of day when I do not crave a cheeseburger. The Boyfriend can ask me at any given time "What do you want to eat" and the first thing that pops into my head is cheeseburgers. I just love them. I do not however love a nasty fast food cheeseburger or an over priced over cooked burger. 

Five Guys does it just right. All the ingredients are fresh and the burgers are made to order. They also have sweet tea which is always welcome. The natural cut fries are seriously delicious with the skins still on but bring someone to share with because that is a tone of food!

P.S. Get the burger with jalapenos and it will be even better. YUM!

Five Guys is a pretty good fast food lunch alternative to the traditional chains. Their burgers are thick and juicy, made from high quality beef. They tasted like something you might grill at home, which is high praise for fast food. 

The menu simplicity is much appreciated, sort of an homage to my favorite burger joint that doesn't happen to have any locations in Colorado. I think everyone will have to learn about their unique (i.e. HUGE) potions the hard way.

One complaint, no ranch. Who doesn't have ranch? It's like no hot sauce at a Mexican restaurant. I wonder what their policy is on outside jams, jellies, and condiments?

I personally love this place.  Their cajun fries are oh-so-good!!  They give you so many; it's like another order at the bottom of the bag.  The only thing that bothers me is I wish they would toast the bun a little and I hate the way they chop up the onions (I like my onions in rings).  Oh yeah, I also think the cheese would be better if it was melted on the meat.  I know, it doesn't sound like I'm a fan, but, I'm a "critiquer"...that's what I do!  :)

Five guys knows fries!  Holy shit, these guys cook their burgers EXACTLY the way you want them!  OMG, their potatoes are so fresh that they have to keep big sacks of them all over the restaurant!! LOLZ!!  I could eat five guys all day every day until have to have my feet amputated from the diabetes!!1!!

This is how the review would read if my old roommate wrote it.  He's really high on the five guys cheeba.  Incidentally, the same praise is also plastered all over the restaurant.  Pretty much anywhere you look while you're here, you're going to read positive reviews for the store.  How can you not love this place if you're being constantly bombarded with subliminal messaging telling you that you want to make sweet hamburger love to the meat patties?

Oh yeah, I know you can not love it.  You can taste the food and observe that it's a very average burger - not in any way bad, yet not really special, either.  And the fries are the super-thick ones that drip grease and still have lots of potato peel on them.  Meh.  I'll take crispy, oversalted McDonald's fries over these any day.

And it's a little stressful that half of the staff is behind the counter yelling numbers at you the whole time while you're eating.  It's 2010.  Please find a better system for delivering the goods.  I don't care if you have to implant an RF transmitter in my forehead, just don't yell at me while I eat.  Thanks.

In my handful of visits to Five Guys, they've been consistently mediocre.  And maybe a little over-hyped.

Oh yeah, and my mandatory restroom review: A+.  It's a single, but everything is hands-free.  Water, soap, paper.  I almost expected to wave my crotch in front of the toilet and have it unbutton and unzip me.

When I open my own burger joint, RF implants and auto-depantsing will be standard.

Good food with energetic service!

I ordered a "regular" cheeseburger and fries. The burger was huge and juicy and the fries were old school. The bag held the overflow of fries which was almost as much in the cup.

The service was exceptional and personable. The counter person was hustling out on the floor, cleaning the tables which is nice to see. I usually need to ask the help to clean tables at the large burger chains.

Way overpriced (Twelve dollars for burger and fries?) and not worth it. I really despise the restaurant model where you have to tell the servers exactly how you want your food cooked. If I wanted to do that, I would just stay home and cook it myself. The fries are horribly oily as well, and they give you a big cupful of them. Thanks, but no thanks. There are better burger joints around, although (revealing my bias), I'm from southern Cali and you really can't beat that for variety and quality. The lack of real competition here makes for greasy, overpriced burgers passing as good food.

I have had five guys burgers I think 3 times now. Not a bad burger and a good concept, but lets be honest it's awesome compared to McDonald's, but it's not that great for the price. 

Everything is a la carte and that's why the price jumps up quickly. Add fries and a drink and you could be at $10 for 1 person. The fries are good. They are made with freshly cut potatoes so be prepared for that less crunch style (I like both, but I know some people don't care for the fresh style).

I am not saying it is bad by any means, I just don't get how some places get these crazy hypes like chic'fil'a, in'N'Out (too small of patties, this place is better but also more expensive), chipotle, wood fired pizza oven (just cuz it is cooked in a woodfired oven doesn't automatically make the pizza amazing), etc... I don't know. Maybe I am too picky ;)

HOLY FRENCH FRIES BATMAN!!!!!!!!! OMG I was so thankful the young lady behind the counter gave my husband and I a friendly tip that the small french fries were enough for 4 people. She wasn't kidding! The burgers were incredible. I am a fan of any burger place that is brave enought to let you pick your own toppings. I had a mushroom, grillled onion and swiss cheese. I was in heaven. 

* WARNING if you have PEANUT ALLERGIES stay away from this place.*

Burgers are greasy and just to get fries with that is almost another $4 and you get so many fries its enough for over 2 people. They put the fies in this little cup and then into a bag. The bag got really greasy as the fries in no way can ever fit into that little cup (what were they thinking) Really over priced for what you get. I'd rather go to McDonalds versus going here for the heart attack burger and fries. Oh, just so you don't get caught off guard, there are no MEALs here everything is ala cart.. so get that extra money out of your pocket!!
I never get sick of the food here.  These guys KNOW burgers.  My husband and I don't really care for the fries, but that's okay, fries aren't good for us anyway.

Okay, the very first thing one needs to know about this place is, if you order a regular burger, you're getting TWO patties. If you just want one patty, it's a junior burger. Having said that, let me tell you why I'm a fan of this place. When you walk into the joint, you immediately notice the sacks of potatoes and extra oil and stuff stacked off to the side like the builders didn't add a storeroom to the blueprint and a place to put all the extra stuff was an afterthought. I think this is to show the customer that the stuff they say they use is truly what they use--peanut oil for frying and potatoes from some potato state. There is also a littering of peanut shells on the floor, as they offer free peanuts to gnaw on while you wait. 

This place truly is about the burger, as there isn't much else on the menu besides burgers (they also serve hot dogs, veggie sandwiches, and grilled cheese, I think)--no shakes, no chili. It's about the burger. I do love that some of the stuff you'd have to pay extra for at other places--mushrooms, jalapenos, green peppers, grilled onions, A-1 sauce, etc.--are all standard and FREE condiment/veggie options. I got the bacon cheeseburger, and it was so big, I couldn't open my mouth wide enough to take a commanding bite. I wasn't deterred, though, and did a number on that burger!! I ordered fries, and they filled the cup to the brim and threw in extra in the bag, so you only need to order a regular size fries and it should easily accommodate two people. 

Both times my burger was juicy and pretty darn good. It was reminiscent of a homemade burger to me. It's definitely worth the $ you'll pay.

Amazing burger for a fast food place. Not greasy but full of flavour. The regular fries will feed two people easily. I'd recommend the Cajun fries. 

Stop over at Maggie Moo's across the street for desert.

Damn.  The second ever place to get 5 stars from me. Whoever said the cajun fries sucked and the burger was tasteless, YOU are clearly tasteless.  This is one of the better burgers I've ever had, got mine "all the way" with jalapenos.  Big burgers, everything is fresh including the jalapenos, everything is cooked to order, they have peanuts to eat while you wait, the staff is VERY friendly,  the place is clean, lord of parking, and the cajun fries are AWESOME.  This is a very good place to bring your business too. I be back.

My first experience with Five Guys after hearing loads about it over the years.  I saw them building this place out a few months ago and couldn't wait to try it.

I was not disappointed.

The burger was in the top five of any I've had.  Definitely the best I've had from a chain restaurant.  The fries were pretty awesome too!
Had it again yesterday. Still love it.

Love the Burgers here. The toppings are all fresh cut and the patties are perfect sized. The French Fries are fresh cut and delicious. The staff is friendly and excited about the food. On the top of my head I can't think of a better cheese burger in the area. Its a must if you love burgers and fresh cut fries.

Seriously, I have to eat at Five Guys everywhere I go!  Best burger I have ever tasted, not to mention you don't have to pay extra for the toppings.  We went to the cherry cricket downtown denver and I was upset.  I wasted my time when I could have just went to Five Guys TWICE! :)  I have been to several five guys throughout the United States and I tell people to eat here all the time!  THANKS five guys!
This place is good but there's so many better choices around.
Looking for a good hamburger place and this wasn't it. The burger wasn't that good and the fries were even worst. In N Out is way better.
Five Guys burgers are amazing.  Fresh and tasty.  And their fries, get out of town!  Love Five Guys, they are way better than any other fast food burger place.  Wished they had milkshakes though.

Awesome deal for the money!   A single (junior) cheeseburger is like $4 and the fries are less than $3 and it serves 2-3, can't be that!  Everything is made fresh and you can tell.  Plus, when you walk in everyone is super friendly and helpful!  Except for them thinking my son was my boyfriend, they were awesome!  lol  Okay, I am too young to have a 16yo and we both don't look our age, but still...who am I kidding, after being grossed out, I was like heyyyy I look hella young!  ;-)  Anyway, back to the joint...it's awesome, if you are ever in that area, it's a must try!

My sis & I are burger fans. Just moved here from Cali & looking for a great burger joint. This aint it. We got the "little burger" which is one patty. Very small, no flavor.....what is with people not seasoning the meat around here. cajun fries were not good. wont be coming back

Very Average.  Another burger joint trying to be "fresh and esoteric" but really just another competitor to In-n-Out not doing quite as good of a job.  Burger was overdone, fries were not fresh and it was expensive for what I consider to be fast food.
dayum Dayum DAYUM!!!

Better than In and Out anyday!  They cook everything fresh and the food is great.  Large portions.  A bit more pricey compared to other burger joints but it's well worth it.  They also stuff your fries to the rim and beyond.  Remember to check your bag for the loads of extra fries you get.  You must eat here if you love burgers.
Very Good Burger Joint! The Fries Are Delicious And Are Very Well Cooked! Could Earn A 5 Star Rating If The Waiting Was Just A Tiny Bit Smaller!

So one of my canadian friends told me to go and try you guys out (because apparently your big up there?)...so I took her advice and made the drive.  Couple things going on here that got you only 3 stars.  First of all making all menu items separate is just a way to nickel and dime and pisses people off.  Give me a combo option here for less than 10 bucks please.  One way you could probably accomplish this is instead of giving me half a 55 gallon trash bag full of fries give me a normal human being size order and make them less than $2.50.  Also for all the hype I just felt that the burger was like many that I have had before.  Not super duper but not bad.  I definitely would recommend not advertising the "fry factor" so much because I would take Good Times or City Grilles fries over yours any day.
