Overall I wasn't totally disappointed about making the drive but I probably won't be making it again anytime soon.  Best of luck to you!

Very simple burger joint: you only have 4 options for meals: (1) Hamburger, (2) Cheeseburger, (3) Hamburger w/ Bacon, and (4) Cheeseburger w/ Bacon. My personal favorite is cheeseburger just because a burger with no cheese is just too plain for me. Basically, the burger patty just melts in your mouth because the meat is super soft (which means very fatty) but doesn't drip any grease from it. I've had burgers that had just grease dripping all over, but not the Five Guys. The patty itself is well-flavored as well. The fries are homemade fries that are both delicious and generous size (you can share an order of Large size with at least 3 people because we never can even finish regular size). The only downside of this place is the wait of about 8-10 minutes, depending on the wait line, however, since the burgers are made fresh and they come out pretty tasty, I think they are definitely worth the wait.

Went for brunch a few weeks ago with a few guys from a flag football league.

The waitress was very friendly and did a great job throughout the meal.

I really enjoyed their coffee (unsure what kind they serve). 

For my entree I had the french dip with fries and ranch. The au jus was very tasty and the meat, cheese and bread all went together well. With the fries I was very full at the end of the meal. 

The brunch options are fairly thin but it appears that most people come for traditional lunch or dinner options.

I did sneak of piece of the kids cheese pizza, which had a ton of cheese and good marinara sauce. The crust is thin but not so thin it falls apart. 

The pricing is not too expensive and parking is not too hard (at least on a Sunday around 11am)

I am going back to this place.  It has a very comfortable patio and just about any kind of seating you could like - tables, high tops, bar, booths...  The atmosphere is clean and fresh.  It would be good for families.

They offer a nice menu of salads, sandwiches, and pizza.

I sat on the patio and ordered a salad.  It had a hair on it when it arrived, so I immediately let my waiter know, and he replaced it.  It was really fresh and delicious, and he was very conciliatory about the mishap.  Despite the error, it is such a welcoming place.  I will eat here again.

My boyfriend and I happened by this place randomly and figured we'd give it a try. We were not disappointed at all! Everything was absolutely spectacular. The service was spot on, Jennifer was friendly and extremely knowledgeable. Everything she recommended was fantastic! We tried the eggplant parmesan, french dip and vegan chocolate cake. Let me tell you, the french dip was out of this world! I have never been a fan of french dips before but this place opened my eyes! The bread was so incredibly soft and delicious, the meat  was thinly cut and the spread (whatever it was) was unbelievable. Bravo Silvi's! 

My boyfriend was apprehensive about trying "vegan" anything but despite his skepticism, he fell in love with the vegan chocolate cake.  Definitely a must try! I wish there was a Silvi's Kitchen closer to downtown...
Hair on my plate, yuck! Omelet overcooked, very limited breakfast menu. No thanks, I can find better in the area.

Amazing. We got takeout from here as we were staying in a hotel nearby. The food was awesome - French dip, sweet potato fries, Brussels sprouts and a Cobb salad. Everything was packaged with care; they clearly do to go orders a lot. And the food was so good that we will be visiting it again during our stay before we head out of town. I heard from the hotel that they have great cocktails, and the bar looked really nice.

Silvi's Kitchen looks small on the outside, but the actual restaurant is expansive once you walk in. The decor is homey and inviting; there are framed pictures that decorate the front entrance and the host or hostess leaves the choice of seating options (bar, stools and tables, or booths) entirely up to you.

I stopped by for their early evening happy hour that runs from 3PM to 6PM daily. As a huge fan of taco anything, I was immediately drawn to the roasted chicken taco and veggie taco that is only available during happy hour. Since every place that serves tacos makes their portion size different, I needed a backup dish to make sure that I would be full. After looking over the main dinner menu, I opted for the mango chicken salad as well. 

The tacos were brought out first. The veggie one had a great mix of seasonal vegetables but sadly lacked some flavor and kick. The tortilla was also soggy from the amount of juices coming from the cooked veggies. The chicken one however was a lot more tasty and was seasoned really well. The mango chicken salad was a delightfully light way to end the meal, with bits of chopped mango, chicken, tomatoes, and goat cheese atop of a bed of greens. 

The waiter was courteous and held a great conversation all throughout my meal, refilling my water as necessary and making sure my time at Silvi's was phenomenal. I enjoyed my visit, although I wished the quality of the food was more consistent; I'm hoping to try some of their fresh pizzas next time I'm by CitySet.

Food and service was meh. The server was definitely stressed out, so I'm wondering if they're understaffed here. She also mentioned that the kitchen staff were backed up when we mentioned that we were in a hurry (even though the restaurant was empty!).

I had the French toast - it was too much - it was deep fried and heavy, not my style. I had a stomach ache after.  There are better places to go for breakfast - places that may 5-star food and provide 5-star service.

We had to check out Silvi's Kitchen, based on Yelp! Reviews, as well as the type of restaurant that they are.

This restaurant definitely is not afraid to make your food/order the way you need it to be, for special dietary needs. They state right there on their menu: gluten free, vegan, vegetarian, as well as low-carb, options.

I explained what I needed, what I could/could not eat, and the waitress was so helpful! We ordered a gluten free pizza, with very specific toppings, etc. The waitress did not flinch! It was awesome! Our pizza and salad were both very good! Actually, excellent! 

The interior of this restaurant is HUGE! The interior colors are brown, black, and white, with clean lines as well. There are plenty of booths, high top tables, as well as regular tables.  The interior is clean, open, and not at all crowded. Feel free to sit down, enjoy a drink at their big bar, or at one of the tables. Or, look at the art work on the walls, of food, and food preparation.  Have a happy hour there with a co-worker, or a friend or two. Enjoy a meal after doing some local shopping. 

Silvi's is not trying to be a "chain," restaurant, and I'm glad they don't try to be. They also are not trying to be one of those "places to be seen" restaurants either. Silvi's is simple, straight up, and just plain good!

See you there!

Checked into a local hotel and walked to grab lunch.   The Margherita wood fired pizza was delicious with a thin crust, feta, basil and tomato.  The craft cocktail cucumber refresher was excellent.  Service was superb.

Great veggie Omlette! The goat cheese made it so delicious. Every bite melted in my mouth.  The cup of joe was what I needed, after my long morning flight,  and it was the best size-BIG.
Friendly staff with great customer service skills,  even when I didn't think our server heard me,  she did and brought me the spoon within in seconds.

I happen to love this place. I think I've been here 4 or 5 times and I usually stroll in around 1-2 pm and sit in the bar. The bar tender even recognizes me, which is funny, as I've yet to have an alcoholic beverage. LOL

They serve grits here, which as a southerner makes my heart go pitter pat. I either get the breakfast sandwich or eggs, grits, sausage and potatoes. That and a coffee or a smoothie have been my drinks of choice thus far. The price is super reasonable. One day I will go in and sit in the big dining area. I've always had great service and good food. I will definitely keep returning!

My friend and I came for lunch, and it was super tasty. We each had a small salad and shared the Hummus Plate with falafel. My Etai's Power Salad was super fresh and tasty. I loved the chunks of beets and sesame dressing. The Falafel plate was awesome as well. The vegetables were very fresh, and the bread was great. The falafel were flavorful, and the hummus was earthy. We were pretty stuffed to the brim by the end. Our server was super friendly, very knowledgeable about the menu, and prompt. And the prices were great! I was a bit mystified by the bar, as they seem to close fairly early. I'm glad it's available for other meals though! I definitely plan to come back to try more things in the future.

I came here with a group for lunch the other day.  There were six of us, and I am glad we arrived before 11:30am, as the place filled up rapidly.  Probably my biggest complaint about the dining experience would be how incredibly noisy this room became as it approached capacity.  I could hear my dining companions on either side of me, but the folks on the other side of the table were much harder with which to converse.

Our service was good, but our server kind of kvetched about how we split the bill, which she could have avoided by proactively splitting or at least better organizing it.  As for the food, I really enjoyed the appetizers we ordered.  The hummus was quite good and came with a small garden of side veggies.  The brussels were very tasty.  The mac and cheese (cavatapi with a good bechamel and bacon) was delicious.  My burger was decent, with good toppings, but seemed a tad dry.  I thought the fries were rather limp, but others enjoyed them.

All in all, it really was a solidly okay experience with some highs and lows.  However, I am definitely willing to come back and try them again.

Good value, nice drink selection, and a broad enough selection of food so you can eat healthy and have something tasty at the same time.  Service was great, tab was reasonable, and I always consider this an option when I'm in the area.

No complaints from this family of 5.  The kid's menus is $5 and includes drinks and the kid's pizza is huge and definitely fills the kids up.  We tried the Happy Hour (3 to 6) pizza and green chili cheese fries and both were good.  We also had the french dip and it was awesome!!  We will definitely eat here again!  Aurita was our server and she was terrific!

Love this restaurant!! Great service and food!  Chris was great! Staff is welcoming and friendly!
GF as well!

Had lunch for the first time here today. Met the friendliest bartender who was not only nice to chat with but also solid at service. 

So the eats: Peanut Chicken Salad & the charred brussel sprouts. 

For overall taste the salad missed a few marks. it needed something - maybe a stronger ginger flavor in the dressing or won ton crunchies on top for texture...(is that what they're called?) or maybe a little thai spice to bring out the flavor more. 

I thought the Brussels were great. I had to bring some home...will see what I can do with them - maybe an omelet or something. But yes, they were good enough to bring home. And I don't like leftovers. 

I can't wait to try other things on the menu.
They have fresh pressed juices!!! The guys didn't like their's but I absolutely loved mine and so did they.

Good food and drinks. We started with the Brussel sprouts and I had the blackened salmon wrap with quinoa salad. I ended up taking the salmon with mango salsa out and mixed it with the quinoa which made the dish much better. Good clean food and the staff were friendly.

I decided to go with the lamb burger. I ordered over the phone and asked about how the meat should be cooked. The employee recommended medium. I went with medium well since I'm not too familiar with how lamb taste. When I bit into the burger, it was tasty but a little dry. I should have gone medium. Overall still a good burger. I also had the lobster soup. Very good tasting. My wife had the french dip sandwich which was also very good. I'd come back here for sure.

Meal was fine - nothing over the top but tasted fine. I had Cobb salad and little guy had Mac and cheese. The portions were big and the service was pretty good. Good to try something new....curious about breakfast so we might be back.

The French dip is to die for!!  I love the chicken sandwich as well. All of the bread products here are yummy as it is the Udis company.   I also love the California burger. All of city set has great food but I left the kitchen next door wishing I had eaten at Udis/ Silvis instead.

Came in for a meal this past weekend. I'd actually been looking forward to checking it out because I love a nice thin, crispy pizza.

Started with stuffed breadsticks....they were not stuffed breadsticks. They were definitely more like mozzarella sticks, and while tasty, not sure they were worth the price. Actually, I feel they weren't worth the price. 

We got two pizzas, one Hawaiian and then made our own. They were okay... One was a little more "well-cooked" (read:charred) than the other, but it was ok.

We also got a beet salad that was really good and well dressed. Service was perfectly lovely, bartender was very attentive and nice.

I guess what it came down to was value: 2 okay pizzas, one beer, a glass of house wine, a small salad and 3 mozzarella sticks...$60? Meh.

Silvi's Kitchen: Impresses

In the month of June, I visited Silvi's Kitchen on two different occasions. With each visit I was very impressed with both the menu selection and service. I highly recommend the Silvi's Famous French Dip sandwich. The sandwich and dipping sauce was delicious, well-made, and very filling. The Silvi's Hummus is also an excellent choice. It is a great alternative for customers who are vegan and weight conscious. During my visits, customer service was also consistently excellent. Our waiters was professional and attentive. I would recommend this establishment if searching for a casual dining or upscale experience in the Glendale area. Lots of parking is available, the menu prices are reasonable, and this restaurant has a diverse menu selection. Perfect for couples or a work lunch location.

This probably one of my favorite to-go options in CitySet. However, all 3 times I've actually gone to dine in, the service is always terrible. All the waiters seem to be disinterested in providing a good experience for their patrons. This past experience, my boyfriend and I sat for a good 10 mins as 3 waiters walked passed us and completely disregarded us. Disappointing, even after giving them another chance to make it right.
We have been here several times and everything we have ordered has been amazing. The service is excellent. The food is fresh, delicious and high quality. It has become our new favorite place.

Really good value for really tasty food. The green vegan breakfast bowl is my favorite! Their juices and smoothies are fantastic as well. Also, appetizer is a must. My wife and I come here often for brunch lunch or dinner.

I might come here a little too much, sometimes four times a week, which will likely continue as long as my office doesn't move or Silvi's doesn't stop being awesome! 

So... what's good? I'm usually here for lunch so lets start with the pizza special Mon-Fri until 3pm that comes with a side salad. You can get margherita, pepporoni, artichoke basil or sausage all under $9.75. This is a personal size (9") with six slices and I'm usually full by the fourth slice. Skip eating the crust and you might be able to finish. Otherwise, you can take two slices to go for an afternoon snack. The salads at Silvi's are huge. I would say a small size is good for just about anyone. You can add on a smoothie or bites (appetizer). But a full salad is just too much of a good thing. Depending on your preference, I'd recommend the Silvi's Cobb (if you love ranch like me), Mango Chicken Salad (if you like sweet), or Robin's Power Salad (if you like kale). The sandwiches and burgers come with a side salad or fries. For $1.50 more, you can get the sweet potatoes fries which is worth it! The spicy-jalapeno cheddar turkey is my go-to sandwich. Tastes healthy, but delicious and has the spicy kick to it.

Now, lets drink! The reason I'm here so much is to stop in for coffee and smoothies. My co-worker and I stop by so much for our routine coffee that most of the staff know our orders: a mocha and a vanilla soy latte. You can order coffee directly at the cashier and get it to go. Same with smoothies. I love the Blue Monday which includes blueberries, strawberries, oranges and bananas. And again if you like kale, the Mangolicious and Power Shake are good too! (I say this because there is a specific kale taste [sour] that people don't like.) I've also been to the happy hour a few times (3pm to 6pm daily). The Floyd's Pink Lavender Lemonade ($4) is worth a try! It does have that lavender/floral taste to it so might not be for everyone. You can also ask for the daily shot special to get a $3 shot. My only wish is that Silvi's would open earlier in the morning. It currently opens at 10:30am so sometimes I need to get my coffee fix elsewhere. Haha, such a hard life.

I'm writing this 5 star review because this is an awesome restaurant where the food is delicious, the portions are quite large, and the selections are thoughtful in terms of health and the earth.  Breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

It's our obligation to support conscientious businesses, but it's a pleasure to support these guys.  Everything's so good.  They have many vegetarian options.  They're very flexible for allergies, substitutions, or gluten issues.  They have 8 nice beers on tap as well.

We loved their Colfax location, and will just have to trudge a bit further for our fix.

Excellent brunch experience! They have fresh smoothies and local kombucha - yummo!

There is a full bar, a large menu and a variety of fun beverages. I enjoyed some strawberry hotcakes and the service was great. The space is huge and there was some decent people watching for a Saturday morning.  The pricing is decent and the energy is welcoming.  You can crawl in hungover or bring the fam for some eats and both are acceptable here!

If I found myself over here during happy hour, I might give it a try but I am not going out of my way.  It seems some of the more harsh reviews  are in regards to this. 

This area of town is interesting and odd. We examined out options in the area for a high quality drinking brunch and this fit the bill nicely! It will definitely be added to the rotation.

My brother, wife, and I stopped by here after reading their website.  

They have fantastic vegetarian options (for my wife) but still plenty of non-veggies dishes. 

The food was great, and the beer selection was even better.

A few people here have complained about burned pizza crust.  Mine was a tiny bit burned in a few places, but it's cooked in a brick fire oven.  It's worth it.

Highly recommend people go here.
The French Dip was good, but leave room for the bread pudding because it is amazing. Moscow Mules are also delicious, with a good bit of alcohol.

Great food, I loved the salads and pizza.  They were very accommodating about the infant carseat carrier and seated us at a booth during a very busy lunch rush! The staff was very friendly with our baby as well!

always a great experience. the French dip is absolutely the best thing they have there. 

There was a time when my boyfriend & I went there & both our French dips were cold to the touch... we informed our server & he was quick to bring us our new warm ones and apologetic. we aren't the kind of people to make a huge deal out of things. They are always on top of everything & the food is always great!! 

Would recommend trying this place

Wow! I came here for lunch today with my mother and her co-worker. My mother ordered the Jerusalem chicken sandwich, and her co-worker and I both ordered the French dip. All of us ordered fries. Now, I assumed this was one of those health-obsessed restaurants, with the gluten-free, vegetarian and vegan options, and I expected that the fries would not be very good. Boy was I wrong. They have some of the best fries I've ever had in my life. They are seasoned simply, not drowned in oil or overly salty, and they are delicious! The Jerusalem chicken was very tasty. The French dip... I have never had one quite like it. The bread is delicious, as is the Gouda cheese (that was new to me, I've only ever had provolone on a French dip before).

Aside from it taking a bit longer than average to get our drink orders in (and I think they may have been short-staffed, so it happens), the service was fantastic. We never had empty drinks for more than 30 seconds before they were refilled. Three servers were very friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu. Long story short, I'll definitely be back!

Love the atmosphere of this place- nice, but comfortable. Food was so good and they customized our pizza just right. Drinks are strong so definitely worth the price! Employees very friendly and laid back, but professional. Definitely a place I will come back to!
If it wasn't for the salty fries it would be a 5. French dip is as advertised. Bartender is social and helpful. He was willing to put the Cubs on the tv for me. Nice!

I have eaten at Silvi's twice in the past 2 months, very disappointed. As another reviewer mentioned I come here when I am eating out with non-vegan friends, so we can all have good choices. Well these last 2 times,my friends have had huge burgers come out that they loved and I paid $9 for a Pita Falafel, with hardly any falafel. 4 tiny disks shaped falafel. Very disappointed that vegan choices are so limited and so small. I do love their juice, Verde! I did write a comment to them online, heard nothing, apparently they do not care if my friends and I take our business elsewhere.

Sweet potato fries are best in the city, and the chipotle aoli sauce is addicting. 

We eat here at least twice a month. 

Staff is always friendly and helpful, food cooked correctly, lots of healthy choices. We really appreciate their gluten free accommodations.

I had a delightful experience at Silvi's Kitchen. My Peanut Chicken salad was perfectly proportioned and dressed with a great slice of house made bread. I give this popular Lunch spot 4 stars instead of 5 for 3 reasons. I had a very comfortable cove seat for one that made me feel less uncomfortable eating alone, but I was forgotten and it took a bit to get my meal going. The chicken in the salad is cold, which I mostly expect now but always wish for different. Lastly, Silvi's does not have caloric or nutritional information about their food. They blame the change in seasonal foods and how they are prepared but this excuse screams inconsistency to me!

I'll start with the good things and work my way down. Mandy, our server was excellent! She was very sweet and on top of things, including water ( we drink a lot of water ) so thank you Mandy! The atmosphere was kinda cool..... Except the crying baby. Unfortunately, the most important reason for eating out, the food, was the worst part. To illustrate, we ordered the Hummus and got a plate of hummus, defiantly not homemade, with things to dip in it like canned sliced olives, pickle slices and shredded carrots. Interesting, not tasty mix. The rest was not much better, but the prices suggested they should have been.

I really dig this place!
It has a nice feel to it, the food is delicious, and the staff is friendly. What more could you ask for???

I have been going here pretty often. They offer some pretty delicious vegan dishes. I've enjoyed everything that I've ordered so far. I think it's my new go to spot!

Having been acquainted with udis gluten free products from te freezer section of my local grocer, I was very eager to try something fresh made and gluten free.

Udis offers the ability to make almost all meals gluten free, vegetarian, and vegan. Which is extremely nice, especially for those with advanced celiacs who are not only gluten intolerant, but sensitive to lactose and casein as well. 

I settled on a small bites plate, a salad, and cocktail.

The cocktail was a cucumber refresher that had gin, mint, and st germain. I probably should have realized that with the st germain, this was going to be more of a flowery sweet drink then I normally fancy. It was also a smaller sized martini and $9.

The roasted beet salad was very good! At first I thought they just gave me canned diced beets because some were vinegary tasting, til I realized that was the doing of the balsamic drizzle. The candied hazelnuts added a smoky and sweet taste that nicely off set the hearty beets, mild goat cheese, and balsamic.

The "small bite" was really the outstanding part of this experience. I was presented with  two plates, one heaping with chopped veggies and a nice chunked up portion of gf bread and one with a pool of hummus and neatly arranged falafel. The hummus was creamy and had good spice to it. The tahini was a little bitter for my taste so I mixed it in to the hummus. The bread was warm and had sage an sea salt on it. I'm not usually a green olive fan but these were nice and firm and thickly sliced. 

I may have to hit up udis again to have an entree while I'm in Denver.
Unusual and excellent preparations of pizza and sandwiches, including a delicious lamb burger.  Affordable with good service.
Great little place for a quick lunch ! Good choices great - Brussels Sprouts - awesome great salads - and a huge shout out to the French dip !!

Their happy hour is bonkers, great food and wine at super discounted prices. Get the smoked chicken slider and you won't be disappointed: smoky sweet chicken with crunchy snow pea and shaved brussels sprout slaw. The hummus is also on point.
Good sized portion. I had the southwestern chicken salad and my daughter the BLT sandwich. We both enjoyed our dishes.

It took us a while to find our waiter (and I'm not really certain we ended up with the right one as he said ours was "slammed").  But, for a $25 full service and fresh lunch for 2, it was okay that the service wasn't perfect. Would I recommend they hire some more folks?  Definitely.  Would I go back?  Maybe.

The butternut squash pizza was great, but that's pretty much a given if you include butternut squash in the name of pretty much anything. But that doesn't mean the doughy thin crust shouldn''t get props.
The quinoa was tasty, but I really don't get the quinoa craze that's been going around. Sure it's better than pretentious rice pilaf, but come on, it's not THAT much better than couscous. Regardless of whether or not we agree on quinoa, I think we'd agree that their quinoa is pretty  darn good.
I jumped at the chance to go Greek when I saw a lamb burger with feta. Great combination, good flavor mix. But the texture of the burger was pretty disappointing. I don't doubt the quality, but I just didn't love tearing into the slightly rubbery, semi-ground-chunks texture of the patty. But really, it wasn't bad. Not bad at all.

I forgot my cell phone at Udi's. Our server had clearly turned it in right away because we called within minutes. Good honest people, genuinely polite, standard service with a smile. Overall a great place. Next time I want a quicker sit-down bite, I'll be back.

My wife and I love this place!  The atmosphere, food, drink, service, and parking are all excellent.  The French Dip is incredible!  My wife and I always swear we are going to try other things but the French Dip always gets ordered by both of us.  It's like the French Dip gods have hypnotized us to always order it at Silvi's.  Either that or because it's just so frickin' amazing there is no way anyone in their right mind could order anything else.  The rest of their menu does look very yummy so maybe next time we will try something new.  The root beer here is also the bomb!  Definitely going back on a weekly basis.

Perfect location...across the parking lot from my hotel. There is no shortage of places to eat in this block. I chose to go here based on the menu. 

Awkward entrance. It was raining, I was scooting my feet on the mat to dry them, hostess said hi and stared. I remarked that it was really wet. She said yes. She mumbled and I said thank you. Anyway I chose the bar as opposed to the high top tables.

After looking over the happy hour menu (3p-6p) I chose a veggie taco, green chili fries and a chicken slider with Brussels sprout slaw. Loved that I could choose several small things to sample. Loved the chicken slider with slaw!!!!!!!!!!! The fries were ok -- a little green chili goes a long way for me so I was tired of them quickly. I forget how much I dislike goat cheese until I order something with it like the veggie taco. Just wasn't my thing. But it was a small serving so I wasn't out much $ and I didn't waste much food. I like being able to do that!

I'll be back . I hear the pizzas are good too.

5-star for ambiance and staff - but the food was a big disappointment.

I had the French dip sandwich. I can only assume a restaurant doesn't have any faith in their protein when they have to use heavily flavored bread, which was certainly true with my sandwich.  However the real gotcha was the gouda cheese that was crunchy.  Seriously. I would have expected that it would have been melted cheese but what I got was a piece of hard, crunchy cheese.

My lunch mate had the Asian pear salad. She spent the entire meal searching for pear and eventually came up with about 1 tablespoon full. There wasn't much chicken either. 

I would recommend the place for times when the food doesn't matter but you need a friendly venue, especially for a business discussion.

I ate here tonight for the first time, and I will be back. It was delicious. I had a roasted half chicken with farro and charred Brussels sprouts. The chicken was very moist on the inside and had a beautiful crispy skin. My compliments to the chef! I got calamari for an appetizer and liked it a lot, too. For dessert,  I got challah bread pudding with creme anglaise. Delicious!  I'm already looking forward to eating here again.
Everything was amazing. Jedd was helpful and friendly. Recommended the mango  chicken salad, pizza and desert were all so delicious. Will definitely be back next time I'm in Denver. Thank you!!!

Ok so I have been here four times and everything is much improved.  My server was attentive and the pizza's came out great.

If your in the neighborhood, give it a shot, you'll like it.

My husband, daughter and I ate at Silvi's three times over Thanksgiving holidays.  We were all more than impressed with the food and service.  The french dip was great and flavorful, and the breakfast items were very, very good.  I travel to Denver frequently, so I will be back.

I'll start by saying, most astoundingly, I received 5 star service from all staff I interacted with. Service you might find at a top tier steak house downtown, which was a pleasant surprise for a cafe style Sunday lunch with my pup. 

Service highlights:
-server: Jedd
- even though the patio was closed the hostess happily cleaned off a table and chair so I could enjoy the beautiful day outside with my dog 
- hostess quickly had water brought out for my dog and I (I was glad to see my dog was a welcome guest!)
-Jedd addressed me promptly and I placed my order (beet salad, iced Americano, gluten free Colorado BLT with a side of Taziki and sweet potato fries) 
- salad came out within monuments accompanied by my Americano 
- table was cleared and new napkin and silverware were brought out with my meal
- friendly banter with wait staff and condiments and such brought out as needed.
- no rush but no wait for check either


Food highlights;
-perfect espresso, not bitter
-slightly over dressed salad 
- excellent sweet potato fries with large chunks of sea salt
-perfect home made Taziki (which I recommend with sweet potato fries) 
-obvious plus with the Udi's gluten free bread
- fresh, crisp produce and perfect amount of guacamole to keep my sandwich from being dry

Bottom line: now that I've given it the trial run I can easily say brining my picky, foodie, classy, LA, parents here next time they visit will be a success. Seeing as I am a student who can live off Nutella and toast, it's always a challenge pleasing the parents' palate when they visit.
Great atmosphere and impeccable service. Brunch was delicious...especially the blueberry lemon pancakes. Omelette was slightly overcooked, but still good flavors nonetheless.

My family and I headed to Silvi's for brunch on a Saturday when visitng Denver.  I've passed by during past visits (recognizing their former name, Udi's, as the GF bread brand) and was curious to try.

We ordered a variety of smoothies and coffee.  The coffee took about 15 minutes to come out, which is way too long for this Jersey girl.  The smoothies actually came out way before.  I tried a sip of one of them and it was very fruity and fresh.  

For our food, some of us went with the breakfasty options (omelettes, burrito) and some with lunch (sandwiches).  Everyone seemed to more or less like their food.  I tried a bite (or a couple) of my sister's falafel sandwich and realized I probably should have ordered that! I ordered the mediterranean omelette and thought it was just okay (very small).  I did like the walnut cranberry toast and jam that came with the omelette.  

Overall, decent food but very slow service.  I wouldn't mind going back for the falafel sandwich, now that I know what to order.

Our hotel was in the same parking lot so we thought no matter the quality, at least Silvis was within walking distance of our door. Man were we wrong! AMAZING FOOD AND FABULOUS SERVICE. The French dip was to die for! We have a new favorite Denver local!

I hesitate to write this review, because the hubby & I would like to keep this restaurant as our secret gem.  Let's start with the smell of bacon cooking as we walked up--oh YUM!  Then there's the service:  Jedd met us at the door and literally made us feel like family.  He's a champ!  Make sure you ask for Jedd by name, you won't be sorry.

Now the food--OMG!   I had the salmon.  The skin was crispy & delightful.  It was served with Brussels sprouts & cauliflower.  Divine!  Hubby had the Jerusalem chicken, with amazing spices and great veggies.  
But the highlight was dessert.  This is THE best bread pudding we've ever had!  Chunks of challah, crispy and buttery on top, nestled in a silky custard.  It arrives at your table still sizzling from the oven.  I thought hubby was going to dive in face first.  He did threaten to lick the dish clean.  Jedd offered to hold up a napkin to give him the privacy to clean the plate.  Now THAT'S service and a sense of humor!

Best Udi's I've been to so far.  The food is great, I really like the layout of the restaurant - it has more of a bar area near the front in addition to the dining area.  The service was just OK - not spectacular but nothing to complain about so I'm ok with it.  
I usually get a salad but they do have a great gluten free menu if I stray.

City Set is a great addition to Glendale and with new places coming in all the time, it's definitely going to be the go to place in the neighborhood.

Udi's has been there for some time now and compliments the other establishments nicely, giving visitors a good variety of food options to choose from.  

Just like everyone else I was surprised to find this Udi's has a full bar, who knew?  It's a bit different than other Udi's because you can order at the counter or you can sit down and have full waiter service.  I think it's a little odd to have both options, it's like they don't know what they are, full service or counter service.  Pick one and stick with it guys.

I thought the food was average.  I ordered the Cobb Salad which was ginormous. The size could definitely be decreased some and price potentially reduced.  I would be surprised if anyone could finish that salad in one sitting, and who takes salad home and actually eats it the next day (admit it, you actually just throw it away).  The ingredients were plentiful and I felt as though I had a half a chicken in my salad, very filling indeed.  I also had their soup of the day, a spicy pumpkin soup, which was a bit thicker than a soup, more like a puree but the flavor was there and I enjoyed the warming effect.  The BF ordered a side of Brussels sprouts with some orange that were really yummy.  I would beware of menu descriptions on this one, on Udi's menu apparently charred means fried.  I don't mind fried just as long as it's listed as such on the menu and not deceiving. 

Our waiter for the evening was a funny guy and thoroughly entertaining during our meal.  At times he was a bit too much but he really had a great personality and made our experience enjoyable.

If I was in the neighborhood I would consider Udi's as an option but wouldn't go out of my way to return.  Your meal will be satisfactory.
Silvis is the best! The crew is awesome,  so is the food. Also, they will customize the cocktails to  your liking.
Love this place.  The happy hour is the best 2.75 premium drafts and amazing happy hour burger

Great choice for today's breakfast!  Seated in a booth against the far wall from the entrance.  Our server Jesse was very attentive and took the drink orders right after we sat down.

I ordered a 4 shot dirty chai to have with my meal that was outstanding.  Came out in a large mug and had a great smell.  Perfect temperature to drink when it arrived as well!

For my main course I ordered the Mediterranean omelet with home fries and the house gluten free toast.  After a short wait the meal arrived.  Nice surprise to have some sweet potato fries mixed in with the home fries, the omelet was the perfect size and was made with fresh ingredients.  The goat cheese was not over done and the green olives were very crisp.  The house GF toast was very tasty when you used the cream butter and fresh strawberry purée.

The only down to today's visit was the hostess when we walked in.  She just looks like she was having a bad morning.  Everyone is entitled to a down day, and maybe today is hers.  The thing of note is that she was making the servers work harder across the board.  This blemish however didn't effect my overall impression of the visit.

Silvi's Kitchen has been the favorite eating out place for me and my family since they opened. The staff and service is the greatest, always helpful with diet issues and other concerns. A good family restaurant in the Glendale, Cherry Creek area of Denver. Hats off to Silvi's and their staff!
Jim & Joni Horton-Denver

I was looking forward to lunch at Silvies because they have one of the best falafel sandwiches I've ever had.  I have to give this place two stars because they changed the sandwich to a falafel wrap.  I really wanted to like the change but it is awful.  The wrap has this trrrible lettuce mix on it that kind of tasted like it had French dressing on it.  The falafels were too big for the dry tortilla so the wrap fell apart.  I felt that the sandwich was the best vegan thing on the menu.  I'm going to have to look for a new place for a good falafel sandwich.

What I love about Silvi's Kitchen is their consistent, fresh quality of food. Every time I've been here, the service has been very friendly and fast, even during the weekday lunch rush. Almost everything I've tried on the menu, so far, has been great. Mango Chicken Salad, Falafel Burger, Jerusalem Chicken Sandwich (with 21 spices!), Vegetable Tajine, pizza, and don't forget the freshly squeezed juices (you gotta try Liquid Sunshine - it's like an explosion of green juicy goodness consisting of kale, orange, ginger and lemon). Overall, Silvi's is good place to grab a relatively healthy and reasonably priced lunch or dinner, especially if you like good, fresh bread (which is part of why their sandwiches and pizza taste so good)!
Great location and good food with a lot of gluten free options. Our waitress was extremely helpful and fun!

Great lunch, fabulous pizza. My companion *loved* the Reuben Sandwich. The place does get a little busy, so heading there for an earlier lunch time before noon would probably be better. The only thing that keeps me from giving a 5 star rating is the service. I'm not knocking our waitress, but I think they need some more servers. We weren't the only table looking around for our wait person to help fill up sodas, pay the bill, etc. I saw a couple of people at other tables trying to flag down wait staff with no response. I think they're just a little short staffed, easily remedied. I did like the bar area quite a bit, from what I saw. Full bar, couple of big TVs (only two, not a whole wall of them), nice set up. Would definitely be worth checking out for an after work happy hour.

I love this place.  Service is always great and food is even better.  I always get the smoked chicken sandwich and Brussels sprouts.  Sooo gooood.  Their hummus is great too. I always crave everything here!

Love this place every time I go.  This time it was awesome - the very best crab cake I've ever had, and that includes being right on the east coast.  Had potato salad on the side - and it was really as awesome as the crab cake.

You can order yourself then sit down or be waited on which we did today. Great houmous and bread.  Shared a sandwich and fries with my dad.   More than enough food that is for sure.  I would certainly go and try something else.  

The area itself is great.  There are different restaurants and a beer bar.  Gotta try something in there now that I am drinking beer.  Help me drinking beer.  Oh no. Oh Yeah1.

Oh my God, can I just tell you that this place is amazing! The people, the environment, and especially the food are amazing! They have a lot of gluten-free options.

You literally walked out of sure feeling satisfied and not bloated at all. I wish this place was in California. I will definitely come back. Don't count that three times I've been here in the last three days LOL!

I'm not familiar with Udi's and I took the negative reviews with a grain of salt.  However, I too was disappointed. 
This place has so much potential if they were to fine tune (or overhaul??) their operations. 
My first disappointment was the cappuccino.  It was too weak and was served in a paper cup.  My plate had to be washed, my silverware had to be washed - where's the ceramic cup?  If a joint that serves espresso can learn one thing it is 'stop using paper cups'. Totally ruins the coffee.  Might as well go to a gas station. 
The Eggs Benedict was lukewarm which I think was the result of cold Hollandaise sauce.
The final straw was the fruit dish.  I found pieces of lettuce and a caper in the bowl.  I only hope this was not from someone else's plate. 
Again, this place could totally rule this hotel parking lot.
Great sushi grade salmon. I got mine cooked medium and it was perfect. Was not a huge fan of the "ultimate mac and cheese", but overall great experience and will be returning for the salmon!

I have been coming to this restaurant since it opened.  I always have a good experience.  The food is great and well priced.  It is never too crowded which makes it a great option for a weekend brunch.  I would recommend it if you are looking for somewhere to go on a Saturday or Sunday late morning but don't want a thirty minute wait.
It is very family friendly and it has always been a good place to go with my son.  The bread is made in house so I would suggest ordering something with the bread and giving it a try (pizza, breadsticks, sandwich, etc.)  They also have a surprising good bar selection as well.
Great happy hour.  Drinks are cheap and bar service is great.  Had the $2 chicken tacos, highly recommended!
Big fan of the mules.. the food's pretty good too. Definitely a solid place to refuel.

To rip off an old, old SNL Commercial Parody: Is it a floor wax? Or a dessert topping? It's Both!

Udi's at Cityset, a new assemblage of restaurants in the free state of Glendale can't make its mind up whether it's Fast Casual, Sit-down or Step-up (to the bar...) And that's to our advantage.

Midway through my bike ride along the Cherry Creek trail, I needed a little breakfast. I sometimes head to Moe's for a bagel, but this time I was not that motivated. So, I find myself cruising this new space, looking for a bike rack (hint, they are hidden on the west side of the building...) 

I stepped up to the counter, ordered a breakfast burrito & coffee. The friendly girl behind the counter handed me one of those wireless pucks you usually get while waiting for a table. This one appears to mark your location. She brought out  my burrito & grabbed the puck.

The burrito was fresh made, and very tasty. Lots more to discover at Udi's!

I didn't think place was special at all. My friend and I had dinner there, it just served regular salads and regular sandwiches and it wasn't anything special. Our waitress was very nice, though she forgot about us a few times, but I didn't mind since I was having a great time catching up with my friend. The space is the best part of the restaurant, I loved the open kitchen layout with great furniture. I won't be returning because of the mediocre food.

I don't know why everyone has been so negative about this location. They just opened about a month ago. They are not a coffee shop, they make delicious food. They have a decent happy hour and their pizza chef is quite attractive. I come here at least once a week!
Everyone needs to relax and let this restaurant work out its kinks before nitpicking it so much.

Our waiter, Billy Judge, was such a gem. We couldn't have asked for a better first time at Silvi's. He was super polite and walked us through everything. Aside from our fantastic experience with our waiter, we really enjoyed the food. I'm not going to go into detail about the food, because literally everything (carrot cake, sliders, cheese fries, and salmon sandwich)  was was to die for and I encourage everyone to come and try Silvi's with Billy.

We just moved to the area and are excited about checking out all the new and wonderful restaurants, but we keep coming back here. We have probably been four times in the last month.  They are incredibly friendly, very accommodating to our 11 month old son, and the food is great. We love the Sausage and Sage pizza, the Beet Salad, and the Salmon entree. Yum!!

I guess it all depends on what you are looking for and if u find it, does it meet or exceed your expectations. I travel on a limited budget so I am always looking for best bang for the buck. I like heathy food with a good beer selection, easy atmosphere. Silvi's Kitchen exceed my expectations. I had fresh salmon w veggies, a roasted beet salad and a killer IPA. Erick the GM has done an awesome job of retooling his beer selection. Many Colorado beers to choose from. This is an above value restaurant and I would definitely come back

I saw the yelp reviews. and had the short ribs which were fantastic. tender without being stringy and sauteed chard which was not over cooked. I am giving this place 3 stars because my friend had the greek appetizer with falafals, hummus ets. which she said was very mediocre. the service was pleasant and efficient. nice place to sit and chat. i  would go back but be careful what you order

We had the roast beef sandwich, brussel sprouts, and the Mac and cheese. The service was good from the waitress. The food came out fast. Too fast like lees than 5 minutes. That said the food was just ok. Nothing I think I'll go back for to spend my hard earned money on.
Loved this place! Great customer service and great food! Was in town for business and ended up coming here multiple times in one week.... Order the pizza!

I absolutely love this place. I have never had a bad meal here, which is saying a lot because I've eaten quite a few times. My mom was recently in town and I brought her to the Silvi's at CitySet. She was impressed by the patio and overall environment of the surroundings. We ordered the Kale Gratin, Charred Brussel Sprouts and the Kale Pizza. Each was very flavorful and fresh. My mom loved it so much, she asked to go back on her last night in town to try another pizza!!

I would also recommend the hummus appetizer and butternut squash pizza. Also, they have pretty good happy hour specials. I definitely would say this is a favorite local spot in Glendale!

This is the second time I have been there and they do not seem to get "it" together.  First time they didn't get the meal out on time for my friend so we had to leave.  This trip I ordered the short ribs for $21 and it was barely enough to feed a small mouse.   They brought the main dish out fast and my soup, salad, and bread for my daughter came much later.   Although the taste of the food was good, it was not worth the high price.  JAX as also over priced for what you got.  Skip this place and find something better.

We went for lunch around 2: 00 PM  and were seated in the dining room at our request. The entire room was pretty much empty but we were seated right  in front of a table full of dirty dishes which never was cleaned up during our meal. Our waiter served our drinks but we needed a couple minutes to decide on our food. After 10 minutes I went and found a waitress to take our order. Our food was good except our avocado salad was missing avocados. We never saw our waiter until I again found a waitress and told her we had to leave. Our waiter brought our bill and disappeared again. We were overcharged by  $5.  Again we found the waitress as our waiter was no where around.  She had the manager fix it.  The manager never came by. To top it off the women's bathroom was dirty. 
I doubt we will go back.

Oh my good God, they have the best french toast! I've also had the brussel sprouts, which were good, but nothing surprising. That french toast is enough to make me want to follow them back to the kitchen and learn it for myself. Really good.

Um, thanks for the mediocre over priced food Udi's. I went here for what ended up being an over priced lunch. I ordered the brie sandwich at the recommendation of the bartender. It had wilted lettuce, which the substituted out when I pointed out to them. The sandwich was dry and lacking in flavor. The service was lousy. The bartender is apparently going to culinary school to be a chef and cared more about bragging to other customers about his schooling and internship than making sure that I had service. I had to interrupt and ask for a refill on my water.

They upcharged me substantially for gluten free bread. I had a second upstage for sweet potato fries. My lousy dry sandwich was $17 after the upcharges. 

Udis, I will never go back. After the bad sandwich, I'm hesitant to buy your products at the grocery store.

Over 100 beers on tap....sounds good to me!  I started with the House IPA, brewed by the Uinta Brewing Company. With big hop aroma bursting with citrus flavors. Next up I tried a Boulder Buffalo Golden blonde ale. This is a popular flavorful local light beer, it was fine but I do prefer the IPA's in this town. Had a sample of Breckenridge Agave Wheat, the combination wheat and citrus makes a perfect blend of flavors.

I ordered the coconut shrimp as an appetizer to share, 3 large pieces and even though they were a little over cooked... they were really good.We also shared the lobster, crab and artichoke dip...yummy four cheese blend with baked pita chips.


This place is a chain restaurant and I'm ok with that...just a simple place to go and enjoy a huge selection of beers!

**MORE LIKE 2.5 Stars**

If you know me, you know I LOVE YARD HOUSE.  I wish there was one closer to where I live or least accessible by train or mass transit.  Most of the time, I visit Yard Houses when I'm doing my sports tours, Denver was no exception.  We were excited to see that there was a YH right by where we were staying.  A bit of a walk but we're New Yorkers.  We're used to it!

I walked out a bit disappointed.  

Usually the menu is pretty standard, but the place was pretty busy, and they were able to seat us right away...in like the crappiest area, right by the door at a HUGE table that was better suited for a family of four or EIGHT.  No joke.  But you know what, we were willing to overlook it because we are fans of Yard House.

My beer was a bit disappointing, as was my food which is usually my stand by (the grilled cheese with tomato bisque).  I mean, it's tough to be disappointed at this place but between the service, the food and beer (which are pretty hard to mess up here), I think I might eschew this place next time I'm in Denver.

Pros:
Lots of beers on tap 

Cons:
Service is soooo slowwwww!
Coconut shrimp way over fired.
Skirt steak was overly chewy and served pre-cut rather than as a whole piece 


The yard house was extremely busy on the night I stopped by.  I didn't stay for dinner, but was able to try a few apps and experience enough disappointing service for a long time.

OK, it's a chain but a very good one and worth a visit.

PRO TIP #1- You may have heard that they have 100 taps and that's true.  If you don't like beer, DO NOT WRITE THEM OFF!  They have an excellent wine & specialty drink list.

ATMOSPHERE- I blew in for an early dinner.  The place was bustling and huge.  What was really interesting is the vibe was what I would call happy casual.  Dozens and dozens of folks were munching and sipping and laughing and generally having a good time.  It really was infectious and a great sign.

CUSTOMER SERVICE- I sat at the bar and was served by 1  1/2 bartenders.  Don't ask me if the  1/2 was the top or the bottom half.  It's just that I had one primary and one occasional bartender.  My occasional bartender was really cute and I preferred the top half!  Both were friendly and competent.

ADULT LIBATIONS- This place will please everyone.  Beer, wine and specialty drinks are all there.  I was sampling small glasses of beer which here are called shorties.  I was a happy camper.

FOOD- As others have said the menu here is GINORMOUS!

Pro Tip #2- Portion sizes here are tricky.  Some are just normal and others are huge.  If you are thinking of ordering three or more items just for yourself I would be very very careful.  

FOOD- I began with Deviled Eggs and was delighted.  The portion size was normal with four halves.  The topping was a little spicy and bursting with flavor. 

Next I opted for Grilled Korean BBQ Beef.  It was presented on the menu like an appetizer.  I was asked if I wanted brown or white rice which was a nice touch.  It arrived quickly and was huge!  The beef was tender and the sauce was appropriately tangy/salty and it was all around delicious.

I was completely stuffed.  There was no chance I could even look at a full sized entrée.   This is what I mean about portion sizes!  This would be an Ideal place for a bunch of folks sharing dishes.

This is easily one of the best chain experiences I have had in a while and I would return in a heartbeat!
Sat at the bar on Monday night football - happy hour all night long! Great deals on drinks and apps. I like the poke stack and the nachos were huge (and nice and crispy).

I've been to yard house in other states and I had a better experience. Denver has happy hour till 6ish everywhere. Yard house has Happy hour menu and it's very limited and not a good deal, IMO compared to what you can get at other yard house or other places in Denver.

Service is attentive though.  Stop by here if you are super hungry as the portion size is pretty big.

A couple of my coworkers were in town for a work conference over at the Colorado Convention Center. This place was conveniently located in Downtown Denver and in between the convention center and our hotel. So naturally we stopped in for lunch one day. It was pretty much a standard Yard House, so you can expect a wide range of beers to choose from as well as great fast service! And most importantly, their food isn't too shabby as well! 

*Cobb Salad added Shrimp*
I decided to go with something healthier as I had been overindulging on burgers and other less healthier food as of late. This was a great choice. It was one of the better Cobb salads that I've ever eaten. Adding the shrimp made it even better. I could eat this salad every day if I must!

*Denver Beer Co. Graham Cracker Porter*
I had this nice locally brewed porter to go with the salad. Normally I drink a porter or a stout with my burgers, but it went well even with a salad. It was not too bad and not overly sweet.

Overall, you should come here if you want something safe and more than decent in terms of food and libations. However if you're new to Denver and feeling a little adventurous, you should find somewhere else as you can go to a Yard House in practically any major US city.

This is a nice space and our server was friendly and helpful. The poke nachos were great and set the bar high for the rest of the meal which sadly let the tacos fall a little flat. My husbands lamb burger was pretty tasty and the truffle fries were not bad either. All in all I'd say pretty good!

They're called a high-end sports bar, but I'm not sure how they got that label. Overpriced food and mood lighting? The food selection is huge, but makes me scratch my head.  Be prepared to wait awhile regardless of what you order. And then be prepared to scratch your head too and say "huh" aloud when the food hits your table.  The guacamole is pretty tasty but it's confusing when 11 chips and a thimble-full of guac arrive. Similar scenario when presented with the thai chicken pizza (crust very bland).  The overarching theme here being your money doesn't go far here for small, mediocre-tasting dishes

This place does do beer really well. Dozens of beers on tap and you can get them in their trademark 'yard' glasses (think those hand grenades you get in New Orleans). They should probably offer more local brews considering they're in the (unofficial) craft beer capital of America, but you'll be sure to find something you like. 

If you're staying in the Sheraton downtown or perusing 16th street mall, this wouldn't be a bad place to swing by. I wouldn't seek this place out otherwise though. [See: Stout Street Social]

Service extremely slow,  meals cold and our Swiss friend was served a salad like this photo.  overpriced.  I could get a better burger. from the burger chief food truck  hotter for sure.  Sent one cold meal back and it took ages to get it back

Only tried the pork belly tacos but they were soooo good. I honestly don't have anything bad to say about the food, but the service was slow. Our server had too many tables to handle so its definitely not his fault.

The ambiance was nice and the server was at first. We were placed at a table and sat down and ordered drinks. We got an appetizer for around $14 that was mediocre at best. When we told the server we may not be having dinner, he was annoyed and tended to us much less even though we continued to drink beer. We decided to order dinner after all to avoid leaving the hotel in downtown on a Friday. We ordered a single pizza and salads. After a $90+ bill we noticed we were charged $3.95 for extra dressing for the salads and we didn't even wind up with it. $3.95 for dressing is one thing but at least include it in the to go bag. Overall this place is over priced and snobbery abounds.

Good but not great. Service was good, although a but slow due to higher than usual downtown crowds plus rainy weather.

Chicken tenders were excellent as were the duck wings, both of which I would recommend. The queso dip was also excellent. Pizza was good but not great. 

I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there but I would go again for the duck wings if I was in the area.

I'm updating my review on yard house and bringing it down to 3 stars. This used to be one of my favorite places to eat at but the last dozen or so times I've come I've been unsatisfied with the quality of the food. I don't know if it's just this location or all yard houses but for some reason the food just isn't what it used to be and it just seems mediocre at best. Hope they can get it together soon because I used to really love this place. 
On a brighter note, my waitress on my recent visit (Emily) was beyond excellent. She's such a doll!

Happy Hour is where it's at! Awesome atmoshpere that's equally great for watching a football game or going on a date. Excellent beer selection, and the nachos are enormous. More than anything, though, I commend the customer service. Will definitely be coming back to this Yard House in the future.
You could never go wrong with The Yard house. Food is always on point and my waitress Lindsey was awesome.

Worst service ever.

Sat at the bar after work. Food and wine.

Waitress/bartender--Makayla.

Repeated requests for water ignored.

No set up. Had to ask the food runner.

Never followed up to check on my dinner.

Complete arrogance.

I really like this place, we took my daughter for her 21st bday and it was an awesome experience. I'm jealous we don't have something like this here. Service was bomb and the vampiro taco was deeeeelicioso!! Perfection, over 100 brews to choose from and they're poured on a TALL glass...ahhh so cool!

We have eaten at the other location and had a wonderful experience. This restaurant was one of the 2 reasons we drove almost 4 hours to spend our weekend in Denver. Keegan was a wonderful waiter. I had the mooshu eggrolls for an appetizer, and my husband had the devilled eggs. My Caesar salad came out and while tasty, it had LOTS of brown middle parts of the lettuce, more than I cared for. The good news is that it was a BIG salad for the $3.50 add on fee. At least I got my money's worth. I had the pepper crusted filet and my husband had the enchilada stack. My steak was good, but I ordered it medium and it was medium well in the middle and well done everywhere except the very, very center. I would have told Keegan but he didn't come back for about 20 minutes so I just chowed down anyway. No worries, I just wanted to let the kitchen know to take it off the fire a bit sooner. My husband wasn't impressed with his stack, said the only taste on it was the red sauce. My sons food came out early, like we asked, and it was just fine. We ended up eating it since he didn't.. That's a toddler for you. I will upload pictures in a few minutes.
I ordered a cheeseburger (take out) and it was burnt and tasted awful. Feeling sick now too. Don't waste your money.

Welcome this is a YardHouse,
  YardHouse serves up some of the best beers on tap and some decent music. It's one of the better Darden chains.  Any place with Dellirum an tap gets 4 stars.

Beer selection is insanely huge! Our server, Michael, which gave great service, recommended Colorado native lager and my boyfriend was very satisfied. Of course, He got the halfyard  You can never go wrong with the happy hour price. We also ordered chicken nachos, traditional wings and my boyfriend's favorite calamari. Everything were awesome. I highly recommend this place.

Yard House wouldn't be my first choice if I were looking to grab a beer in Denver, but this is a great option if you're trying to accommodate a large group of people. I arranged a happy hour with a diverse group of coworkers and everyone had a great time.

They have a nice beer selection, with some good sours when I went. I think they occasionally have 120 Minute IPA on tap also. 

Their happy hour specials are great and the servings are enormous! I ordered chicken nachos and it was enough food for three people (and I'm a big eater).

The decor is definitely a little chain-like, but I remember the acoustics being really good. There were 12 or so of us at the table and nobody had to scream to hear the people at the other end of the table.

Service was top-notch also. Our waiter was really attentive and had no problem splitting up our check.

Came for the beer but also got some pretty good food. 

What you get with Yardhouse is a massive beer list and elevated bar food. 

The service is always good and the servers are knowledgeable to the beers which is always helpful. 

For snacks we got the duck wings (damn delicious) and the Kobe beef with spicy fried rice. 

I've never been let down by Yardhouse and the same goes for my last visit.

I stayed at the Sheraton a for a week, and if there has to be some chain connected to it, Yard House probably isn't a bad one, just due to their vast menu. I ate there three different times and tried different items each time.

-Southwest Salad. This was really pretty good. Had good flavor and was a very generous size. 

-Street Tacos, fish and chicken. These were really good. Rice was a little spicy, in a good way.

-Mac and cheese. Very underwhelming, especially after our server told us it was one of the best items on the menu.

We had inquired about the different desserts, and they had run out of a few different ones the previous night. However, our server told us that he himself had eaten about two of them. I think I know why they were running out.

Overall, food was good, and service was spotty.

Good for watching games and having beer (lots of selection) but the food is pretty gross. You should think of this place more as a bar and hence bar food than a restaurant. 

Also given its location the place gets filled with tourist (90% men) and so depending on your preference it may or may not be for you.

Ended up at Yard House after we couldn't find the Liang food stand....and glad we did. They have a large extensive menu with a large variety of items which I sometimes get worried about because I worry that nothing is unique and the entrees can be too "standard". I ordered the Nashville hot chicken sandwich, which is definitely NOT spicy, but certainly tasty as hell. Comes with well-breaded chicken, pickles, fried slaw (?). It was delicious, tender, flavorful. Also comes with fries, which can be upgraded to truffle fries for just $1. That being said, the amount of fries that it comes with is VERY generous and overall a good deal. I wasn't wanting to eat at a franchise restaurant necessarily but I was definitely satisfied with my meal here. They also are vegetarian and vegan friendly, and have a good variety of beers. Winner, winner!

I recently stayed at the Sheraton in downtown Denver for work and this Yard House is attached to the hotel so I ended up eating there twice out of laziness and not wanting to go out in the snow (really Denver - snow in April??).  I had a horrible experience at the location in Atlantic Station back home (Atlanta) so I was a little hesitant, but I'm glad I gave it a shot.  The food was OK both times, but what really shone was the service.  It was a little pricey, but the portions are huge.  Unfortunately I didn't have a fridge to keep any leftovers. I got takeout both times so I could eat in my hotel room and work. 

First time I went, I entered in through the hotel entrance.  The host opened the door for me and walked me back to where they normally handle take-out orders.  He was extremely pleasant and asked me about what brought me to Denver, where I was from, etc. As for food, I got the blackened chicken torta (sandwich).  It was tasty but I didn't think it was necessary to have 3 kinds of fat - cheese, mayo and avocado.  It was a bit much - and made for a messy meal.  

The second time I went I got the chicken nachos.  Unfortunately the chicken was a bit dry but I just covered it in sour cream and guac and it was fine.  Again, the service is what stood out.  The man who took my order over the phone was the one who got my food from the kitchen and rang me up.  Even though they were completely slammed with people from a nearby convention, he was very nice and took the time to double check that all parts of my order were in the bag.  When he realized they forgot something, he ran back to the kitchen to get it and then offered me extra napkins.  

If I'm ever staying at that Sheraton again I would definitely eat there again (especially since the Sheraton's room service was god awful)

Great place, great food and amazing selection of beer. This place was attached to our hotel (Sheraton downtown) and we luckily decided to try it.

The pineapple chicken was the star of the night (takes 20min) it's simply baked to perfection. I had a delicious chicken and rice bowl with tons of really fresh veggies. 

Beer list was amazing as expected
Go here!!!

I love that this place has a ton of beverage options. Dion is not my favorite bartender, he's kind of miserable. The Mac and Cheese was ok, but not great, a little bland. The ahi tuna salad was legit, loved it. The vampire tacos were okay, but I liked the flavor a of the ahi tuna better.

For a "chain" bar/restaurant, I really was pleasantly surprised. I have been a few times now, and food and service is consistent, the staff are very friendly. The daily happy hour is what brings me back. They do a "Vampire Taco" which is packed full or garlic and is served in a cheese-crusted tortilla, and whilst it is fatty it is SO tasty. 

If you are a beer drinker, there are dozens and dozens of beers on tap, and yes, they even serve yards of ale (I wish I liked beer when I see that come out!)

I try to typically visit local restaurants, but was pleasantly surprised by Yard House. For starters, I found many GREAT vegetarian options on the menu! It's hard to find a place with a large beer selection (for the husband) that also offers vegetarian foods. 

I ordered the Gardein "chicken" strips. Boring, I know. I just really miss fried chicken. Haha I took one bite and was questioning if they accidently gave me meat. The "chicken" strips were sooo tasty! The texture wasn't too chewy and they were crispy and perfect on the outside. I found myself wanting to order more. (I didn't ) 

We also ordered the trio option for dessert. This came with crème brûlée, peach apple cobbler, chocolate soufflé cake. I wasn't too impressed with the dessert. The crème brûlée has the weird tasting chocolate in it that totally ruined it. The cobbler was my favorite out of the three. 

I honestly can't wait to go back and get more of the Gardein "chicken" strips!

Hotel staff referred us to this hotel bar and grill as we were hungry, new to town and it was late.  The beer was great and the music they were streaming was pretty good.  The French fries were good too. The rest of the food left much to be desired. Fish (from the fish and chips) was VERY fishy tasting, the chicken strips were bland, the jambalaya rice was sweet (found that difficult to wrap my mind around. Why sugar the rice? The enchilada stack sounded interesting, but there was an off taste in places but not throughout. Stick with simple far and enjoy the IPAs.

Really yummy appetizers such as the calamari and the chicken lettuce wraps. I had the Firestone nitro milk stout that was to die for. Missed happy hour so it was a bit pricy ( about $7 for pint ) but worth the atmosphere.
Had the small tomato Bisquesoup and some sliders. It was nice to be able to sit outdoors with such nice warm weather.

This experience at the Yard House in Denver irked me a little. As a rule, we like the Yard House chain for a couple of important reasons. 

First, I'm a beer lover and I love the variety (though I would recommend that you consider replacing a few with some more interesting micro-brews from the area, we have many that are awesome - my suggestions would be Billies Chilies and a couple of good sours).
 
Second, I'm a pescetarian (for now) and my BF is a lifelong vegetarian, so we really, really love the Gardein section of the menu. It's awesome and I wish other chains would do this, but until that happens, we'll eat at YH anytime we are near one. We especially love the veggie buffalo wings - they were perfectly cooked here, crispy under the spicy sauce. 

As usual, we ordered the "wings." When they arrived, there were a measly 3 pieces of celery in the basket. Since we order this dish EVERY TIME we come to a YH, we know that there's usually about 5-6 pieces. I asked about them, and the guy who was delivering them from the kitchen said he'd ask the kitchen - but there might be an EXTRA CHARGE for any more pieces. I was shocked. We explained that the dish wasn't typical, and we know because we order it often. I  asked him to check with the kitchen, but if they decided they wanted to charge us for a couple extra pieces (we only wanted 2 or 3 more), I didn't want that - instead, I told him, I would want to talk to a manager. When he came back from the kitchen, with a basket of WAY more celery than I asked for (or needed), he came clean and told the truth: they were simply running short on celery and were trying to conserve. Jeez. Why didn't they tell the servers to let customers know when they're ordering? Or simply provide the normal portion until they run  out and then tell people they're out? Or, better yet...why didn't someone run down the street to the store and buy a bunch of celery? It's cheap! 

We will be back. But, we were definitely annoyed by the lack of customer service for a small request (and a threat of an upcharge to try dissuading us).

Let's start with the false advertising. They do not have the most beers on Tap in the world. Doherty's ale house Warwick RI blows them away.
The food is decent, the bar tenders not so much. Sasha can't pour a proper Guinness to save her life. Then went into a rant how she was superior because she went to private school on the taxpayers dime.
Yea no thank you not visiting this place when I am in Denver

Beer?  Think twice.

I really like the food and beer at Yard House.  I've been eating here and another location in Lakewood for about 12 years.  Their food menu is varied and thoughtful.  Their beer selection is incredible.

I'm very disappointed with their recent beer prices, however.  Perhaps the overhead on the 16th st mall is super high, but who charges $7 for a beer?  That's pretty ridiculous.

Service was extremely slow. They have an extensive food menu, however the food itself was less than impressive. We ordered the chicken tacos and the fried chicken sandwich. The chicken on the tacos were cold and French fries with the sandwich were luke warm. This place does have an extensive beer list and would be good to watch games at. Save your money and go elsewhere if your going to eat the food.

Great atmosphere for a night out. They seated us even though our party was incomplete on a Friday night, which was generous of them -- busy places typically don't allow that! When everyone arrived, our waiter promptly took our orders. We were celebrating a birthday, so we got two free mini desserts to share with our party of 5. Both were delicious.

The BBQ Chicken Salad is my favorite thing on the menu. There's so many toppings that it doesn't really feel like you're eating a salad. I always ask for the chicken to be warm, since it's typically served cold. The half size is the perfect meal portion for my wife, but of course I always get the full size.

We knew we were going to eat too much, but no regrets. Started with crab dip and lettuce wraps which are staples for us and their excellence covered in a previous review.

Tacos never disappoint, burgers are always excellent, but the new addition this time was the pork chops. Juicy, and well prepared with an apple cider sauce to go with it. The other was the lobster garlic noodles which had a healthy portion of seafood and tasty noodles in peanut oil. Both were impressive and worth adding to the list of regular options, though I don't think I've had anything bad here.

I'm not sure why someone would want to go to a Yardhouse (yet another place to stare at sports center, perhaps) but it sure isn't the food. 

It is a chain, so you can't expect much in the way of quality. Still, for the prices they charge they should do better than a microwave. 

Portions are huge here, much like their oversized bankets. If you order something, you probably won't finish or need a box.

It's too much to ask for them to cook your burger to the proper temperature, hopefully you like charcoal.  Also, your meal will likely be cold by the time they bring it to you after spending plenty of time in the window.  

The calamari is unseasoned, and the desserts are a molten mess of diabetes in a pan.  

In all seriousness, there's probably a McDonald's not too far away, at least you won't overpay and you might get lucky with a fresh order of fries, both are beyond the Yard House's capabilities.

The service was great. and atmosphere was lovely. however they were out of everything we tried to order. I would understand if it was close to closing time, however we arrived only at 7:30pm. wish we could have tried what we wanted. would suggest the half yard beers though!

Super dark inside. Loved the location of this place. Our server was very friendly and awesome. I ordered the Brussels sprouts with potatoes. Delicious!! My wife got the Jamaican jerk wings and she loved it. She also got the truffle fries which were delicious as well. Yard house does have a house white beer that tastes similar to Hoegarden. Just a heads up. 

This was just a stop to have my wife and one of our friends eat but I'd love to come back and try more of their food items in their menu.

Although the Yard House is a franchise, the people who work at this one do a good job setting themselves apart from the pack. The customer service from the friendly servers was above and beyond all expectations. They are doing an excellent job and should be recognized for it. 

Yard House is a restaurant and bar that is known for featuring more beers on tap than anywhere you have ever been before. The food here is also really good! I had the enchilada stack and had no idea what to expect. When it arrived I was extremely surprised to see how much effort and pride that the cooks put into the presentation of my meal. 

Back to the reason I am writing this review, the service. I believe that our servers  name was Lynnea and she was the best ever. She walked us through the humongous beer menu, making great recommendations and proving that she actually knew what she was talking about. We told her that we had just gotten to Denver and were wondering about a good place to watch the college basketball championship. She took the time to hang out for a little and tell us all about Denver's sub districts and her favorite local spots. She even wrote everything down for us and taught us about the best ways to travel throughout the city. 

The location for the Yard House is brilliant. It is located right in the heart of downtown Denver and along the 16th street mall. If I lived in Denver than this would be a place I went to regularly. There isn't a single thing that I could find to complain about. If you are in the downtown area visiting, give this place a try and you will not regret it.

The food here is alright it is like a step above Chili's. I had the Street tacos with beans and rice. The tacos were ok but I've had better. The beans were bland but the rice was great, it had a good flavor. That's really all I have on this place, the customer service was ok.
