Wow! Great service and excellent food. I've spent twice as much on a ribeye steak this good. If you get the steak, though, don't put the steak sauce on it. The steak is best on its own!

I've been here quite a few times and have never had good service. There's always too many hosts/hostesses crowding the front and bone of them seem to know what's going on. Servers are too distracted by all huddling and talking together, leaving customers neglected. I only come for the extensive beer list, but if you have the time, go to Falling Rock.

It wasn't busy, but it took them 45 minutes to get me a sad looking burger and obviously pre-frozen fries. The waiter was nice enough, but none of the 15+ staff members and managers milling about seemed to care if I was there or not. I would not recommend this to anyone. I can't imagine how bad it is when they're busy.

Amanda was terrific. I love the Yard House but this place in Denver was great. If every one else is having the beer lovers experience I am, horrahh for Yard House Denver. If Amanda's your server...bonus. Good times.

Stayed very close to this place and wanted to check it out after reading positive reviews and it did not disappoint.

They have a great beer selection. It's overwhelming which is a good thing.

They have plenty of TV's which was great for a Saturday with many college football games on.

The food was really good. We got guacamole for an appetizer and we both had pizzas which were very tasty. I got the margherita and my dad got the ham and pineapple. The portions were huge which given the price really surprised me. It was a great value.

We enjoyed it so much we tried to go again after the Broncos game but it was packed and there was an hour wait. I definitely recommend checking this place out if you're in the area.

Fun place to eat. The grilled cheese is the best I have ever had! 
The service is FABULOUS! My son has a lot of food allergies and the waitress vetted everything very thoroughly.
It was very, very busy so the food came out a bit slow.

Visited this location while on a trip after trying and failing to find an open food cart on the Mall. Figured at least you know what to expect with a chain restaurant. 

Went around 3:30pm and it was busy with customers but most were ordering drinks only so no reason for the kitchen to take super long with 1 appetizer and 1 entree. The food took around 30 minutes to come out, was lukewarm, and when we asked for some paper napkins, we were brought bathroom paper towels. Kinda gross. Having barely eaten breakfast, we were too hungry to even bother mentioning it. The weird thing is that they had plenty of servers so there's no reason why the food should be cold. It probably would have tasted better if it was warm, but the food was ok. 

Besides all that, the entree I ordered came with significantly less vegetables than normal for that dish. I saw another review in which someone mentioned them conserving celery.. Is there a produce shortage in Denver?

We stayed at the Sheraton, so we decided to have dinner here before heading to a baseball game. 
The Chicken Nachos are HUGE, but delicious! I had the Southern Belle for my beverage- also very good! 
My husband ordered a burger medium- it came out well done! They also didn't have the whiskey he drinks.  Our waiter did offer to have another burger made, but my husband declined. The manager also came to our table (without us asking) to see if he could have another burger made or if we would like dessert. We thanked him, but told him that wasn't necessary. The burger wasn't so bad that it wasn't edible.  I thought that was great customer service just because so many places will just dismiss it if you don't make a big deal.  In the end the manager took my drink off the bill as a courtesy! We were surprised but grateful for such great customer service!

I may have just discovered a new gem in downtown Denver Happy Hour dining.  There is a large selection of discounted food options at rhe Yard House, which defines itself as American fusion cuisine, including Asian and Mexican flare.  I tried the Blue Crad Cakes ($7).  These were were fresh and slightly spicy, though had a little too much filling for my taste especially with the deep fried panko bread crumb like crust.  I also tried the Seared Ahi Sashimi ($8) served with red cabbage slaw with a soy vinaigrette.  This dish was fresh and tasty and complement well by the tangy slaw accompaniment.  Portions were appropriate to large.  Personal preference, I would probably not select the crab cakes again, since I have had more impressive elsewhere.  I would opt for the the Seared Ahi again, but also look forward to sampling thier large selection of other Happy Hour fare, including a very considerable portion of Poke Nachos, always look forward to discovering a good calamari, and their pizzas ($6 on their happy hour menu looked very appealing.  I am definitely looking forward to future visits.

Love this Yard House; great food, friendly staff, clean place. They have one of the best happy hour menu's out there! Definitely recommend the poke stack and blue crab cakes! Never had a bad dish here, if your shopping at 16th street definitely come and eat here!

Greeted and seated promptly. Ginger crusted salmon was delicious. Kale Caesar salad was equally creative and excellent.  If beer isn't your thing, the wine choices are equally satisfying.  Definitely recommend.

To give context to my experience, I came on July 4th, and it ended up being a super odd night. There seemed to be a bit of confusion with the servers, as it was super packed. Our food ended up taking over an hour, and it turned out that there were some issues with the kitchen. The assistant managers, Bobby and Jordin, were super nice and came by to check on us. They even comped our table! I do wish that we had received an explanation of what was going on earlier, but I imagine they were working their way through a packed restaurant of slightly peeved guests.

In terms of the food and drink, the drink list was super awesome. They have a great selection of beer, cocktails, and wine. For food, I had the kale Caesar salad with chicken. I was a bit skeptical at first, as it had both raisins and pistachios, but they ended up being super tasty. The chicken was well-cooked, and the salad was fresh. The raisins added a nice sweetness, and the pistachios added a very rich, nutty flavor to counterbalance the bitterness of the kale. The main stain on the night food-wise is that one of our party had an almost completely raw burger. They however came back to remedy the situation. Overall, I had a decent experience regardless of all the oddities and hope to come back and try some other stuff some time soon.

Had a better experience this time around...Amber was our waitress and was pretty good! She was funny, she was nice, and she didn't disappear on us after we ordered our food. I got the California Sushi and I must say I liked it. It's different and I like different. The only thing about it...it was HOT!! Probably the spiciest I've ever had. I couldn't finish it but it was so good so next time I'll make sure I don't get the serranos on it because even after I removed them from on top it's like the flavor of them seeped into the sushi.

Why 4 stars? Because the beer selection is great, but not very local.

   ---   ---   ---

What do you do on the majority of your drive from Aspen to Denver? I'll tell you what I do:

Hardcore research on the best brewery to visit for our last night in town, before we take a red-eye home.

But that can't take 4 hours, you ask? Well, as you know, reception on that drive isn't the best. And Sunday nights aren't the best for visiting breweries. So many of them were closed by about 8:00 when we were getting into town. Others were way off the beaten path, and some just had a tap list that didn't seem worth the trek.

So... I had Yard House as the back-up the entire time, and ended up having to go that route. There's TONS of beer here, but almost nothing that I hadn't already seen a million times at places all around the country. It's weird - there are now places that can have 50+ taps, but not really feel like they have a great selection.

And while Yard House wasn't really what I was looking for, I can't really rate a place 3 stars with that much beer... even if it's mostly not local.
Open for great late night eats: wings, chicken strips, nachos, and queso hit the spot. Great patio. Strips are great.

Always good quality, always good service, great food and TONS of beer options! 

Try the Mac and Cheese, or the Truffle burger. You will NOT be disappointed!

Kinda bummed there was no yelp coupon for this place! We had a great time on a Friday night , and the menu had some good variety. The service was great despite a packed house, but we did have to compete with the noise to hear each other.

We got truffle fries ( basically garlic Parmesan fries) , French onion soup , a Margherita pizza, and a large brownie for desert. The food was warm, the soup in particular was piping hot, and aided the beer we drank. I ordered Breckinridge brewery agave nectar. I did not particularly like the margarita pizza ( it was a cheap cheese pizza with tomatoes on it) and the brownie was so so. Cost us $60, but had a great time, so it's all about the company you bring!
Stopped in for a few apps and a couple local brews. Bartender was extremely helpful and knew what he was talking about. Food and drinks came quick. Will definitely be back.

With so many craft breweries in Denver, I just don't think it makes sense to visit these chain places - Yard House, World of Beer, etc. I think you can get better beer & food elsewhere. I think the novelty of this place is that its on the 16th Street Mall and convenient for tourists.

We didn't have a bad experience here (were waiting on some people at the Sheraton, so it was convenient), but I just think Denver has much much better to offer.

A great choice for a hotel restaurant - I'd go back even if I wasn't staying there. Tons of food choices - thrilled to see a whole section of Gardein fake chicken items! 
Great drinks menu as well... Sunkissed Sangria!

The insane beer selection is one of the best I've ever seen.  Could come here for weeks on end and still never catch up.

Food isn't that great, but it's good enough.

Come for the beers, maybe maybe dinner.

This was an unexpected surprise. We really did not know where we were going to eat while in Denver but reviewed Yelp and this looks like as good as any. Wow had the skirt steak egg over medium and it was serves on sweet potato corn cake....damn it was great. Also had a really good wine selection that per bottle was not so over priced. Service was good and it was clean.

Adding a star after my most recent visit, where I finally decided not to sit at the bar. Usually I prefer the bar, as service is faster, but we experienced exceptional service at a table. Both our waiters were quick and attentive, including informing us that the first was leaving and introducing us to our new one.

We also had the pleasure to speak to Jordan, the manager, as we were inquiring about doing a group dinner. Unfortunately they don't have the facilities we were looking for, but Jordan asked his staff for ideas of other places and sat down with us to chat about it. Truly friendly and helpful.

And I finally had some of their food. The carnitas tacos are delicious, and there are many other tasty sounding options. Will probably avoid the fish taco next time, as it was a bit bland.

Beer list has gotten a bit more diverse since my previous visits, but they could still mix it up a bit more with brands and special tappings.

All in all, a good place to chill with beers and bites, and pleasant wait service.
Love the large variety of beer and the half yards they serve them in. Service is great and the servers can take and give a ribbing with the best of them.

i really liked this place i'm bummed the other reviews don't agree 
its one of the nicest largest cleanest sports bars ive ever been to
and we didnt even go to watch sports 
we had amazing beer suggested by the water and shared spicy edemame (spicy) and ahi tuna poke bowl (sooooo yumm)
the menu has asain and american influences so there is somethign for everyone adn typical bar food but also fresh healthy options 
i wish i was here for longer bc i would totally go back but i must try other places since im only in town for the week

Rude I cannot believe this happened. We asked to sit on the Patio on a Tuesday afternoon. Not too busy. The host proceeded to tell us there were no tables on the patio(there were at least 4-5 that I saw we were willing to wait). The host didn't like when we mentioned this. Proceeded to take us to the farthest deepest corner of the resturant. So we left. I was on Vacation this was ridiculous

Our first night in Denver and the night before a big meeting we did not want to venture far.  Yard House is attached to our hotel and seems to be the perfect choice.

Came in after a couple of drinks at the bar ready for some American food.  Was sat for a party of 3 one in route immediately.  The place was VERY busy but luckily we got a booth and got some drinks!  Finally I am not sober driver this night so I got my fav which is a Cosmo, the drinks were mixed nice and it was a cosmo not a vodka cranberry.  Thank god some bartenders really do not know the difference... 

Checking out the menu and they had some great options and Yelp of course helped me out as well.  I chose something I haven't had in a few years and kept calling my name, the cuban with truffle fries. (truffle fries are a weakness of mine)  My sandwich was delicious a nice thick cut of pork with the right amount of sauce and was so large I could only eat half.  Luckily I had a fridge in the room sadly I couldn't eat the other half with all the other great places we tried! 

Service was on Par and the drinks came when one was empty and since I was not sober driver for once I greatly appreciated that!  LOL

Great food/cooks, Good bartenders and a Great server.
Amazing seared ahi sammich. Very generous portion of fish. Bar staff provides tremendous service. Love the beer selection on tap.
I had a fantastic pomegranate margarita and the jambalaya, it was superb! My nephew had a burger and fries and the pineapple express cocktail, looked really good!

Okay food and decent atmosphere, I come here because they have vegan options (although not labeled) and I can watch my Cavaliers. The gardin menu is convenient, but feels like a cop out. I'd love to see a little creativity put into a vegan dish.

Zach D. Was taking care of us tonight. He had great posture and seemed like and astute man. As he approached the table you sense that this man knew what he was doing. He described the menu like an author describes a sunset, and that emotion produced by that sunset was the same as my experience at yard house thanks to Zach D.

TVs everywhere! Great place to catch a game or an upbeat dinner. The menu is so large I'm certain you will find something, no matter what mood your in. The service? Excellent!! Our waitress was beyond perfect. She made our dinner enjoyable. Our glasses of water were never empty. The food was average. I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich with a house salad. I asked for half dressing. And when she brought it to me she told me that if it was still too much to let her know. Wife ordered the vegan burger and also a house salad. Waitress asked if she was truly vegan, or were the croutons in the salad ok. Wife enjoyed the vegan burger and house salad. I would recommend this place to everyone. Food is good and service is superb. Food came out in a reasonable amount of time. Only time to avoid this restaurant would be if u wanted a quiet dinner as it is loud inside.

The wisconsin cheese curds are a must have! The tacos were also pretty good, especially the chicken tinga was my fave. Great beer selection and good service, our server Thalia was great! Lastly, is worth saving some room for the mini dessert trio.

WOW! Rude hostess by the name of Abril seated us and even after I said that we would prefer a booth she say is at a bar top table. I had surgery on my back and this place went out of their way to make us feel so uncomfortable. What junk! People just dropped of the food and bailed without any check up. NEVER AGAIN!

Came here for a company dinner, service was okay. We had over 15 people and the quality of food was horrible. Talked to manager and she understood but didn't care enough to rectify. Not coming here again.

Yard House has some really great food... I've only ever eaten there while having drinks with friends and it's been great. Good appetizer portions and attentive staff.

Today I decided to try to-go lunch with a co-worker. Service was great but I'm disappointed in my food. Although it tasted wonderful, I paid approximately $4.50 a piece for a single street taco. My hand was waaay bigger than the tortilla and I'm a 5'2" woman. My issue here is portion size vs price.

I ordered a blackened swordfish one and a carnitas one.

The blackened swordfish was delicious... I've never had swordfish before but this was a perfect introduction, albiet I got two pieces of meat instead of it being packed full. Please please please look at the photos. Yard House nailed the flavor combos and swordfish had the consistency of a tender steak and wasn't very fishy at all.

Carnitas are one of my favorite dishes. I got a decent proportion of meat for the size of the tortilla, but was still disappointed by how overwhelmingly tiny a portion this was for lunch. It was very delicious, however.

I think I'll just stick to drinks and shared appetizers here. I know it's located adjacent/within the Sheraton and the ingredients are very fresh, but then again, so is a $6 sandwich.

The wait is crazy especially on a Saturday night. Some people were leaving because they were waiting for over an hour. If u are a beer drinker, it is definitely a place to be, so many choices. Calamari was amazing and also the lettuce wrap. I ordered pineapple chicken with fried rice. The Chicken was too burnt but the waiter said that is how it was suppose to be. I tried to eat it but could not even take three bites out of it. The waiter was nice to offer a menu for me to choose another food but I was ready to get out of there. For the price, I expected better food. I would come for drinks but not for food. Come during happy hours to get discount on drinks.

This is one of the best restaurants we visited while in Denver. For starters the beer menu alone makes this restaurant worth going to, with over 100 taps you can't go wrong! The service is great, the food is exceptional, and the atmosphere is brilliant. If you're looking for a restaurant to go to check out the Yard House, you will not be disappointed

I went with my girlfriend for lunch on a Tuesday, our first day in Denver on a trip. The service was excellent, but we both agreed that the food was awful. We didn't like anything we got, except for the burger, which was okay. Maybe we got the wrong things since we're used to NY food, but definitely avoid the onion rings at the very least.

Huge tap selection and a spacious bar area, although the prices are a little high.

My girlfriend and I stopped here while walking down the mall - we're suckers for a place that advertises itself as having the most beers on tap in the world. We found a seat at the bar and was immediately greeted by a very friendly bartender. We ordered our beers and an order of the Deviled Eggs ($3). The beer list is massive and are arranged by taste/type (Light, Fruity, Wheat, Malty, etc.). The beers tasted fine but were a little expensive - they cost between $6-7, and one of those was a Blue Moon. The deviled eggs were really good - spicy with a little bit of egg on the bottom of each one so they didn't slide around the plate. 

Overall, for pure draft beer variety you can't go wrong (the rest of the menu must be good since this place was packed at lunch). Just know that it's probably a bit more expensive than bars further away from the touristy areas.

I'm not sure whether the 2 stars are for the restaurant as an idea or problems related to my visit, so please take this with a grain of salt.

Visit was at midnight on a Friday. Place was packed which certainly surprised me.  Very dark inside with electronic candles which didn't work.  I had to use my phone to illuminate the beer menu. This was a bit of a turn off.

The music was VERY LOUD to an uncomfortable degree.  And crappy electronic club music.  That's probably my problem but crappy, loud music makes me cranky.

Beer menu is impressive, I guess, although the novelty isn't quite the same after having visited a number of brew pubs within walking distance that night and the days before.  They advertise they have the world's largest selection of draft beers so I'm sure that's true, but for whatever reason it was almost too much.  A lot of it is European,  but also nothing SO unique that I felt like I was being treated to something.  This is a problem when the menu is so massive.  Shouldn't I have found something fun? Instead, it was slogging through lines and lines of beers I didn't want to drink.  Again, maybe this is my problem. 

We ordered the nachos which were giant.  Decent food.  

Service was spotty. Waiter was nice, but given it was the night before Halloween he must have had a costume as a ghost because we rarely saw him.  Beers came quick but we had to track down someone to grab a soft drink for one of our party.  It took awhile to get the check, too but we saw others having the same problem.  

Did I mention it was loud?  Good heavens.  

2 stars for a mixture of me just not liking the joint and for spotty service.  Much better places to go in the area of you're a beer drinker.  Oh, and for it being LOUD!


Updated after the comment by the business: Clearly this is a business that cares about its consumers and I very much appreciated their comment.  If it had been high energy classic rock I probably wouldn't have had the same issues and really had we come earlier in the evening I'm sure my waiter would have been more attentive to my beer needs.  I would give this place another shot, maybe earlier in the day and when I had time to really explore the menu with help.

Large selection of beer on tap. The server got my friend's order wrong and when he corrected it, he threw the wrong beer out. Kinda surprised that he wasted the beer rather than giving it to him. Tends to be crowded and loud during happy hour.

I ordered a cheeseburger here. And let me preface this by saying I know a thing or two about cheeseburgers. It was absolutely delicious. Cooked perfectly. Medium. I mean if I'm being honest I kind of wanted to hate this place. It's got a ridiculously large menu and I'm thinking to myself "how can they possibly make this many things well?" They can. My wife had Thai pizza she loved. My daughter had a Hawaiian chicken entree that I tried and it was delicious as well. The wait staff was friendly and professional.

Dimmed lighting, lively crowd and the best soul music one could request. 
Yard House offers traditional American cuisine with their own flare. We visited during happy hour and got a great bang for our buck. Half price pizzas, sliders and appetizers. They also offered drink specials on everything from beer to martinis. 

With the friendly service and tasty options Yard House is a desirable option for winding down. Be sure to try the buffalo wings and the local pilsner, it takes seven minutes to pour but it's worth the wait. We also tried the classic and bearnaise sliders and they were both awesome options.  

Overall we give Yard House a thumbs up!

A fun open exposed Windows beer bar in the heart of Denver with great coctails & life in motion all around you. It's an awesome place to go with friends, have a bite to eat, grab a few beers or coctails no matter the reason or even people watch.

I'd easily say one of the best places in town for food/drink at happy hour.  Although it is 3-6 M-F, I'm still giving them a huge shout out because the foods typically spot on and you can enjoy a discounted half yards at the same time.  My usual fave is the chicken tenders piled up with some fries for $6... best deal in town! My last occasion I happened to also have the Margherita pizza and g'all darn that was good too and only for $6.  

These delicious treats along with $4 off import/craft half yards and you got yourself a nice little deal to start the night!  Unfortunately, I have been here during normal hours and the prices typically deter me from having quite as good of a time so I really can only recommend the HH.  

Overall the location, cool vibe and great food and drinks keep me coming back happy hour after happy hour, I'd recommend the same for anyone.

Pros:
A wide selection of beers and cocktails. Some great options for vegetarians, especially if you like Gardein products. Everything I've eaten here has been good (and often great!), and the menu has a nice range of food options. 

Cons:
The servers tend to be nice and do a good job, but I sometimes wonder if they don't simply have too many tables. It can take awhile for them to check on tables. The restaurant itself has weird lighting: generally dim but with random spotlights, sometimes directly over customers. It's also a bit loud for my taste, although that's just my personal preference.

I've been to this restaurant twice and had a great experience both times. Our waiters have been magic. Taylor, On the first night and Kevin on the second night, so knowledgeable and welcoming - both absolute superstars!!!

As for the food. We had fish... Yes, fish in Denver. It was flown in that morning and was amazing. I had the sea bass. It was delicious. I'm not to proud to say I also had a cranberry mojito, also very good. The second one was better. Funny how that always happens. : )

Went to dinner before the game and had thee best waiter. His name was Dillon. Soooo friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and beers. Had a great experience and went back the next night for a quick beer. Thank you Dillon for being such a great and happy employee.

This place is legit!
Whole rotisserie chicken is delicious, nice crispy and moist.
Potato salad is the bomb.
Burrito Asada & Tacos al Carbon are straight off the taco truck in DTLA. 

Reasonable pricing.

I've been here twice now and it's a fantastic lunch for $6.00: Half a chicken with rice, beans, tortillas, pico and their fantastic salsa. The chicken is crispy and perfectly seasoned.

The counter help is friendly. The place itself is "spartan" and dull but clean. 

Take a break from Chipotle and give these guys a try.

Chicken was great!! Baked and flavorful. Spanish rice tasted authentic, and tasted potato salad! A great alternative to other chicken joints, plus the price is great 12.99 on Saturdays and Sundays for a full chicken with 3 sides!

Yes! So good. It reminded me of el pollo loco in California. This is a simple menu with great options from single meals to large parties. The food is fresh and delicious. The sides are whole beans, Mexican rice, creamy fluffy potato salad. The pico de gallo is fresh with a mild or spicy option. We  ordered 1/2 flour & 1/2 corn tortillas. I ordered extra tortillas just in case. Lol! totally not necessary. My daughter and I have plenty for 2 meals. This is a healthy fast food option. Simple and warm! This made our day! So glad we found this place! Be back soon!!
Price was right, food was good. The chicken was done wonderfully, crispy outside moist inside. Will definitely go back. Not that impressed with the tacos, but the chicken combo was right.

Excellent rotisserie chicken meals. Similar to Rico Pollo, but higher quality and much cleaner. The food is a great value. Our family of four was full after we ate the Mini Pack at $14.99. It came with a whole chicken, 10 tortillas, beans, rice, potato salad, and pico. We asked for hotter salsa and got a medium pico and a roasted tomato salsa. It was all great and the kids loved it, too.

Stopped in to pick up the mini pack which includes a whole rotisserie chicken cut up with a lime wedge, 3 sides: potato salad, beans, and spanish rice. Also a choice between warmed up corn or flour tortillas, pico and choice of spicy sauce for $14.99. Placed order with a female associate possibly daughter or family member. The gentlemen who packed the food was friendly but the lady was not, maybe it wasn't her day or she was tired? The horchata was not good, couldn't even distinguish taste or how long it's been circulating in the machine. I actually threw it out. It was like sweet water but with a weird aftertaste and a small was $2.75. As soon as I ordered I heard the beeps of a microwave and I was the only customer in the whole place ordering. Ummm not sure about this. I watched her get ice with a scoop on the side of the ice machine because she couldn't reach the one on top. I could see her irritation. The man was friendly and explained what was in the bag. I paid by cc and she watched to see if I was gona tip. Still unsure of this because I am ordering and picking up myself and I could see her eyes on me when I put a 0 and just signed the amt. 
The food: The chicken skin was crispy and had descent flavor. The potato salad had a creamy texture of mashed potatoes and a different flavor and just not sure of the texture... The beans were mediocre and the rice was fluffy and taste ok. The pico was like a day old but spicy with the looks of the wilted cilantro. The spicy sauce was different. Maybe because it was a Sunday and slow but I was not wowwed. It was just ok and the chicken at Costco for $4.99 would be my choice next time. I like to support mom and pop shops so give it a try still.

Place is really authentic. I tried the half chicken order when dining in. Chicken meat is really infused with great flavor, correctly cocked and juicy. The size of the bird itself is big therefore the portion is generous. Staff very attentive. Many customers just drop by to pick up their roasted chickens to go. Nice and authentic salsas as well. I'll continue to return to this place. Prices are really affordable.

This place is legit authentic southern California Mexican pollo. I was beyond excited when I saw the menu for this place - it definitely felt like I was back home in SoCal. Great service, fair prices, awesome affordable catering options, and amazing food. Even though I live and work 20 minutes away from here, I'm sure I'll be frequenting this place from here on out.

Was in from out of town,  took a chance on an highly rated place with only a few reviews.  Great Choice!
We had the chicken, served with rice, beans, slaw tortillas and hot sauce.  Its not fancy, great service, great food
This place has really good chicken and the guys who work there are always so nice and polite!  One chicken meal feeds 5-6 people with the sides.

I love these guys roast chicken! We got the $14.99 dinner pack which came with rice and beans and potato salad! It was delicious! The skin was nicely roasted with a nice lime flavor to it. My wife is very peculiar about potato salad, but she really enjoyed these guys!

Very tasty!! Lots of options, from salads, burritos, tacos and of course the roasted chicken!! The potato salad is very creamy and delicious. They have a variety of bottled sodas as well. I would highly recommend if you're looking for a substantial meal on the go, or looking for something to take home to the family to avoid cooking.

You get salsa, tortillas, and 3 sides with the whole chicken meal.  They look small, but once you build a plate, you'll see it's a lot of food. I think 3-4 people could easily eat from that order. Please give it a try!

If you are from Southern California, and/or you've had El Pollo Loco, it is like this only much, much, much better.

Fantastically juicy chicken - I could go for a few more sides, but the rice and beans and tortillas do the trick for me. Definitely will try this place for a take-home chicken dinner sometime vs. getting one of this boxed chickens at the store.

Oh. This IS some DELICIOUS chicken!!! I don't know what spices are on the skin, but they are magical! This is the first and only place I rush to eat the dark meat because I don't want to miss out on all the chickeney goodness. I'm pretty much a white meat/ breast only chicken eater..not here!  The first time my husband saw me gnawing on the little wing bits.. He said.."who are you and where did my wife go?" Tonight we ordered a whole chicken and medium sides ( rice, beans, pico de gallo and potato salad) for $14.99. ( side note:  The wonderful folks who run the place make this homemade salsa that is full of heat and just a touch of smokiness that sets off the flavor of the chicken so well...don't miss out on it! ) Even though I was worried about leftovers...we ate every single bit of that bird! With glistening fingertips,  I was only left with sadness that I didn't have room for more! 
Do yourself a favor and take the night off,  let Juan's Super Pollo make your chicken dreams come true.

Came here based on others reviews! Most excellent!  Very friendly, very quick, and sooo delicious!  We had the family pack, it feed 4 adults and 2 growing teenage boys, with left overs!  The chicken was moist and yummy, crunchy, tasty skin!  Only here on vacation, and I know we will be back before we go home!  Very, very good!  The price is fantastic! Thank you!
Great crispy skin with delicious juicy chicken inside. Also, they have horchata, so who could be upset by that. Very reasonably priced.

Two words.  Delicious chicken.
I've been looking for a 'Mexican chicken' place since I moved here last summer and when I saw a recent Yelp review a few weeks back, I knew I had to check this place out.  In DFW, I had a place called El Pollo Regio that I frequented to get my chicken, beans, and rice fix.  In SoCal, I had El Pollo Loco (even though it's a chain, it was pretty decent).  So a couple weeks ago I headed over to Juan's Super Pollo.

I went on a Monday to check it out for lunch with the plan to also get takeout for dinner if it was any good.  To begin with, they have a lunch combo for $6.99 that's not only delicious, but a hell of a deal.  For that price, you get two pieces of chicken, two sides, tortillas, and pico.  I got beans and rice as my sides and the two pieces of chicken I got were a thigh and a breast (you can pay $1 more for all white meat).  This was a lot of food for $7!  And it was good!  While I was there, I noticed an ad on their wall for the Monday special - $20.99 for the Family Pack (normally $24.99, this is two whole chickens cut up of course, your choice of three large sides, tortillas, pico, and house salsa).  It sounded like a deal so I got it for takeout, as well as buying some extra pico.  So for about $25 I ended up with enough food for me and the Hubs not only for dinner, but also two days' worth of lunches for us - roughly $4 a meal!  My one economical purchase for the week!  I think on Thursdays they have a special on the Jumbo Pack, which is three chickens with extra large sides, etc. for $31.99.

They also do salads, chicken bowls, tacos, and burritos, but the whole chicken packs are the way to go for feeding a crowd, economy, or both.  I noticed they have pricing for party packs of larger quantities of chicken if you're planning a really big crowd (you might want to call them first if you want the 20-chicken party pack, though).

The décor in this restaurant is non-existent.  It's very clean (even the restroom), but not really a place to take a date or spend much time.  The day I went, the TV was blaring which is why I'm giving them four stars instead of five.  No one was watching it and there were only diners at two other tables. Plus they had music going on the other side of the room.  My suggestion to the owners - turn the festive music up a tad and mute the TV.  I think the folks working there were the owners and they were very friendly.  I like supporting the local Mom-and-Pops.

Anyway, all of the food I had from here was excellent and even though this place is out of the way for me, I will return for more of that tasty chicken!  Soon!

Great service and awesome food! I couldn't findcthe full menu online so the lady who answered the phone told me about their lunch special. I couldn't make up my mind on hot or mild salsa so I asked for both. I only got one container so maybe the salsas were combined? Not sure but it was spicy, good spicy though. They had a good selection of drinks as well (horchata, tamarindo, pina, jarritos, soda in glass bottles) Restaurant was very tidy. I work in the area and will be back!

The Chicken is awesome.....roasted to perfection.....and thats it.....oh yes they have great beans and potato salad......and deliciously hot salsa.....but that's basically Juans Super Pollo. They have variations on chicken....like tacos...salads...nachos and quesadilla. I recommend any of these items for a cheap and tasty lunch.....or take a couple roasters home!!!!
This place is amazing. The service, the cleanliness and the food. This place should be constantly packed.

Chow Sun is one of those places that I use as an example when discussing the culinary diversity of Aurora. This restaurant may not stand out from the street, but it is worth the stop for the Thai and Filipino menu. The pork drunken noodles are amazing... Chow Sun doesn't make them as spicy as Thai Monkey Club, but the dish is tasty and full of flavor nonetheless.

I also had the strawberry smoothie last time I was here - it tasted like a dream... smooth, creamy, and full of fruity goodness.

Service is reasonably quick and friendly, but we tend to visit on Sunday afternoons when the restaurant isn't too full.

Finally got a chance to try Chowsun.  Being Filipino,  choices are pretty slim for dining and groceries.  The Lotus Market next door has probably the largest selection of Filipino groceries in Denver.  I heard the owner of Lotus also owns Chowsun so I couldn't wait to give them a try.

I was expecting to order and pay at the counter, but it appears they have changed to full service dining.  Service started very slow;  acknowledged quickly but took awhile to take our order.  From there, service was friendly and fast.

My wife and I decided to try the lumpia, Lechon Kawalli, Diniguan and Halo Halo for desert.  Lumpia was a little disappointing for me;  they were fresh and hot but reminded me of some of the Frozen lumpia available next door.  Lechon was very good and it would have blown me away if the skin was crispier.  The meat was a little dry so making the skin crispy would have likely really dried out the meat.  Diniguan was delicious, my favorite of the two entrees.

Halo Halo was perfect....not overly sweet and the Ube ice cream just topped it off! 

Pricing is a little high but not unreasonable.  Looking forward to trying some of there other Filipino dishes, Thai offerings and especially their Siopao.  Overall
3 stars price and value
4 stars overall for food because of selection and overall flavor
4 stars for service after overcoming a slow start

Excellent service, delicious food. I'm so glad there's a fantastic Filipino restaurant not far from home! 

The lumpia is great, and made fresh when ordered. I personally like the pancit bihon - the rice noodles are cooked to perfection! My husband likes the sisig because it's marinated well and so tender. And of course we end our meal with halo halo, because it's such a good treat.

Side note: the portions are large, so sharing is probably a good option.
I come here occasionally for lunch. The food is good and reasonable priced. A great addition to the area.

Oh man!  I can't believe I found this spot!  It was my last day (really, it was my last meal) in Denver and I wish I had found Chowsun much, much earlier!  I was in the mile high city for work, and I wasn't sure if my co-worker would go for Filipino food, plus it was out of the way from our work site.  So I waited until the weekend when my hubby came and I'm sure he's glad I did.

After a week of not eating rice (c'mon, I am Filipino after all), I was craving something from the motherland.  So on our way to the airport we stopped here.  Chowsun is located in a strip mall, next to an Asian grocery store.  You walk in and order your meal from a menu board at the counter.  The menu features mostly Filipino food, but there are some Thai dishes as well.  

I ordered the tapsilog/longsilog combo and my hubby ordered the longsilog.  The dishes each came with garlic rice and a fried egg (as it should).  I don't know what longanisa they used (whether they make it in-house, or if it's one that I've never tried, but it was really, really good)!  The tapa had a perfect meat-to-fat ratio and it was seasoned well, without tasting overly salty, as I've had in other places.  We shouldn't have, but we ordered dessert.  I had the ginitaan bilo bilo (tapioca balls and other fruits cooked in coconut cream) and my husband had the halo-halo (crushed ice with ube ice cream, evaporated milk, and various other items). 

We really wanted to try more food items, but (1) we were stuffed and (2) we had a plane to catch.  For sure, if we ever make it back to the Denver area, we will be stopping by!

My wife and I went to Chowsun this last weekend.  I liked it.  The last time we went here, you still had to go to the counter to order.  This time it was a sit down and someone will take your order.  My wife had the Pad Thai and I had BBQ pork sticks with a side of Lumpia.  Both dishes were excellent with large portions.  Service was fast and friendly.  Three other diners in the restaurant.  There was one group of Filipina ladies that could have been a little quieter but, we still enjoyed the food.  Will definitely go back.

I've lived in Denver for 20 years. Filipino restaurants have come and gone but none have been as good as chowsun. 
Fast casual dining. The ambiance Taylor's to this fact. 
The good comes out relatively fast and the presentation is acceptable but the best part of the visit are the flavors associated with the food. 
We started with the basics lumpiA Shanghai. The were very good, crispy and moist. The adobo we ordered was fantastic. The chicken was moist and the flavors were bursting from the chicken. Did they use a slow cooker for this??? 
The beef calderas a had very good flavors but the meat was dry. 

3 stars for ambiance 
4 stars for flavor 
5 stars compared to other Filipino restaurants 
4 stars overall

I love Lumpia and it was OK here, but I found it to be way too greasy, which diminished the flavor.  

My better half had the sinigang with pork.  She liked it and it was definitely a large portion.  I'm going to average the 5 for hers with the 3 for mine and give it a 4.

The place was very clean and the service was good.  Lots of good looking choices on the menu.

Honestly since I have been to the philippines a million times I know there is nothing like mang inasal, jollibee, and all the mom and pops out there but this place gets me buy when I miss  Pi. The menu is foreigner friendly but is expanding and it has a Thai menu do it's not a dedicated  Pinky restaurant but I still like it a lot, seating is good and very available and the  food is a bit over charged but still.delicious. if you never had  food from the Philippines it's a good start for your first adobo. I believe it's a great lunch time restaurant at work and on the weekends.

I dig this place!  From talking to our server it looks like most of the food is made from scratch.  I tried the Pancit Canton and The Boy had the Filipino Spaghetti.  Both were delicious.  The boba drink he ordered - banana flavor - was kind of gross in my opinion, but he seemed to like it.  And the red bean sesame balls - YUM!  Our server was super friendly and helpful and spent a lot of time talking to us about the food and the restaurant.  We will definitely be back.
I'm Filipino and I love their food! Beef Kare Kare is not to be missed! And the barbecue is great.

Fast and casual Filipino food is a must for my little family. The pancit bihon reminds me of my moms pancit, which is a very good thing. The chicken adobo is on point as are the pork and chicken skewers. My kids can eat the lumpia every day if you let them. Maybe the best part is the friendly staff, it's a must try in South Aurora.

if you know Filipino food, then this will hit close to home. they have every possible Filipino dish your mama's ever made. everything is delicious & the staff is so genuinely nice. reasonably priced with pretty decent portions. they will also give you halo halo on your birthday! YUM.

SUNDAY NOVEMBER 9th 2014.  TIME : 17:50hrs ish

We have been a regular to Lotus Asian Market next door, ever since our moved to Colorado.  Then when we found out that the Owners of Lotus Asian Market, intends to open a restaurant, we are super excited.  NOW, FINALLY CHOW SUN has opened their doors for patrons to enjoy what they offer aka FILIPINO and THAI cuisine...

When we arrived, THANKFULLY we arrived before the MAD DINNER RUSH...

Yes, you order at the Counter, pay your order, get your ticket/receipt and they will call your order Number.  

From what I could recall we ordered these following items :

*  Chicken Eggroll ($2.95)
*  Green Chicken Curry ($7.95)
*  BBQ Chicken Skewer ($7.25)
*  Aloha Canned Drink ($0.95)
*  Canned Soda ($0.75)

YES, everything comes in those disposable containers what nots..

YES, the food comes out hot either from the Wok, or the FRYER...

But in terms of flavors, YES THEY can DO BETTER...

Hubs order of Thai Green Chicken Curry was NOT SPICY at all, aka NOT THAI HOT that we requested...  Yes the flavor tones, of sweet, sour and spicy is there.. but NOT to our taste bud THAI HOT...  Oh Well..

As for the BBQ Chicken Skewer, its 3 skewers, comes with Rice and Shredded Cabbage and Carrots with some kind of dressing.  In terms of BBQ Chicken Skewer, its marinated with some BBQ sauce, comes out tender, though I wish they could "elevate" either by grilling or marinated more with other Spices etc..  

The Highlight of our Dinner, was perhaps the Chicken Eggroll.  Hubs kept on raving on those.. as outside it was Crunchy with Eggroll Wrapper, and it comes out hot from the Fryer!

After our Dinner, I also ordered the Honeydew Boba Smoothie ($3.95), which was just OK.  It ONLY comes in 1 cup size.  It more like "slushie" but the BOBA itself some overdone or overcooked.

All in all, Chow Sun has DEFINITELY ROOM For Improvement, and we don't mind returning when needed coz there are many other items we want to try in our next mission to Chow Sun.  Or perhaps to order TO GO ITEMS from here.  

We were somewhat felt "rushed" at this recent visit coz a BIG GROUP of Patrons tend to take all the seats..  right after we came and order our food.  YES, everyone from the Owners and the Staffs, are inviting, helpful and friendly.  The establishment is kept clean and the Decor Design is modern and simple.

Above anything else, we hope and pray for the success of CHOW SUN many more years to come.  Thank you CHOW SUN, see you soon...  3.5 stars at best for Chow Sun for this visit.  Left this establishment at about 18:30hrs ish.

CHOW SUN is open EVERYDAY from 10am to 8pm.

Chow Sun
830 S Buckley Rd
Aurora, CO 80017-3174
Tel : (720) 410 2135
Fax : (720) 410-2137

@210/2014
I tried the BBQ chicken skewers and they were yummy! I will definitely return, hadn't even heard of this place

I always have the jeprox (fried dried fish ) which is awesome but I wish they have more tomatoes n' mango salsa in it and separate from the plate ! Pork adobo was great ! A year or so ago I ordered pork sinigang and it tasted like just plain water with no taste of sinigang at all and now I adamant to order regular filipino food because I go for the taste ! Since it's the only filipino resto close to my house I will still go ! Oh I hope they put leche flannon their halohalo

Filipino food in Colorado is about as rare as Fox News actually reports real news. This box lunch joint serves up all the popular Filipino favorites like chicken adobo and pancit. If you want to get more adventurous they also have sisig, dinuguan and other traditional dishes. We had several dishes which were all solid, but the halo halo which literally means "mix mix" was the highlight of the meal. I can't describe it very well other than to say you must give it a try once in your life. 

My family enjoyed the relaxing tunes that they played and the staff was very courteous.  The menu is large and we will have to get here a few more times to get through it all and it is well worth the drive from downtown.

I have been eating here since they originally opened. I tried almost everything thing on the old menu. I have not been by in a long while and they have a new menu now ,also I think they sold it .The only thing that I like on a regular, is there chicken buns they are scrumdiddlyumptious!!!!!!! 2 stars for poor customer service.

Paid a second visit just yesterday-- Lechon kawali and Kare-kare it was.

Lechon kawali was delicious and boyfriend enjoyed it, but I felt like the meat part was a little dry and minimal; however, lots of delicious fat, of course (yum)! I was pleased that it came with Tomas sauce, and the kare-kare came with bagoong. 

Unfortunately, I was slightly disappointed the kare-kare was beef pieces rather than the traditional oxtail. The vegetables were very soggy and I hate to say this, but the beef was dry and the sauce was kind of bland. Luckily, the bagoong gives it that authentic, homey, taste to it. I understand a lot of people have different styles of cooking different dishes, but I love having crunch in my veggies for kare-kare.

I'll definitely come back to try more of their dishes.
I got the triple pork adobo for lunch and while the portion was adequate the meat lacked tenderness

The prices are reasonable and the people are really nice! The halo halo is one of the only places in the Aurora area and it's good too! There's a good variety of asian dishes here that can satisfy the average palate.

First time here.  You must try the Pork Adobo.  It's excellent!  Also got to try the Halo Halo for dessert.  That too was delicious.  My son had some noodles, but I forget what it was called.  That was full of flavor as well.  I'm definitely coming back for more Filipino food.

We tried this place because we both like Phillipine food. It was not much from the outside. Fast food look. It was very good. I had noodles with pork. Very tasty husband order hot, the spice was great.
.

When the space next to Lotus Asian Market became vacant (after having been occupied for many years by the Mexican eatery known as El Parralito) it was quickly snapped up by members of Aurora's Filipino community with the goal of offering local residents and visitors a taste of their home country. As the saying goes, patience is a virtue, and although the project took a little while to come to fruition, I can personally attest that the restaurant now in that spot, ChowSun, is worth the wait.

Start your meal with a couple of springy Siopao (steamed or fried buns filled with chicken or pork), or perhaps some Ukoy (shrimp fritters) while you ponder your next move. Why, they even have chopped and fried pig intestines (Chicharrón Bulaklak) if that doesn't sound too offal to you. (OK, I admit that was corny). If you arrive early enough in the day, you can try a breakfast specialty, like marinated beef (Tapa), milkfish (Daing na Bangus), or a variation on corned-beef hash (one of the United States' historical gifts to the Philippines).

But if you woke up just a bit later than you planned, don't worry - there are still a number of culinary possibilities waiting for you. Kare-kare is a long-simmered beef stew fragrant with peanuts and annatto seeds, and chock-full of soft eggplant, green beans, and bok choy. (Don't forget to ask for the little container of purple fermented shrimp paste [Bagoong] on the side to really make it sing!). But then again, the quintessentially Pinoy garlic/soy/vinegar chicken dish called Adobong Manok is equally likely to get those salivary glands working overtime. And I can't forget those moist, plump, juicy BBQ pork skewers either. (Each main course also comes with a nice big scoop of steamed jasmine rice in case you thought they'd forgotten). 

Oh, some members of your party were more in the mood for Chinese, or Japanese, or even Thai? Never fear - ChowSun has you covered in this scenario as well. In addition to three (count 'em!) Thai-style curries - red, green, and the Indian-influenced one known as Mussaman - you can also avail yourselves of noodle offerings which have been the pride of Siam for centuries, such as Pad Thai and Pad See Ew. Dishes representing Japan include wheat noodles and assorted veggies fried in oyster sauce [Yakisoba] as well as a version of chicken teriyaki. And folks seeking a little Chinese-food lovin' won't be disappointed by fried rice (available with several choices of protein) or the like-chow-mein-but-even-tastier creation called Pancit Canton.

Complete your meal with a boba drink (I like the one with molasses-based black sugar in particular) and a dessert such as Gulaman (sweetened grass-jelly cubes) or even the fruit/beans/milk/crushed ice extravaganza known as Halo-Halo. [BURP]. Oh wow, excuse me - that was a bit rude. But after you've tasted all the delicious items at ChowSun, I think you'll sympathize.

I grew up on Filipino food and have been to the Philippines many times and this place was kind of a disappointment. We got the bangus, sisig, lumpia and pancit bihon. Everything was alright but I definitely won't be going back for the sisig or the lumpia. I like Sunburst Grill much more so far. This place is no where NEAR authentic but not ready to give up on this place though so maybe I'll have to try different dishes.

Yesterday was my second time eating at Chow Sun. The first one was when they first opened. Back then, there was definitely a crowd. Yesterday, there was just one other table occupied (dinner time). 

CLEANLINESS. Things are clean and nicely laid out. They got it right.

SERVICE. It's counter service. I think they are efficient. 

FOOD. This is where it's really mixed. Let me make an important distinction here. My perspective is coming from a Filipino guy that can cook Filipino food well. My expectation is for Filipino food to at least meet or exceed food I grew up with in the Philippines. That said, the food that I tried did not satisfy the "authenticity" test:

* Tapsilog - a traditional Filipino breakfast combo I look forward to eating even for dinner especially last night. I was especially looking forward to dipping the meat in spiced vinegar. 

Overall, the Tapsilog did not meet expectations and surprisingly so. I really did not expect them to fail on the tapa itself. It's so easy. Beef, garlic, soy sauce, vinegar, salt, pepper, and sugar. That's all there is to it. The tapa they served did not resemble any tapa I have ever seen/tasted anywhere in the Philippines or in Filipino households here in America (I asked and they insisted that it was tapa). It was odd. The appearance was more like a cross between Tocino and Tapa. Kinda red kinda darkish but  did not taste like either. I ate it anyway so as not to waste food. It was edible but just not tapa.

It also came with garlic rice, egg, and longganisa. The rice was okay. The egg was not the sunny side up I was expecting just fried to a crisp on the outside and kinda rubbery on the inside. The vinegar was store bought, which is okay I guess. Unexpectedly, it also came with sweet longganisa (Filipino sausage). Nothing special. Feels store bought and fried. It was close enough to a mediocre Filipino brand of sausage so I would say it's authentic. Not spectacular but authentic enough. 

* Curry - I actually honestly enjoyed their curries. It's definitely NOT Filipino-style curry but who cares... it tastes good. I like it spicy and they make it spicy.  

* Lechon Kawali - They got this acceptably right although the portion size was a bit small. I still prefer the way they make it (and portion size) at PinoyPinay in Panorama City (LA Area). Chowsun's rendition had nice texture on the meat and crunch on the skin. However, this crunch was not like the chicharon-like crunch from PinoyPinay. But I guess it passes the authenticity test - I can see this served in the Philippines just not at a place I would consider that makes it 'just right'. If they can achieve the "lechon" style meat taste and texture combined with the chicharon crunch  - now that would be awesome!

* Pork BBQ in Skewers - We had this in our first visit and I still remember it being okay but not quite there yet. It was a little dry and the taste wasn't particularly Filipino. Chowsun's was more akin to Indonesian satay than Filipino BBQ. It doesn't have that delicious interplay of sweet (from brown sugar and banana ketchup), sour (mainly from Calamansi lemons), salty (from soy sauce), and spice (from garlic, pepper, and maybe from using 'hot' banana ketchup) - I just made this last week. For reference, try the one at Sunburst Grill. I think they have a better rendition of this although theirs incorporate peanut sauce, which is not exactly part of the traditional recipe but does work. 

* Halo Halo - This one is good. For most places, I do not expect homemade ingredients and just the pre-bottled kind. The format is like Jollibee's and that's alright. Nothing stunning but it was tasty. For reference, what I consider the best Halo Halo I've ever had was in South Cotabato. It was served in a coconut husk with all ingredients artisan-made. The coconut water also somehow made it into the halo halo I was just not sure how. You can taste the difference. This is not necessarily a comment against Chowsun's version just a reference to what I consider great and so far unmatched by many commercialized versions of the halo halo.

Overall, I am disappointed with this place. I do not think I am going back. Other reviewers seem to like the adobo and pancit. That's great I really hope they improve. For now, I think I'll stick with Sunburst Grill and any other (crossing fingers) Filipino restaurants that come along. I think a major (though not insurmountable) obstacle to Chowsun being more authentic is just the mere fact that they are not owned nor operated (staffed in the back maybe?) by Filipinos and while eating there was never really anyway for me to chime in on how the food tasted or how I liked it. It's a shame though since a good Filipino restaurant located right next to the only Filipino-centric grocery store in the Denver Metro area makes a lot of business sense. It's just not good enough... YET! I wish them all the luck and that they would strive to improve and achieve a "Go To" status
Love Filipino food after mass. Great customer service. Delicious food. Huge selection.

I tried Chow Sun just one day after opening, and considering, they are doing a great job. 

There were two of us, and we had the chicken pad Thai, a chicken steam bun, and the bbq chicken skewers. Everything was delicious and fresh. 

The cons were that they're only serving food in disposable take away containers, and because of that their trash was overflowing. 
There was also a really big lack of veggies with the bbq skewers. I had two pieces of cold steamed broccoli, and three pieces of cut raw carrots. It felt like an afterthought. Maybe in the future they could add more veggies that are warm. It would really be the icing on a already very good dish.
The pad see ew is so good! I had it with combo chicken and beef. I loved the flavors and the portion sizes are huge for the price. Try the pad see ew, you won't be disappointed!

Every time I visit a town, I try to checkout a Filipino restaurant. This place is next to Lotus Asian Market that have a lot of Filipino branded food so it's a great 2 for 1.

The place is clean and got my food fast. I tried the pork bbq. A+ on the portion and taste. Reminds me of the times I would buy bbq at the corner street vendor. BBQ on a stick is classic Pinoy. I only gave this 4 stars because I think they can improve on their condiment that goes with the food. Shredded cabbage and carrots topped with ranch is not a good combo. Make it truly Pinoy and use atchara and/ or vinegar with garlic to balance out the flavor. The bbq has a sweet taste to it so it would have been really nice to have it with my meal rather than ranch dressing.

Being originally from NJ, I was excited to hear about another Filipino place near the Denver area. I ordered the Mami Soup, Beef Caldereta, and Pancit Bihon combo to go. After my 50 minute drive back to Denver, I then pulled out my to go dishes and was really disappointed in what I paid for. How is it that I paid almost $10 for Beef Caldereta and the rice was in the larger compartment than the actual entree!? If I knew I was going to pay for mostly rice, I would have passed on this place. Then onto the combo pancit.... And no shrimp, barely any meat. $11 for noodles.   Even more disappointing!? As for taste, the authentic taste was missing. Makes me wonder of this was made by Filipinos or Thai (since part of the menu had Thai dishes). I highly doubt I'll be back again. 

If you're looking for authentic food, don't bother. It's worth a try, but this place may suit those who aren't familiar with this cuisine.
Love the food, love the ambiance, feels like I'm back in the Philippines. Definitely will go back here. The crew are friendly, kind and always have a smile on their faces.

This place its a JOKE AND A RIP OFF, I've been here twice coming from Colorado Springs both times they gave me baby portion meal. I ordered "lamb" caldereta which cost me almost $13 without a drink, I figure it would make me full. Boy!!iwas I wrong, it had 3 pices of meat which is almost all bones in the very small bowl and rice that was it. I was very very  disapponted that I didn't even wanted to take picture t show it, it was embarrassing to even show it. DONT let them rip you off with your hard working money.!!!!!!!!!!!

I've never been to a Filipino restaurant anywhere in the US that you could consider haute cuisine, in fact most are pretty much little mom and pop or Ate and Tito joints in an old strip mall.

Denver has a mainstay place in the Sunburst Grill, but service and food there can be hit or miss, but it's never top shelf.  Chow Sun avoids some of the issues with service because it's counter service.   They have 4 or 5 people in the back cooking to order, and depending on the day or time maybe 2 or 3 up front, so they are better staffed and they have a comparable number of tables.

Since the owner is Tum from Lotus Asian Market they seem also to have freshers and more ample stock for preparation.  And just like Lotus Asian the place has been meticulously clean each of the 4 times we've gone there.

The menu has changed and bit, they added Lechon Kawali and it seems both larger and tighter.  They've learned a lot about this business in the three or four months since they opened.

Sure at Sunburst you get real plates and at CS you get take away cartons, but I think the foods a touch better, the service is better and my hands have never stuck to the table when I say down.

The menu is broader than Sunburst's as well, with Filipino classics like Pansit, Sisig, Bangus, Chicken  BBQ, Siopo, Sisig, Turon, Lumpia, Dinuguon, etc and etc.  But also PadThai, Masaman curry, Tom Yum, Drunken Noodles, Soba etc.   They don't server baluts but if you need to they have them at the store next door.  There's somethings us Kanos won't always eat.

This is a great little restaurant in a strip mall off Buckley, the difference is that the values of this hard working family show in the quality of their food.

Oh and the Halo Halo is top notch...

OK food. We had Tapsilog, Bansilog, Longsilog, Pork Lumpia, Pork Siopao, and Fried Pork Buns. All of their breakfast plates come with an egg and cucumbers, missing tomatoes though. How can you serve Filipino without tomatoes!? The eggs were over cooked also. The Bansilog that we had ordered was missing an egg when the menu states it comes with an egg.  Their Boba was actually good and their Thai Iced Tea. They serve Thai food as well. I actually had their Pad Thai here a month ago, pretty decent. The only one I found good enough to eat here in Denver area. Rated 2 stars because the food needs a little improvment. Can't half ass your food. "Chow Sun?" sounds like a knock off of "Chow King" from Cali obviously with better food. Coming from San Francisco, CA, we have pretty high standards when it comes to food.

I am not sure why they don't offer the pepper beef udon anymore,I only had once and they never carry it again;and I have tried many other dishes that they offer and it taste pretty bad. Especially their traditional items on the special menu.  I have not went back  since...

Decided to go here on a stormy night.  Really enjoyed my meal.  The Thai tea tasted like other Thai teas I've had and was strong and creamy.  There was a very nice green beans with chicken curry sauce.  The garlic rice was interesting and had to take it home and the plain rice was pretty decent and tasted fresh. I also tried the Pilipino version of a egg roll it has a nice thin dough crust.  I also tried the banana fritter which was a quarter of a banana wrapped in the same dough as the Pilipino egg roll and deep fried then sprinkled with a little confectioner sugar.  I loved the thing.  As a dessert its not very sweet.  I actually would order it as a appetizer or side to my main meal.  The garlic rice was nice.  Its not like a fried rice full of soy sauce.  Its the regular  rice with very fine fried garlic powder sprinkled on the top with I think some green onion and possibly other seasonings.  Like most rice dishes It didn't reheat well in the morning in the microwave but still had a ok taste.  Best served fresh  A very big portion so two people could share it as a light simple bowl of rice lunch.   I also looked around the dining room and thought the place was pretty much spotless.  Ordered more than I normally do just to try a few new things.  Overall happy with the meal and a nice surprise.  Update went back again food ok warning found out the do not have a public bathroom.  Had to return home to wash hands.  Planned trip to park and eat dinner watching sunset cancelled.  Why would a restaurant not have a public bathroom? Removing a star

I visited Chowsun for the first time yesterday with some coworkers.  None of us have been there before, and we ordered a couple of appetizers and main dishes to share them so we could all sample several items.  I heard it was a filipino restaurant, but I was pleasantly surprised to see they offered many Thai dishes as well (I have been looking for a Thai restaurant closer to my work).
The staff was very friendly and the the food was very good; lots of flavor, my favorite was the Pork Adobo. All of my coworkers and I thought everything was good. 
The only reason I am giving Chowsun 3-stars (not 4 or 5) is because of how we received our food.  In most restaurants, all of the people at a table receive their food at the same time so they can all eat together.  That was not our experience.  Instead of bringing all of our food out at once, one person received their food and the rest of us waited... and waited... and waited. Then the second person got there food, and again we waited & waited, until the next person to get their food... and so on, and on.  This was the only negative comment: the very slow service.

It was ok.

2 1/2 stars.

We ordered a few things to see how good it was. 

-We didn't like the shrimp pad thai. It had a weird taste.
-Lumpia was ok. No bold flavor. But still ok.
-Pork skewers were ok, thin. Only came with a scoop of white rice. 
-pork adobo was very good. 
-coconut smoothie was uh, okay.

I wanted thai boba tea. (I love thai boba tea).. but they wouldn't do it for me. I thought it was weird but doesn't really factor into my overall score much.

This place is awesome. I'm not easy to please when it comes to Filipino food, adobo especially. Their chicken adobo is spot on. The lumpia rolls are thinner then my Gma makes them but their still good. Skewers are pretty damn good and $1.50 each! I've had the panang and green curries. Both are great but I prefer the panang, medium or spicy. The spicy level is totally enjoyable. The wife really likes the pad thai. It's a very generous serving size. It's very typical and very delicious. The chef has Filipino specials available which are nice for regulars. The menu is large and paralyzing for those not familiar but the staff are very helpful and pleasant. 

It is modestly decorated and not a place to expect much other than delicious food. 

For those who haven't enjoyed Filipino food before, start with the adobo chicken. You won't be sorry. Don't doubt their thai chops either, it's allllll good.
This is a temporary review until I get a chance to try a few more dishes here but my take so far is that it's like the Filipino version of L&L Barbecue. I like L&L a lot!
Everything is authentic here. It takes a bit for you to get your food but it's worth the wait as they make it from scratch. The price is very affordable here.

So we ordered food to go for, uhm, "The Fight of the Century"...Our Lumpia was probably the highlight of that entire night! :)

First off, they were sooooooo nice and accomodating.  The food (even though we re-heated them in our oven when we got home) - was still fresh tasting and absolutely delicious!  The Lechon Kawali is the best that i've had in a while, and their Chicken Barbecue is amazing!  We will definitely come out and visit this place again and this time, will be eating in to get the full experience.  Worth the 25-minute drive for sure!

I'm always looking for authentic Filipino food and you rarely find it here in Colorado. ChowSun was really good. Not as good as my mom or my Lola's home cooking but really good. Great food, prices, and portions! Very pleased. Everyone should give it a try!

The pad thai was not the best, but my boyfriend liked the drunken noodle and I really like the soup with all the veggies.  As an environmentalist, it's hard for me to go to restaurant that produces so much waste with everything served in disposable containers.  It also ruins the taste of the food for me when it's served in plastic.

I might be a bit biased because I've been waiting for a good Filipino restaurant ever since Manila Garden closed down years ago. (I hate Sunburst Grill).  This is a Filipino/Thai restaurant.  Bare in mind that I also have a Filipina mother who is an awesome cook.  So, I kinda know what I'm talking about when it comes to good Filipino food, lol. 

When I first realized this place opened I went there about three different times in a month because I wanted to try almost all of the Filipino foods that I'm familiar with and know that I like. I tried a little bit of the Thai food and boba as well. Now, some of these dishes are made a little different than how my mom makes them, but they were still good.  Among these was the lumpia. Theirs is rolled thinner than I'm used too, but it still had a flavor very close to my mom's lumpia. I'm used to kare kare being made with ox tail, but the beef kare kare is still really good. I tried many other dishes and I wasn't dissappointed. The steamed siaopao, pork adobo, beef skewers, and pancit bihon - just to name a few. The halo halo and boba are friggin amazing here as well. I'd never had or even heard of "popping" boba before trying it here, but it is crazy good.

The menu choices here go on seemingly forever, which usually worries me with small businesses. It seems like other restaurants who try this spread themselves too thin, but it doesn't seem to have any negative effect on the cooks. The food is always hot, fresh, and fast.

It is counter service here rather than waited service, which I think was a great idea. This makes sense since a lot of Americans are not familiar with a lot of Filipino and Thai dishes. Thus, they probably have a few questions. I know I've asked those dudes a million questions about the Thai side and even the Filipino side of the menu. I wouldn't feel comfortable doing so if I was being waited on while drastically and rudely slowing down other customers' service. By the way, the service has been fast, friendly and knowledgeable every time I've been there. If you're there just trying something different, the counter help can make some good suggestions for you.

Prices are very reasonable. Unless, you're gluttonous fat fu** like myself, you should be able to get a full meal for less than 10 bucks a person. 

Also, the Lotus Asian Market next door is owned by the same family. There are some other Filipino dishes you can get there that may not be available at Chowsun. Tocino, balut, and puto bread among many others. 

Anyway, I could rant and rave all day long about how awesome this place is, but you really should just check it out for yourself.

Very nice Filipino restaurant. Very clean place. Very friendly and helpful people. Fresh food NOT food left on a warmer all day. Many dishes to choose from, made fast. I've been to quite a few Philippine restaurants in the Aurora area as they have come and gone over the years. This is by far the best we've had. Order at the counter and take out or eat at the tables there. There is plenty of seating.

I lived in Denver for 3 years and just found this place! This place really reminds me of the small Filipino places in California! They have fresh manapua (Hawaiian for bao) and the second best to getting manapua in Hawaii. They have boba tea!! One of my favorite places for Filipino food.
Most delicious pancit I have ever had!  Ties, or possibly beats homemade!

I recently visited this place and felt very welcome and the food was great! When I ordered my food I asked them for a preference for spicy and they hit the nail on the nose and asked the cook to make it even spicier for me. Definitely will be coming back here to get my spicy fix!

My husband and I ordered the pork bbq on skewers. We were disappointed because it was dry. My daughter had the lumpiang Shanghai and she liked it. If I visit next time, I will try other dishes and hope I am not disappointed.

Finally, a Filipino restaurant worth writing about.  After months of waiting we had our first order today and we were not disappointed.  Had the pork bbq, dinuguan and pansit bihon and they were scrumptious!  As for the vegetable side dish-I never liked atchara so I was very pleased with the cabbage/carrot side dish.  It complemented the bbq well.  They had good portions for everything and had a big portion for the pansit.  They were not skimpy on the quality of ingredients which we liked very much.  Rice was perfectly made and of good quality Jasmine.  We can't wait to return for more.  So happy to have Chow Sun here in Colorado!  Give them a try!

Hell freakin yes. No place is quite as good as a mother's home cooking, but it is pretty spot on. I've only ordered off the Filipino portion of the menu but their Pancit Bihon pork is amazing! How can you beat Lumpia for a couple bucks?

They have a good variety of Filipino food available here. Ordered lumpia, diniguan, beef caldereta, and kare kare. Husband enjoyed the kare kare after he asked for some shrimp paste to go with it, the beef in the caldereta was a bit tough and so were the veggies, but the sauce was ok. The diniguan was good as left overs!  The sauce thickened a day later. Overall, the food was ok. I might be back for some more diniguan and maybe I'll try other Filipino dishes.

I'm married to a Filipino man, I eat my mother in laws cooking, we seek out Filipino food when we lived in Las Vegas and out in DC, which both has great selection!  This is definitely one of the best fast food Filipino restaurant!  You can tell care has been taken and the quality of food is high.  It's just too bad Filipino food isn't showcased more out here in the Denver area- makes us homesick!

Food is good.  Very disappointed by the variety if filipino dishes.  They advertise "proudly servicing filipino-asian cuisine" but offer 10 dishes out of 44 items listed on the menu.  No Lechon or garlic rice :( .  But the food is good, place is clean and staff is friendly.
I finally tried it and I'm not disappointed. Filipino restaurants are scarce here in the Metro area and so far, this is my place. Coming back to try other dishes, YUMMY

I've gotten to know the staff here at China Jade. This is a family owned restaurant and ran by family members. 
The Beef Schezwan, Beef with Broccoli, Orange Chicken, Combo Lo Mein Noodles with no Pork and Shrimp Vegetables are all amazing, our faves... 
The service is great and the resto is always clean! The price is average, but great quantities. You pay for what you get and it's definitely worth it!

Terrific menu, full of Asian speakers, not your typical Americanized Chinese eatery.
Try it!
I think they are closed on Tuesdays, call first!

We were recommended this place but on both occasions we've eaten there had poor experiences.  This is a review of our latest visit.

Arrived in the restaurant and didn't seem that busy, told to sit anywhere.  After about 10 minutes we hadn't been given a menu or anything so I just decided to go up to the front counter and get it myself.  Staff were hanging around there and didn't say anything.

Then it took a while for staff to come over and take our order, we waved to them but they ignored us, they were standing around doing nothing.  Just when we thought things were getting back on track we had received 2 wrong dishes so asked for the correct order.  Well, the staff member gave us really bad attitude, I really wasn't expecting that at all.  Eventually they agreed that they had made a mistake, we got 1 dish changed.

The food was not that impressive, tasted bland, had better but also had worse.  I would say the food is Americanized, even the more authentic Chinese style dishes.  I would say 1 out of the 5 dishes we ordered was good.  We had quite a few leftovers but just decided to throw it away.

From an ambience perspective its quite obvious they haven't put a lot of effort into the place but that's ok if it keeps the prices down, it appears to attract quite a few students.

It appears to be a family restaurant and they just don't gel together at all.  We heard arguments coming from the kitchen and they bought that into the main dinning area.  They appeared to have friends dinning in there and they got more attention than anybody else in the restaurant.  Some customers were leaving feeling quite upset not talking to the staff on the way out.

I think its quite safe to say that we will not be returning to this place.
I just love the food here. You can have flavored spicy. Usually come here for spicy. My favorite is Spicy pot stewed pork blood tofu.

I've had takeout from here on two occasions and both times I wasn't impressed. It had a lack of flavor and wasn't fresh at all. I will say that I've heard their Szechuan plates are great but I haven't had the motivation to come back.

Let me start out by saying the one star is generous and only because the hot and sour soup was OK, and the rice was OK.  Oh and my food was ready to go in 10 minutes like I was told.
