I ordered take out, asked for chicken in garlic sauce and hot and sour soup.  

First....Evidentially I pulled the wrong menu, because when she gave me my total I almost passed out and I questioned the price; I was told it was an old menu, probably more than five years old. The problem was that I could not find another menu that was any more recent. Asian food, prices go up in the evening, I was still ok.  My order was repeated back to me and I was told 10 minutes....

Second...Instead of chicken in garlic sauce I was given curry chicken with vegetables.  Gahhhhh.....I was already at my destination when I found out.  I never thought twice about my order being wrong because along with the comment about looking at an old menu, she again repeated my order...

Third....I called to explain the situation and asked if they could deliver the correct order to my current location, less than a block away, I was told NO...I ordered curry chicken and she was busy.  WTF, $16 for my soup and entree and you can't give me a little customer service?  I told her I would be back a little later and would expect the meal that I originally ordered and paid for....I sure hope the attitude has changed!Horrible customer service is a huge pet peeve of mine....I was bringing myself, a new customer, to spend money at China Jade and was treated so poorly that I will not be back and I will tell everyone I know about how I was treated.  Next time I will give my hard earned money to a business that appreciates their customers!

Ps....I will be back tonight to get what I paid for, you have one and only one chance to change my mind about your restaurant.  I am guessing you probably don't care, so I will just take my chicken in garlic sauce and won't return!

Update 12/30/15, 9pm....went back to restaurant after my event, explained my situation to a different person.  The situation was made right and I received the correct order, chicken with garlic sauce and an apology!  I really appreciate that they made this right, thank you.

FINALLY some Chinese food worthy of recognition!! I'm so happy we stumbled upon this place. My first suggestion: don't order blatantly obvious Americanized-Chinese dishes; relish the opportunity to eat some delicious Chinese dishes! Dishes are family-style, and are about 4 or 5 servings, so 4 dishes in total are plenty to feed a group of 4 or 5 people. I've been to many Chinese restaurants in Los Angeles, and the food at China Jade is on par with the LA Chinese restaurants--so you know it's pretty good. Check this cute lil' restaurant out! I guarantee you'll be thanking Yelp for the recommendation.
This is a really nice and traditional Chinese restaurant. Loooooove the food! Typical southern province style.
Started to visit this place since I moved to Denver 5 years ago. Not sure about the American Chinese food menu. But the authentic menu are always tasty.

I can't even write an objective review of this place at this point. I used to try different things here, but the girlfriend and I have been ordering spicy boiled fish and Kung pow tofu for the last half year...I like, emotionally need this specific combination of dishes every month or so at least, and it never disappoints. I strongly, strongly recommend trying these dishes here.

A terrible experience ever about dining. Being there dozens of times, but this was our first visit in this year. This restaurant changed tremendously. Hair in rice (cant post pic), was far from the worst part. What really ruined our good impression about China Jade was the chef (likely the owner) came out yelling at us, saying we made up the story. 

This restaurant isnot the one before. Can't recognize the menu, waitress, chef, even the owner.

Find another one, like Golden Shanghai. You will thank me.

Love this place. Super authentic and the people here are so friendly. Great Szechuan food. Don't order off the Americanized menu. Try Ziran lamb (or beef), the spicy water boiled fish and any Chinese vegetables they have for the day. Show them this: 

Kong xin cai
Dou miao

These two are the best simple stir fry veggies available that aren't shown on the menu. If you can get either of these, do it. Will change your life!!

Food was ok. Way over priced there are so many better and cheaper options. Even their lunch menu was over priced. $8 for lunch?? What caught my attention the most was the awful customer service. Let's just say this place likes to choose who they give customer service to. We literally sat across from a couple who got the grand service, they were so chatty with them they even brought them out an entrée that wasn't on the menu for them while I was told I couldn't order their "sweet and sour combination " which they had on the menu. After we finally ordered that was the only contact we had with our waitress. She didn't stop by after that. I wouldn't suggest this place, like I said so many better options in terms of Chinese food. Won't be coming back.

We are spoiled, prehaps even arrogant, when it comes to Chinese cuisne, although hardly coinessuers. We use to Live in Lexington MA, home to great Chinese restaurants. China Jade is an exceptional dining experience, I give it 5*s for authentic ambiance wraped in tantalizing aromas and fantastic food. This eatery is clearly up to Lexington MA standards. When NE Patriots come to kick some Bronco Butt in December, I am going to post to Patriots FB page how good this eatery is; a restaurant to savoir a Patriots win, pre or post game. 

Brady vs Sanchez, Simion or ur # 1 draft pick NP!

For those looking for authentic Sichuan food, look no further than China Jade.  The store-front is very unassuming (yes, it's the place that has frosted glass without a very obvious front door), but when you walk inside you know you're in business because many of the patrons are Chinese students.  

Food/Beverages: There are two menus - the authentic Chinese menu and the Americanized Chinese menu.  The authentic Chinese menu is two pages, but has enough for multiple visits.  My favorites include the kidney (could use a bit more peppers and onions, but you do get a good helping of delicious kidney), the fried large intestines, and their sweet potato leaves with minced garlic.  I actually think they do vegetables the best of all the Chinese places I've gone to.  The flavors are great, and for those interested in heat, you can definitely find it here.  

Ambiance: Clean, utilitarian with some touches of "Asian-esque" pictures up on the far right wall.  Seating available for small and larger groups.  Also, as mentioned above, the exterior has frosted glass so you can't actually see into the restaurant. Don't be deterred, just open the door and walk in.

Service: Can be slow, especially around dinner when the customers start rolling in.  Don't expect them to wait hand and foot here and take initiative if you need your rice or tea refilled.

Pricing: A little bit on the pricier side (as compared to HK BBQ) but some certain dishes are worth paying a little extra.

Hours: Closed on Tuesdays! Don't make the mistake that I've made several times going there hungry on Tuesday nights. 

Tip: If you're looking for the authentic experience, make sure to ask for the authentic menu.
Great food. Great service. I've been here for tons of times. Definitely my favorite Chinese restaurant in Denver. Personally I like their woks more than their hot pot.

Ok tried the spicy boiled fish, since many people reviewed it as good. I was not impressed. First it was not spicy, the foods was bland and the fish? Yuck!. I had the food to go and tried to spicy it up at home, but I could not eat it. I threw out the rest of the food. What a waste of my15dollars.

*BASED ON HOT POT REVIEW ONLY*

Well, Well, Well...  Now this China Jade has moved to a BIGGER Space, aka more seating areas for Patrons alike.  Recent visit was for a farewell party, I suggested to my fellow Singaporean friends to go here for the HOT POT!  Thank God, they are willing to go to this China Jade.  2 of my friends made the reservation.  I came early as usual since Hubs need to run some other errands.

  That evening was on Saturday June 14th 2014.  Time was 18:00hrs.  The reservation was for 18:30hrs.  Thankfully, the owner and staff allocated us in the PRIVATE Room!  SCORE!  The seating arrangement and all the Burners are all ready for us, including the RAW FOOD such as 3 Plates of TIGER Shrimp ($26.85), 2 Plates of Fresh Cod Fish Fillet ($15.90), 2 Plates of Hot Pot Fish Balls (L) ($13.90)  and other condiments are all set.

  We opt to have the DUAL HOT POT aka House Yin-Yang Pot, which one half have the SPICY Base and the other was the Herb Base.  Just take note, this REQUIRE RESERVATION IN ADVANCE if you want to do the HOT POT!  The items you want for your HOT POT can add up!  So just be warned.  Since there are 12 of us, the SOUP Base cost was $47.40.  Hence that is like $3.95 for each person.  4 of us share one HOT POT.  Doable to some.

  With the choice of food we opt were :
*  1 Plate of Hand Sliced Fatty Beef ($8.95)
*  3 Plates of Lamb & Beef Platter ($29.85)
*  3 Plates of Chicken Breast ($17.85)
*  4 Plates of Beef Tendon (L) ($23.80)
*  3 Plates of Napa Cabbage (L) ($11.85)
*  3 Plates of Glass Noodle (L) ($11.85)
*  3 Plates of Fresh Soft Tofu (L) ($11.85)
*  3 Plates of Enoki Mushroom (L) ($17.85)
*  2 Plates of Pancake ($7.00)
*  12 Bowls of Rice ($12.00)

My friends also order a couple of Beers, Soft Drinks and Tea.  We are indeed stuffed at the end of the HOT POT DINNER.

  4 of my other friends also order the Pork Belly ($5.95) for their HOT POT Dinner.  At least throughout the HOT POT Dinner, one of the Staffs checked up on us, to make sure we need other things and also provide refills of Water, and other Beverages that we need.

  Since it was a farewell party for my friend, each of us paid like $35 with tax and definitely generous tips to boot!  Take note, in our check, 18% Gratuity is already included.  All in all, its THE Company that counts.  THANK GOD, all my friends are OK with the food.  In terms of the HOT POT items, China Jade can do better hence this 3 star review.  

China Jade
12203 East Iliff Ave, #D
Aurora, CO 80014
Tel : (303)-755-8518
Fax : (303)-755-8519

If you have any concern you can call the Manager directly via this number :
(720)-288-3401.

@126/2014

!!!!!!  Unreal.   Please do it.    This is not Panda Express !!!!         Meet a Chinese guy at the BBQ place next to H mart.   He told me about this place.  
   The twiced cooked pork was the real deal.   Nothing like the crap all the normal American Chinese places serve.

Food was not good or tasty.  Really seemed like fast food served in large quantity.  We ordered on phone and when we went to pick up, we were told the prices from online menu had changed and they had not updated their website. Very expensive now so beware of price discrepancies.  When I had asked on the phone the price, the guy did not respond. I would not recommend anyone going here.

Decided to try a place my friend had never tried. I had a craving for hot pot, probably because it had been so good in New York. 

When we walked in, the restaurant was almost full, bustling with people happily eating dishes of steaming Chinese food. We were immediately seated and brought two menus. I asked for the hot pot menu, which surprised our server, but he gave us one and told us there would be a wait. My guess is that it's not ordered often, so they were going to have to prep. 

We were there to catch up, so there wasn't a rush. We ordered fatty beef and fish filet, bok choy and cabbage, enoki and shiitake mushrooms, corn, fish ball, bean curd, quail eggs, glass noodles and spicy broth. The server brought around a cart so that we could dress up our sesame sauce. 

We had a great time. Our table soon filled with plates of ingredients, larger portions than we expected, as we soon got to work. The veggies were nice and fresh, the meat was tender, and they gave us a bowl FULL of quail eggs. The spice was just right, and three people were filled to capacity, with food left over. 

It's not NYC equivalent, but it was pretty good. 3.5 stars, rounding up because the service was friendly.

Spicy Boiled Fish here is a must!!! There's a Chinese menu and an American menu so you can decide how authentic you want your dish to be.  The Beef Chow Ho Fun is the best in Denver... not too greasy like most Chinese places.  Szechuan Kungpao Chicken is yummy as well... fyi~ there's cucumbers in it.  Food always comes out superfast but service is hit or miss... they finally realized I'm a regular after a couple months and are super friendly now.  Yay!

We wanted to stay in and have a meal in our PJs.
So, we chose the Take out for China Jade.
The first comment is that they have no online menu. So I called to make sure. The employees answer to my online menu request was, " Tell me what you like and we have it! I'll just tell you how much it is."
That's not how we are comfortable ordering so I got dressed to go pick up a paper menu!
Came back home to get the families picks!

We decided on:
The Pupu Platter....which we ended up not eating most of.
Pork chow mein and pork fried rice...both OK!
Shrimp with snow peas and Orange Chicken...both  actually kind of yummy.

Overall, the food wasn't good enough for the trouble we had to go through to order it.

We came across this spot while looking for some good and authentic Chinese food, and we not disappointed at all. The food is very tasty and spicy like authentic szechuan food. This place is great if you like love authentic and non Americanized Chinese.

Stopped in to see if this restaurant is a worthy choice. Lots of Asian customers- a very good sign. very busy. Ordered Happy Family to go along wit their egg drop soup. Soup was flavorless. The HF was pretty good. The interior was very well done is a current trendy style. I will try them again. They have promise!
Surprisingly authentic Chinese and Szechuan food. After living in China for a decade, I never thought I would find their "Szechuan Water Cooked Fish" outside of Asia. Great family run restaurant.
One of my fav Chinese places. Order from the Chinese menu! A place with food that I get cravings for.

amazing Chinese~I live in Denver and would drive to this place for a meal. Recently dined there for a tasting event for an upcoming Aurora Asian Pacific Comm. Partnership Holiday Party planning. I loved the Ziran beef... so much better than any beef and broccoli dish.

Went again. Don't have a reason to be in that part of town but the pork and tofu called to us. 

We ordered the usual favorites and were not disappointed. Going for the hot pot next  it looked excellent.

We found this wonderful restaurant years ago when it was a small restaurant that focused on take out. Our son who lives in Beijing originally found this on yelp.  We went here and he responded quickly with a double thumbs up.  
The boiled fish is spicy killer, awesome. The lamb dish, i think called zirchan [?] lamb  is really really good. For veggies try the eggplant dishes, one with pork the other w/o pork.  You can get  both as veggie.   Also have the on choy with garlic sauce, really really tasty.
Go and try the food. I want people to go there, eat and enjoy. That way it will always be here for me too.

Ugh, I'm very sad to be writing this because coming from Seattle I so badly wanted to find "authentic" Asian cuisine here in our new home town of Denver. 

Anyways we ordered Mongolian Beef which I found to be quite bland, had no heat and was lacking... Dare I say it salt! 

Next was our shrimp and snow pea dish, the snow peas were fresh which was positive however the shrimp did not taste fresh. Once again I felt as if the dish lacked flavor ie garlic, oyster sauce, and SALT! 

Finally we ended on BBQ pork chow mein, this was nothing like any chow mein I have ever had... There were no soft noodles and it only had those deep fried crunchy ones on top. 

After reading this review you must think I love salt... Truthfully no I don't I just did not get the sense that the cook was serving authentic Asian food... And quite honestly I believe that I could have cooked these dishes better at home.... 

Alas my search for good Chinese food in Denver continues!

Ordered take out for lunch. The restaurant itself is in a strip mall that is dingy. The inside could not have been cleaner. The rice was perfect- I mean perfect. The General chicken was a great flavor with enough sauce, the chicken could be better quality though! Would return.
Just like the other reviews say. It's really good. Two menus. One American style Chinese and the other is traditional. I ordered off the traditional. Fabulous.  Will be back.

Amazing and delicious authentic Chinese food!
I decided to try this place out with a couple of my friends from Chinese class and loved the new decor (they had recently remodeled) as well as the food. Everything was fresh and just the right amount of proportions. 

The hot pot was especially delightful. We all decided on the spicy variety and added bits of sliced beef, dumplings, and mushrooms, as well as clear glass noodles. The dipping sauce was a delicious compliment to the spicy soup as well. 

The staff was friendly and there were a fair amount of customers who looked like they greatly enjoyed the meal they were having. By the end of the night, we were definitely part of that group! 

All four of us are planning on coming back again very soon.

Delicious! My husband and I just moved to Denver and we were so happy to find an authentic Chinese restaurant! We ordered off the Chinese menu (they have a Chinese-American menu as well) and everything was delicious. The oh choy veggies and mu shu tasted exactly like food I've had in Beijing. We even ordered some dishes that weren't on the menu and they were delicious as well. 
Great service as well!

This is the best chinese i've had in denver, but that means East Coast Barely Worth Bothering. My first visit, I did enjoy my chicken curry and as I mentioned in my previous review, it didn't make me throw up, as chicken curry has a tendency to do. HOWEVER, they did not give us any rice. We ordered one noodle dish and two chicken dishes and got zero rice. I was also bummed because I was sick and really wanted some chicken rice soup and they refused to make me any even though it is literally chicken broth and a scoop of white rice and in my experience any chinese restaurant will do this for you even if they don't list it on the menu.

We did get the extra hot mustard and duck sauce my boyfriend asked for.
If your looking for some good authentic Chinese food this place is great! I love how you just order a bunch of food and share it.  The eggplant in garlic was amazing. Definitely going back!

My family visited a few weeks ago - really liked it. Great food - many hard-to-find Szechuan dishes - friendly staff, clean environment, and comfortable experience overall. Did not have a dish we didn't like a lot, which says everything. We actually said to ourselves that this is one of those few places we'd like to go back to (and plan on it). Damn good on all levels, which is rare.

Now this is what Chinese food should be always be like! It's been quite some time since I've had great Chinese luckily this place was in walking distance from my friends apartment. We had been drinking and eating bar food all weekend and I needed to change it up. They have a broad selection of classic Chinese food, I ordered the kung pao chicken with white rice, beef fried rice and crab meat cheese wontons. Everything was delicious! Took about 30 minutes to get everything ready so we waited a little bit inside. I am not big on chain restaurants and it sounds like this one is the only location in the Denver area. If you are ever in Aurora and craving Chinese this is the place to get your grub on!!

Yeah, so, we read the reviews and were interested in trying the hot pot.  No menu showed any signs of them, so we ordered Ma Po Tofu, which we were told typically contains pork, something I have never seen before, and the waiter recommended the vegetable delight.  We also ordered a large hot and sour soup, which was surprisingly vegetarian.

Ma Po Tofu seems to be for people without teeth, as it is a limp bean curd that quickly becomes mush.  The tofu was cannonballing into a hot sauce that showed strong separation, which I assume to be disgusting oil.  The vegetable delight was $9.95, and was just an asinine offering of sauteed bok choy, shitake, wood ear fungus, broccoli, and bamboo.  No sauce, no sign of being a Chinese dish except for the style of vegetables, and the fact that it was completely overpriced.  I have had large hot and sour soups, and this one fell quite short, as the large's I have had before have been about 2x the size for the same goddamn price.

This place fails to acknowledge that they use serious amounts of MSG.  I am quite allergic to this, and once home, immediately fell asleep.  Upon arising, I had a nice trip to the john, due to this fecal food.  I hated everything about this experience, and for my efforts, am $32 poorer.

arrived. owner said they are busy with a take out order. we waited 15 mins before getting any service. ordered 4 dishes, 1 soup.  worst 3 cup chicken, veggie, mapo tofu, one soup.  bill was $70! you do the math. again, owner made us wait when we asked for the check. another 15 mins goes by. asked again. owner again said wait. we then told her we were leaving. she then gsbe us the bill and to go boxes to pack ourselves. 

overpriced. bad service. definitely way overrated. $70 for 4 dishes and a soup for decent chinese food.  really?  she charged us $15 for that sorry 3 cup chicken. what!?  

worst part, she never said sorry making us wait before we order nor after we waited again for the check.

Just... the best. The effing best. Get the spicy boiled fish and mapo tofu. I've had a couple other assorted dishes that are good (Thai curry and ziran, I believe) that were also great, but if you are here, order at least one thing drowning in peppercorns. 

You want legit Chinese food? You want legit mala? Get your face in here. Szechuan food is a religious experience.

I have been going to this place on a monthly basis for over a year now. Today I couldn't believe the customer service in this "restaurant" . I walked in and I was the only one there, two ladies (employees, owners) were just standing there and starring at me while I stood at the counter almost begging them to take my order. I set down and 5 min later my food arrived. The only interaction between me and one of the ladies/server/owner (who knows) was that I was served my order by one of them. Best part was while I was eating that one of the ladies brought out her nail kit, (she was doing her nails) at the table next to me. Not once was I asked anything like is the food ok, do I need anything else etc. I finished my meal got up, paid my bill (left the tip line blank). I wasn't waited on and didn't feel like anyone deserves my money if they are not working for it. As I was walking towards the door the lady that felt like she was my waitress, was saying something and holding my receipt in the air, I went back and wanted to see if I signed a wrong copy or something. She was pointing at the tip line, without any english knowledge she said: "No tip for me?" and handed me a pen. LOL. I took the pen and wrote 0 and turned around and again after I was about to leave she said: ASSHOLE to me. I just turned around looked at her and left. Yes, this is a "restaurant" where you as a repeat customer get treated like shit and get called an asshole. Obviously her english got better with those type of words, but speaking more beyond that is impossible, since I was never approached by this so called "waitress". Just because you work at a restaurant doesn't mean money will be thrown at you ;)

I wish yelp had a "no star" option!

Probably as authentic as it gets in the area. Don't come here expecting syrup sweet Chinese food; this is the real deal. The tendon and beef flank appetizer (served cold) is phenomenal and the boiling fish soup is the best dish on the menu (yes it does have numbing sichuan peppercorns). The pepper chicken is fantastic too but if you're afraid of spicy stay away. The only downside of their menu is that some appetizers are grossly overpriced relative to the portion size such as the sichuan green beans for $10.

I'm looking for a replacement authentic Chinese restaurant to replace my beloved Chef Liu's and so far, China Jade has come the closest.  They offer a lot of tripe/stomach based dishes, so that was a good sign.  However, I was disappointed to discover that their soup options are limited and they don't offer Mongolian Lamb (they do offer the beef version).  I tried something labelled "zumin flavored lamb" and found out that zumin=cumin. Not my favorite dish but it was not bad either.  My friend Jessi ordered chicken fried rice.  She didn't seem overly impressed but I tried a little of it and liked it.  Service was pretty slow - it took almost 15 minutes to bring out our drinks despite not being terribly busy - there were maybe 4-5 tables that evening.  I'll come back and try some other dishes and update my review.

I was not impressed with this place. The platic water glass needs to be replaced. They do have different and unique menue items. The service was very lacking. The prices were expensive. The card machine was broke and I had to pay cash. Good thing I did have enough but what if I didn't.
I called for information and they literally said sorry no delivery and hung up! Never ever will I eat here.

Just moved to the area and looking for a Chinese place to try out. Looked to Yelp for reviews.  When we called to place our order we were told they do not deliver, but were able to do take-out (which was okay with us). We ordered the crab cheese wontons, fried dumplings, beef chow ho fun, pork in garlic sauce, and the szechuan kung pao chicken.

The crab cheese wontons were a bit on the chewier side and the fried dumplings were okay, but nothing spectacular. The beef chow ho fun had good flavor and the beef was perfectly cooked, but the noodles were a little overdone (too soft). The pork in garlic sauce was excellent - the kick of spice was just enough. The szechuan kung pao chicken was one of the best kung pao chicken dishes I have had from a Chinese restaurant! Normally the dish isn't spicy enough for me, but the one was China Jade was spot on. I also liked how the chicken was cut into thin strips versus chunks (never seen that before).

Overall my family enjoyed the food and it was reasonably priced. We are looking forward to trying other items off the menu.

Authentic Chinese food at an affordable price. I recommend this place.

I will upgrade to 5 stars if they change the waitress.

I certainly agree with reviews criticizing the new waitress, but don't let her punish this restaurant. Let the owners know that you are not pleased with her service.  Im a long time customer but now I hesitate to go because the new waitress makes me feel uncomfortable. Other reviews cited rudeness and apparently she called a customer an asshole. 

The owner needs to know and make changes ASAP. If the waitress stays, I will downgrade to 3 stars.

I have a friend who grew up in New York City who introduced me to Chinese in all its glory.  I finally got to take him to this place.   It was my third visit but the first since the remodel.   This place is the type of place to take a large group and try a lot of items.... I will take it however I can get it.

The place is newer, cleaner, nicer but basically the same.  I missed all the post construction chaos and we arrived early on a Saturday--about five.  We lingered for an hour and a half and in that time no one that was not speaking Chinese was there, except a group of Asian twenty somethings ordering take out.  I always ask for the "Chinese" menu not the "American Chinese menu".   There are a lot of "variety" meats on it and a lot of regular items too.   Take your pick.  

This time I repeated the Shanghai smoked fish (which has received the same glorious accolades and been eaten down to the skin all three times), and had the Simmered/Stewed Pork Roast with Vegetables, and also the Szechuan fish and tofu (sorry my memory for specific names is terrible).  The Pork was 5 star.  The complexity of flavors (not spicy, mild) rivaled the best Indian cuisine I have had.  Absolutely memorable, and the pork was moist and fell apart--clearly indicative of a good preparation method.  The vegetables were crisp and held their own flavor so I am pretty sure they were steamed separately.  The hunk of pork was right off the roast, whole, and I estimate it was a pound and a half, if not more.

The fish and tofu(firm) was the right amount of spicy for someone who is used to Korean spice but doesn't want the mild fish and tofu totally overwhelmed.   I took this home (portions are huge, the three dishes would have served 4-8 depending on appetite) and it was great microwaved leftover twice, on some jasmine rice I made.  That was fresh fish.

So five stars on two dishes and 3-4 on the third.   It is a small place and I imagine if you arrive at rush hour on a peak weekend night you might be impatient for the service, but I don't know.   I have been here when large groups of Chinese or other Asians were dining so I can imagine the dining room of about (estimate) 20 small tables could get overwhelmed.   

Definitely go, though.  You won't be disappointed if you have an adventurous palate. this is definitely as good as it gets in Denver/Aurora, but I have a dim sum favorite place on the west side too.

The food was good. I had duck and the potstickers. Service was okay, but when i paid my check and wrote out the tip ($4.20), she actually called after me as i was walking out and was like "only 20 cents?!" I had to assure her that there was a 4 before those 20 cents. That was definitely a turn off for the place.
The spicy boiled fish. Do it. You'll thank me (but thank them first!). And get the eggplant and garlic too. This is my new favorite spot for good Chinese food now that I'm on the east side of town.

The food was very Chinese, very szhechuan I have to say. Hadn't had such a authentic Chinese flavor for a long time. The dishes were large and the rice was plenty. Great service too.

The biggest downside was the sand in the vegies :(

Have never ate such disgusting food ever. The Szechuan-style food is not the way that they cooked. They simply stir-fried red pepper and salt for every dish. Salty and not healthy. Can not distinguish pork and beef by taste. Not real Chinese food. Besides, waitress was rude. Be careful!

Tried this spot for the 1st time today & it was delicious! I ordered sweet & sour chicken, 2 vegetable egg rolls & an order of crab and cheese wontons, all of which came out to $23 and some change.  The sweet & sour chicken came with rice & the portion was enough for more than two people in my opinion.  The outside was really crispy, while the meat was juicy! The wontons were really delicious; however, the corners were a bit too hard for my liking, so watch out for that.  I gave this place 4 starts instead of 5 because with all the food I ordered they only gave me 1 packet of soy sauce!! I mean really?! Anyway, I'll definitely be going back.

They do not deliver so I ordered carry out.  I got tofu with shredded pork, a dish I have loved at other places, but here it was terribly bland.  The hot and sour soup, on the other hand, was way more spicey than I am accustomed to so I couldn't eat it.  The steamed dumplings were decent.

Szechuan Cuisine (MaLa Numb Spicy)  

Not your orange chicken Panda Express. Szechuan cuisine is different than the coast cities of Shanghai and Hong Kong. If you've never had real mainland Chinese food before this place might not suite your taste. But if you like spicy food, my favorites are: 

H6 Spicy Boiled Beef Slices (Numb and Spicy) 
H18 Ziran Flavored Beef (Cumin spices)
H32 Twice cooked pork (Lots of pork fat)   
H35 Eggplant in hot garlic sauce (With pork?)

This is the only place I know in Denver that serves a dedicated Hot Pot menu but advance reservation is needed. If there are other hot pot places, please let me know. The service needs to get better and having friendlier staff couldn't hurt. This is the DEE place to go for some real mainland Chinese food.
A rare criticism: your new waitress is rude, offensive, and the reason we walked out and won't be back.

This was my second visit to China Jade, and it was a disappointment.  The Thai Curry Chicken was nothing more than a large helping of potatoes, chicken bits, and red pepper.  The flavor was all right, but a dish that is mainly potatoes is not what I've come to expect in an Asian restaurant.  Perhaps another dish would have been better.  The wait staff was courteous and I've no complaints on that score, but do not expect to go back.  There are too many better choices in Aurora.

Might as well just strap those Crab Cheese wontons directly onto my thighs.... 
If you are on any kind of diet, don't even bother... this is the place to go when you want to have Fat girl Friday, Hungover Headache Saturday, or even I just don't feel like cooking Monday. Ordered Delivery-Quick, Inexpensive, and lots of variety (everyone can find something they like on this menu!) Yum in the tum! 
I still have dreams about those CC wontons...
My family loved every dish.  We'll be returning of course.
Fantastic and authentic!  We loved the boiled shrimp.  Seemed to be the signature dish.

Been here twice in the last two weeks!  The first time with the family.  We enjoyed the beef chow ho fun, basil eggplant, and the shredded pork in the spicy garlic sauce.  All were great as left over meals too.

On my next trip I had the boiled beef and the Ma Po tofu as the family went back home.  Both were very spicy.  Next time I'll have to mix it up with the sweeter basil eggplant or shredded pork.  Yes, I know both of those are spicy too, however they have a bit of sweetness to them!

I really like that they have the "Chinese" menu as well as the traditional American Chinese menu.  I am from CA, and that is what they do back there too.

Best Szechuan in Denver. Does it hold up to West Coast standards? Not really, but it's  still pretty good. I think business has massively shot up here too ever since the only other authentic, Chef Liu's,  closed. I waited for a solid 45 minutes here to get seated on Saturday night, but if you miss authentic szechuan flavors from another place, it's the only place to go.
Best Chinese I've had in Colorado. Great food, fast service. We had chicken love in, sweet and sour chicken and beef and broccoli. It is worth driving for carryout.
Terrible food. And I never write reviews. Not sure what rave is about?? Nice people nice service. Just bland tasteless food. :(

My boyfriend and I got a few dishes from here to-go the other night. The Tianjin style pork buns are pretty good, however the orange chicken is really delicious. Not nearly as overly sweet and drenched in sauce as many gone-wrong versions of this ubiquitous dish are. Would love to try more of the traditional dishes and hot pot here when I get a chance to dine-in, many look really delicious!
Great Szechuan food! I have American and Chinese friends, they both love it! If you love spicy, this is it.

I thought this place was very good. I'm not a huge Chinese, or Asian cuisine fan so I really need to be in the mood for that type of food to go to a restaurant of that nature. I met a friend for dinner there and it was a cute little place. The staff were all very friendly and attentive. My friend got the poo poo platter and I ordered the General Tsos chicken. The portions there are huge! I definitely couldn't finish it all. But i liked it! Not every place makes that dish the same, and this one had a little more kick than I am used to, but it was a good kick! The prices were okay, it was dinner time and i paid like $11.50 for my meal..pretty standard in Chinese dinner prices I've found. We'll definitely be back, my hubby loves Chinese food so I'll have to introduce him to this place!

The  egg drop soup came out luke-warm and bland. We told the server this and put the soup to the side. The rest of the experience was even worse. She never came back once to check on our food, fill the drinks or give us a bill. I went up and grabbed my own to go boxes and had to ASK for the check. When it came, the soup was still on the bill. I pointed this out and  she stormed away and said she had to talk to the owner about having it removed. After a few minutes she came back to the counter and did remove the 2 soups from the bill. 
Below average food and HORRIBLE customer service. Do not waste your money or your time here.

Haven't been to this place for two years, it's changed quite a bit! In a good way though. Now it's twice as big as before, new granite top tables, nice tile floors, curtains, just much better atmosphere. I am so glad their business is expanding and doing so much better!

Now the food. We order the fish and tofu boil, twice cooked pork, boiled beef, tofu and shrimp, also beef tendons. We had a friend didn't eat red meat otherwise I wouldn't have ordered tofu and shrimp, it was pretty plain, not much flavor at all.

My favorite was the twice cooked pork! Best flavor ever! 

Spicy boiled beef and fish and tofu were decent too, especially fish and tofu. Beef tendon was ok, not spicy enough.

There are translations on the right side of all the Chinese dish names, I don't see why some people can't figure out what to order? Do you really need pictures for everything??

Oh did I say the service was fast and our food came out within a few minutes? 
Love this place! Will definitely go back again!

I would love to tell you about the food.  But after the first waiter didn't listen to our request for baby seat accommodation.  Then asking another worker about an item on the menu and being told "you ask your waiter.  Go.  Go" and gesturing me to leave her space we waked out.  Maybe the food is exquisite but the staff were wretched.

My friends are crazy about this place, and right after I landed to Denver from Houston they took me here. Must say, there are only few authentic Chinese restaurant in Denver/Aurora area. After the famous Chopstix closed down, the closest thing we found is this. I like the overall fell of the restaurant and we ordered Ma Po tofu, fish and fried rice. The portion sizes were good, and overall taste was excellent as well. I will definately go back there as soon as I hit Denver.

Not for white folk...

1.) do not eat here if you can not read chinese!!
2.) bring a warm jacket as the wind blows through the front door when ever anyone opens it..
3.) expect to be frustrated regards the menu as they have their own ideas about what stuff means
4.) it is expensive.

In general a total and complete failure as far as our meal there went, we hated everything and actually stopped eating, asked for the remainder of our weird meal to be placed in takeout containers so we could throw it away at home without embarassing ourselves or the chef and went across the street and ate at Quodoba and had a burrito.

Nice restaurant, very clean, nice waiter,  but who really wants to eat crispy fried pig intestine??

As an aside, recently, my daughter had a speech and debate tournament at Overlook HS, up the street, some students ordered food from this place, according to her everyone hated everything they got, I am confused by the great reviews, really confused, I am serious... be careful here If you need authentic Chinese I think Chef Liu's is often awesome for its spicy and well prpeared food and is close by..

ACTUAL Szechwan food.  Order from the Chinese menu.  Best In Denver.  Best I've had since... China or New York.

We tried the Pork Buns, Mabo Dofu, Flavored Lamb, Szechwan Pork.  All four of these were the best in Denver.  (I do still recommend Hong Kong BBQ for that style cuisine, maybe a bit better portion for the price, but... I prefer Szechwan most all the time.)

Friendly staff, clean, newish nice-enough decor.

This restaurant seems to have changed hand or something  since last we visited. We live kinda far but it used to be one of our favorite go-to places when we crave for authentic Chinese cooking. Afraid it's no more! We noticed the place is expanded to double its previous size, but definitely the quality of the food and service diminished. I agree with one of the reviewer's comment about their non-attentive attitude. Price went up quite a bit but portion has gone down a lot too. Guess I'll head to Federal Blvd & Mississippi Ave from now on. Sad!

Literally the only place in Denver to get authentic Szechuan dishes. 

I tried the beef in hot sauce and other staples of my childhood. I was born in Chongqing which was a part of Szechuan years ago. I love spicy food and the taste experience here is one of the only places in Denver where you can find these dishes. 

Although the spice level of the dishes are not near as spicy as it is in Szechuan. I may ask them if they can make it as spicy as that of China next time I visit. 

They also seem to have standard items too if you're looking for more traditional staples of Chinese American food. e.g. Sesame chicken, broccoli beef, etc.
Service was a little slow getting started, but they were very nice and the food was excellent. Our favorite dish was the spicy boiled fish.

This place is awesome, good service, but food..... The portion sides are Large! This is because, it's how it should be; it's how they do it in China. It's set up so that you all eat together, the more people involved the more dishes, 5 people 6 dishes is the rule, but with this place, it'll be a one to one ratio cause the portion sides are generous and delicious, authentic. 
     The hot pot menu also has a Huge selection, hot pot is the best part about Chinese food, or at least the most exciting part when meeting it for non-chinese, like myself, traveling. This place is a gem waiting to be discovered, nice inside, good temperature, This is Chinese food Denver or Aurora!
     I don't usually take the time to write a review, but if you want authentic Chinese food, you need to be here.

Got takeout from here on Easter Sunday to keep up with a family tradition. I couldn't find what looked like an up-to-date menu online and so we stopped in at this location and easily picked one up.

We placed and order for mongolian beef, broccoli with garlic, lo mein with chicken, and spring rolls. As we were picking the order up, the wait time was quoted as 15 minutes. We showed up and they appeared to be running a bit behind. After waiting an extra 10 minutes, we had our meal, along with an extra pint of hot and sour soup. A lovely touch!

When we got home, we discovered that we had been given another beef and vegetable dish instead of the broccoli. Not ideal as it was super spicy like the mongolian beef, but it was still tasty. All ingredients were very fresh and properly cooked. The lo mein was delicious and had a nice garlicky taste to it. There is a large presence of oil in the dishes and I will request for less used next time (if possible).

Would definitely recommend this restaurant. Our total was $38 for the 4 dishes and they fed the two of us for 5 meals.
The food here is not very good but the service is even worse.

Based on all the reviews I read, we drove from Breckenridge to this restaurant.  The food was not worth the drive.  It was way too salty and there was no beef in the Mongolian beef and the twice cooked pork was fatty.  I cannot believe this is considered good Chinese food. Then, I got charged twice for this awful meal.
I went here based on the Yelp reviews and was quite letdown. It seems like they cater mostly to the Chinese customers, who all seemed happier than me; my food was greasy and did not sit well.

Caught this place through Yelp on the way back from the Airport.
This is original and awesome Chinese Food, and possibly the best I have ever had.
Just great.
Enjoy.

randy

I have come  four times .. really enjoyed the spicy boiled fish, the spicy butter pork, the sesame balls... Service is fine ... But I do see how some of the other reviewers experiences may have occurred ...  Maybe culturally oriented.   Overall really pretty good food.

Their food is good but I had the worst dining experience ever! Every single word I say is true. Today we ordered one dish to go, there were a lot of people so it took too long. We felt starving at the time we got our food so we decided to sit down eat a little bit and take the rest to go. The restaurant owners didn't say anything but they didn't look happy about us. After eating, we found the box couldn't be locked so I grabbed another box. THEN! The owner came out yell at us in front of all the guests" how could you grab another box! Do you know how much the boxes are?! You guys are the worst! You just go to a Chinese restaurant to grab box! " I said " calm down, I just grabbed one box and actually we will leave more tips" She yelled again with a dirty look" I don't care how many boxes you grab! You are just the worst! " SERIOUSLY?! I only go to there less than 5 times per year! And now I'm the worst guest because I took a box?! It's so tick me off! Do they only judge Chinese guests are the worst because " we are here to take box" even though they are also Chinese?If I could rate no star I'll definitely do that! Worst dinning experience ever!

Stumbling across China Jade's menu when I first moved into my apartment was like finding a gold mine. This is by far my favorite Chinese restaurant. 

I absolutely love Crabmeat Cheese Wontons. Love, love, love them. China Jade has the best Crabmeat Cheese Wontons I have ever had. They are like little pillows of heaven. There is no hunting for the filling in these bad boys. Some places skimp on the filling leaving me wanting more. China Jade fills them full of delicious goodness. I always feel like I'm getting my moneys worth when I order these. Which is, uh, every time I order. In fact, I just placed an order this evening and it takes every ounce of my will power not to eat every single one of them in one sitting. I highly recommend them.

Their Teriyaki Chicken is delicious. By far one of my favorites to order. I also love their Sesame Chicken, my only desire is I wish it was a bit sweeter. It is still delicious none the less.

The service and demeanor is completely terrible. I ordered two items to-go and the guy at the cash register tried to overcharge me and when I called him out, he was so rude that he told me to not come back ever again. Completely uncalled for, especially when he was trying to overcharge me. The food was bland and not worth the anger that you would leave with. Do not come here.

I've been going to this restaurant off and on for about 19 years now. I am Caucasian but was raised by a Chinese step dad so I've eaten my share of authentic Chinese food. Considering Denver does not boast a superb Chinatown as does San Fran or New York, I'd say their food and dim sum are about a good as you're going to find. The service is average but consistent. They've had the same waitresses as long as I've been going there. It is definitely my "go to" place for char xiu bao, roast pork and roast duck. The 5 minute drive there is a plus too.

Overpriced. What should have cost me $10, cost $17. 
Not friendly service either. Pro: good flavor, done quickly. 
Will not return.

When you get asked if you want the "traditional menu" you know the place is going to be an adventure. 

I go here with friends and we always split dishes so we can get lots of different things. The level of spice honestly depends on who's cooking, but the food is always authentic.  I am pretty sure I ate my weight in rice one trip since my tongue was nearly on fire. 

If you want good Chinese food, this is your place.
Was in Shanghai a lot this year and this is the closest I have found in Denver to authentic. Great Denver find

Hands down the BEST Chinese food in all of Colorado!!!!!!  The old adage is soooo true.  Literally every time I have been here I walk in and almost every seat is filled with an Asian face that will stop momentarily and glance at the largish white guy filling the door way, smile politely and go back to eating. 

The variety, authenticity and spice level are amazing.  While this is nestled in a strip mall in an un-remarkable space the food is anything but!

My Wife is Half-Chinese and she almost cried when she tried their Mapu Tofu as this was a favorite childhood dish and China Jade has been the 1st place in 15 years to get it right for her.

I've tried almost everything on the menu (including the stomach and intestine dishes) minus their  seafood offerings and they are all delicious.

I recommend the Ziran Beef and the  Garlic Green Beans.  All of the food is amazing regardless of which menu if comes off of, but the "Asian" menu does have a larger selection of dishes to choose from.

The staff is  all Asian (and related?) and fantastically attentive and FAST.

Even when they are packed (which is often) the food comes out surprisingly fast.

I think I found my new favorite Chinese place! China Jade isn't your everyday run-of-the-mill Chinese restaurant - yes, they have your everyday "American" Chinese food such as lo mein and sweet and sour pork, but they also carry authentic dishes such as peking duck and sesame balls on a separate menu in chinese (both of which are AH-MAZING).

Lately, I have found myself venturing back into the "American" delicacies such as beef with broccoli and lemon chicken - my recent cravings. They do have a pretty gnarly lunch and combo special (which runs all day) and includes a soup, an egg roll, a deep fried shrimp, and a crab cheese wanton for a pretty reasonable price. They used to deliver, however, the last time I called, an employee told me they weren't; so I don't know if this is due to staffing that day or if they don't deliver anymore.

Now, China Jade isn't the most fancily decorated restaurants. Tucked away in a shopping mall off of Iliff and Peoria, it is what you might think of when you think of a strip mall restaurant. Yet, you wouldn't expect this to be the location for some worldly food, and here it is. Everything from the food to the workers to the customers all tell a great story of some genuinely tasty food.

Anyways, China Jade is a truly great find for Chinese food. Whether I am eating in or getting it to go, China Jade is my go-to place for some tasty Chinese food. If you happen to be on that side of town or wanting to go on a cross-town adventure, I recommend it hands down!

I think this is the most authentic Szechuan food you're going to find in Aurora/Denver. The Ma Po tofu is delicious and tastes like the kind you can get from any of the myriad of amazing Szechuan restaurants that are located in the San Gabriel Valley (shout out to Spicy City- miss you!) in So Cal. Although most of the other Szechuan dishes on the menu are good, the Ma Po tofu is the best and most authentic tasting of all IMO. Out of all the restaurants that serve passable Szechuan food that I've been to so far, China Jade is the priciest but also the best. It's definitely worth it and that's why we keep coming back.

This place is the bomb! We had the Classic American and the Retro and both were phenomenal. Squishy, soft buns, delicious toppings! I would strongly recommend anyone who likes burgers or sliders to try this place. I was very pleasantly surprised when I tried them at a beer festival I was at this weekend. Plus the people who work the truck are very nice!

Came to Factotum's Birthday celebration, and 5280 Sliders was outside selling some eats.

The girl and I tried 4 sliders: the Classic, the Cajun, the Jalapeño, and a pulled pork special.

All were tasty!  Really good.  I think the Jalapeño was the best, but all were solid.

They're sliders and on the smaller side obviously.  I wished they had a larger actual burger, because I'd be so down with this place on a regular basis if they did.  Was still hungry, but I could have totally had more, so that's my problem being a big dude.

Good stuff though, I liked it!

Before you get carried away, just remember that you are approaching a small food truck with four items on the menu, all of them being sliders. So set your expectations to eating relatively simple food that happens to be a really small burger.

That being said, this is good food. There is just nothing to cause any sort of crazy reaction like some of my Yelp colleagues have exclaimed. For $2.50 each, you get a selection four different types of sliders, all of which are tasty. Other options include chips or a drink. However, four sliders does not make a must visit establishment. Unfortunately, 5280 sliders is more of a one visit and done place. A little variety, or sneak previews of upcoming menu items and that would have me coming back.

If 5280 Sliders is in your hood, go now. Enjoy a nice lunch or small dinner. And hope that the next time you are craving a slider there will be more for you to explore.

I had 3 types of sliders and they were excellent.  I requested mine without cheese so he had to make them fresh.  Because of my long wait, he offered me free chips and water.  I appreciated the customer service.

You will not find a better slider. You can only hope your "other" choice is close to being in the same realm of 5280's famous sliders. I can't stop thinking about the mistake I made...which was ordering just 2 Retro Sliders. The juicy meat, the special sauce... it all comes together to create the ultimate flavor explosion. I need more 5280 Sliders in my life!

Holy crap. These are probably the best sliders I've ever had.

Like, standing outside the truck is legit difficult because of how good it smells. Believe you me I did quick mental math on if I could hoist myself up through the order window and steal literally all of the burgers before they noticed. I opted instead on paying and waiting like a normal human being. 

I ordered two doubles, and they were both amazing. Though honestly I couldn't quite tell them apart. Would've loved a little more aggressive flavor -- but I also don't really care too much.

Guys, they're awesome. They're SO good. Two doubles is perfect if you want to pretend you're fat but still be like hey it's not THAT much food! They're just so good. I was angry I wasn't starving to death because I wanted to eat like 400 sliders. 

Look I know this is hyperbolic and all, but I'm immediately a massive fan of this food truck and cannot wait to follow them around town to breweries.

Waited in line for nearly an hour with my wife and toddler, missing most of the concert like everyone else in line. The guys were clearly overwhelmed, which is really at least as much the fault of the event organizers. However, my starving two year old couldn't handle the wait, so my wife took her to walk around and not subject everyone else in line to a crying kid. 

Not two minutes later, I made it to the front of the line, ready to finally get to the front to order. I ask for a modest 3 on the tiny sliders, one for each of us. I'm brusquely told they are only going to serve 2 per person because they are moving so slow. I politely explained 3 of us had been waiting a really long time, but my young child couldn't handle it and all we wanted was one measly slider each. The guys in the truck were pretty much huge jerks about it and yelled back only two or nothing. I chose nothing since I didn't want to give business to a couple jerks so 3 people could pick over 2 sad little sliders. Night now ruined, we just left the event early and went to a real restaurant. 

I won't return to their truck, and would never hire 5280 sliders for any sizeable event. They are neither efficient or professional enough to handle the volume.

Whoa whoa whoa hold up here?! I thought the Cozy Inn was only in Salina, KS? You know the world renounced slider joint? Well this place has brought some competition to the sliders world. This place is without a doubt the best sliders you're going to find in Colorado. Kansas, maybe not but they without question come in 2nd. No wait? They get 1st place! Why you ask? Because they allow cheese! If you have ever had the Cozy Inn, then you need to come here. It's like you drove 500 some miles to the middle of nowhere Kansas and got some amazing sliders. 

Thanks 5280, those classics were bomb diggity! I'll be back again for sure! If this was near me every day I would probably turn into Randy off TPBs. I might have just have to order one more. Thanks again for bring a little taste of home to the Mile High!

The burgers are great. I first had them amidst a night of drinking outside of Mile High Spirits. After that, I embarked on an annoyingly long search for them. Two separate times, I had a craving. I checked their website to find them, went to where they said they were and they weren't there. That sucks. I finally found them after they were an hour late to their destination of Jagged Mountain Brewery. The cook was cool, the cashier seemed to be flustered and probably not the best person to be handling customer service.

Perfection.
Love the Retro Burger (no onions for me)! 
Dominic is a sweetheart and I love supporting this food truck when they're in the neighborhood!
Really delicious sliders :)

I seen this little Gem parked on Market right before 19th. And who doesnt love Sliders? They are Delicious. The 5280 Slider with its sauce was Epic. I came back for a Second Round they were so Delicious. 
If you see this truck dont pass it by.

These guys came to my workplace out in Lone Tree. They only offer 4 different burgers, I ordered the Jalapeno Popper and the Retro with were both very tasty. The price was right, 2.50 for a single and 4 for a double. They also offer chips and soda. The service was a bit slow and confused, some people got served really quick, others were waiting for 10 minutes or more, so it was strange to say the least. 

I wasn't expecting too much, the burgers were very good, and the price was right.
This truck swings by Fiction Brewery every once in awhile and the sliders are to die for!  Highly recommended!

You will not find a better food truck in Denver. Period. I've been on a mission to find the best burger in Denver and nothing comes close to these sliders. Do yourself a favor and ask if they have their Potato Salad. Sooooooo good.

great sliders. They're just the double is just right size when you don't want a huge burger for lunch. 
These guys couldn't care more about their food or ingredients, and they're friendly. I had the Cajun BBQ slider with pickles and fried onions (and the rest of the good stuff).  Definitely coming back.

First of all the guys who run the truck are just the coolest ever! Second of all their food.....what can I say besides amazing!? The flavors are just so well put together and the meat is so tender and just melts in your mouth. If you EVER have a chance to try them, DO you will not regret it!!

These guys were in the neighborhood this weekend for our end of the year picnic.   We had the American sliders.   Fantastic!  They literally melted in your mouth.   My oldest son hates onions and he couldn't rave enough about how good the onions were!   You can tell they love what they do.  The service was awesome, they couldn't have been nicer!

Sliders are tough to get right. I've tried plenty of times to make them myself. And I make a killer burge. These guys know wassup. Soft bun. Flavorful, juicy meat. Quality toppings. Track them down. You won't be disappointed.
Wow jalapeno popper is amazing!!!! The potato salad was good also. It had pieces of real bacon in it. first time for that. terrific food truck. thanks!
These guys know what's up with sliders and you can tell they care about their work.  If you see the truck you have to stop or better yet go find them and try a jalapeño slider!

WOW! Seriously yummy!
 I live in the "RINO art district"/ ghetto Globeville. 
The 5280 sliders truck parks on Tuesday and now Wednesday nights at the Mockery Brewery off of 35th and Brighton blvd. I happen to live around the corner and have seen the truck there weekly. 
Tonight was such a beautiful night that I walked over to check it out and taste a delectable, juicy & made to order absolutely spectacular American Slider! I am so glad that I did. 
The gentlemen who run the truck were super sweet and friendly. I talked to them the entire time I waited for my order to be prepared. 
I informed them that my cousin owns The Monkey Barrel over off of 15th and Platte and recommended that they talk to him about parking the delicious 5280 Slider truck over there on available evenings. 
FRIENDLY AND FANTASTIC CUSTOMER SERVICE! 
DELICIOUS SLIDERS! 
SUPPORT YOUR LOCAL DENVER SMALL BUSINESSES FOLKS! These guys are great!

This Monday while at Mile High Spirits, my boyfriend and I ordered some sliders from 5280 Sliders. Amazing little burgers, fair price and excellent service... They even delivered the food to us inside the tasting room. Burgers and whiskey, how can you go wrong?!

What an amazing dinner we had last night.  My wife and I both had the Filet Mignon special with a mushroom marsala sauce.  It was amazing (certainly far better than Del Frisco's). Cooked to the perfect temperature, very tender and full of flavor. The accompanying potatoes and squash were equally amazing.

Service was by Kyle was great and he made an excellent Bloody Mary from scratch, something few restaurants can do anymore as they all used bottled mixes. 

This family owned small business is where you need to go. Forget the chains and support people in your community.

Why haven't I been here before I ask myself! Wow, what a great small, cozy and welcoming bistro in Greenwood Village. From start to finish, it was a great dining experience.

We were greeted immediately upon entering by Erica Sansone, co-owner. She was very personable and took us right to our table. Our server Kyle, was very friendly, gave great suggestions and was available right away if we needed anything.

The bistro is small but very comfortable and I loved the warm and inviting decor. There was only two couples at the restaurant when we arrived, but within 45 minutes the place was packed. It looks like it is a favorite neighborhood restaurant and I definitely can see why!

I ordered a lemon drop martini (well-prepared and delicious!) and my daughter a glass of white wine. At first she couldn't decide between two of the white wines and Kyle brought out a sample for her to taste without any prompting.

We decided to start of with an order of the calamari Portuguese (fresh mint, banana peppers & olive oil with fresh marinara). Our entrees were the Sole Picatta (egg battered and sautéed with capers, broccoli, finished with lemon, sherry wine, and butter served on angel hair pasta), and the Wiener Schnitzel (award winning house favorite) (traditional thinly pounded veal, breaded and pan fried, served on their house brown sauce, garnished with lemon, capers, and anchovy). Both were so well-presented, well-prepared, a good portion and delicious!! All the flavors blended perfectly with one another.

We got our entrees before getting the calamari Portuguese and told Kyle it was okay, he didn't have to bring it out. He apologized profusely but we told him not to worry about it. He came out with two to go boxes with the calamari and didn't charge us for it. Now that is great customer service and was so appreciated!!

Since we arrived around 5:15 pm on a Friday, we got complimentary desserts with our meal. (complimentary desserts are available between 4:30 pm and 5:30 pm Monday thru Friday).

I chose the Blackberry Buckle and Calina the decadently delicious Chocolate Cake. Both were so yummy and were a perfect ending to a wonderful meal.

They also have a frequent dining rewards card you can fill out when you get the bill. They also gave us a coupon to try out Fins & Noodles Italian Seafood Restaurant (their sister location).

The prices were very reasonable and the entire staff was friendly and attentive.  Will definitely be coming back--want to try their crispy duck entree and other items on the menu!

I have to say that I really enjoyed my dining experience. Initially I was a bit put off as I was dining solo and I had a reservation and I felt a bit odd standing in the very small area at the front of the dining room and there I am peering into and at a handful of diners. I think it simply had more to do with the fact that the manager wasn't aware of the reservation and was making sure my table wasn't reserved too soon for a following reservation.  That and the fact that a solo diner is perhaps a bit of a curve ball for this establishment as it really is a nice cozy dining room.  I saw quite a few regulars being welcomed warmly so it is obvious service their customers is important.

They brought me water quickly and of course I had the menu to look over and I was told that they were trying out a new menu. The classics were there along with some new Chef specials. I opted for the Manicotti Florentine and I absolutely loved it!

The dish was very appealing with the Manicotti topped by crisp "flash fried" (?) spinach leaves that gave the dish a better presentation than most traditional Italian dishes involving melted cheese on top. The spinach leaves just melted in your mouth. I did drive in to the manicotti quickly after that and I have to say that the balance of flavours between the spinach filling, the marinara, cheese and spinach shells was well worth ordering and scoring along with the fresh spinach on top. This dish was quite wonderful since the pasta and marinara didn't over power the dish. They even paired some cauliflower and asparagus on the side. These were not afterthoughts as they were cooked to perfection and the asparagus spears had a good flavour with the wine reduction it was sautéed with.

Interestingly enough, I was the first person to try the dish as I was told by the Chef who politely came out to check on the diners enjoying his new creations. I think this is something that probably occurs in any evening before the crush of a full dining room.  

They offered a great selection of wines by the glass as well as cocktails. I enjoyed 2 very good glasses of Pinot Noir at a reasonable price.

Despite the fact that I left barely a crumb ( except for the bread crumbs - which I am glad I did not overdo it), I ordered dessert. It was a blueberry, pear and pecan crumble a la mode. Yummy-licious! It was served as a pie slice but it still had a soft but somewhat firm texture combined with the crumble at the base. Again, another delicious choice. The desserts are made fresh so it is likely that you won't have the same options the  next day. 

The only dessert that they feature regularly is a Grand Marnier souffle. And I heard other diners asking if It was still going to be offered on the new menu. Obviously a pleasurable experience with the number of people who asked... warning, you want to know if you want to order it at the beginning of the start of your meal as it is a 20 minute prep time for the dessert. I think it is great that they ask you early in the ordering process so you know that it will take time to get it out. I think that shows great service to make your guests aware so they cannot be surprised at the time they want to order it.


5 stars could definitely be a review ranking on my next visit.
 Definitely worth a return visit.
Great food and desert. We had the weinershnetzel and an oreo based cake. Good ambiance. Owner was curtueous and checked on us multiple times. We will go back next Tuesday for their italian specials.

Yummy
Extremely surprising this place !
The Calamari and Mussels Provençal  were amazing !

I think all of us enjoyed our entrées also very much. 

It was amazing that the Chef Kevin came out to say hello and asked how he felt about his great food. It is rare these days that A restaurants chef comes out and asks  anymore. I'm a little old-fashioned and I think it's great.  

 A great experience for my friends on my sisters birthday! 

Yeah !!

A friend and I dined here on a recent Saturday night. She had the filet and I had the shrimp and grits, along with house salads.Everything was outstanding, including the service. This is not an inexpensive place to dine, but their food is terrific -- and make sure to get their signature dessert -the Grand Marnier Soufflé.

Let me start with the mussels. 

When they came out from the kitchen, I was questioning why they were on the half-shell. When I order mussels at a restaurant, I typically think of a bowl of fresh mussels still in the full shell, nicely popped open from cooking... call me crazy. After tasting the leathery, chewy, tasteless things on the half shell, I couldn't understand why any chef in their right mind would serve something like this to a paying guest. I came to find out that the restaurant orders their mussels preshelled from their food supplier, rather than buying fresh mussels and cooking them properly on site. I specifically asked and was met with a response "I wish we could get fresh mussel." Whole Foods sells them, as do many other markets. I'm pretty sure that US Foods or Sysco could deliver a bag of fresh mussels to this restaurant.

Suffice it to say that nothing else that came out of the kitchen was really worth eating. I know I'm not in Little Italy, but they really should be ashamed with the food they sent out to our table.

The staff was very nice, the location was fine, but I can't understand why this place has such a high rating.

Loved loved loved this place!!!

My husband and I went for Restaurant Week, mainly because of the location closer to our house, the menu they had to offer for Restaurant Week, and the great reviews it has received on Yelp! It beat every expectation we had.

That being said, don't let the outside of the restaurant deter you. It is located in a small little strip of shops/restaurants on University, but the inside is quaint and inviting. As for the food, we started with the gnocchi and greek meatball appetizers and we both licked the plates clean. The gnocchi was in a spicy sauce and paired with cantaloupe for sweetness, an amazing combination. For dinner I ordered the pork tenderloin, which was one of the best pork dishes I have ever had and my husband ordered the Osso buco and finished his entire plate. Instead of a dessert, we started with the beanless chili, which I could have eaten the entire pot of.

Needless to say, we will be visiting Sansone's again very soon. Thank you for the great experience and date night!

Bad service and I really didn't like my server's attitude. It bothered me the whole time I was there. Food is over priced for what it is. My 31 dollar tiny medium rare filet mignon was burnt too much and hard as a rock on the outside but they still served it to me. I honestly would not pay a dollar for that tough meat. Seriously it was the worst meat in my life.
Food was awesome.  I tried multiple dinner plates from shrimp and grits to an incredible chicken dish.  Soufflé was divine.

Two words -- Lobster Ravioli! 
Rockstar. I basically licked the plate clean. This is a great place to go and support a local owned restaurant. This are small, so make a reservation if you can, but they are worth the wait! They have a wide variety of items to choose from, but did I mention that the Lobster Ravioli is excellent. Yum!

Yummy comfortable easy. Really nice wine.

That's  just a start love this neighborhood family run pace. Always consistent and good. Want traditional ? Check! Want something new? Check!  Check it out!

Had a great dinner there. I've been to Germany numerous times but the Weiner Schnitzel here is the absolute best. My wife had veal parm, a very good classic style. Service was great. The chef even came out to check on our meals. Going back.

Almost forgot to mention the soufflé - awesome, a perfect ending.
Fantastic service, wonderful food, and a quiet intimate atmosphere. Truly a great place for a lovely dinner. The duck and the lamb chops were AMAZING!

I chose this place for my restaurant week dinner because it was the only one that came up when I searched the phrase gluten free.  I thoroughly enjoyed the meal.  There were a few gf options,  even on the limited restaurant week menu.  When they brought the bread for my husband,  they brought me some gf crackers.  That's never happened before!   I ordered the Hangar steak.  It was pretty tasty,  but a little overdone for my taste.  The edges were crispy.  I loved the squash side!  The drinks were reasonably priced,  and I am always happy when I can have a Moscato.  Dessert was delicious,  but skimpy.  With the drinks, tax and tip,  our $60 meal came close to $100.00. Ow.  Still,  I'd like to go back and try their early bird menu.  Service was impeccable.

Great place for a romantic dinner for two at a surprising price.  We had drinks at the bar until our reservation time our bartender let the hostess know to seat us.

The escargot was very nice and the crowd was older but I was too busy enjoying our meal and my wonderful wife.  

I would recommend the Veal Piccata and pre-order a souffle.  Even though the Salmon Nilla was a creation it was too sweet for my taste.

Overall a wonderful time.  The chef came by to make sure we enjoyed our experience.

Rude waitress and dry and blend food. 
Salmon was over cooked; lamb was dry; ravioli was blend; filet mignon was chewy. Deserts were blend and dry too. 

Waitress started with "high folks" as if in a tucker cafeteria....
One got a starter and finished before the other got their starters. Just when it was time to get a soup, it was not there anymore (it was a special and we were the 4th table in the restaurant...). 
Other people in restaurant left their meat on the plate as well....

Very expensive for average food and bad service.

Went here with my boyfriend to celebrate 5 years and we are sure glad we chose Sansone's Bistro! The calamari app that we ordered was probably the best we have ever eaten. Also, I ordered the Crispy Duck for my main course and it was absolutely amazing. We ordered the Grand Marnier soufflé to share to finish off our meal and it was the perfect end to the experience. We are glad we splurged and will definitely be back!

I. Love. Sansonnes.

This little bistro beats the flashy over-priced chains that try to be upscale hands-down. 

The staff makes you feel like an honored guest.

The chef is so gifted, and puts lovely hints of herbs into his creations that keep you guessing. 

The menu has new additions regularly.

Its small and quiet, so you need not yell over your table to the folks you are with.

There is no rush. We often are headed somewhere afterward, but for the times we are not, I always feel like we could sit there all evening, and they would not mind.

Overall...a huge hit, and great place to add to your favorites, and then you can write your own glowing review!

We have been here before and enjoyed our dinner very much so I bought a Groupon to use for my birthday.  OK it was on a Monday night the day after Father's Day.  Restaurant was not crowded but our server seemed tired.  I ordered the Wienerschnitzel and my husband ordered a rib eye that was a special of the evening.  Our salads were small any only lettuce.  No other vegetables.  My dinner was very good except I am surprised the server didn't ask me if I wanted the smaller portion.  It was HUGE and I took half home.  My husbands steak was tough and full of grizzle.  You don't expect to pay $28 and get a bad piece of meat!  We should have sent it back but we didn't.  We ordered the special dessert of the soufflé.  It was nothing but a bunch of egg whites and sugar and some sauce.  Other desserts would have been much tastier than that one.  The Pino Noir wine was excellent.  Might give this place another try sometime but definitely disappointed for a special occasion.  They did give me a little birthday card but a complimentary something would go a long way toward customer service!
Very nice little place.  The food is very good with generous portions.  My only complaint is that it is a little slow, but I suppose that's because everything is made fresh to order.

It was a good dining experience -we had some wine before dinner and the waiter brought it over to us I had the lobster ravioli and my friend had the salmon bulla. The hey we're both good! We topped it off with chocolate mousse. I just wished that their hours were open longer.
Fantastic food at good prices.  Our group of six enjoyed wonderful food and great service.  I was sad when LeCentral closed but Sansone's is my new favorite place to dine.

The bread that they brought out was good.  I started with a garden salad with strawberry vinaigrette which was yummy.  Everyone else's salad had green olives, but mine which was disappointing.  Share the olives!  Then I had the salmon with the nilla wafers, which was excellent.  Disappointing that the salmon was not wild caught given all the bad publicity of farm raised.

Avoid and go home. High-end prices for what my teenager could make (her's would be better).  It was mediocre at best. Waiter had to read the menu and was on a definite "upsell" mission. 

If you want really good food, go across the street to The Wooden Table.

As in the past, the food and service was impeccable. 
The owner is on the floor constantly making sure that everything is perfect for his guests.  I was also very impressed with the pride exhibited by the employees. 
I highly  recommend Sansone!

THE SOUFFLE WAS DELICIOUS!!!

This place really is a neighborhood gem. It has a really intimate atmosphere and a very dynamic menu.  There are always great specials.  The chef/owner is VERY CREATIVE!  They haven't missed on one meal yet.  Everything has been delicious! 

Did I mention the soufflé?

We came here for Restaurant Week.  We were looking for something outside of downtown, and the reviews here were rather good.  I am very glad we went here. We had a chance to chat with chef/owner Robert Sansone and his gracious wife, Erica.  It was very nice meeting them, and I can see they take a lot of pride in their restaurant. Our server for the meal, Jessica, was excellent.

We were a party of four, and I was able to sample several dishes.  For your three choices here, you get an appetizer, an entrée, and somewhat uniquely, for your third choice you get to choose between a salad, soup, dessert, or a glass of wine.  This allows you to decide if you are more hungry, thirsty, or wanting to indulge your sweet tooth.  They also had wine specials for $7-8 per glass or $25 for the bottle.  We killed two bottles of a nice Malbec (the Alta Vista) from Argentina.  It was a well-rounded and soft red wine.

For my starter, I went with the Italian Sausage Stuffed Mushrooms (Three Crimini mushrooms stuffed with spicy Italian sausage and drizzled with our homemade Bleu cheese dressing).  The sausage is made locally, was nicely spicy and flavorful, and went well with the shrooms.  I was able to taste the B'stillas (Moroccan Chicken and Almond pie).  I have had this dish before at Morrocan restaurants and this tasted as I remembered.  I also helped my friend with his Pate de Foie de Canard (Smooth, rich, and decadent duck liver mousse served with Lingonberry jam, Dijon mustard, chopped egg, red onion and rice crackers).
