I wish that I had been adventurous enough to order this dish.  I was afraid it would be "too livery".  However, it was amazing.  Rich, flavorful, well-spiced, complex . . . very impressive.

For my main course, I opted for the Pork Cassoulet (A rich, slow-cooked casserole originating in the south of France).  It was a rich and creamy dish with nice notes of salty pork and reduced beans and veggies.  I liked it, but would probably not order it again. I had some of the Varenga (Roasted shredded Beef in the classic style of Madagascar) my friend ordered.  This was like an exotic pot roast, and was a lot of meat.  What I almost ordered, and wish I had, was the Sansone's Chicken (Artichoke Sautéed Chicken and Artichokes in Lemon Sherry Butter). This was reminiscent of a Chicken Piccata.  The chicken was fork tender, uber moist, and the artichokes and lemon sherry butter brought a wonderful sourness to the dish.  Both the chicken and the beef came with a side of African Broccoli.  This was marinated in mayo and sour cream (I believe that was what they said) and had aggressive coriander flavors.  I really enjoyed this side.

They also had four desserts to choose from (two of them were bread puddings).  I went with the chocolate cream pie, and it was a nice way to end the meal.  I will definitely be back again.

I really enjoyed this place,  I went in with a Groupon not knowing quite what to expect,  and I was more than pleasantly surprised.  The bread was brought out hot and fresh from the oven (and was delicious), the caesar salad was good,  and my chicken parm was some of the best I have had in awhile. I am guessing my boyfriend enjoyed his pasta as well since he wolfed it down before I had a chance to try it! will definitely be back to try more of the menu!

This was my second visit.  The first was our anniversary dinner with my dad and his wife.  We really enjoyed our meal that night especially the special souffle for dessert.  When I heard it was open for lunch I really wanted to give it a try.  Luckily that happened by surprise yesterday.

I wanted soup but it was cream of eggplant and did not sound good. Was I wrong .  I had a taste and it was delicious.  My grilled romaine Cobb salad was tasty.  My dad had a duck salad and ate every bite.  

This restaurant is in a strip mall next to antique store and a flower store.  There is also a fish restauant nearby.  This is a good place for a nice quiet meal and the owner just happens to be the chef.   At dinner there seemed to be an older clientele and during lunch there were only a few people so can't be sure if that holds true at lunch.  It is a place I would try again but there are so many on my must try list.  I would probably try something new first.

Went with a friend during restaurant week. Absolutely charming little "find".  Easy to locate, easy parking situation.  Felt comfortable as soon as we walked in. Greeted by the owner, really nice!

Pairings and flavors were fantastic.  We both had the filet mignon and it melted in our mouths.  For dessert we shared the brownie, which was dense and decadent as well as the grand mariner souffle.  Both were wonderful!

I love that it has the cozy ambiance you would expect to find in a small, family run business, but leaves you feeling treated.

We went in on a Friday night and had a wonderful time. The food, service, and experience were out of this world for two foodies who enjoy trying new places.  Sansones is a must for any italian-food lover but also for someone who doesn't want pretentious or stuffy.  The chef/owner came by and talked to us a least 3 times, and our server was great!  We will go back often!

Had a nice dinner here with my daughter.  I was most impressed with the uniqueness of the foods and their flavors and that Robert Sansone (the ower and chef) brought it out to the table and described the dishes to us with such love.  I was least impressed that the staff almost refused to say "You're welcome" to our "Thank you," other than the busboy Zack.  For being an upish scale restaurant, I don't expect the girl bringing the drinks from the bar to say "Yep" when we say "Thank you" or, the waiter to say "No Problem" when we thanked him.

Towards the end of the meal, when Robert came out to ask how the special desert was, we ordered the Grand Marnier Soufle at the start of the meal, I told him about this and was concerned for the restaurant experience.  We could see him talking with the staff shortly after this.

Later on we thanked the waiter and he replied "No prob... You're welcome."  My daughter just about did a big giant spit-take with her soda.  I laughed a little on the inside.  The busboy came over with a big ear to ear grin and said thanks for saying how polite he was.  Hopefully everyone came away the better for it.

The food was very good although I wouldn't call it wonderful.  The price was very expensive, overly so.  We spent about $80 and I had just 2 beers and my daughter had a soda.  Service was a little on the slow side so, I'm giving it 3 stars.

For the cost of a meal here, I would expect excellent cuisine and beyond professional service.  Our waiter rarely responded with a "you're welcome" and seemed unfamiliar with the restaurant's dishes and wine list.

I love that it is local and I would certainly prefer a place like Sansone's to Chili's but feel there are much better options in the Denver area.

First time here.
No expectations.
$52.80 Restaurant Week...my only one this year.
Easy to find.
Plenty of parking.
Seated immediately with a smile.
They took our coats.
This is service.
The wine suggestion was divine.  "Another bottle please."
The first course was, shall I say, the best, without a doubt...
The best pate I have had in my entire life...
Here in the States or in Paris.
I can't describe the smile on my face with one little bite.
"My Precious. My Precious."
Pate de Foie de Canard (smooth, rich, and decadent duck liver mousse served with Lingonberry jam, Dijon mustard, chopped egg, red onion and rice crackers)
I could have just sat and enjoyed another serving and ignored everything and everyone else all evening.
But I didn't.
The Chef introduced himself.
The wait staff...amazing.
Then the main course.
I tried the Varenga (roasted shredded beef in the classic style of Madagascar)...very boring...sorry.
But, my dining partner shared her Sansone's Chicken ( sautéed chicken and Artichokes in Lemon Sherry Butter).
This chicken may be one of the best dishes I have enjoyed in months.
Then a coffee, not just any coffee, but espresso and a piece of wonderful Chocolate Cream Pie.

4.4999 stars rounds down to 4, but I really like this place and can't wait to return.

We went here for Thanksgiving. We were one of the latest seatings. Overall, food was excellent. I only gave it 4 stars because of a couple of minor things: the green beans were fiber like. Mine were inedible and it was obvious they were running out of food as  our pieces of pecan pie were much smaller than what we saw served earlier. Service was friendly and attentive and the place obviously has a loyal local clientele. Almost everyone in there was over 65 when we went. We would go back and try their regular menu.
My family and I have frequented Sansone's for quite some time, and we have always been so happy with the exceptional service and the quality of the food.  Two thumbs up!

So this is what became of the old Chez Walter space.  It's nice.

Good wine, decent food, nice atmosphere.  This has an older crowd, but Mr. Mixer and I didn't feel out of place.  

We did wait about 20 minutes beyond our reservation time for a table and then the service was pretty slow.  That's ok, the food was nice.  Especially the veal (which I don't eat, boo, but Mr. Mixer loved it).  The gnocchi were good, but very heavy.  Salads were fresh and the homemade dressings were great.

The cranberry tart dessert was awesome!

Came here on a groupon , will  be back ! Service excellent! Food was excellent! My wife had the lamb chops , I  had the veal Parmesan , the lemon cello ( my wife wanted to lick the plate) what a great  find!**

Another great meal, celebrating my birthday. The spinach chips are a great appetizer. I had stuffed eggplant and M had a veal dish. This is our go-to restaurant for special events. The chef visits each table to listen to comments, a very creative owner, manager and kitchen guy!

This is a STRONG three stars.  We had noticed this place many times in a little throwback strip mall.  An email from Open Table listing it as a "neighborhood gem" got us to go.  As other reviews have stated it is very small, and the interiors are pretty much what you might expect considering the look of the exterior - it's a throwback.

To say they 'cater to an older crowd' is one way to put it. It was like we were at a cast party for Cocoon.  I'm in my 40s and literally the only people there in or below my age bracket were there with their parents.  This is not an exaggeration.  We were surprised no one yelled out BINGO! during dinner.

But you know what else surprised us?  The food was really terrific.  It's not really like any menu I can remember seeing - schnitzel, veal liver, lamb.  My wife had a lemon chicken (no, not Chinese food) which was wonderful, and really well presented.  I had a rack of lamb special which was fantastic.  Perfect medium, on a bed of asiago mashed potatoes.  The common side was a pickled cabbage dish with the deep merlot color of canned beets.  Despite a slightly off-putting pungent aroma, it was terrific.

Service was earnest, though a tad overwhelmed when we got there.  (I think the Open Table email had given them a somewhat unexpected bump).  But once things settled down all was professional and attentive.

So yes, I would concur - this really is a neighborhood gem.  Charming, a bit old world, and a great change from what we're used to.  Well done!

Fabulous surprise. I've driven past this place 100 times and had no idea what a treasure I was missing out on. So pleased that Restaurant Week helped me find it and that the fantastic food and service will bring me back.
High end dinning prices with mediocre cuisine and wait staff. Good location, could be much more. Not on my return list. To bad it's close by.

Magnifico, we had an amazing 5280 dinner at Sansone's Bistro last night!  Now is a prefect time to try this enchanting European style family restaurant.  During Denver Restaurant Week you can sample Robert Sansone's creations at a budget friendly rate.

My first course was a wonderful Calamari Posilippo which is tender calamari, lightly sautéed and served in a savory white wine broth.  My main course was Veal Piccata that was thin, tender, and skillfully sautéed.  The Piccata sauce was delicate, bright, and zesty.  The entree was plated with snap peas and a side of linguine marinara.  The finale was a beautiful soufflé served with two sauces (add $4.50 premium dessert).

The wine selection is nice and they are offering some special bottles paired with the 5280 menu.  We really enjoyed the Cocetti, Grape Feet Red, that is a nice red varietal blend from California.   

We thought it was a special touch that Robert Sansone brought our meals to the table and was frequently in the dining room checking on guests.  The restaurant is small and intimate, capacity is only 49 patrons, and crowded during the 5280 event.  Make a reservation on www.OpenTable.com and prepare to enjoy a unique and truly exceptional dining experience.

I am a firm believer that Chef Gasteau was right - anyone can cook. Some of us are fortunate that we can charge for our craft and some simply reformulate things we buy from other stores. Tonight was disappointing, frankly I will not give this place another try. I am uncertain how anyone can look past the mediocre food, dated decore and rate this place with more than 2 stars.
Upon our arrival we were sent to the bar in the back where it took about 15 minutes for the bartender to even look at us and say hello. Once acknowledged, the spouse ordered a glass of wine (house special), well it was flat and tasteless. Hey stuff happens. We were seated, as the spouse asked for something else, a taste glass was brought to the table with something "swimming" in it. Again, things happen.
We ordered the following:
The pate de canard - goose liver, the description sounded good. A few minutes later a sloppy looking pate was presented on a plate with a side of store bought "crunchmaster" crackers. Sadly, it appeared like it the pate has already been once.it was runny, salty and "paired" with the salty crackers was simply not good.
Our friends ordered the Morrocan / French chicken filo dough pie with pistachio and powdered sugar on top. Although a decent presentation, half got left on the plate with the "weird" as the final comment on it's taste qualities.
For entree we chose the ciopinno, a rather simple dish that I have had all over US. This one was simply the worst. Salty, unappealing, seemed like it came from a can with a few "seafood" items added.
Friends had lamb and chicken - although the chicken was tasty the side of eats that also looked like they came from a can did further place this place as suspect.
I would go on but why bore you with more mediocre details. 
Perhaps chef Gasteau (Ratatouile) was wrong, not everyone can cook ..... C'eslt la vie.

We live in an average middle class neighborhood that is surrounded by the extreme upper class, with that being said we have some amazing restaurants around us. However, not to many are budget friendly.
But you never have to go far for that special occasion.
This night being one of them.

My husband and I rarely get the chance to go out "alone", we had the opportunity to drop the kids off at a local movie night for 3 hours of peace.
We thought what a great night to take advantage of a nice dinner out.
I purchased a $25 certificate of Restaurants.com for $2. Which I thought was a great deal to try this place out. However the small print... you need to spend at least $50 which can not include alcohol.
That's not that hard to do here, so really, no small print needed.

We were greeted right away by VERY friendly staff! They checked our coats for us, which is a small plus in my book. ;)
They had a great special on 3 wines that night for only $25 a bottle.
So I couldn't resist. However the husband stuck with Coors.
I thought the wine list was just fine. Not a huge selection, but definitely enough and in a wide range of pricing.

We started with an appetizer which was a hard decision! They had so many tempting things on the menu. But we figured we'd try out the Calamari. It was wonderful! Almost a Mediterranean style with banana peppers, lemon and a tomato sauce that was more the consistency of a soup with wonderful flavor!

My husband went with one of the dinner specials, not on the menu, the buffalo prime rib encrusted with pumpkin seeds and served with roasted winter veggies and garlic mashed potatoes.
This was by far some of the best prime rib. Cooked perfectly to my husbands liking. 
I went with the Veal Parmesan, I usually do chicken, but thought what the hell, give it a try. It was topped with smoked Gouda cheeses and a homemade marinara sauce. While it wasn't the "best" thing, it was still delicious! I'm sure the chicken would have been more my flavor.
All entrees come with soup or salad, husband getting the roasted pepper lentil soup, which he liked and myself the salad with a strawberry vinaigrette. FABULOUS!

I was stuffed!, Couldn't even finish half my meal. However! I MUST try dessert here! This is where they lose a star from me.
I tried the Apple Streusel which I'm sure to some, they would have loved it, but it was not my taste at all! Hardly any pastry at all wrapped around it and the spices were so overwhelming I couldn't take more then one bite.
I sent it back, which is hard for me to do, but with that kind of price, I'm not paying for it! They were very apologetic, and made me a new dessert, which was a banana chimichanga served with Ice Cream. At this time, we wanted it to go. This was not smart on their end since they threw in a scoop of ice cream with the hot dessert in a to go container. Needless to say, by the time we picked up the kids and got home to eat it, then ice cream was a huge melted mess and the dessert now soggy. 

However, one of the things I thought was sweet, although a tad embarrassing, was the actual chef came out to apologize about the dessert and to make sure everything else was to our liking. I've never had this happen, usually the chef could care less about what someone thinks of his cooking OR wouldn't want to come face to face with a complaint. I also noticed he went to a lot of the tables to check on them.

YES, the crowd is a bit older, however you can tell they're all the rich old money from the neighborhood that make this their regular spot for dinner. The owner and waitresses knew most the them by first name.

I would definitely go back. It was great service, great food in a great neighborhood!

Went here for Valentine's Day with my wife. Food was great, the bread is off the charts amazing. I know, weird to comment on the bread but I thought it was that good. It's located in a little strip mall but once inside its a nice, quaint space.

Yum!!!  Everytime we come there is something new and uber delicious!  Intimate restaurant in an unfortunate location (dead strip mall), but SO worth the trip!!  Chef takes great pains with regular menu and rotating specialties from around the world.  Sign up for the birthday discount and don't forget the mailing list to find out what the rotating options will be.

Delicious! I love the food, the ever changing menu, and the owners. I feel like I am taking a trip to a European restaurant whenever I go to eat there. When I am not sure what to order I will ask the chef and I have yet to be steered wrong. Once I ordered the salmon at his suggestion, and I typically don't like salmon. Trusting his suggestion I tried one of the most tasty dishes I could ever had imagined. Plus there is something to be said going to a family owned restaurant with such high standards.

You must qualify by being 62 or more years of age to enjoy this restaurant. It has some redeeming features: not a chain, good service, chef visits your table to ask how everything was. On the (unfortunately predominant) down side, do not order the Wiener Schnitzel unless you like batter way more than veal. Wine list is disappointing. White wine not adequately chilled. Special baked dessert not worth the cost or the time it took to cook it. Overall, the owners try hard and I give them credit for the effort, but sorry, I would not return as there are too many better alternatives.

This is a great spot located in a little strip mall . Very unassuming from the outside. The restaurant itself is quite small and probably caters to more of a middle aged crowd. The atmosphere is kind of quaint- table cloths on the table are a nice touch. There is a small bar - kind of a personal neighbhood kind of bar. You are greeted warmly at the door and the service continues with the wait and table staff. Very friendly and attentive without being distracting. Waitress was also knowlegeable about the menu and ingredients.She was also comfortable offering suggestions.
I tried the Vietnamese Basra fish which was on special that evening and it was great! Cooked perfectly and the bolognese sauce was not something I would have thought to put on fish, but it was a very good combination and did not overpower the flavor of the fish. My friend had the filet which was a little over cooked for my taste, but seemed to work for him.  The wine list was adequate for this size restaurant and affordable. 
While this restaurant might be a little too sedate for some folks, it was a nice change from some of the large noisy restaurants and sports bars that have become the norm.
The chef also comes out to check with the guests about their meal and dining experience. Nice personal touch!!!

What a great find. I wish Denver had more places like this one. Chef owned, old world menu with some nice surprises. Off the chart service. Supper club atmosphere, cozy. About the only nit I have is the wine list could be a little bigger, but that's about it. We'll be back.

Some of the best freshly made food and great personal service you can imagine. Everything was so delicious it made me want to try their entire menu. The owners came out to check on all of the tables and the service overall was attentive and pleasant without being obtrusive. The food makes me eager to return and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a high quality meal!

We had dinner here a couple of months ago and what a delicious and delightful surprise it was!! The ambiance in the restaurant is very warm, the service impeccable, very friendly, personal and attentive. Every dish was delicious and the Grand Marnier soufflé is devine. We can't wait to go back.

Sansone's offers an interesting alternative to food found elsewhere around Denver. Yes, the crowd is a bit older. But the place is cozy and the staff is attentive. I was there for dinner last night and the chef/owner cleared my table himself. Some interesting menu items I've enjoyed there are prosciutto-stuffed pears and crispy duck confit. My only complaint that most entrees are $20+, which is a bit out of my price range. This place is great for an anniversary dinner or even a random weeknight where you feel like treating yourself to something special. Give it a try!

We went to this restaurant with good friends who have been here many times.  We have visited this restaurant a few years ago and did not like their wine list so didn't come back... This visit I liked their scallops and their souffle--- delicious!   But my husband did not like the vienner schnitzel-- too thin a cut of veal and too much batter for his liking.   I also liked the artichoke appetizer.   yummy!   The brie appetizer must have been a hit at the other end of the table as I didn't even get a bite!

Food was good and worth the price.  Service was good.  Wine list was limited.  I ordered a bottle of the low end Pinot Noir (they had two on the list), and I was informed that they were all out.  So I ordered their more expensive bottle of Pinot. (nice way to upsell).  I read good reviews and how the personable chef  visits with his patrons, which inspired me to check it out.  The chef visited all seated guests except for us; probably a coincindence that we were the only couple under 50 and not caucasian.  I noted on the res. that it was my wife's birthday, and at the end of the meal she was presented with a cardboard to go box, shaped & decorated like a pie, with a handful of dinner mints inside. (very tacky)
And, they don't take American Express.

There are too many really good restaurants in the area for us to go back to Sansone's.
i take my mom here...so it has to be good...

REMEMBER THIS: Abelkievers! Kind of like Donut Holes, but better! Made out of Pancake Batter filed with of your choice, Cream, Rocky Road or Lemon. I picked Rocky road and it was delish! Paired well with my coffee. 
Main course was Smothered Breakfast Burrito. It was huge and so good! 
The Abelskivers stole my appetite, so good! Literally.

I ordered the Ultimate Frittata. It wasn't. A frittata as I understand it is beaten eggs enriched with various meat and veggie fillings fried in a skillet and often finished in the oven--almost like a crustless quiche. The dish I received in no way resembled this. My plate contained a watery pile of slimy scrambled egg substitutes (not even fresh eggs), crumbled greasy pizza sausage, a few small chunks of potato and broccoli, and pepperoni slices that were stuck together because no one could bother to pull them apart so they would cook properly, all of which was mixed together and topped with unmelted shredded cheese. It was underwhelming and left me feeling queasy. 

The prices and portions were on par with most restaurants and the service was friendly and efficient. However, food is paramount for me and a breakfast restaurant that can't properly execute an egg dish or use real eggs won't be earning my return business.

I usually don't write Yelp review. (Last one was 2014) but I need to write a review about this place.

I don't think I've ever been treated as awful at any other restaurant. 

From the moment calling this place to order food, the guy on the phone was rude and unfriendly.

Showing up to pick the food up, the guy who took our money (I'm guessing the same person), Damion, didn't even acknowledge me or my friends who were there. He didn't say anything to us. He just took our money to pay for the food. He was also annoyed that we split checks. Like c'mon, I'm sure we weren't the first people to frequent this business and wanted to split the check. Overall, he was extremely unpleasant. 

So if you want to be treated like shit for no reasons, then come to this business.

Otherwise, I'd rather go to the local IHOP and get some pancakes without a side of rudeness.

I really wanted to like this place because they open at 6:00 a.m. and they are relatively close to where we live and we don't have much to choose from nearby.  

However, we've gone to this place twice and both times it's been subpar.  The menu is very limited, the coffee is super weak, and the potatoes have been undercooked both times we were there.  On this visit, I ordered the eggs Benedict and the eggs were overcooked to the point that the yolks were solid and the bacon was too salty.  

I was hoping the first time was an off day but apparently this is the norm.  

I wouldn't go back.

I stopped into Three Little Griddles on morning after arriving in Denver before heading into the office. I was able to grab a seat at a table just before it started to get crowded.The staff was friendly and the atmosphere here is warm and welcoming despite its strip mall location. 

Inside you will find a small bar with seating for four and about 15 small tables for two, which could be combined for larger parties. I took a look at the menu and decided to go with the Classic Benedict, which was served with breakfast potatoes. Overall this was a solid choice, and the potatoes were perfectly seasoned. The perfect portion size for the price, which was only about $10. I seriously considered an order of their Evalskivers, which were Danish style pancake holes filled with either fudge, lemon curd, or their seasonal selection but I resisted the temptation.

Overall this was a pretty good choice, and I am more than likely to try to return if I am in the area again as their griddle bananas foster toast sounded excellent too.

I really wanted to love this place based on the reviews but I didn't. 

We arrived at about 11:45 am on a Sunday for brunch. We were quoted a 45 minute wait but ended up being seated after about 20-30 minutes. The food was decent and service was decent but nothing above average that makes me want to go back for more. 

Three of us had a build your own omelet and were all satisfied.  The fourth had a two egg breakfast of some sort with an added biscuit.  The biscuit was dense and tough which is our only major food complaint.  

Everything was good just nothing special. If I leave a meal feeling like I could have created it at home myself then it really wasn't the experience I was looking for.  If I were in the area and there was no wait I'd eat here again but I won't be going out of my way to visit this establishment in the future.

The Three Little Griddles is such an unexpected gem in this seemingly pedestrian strip mall. We visited thanks to the great yelp reviews and it exceeded our expectations. We ordered the shrimp and grits---it had run out.  Now we were intrigued. We ordered the Red Eye ham with grits and egg as well as the pumpkin ebelskivers. We were in gastronomic heaven. Two days later we were determined to partake of the shrimp and grits. We added cinnamon rolls to the order and the biscuits and gravy. Nothing disappointed but those shrimp and grits had us promising to return from California for just to have them again. Go to Three Little Griddles!!!

First time I tried this place I ordered an omelet but it was a little of the Burned side    my daughter ordered the three meat cake it was not at all what she thought she was not impressed we also ordered red velvet cake Donuts which were also burnt and mushy on the inside and I have to say the service was not good at all they did not come back and ask how everything was I would not return

Let me just start by saying this: You have not had a well-lived life until you have eaten an ebelskiver (ABEL-skeever). It's a freaking cream filled donut hole made with pancake batter. 

I'm still dreaming about those things a week after eating here.

I also got a fritatta and, of course, this being a week later, I can't remember what the heck it was called. But it had sausage, pepperoni, broccoli... wait, wait, wait, where are you going? Come back! Hear me out on this. Any way, broccoli, potatoes, eggs and cheese. 

Y'all, it was gooooooooooooood.I know it sounds like a weird combo, but I was a little hangy that morning and this was the perfect combination for my rumbly tum.

Yes, it's WAAAAAY outside of Denver, but it's worth the drive. 

AND GET SOME EBELSKIVERS.

Hands down one of the best breakfast places I have ever had. It is definitely worth the wait! Came here around 10AM on a Sunday. The wait was about 40-45 minutes for a party of 2 with a baby. And we all know babies don't do well waiting, so thank goodness there is an Albertson's next door to stall time. They don't have much space inside to wait in the restaurant anyways.

Atmosphere: It's a small restaurant, but enough space between tables so you don't feel like you're trapped. Cute simple decorations to make it feel homey. Nice thing is you can hold a conversation and not feel like you're shouting. Super kid friendly. They have lots of high chairs and enough space to bring in the carseat for super young infants. (:

Service: We have had nothing, but wonderful service from all the workers since we walked in. We loved that they had the option of waiting in the restaurant or they could text us when our table was ready. Our server was very pleasant and even sat at the table with us while taking our order so we were eye to eye and was able to feel like we were having a regular conversation.

Food: GRIDDLECAKE and SPECIALTY EGGS BENEDICT (oh and if you love sweets, their cinnamon roll). 

How have I never heard or had a griddle cake before. It's like the best thing that can happen to breakfast. Pancake, hash browns, eggs, cheese, breakfast meats all in one large pancake looking thing?!?! It definitely could not be better! So fluffy, airy, melt in your mouth, deliciousness in each and every bite. Can I have one right now? Seriously. It will hit every breakfast craving you have. They have the options of three meats, vegetarian, or their specialty (I can't recall right now). 

Who doesn't love eggs benedict? It's a traditional breakfast classic. But add in some chorizo and jalopenos. You got yourself a spicy bomb breakfast. Especially if you love spicy foods. Their house potatoes. Delicious with the runny yolk. 

Cinnamon roll: Drenched in their original frosting or cream cheese. We went with the original and it definitely did not disappoint. It's really heavy with the sugar... so I would definitely eat this in a couple portions. There is definitely fluff and richness in each sweet bite.

Too bad they aren't open past 2. I can definitely eat this for breakfast, lunch, and dinner

Recommended by Yelp. It's in a shopping center. 

Cute place. A few tables and long bench on right with tables. Coffee taste good. Server was very helpful. 

We had the shrimp & grits; amazing. I don't like grits. My boyfriend ordered it and he is picky. Wow. 

I had the burrito with sausage. It's a little spicy; it was delicious. Drenched in that yummie sauce. 

Blueberry pancakes were delicious too. 

The girls had griddle and eggs.  They loved it. The griddle was big.
tip: if you want to avoid the lines, visit the DTC location. Its a little less crowded.

They have the best gluten free French toast I've had in a long time. Their service was prompt and quick with our meal and we only had to wait 30 seconds at 8am on a Saturday for two although they were very busy.

Grabbed a nice leisurely breakfast here the other day and it was awesome. Had a cinnamon roll, iced chai, and eggs benedict. Everything was awesome! The service was great, our server was very friendly and quick. The ambience is very casual, they seem to have some regulars that come in. Little small, not a ton of seating, but totally worth it. 

They tend to run out of cinnamon rolls as other reviewers have noted, so make sure to get one. They're huge and delicious.

My boyfriend and I are always looking to try new breakfast places (especially with good reviews!) - Three Griddles did not disappoint. 

We came in around 1030 on a Saturday, I know what you're thinking, peak breakfast time!  This restaurant is a small outlet within the Albertsons shopping center. If I were to guess, it seats maybe 60 people but don't quote me. First, the waiting area is a bench that fits maybe 6, so better to send just one person in your party inside to get on the list otherwise you are about to get friendly with those already dining. 

We walked in and it was hectic near the door but we were committed.  Someone approached us immediately and after seating two other parties we were able to get on the list. She said about 25 minutes- great! We stroll over to Albertsons and grab some things we needed and after not even 15 minutes we received a text that our table was ready. Woohoo!

We were seated at the back and the hostess explained the specials. Shortly after we were greeted by our awesome waitress whom brought us water and offered additional drinks.

Time to order! Our food was in front of us before we knew it! Probably in less than 8 minutes (all cooked to order).  I ordered one of the specials "Chunky Monkey" three (good sized!) griddle cakes with chocolate chips and banana slices cooked in and a side of syrup. Also a side of cheesy grits (why not, right?!). My guy ordered eggs benedict (cant go wrong) it is prepared the traditional way and included home fries. He said that the hollandaise was heavenly and the english muffin they used was fluffy, tangy goodness.  We both had leftovers and probably could have shared one dish. 

Usually when we go out for breakfast on the weekend, we prepare ourselves for long wait lists, slow service and long cook times. Not here!! We were in and out in an hour.

We will be back for the great priced, delicious food, friendly staff and open atmosphere!

AWFUL! I have absolutely no idea why this place, is so popular. The only reason I can fathom, is that there are few breakfast places in Aurora. 
The service is beyond sub par and flat out rude kost days. 
The potatoes are always half raw! And our pancake was undercooked and our friends omelet was drenced in butter to the point she couldn't eat it. And they just argued with her rather than just wanting to fix it! This is the last time we come here. We have tried and they have failed 3x's now. They don't care.

Staff was helpful as soon as I walked in, explained any questions I had with the menu. The food was fantastic. I got the Elvis toast and abelkievers to go. The Elvis toast was amazing and I was not able to finish myself. The abelkievers were ok for my road trip snacks. They would be better if I had a dipping sauce for them. I will def go back if I'm in the Denver area again.

I'm back!  Came to Aurora to visit my older brother and had to stop by this place again!  This place is freaking awesome!  As you can tell from my reviews, I'm a huge biscuits and gravy guy and this place does it right.  Best that I have ever tasted without a doubt!  We stopped by on Friday 12/11 around 11:00.  The food and service was all top notch!  Excellent!  The owner stopped by to chat with us, cause she probably recognized my older brother, cause he eats there a lot!  It was awesome to hear they are opening up another location.  Every time I come to visit my brother, I'll make sure to stop by, cause this place is doing it right.  Outstanding food and wonderful people.  I highly recommend this establishment.

We ordered of course biscuits and gravy topped with an egg and the Elvis Toast.  Delicious!

Made this my last stop in Colorado before heading East. Upon arrival, I was told that the wait would be 45min, but my friend raved about this mom and pop breakfast joint so I decided to stay. If you've never been to Aurora - know that it's corporate city, mom and pop anythings are very very scarce. 20min into my wait a table opened up, woohoo! 
So everything is made from scratch here, Amazing!! I had the chorizo jalapeno eggs Benedict - which I MUST add was off menu but the chef offered to make me something special since both items I'd requested were sold out for the day, which is awesome and great customer service. The Benedict was amazing.

Love the food and atmosphere,  however, not being able to get a cup of coffee while I wait is ASININE! I am here to eat and if I need to wait 30 minutes, I would like some coffee. Add it to my bill....

They estimated a 40 min wait, but we were seated within 20. Hard-working, efficient staff. They have an excellent system in which you can tell where you are in line from your smart phone. It enabled us to walk around with our kids and not worry about whether or not we'd miss our names being called.
Whenever they say, "If you want a cinnamon roll, you might want to order it before we run out"? That's normally a good sign. And yes, it was a delicious sign.
The Upstate Frittata was greatness. Hit the spot. 
PS - If you have a kid, ask if they have a penny for the candy machine on the way out.

Number one thing, their plates are HUGE. I could barely eat half of my griddle cake!! 

They have the normal brunch dishes like eggs benedict, breakfast burrito, griddle cakes (pancakes), etc etc. I chose the "veggie griddle cake" b/c it looked unique! Instead of sweet toppings, this one is made of vegetables mixed into the batter with a lot of cheesiness on top. It's topped with sour cream, salsa, and avocado.. and everything just works so well together. It's super savory and delicious! I would definitely order this again.. it's definitely shareable between 2 people too. 

My friend got the special griddle for the season.. it was the apple one.. it was way too sweet.. it was like eating dessert for breakfast. I would pass on that if you don't like things too sweet. 

They serve Dazbog coffee and different juices!!

I'm definitely coming back!!!

My wife has been hounding me about coming here for a long time and I finally gave in. I will admit I was dead wrong about coming sooner. This place is very good and the service is excellent. I got the Upstate Frittata minus the broccoli and it was excellent. The pepperoni gave it an awesome flavor. My wife and I shared an order of biscuits and gravy. This is the way to go since it is a huge portion. I can't say it's the best biscuits and gravy I have ever had, that honor belongs to my momma, but they were pretty dang good. The gravy was by far the best I have had in Colorado. The best part of the meal though was the eggs Benedict. It was amazing!!!!! Overall a great breakfast place and we will definitely return.

One of our favorite brunch spots in Colorado!  Anytime we have guests visit we love taking them here.  There food is always fresh and delicious.  The staff is very friendly.  If you go on a weekend be prepared to wait awhile.  It's no secret that this place is amazing so everyone wants to brunch there on the weekends.  Make sure to try their Ebelskivers.  Our usual is the shrimp and grits, the eggs Benedict, and the kid griddlecake.  Don't forget to check out their specials!  They have high chairs for the littles.

We visited this location close to Smoky Hill Road in Aurora on a Saturday morning. The place was crowded and so we were excited but unfortunately the pancakes were really doing they want fluffy like I had expected with a name like griddles.

Hi my wife would rather visit snooze because their food was consistently were good for us. This restaurant just did not do it for me although the wait staff was pleasant it just seemed that the place was really crowded and very tight and I am not a large man.

The food here was great. I had the pork green chile breakfast burrito and it was really good. My friend had the Elvis French toast which was big and crusty bread with peanut butter and banana. All the food was great and the service was good. I would definitely come back.

Great breakfast stop, and can see why they have opened a second location by IKEA. First time to stop in with the family, and service was friendly from initial entry up until we left. 

They are kid friendly with high chairs, crayons, and coloring place mats. Portions were a good size and was enough to share. Had the pork hash that was well prepared and tasty. 

Recommend coming in and enjoying for yourself, and great to help a local business.

After suffering through quite a bit of vegan biscuits and gravy trips for months, it was finally time to return to the real deal and Three Little Griddles did not disappoint. A giant of plate of massive biscuits covered in scrumptious gravy hit the spot.

I'd give it 4*. It was good, filling and enjoyable. What gives this establishment 5* is that they use Dazbog coffee! You need to understand that coffee is an afterthought in most diners and barely drinkable, but TLG uses my favorite chain (local!) as their coffee provider. Brilliance given that most of my Yelp is about coffee.

So I absolutely recommend this place. They have some of the finest biscuits and gravy that I have ever had as well as some very decent coffee to go along with it. Can't ask for much more!

ok...AWESOME!  Cinnamon Rolls are amazing.  I'm totally ruined for anyone else's.  Food was delicious.  Service fast and friendly.  Big portions.  Hooray for yummy leftovers!

I love supporting family owned businesses.  This one is a keeper.  For sure I'll be back!
Great food, service and value.  The owners are very friendly and take the time to socialize with their customers.
Taste breakfast food. Had the breakfast burrito it was well proportioned, I could only finish half. The green chili we very tasty.

The food saves this place. It has so much opportunity! It's the only restaurant that shows up as a breakfast joint out in Southlands, sending an ample market its way I imagine. It's easy to get to, and the real estate has the potential to be very inviting and warm... Instead, it's a concrete unloved floor. Wood benches. Minimalistic chairs. Industrial feel. Overcompensating red to attempt to add some flare. My feet are cold and I actually asked that they turn up the heat. Cold in temperature and ambiance. 

The servers were quite sweet, and the burrito was fantastic. A little redesign and I think they've got something to talk about.

Awesome breakfast and service. I got the biscuits and gravy with an egg and it was A LOT of food and very tasty. Well worth the trip...I was just visiting the area and relied on the Yelp reviews and they were spot on.
I wanted to love this place. But the food was just average, not too many healthy options, the coffee was weak, and the place was too crowded. I'll stick with the chains, thanks.

Can I just say YUM?  After being sick for a week both my husband and I needed out of the house. Instead of going to our old stand by diner for breakfast we decided to see what else was around. When we got to Three Little Griddles the line was out the door. 

This place is small, but they did a great job with the name. We put our names down, they said it'd be about 25 minutes and they would text us when our table was ready. We chose to get a trip to the hardware store out of the way while wating. 

The servers were fast and friendly. My husband got the Biscuits and Gravy and I got the Classic Eggs Benedict.  We shared an order of the Little Dutch stuffed pancakes. We got the fudge.

Everything was amazing, the portions are big so we will likely share next time. We each took home half our meals. My husband said the biscuits and gravy were just the right amount of creamy with a touch of heat. My eggs Benedict was perfection, and their home fries are amazing, all I can assume is they are finished in butter!

Can't wait to try this place again!
THE BEST FRENCH TOAST EVER!!!!! I highly recommend the toast with peanut butter, honey, and bananas :)

Went on a Sunday about 1045am. There was a 30-45 minute wait and their computer system was down. There are patio type chairs to sit on to wait outside. The place is very small inside. Party of 3. I ordered an orange juice, coffee, and the 3 meat griddle cake with a side of green chile. Huge size, can be 2-3 meals or serve 2 or maybe 3. I ordered the special pancake balls but sent them back as they were not cooked all the way and had wet batter dough inside. $20 with tip. The griddle cake was unique but I think next time I will try the shrimp and grits. Our waitress was somewhat attentive.
Not so good this time. I have been here before and the food was better than this. Told the waiter and he doesn't care. Grease  potatoes.

Heard how great this place was and was not impressed. The cinnamon rolls were hard and heated up in the microwave. The rest of the meal was just average. Breakfast burrito was bland- would rather go to Village Inn.
Another great meal. This is the Elvis toast.  Huge and absolutely inedible.  Bioche bread,  peanut butter, bananas,  and topped with bacon crumbles and amazing syrup.   Sooooooo good.

Our favorite "go to" breakfast place! You've gotta try dessert first with the ebelskivers!! We like the chocolate best but they're all DELISH! For breakfast I usually go with the AWESOME biscuits and gravy, or dynamite eggs Benedict myself, but the savory griddle cakes look fantastic too!! Service can fluctuate when the owner/family isn't around, but it's usually pretty good. You may have to wait 30 minutes on a Saturday or Sunday but it's usually less. So don't be a baby and just have a seat. It's worth the wait!!

The staff here were nice and the owner made a point to visit with people. They knew lots of customers by their names and gave hugs and kisses so you can tell they've got a loyal fan base. Customer service wise, I would give them 4 stars, but I'm also taking into account their food. 

Food wise, this ranks as probably the worst breakfast places I've been to in Denver. If I had to describe the food in one word, it would be 'mushy'. I ordered the Nutella Swirl pancakes and they tasted like Nutella, but it was so mushy. The entire top piece was just covered in sauce. I ate the bottom pieces which didn't have as much sauce on them, but they were still mushy. I don't mean soggy either like they'd been sitting out and the sauce soaked into them. I mean mushy like undercooked mushy. 

My wife ordered the Keeping It Simple with bacon, white toast, and scrambled eggs. The eggs were the worst eggs I've ever had in my life. Visually they looked liquidity. Taste wise, they were undercooked and runny. They were also just one giant piece of scrambled eggs. Not good. The bread was white toast. Only the top pieces were buttered. The bacon was okay. The only redeeming factor were the fries. My wife loved them because they were actually seasoned. 

Side note, they don't give you ice with the water so you have to ask for it. Kinda strange. 

Overall, definitely not a repeat in my book, but I'm happy to see others do.

First off, I'm not sure why anyone would complain about the service.  This is not fine dining!  The service was quick, friendly and good.  The place was packed on a Saturday morning but still we didn't feel ignored.  The food was fantastic and coffee was also very good.  We had the savory griddle cakes and it's such a great food invention! Overall, it was worth a 40 min wait and we enjoyed it very much.
Small family owned restaurant, great food, great service. The cinnamon rolls are amazing. Great for business, family or one person dining meals.
Amazing curry flavored green chili smothering a fantastic sausage breakfast burrito fit for a king!

Loved having brunch here on out first day arriving in Denver, portions are gigantic so be prepared to either share or pack the rest for later. Service is pretty good, ambiance is relaxed and casual. Be sure to go there early or wait for a table since the place is quite small. Worth our wait for a table!

Disappointed. I was excited to come here after reading amazing reviews but my experience was much different. In fact, I wasn't even able to find anything to order because they have no meat options that aren't pork. Even the hash is corned pork hash...what! No turkey alternative. No chicken. No fish. Nothing. Not a Jew friendly place! 
On the flip side if you are a bacon lover, this is your place. The atmosphere is a bit different than most downtown brunch places. Lots of babies and young kids.

This place is just amazing.  Their green chili is out of this world.   I also learned a new word.  Ebelskivers...or something like that....its a stuffed pancake ball.  Sounds weird...but get some!   The breakfast burrito is the best I've ever had.  Everything else is great too.   

GO HERE!   But...expect a wait.

We had breakfast here on a late Thursday morning. It's great to find another independent restaurant near home! The servers were attentive and helpful with the menu. All of the food tasted very fresh and the Eggs Benedict was one of the best I have had. It is my go-to at Snooze and Three Little Griddles edged out Snooze! My hubs had an omelet and had no complaints. It had plenty of fillings, the eggs tasted very fresh, and was just the right amount of fluffy.
They serve Daz Bog coffee which is a big draw for both of us--they had Mocha Java when we visited and it was the best coffee we've had in a restaurant in a while. 
Our server was super sweet and attentive--it was a great dining experience!
This is the spot for breakfast in Aurora Colorado. I had to wait on a Monday morning to get in.

Not impressed.  I can get a better breakfast at an IHOP. The seating is atrocious and uncomfortable. I ordered the Classic toast and lemon curd aebleskivers. The French toast was dry in the inside and the aebleskivers were under cooked. Hubby ordered breakfast burrito with sausage. The filling was in sections. One end was the eggs, the middle was german sausage and the last section was potatoes, smothered in a bland chile. Let's not forget the army of flies attacking you while you eat and try to defend your food from their poop covered feet. Water glasses were filthy and covered in crumbs.

Went this past Saturday morning-ish at about 1045 to three little griddles.  

Pros:  Great food, large portions, generous pricing

Cons: the wait, we sat down immediately and ordered but didn't get our food for almost 30 minutes.

With that said, the staff / manager apologized and told us they were experiencing delays in the kitchen and discounted our check the coffee's for the inconvenience.   So no complaints really.  That's the only thing keeping this from a 5 star review.  We will be back again!

This was such an amazingly unexpected delight. I had just returned from four months in Iraq, my wife and I were headed home from the airport and we needed breakfast. Griddles was close to our route home so we decided to stop in. 

Mind. Blown. 

The GF Eggs Benedict was a huge hit with my wife. She said the Hollandaise was perfect. I had the biscuits and gravy. Perfect flavored gravy, perfectly prepared biscuits. I added some cheese grits because I was still hungry and even added some of the Monte Christo ebelskivers. 

Everything was awesome. The wait was totally worth it. They are going to have to expand within the year to keep up with the popularity at this rate.

I love this place.  Close to the house and no 90-minute waits like that place on Colorado Blvd.

Good food. Will cook your food to order.

Have been back a few times.

Food: 5 stars. The best part of the experience. Great food. Really enjoyed the breakfast burrito! 
Service: 4.5 stars. Girls were very nice and attentive.  Nice work. 
Atmosphere: 1 star. Owner totally missed it here. Interiors are hard. Cold. Industrial furniture, benches with no cushions. Could have made it more comfortable and relaxing. Ugh!! 

You want great food? Definitely visit. 
You want a place to chill, enjoy coffee and possibly spend time on your laptop, go to Starbucks.

I eat here a lot with my daughter and enjoy the food.   Simple breakfast is cheap and tasty.   There speciality griddle cakes hit the spot for my sweet tooth.   A bit of a hipster crowd but I'm kind of a hippy my self

Absolutely fantastic. Very cozy and clean little establishment filled with smiling employees-from the servers to the owner himself. Brother had the b.l.a.t. Which consisted of bacon crisped to perfection and fresh veggies. I had the strawberry cheesecake griddles which had a superb cinnamon and strawberry taste. The only downside to this place is there is so many delicious options to choose from! Cannot wait to come back and try everything else :) definitely found our new favorite breakfast place!!!!

We had the Nutella pancakes to share for two and ordered sides. The home fries were ok, some were burned and others were good, but they didn't taste great. The space in there is fairly small, and the service wasn't very good. Over all wasn't impressed by the food. The ratings are to high for this place.

This place is awesome! If you live in the Southlands area you are probably already familiar with this little joint.  Standing strong as one of the only breakfast places in this area, this little family owned joint certainly has made a name for itself.  

Whether you are into savory or sweet, they have you covered at three little griddles. Serving up options like Ebelskivers which is are much like a donut hole.... but made of pancakes.  That's right, who wouldn't love a pancake hole! They also have cinnamon rolls the size of your head, pancakes as big as mountains... including one called the Elvis which includes... you guessed it... peanut butter and bananas! 

I got the "keeping it simple,"  which is the traditional egg bacon and hashbrowns breakfast.  Their potatoes were tasty, the eggs were poached perfect, and their bacon is crispy and delicious! MY partner got the red eye plate, which is the same but has grits underneath and covered in gravy.  

This has become a staple for our family and we will continue to come weekly and enjoy a lovely breakfast. 

Great customer service!!! Plan to wait 20 minutes (this place isn't huge).  If you don't live close don't worry.  They are opening a second location in the tech center!

This place is amazing. And small so don't even think about showing up and being immediately seated. I will say that it is CERTAINLY WORTH THE WAIT!!!

My family and I have had many things from the menu but what sticks out are there yummy griddle cakes, bisquits and gravy, and the best bacon this side of the Mason/Dixon line. 

They close at 2pm or something like that so come early, and I guarantee you'll leave happy!

First impression was that the floor was dirty. 

Five of us had brunch there today. Two are vegetarians with a gluten allergy. We made this extra clear to the server. 

My granddaughter's gluten free, vegetarian French toast came with bacon crumbles, even though it was ordered with no bacon.  The replacement order still had a few bacon crumbles on it. 

My grandson's pancakes were not the ones he ordered. 

The bill included the wrong pancakes as well as the correct ones. 

To cap off this already bad experience, both my daughter and granddaughter had gluten reactions, suggesting contamination.

I've been going here since it opened and it continues to satisfy me as consistently as any restaurant I can think of. I have yet to find a bad item on their menu. Service is usually very good. The Aurora location is a little small and can get very busy but the second location should help with that. Definitely worth a visit if you haven't already done so. 
5 stars without a doubt!!!

Cute little cafe!  Very busy, expect to wait for a table.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.  I was able to modify my meal to make it Paleo friendly.  

I ordered the "Corned" Pork Steaks.  It came with homefrys and toast, I was able to substitute fruit the toast and potatoes.  The pork had great flavor but was a little dry.  I ordered my eggs poached medium, one was perfect and one was almost well done.  Once I chopped it all up the flavors melded well and the lack of finishing salt on the eggs where negligible.  The fruit was in season and sweet.  A very nice ending to my meal. 

The establishment appeared to be family owned and operated.  The entire staff was friendly and very attentive.  They didn't even mind me taking lots of pictures.  I recommend stopping in if you have the time.

"Three Little Griddles" . . . say it out loud.  It seems to bring a smile to my face when I say it.  It must be the way it sounds like "liddle griddles" to me.  And, I definitely was smiling when I left this place this morning.  I don't typically walk around just handing out five star reviews.  However, I definitely feel it was merited here based on my experiences.

This area has (in my opinion) sadly lacked for breakfast choices.  I had dropped my dogs off at Club Pet (east of Parker) and did a quick Yelp search for breakfast options near Smoky Hill and E-470.  Three Little Griddles popped up as the number one Breakfast and Brunch place.  This name was new to me, and I drilled down to scan the many positive reviews.  A short drive later, I found myself walking into the restaurant.  I remembered this location from when it was a "Nick-N-Willy's Pizza" several years back.  The place is cozy (it seats 44), but seems a bit roomier than one might expect.  It was maybe half full when I walked in, and I was quickly seated at the counter.  From talking with the staff, this place is much busier on the weekends, but then again, what good breakfast place do you know that isn't?

My service, from the time I entered, until the time I left, was top-notch.  Very friendly people were all working, and I think I met all of all of them except for the nice waitress from Scotland.  The place is family owned, run, and mostly staffed.  I met the patriarch of the business (Ron), and very much enjoyed talking with him about Three Little Griddles.  I also met chef Kelly (Ron's son), who was cooking up a storm, but still had a couple minutes to chat.  Also slinging hash was Megan, whose breakfast wizardry was fun to watch.  Although the cooking area is modest in size, this is an open window to the kitchen for those who like to see where the action is.  The upscale restaurant backgrounds of these two become apparent both when you watch them work, and when you dig into your food.

I had the Special Benedict.  This rotates seasonally (which is wonderful).  They are currently taking advantage of tomatoes being at the peak of ripeness.  My quite large breakfast consisted of two over-sized English muffins, covered with lightly sauteed spinach, slabs of heirloom tomato, perfectly poached eggs, and an unctuous cream cheese Hollandaise sauce.   This was so filling that I only ate half of my home fries.  These are cubes of lightly seasoned, flat-top griddled potatoes, that were about the size of large casino dice.  I would have liked my muffin toasted a bit more, and a heavier sear on my potatoes, but this is personal preference and a very small complaint.

I will definitely be back, as there are many more items on the menu I want to try.  The sweet items (particular the french toast) were putting out a siren call to my nose, long after my belly was full.


P.S.  I have been back several times now, and it is always, consistently, wonderful and delicious.

P.P.S. Fudge Ebelskivers are the best!

Wanted to find a good breakfast place close to us and we read good things abt this place. Ugh... yuck! the food came out semi warm. we sat right infront ofbthe kitchen and i was able to see the cooks in the back make the food. nobody wore gloves and the lady cook touched her hair and face several times. the biscuits were touched directly with her hands and so was the bread and rest of the food coming out of the kitchen. YUCK! the waiter was nice but the food was not good and not hot. we will NOT be back.
Weird place. No meals.  You just get pancakes. Or potatoes.  Building is inappropriate for the size of the business. In the winter you must dine with snow cloths on. Not comfy at all.

My wife and i have been going to this restaurant since it opened. I think we have gone thru all of the menu items.
We believe this has the BEST food hands down.
We go to Village Inn and other breakfast locations and none of them compare to 3 Griddles.
i would give this place a BIG high 5.
Everthing is great!!! Family operated ....NICEST people!!!!!! Nothing else in the area comes close. Skip the chain restaurants, eat some amazing food and support this wonderful family business!! :)

Oh my....unexpected little gem! We were in the area for a game and had time for some breakfast on a very rainy Saturday morning.  We were welcomed into a tiny little restaurant with a big bottled water for our table and fresh Daz Bog coffee. I was soon swooning over my eggs Benedict with avocado replacing the Canadian bacon and fresh home fried potatoes. Incredible sauce and delicious sourdough English muffins. My hubby loved his savory biscuits & gravy full of sausage.  I would return in a heartbeat if ever out this way for breakfast or brunch! Yummmmmmmmm! I might even make a special trip.

Great service! Great food!
Love the concept and how fast they were. We will definitely be back.
Very tasty.  I got the breakfast burrito and it was fresh.  I only take off one star because of the prices.  It was over $50 for breakfast for two.

This place was good. My husband and I came here at the recommendation of a friend. Huge portions - he ordered a savory pancake and it was bigger than the plate. I got the uptown frittata with a short stack. Delicious! Sausage is slightly spicy and the combination of eggs and pepperoni is good. 

The only downside is the size of the location. I'm not sure I would dare coming on the weekend. Very small location and it was packed on a Thursday morning. Otherwise this is definitely a place to check out!

Awesome and friendly staff here made all the difference. My hungry toddler son was on a breakdown because we had been in the car too long. Instead of a breakdown, the chef noticed and offer a little ramekin of chocolate chips. Made all the difference and we had a wonderfully happy meal! The menu is creative and delicious; there were several dishes I wanted to order. Wait staff was very attentive and patient with us as we got situated, even though it was very busy. 5 stars, deservedly so.
I have had breakfast here many times. It is WORTH the wait. Make sure to go early as it fills up fast. But the portions are huge and everything I've tried is delicious. Great service.

This is my third time here.  Every time I've come, they've been very busy, sometimes with a line waiting at the door.  I came for breakfast on a Tuesday at 10:30 am.  The only place open was the small bar, which was fine.  I was promptly greeted at ordered my breakfast of coffee and pancakes with a side of bacon.
Coffee service was prompt.  Breakfast also came out quickly.  Strangely though, I had to get the attention of the server to ask for some butter with my pancakes.  The gentleman next to me did too.  Obviously he is a regular because he stated, "you always have to ask for butter, I told them to change that."  Guess they haven't.  The pancakes were well prepared otherwise.  Tall and fluffy.  Too much food really. Now for the bacon.  Well, the three pieces I received were crispy but were also barely warm.  I tried a piece right after the waitress brought it and it was barely above room temperature.  This is whey the restaurant gets 4 stars and not 5.  If you are going to pre-cook your bacon, figure out a way to get it to the customer while it is HOT. Please.  Service was prompt and courteous.  I will say, their little coffee bar, cash register, sink, dirty dishes area is far too small for 3 wait staff to maneuver around in.  One waitress accidentally tipped over and broke a bottle of water just trying to leave.  Not really her fault.  I will come back.

This is a gem in the neighborhood. I was so happy to finally get breakfast at this place. The wait was 50 min at 9:30 on a Sunday. I expected this based on how small the place is. But very worth the wait. Started off with the cinnamon roll with regular frosting. Amazing- everyone at the table kept stealing bites. I then ordered scrambled eggs and a short stack. Both were cooked very well- the pancakes were nice and fluffy and the eggs were neither too dry or too runny. I also tried a breakfast burrito and home fries from someone else's plate. Delish.

The decor is so cute. It is a really small place, but it had a nice personal feel because of it. I love supporting a family business rather than a chain. This place has mom working the front while her kids work the grill and serve. They even had their grandson helping out. Great family and great service.
Plan on returning soon.

Almost shouldn't say anything; we all know it's just friends and family reviewing here anyways 

First tried the Ebelskivers (Danish)..nom nom nom.. Need I say more?

The breakfast pork hash was fantastic, and she said the breakfast burrito definitely hit the spot.

Great job and excellent service!  I'm sure to return!

More like 4.5 stars but they get the 5 instead of 4. A few little things like long wait times can be annoying, buy hey... its good, gotta deal with it. My only 2 points of feedback would be that is kinda hot inside during the summer and the water that comes out in the bottle is not usually cold. As such, ask for ice. 

All and all i like coming here fkr the great food and good service.

I took my 2 teenage daughters to 3 Little Griddles on Saturday this weekend, for the first time.  All 3 of us were absolutely delighted by our experience and I couldn't wait to write this review!  

We got there pretty early - about 8:30am, and there wasn't much of a wait.  As I'm sure others have already commented, the waiting area is teeny-tiny.  The restaurant has several very comfy Adirondack chairs sitting outside their front door, which would be a great place to wait during the warm summer months.  However, when it's cold, the front area has got to be super congested while people wait for a table.  This was not our experience, just an observation.  I'm not sure what they could do about it, other than take out a table or two - but then they wouldn't be able to get as many diners in.

Nearly every moment of our meals was perfection.  Our waiter was friendly and knowledgable, and was quick to bring us water and coffee.  The coffee was hot, delicious and Daz Bog, which I really have an affinity for, so it was great to see that 3LG serves it.  We started with the Cinnamon Roll with cream cheese.  YUMMMM!!  It was a perfectly gooey balance of tender, warm roll, butter, cinnamon sugar and topped with the most luscious cream cheese icing.  I think we may have finished it in 60 seconds :)

I ordered the Classic Eggs Benedict.  It came with an enormous, fluffy English muffin - not the little ones that I'm used to at other restaurants.  The slab of canadian bacon on each slice was also very thick, almost perfectly matching up to the size of the muffin.  I like my eggs poached hard, and that was done perfectly.  My only complaint would be the Hollandaise.  I LOVE Hollandaise with all of my little heart and rarely have a complaint.  This one was more citrus-y than those that I've had in the past.  It wasn't awful, just more tart than I would prefer.  The potatoes that came with were cooked to perfection, and I adore how they are all cut into perfect rectangles.  Fun touch :)

My older daughter ordered the griddle cakes with blueberries.  The cakes themselves were light and fluffy, and came with an abundance of juicy blueberries!  They come out of the kitchen as 3 VERY large pancakes, and we brought 2 of them home.  I had the leftovers for breakfast this morning - still very yummy and very filling.

My younger girl ordered the Biscuits & Gravy and WOW it was an enormous place of gravyish goodness.  2 very large, light and tender biscuits were topped with an ENORMOUS amount of very flavorful sausage gravy.  We brought those leftovers home to my husband, who ate them immediately with two great big thumbs up!

This area of town has been in need of something new and different in the breakfast realm, and 3 Little Griddles is a great addition.  We look forward to many more visits in the coming years.

I was super excited to try Three Little Griddles after reading the glowing reviews and seeing the many pictures of tasty Eggs Benedict. It was a 35 minute drive, but I figured if the food was as good as the reviews stated it would be worth our time.

When we got there, there wasn't a wait; we were seated immediately. However, after that our server, took a very long time, when we finally got to order I ordered the Eggs Benedict with a side of cheesy grits in place of home fries and a cup of coffee. My friend ordered the large order of lemon curd Æbleskiver.  

The coffee is Dazbog, not my favorite but decent. However, my breakfast was not very good. When the server brought it out, I thought the Hollandaise had a very potent smell, and then I realized I was smelling the vinegar from poaching the eggs. In fact, the Eggs Benedict was not only vinegary, but it was room temperature, the English muffins weren't toasted and the Canadian bacon was very salty. Additionally, instead of replacing the home fries with grits, she brought out a side of cheesy grits in a mug. The grits were pretty good: creamy, but the only cheese I tasted was the light sprinkle of shredded cheese on top. I'm glad I got the side because the home fries were undercooked. I had one of the Æbleskiver they were also very good.

As previously mentioned, our server was slow. Not good on during breakfast service on a Saturday. Several tables, ours included, should have been out much quicker so that people waiting could be seated.

So ultimately I'm giving them 3 stars, and frankly that's generous. Maybe it was an off morning for Three Little Griddles, although I've noticed that the other low ratings have similar experiences to mine. And, considering that it's a 35 minute drive out there, I'm not willing to return and find out.

Love this place! Although there is usually a wait for a table, you can go run off and run an errand and get a text when a table is almost ready for you. LOVE this concept. Wish more places did this!

My husband is very picky and it takes a lot for him to say something tastes great. While sitting at the table, he said the biscuits and gravy were the best he's ever had. And he's had a lot of biscuits and gravy. I very much enjoyed the Classic Toast (French toast). It just melted in your mouth. 

We will be returning and I can't wait to try other items on the menu!
Absolutely love this place. Super busy on the weekends but worth the wait. Everything I have tried is amazing and the service is great.

I agree s with some others the burrito is great!   I got the chili on the side so I could split it with my 5 year old.  He liked it sooo much he ate half!  The chili is very similar to Santiago's green chili (which is a good thing since the is no Santiago's near us)  
One thing, don't bother with the ebelskevers (sp?) They were kinda gummy.  Tasted ok but the texture was not good.

Woke up Saturday and said to my wife, "I wish there was a good breakfast place out here... If there was it would be packed." Pulled up yelp and saw a new place right near us close to Southlands Mall. Woke the kids and were there in two minutes. 

Packed.  And GREAT food.  You can tell there was allot of thought put into this little spot.  Only problem, not enough tables.  I'm sure this was discussed before they opened... But hopefully they can expand a little. 

I had biscuits and gravy. Finally.  Someone who serves some good B n G. Great gravy filled with Sausage.  Only thought here was one piece was the the size of a large meet ball!  Ha. Not complaining for sure but had to use a knife to cut it. A little more constancy there perhaps.  Biscuits not to huge served open faced.  Just great.

The quiche was large and filling but not dry at all.  Very good. 

The only thing we thought was the griddle cakes were a bit I thick... SUPER good, but a little hard to not tap out after about half way through the stack.  Any thicker and they would be to bready for sure. 

Thank you for using real blue berries. Compote belongs on toast not in a pancake. 

Also some egg thing. Awesome. 

You can tell there are some new Peeps working front of house but they will improve.  

Before you give one star, just remember everyone has a bad day :) 

I thinking the owners are cool and probably wear funky glasses.  Loved it. 

WHEN I LEFT I THOUGHT: We will be friends.

I had the shrimp and grits on special and loved every bit of it. Every time I come here I try something different and an never disappointed. The corned beef is spectacular as well. Always friendly and fresh!

After sleeping maybe an hour the night before in the airport we found this place and it hit the spot! My mom had the traditional egg Benedict and I had the specialty eggs Benedict. Food was amazing and the service was also very attentive. I would totally go here again!

Unexpected strip mall delight! Stopped here on the way out of town to the airport on a Sunday morning. Had to wait about 15 min but grabbed a coffee at the Starbucks in the grocery store next store. The service was excellent and the food delish! The servings are huge, my fiancé and I each prob ate only half of our dishes. I probably could have just ordered the home fries and a side of the pork chili and been content!

Our waiter forgot to put our Oder in! We are sitting here now, after 40 minutes and the table next to us got served first we figured it out! What a bust!! I have a four year old with me! She's starving! First and last time!
Great food , but really busy. Long wait times after 0900 on the weekends. The have the best Briskets and gravy. Love it

Our first visit was to the Englewood restaurant.  It was FANTASTIC, and we WILL be back!  Ashtian was our server and took excellent care of our large party.  She interacted with the kids which we appreciated (many servers ignore kids).  Everything we had was outstanding . . . the ebelskivers (fudge & "sopapillas"), breakfast burrito, cheese omelette, quiche, griddle cakes, frittata, corned pork hash, & the veggie griddle cake (about the size of a dinner plate!) was especially amazing!  We were fortunate that we had no wait which will spoil us the next time we visit.  We really love that this restaurant is a Mom & Pop, and we enjoyed meeting the owners who are at this location.  
We highly recommend this restaurant!  Treat yourself to Three Little Griddles, either location, and you will be glad you did!

Our favorite breakfast house.  Pancakes are great, and just about everything on the menu is awesome.  Usually there is a line; but, what do expect from a great restaurant.  The staff helps make the place.

Heavenly.   That's the word that comes to mind when I think of the wonderful food turned out by this restaurant.  The service was spectacular, but the restaurant is small.  The kitchen is tiny and the drink station is behind the bar that seats four.  The size of this restaurant only makes the quality of the food that much more impressive. 

The eggs benedict was sublime, and the home fries were the best I have ever eaten.  The breakfast burrito was phenomenal and the green chili, while not spicy, was fantastic.  This will be my new breakfast spot.

Don't let the tiny size of this place deter you,  this family-owned restaurant is AWESOME! They were very busy on the Saturday morning we went, which honestly, is a good sign.  We shafted a giant delicious cinnamon roll, and it wad so good that it was gone before I could snap a picture. We also got an order of the baked (or fried?) Donut holes which were also awesome, we had the seasonal special of pb&j filling. My husband ordered the biscuits and gravy, and I got the savory veggie pancake- both were amazing! The portion sizes are so big, and our eyes were much bigger than our stomachs! Also, they serve Dazbog coffee, so that is s giant plus for me! We will definitely be back,  YUM!

It pains me to have to write this review as this place used to always be my go-to breakfast spot. But unfortunately my visit today for breakfast will be my last at this place. I  recommend taking your business elsewhere for breakfast . I was taking the visitong family out before they had to drive the rest of the way home. We stopped by on Tuesday morning at around 10 o'clock and there was a 20 minute wait which is usual but I was surprised for it being just a Tuesday. Once we were called we got seated had to wait a little bit to place the order but once we did the three of us all ordered the same thing which was eggs benedict. Unfortunately when the food came out only two of the three eggs benedict orders were put in, the waiter told me he was sorry and dodnt know why he forgot to add my order as well but he went ahead and told the kitchen to start my order after the other people had gotten theirs. It was a huge dissappontment. My table was eating and I did not have my food but sometimes these things happen so I tried not to let it upset me. Once I got my eggs benedict the Egg was raw, at this point the other people at my table we're almost done eating. I then asked for the waiter to take the plate away and to remake the order as the eggs were Raw he apologized and took the plate back and put in my order again for an eggs benedict. By the time I got that order everyone was completely done eating and all the plates were cleared it was embarrassing that I had to get my food once everyone was done eating even though I had given my order the same time as everyone else.  I decided  just to eat it at this point and not make a big deal about it because I was in front of family and was trying to not ruin the experience for them. We got our bill, I  was shocked to find out that no discount was given or no apology was given as to the poor customer service or apologizing for the egg being wrong or not even placing my order originally which would have avoided this entire situation. I am extremely disappointed in how this was handled, management should have stepped in to apologize for the continued inconveniences that we were getting and poor customer service as well or given us something like a discount or money towards or next visit for the terrible experience we had today, something!  Instead you made me feel like you just wanted my money and didn't make up for the poor experience we had today.
 I'm sorry but raw eggs? No thank you.
