Small, expensive. But the food is unique, and very good. Not the right fit for my toddler. Seating is cramped, but I will definitely go back without the kids.  The close seating brings out the uniqueness and charm of the staff.
Delicious! Adorable! The best Mexican food I've found since we moved to Colorado! Our new favorite place!!!

GREAT!!!! PLACE!!!! So cute and amazing food!!! Customer service here is also amazing...such nice and helpful girls working the front :) I can't wait to try my food! Heard a lot of great things about this place
love their food!  The green chili is the best I have ever had.  Tons of food great value~
Took a chance and stopped in for lunch while I was in town for a conference. I love this place! Very friendly, and the Cubana torta was excellent. 5 stars all the way.

I absolutely love this restaurant the outside of the restaurant is a bit shabby but once you pass through the doors you enter a world of absolute yuminess . I've never had a bad experience, I wouldn't be surprised if my step mom was the cook because it's Mexican deliciousness to a t
I recommend this for anyone looking for Mexican food.
Food was fantastic and authentic.  If you're looking for a good authentic hole in the wall type mexican restaurant I would highly recommend this one.

This is an authentic Mexican restaurant. I felt like in Mexico. The food is well presented and the taste is delicious. They have very affordable prices. I couldn't believe that the horchata was homemade, when I tasted I immediately knew that it was not the powder thing. The ambiance is pretty and nicely decorated.

When we came in, it seems that there are 2 areas to seat.  The staff said, you can choose where ever you want to seat.  So we decide to seat ourselves at the Bigger Dinning area located at the Left wing of the establishment.  Perhaps the one, at the Entrance, the "smaller" section of dining area, are meant for TO-GO waiting area etc etc..  My bad, did not ask our lovely server about the different seating areas.

This recent visit was on Saturday January 18th 2014 after running some errands in this neighborhood.  That evening was about 17:30hrs ish.

Once we seat ourselves, our lovely server gave us the Menu and ask if we want anything for our Beverages.  At first Hubs wanted to have Coke Cola, but our server said, they don't have Coke Cola, but they have Mexican Coke Cola in a bottle.., hence that was Hubs choice of beverages, while I opt for water.  I ask our server if I can order different types of Tacos and she said "YES"...  SCORE!!

We ordered the following items :

* 1 Lengua, 1 Beef Asada, [1 Tripa (Tripe) + $0.25] and 1 Birria aka Tacos Mixitos ($8.00)
*  Beef Asada Street Tacos ($6.75)
*  Mexican Coke Cola ($2.75)

While waiting for our food to be ready, our server gave us the Chips and Salsa.  We like the Chips and Salsa coz they heat up the Chips and the Salsa was put into a tortilla bowl.  Addictive Chips I must add, OR perhaps we were "starving Marvins"....

After waiting about 15 minutes or so, we received our Tacos orders.  The Taco Plate comes with Diced Raw Onions, Cilantro and 2 Limes Wedges.  Each Taco Plates comes with 2 kinds of Salsa, one was Green and the other was Red.  The amount of meats in each Taco, can be split into 2, hence in total you can get 8 Tacos.  Decent Tacos Hubs said.

The Lengua was my least favorite coz they do not cook it further though I cannot deny its tender.  The Beef Asada Tacos was Okay.  The Tripa aka Tripe, they FRIED it.. so crunchy, very addictive and I like those too...  Isn't "CRUNCHY" and "FRIED" good in the books??  The BEST Taco I have from this establishment was the Birria, the steamed goat.  Its so tender and melt in the mouth...  With all "8" Tacos each, indeed the Taco Dinner was filling.

Once we were done with Taco Dinner, there are many more patrons dining in and this establishment really got filled up.  There is also a Bar Area allocated at this establishment. 

The service was prompt, efficient and our server her name is Evelyn was very accommodating and attentive.  Our Dinner was $19.17, with tips was $23.

The Qualm we have or I guess it was just me, the Parking outside can be a nightmare during PEAK HOURS of Dinner while we were there, be it before or when we were about to leave the establishment.  Just be extra careful.  Left this establishment about 18:20hrs ish.

Los Gordos Taqueria
1034 S. Sable Blvd
Aurora, CO 80012
Tel : (303) 750-0502

@17/2014
This is my favorite Mexican restaurant around. Good food and good service for a good price. If you haven't tried it you should.

Loved this place, we were here for lunch and it wasn't busy, so I have no solid comments on the service.  But let's talk about the giant bowl of boiling meats that you can see in the pictures...

I've never seen a giant boiling cauldron of meats before; it's insane.  Similar to a fajita plate, they bring it to the table with contents boiling around the edges and topped with cheese.  The meat is quality, the tortillas are fresh, the service was fine.

Honestly one of the most unique dishes i've ever had, and so delicious.  If I take anyone here, I won't even allow them to order anything else.

**Don't let the $15 price tag drag you down, this thing feeds at least 2-3 people; I made 2 extra meals from the leftovers.  Just order it and be amazed.

ALSO - if you didn't already know - there's a super sicky "Phat Mart" right next Los Gordos if you feel like seriously copping some style after the cauldron fest.
Don't get queso! Gross! The big burrito and fajitas were good. Huge portions! There are better Mexican restaurants. It was a little pricy, as well.

it was our first time here. Had been in before to order take out but it seemed a bit pricey for to go food so I left. We decided to give it a try. Good margarita, and only $4 or $5. That's a steal nowadays! Really liked the chips and salsa and wanted a refill but there's something about having to pay for refills. Sorry, your a Mexican Restaurant. I'm guessing you charge enough on other dishes to cover your cost for a second basket of chips. What really sucked is that I had ordered a side of gaucamole and would have loved more chips to finish it. Excellent gauc! I had a torta, lots of meat and cheese but was disappointed in the toppings. A few small onion ringlets , I got the core of the iceberg lettuce on my sandwich, sad little tomatoes, and the biggest bummer was the tiny little sliver of avacado that I had to hunt for . But was good, not the best I ever had. My hubby got a combo plate, chile rellenos were excellent, yummy tamale, and I didn't try his enchilada. He was very impressed. We eat a lot of Mexican food out.  Got a horchata that seemed like something was missing. A bit flat in flavor, seemed almost watery. But I drank it and was happy. Service was great but it was 2:30 . Only 2 other tables in the place. The guy behind me ordered gaucamole and the size was incredible! I can't wait to go back and try the molcjete! And tacos. I hope they have good tacos. I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 because they charge for refills on chips and salsa. Perhaps you should change your policy to 2 baskets are complimentary. We charge for a 3rd. Or make bigger baskets, and cups of salsa!

Please don't waste your time. Service is very slow, only had one drink refill, they charge you extra for every little thing, food is not well prepared, atmosphere is good, burritos are loose and basically filled with more green chile and juices than meat, cowboy tacos had more lettuce as if they were feeding a rabbit, and basically isn't worth the time, money, or gas to drive here.

Wes the manager is very nice his waitresses are nice but they tend to mess up even if you ask in Spanish. The food is great! I'm gluten free due to celiac and wes and the staff were willing to accommodate me
Unique Mexican place they have some tacos that I hadn't tasted before staff is friendly and welcoming have only ordered to go
The tacos were delicious. The service was ok but the delicious food made up for the ok service.

Went there again last weekend. The server from last year was there, but she was behind the bar and seemed not to be obsessively checking on people (we sat at a table in the bar area). Sooo...five stars this time. The carnitas con pollo is AMAZING. I love the food here. It was nice and busy (but not too busy) with a diverse crowd on a Sunday at dinner time--that says good things to me.
Didn't feel welcomed. Facility needs some TLC. When a place nickel and dimes you for a chips and salsa refill I'll go to one of the other hundred Mexican places in town.

The food here is amazing! The service is awesome and the people are friendly. I'm from Texas living in Wyoming and this made me homesick. This is Mexican food at its finest and will definitely make the 4 hr drive to come and eat here again.

Some of the Best tamales I've ever had.  Very light, fluffy, and flavorful.  Skip the rellanos though, They were soggy with grease and had no flavor. The salsa was super flavorful and comes in an adorable tostada shell that is very tasty when all the salsa is gone. Everything else was just average in taste. Still, I would gladly come back here.
A little more expensive than expected, but it's the real deal.  Great food, but a little slow on service.  We'll be back.
For 5.99, I got 4 small tacos.  The tacos were not as tasty as I expected.  I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.

Great food and fast.
The nachos are awesome and you get your choice of beef pork or chicken. 
Their Los Gordos big burrito certainly IS big!
Awesome fish tacos
Awesome Tacos "cowboys"
The food here is one of the best mexican restaurants in Aurora.  And they have karaoke nights! You can also get ready to order tamales, red or green chili a dozen.

The food was good.  However, the service was horrible.  When we arrived we were the only ones there.  By the time we left there were 2 other tables total.  Had to ask several times for water and items were forgotten.  Will not be returning.

They recently expanded into the next space and have increased their dine-in area to include a bar (still in progress).  Also, they now serve Jamaica (pronounced ha-mic-a) a flower based drink I enjoyed in my childhood.  Very nice!
Great food! I come here regularly and am never disappointed. I recommend the chicken tacos, the breakfast burrito and the Gordos Big Burrito!
Yay found a place close to home with great food! I had the enchiladas with the huevo on top very authentic flavor hubby did fajitas which were good as well . Clean, nice staff we will be back

This is really great authentic Mexican food. The Los Gordos big burrito is the largest burrito I have ever seen and it is really tasty. They always serve you fresh chips and salsa. The horchata is always amazing and you get free refills on it.

The only thing I wouldn't get is the goat meat dish. It was really, really salty.

Awesome Mexican food treasure!  My husband enjoys their Carne Asada Tacos and I had the Tamales, I enjoyed the red over the green but they were both yummy!  I love their little salsa chip bowl and how the chips are nice and warm when they come out to you.  I am so excited that my husband took me here, the food is awesome!
Amazing food, amazing costumer service, an a great environment to eat a great meal! All the food on the menu is amazing guaranteed anything you order you will love!

went to Los Gordos for lunch and it's a tiny place next to a Old Country Buffet. 

They have a variety of Mexican favorites, even birria de chivo...

This is by far the best sushi place in town. While they have Hawaiian choices and sushi. Everything is super fresh never failed. Try paradise rolls and walu (which is basically white tuna) with plum wine, you won't be disappointed. They also serve in house coconut cake, yammy.  I am absolutely in love with the place, service and quality. 
Prices vary from $15-$25 a person for a stuffed belly! 
Love it

This is a little sushi place located in a run down strip mall. The inside looks pretty average for a sushi restaurant. The staff were all caucasian.

Due to the raving Yelp reviews on the Garlic chicken ($10), my friend ordered that. It's deep fried chicken with garlic sauce. It came with a side of rice and cold macaroni salad. The garlic chicken was alright. The sauce was definitely tasty but my friend didn't seem to be the biggest fan of it.

I go the chicken katsu ($9). I thought it was meh and I was pretty disappointed. It was very crunchy yet didn't have much taste. I wasn't a fan of the sauce it came with on the side. I've had much better katsu at other places. 

Idk if I'd try this place again... maybe for the sushi but maybe not...

I was completely surprised by this place.  Located in a strip mall, this place is unassuming and has a sign outside saying SUSHI.  Stop in and stay for a bite.  

The meals being produced out of the kitchen are flavorful and delicious.  I ordered the teriyaki beef lunch plate which came with the traditional scoop of macaroni salad and steamed rice.  The beef was super tender, thinly sliced and cooked in the house made teriyaki sauce which was sweet with a kick.  The macaroni salad was simple but so good!   

My husband ordered the garlic chicken which I regretted not getting but he was kind enough to share.  They are bite sized pieces of chicken thighs that are marinated in a garlicky sweet sauce then dredged in what I believe is corn starch and fried and then lightly tossed in a sauce.  Sooooo good!

We also shared the spam musubi which was unlike the traditional way of serving it and actually made into a roll and sliced like sushi.  Delicious.  

The restaurant is pretty small but I appreciate that they aren't stacking tables on top of each other and space them out so there's some privacy between the patrons.

Came in on a Monday night and it was pretty empty, which was a surprise as other reviewers have mentioned that this place can get a bit busy. 

We started with the oysters, which was okay. They were huge and it came with some sort of sauce (kinda bland in our opinion). They were also topped with salmon roe, which I could've done without. However, the oyster did taste really fresh. 

For sushi we had the Denver D. Roll and a spicy scallop sushi. The Denver D consisted of spicy salmon topped with shiso, lemon, & hamachi. I'm not sure if there was some sort of sauce that was in the roll itself, but this roll was very citrusy, it kind of overpowered everything else. The spicy scallop was good, if you're not a fan of spicy mayo.. I'd stay away from this.

Our favorite dish of our meal was the garlic chicken. Now this was delicious, I've never had this anywhere else. It's basically little pieces of deep fried chicken, I'm not sure if they cover it in a garlic flavored batter or if it's a garlic sauce, whatever it is. It's good. 

Service was great, everyone was super nice and welcoming. Our server was very attentive, as well as the sushi chefs, who every once in awhile checked in on us to see if we were doing okay (we weren't even sitting at the sushi bar)

2 stars for the friendly service, seasoned edamame and the Kalua pork. Negative 10 stars for the fact that the sushi chef is making rolls with HIS BARE HANDS. So gross!! Why no gloves?? We really enjoyed our visit here but will probably not be back unless they pay more attention to sanitary measures.
Everything we have tried is amazing! Garlic chicken is my favorite and the staff are super nice. I topped it all off with the banana egg rolls and omg they were ridiculously good!

We had dinner here the other night when we were in town visiting family. My aunt said that during the weekend this place gets jam packed and there can be a pretty considerable wait time. We were able to get a table right away on a Tuesday night, but it was still pretty busy for a weekday. 

It's a very small restaurant with a long sushi bar on the right side and tables and chair on the left side. Pretty traditional sushi joint atmosphere, not a ton of frills here. 

Our server came over right away and it was awesome to hear that pretty much anything except for a few kitchen items could be modified to be made gluten free. My aunt and I shared the fish tacos and I ordered a couple rolls including the Philadelphia and a tuna and jalapeño roll which had gf sauce inside. My uncle had the butterfish and my fiancé the katsu.

Everyone really enjoyed their food and I was super pleased. The Philadelphia roll was pretty standard but that tuna jalapeño packed a punch! It was awesome! The fish tacos were excellent as my aunt promised. I also got a glass of wine and I have to give them a shout out for almost filling it to the brim, now that's a glass of wine!

Service was great and food came out quickly. Price and quantity were very reasonable. I can see why this place is so popular.

Went there yesterday for the first time and loved it! It was a Friday night and we got there around 8 and was seated quickly. It is a small and cozy place with a great atmosphere, quick and friendly staff, and delicious sushi!! We had the best mussels we have ever tasted, great chief choice variety plate and customized California rolls. Will be returning

Love love love Iwayama! We have come here at least once a month for years. Love the fish tacos, jalapeño poke and the special rolls. The best is Lee's special
Coconut cake. Yum!

This is a re-visit to Iwayama Sushi.  This time I had some spam sushi (think it was called mishubi) along with the Philadelphia roll and some shrimp tempura.  For dessert, their coconut cake.  Again, everything was more than good.  Service is always the best, fish is the freshest and most importantly, I learned what spam was (see pic).  It taste like bologna.  It's cooked and served over rice, wrapped with seaweed in a little roll.  Philly roll was fresh. The tempura shrimp was lightly battered and deep-fried just to perfection.  Big pieces of shrimp.  The coconut cake was soft and moist.  Really, nothing had changed since last time I went.  Prices are a little higher than most sushi restaurants but this is also the premium sushi spot outside of Wash Park or downtown Denver.

HOLY SH*T. Phenomenal!!!!!!
We got: the Spider roll, the Po' Boy roll, the Big Nasty, usually a couple specials, the Unakyu Roll as well as some others. Hands down everything 10/10. If you're reading this right now, trying to decide- I really hope you can just trust this review and say F**K yeah let's do it. The service is very family oriented and friendly, the wait is worth it. The food is really creative. Definitely recommend the first 3 I listed. I've dined all across the United States and I can say, this is the best/ most unique 'soft crab sushi roll' I've ever had. ENJOY quality time with good peoples!!! SUPER STOKED about this place!!!

If it says anything about how we feel about the food here, we live in Westminster/Broomfield and we make the drive down to get the food here.  The Hawaiian food is probably the best we've had in Colorado and we've gone back a couple times since we found it. 

The Loco Moco is awesome and after my first bite, I was hooked.  We love their Kalua Pork and order it every time.  We've had their poke as well and as simple as it is, they do an excellent job.  It can get busy here especially on Friday nights as we learned firsthand but they get things through as quickly as they can.  Service is consistent and they are pretty friendly here.  

If you're craving some sushi or Hawaiian, stop in and try them out.

Sushi is probably my favorite food. When we moved here, I quickly did a yelp search. A sushi restaurant nearby with 4.5 stars? Count me in!

It took us a while, but we finally made it. It was a Saturday around 6 so they were busy. I wasn't sure what to expect, but the tiny interior of Iwyama wasn't what I had been anticipating. There are probably 12 tables and some bar seats - that's about it. We're lucky we got a seat.

We ordered three rolls (Philadelphia, spicy tuna, and California with mango) and the chicken teriyaki, because we had read that it was so good. 

The teriyaki came out first. It was good. Not mind blowing, out of this world good, just good. It was on par with other teriyaki I've had. The texture was really soft, which was surprising. 

The sushi was fresh, that I could tell. I think the Philadelphia was my favorite, followed by the spicy tuna. I didn't love the California with mango - it was a little spicy, which isn't really a flavor profile I expected from what I ordered. But whatever, I just wouldn't get that one again. 

Service was great. Our waiter was really nice and gregarious. No complaints there.

So why 3 stars? The sushi took a REALLY long time to come out. I know it's Saturday and they were busy and the chef was behind. That's fair enough. But going somewhere and getting half of my food and then having to wait a long time for the rest of it never sounds all that appealing to me personally.

Also, the coconut cake everyone raves about? The table next to us got the last slice. 

I know people rave about this place, and I've read plenty of reviews saying that the wait here is worth it for them. I can appreciate that! But based on my first experience, it isn't for me. My quest for amazing sushi in the area continues!

This is a pretty small restaurant very cozy. I was expecting more of an upscale but when we got here it was nice and quiet!! Quick service and attentive servers!! We got their baked mussels and simple rolls. Also tried their Ahi Tuna I thought it was okay I tried one in LA and they had more flavor and also rice. Overall not a bad experience and good food.

We live in Miami. A giant melting pot of cultures and cuisines. Yet, you will not find true Hawaiian food. And this makes me very sad. So whenever we visit the West Coast or Utah/Colorado, we make it a point to find good Hawaiian food. I 

Upon arrival in Denver, we were hungry. A Yelp search for Hawaiian food led me to this place, so we detoured slightly to get there.  We arrived just before the lunch rush and the place was empty. I mean, dead empty. I was questioning my decision to come here, but Kalua pork was calling my name.  

Our server was friendly and helpful. He set us up for sushi, but I was there for Ono grindz! We ordered a plate of Kalua pork and a plate of Kalbi. Because we're fatties, we inhaled every last morsel. Everything was delish! With the Kalbi being the overall favorite. For dessert we had a banana egg roll thingy that was fantastic!

We continued on our planned route to Moab with a full belly and a happy heart! 

Until next time!

This place is legit! The owner is from Hawaii and he has some Hawaii dishes on the menu. You will have to order the fish tacos. It is out of this world ! 
We also ordered the nigiri kaki katsu (fried oyster ) it's yummy ! I am so glad we found this little corner restaurant that has fresh authentic sushi. love it ! We will come back again for sure.

When I moved to Denver, I had no idea that finding local kine grindz was going to be so difficult. Luckily, I took a chance on these guys and got a belly full of aloha. 

Don't be deterred by the location in the burbs or being tucked in a small strip mall that has seen better days. The restaurant is small inside, too. Maybe ten tables and seating at the sushi bar. But it's clean and modern inside with some Hawaiian decor that's very welcoming. And I've always been seated immediately. 

So, the food. They have local style plate lunches - teriyaki, kalbi, katsu, loco moco, garlic chicken and more. They all come with the standard two scoops of rice and a scoop of creamy tasty mac salad. Teri is rich and delicious. The garlic chicken comes out in nugget to popcorn size pieces, very crispy and garlicky. Not on par with Side Street Inn, but that's asking for the impossible. I ate it all, even though I was full. So ono! Speaking of portions, I've only been at lunch and had to waddle out, so I can't imagine the dinner size plate! Can't wait to make my way through the entire menu. 

Of course, they also have sushi. Great combos and the ability to customize. Fish is very fresh and rolls are expertly made. I've only tried a couple items, but I'll be back for more. 

Mahalo, guys!
I really like this place until my last visit where my spicy chicken was essentially raw. Unless there is a chicken sushi I accidentally ordered I was not very happy.

I'm giving one star because I'm not allowed to leave zero. 
Me and my girlfriends went here to enjoy some food. We were sat rather quickly and given water and then watched the waiter pass us about 20 times, at least 10 minutes had passed before we were asked if we wanted to order. Keep in mind there are like 6 tables in this restaurant. We order sushi and miso soup. Our sushi comes out and our miso soup was forgotten. Lady comes up and says it's "on the house".  We pay our bill in cash and leave $64 on a $50 tab. We go next door to the liquor store before heading to our car. As we are almost to our car we hear some lady yelling at us from the patio of the bar in the same center. She has the cash in her hand and the bill and says we shorted her $7. Hmmm weird. $7 equaled the miso soup that wasn't on our bill. So anyway we give her $7 even though it makes no sense because we left $64 on a $50 tab and now all of a sudden $7 is missing from a $50 tab meaning there was only $42 left? Video tape your cash leavings for these con artists.
The food is fresh and really good. Very happy to have found this place. My new go-to place for teriyaki!
Everything we had was delicious, sushi, burger, korean bbq, miso soup, edamame! We will definately return.
This is by far our favorite local sushi restaurant. Excellent food and service. Best in Littleton!

Favorite sushi place I have found around Denver. My kids had the fried chicken, I had the pulled pork, and my husband had two orders of sushi and we were totally impressed and just ate and ate. They offer two desserts, we ordered both and those were gone within 5 minutes. It's a little hole in the wall place, but clean and the staff were very kind and attentive.

I don't want to add my glowing review for Iwayama, because then it'll be busier every time I go there.

But... Sigh... I have to.

It's a gem of a find in an unassuming strip mall in suburban Littleton.

I love the Chirashi (see photos) ... Lunch is around $14 and Dinner is $21.50.  Right in line with where it should be.

Hubby liked his Salmon Teriyaki too, and since he isn't a huge Mac Salad guy... BOOM! I get the Mac Salad!  Can't beat it.

This past time, we tried the Banana Egg Rolls for dessert.  YUM!  Bananas and White Chocolate fried in egg roll skins (they weren't wonton wrappers, more like spring rolls) and served over Vanilla Ice Cream with Chocolate Syrup.  

Yes, Please!

Try Iwayama for Lunch or Dinner... You won't be disappointed...  But promise me you won't tell anyone else how great it is!

I was expecting more from this restaurant based on all the rave reviews. Instead, it was just like the food on Big Island -- average and nothing to write home about. Maybe we are spoiled by the great sushi we get here in Boulder. 

This is a small restaurant in a nondescript strip mall. Clearly they are doing very well as it was packed and there was always someone waiting for a table. We were lucky that a table cleared just as we got there and we did not have much of a wait. 

Our miso soup was very salty. So salty that my husband who usually puts salt on everything could not finish it. We ordered two sushi rolls and da Big Kahuna burger. We ordered the regular burger, not the Juicy Lucy or the Santiago. Unfortunately the burger came out before the sushi. The burger was fine. I was looking forward to the mango salsa it is supposed to have on it but there was none. I could have asked but by this time I just wanted to get out of there and for no fault of the restaurant. Well, maybe. The table next to us was really really close to ours, and so right next to me sat a woman with a terrible cold. Every two minutes, she would blow her nose violently into a tissue which she then proceeded to open up and lay out to dry on her purse so that she could get a few more uses out of it. It didn't help that there was someone else two feet away with a very wet cough. 

The sushi was average. We ate it. We left. It was expensive for the quality of the food. The service is great and it looked like no-one was waiting very long for their food, despite being so busy. So for a small strip mall in Littleton, I think this was fine.

Amazing! This place has the best hamburger in the city! So amazingly juicy and flavorful. Grilled to perfection. The bun was fantastic with the right amount of crunch on the outside and softness inside. Loved it with the fresh avocado, lettuce, onion and tomato. The paradise rolls were also very good. The dumplings also best in the Lakewood area.

Braddah!!! Come here now! Food broke da mouth! Ono grindz! Started with a Korean salad and unagi (uni) sushi....incredible start. Longboard from Kona remind me of home. Juicy Lucy.....I betta no say anything. Amazing burger! Kalua Pork- good, but not same as Hawaii. Where my cabbage? You don't smoke it last night? 

   But, come on, get you okole here now or you missing out!

SO GOOD!  SO GOOD!  SO GOOD!  

I was craving sushi the other day and literally typed "sushi near me" into my favorite search engine and this was one of the three that came up.  Not only did they have great reviews, but having lived in Hawaii before, this one pulled at some familiar heart strings and ended up being the one I decided on.  

As I pulled up, I realized it was in a strip mall type of setting, so I thought to myself "I hope the reviews were on point and not just friends of the owner hyping it up." 

It was crowded and I figured there would be a wait for a party of two but as I gave the gentleman my name, he quoted me 5-10 minutes.  I stepped outside and started chatting with my companion waiting for our turn.  Less than 10 minutes later, my name was called and we were sat.  He kept his 5-10 minute promise!

I took at peek at the menu and was thrilled to see some of my favorites from the Islands as well as a big selection/variety of sushi, sashimi, nigiri, miso soup, etc.  We picked a few different things, placed our order and eagerly began to anticipate its delivery.  

The tables are a bit close together so me being the Chatty Cathy that I am, I struck up a conversation with the table to our left.  Come to find out, they are serious regulars and come 2-3 times a week.  As we were chatting, the server brought out a HUGE platter of deliciousness for them and said "here's your regular" before setting the bounty before them.  

A couple minutes later our deliciousness arrived and we dove in...

...the long and the short of it all?  

The reviews DID NOT LIE!  This was amazing!  Fresh.  Tasty.  Expertly hand-crafted.  So YUMMY!!!

All-in-all, this has become my favorite sushi place, so much so, that I still have yet to try any of the Hawaiian delights, lol.  

DEFINITELY CHECK THIS PLACE OUT!!!
Oh god yes!!!! The garlic chicken is to die for! Sushi is on point! The location is small, but great for a more private dining experience! I love this place

Packed on a Friday night Karma wait staff which attentive an helpful. Sashimi was fresh, crisp comma clean and well-dressed. Portioning could have been a bit bigger. Tempura was hot and crispy. Rolls well filled, tight and flavorful. Hot sake could have been warmer. Tables are a bit cramped when the place is full.

Cost was a bit above average. Value was on par with Land of Sushi , at a bit higher cost, but not as expensive as Sushi Den. Family of 4 ate for $100. We will be back.

Excellent sushi and Hawaiian food.  Their Loco Moco is the best I've tried outside of Hawai'i. Their Chirashi sushi (similar to a sushi rice bowl) is a great deal!  They pack a lot of very fresh fish into their bowl.  The Kalua Pig, Miso Butterfish, and Chicken Katsu is also excellent.  -- Actually, we've never had a bad meal here and always had friendly service.  The only downside is that the restaurant is small and can get very busy on the weekends for dinner so you might have to wait for a table.

I love sushi and so when I sopped by Iwayama Sushi last night - it was such a treat.  They are more Hawaiian than Japenese. The Sushi bombs and the Juicy Lucy are too die for!!! And you'll thank me for the garlic chicken. I had too take some of it home along with the dessert. I was stuffed!!! 5 Stats definitely!

I came here the other night with my boyfriend after seeing the great reviews online. The inside was cozy and the servers were very polite and prompt. 

We ordered some sushi (spider roll and po boy roll) and they were quite good, fell apart a little bit delicious none the less. Then we received our entrees and we were both quite disappointed. I order the pork tonkatsu, the sides that came with the dish were ok but the quality of the meat was awful. It was chewy and had tons of tendon, in hindsight I should've said something to the wait staff. My boyfriend ordered the chicken teriyaki, again the sides were ok but his chicken as slippery and chewy tasting. 

Overall, the service and sushi was great. The quality of the meat for the price you pay for entrees is not worth it. We won't be back.

This is my first visit here based on a recommendation from my friend Whisky :).  He was absolutely spot on with the quality and flavor.  My food was amazing in flavor.  I ordered the dynamite appetizer done hot in a flavorful sauce/broth with scallops, asparagus, onions and mushrooms.  It's rich so order a side of rice to accompany it.  I also had a soft shell crab roll with avocado.  It was amazing.  My only complaint and why I don't go for the 5 stars, is because my roll wasn't tight and fell apart when trying to eat with chopsticks.  I do recommend this spot and will come again.
The food is fantastic! Depending on who you get as your waiter, the service can be great or just OK. Do expect some wait times if you are going on Friday or Saturday.

When we first saw this place from the outside, I have to admit, we did not expect much.  In fact, at first, I thought that we may have come to the wrong place, since nothing indicates the Hawaiian delicacies that can be found inside.  However, they can most definitely be found here!  This place can satisfy most of your cravings from the Big Island.  The Kalua pork is simply amazing!  Garlic Chicken looks so good that it should be on a magazine cover.  Take a peak at the menu or the pictures for some of the other treats they offer, just try not to drool too much :D With some plate entrées, you may request two half portions of protein instead of one, if can't make up your mind ;)  The staff is extremely helpful and friendly.  I would highly recommend!

When I moved away from down town I thought my days of having great sushi were over, but when I found this place I was pleasantly suprised to find they had very fresh fish and outstanding sushi in general!

I was prepared to give this a three star rating, due to their salmon, not the best that I have ever had but it was decent. There ends the good, now for the bad. 

The rice was by no means sushi rice and the rolls fell apart like crazy, very bland and tasteless as well. The tuna was not cut from standard sushi fish, (before a sushi restaurant cuts a filet into slices, the fish market that sells the filet must cut it the right way; making it sushi grade fish. If you do not buy this to cut for your customers, they can get very sick.) Upon arriving I couldn't help but notice the 10-12 signs asking people to be patient on their busy nights. Seriously one will do, just fine.

Now for the ugly, the tuna was disgusting because it wasn't sushi grade. Then I got to the Unagi, after chewing for about a second I could taste the off, horrible rotten fishy taste. It was not only bad, it was dangerously old. I quickly warned my fiance not to eat it, and ended up running back and forth to the bathroom for the majority of the evening. Words cannot express how horrible the Unagi was, just writing about it makes my stomach turn.

Summary, I will never be going back there. I also question all the good reviews validity. They are in serious danger of making someone extremely sick. DO NOT EAT HERE.

Had dinner here last Wednesday on a recommendation from a business friend while on a trip to Denver. 

I had a California roll and something awesome called the Paradise Roll which was unreal and delicious. 

However, for my entree I had the Teriyaki Chicken and by the far the best Teriyaki Chicken I've ever had in my life. Not that I order it that often but it was pure taste. However, the also give you a side of Macaroni Salad which is also out of this world good, I wish I had the recipe it!

Anyways, this place is not huge so get there early but I'll be back on my next trip to the area.

I live within walking distance.

Raw-

Very good quality sushi, they take their time creating the food they serve. Which is appreciated by me. Being from the Northeast and having had off the boat to my stomach sushi and fish in general, this place is about as good as I think you can get in Colorado. 

Cooked-

I'm quite happy with the sushi I've had here, I've only had hot food once. It was delicious and well presented. 

The best nights for guaranteed access are Tuesday and Wednesday in my experience. Looking for a Friday/Saturday night good luck... They are always busy.

It's so nice to have great sushi on the southwest side of town. Chef Lee serves it up along with a touch of Aloha. That's right you can get some of your Hawaiian favorites here too. Try the butterfish when available.

The service is friendly but this place is no secret, so they are quite busy.

Their loco moco was delicious along with the Patrice roll and the low carb lollipop role. If wine, beer or soda doesn't pair well with your sushi then try a fruit punch.

Its great either way.

No one greeted us when we walked in.  A couple waitresses motioned us to walk their way in order to be seated.  Food is excellent without a doubt.  Our service was really good.  Our waitress checked on us at the right time each time.  The sushi chefs must've been having a bad day.  Everyone behind the sushi counter had a stoic and almost unwelcoming look.  Not sure if they were concentrating too hard or whatever. Everything we ordered was excellent.  Everything from sushi to salad and everything else was good.  This place is definitely good but a further drive for most people.  As many people said prices are definitely on the higher end.  I'm stuck in the middle cause the beginning and end of meal wasn't memorable  but we might make another go around in the distant future.
I've had many chances to go back and have come to realize this is one of the best restaurants in the south suburbs of Denver.

Tried it out Friday night.  Little disappointing. They were out of somethings. I don't get a full sushi menu up here so I was looking fwd to a few items. I would have thought on a Friday night they wouldn't be out of anything yet. They were a little busy and our food took a while. I was really hungry so every minute seemed like an hour. I'll give them another try some time. Waiter was nice. Food was great but like I said I was hoping for more.

Wow! Lee and team do it BEST. A+ quality fish, specialty sauces, art, creativity and Lee's culinary expertise will inspire even the most discriminating sushi connoisseur. Wish we didn't live so far away from this Littleton gem (Larkspur for us) or we would be weekend regulars! Aloha and Mahalo  to Lee and the Iwayama Sushi Bistro Team! Yelpers will love this place!
Dan & Roberta

This place was just ok. After reading all of the rave reviews, my husband and I went for dinner this past weekend when we were in the neighborhood. The place is a little hole-in-the-wall, not recommended for a date night because none of the tables have any privacy whatsoever and the overhead lights were really bright! The sushi was ok, definitely not the best I've had in town, but the service was pretty bad. Granted, it was a Saturday evening so they were busy, but our order of 4 rolls took over 30 minutes to get to our table. It was tough watching tables who were sat after us get their dinner way ahead of ours. When our rolls were delivered, it was unclear which was which and they weren't pointed out to us, which as a sushi lover, has never happened to me. I thought naming all the rolls on the platter was pretty standard. Anyhow, we were pretty disappointed with the whole experience and won't be back. I don't get what the fuss is about!
Excellent Hawaiian and Japanese food

I'm sorry this place was disappointing, after all the high yelp reviews, I thought how can you go wrong?  I ordered the garlic chicken which everyone on Yelp raved about but what I received was a raw mess of what I guess could be garlic chicken. The chicken was very under cooked, I felt like I would get sick, which I didn't by some miracle. But undercooked chicken, wow, sorry but that's where I draw the line.

It was ok. We wanted to try this place because of the great reviews. We got there and we're immediately seated. However, the waitress failed to give us the specials of the day. No biggie. We started with a California roll, rainbow roll, and spicy ahi roll as well as gyoza. Prior to ordering this, we asked the waitress what fish was on the rainbow roll and was nicely advised that all different types on fish and that was why it was called a rainbow roll. HAHAHA.
We got our apps. Again, it was okay. We then ordered our main dishes. The pork katsu was dry and chewy. The garlic chicken wasn't crispy enough and there wasn't enough sauce. The mac salad didn't include what you would find in a normal hawaii mac salad. It was basically noodles and mayo. We did need to ask for additional utensils for the loco. It was nice and I really had high hopes for this place, but I don't think we'll be returning.

After years of living in Littleton, my husband and I were looking for a new place to eat and we stumbled across Iwayama Sushi.  It was a Saturday night and very busy, but we were able to get a table after waiting only 5-10 minutes.

I couldn't decide what to eat and I was starving (minimal breakfast and no lunch) so I decided to order two things to try - the garlic chicken and the daily special, a burrito made with Kalua pork.  My husband is a big sushi fan so he went with a variety of rolls and nigiri.

I LOVED both of my dishes!  The garlic chicken was juicy and extremely flavorful, and the macaroni salad that came along side it was great.  The Kalua pork burrito was so good - the pork had that awesome smoky flavor and was very tender.  The servings were huge and there was plenty for leftovers.  My husband really enjoyed his sushi and commented on how fresh the fish tasted.  

The service was friendly and the atmosphere was nice.  We appreciated the Hawaiian hospitality and plan to come back often.

Small portions. Poor service that took a long time. Owner and sushi chef appeared to favor repeat customers. 
Great decor, very modern and ample lighting. 
Decent taste for sushi but Mr. Sushi about ten minutes away had mich bigger portion!

The customer service leaves you to hope for more. Unreliable place, it has been numerous times when we would plan to use them for dinner and then be told that no take outs that night. Today I called in to confirm that they are open tonight and the food can be ordered to go, then I called back 4 hrs later to place my order and was informed that there will be no take outs. We had people coming over for dinner.... Good food, but service simply SUCKS!!! and they cannot be trusted for any occasion.
The sushi was great, but they have the best fish tacos I have ever tasted. Very subtle flavors in the taco that mixed together to create an amazing taco. They were a hit with everyone at the table.
8:40 and they are closed for the evening.. Business hours till 9pm posted in the window. Enough said
I've tried all sushi places in the Denver metro -this one wins top spot! Paradise roll and rainbow pesto shashimi were my favs!!

I've had sushi all over the globe and this is as good as it gets right here. The creativity of dishes and the freshness of fish is outstanding for the mile high city (thank you Fed Ex!!!).  Absolutely love the cultural Hawaiian feel. We drive past at least a dozen decent sushi joints to come here. Would love to see ownership add tables and even better, put a location down here in the HR "bubble".
Unique! Not your average sushi place. They are hawaiian! So you can get delicious pork dishes and tacos and then your sushi choices with some twists. Highly recommend the pulled pork!

Have to start off by saying that this is the best sushi and Hawaiian BBQ restaurant in Littleton! We went on a Friday night and waited nearly an hour to get a table. It was definitely worth the wait.

Our order:
2 orders of Walu sashimi (the best dish since we had to order another one after devouring the first serving)
1 Fransisco Roll
1 Italian Stallion Roll
1 Rainbow Sashimi
1 Gyoza
1 Loco Moco

Sushi was very fresh and just as good as Sushi Den! Yes, that's correct, Sushi Den. The fish was fresh and the creations are unique. Like the Walu Superwhite Tuna sashimi topped with ginger pesto and ponzu. The Italian Stallion had spicy tuna with avocado, asparagus and tempura shrimp. Aside from the sushi, the Loco Moco was great as well. Tender ground beef patty with a perfectly fried egg and savory gravy over rice. 

This place is small and on Friday and Saturdays make sure you arrive early because it gets packed quick. If you're in a hurry, don't bother paying a visit. They are a staff of 4 with only 2 people running the kitchen. Chef Lee has a very cool and relaxed attitude towards his dinner service. If you're lucky to get a table, sit back and be patient because the reward is incredibly delicious.

The food here is amazing and it never disappoints. The staff is always friendly and on point, no matter how busy they are. Their Garlic Chicken and Coconut Cake is a MUST every time we visit!  Try it! Your tummy will thank you!

Ok so it's in a strip mall so you may miss it but boy is it great. The owner Lee is Hawaiian and instills and island fusion in his sushi and entrees. There is no better sushi in the Denver suburbs. It's small so there may be a wait. But it's worth it.

I've only had the kal bi so far and.... Oh man, I did not leave a single piece of food on my plate when I was done
The Mac salad was amazing and the beef was marinated to perfection! Definitely recommend this place
Everything was so good. The coconut cake was a big hit with my son. The service was top notch.

I can't believe I lived down the street from this place for six years before trying it out.. I weep for all the delicious sushi and fish tacos I missed out on eating.  Really great sushi... And no "for the burbs" qualifier needed.  Fish tacos are super delish.  And their specials.. Ever changing and always good.  

My husband also loves their special cakes.. I never have room to try them.  

Add in super friendly and welcoming staff.. It's great!
Love this place!  Delicious, high quality sushi.  In addition to sushi they have great steak and awesome burgers so if not everyone in your family likes sushi it is a great place to go for all.

******
UPDATE 10/23/15  My wife and I have been back many times.  This place is awesome.  Our favorite off the sushi menu is the Danielle roll.  Today we had that plus Lee's Special Spare Ribs.  Wow, these were amazing.  I'm not on Facebook and vowed never to join, but I just might have to so I know the next time Lee makes these.  Fantastic meal as always. I would add a sixth star if I could.

UPDATE (9/12/14): Well here it is only two weeks later and I have already been back.  I just had to try the fish tacos (see the picture in the photo section that someone posted).  All I can say is delicious!  They had a little bit of kick to them and the fish was wonderful.  

I foolishly ordered some sake nigiri too, because it was so good last time; it came first and was fantastic.  I was beyond stuffed, the taco plate is plenty (3 tacos), but the sushi was too irresistible.  I will certainly be coming again soon.

Original review:
I am a sushi novice, however I know what I like, and I really like Iwayama!  I can't believe we haven't been before, it is so close to home.  Damn it....I have been missing out for too long.  My wife and I came for lunch today and I can't wait to come back.  The food was delicious and quite reasonably priced.  I am already looking at their menu thinking of what we should try next time.

Best sushi!  I always made the trek to sushi den and discovered this place in my neighborhood. You will be very satisfied. The coconut cake is to die for -so save room after your dinner. What a gem!! Love love this place.

Really great food. Skeptical when it came to the sushi, but very flavorful.  Loved the hawian pork. Not bad prices either. Even brought my kids a complimentary slice of coconut cream cake.  Will be back

Great, fresh sushi along with some inspired chef's creations (rolls). Aside from that, the Juicy Lucy burger and the coconut cake are fantastic. Plus, the owner and the staff are very friendly and efficient.

Holy moly this place is delicious! The shopping center is very deceiving but inside you get great food and wonderful service. I've never had Hawaiian food before my visit but I can't believe I've been missing out on it. I only tried one sushi roll but it was delicious as well. Can't wait to go back! :)
This is so good--friendly, authentic, delicious, unpretentious neighborhood haunt.  Ono!

We got sushi, spring roll app, and the Hawaiian pork plate entree.  We also had the coconut cake for dessert.  Everything was good but I guess I was expecting more with such great yelp ratings. I think the cake was the best part.

For years my gf would beg me to eat sushi... She is ALWAYS craving sushi. I HATE sushi and generally dislike Asian food... But I couldn't take anymore of her begging and pleading so I found this place on google maps because it was close.... OH MY FU*K!!!!! I have never had food that gave me the emotions and gratification this place served up. I tried a sushi salmon roll with jalapeño and cream cheese, it made me cream cheese in my pantaloons.. FINALLY found sushi I will gladly devour every night and day if I could. We had grilled muscles and edamame that made me call my mame and recommend this place IMMEDIATLY! And lastly the fish tacos I had were better than the FUC*ING fish Jesus served up on that one day where he fed people fish... GOOD GOD I'm in love I highly doubt I will ever find a place that can beat the flavors and experience this food gave me this afternoon. Might get a tattoo of the places name on me just to rep it for life...

Oh man. One of my new favorite places ! 

The Kalbi is the BEST. The marinade is tangy and it comes with rice and macaroni salad - the macaroni goes so well with the meat! 

I also had a California roll, which was good, They make their California Roll the standard way with the crab salad instead of the bland crab stick. Their Shrimp Tempura roll was perfect. Most Japanese restaurants will serve the tempura cold, but this was warm and delicious! 

The service was good and lunch time on a week day isn't too bad!

Lee makes some delicious food and his sushi is wonderful.  The Walu is a must.  White fish with a ginger topping.  It melts in your mouth...so good.  Our favorite rolls are Italian stallion ; shrimp tempura, fried asparagus and spicy tuna and the Francesca roll spicy tuna with jalapeño tuna on top!  Lee makes a fabulous cheeseburger. I know cheeseburger at a sushi restaurant but it's really delicious.  You also MUST have his coconut cake.  It's dense but not rich.  It's truly amazing.

This is some great sushi.  Highly recommended if you are in the area.  Don't think twice based on the location.  You will not be disappointed.  I gave the chef.. who is the owner... free reign and he made a very unique roll with tempura asparagus, jalapeño, topped with beef teriyaki, crab, and fried onions.  It was awesome!!  He also created a very unique lunch special that was delicious.  I'm going back whenever I'm in town.

Paradise Roll is to die for! 
Oh my god! It just melts in your mouth. A must try!!!

Rainbow Roll was also yummy. 

Ahi Jalapeño was also delish. Nice and light. Just wish the jalapeños had some spice to it, would've been perfect. 

Italian Stallion was is amazing. Perfect crunch and flavors all rolled into one.

Lastly, we finished off with some Coconut Cake, which was perfect! Moist and not sweet at all. 

Overall, this place is amazing. Delicious food with amazing service. Will be back for sure! :)

Best sushi in Colorado. Hands down. Even on their busiest days, they are well worth the wait. Me and my boyfriend will be making the commute back here to eat once we move out of Littleton. It's that good!

Excellent pricing, good tasting sushi, lots of variety, great service. Environment could be better, as far as available seating and set up, but that's not really something they can control right now. Otherwise, I give it an A plus.

This place is a gem, and an especially remarkable find in an area dominated by chains. 

We've been coming for years and are happy to see how much Chef Lee's business has grown.

My favorites: bahama mama sushi roll, garlic chicken, and coconut cake.  Everything I've eaten here has been great.

I am a taco lover and connoisseur and believe that the fish tacos at Iwayama are as close to perfection as I've tasted. After consuming 1000s of fish tacos in my life, these delicate taste explosions are even better than I could have dreamed of a fish taco tasting. 

The fish was phenomenal. Light, crispy, flavorful, perfect. The salsa was the perfect balance of sweet and spicy. The sauce added texture and flavor without overpowering the dish. Ono!

The staff is friendly and the interior is clean and modern. A hui hou Big Kahuna!

The best sushi for the price in denver.  Don't let the random name or Hawaiian name throw you. 

I'm a seasoned sushi lover, and this place is a great find. Amazing sushi for a very reasonable price. In my honest opinion, it beats sushi den, rice, and all those uppity places. 

It's small, so get there either early or late or else you will wait a while. 

My only problem? It's closed on Sunday.

This small restaurant, tucked in a corner of a strip mall, has great food. 

Our family's Kalua Pork and Chicken Katsu were excellent- the Katsu was light and fried perfectly, and the Pork was full of flavor. The Teri Beef had a great taste and fell apart in your mouth.

I had the Loco Moco, and it's the best I've had outside of Hawaii (Da Kitchen, in Maui, might be the only better I've had). Often restaurants just brown some meat and toss a scoop of barely heated brown gravy on top; Iwayama mixed the gravy throughout (so you don't have dried rice on the bottom) and put a real, honest-to-goodness tasty burger on top. If they pay attention to the little things on a dish this simple, it speaks well to the rest of their menu.

We did not try the sushi but all agreed we'd go back.

This place gets busy- on a Tuesday night it was full with a line outside the door, so plan accordingly. Even with that, we had friendly, fast service.

This is acceptable for this side of town... But I have to be honest.  The sushi was ok.  The hawaain food was ok.  We had the kalbi beef... Overpriced for the meat u get (I rather have really Korean kalbi)... Rice and Mac salad on the side, we ordered musubi... Well what do u expect when u order spam musubi anyways.  I would much rather go to Denver for my sushi, salamon, scallop , tuna and yellow tail were decent.   Anyways..  this place was PACKED the entire 2 hours we were there.  Not really good for a big group at all.  Had fried bananas for dessert... $6... Really?  Wasn't even a full banana.  Doubt we''ll be back.  Not worth wait and cost for ok food.

Yelp came through again, we were in that area and looking for a place for dinner. Lots of good reviews on Yelp. Seated right away, orders taken and food served promptly. I ordered the Sort Ribs, my wife ordered Kalua Pork. Came with the traditional two scooped of white rice and great macaroni salad. Both meals were very good. We were pretty full but had to try the Coconut Cake that so many on Yelp raved about, it was as good as described. It's too bad this is so far away fro where we live but I'm sure we will return.

This is the best sushi in Littleton! Every time I'm in the area I have to stop in here and eat. Worth the drive from anywhere, but if you live in the area... Well I'm jealous! 

You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. They really know their sushi, and they have some twists you won't find in your average sushi restaurant. And the prices are very reasonable.

It is entirely possible that I can survive in Denver now after discovering this local place! While I don't recall ever having loco moco served in a bowl, it is about as perfect as I can remember and the Kalua pork was amazing as well. Lee, the owner, had just smoked some pork and shared it with us. He also shared some Portuguese Bean Soup. No ka oi! My tummy left satisfied eating local grindz.
Went back the next day with colleagues from Canada and locals from California who know good Hawaiian food. We all went and while we left SUPER full, we couldn't wait to visit again. My colleagues have since returned and said that of all the food they ate while in Colorado, this was NO KA OI!
Mahalo to Lee and the staff. Can't wait to go back!

Wow, we drove from Ridgway, CO looking for something different! We hit the jackpot! We had very nice greeting and waiting a few minutes. This place was packed. We didn't know what to order but the table beside us told they came here every Friday night. We ordered what they suggested and it was delicious. We took a piece of coconut cake to the hotel for dessert later! Best sushi we've had in Colorado!

Great place with very friendly staff and the combination of sushi and Hawaiian food is interesting but it really works.  Small and intimate setting. If there's a wait they'll encourage you to grab a drink at Chatfield's and they'll call you when your order is ready.  Great customer service.

Though at first I was nervous to introduce this establishment to my frens, I am glad I did.  Here was why I was nervous, a couple of weeks back before the event scheduled, I called Iwayama.  The caller who received the call, told me that THEY DO NOT ACCEPT RESERVATION ON A FRIDAY OR SATURDAY evenings.

But I told her, expect a PARTY of 12 to 15 people on Sarurday March 19th 2011 for a 6:30pm dinner.  Then when I arrived on that evening, from what I heard from my friends, the waitstaff told them, there was NO reservation made under my name.  HELLO???...

Okies, I settle my cool, and go with the flow despite still being all "nervous".  

The group ordered the food.  The kitchen was indeed swamped with all orders from other patrons that evening.  Man this place is indeed jam-PACKED.

From what I could recall I had these for my dinner @ this establishment :

*  Shiromi Nigiri
*  Kani Nigiri
*  Kaki Katsu Nigiri
*  Kaibashira Nigiri
*  Kaiba-Mayo Nigiri
*  Unagi  Nigiri
*  Tobiko Nigiri
*  Eggplant Nigiri

Specialties of the House
*  Ahi Jalapeno
*  Fish Tacos
*  Baked Mussels 
*  Tai @ NZ Sea Bream and Fish Taco.

I was slightly dissapointed when they ran out of some of my favorites, but oh well life goes on.  Another slight disappointment, some of the Nigiri or the food I ordered, have more "citrus" dressing or lime or lemon after taste.

All in all, though things went well.   Some of the food came out on a timely manner but some last minute decision food took slightly slower but I can understand why that evening.  One of my frens who is Japanese was indeed pleasantly surprise with regards to this establishment on what they had offer.  Even one of the waitstaff is Japanese.

Thank you Iwayama, your waitstaffs and crew for making that evening, enjoyful for my friends and I to have a feast at your establishment.

Still as good as ever. They are so packed on a Saturday night and they still had time to make my favorite musubi. I love their sushi and food in general. I really didn't like the salad too much but it's salad so don't waste your calories for the day on salad. Get the sushi or the spicy chicken. I haven't tried the Loco Moco yet but I will have to update when I hit that. The coconut cake is so good but I forgot to get some to go. :-(   The young guy that works there is really nice and you can tell he is a hard worker. I like it's a family owned restaurant kind of a feel and I like to support the local food scene. Keep up the good job!

What a great find!  Who knew there would be such good food hidden in a remote suburb of Denver?!  Right when you step in the door you know this place is legit--it's ran by this happy Hawaiin gentleman, ready to suggest yummy selections from his menu.  

One of such suggestions is the fish tacos.  Best I've ever had!  Fresh, juicy, and an absolutely perfect combination of texture and flavor with the mango salsa and avocado.  I had the kalua pork and garlic chicken combo lunch plate the next day and that was amazing too!  It's a passage to the islands I tell ya!  

I look forward to this place when my work requires me to travel to Denver... have gone back for lunch every time I'm in town.
Dinner tonight was short ribs and garlic chicken. We enjoyed both entrees. Service was excellent.

This place is good.  The Kahlua pork is awesome and a big portion.  Sushi is decently spicy, and I do like spicy.  The Big Nasty roll is very tasty.  All in all, food is excellent and the servers are nice.  Surprising find in a little corner shopping center.

I have been living in Littleton my entire life and never knew this place existed. What a shame!!! All of the staff members were extremely friendly, the food was amazing, and the coconut cake.... there are no words. That is simply the best cake I have ever had in all of my life. Yummmm. I will be going back for sure!

When we first moved to Denver, this was one of the first sushi places we tried, and we loved it.  The food was awesome, the service was great and it was close to home.  The prices were right, too.

The last time we went, we were disappointed.  The garlic chicken everyone seems to rave about was almost inedible.  It was like eating deep fried chicken fat - chewy and soaked in grease.  It just had a bizarre texture that I can't really put into words - suffice to say, we weren't fans.  And, we found that the sushi rolls we got (basics, always spicy tuna and salmon) were lacking and very light on the actual fish.

So, it wasn't a good experience.  But, I wanted to go back again, give it another try.  So, we did just that tonight.

Unfortunately, the experience was just as bad.  We had a spicy tuna, spicy salmon and a tuna roll.  The spicy rolls were seriously lacking in fish.  Like, there was hardly ANY fish in them.  I don't expect them to have fish pouring out of them, but the avocado and cucumber were 80% of the roll, and that's not okay.  To make matters worse, I kept getting bites of sinew and gristle, as though they aren't cutting the fish properly.

Shortly after we started eating, our waiter came over and asked how things were.  I gave him an "ehhhhhhh" and the wavering hand that indicates things are only so-so, and his response was, "Great, glad everything is good" and then he walked away.  So, basically, asking for the sake of asking, but not even listening to the response.

When another waitress came over to take our plates, she also asked how things were.  I said, "Honestly?  Not great."  And, I told her how we were trying to give it one more shot, and how little fish had previously been in the rolls, etc.  I also pointed out that I had gristle in my fish and that there was a chunk of it on my plate that she could even see.  She apologized and said, "Well, I hope you come back again so we can make it up to you!"  And, I said, "That's what /this/ visit was."

No discount, no concern over the issues we had, just "Oh, so sorry, come back again!"

We won't be.  I didn't expect them to comp my check, or anything, but even just having the manager show some concern (I don't even think the waitress told him that we had complained)...

The prices are right and the atmosphere is nice, but I like some fish in my sushi rolls, and this place is straight stingy.

pro tip: get the breakfast burritos for there even if you want to take em to go because they make em HUGEEEE when you eat in.

and get the agua fresa - it's so refreshing and delicious!

It was a cold wintery night.  Traffic was bad, really bad, en route to the Vintage Theater.  So bad, in fact, we missed our dinner reservation elsewhere.  We arrived at the Vintage about 40 minutes ahead of curtain, and Lo, what do our eyes behold?  A gorgeous neon sign guiding us to La Morena.

Seizing upon a final opportunity to get something into our frazzled systems before the show started, we enter and found La Morena dead empty.  A group of servers jumped to attention and seated us- we explained we need to eat fast.

About 14 seconds later, everyone squealed with delight and relief when they presented the frazzled driver (yours truly) with a margarita.  The chips and salsa were also served immediately and wow!  Was that salsa good!

We enjoyed an order of the Quesadillas, big juicy things stuffed full of chicken and cheese and topped with all the trimmings.  They were delicious! We also enjoyed two orders of the barbacoa plate, tender cheek beef simmered forever in the most delicious sauce, served with rice and beans and guacamole.  Everything was served in GIANT platters!

In 35 minutes, we dined, had a couple margs, and made it to the play in time for curtain.  Thank you La Morena!  This was a save, and a truly delicious meal!

Stopped by for a bite while my clothes were at the laundromat next door. I'm new to the community, but I could tell that this restaurant is a vital part of it. I ordered a bean burrito and was pleased. The green chile was flavorful and guacamole, authentic. The waitress was very accommodating--I'm vegan, so finding something on the menu was a bit of a challenge, but we worked it out. Quick, friendly service, and great food. My only complaint is that the music was a little loud.

Delicious! Authentic Mexican food. The salsa served with the chips has a little kick but is full of flavor. We had the shrimp cocktail and it was perfect. I had the medium combination plate (which there is nothimg medium about that plate) with a ground beef burrito and crispy chile relleno with beans and rice all smothered in delicious pork green chile. My husband had their crispy relleno plate and loved it. Their lemonade is freshly made.

Their service is great. They were very attentive to us and were very friendly. 

They have karaoke every night and although it's loud, it's a nice atmosphere. Plus, if you want to learn Spanish,  I can think of no better way to enjoy learning.
What a terrible place. I don't recommend this place to anyone. Food is weak. Staff is racist. Restrooms are filthy. Go elsewhere, trust me.
I had a snack on a Sunday afternoon and it was 60% filled with customers.  The Sope de Pollo was pretty good.  The service was great.  La Morena seemed like a very authentic Mexican restaurant.
Great food. Music was way too loud. Some people like to go out to eat to relax and talk to each other..could hardly hear. Would be a 5 star based on food alone.

Fantastic food, very flavorful and delicious. The service was great and we were sat as soon as we walked in for lunch.  Music was a bit loud but tolerable and both my boyfriend and I had cartilage in our chicken burritos but were easy enough to pick out.

Came late on a weekday and the restaurant was almost empty, understandable for a week day. But that didn't slow the service whatsoever. I love Mexican food and La Morena exceeded my expectations. From the second we walked in the door I was so happy we chose to eat there. The service was friendly, and attentive but not breathing down my neck :). Food is amazing and portions are fantastic. We will be back!!

La Morena is a solid middle class Mexican restaurant. All their prices are similar to the almost high end Mexican joints. 

I order Carnitas plate with one side egg. It was a generous looking plate due to the famous trick by using large plates. 

My wife order very fresh Menudo, so fresh you can still smell the cow! Most people gag at the smell but not me. 

Fresh good homemade tortillas came with our order. They make them only on the weekends according to the menu. 

For the price they are not very competitive to the higher end Mexican restaurants. It is a good restaurant just sadly I know better ones in the price range

We decided to give La Morena a try because we wanted an authentic Mexican meal. Bad choice. Loud music, mediocre guacamole, tasteless refried beans and bones in the chicken burrito (it's clear they slow cooked an entire chicken and missed the icky stuff when picking it). We were skeeved out for hours afterward. Never again.
Very good food but it you don't know a little Spanish it can be a challenge to order.

Nice comfortable place!The service was very nice and the food was great quality.The prices are pretty fair for nice portions.The food is slow to come out and parking is more difficult than you would like.

Food was good. The salsa was too hot, for me. I must agree with the other reviews regarding the loud music. Would return if/when they turn down the overbearing music. During my visit, Mariachi Azteca was playing (for the first part of the meal). It was wonderful. Then came the Automix & YIKES. Is someone nearly deaf? Back to the food. It was pretty good and priced right. Enjoy.

Wish I could give this place more stars, but the loud music on a weekday is too much for me.  If you are dining alone it just MIGHT be fine.   If you come with a friend don't expect to make conversation because you'll end up losing your voice by the time you leave; that's how loud the music is.  Other than this, the waitress was very nice.  Food was good, just need to work on ambience.

I've been going to this restaurant for awhile and I've always been satisfied with the food and their portions. Unfortunately, they recently jacked up their prices without changing anything about the establishment.
The atmosphere is pretty irritating. They either play Hispanic soap operas or music videos and the TVs are on full blast. The waiters are less than attentive most of the time and you'll find yourself flagging someone down for a drink refill.
All in all, the food is good with an undesirable atmosphere. Could be worse.

Me and my partner love coming to this restaurant, we love the margaritas, huge plates of food and so many options. The environment is very entertaining but I do wish they didn't play the music soooo loud! This has turned into a fun place to go to with my friends after work. I definitely recommend this place.

Are you kidding me? I love this place. I had the Taqueria rancheros and my boyfriend has paella (seafood and spicy rice). Everyone was so nice and friendly. This is gonna become our regular place. Oh... And they have fried ice cream and a full bar.

lacks flavor i ordered the chorizo enchiladas and it was nasty in fact i did  taste the flavor of the meat but whatever seasoning they used it was lots of pepper/ i returned it for the chicken and it lacked flavor although it was tender/the waitress was not attentive to our table /just not impressed and wasted calories

This place is horrible.  8 people for lunch.  15 minutes into sitting down we got our order taken.  1 hour later we got our food (not all at same time) - appetizer last!  Worst thing......it was cold!!!  Then, when we complained to all employees NO ONE offered to do anything except to say "lo siento".   Go somewhere else.

Decided to get dinner before seeing a play at the Fox Theater. This place was empty on a Saturday night at 7 o'clock....not a good sign. Chips and COLD salsa were served, they were just okay. Waitress was wearing faded, ripped jeans and a sweatshirt...gave me the impression that she just walked in off of Colfax and threw on an apron to serve us. For being the ONLY ones in the restaurant, they still managed to bring out my food without part of what I ordered. The food was really inexpensive (two dinners and 1 soda for around $17), so I got what I paid for.....mediocre.
I live within walking distance and have been happy everytime I have eaten here. I have brought friends and family and everyone has been happy.

Ordered delivery using the Eat24 app. Food came fast and hot. All my special requests for well done this and sauces on the side were accommodated nicely. I can't tell you how many times restaurants have completely ignored those requests lol Food was really tasty. I will definitely be ordering from them again.
**Update**
Continue to order from them and they are still delivering super fast. Was not a fluke the first time lol This is becoming my regular spot especially when I am hangry and want to hurt someone. My favorites so far are their breakfast sandwiches and their chile rellenos.
There is more going on here than I realized.  This food is yummy.  I've ordered from every part of the menu and everything is on point.

Barricuda's is a bar that is located in the same small strip mall as 7-11 and also across the street from Whole Foods. 

My husband and I came on a Saturday night around 8:50 pm. We made an order through eat24.com for some late night eats and food to take with us tomorrow at the Botanic Garden for a nice picnic. Anyways, a minute or two right before we arrived, we got a phone call from Barricuda's letting us know that our food was ready for pick up (that is very nice of them to call us). This is what we ended up purchasing:

Quesadilla, $6.95 prior to tax- I like that the sour cream, guacamole and salsa was packed separately and individually. I really liked the guacamole, it tasted fresh and creamy. Although the quesadilla was consumed the next day, I thought it tasted pretty standard to other quesadillas but good. There was plenty of cheese filling between the tortilla and a large order for one person to eat or to share. 

6 Chicken Wings with Ranch Dressing, $6.95 prior to tax- My husband picked teriyaki chicken (you can choose sweet and spicy chili honey chipotle barbecue, Shiracha or buffalo). These wings were good and tender. The sauce was sweet and savory. 

Tofu Melt with a side of potato salad, $8.95 prior to tax- Fried tofu with a honey chipotle barbecue sauce with grilled mushrooms, onions, peppers, tomatoes and melted cheese on sourdough. I really enjoyed the seasonings of the barbecue sauce mixture of the added toppings. This tofu was a little on the soft/ soggy side and not as crunchy as I had hoped. But considering that I ate this the next day, it is understandable. I really enjoyed this sandwich. It was really good and flavorful, but a little on the spicy side because of the peppers. The serving size of the 2 halves was a really good portion. 

I also really enjoyed the potato salad. It was creamy and had good flavor. The size of the potato size was more than enough for one person. Overall, this meal with the side is an excellent value and really filling. 

Half Pounder with a side of potato salad, $8.95 prior to tax- My husband ordered this and also went with a side of potato salad (you can choose macaroni salad or fries instead of the potato salad). This sandwich was quite a mighty size that is more than enough for one person. The meat was tender and what you would want in a beefy sandwich. 
------------------------------------
(Total= $31.80 prior to tax) 

When we came into Barricuda's, pick up was easy and simple, especially since we had already paid in advance (I recommend you sign up for an account with eat24 so that you can get weekend coupon codes to save some money on your next purchase). 

Overall, we really enjoyed our meals the night of and the next day. Food was perfectly made with the right amount of seasonings and flavor (although not healthy and is greasy/ oily). I would come back here for a late night meal and maybe even consider staying for a drink ($7 for all day pitchers of beer and $3.50 well drink specials every day until 1 am).

The bartender, Morgan, is fantastic. Great drink specials. Very friendly hostess, waitstaff, and clientele. Good jukebox. Very clean bathroom.  Had the Barracuda bites: fish n chips. Delicious. One tragic fail: they won't turn up the jukebox because of some corporate rule. I get it (Tech Nine), but srsly, we can respect each other's bad taste. Hehe.

The lead bartender, Charles, is very knowledgeable of mixology. Very friendly, funny staff. Family place until 10 pm. Don't put Peaches on the jukebox during the day.

On a recent trip to Denver I read about this place being open super late so I kept it on my radar while my boyfriend and I were in town. We ended up coming for dinner right around sunset and found parking right in front of the door. Our waitress was very down to earth and had a good vibe. The seating around the bar was completely full and seemed like it was all locals. We sat in a comfy booth and read all of the free magazines set out by the door. My bf and I shared potato skins minus the bacon for a vegetarian version. I had the biggest burrito of my life that took me 3 days to eat full of veggies and covered in veggie red sauce that had the perfect amount of spice. The cheese enchilada was killer and the tostada was the best I've ever had. I would go here all the time if I lived in Denver. Amazing prices!

SO I know what some of you may be thinking, 5 stars for Barricuda's? This is a perfect example of judging a place based on what you want and what you expect. 

Now you're not going to go to Barricuda's for fine dining... but the dining is more than fine! This is my go to Denver brunch with a big group (well, not huge, but usually about 6). There is rarely a wait, which is a huge factor (I like SAMs, but man, am I tired of crowded places. We always pick a table in the back corner, and we get served by either Jules or Scuba Steve. Both are complete sweethearts, do a great job with all of our wonky orders, do their job with a smile and are completely personable with their patrons. 

The place is pretty dimly lit (THANK GOD) for any rough Saturdays or Sundays. The have bottomless mimosas, full bar, and bloody mary's that aren't so thick that you feel stuffed from just one. 

It's GREAT diner-esque food, and with the lack of a wait, the food pricing, and the bada$$ staff, I will continue to go back. It's sorta becoming a tradition. OOOOOOH...Barricuda!
Love this place! I order through grubhub frequently and I've never been disappointed. The food is great and always comes fast.

Hey Mitch, this review is just for you. I've been a regular at Barricuda's since 2009. Tonight when you tried to kick me out, I was waiting to pay my tab. Patiently. As I had been for 30 minutes. And I was waiting for a brand new server, with whom I had been oh so very patient with all night, to cash us out.
