But you felt the need to roll your eyes at me when I said I was just waiting for my card. And then yelled at me for trying to literally just paying my tab. Do you want me to pay in the parking lot? Because I walked out before 1:55, having signed my tab and yet I know for a fact having been in the bar industry since 2000 that your behavior was 100% unwarranted and that you didn't need to be a douchebag about it! Hope you get your shit together, the service industry really isn't that hard.
Great place for a night out, karaoke and food. Large selection for all meals plus extra snacks and breakfast from 12am until 4am
Great food and quick service although I do consider adding how spicy each entree is. My friend does not like spicy foods and had no idea it was spicy.

I really had a bad time there today. My partner Chuck had just passed away in hospice. on my way home I needed to get something to eat. when I got there all the parking out front was for delivery drivers. I got into it with one of the drivers and cussed him out. Then I parkedand went in and the punk bartender wouldnt serve me food . I told him I would never come back and he just laughed at me and said who needs you? I have been there when we were the only customers there. I guess you guys are busY ENOUGH NOT TO NEED CUSTOMERS.
Y

I have never had a bad experience with Barricudas! I always order through grub hub but they are by far the fastest and tastiest mexican food I've ordered through that app. Today, they delivered within 20 minutes which is almost unheard of! There breakfast burritos and their dinner burritos and enchiladas are amazing!

I've seen this place 100 time and finally decided to try it after seeing it on many late night eat top 10 list. I ordered a 1/2 burger. The place is surely a dive bar but I got to take a sneak at the kitchen on my way to the restroom and it looked clean. They have tons of tvs and a couple pool tables. The staff was nice but not over the top or anything. No worries, they're good. My girl got a salad instead of fries that came with the burger. The salad was a perfect size. I didn't like that the hamburgers were made with preformed patties. I did like how crisp and fresh all veggies were on our burgers and in our salad. Not the best I've ever had but they were good and i will not hesitate coming back.

My go-to brunch. Their menu is HUGE and there is never a wait. Their bottomless mimosas entail a small picture of OJ and the waitress simply putting a bottle of champagne on the table. My kind of operation.

The staff is always excellent. Definitely the place for you if you like a huge, cheap, divey breakfast.

Best dive brunch ever, dont let the dated bar look and feel scare you away, the food is great. I challenge you to find another place in Denver that offers bottomless mimosas 7 days a week! Check this place out, you won't be disappointed, it's one of my hidden gems of Denver for brunch that you never have a wait on the weekends.

Typical dive bar.  Smells of long-forgotten urine and mildew, with the memories of better days gone by.

The drinks are fine, decent specials and on the cheaper side of things in general.  Hard to screw up drinks, even at a dive bar.

Staff is fine: decent, polite, prompt, and knowledgable.

The food though, is just awful.  They talk up "home cooked" and "feel good" food, but it is frozen crap.  Literally, all their food seems to be CostCo or Kroger frozen meals.  Nachos are .99 store bag of chips, microwaved cheese, and generic beef with a dollop of sour cream and store-bought guacamole.

Tacos are pre-made and then frozen, even confirmed by the staff when my friend tried to substitute something else inside them.

Come for a drink or two, people watch the regulars, but go elsewhere to eat.

Holy Capital Hill dive-bar, batman! This place hasn't changed since the last time I was here - some, oh, I don't know, 15 years ago? But no matter, it is what it is: a local hangout - more bar than restaurant - that offers good drinks and food to bring the community together. We met friends here for brunch and enjoyed a really good spicy bloody mary and a decent benedict. As good as any that I've had in higher-priced places and a heck of a lot better than many! If you live here, you probably go here. But if you don't, you should go. Be comfortable. Hang out. Imbibe. That's what it's all about here.

I've been going to Barricudas for ages. It's an unpretentious neighborhood staple. We generally come here for breakfast or late night snacks. I think we get a breakfast burrito 80% of the time. Always a solid choice. My only real complain is the horrid pink lighting. It's not an issue in the front of the house because of all the natural light from the windows, but in the back, it casts a sickly glow onto everything. This morning, I had the huevos ranchero. Definitely good, but portions of rice and beans were supersized. I think there was a least a full cup of refried beans on my plate. Way too much. I saw they deliver now! I think we'll be ordering breakfast in the future when going out seems like a chore.

This is not a high end restaurant, it is a dive bar, but the food here is damn good!  Really tasty food- way more than I would have thought just walking by. Shit is cooked with care. Seriously it is better than many diner breakfasts, I have eaten.  The prices are low and they serve food to the dark hours, say 4AM?
I am a night owl Woo Woo. I work in the service industry and sometimes get home and am starving. 
We have eaten here twice, and it is now my late night, FEED ME- go to! 
We had the chicken fingers the first time, they batter them in house. Our friend had a mammoth Mexican breakfast, with corn tortillas and poached eggs, with really good brisket and a spicy and seemed homemade salsa/sauce all over it. They were happy to accommodate her  gluten restrictive diet. 
The other night, I and had a rough day, and I needed some food in me once my adrenaline went down. After 12:00 AM they switch to breakfast, which is actually what I was craving. We both had a nice standard breakfast 6.95$ with eggs, hash browns, bacon, and pancakes all cooked just right.  Nothing could have made me happier. I also got to eat breakfast and drink beer with it past midnight! You can also get appetizers and a couple more dinner plate options. The waitress said to try the chicken fried chicken, I will soon.
The staff is full of characters, who enjoy there jobs, and make for an entertaining and warm visit here.

Barricudas is an awesome neighborhood spot with great drink prices and solid food. Are they breaking new ground? No. But every dish is quality and it won't break the bank. Shout out Mr. Lee, Cheryl, Christina, Jules and Scuba!!
Love this little hole in the wall.  Great Eggs Benedict and Spicy Bloody Mary's to boot.  Perfect little place to get away with friends for a quiet morning brunch!
Staff is always friendly and welcoming. Food is just okay... I mean it's bar food... You can't expect much. Karaoke nights are always busy and pretty fun.

My friends and I came here the other week as we were bored from park tavern across the street.  The bar was pretty empty and they had karaoke going on.  It's an odd mix of dive bar with big furniture.  Hopefully they spice the place up a little and attract more people.  The karaoke was definitely outdated songs.

With apologies to Ann and Nancy Wilson . . .
Barricuda's

So this wasn't the end, went the first time, yesterday
I had to turn my plate away
Eggs like the sun, coffee for everyone
Green chili, it never fails

Your prices so low, yes indeed
I bet your gonna impress me 
Now you have me down, down, down with what I need
Now don't you, Barricuda's? Oh . . .
---------------

$6.95 for good eggs benedict?  Sign me up, please.  My eggs were well-poached.  The hollandaise could have been a bit thicker, but had a nice tang.  The english muffins and ham were solid.  The hash browns came out wonderfully crispy, just as I ordered them.  The portion size versus the price was a very good deal.  I sat here with a couple fellow Yelpers enjoying a very affordable "brunch" in what otherwise appeared to be a dive bar / restaurant combo.  

I also drank several cups of the regular old coffee that tasted just fine, and they kept them coming.  I quite enjoyed a cup of the pork green chili that someone else had on the side, and did not eat.  It was meaty, spicy, thick, and flavorful. I did not partake of the $10 bottomless mimosas, but they definitely kept up with the consumption of those who did.  So, although I am just reviewing this as a brunch spot, I was quite happy with what I received here, and would be willing to break my fast here again soon.

Oh, my dearest Barracudas. How do I love thee? Let me count the ways...

First, the overall atmosphere. Very unpretentious, with an "everyone welcome" kind of vibe. Like a good dive bar, this place is dark, dingy, and kind of gross. 

Karaoke on Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday. Some nights are pretty dead, so you can make the bar into your very own concert hall. 

The people. A mixed bag of college students, middle aged alcoholics, local old-timers, artistic hipsters, punk rockers, etc. etc. Expect the occasional crazy person to enter the mix. Definitely a strange crowd, but the overall feel is super friendly.  

Cheap, strong drinks. 

Pool tables, jukebox, and erotic photo hunt in the side room. 

Next door to the one and only Sexy Pizza, so you can satisfy those late night munchies.

In conclusion, Barracudas is high up on my list of Denver dive bars (coming in just behind PS Lounge, Horseshoe Lounge, and the infamous Nob Hill Inn). Definitely a must-try.

I'm really sad I have to post this, but I've been going to Barricudas for over 20 years and the service has just gone completely downhill. I feel as though since they started doing delivery service they have completely let their customers who dine in fall to the waist side. It's apparent they do not have their system set up for success. Let's take yesterday for example. We were a party of eight who had the respect to call ahead and let them know we were coming, and although we had a table waiting when we arrived the waiter came right out and said "we don't split checks!" OK... He did fail to mention that we'd be waiting over an hour to get our food. After we saw THREE tables come in AFTER us who ordered their food, get it and eat it and got their check, we still had nothing. That's when the patience wore thin. We called the hostess over to let her know how long we'd been waiting, she automatically said, "well it's because we have delivery orders going out, too." I was beside myself. She proceeded to go back to our waiter and let them know we want our food it came right out like it was magic. AND THEN, to add insult to injury, our food was cold!!!! It had been sitting there for a while yet no one bothered to bring it out. At that point I was done. I'm sorry Barricudas but you need to get your act together. Gone are the days of Liberty and Marissa on tables and Christina behind the bar. I'd like to say I'll miss you but....

My go to dive bar in the neighborhood, though they do serve food! And it's good food! The appetizers taste like they've been reheated from frozen, but everything else seems fresh. Burritos, burgers, sandwiches - all great. Not to mention the cheapest drinks in Denver! 

The vibe here isn't always the most welcoming, and I think that in part is some of the regulars. But the staff is awesome and fast, and the place is clean.

My girlfriend n I have ordered delivery from them about 5 times in the last 3 months and I gottta say, they nailed it! I luv the Barricuda bites w/ homemade tartar sauce. The tacos were good, and everything else we ordered exceeded our expectations from a bar/restaurant. I can tell they make most things in house and to order, that what will set them apart from other places w similar set-ups. To also get the food still nice and hot is awesome! Now we just need to go in sometime and try it even fresher. Thanks for being a neighborhood fav for us and keep it up!
Great breakfasts and overall cheap. Fix the jukebox.

Ordered Barricuda's for delivery on a Saturday afternoon. My order arrived faster than expected! And the food was delicious! Husband is still raving about the Breakfast Tacos. I'm inhaled the E 11th St Skillet! The pancakes were not so good because of the syrup that came with them. We will be getting Barricuda's again!
Yum, great breakfast. Nice to see the new  updates and  nice staff.  I had biscuits  n gravy, and my buddy had a carnitas torta. Both very good.
Good food awesome service. I had the turkey jalapeño burger and it was awesome. You definitely can't tell by the looks of the place but it's a solid pick.

You can go to a bougey expensive brunch place for sub par food or you can come here. 
Their food is cheap and SO BOMB. 

Also 10$ bottomless mimosas is always a steal.

I started going to this bar about 6 months ago and immediately felt at home . The staff is some of the nicest people I have ever met . Leash, Christina,Ashley, Charles,Danny, Jewels,Cheryl and anyone I'm forgetting are some of the nicest people I've ever met . Drink are reasonable but what keeps me coming back is how much fun it is to drink there. I felt like I had been going there for years after only a couple of visits. The owner Mr Lee is truly a man of the neighborhood and throws the best thanksgiving buffet ever . Everyone's welcome here. Have fun and try a shot of puntang.

I used to love this place and eat there a lot, both there and delivery. We started getting delivery again recently and it has not been great. The first time the portions were okay and the food was average. Today they nickle and dimed us and did not tell me until they were at our door. I was paying cash and had the exact total I was told plus tip. The driver gave me a different total and explained it to me, I did not want to short the driver so I went back in to get him a few more dollars. They charge 2.50 for a side of hollindaise and it is not that good of hollindaise. Snooze, Racines and even Jelly just charge you about a 1.00 or so and their hollindaise is 10 times better. I also paid for an upgrade from toast to french toast and I got 2 shriveled up pieces of bread with what looks to be egg on it? The "chicken fried chicken" is just chicken tenders with gravy on the side. I will not be back because I am feeling pretty ripped off right now. I could have gotten a bigger better breakfast from McDonalds for 1/3 the price. I gave 2 stars because the driver was very nice.

My favorite neighborhood dive in Denver. Although from the outside it appears to have a "sketchy" appearance, the staff and patrons are very welcoming and helpful. The bartenders and servers are very fast and attentive. This says a lot for the typically slow service you get in Denver. I only had to go there once to feel like a regular. I haven't tried the food yet, but the drink deals are great for happy hour and all throughout the day. The karaoke nights are very entertaining.
Great food the owner is the chef great Mexican food and specials...Server Allie is the bomb.......not a real bomb...but very pleasant

Had the French toast special on Monday, oh my!!!!!!!.my!!!!.it was so delicious. Was perfectly executed love the caramelized banana with walnuts on top of it. I wish they have this on their menu. Love you barracudas .............

Divey as hell, cheap drinks, shitty karaoke, nasty carpet. What else do you want?

That's basically it.  Nothing remarkable about the place except the people watching.  Now THAT was bloody remarkable.  Highlights?  Dude with a pink mohawk, a beautiful butch girl (or femme guy.... unclear), an old vietnam vet.  Better than a mofo-ing circus.

Amazing service on Christmas Eve! They were able to accommodate the large delivery order for my nurses working tonight! Thank you guys so much! Food was great and everything we needed tonight! Merry Christmas!

1) I understand hovering over diners, but staff seems to stand around a lot, visitng among themselves or acting more busy than they are.
2) Some of the staff can be discretionary & judgmental if they recognize you from around the neighborhood (putting their emotions over their wallet), giving worse service than they're usual avg. But don't worry since most are too ditzy to remember.
3) Food is avg.
4) It calls itself bi-friendly, yet I ran into attitude from the straight guys at the pool tables one late night, making it clear 'the straights' had the tables and they didn't want to play with gays.

All said & told, there's WAY better.

For a place that doesn't look appealing from the outside , the menu is pretty diverse and you can find something to eat in case you date is picky and complains about fattening food . There might be some celery she can eat . Service is great , food is good , and they have karaoke like 4 nights a week . Some people really suck so u might need ear plugs . But I don't have anything negative to say about this place .

The bartenders were great...drinks were priced right...and the food was good enough. Tip your bartender and he'll treat you like a king...or queen!! I visit Denver a lot and this spot just became one of my stops!

Love love love Barricuda's. I live a block away, and I'm not ashamed to say that I frequent here a lot. When my roommate and I first moved in, we noticed a small dive-y looking bar tucked away in the corner of the 7-11 mini strip mall. I'm sorry to say that we were initially hesitant to go in. However, we were pleasantly surprised once we finally did. The atmosphere is wonderful, so unpretentious and relaxed. The music is never too loud, fellow patrons are friendly and the staff are quick and attentive. The menu is massive, which I like, and the drinks are reasonably priced.  OH! I almost forgot the karaoke is a sight (and sound) to behold and something that must be experienced by all!

My boyfriend and I love this place! We used to live two blocks away so this was our spot a few nights a week. When we were looking for a new apartment, we were looking for somewhere near Barracudas, which tells you how great this place is. We ended up moving out of the neighborhood but make frequent trips to this lovely bar. I love the space, the atmosphere, the people, and the FOOD!!! I love bar food and this place is top notch as far as that goes. I also love that there is a mixed group so there are various ages and ethnicities hanging around this place... Never any drama unlike the bro haven Park Tavern across the street. As long as we live in Denver we will always come to our beloved Barracudas!
This is a great local bar. Im only 17 and they let me hang......Im chillin like a villan

Benedict's and mimosas! I have tried most of their Benedict's and never had a complaint. I have been here several times. 

The bottomless mimosas cannot be beat. They bring you the bottle of champagne and a small creamer size pitcher of OJ and you can make them exactly how you like. Of you want to have a real Sunday funday, don't miss this place. It might look sketch, but it does the trick! I am so glad I am back in the neighborhood and can walk here again.

I've lived in Capitol Hill for five years and maybe went to Barricuda's twice during that time mostly for a couple of cheap beers.

I had no idea that Barricuda's has weekend brunches and that a few times a year they have a brunch that, for its price, is probably the best brunch ever. 

I went here on New Year's Day (Thanks for the invite James and Ali) only to see an amazing spread of brunch delicacies before me: Fresh fruit, eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage, gravy, biscuits, French toast, crepes (three kinds!), cheese, even lox and tamales. And the best part is the smorgasbord was all you can eat with coffee, tea or soda included all for $10.95.

My friends say this is a pretty occasional occurrence. Apparently major holidays only. But they do have a regular brunch menu each weekend. Went again for that and the prices were likewise pretty reasonable.

This isn't Jelly or Snooze. The hollandaise for the Benedict was de-emulsifying in a warmed tin container. But for the price and for the selection, Barricuda's can't be beat. And that is nearly just as true for their incredibly cheap drinks and regular weekend brunches too.

UPDATE:  Received a call from the manager after she read this review.  She apologized, offered a refund, and said she would pass the info on to her owner and the cooking staff.  That helps, and was much appreciated.  Don't know if I will try it again, but the follow up was well done, so I added a star!  ORIGINAL:  Disgusting ... sums it up.  To say it's bar food says you are going to the really really low class places like The Squire or The Viking.  Seriously - their food is worse than that.  Totally inedible - I fed my entire delivery order to my dogs except the wings which I trashed so it didn't kill them.  NEVER eat here!

It is what it is!  I love the I can walk to this place.  The food is  pretty decent for a semi dive.  I usually come here for a breakfast and a bloody instead of waiting an hour at some hipster flavor of the week joint.  They also serve food very late and if I get the late night munchies during the week I will pop in for a bowl of French onion soup and a grilled cheese. I like their French onion soup....  I have never had anything I don't like here but it is a pretty straight forward menu.

The clientele is all over the board and I have overheard some of the funniest conversations of my life while here.  If you are easily offended  this may not be the place for you on a busy sat  morning.  It has good drink specials and is a plus as part of life on the Hill.

Oh hello, big ole plate of chili cheese fries.  I didn't see you there, creeping into my mouth and down into my belly.  GET IN MY BELLY. The rest of the food is decent, but I have a slight obsession with chili cheese fries.  And cheap drinks, which this place has.  At all times of the day or night.

It's a little bit hipster and a little divey, but isn't that the best part of living in Capital Hill?  It's never too terribly crowded, and even when it is, I can dig it.

There are lots of events going on.  The karaoke on Tuesday and Friday nights is enough to knock your ear drums out.  Once they're out, you will want to stomp on them to keep yourself from listening to the singers because they are awful.  But also awfully fun to listen to and make fun of.  Bless those souls who have the guts to get up there, I envy you. Monday nights are Trivia nights, and I believe Wednesday night is open night for comedy.

Now I want chili cheese fries.  Dang it.  The rest of the food is alright, but those chili cheese fries? Oh goodness!
Friendly wait staff, but pricey for average tasting breakfast.  Spacious layout.  I may return.

Worst service I have ever experienced from a restaraunt. It took the server over 30 minutes to greet the table, and immediately he started telling us why he couldn't do bottomless mimosas. When labeled clearly on the menu we had 30 min to do so. We asked if they could prolong service of mimosas due to the slow greet. The manager was extremely unprofessional in the way he tried to "help" us, and never even said his name. From working in a restaurant myself I would be highly ashamed in the manor the restaraunt was opperated.

This was your typical bar restaurant. The atmosphere was dim but it was friendly! There are lots of tvs playing everything from the game to Cartoon Network. It was a great place to have a casual dinner with friends. Though, I'm not exactly biting at the bit to get back. Not to say I wouldn't go back, I would totally, it's just not at the top of my list. 
So you may wonder about the food. It was decent enough. The portions are fairly large and not overly priced. Though the BBQ sauce is a bit weird. I had a burger and fries, the two people I was with got the chicken fingers and the double decker blt. Like I said the portions are healthy so no one went home hungry or upset about their meal. 
All in all it's an alright place here in Cap Hill.

Barricuda's is a dive, but a nice dive (if that makes sense).

If you want to watch the Broncos game, this is a relatively quiet/relaxed environment compared to other bars/restaurants.

Food is a-ok: I had a combination Mexican plate, which came with a burrito, enchilada, choice of rice or beans, and choice of tostada or taco. Nothing to write home about, but the food is filling. Their menu is quite interesting with sandwiches, pizza, appetizers (lots of appetizers), Mexican dishes, and even a small section for "Oriental" dishes ('ey, ICYMI, that term is outdated and offensive, Barricuda).

The prices per entree are reasonable, as others have already mentioned: most are under $10. If you want a NY Steak, that's going to cost $15; not sure of the quality.

I'll come back the next time my friends want to watch any sports games.

I remember Barricuda's from back in the day when it was arguably the smokiest bar in Denver.  Fortunately, the smokers are forced into the cold to do their business, and now I can enjoy this place without smelling like an ashtray at the end of the evening.  

Great bartenders, good mix of patrons, and a handful of fun events throughout the week - karaoke, trivia, etc.

I'm pretty sure that they spelled Barracuda wrong, however.

Staff rocks.  Service rocks.  Amazing brunch and $10 all you can drink mimosas.  I have been coming to Barricudas since 2003 timenframe and honestly, it has gotten way more tasty, delicious and a variety of flavors:  mexican, american, and cuban.  Delish!!!!!  Gay friendly, kid friendly, and BFF friendly.  Oh, might be a great place for a discreet rendezvous.  Not me silly, but I could totally see it.
I went for brunch. The mimosas were great and the food was good for the price. I'd say it's a good bang for your buck.
Decent place, decent food, a little pricey for the food...the bright shining spot was Natasha, our server.  A+ to her hard work to serve us with great customer service.
The fact they deliver has made some weekend hangovers on the couch pretty fantastic!

Regular customer, just happened to order food for delivery this time, and was presented with the worst tasting and looking chicken chimi imaginable that literally smelled and tasted like cat food. Contacted the management and the REFUSED to refund my money or replace. If i had dined in you would have replaced the meal or at least comped one of the meals. I don't like how your service changes from in the restaurant to delivery and you don't even care about the quality of food that you put out. After 8 years of my business, i think it is time to part ways.

Good local joint. 

Random crowd but always a good time.

I've never eaten here (nor do I plan too), but the service is friendly and there's always a seat to be had.

This was such a great place.  There were 10 of us and we were faced with a ridiculous 2 hour wait at another well known brunch location.  Thank GOODNESS for Baricuda - saved our monthly ladies brunch with no wait, bottomless mimosas and tasty food!!!  Will definitely go back!

I'm here Karaoke night. To say this is not only a joke, but disrespectful to the people who have both spent enough money in this dive bar to get drunk with courage, but waited long enough to get up and sing, this is a sham. The "DJ/loser paid to play music" turns off the mics of those trying to sing.!if you're not at least mediocre, you are singing to the carpet. Hey buddy... Fuck you! These drunks deserve to be heard!! Booooo Baracudas! Booiooo to the dick running karaoke!
Dj aron is a rude arrogant mean douche. Cut me off in the middle of a song after i spent a ton of money of booze there. Sorry im not american idol potential.

Many a late night, I have stumbled into Barricuda's and mauled a fried snack after boozing the day away.  I am always impressed on the good service, the friendly vibe and fantastic prices that I find.  This along with the walking distance from my pad makes this the place to be in my little nook of Capitol Hill.  I always stroll right past the dumb a$$'s over at Park Tavern to be with the peoples people at Barricudas.

 Grant it there may be the occasional drunken make out sess. or slurred argument over how drunk the other person is by some crazy looking goofballs at the bar.  This, however, is what makes the bar a special place and keeps us regulars coming back.  Cheap pitchers, fun people and crazy times!  If you live in the hood you probably been here, if you don't you probably won't.  I do recommend anyone looking for an interesting eve at a cheap price to try them out.
I'll come here for brunch every once in a while. The food is pretty good, and is pretty reasonably priced for what it is. Bottomless mimosas used to go until 3 I think but now it's 1.

Came here after our time at Park Tavern had come to a close, and the Karaoke was absolutely jammin'.  It's a super loud semi-divey bar that has the weirdest layout you'll ever see.  Try to get to the bathroom without feeling like you're going into the kitchen.  You can't.

Our waiter wasn't having a good night and he was pretty out of it and never came back to take a second drink order.  But they had $7 steins of Fat Tire so I was one-and-done so I didn't mind.  Overall it's okay, nothing great but nothing bad either.

Barricuda's has been serving me up bottomless mimosas and amazing food at cheap prices for about 4 years now. I love coming here for its divey feel, especially when nursing a hangover and bright lights are a sworn enemy. The location at 11th and Ogden is convenient to my apartment in Capitol Hill and any friends who crash at my place know that we'll probably be making the journey there for brunch at least once during the weekend. The service is always friendly and quick and both the breakfast burrito and pizza are to die for! One of my favorite neighborhood bars by far!

RUDE TAKE OUT SERVICE!!! (Steve) Although the night life here can be very entertaining at times the comments from the morning bar boy when i picked up my take out order was extremely rude, presumptuous, & Holier than tho-ish. What ever happened to polite service without individual nasty commentary?????

Food was decent but two stars because they have this new absurd policy where even though they do brunch until 4pm they stop offering bottomless mimosas at 1pm! What an silly policy. I don't even get to brunch until 1pm! If some people ruined it for the rest of us they could come up with a more accommodating and reasonable policy such has having a two hour limit, etc.

The theme of my entire trip out to Denver seemed to be "hit up places at the opposite of their peak times."  That being said, I found myself at Barricudas for breakfast, and I thought when I stepped inside that Barricudas looked like the kind of place I wish I were hanging out and drinking at the night before.  Total dive atmosphere, even in the daylight, but that's all good in my book because I love dives.  Dark walls, carpet you probably don't want to run a black light over, and a myriad of circular high tables, perfect for setting down your tall boy can on while you crowd around because all the women are in the stools and we're all gentlemen right?

Anyway, for a breakfast time, my friends and I were seated promptly, and were attended to pretty quickly.  I ended up ordering a breakfast burrito, and since I wasn't driving, what the heck, the bloody mary as well.  Waters were served without asking, because that's either common courtesy in today's dining industry, or my friends and I really must have looked like we were out drinking the night prior.  Either way, it was welcomed.

The bloody mary took a precariously long time to arrive, and I have to say that I wasn't too pleased with it.  I tend to not like ice in my bloody marys, because they water them down, and something about the presence of ice interferes with the addition of extra pepper and tabasco.  And it was just generally weak.

Thankfully the burrito was fantastic.  It was a generous size, and was stuffed adequately.  I can't say the potatoes had nearly the presence as the egg, and the added bacon and sausage, but the flavors were still good, and the sauce they coated it in was flavorful, and not like the bland boiled flavor that plagues so many other breakfast burritos.

In the end, I was stuffed with burrito, and satisfied with breakfast.  The bloody mary was a little weak for my preference, but that's like a morning drink anyway.  This is the kind of place that I wish my friends took me to the night prior, and from what they describe, is a great place to keep the drinking going and get late night munchies and fries AND there's a 7-Eleven right next door.

Pretty divey but not gross by any means. Bathrooms are usually clean and the beer is cold. Thats what I like. 

Their bottomless mimosas . . . Every place should serve them like this. Give me the bottle and some juice on the side and let me get my proportions just how I like em. Then bring me another bottle. Amazing. 

I can not speak for all of the food but I can speak on behalf of the Chile Rellenos - They are great. Had them a few times. Only thing I order there because the first time I had them they greatly exceeded my expectations.
Ordered a burger and enchiladas for delivery, and wasn't sure what to expect with the mixed reviews. Unfortunately both were awful. Won't be ordering from here again.

There's no better way to celebrate a weekend than with bottomless mimosa brunch, and there's no better place for that than Barricuda's. The service is excellent, the food is tasty (especially for treating a hangover) and the ambiance is great. The breakfast burritos and the skillets are delicious.

Grab your friends and check out Barricuda's one weekend. You won't regret it!

A great dive with a local vibe. After living in cap hill, I have become a regular here. They have excellent drink specials, great service and better than average bar food. 

I recommend the 'Statutory grape' shots, with a $6 pitcher and a plate of potato skins. They also have a pool table, a few screens to watch the game, and they serve food until the wee hours. If you don't want the obnoxious trendy scene, check this place out.

Barricuda's used to be our favorite local place for late night dining, but ever since Liberty left, the service and the like has significantly gone down hill.

Eager to introduce our friends to our local spot, we stopped by the other night. Despite it being almost empty, they put the four of us (not small people to start with, bundled in large amounts of winter clothes) in literally the smallest booth in the whole place. Fine.

Two of the four of us ordered Fat Tires. What arrived was one Fat Tires, and one beer that was significantly darker. I don't even drink beer, but was able to notice the difference, and when my partner tried it, they said they thought it was New Castle. TWO fat tires; wouldn't you notice if you were service two DIFFERENT beers? Apparently not.

After waiting 15 minutes to have our order taken, it took a full 40 minutes to get our food out...which is ridiculous given the emptiness of the place. The food was ok (hardly any blue cheese on my blue teriyaki veggie burger, but I ordered more to solve this issue)...and the teriyaki sauce was not nearly as good as it used to be. We ate, waited another 20 minutes for our check, and were stunned.

Not only did they charge me extra for the additional blue cheese that should have been on the burger in the first place, but they charge me TWO DOLLARS extra for my veggie burger. I think charging extra for a veggie burger is ridiculous in the first place (and discriminatory towards vegetarians), but two dollars? The difference between a veggie burger and a beef burger (both plain) is 45 cents. How the heck do they get off charging two bucks? My so-so burger at Barricuda's cost more than the delicious Bonzai burger with unlimited fries and free blue cheese AND free veggie burger at Red Robin. 

We'd usually rather support local businesses, but this has turned us off Barricuda's for now, until they get their act together. We felt ashamed to have talked the place up so much to our friends, and then have such slow and lackluster service, and over priced food. Almost $50 for two beers, a cider, two sandwiches, and two apps at a local dive bar? No thanks.

I'm not going to lie, I'm a little shocked to see so many good reviews even though I was coming on here to be fairly positive about it. 

Barricudas is a locals kinda place 100%. Regulars don't look thrilled to see new people walk through the door but you know they are all here a few times a week. So I don't really speak highly of the crowd which is why I tend to not go there. However, we had a very nice time Saturday so I felt like I may need to give it a fair chance. 

We ended up here because our group was too big to find space at Park Tavern during a Broncos game. Being closest we headed to Barricudas where the staff kindly went out of their way to rearrange several tables in front of the TV for us. He told us that they take reservations for big groups on game days which is awesome. Our waiter was great, OK a little forgetful we forgive because it was really busy and he was very friendly. The pitchers were $5 during the game with other drink specials on bottomless mimosas, screwdrivers, stolis, etc. We seemed to have different feelings about food: the fish and chips (Barricuda bites) and fried shrimp were fairly icky but our table ordered a bunch of grilled cheese sandwiches and they were well loved. 

I'm not sold on it yet but I'm certainly willing to consider it more than I was before.

Smothered beef and bean burrito is the best!! And great price. I've never eaten inside, just ordered through Grubhub but love the food. Breakfast sandwich is also amazing. Great food for a great price. I have become a regular lol!

The food is awful. Maybe if they cutdown the menu and refined it a little they could have some decent food. Is $10 for all you can drink OJ mix and bad champaign the new hipster way of brushing your teeth? Not to be a downer but clean up you smelly bar. It's 2013 not 1993 dive bar shit holes are out of style.

I stopped here for dinner rather unexpectedly over Halloween weekend. I had originally planned on eating at Park Tavern, but I completely forgot that the final game of the world series was on, and there was not an empty seat in sight. There were plenty of seats at Barricudas and the beer was cold (and cheap!) Two of my favorite qualities in a draft....

I think I had a french dip, which was delicious, and several more frosty cold beverages before heading to a house party in the 'hood. The service was good and the crowd seemed cool. Definitely my kind of Cap Hill establishment. Added to my list of local favs!

Hand's down my favorite neighborhood bar! After spending 10 days in Germany I wanted nothing more than a drink made with real juice and some potato skins from Barricuda's...first stop after I landed - sweet deliciousness! 

I took a friend here for a couple of drinks before we hit the town. She was hungry and wanted some food beforehand. She didn't want "bar food," but I made her go to Barricuda's with the promise that she would like it. Sure enough, after a hefty plate of pork chops, she stood corrected! 

The late night menu is awesome! Love me some potato skins, nachos, the BLT, the burger...anything and everything is good here! With food service until 4am how can you go wrong? 

Well, you can go wrong when (like me) you walk in at 2am fishing for more drinks and then continually ask for vodka at least three or four more times :-) But, being the awesome place this is, they didn't give me the boot but rather offered lots of yummy juice and greasy food for my drunk as*! 

They have live trivia, karaoke, pool, excellent people watching, pin ball, a juke box and an awesome special on pitchers. 

I love this place during the Holidays too. The decorations make me feel right at home and the locals hanging around are always cheerful and nice! Moreover, the staff here is attentive and polite...high marks for sure!

This place is fantastic. This is a Capitol Hill gem. With very edible food and cheap drink, you cannot go wrong. It's pretty divey, and yet it is a bona fide restaurant. People from all strokes of life are there.

Most recently, I bellied up at Barracuda's at 10am on a Saturday, and there weren't any bar stools to spare. This place is bad in all of the good ways, and good in none of the pretentious ways. And don't let me forget about the jukebox. They have one of the best jukeboxes in town.

I struggle to elaborate. Sometimes when something is so right, it's better to be brief.
Just a great dicey neighborhood bar...  with  pretty darn good food.  They have an excellent brunch with bottomless mimosa's.  The staff is always friendly and I always have a great time!

I absolutely loved this place... My girlfriends and I were at a swanky bar in cherry hill area and decided we wanted something more low key and a place that had karaoke. Looking on yelp, we found Barricudas- called and confirmed they had karaoke on a Tuesday night! 
 First off, if you're looking for one of those swanky or trendy bars then this one isn't for you... But if you want friendly people, good drinks, and a place to let loose then this place is awesome. 
We pulled up and the outside seemed a little sketchy... The decor on the inside is dingy but we weren't there to look at upholstery. We ordered a couple appetizers and everything was sooo good! Best greasy yummy bar food I've had in Denver- chicken nachos. That's all I have to say about that. 
The waitress was super nice, even with us 3 loud and indecisive girls and one lonely male soul. The bartender that we migrated to once our waitress was done for the night was super good, didn't give us crap about not knowing the certain name of a drink, and even opened up a sample bottle of honey whiskey for me! The tab at the end of the night wasn't bad either! No sticker shock. 
The crowd was a complete mix of people, old and young, hipster and laid back, probably a war vet or two in there somewhere but wonderful people to talk to! The karaoke was super fun and they had a ton of songs to choose from, even brand new stuff. Definitely a diamond in the rough that we will be going back to!

Love this local dive bar. They have a bomb brunch menu for pretty awesome prices not to mention $10 bottomless mimosas! You really can't get much better then Barricudas when searching for a decently priced brunch spot in the neighborhood! Will be back many more times! The service is usually pretty friendly also.

I love this place so much! It's our go to place... Our lil neighbor bar. I prefer this place over other places in the nearby area. This reason I like this place is because it's always chill and comfortable inside with great food and service. I will say I never sit at the bar because I feel it's a breeding ground for alcoholics but the rest of the place is just fine. I've come here for breakfast, lunch, and late night and I've never been disappointed. For brunch you can get bottomless mimosas - they bring you a bottle per 2 guests with little carafes of oj, cran, or grapefruit so you can make them exactly how you like. Their Benedict's are worth a try and are so yummy! Bloody marys are great too. For dinner I've pretty much tried everything. Thumbs up on: wings, chicken nachos, French onion soup, chefs salad, burgers, and Mexican food! The only thing I didn't care for is the tofu melt - wasn't really my thing. Drinks are cheap @ $2.50 for wells! Can't beat that! The have 2 pool tables and a juke box for tunes. Great lil divey place!

Amazing drink specials! I would take a bath in the green chili from here if I could. The south of the border burger is the best smothered burger I've ever had in my life. The French fries are PERFECT. You know how every now and then you get that one perfectly fried French fry? Imagine having a whole basket of those. That's how they roll in this joint. The service can't be beat, either.

We were so excited to try this place! Unfortunately, we got there and we had a new waiter. I think it was his 5th day or something. I totally understand that being a new server is soooo stressful and we tried hard to accommodate but after awhile it just kind of got ridiculous. Someone should have been picking up the slack and no offense guy but after 5 days you should be able to figure out what ticket is ours...

We are definitely going to give this place a second chance because we really want to try the food.

Here's the skinny.

The people are great here.  The staff is amazingly delightful and will meet any need or want you have - within reason to be sure.   I also met 4-6 very friendly (but not uncomfortable friendly) people while just out smoking.  Needless to say Barracuda's has a very sociable at home atmosphere.  

Everyone is respectful even after the alcoholic beverages begin to kick in.  A female wishing to go somewhere without being hassled, what's your numbered or drunkenly glommed on would be make a safe bet going here.  The staff being mostly female is all too attentive to these things.  

The place stays open until 4:ooam on Friday and Saturday nights, so you can plan to go there for "after 2am" eats.  It's a treat when everyone piles in having come from all their own nights out.

There isn't anything particular about anything at Barracuda's other than the owners being Korean and Filipino. Asian food flare is brilliantly disguised in the menu without scaring someone who has never heard of it.  It tastes good.  There's standard beer selection, standard menu fare for appetizers, breakfast, lunch or dinner.  Breakfast is served any time.  

The crowd is a mix that doesn't have a name per say.  There was a healthy combination of men, women, young, old, straight and gay.  The spectrum of the socioeconomic scale was represented. Most important to that fact - everyone got along smashingly.  Prada was represented almost as much as "plain Jane."

I will absolute return to Barracuda's when I'm looking for communal type evening and a true home town atmosphere, and deep fried artichokes of course. It would be an excellent place to start a night out too...or even to stop by on your way to another destination.

My four star rating is largely due to the superb service, dynamic representation of all communities in the crowd and the "say what you wish" somehow remaining respectful atmosphere. 

I'm marking good for kids as "unsure," but it's OK for them during the day for breakfast or lunch.



Ode to Barracuda's

The Cycle Sluts I do read
Whilst drinking my mead
Your pool tables times two
On my deep fried artichoke hearts I will chew 
I drink brew after brew...

Stella Artois was her name
In a fine glass she came
In the stall there she went
Not too much money was spent
A fine time had by all

Meeting folks as I had my smoke
Telling joke after joke
In the mean time still not broke
Barracuda's I must stroke

No need to travel far
After beer...in the taxi car
Stay for breakfast with a smile
Fat and sassy all the while

With and ode and four stars
You shine amongst dive bars


Ode to Barracuda's

I drink brew after brew...

Barracuda's I must stroke

No need to travel far
After beer...in the taxi car
Stay for breakfast with a smile
Fat and sassy all the while

With and ode and four stars
You shine amongst dive bars

How have I never been here before?! We stopped in when Park T was way too packed during the Broncos game and had a wonderful time. Stiff drinks, cheap delicious food, great service, Yes Please! We were sat right away and everything was perfect from there. I split the vegetarian burrito with corn tortillas on the side and it was delicious! The burrito had peppers, spinach, and even broccoli which is rare and hit the spot. Everyone elses food looked great too. The fries were bland but with vegetarian red chili we fixed that. Such a wonderful surprise overall not at all what I expected.

Love this place especially since you can get bottomless mimosas everyday from 10 till 3... Servers are great and very personable... The food is ok  not the best but not horrible.  I recommend getting the breakfast burrito with chorizo smothered in green...that's one platter that'll  enjoy. I definitely recommend this spot if u want bottomless mimosas through out the week. Only thing that does suck you have to leave the restaurant to smoke there is no balcony or patio nothing. If that had a little patio spot would just make it so much better.
This place is awesome, but I mostly go in for the food. Love the breakfast, lunch, and dinner. They're pretty generous with drink specials ;) Go in and check them out!

Somewhere between a three and a four, I'll increase it to four because our server was very helpful and delightful.

Barricuda's does not do a traditional happy hour.  Instead of designating drink specials for a set block of time during the afternoon/early evening, B's just has cheap drinks all the live long day.  $2.50 wells and cheap beers (stuff like Coors...) are what's available, along with daily specials later in the evening (starting at 10pm).

They have both breakfast and lunch/dinner items available - depending on what time of day you go.  I've only been here for the dinner menu, of which they have an extensive selection.  Plenty of apps, salads, sandwiches (from the basic BLT to the tasty Tofu Melt with bbq sauce and sauteed onions/green peppers/mushrooms), burgers, Mexican dishes, plates, and even pizza.  Nothing fancy, but a heck of a lot to choose from and stuff that'll surely hit the spot when you're a few in.

Bathrooms are clean, but I suspect they might go downhill as the evening passes (as I've heard very personal stories from friends involving the gastrointestinal perils of too much to drink).  Still, get there early enough and overall it can be a very pleasant experience.  It's dark and outdated, but there's no attitude or pretension.  Just cheap drinks, good bar food, and nice service.

FYI:
- single Stoli is $4.50 ($3 from 10pm-? on Friday nights)
- Long Island is $7
- tall is $3
- double tall is $5 (because 2.50 x 2 is 5, der...)

Such a fan of this place. The staff is ALWAYS friendly and awesome, the food is delicious and its always a solid choice for brunch. I love going here because not only do they serve up good drinks, good food, good service but despite the place looking by appearance somewhere you maybe wouldn't choose a first choice for eating, its clean and awesome. Highly recommend it.

We really enjoy this place. We usually come at least once a week for lunch, usually after church on Sundays. The food is consistently good, along with the service. The drink selection is diverse with some excellent beer and cocktail options. My family has several different dietary needs and this places works very well for us. 

Bad daddy's is a gem in Northglenn and I would highly recommend you check it out.

Craving a tasty burger with a great view Carrie J. and I decided Bad Daddy's was just what we needed after our afternoon climbing date!

+ I chose to nosh on the Pittsburgher Burger with a side of sweet potato fries. Super tasty! I haven't had sweet potato fries in a looong time. They def hit the spot! 
+ I decided to be a glutton and get a strawberry milkshake to top off my meal. It was just the right amount of sweet. Though I was a little disappointed that it wasn't more pink in color. But it had the flavor and that's what's important.
+ While I didn't imbibe on this visit, there are tons of great local brews on tap!
+ The view of the mountains from the upstairs patio is great! Plus there's a fire place outside to keep you toasty on those cool winter days.

- Service was unfortunately lacking during our visit. While everything was timely with our order when we chose our table on the upstairs patio it was dirty, as was the table of another patron who had arrived before us. It took the server a bit before he came to both greet us and clean off the tables.

I'll be back to satisfy my burger craving next time I'm in the neighborhood!

Dinner last night with friends and the kids.  Took well over an hour to be seated, and then only because people on the list ahead of left.  The staff seemed overwhelmed and everything was slow.  I would have expected a full turn of the tables in the time we waited, but it took so long for food to arrive, it was no wonder we waited so long.

The manager offered us a free appetizer for the long wait, then it showed up as a charge on the bill.

The beer was cold and the burgers were good.  We sent the foes back, they were cold and soggy, replaced with hot and crisp.

Not sure if the kitchen was off, the waitstaff was having a bad night or there was simply no management of anybody.

My first time at this chain, I won't go out of my way to go back.

Cool bar place.  
We all loved the food here! We had about 12 adults and we sat near the bar and tables around it. The management did a great job as we all showed up at different times and we weren't sure all was coming, kudos for making it work. 
I ordered a double turkey burger which with sweet potato fries rocked! 
Great beer selection too.

Casual burger joint that seems to be popping up all over the Denver metro area. Their burger selection is great, and if you do not like whats on the menu, they offer you the option to customize your own! 

Decent amount of seating, a full bar, and a rooftop patio that I am sure is gorgeous in the summer. We came in during a little bit of colder weather and waiting around 40 minutes for a table. This seems to be the scene on a Friday or Saturday night, but it was worth the wait! 

Food came out fast and our server was nice and a little comical. My mom and I split the ahi tuna burger with coleslaw and my other family members went for bacon burgers. The fries are plentiful and the food was great! Atmosphere in the restaurant is fun and not overdone. Beer selection is pretty decent!

OMG, Prob one of the best Bloodies I have had in a long time... Shelby, our bartender is soooo adorbs, attentive and friendly! 
My buffalo chicken sammie was Bomb, and tater tots... Hello, amazing!! One of my fav stops when I'm in town!!

We thought this bar and grill was amazing coming in, and it has a lot of vintage posters of the Beetles, Native American Art, scratch records and a built in bar. We started off smooth with a nice male server, which I didn't ask for his name because laziness. But I should've because the service went downhill after that. No refills, no to go boxes, and I guess it's understandable because we went an hour before closing. Surely that's not the case because it was a full house when we came in. 

What we had: Truffle Parmesan Fries that were pretty creamy to start off with but the salt was overwhelming and not off to a good start. I chose the Bacon Burger on Steroids, (That's literally what it's called.) it was cooked medium well which was good judgement from our server and then we had the notice of our choice to build your own burger and salad. My guy had built his own burger, and you can choose different types of meats, cheeses, veggies and condiments. He created a simple burger with bacon included. Apparently every order comes with a side of French fries, potato tots, etc. he chose the regular fries. 

The fries at the end made my head burn of a migraine because of how salty they were. My bacon burger was out of this world. This burger was great, but the fact that our server had forgotten us made me disappointed. I wanted more strawberry lemonade but how can I when I'm forgotten about? He was a sweet server and very adorable but the service sucks during the night. I loved the burger and his suggestion to have it cooked medium well was excellent put out. 

The dessert was pretty good we had the brownie covered in cream vanilla and it had a few strawberries and sugar powder with a green leaf. It isn't too busy on a Monday night, but you pay the price of getting lame service. The people are nice though. There's no bias here.

This place very yummy! We had just arrived by flight and needed food before we headed to the Rocky Mountains. If I had to brag about anything I would say the sweet potato fries are amazing. Service was a little slow, but it was the lunch rush. The burgers were taste and so were the nachos as an appetizer. If we are ever in the area again, we will return.

A really good time. The burger was tasty and the beers were cold (and good). :) We came up to Northglenn for a little date and mini golf. I am so glad I found Bad Daddy's on yelp! Check it out if you are in the area, it's fun!

My burger was 4 stars, but the service was a little off the mark, which is why only 3 stars. The guy and I went for dinner yesterday -he'd been raving so I had to try it!

I like the concept and built myself a nice little burger on brioche with thousand island, american cheese, bacon and a fried egg. Eggs on burgers is my new thing and this was awesome. It can get a little pricey for a burger with all those delicious toppings, but it was cooked perfectly and arrived with piping hot tots - who can complain about that?

Service was a little slow at times and our burgers came out when we were still halfway through apps, but no biggie. 

I'd definitely head back for the burgers.

I ordered for take out, their build your own burgers. I prefer on basically mushroom and Swiss on lettuce and a bacon guac burger on a regular bun. The bartender was very great talking to me while I was waiting and the manager even talked to me for a little bit. The food came out very timely, and looks great. They taste fantastic. I strongly recommend Bad Daddy's, especially for their burgers. 5 out of 5!

A very polished burger place.  Everything is done well, if not perfect.

If you don't want a burger try the club.

We came here to celebrate a friend's birthday. There were 6 adults and 4 children in our party and we sat upstairs. When I first arrived (I was the late comer), I was greeted by the server asking what I would like to drink. We then had to flag down our server to place our food order. I ordered a bowl of their red chili and my husband and I shared a hamburger. The burger was cooked to how we wanted with all our toppings including cheese, bacon, and peanut butter! 

After we ate, we still had to flag people down to get boxes for our food and to order my friend his birthday milkshake. We also had to flag people down for our checks.

The food was good, but the service was not the best and they were not that busy upstairs. I think I watched the bartender and both servers just chatting behind the bar for 10 min while we waited for our check (this was before we had to ask for our checks).
Been here many times. Never gets old. If you love a good burger. This is it. The bad ass burger was no match for me, I customized it and added a second patty!

Terrific, satisfying burgers, according to my hubby & son. Find a specialty one on the menu or build your own from a wide variety of options. For those wanting something lighter and healthier, choose the build your own salad option, which what I did. Lots of choices to ensure you can create the perfect salad for your taste!!

This restaurant is on the pricier side for a burger joint, but the food was good and fresh. When building your salad you can add up to 7 non-protein toppings which is a fair amount. I chose avocado, chickpeas, cucumber, blueberries, strawberries, tortilla strips, and feta cheese w/ balsamic vinaigrette on the side. My salad was delicious, though I would have loved a few more blueberries & strawberries on it. The feta was the perfect amount. 

For sides, the coleslaw was kind of boring and lacking in flavor, so next time my husband would opt for the fries instead.  

Service was prompt and friendly.

There are lots of restaurant choices in the immediate area, but Big Daddy's is worth the stop for a good meal .

Meh.. I've had better food. Can't really say much about this place besides the service was really slow. Even on a slow day. Manager didn't even seem to care or probably was too stone to care? I'll take my business else where. This place is a no go.
Found bad daddy's by accident . Best thing to happen that day. my wife and I had salads that were great. We will be back .

We finally got the chance to stop in here a few weeks ago, and we will definitely be back! My bf and I got the Amber Ale Queso as an app, which was good, but we probably will try another app next time, it mostly tastes like melted Pepperjack slice cheese. He ordered the Classic Southern Burger and I created my own, they were both delicious! I ordered my burger medium well and it came out pretty burnt, so next time I will be ordering medium and see what happens. I also got the Moonshine Blackberry Limeade, which I could easily down a pitcher of! The service was great, and the atmosphere is fun, we had a good time looking at all of the knick-knacks on the wall! We will be back for another good meal soon!

Looking for a burger joint after a late night basketball game and I'm so glad we did. It was a full house even at 9 pm. The staff was pleasant and knew the menu well. 
In our party we ordered, the bad ass burger, burger on steroids, patty melt, kids grilled cheese and a BBQ salad. Everything was cooked to order. We will be back.

When a turkey burger can make you feel like you're eating a decadent meal, you know you've found a place that know how burgers of any meat should be done. Seriously, turkey burger, brie and baked apples. How do you NOT drool over that?

The beer selection was pretty good, with lots of local craft choices and the staff was very friendly, if not overly social between themselves. The rooftop area was really beautiful and the seating was pretty ample. 

The only barrier preventing me from coming back here soon is the fact that it's in Northglenn, which is a pretty far drive for me to make to get a good burger.
I feel like it takes less time to purchase a car than it takes for this place to make a hamburger

Overall this isn't a bad option. Lot's of good choices and their fries and sides are good. However when you only do burgers you should always be able to nail the cooking temperature that the customer ordered. I tend to be picky when it comes to the doneness of my burgers but when two people order medium well, and two people order medium and all four burgers com out well done with no pink in any burgers you have to question the cook manning the grill station. It wasn't enough for us to send anything back or cross this place off our list, but again if your going to ask people their preference on the burger temp you should try and get it right. There are plenty of great burger places in Denver we may try a few others before heading back.

The burgers here are good, they're not great.  They have good flavor and the meat tastes fresh and semi juicy.  T got the bacon cheeseburger on steroids.  The burger is huge with lots of bacon.  LOTS.  We also got wings, sliders and green chile tots.  I created my own salad.  The side salad was actually pretty big.  The sliders were a let down.  Very dry and bland.  Can't go wrong with green chile or tots.        

First time here was for my broham's birthday.  We reserved the rooftop for a small party.  It was crowded and things got hectic and the servers mixed up or forgot or messed up a few orders, but nothing major.  There were a lot of us and we kept moving around and hey - they say all asians look alike, right?  Haha.  Service at other times I've been here have been decent. No complaints.   A got the bacon cheeseburger on steroids - but a double - and with buttermilk fried bacon.  It should be called the heart attack burger.  I built my own burger with bacon, cheese and a fried egg.  I remember it being a pretty regular tasting burger.           

4 stars is more for the venue and the atmosphere.  It's a cool spot with the bar vibe and I love the rooftop on a nice day.  Food would get 3 stars.
I have been back several times and the service has improved immensely and the burgers are the best. I love this place!
Pretty damn good burger, had the badass with green chili cheese tots..the service was quick and good, i will be back.

Really enjoyed this place, the burgers and milkshakes are phenomenal and my only complaint is that the fries were a little too seasoned for my taste. Good drink selection and a good staff. Look forward to coming back next time I'm in the Denver area!

I've been to Bad Daddy's several times now. The appeal for me is the ability to build my own burger/sandwich or salad. There are a lot of choices, which I like. The turkey burger was not good. The texture was awful. It was more like turkey paste, not at all solid like a burger. I'm not sure what kind of quality meat they use but I can make a much better turkey burger at home. I stick to the grilled chicken now. My husband usually gets beef but loves their fried chicken sandwich. 

There are several buns to choose from
including a gluten free version and a lettuce wrap. They have a very large variety of spreads including my favorites, bacon mayo and parmesan spread. Including some very interesting toppings that cost a little extra: bacon, jalapeño bacon, buttermilk deep fried bacon, pastrami, egg, fried onion strings, etc. I've had the onion strings and I don't think they're as good as what you can get at Red Robin. They also don't give you very much avocado, considering it's 75 cents to add and I can buy a whole avocado for a dollar at the grocery store.

They also have a few different sides to choose from. The fries and tater tots are great. They're especially good with a side of Bad Daddy's sauce (homemade BBQ with a kick). Bad Daddy's also has a house beer for only $3 that my husband loves. He's also a fan of the apricot beer. We will continue to come here as long as the quality continues. It's a great place to go if you're picky and want to create your own meal.

I really enjoyed my experience here as far as the food goes. I had a buffalo chicken sandwich and it was fantastic. The sauce is fabulous and there's the added perk of they brew their own beer. The house tap is pretty affordable with a large beer only costing ya around $4. But the service I received was underwhelming and definitely less than par. Will try again since the food saved the day.

Ate here last week based on there reviews. Stop dont just dont. We came on a Saturday apx 8ish .Food wasent terrible but just ok. 
Fried pickles not so great change your grease guys....
 Service =bad waitress told us she couldnt waite to leave. She would disappear for 10 min then bring food.Then disappear 15 and bring nothing. Never checked if we needed anything. 
Then the bill. It took 25 min to pay that.She disappeared again for 15 min brought back a $20 bill as change guess you wanted no tip because your service was sure  not worth a $20 tip.
 Save your money dont go..

Yum!!! This place is super yummy. You can get what you want off their regular menu OR create your own burger (with multiple meat/non-meat choices) or create your own salad. I picked create your own salad! It was soooo good. I got spinach (you pick between romaine, spinach or mixed greens), black beans, corn (which was actually good corn!), red peppers, red onions, tortilla strips, avocado ranch for dressing, and added a black bean burger patty. Oh my gosh it was phenomenal!! 

I do not recommend getting their "giant" size though because their "small" was more than enough food especially with the addition of the black bean patty, SO filling! I got a side of sweet potato fries....DELICIOUS! I don't like my sweet potatoes with marshmallow sauce and brown sugar, these were just served salted...perfect! 

All their sauces are spot on! I tried chipotle ranch and "bad daddy sauce" which is bbq sauce, ranch, & chipotle peppers...so tasty. 

Will definitely be back! Love that you can customize anything and everything tastes like quality and a clean kitchen. Bravo!
Crazy recipes. Love the Blonde Ale. I had the ricotta burger, delicious. Love the different types of atmosphere- upstairs for a quaint bar, deck then downstairs with a ood horseshoe bar.

I've tried this place a couple of times but after yesterday's experience I finally decided to give them the review they deserve.
We came on a Sunday afternoon around 3pm and it was a PERFECT day for patio seating. It was packed of course because a nice sunny Sunday in February is practically unheard of around here. Luckily upstairs is open seating and we caught a couple leaving. 
Ordering went off without a hitch but I think my girlfriend and I had both noticed a good amount of time had gone by. I would say a good 45 minutes after ordering. We're both not really ones to cause a fuss but our waitress took initiative and came over saying we've been waiting a while and she would check on our food. Turns out my burger had been given to the wrong table and was being remade. No worries. We're patient. The create my own burger finally came out and PERFECT might I add, I was also thankful my girlfriends food was either remade or still hot so she didn't have to lose out because of me.
-Burger with buffalo, ranch, avocado, and a fried egg
-Tater tots ALWAYS amazing
Girlfriend had the
-Pastrami reuben burger which she said was excellent
-and fries (should've been truffle fries but we didn't know it was an option until after.. Darn)
The manager ended up comping my meal and gave me a card for a free burger for my next visit on top of it.
If I have to have a mishap with my food, I'm glad it happened here.

I had the fried pickles and the bacon cheeseburger on steroids to eat when I was there. I've had fried pickles from 4 different states (Virginia, Massachusetts, Texas, and now Colorado) and these are definitely the tastiest of them all. The burger itself was amazing and cooked perfectly medium as I requested. Also, the service was great from the hostess to the waitstaff itself. Highly recommended!

Went there yesterday with my husband and Sister.
Tried the tuna burger seared and the sweet potato fries!
ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!
Definitely going back:)

I'm not a burger fan. I like them occasionally. I am new to the area and I yelped good places to eat around here and this one won. I went in around lunch time on a Thursday and was seated right away in a booth (I asked for one). The waitress was awesome and nice and explained things to me on the menu. I was so hungry so everything actually looked good but I got the southern burger. I can't remember the name but it was basically their chilli burger. I had decent hopes because, like I said, I'm not a big burger fan so it's rare that I like burgers. Five guys was pretty good, but I still don't really care about them. Have to be in the mood. 

My food came out and it looked pretty good. So, I got a tater tot (my side) and dipped in the chili and oh my god... I was in heaven. So I cut in to the  burger to make sure it was well done. I can't eat any red meat if it's red or pink. And it was well done, thank god cause I'm hungry and so far this is dang good. I cut a piece of the burger off and oh my god it was SO GOOD!! I sometimes don't like burgers cause the meat is flavorless and any slight taste of meat grosses me out. Like if it just taste like raw meat or whatever. Every single friggin bite was amazing! I was full when I left but my goodness, did I want more! I almost wanna go back for dinner! I can't wait to try the other burgers now! So glad I just got a place near this joint!
This place is amazing. The best burgers and if you can't find what you want you can create your own. My boyfriend and I loved it.

Enjoyed lunch here with a friend!  We ate indoors, because it was a little overcast, but there is also patio seating on the roof.  They have a great "build your own burger" and "build your own salad".  I chose a crispy black bean (vegetarian) burger, and had the small salad on the side, which I ended up taking home.  My friend had the Club Sandwich with home made potato chips, which were slightly overcooked.  Her little girl had chicken strips and fries.

There seems to be a very large assortment of craft beers.  We showed up at 11am and other diners didn't really show up until noon.  Really good food, big portions. For the three of us, $30 +tip.

Bad Daddy, thank you for bringing a real burger to the Northern Coloradans... 

This place stays very busy, so beware of the lines. That said service is fantastic and the burger is what dreams are made of.

Try the fried egg on your burger, live dangerously, take chances, drive fast.

Service was fantastic! Greg was a wonderful waiter. He provided very genuine and sincere service. BF ordered Cheeseburger with homemade American cheese. He said it was a great burger! I ordered  the Catina (crispy) and with Greg's recommendation we both got the tots. 
Tots were fantastic and the dipping sauce rocked. My black bean burger was awesome! Good sauce on it as well, super messy... so good thing paper towels are on the table. Good music,tvs for sports, cool vibe, and looks like a fun patio for summer. The Yelp reviews drew us in and we will certainly be back.

I am finally compelled to review a burger joint..because omg. I have been chasing the best burger around for a while in my local area. I have yet to find one that I really wanted to go back for the next day. Some good ones to be sure, but nothing compelling me to return or even to write a review. Then I found Bad Daddy's while on a trip. And today is the next day.

I WANT ANOTHER DAMN BURGER BUT ITS 12 FRICKN HOURS AWAY. [super sad face] 

I had the Bad Ass signature burger and fries. Everything looked so good I wanted to steal bites from everyone. I might have actually done so but there arent pictures so it didnt happen.

We also got the last of the ba*con queso that night too. We almost didn't though. Our waitress almost ruined our night by telling us they were out of it. Thankfully the management staff was on point and made us a super happy table in spite of her sloppy inattentiveness. Seriously keep up with what's in the kitchen Morgan.

Pssst...Morgan rocked by the way - kidding about the sloppy service and bad attitude, really, she's absolutely awesome. See you next year! :)

This place has some pretty good burgers, I'm never disappointed. The happy hour is decent and offering an in house brew for $4 is awesome. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the burger menu is pretty basic and they hardly rotate anything. They used to offer 2 new burgers a month but that has gone away. Pretty sad bc I stopped coming here for a while since I was ordering the same things each time. I think they only offer like 9 types of burgers while Red Robin offers 4 pages full  of burgers. Would recommend going if you haven't.

Did not disappoint!

Started with the chicken nachos - the pineapple added amazing flavor! Kiddos had plain ole chicken strips and fries - no complaints from them! I had the veggie burger than comes topped with avocado - delish! I ordered mine grilled (also comes fried) and it melted in my mouth! Had a side of tots that were everything you'd hope tots to be - crispy, salty and tasty! My husband had the burger topped with egg and barely came up for air until half way done with the burger! Our other dinner mate ordered the smokehouse burger and it was cooked to perfection. 

Only one gripe.... waiter was super slow on drinks, which is a no no with a salty menu!

If you're on the prowl for a 5 star burger joint look no further. These guys have the full package.

A full menu of amazing burgers that are crazy-creative, wicked salads and I can't even tell you about the things they do with bacon. Then then there's the beer list, loaded up with local colorado brews and then throw in some awesome original cocktails for good luck. Did I mention their shakes!?

All of this comes together under one roof (unless you are on the rooftop patio) with an extraordinary staff and good tunes. This makes the 5 star experience.

Try the Sam I Am and a Southern Hospitalitea, you won't be disappointed! Also check out their happy hour specials, go late happy hour starts at 8.

On a serious note they totally swung and missed on my burger, manager came out and agreed. He bought my burger and expedited a replacement then gave me a free burger on my next visit. We all make mistakes but these guys know how to make it right!
This place is amazing, the food is perfect the drinks are great and it's a fun atmosphere. Can't wait to come back with my friends and family.

This Bad Daddy was just as great as the DTC location from quality of food to service. I ended up getting the Emilio's chicken sandwich and it was massive, but probably one of the most tasty and crispy chicken sandwiches I had ever had. The shakes are also great to pair with any of their meals. I highly recommend the garlic ketchup for your fries. The staff was very friendly and even though I had to wait 45 minutes for a table, it was well worth it!

I have eaten here several times with always an exceptionally good experience. It's about a  1/2 hour drive, but if you want the best burger it's certainly worth it! On this occasion I ordered the Bad Ass Burger. It was free because I joined their e-club. Thank you! I added onion straws and it had tremendous flavor. The 10oz patty really helped to divide the different flavors of the burger and everything on it tasted great! It is just too darn big for me to eat alone so I split the order with my wife and we devoured it!! When going to a restaurant I always pay close attention to the wait staff and where the Manager is. In this case there were two Managers on the floor and both stopped by our table at different times to check on us. Had some enjoyable conversation, and thanked him. I have tried both Cherry Creek and here but am prone to this location. It's an equal distance from home but can be sure parking is always available because of the strip mall location. Love the "Bad Daddy" theme with all the photos, awesome staff and Management team! I'll continue to make the drive not only for the awesome food, but also because I leave with the feeling that I enjoyed an "Experience"! Thanks Bad Daddy's!!

OMG Where to start. The beer list, and Lunch Happy Hour is a plus in my book. And the Burgers, You cant go wrong. They are big, and I definitely recommend cutting it in half. Lots of seating upstairs and down. And a seating area outside for nice days.

Oh duh! I checked in and posted this review under Big Daddy's! Oops!

Burgers here aren't cheap but I think you're getting what you're paying for. My Pastrami Reuben burger was served on thick sliced rye bread and the burger was tasty and moist. I had it with Tater Tots and it was a good sized stainless steel mixing bowl full of nicely crisped tots. The 16 local craft beers on tap looked like a pretty good mix of beers from several Colorado brewers. The atmosphere reminded me a little of what the Dark Horse in Boulder (kinda what the No-Frills-Grill setup if you only know Denver) was a lonnnng time ago. The guy sitting next to me ordered the Bad Ass burger and yes, it was. I might have to go that route if I ever make it back in here...let's see... what have I got going for lunch tomorrow?
Awesome burgers. First time to the Denver area for me and my family. Wish this was near home in Orange County CA.
