Yummmm this place is awesome! I've only ever had the burgers here but I haven't heard a negative comment from anyone. I always do the build your own burger and they have so many options to add things on. Be careful because if you add a lot you'll be paying a lot. 

Definitely a great place to get a burger and fries. Ooh! They have tots.. Those are delish too.
This place has excellent burgers, fries, and customer service. Only note is the Parmesan fries were a little too salty.

Awesome burgers, fast friendly service. Gotta try the fried pickles it's worth the trip there! Great for large parties and gatherings! I was a bit tipsy when I ordered but I remember it was delicious!!

Bad Daddy's is an extremely pleasant place to get a MEAN burger, tater tots that are out of this world, custom salads that are among the best I've had, micro-brews and milkshakes.

Oh yeah and the multilevel layout with open air or partial open air in what looks like a converted garage as well as great service, set this place apart.

Highly recommended for lunch or a lazy weekend morning.

The food was delicious. The sports themed environment was very cool. My only complaint was that the service was a bit slow. They could have had a bad day, or I could have been very hungry. I'm sure it was just an aberration. I'll try again when I'm in the area next time.

We started out with fried pickles and they were great the portion was small probably best for two people. My husband and I ordered the Emilio's chicken sandwich and the bacon cheeseburger on  steroids. We probably could have shared an entrée and ordered our own side. Both were great and worth the price. The Parmesan truffle fries were also wonderful. We did wait for a while to get our food which was disappointing. We mentioned to our waiter that we were on a time crunch and had a plane to catch and after bringing our food brought out our ticket to sped up the process which was wonderful. Would definitely recommend Bad Daddy's to anyone visiting the area!!

We are probably the biggest fans of this place out there. It is amazing! We have been here at least a dozen times now over the course of the last year and we have never been disappointed. I always use the pad on the table to create my own burger. My boyfriend always gets the Bacon Cheeseburger on Steroids. We have taken multiple, multiple different people here though and everyone has ordered different items and everyone has loved their food. The tater tots are amazing! Sometimes they have too much salt on them, but we just brush some of it off and they are perfect. We have always had good service. Definitely our favorite regular place to go! It has made us not like burgers other places we go, because they never live up to Bad Daddy's!

was totally awesome, yeeaaasssseeeaaahhhh....

I came in from the road all hangry and thought the feds were after me or something.... We told the waitress we done been travelin' all day on the first leg of our comeback tour and needed beer and food right away.

The local brews did not disappoint (I had a blonde and a red er something) and the nachos were totally righteous.... Byeeeaassseeaahhh!!!!
Excellent service. Our hamburgers were delicious and so were the appetizers. Highly recommend for lunch or dinner with friends. The facility is also very clean and well maintained. Love it here.

Nothing to write home about.... Personally I would take a Burger at The ***** in Northglenn over this any day.... at a much nicer price. Average Burger for a place that is supposed to be specializing in Burgers.

Great burgers. I had the Bacon Cheeseburger on Steroids with a side of tattor tots covered in cheese and green chili. Burger was cooked perfectly medium rare. The bacon pieces were huge, thick and crisp. It was pretty large. So much so that I had to punch down the top to take a bite. I have a big mouth but obviously not big enough for this burger We also ordered the house cut chips... Yum, make sure to ask for more French onion dip ahead of time for these. The pimento dip was blah and runny so skip that. We tried the Elvis Shake and the Cookie shake. They were nothing special. More like a DQ blizzard. We won't order those again. The house draft was also nothing great unless your a fat tire fan. We will be back for the burgers again though and to try the fried pickles.

This is absolutely the best burger I have had in a long time. Loved the fun atmosphere and the rooftop patio rocks!! They have a bar on the first floor and also on the rooftop. Great service and location. We have been waiting for this area to explode with new restaurants and it finally happened. 

We started off with their fried pickles and they were mouth watering. Then I chose the Surf's Up Tuna Burger and it was amazing! It's made with ground sushi-grade tuna marinated in ginger. It's served with lime and soy wasabi mayo and peanut soy Asian slaw on a multigrain bun. So delicious. I have not experienced anything like that in a form of a burger before. If you want a healthier burger you must try this yummy goodness.  My son chose the Sam I Am burger and it was great as well. I believe you cannot go wrong in your choice. They all looked amazing!

I look forward to returning soon and maybe even trying something different?:))

I wasn't a huge fan of the decor here and we waited quite some time even though there seemed to be some tables open, once we were seated though we did get a fantastic burger and great fries. The prices here were good too because you knew what you were getting and you could build your own burger. Deep fried buttermilk bacon made my burger a bit hard to get into my mouth but I'll be honest on the side it was totally worth it. Our waitress brought my husband a few beers to try because he couldn't pick one and he said they were all amazing! He got two of them and she was very prompt. 
She made recommendations and even helped us with our daughter who was very fussy until she got our food. She didn't make us feel rushed even though she was busy. We'll go back - maybe on a less busy night!
Amazing service, amazing food! I haven't had a burger this good in a very long time, and the truffle fries were incredible!

One thing I have learned in Denver is they have a lot of good burger spots. This is one of my favorites. I tried them and couldn't believe how good the food was. The server was awesome and they allow you to sample the beer before you buy it. Nice them to the place, awesome beer selection and great food. I couldn't ask for anything better. I will eat here again on my next visit to Denver. I recommend you stop by and give them a try.
The view from the rooftop patio is great looking west.  The burger was very good, but the other sandwich was poor.  Service was very good (ask for Megan!!).

Love it here! The burgers AND salads are both awesome! My favs are the pittsburger and the cue the chicken salad. Also all of their homemade sauces, sweet potato fries, etc. Really everything.

They've got lots of TVs, a cool rooftop patio, friendly staff and unique decor. Good beer selection and drink specials too. 

Only complaint is that the service can be a bit slow for a work lunch - would be great if they had a quick lunch menu or were just a little more aware that weekday lunch eaters usually only have 50 minutes.

Yum great food fun fun fun !!! Bar is indoor out door . Come and in joy

Well it was refreshing to have the manager John came to talk to me . The kitchen was slammed . He told me they were taking care of me they only want professional perfection. Look if you get a chance come try this place. Good old customers service. Best service I have had up north by far. !!!!!
love the burgers here and the homemade chips are to die for!  Be sure to try all their fun dipping sauces

When I walked in I felt instantly at home with the ambiance. Fun, modern, good music. The staff was very friendly, but the magic ended there. I ordered a burger medium rare but it came out medium well. I normally don't complain, but I normally don't eat red meat. I had a specific craving for a burger and saw that they used hormone free, local beef, so I figured I'd get my cheat in there. The bartender was super nice and understanding so he took it back and had them remake it. While I waited I asked for a Deep Eddy Cranberry vodka with soda and received a grapefruit vodka and soda. At least I like grapefruit so I said nothing and drank it. When my burger came back out, once again, it was medium well, no pink at all. So I asked for a box and took it home to my dog. He asked if it was better and I showed him it was not. They gave me a "free entree" coupon but I won't be back. I don't want to go back to a place where my $30 (including a 20% tip bc I have been in this industry and at least they were nice) doesn't get me what I ordered.

Best place around to get a burger and a beer! The rooftop is where it's at on a nice day.

Staff is friendly, and their take-out service is fast.

If you love endless choices, amazing meals, and great beer including local varietys- this is your spot! The service is excellent. Everyone has a great amount of energy and really takes pride in creating the ultimate dining experience. I have dined at the bar alone, with friends, large parties, and small parties. Each time the service has been top notch! My favorite pairing is the buffalo chicken sandwiched (grilled) in a lettuce wrap, sweet potato fries, and Night Hawk's Grapefruit IPA! :)

I came in from out of town & figured I would look for a good burger joint. I found Bad Daddy's which had good reviews, so I decided to check it out. The food was very good, and the beer was delicious. The staff & the atmosphere were also a great addition to the restaurant. I will definitely come back here when I am in town next time.
Love Bad Daddy's. Burgers are greasy but delicious. The tots and Bad Daddy's sauce are awesome.

I got the Western burger with beef instead of buffalo...delicious!
My wife wasn't starving so she ordered a kids meal with chicken fingers and the tater tots...loved it!

For our first time here we were very impressed. Our server, Molly, did a great job and made perfect recommendations. When we were done, the manager Brian, stopped by to make sure we were satisfied. Class act!

When we first arrived there was about a 50 minute wait. The bar downstairs was full so we went upstairs and found 2 chairs at the community table and had our food in a matter of minutes. They played great music the entire time we were there, mostly 80's. 
We will definitely be back.
Fabulous. The burgers are excellent. The green chili cheese tots really start things off. Will definitely be back.

A staple restaurant for me. The food is ridiculously amazing! I would highly recommend the Surf's Up tuna burger. The waiters are always friendly and the manager is friendly and a pleasure to chat with. If you've been thinking about going, get on over there for a great meal!

The name says it all. The food is great, the service is what you expect from a burger joint and the beer not too bad. I come here to get fatter, full and hoping my wife will let me get lucky after she drinks beer.

Great food! Great selection of beer! Nice atmosphere! Friendly staff! What more could you ask for. I filled out the paper where you create your own burger and went all out. Best burger I ever had in my life.

Fun bar atmosphere with outstanding food! My husband got a patty melt sandwich and didn't say two words to me during dinner - his food was that good! I built my own burger without the bun. Their beef patty,  grilled mushrooms and onions, and pesto were terrific. One of the best burgers I've had in a while! We both got the slaw as a side and it was fine but nothing outstanding. But hey, slaw is slaw. We will definitely return to this location!

First of all, I would have to say the music is played very loudly (I'm not even old!) which made it hard for my husband and I to have a conversation at all. I was quite surprised at how busy the restaurant was considering the time of day we went (mid-afternoon) but took it as a good sign. The service was very good but it took quite awhile for our food to arrive. Once it did, the food was good but could be great. We had both ordered our burgers medium which is what his was. Mine was much more rare. Probably the pinkest hamburger I have ever eaten in fact. Also, the fries are tasty but soggy. Overall, I would go back because the food was good and we may have been there on an off day.

Bad Daddy's is a nice oasis serving micro-brew beer and -- you guessed it -- burgers. We've only been in once, so I cannot say for certain I learned a whole lot about the customer service. We sat at the bar, and the bartender took great care of us. We were pleased by that.

The micro-brew beer was served in large 20oz. glasses (or shorter, if the patron so desires), and poured quite well. So, no complaints there.

We ordered fried pickles for an appetizer. They were served quickly and hot. The fried pickles weren't the usual pull-it-out-of-a-bag-and-microwave kind; rather, they were homemade. Having lived in the South for quite a few years, I thought these would fit in quite nicely in any Southern restaurant. To get that down-home flavour, however, chefs should consider using more vinegar. The taste just wasn't rich enough to compete with what I've had in the Mississippi Delta.

Finally, and perhaps most importantly, I was impressed by a manager on duty 31 May 2015! Most of the waitresses and the bartenders are young women. Two patrons sitting near us at the bar were talking crudely about them; it was -- to say the least -- offensive to anyone who heard them, including the young women. The manager approached the two patrons and asked them to stop talking about women that way. (Note: the manager didn't just say to stop talking about his staff that way, which is a foregone conclusion, but to stop talking about ANY woman that way.) Of course, the two patrons had some smart-alicky comment to say, but the manager just insisted they stop or leave. The two patrons decided to leave after a few more sips of their beer -- good riddance!

I will return just because of that manager and the moral courage displayed that sunny afternoon in May. Way to go, manager! You have definitely earned my respect and admiration.

If you like them overpricing greasy burger this is the place to visit but I give her a three-star because the service was good and friendly and I might try it  again
Because my son likes burgers

First time I have tried this place. The wait staff was friendly, the place was clean, the food looked good. I took a burger to go. I specifically ordered it to be cooked medium. I got it home. Everything looked good. I took a bite and it was practically raw. I couldn't eat it. I will give this place another chance but they have to do better. The fries were good.

Based on the number of more positive reviews, I'll give Bad Daddy's another try. My initial impression of the place was underwhelming. The service was good and we were seated quickly. 

The food was okay, but for the money, there are several other places I'd rather go.

Service was good. Management sucks. My meal was so-so; I think it would've been better hot. I, as a paying customer was asked to conform to another AFTER I had been asked and made my choice. I did NOT leave a tip and stated why not. This place will not be getting my business again nor a good recommendation or referrals to others. Once again my apologies to my actual server.

You better come hungry and ready to get messy! One of the biggest burgers I've had in awhile! I had the jalapeño bacon burger, wasn't sure how I was going to feel about it but It was great! Bacon was cooked just right! Most places can't pull off sweet potato fries but they had then perfect. The service wasn't the best. I only saw our waitress maybe 3ish times but other than that I highly recommend this place!

I went there with a group people at work for lunch. We waited 30 min to get 6 burgers.....I built my own burger which is smaller version of the bad ass one. It's the most greasy food I have ever had in my life....the buttermilk fried Bacon is so greasy and too much, everything taste salty and deep fried. I mean literately everything.... We end up feel so sick and can't even stand the smell... 
Well if you like unhealthy and greasy food, this might be your place. But for me, burgers taste like it has been deep fried, I will not go back.

My mom and I came here while staying in Westminster. We both built our own burgers. My burger had the spicy garlic ketchup, mayo, sautéed onions, and mushrooms. My mom got fries and I got the homemade chips. We both loved our food! I would definitely come back!

Eh... Not too great. The food was okay, the service was okay. Probably won't be back... I can't say I enjoyed any part of the meal... Maybe the Pepsi because I love Pepsi and not too many places serve Pepsi....

This review is specifically for the experience I had on this night. As we arrived we were told it would be a 40 minute wait, which we thought was fair considering it was a Friday night. Yet, as they were ready for us, we were simply told to walk up stairs and "we should see an empty table". No one greeted us as we got there and we waited at the table for about 6 minutes before flagging down a waitress to ask for menus.
      My wife ordered A Bad Ass Burger and I had a chicken topped nachos. Her burger was fine but my nachos were simply gross. Not sure what went wrong but the description of them didn't properly explain it. None of the flavors meshed well. The Bbq sauce completely threw off the nacho cheese and the pineapple didn't work with anything.  It was just a bizarre mess. I told the waitress it was too weird and when she came back later I let her take it away.
      I only finished about a quarter of it and seriously couldn't stomach another bite. They never offered to bring me anything else nor did I ask. If I go back I'm sure I'll just stick to burgers.

My husband and I have driven by many times and always said we needed to stop in to try it out. After all the hype we decided to give it a shot. 
Initial thought was 'great yet another burger place'. More like a bar and grill turned burger joint. 
There was about a 20-30 minute wait. The hostess was very kind and knew i wasnt thrilled about the wait and told us it was open seating uostairs. When she heard there was a clean table she let us know. Making the wait less than 10, huge plus.
Delicious burgers. Big menu selection. Great drink choices.

I definitely see us going back but more in the summer time to enjoy the rooftop patio than the dining room.

Overall a pretty good burger joint. My bacon burger was tip top, and so was my strawberry lemonade. The only real problem I had was the music. The music selection was fine (mainly rock) but a little to loud. Overall great place. Next time I want to try the rooftop lounge.

I like this place very much the pastrami is one of the best by far in Denver they use a BOARS HEAD pastrami, if you don't know what that means Boars head is as high premium quality and taste the the best, I had the burger and it's fine but my favorite is the Pastrami Burger and the bar tenders are very nice if you know a drink u like they can make it better the place is very accurate with the waitresses they don't make you feel like u gotta hurry and they are honest as can be they'll tell you what's really good not just try and get something to sell

If you want a good burger and fries, this is the place to be! I got the Sam I Am burger with sweet potato fries and it was delicious. However, I did ask for my burger to be cooked medium-well and seemed to have gotten a burger that was well done. Despite that, it was still a great burger. My brother got the Badass burger and that thing was massive. It is definitely worth the money for something that enormous. I would highly recommend the sweet potato fries or tater totes as a side. We got buffalo wings for apps and they were great as well. This place has a great atmosphere, very friendly service, and great burgers!

This place is ALWAYS packed, which is really my only gripe about this place. 

The menu is amazing so it's no wonder why it's always busy. I've started ordering take-out on weekends since they don't take reservations- which works out great. 

Highly recommend this place, especially if you can get a seat on the rooftop patio.

Just took my fiance here for all you can eat lunch;
Very attentive servers with amazing manners.
Food was delicious fast and came in abundance.
Green tea is perfect!
We will be back for round 2!

This USED TO BE my whole families go to Asian restaurant. 
I knew the original owners sold it a couple months ago. 
I was afraid it may go downhill but I didn't figure on an avalanche !
I ordered the chicken noodle soup. It's always been my " go to " when I'm not feeling good.
How HARD is it to totally ruin such a simple thing? There was maybe three pieces of chicken, three or four veggies, almost no broth and what there was had to be " doctored up" to even have a taste at all! 
I would have been better off with Ramen noodles & I hate those! 
To top it off it was $1.50 more than the great soup of old & the didn't even give me those crispy things ALL others give with soup.

Guess I will be looking for new Asian restaurant & make CERTAIN the rest of my family knows that now it is as bad as used to be good! 
DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY !

I haven't been back to Dragon Boat for several years but we were swayed by the price - just $16 for all-you-can-eat sushi dinner?  Sounds too good to be true.   Turns out, it kind of was.

Let's talk about the good first.  The man who served our table was very nice and helpful.  So nice, in fact, that I considered not posting a review at all.  He single handedly bumped this review up from two stars to three.   He was kind enough not to charge us for our uneaten sushi, which was really cool and he even let us take the leftovers home.   The other positives for Dragon Boat are the price for the AYCE dinner (about half the price of other sushi joints around town) and a really good selection of sushi, rolls, and appetizers.

Unfortunately, there are some major downsides when it comes to the food.  While I very much enjoyed the eel and avocado tempura appetizer we shared, the sushi and rolls just weren't very good.  The spicy crab roll was bland and not very spicy.  The grand canyon roll had such a ridiculous amount of cilantro and jalepeno in it that it was not edible until I pulled what equated to a side salad out of the roll (to be fair, after that, it was actually quite good).  The dancing roll was also kind of meh.  As far as the sushi goes, the quality of the fish was fine... not great, but perfectly acceptable... but there was WAY too much rice.  Same with the rolls - rice overload.

I think it's worthwhile for the price you pay, but you have to be VERY CAREFUL not to over order here because the amount of rice in the sushi and rolls makes each serving gargantuan.  I would not recommend ordering more than one roll at a time.  And that's a big disappointment if you're looking to try a little of everything.

This USED to be my favorite sushi place until the new owners bought the restaurant.
My boyfriend and i decided to do the all you can eat dinner sushi. We ordered a couple sushi and some appitizers and soup. We didn't get our appetizers first which all was good! Then the sushi started coming in one by one at the table and it was NOTHING like it used to be. They all looked the same, the celery inside the sushi was SLIMY. We tried looking for the waiter but she acted like she was busy. I never got my soup, anytime the waiter did come we felt like we were bothering her and she acted annoyed. Spicy tuna was the DISGUSTING part of the sushi, it smelt old and i had to spit it out. We payed and just left, never will i come back to place. Seriously, DO NOT eat the sushi!

This is my Go To place whenever I crave take out or delivery, and sometimes even come in and enjoy the service. The soup is delicious, I can always get brown rice instead of white or fried rice. My favorite is the Jalapeño Chicken extra spicy, but generally they are able to tone the spice up or down on a dish. The sushi is also a good choice when looking for variety, and don't forget to try the green tea along with the Miso soup. Highly recommend!
Everything was delicious, and it didn't take long Norway it  was expensive. Soup was cold when it arrived.

Ordered 2 soups and a order of dumplings, live less than a mile away, took 1.5 hours to show up, Ice cold... called to complain... they sent out another order was to me within 10 minutes of phone call, new order had hot dumplings and cold soup, not warm, cold... aka their soup trays weren't even keeping soup at 140 degrees aka health code violation aka they sent me soup that could make me sick etc etc who knows how long it's been under 140... hope the health inspectors come and shut this place down!!! I will be making a formal complain on Monday, inspections incoming!!!! Don't expect this place to pass..... avoid at all costs!!!! I mean unless you wanna get sick.

Love been coming to this place for years. Two main things to consider: Quality food and service. Servers are attentive and helpful. Their prices are moderate but still the food taste great. They are closed Sundays by the way. Also their sushi buffet is really good and not pricey. It's worth always to try new things. Each time I go to eat, sometimes once or twice for lunch is a good experience. The kung pao chicken is my absolute favorite.

I've always had good experiences when coming here. Their all you can eat sushi was good considering it was all you can eat. I have tried their lo mein as well and I love it. Their plates are large and affordable which is a huge plus! The couple times I've been here all the food seemed fresh. I've always had good service here, the employees are very friendly. One thing I will say is the inside isn't very clean and organized. Other than that it's a fairly good place for a quick bite.

I am always in search of a great all you can eat sushi place. I hate when you get there and the options for rolls are like 5 and you get soup and edamame. Lame. Dragon Boat has almost their entire menu available for all you can eat lunch sushi for $14 a person. It may not be the best sushi ever, but fantastic options to pick from, friendly staff and 2 for one sake. I love to try new funky rolls and all you can eat is the best time to try it. Check out Dragon Boat for some good sushi roll options for all you can eat.

We love this place for our family sushi night! We've been coming here for about 8 years now, this is our family sushi joint, close and convenient.
They have the all you can eat sushi, happy hour and entree plates.

The kids loves the pu pu platter, egg drop soup, Lo mein combo and beef with broccoli. They can't get enough of it! Fiancé and I likes their eel, spicy tuna and salmon sushi. The kids loves their Cali roll and tuna roll. The seafood soup is also good. 

This resto is amazing, great price for a large family, service is great and they have different variety of Asian cuisine! I also like to order Togo and my food is always ready when they say it will be. Never had to wait for a long period of time. Eat on and eat lots of it!

Super Fast Delivery( the guy who bring the food to my door is super nice and courteous). Love their sesame chicken, Mongolian beef,  salt pepper wings & Cantonese fried noodle. One thing sets this place apart from other Chinese restaurant is that they also carry sushi which I crave from time to time( bring to your door). Of course you can do all you can eat as well if you dine in. Ordering is super easy from Yelp that I don't need to call in and the menu are right there. I am just lazy and I prefer staying home and get what I want delivered right to my door step. Thanks & keep up the good work!

I've been coming here for years and the quality just keeps getting better.  I love all their food but I really love that they deliver sushi too now because its my daughter and my favorite.  Sure, its pricier than an all you can eat sushi place but its totally worth it!  I am asian and I'm very picky about my asian food, this place is the best place in the Aurora/Denver area by a long shot.

Amazing how quickly a great restaurant can go downhill:  I have enjoyed their very reasonably priced and excellently prepared dishes.  Their $1 sushi was also a very enticing bonus.  I understand that this place changed owners this summer, which resulted in deteriorating food quality which has only been surpassed by their incompetent, and evidently completely disengaged staff. Too bad! - This has been one of my favorite lunch spots over the years, but I'm afraid I'll have to find a new one now.

My boyfriend and I decided to try our this place because of the all you can eat sushi. We go in and it's empty apart from an older couple.  We sit at the bar to see how the sushi was made. We wait for a while and finally a waitress comes and asks what we want to drink. We order our waters and tell her that I want to order from the all you can eat and my boyfriend from the menu. The all you can eat menu looks good. We can get soups, wontons, lo mein, and lots of choices of sushi. I end up ordering mango, crunchy California,and Philadelphia rolls with lo mein, and wontons.

 My boyfriend got a California rolls and Philadelphia roll from the menu. After waiting a while finally the sushi maker comes out and she does not say hi or smile or anything. She starts with the rolls and a misunderstanding leads me with my boyfriend's rolls and him with mine. She still had not made the mango roll. So we are eating them and yes they are pretty good. They are a big size which makes you look like a chipmunk while eating. I start taking pictures and I tag myself using yelp on to facebook. You can see the pictures I took. I did like the wontons. They were very, very,  very good. 

 She makes the mango sushi roll and I take it. What I did not like about the sushi is that they used the long sticks of imitation crab instead of the shredded crab meat. The mango roll looked like the California roll but with fried imitation crab.

So there I am eating my sushi despite the sushi maker that's what I call her,does not say a single word and I am watching her roll the sushi all clumpy and like if she just started learning the art of sushi; when I get a notification on my phone. There on my Facebook my sister commented and said, "ewww why are you eating there? There are  cock roaches there." I look at my Facebook post and omg I cannot believe that right there where I so proudly said I was eating all you can eat sushi the report card of Dragon boat was showing from yelp. 

It said how dragon boat had failed inspection and how there were roaches near the water and how storage of food was not safe. One I felt immediately grossed out I could not finish my sushi. Second how embarrassing to be posting on facebook that I'm eating at a place where roaches and improper storage of food is a common thing.  I gathered my stuff and paid and bolted out of there. 

The whole way to Costco I was trying to not throw up my food and forget that I was even there. So if you guys want to eat where they failed at an inspection go ahead. Until they get better grades and I see that then I will go back. The staff was friendly but were invisible most of the time.
Good food, and service. When you pick up or dine in, you get hot food and crispy sesame, orange, or general tso's chicken. Sushi is good also.

It have the potential of being an awsome place. The  place is decorated decent. Sitting in the center of the dinning room are the unsightly bus tubs.  Bus carts and tubs should never be in view of the dinning guests. That's gross. They take up several tables in the center of the room and use it as a work station to store and prep condiments and roll silver. Another thing that should not be in view.  It was cluttered and just plain tacky. The whole staff sat at a table in the dinning room eating. Every time a guest walked in they were greeted by a staff member with a full mouth and no hand washing. 

Ah the food..  my son got all you can eat sushi. He was happy. 
I tried the Vietnamese noodle bowl. I was surprised to learn that it came with soup. The egg drop soup was very good. The egg roll and wanton were fine. The noodle bowl was very plain and not the quality I've had at other places. The veggies were basically lettuce and some cucumber slices. Not visually appealing in anyway. The sauce served on the side is always the best part. You expect the flavor to be in the sauce. It smelled like rotten feet. Not good at all. 

I wonder if they break as many rules behind the screan as they do in the front of the house? Sushi is very sensitive to preparation and tempatures ect...

Terrible sushi!! Ordered sashimi but they brought out a bunch of rolls with a ton of rice to fill me up and they waited until you finished each plate before bringing you the good stuff. For the price go to Saigon Tokyo for amazing sushi for less than their 17 all you can eat ..
Ordered delivery and the sushi was just ok. All of the rolls pretty much fell apart. The flavors were almost there but nothing stood out. We probably won't be ordering from here again.

All you can eat sushi, count me in. People argue the merits of a sushi place that offers all you can eat, but you must temper your expectations. 15 dollars for a full menu of sushi and appetizers is a can't miss deal. Yes they get your order wrong 44 percent of the time, but it's still worth it. My favorite is the Sakura roll and the the Aspen roll. The beef skewers and calamari are solid for appetizers. For the value and quality of food, I must give this tiny joint a high rating.

Don't eat the sushi...whatever you do. Don't. Eat. The. Sushi...blah

We came in excited and the cooked appetizers were okay, but when the sushi came it was horrendous. We told the waitress and she told us it was because of the sesame seeds...that being said, they were the only things edible. The pineapple juice was old. We felt bad and still paid but literally could not swallow the sushi for fear of getting sick.

Tried the all you can eat sushi.  The beef was phenomenal, but the quality and taste quickly dove to below average (well below grocery store quality).  Overcooked chow mein, over salted salmon roll, and the "zombie brain" was just a pile of mushy tuna.  The waitress even circled a reminder to tip on the receipt.  Won't be back.

If you're in the mood for good sushi and large portions, look no further! Specialty rolls that cost extra at places like Sushi Katsu are included on the "all-you-can-eat" menu here. They offer a variety of appetizer, nigiri, and rolls. We ordered two soups and a couple of rolls and were completely stuffed. The rolls come with 8-10 pieces each and are packed with fish - not rice. My only negative remarks are that the staff is somewhat inattentive and that the restaurant is messy (boxes and stuff everywhere that doesn't need to be out). If you can stand the mess, I recommend this place.

I've lived in this area for a long time and whenever I get the craving for Sushi or Asian anything for that matter, I always come here. The food is always fresh and I tend to order more than I can put down. Highly recommended!

We do not normally have Chinese food delivered but when we did we counted on Dragon Boat - for about 20 years.  When I placed the order she said delivery would be an hour, ok no biggie, not unusual for that time of day.  Showed up about half hour later and everything was barely warm.  When I called to complain she asked if I wanted credit for next time which was nice but would have rather had fresh hot food re-delivered, will be a long time again before I try if I do.

I use to go here all the time for delivery/take out but also ate in the restaurant many of times. 

The staff and delivery guys were always above and beyond nice. With delivery they always asked if I needed plates, chopsticks, etc. 

I really enjoyed the food -- you get ALOT. Not to mention their to go containers are really nice -- something a lot of places seem to not be using anymore -- resulting in spills. 

When we went into the restaurant they seem to always have a steady stream of customers but not crowded. 

I highly recommend...
-chicken LoMein
-sesame chicken 
-fried rice 
-crab cheese wontons   
soy wrapped sushi roll 
-avocado 
-mango 
-cucumber
Chinese Food is mostly gross wherever I travel but this food was very, very good!  I had the hot and soup and the Mongolian combo with beef, shrimp, and chicken and it all was very good!
Have come here a couple times for lunch. It's not bad if you're looking for a quick fix, but it's not the greatest. Sushi is "ok", again, nothing to write home about but it definitely won't kill you.

I did it. I did darken the doorway again. Of which, I swore I never, ever would again, after my last visit. I like the sushi. I sat at the sushi bar, and was promptly waited on. I have ordered sushi and menu items many times before at other sushi restarants. It doesn't have to be 'Rocket Science". And merely ordering seemed difficult, and confusing. My waitress, " order sushi on sushi menu". So, I did. Well, that was not right. Needless to say I had, 2 attempts, and got the,sh*! ordered. The waitress made it so confusing, that I was frustrated. And, to my Great Surprise, the waitress offered the least exspensive way to order. My food was fabulous. The dynamite roll came in a dish. I did inquire why. If this " roll" is in a dish why is it called a roll? I have had dynamite roll before. The answer was as believable as Mr. & Mrs. Clinton, these days.

Know your venue.  It kills me that people write about this place being "tacky."  Well it's an all-you-can-eat sushi joint in a strip mall right off the highway.  (Surprise!) On the upside, your sushi is prepared as your order it...not hours beforehand, then left on a self-serve counter.  It's inexpensive (12.95 for lunch) and includes all the specialty rolls.  On the other hand the fish is definitely not as lovely as Sushi Den, etc...considering that the whole meal costs what a single Sushi Den roll might cost, that's not surprising.  If your tummy is fickle, there are several cooked options like unagi or tempura rolls.  IMHO, the rice was well cooked, but flavored with a just bit too much vinegar.  The staff was extremely pleasant and welcoming.  All in all, a good healthy lunch option!
This is still my favorite  sushi  place.  Havent been able to find anywhere else with a lot of variety and such a goo price. When i want sushi i think of this place.
Very fresh sushi, attentive and friendly staff, an authentic experience and the AYCE special is a tremendous value!  True Japanese experience in Colorado, great for 2 or even better for small groups!

Once again I have to change my review.. I keep coming back to this place because their hot food is actually good and a very decent price considering that their entrees come with soup, egg roll, and a cheese wonton.

BUT I was in yesterday 5/20/2015 with my husband and my sister in law.. service again was terrible I asked the server for hot oil sauce and she made it seem like I was asking her for an arm and a leg.. the food was ok I have never fully liked their sushi I think the rice isn't fresh which is what makes the sushi taste not so fresh but what put the cherry on top for me NEVER WANTING TO COME BACK was when we go our bill. They are now INCLUDING TIP and I don't think this is right. I am a server myself so I know how hard the restaurant industry is but normally a tip is included if it is a party of 6 or more but when its just 3 people having dinner and getting shitty service its not ok to add tip.

Just because they were probably receiving no tips due to their horrible service doesn't mean that they can now include the tip.

Good food, good price. My only complaint is that the waitress yelled at me for taking a bite of my friends sushi off her "all you can eat" plate & threatened to charge me the full $12.99. ( I just wanted to try one piece before I ordered it!)
Consistently some of the very favorite Asian cuisine in town that the wife and I enjoy and have for years!!

English: I definitely  rate this restaurant a 5 star, it was the best sushi I ever tasted, they where perfectly rolled amazing me and my husband are definitely going back soon, the only thing I wish they had teriyaki at the tables :) they have great service it was our first time there and we don't regret going - 3/6/15 

Spanish: Este restaurant meres 5 estrellas era el mas mejor sushi que eh provado, estaban perfectamente enrolladas,  yo y mi esposo vamos a regresar, la una coso que estaria bien si tenian teriyaki en las mesas :), tienen buen servicio, era nuestra primera ves y no nos arrepentimos ir.

German: Ich auf jeden Fall bewerten dieses Restaurant ein 5-Sterne, es war das beste Sushi ich je gegessen, sie, wo erstaunliche mein Mann und ich werden auf jeden Fall bald wieder perfekt gerollt, das einzige, was ich wünschte, sie hatten Teriyaki an den Tischen :) sie großen Dienst haben es war das erste Mal dort und wir wissen nicht bereuen

French: Je dirais que vraiment ce restaurant 5 étoiles, ce était le meilleur sushi que je ai jamais mangé, ils où étonnante mon mari et moi seront certainement bientôt de retour laminé parfaitement, la seule chose que je souhaite qu'ils avaient les tableaux Teriyaki qu'ils ont un excellent service :) ce était notre première fois là-bas et nous ne regrette pas
First time here. Excellent service fresh food 2 for 1 wine & beer all you can eat menu $15.95 includes much more than just sushi!

This place isn't worth time or money.  There are better sushi places out here.  Literally couldn't finish the sushi due to the fishy taste which means not fresh. Way to much rice and not even sticky.  I paid to not eat the rest of my sushi.

The sushi is good, and much better than the rest of the menu, but there are better places to eat sushi at. 

I have eaten at Dragon Boat many times when I was living near there, and it is overall an okay-to-good restaurant. I never had a bad experience, but also never had a great experience either.

The all-you-can eat sushi is good, and stands up on it's own as being quality. My personal favorite, and I would recommend any sushi fan try, is the zombie brain dish, a mixture of avocado and tuna. I have nothing but good things to say about the sushi, especially the price that makes it very inexpensive for sushi. 

I have tried the orange chicken, and didn't not care much for it, it was very citrus heavy, without a lot of sweetness. 

The only issue I had with the staff was that frequently when eating there, the staff would have conversations just a few tables away, loudly talking and laughing with each other, to the point that it overwhelmed my own conversations.

That being overlooked, the sushi is good and at a fair price, but the rest of the menu and atmosphere can leave something wanting.

Ordered one time delivery . Food was old . Ordered garlic sauce shrimp. Doesn't taste good . Very sweet for some reason . If you really looking for a real Chinese food restaurant. That's not the right place . Ps. Thai tea was ok .

The general tsos is okay, but delivery takes more than 2 hours when you live a block away from them. I ordered food for delivery at 6:27pm on a Monday night and I didn't get my food until 8:25. I was told my wait would be 45 mins. The time I was told seemed long at the time because this place is less than 2 blocks from my house (I would've ordered pickup and walked, but it's really cold outside) little did I know it was going to be TWO HOURS. It was a clear night and they were less than 2 blocks away from me... 
The general tsos chicken was not spicy AT ALL and it was soggy (even though I ordered it EXTRA spicy and crispy) but, it did still have somewhat good flavor. 
The delivery driver was rude and demanded a bigger tip. I am a delivery driver, his behavior was unacceptable.

I used to love coming here for their all you can eat sushi, they have changed so much over the years. This last visit was awful. After waiting to be seated, the waitress was completely rude and rushed us on our order. We asked for additional wasabi and she was again rude, rolled her eyes and walked off to get it. 

On top of all that, the fish did not taste as fresh as it used to be. Now that there are more all you can eat places closer, I will not be coming back.

Ok so I live in Wyoming. So I was like yah food. So I got seaweed salad, cause I'm adventurous, it was interesting not bad. I'm pregnant so it looked both bad and good ate two bites lol. Had to have my ragoons! They were uh, ok. My chicken egg roles were yummy! Then cho main I think. Lol can't remember I'll take a pic of the receipt. It was good. Everything seemed blan. Then again it could just be me.
One of the worst sushi u can eat in town. Service is terrible too. Don't waste your money.

To be honest, I'm really surprised about the low reviews!!! We are fond of this place. Not only is it close, but the staff is great! The food was amazing (ordered on Friday night) and the delivery fast! The young man who delivered was very sweet and the food was steaming hot crispy! Only ordering from Dragon Boat from now on!

2 words: DON'T GO. 
My son has a bad cold and I wanted to take him somewhere to get soup. We spotted this place on our drive and decided to give it a shot. We ordered combination Lo Mein, chicken noodle soup and a California roll with baked salmon and dynamite sauce. It's a common roll. The server kept asking me, almost cartoonishly, if I wanted Lo Mein. Our less than average dishes came after a lengthy wait. (And it should be noted that their version of chicken noodle soup is a very long way off from what the average person would call chicken noodle soup.) They were tossed on our table by another server, who promptly walked away. We had no plates or silverware. After several minutes of trying, we finally flagged down someone who brought plates. We began eating but I kept wondering when the roll would make it's appearance. Finally, another server brought our roll- the wrong one. After several minutes of trying to flag someone down, I gave up and moved it to the side of the table- where another server picked it up and apologized for leaving it at the wrong table. Amazingly, our original server walked by and I asked if our roll was coming and she turned and yelled across the restaurant in her native tongue to inquire. The roll came about 10 minutes later, when we were completely finished eating. It was served not as a roll, but as a block- absolutely drowning in dynamite sauce. I ate one piece and just couldn't do it. Very low quality, not even made with sushi rice! I sent it back. Yuck. We had to wait another 10 minutes to speak to our server AGAIN to request our check. The best part of our meal was getting the heck out of there!!!!!!!

Terrible, horrible, disgusting.

Bugs literally crawling everywhere when I went to the bathroom. Told the staff and they argued with me to the point that our entire table got up and left. 

I LOVE sushi but refused to eat it once I saw the amounts of bugs. Did I mention they did NOTHING about it either? No discount, no meals removed, not even an apology. 

NEVER AGAIN WILL I STEP FOOT IN THIS PLACE

Think sushi Katsu with slightly more disgruntled employees.
I can't tell the difference between this sushi and katsu's, both about the same price, katsu may be slightly better... Like the way top ramen is slightly better than a hot pocket.

I have never eaten inside but we used to order from here once or twice a week. Their delivery is extremely fast and their deliverers are very friendly. We used to get the Philadelphia an volcano roles. Both are very good. I have also tried the orange chicken and pad Thai as well as the wontons. All very very good. If you love close I definitely suggest giving them a try. Very comparable to Sushi Katsu.

This place has really gone down hill. It used to be good for Chinese and okay for Japanese food. After a prior negative experience, my fiance and I decided to try it again. Bad idea. The server that we had, gave a dirty look most of the time, whether intentional or not is unacceptable. 

We ordered from the all you can eat sushi menu. We both love sushi, but my fiance can only eat small portions. She ordered calamari tempura, edemame, hot and sour soup. I ordered a volcano roll, unagi roll, spicy salmon roll, one order mackerel and one order spicy scallops.

As expected, because her food is cooked she received it first. The calamari tempura was greasy and the sauce was heavy. The soup however was good and the edemame acceptable. I waited at least 30 to 40 minutes for my sushi, even though it wasn't very busy. When I finally got my order, it was incomplete. I didn't say anything, as I thought the rest might still be on the way. The volcano roll was good, almost as good as you'd get at a good sushi restaurant. The unagi roll was lacking. The unagi was all inside the roll. The rice outside was somewhat dry. Not terrible, but far from great. The spicy salmon roll was never served. It was supposed to have spicy salmon, tuna and yellowtail. I think this was left out on purpose, as it was the most expensive of the three. The small mackerel order was good, although heavy on the rice. The small order of spicy scallop was also missing and replaced with cheaper tobiko rolls, which I didn't bother eating.

 Also throughout the meal, we had to ask repeatedly for drink refills, which also took forever. So we waited a long time on poor service, to not receive what I ordered. In between serving tables, the waitress would go to the corner of the restaurant and eat. At one point, all the staff mysteriously disappeared into the kitchen and didn't return for several minutes. The missing items and substituions seemed an easy way for the restaurant to be cheap, while testing the customers memory of what was ordered. The restroom smelled of raw sewage. In short, I will never return. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. It seems another victim of negligence from staff. They don't care as long as they make money.

Great price for the all you can eat lunch, $12.95. Although the volcano roll says it is spicy, I found I had to add a bit of the Wasabi to it for more of a "kick."  The tempura is nice and light and really made the calamari enjoyable. The vegetable tempura had a nice variety of veggies, the most I've seen from places like this (broccoli, yams, zuccini, mushroom, green pepper and green bean).  If I'm ever in the area, I'll be sure to stop here again!
Food was delicious.  Ordered from grub hub and it was delivered very quickly.  Portions were large so plenty available for left overs.  Would order again from them.

I'd sort of forgotten about this place in my enthusiasm of trying so many other Denver area restaurants.  I was hoping delivery would be as good as dine-in and take out, and I'm very pleased.  

We ordered lunch delivery today and received 3 entrees (sesame chicken, pad thai with chicken, and cashew shrimp) along with 3 spring rolls, 3 containers of soup, and 3 crab wontons - all for UNDER $23 BUCKS!!  We have tons of leftovers, and received our order only minutes after hanging up the phone to place our order.  I noticed that they did not even charge the standard $1 delivery fee.

Everything was hot, fresh, and delicious.  The spring rolls were exceptionally good.  I discovered that the pad thai is not my style though.  I prefer the sweeter "red" sauced pad thai dishes.  This brown variety is probably considered more authentic, so if you prefer your pad thai less sweet be sure to give this a try.  No biggie...I'll order from here anytime I want Chinese or sushi and will save the Thai entrees for Thai restaurants.    

If you live within 3 miles of this restaurant, I'd recommend trying the delivery option.

This place was conveniently located across the street from the DoubleTree Hotel where I was staying.  I had already hit up the gyro spot (which was great, by the way) so I decided to break my rule of not eating any seafood in a landlocked city and got some sushi.

I've read some of the reviews about this place and I have a hard time understanding  some of them.  Some said the service was slow.  Slow? My sushi and beers (BOGO free) can in a blink of an eye and I never had any problem with the service.  I thought the quality of the sushi was fine.  Not the best, definitely not the worst, but fine.  Then again, I'm not a sushi connoisseur, so I can only recognize the really bad.   

I came back with friends later that night.  This is where I had the biggest problem.  It was late and the restaurant closes at 10.  We were seated and served, but felt like we were being rushed out when the food was served.  If they wanted us to leave at a certain time, they should have told us that we either can't be seated or "sorry for the inconvenience, but we start closing up at 945.  Not a big deal, but it would have been nice to know ahead of time that I could only get 2 beer as opposed to my initial plan to get totally blasted.

Decided to try the all-you-can-eat sushi dinner for $15.95 per person. My husband and I generally get 5-6 rolls when we do AYCE sushi, plus appetizers. At Dragon Boat we ordered a few appetizers (crab cheese wontons, potstickers, and a dish called zombie brain) and those were between average and above. Then we started with 3 rolls. Worst sushi I have ever had! It was tough for my husband and I to get through the rolls. One of them had so much mayo-type sauce that I gagged when putting it in my mouth, another had tempura shrimp with the grossest thick batter on it, and the last one was very mushy but dry at the same time. Needless to say we are not going back there for sushi. We would rather pay the $23+ per person AYCE sushi at other places we've gone to in the past (Wasabi, Sushi Katsu, Samurai to name a few).

I've read many reviews of this place and decided to try it out. I went during lunch and was surprised there wasn't a crowd. Our waitress seemed a bit grumpy. We ordered 4 sushi rolls, 3 appetizers, a water and lemonade. It came out very quickly and we were very surprised by the size of our sushi rolls. They were very generous. I posted a few pictures. We noticed on the top of the menu you have to pay for whatever isn't eaten. So we were careful not to over order. But we weren't ready to leave yet and were wanting just half an order instead of a full order. So we asked our waitress if we could order that and with attitude said yes and when I asked if by chance we couldn't finish it could we take it home and she said "NO it says you pay on the menu." I said "I was just asking but I understand, thank you." So we ordered 2 more appetizers. Which this time took forever to come out. She did come over after a while and pour more water in my cup which went all over the table. She didn't say anything nor did she clean it and walked off. We just looked at eachother. We finally got our food and it was delicious. Total cost was $29. Will we go again? Yes, I'm going to give this place another chance. I loved their food and they do have 2 other waitresses. ;)
Good food. Cheap price. Where else u can get this price with a good flavour. Friendly staff.

Dragon Boats's sushi standards have really hit an all time low. I ordered some sushi for pickup yesterday night for four people with the hopes of tasting the same delicious sushi I used to constantly have when I lived close to their location. I was immediately disappointed by the soggy presentation of my sushi. I ordered some "Crispy" California rolls for my parents who aren't big fans of sushi and to my demise received regular badly rolled pieces of sushi with dry rice that were falling apart the second I put my fingers on one. The seaweed was so dry when I took a bite a could feel and hear the crunch as I chewed. As for the Sakura rolls, the avocado was somehow sloppily smeared on it sprinkled with a baby handful of masago on top. The spider roll unfortunately had to be thrown out because of the slimy and sour avocado that was rolled into it. Least to say we were pretty grossed out by our dinner. Definitely last time I stop by or order from Dragon Boat. 

Cheers!

Tbh on i eat at Dragon Boat for all you can eat, but there was on my day off i went to sushi katsu few times with couple of my friends and we agreed that sushi they make here at Dragon Boat is way better than anywhere for all you can eat deal. Fresh fish and rice ! We got good fresh food with good deal ! :) My husband loves their Zombie Brain, Volcano and Spider Roll !!
Best sushi! My husband and I always come here, never have been disappointed. We always get the all you can eat menu because we get more then just sushi for an awesome deal. :D

I wish I could give this place three and a half stars. I like it a lot but for me the wasabi wasn't hot enough otherwise it would be a solid 4 stars. Good sushi and my boyfriend got mushy chicken which I didn't try but it looked delicious.
Pretty Average on their sushi, but their General Tsao Chicken & Orange chicken are fantastic!

I ordered delivery last night at 645. She said it would take 45 minutes. I called after an hour. She told me they will be there any minute. They finally arrived at 8:30. We ordered fantail shrimp and it was cold. The miso soup was luke warm but truly the worst miso I've ever had. Then we ordered 3 sushi rolls. They included 2 soy sauce packets... On top of that. They hardly stayed together and was not fresh. Very disappointing. Do not order their delivery. LISTEN TO THE REVIEW IT IS NOT WORTH IT.

I rarely spend money dining out, it is so frustrating when the food and service is terrible. Waste of $35.

For some reason, Colorado has a lot of over-priced Chinese food. Dragon Boat is not one of them. 

The lunch special is incredibly cheap and will keep you full way past dinner time. The egg drop soup is wonderful, and the sesame chicken is great as well. 

Sometimes my rice is a tad cold bit I know how to use a microwave so it's not a big deal. Overall, I love Dragon Boat.

Remember you are getting what you paid for. Came here for the lunch buffet. $12.95. They have a decently varied menu, and I think better options than other all-you-can eat sushi places. The food comes out extremely fast and fresh with good portions sizes.
The worst customer service.  Took forever to get drinks, appetizer, and then rolls came out 30 minutes apart.
EH.......this use to be a great place. The waitstaff seems really upset of grumpy. The food was ok at best, I may have caught them on a bad day, we all have them I will try again another time.
Good service. Good food. Portions were pretty big. Kung pao tofu was good, not too spicy. Basil tofu seemed too spicy as my girlfriend kept pawning off her chili peppers on to my plate.

So, I ordered delivery from these guys this evening. I ordered: unagi roll, avocado roll (for my 3-year-old who loves sushi), sake kawa (salmon skin) roll, a tempura shrimp roll (with spicy mayo), a salad with ginger dressing, and vegetable tempura (again, for my daughter). 

The unagi was undersauced and didn't really taste like much, same with the sake kawa (though I enjoyed the danmuji/pickled radish in it- reminded me of gimbap) and the skin could have stood to be a little bit crispier. I could barely tell the two apart flavor-wise apart from the radish. Those were mostly meh, and I don't think I'd order them again. No complaints with the avocado roll- I mean, it's an avocado roll.

The tempura shrimp roll was pretty outstanding. Massive shrimp, and I asked for them to put spicy mayonnaise on it- which they did. It was delicious. You get eight pieces per roll, and the pieces are large- I was definitely impressed with the portion sizes for the money. The vegetable tempura was a massive bargain for just over five dollars- there was an absolute ton of various veggies and sauce- enough for more than two people as an appetizer. Broccoli, Japanese eggplant, bell pepper, onion, carrot, and even snow peas were fried up and still very crisp upon arrival.

The salad was also a massive portion, with an adequate amount of dressing. The ginger dressing was really outstanding- maybe a little on the sweeter side than I'm used to, but it was delicious. I found myself eating the salad and tempura and then barely touching the sushi (it's in the fridge for tomorrow's lunch). 

I spent just over $30 and got enough food to probably feed three people- too bad it's just me and my little daughter! I don't mind leftovers, but I think I will order less the next time. Their delivery fee is a mere $1 in their delivery zone (which includes my flat in the Broadstone Vesta complex), it arrived within thirty minutes, and the delivery guy was really nice. 

I'd definitely order again, but maybe stick to the more flavorful items on the sushi menu.

Heard good things about this place, but apparently I didn't order the right things. Ordered 3 different rolls that pretty much tasted the same. The unagi roll was very disappointing. The regular sushi was very bland with too little fish and lots of rice.  I will probably try it again because my husband really liked his food.

Don't ever go here!!! I ordered food here for the first time tonight and it took two hours! Except I actually never got my food! I used grub hub to order there and they claimed they never received an order when I called to ask them about the status of my order. I'm guessing it's because I decided to pay with cash and they had no way to track that I ordered food. The lady I spoke to didn't even care. She was just was like oh no big deal guess you'll have to talk to grub hub about that. Based on all the other reviews I would never order here ever ever ever again and and I would recommend that nobody else orders there!
I LOVE this place! I come here all the time with either my wife or friends and have never had a bad experience. Great price for all you can eat sushi.

Happy Birthday Cierra !.....This place, if nothing else, was an interesting story. We were seated by a man who I thought was our server. He wasn't. He brought us our drinks and I ordered green tea. I got a MUG of tea, in a semi-clean mug. We waited a good 15-20 minutes for someone to take our order. In the midst of our wait, a man burst into the dining room from outside, hollering "CALL 911....CALL 911...someone is beating up my father !" 
Apparently, there was a fender-bender out on Iliff that turned violent. 
Then our food arrived. I ordered the crab and avocado salad that was supposed to be on a bed of greens, and I ordered peanut dressing on the side. What I GOT, was shredded...maybe crab...with a good looking avocado, on a bed of iceberg lettuce hearts (you know, the bitter insides of the already flavorless iceberg head.)The dressing for my salad tasted like peanut butter. Not peanut sauce. Disgusting.  I could only eat a bit of it. Ugh. 
My son ordered sesame chicken. It was awful. The batter surrounding the chicken was mushy and porous, the sauce was way overly sweet, and the batter soaking up the mess made the dish pretty un-edible. The birthday girl ordered the all you can eat sushi for 13.95. She had one plate of the stuff. She said it was "okay". My sons water glass was empty, and he saw the water pitcher on an empty table near us, so he helped himself. The server dashed over and fairly knocked him aside to fill his water glass for him. She wasn't smiling. No, I will never return here.

Tuesday June 02nd 2009

A group of my friends who loves eating sushi went to Dragon Boat Sushi and Asian Kitchen for our monthly sushi fix.

This was my second visit to this restaurant.  My first visit was way back sometime in September 2007.  

The decor is the same.  The staffs are also the same.  The place is clean as what I could recall.  The only different was the seating arrangement that were allocated for us.

The sushi is basic.  Nothing spectacular or fancy.  All my friends like it.  They rate it between 3 to 3.5 stars.  They allow reservations and allow separate checks.  The slight downside, only 1 person prepared our Sushi for our group so that took awhile for the whole group to have their Sushi dinner.

Price was reasonable.  All in all an OK experience.  Rate it between 2.5 to 3 stars for my personal experience.  Though I cant deny, my first visit to this restaurant, I experience better sushi.  Oh well.

So, I've heard a lot of good things about this place... Reasonably priced, good service, etc. I finally got a chance to try this place out. $15 all you eat sushi. I started with the crab cucumber salad, which was very tasty. Then moved on to the sashimi... The octopus, crab, and tuna was great. They were very generous with the portions, unlike other spots, that I feel try to cut back due to the whole "all you can eat" factor. The waitress was also very pleasant and suggested I try one of their specialty rolls once she found out that I was a fan of spicy tuna. I will definitely be back.

I've given Dragon Boat 2 stars for a few reasons. They delivered my food within 30 minutes as they estimated. I live right across the street from this restaurant, but had never ordered before. I ordered based on yelp reviews without a menu. When I looked over the receipt they charged me $1 for delivery. If I would have known this I wouldn't have left as much for a tip. I'm walking distance from them. It does however say they charge $1 for delivery on the menu.

The Crabmeat Cheese Wontons were pretty good. Not horrible or spectacular, but decent. The Wonton Soup was about the same. I ordered Sesame Chicken, one of my all time favorites. It tasted like it was slightly burnt and the flavor did not resemble Sesame Chicken in the slightest. I can't say I will be ordering from here again. I ended up with rice, soup and wontons for dinner,
Hot sour soup was gross but everything else was fantastic. The jalapeño garlic wings were delicious!

This place is disgusting!!  The bathroom was filthy with feces on the wall and stalls.  It was so disgusting that bugs were everywhere.  The soap dispenser was black with dirt and god knows what else.  The staff is rude and unfriendly.  Everything in that place from the door knobs to tables were covered in a layer of dirt.   I wouldnt take my worst enemy there.  They got horrible health inspection reviews.  If you want to get sick, eat there   If not, there are plenty of other asian/sushi joints that are clean and friendly.

What I like about this place:
**Very affordable--from Sushi to actual entrees, everything is very affordable and has good portions. 
**Octopus salad--I've never tried this elsewhere, but I really like it here. The portion comes in a pre-dinner salad size, where its just enough to eat as an appetizer before your actual meal. You can request it mild or spicy and the ingredients are usually fresh.
**Fast and friendly service
**Buy one get one free beers

What I don't like about this place:
The sushi is just okay--nothing special about them and the rolls are pretty small. 
This goes for entrees too.

So I guess the best way to describe this place is that you pay for what you get. You may not be paying a lot, but you're not really getting a lot either. If you need an inexpensive meal that won't totally suck, here's your restaurant. If you're looking for an actual sushi fix, I'd go elsewhere to be sure to not disappoint.

Not that great.  The three star rating for this place is accurate.  Nice staff, but the food is really mediocre.  Cashew chicken was incredibly bland, the sesame chicken was nothing to write home about.

I can't say I wouldn't eat here again, but I wouldn't drive very far to do it.

Before I came to this place all I knew about sushi was Tokio Joes.. But now after giving at a try its my favorite place ever (I even celebrated my b day there) very fresh everything! The best sushi roll is the "spider roll" amazing

Not good sushi, very unfriendly staff, place was freezing cold and not very clean. Rice was over cooked on rolls, seaweed wraps were too chewy and overall just disappointing. Would be better going to Katzu every time for the same price and way better everything
I have been coming here for years and really love the fact that I can order 3 sushi rolls under $11.00 and have it be delivered! Great selection of food!

This is a tough review.  I don't eat Sushi.  I don't really like Sushi, but we were at a friend's birthday party and there was Sushi.  I was coached quite well as to what I should try and what I should avoid.  A couple of the items (cooked) actually tasted very good, but Wow! I ate a couple of fishy items.  My friends at the table just love this place and it's selections.  The service was great.  I'll be back, but next time I have the Chicken.

The staff is kind and the fact that they deliver sushi is wonderful. Sushi is not too pricey, but is also not the best sushi in the world. It's not a place I would go to first, but if there are no other sushi options then this place is a decent alternative.
My son and I had all you can eat Sushi.  Not bad.  Wish we had more room in our stomachs to eat more than we did.  The Chinese food looked good.  I might go back if I am in the neighborhood.

Heard good things about them so figured we'd give them a try on their lunch sushi buffet.  Can't say we'll be back and here's why:

1. Miso soup is nasty.  Probably worst miso soup I've ever had.  Too salty, and they used dried seaweed.  It's fine to use dried seaweed, but not like that, not a big square and letting it soak for hours.  And I know miso is supposed to be salty, but I'm not supposed to pass out from my sodium consumption from one bowl of soup.
2. Sushi was not good.  Too much rice, and not good rice.  It's way too dense and mushy.  The kind of rice where you can't make out one grain from another, so it just looks like the fish was rowed in mashed rice ball.  
3. I don't think the fish is too fresh. Not asking for flown overnight fish, but just somewhat better.
4. Things that were cooked and came out hot is a little better, but not enough for me to come back for their sushi buffet again.

For same/similar price, do yourself a favor and just go to Sushi Katsu instead.

Ordered food at 7:45. Got a call at 9:15 that said they can't deliver my food until 9:45 and they said I should pick it up and were only willing to give me "free wontons".  Really?!
I already waited over an hour and was STARVING and I didn't want to wait another 30 minutes for hour old food. 
Wish I knew what their food tasted like so I could review it. 
Not sure if I'll try again. 
Now I get to eat a PBJ. Sad face!!

Oh my, what to do, what to do. Good food, good service  - thought I had finally found a decent Chinese place - that is until I went back to the restroom after finishing my meal. Lo and behold, on a chair RIGHT BESIDE the restroom door sat two large mesh bags of fresh cabbages. I guess they had been brought in a side door and left by a delivery service. I can tell you it was a real turnoff seeing them sitting so close to the restroom sort of mingled in with the restroom smells - dampness, and all that goes with it. Not good. I doubt if I'll convince myself to go back. I really hope someone from the place contacts me to explain this. I want a good Chinese place, but until I understand this situation it won't be this one.

We've been going there for years. Loved the all you can eat sushi!  Until the cockroach fell from the light fixture and we were asked to help kill it. Sorry we had to experience that, but now you don't have to. Had nightmares about it.

Do NOT order sushi at this non-Japanese restaurant. I ordered a sushi dinner & got 6 pieces & a California roll. Only the salmon was decent... Just OK. The rice on the roll was dry & so was the sushi. These people should not be trying to sell sushi. This kind of poor attention to detail will give sushi a bad name - not mention bad taste. Cooked stuff is much easier to pass off as good food.

I decided to try this place because I wanted somewhere that would *deliver* sushi to me. Overall it was pretty good. 

We ordered a Baked California roll, a Spider Roll, and some Taco nigiri. I won't say that it was the best sushi I've ever had, it could definitely have been fresher. However it wasn't bad either.....just average. 

We also ordered some basic meals. I got the Pad Thai and my husband got the Sesame Chicken. Both of those were excellent. 

I would definitely order from them again.

Living in the heart of Plenty, of Asian food that is, I haven't tried Dragon Boat for roughly 8 years... but since its the closest to me I figured we'll give it another go. 
We pulled up the menu online (love that!) called in our order and shortly thereafter took off to pick it up. 
The place was nicely decorated, there was a family eating in and most people were at the "sushi bar". Mostly it appeared to be waiting for their to go orders. 

I ordered the Orange Chicken/friend rice/ hot and sour soup. My beau order General Tso's chicken and the same sides. Also an order of pepper calamari. 
My Orange chicken was really delicious! I guess I wasn't expecting it to be breaded and fried like sweet and sour chicken..but it was good none the less. Including the veggies. The HoT and Sour soup was really good. That stuff was super HOT from the stove for quite a good while too! 
The pepper calamari on the other hand completely lacked any crunch to it. They were however BIG pieces..but we'll skip that next time around. 
All in all a good experience and we could make it our usual go to for Chinese take out.

Not sure why there are two of these under the same address, but whatever.

But wow am I impressed. I honestly haven't enjoyed a meal so much since I left Ohio, where my beloved Jasmine is, so I am glad I checked this out.

Cheap prices, very fresh, great portions, nice staff. When I say they take their time on the sushi it is not a complaint - sushi is not something that is supposed to be immediate. The girl who made mine painstakingly made it look perfect, in fact I was slightly sad to eat it, it looked pretty adorable.

Also, not sure if I happened to pop during a happy hour or something (right before 5) but amazing prices. I got 3 (THREE) pieces of sashimi for $2/3. I loved how they asked about 3 times if I was sure I wanted sashimi and not sushi (it has no rice!) but I don't need rice. If the fish is fresh, gimme it, leave the rice. And like I said, very fresh.

SO my vote is if you are in the area or want to make a small fieldtrip for fresh cheap sushi-def a stop.

As far as their entrees or Chinese menu goes - I have no idea. Sorry!

I love the different options you get to really make the pie the way you want it. I have been to the one in Broomfield on many occasions and got the same high quality pie here. Great atmosphere and good service. We went to a show at the King center next door and decided to try this location before the concert. 

We got there 15 minutes before closing time and I knew we wouldn't be out of there by the time it closed but the guy said no problem to stay as long as we wanted. The pizzas were fantastic and a great price. The atmosphere is what you would expect on a college campus with lots of room and funky wall decor. 

Job well done.

One of the better places to eat on campus, I'm glad to have this as an option as there aren't many! I love that I can create the exact pizza I want... I can be a little picky when it comes to pies. They always have a pie of the month. My favorite by far has been the pumpkin with crumble and frosting drizzled over the top... OH. MY. GOODNESS. It was amazing. I usually get something cheesy with white sauce (I'm not a fan of red sauce on pizza, but theirs is ok ish). They have a thin crust and a regular crust, though I can't tell a whole lot of difference between the two, maybe a little more crust on the edges. They also serve beer on tap! Can't go wrong with that! 

All in all this is pretty tasty. The only complaint is sometimes it's too loud to even think. Being that I'm usually here between classes I would prefer to have a little more comfortable environment. 

*tip* if you ask for a to-go box, take your food out of the restaurant... I don't usually eat a whole pizza, so I take half with me, even then when I eat it there I feel like a terrible, earth hating person.

If you're looking for a quick, easy, & decently priced place to grab lunch while on the Auraria Campus, this is a good option. I say that mostly because all the other food on campus is terrible, though. 

The pizza is okay. It's pretty doughy and most of the time the ingredients taste pretty low quality. But that's to be expected for a $7 personal pie I suppose. It's good for what it is and will fill you up in a hurry as long as you're not a pizza snob. 

The atmosphere is what you would expect from a college pizza joint. Crowded, noisy, and a bit drab in my opinion. But who's paying attention the the atmosphere when they have to cram a pizza before their next class.

This is single-handedly the best place to eat on campus. Their pizza is made fresh -- right in front of you. They have a variety of toppings and drinks they offer. The environment is always busy and welcoming. I'm not even a huge fan of pizza but i can never turn down coming here

Always solid. I often stop here for a quick bite between classes. They never take more than 10 minutes and they're almost always busy. 

4 bucks for a personal sized cheese pizza? Can't beat that.

I have a meetup group that needs to cater to all of the dietary needs of each member. The nice thing about iPIE is that I can get everyone's order ahead of time and because there are an infinite number of possibilities on an 8" crust.  Weather the person is vegetarian, gluten free or allergic to anything else, everyone get's something they enjoy at infinitus pizza pie. But, remember it's not pizza it's pie!
     For the best pizza catering in Denver these guys rock!

These guys were slangin some Za for the Tivoli Brewing Grand Opening.  I thought it was cool of the guy walking around giving out slices.  I was eating two at a time, sausage, pepperoni, cheese, vegetable it didn't matter.
Ipie is always a good place to go, the foods always good. The place is typically packed though so you might have to take your food to go. Staff is awesome. It's a nice place to hang out.

This is my all time favorite spot on campus to spend my almost 2 hr. break between classes at. I can concentrate on reading or studying around noise, so the atmosphere doesn't bother me at all. I actually prefer working around the music and chattiness of this pizza/bar over in a quiet library. 
I love their "bread for the fans" bowl for when I'm not hungry enough for a pizza, but a little snack does the trick. They just put little rolls in a bowl that are free for whoever would like some. I also enjoy their selections of beer. I work at a bar downtown with 50 taps and 500 bottles, so it is sometimes hard for me to find something I haven't tried as far as beer goes, but with their 4 taps (a couple of them rotate) and bottle/can selection, I have had a beer I've never had before almost every time I go in there.
