To add to that, the student staff are always very helpful and often really funny. I am so glad this place is on campus where I go to school.

IPie is pretty good. Prices are reasonable and it's always made fresh. Staff is nice. 

The only reason I give it three stars is because the service time is so unreliable. Sometimes you'll be in and out in like 10 minutes and others you'll be waiting for 25. 
That wouldn't necessarily be such a problem (certainly not one worth 2 stars) but this place serves a college campus. That means people are stopping by on breaks between classes or on their way to class. That means most people, myself included, are need to be somewhere at a certain time. If it consistently took 10 minutes or if it consistently took 25, that would be fine. But never knowing how long I will be waiting makes it impractical for a quick bite which is a shame because it's far far better than the crap they have downstairs in the food court. I waited for 25 minutes once and ended up being 15 minutes late to class. 

So overall I recommend it butjust know that you can't really budget for time because you don't know what you're gonna get.
Amazing place to grab a bite, catch up, study or get to know new people!!! Jolly Molly is the great employee ever!! and I love that they employ Emily and others to help them work on production!!!
Definitley one of the better places to occupy this space in the Tivoli. Great Pizza and wings, but sometimes their wings are a lil undercooked.

I need gluten free food and I love pizza so it's hard to find a place that caters to my needs. This establishment has really good ingredients and the food is great.  I go to a lot of pizza parties but, I know that I won't be able to eat the food because it's not made with the right stuff. I wish everybody would order this instead of that other stuff!

We love iPie.  My kiddo, even at age 4, asks for it by name.  I love all the choices:  because they are all personal pizzas, everyone gets what they would most like.  And it is fun to experiment.  My husband always gets the teriyaki sauce with chicken, bacon and pineapple.  I'm a ranch sauce girl with sausage and mushroom.  And it's nice to be able to pick up the kids a small Hawaiian kind.  I can only speak for the pan crust since that is what we all get, but it is delicious.  If I was into stocks, I'd put money into this biz as soon as they go public.  I'm thinking it has a great future ahead.  Best pizza chain in Colorado.
Great pizza. Fair price. Hade the garbage pizza. Red sauce was yummy. $7. Recommend! Better than most options in campus. Good selection of pizzas or make your own. Cheese pizza is $4.

Great place to grab a sub. Mmm mmmm mmm. Get the hook & ladder fully involved. 

Complaints are mostly impatient housewives who can't wait 5-10 for a sub.

I've been here about 20 times over the past few years, and I can definitely say that the food here isn't that great, and I've tried most of the subs. Nothing seems fresh here. Also, the service can be super slow when it gets busy. I usually walk away when I see the line close the front door. Plus, when its busy, there is no place to wait for your sub, its gets very uncomfortable. Just another chain restaurant with below average food, on par with Jersey Mikes.

I have never waited so long for a deli sandwich in my life! And I was the first person in line! The prices were high and the sandwich okay but nothing spectacular. Wasn't impressed- today was my first and last time I go to Firehouse Subs.

Chaotic on a Saturday. Apparently a lot of folks called off when I visited. Apparently the workers that day were not happy because they kept saying that the boss told them to deal with it and he was not calling anyone else in. Okay?!? They were out of 6" white bread too and their POS system did not honor my Firehouse Club points. How can you be out of 6" bread when you also serve footlongs. Would you not just cut the footlongs into 6" subs? I'll probably give them one more chance someday.

I've never been and decided to try Firehouse, I will not be going back. I ordered the Italian sub and it was SO overwhelmingly sweet I didn't feel great after eating it. Besides that, it really had no flavor. The grossest sandwich I've ever had. Save your money and go to Subway, Jersey Mike's or Jimmy Johns.

This location is dirty every time I've been. The staff takes a minimum of 10 minutes to make one sandwich and often the cashier has no clue what they are doing. Last time I went the poor cashier walked away mid order to get sick in the restroom but then returned to work. The sandwiches are sloppy and inconsistent. I will not go back.

I'm not much into sandwiches but this place might change my mind.  Chris helped me pick out the Turkey Salsa Verde and its totally yum (and only 430 calories!).  Added a side of coleslaw, which may have upped my calorie count, but oh so worth it.  Whatever they use, it has a good taste and not over mayonnaisey.  Priced right too! May have to take another trip soon to try that brisket!
First time ever visiting a Firehouse Subs, and I'm glad I did. Not a big fan of dubs but this was really good. And the place had a cool theme

I love the concept and I want this place to do well. However, they must fix there customer service. The employees act like they don't want customers! The sandwiches are really good but take FOREVER to make. Improvements must be made to keep my business!

Every time I'm in the area I call ahead and order that big meatball sub.  I think they put something in it that's addictive and makes me crave it!!  Just kidding, but I don't know why I need to get it each time.  Great guy who owns it, too!  He always is friendly and says hello when I come in.  Good group he's got over there.
Bravo.  Keep the meatball subs coming!!
Great people. Always fun, happy and helpful. Not perfect but who of us is??  Food is always fantastic and I love the service.
Worst customer service that I've ever had. Staff was extremely rude and unprofessional. We will not be back.

I came in on a Sunday with a mobile app promo for a free medium sub coupon with the purchase of a combo meal.  I ordered an Italian sub with chips and a drink.  The cashier knew nothing about the promo.  

The cashier brought  the sub to my table and said they were out of free medium sub coupons/cards and offered me a free dessert.  No thanks.  I chose to order a Hook & Ladder sub to go.  I was disappointed that they did not have the coupons available.

First time and last time for us. Grabbed subs before stopping at the Reservoir and it was a 15 minutes to get our subs. There was a whole crowd of pissed off customers along with us. Open them up and not only did we get one wrong sub, but they were absolutely just thrown together without a care in the world. Sloppy, nasty mess. It was disgusting.

Came in From California  on business got helped by employee named jhonnie and was served with great customer service and the sandwich was great ! he even gave us some advice on places to see while we were in Denver thanks alot ! 

Turkey, Bacon was really good I recommend!

Firehouse subs is a chain of sub shops that is sort like a Quiznos.  A selection of a lot of hot subs, some cold and sides like chili.  They have the cute Firehouse themeing and lots of cool lingo (like the hook and ladder or getting your sandwich fully involved). You know, if you are into that sort of thing. 

This one popped up on the other side of E-470 on Smoky near Aurora Parkway. There is limited fast food in this area so it is a welcome sight!  I stopped in today (having been to another Firehouse before) and got a couple sandwiches.  It is one of those places where there are 10 people working and no line, but it still takes forever to get a couple sandwiches.  I suppose it means they make them with care? I don't know, but it is a little slow and a bit pricey (a couple sandwiches, chips and drinks where around $20). Maybe it is pricier because they have the fancy schmancy coke machine that has every flavor under the sun and kinda looks like some red glowing computer :) 

At any rate,  I do love the flavor of the deli meats they use.  The bread is always soft and fresh.  And they have a varied enough menu I can find a few things that please me.  All in all it is a good place to get a sub.  I'll be back! It is tasty and relatively quick in an area of town that doesn't have a lot of selection!

I've been going to this firehouse for a few months now and I have to say I have never received such friendly service at any other sandwich shop.

Jonny really livens up the atmosphere and brings a humbling smile to this establishment making for a pleasant conversation rain or shine. 

5*s all the way, you earned my business!
Jonny, keep up that dedication and that attitude. Traits like those don't go unnoticed.
Their sandwiches are great. But, contrary to what Yelp says, they do not deliver. The online ordering function is for pickup only

I came here once when it first opened and there were so many issues I haven't come back until today...no improvements since then. Finding a clean table was impossible, which is surprising since hardly anyone was in the store and there were 5 employees standing around. I did see one girl sweep the floor under a dirty table, but lacked to wipe the tabletop or clean any other tables. I did notice her have time to get herself an iced tea and wander back and forth from the back of the kitchen to out front. After placing our order, it took 15 mins to get our food! Why? The food was good, but the store was so dirty I do question cleanliness of the rest of the store. Sorry firehouse, this is the last time I'm coming here.
I have been here many times and enjoy the steak and cheese sandwich.  The sandwhich is made to order and the meals can be customized. Staff  is quick and the staff is friendly

Firehouse is a cool joint to get a straight-up sub. The deli meats taste fresh and good. Same goes for the bread. I was here on a weekday, and most of the seats were occupied around lunchtime. The sandwich came out hot, not overstuffed, and pretty dang satisfying. 

I like the theme here and the "Fully Involved" option--mayo, deli mustard, lettuce, tomato, onion, and a kosher dill pickle on the side--clearly explained, although I missed the sign at first. I also really dig that Firehouse has a non-profit foundation "to provide funding, life-saving equipment, disaster assistance and educational opportunities for first responders and public safety organizations."

mehhhh.  On a positive note, it is a step up from subway.  Fresh ingredients, nice gimmick they have going on and very very friendly staff.

On the other hand, I have heard RAVE reveiws from this place.  I tried it twice, and it is just OK.  Nothing special, no customization available and pricey.  It reminds me of quiznos.  I just went here for lunch and ordered the Hook and Ladder.  It was good, but nothing I would crave or rave about.  I've had better subs elsewhere so I wouldnt pick this out of a lineup,however, if I got dragged here I wouldnt complain either!
:)

Kind of a hob knob kind of place but maybe it's the area and not the chain, kind of got the impression that the manager or owner was having a bad day, seemed impersonal and short, but whatever, people are people right.. Came in with my wife a few weeks ago, we liked the atmosphere and theme. And the high tech soda fountain has a futuristic wow factor to it. Greeted with a fast almost preprogrammed "welcome to the firehouse" hello. We ordered a meatball and a club, it was fantastic !
Maybe the owner/manager will relax, it's a good sandwich but its nothing to get all stuck up about.
Also the parking is tight so park carefully unless you like door dings.
Its ok just a step up from subway....they seem to do a lot of charitable things for kids.cool...but as for the subs...mehhhh....

Alright so here's my biggest gripe with this place:

You have an ARMY of people behind the register/counter making sandwiches, no line, yet it still takes approximately 15-20 minutes for a sandwich?  I've been to other firehouse subs and they are 10 times quicker, you shouldn't have to wait that long for a sandwich that is nearly the same every time someone orders it.  Also, the "welcome to firehouse" is beyond annoying, I get it, it's supposed to be all like a club and a firehouse but when it's robotic and no emotion behind it, it's annoying.

Now that's out of the way, the sandwiches really are good.  Fresh ingredients, crisp pickle, and good selection of drinks.  My favorite sub is the turkey bacon ranch.

2 things to note if you eat at this location; 1. order online, otherwise be prepared to wait and 2. the large sub is seriously large - like which wich large 14".

One word describes it here. "Blech."

Went because my husband has been to other locations and loves it. I've never been before but it seemed like a good idea. I only have 1 question...Are all of the sandwiches made out of grossness & mayonnaise or was it just mine? Seriously, how much mayo can 1 sandwich hold? Apparently in my case it was a lot. Ugh. The soda was mediocre. I can't even imagine how you mess up soda. The chips were good. Thank goodness they were sealed. Next time I need a gross meal I can go to PetsMart and open a bag of kibble. It's cheaper. No, I won't return...ever. May God have mercy on those emotionally strong enough to come in this place.

I like Firehouse went in yesterday, they were packed. Took 10 minutes to get to the register, not so bad. Took about 15 minutes to get food, with a full house that's not to bad in my book. Food is always good, as for the others that say it cheap meat/products... Please eat at subway for 5 dollars and tell me that's top grade anything, their food seems fresh veggies crisp. I will be back.
Awesome place! Cheddar brisket is delicious! Nice owner, great service!

Though the food is always good the service is always horrible. They seem to only hire high school kids that make it obvious they hate they're jobs. Every time we are there the workers are usually joking amongst themselves and when we finally get helped it's like we are bothering them. I've never seen a smile on any of the workers faces when they are dealing with customers.

I normally love going to fire house but lately have been disappointed. today we came in for a quick bite to eat and it was far from a quick bite...all the employees were brand new it seemed ...took 16 minutes to get our sandwiches ...then they didn't even get it right....also the tables are never clean..no one walks around and cleans then anymore ...whe. this location first opened they had full staff and rocked it ...now its like I keep waiting for that old serves but keep getting lwt down.
Subs are great, but expect to wait.  Save time and order online.

I live in the area and have been here several times.  Today I went around 7 pm and ordered a sandwich combo.  I had to remind the cashier to give me a drink cup.  Next, the fancy soda machine was out of several flavors and was also out of ice.  I had to go back to the counter and wait to talk to someone to request ice.  The cherry limeaid sounded kind of good.  I got some and looked to put a nice slice of lime in the drink.  There was one nasty room-temperature slice of lime in the bin by the drink area.  Yuck.  Also, there was some unknown sticky substance on the button I had to push to get my drink.  Lastly, it took a full 15 minutes to get my sandwich.  There were 4 people working the counter and they didn't appear to have any sense of urgency.  I wasn't in a hurry but why does it take Firehouse 10 minutes longer to make a sandwich than the folks over at Quiznos or Subway?  I would only come back if I had lots of time. When my sandwich did finally arrive, it was decent.  I would order it again.  Attention to detail by management is lacking at this facility.  Hope they figure it out soon.

The cheddar brisket sub is off the got damned chain. Not sure about anything else there cuz I can't bring myself to order anything else. They have one of those coke machines that can make like 500 different sodas. But that's just something to keep your mind occupied while you wait for them to slap that brisket sando together. And when they do make sure you grab a grip of napkins, not cuz the sando is messy, but because YOU WILL jizz in your pants once you take a bite of that beefy gooey cheddar goodness. I go there so often now I have to do laundry twice as often. The whites, ya dig?

Always friendly, never get overwhelmed if I ask for something a little different.  My choice always for a sandwich.  WAY superior to Subway.  I like it!  If I am looking to give a gift to anyone - I use the Firehouse Sub gift card.

Wow finally firehouse Subs gets closer and closer to my house. its always amazing.  I know its a chain and usually i'm not really a fan of them firehouse is diffrent. Subways microwaves their subs, Quiznos toasts them but firehouse steams their subs. They never skimp you on meat and have literally a whole bunch of diffrent hot sauces to use. it is a little expensive but its worth it. will I go again well duh of course I will

The staff and especially the manager Luis, are excellent when it comes to consistent, superb customer service!!! Not to mention the amazing food and Happy Hour specials! It's also very authentic Spanish style decor in here. Super cozy, great food, and family style dinning, with a cute little bar area too...what else can you ask for?!

Great food & margaritas! Great service. I couldn't give it a full 5 stars because they were out of a lot of different tequilas to customize our margaritas!!!  The food was as authentic as we are going to get in Aurora, CO!

Absolute Best cheese enchiladas! GREAT topshelf margaritas. The service is ALWAYS friendly and professional. The restaurant is clean cozy and comfortable. Ajuua! Is the real deal for authentic Mexican food!

I highly recommend the Ajuua near 225, this and the north location not so much.  They were under staffed with one waiter whom I believe also served as bartender.  He was a very polite and helpful waiter, but shouldn't have been alone.  We were left waiting at the door for a strangely long amount of time without seeing anyone.  

Most disappointing was the portions.  My wife and I both ordered Cabo bowls.  They were good, but for $11 they were seriously lacking.  They filled about 40% of the bowl they were served in.  Oh, and the salsa was just okay and quite runny. 

Otherwise the place was clean and is well decorated.

This is our favorite Mexican restaurant. Great food, fast service, reasonable prices. I've tried enchiladas and fajitas, which taste absolutely divine in any season. We will keep coming to this location!

Honestly there was nothing that stood out and that includes the service, the food was average and the service was too, it may just be the branch by  the southland mall.on smokey hill but it's not a place I would make a plan for. It's small clean, but very very average Mexican food.
Kids eat for 1 cent on Monday! This place is so consistently good that we don't hesitate to come back. Love it!!!

One word--disappointed, We tried this restaurant tonight for the first time in about three years. We had a couple of bad experiences back then so it took awhile to forget and to decide that neighborhood Mexican food was worth the risk. Boy were we ever wrong. We started with queso dip that looked like it had just been poured out of a can and microwaved. Our dinner arrived about 3 minutes after ordering, making us wonder how it could have possibly been prepared fresh. The waitress even commented on the speed. I ordered the chicken and steak combo fajitas and it looked a lot more like stir fry than Mexican. All vegetables, just a few tiny scraps of meat, and sauce right from the supermarket aisle. My wife ordered the rellenos which were tasteless and full of cream cheese. We also ordered a chicken burrito that was completely devoid of flavor. On the bright side, we now  remember why we drive to Los Dos for real Mexican food.  What a shame but lesson learned.

Me and the wife went out for dinner and chose this restaurant. My wife and I shared the shrimp mazatlan appetizer, which we loved. For dinner my wife had the chicken Cabo bowl, which she loved, and I had the abondigas soup which I loved. Service was very good, kept our drinks and chips and salsa full, and even the manager asked us if we were enjoying our meal. Great customer service! I'm reserving a 5 star rating as we will be going back and if we have the same experience I will update to a 5 star rating.
My whole family LOVES this place.  It's a hole in the wall place and love it!  :)  Great salsa and thin chips!  The best!  We go at least once or twice a month!

This has become our Mexican restaurant. We have loved the food...the Carnitas Burrito is killer. The Chili Relleno is another great entree!!  Chips and Salsa are fresh and free!!  Finally, the service has always been consistent and with a smile. 

Great choice when your south of the border crave hits!!

I've been eating at this location since it opened.  The food is great and I'd say 90% of the servers are amazing.  I have my favorites and actually try to go there when they are there, so I'm completely biased :)  The owners are very sweet and I've watched their kids grow up.  The spicy green chili is great and they will add pureed habanero to it if you need more spice.  The combo plate is my fave, but I love, love, love the cabo bowl with shrimp and black beans if you want something light.  I add some lettuce and the spicy chili mentioned above.
Both this location and the one on Iliff are great. Wonderful food at a decent price and fun atmosphere. The bowls are excellent!

Decent Mexican food! Very mild, I was thinking that it wasn't going to be very good but after having a few bites I was pleasantly surprised! The food was delivered with a warm since of hospitality and very friendly staff! It was my first time to this chain and I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised on how delicious it was. Thanks again and I look forward to coming back in the near future for some tasty Mexican food!

This used to be our go to place for good Mexican food. Over the last few visits things seem to have gone down hill. We tried to go yesterday and waited 15 mins to be seated and it was far from busy. No one ever showed up to seat us or even tells us one moment. We ended up going somewhere else. We tried again tonight and got sat right away. The chips were basically crumbs the salsa had little flavor. The food was ok but not the typical that made this place our favorite Mexican food. Sad to say but I think it has come time for the search for a new place to go.

margarita: 4 stars
chips: 4 stars
salsa: 3 stars
green chile verde: 5 stars
fried ice cream: 4 stars
sopapilla: 5 stars
service: 5 stars
Way to totally redeem yourself!!  Must have just been an off day last time! I stand corrected!!

This should be 4 stars however the lack of service dropped them an extra star. Was waiting to be seated for several minutes even though it was slow with many extra tables. 
We were given chip crumbs and asked for more chips that never showed up. 
Food overall was not bad at all. Enchiladas had random bits of potatoes that i assume were from breakfast?  But whatever... 

Solid 3.5 overall. Could be more with better service.

This place started out good but slipped. Now the place is dirty, the booths torn and only 2 people working the last 2 times.  The food is about Taco Bell quality. I do not know what is with mexican places but they cannot maintain any quality. Better than On The Boarder but so is Del Taco.
¡Ajuua! A great place to dine (great flavor, large plates, reasonable prices) and very family friendly. BTW, Monday kids eat for 1¢.
They have phenomenal street tacos and margaritas!!  Great neighborhood restaurant.  The staff are friendly and the atmosphere is relaxed.  Good place for solid food.

Disappointed!  We visited this location about 3.5 years ago and had a less than optimal experience. We returned this time because of a Groupon. We figured, it's a discount and maybe things are better - not so much. First error was with the drinks. I ordered an iced tea and they brought a Diet Coke. My friend ordered a margarita on the rocks with no salt. It arrived with a salted rim.  We ordered an appetizer but it never arrived. When we mentioned it to the sever who brought our entrees (not our order taker), she apologized, but at that moment we knew it was best to nix the app entirely. Our entrees (beef fajitas and cheese enchiladas) were average. The side of rice was crunchy - really? Crunchy rice is never a good thing. Even with the groupon we felt we overpaid. Not a good value at all.  They get 1 star for being courteous. Sorry, but I won't go back or recommend.
Food was okay. The tamales were good, service was good, place was a bit crowded. Not sure we'll be back.  Still searching for the perfect Mexican restaurant. The search goes on.

Nothing special to talk about here. The green chili was mediocre and the carnitas burrito was just average.  Staff was nice and the restaurant was clean. Good chile relleno and a nice choice of tequila and margaritas. The music playing over the house speakers is loud and annoying.

Great family restaurant. Great food.  Good people. Great local business. I just recently found this place...I drive by it every week and never made a point to try it.  My goto has always been Chipotle but not anymore.  Honestly the Asada Steak Tacos are excellent.
Waited 10in to get In then sat for 25 with out seeing awaiter  when we started to leave waiter  rushed over to take  our order..Wendy's was good that night

Service wasn't that great as slow as it was. I asked for a steak burrito which should have 9.99. I actually pointed to it on the menu. I got the check and it showed 13.99. They brought out the bigger one I didn't ask for. And the Green chile was bland. No refills on drinks. I would have rather gone to OTB
Not as authentic as they advertise for. Went there for lunch the food was taste less in a way.
Food was great, Ricardo's margarita is fabulous, service was fantastic. This just became our go-to Mexican. Yummmmm!

Have eaten there about a dozen times with the whole family. Like the food. Always have received attentive service. Have recommended the place to many friends and acquaintances. Always tipped 25% +. Tonight however the waiter basically ignored us. Like Chad N. commented on 3/24/15 we got the chip crumbs and never offered a refill until the waiter was at the next table where I waved at him for about 60 seconds and he finally made eye contact. Idiot got a 10% tip, a bad rating for the business on yelp, and lost my business until I maybe forget the bad experience.

hair in our food, 20 minutes for any type of service because there was only 2 servers, asked for 2 tacos on the side and they came out covered in green chile. Ordered sour cream and guacamole and it came out 15 minutes after the food...adult cartoons on the tv...they should be very embarrassed. Would give 0 stars if allowed.
The more I come here, the more disappointed I am. Meat is made chili like, too much salt on their chips and guac is tasteless.
First time eating here and my husband and I loved it! we will definitely be going there again soon! Our new spot and it is close to home...perfect! The staff is also VERY FRIENDLY!!!

Food is quite good. Authentic Mexican food. Friendly staff and outstanding margaritas. 
The Ricardo's is very good by loving the perfect marg!

Frequent this location weekly, sometimes twice a week.  Great service and I love the food.  I've tried quiet a few in the area and so far, this location of Ajuua is the best.  I love the chips and salsa and my fave soft chile relleno so far.
Great local place, good food, good service, especially Louis and reasonable prices.  We go at least once a week.
I always get the steak fajitas and they never disappoint. The staff is always so friendly and the food is always good.

We have been fans of Ajuua since 2007 (@ Tamarac) but things have gone down hill at this location.  We ordered, and 5 minutes later, our food arrived.  They did not even pretend to cook it, just a zap in the microwave.  My wife still likes the place, but I don't care for it.  The one on Iliff still seems to care though, and I had good food there.

Date(s) visited: about 2 times.

Food/Drink: 4/5
Service: 5/5
Atmosphere: 5/5
Price: 4/5
Parking: 5/5

"A PLACE WHERE YOU CAN GET ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT TACOS"

Food/Drink: 
While I was here I tried the Chicken Mole (because I LOVE Mole') and the Taco Buffet for around $7.99.  With the Chicken Mole I really liked the sauce they used but thought the chicken was a little "dry".  They serve their tacos "two at a time" until you can no longer keep ordering more.  I have to say I was quite stuffed after I had my third taco and could not go a third round.

Service:
The servers here are always very friendly and professional.
Great Service...

Atmosphere: 
This place definitely has a Mexican feel and when you look around, you can see all kinds of Southwest pieces that add to the ambiance of the restaurant.  The one thing I found a LITTLE disappointing was the fact that the place did not offer any dishes that had cactus in it.  There are many great and authentic Mexican restaurants that offer cactus on their menu.  I just wished that a place that looked and felt so authentic would've made it available to their customers (and I say this in a nice way!)

Price
Decent...You'll find a lot of items on the menu for less than $10.

Parking: 
Free parking in front of the building.

MY THOUGHTS?
I would come to Ajuua again since they do have great specials.  I also enjoyed the service and for the most part can appreciate the authenticity of this restaurant.

RECOMMENDATIONS:
Try their Taco Buffet (but know that they only do it one day out of the week).

Here are some of their other specials:
http://www.ajuua.com/specials/index.php

Authentic Tex-Mex!!

If you want authentic Tex-Mex, this is the place.  As a transplanted Texan, I know my way around Tex-Mex.  No, you're not going to get cactus on this menu- this is not a southwest restuarant-it's Tex-Mex.  Warm fresh chips and the obviously in-house made salsa are always good.  Margaritas are great with good kick and the Tacos al Pastor are just the right size and used proper plating (just small corn tortillas with the cheese & meat) with condiments (cilantro, onions etc) on the side.  Good job with the rice and beans too - the obvious side to most dishes. My family has been here several times and we always enjoy the food. The service can get a bit thin on busy nights but all-in-all, this place is a winner. We will be back.
Great food great service friendly staff fast service clean. My wife and I consider this place our favorite Mexican restaurant plan ahead it can be a little packed
Friendly wait staff and pretty good food. Had the Arroz con Pollo, the sauce was very tasty. Nothing to write home about really, but worth a stop if you're in the neighborhood.

I finally checked this place, and I will not be returning! 
First off the service is S...L...O...W!!! We were there for a total of a hour and a half. Our server kept walking by our table avoiding eye contact with us. I thought maybe it was just our server, but then realized the table by us that had been sitting there before we were seated had not been waited on yet either.
When our server brought out our drinks I noticed that my glass was not clean. I had to ask for another one, and when our appetizer came out the plates he sat down were also dirty. SERIOUSLY?!?!
The food was bland and nothing special. I have had better food from taco bell. Their prices are over priced for what you get. Definitely not worth the bill.
At the end I had to flag down our server for our bill and ended up having the hostess ring us out. 
SAVE YOUR SELF THE TROUBLE AND DO NOT COME HERE!!!!

If you have a coupon to this place don't even bother stopping in. They don't really give you the worth of what your trying to save with a coupon. The manager is very rude and disrespectful. I've giving this place over 4 chances and nothingn is ever changed. They always try to over charge every bill and will don't give a correct portion for what you pay for. There was also a hair in my burrito last time I went and they did nothing to make it right. I'll never be coming back here

This is a duplicate Ajuua. Not sure what happened but someone changed the zip code on the real one and moved it, and then we have a new one with the right zip code.. but whatever.

Regardless, this place is good enough that I'm willing to review it twice. Service here is always excellent. Food is yum and the drinks are nice and large. 

They're prone to filling up at dinner time because they're so small, but the food comes out quick so it's usually not a big deal.
Chips and salsa is amazing! The service has always been impeccable . I love the pork carnitas tacos and they are juicy and fantastic. Can't beat the deals and groupons!

Went there because of a Groupon. Very good food! Fun atmosphere. However the service is SLOW. It took our server over 15 minutes to acknowledge us yet she assisted the table next to us 4 times! At one point, she finally acknowledged my "will you please help us?" gaze by giving me the "peace" hand symbol as she buzzed around the restaurant. I could have accepted this, however the restaurant was not very busy. Our waitress got my order wrong. She offered to correct it. Because it took so long to get our food I decided to let it go. I may try the Denver location next time. This is my second experience with that waitress. I wasn't impressed with her either time.

Went here on Valentine's Day. We waited for over an hour for our food. Never got it. There were 3 tables that arrived after us and they got their food first. When it was mentioned to our waitress she said they were there first which was bull. Waited 10 more minutes then said to heck with it and left. The places was half empty and being busy was not the issue. When we were leaving we were ask if we wanted our food to go? Really, no we wanted to sit and eat at the table. I will never go here again and I wish people luck when you do.

Nice little place to eat. Salsa was fresh and had a nice little kick to it.  Chip were always warm. Ordered the cheese and chorizo dip, it was very good. For my meal I had the carne asada burrito it was good as well.

Being from California and having a wife whose family is not far removed from their origins in Mexico, I had high hopes for this place.

If by certified "Authentic Mexican" they mean bland salsa and rice, then they've hit the mark.

I will say that the Carnitas were decent as was the chicken and refried beans.

The service was ok, nothing spectacular; our server was nice.

We sent back our iced teas, because they had a decidedly "fishy" taste. The water we had was fine, so there must be something wrong with their iced tea maker.

The place is a little pricey considering the atmosphere and quality of the food.  I don't see my family and me going back there or to any of the other restaurants in this chain.

This place isn't very big and not much of a waiting area, so hope they can get you right in.  The chips and water guy was on top of his game.  Though our server took some time to get to us and hardly ever checked up on us.  Chips and salsa were pretty standard, though I liked the salsa quite a bit.  Girlfriend had taco salad.  She liked it though the shell looked like it sat in the fryer a little too long.  I had the carnita street tacos.  They were actually pretty tasty.  This place was pretty good overall.  I guess I should cut the server some slack b/c there was two homecoming parties there.

Finally gave this place a try and wish we'd just passed. But at least now we know.  It's just.."eh".  The prices are way, WAY more than we would normally pay for mexican food.  
We ordered a nacho platter and split it (family of four). I think we ended up spending around $13 bucks for it but it was like the only affordable solution other than just walking out.  That might sound like a reasonable price to some people for a plate of chips with toppings, but not to us. And apparently it is because they're still in business.  But this is my take on it (hence the personal REVIEW). 

The staff was nothing to write home about either. In fact they looked like they were there bodily but their minds were on their next text message which they promptly attended to whenever possible.  

All in all, prices are just too high for what you get - so-so service, so-so food and hole-in-the-wall atmosphere. If you're like me and love finding a gem of a "Mom and Pop" eatery, this is not it. 

We won't be back.
One of our favorite mexican food places.  The food is always great.  The staff is friendly.  Very quick service too!

Was pleasantly surprised by this little hole in the wall. It is a bit pricier than The Rock or On The Border, but in my opinion the food is better, more authentic, and the Staff is 10X better. It is worth paying a bit more for great service and that is what they provide. They made a regular out of me and my family, that's for sure!

Food is solid, prices are reasonable, and the service is always good.  The carne asada and chicken mole are favorites.  They treatus well when we eat there, and when we get take out, it's always ready quickly.

We had dinner here a few weeks ago and it was terrible. The food was so incredibly bland, the service was horrendous and it was expensive for a Mexican restaurant. We will NOT be returning. And SERIOUSLY who puts mushrooms in their normal fajitas? Since I have an allergy, I didn't trust them to omit them from the order, so I went with a shredded beef burrito. There was barely any chile smothering it and it was all bland and tasteless. Not impressed, not one bit!

Awful service, bland-tasting food, overpriced menu. No thanks. Real de Minas off Arapahoe and Parker is a much better option! Or make the trip to Hacienda Colorado in Lone Tree. This place is a waste of time -- rude servers, dirty restaurant, long wait times and inattentive service. Take your money somewhere else.

What happened to this place? We used to love it, but tonight the food was meh, and the service was horrendous. They were reasonably busy when we first came in, so I was willing to cut the server some slack, but she waited promptly on the table next to us. I guess it helps to be related to one of the employees. Besides not taking our order when she brought drinks, even though our menus were closed and we were ready to order, she never voluntarily refilled our drinks. I also had to ask for more tortillas for the fajitas (which turned out to be a bad choice, cause yes, mushrooms, and I'm pretty sure I ran into a piece of pineapple, which might have been OK without the mushrooms). My drink glass was empty when she brought the tortillas (by which time I was by far the last one still eating) and she still ignored it. I asked for a box, and even at that point, she wouldn't just leave the check. It's like she went out of her way to provide poor service, like she was punishing us for something we did to her in a past life. As a few other people have said, the food isn't so amazing here that you need to go out of your way to come back. I'm not sure if my standards are higher now, or if theirs are lower.

I am definitely a fan of Ajuua!  The menu is extensive and the selections are more authentic than your chain Mexican restaurants (i.e. On the Border).  The wait staff is friendly, the prices are reasonable and the food is delicious.  I love the Tacos Del Carbon - they are my faves.  The 4 corn tortillas with steak, cilantro, onions and a green chile salsa is a simple dish with some heat! It is sort of their version of street tacos.  Even my husband, who tends to get the same thing everywhere he goes (ground beef burrito with green chile), is a fan!  Big portions and yummy food make it a place we keep going back too!

This is my go to restaurant for friendly, consistent, fabulous Mexican fajitas. My daughter loves the beans and rice and she cleans her plate every time. We won't go anywhere else customers for life!!!
Never once had a bad experience, and the food is amazingly fresh. Service is always friendly and fast. Expect a line if going to dinner, and especially on Friday & Saturday.

Ajuua is a great authentic Mexican restaurant w/o all the yuppie flare that many Denverites expect from pseudo-Mexican places like Hacienda Colorado. "Mexican food with altitude." Give me a break. 
This is a local chain, which I always appreciate, and they have a HUGE menu, which they regularly update. There really is something for everyone here. Their regular size margarita is 18 oz. - plenty for me. While this location is much smaller than others in the Denver area, it's usually not too hard to get a seat. Service in generally good, however, sometimes speed and communication are a little lacking. The chips and salsa are consistently good (always a good gauge of a Mexican restaurant), and the rice is yummy. For something a little closer to authentic, give this one a try.
Great for a nice family outing in the neighborhood!  Kids love it, service is quick and cost is reasonable.
Fast, friendly, good food, large margaritas. All good things.

Beware of contents inside!  Menu items may not come out as described.  Some of you may have seen this restaurants coupon ad that comes in the coupon mailer and said to your self hey not bad deal... especially this one entree free with purchase of another entree $8.95 or less GOOD LUCK finding something on the menu that meets that requirement.  I decided on the all you can eat enchiladas on Wednesday deal.  The selection was great I thought it was just going to be cheese enchiladas only.  But here is where I have a problem.... the menu clearly says the Chile Colorado is made of ROAST BEEF, I double check to make sure there's no Pork in the chile and the waitress says no.... my question should have been was there Pork anywhere on the dish?  For religious and personal reasons I do not eat pork, I think many of you can understand that.  So when I get my meal... careful the  plates are freakin hot!!!  I start eating away and when my server comes back to check on the meal, my vegetarian friend asked if there was meat in the Chile Colorado (not knowing that's what I was eating) and the waitress confidently replies yes it contains PORK!  WTF!!!  I just ate half of my meal.  I really don't want to get into the conversation I had with the manager, who was not really the manager just the guy put in charge that night per his response when I asked him if he was the manager.  But evidently management has been aware for months that the menu states roast beef but it's really pork.   Thank God i'm not allergic to pork, but I can't believe that it's really no big deal between the difference in what they're selling from what they're serving.

I have been to Ajuua twice since we moved to the area and we like it. It's not our favorite Mexican joint but it is good. Like many have said it is a bit overpriced for Mexican but they do seem to give a fair amount of food. Both times I have had the Ajuua burrito and I really like it; it's filled with grilled steak, rice and your choice of beans, it is topped with pork green chile, sour cream, and guac. There margs are good but are WAY over priced though unless you go during happy hour when they are half off. My wife has had the rellenos, tamales, and enchiladas and liked all of them. In all I think that it is has good, authentic Mexican and will definitely go back but not as often as I would like because of the prices.

Hello - my name is Chris and and you can contact me at 970 389 9116....I write this  # so you know this is a real review. I was there on Friday 9/30

To say this place is OUTSTANDING would be not strong enough words. I brought my date to Angel's Share (she lives only five minutes away and had never been!)....and had a truly great experience. The menu is outstanding and very reasonable. The service is remarkable - because our server, and apologies because I cannot recall her name - was fun and friendly, and knew exactly when ask if we needed anything. Thank you - this was my 4th date with my companion, I'm trying to impress, and she had such a nice time. 

AND - HERE IS THE OTHER REASON I AM A LIFETIME CUSTOMER......my car battery died. I went back to Angel's Share to see if they knew anyone to call. I live in Boulder County, so Roxborough is a long ways away. The chef - Theo - dropped what he was doing, and pulled his truck around to jump start me. What a lifesaver. Theo - I owe you big time. 

Thank you guys - for the whole evening. If I end up spending more time in this area - I'm a regular.

Wow. Driving around and landed here on a gorgeous day and what a great meal.  Lunch was fabulous.  Duck fat fries excellent and the Duck Confit sloppy Joe was so flavorful.  Service was great and absolutely will be back here again. Strongly recommend.
Not Your Mamas Grill Cheese sandwich is the best ever! A real treat! It's hard to imagine a grilled cheese this good! Heavenly!

Overall great dining experience. The food is inventive and well executed. Service is great. Menu options were a little limited but what they do they do right. Great space and a hidden gem in a strip mall. I hope these guys do well! Try The Quacker (duck confit sloppy joe with fried egg) as well as the duck fat fries, which were incredibly crispy with great flavor

Amazing food! We had the duck fat fried, bacon and brie crostini, Mediterranean chicken tacos, and vindaloo. Everything was perfect!. The crostini was one of the best thing I've ever eaten. Try out this jem for sure!

Came in on Wednesday... turns out is 1/2 off battle of wine.... so we order the Carnivor. LOVED IT.  My husband order the "Ridge Burger" and the duck fat fries we're amazing. The pasta carbonara was the perfect choice for me. The staff is amazing and out going. They told us about Martini Thursday $5... came back and i needed up getting 4 of the "Fore Play", its topped with red wire. I think this is our new weekly hangout place.

I hadn't had duck fat fries until I came here. They're more delicious that you would think- they are awesome!!! The workers there are very friendly and helpful and they know the regulars names too. It's a hidden place in Littleton but it's worth the find. The crab crostini with avocado is worth the drive.

We came here excited to try a new place. Our burgers came out still mooing, as if they didn't cook it and then blamed it on the girl fine I can deal but then it came out burned and well well done. The meat tasted very gamy and beef should never be gamy. I just feel I could have had a better burger at sonic. The waitress was amazing. But food was terrible.

Stopped in after a long hike on Sunday. Inexplicably, they don't feature their draft beers on the menu. After we were seated and asked about what's on tap, we were told they were on the chalkboard at the front of the restaurant. The wasn't knowledgeable of them, so we walked around and looked quickly with her waiting and ordered one hastily. She brought us a sample of each, thought i just kinda wanted a beer. We ordered the recommended duck fat fries - they are very good. The service just seemed a bit lacking and uninformed where I was expecting someone more familiar with the menu - both in alcohol and food - to make recommendations or educate. We drank our beers and left.

I needed a place to take clients to a belated holiday luncheon for 8 people and this was perfect. The chef/owner took care of us as well as the rest of the staff.
We shared a few appetizers included duck fat fries, hummus and risotto balls that we de-lish!
For my entrée I got the "The Quacker" Duck Sloppy Joe with rosemary duck confit, caramelized onions, gouda, & a fried egg on a beer pretzel bun. It was so freaking good! A little messy to eat, but totally worth it. Everyone loved their entrees including a steak salad, shrimp risotto and salmon.
For dessert we got 1 of everything, so 4 each for 8 and the highlight was the bread pudding.
I look forward to returning with my friends that work on this side of town.

I had read reviews for this place and was skeptical they would live up to the hype. After spending the morning at Roxborough State Park, we came here for lunch at 2:00 on a Saturday to avoid the lunch rush. Right away our waiter was accommodating and friendly. We had our kids with us and the waiter was attentive to them which was nice. He told us about items that they could prepare for the kids that weren't on the menu. Additionally, he brought out papers and pens for them to entertain themselves while we waited for our food. My wife and I had the sausage, spinach, and peppers for an appetizer. The blend of these three were perfect and the sausage had the right amount of kick and flavoring. We tried the Ridge Burger with the Duck Fat Fries and the Marherita Pizza. Both items were exceptionally good. We substituted the bleu cheese on the burger for gouda and the pretzel bun was the perfect way to hold it all together. I was impressed and definitely agree with the majority of the review that this place is a hidden gem in the area. Anytime I am in the area, I will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu.

Awesome food (pork tacos & duck fat fries are killer), people (super friendly owner & staff), and the perfect place to unwind, have a drink, and enjoy the area. The portions are huge, so go hungry (and thirsty)! Nice outside patio and dog friendly too..big plus!

ABSOLUTELY love our new found find!!! Mike, the chef, and Allie the bartender-who makes the best Bloody Mary martini's-are incredible staff, friendly and interactive! The food is unique, fresh ingredients, and served with style. I highly recommend the Mediterranean Chicken Tacos, Not Your Mama's Grilled Cheese and Citrus Paridisi salad! This place is is perfect for a Ladies Lunch or Dinner with your Hubby! Responsibly priced, as well!
Kurt and the crew do a great job... love the mirco brews and great apps.

This was a great discovery while staying on the Denver area on travel. They have a solid wine list and (as appears to be the norm in Denver) an excellent selection of beers on tap with a strong understanding of the offerings. The food is excellent but the atmosphere is like a pub or a small intimate restaurant.
Food was good and the service great. Place was kinda dead on a Saturday night but we'll definitely go back.

Great first experience! We went there for dinner and drinks after a hike. Allie, the bartender/waitress was very nice, knowledge about the menu, and gave great drink recommendations. We ordered the burger, duck sloppy Joe and duck fat fries and it was all amazing!

Fantastic first visit. Had the special tonight lasagna with Colorado sausage and home made marinara. The white chocolate raspberry bread pudding was amazing as was the cheesecake made in house. The Colorado mules made with Colorado moonshine were great. Service was the best. Will definitely make this a regular stop.

This place is so awesome. The food is absolutely top notch. We started with the artichoke fritters. 4 huge fritters comprises mainly of chopped chunks of actual artichoke hearts, sun dried tomatoes, minimal batter, with a sweet savory cajun remoulade sauce. Best fritters i have had in a very long time. We moved on to the duck confit flatbread. Dried cherries, goat cheese and balsamic reduction. Absolutely on point. Great wines and great beers and the prices are by far worth an awesome drive down the front range from anywhere near the city to come pay this place a visit. The staff and chef are extremely personable and courteous. And as a side note to all the michiganians out here, one of the bartenders and the chef are native michigan guys. Love this place and recommend if!

Swung in on a Friday after work, to find a full but not crowded warm environment. After ordering a glass of wine, several regulars walked in and were greeted by the staff with smiles and hugs. Definitely can tell right off the bat this place takes care of it's customers and they love coming back.

The sausage and peppers app was a great small dish to start, while small it still was a good portion. For the main I had the Alaskan salmon. Decent sized portion with the salmon being cooked well with tasty greens + cherries to go with. Quality meal to go with a refreshing glass of wine. The server did an awesome job handling 4+ parties. She didn't miss a beat ;)

Stopped in for a late lunch.  We ordered two margaritas.   They were good, but very small.  I ordered the special which was a pastrami on Rye.  It was really good but the pastrami was fatty and I had to rummage through the sandwich to get the chunks of fat off.  My guest also had the special but it was a spicy shrimp with noodles dish.  It was very flavorful.  I enjoyed an Octoberfest beer and it was good.  I didn't see the bill but it turned out to be an $80.00 lunch, which seemed pricey.   I was nervous of the duck fishes but may venture in and try it.  I wondered why our server "ran out" to get something to eat, when they have a full kitchen.   Did the employee not like the food?  Was it too expensive?  The substitute waitress heard my comment and stated frankly that it's nice to leave on break, and they give the help a generous 50 percent off their meals.  After seeing our bill for $80 with 3 drinks, I understood why he left for lunch.  I would have done the same.

We went last night and I was very impressed.  Every detail of our dinner was superbly handled from the moment we walked in until the end.  I'm not comfortable describing food, I can tell you, everything was 5 star+ blissfully good.  My favorite was "the quacker" duck sloppy joe. We also had salmon with risotto, bass, and pork tacos.  Everything was beyond our expectations.  The chef stopped by and made sure one in our party was happy with the menu choices,  telling her he could alter, change, add, delete anything to a dish to make her happy. He succeeded.  One of us was in a wheelchair and wanted to also watch the Rangers game.  So without a moments hesitation, tables were moved out into the bar area so our wheeled friend could watch the game. I will go back anytime I'm in the Denver area.

Great drink varieties, food options are great. We waited a ver long time for our food and we were the only ones in the resturant. It was lunch time, so not busy at all. Owner - manager was really a nice guy. I ordered the risotto with shrimp. Shrimp was delicious, risotto  was not cook properly.  It was to hard. Fuck fat fries are amazing. Expensive place. Not likely to return, but its nice to have an option.

Way too expensive.  Portions tiny.  No sweetener for iced tea.   Not a lot of alternatives in this area, but we didn't have drinks and it was over $50 with two small salads and a 50% Yelp coupon $3 plate of hummus with Iced Tea.  I think they have the right ideas about good ingredients and the food was tasty and fresh.   Just not the for the price.

What a find! This place is amazing from the service to the food. We showed up an hour before closing on a Tuesday and it was pretty quiet but we were greeted with a smile by the cook and waitress. She suggested a wonderful bottle of wine and the crostini appetizer. We had the citrus salad, elk and green chili ravioli and curry chicken tacos. It was all delicious. The waitress took great care of us and the cook came by to ask how everything was. Very personalized service and fantastic food. We will be back and will definitely recommend to friends!

This place was awesome! Great food, great drinks, awesome service. I only wish we lived closer. I always want my husband to share multiple dishes with me so this concept is perfect! I love that the chef is always changing it up and trying new things as well.

I was passing through while touring Colorado. Based on the Yelp reviews I decided to have lunch here. I couldn't have been more pleased. The food, service and ambiance were spot on. I enjoyed the experience so much I made it a point to return the second (and last day) I was in the Littleton area. I only wish there were a similar place in my neck of the woods.
Wow! Delicious food, friendly staff, quick enough for business lunch, and the price is right.
The Asparagus Crostini and Rosemary Shrimp were outstanding! We'll definitely be visiting again.
This place is fantastic. Amazing food and great staff. Pasta Carbonara, grilled cheese with bacon and fig, shrimp risotto, flatbreads...all amazing. Will go back again and again.
Angel Share consistently has quality service as well as delicious food that surpasses anything south of Downtown Denver. Amazing food and company in the beautiful foothills in Roxborough!

Holy Cow!  
Place is definitely a sleeper!!!   Food is amazing; owner/ chef definitely has "IT" .   Don't miss  "Not Your Mama's grilled cheese" make sure you add the bacon and fig jam, pulled pork tacos with peach and apple chutney on top... amazing. Check for their specials: we're doing "wine down Wednesday" half price on selected bottles.   Awesome Place ! Wish you were closer to us in downtown Denver!

Angel's Share is a place my husband, friends and I frequent.  Love the gourmet style delights - not for those who like fast food type dining.  Amazingly friendly staff, delicious food and great drink specials throughout the week.  We will be back again and again!
The place is amazing, everything we tried on the menu was top notch. Appetizers and main courses were all just WOW.

The food here is phenomenal!  The owner Kurt is a true professional who takes a lot of pride in his creations. He and his staff also make great pairing suggestions from their extensive wine list.   
Angel Share opened in 2013 and has the loyalty of everyone in our neighborhood.  If you've never been there, I highly suggest you give it a try.  You'll be loyal too:)

If you have not tried the "Not your Mama's grilled cheese" you owe it to yourself to try the best sandwich ever.  This concoction includes 4 different cheeses, asparagus, and the option of adding fig and bacon which make this a truly delectable and unique dish.

This explodes in your mouth with every bite being different and wonderful.   Many great dishes in the menu. But this is really unique and great.

I've been a customer of this place 4-5 times. I've enjoyed their food and service each time. The only downside for this place (for families) is that there aren't highchairs or booster seats. It's more of a classier place to eat... great for dates, gatherings of friends, or business-related meetings. Nevertheless, my toddler sure enjoyed the duck fat fries and risotto.

Good place for food and drinks. Went here with some co-workers after playing soccer and the hostess didn't mind us being sweaty and tired. There was some kind of game night when we went that was kind of annoying but other than that it was a good place to hang out and eat!
This is one of the best places I've eaten in a while! Amazing staff and service! I suggest the duck flat bread and the bread pudding for dessert. The menu has so many choices and the wines are great!
Friendly,  cozy atmosphere with unique takes on some old favorites.  We will definitely return.

I walked in for brunch and the chef cooked me up some awesome french toast with an egg and bacon on it which was amazing. They have an interesting selection of things on the menu which I want to try. I will be back for sure
Decadently Delicious.....we tried 3 different sandwiches ...all were spot on...excellent service....cool chic atmosphere....Bonus: awesome beer selection
Awesome food, great service, small comfortable atmosphere.  Had the quacker, which is a great sandwich, and it has an egg on it.  Wife had the lol dip which she also enjoyed.
We love this place! We sat on the patio on a gorgeous day enjoying vodka lemonades and several tapas!  Owner Kurt is awesome too!
The food and service were top notch. I was more than happy with my meal. What a gem in Roxborough. I highly recommend it. It is worth it!

Tried Angel's Share on Friday night after a long, obnoxious week at work.  Life had already improved after the appetizer.  We tried the pulled pork tacos, which was a generous portion and had really good flavors.  Hubby got the shrimp risotto and I got the "Quacker Duck Sloppy Joe."  We spent most of the meal debating which was better, but never came up with a clear winner.  Both dishes were amazing and we're excited to go back.

Overall, the food was great, the service was exceptional, and the wine, beer and cocktail selections were good and reasonably priced.  Not a combination that's easy to find.  Looking forward to a motorcycle ride into Roxborough this summer.  I now know a great place to stop into for some wine and tapas.

I love the brunch scene in the denver area and this is by far the best I have found. Everything was perfect from the service to drinks to the meal.very well done and will send everyone over here because it's that good!

We had a lovely date night dinner out on the patio. The owner, Curt took his time explaining some of the wine options as well as the small plate dinner offerings. We split the Littleton Pig and the Brussel Sprout apps - both very good. I ordered the Elk Tenderloin - which was amazing. Hubby had the ravioli special - which was in a fantastic white wine cream sauce.  Nice wine list.  Will go back for sure!

I stopped into Angel's Share for the first time last night ... it will not be my last time!  The layout and atmosphere is very friendly and inviting.  I ordered the Duck flatbread and it was delicious!  Chef Kurt came over to chat and is very personable and informative.  His recommended unfiltered Wit beer was the prefect pairing for my entree on a Colorado summer evening.  This little gem of a restaurant has been around for a couple years and needs to be on everyone's short list!  Unique menu with high-quality, tasty food.  My highest recommendation!

Wonderful gem in Roxborough! Quality ingredients and creativity go into every Tapa and dish served. Delicious!
Great cocktails and wine list too!
The space is comfortable and inviting. Good place for dinner with a significant other or cocktails with friends.
Will definitely be back!

Randomly stopped on way home from roxborough state park. Ridiculous!  Delicious food, fresh and real. Great variety on tap. True service. And an open fun atmosphere. And try the creme brûlée, it's really world class.

After seeing all the rave reviews on Yelp, I decided to give Angel's Share a shot.  I know it's just right around the corner from my home, so I decided to take baby with me. I figured it's in a neighborhood shopping area, so it should be kid friendly, right?  Um, NOT a good idea. They didn't have any highchairs and the single clientele did NOT appreciate the baby jabber!  

On to the food:  Eh, it's really nothing to get excited over.  I was more excited reading the menu then actually eating the food.  I had the Formaggio de Capra (which was ok, but really needed more seasoning), the Margarita Flatbread (not enough cheese to make it worthwhile) and the Devil's flourless cake (It's more like a light brownie than a rice flourless cake).  Overall, I was pretty disappointed.  Sadly, I wouldn't come back again.

We live in the Roxborough area and have only been here twice.  Not sure why?  Great food, great atmosphere, great service!!  We recently went in with some friends and had a great meal and evening.  Food and service were awesome!  I would highly recommended this restaurant for those who enjoy the option of tasting different meals cooked with love.  This is better than most places in Downtown and it's in a great setting.  Go for a hike in the State Park and stop in to this place for a great meal!

My wife and I came in to Angel's with an open mind and a dinner for two from Groupon. This place more than delivered.... it hit it out of the park! The chef absolutely cooked our boar and steak to perfection, rare and medium. Being a chef myself, l this was a great relief to find another chef that can prepare and execute dishes to this standard. Wait staff was wonderful and gladly accepted our Groupon without making us feeling belittled.  Overall, if this place were in Denver it would easly be in the top ten of 5280's top restaurants. It is more than worth the drive.
Loved it!  Food was unique and well prepared.  It's a cozy, comfortable atmosphere with a very pleasant and friendly staff.  We'll be back.
A bit out of the way if you do not live south, but worth a trip.  Good wine selection, small, but great beer choices, and fantastic food.  Small room and good atmosphere.

Nice small plate bistro and wine pub in the SW suburbs. We were happy to see a new, unique independent establishment in the south Littleton area. We have had great food and service the few times we've been in. The Brussels Italiano and Torenados (sp?) were standouts.  The atmosphere is cozy and can be loud when busy, but no matter--the food and wine is great.  Keep up the good work!

Love this neighborhood wine bar. A definite must go!  Great food, great atmosphere, and super management and staff.   Love the Parisi salad and the Brie & Bacon crustini. The pizazz are marvelous too!

Love the food and the staff!  Wonderful to have such a great place right in our neighborhood!  The tapas menu offers perfect portions and the Chef Marc Anthony is creative and fun!  Kurt mixes a killer mojito!  Good wine selection!  I attended a wine dinner there in July and the food pairings were very well done!  I eat there many times per week for lunch and dinner, and of course the excellent Sunday brunch!

Love this little place and hope it stays around for a long time. Unique and spectacular with an always changing menu. Nothing ever gets boring here. They have great specials daily and love their exploration with the local foods and appetites!
Great food, great cocktails, attentive staff & a wonderful atmosphere. A gem in Roxborough.

Delicious, creative menu! Amazing cocktails!  ASWP is a great addition to the Roxborough area and absolutely worth the trip for those who don't live in the area.  Owner and staff are very friendly and attentive!
Amazing food and drink in this neighborhood restaurant. Definitely worth a try.  You won't be disappointed!

Found this place on Groupon for a date night with wife.  Food was excellent.  Crab Crostini with avocado, Wild Boar Pork Chop (bone in) and Burger were done to perfection.  They have a great use of fresh herbs in their dishes.  They also have a nice selection of wine.  Door to Door from Highlands Ranch was 15 minutes.  We will be back.  Not kiddo friendly during the week but on Saturday they have life music and kids can run around on the sidewalk.  Looking forward to trying other items on the menu.

Excellent. I have waited until I have eaten here enough (four times) to rate quality and consistency of the food and service- which have been outstanding. The scallops are divine, the citrus arugula salad is light and flavorful, and the wine and beer selection is diverse. Service is friendly and professional and it's not uncommon to be able to speak to the owner or the executive chef, either of whom you should expect to come and ask you about your meal. Whether you live here or not- it's worth a visit for sure!

In short, a hidden gem.  A creative menu with many truly unique options, topped off with a very nice selection of wine & craft beer; draft & bottled.  The food quality is excellent, and the environment warm and inviting. I wouldn't say it's not kid friendly, but given the atmosphere, fine food and drinks... It's best to relax and indulge!

We always get exited when a new restaurant opens in the neighborhood and try to support it (if it's worthy!).  We noticed the new sign up here a few weeks ago and decided to check it out.  The ambiance is a bit cold or uncomfortable.  The wood benches (cool concept -made of wine barrels or wood) just need some softness around.  But once you get your food, the cold surroundings don't matter.  It was DIVINE!  We were surprised and delighted with the beef medallions with the little potato cakes and the lamb lollipops, which are so delicious that we came back a week later for them again. The apple salad with walnuts and blue cheese was excellent.  We are looking forward to coming back again and again.  Such a wonderful surprise to be in our little strip mall in Roxborough Park! It is worth driving out from anywhere in south Littleton.

I work nearby and decided to try this place. Wow--the food was excellent! I had the "Not your mama's grilled cheese" and I highly recommend it! Although I didn't stay long, this place has a cool interior and would be a great place to hang out!

Everything I've tried has been wonderful.  I have to say my favorite was the mushroom pizza, amazing flavors. Great place for lunch, dinner and a fun happy hour.  Probably not the best place for kids, definitely the place to go without the kids! Date night or girls night out anyone?
This truly is a special little locale.  Our entire family loves Angel's Share!  We feel luck to have this amazing restaurant in our neighborhood!

Finally some really GREAT foods in Northwest Douglas County. Innovative dishes, superbly prepared. We went with friends and tried the "happy hour" selections the first time and were very pleased with the wonderful variety of tastes. So we went back again and tried the regular menu. As good or better. I can't remember all of the names of the dishes, but they ranged from perfectly grilled scallops with a nice accompaniment of greens to a fabulous duck dish. I can't wait to go back.

My friend and I stopped in here for lunch after visiting the nearby Roxburough State Park. The potatoes brava and grilled vegetables were not only lovely to look at, they were delicious. The small plate of duck on flat bread was very generous and tasty, but a little awkward to eat. There were many other interesting tapas I hope to try in the future. Great wine selection, great service.
Many taste treats, great wine list, & ambiance. Might get a bit load, but that's because people are having a wonderful time.

Excellent food. Excellent service. Full Buffett. Full bar. Well done decor. Chicken and lamb dishes were good. Veggie Korma was really good.
Wide variety of dishes to choose. I tried a little of every thing. The mango custard was so good I couldn't stop going back for more again and again.
The only complaint I have is the elevator music is distracting.
It is a bit on the expensive side.

I don't even know how to start to explain how great this restaurant is. Indian food buffet with plenty of options, all equally delicious. The Sang Paneer was out of this world. Chai tea with unlimited refills, AND they brew their own beer. This place is truly a gem. So glad we ate dinner here. Highly recommend.

UH MAY ZING! Food is so flavorful and the entire interior is beautiful. Exceptional service! I couldn't believe the lunch buffet was only $10!!!! Gluten free and vegan options! Let's not even get started on the saffron rice.

My wife and I went here during a short weekend vacation to the Denver/Boulder area. Food was good for the price and they had a wide selection of Indian food. I would definitely recommend doing the buffet, because you get to taste a bunch of different Indian foods and you can keep going back for more and more until you're ready to explode from eating all the delicious Indian food.

I've been to all three locations, and sadly, this was my least favorite. We came on a Saturday night and were surprised they still had the buffet running. Our server had informed us that we could still order from the buffet, but that our food would be taken straight from the buffet. Real appealing, right?

The buffet was... Well, a buffet. Quality was noticeably lower than when we've ordered off the menu. Naan was delivered to the table but was dry, cold, and a bit hard. 

They came and refilled the chicken tikka masala because it's so popular, which was a plus. But that quickly ran out as well.

Overall, I wouldn't recommend the dinner buffet. Might try again at another Yak and Yeti location, though.

I really like this place. The other location is a ambiance that is a better  for a date night but this place is  at a really convenient location and the food is quite excellent. I love the sag and the tandoori chicken is reliably good. The buffet offers a ton of choice including salad, fresh fruit and steamed broccoli along with a lot if traditional Indian options such as chicken tikka masala and lamb vindaloo. You really can't leave hungry unless you're trying to.

During my visit to Yak & Yeti, I spent most of the time trying to figure out how they had so many 5 star reviews. I know that sounds very negative, but it is the truth. 

I requested a booster seat for my daughter as soon as we were being seated. They never brought it to us even though we asked twice. It's a bit difficult  to try to contain a 2 year old that doesn't have a seat to sit in. 

A server other than our original server asked us if we were doing okay. We then asked for a water for our child. They then proceed to bring us a coke. After telling our server that we didn't order a coke she then goes to get the guy that asked us if we wanted anything. What the hell! Why not just take the drink we didn't order and bring us the kids water. I felt as if she didn't believe what we were saying. 

The food just wasn't that great either. I was truly expecting to taste "my new favorite restaurant" type of food, based on the reviews that I was reading. 

On the plus side, they did have many vegetarian options! Overall, I would not recommend this place.

Wow! This place has awesome service! Our server was incredibly friendly and helpful. He let us sample their chai and also brought out complimentary crackers!

The garlic naan was really tasty. The naan was on the sweeter side, but oh-so soft and warm! The Alu Gobi (medium spice) was pretty flavorful, had a bit more oil than I expected, but the potatoes and cauliflowers were cooked to perfection. I tried a bit of the Sweet Potato Masala (medium spice), and found it to be really yummy! The dish was sweeter overall, but had a small bit of luck to it.

One thing I did notice was that the server assumed that we were doing the buffet, so if you're planning on doing the regular dine-in, flag 'em down and let them know you want a regular menu.
The best naan in Denver, and the nicest people. The service is always great, and the food is even better. It's all about that buffet.

As far as Indian food goes, I have to say I'm a bit of a noob so you'll have to take that into account. The naan is without a doubt FANTASTIC! Since it was a buffet, I decided to sample a variety of different foods. There was chicken marsala was great, there was also this other vegetarian dish that had a creamy spinach type of sauce in it, that was pretty good as well. The chicken curry was just OK to me. It had great flavor, but it kind of lacked the spicy kick that I was expecting. I would definitely go back.

Yuuuummmyyy. I'm a sucker for saag, and they do it perfectly here! The service has always been good, food has always been hot, and the water always full. I never leave dissatisfied, and the price is reasonable.

Excellent food! I've been searching high and low for Indian/Himalayan food around the area and this place is amazing! Great buffet selection, the sweet potato masala is one of the best things I've ever eaten. 
Great service. I will definitely be making this a regular spot.

I'm writing this review on behalf of Hubs as he's the BIG Indian food fan in our home.  With out question, he went straight for the buffet & seemed all too pleased with his decision. I stuck with the chicken soup.  Service was incredibly friendly even as we walked in as soon as the lunch buffet was winding down. The food was still pretty fresh from what he could tell. I was a little bummed by bowl of soup came from the buffet line, but, eh, what are you really gonna do about it? Hubs had at least 3 plates with various curries and rices.

The biggest downside (for me especially): naan. It wasn't very soft or warm when we got it. A little bummed that it was so hard within 5 min!

I have lived a ten minute walk down the street from Yak and Yeti for 16 years, and have somehow NEVER made it in until this week.
I can't believe I wasted all that time.

I came in for the dinner buffet this week and was pleased with every. single. thing. I got to try. Sweet potato masala? Lamb kadai? Gulab jamun?
I might never have gotten around to any of these dishes if left to my own devices, but the buffet gave me a perfect excuse to stop ordering my usual chicken saag, and start experiencing some more food.

5 stars.
I'll have to come back a lot more regularly to make up for all that lost time.

Pros: Good flavor and just about the right spice level. The breaded bananas and honey balls were a nice addition to the rice pudding. 

Cons: The Chicken Masala was warm not hot. The Rice pudding was runnier than I'd like. 

Conclusion: Good place to eat overall. I'll come back on my next trip.

The place was ambient and had a nice aura around it. I had the lunch buffet and I didn't find one dish that wasn't made well. In fact, more than a couple were too good and I really enjoyed the food.

Would highly recommend. I wanted to try their award-winning beer and ale, but may be next time.

Worst experience. I paid $44 for their buffet. That was dried out chicken Marsala. Was in the restaurant for 40 minutes not once was anything replaced. Good thing I have been to the original on Ralston or I would never be back. Was so looking forward to good Indian. Now I think I'll be looking forward to an upset stomach tonight.

Been to the Arvada location and is so much better. Had the buffet and food was over cooked no turn around on the food. It just sits and keeps cooking. Tables dont get cleared and the workers are just standing around. This is not a good location. Love Yak and Yeti but this location really stinks. Just glad went to the arvada one first or i wouldn't have tried them again.

This is probably the best spot for Indian buffet in Westminster.  Quite a few items are on display and they really take care of vegetarians as their potato Somosas are amazing.  Their naan is also hot out of the oven and unlimited so you get your fill whenever you go!

Their veggie curries are what I usually get seconds on, especially the cauliflower.  There's also a nice 20% off coupon for all those bargain hunters out there!
They no longer serve Togo buffet. We've been comming here for years and eating at least once a month the buffet togo....no more. So we won't be eating here anymore....

This was the first place I thought of to go to when my boyfriend suggested that we eat Indian food for lunch. I love this place because they have a buffet for both lunch and dinner. The lunch buffet is ~$11 and the dinner is ~$15, very reasonably in my opinion since it's all you can eat.

The lunch buffet had a great variety of curry like chicken curry, tikka masala curry (can't go wrong with this one), sweet potato masala and more.
