They also have white rice, yellow rice, and naan for you to eat with they curry. The naan here is absolutely to die for! It comes made fresh and isn't super oily like some of the naans I've had elsewhere. I also really like their desserts, especially the banana pakora and mango custard.

Yak and Yeti is also a brewpub so they've got selections of beer like the Himalayan ale and Chai milk stout.

Indian and Nepalese food. They push the buffet. It is ok but not items I wanted. 
Had curry chicken. It was tasty but chicken was not great. Thought there was a lot of fat and skin on chicken pieces. 
Service was weak. Had to describe 3 times for regular black tea. 
Best for buffet and no service . Check out items first though. I will not go back

A couple friends hosted me and another friend while we in Colorado for a few days. We wanted to take them out for dinner as a thank you. One of them is a vegan so it was difficult finding a place but this Indian place fit the bill. 
They really push the dinner buffet. The server was surprised when two of us said we wanted to look at a menu. I ordered a mango lasso which was so good! The sweet potato masala was delicious. I chose not to do the buffet bc I really only wanted one thing and wasn't overly hungry. Those who got the buffet got their money's worth. 
The place is decorated very colorfully and has a fun vibe. Was a fun dinner.

I went here the other day and I was hoping for some competition with my other favorite Indian restaurants.The service was great --very attentive and I never waited on a refill.
They do have a wicked good chicken tika masala, and I liked seeing the yellow rice as an option. I had some veggie korma and samosas. I tried some of the coconut soup,but I wasn't really impressed with it. They did have a lot of options: tandori, chicken chili, and fish korma lots of the normal you would expect to see. However, I just feel that in general the flavor is lacking. Especially when I tried the dessert rice, I always expect a bang from cardamom or cinnamon. This was just lacking. They do have good options but nothing compares to my favorite Indian place.. I did consider that it was a weekend and they might not be at the top of their game. I will probably try this place again because my boyfriend loves it but if I have my choice, I'll go somewhere else.

I went here on New Year's Day and had a really wonderful experience. No vegan options on their buffet, but they have some really delicious (and big! And cheap!) menu selections and I didn't mind "having" to choose from their menu at all :) 

Also, the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful! I was really impressed and am definitely coming back!

I really like the two yak and yeti restaurants near me in Arvada.  We do some frequent take out from the Westminster location but three weeks ago I had an alarming issue. After picking up my takeout bag and driving half way home I got a call from the restaurant that they had forgot my tiki masala. I looked and they had added a saag dish instead (as it was green)   Now I was thinking- this is great I will get a extra dish for my drive back. When I walked in to take my masala they told me they wanted the saag container back.  What???  They then placed it with another take out order to the side that apparently ordered that dish.  This violates all health laws and I told the desk people "you can't do that" and I got some confused looks back at me but they very clearly placed it with the outgoing takeout order.  I have been known to nibble on my takeout while I drive home ( especially when I order those delicious fried paneer cheese things)  I hope you didn't have the paneer takeout on Friday 8/19 around 7pm.

The Food is always AWESOME...this location took forever to get us a menu or take our order. My girlfriend got tired of waiting so she served herself from the buffet and started eating... I wante vegan food and the girl looked at us like she could not understand a word you were saying. Everything I said she looked at me confused..my friend finished her meal.. never got her ice tea. My food took at least 30min..and only came out when my friend said she was ready to go..there were not that many people or tables with anyone...and everyone who was there were already eating from the buffet..go to the Arvada one they are fast there. And they know what vegan means..

Good selection of food for their dinner buffet. As a vegetarian, I always leave full and ready to explode from all the choices I can get. Be sure to ask for the naan which comes out fresh and hot. Came in on a Wednesday night and seems like the only one who does dinner buffets during the weekdays.
Pretty decent indian lunch buffet: it's a little spendier than some without being that much more exceptional but it's conveniently 'on the way.'

I love Indian buffets but usually they are only available at lunchtime. They have a dinner buffet here!! Lots and lots to sample, plus some salad stuff, different kinds of rice, many vegetarian items, soup, and dessert. I absolutely loved unlimited samosas and pakoras plus gulab jamon. The service was fantastic, so very fast. I can't wait to come back for lunch.

We are regulars here as well and sample their buffet. Everything is delicious. The staff is friendly. I recommend their award winning ginger soda for a non-alcoholic choice. They brew their own beers at the Arvada location.

Yummy Tibetan food for the vegan and carnivore alike.  The buffet is pristine. Better than most southern Asian sit down restaurants and top shelf microbrews!!! 

Great date place!

I have been coming here for years!! I love everything about this place!! The food is always delicious and the price is perfect. 
Now that I've said that. The reason for the 3 stars is because today during my meal I bit into the Saag Paneer and pulled a, what I can only describe as a cloth texture something out of my mouth. I was completely disgusted and was told it was "spinach" after I showed them that if you pull on it, it doesn't give. And I pulled hard until my hands shook. Then after the guy went to the back he asks me where it came from and I told him and he removed the entire tray of that food item. I was compensated the entire meal including my sons, but I can only hope what I pulled out of my mouth was not a cloth band aid. This experience will not stop me from eating here. However, I felt it necessary to let it be known of today's happening.

Great place to eat at. I sometimes drive all the way from Boulder just to eat here or on my way back to Boulder from the airport. Great food indeed. 

The waiters there are not necessarily friendly, but that's just the cultural difference. They are kind of neutral and keep to themselves which is fine by me.

Buffet was good..
Not as good as the jewel of India -
Some items cold-
Some items too recycled-
Good but they can do better..

Good overall experience, parking is a challenge during peak times.  A fun diversion in Old Town Arvada in an old house with lots of history.  While I wasn't looking for a dinner buffet and often avoid buffets all together, both my husband and I got the buffet and were pleasantly surprised with the various options, taste, heat and overall dining experience.  I recommend!

Due to a recent message from Yelper "Marco M." titled "Seriously" which read "Too much information...." I will keep this one short.


I would swim in a pool of their saag paneer. That is all. 

By the way, Marco: ellipses have three periods. Just three. 

Hashtag haters gon' hate.

I was pleasantly surprised here. The food was pretty good for being buffet style. Although I feel like there are better places for this kind of cuisine, this place is worth going to if you're in the neighborhood. The brews here aren't too shabby either.

I have no complaints about Yak & Yeti's food, but they get a big down-check for service, ambiance, and attitude.

I never thought showing up at 7:30 would mean 'last call for dinner' but that's my experience all 3 times I've dined there.  The server is more interested in feeding the owner's kids crawling all over their large group table than feeding the paying patrons.  (I figure it has to be the owner's family because the same group occupied the same table all 3 times).  Then, long before we were ready to leave the vacuum starts up, chairs get turned over onto the tables and they make it very clear that they want to close up and go home, whether we're done or not.

So, they get their wish - I'm done with this place.

The overly priced dinner buffet made my rating a 2, if I had based it solely on the lunch buffet it would have been 3. I've been eating the buffet here for 2 years at least and it's gone from really good to just so-so, quality wise. There is never anything different on the buffet and on 3 occasions recently the chicken dishes had so many shards of bone in them, that I couldn't eat it.  We always go for lunch but decided to go for dinner once thinking there'd be different options, nope!! Everything was exactly the same as the lunch except for a higher price and that's annoying especially when they leave things empty or barely any left. The service is always hit or miss...I cant say I'll never go back quite yet but I'm becoming increasingly disappointed.

Outstanding Sunday lunch buffet. 
Samosas were the freshest with great savory chutney. 
3-4 entrees and two types of rice. 
The dessert selection included gulab jamun, kheer, manog custard and halwa, all of which were delectable.  
Highly recommend- skip your breakfast and go there for a hearty lunch. And the price is right too.
Decent food at a good value. Your experience here won't blow you away, but you also won't leave disappointed.

Rich, flavorful, spicy Indian cuisine! My girlfriend and I are regulars here and we have never had a bad experience. Entrees are usually $8-$13 and the lunch buffet fantastic as well (ranges from $10-$15) depending on the day you visit. A few of our favorite dishes are the honey ginger chicken, chicken chili, lamb curry, sweet potato masala, samosas, rice pudding, and; the best desert ever: banana pakora. The drinks here are expensive, but also worthy of your hard earned money, as you can't find drinks like this anywhere else in the Denver area. They brew most of their own drinks, and cook with fiery passion. I love this place!

This place is great. I travel quite a bit both internationally and domestically which means I get to try a lot of food. Indian is one of my favorites and I just LOVE that there is a great indian place near home.

Live in Broomfield so I usually go here because its the most convenient. But with that said, I do think the atmosphere of the Arvada location is better. This one seems like it used to be a Dennys or a Perkins and was converted. Doesn't affect the food mind you, but if you want a more intimate experience, make the drive down to Arvada. 

The buffet is usually well stocked when i do that, but does not seem to ever have Naann.

You really should order the Naan, they have a variety of tasty flavors. 
They also have a great selection of craft beers.
I could eat here every day!  The buffet is fantastic.  Nothing bad to eat here!  All so tasty.

I give Yak and Yeti 3 stars because of the lack of service.  For $11 for the lunch buffet I would expect that plates would be cleared or at least one check in to see how we are doing. The waiter sat us and then only came back to give us the check after we waited awhile.  He was not busy, once I saw him checking his teeth in the mirror in the dining room. Rarely do I tip below 20% and today I tipped a bit less than 15%

Food was really good, and I may try their other location.

I love their lunch buffet and come here almost once a week. The food is delicious and at a good price.  There is plenty of flavor  and i love the way they have so much selection compared to the other lunch buffet options at other restauraunts. One side of the buffet is completely vegan and although im a big meat lover their vegan food tastes as good as if it has meat in it. The naan bead they being out is always fresh and soft and delicious and tastes delicious by itself, swooping all your food ir dipping in the chutney. I tey not to eat too much of it though because it is very filling. Also they have alot more dessert offerings than any other Indian buffet i been to.

Visited Yak & Yeti during a business trip. I went solo on a Friday night, was seated right away and drink order taken. The reason I give 4 vs 5 stars is because I had scoped out the menu before visiting and had my eye on a mixed drink listed on their website. When I asked for the drink menu at the restaurant, none of these mixed drinks were listed (just beers and wines). I asked for the whiskey w/their ginger soda and received a plain soda, no alcohol. I was charged for a plain soda (the soda was good!) but still, I was ready for a drink...

So many options at the buffet! Everything I had was delicious and definitely fresh as the waitstaff was constantly replacing and replenishing items. Both the chicken and sweet potato masala were awesome, loved the chickpea dish. Broccoli was so good. Naan was perfect.

Visit this place! I'll be back the next time I'm in Denver. Definitely would bring my husband to try their beers!

Upon your first entrance you have been transported to Nepal, having found your way into a small eatery.  The faces that greet you are smiling as to say Hey YOU found us, we are so happy to see you. Maybe that was because it was a Monday night. The spot was busy but not to busy, The buffet was at appropriate temperatures, so we decided to grab a table and then hop over to the buffet. What can I say, with three options of rice were yellow, white, and Brown.   Then to follow 5-6 Indian specialties that are finger licking good. I could put that Vindaloo Sauce on EVERYTHING. 

Now yall that follow me know I am never a proponent of buffets. I can however vouch for this one. It is tasty and well kept. Now if you are looking for a server to come to your table and charm your pants off....,thats not this type of establishment. The water glasses are HUGE so if you wish to have tons of drink be sure to ask for low ice. 

Final Verdict: Must Stop in Denver Burbs, Take plenty of friends, have plenty of laughs and try a funky beer, but don't expect any of the servers to bend over backwards.....You are there for the food.

First time here today. It was okay but I prefer Jewel of India. We just happened to be starving and in the area so... gave it a go.  I did like that they offered 5-6 veg only options as well as the traditional chicken options. No beef or lamb when we came today. The Chicken Chili and Curry were spot on. The Saag Paneer was really watery. Nothing else stood out, If we are on this side of town again I will give it another shot.
Amazing, great variety and excellent quality.  Thanks for the wonderful meal, I'll be back whenever I'm in town!

So. Much. Deliciousness. I can't even.

First of all, this is hands down the best Indian buffet I have been to in Colorado. They have a huge variety of selections, including multiple soups, a variety of salad options, meat main meals, veggie main meals, three types of rice and desserts for days. Also, both their buffet and regular menu are well labeled with what is vegetarian, vegan and gluten free, with plenty of food for folks with all types of dietary needs.

Ok, so yes, there are options...but how are they? Ah.May.Zing. Really. I mean, first of all, who makes Sweet Potato Marsala? Um, Yak and Yeti, that is who. That is fabulous. Their appetizers are fabulous. Paneer Masala is amazing. Mali Kofta dumpling action is phenomena. I haven't had anything bad here, and neither have my friends who actually eat things of the meat variety. Whether you rock the buffet (including lunch prices on the weekend, which is awesome!), order off the menu, or take it out for a yummy night at home, Yak and Yeti is tasty, affordable, and offers a selection that is sure to please all palates and needs. Highly highly highly recommend!

We come here once in a while for the buffet. The atmosphere is not the best, but the food is good. Overall, I wish the food was a bit spicier, a bit more flavorful, and a little less sweet. I'd like to see other paneer options on the buffet besides saag paneer. 
The beers from their microbrewery are good.

Delicious! Finally had this for take out for the first time and its some of the best Indian food in the Denver area. The chicken masala was to die for, I ordered extra spicy, and it sure was. Just the way I like it.

Compared to other food options in the sadly lacking Westminster area, Yak and Yeti is pretty dang good! You can get as much delicious Indian food as you'd like at their lunch AND dinner buffet (dinner buffet, how great is that?!). It is a little pricey for two people to go for dinner - but if you don't order any drinks, you can walk out (for two people) under $35. Their food is not the best Indian food I've had, but it is very good and satisfying. Absolutely worth a visit if you're in the area!

With a lack of Indian options in my area of town, I decided to trek out and try something different from my previous visits to Indian establishments in town.  Lunch buffet is $10.95; dinner I believe is $4.00 more.  They have free wi-fi, you simply have to ask for the password.  I went with the buffet (very late lunch).  Below is my review of the items I sampled.  

The lamb vindaloo was disappointingly mild and referring to it as mild would be a stretch.  I know that many people don't enjoy food classified as "spicy", but a dish that is known for its heat should at least be a "medium" in a buffet setting.  The raita was very good and had a nice balance of flavor.  Aloo matar had a nice consistency to it and a pleasing .  Mix pakora was overly fried and seemed to be heavily battered.  The large variety of desserts was a nice change of pace--it seems many places usually limit it to one or two options, but I counted at least five.  They bring fresh naan to the table and while it was the crispier, flakier variety, I felt like it spent too much time on the oven as it tasted burnt.  The vegetable korma had a very good, creamy taste to it.  If I'm in the area, I'll probably stop in again, but I won't drive 15 miles on a regular basis.  If they had another location closer to my house, I'd probably eat there regularly.

Ah yes, the Yak and the Yeti.  Come for the Yak, stay for the Yeti.  The Yak will entice you with its siren song of delicious tandoori chicken, but the Yeti will soothe your soul with the flavorful offerings of chicken tikka masala.  No but seriously, everything here is good and they brew their own beers and this place is the best.  Do yourself a favor and hit up the buffet.  I highly recommend at least 3 bowls of the shikarni.  Staff is friendly and they have like Himalayan hats you can buy on your way out in case it's cold I guess.  Also, this place is called the Yak and Yeti.  I DARE you to find a better restaurant name.  Lastly, if they got the jalapeño beer, skip it, it seems like a better idea in theory than in practice...

I love this place! I am not a fan of buffets at all, but this place I have an exception for. For fast options this is great. The food is not as spicy as traditional Indian food, but it makes it great for your picky friends. This is 5 stars for what it is, but this is by no means is the best Indian food in Denver, but still Yummy!

I've heard about Yak and Yeti for years, and finally got the chance to make a visit a few weeks ago.  On the one hand, I was kind of disappointed to find out that the only option was the dinner buffet, since I'd hoped to order off the menu.  On the other hand, I had the chance to try a couple different dishes, and everything was set up pretty nice.

We tried:
--chicken tikka masala: my husband mostly had this, and I had a taste-- it was great.
--lamb vindaloo: actually very spicy, which isn't surprising for vindaloo but is surprising for a buffet.  Very good dish.
--sweet potato masala: the main reason I'm glad we ended up with the buffet.  I never would have ordered this, but it was delicious.
--vegetable samosa: not the best I've had, but quite tasty.
--saag paneer: very good dish
--kheer rice pudding: not my cup of tea, but my husband enjoyed it.
--some sort of fried banana dessert: I don't remember the name, but it was fantastic.
--naan: this was pretty good, but they don't keep it at the buffet, and we didn't get any brought to our table until we were almost done eating.  Not the end of the world, but it would have been nice to have it earlier to soak up some of the delicious masala and vindaloo sauces.

We also tried both the chai milk stout and the IPA, and were impressed with both.  Service seemed a little abrupt, but nothing dramatic to complain about.

I'm not sure if I'd make the trek across Denver for Yaki & Yeti, but I'd definitely give it a try again if I'm in the area.

Well, I came here with a full stomach. Just wanted to relax with a drink and check out what's in the buffet. The server looked disappointed when I only asked for a drink. I was not impressed so much by the selection at the buffet either ( having been to so many of them other times). Some chicken dishes, stables like saag paneer, chick peas and veggie korma... kinda boring.
Usually this stays as 2 stars. I did give them credit for having free wifi (jump in and out a lot) and house brewed beer.

I went here several times in 2013-2014 and loved it. However, today's lunch was slightly lower quality than previous visits. Highlights include the tandoori chicken and this carrot pudding and sweet potato masala in the dessert area. The service was not great; took a while for the naan to be delivered and I was not asked if I wanted a drink. I used to say this is worth traveling to even if you live elsewhere, now I say it is only worth it if you have another reason to be in the area.

I typically don't like buffets but this place has Excellent food. I eat Indian food very often and in different states. This is the best Indian food I have ever had. The Vindaloo, Korma, and Curry are amazing. And the Masala is hands down the best I've ever had. I love the yellow basmati rice as well.

I love Indian food and have traveled across the nation , so, I know good Indian when I have it. This place makes great Indian food! A lot of places add so much sugar and the portions of spices is way off. The food here is savory and spot on! So glad I live near it! Or maybe not. I'm trying to lose weight, here lol The only complaint is: it's always hot in there. Not unbearable. Just not comfortable. And that's just my personal opinion. And today I noticed my napkin had dog hairs on it and it wasn't clean. But I'm not there for the napkins. lol

Love this place. It's our go to when we are craving Nepalese/Indian food. Plus they always have a lunch and dinner buffet. My favorite items from their buffet are the sweet potato masala and chili chicken. Also, they brew their own beer and it's pretty good according to my husband.

Food = 5 stars. We were in a rush so instead of ordering from the menu we went straight to the buffet and started shoveling anything and everything onto our plates. There was no shortage of meats drenched in spicy, colorful sauciness, varieties of rice, and even some sweeter dessert-like fare. Waiters bring a plate piled with fresh naan to your table as well--perfect for mopping up the remainder of those glorious sauces on your plate. I was incredibly happy with the food.

Service = 0 stars. Holy...... I get the feeling this might be a sort of family business, as the waiter acted like he had no interest in being there, as if his parents or someone guilted him into working at the family restaurant instead of pursuing his own interests and now he's incredibly resentful. He absentmindedly brought us double the waters needed and didn't bother to correct himself (the place wasn't even busy!) He also brought us a check at the end that wasn't even our's, to top it off.

We absolutely love the yak and yeti in Arvada so when we moved to Westminster, we were excited to check out this location. We walked in and took a seat at the bar, hoping to place a take out order and enjoy their beer while we waited. So many employees walked past us and ignored us. We finally flagged someone down and ordered. I got my beer shortly afterward but my boyfriend waited another 5 minutes for his. As we waited, groups of people were coming in and waiting at the door and no one was helping them either, even though there seemed to be plenty of people working. The food was still good, but the naan was very burnt. We will take the extra time to drive to the Arvada location.
Been all over the world, including India, and this is the best Indian styles food I have ever had! Eaten here well over 100 times by now. Can't go wrong here. Highly recommended
The dinner buffet is such a good deal. My favorite part were all the vegan options. I highly recommend it. They also make their own beer. Win all around.

Absolutely LOVE the food at Yak & Yeti. Best Indian food we (my husband and I) ever get, and we get it often. We usually get take out. The service usually isn't that great/friendly, but they get the order correct and the food is amazing. My husband enjoys the buffet when we do eat in, but I'm a vegan, so I always order off the menu. LOTS of vegan options, YAY!

Since moving to the ethnic food desert that is Boulder, Colorado this August, Indian food has been desperately missing from my diet. 

Yak and Yetti's buffet is filled with the staples (lamb vindaloo, saag paneer, chili chicken) and it's all delicious. They bring naan bread to your table and feature four Yak and Yetti Brewery beers. I had the himalaya IPA -- it was ok but a little light on flavor and hoppy bite. One thing I will critique that is probably more the result of a communal buffet setting rather than a knock on Y&Y is the vindaloo had almost zero heat. I, of course, went for seconds (#likeafatty) and added hot sauce to my second plate because I like my Indian food to be melt-your-face-off spicy and this was not so much.

Food: 4 stars
Atmosphere: 3
Service: 2
We had the buffet, and most of the dishes I sampled were very good.  If you get the buffet, they bring you naans at the table, which is a nice touch, but unfortunately, the naans were not good, quite dry and brittle, I don't know if this was just bad luck, but  still, it's a shame if an Indian restaurant can't get the naans right.  
My problem really was with the attitude of the staff at the restaurant.  We went last night, which was a Saturday, knowing that the place closes at 9:30 pm.  We arrived at 8:45, wanted the buffet, but were told the buffet closes at 9:00 pm.  We still went with the buffet, even if the 15 minutes left were far from ideal.  A big group that came after us was told the same thing and they were hurrying to get their food on time.  I thought that rule was quite strict, especially since there was another big group, but, fair enough, we had been warned.  Then at around 9:20 pm, someone started vacuuming, we were actually joking about it, until at 9:25 they basically started vacuuming right next to us, almost under our table. It was so loud, we could not talk anymore, and when I asked the person to go vacuum a little farther, he answered "we are closing".  Well, that was too much, it was not even 9:30 pm yet, which I told him.  But since he kept saying we are closed, we just left.  I noticed the other group left right afterwards.  Wow!!!
So, yes, the food is good, but not good enough for me to go back.  There are enough other Indian restaurants in the area that also offer good food and where they seem to care about their customers.  Next time, I'll go to the Taj in Louisville, great atmosphere, nice service and good food.  And it's right next to where I live...
Love the Saag there! Great eats!

I absolutely love this place. I usually go for the lunch buffet as it is a bit cheaper than the dinner but I ALWAY chose the buffet as there is a variety of food. I get stuffed very easily so it should say something that I pay for the buffet even though I get full on one plate. The chicken tiki masala is my favorite meat dish and the saag paneer is my favorite vegetarian dish. Both of these go great with white basmati rice. I love to soak up the sauce from each of these when the rest of the dish is already in my belly! I love both locations. I enjoy the mango lassi but because I get full so quickly, I usually just opt for water.

BEST BUFFET EVER!

HUGE selection--well over a dozen entrees, most of which were vegetarian. Lots of old favorites (chana masala, vegetable korma, saag paneer, etc), along with a few plates that I had never seen before. I got to try egg curry, coconut soup, sweet potato masala, and carrot pudding for the first time. I didn't care much for the egg curry (I'm just not a big fan of hard-boiled egg), but I definitely found some new favorites with the coconut soup and carrot pudding! All of the vegetarian entrees were expertly spiced with full-bodied flavor. SO GOOD. The chicken tikka masala was also very good--the most tender that I've ever had. 

The dessert selection was also by far the most varied I've ever seen at an Indian buffet. Mango pudding, banana pakora, kheer, and shira (think, cream of wheat with sliced banana). I might have also had an extra helping of the carrot pudding...

Would be a do-over if we lived closer! We just happened to be in the area. But, we'll have to make another trip back just to try it again!
Nice place to have Indian food and good service. Samosa,pakodi ,veg curries ,especially lab curry was too good.
Tasty Indian buffet, decent but not overwhelming selection, way too easy to eat way too much. They also have their own beers, which were quite yummy.

Decent but small lunch buffet with the staples. To my disappointment, nothing was remotely spicy. BUT none of the food was bland either. They had brown rice as well. You rarely find brown rice in a buffet. They also had white and yellow. The naan was just okay. Mine was lukewarm and a little undercooked. The carrot pudding was very good. It's like a pudding with minced carrots in condensed milk. I had their home-brewed Chai Milk Stout as well. It was refreshing, and served in a nice fat goblet. One of their other three homebrews was a Himilayan IPA. The server was cool to let me try a sample of the two. The restaurant itself is nice as well. Would I return to Yak and Yeti? Maybe.

Amazing vegan options. Couldn't be happier with our food. We came in kind of late and still got great service. I'm definitely coming back here again. I'm in love with the Bhindi Masala. The okra and tomatoes were perfect. Impressed with the clearly noted vegan menu!
Never eaten Indian food before so I do not have anything to compare to but this place was very delicious!

Had the buffet. Everything I had was delicious and still warm. The in house brewed beer was really tasty. 

My only complaint is they never came and refilled my water.

This is the best place for Indian hands down! When my hubs is out of town I love to go cause I'm treated do nicely.  The tikka masala whether it be with chicken or sweet potato are my favorite but I always look forward to the different dishes they put out every time I visit.  Like tonight lamb vindaloo and chicken curry!

Get the buffet.  You won't be sorry.   

Four stars in a five star kinda way.   Twice as salty as it need be, but it is great food.   Better than others, for sure!   Quick service and reasonable pricing makes it even better.  

Sweet potato Masala and Saag Pander  is a must try.

Skip custom orders, do buffet!

This place is about as close as you can come to actually visiting the Himalayas. The staff is super hospitable just like they are in India. 

The food is legit and super authentic. This is validated by the fact that we always see people of Indian decent (dot not feather) eating here. They do a great job maintaining the buffet. My favorite is the homemade hot sauce.

I was only about 8 weeks off of spending the month of January in India, and despite every single one of my expectations, I had a hankering for Indian food. When I was in India, there were good things and bad things, but the majority of foods I enjoyed seemed to be confined to a tiny portion of every menu, so I didn't think I'd be going back any time soon.

But I needed some kebaba, naan, paneer, and hoped against all hope for a little gulab jamun to cap it all off (but they didn't have any) so I went up! I had some house-made craft beer, and inhaled some phenomenal medium spiced kebab. Remember, this is an Indian place. And they have real Indians working there. When you want spicy, then ask for it and they will proceed to murder the life out of your face with heavy spice. Note: It's wonderful! You will feel like someone on bath salts trying to escape your own skin with how spicy it is, only in the BEST POSSIBLE WAY. It's truly great.

The funniest part to me was that we had an Indian server (as you might expect) and his service style was in no way at all colored by what most American diners expect. He was serving just like he was in the middle of a touristy restaurant in Mumbai, Delhi or Kolkata. Despite a little awkwardness, I thought it was fantastic. 

All in all it's a wonderful stop with excellent beer, and authentic Indian food, and a fun semi-kitschy decor that complements the meal well! 

Protip: If you're going for the Yak or the Yeti, I saw none on property. You will be disappointed.

This is by far my favorite place to stuff myself silly with delicious Indian noms. 

I've come here twice now for the $14 buffet (price includes fresh naan). They have a great selection of dishes to try. My boyfriend particularly loved the sweet potato masala, and as always I am a die hard lover of the chicken tikka masala (theirs is phenomenal). They also have warm carrot pudding that will knock your socks off. 

Come with a very empty belly! You definitely want to have room for all this goodness.

We wanted something different and this was close to our hotel, the Denver Marriott Westminster. We actually stumbled across it looking for breweries and decided to go for the Indian food. Delicious food. We had the chicken tikka masala and a vegetarian paneer entry. Also the vegetable samosas and garlic naan. Yum! We don't get good Indian food in Florida so we were elated to be there. Also awesome - if you order chai, they refill it throughout your meal. The chai is really good, one of the best I have had.

Horrible horrible horrible. I give it a zero star. 
Horrible. They should be banned. 65 dollars down the drain. Don't ever go there. I do not know how they have such good reviews on yelp. I have lost my trust on yelp reviews. 

Food: horrible. It was super stale food. Naan was not cooked at all. Food was tasteless and stale. I felt like throwing up on eating it. Paneer was like stone. Sabji seemed to have a lot of food color added to it. Kofta seemed like it was just removed from the freezer and gravy was thrown on top. 

Buffet: a friend got buffet instead of ala carte. Stale. Super stale. Undercooked and stale. He was scared he will fall sick on eating the buffet. He just picked some fruits from the Buffett hoping fruits would be fresh. But canned fruit would taste more fresh than this. 

Service: I think the server was stoned. Definitely stoned. He couldn't understand us well. Gave weird or non comprehensible answers when we asked him questions. Had this smile stuck on his face throughout even when we tried to ask him a serious question. I am very sure he was super high and in a different world. He even missed items from our order. 

Also overall staff was super rude. We had just started eating when the come ask my friend who had taken the buffet to pick what he wants as they want to wrap up. They should have mentioned this when he was choosing the buffet saying he will get 5 minutes only to pick all he wants to eat!! And when he requested for 10 more minutes as he didn't want to waste food by taking more, the staff became very rude and sarcastic. They taunted us saying "we can surely go 10 minutes late for you"!!

We were very dissatisfied with the food and angry about how we were treated. We couldn't wait to get away from the rude and stoned staff who didn't care.  We wasted so much food and left the place hungry. 

Please do not eat here. Even if there is no food on the whole earth and only they have food, please choose to die of hunger rather than off the food from them. 

:(

Had a very good buffet dinner here with DH recently.  I was craving something other than our typical homemade dinner and decided to stop on in for the buffet.

I was very satisfied with the selection, the service and the dessert.  As we tried just about everything on the line, I have to admit that everything was fresh, hot, and replenished quickly if it was near out.   do admit they could add a few things to their line, but the place is pretty small already.....to add to the line would be create more cramped tables.  We were already nearly sitting on top of others as it was.  

Don't be afraid to try their chutney selection.  All are great and make good dipping sauces.

The BEST Indian buffet in town...period.
This establishment has a strong following and loads of fans. I am a HUGE fan of their Saag Paneer and Sweet Potato Masala.
Service is always good and their in-house beers are excellent--winners of Great American Beer Festival medals!
UPDATE 07/2015: this place is still great! I have now enjoyed three of their locations and can vouch that each is consistent with the others--all with great tasting food.

After reading a handful reviews, my husband and I were had high expectations for this place and they were not met. We arrived twenty minutes before their closing time because we thought they closed at 10 instead of 9. That was completely our fault. We walked in and were greeted with a warm welcome by a few staff members which is always nice! They didn't have a large drink menu, but it was decent enough for my husband who normally orders beer and I ended up getting mango lassi. We both were happy with our choices! We started getting food from the buffet and immediately realized that all the pans were almost gone. There were still enough amount left for us to try most of them. They had good, but not great, flavors which is still fine for a buffet. After our first round, we got up for another and the staff had started pulling the pans to take it to the back right at 9! We were also told that whatever we want to eat, we better grab it now because they were closing. I understand that this establishment isn't a large chain that will wait for the last customer to leave at their leisure, but I wish they would've let the patrons who were already inside to enjoy it a bit more. 

My tip would be for you to arrive with PLENTY of time to eat before closing time!! We will probably be back to try again, but our experience gets a 3 star this time.

This place is great -- delicious buffet, easy to get to, not too pricey at all for what you get. In fact I just had a delicious lunch there today ... but now I have the feeling that I might have been MSG'd. I didn't think to ask, but I have the tell-tale physical symptoms, so if you're super-sensitive, ask before you dive in. (Or if management replies and says I just ate too much samosa, so be it! I've been three or four times and never had this feeling before, so maybe it was one particular item.)
Yak & Yeti has improved their service.  Their staff now come around to fill your water and drinks and see how your meal is...that is new.  The food is quite good and they have a great buffet.

This place is AWESOME!  I have not ordered off the menu.  I always get the buffet.  The Tandori Chicken is why I come here.  I love that stuff.  Fresh Naan and yogurt sauce please! They also have an excellent selection of Beers from around the world
Yak and Yeti is the best Indian food I've ever had, hands down. They have a two-page vegan menu. I love this place. We always get the baingan bharta and the vegan saag.

Absolutely delicious! I love the ambiance and the feeling of the place. The people are very nice and attentive. Everything we ordered was soooooo tasty!! Our waiter was amazing! It was a wonderful experience overall and I will be back again and again and tell others about it!!!

I will not fly into Denver without stopping here! Really...you say....there are so many good restaurants to choose from. Yes, it's that good! I actually will go as far as to say it is in my top two Italian restaurants, ever! The food was delicious and service amazing, but that's not what I want to talk about.

I want to talk about the ladies bathroom, yes you read right. The LADIES BATHROOM
Ladies, you must go tinkle, maybe even twice. I must warn you though, you may be tempted to lingerrr.  I don't think I have ever experienced so much attention to detail and a desire to pamper a lady in a restaurant bathroom! Yes, I encourage you to not pass up your opportunity to experience the Odyssey Restaurant. You will not regret it!!!

Meal: Dinner, eat in

Ratings out of 10:

Food Quality, Spend Value, and Service: 10
Overall Rating: 10

I am a bit of an Italian food snob, which anyone who has read my reviews will know and as a result am quite picky. Odyssey is rave-worthy. Combine the ambiance, the food, and the service, and you have a rare Italian dining experience that surprised me and left me yearning, or longing, or craving, or....lusting for more!

Odyssey is a Sicilian style Italian restaurant, and they pride themselves on making everything fresh in-house. The menu is broad with many options, and I had trouble deciding what to order since there really wasn't anything that didn't sound good. We started with the house special cocktail, infused limoncello, of which they had both lemon and orange, mixed with either Prosecco (drier) or Moscato (sweeter). I preferred sweeter, and through the course of the meal tried both lemon and orange. Both were delicious, with lemon having a more subtle taste and orange much stronger and bolder (and ultimately my favorite).

Since we had a large group, we decided to order 4 appetizers to share. The Arancini (Sicilian Rice Balls) came with 4 lightly fried risotta balls and a side of homemade marina sauce. They were stuffed with peas and 3 cheeses--mozzarella, parmesan, and gorgonzola. They were some of the best I have ever had, bursting with flavor and even better with a bit of marinara. 

The Crab Stuffed Mushrooms came with 6 and were served over a bed of spinach and tomatoes with a lemon wedge. The mushroom bells were quite large and jammed full of a stunning crab concoction and then drenched with lemon butter white wine garlic sauce. The mushrooms were to die for, and they were fabulous with a bite of raw spinach.

The Fried Cheese Ravioli was a bit different, as I am used to many places doing more of a heavy batter deep fry. These ravioli were very lightly fried and still very much resembled ravioli, just with a crispier texture. They had a very attractive mezzaluna shape and a wonderful flavor, and they were stuffed with divinely fresh ricotta cheese. Either naked or with a bit of marinara sauce, this was quite a delicious app!

The final appetizer was Clams and Mussels, a very nice serving of fresh clams and mussels that had been steamed in a garlic white wine seafood broth. The shellfish was extremely fresh, tasty, and tender, and the broth made it more-ish. The broth also served as a great dipping sauce for the bread. 

I had a bear of a time deciding on food and ultimately went with both a pasta dish and a meat dish. I started with the Penne Rustica, which I have had at a few other places, but past experience was nothing like this. It consisted of roasted red peppers, garlic, onion, chicken, and sausage, all mixed in a sauce combining both rosa and marinara with a splash of cream, then topped with a large lump of fresh ricotta cheese. It was beautiful to look at in person, but rather than staring I stirred the ricotta in throughout the dish, making it creamier throughout. And oh, the flavor! The freshness of the ingredients, the melding of flavors, the incredible smooth creamy finish....I could have dreams about this dish.

At this point I was already about to pop (I had also eaten a Caesar salad), but next on the docket was what I had been most looking forward to: Colorado Rack of Lamb, a half rack of local lamb that had been marinated in lemon and olive oil and then smothered in a delicious reduction of red wine mushroom and rosemary. It came with sauteed garlic spinach and roasted potatoes, but I subbed a side of the bowtie pasta with gorgonzola cream sauce for the potatoes. I was in Heaven. The lamb melted in my mouth and was so insanely tender, moist, and juicy, causing a mosh pit in my mouth! The spinach was delicious and garlicy, and the gorgonzola cream sauce was stunning--sharp, creamy, smooth, and simply wonderful.

At this point a wheelbarrow was in order, but I wasn't leaving without trying the table side bananas foster dessert. Someone else ordered tiramisu, and I got a couple of bites of it. It was smooth and fabulous, and the only thing preventing me from eating more was the impending pyrotechnics show. Our waiter did a fabulous job making the dessert, filling the air with deliciousness and putting on a pretty cool show, too. He poured the final syrupy sweet bananas over ice cream and topped it with whip, and a frenzy of deliciousness ensued. What a way to end a meal!

The restaurant itself is like a big old house, with a super cool ambiance. We were able to sit in a private room on the third floor, and it was quite cozy and homey. The service was impeccable, and we even got to converse with Chef Ignazio during our appetizers! The food is a bit pricey, but for both the quality and the portion size, it is well worth it. I simply cannot say enough good things about Odyssey, so I will summarize with this: I would fly to Denver again just to eat at Odyssey.

We have eaten here several times in the past. The place is cute, dine on the top floor if you are inclined to eat there, it is small and private. Being Italian, I like to think that I have had my fair share of bad, good, and great Italian cuisine. The Odyssey is fair at best. Recently, we had a guest visiting and we brought him here as we were in the neighborhood and it was a Sat. evening; Meaning, it was unlikely we could get in one of the better restaurants in town.  

The meal was a total disaster. Overcooked calamari which were as tough as rubber-bands, overly-spiced seafood dish, (one needed a fire hose to dampen the heat), and they even shorted my guest on his shrimp dish, which was completely tasteless. Like, shrimp with a warm water sauce. Blech!

The server was new and we suffered as a consequence. The owner was not there that night and for some odd reason, we were told that there is no manager. I left my name and number with the front desk but heard from no one. Same when I emailed the restaurant.

So, we have crossed Odyssey off our dining list.

Reading all the prior reviews on Yelp, I had very high expectations for this restaurant.  I leave less than impressed.

They sat us by the fireplace.  It's right next to the kitchen and the stairs to the upstairs dining, so that's a heavy traffic area.  It is what it is.

While we are awaiting our appetizer, they start blaring, and I mean blaring, that noted Sicilian singer Louis Armstrong over the speakers.  This *is* an Italian place, right?  They did reduce the volume of course.

OK food.

*Oven fried cheese ravioli was good
*Linguine and Clams - fair amount of the clams were unopened. 
*Lobster Ravioli - good, but not great
*Fettuccine Alfredo - no complaints from that diner
*Veal Saltinbocca - the creamy dijon mustard overpowered the veal.  Not a good combo IMO.

Prices for entrees are generally $3 higher than listed on their website.  So yes you too can pay nearly $30 for Veal Parmesan should you choose to do so.

Wine pours were good, although the wine by the glass - or at least our choices - mostly meh.

No problem with the service.

If this is considered one of the best Italian restaurants in Denver, then it's time to get new Italian restaurants in Denver.  Or hope others have picked up their game (looking at you Locanda Del Borgo...)

Service: 5 Star
Food: 5 Star 
Ambiance from the room I am in: 5 Star
Perfect attention to detail. 
Gluten Free as well as Dairy free options.
Street Parking only, but worth it. I found a perfect spot on Sunday around 6pm less than a block away.

Atmosphere~Beautiful, Sweet, Cozy, Romantic. 
Indoor and Outdoor Seating. 
A beautiful Violinist plays in the background for a perfect romantic dinner. 
Violinist goes to another room to play~ Cue the perfect backgroud music.
For a moment I forgot I was in the Midwest. 
The restroom gives many options~ Which kind of mint are you fond of? What sort of hand wash would you like today? A new one each day of the week? Well...your wish is granted. 
Outstanding service from each person I encountered. 
The last Italian place (that was also highly rated on Yelp, though I can not figure out why) in denver I went to does not even come close to this place. 
Monday Specials!?! Well go on a Monday and find out all about it. 
I will be back, and I will bring my lover.

Oh my, this place is absolutely incredible!  I bring family here each time some visits, and everyone loves it!  The ingredients are the freshest of any italian restaurant I've tried, and the pasta is home made.  This place holds on to their Sicilian roots oh so close and if you close your eyes, you actually feel like you've transported to Italy!

The service is alway impeccable as well, honestly the best service of any restaurant I've dined at in Denver!

While the menu is pricey - although worth every single penny for the quality - if you're on a budget, fear not!  Monday's they have $10 pasta specials, and for the price, it's a steal!

Best service i had last night. Our waiter (Mikey) he was very attentive and super friendly. He had great recommendations of wine, appetizers, and dinner options. Great surprise that i had last night was that all the pasta entrees were $8.95 on every Monday's (except for the seafood pasta dishes) for the price of $8.95 - you get bread with delicious balsamic vinegar with olive oil, roasted garlic, and brown sugar, Cesar salad, and your main entree dish, pasta carbonara with shrimp. Food, service, and price at Odyssey are on point! Definitely coming back to this restaurant on another Monday!!

I cant believe these people.  Notifying me 1 and 1/2 before our reservation that they had overbooked.  Meeting friends driving in from out of town, truly bad, horrible service.  Offerring a 30.00 gift coupon is just lame!  Thanks for screwing up our evening!
First time here and what a treat. Our Server Phil along with the Chef really made us feel at home. Nice romantic setting with authentic Sicilian food, bring your girl here and you can thank me later.

Where to even start,
What a wonderful restaurant. Walked in five minutes before our reservation and were seated right away. Servers came right away to take drink orders and go over the daily specials etc. Salad and bread came right away and we're delicious.
Only slight issue was how fast our entrees came out but I won't deduct a star just for that. Food was wonderful as I had the gnocchi with the red sauce and my date had the tortellini with pesto.
Excellent service and never had my water glass empty.

I never write reviews, I don't really care to.  But this place is so great.   Ignacio the chef came out and talked with us and was so nice. The staff was incredible.  The food was fantastic.   Gnocchi gorgonzola cheese sauce with lobster bits was everything it sounds like.   Completed with bananas foster prepared by the Ignacio himself.  So great.  See the happy faces...

This was our first time at Odyssey. I want to start out by saying be mindful of parking here. It is only street parking and it is not easy to find parking. So, if you go leave quite a bit before your reservation as parking is rough.

Otherwise we LOVED this place! So quaint. A very romantic atmosphere. Staff was fantastic! Very understanding that parking is hard to come by so they took my drink order and brought water and bread while I waited for my husband to park.

The bread is delicious, very soft. For appetizers we had the tomato, mozzarella, and basil salad and the fried ravioli...don't miss these! They are delicious! For salads we had Caesar Salads, they were rest-served with lots of parm! For the main course we had fettuccini chicken Alfredo and fettuccini bolognese I loved the bolognese, hubby said the Alfredo could have used to be spiced up a little as it was a bit bland but overall pretty good.

We will definitely be back, but may uber there after parking downtown first! Ha!

The service is exceptional, the chef/owner is ever-present and involved, which makes the experience feel special and exclusive, every time. 

Salads are appropriately dressed, the olive oil and balsamic for the bread should be done at every italian spot, delicious. The entrées have never blown us away. The lobster  ravioli is good but not amazing, steak is almost always over-cooked for us. The mussels are pretty good and wine selection is nice. You won't be disappointed when you eat here, but don't expect the best meal of your life and weigh that against the price.

Everything about this restaurant is outstanding. Whether it's a quick Monday night pasta date, or a three hour experience with family and friends. 

Odyssey offers that lower Manhattan, small Italian restaurant dining experience - without the pretentious attitude and exorbitant pricing. Like a fine wine, this place only gets better the more often you go.

So many things to love about Odyssey. The service, for example, was incredible. One couldn't have an empty water glass without it being refilled and our server was very attentive. 

The atmosphere was also very special. If you're looking for a romantic date night spot, this is the place for you! Think candlelight, rose petals and traditional romance.

The tiramisu was maybe the best I've ever had as well. It was light, fluffy and sweet with a hint of savory dark chocolate powder. Mmmmm.

My penne bolognese was decent. The menu listed cinnamon as an ingredient and you could really taste it, which provided a sweet and somewhat unusual take on the dish. The capers were also a little sweet (more like peas), which was okay, but not my favorite.

I did like Odyssey, but not enough to visit again without checking out a few other new places first.
Great restaurant all around! Fairly small place and intimate. It was perfect for a first date for my boyfriend and me. Food and service were very good as well. Look forward to coming back here.

This is the perfect place for Valentine's Day, special occasions, or just your weekly date night if you want something fancy. I booked a month before Valentine's day and many other restaurants were already fully booked. Odyssey had a lot of openings so I was able to book through open table easily. When we arrived, the place was packed and even though we were 15 minutes late, no questions were asked and we were immediately seated on the top floor that had a window view. The seating was quite crowded but it is Valentine's day after all. 

I loved how the table was decorated with red roses and the lighting was a soft lighting that really set the romantic mood. The waiter was super accommodating and explained the wine menu to us. We decided to go with the Borgo Scopeto Chianti Classico which was a light and refreshing red that wasn't too bitter. They give you bread with a olive oil and balsamic vinigrette dip. It was seriously the BEST free bread I have ever had at any Italian restaurant. The dip was especially delicious because the vinigrette reduction was very sweet and it came with freshly chopped garlic. I loved it and when they asked if we wanted a second serving of the bread, it took a lot of self control to say no. We also ordered the riceball as a starter. It comes with 4 rice balls which is perfect for sharing. It's a ball made of risotto and lots of different cheeses deep fried so that the outside is crispy. With the marinara, this is absolutely phenomenal. Just when I was reaady for my entree, the waiter told us we also get a free cesar salad. What?! What restaurant gives two free appetizers? This is crazy. 

For my entree, I ordered one of the pastas under the specialty list. It was the chicken with mustard sauce with a side of sauteed vegetables. My boyfriend ordered the veal with a white sauce, capers. Both our dishes was a HUGE portion and we only ate through about half of it. THis as left overs the next day was pretty delicious as well. They hand make all their pastas so the noodles are just perfect. I really liked my entree as the chicken was very moist and it had proscuitto and the vegetables were delicious as well. My boyfriend was a bit sour because of the capers and also it was a bit salty for my liking. The waiter also told us they have $8 pasta mondays which we will definitely come back to try. This place gave us the perfect 1st Valentine's Day Dinner together. Thank you Odyssey!

What an amazing evening with Ignacio and Mike at Odyssey. The atmosphere is fantastic and the food....hands down 5 stars. If you want great food, feel like part of the family and need a night out, head to Odyssey. We will be back again and again. We love you!!
Went back again for $9 pasta night. So good. Also tried the Bananas Foster this time.  Made tableside..delicious.

So I'm in the car right after eating. I can't think of one bad thing to say. Amazing ambiance, service, and food. What more could you ask for?? 
We started off with the toasted raviolis.. Drizzled with balsamic and served with the yummiest marinara I have ever eaten. I missed the memo where we also got salad and bread with a balsamic and oil mixture.. Both out of this world.
For entrees I had the seafood fresco... As you may know finding good seafood in quality and preparation is hard to come by but holy cow.. It was mind blowing.. Scallop, shrimp, and artichoke hearts with sautéed spinach with creamy fettuccini. Huge portions too.
My man got the butternut squash ravioli. He loved it as well. We also ordered cannolis to go. They have a mean wine list and both had a few drinks and the check came out to around 125. Worth every penny. We will definitely be back.

I don't even know where to start with this review...it is so rare to walk into a place and feel so special, but that is how the staff makes you feel when you go into this restaurant.You absolutely have to try this place out! 

I planned a company dinner here and I searched for places to go and came across Odyssey. I read the reviews and figured we could go check it out before the actual event. They went as far as doing a tasting for us and created our very own printed menu with the items we had selected. Every single detail was incredible. We walked up and they had placed tables and a fire pit outside to set the mood, they always have rose petals lining the red carpet leading up to the restaurant and inside they had gone all out with decorations, our own wine table, appetizers set up on the bar - everything was so immaculate and beautifully done; I was speechless! 

The staff is incredible. From the hostess' (Megan is so great to work with) to the wait staff (Andrew) to the owners and managers; I was seriously blown away. Not one person was rude or unhappy. You can tell that it's a family restaurant and all they want to do is provide the best customer service for their customers and they definitely show that during your time spent there; you don't feel like a customer - you feel like you're part of the family. Michele and John are both incredible and they just makes you want to be around them all the time. I love them! 

And the food...holy buckets, the food! It's authentic Sicilian style food and it was amazing! The Bruschetta and Italian Fried Calamari was the best I've ever had and (the calamari was so lightly breaded and so tender). We had Fettucine Alfredo, Spaghetti with Meatballs, Butternut Squash Ravioli and Veal Marsala for our entrees and all of them were incredible. I do have a sweet tooth, so that Bananas Foster...oh I dream about that all the time! They do a tableside flambe and make the experience so much fun! If you want good food and a fun show to top off your evening - go! 

I could go on and on about this place and will definitely be going back regularly and am actually about to plan my birthday dinner there because I know that I will be well taken care of and treated better than any other place could treat me! Thank you to every person who made our first experience there just out of this world amazing!

We went to Odyssey for a graduation celebration.   There were six in our party, each of us had something different to eat.   Every meal was excellent.  The ambience was excellent.  Looking forward to going there on date night with my wife.   Definitely thumbs up.

This was the best dinner experience I've had in a while. Everything about this place is amazing but the customer service is what really won me over! My boyfriend and I came once before on Valentine's Day and he decided to take me here again for our anniversary. I ordered some steak and he had seafood the food was delicious and it was a really big portion so we even had leftovers for the next day! Now this is the part where this place completely won me over; While we were finishing our meal a man came up to us and complimented me several times and gave me a rose telling me I was absolutely beautiful it was one of the sweetest things I've ever experienced because this man was so sincere and genuine. He then found out it was our anniversary and he asked if he could treat us to a glass of moscato and of course we said yes! He poured us two glasses and gave us the rest of the little bottle for us to keep! we talked with him for a couple more minutes and we eventually found out he was the owner! He told us he doesn't come to work to work he comes to have fun and make friends and that's all that matters to him! I've never in my entire life seen an owner of any restaurant or any other company treat his guests so well and go as far as conversing with them and giving them free wine just because it was a special occasion. I don't even know if I can consider that good customer service that is above and beyond anything I've ever seen I think this man is just a wonderful human being who just happens to own a restaurant and his restaurant reflects what an amazing person he is! We've decided to make this place our traditional anniversary/special occasions restaurant!

We chose this restaurant based on great Yelp reviews and we were certainly not disappointed.

While the outside of the building suggests nothing spectacular, the inside is just that. There was a romantically lit bar with roses in wine bottle vases, a woman playing violin in the main dining area, and an overall cozy atmosphere. We were told we would be dining upstairs and (in order to get there) passed through the quaint kitchen to the staircase. On the second level we found bedrooms that had been converted to small dining areas, complete with linen table cloths, candles, and more fresh flowers.

We were given an excellently seasoned and buttered loaf of Italian bread to start with as we looked over the menu. My boyfriend ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and I ordered the pasta primavera. They were even nice enough to accommodate my request for specific vegetables, some of which weren't even listed for this dish. Our food arrived hot and made-to-order and was absolutely delicious. 

Our server, Adrian, was exceptional as well. He was very knowledgable of the menu and wines and was perfectly attentive. 

The best part of the evening was when we ordered the bananas foster and the owner himself arrived to flambé our naners! He jested with us and honestly made us feel like we were welcomed family members attending a dinner at his home. 

We will definitely be back!!

This is hands down my favorite restaurant in denver.  It is built out of a lovely old house with tons of history, and every table/room is cozy and comfortable, and usually has a story behind it.  There isn't anything on their menu that isn't amazing.  Order the rice balls, lamb chops, and bananas foster and you won't be disappointed!!  They also have two private rooms upstairs for large parties/private parties etc, and I have thrown many a great business dinner here.  They will cater to your every need, always have perfect service, and never disappoint with new specials to keep it fresh!  Their wine selection is top notch as well, and mostly imported from Sicily or Italy.  This is pretty much the only place to take someone on a date, roses on every table with rose pedal table decoration too!!! And some nights they even have a violinist!!  Best spot to eat in town hands down!

You will leave here feeling like part of the family, I guarantee it!

Loved it. Small restaurant with a warm authentic Italian hospitality. Greeted by the chef at the door and made to feel right away that it
Would be a wonderful experience. Food fabulous. Wine fresh and tasty.

Pricey menu, but great staff and service. I ordered the fried calamari only to learn my date had celiac's and couldn't touch them. They immediately brought out another huge dish of grilled calamari - on the house!

This is my favorite restaurant in Colorado. I sometimes try to recommend dishes for those who read my reviews, but honestly I have not had a single entree I did not love from here. For dessert, however, get the banana's foster. It is a delicious flambe that is prepared in front of your table.

The atmosphere is intimate and romantic, and so is perfect for date night. The service always amazes me; the waiters/waitresses are always attentive and knowledgeable. 

If you come here, then prepare to have an astonishing time!

So far, this has been an interesting experience. Our error was not making a reservation. When we arrived, we were told it would be a 10 minute wait, and it ended up being about 30 minutes. We were told that the hostess is new. Regardless, the food must be fantastic, as this place is legitimately standing room only. When we finally were brought to a table (a 2 top for the 3 of us which we suggested), we were told there was only 1 chair! My wife sat down with our son on her lap. A few minutes later I was given a recently vacated chair.

In all honesty, none of this is upsetting. The wait staff is doing their best and the food smells delicious. Can't wait to eat....

Wow just wow!

We came in for dinner & left with friends. Aside from the food being absolutely delicious the dinner was such an experience. So personal Manny our server your awesome. Mario your banana foster is amazing! 

Mickeli & Ignacio you guys made us feel like family and as if we were enjoying a beautiful dinner at home. If your looking for a great dinner in Denver look no more, this is your place. It was the perfect date night and ambiance was perfect! So glad me and my husband came here! 

Side note: Other reviews say parking his difficult but we found parking right away.

Make reservations.  Probably the absolute best Italian I've ever had.  Quaint little place with great service and authentic offerings.   The bruschetta was fantastic, as was the Caesar salad.  I had the pasta bolognese and it was delicious.  I will definitely go back.

This place is too cute!

 The restaurant looks like it's in an old home so the place is very cozy, warm & inviting. It's a multi-level restaurant with ambient soft lighting, candles, fresh roses on the table, rose petals @ the entrance-way & oldies music like Sinatra. I was excited to hear a song about SF come on during the first 5 minutes I was seated. Wine menu is fairly priced (around $9-12 per glass) & the waitress was very informative & helpful about the menu selection. I was eyeing the veal with potatoes & spinach special + the diablo spicy lobster spaghetti special. I tend to order whatever is on the specials menu if they offer one. I was excited when the waitress came to my table & suggested the exact 2 things I was eyeing. So naturally, those were the two dishes I tried. Prior to the entree, I had the delicious, freshly baked bread with parmesan cheese with a side of garlic, balsamic vinegar + olive oil dip. The bread was delicious & I couldn't help but have two servings of it. The entree came with a nice caesar salad that tasted like it had homemade dressing. It also came with olives which is a nice twist to the traditional caesar. The veal came with prosciutto and some spinach that was cooked in white wine. The lobster pasta dish had tons of whole pieces of lobster meat & it had slices of pepper in it. It definitely packed some good heat. With the ambient lighting & roses everywhere, it is hard to imagine this place as anything else but a date-night romantic-type restaurant. 

Servers were great & friendly. I didn't get to try dessert but I'd love to come back to try their banana flambe dessert that they flambe table side.

It is a great restaurant  We decided to make it our new favorite Italian restaurant 
Anything lobster is amazing !! Chicken dishes were great Calamari was yummy 
Dessert was over the top

Elyce our waitress is soooo cool and sweet she was so helpful 
Come for the delicious food !!!

This place is truly breathtaking. Specializing in veal and lobster they offer mouthwatering dishes that will keep you asking for more!

The moment you step into restaurant you are immediately taken into another world. A small original Colorado home that has been converted into a little piece of Italy itself. This place is amazing!

I had the opportunity to try several dishes however the sword fish as well as Lobster Diablo were something that was truly special. Offering a unique taste that I have yet to find at any other restaurant.

For dessert the table side banana foster is something from heaven. There are simply no words to describe it and is something you must try for yourself. I can promise you won't be sorry! 

Highly recommended!! however parking sucks (hope you can parallel)

Been through their front door early and often since they opened for business. Watched this family style, romantic, authentic Italian/Sicilian restaurant grow from the ground up  to become the thriving hub of activity that it is today. Roses, wine bottles, white linen table clothes and subtle mood lighting are only surpassed by the magic of the old school European service and the love attended to the ingredients by head chef Ignacio and his front of house son Mikele (Mike) and their talented staff !
I could pick out singular dishes (pasta rustica) but why...all plates are fresh, plentiful and there will not be any chance of disappointment ! Take a chance...roll the dice ... and tell your server "whatever the chef would like to prepare '...you won't be disappointed ! 

Plenty of fine regional Italian wines and good staff recommendations !

I can't believe I'm giving a 5 as I always think there's some room for improvement. 

But the food was fantastic. Our server was more than accommodating to my wife's allergies; he even went out of his way to make her a custom salad dressing which she loved. The atmosphere is romantic and warm. 

It does cost to eat here but the price is proportional to what you get.

I returned to the Odyssey last night for the second time, as it is one of my friend's go-to restaurant each Monday for "Pasta Mondays." Every Monday, the Odyssey offers their pasta dishes for $8.95, which is a screamin' deal. 

We were warmly greeted when we walked in and spoke with Mike, one of the owners, and sat down outside. The patio was nice and would be great for a romantic date. We ordered a bottle of Chianti from Tuscany (I believe), which was tasty. I forgot our server's name, but he was attentive and brought us many plates of bread and the olive oil/balsamic/rosemary mix to dip the bread in. We also ordered calamari to start, which was lightly breaded, delicious, and had subtle hints of lemon in the breading (prior to squeezing the lemon over the dish).

With each pasta dish, you get a small Caesar salad to start. It's the perfect amount to have prior to your next course. For my main, I had the pesto tortellini with chicken. YUM!! The pesto is creamy and filling, while not leaving you feeling couch-borne after eating it. The tortellini was stuffed with ricotta and was soooooo goood. 

At the end of our meal, Mike surprised us with some gifts to take home. We also met Ignacio before we left and checked out the upstairs. The entire time I was at the Odyssey I felt like family. This is true and great customer service. When you leave a restaurant beaming with a grin from ear to ear, you know you have been to not just a good restaurant, but a place where you are truly valued as a customer and new friend. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone who likes good Italian food and being treated warmly by such gracious hosts ;) I will hopefully be returning in a week or two for pasta Mondays.

As per my Italian and East Coast friends (who know good Italian), the Odyssey is the most authentic they have had in Denver AND you get warm Italian service, too.

The best Italian food in Denver, as voted by real Italians. 

I was referred to this great little establishment by a coworker and we will definitely be back. The owner and his son welcomed us (and every guest) at the door. We were seated right away with our reservations and were immediately waited on hand and foot. The wine and appetizers were great to get us started. We enjoyed the fried calamari (some of the best I've had) and the chief's tasting board with lots of meats, peppers, cheese, tomatoes and even grapes. 

Our food came out quickly and by the end we were so full we unfortunate didn't have room for dessert - even though we had seen and wanted the bananas foster. We will have to come back for that very soon.

Amazing, homemade, authentic food and servers that are knowledgable in the menu and ingredients. We have lived in the neighborhood for years and had driven past a number of times without really noticing it. We were looking for a "mom and pop", family owned restaurant and saw reviews for Odyssey that fit what we were looking for. So happy we found this delicious and quaint spot in the area. Food was out of this world good, and portion sizes were perfect for bringing home leftovers. Can't stop telling everybody I run into to go check out this restaurant!

My husband and I were visiting from California and wanted to treat my parents to their favorite restaurant.   

The evening started out a little rocky when my parents received their manhattans from the bar which were NOT a manhattan.  My 80 year old father approached the bartender and inquired how it was made and he assured my dad it was done correctly.  My dad came back to the table with his drink still in hand and left speechless.  However, approximately 5 minutes later, 2 new drinks were delivered to the table and made correctly.  An apology wasn't offered, nor an admit to the first mistake.   Dinner went smoothly and everything tasted great, however, the cook dumped at least a half of cup of capers on the chicken and the veal piccata plates.  The taste overpowered the entire plate.  

The kicker came when on the drive home my husband mentioned he was surprised he was charged $1.00 for each drink that was ordered "on the rocks"!   My parents were shocked and had never heard of such a thing!  As I looked at the bill I realized we were over charged $3.00 on three of the four meals ordered!  As well as noting the $8.00 glass of wine I ordered was billed as $12.00!  I am one who looks at menu prices and I guarantee I knew I was correct which I later confirmed with their on line menu pricing!  

After several calls to the restaurant I finally spoke to the hostess who assured me my card would be reimbursed for the $15.00 mistake.  She put me on hold to inquire the ice charge and said the bartender charges a service fee for having to "scoop the ice"!  Unbelievable!
Approximately 10 minutes later, the owner called and over talked me the entire time as I tried to explain his menu prices do not reflect the bill.  I finally said we must have had an old menu and he basically called me a liar and said the prices changed 10 months ago... However the on line menu does not reflect the "new" prices.  His reasoning for the ice charge was because they used a bigger glass.?!  

I will say, he credited my card $25.00 to "make me happy".   And said he looks forward to visiting with me next time!  But my parents are highly disappointed and do not plan on visiting again.   

Bottom line, check your bill before you pay!

After the Broncos vs. Vikings game we decided to try the Odyssey. Partly to avoid traffic on our drive back to the hotel and because it looked very promising from Yelp reviews. We are very glad we stopped in. 

They do not have parking but we found a space on the street about a block away. 

At the entrance we were greeted warmly by the owner Ignacio. Our server Jessie was very enthusiastic in her wine recommendation and it was spot on.

The bread they give you is served with a plate that has olive oil, balsamic, herbs and fresh garlic on it. Quite tasty with the bread. The bread is New Orleans style with a light, dry and airy consistency so perfect for the olive oil mixture. 

My husband and brother both had the spaghetti and meatballs and Jessie suggested the children's portion (no salad). It was a large portion with 2 very large meatballs. They both enjoyed it. 

Sometimes you just want comfort food and that is why I ordered bowtie pasta gorgonzola and added shrimp. Nice sauce and the sundried tomatoes added a little pop. The small salad that accompanied my dinner had lettuce, olives and shaved parmesan with a light caesar dressing. Just enough.

Because of a mixup over our appetizer Jessie offered free dessert and we tried the tiramisu. It was quite good and the plate was dusted with a hint of cinnamon (?).

We will definitely return the next time we are in Denver.

They have a nice fireplace that adds ambiance.

Service was excellent, ambiance was intimate and romantic for a date night. The food was excellent! My bf ordered and I both ordered pasta and the flavor was tasty, portions were a great size, and overall the quality of the dish was excellent. we also ordered the banana dessert which they prepare in front of you. although I'm not a banana fan, I still enjoyed it! I would highly recommend if you're looking for quality Italian food!

I have been here 3 times, and each time seems to get better and better. This old house turned restaurant is charming and quaint, without feeling crowded. They have a very nice patio, cute little bar, and tons of atmosphere!

The staff is the most personable and friendly I have ever seen. They greet you, seat you and make you feel at home. They try to accommodate your every need, so if you want something, just ask! They are incredible at going that extra mile!
