As if all that wasn't enough, there's the food! Every I've had has been incredible, and if you see something you may want, ask for a taste! Especially their meatballs or Bolognese! They want you to be happy and full, so they make sure you leave well satisfied! I can't accurately put into words the experience, you just have to go!

The most romantic restaurant I have ever been to. My boyfriend and I decided to come here because we wanted some Italian and little did we know how nice and romantic this restaurant was. We came back for my birthday. Especially in the evening, dim lights and roses in a wine bottle. Love this place!

This place is in a cute house and the wait staff is very friendly.  We had the penne rustica w/chicken and sausage and the Penne Bolognese w/ricotta and a glass of the banfi chianti classico.  The food was good but I have to admit it was more Americana Italian than true Italian.  The prices were steep with each dish being $18.00.  Still we thought it was cute and romantic.  We got a complimentary mini bottle of prosecco as a parting gift which was sweet.
Amazing service with Vinny, authentic cuisine... To die for after dinner favors, luscious wine with favorable tasters... And a venue to die for!

My fiancée and I are in love with this place. It's so rare these days that the owner of a restaurant is so concerned with each customer. We were comped a dessert simply because we drove up from the Springs. If more restaurants these days put the love that this place clearly puts into their food, I'd be broke. I've never had better Marinara. I can't talk this place up enough. We are always treated like family. It's honestly so refreshing. Every negative review on here either has no taste, or didn't even give the place a chance. Bar none, best Italian in Colorado.

I had the ossobuco and a glass of Sicilian red. They were both excellent. The complimentary starter salad was also beautifully made - the romaine had just the right amount of dressing without being excessive. The atmosphere rounded out the experience nicely.

Odyssey is a new favorite of mine. I've eaten here twice, and got Penne Bolognese and the Caprese Salad both times. The salad has a balsamic reduction which is very good and I also requested some pesto on the side to drizzle on the salad. They also offer bread and a dipping oil/balsamic/herb mixture that is fantastic. The pasta was very good and was a large enough portion that I was able to take some home with me. Service was also good. I will definitely be back again.

I am embarrassed that it has taken me so long to write a review about the Odyssey. We have had several large family dinners here and each and every time it has been great!!! My wife's family is Sicilian and so they have always loved the "connection" to the owner and his son. The first thing that we love is how they have always made us feel like we are long lost family. I will say that reading through a few of the negative reviews, some have not always fully understood that attention and have considered it "over the top", but for a large Italian family it is like a wonderful family dinner. They truly do treat their guest like family...and if you don't want to be treated like family...well, you are probably out of luck. Second the food. Sicily is not my favorite region for Italian food. But, this place does Sicilian food wonderfully. It is authentic (according to my Sicilian family) and wonderful. The atmosphere is wonderful as well. We have eaten in almost every room in the house and they all of their pluses. It is a converted house so they couldn't avoid some of the layout difficulties...but they have done a great job of minimizing the impact of them. Lastly, service has ALWAYS been friendly and wonderful. I really do believe that this is one of the best places in town to take a family for a special meal....at least based upon our experiences.

You can tell that this restaurant is ran VERY well! It really makes a difference when the owner is involved in his business. My 4 star rating was due to the negative taste of my food however, I would recommend this restaurant based on the level of service that they provide. I'm thinking that my food fluke was a random thing. 

Our waitress had put in my order incorrectly and she noticed it immediately, even before I realized it. Accidents happen right? As soon as she told me that they will put a rush on my corrected order, I knew that this may or may not work out for me. When my linguine dish finally came out, the noodles were perfectly el dante however the sauce was super thick so all the noodles were stuck together into a large mass. The sauce wasn't impressive nor was it salted very well. I had also ordered a side of meatballs as well, they were tough with a "microwaved" texture. Maybe my reaction to my food was  a mental thing due to the mixed up order??? Not sure, but I was hungry and in the mood for one of my favorite comfort food so I doubt it. Regardless, my husband and his friends loved their dishes though. Also, without me mentioning anything, the restaurant also took care of the bill for my order because of the mix up. I thought that was a very classy move!

If you like fabulous service and mediocre food for $20+, this is your place. The bread is dressed up 7-11 bread (literally) and the sauces were bland. We had a party of 10 and all walked away feeling that way about it. Our waiter was incredible and he brought out a rather large slice of chocolate cake with ice cream for the birthday boy at no extra cost which was a very thoughtful thing to do on their part. It's very unfortunate that the food doesn't match the service. Good luck to you if you choose to spend your evening here, I hope you enjoy your food more than we did.

The best Italian food I've had in a long time. I had the homemade lobster ravioli and I couldn't stop eating.  Excellent service and I loved the atmosphere.  Great for date night.  I look forward to going back.

First time here. It was my birthday, so this was the restaurant if my choosing. This a a beautiful Victorian home that was transformed into a Sicilian gem. We had a reservation and was put in the third floor room, which was very small and intimate to say the least. Very Romantic. We had a bottle of Pinot noir with our entrees. He had the penne Rustica and I the Veal Braciole. The sauce on with veal was magnificent. And the portion was more than generous. The bread served dinner was accompanied with an olive oil and balsamic reduction with roasted garlic and herbs. This was amazing. I would give five stars, however, you must your the kitchen to get onto the 3rd floor and the kitchen was not as clean as I believed it should have been. However, service was great and the food brilliant

I went here for the first time ever about a week ago on Saturday night. Even though I was with a girlfriend, the table we got was very cozy, next to a window on the second floor. This is a good date stop...although its a bit too dark in the restaurant. 
Without a doubt...their fresh bread is so AMAZE! I could just have that alone! We ordered a couple appetizers along with a pasta, which we shared. Everything was great- except the pasta. Im ok with pasta being al-dente, however this one was hard to chew and undercooked. I think the atmosphere and experience of the place made up for the average Italian food. If I happen to go back, I will update my review. I really want to give it 4-stars...I just cannot justify it at the moment.

I went to Odyssey on a spontaneous date night with my husband. My favorite part was the atmosphere - it is very cute, dimly lit, and set in an old house. The close quarters makes it a bit difficult to hear though. They had some trouble with the sound system, I think, because in the middle of dinner the same song came on a couple of times at full blast, before being shut off a few seconds later. We thought about starting with an appetizer, but since the entrees come with bread and a salad, we skipped it. I would have been interested in the arancini di riso since that is one of my favorite Italian dishes, but I did think it was curious why they didn't call it by it's Italian name on the menu - it's listed as Sicilian Rice Balls. 

I had the ricotta tortellini and my husband had the gorgonzola bowtie pasta. Both were decent but nothing to write home about. It's a lot to spend on pasta, too, with both dishes in the $17 range. The pasta was cooked until pretty soft, and I typically like mine a little more on the al dente side. My husband had a glass of chianti that he didn't love, but I liked the white wine that I ordered. If I came back, it would be just to have a glass of wine in the cute setting.

After driving by this neighborhood restaurant that sits right on 6th Avenue -- we finally decided to try it.  We were seated outside -- right on 6th -- didn't matter at all.  Denver has turned into such a busy city, I think everyone is used to the loud city sounds.  The waitress was so pleasant and attentive.  The owner was very engaging.  The experience was great.  They  suggested an amazing bottle of wine and the entrees were perfect.  It was delightful.  We will definitely be back.

I tried to eat here on a Saturday night for my birthday. We had a small part of two, a reservation, and arrived early. Once we got there we waited about 10 minutes with a short line of people before someone acknowledged us. At this point multiple servers had rushed by without looking at anyone waiting, or told us that someone would be there to help any time soon. 15 minutes after our reservation time, the man at the front told us it'd be another 15 or so, which was understandable since it was busy. But then he kept repeating "Sorry I'm trying to kick people out as fast as possible but they're not leaving" a bit loudly, which threw me off a bit. We ended up leaving after waiting a bit longer, and he was grateful for to have less people to deal with. 

I'm aware that this review doesn't have an actual dining experience, but being ignored for so long and hearing those negative comments didn't leave me with a good impression.
My favorite restaurant in Denver! The food is all made from scratch with wonderful flavor. Service was great. Historic home with several rooms for dining plus outdoor patio.

FANTASTIC little authentic Sicilian restaurant! The entire staff are absolutely wonderful. From the owner and head chef, Ignazio, his son, Michele, and our server, Alyssa. The family is from Palermo, Sicily and their menu consists of authentic Sicilian dishes. The food, the atmosphere, and the staff, were fantastic! What a wonderful way to spend our last night in Denver!

The bread and crab stuffed mushroom appetizer was soooo good.  The seafood platter was excellent, especially the scollops and shrimp, it's a huge platter.  The hazelnut cake and tiramisu were delicious. But we very disappointed with the lobster linguine.  Service was excellent but very slow.  Too many customers.  We REALLY like our server and manager.  They took care of us.  We will come back and try their other dishes.  I recommend this restaurant.

A lucky find for us. We were going to eat across the street but it was jammed with a 30 minute wait on Sat nite at 6pm. So we went over to Odyssey and what a great experience. 

Atmosphere, super friendly staff, really intimate and rustic interior, great service, great drinks (martini and Manhattan both perfectly mixed). The food was delicious and plentiful. The chef came out and visited and gave my wife a rose. Nice touch. 

Maybe the only negative is parking but it's well worth the effort. One of a kind Denver gem!

Had a nice experience here and would recommend to friends. Odyssey is a great restaurant for a romantic evening. Soft lighting, lovely music, and delicious wines and foods. 

When we first arrived there was a bit of an awkwardness during our wait. There is no space available to wait or sit so we were stuck in the way of various servers trying to get past us. But that first impression quickly faded once we were seated. Our uber friendly server came by quickly to take our wine order. We tried two varieties of Chianti and both were great. Our server informed us that we arrived on the right day for pasta because they were only $8.50 on Mondays. Winning! And they came with a small caesar salad too. Just what I was craving. 

Before our pastas arrived we were treated to a small loaf of soft and yummy bread and olive oil mixed with balsamic and spices. They even offered a second loaf once they saw how quickly we devoured it. Our pastas were cooked perfectly al dente and the sauces were made well. I kept eating that large bowl of noodles until I was stuffed. Each bowl could easily feed two people but I tried to take it down myself. :-) 

My guest and I really enjoyed our experience at Odyssey. It does well as a semi-casual Italian restaurant with great service, food, and atmosphere at reasonable prices.

My friends and I came here for my birthday dinner at 730 pm on a Sat night after our original plan fell through. I could not be more happy to have my plans changed! The staff was unreal in how accommodating they were, I truly felt like a celebrity or something! We walked out of there happy, laughing, full on delicious food and so very pleased with our dining experience. We met the father and son that run the establishment and you can really tell they love what they do and take pride in it. They gave me a rose, and small bottle of proseco as gifts and made me feel very special. To top the whole thing off, they included the most amazing table-side flambayed dessert for free for the whole table! I am truly impressed with the hospitality, great food and love this family puts into this restaurant. Support local small businesses! Dine here, you will not regret it! 

Also, if you notice, there is one very negative review of this restaurant. However, none of the others really are at all. I'm not sure what happened to that one lady, but I'd bet it was a fluke or something because this place is really fantastic! Maybe she was having a bad day. Lol :)

My favorite restaurant. Everything ive had here is fantastic. The service is fantastic. Get treated like family every time I come in. I think my favorite pasta so far was the bowtie gorgonzola with sundried tomatoes. That sauce is unbelievable.

I created a yelp account just to review this place. That should say plenty.

This review is long overdue. We came here August 2014 during a summer vacation back in our home city. Looking to venture out of the typical box we were accustomed to growing up in Denver, we reached out to Yelp (which wasn't an option growing up) and stumbled upon this place. There wasn't nearly as many yelp reviews back in August as there are presently, so we really came here with no expectations at all, just curiosity and in desperate need for a rare date night. 

Once we arrived to the front entrance we received a welcome from the hostess and passing by was the owner, Ignacio. As I informed the hostess that we did not have reservations (not that it's mandatory anyway), Ignacio must have overheard and immediately said "no reservation, don't worry about it, this restaurant is your home" while putting his arm around my trapezius. Honestly, I thought this was a bit of a stale routine. A smart businessman, I can appreciate him going out of his way to welcome us to his restaurant, I thought. What I later learned that evening is that this type of greeting and the treatment thereafter in this place were actually genuine, even if routine. And that blew me away.

In short, they (hostess, waitress, Ignacio) made my wife feel like the queen she is. There were flowers, Ignacio had a violinist play for her (can't remember her name but she is amazing!) some complimentary wine, dessert and service from our waitress that wasn't too overbearing but gave us enough room to enjoy our evening while routinely accommodating our needs expeditiously. We enjoyed our food from appetizer to dessert, hands down the best pasta we have had so far. Why in the world were we eating at Olive Garden in the past?

The food was delicious. The wine was fantastic. The atmosphere was comforting. This place actually made us miss home. Props to this establishment for making ordinary people feel appreciated while being genuine at the same time. Ignacio was right, this place is like visiting family at home. Good people here and great food, this place will be a staple of ours every time we come back home. Tip generously, they actually merit it.

I'm shocked that this place has such good reviews, it's clear that this place panders to people who never go out to eat.

It's like a cheesy Olive Garden with "special" service. The roses on every table, super cheesy service that is nauseating, it's like it was made for teenagers who are going on their first big date.

The food was nearly abysmal. The Caesar salad was runny and flavorless, and my pasta had so much thin cream sauce that it was practically soup. 

I left so embarrassed that I had chosen this restaurant.
Attentive service, flavorful food, and reasonably priced wine to boot. Enjoyed the experience! Ambiance one of the best for Italian restaurants in Denver.

It was my first time visiting the Odyssey and let me say that it was superb. The service was absolutely exquisite. Emma is a sweetheart and the wonderful chef who prepared our flambé of bananas foster was just amazing. He provided insight and guided us on what each dish entailed and how it was prepared. Not once did he seem annoyed or agitated at all our questions. On the contrary, he seemed thrilled and over joyed to provide us with all the knowledge we needed to make a selection. I would give them an A+ for service. 

As far as the food goes, it was just prefect. The flavors are just as delicious as the aroma the food lets off. The pasta is just great and the tomato sauce is to die for. We received a complimentary bowl of sauce and just spooned it into our mouths! The chicken was so juicy and moist. But really, the dessert is what has my heart captured. That ooey gooey goodness was orgasmic. I can't wait for my next visit.

Amazing family run restaurant inside an old Victorian style house with friendly service, outstanding italian dishes, healthy portions and decent prices for fine dining. Moving from NJ where there are endless delicious italian restaurants, it's not easy to find a place that can compare, however Odyssey stacks up. The restaurant has a romantic atmosphere, dark with candlelight and dried roses for decor. In the summer the patio under the twinkle light tree creates the perfect date spot. They even give the lady a rose as a parting gift for dining with them. I will continue to go back to try their specials and new dishes. Highly recommend this place to anyone who loves italian and a good atmosphere.

This restaurant is a good as it get when it comes to service! The atmosphere is definitely family style and some of the flaming deserts are prepared right at your table.The wait for a table was made up for with complimentary drinks for myself and my two guest. All of our appetizers, food and desert was delicious. It is also kid friendly and good enough for our VERY picky 9 year old. The best touch was the owner coming by to explain the history of the house the restaurant is set in. If you haven't already TRY this place FAST & thank me later.

Amazing I think is the only word to explain this place. This was our first time and it was phenomenal! Our waitress was Elise and she is exceptional, very kind and helpful and knows how to joke around. We had the calamari which was great, especially with their homemade marinara sauce. We followed that with Fettuccini Alfredo for me, and my wife had the penne rustica, and both of us could not say enough good things about it. We had tiramasu for dessert, because we had to after that delicious meal. This is honestly one of if not THE best Italian restaurant i have ever been to!

We decided to give Odyssey a try this evening. Parking is impossible as they don't offer any, so you have to park blocks away on side streets, but that is hardly their issue.

For the apps, we had their calamari. It wasn't good at all. It was frozen section of your local grocery store quality. That gave us pause and had us hoping that we didn't make the wrong choice for date night.

But that was it. That was the only thing the entire evening that wasn't amazing.

Caesar salad? Off the chain! Amazingly delicious.
Their Focaccia bread with parm cheese on it? Divine! 

We ordered off their nightly specialty menu. Both of our meals were amazing. 
Their Veil Tuscany was delicious. The Sea Bass was fantastic. I don't even like mushrooms but their mushroom risoto was amazing!

Their tiramisu was fantastic for desert, and their specialty cocktails were out of this world.

Overall, we loved their food minus the calamari. We will absolutely be back and just order the meat and cheese instead of calamari. 

One thing to note: The wait staff is incredibly friendly. Heck, they have a very limited beer selection and even offered to run literally across the street to buy us anything we may want. Who does that? Only they do. So nice!

10/10 we will be back. Again, the only thing that we would recommend to stay clear of is the calamari.

Wow! The best word I can use to describe everything about this restaurant! 

From the moment you walk in, you are greeted warmly by happy employees. The decor and atmosphere of this restaurant is gorgeous. We had a seat right by the window and I felt like it was a scene out of a movie. Fresh flowers on every table. 

Service was exceptional, everyone was accommodating and happy to recommend their favorite dishes. 

I opted for a chicken Parmesan with Alfredo sauce as opposed to marinara. To die for! The best Italian dish I have ever eaten. Not to mention, the vegetables on the dish were the best veggies I have ever had, and I am not a vegetable fan. 

I can't wait to visit Denver again so that we can return to this establishment. Thank you for the hospitality! You made our trip wonderful!

I really loved the atmosphere, decoration, and waiters. It was a perfect place for a lovely date! I enjoyed it a lot! It was not an ordinary restaurant and food. I love Italian food. I used to have italian food all the time ! I've had the best Italian food ever back home! And let me tell you that their food has high quality, but I've had better and more delicious italian food without a very expensive bill! You are just paying for the decoration and eating in a classy place not for the taste! I even couldn't go further than half of the salmon, whixh the waiter told me is very popular here! But I just didn't like the taste of those noodles on top of it and all the spices! But I had a wonderful time with my boyfriend!

HOLY S#!T!! this is the best Italian place EVER... period!!! GREAT experience!!! 
MUST COME!!

We enjoyed his restaurant. What started out looking for a decent Italian place turned into an exquisite authentic Sicilian meal. 
The ambiance is very nice and creates nice atmosphere.  
The meal was fresh and perfectly prepared with customary table bread loaf with olive oil dipping sauce. 
My only complaint is that some of the artwork was a bit out of taste for a restaurant of this scale. We sat next to a dirty framed picture or Frank Sinatra. Very out of place. 

I would recommend for the food. Be prepared to pay a lot!  this is an expensive restaurant.

The experience from the second we opened the door was exceptional. The environment is swanky and classy and warm. The service is fit for a noble king. Mario, our server, was just great. He gave many great suggestions and ultimately made our meal awesome. 

We WILL tell others about this great restaurant and we will be back with them.

Stop thinking about it and go. You will be pleased start to finish.

I suggest the Mellon prosciutto appetizer... Amazing.

Tasty dinner and completely Blown Away on how great the service was.  I've never been treated so well in my life.  My business allows me to travel and I've been to some of the top restaurants in New York City and LA this is hands down the most authentic Italian feeling even compared to the best restaurants in Boston. Besides everything the house is amazing. it's the setting of an old Victorian in 1908 nestled on 6th Avenue dimly lit and very intimate dining just what I love!! Do not waste any time anywhere else go directly to Odyssey you will not be disappointed!!! this is easily a 10 star restaurant.

Went here tonight for dinner and it was amazing! The environment is intimate and comfortable. From the minute you walk in the door you feel like family.

First and foremost the food is heavenly. The bread is piping hot and served with olive oil and balsamic jelly - such a great combo. We ordered the rice balls to start and they were amazing. They're stuffed with risotto and cheese and then fried - can't go wrong! My hubby ordered chicken parm and I had shrimp scampi - both were delish! Stay away from the scampi if you don't like garlic though - it's covered in it! 

Secondly, the service was great. Our water was constantly full - always a plus. Our server was great at checking in and also giving recommendations (the rice balls were his choice for apps). 

We will definitely be back - keep up the great job!!

The Odyssey was nothing short of an amazing dining experience...if I could give more stars, I would!  Even before we arrived it exceeded every expectation! One of our hosts Michele' or "Mike" called a day ot two in advance to welcome us and ensure we knew they provided valet service for our car. He is a really friendly and great guy whose father is both chef and owner of the restaurant. 

Attending to our cozy corner table was Jessica. She was also delightful and entertaining throughout our meal. She was very familiar with the menu and made a number of great meal and wine suggestions and provided superior service all night. 

As we enjoyed cocktails, then our wine, we were served delicious fresh bread to dip in a dish covered with olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and loaded with fresh garlic. Mmmmmm.

Our entrees were swordfish, and  lobster tail over a spicy pasta. Both prepared nicely. Each came with a dinner ceasar salad Again, the food was cooked to perfection, served at just the right time and always with Jessica ensuring we were happy with every portion of meal. 

We shared a nicely proportioned tiramisu dessert, again, delicious!  Other diners enjoyed banana foster flamed tables idea that I have to try next time. 

To cap off the night,  we were treated to a tour of the historic building which was filled with fun dining nooks on several levels..and we met Ignazio Mulei, the chef and deservedly proud owner of the Cucina Siciliana Odyssey. 

Well done!!!  ... We shall return and to anyone looking for an authentic Sicilian dining experience, you will not be disappointed here!

Had a late Friday night dinner while in Denver on business. Wonderful food and atmosphere! Owner/Chef personally came by our table to ask how our food and service were that evening.
Would definitely recommend!

We were celebrating our first anniversary and Odyssey came highly recommended. We were placed in the "carriage house" in a little corner booth and told it was the most romantic table in the house. It took the server about 5 minutes to get to our table for drink orders. We ordered two appetizers, the one called Sicilian Rice Balls was good, the fried tracking ravioli was mediocre at best. Our salads were great. My husband enjoyed his penne rustica, but I found the eggplant rollitini bland. We had bananas foster made tableside, and it was neat to watch. It was pretty good as far as flavor. Unfortunately the pan and burner were left next to our table and did not smell good after our server was done. At the end of the meal we were given the wrong check. The server caught it and charged the correct amount to our card. Overall, not the best Italian I've ever had, we will not likely return.

I love this place... seriously I've had such wonderful service and food here that I find myself in here as much as I can. The food is legit authentic Italiano/Sicilian cuisine from recipes that the family has held on to for many years. All the dishes and the wines I've had here really embody a very deep wonderful flavor. The service is really spot on, they keep you fed and keep your glass full of delicious vino. There's really something to be said about how much better food is when you can taste the passion of culinary and ingredients. I've straight up cleaned my plate each time I come in here and I can't wait to visit again. If you love Italian food, you will love this place it is bellissimo!!!

One word. Amazing! I live in California and I only have one rule when visiting my son in Denver. We eat at Odyssey. The food is so flavorful and beautifully presented! I have never been disappointed with anything I have ordered. If my meal mates are to be believed, neither have they! The icing on the cake is the staff! They are all amazing! It's easy to see how much they love their jobs and how dedicated they are to making sure your visit is a memorable one! Michele and his dad are most highly amazing! The only thing bad I can say about Odyssey is that it isn't located in Livermore, California!! I'll be back!!
Aaaammmmaazing!!! So many good options to choose from and the best staff Really friendly and you can tell they are passionate about their food and customers

We made a reservation and although the restaurant was very busy, we were seated right on time. There were four of us and between us, we ordered 2 different types of salads, 4 different main dishes and three different desserts. Everything was absolutely delicious. Service was excellent as well. The main chef even came out and asked us how everything was. They are also excellent in dealing with food allergies. I can't eat dairy, it was not an issue as I was told, all sauces are made to order when they are ordered. I also had the house martini with home made lemonchello, made by their bar tender, I highly recommend it!

I visited with my two sisters.  We had a bottle of chianti and all had seafood.  Pastas were al dente as expected.  Sauces were each delicious and memorable.  Appetizers were good.  Calamari and caprese salad were delightful.   The CO tomatoes were splendid!  The server had only been there one week and already embodied "the" right mind set.  The owner came and said hello to wish one of the sisters happy birthday.  The staff made it very special.

The food was delicious.  The experience was fantastic!

Been here many times. I am a big fan not only the restaurant but the geniuses behind the master piece that Odyssey is! Mike and Nat are no strangers to growing and developing some of the best restaurants Denver has ever had. I won't mention names because I would be advertising for others, however I will say if anyone here has a problem waiting in line to get into a great restaurant then go to Mc Donalds. No wait there. Or, become friends with Nat and Mike so next time they can tell you when you call, if it is a busy day to come in or if they can sit you promptly. To me, the fact that there is a wait sometimes just tells me this is a superb place to come to. It's a good sign. If I ever go to a place where you hear crickets, well...
     This also goes to the person that complains about the noise. I have been on dates to Odyssey many times and it's always been quiet and a great atmosphere but any restaurant that is busy at one point will be loud and noisy. If they want to pay George Clooney style and reserve a restaurant for themselves for 30K for the night I am sure Mike and Nat would not oppose.
      Finally, for anyone out there that understands how much effort it takes to run a successful restaurant you will have a bit more respect to Nat and Mike. No one can say anything about the food, the food is fabulous, the staff and service is incredible and these guys truly care about serving great food and the people that come to see them. Italians look at food as part of a larger, more essential and pleasurable part of daily life. Not as an experience to be collected or bragged about. Great food is made with pride and love, love for what you do and pride to share it. 
      Nat and Mike...I am coming over tonight!

Not impressed. Super over priced to assure you the quality is top notch when that is far from the truth. The service was very inattentive and quite unprofessional. Won't be wasting my money here again.

Odyssey Italian is our favorite spot for Italian food in Denver.  After a trip to Italy several years ago, we were on the search for a Denver spot that could satisfy our real Italian pasta cravings.  Odyssey has been our winner!  We have come back several times, and visited again this week while staying at a nearby B&B for a mini staycation.  We, again, had a wonderful meal.
Monday nights are pasta night and you can order any of the pasta dishes for $8.95.  That is an incredible value and we love to visit on Mondays!  I would highly recommend a reservation to avoid a wait.  
The restaurant is charming and cozy, with exposed brick, dim lighting, white tablecloths and a red rose in a wine bottle on each table.  It's a great date night or double date spot.  The patio is also nice in warmer weather!  We made a reservation for the main floor on our most recent visit and were seated right away to a table beside the fireplace.  Service is attentive and the food comes out a good pace.  The staff is always warm and welcoming, and you will feel like an appreciated guest.
We gravitate to pasta when we dine here because the pasta dishes are so fresh and delicious!  Each comes with a salad and bread.  The mini loaves of bread are delivered to your table fresh and hot, topped with grated parmesan and herbs.  They are served with oil and vinegar to dip in, but the best part is the fresh garlic and herbs that are mixed into the dipping oil!  The Gnocchi with Pesto Cream Sauce is a favorite dish of ours, and I also really enjoy the Fettuccine Carbonara.  We've never had a dish we didn't enjoy!

Last night was my first trip to Odyssey. I went with six girlfriends for a belated birthday dinner. Our experience was terrific. The setting is intimate and warm and the food is fantastic; for such a nice place it's very relaxing. The prices are very reasonable and the portions are quite large. Ignacio and Michele went out of their way to make us feel so special. I will definitely return!

Come eat here and ask for Rae to be your waitress. 

After waiting well past our reservation time on a very busy NYE (which, I must say, the hostess did an excellent job handing), Rae provided exceptional hospitality and service- starting with a very thorough wine tasting experience. She made our dinner an amazing night never to be forgotten. Oh and the food is superb as well. Just go in and ask for Rae...you won't regret it.

I've been here twice and both experiences were phenomenal! The service is the best I've had in Denver, the food is superb and the atmosphere is my favorite. I won't go to any other Italian places in Denver as this will always be my #1!

I love this place. There is something about Eat + Drink that really speaks to me. It's cute and cozy, and has fresh, great tasting food. *Try the simple sandwich and burrata* 

One of the best things about supporting a local business is the intimacy. Often it's the owner that is serving the tables at night.

Great little place for a date night!

I've been visiting Eat Drink for their Tuesday night Cheap Date special for the last two years and have had nothing but great service and delicious cheese. 

I called ahead tonight to check on their hours, knowing that they close between 7 and 9 depending on the time of year. The girl who answered informed me that they closed at 8. I arrived at 7 pm with my boyfriend and another couple only to be told that the kitchen was closed. I said that I thought they were open until 8 and the girl repeated that the kitchen was closed.

Listen, all we wanted was two cheese plates and some wine--it doesn't require a lot of cooking (actually none, just slicing some cheese and throwing some nuts on a plate) and we arrived with plenty of time for her to close up shop before 8. Because of her refusal to assist us, I will no longer patronize this local shop and instead will head over to Postino (which is what we did) and get my choice of bottle of wine and a sizable board of bruschetta for $5 less than Eat Drink offers.

This has been on my hit list for a while now and Friday was the day. The staff was so so nice and I was happy to support a local business because of them. 

The artichoke, lemon ricotta and roasted tomato sandwich was my pick of the day. I love that I was given a choice of salad or chips with no extra charge for salad. The sandwich was rock solid and a unique spin on a vegetarian option. The bread was crispy with creamy, rich ricotta. The hint of lemon was a perfect foil for the artichokes. The side salad was great too and went well with the sandwich.

I'm finding loooots of fabulous cheese-centered places in Denver, so I couldn't be happier. Eat + Drink is definitely at the top of my list. Have y'all been here!? I'm mildly concerned because I've been here 3 times now and I've been the only customer in there each time... granted I've gone at not-extremely-popular hours.. typically late lunches after 1 PM. Anyway, I hope this place gets plenty of business because they're pretty awesome. They close at 8 PM.... what's that about? Sometimes I want cheese for dinner after 8. Sometimes meaning all the time. 

Eat + Drink has a very simple but lovely menu. Soup, salads, cheese plates, charcuterie boards, and sandwiches. Everything I've ordered (or have seen friends + family order) is fresh and beautiful and delicious. I prefer the 3 cheese plate, and I let the staff choose a variety for me. On my last visit I had a bleu, a triple cream brie, and a Colorado made goat cheese. Soooo good, all of them, and the portions aren't skimpy. It's a fair amount of cheese, so find a friend to share. The cheese plates comes with fruit (pears or apples), nuts, dried cranberries and pumpkin seeds, crostini or gluten-free crackers, dried apricots, and almonds. The charcuterie board comes with 4 meats, spicy whole grain mustard, and pickled caper berries + onions + pickles. Yeeaaahhhhh.

They have a great wine menu here; you're looking at $7-$12 per glass and $5 glasses at Happy Hour from 4-6 PM. Not bad at all! This is a tiny restaurant but they have a really cute patio as well. Plenty of space and really sweet service.

If you like cheese and wine - this is a great place to try some new tastes. They have lots of tasty cheese to choose from and if you are unsure of what you'll like, they will put together a plate for you based on your taste profile. They have a happy hour with $5 glasses of wine and $10 cheese plates, plus they have Tuesday Date Night specials - $25 for 1 bottle of wine and a 3 artisan cheese plate. 

It's a small location with a quite atmosphere. Our table of 8 basically took up 1/2 of the dining area, but it's a great place for a small group and some conversation. I highly recommend you give them a try!

Full disclosure: I would probably not have made the effort to come here if my love's cousin didn't work in the shop. Either way, I think we found a little gem. 

Wine? Cheese? Just let me slap myself so that I know I'm not dreaming! What a quaint little place to stop in for lunch. 

They don't make everything in-house, but they DO choose very well-made, very good ingredients. Have a taste of the wine or the cheese (or both) and you'll know I'm not lying. They carry one of my FAVORITE cheese brands of all time- Cypress Grove. It's so good I'd bathe myself in it. 

We had little tastes of everything- paninis, cheeses, and the gazpacho. I can't even get into detail about how well everything is made because it would take me pages and pages to tell you about it. They do an excellent job of flavor combinations with a simple menu. For example, I had the California panini which did an excellent job of pairing creamy with sweet, a bit salty, and little bit of funk from the brie. The gazpacho was completely unexpected. I suppose I haven't had too many gazpachos in my lifetime- in my experience they are bordering a bowl of plain old salsa. The one we had was tasty- sweet from the watermelon, zingy, and a little spicy and minty, perfect for a hot Denver day when you're not exactly hungry. 

Eat + drink pretty much sums it up.

This place is fantastic.  Excellent quality ingredients are featured in superb dishes.  This has to be one of the best lunch spots in Denver.  Great salads, sandwiches and cheese plates.  They also have a great selection of beverages, both alcoholic and non-alcoholic. There are indoor and outdoor dining areas.  The interior is light and fresh (like the food) and the outdoors has a classic sidewalk cafe feel.   I'm an instant fan and will be back.

I really wanted to like this place because cheese and wine are the two most fabulous things in life! Also, this place is in one of my favorite areas of town! However, my experience at Eat+Drink left a bad taste in my mouth, literally. 

We sat down and after a longer than usual wait we were asked if we were ready to order, I said "yes, we are ready to order drinks, but still haven't looked at food"...we ordered our drinks and were again asked what we wanted to eat...a bit awkward but passable. But now I felt rushed/awkward. Still A-OK. Next, I was told that they were almost out of the wine I ordered, so they'd take a dollar off my wine since the pour was light...this was thoughtful and much appreciated...although the wine was great so I was a little sad (but come on, its spring, they should be prepared with lots of Rosé). 

Our appetizer, the burrata, was okay although the bread was hard (like cut your mouth hard) and a little overly chewy in places, as in hard to bite without flinging part of it across the room. The burrata itself, I would rank in the lower half of all burratas I've tried (and that's a lot - I have a problem), but the texture was nice. My friend ordered the California Panini with chips and loved it. I ordered the Arti Panini (artichoke hearts, lemon ricotta, roasted tomatoes, chevre, arugula) and had to fight myself not to spit out the small first bite I took. The only thing you could taste was the very strong goat cheese...basically like taking a block of goat cheese and eating it straight. The particular goat cheese on this sandwich was very barnyardy - like standing downwind from a wet goat. I never took another bite. I had sat in disgust for about 20 minutes picking at the potato chips on my plate watching my friend eat his food before our server returned. Without ever asking how everything was or noticing I had taken only one tiny bite out of my sandwich, I asked for a box but told her never mind because the sandwich was awful . She asked if I wanted something else, but at this point I was grossed out and not super hungry anymore...although in retrospect I should have asked for something else because we still had to pay for the sandwich I didn't eat.

EAT + DRINK....but unfortunately I only had the opportunity to drink because I came post-brunch & had little appetite for food.

The breakdown: Around $8 for a class of wine & $12 for a flight of three wines (flight options: red or white).  I tried the red flight which surprisingly came out to be three full glasses of wine . I thought I'd get a wine teaser but the quantity of wine in the flight was definitely doing more than teasing me. 

The red flight:
1. tempranillo: muse by pollyanna | rioja, spain | supple.earthy.silky 
2. malbec 
3. something that starts w/ a c that is not chardonnay nor cabernet sauvignon 

Also tried a pinot noir. 

The waitress was polite & seemed genuinely sweet. I came during an afternoon lull & had the place to myself so the atmosphere definitely felt relaxing. It's not the most inviting or cozy of shops because of the tall ceiling, bright windows & proximity of the front door to the counter then to the seats but I thought the brick walls & worn wood floor were homey. 

Review to come for when I try the cheese & small plates.

This is the best little spot for a quick, fabulous lunch or a glass of wine and some great cheese after work. I've frequented the California panini sans turkey and it's too good to be true. You can get a salad on the side which is a beautiful, simply dressed arugula mix. Also, if you ever need to procure your own cheese plate at home, this is a one stop shop for everything you need!

I mean! This whole restaurant is dedicated to cheese plates and drinking wine. What's not to love friends? And even though I didn't drink any wine the day I went most recently (because it was for a lunch meeting) I still have a mad crush on Eat + Drink. 

It's small and friendly and casual. I think it would be a really fun spot for a date and I know it's a really great spot for lunch, either solo or on a meeting.

My only wish is that they would be open later than 8 pm. Because then I could have more date nights there with Sir Nicholas.

Quaint restaurant on Platte St. Small atmosphere. The food is very good, service is nice.  Fun loft atmosphere.  Mix of sandwiches, soup, and salad to pick from for lunch. Also have a few chocolates and gourmet cheese to pick from.

However it is expensive!  I paid $17 for a sandwich, side of salad and chips the other day.
Not sure if I want to stomach that again.  It's good, but not $17 good.  Value is not there.

The cheap date night is a great deal, but I'd stay away from the rest of the food.  The Arti was missing vinigar or salt in it.  The charcuterie wasn't good at all.  The two pates were really fatty, the prosutto was cut too thin and was dry, and the capocollo tasted like star anise.   If I come back i'll stick to the wine and cheese.

Eat + Drink is a wonderful new addition to Platte Street and will soon become a beloved staple of the neighborhood.  

I would consider it a cheese shop and a lovely dining stop for lunch or dinner.  They offer a good variety of reasonably priced wine by the glass or bottle.  Take your pick, they have red, white, rose, and sparkling.  The menu is simple and offers, charcuterie boards, small plates, salads, paninis, and sandwiches.  They also have a cute shop with a variety of cheeses, chocolates, fresh bread, sausage and other little items.  If you're looking for a gourmet cheese basket, this place sure would make a great one for any of your friends (they offer a variety of sizes).    

I had the pleasure of trying The Emilia, a panini with prosciutto, mozzarella, pesto, tomatoes, and truffle oil.  This panini had wonderful flavor and was the perfect lunch destination for my Mom and I on a sunny afternoon.  Each ingredient had a purpose and added much needed texture and deliciousness to each bite.    

The women working here are very sweet and will answer any of your questions and will also allow you to sample some of their cheeses to make an educated decision.  

On a sunny day I could see myself making use of their wonderful patio, enjoying a glass of wine and some of their decadent cheese.

Once upon a time in Denver there was this sketchy area of Denver surrounded by warehouses and railroad tracks to venture there you had to know where you were going..get there and get out.  At least that was what it was like when I was a wee little girl in Denver.  But as the City grew and expanded it did so into this area now known as Confluence Park and Riverfront.   The beauty of this area is a show of what can happen with planning and growth in a community to help to make it prosper.   

Located on Platte just near the bridge that walks you over to the Highlands and walking distance from REI is this fabulous wine & cheese emporium, so subtle in its appearance from the street you would hardly know it is there.   It is the sister restaurant of Eat!Drink! in Edwards and offers wine, beer, small salads, sandwiches and soup.   But mostly an ambience of a new found favorite deli..Denver Style.   Meats so fresh and cheeses so remarkable that you aren't overwhelmed with the petite presentation of your order when dining there.   I was there for a small intimate group dinner - well not dinner as much as an evening of 15 friends with wine and conversation and bites.  It seats not more then 20 at most, and if you bring a group be sure to call ahead. 

In the winter come sit inside and watch the snow fall or in the summer sit outside on the patio and watch all the locals walking around.   There are lots of other great places near by so you can begin or end your day here.  One of the conversation we had at dinner was in regards to the area as I sated in the beginningthis area has grown and it is beautiful and neighborly.   Much is happening in Denver and this is just one of those areas worth your time to check out.

Cheers to the idea of sharing and good wine and cheese plates.  Hint a nice intimate place for Valentine's and they sell cheese and wine as well.  All you will need to get else where are the flowers...

http://eatdrinkinc.com/eat-drink-denver/#about

I love eat + drink because it's a casual, inexpensive bistro-type restaurant to grab a quick, casual dinner. I feel like Denver needs more restaurants that are serving this type of food at these prices. 

My only request is that they change up their menu from time to time. I would love to see some new salads/soups for winter!
Exceeded all expectations.  Fresh, high-quality food with a well-thought menu.  Can't wait to go back!

I went for the first time to Eat + Drink on a Friday evening. We went for the tail end of happy hour (4-6 PM), and were the only ones there for about a half an hour. During happy hour, a glass of select wines is only $5. 

The waitress was really nice, helpful, and knowledgeable about the menu. My friend and I are cheese fanatics and each got paninis and LOVED THEM. 

The ambience is quaint, and the restaurant situated on the adorable Platte Street. I would come back here often.

Yummmmm we dropped in one day and the staff was super friendly! We got some wine and I think we had burratta, which is hand pulled mozzarella. I may have spelled it wrong, but it was super delicious! I'd like to try their cheap date night! I definitely recommend this place!
